metadata.novel_title: I Own EVERY Class in This World: Life Set to HELL Mode!

novel_info.title: I Own EVERY Class in This World: Life Set to HELL Mode!
novel_info.author: EndKun
novel_info.summary: “Wait a minute… why does this truck have no driver-”An average man was hit by two trucks and was suddenly reincarnated in another world with the help of Rher, the God of Fate; but it seemed like this new world he was in had magic, classes, and even a very game-like approach to it?Your class is decided at your birth with no way to change or choose it, and yet here he was, with the [Chosen One] talent and the [Class Wheel] skill, which allowed him to spin the wheel to gain a class every time.And so the first time he spanned the wheel during a fight...“What the fuck is the SSS-ranked 'Domination' class? Never heard of it!”Follow the story of Stark as he faces all the challenges of this world and tries to survive everything and anything that comes at him.

chapters.title: Chapter 1 - 1: The Judgment
chapters.content:
"Wait a minute… why does this truck have no driver-"
A 23 year old man was in the middle of an empty street, a fog surrounding his view, making him unable to see anything past the five meters mark.
It was already weird enough he hadn't met a singular person in around ten minutes, even though he was on a friday night, but what the hell was happening?
He had just come back from his overtime at his job as a professionnal accountant, but the moment he tried to traverse a seemingly empty road…
A truck came rushing his way, almost as if it was waiting for him in the shadows.
"…" the man wasn't dumb, after all he had read many novels and mangas, but he couldn't let that slide.
He had just been hired to his job three months ago, and he refused to die and let all those hours go to waste.
So… he jumped to his left at the last moment, essentially avoiding the truck right as it was about to kill him.
"Phew~" He wiped the sweat from his forehead, "Nice try, you fucking asshole-"
But right as he turned back his head to see if everything was fine…
Another truck came rushing from the opposite direction, yet again with no driver behind the wheel.
"Yeah okay," this time he didn't even bother to avoid it as it was way too close.
~SLAM~
He was hit in full force by the mysterious driverless truck, and immediately died upon impact with the vehicle.
And just as predicted, almost as if some weird magic was taking place, the two trucks evaporated right after.
They had done their job after all…
***
(In an unknown space)
A mysterious and powerful being was looking at the sky, lost in thoughts.
'When will they arrive…' he was getting impatient, 'I sent those two to catch him, but they're taking longer than expected…'
Just as the being was about to give up hope and go check for himself, a bright light appeared in the distance. The light grew stronger and stronger until a figure emerged from within it.
"Oh," the figure smiled as it saw the body of the accountant emerge from the rift and fall on the ground as he was unconscious.
"What took you so long?" it spoke, not to the sleeping man, but to the two figures that were behind him.
They were covered in white, and their eyes completely dark, their appearance was grotesque and a pair of white wings emerged from their backs, as well as pure black horns from the top of their heads.
"He somehow managed to avoid us once…" they both kneeled.
The two creatures were the drivers of the trucks, also called the 'ascenders' as they were tasked with sending potential individuals to this space, where they would be judged either worthy or unworthy of transmigrating.
"Very well," Rher sat back on his giant throne, his physical appearance was extremely large, and a single one of his fingers would be enough to crush a hundred humans, "Bring him here, as the judgment shall begin."
The two white creatures got up before bowing to their god, then one of them touched the accountant's forehead, a golden light emerging from its palm.
"It is done," they informed Rher before disappearing yet again, off to continue their work.
After a few seconds, the man slowly opened his eyes, finding himself in a strange and ethereal realm.
He sat up, looking around in confusion at the surreal landscape surrounding him.
"You are in my dimension," Rher's voice echoed in his ears as he regained consciousness.
As he slowly stood up, he took in the surreal surroundings of this new dimension.
The sky was a vibrant shade of purple, unlike anything he had ever seen before. The horizon seemed endless, stretching on and on into the unknown.
And beneath their feet, the ground was solid yet ethereal, like a floating asteroid suspended in space.
But what truly captured his attention were the countless other rock islands that dotted the landscape.
They varied in size and shape, some resembling jagged peaks while others were smooth and round. Yet all of them shared one common trait - they too were floating in this bizarre dimension.
Beneath his feet lay one of the many 'islands' that dotted the vast expanse of this dimension.
But this particular island was the largest, capable of holding not only Rher, but also his massive throne and still leaving plenty of room to spare.
"Human, the judgment shall begin," The being known as Rher smiled, his entire figure concealed by a dark cloak.
The only visible features were his piercing yellow eyes, staring intently at the human before them, and his impossibly wide grin.
As he leaned back on his throne, Rher's arms rested casually on the edges, showcasing his long, slender fingers adorned with sharp purple nails.
It was clear to the man that whatever was about to happen was anything but good.
"Judgment?" he repeated, staring back at the God.
"Ohoh~ You don't seem too afraid, I like it!" Rher laughed, "Let's just roll in the tutorial!"
"Tutorial? What is that-"
In an instant, three panels appeared before him, each displaying a crudely drawn image and accompanying text.
The drawings looked as though they were sketched by a child, yet somehow held a strange air of otherworldliness.
"…" he didn't even feel the need to question whatever was happening, so he started reading.
[Welcome to the 'Judgment']
[In this space, many people get judged by the God of Fate, Rher, and only those who are deemed fit can pass on to the next world]
Below that was a drawing of Rher sitting on his throne, and of a normal person with the text 'You' above.
'Who even drew this, these are basically stickman figures…'
[Those who are deemed unfit are sent to the void]
The drawing this time showed the same 'you' falling into the void, which was a dark sphere resembling a black hole, all the while getting zapped by Rher.
[Amount of people that have passed the judgment yet: 0]
The third and final image showed a big 0 with Rher around it, a sad expression on his face.
'Don't act like you're sad, it's your fucking fault,' he groaned.
The man finished reading the 'tutorial', then looked back at the god, who seemed proud of himself for drawing that.
"So let me get this straight," the accountant sighed.
"Yes, do ask."
"You ripped me from my original world, and unfairly killed me just to bring me here? And now I have a 99.99% chance of dying or being sent to some unknown void?" he held his forehead, unable to comprehend how ridiculous that situation was.
Rher looked at him for a second before speaking, "Um… yeah, pretty much."
"…"
"…"
The two looked at one another, and so without hesitation, the man pointed his arms at Rher and gave him the middle finger.
"Fuck you," he spoke, an annoyed expression on his face.
"How violent!"
Rher blinked, surprised by the man's boldness. No one had ever dared to speak to him in such a manner before. But instead of getting angry, a wide grin spread across Rher's face, revealing rows of sharp teeth.
"So what now?" the black-haired man continued, "Am I doomed to be judged by some random criteria I'll never know?"
"Human, this test is to make sure that you have your place in this world, it is much harder than you think…" Rher tried to justify himself.
"Who cares, this world probably sucks anyway!"
"Hey, my world doesn't suck-"
"Nuh uh," he made a 'no' gesture with his hand.
"…"
And yet again, the two stared at one another.
"You are extremely stubborn," Rher went back to smiling, "But I like you!"
"So when does the judgment end?"
"Oh..." Suddenly, Rher's pupils began to glow with a golden aura, and the surrounding air seemed to shimmer, "But it has already ended..."
A blinding light enveloped the man, causing him to shield his eyes with his arm.
And when it faded, there was a massive hole in the ground in the middle of the previously flat island in front of him, seemingly dug through the solid rock.
The man cautiously took a few steps closer to the edge, peering down into the darkness below.
"Am I supposed to jump?" he asked with the most blank of expressions, pointing at the hole, sure that he failed.
"Uh? No! You passed!" Rher laughed again, he really enjoyed that man's personality.
His laughter echoed off the surrounding cliffs as he gestured towards the hole, revealing a hidden staircase leading down into the depths below.
"You are the first and only person who will be allowed to pass, good luck, and don't disappoint me!"
The man stared down into the depths of the staircases, and once he looked back up, there was no trace of Rher anymore, even the throne had disappeared.
'Quit trying to act mysterious,' he groaned as he began descending.
[Amount of people that have passed the judgment yet: 0->1]
He was descending the stairs, and the more he went on, the more dark and obscure the aura in his surroundings became.
And when he reached the last step before entering a black portal in front of him, a panel appeared.
[Congratulations, someone actually managed to convince Rher, making you the one and only transmigrator of this world!]
'Does this mean i'm getting a system and becoming op in the other world?' the man questioned, having read his fair share of isekai media himself, he always knew it was something the protagonists of these worlds acquired to help them on their journey.
[Lol, no]
And just like that, an unknown force pushed him inside the portal, plunging him into darkness and silence. The sensation was dizzying, disorienting, as if he was hurtling through space and time.
And after what felt like hours, days, weeks, months, years…
He opened his eyes.

chapters.title: Chapter 2 - 2: Eventful First Day
chapters.content:
The sky was a brilliant shade of blue, with vibrant rays of sunlight cascading towards his eyes.
As they adjusted to the bright light and noise, he realized that he was standing on the edge of a building at least 50 meters above the ground.
A sea of people looked up at him, their voices blending into a chaotic symphony of concern and confusion. The man's mind raced as he tried to make sense of the situation.
":I" the accountant was confused.
Suddenly, he heard shouting from below, pleading for him not to jump.
He looked up and saw helicopters circling above, their cameras pointed at him.
"Don't do it!" They shouted.
"I know you have no class, but it doesn't matter, it's not worth it!"
'What the fuck kind of argument is that, and what the hell is a class,' the man groaned, pinching himself to make sure whatever he was in wasn't just some dream and that he wasn't in a coma after being hit by the truck.
But the pinch only brought pain, confirming that this was indeed reality.
The wind blew through his black hair as he stood on the edge, contemplating the situation he found himself in.
The chaos below only seemed to escalate as more and more people gathered.
The helicopters were also still spinning in the air, broadcasting whatever was happening live to the entire world.
"Yeah ok," the man laughed as he couldn't hold it in, he couldn't have been put in a more ridiculous situation, but Rher seemed to have a weird sense of humor.
He distanced himself from the edge as he didn't want to trip and fall, after all what would happen to him if he found himself back in Rher's dimension, the god laughing in his face for dying less than 5 minutes after being reincarnated was something he did NOT want to experience.
But right as he moved away from the edge, he heard a voice behind him.
"I knew you wouldn't do it, you fucking pussy," said a young-looking boy with tanned skin and blonde hair, who despite his age, which was 15, towered over most people at roughly 180cm tall.
"What the fuck did you just say to me?" not impressed, the transmigrator looked at the boy in the eyes, surprising him.
"Haha~ It seems like this attempt made you go crazy," The boy smirked in response, activating some sort of power that emitted an overwhelming aura around him, "I'll have to put you back in your place again, classless boy."
"..." Stark didn't even talk, just tilting his head in confusion.
"Stark, you are the lowest of the low and can't do anything right, and yet when I give you a chance to prove yourself, you pussy out?" the man summoned a steel sword out of thin air, it was shimmering with a silver glow, "I'll show you the power of a 'warrior'!"
'Is my name in this world Stark…?' he questioned, seemingly unhappy of the name he had gotten, his previous one was way better.
He didn't even seem to care about the fact magic was being used in front of him, instead focusing on some internal questions, he had no memories of this body after all, so he would need to start from ground zero.
"PAY ATTENTION, FUCKER," the aggressive boy bellowed, his eyes blazing with anger and determination as he charged towards Stark at an alarming speed, his sharp weapon gleamed in the sunlight, ready to slice and dice.
'Hm…' Stark simply stood there, lost in thought, not even bothering to acknowledge the other boy's presence, but this only seemed to infuriate him more.
"Oh! I get it now, Rher! I think this is the tutorial!" Stark nodded and hit the palm of his left hand with a fist of his right.
Then without missing a beat, he instinctively took a step back, deftly evading the tanned boy's attack.
The sudden movement caused the aggressive boy to lose balance and tumble over the edge as he wasn't able to stop, not expecting Stark to avoid and so using his full speed.
"Huh?" the blond man looked down as he fell.
"WATCH OUT!"
"SOMEONE ELSE JUMPED!"
The crowd quickly dispersed, creating a clear path for the falling boy who crashed into the ground with a sickening thud.
Meanwhile, Stark calmly looked down at where the boy had fallen before shrugging nonchalantly, "Oh well, I guess I beat the tutorial," he muttered to himself before casually walking away.
Walking down the stairs, he realized the building he was in seemed to be some sort of luxurious apartment building.
And after a minute, he found himself outside, where the crowd and chaos were located.
"Someone call an ambulance, QUICK!"
The boy who had attacked Stark was on the ground, moving only slightly as his entire body was covered in blood.
"…" Stark looked at him with a blank expression, then shrugged yet again before walking away, "Tutorial bosses are really weak, not gonna lie…"
The commotion and all the cameras were now pointed at the blond guy, allowing Stark to walk away without much issues, and even though some people noticed him, they didn't bother to ask him if he was okay.
"Damn, was this guy really that unimportant? Anyway, I need to figure out where I am before something else happens," Stark sighed as he turned the corner.
But when he did…
"THERE YOU ARE, YOU LITTLE SHIT!" a man in his mid-twenties came rushing his way, he also had black hair and looked a lot like him.
"Who are you?" he asked, unbothered.
"HUH? I'M YOUR BROTHER! YOU USELESS SHIT," the man grabbed Stark by the arm and forced him to seat at the backseat of a luxurious car, "You are the shame of the family, I honestly think you jumping would have made things easier for us."
'How supportive…' Stark rolled his eyes, but smiled on the inside, 'Where the fuck did you put me, Rher…'
Frankly, he didn't take any of this seriously, after all, for him, all of this was only the tutorial, which meant the introduction, hopefully he would get basic information about this world soon though.
Stark observed his surroundings as the car sped off, taking in the opulence of the vehicle and the expensive-looking buildings passing by.
It seemed like he was in a world technologically similar to his previous one.
And after thirty minutes and many different landscapes, he finally parked in front of a mansion.
'Nice, if that's my house then life couldn't get better!'
Or at least that's what he thought.

chapters.title: Chapter 3 - 3: The 'Soul Wielders' Family
chapters.content:
Stark stepped out of the car and looked up at the grandeur of the mansion in front of him. The architecture was impressive, exuding an air of wealth and power.
'Nice,' he grinned while nodding, seemingly happy, 'Good job, Rher, I knew you wouldn't let me down.'
"Mother and father have called you in, there is a meeting with the entire family because of you," Stark's 'brother' commanded, a drop of sweat dripping from his forehead.
"Ok," Stark didn't mind and walked alongside the stranger.
The interior of the mansion was just as luxurious as the exterior, with lavish decorations and expensive furniture adorning every room. As Stark followed his "brother" through the halls, he couldn't help but feel a sense of detachment from it all.
This world, with its opulence and formality, seemed so different from the one he had come from.
But after being sent here as Rher's 'chosen one', he guessed he didn't have much of a choice.
Finally, they arrived at a grand meeting room where the rest of the family was already assembled. Stark's parents, adorned in fine clothing and stern expressions, sat at the head of a long table.
The other family members, which were basically two other woman with red hair were sitting on the table as well.
His father had black hair and red eyes, while his mother had red hair and red eyes as well.
"Stark, you are fifteen years of age, and the 'Class Showcase' ceremony is in two days, yet you disturb everyone again?" his father spoke before he could even sit down, his tone filled with authority.
'…' Stark had to take in most of the information he would get during this meeting, after all he couldn't let it show that he didn't know anything, "Hmm… yes very interesting father…"
"Are you even taking this seriously?" his father barked, "It's already embarassing that us, a reknown family of 'soul wielders' are stuck with… you!"
"My friends keep mocking me for having you as my brother," one of the red-haired girls got up and slammed her fists on the table, "Can't you ever do something right?"
"Interesting, sister, but I don't remember asking!"
"YOU LITTLE SHIT," a red aura appeared around the girl, glowing immensely, "That's why you get bullied!"
"Calm down, honey," her mother stopped her from using her powers, then looked back at Stark, "You attempted to kill yourself, sent one of your classmates to the hospital, and now are disrespecting your siblings?" she glared at her son as if he was an animal.
Since the moment Stark was born, he was already recognized as the weakest link of the family, the first words his mother uttered as he was born were "useless" and "weak" after all as she sensed he didn't have a single trace of magic in him.
But nonetheless, they kept him around since they believed that his powers would come out at a later age, and yet nothing.
'Man… I don't know what is going on with the guy I got transmigrated into, but looks like his situation is tough…' Stark sighed.
His thoughts were wandering to all the things he could be doing at this moment to increase his chances of survival in this magic-oriented world, and although he had no idea what or who the threats were, he was still interested in knowing.
"Can I leave now?" he blurted out, his mother and father had been talking for a good five minutes, but he hadn't listened as all they did was berate him, plus they wouldn't give him any info since it seemed the only time they talked was to insult him.
Of course, under any normal circumstances, Stark would have stayed with his family to take advantage of their money and of the fact he could live in a mansion.
But no this time, since he had the feeling that staying in there was asking for death, and even more so when he stared at their eyes, they were cold, ready to kill him if he did anything wrong.
[Stay if you have a death wish =)]
Even a panel came to confirm what he suspected, and so that's why he wanted to leave.
His parents exchanged a disappointed look before nodding, acknowledging Stark's dismissal.
"Stark," suddenly, all his family members got up from their chair, "I'll remind you one last time what makes you so different from us…"
All of them put their right hand on the area of their body where their heart was located, and suddenly…
~FWISH~
Different colored and textured hearts appeared, one of them was yellow of color and had a lasso around it, another was red with pulsating veins.
His mother's was pink, with hearts surrounding it, while his father's was black, with occasional zaps of lightning.
"It's because you don't have the 'soul wielder' class that you are so different."
All of them seemed powerful, but Stark did wonder how any of this worked, and what all these 'classes' were about.
"Well… um… bye bye," Stark shrugged.
"Don't come back then," his father looked at him with determined eyes, almost confident his youngest son didn't have the balls to do any of this, he was always a scaredy-cat after all.
"Ok," Stark took the door out of 'meeting room' and after a few minutes found his way out of the mansion, "Mannnnn~ Time to figure out what kind of world I'm in," he decided that going to his school was probably the best option.
Back in the meeting room, which was mostly just the dinner room since that's where they ate, all of the family members were flabbergasted.
How could Stark change so much in just a day, just yesterday he was his same old self, did he have some kind of enlightenment?
"It's fine," the father calmed down the atmosphere, "He is too weak to do anything, and he isn't going to survive the 'Class Showcase' anyway, way too many influential figures will be there and he is probably not even gonna participate… Plus we were already planning to kick him out."
It wasn't like they really cared anyway, without Stark in the picture, their family lineage would be perfect.
***
"I worked as an accountant for three months, and it took me four years of studying and one year of internship to get to where I was, you think this will scare me?" Stark exclaimed to himself, he had already slaved up at his job, so he didn't care much about any of these people.
He had just been dropped into this random world with no explanation, but he guessed it was part of the 'game' to discover whatever was happening.
And Rher probably enjoyed seeing him struggle, that sadistic bastard.
'Fuck you, Rher!' he internally shouted.
~BAM~
He hit a middle-sized rock (that clearly wasn't there five seconds ago) and fell to the ground.
"FUCK YOU, RHER," he repeated while shielding his face, and this time nothing happened.
But it looked like this wasn't such an unfortunate event, because as soon as he got up, Stark noticed that a wallet had fallen off from his pants.
He was wearing some kind of school uniform currently, but there was only some golden sigil on it, nothing that could confirm the location of his school.
A wallet on the other hand was everything he needed, plus, after noticing the wallet, he touched his other pocket and realized he also had a phone.
"YAHOO!"
He opened the wallet, and inside were four things: his student card, a credit card, a debit card and a note reading: "have fun exploring this world!"
'Soooo funny…' he groaned before tearing up the paper and grabbing the student card.
Apparently he was a student of the 'Lotus' academy, which was some middle school for supposed 'class' prodigies.
'Bro definitely got in thanks to connections, no other way,' Stark smiled, after all wasn't he supposed to be classless, "Oh! But that reminds me, can't I check my status window?"
The paper that was on the ground suddenly formed back to its original state, and a giant 'yes' was written on the back.
"Status window, I guess, then…"
And surprisingly, it did work…

chapters.title: Chapter 4 - 4: Getting Basic Information
chapters.content:
As Stark called out for his status window, a semi-transparent display appeared in front of him, showing his information.
This was something that every single person in this world had: a status window to check their skills and such.
Seeing the panel, Stark sighed in relief, at least it meant he wasn't THAT weak (or at least he thought).
And so, he began reading.
[Name:] Stark Heartsouls
'They didn't have the inspiration to pick a better surname, did they…'
[Level:] 1
[Health:] 10/10
'…'
[Bloodline:] Human
[Class:] Classless
[Talent:] Chosen one
'Huh…' Stark guessed that he had indeed been chosen by Rher, so not that surprising.
[Attributes:] Strength 3; Speed 2; Mind/Soul 14; Stamina 4; Defense 3
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel (locked)
'I guess that's all…' he sighed, none of this was exceptional except for maybe the locked skill, but he would need to unlock it somehow…
[Commentary from Rher:] Hurrendous stats, might have made a mistake in summoning you…
'Appreciate the feedback my guy.'
…
[Skill: Spatial Inventory]
[Type:] Passive Skill
[Level:] Cannot be upgraded since it is not combat related.
[Description:] This skill is always active, and allows the user whenever he wants to put or take out objects inside of an inventory space only accessible to him (and no, you can't go inside yourself).
…
[Class Wheel]
[Type:] Chosen One (locked)
[Description:] ???
…
'Damn,' Stark was surprised to see he actually had something decent in hand, he didn't get a system as everyone seemed to be able to check this panel, but it was good enough…
He then grabbed the phone that was in his pocket, it was his only way of finding basic information after all.
'Oh, password protected…' he was met with a wall, and unfortunately enough, the classless boy didn't put on fingerprint recognition, meaning he was essentially locked out of the phone except if he found the code in less than five attempts.
"Well… I found the name of the middle school he was in, so it doesn't really matter," Stark shrugged.
'Lotus' Academy seemed to be a weird name for a school, but it made sense considering it was supposed to be one that harbored prodigies with powerful 'classes', or something like that…
Stark had his doubts about the middle school he was supposed to be attending.
Plus wasn't there some big event in two days?
In the end, he realized that he wouldn't be able to figure it out by himself, and instead took a taxi.
"To 'Lotus' Academy," he ordered the driver.
"Hey, wait a minute… weren't you the one that threw that guy from the building…-" the driver tried to say.
"To Lotus Academy, PLEASE," but Stark just repeated his words.
"Oh well… as long as i'm paid."
Through this discussion, Stark realized that the helicopters and cameras that were pointed at him had truly been broadcasting everything for the whole city, if not country (whatever they are), to see.
***
It took him 40 minutes, and he had to pay a good amount of money, but in the end, he had reached his one and only hint as to what the fuck was happening: the Lotus Academy, which was also his middle-school.
The Lotus Academy was a grand school with intricate carvings and pillars, a giant lotus above the entrance. The surrounding area was lush with greenery, with a large fountain at the center of the courtyard.
There was also a giant screen at the top, with many videos of students fighting one another being broadcasted for all passersby to see.
'Huh…' Stark looked at his surroundings for a few seconds before deciding it was time to enter.
There seemed to be nobody around since school must have ended a few hours ago, but as the gates were still open, there was no reason to hesitate.
"Who's trying to enter at this hour?" A muscular man with brown hair appeared from behind the gate as Stark tried to pass, and even he was surprised to see the black-haired classless boy, "Stark? Why are you here?"
"Library," he answered with no hesitation in his voice.
"Oh…" the man scratched his head, even he seemed uncomfortable speaking to him, "It's weird seeing you come back to school after it ended, but yeah… you do you…"
Stark nodded, and as he made his way into the academy, he couldn't help but roll his eyes.
There was nobody in the luxurious looking hallways, but just the aura in the inside of the school made it obvious it wasn't one anyone could enter if they didn't have the power/connections to.
He just followed the signs that directed to the 'Library', and after a few minutes found himself in front of two wooden doors.
He pushed them open and was met with rows upon rows of towering bookshelves, each filled to the brim with ancient tomes and modern textbooks.
Stark wandered through the aisles, his fingers trailing along the spines of the books as he scanned the titles, and after a few minutes, he picked out three different ones.
"Classes for beginners"
"Basic information about combat"
"Important events of the world"
'I hope they give me the needed information…' he sat on one of the available tables with the three books.
But as he was ready to sit down, he turned his head to the left, noticing he wasn't the only one in the library.
"…" A blonde-haired girl was staring at him with a confused expression on her face, almost as if she couldn't believe that he was here.
"What?" before beginning his long lecture, he asked this question as he didn't appreciate that gaze on him.
Taken aback, the girl immediately went back to reading the book between her hands, "Hmft~ Nothing, don't get cocky!"
'What the fuck is wrong with people in this world,' he sighed before opening the first page of a book.
***
(A few hours later)
As the sun began to set, casting a warm golden glow over the landscape, Stark stretched his hands backwards, releasing a content sigh.
The third and final book was finished, and with it came a newfound understanding of his surroundings.
"Ah~ I guess it's a bit more clear now… huh…"
He now understood what was happening around him, and how all of this came to be, but it would have honestly been better if Rher just told him beforehand.
Basically…
The world he was in was named 'Rheria', with the country named Fellarburg being his current location.
In this world, every human possessed a unique power or ability known as a "class". It was these classes that set them apart from one another.
But Rheria was not without its dangers. Most of the outside world was infested with monsters, forcing the population to seek safety within the 28 countries scattered throughout the land.
These countries were immense in size, providing ample space for their inhabitants.
The reason for the sudden appearance of powers is unknown, but apparently it had always been like this since the beginning, no asteroids hitting the heart or sudden apparition of rifts/towers to other worlds…
This was just basic information.
But the things that interested Stark the most were…
The many classes that were present in this world.

chapters.title: Chapter 5 - 5: The Classes
chapters.content:
After understanding the situation around this world, Stark immediately went to learn about the classes and powers that were available.
Instead of the normal stuff where everyone could get their own skills and improve depending on what they choose to persue, this world was extremely different from the rest.
Basically: there are 10 classes, and chosen individuals gets placed into one of them (or none if they don't meet the requirements), thus determining their abilities and destiny.
The classes are the same for everybody, but it is the inner talent and skills that make the difference.
Stark read more about these classes, and as he absorbed the information, he understood more and more why Stark's family seemed to judge him as incompetent.
Most of the population don't unlock a class as it is something rare and for powerful individuals, but his family seemed to be one of 'soul wielders', while on the otherhand he was just one of the 'people'.
In this world, most people dream to get a class and become 'Classifiers', which is the name for people who fight monsters and have powers.
And the ten classes of this world are…
…
[Magus:] master magicians with the power to control elements and cast powerful spells, the spells can be extremely different between each individual, making everyone unique in their own way.
[Exorcist:] specialists in banishing evil/cursed spirits and curses, possessing abilities to purify their surroundings and protect others from malevolent forces (mainly fight demons and use divine power).
[Beast Tamer:] able to summon and control beasts, both magical and mundane, they can create alliances with these creatures to aid in battle and exploration, the more powerful their beasts, the more powerful the tamer is.
[Warrior:] One of the most common classes people get, but still a fairly powerful one as they possess incredible physical strength, durability, and combat skills. They specialize in close-quarters combat and have a wide variety of melee techniques at their disposal.
[Assassin:] Skilled in stealth, sabotage, and assassination, they are masters of the shadows and can slip past guards undetected, silently eliminating their targets with a deadly precision.
[Archer:] Specializing in the use of ranged weapons, primarily bows and arrows, they possess a high degree of accuracy and can strike from a distance with lethal force (strangely enough, apparently some of them use their abilities on guns).
[Soul Wielder:] Ability to summon the power of your soul and materialize your heart in front of you, your abilities depend on your heart and willpower, it is one of the most mysterious classes and also one of the rarest ones.
[Alchemist:] Able to create potions with different effects, they can both sell them or use them in battle to support others or themselves, potion effects can vary from individual to individual, allowing Alchemists to even fight in close-ranged combats with the right potions and ingredients.
[Succubus/Incubus:] Control the desires of others through their charm and allure, they can drain energy from their victims through physical contact, although most people in this class use it for sex work and to enjoy a luxurious life since they are the most demanded people in dating/mariage.
[???:] The last and final class has almost no information because of how rare it is, people who have it do not showcase its powers, the rarest class of them all.
…
'Yo, can I get the incubus class?' Stark asked, it would be really great if he could enjoy himself.
But of course, he got no response, taking it as a 'no'.
During his entire stay in the library, Stark felt the stare of the blonde-haired girl on him as she would steal quick glances at him every few seconds under her book, then would act as if nothing was wrong when he turned his eyes toward her.
'Welp, there's also that 'Class Showcase' thing that's coming up, really annoying and dangerous…'
Many people would die during that event since they only wanted the 'best of the best' to be picked, but Stark had just come to this world and had no class, meaning he was probably at the top of the 'about to die' list.
'I can always ditch it anyway,' he shrugged, although it would become difficult to find a place in this unknown world after.
And as for how the event would go… well… he would need to see by himself during this fateful day.
'Well, I guess that's it for today,' he sighed and got up from his seat.
Noticing that the blonde-haired girl was still staring at him, he just smiled and headed toward the exit door.
He didn't know his relationship with her, so he didn't take any risks, being friendly wouldn't advantage him anyway, not after being almost killed and kicked out by his family from their home.
"Goodbye," he still spoke as to be respectful and then left.
Stark found a hotel nearby afterward, and thanks to the credit card he had, he was able to pay a room for the next few days, although he would need to pay them back at some point.
He didn't waste time as he got in his room and immediately went to bed, not even bothering to change as he didn't have any other clothes beside his uniform.
Stark was dropped to the bottom, classless, with no friends or allies, and now he would have to build himself back up.
"Yawn~" he stared at the ceiling of his pitch black room, and slightly smiled, "I guess i'll figure it out somehow…"
This was how his first day in this new world went, and although he had only found the most basic of information and still had no power (because Rher was a narcissistic greedy bitch, I mean, the guy has the world based on his name), he was still confident in his abilities.
***
(The next day)
When the sun began to appear in the sky, Stark opened his eyes.
Although the 'Class Showcase' was tomorrow, he still needed to attend class apparently, it would help him pass the time and gather more info anyway, so he didn't care.
He took a shower and then wore back the same uniform while leaving his room, he didn't have a backpack, but honestly who cares.
…
[Skill: Class Wheel]
[Type:] Chosen One (locked)
[Description:] ???
…
He inspected that panel while taking the walk to the school, but found nothing that indicated any way to unlock it, maybe it would come out later.
On the way to 'Lotus' Academy, he noticed many other people wearing the same uniform as him, although most of them either ignored his presence or when they looked at him had uncomfortable looks on their faces.
He entered the school but had a hard time finding his class (it took him one failed attempt for a teacher to tell him), and then he finally reached it.
-Class 3A-
The door was opened as people were still entering, and so he did just like them.
But when he took the first step inside the class…
All eyes fell on him.
"Holy shit…"
"He showed himself again?"
"Does he have a death wish?"
Such were the whispers that filled the room as Stark walked in.
But even in his past life, he wasn't the type to care about such things, so instead he just took a seat at back and glanced at the outside world from the window.
And thus, his first day of class started.
[Countdown before the 'Class Showcase: 1 day]

chapters.title: Chapter 6 - 6: Duel Request
chapters.content:
As Stark sat in the classroom, trying to focus on the lesson being taught, he couldn't help but feel the weight of everyone's gaze on him.
It was clear that his arrival had stirred up some kind of reaction among his classmates as most of them had seen the video that was going around the internet of him tricking the other guy into falling off a building.
And after an hour of boring lessons he tried his hardest to listen to…
~SLAM~
The door of the classroom opened, and three guys entered it as if they were the kings.
Stark immediately noticed that one of the boys, who was also the leader, was the tanned blond-haired man he had tricked yesterday.
"Daniel, I won't allow you to cause havoc in my class," the teacher, a man in his mid-forties, who also looked used to this types of scenes, retorted.
But Daniel brushed him off, pointing his hand at Stark, "You, me, at the back of the school right after class ends, i'm finally going to end your pathetic life, you parasite."
"Holy shit… Daniel actually asked for a duel…?"
"Doesn't it mean he is gonna kill him?"
"I want to see that…!"
It seemed like people were excited to see the fight, and looking at Daniel's expression, it looked like he was ready to kill, his powers and family influence probably enough to let him get away with that.
But Stark wasn't impressed.
'Since when do tutorial bosses get second phases…' he sighed.
And without even taking the time to let him answer, Daniel and his little gang left as it wasn't their classroom.
'This guy was massively injured yesterday, and now he is back as if nothing happened… I guess there must be some powerful healers huh…'
The class continued for the rest of the day, but nobody could really focus as all they were waiting for was the upcoming confrontation where Daniel would decimate Stark.
Surprisingly, Stark was the only one that didn't look bothered by this at all, almost as if he didn't care.
And he actually didn't.
As the bell rang for the end of the day, the students began to file out of the classroom, chattering about the upcoming duel between Stark and Daniel.
It was the talk of the school.
"Yawn~" the black-haired boy in question slowly left the classroom too and then followed the crowd toward the back of the school, wanting to just win this fight and get this over with.
[Are you this confident you could win?]
This panel appeared before him, and he stopped for a few seconds to read it.
"Yeah," he replied before resuming to walk.
[Hm… Why are you this confident?]
"I don't know, I just am somehow, tutorials aren't that hard you know."
[It's not a- you know what, forget about it]
And then it disappeared.
Stark took the exit door then headed toward the courtyard, which was the 'back of the school' he guessed.
It was a massive open area surrounded by other middle-sized buildings, filled with benches and trees.
There were also many terrains used for different activities, but mainly for student fighting as it was part of the curriculum for them to train and improve their classes.
As he walked across it, he spotted Daniel and his gang waiting for him near the edge of a field, surrounded by at least two hundred students, and even some teachers.
Stark approached them, and noticing his presence, the students made way for him, then shortly closed the circle afterward, stopping a few feet away.
Daniel, the blond-haired boy, looked at Stark with a sneer, "So you actually came. Looks like I'll be entertaining myself today."
Stark raised an eyebrow and smirked, "Well, if we're going to do this, let's get it over with."
Sensing that this wouldn't lead to anything good, one of the teachers, a woman with brown hair that reached her waist and a very voluptuous body put herself between the two boys.
"There is no need to continue this charade, just forget about it and go back home," she shouted, mainly glancing at Stark as she was sure he would lose.
But Daniel didn't care about any of this, and instead he mumbled, "Duel request: Stark."
After whispering those words, a crimson panel appeared in front of Stark.
[Duel Request: Daniel]
[Type: Deathless]
[Y/N]
With a smirk on his face, Stark looked at the panel before responding, "Y."
Immediately, the panel vanished, and the students surrounding them fell silent.
The teacher, who was in the middle of the two boys, was ejected out of their circle in full force, then landed on the ground a few meters away.
A giant sphere had formed around Daniel and Stark: this was the arena of the duel, and nobody would be able to disturb them in there.
'Very game like, I wonder just how many more things like this will come up,' Stark scratched his chin.
[Commentary from Rher: My guy, aren't you scared? You have no class and your stats are much weaker…?]
'Nah, i'd win, plus i'm sure you wouldn't let me just die like this, would you?' he grinned.
[…Yeah]
A countdown then appeared above their 'arena'.
[5…4…3…2…1…]
[GO!]
And right at the countdown ended, Stark got two notifications.
~Ding~
~Ding~
…
[New Skill: Perception]
[Type:] Passive Skill
[Level:] Cannot be upgraded since it is not combat related.
[Description:] This skill is always active, and allows the user to check the name, level, class, attributes and skills of the person in front of them (also items).
…
'Nice,' Stark didn't waste time and immediately used it to check Daniel.
[Name: Daniel Pridel]
[Level: 12]
[Class: Warrior]
[HP: 1250]
[Strength: 42]
[Speed: 27]
[Stamina: 64]
[Defense: 107]
[Skills: Strike; Force; Buff…]
'Okay… he is definitely way stronger than me…' Stark was actually surprised the difference was this blatant.
But before Stark could even check out the second notification he had gotten, Daniel summoned his steel sword from thin air then dashed toward him.
Seeing him come at him at full speed, Stark realized he wouldn't be able to avoid it like he did last time.
'I have made a severe and continuous lapse in my judgment,' he was mainly speaking to Rher while smirking.
[Do not fret, everything will be fine]
~SLASH~
Daniel used [Strike] and hit Stark in the stomach, causing him 374 points of damage, which was way more than his measly 10HP.

chapters.title: Chapter 7 - 7: The Domination Class
chapters.content:
Stark dropped to the ground on his two knees, blood pouring out from the wound as Daniel removed his blade.
"Pathetic loser, I should have done this the moment I saw you," he knew Stark couldn't have had more than 374 HP as he was extremely weak, so once he saw those numbers above his head, he knew it was game over.
"I guess that's it…"
"Not even that interesting, huh…"
"What the fuck did you expect, it's like putting a toddler agaisn't a pitbull…"
But no… this couldn't be the end, not after all that confidence Stark had given.
After all… there was no way he would just let himself die like this.
…
[Talent: Chosen One]
[Type:] Instant Use
[Perks:] #1 When the user receives critical damage, enough to kill him in one singular attack, he can use his talent and willpower to keep going, setting his HP to 1.
#2 Amidst your journey, your talent will bring forth many events, both good and bad.]
…
Stark smiled lightly once he realized he wasn't dead, just extremely injured.
[Health:] 1/10 (critical condition)
He decided to use this opportunity to check the second notification he had gotten, after all he was sure he wouldn't have gotten nothing while being sent to a world like this.
And as expected…
[Skill: Class Wheel UNLOCKED]
He grinned as he began reading the description.
…
[Class Wheel]
[Type:] Chosen One
[Level:] ULTIMATE
[Description:] When sent to another world using the power of a god, and when chosen by that god, a person is granted one simple talent and skill to aid them, this skill allows the user to spin the wheel of classes.
…
With determination blazing in his eyes, Stark watched as Daniel basked in his victory and reveled in the adoration of the suckers in the crowd.
But Stark refused to let this opportunity slip away. With a newfound skill burning at his fingertips, he knew he had one final chance to turn the tables.
'See, I told you I would get something,' Stark smiled.
"Class Wheel, activate!" he whispered.
And just like that, a giant colorful wheel appeared before him, each of its ten sections representing a class within this world, ranging from archer, to soul wielder to even incubus. It seemed to beckon to Stark, waiting for him to spin it and choose his fate.
Hovering next to the wheel was a pulsing level, adorned with the words "pull me" in bold letters.
'Welp, here goes nothing,' Stark smiled and raised his injured arm to pull the lever down.
~SPIN~
As the wheel began to spin, Stark looked up to see what he would get, it was basically like a gambling addiction except it would actually determine his entire future.
The wheel continued to spin, each colorful segment glowing brighter as it passed by, but nobody seemed to notice it, probably since it was only visible to the host.
While spinning, Stark took the time to notice all the classes available.
"Magus, Exorcist, Beast Tamer, Warrior, Archer, Assassin, Soul Wielder, Incubus, Alchemist and… Domination?" he had never read about a class named domination though, making him wonder if it was the ??? one that had little to no information.
A simple red arrow at the top middle of the wheel would determine which class he would be getting.
And after a few seconds… the wheel gradually began to slow down, making the pressure ten times as high.
'Come on… incubus or soul wielder…' he repeated those two classes in his head as it was the ones he really wanted (don't ask him why he wanted incubus).
When the wheel became slow enough for him to actively be able to read the names of the classes, he kept praying.
And after a few seconds…
~Fsssh~
'Oh my god, it's heading toward soul wielder!'
He was calculating the outcome, and by the low speed and position of the sections, it was indeed going to stop on that class.
Agaisn't all odds, the wheel stopped at the edge of soul wielder…
'YES!' he laughed.
But of course, it was Stark, it was a given he wouldn't be lucky.
The wheel had in fact not stopped moving, its speed was just so low it became almost invisible to the naked eye, and so the section moved, resulting in the arrow to move past Soul Wielder and stop at…
'Domination? Seriously?' he was frankly angry, he felt scammed, and wondered if he could get a second spin if he asked nicely enough.
[The host will be able to spin the wheel and unlock a new class once they reach level 25]
':('
[Domination is a good class]
':D'
Not wanting to waste any seconds, Stark decided to check his class description, making sure Daniel was still paying attention only to the crowd.
…
[Class: Domination]
[Description:] Each class has their strength and weaknesses, but this one is called 'domination' thanks to its ability, with enough training, to absolutely dominate all others, the rarest class of them all, but also the strongest.
[Class Effect:] Your life will become a living hell.
[Class Flaw:] The Domination Trial.
[Class Weapon:] Fists and Magic.
[Basic Skills:] Focus; Domination
…
'Thank you for the explanation my man, I understood absolutely NOTHING!' Stark nodded, still kneeling on the ground, but reading informations about his class made him realize he had also acquired two new skills.
…
[Skill: Focus]
[Type:] Basic Class Skill
[Level:] 1
[Description:] Increases the user's concentration and focus, allowing them to perform tasks more efficiently and with increased control, time seems to move in your favor.
…
[Skill: Domination]
[Type:] Basic Class Skill
[Level:] 1
[Description:] Ability to perfectly control the user's aura and use it to attack relentlessly, the amount of damage dealt to the opponent is completely based on the amount of aura used (it increases with level).
…
Even though Stark had no idea what any of these skills meant, he knew he had to try them out.
'Domination!'
He closed his eyes, and as soon as the skill activated, he felt a strange flow of aura around his body.
Without wasting any time, he subconsciously put his available aura around his hands and feet, a crimson light now radiating outwards in waves around them, then dashed toward Daniel, his speed now immensely increased from that.
Daniel, who was still basking in his victory, suddenly felt a shiver down his spine as if someone had just walked over his grave.
But he didn't even have the time to turn back that something hit his head with full force: it was Stark's fist.
"-827!" this number arose above Daniel's head as he fell face first to the ground, indicating the amount of damage he had taken from his available 1250 HP.
Stark had just taken two-thirds of his life from this singular attack.

chapters.title: Chapter 8 - 8: Flawless Victory
chapters.content:
'What the fuck?' Stark was surprised, he had not expected such a great amount of damage from a singular attack, but he guessed that attacking from behind and at the head did increase it.
When people fought monsters/people in this world, the amount of damage dealt was displayed for everyone to see, meaning that the entire crowd had seen the 827 appear as Stark hit Daniel.
"YOU FUCKER," Daniel didn't understand, but still having his steel sword in hand, he turned back and swung at Stark with the goal of ending him for good.
[Commentary from Rher: it would be adviced to stop this while possible to hide your powers, this could lead you to becoming more powerful and having less enemies]
'HAHAHA, you think i'm stopping now?' but Stark dismissed the idea, he wasn't a real fan of hiding his powers anyways, what use would there be to do that if he was gonna die?
'Focus!' Stark mumbled the name of his other skill, and suddenly his vision became clearer.
Before Daniel could even finish his attack, Stark was able to slightly see it coming, and although his speed stat was still very low, the domination and focus skills allowed him to just barely avoid the strike by backing away at the last second.
Even blocking an attack could cause him 1 point of damage and kill him, meaning even that wasn't option.
Daniel's eyes widened in disbelief as he failed to land a solid blow on Stark. He could feel the crowd's growing tension and shock, and the frustration welling up inside him.
Stark using his perception skill could see the amount of health Daniel had left.
[HP:] 423/1250
This meant that the next person to hit the other would be declared the winner, making the pression between the two fighters grow even more.
'Time to end this,' Stark smiled.
Daniel on the other hand was losing it: he had always been considered one of the strongest in 'Lotus' Academy, and although he hadn't started his 'classifier' life yet, he was still fairly respected by all.
Girls were all over him and boys didn't dare to defy him, no matter what he said.
And yet… Stark, the one he always considered to be the weakest, was here, humiliating him in front of others.
"WIPE THAT SMIRK OFF YOUR FACE," he was actually going insane, and so without waiting no more, he dashed toward Stark.
":)" Stark had indeed been smiling the whole time, enjoying the view as the boy that tried to kill him twice already was struggling.
Surprisingly enough, the more Stark was in control of the situation, the brighter and stronger his aura was getting, and he did notice it.
'I need to figure out how this works later…' he thought to himself.
~SLASH~
Daniel used both the [Buff] skill, which doubled his stats, and [Strike] to attack Stark.
But the black-haired boy saw it coming using Focus, closing his eyes as he avoided the second attack from Daniel, which missed its target again.
"YOU-"
Stark saw the window of opportunity as Daniel was still recovering from his failed strike.
He crouched in front of the 180cm tall boy, then focused all his aura into his right hand for this final attack.
And then…
"CYA!" Stark, with sweat pouring down his forehead, laughed again.
Daniel's eyes widened as he saw Stark below him, positioned in a way that indicated he was about to attack from below.
He couldn't see the aura around Stark, but all his senses screamed for him to run away or abandon the duel now.
"HELP-" he tried to scream, but nobody would be able to hear him from this distance, plus most of them were so focused on the fight they couldn't hear him speak.
"But nobody came," Stark answered as he was the only one that heard his pleads.
~BAM~
Stark with a sudden movement began uppercuting Daniel in the chin, and of course, the clueless 15 year old wasn't able to do anything against such a fast attack.
"-1281!"
Daniel was sent flying against the edge of the arena, hitting it in full force as he received the entirety of his life in that singular attack.
[HP:] 0/1250
And this meant…
[Winner: Stark Heartsouls]
"Playboys like you need to stay put and learn their places!" he smiled.
Giant green text appeared above the arena for everyone to see, but most of them were too shocked to even say anything, unable to comprehend the scene before them.
Stark, THE WEAK STARK, had just beaten Daniel?
Some even rubbed their eyes, thinking that it must be a joke.
But everything was reality, and once the transparent sphere that kept the two fighters safe from other people's interruptions disappeared, many students and teachers went to check on Daniel.
Many thought that he would get up and get angry like usual, or maybe shout at the teachers.
But no…
The type of this duel was 'Deathless', meaning that the two would fight to the death, then be revived afterward, it is like some sort of 'all in' fight where people could use all their powers without risking death
And that meant…
"He is just unconscious…" one of the teachers announced after checking his pulse, after all a deathless match meant even if your HP dropped to zero, you wouldn't die.
And so right after the news, all eyes fell on Stark.
"Why are you all so surprised? Of course the main character would beat the tutorial boss, wouldn't he?" he grinned, confident that what he did was good.
[You are not a main character, and this isn't a tutorial boss, but whatever, good job!]
Maybe hiding his powers was the better move in the long term since most wouldn't suspect the poor little Stark to have any classes, and maybe even believe that the first damage he had caused to Daniel was luck, but now that he had beaten him, there was absolutely no doubt there was something strange going on.
'Oh well… I usually loved to boast about my work at my company, so it doesn't matter,' he had taken his personality as an office worker to this new world.
[You have absolutely destroyed that fool "Daniel Pridel", gaining 1471 experience points!]
[Experience: 1000/1000]
Stark was enveloped in a golden glow as he noticed that he had reached the needed amount of experience to level up.
Beating someone in a duel would of course mean some sort of reward (or else people might just abuse them to train), and in this case Stark had effectively stolen some of Daniel's experience, although not much since he hadn't killed him.
[Your level has increased to level 2, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Current level: level 2]
[Experience: 471/5000]
'Nice, seems like everything works out in the end, this is what I call a good ending,' Stark was happy with himself.
But once he looked away from his screen panels to check his surroundings, he noticed all the surprised, scared, and astonished gazes on him.
"What?" he asked, taking all of them aback.

chapters.title: Chapter 9 - 9: The Awakening
chapters.content:
Everyone in the courtyard, both students and teachers alike, knew the sight of someone's level going up since they experienced it at least once, or because they had seen someone else online.
But what scared them the most in this situation, was the fact the first time Stark had level up was from beating up Daniel in a duel, and he didn't even seem to care.
Amidst the stunned silence, a few whispers began to ripple through the crowd, their voices barely above a whisper.
"A monster…?"
"What the fuck just happened?"
"Daniel got beaten?"
Stark was slightly tired from the encounter, and sensing that his first day of school had been greatly spent improving his abilities, he decided that it was time to head back home.
[Good job, now everyone knows about your 'powers']
'I don't think anyone is gonna expect me to be from the domination class though as it is so rare…'
[…Fair enough]
"Yawn~" Stark stretched his arms, "But wait… doesn't that mean I wouldn't have died even if he killed me?"
He just understood what 'deathless' meant, yet in the end decided it didn't matter whether Daniel would be revived or not, he had done his part.
But as soon as he took the first step toward the exit…
"Huh…?" his pupils started burning, as if they were set on fire, resulting in him putting his hands over his eyes.
"AAAAAAAAA-" he was screaming, taking aback everyone, his entire body surrounded by a crimson aura.
Using his quick thinking to try and find an explanation to what the hell was happening, Stark's mind immediately went toward the information he had acquired in the books from the library.
His body was still burning, the aura now spread throughout everything, even his hair feeling like it was set on fire.
[Information about classes: when someone awakens a class, they will, in most cases, immediately collapse because of the power they just acquired, the duration of sleep completely depends on the person, but it is said the faster a person wakes up, the stronger their class and potential is (although that doesn't mean they will be the strongest)]
[Some people actually fail their awakening even after unlocking their classes, making them just like the rest of people, and some don't even wake up since their potential or mana is just too low]
[Additional info: it has been recorded that the world record for fastest awakening (which is currently held by Miss.Catherine, also named 'The Dragon Tamer') is of one day and three hours.]
The fact Stark stayed up long enough to finish the battle was already a miracle.
'But wait… doesn't that mean there is a big chance I miss the 'Class Showcase' if I don't wake up…?' Stark thought as he fell to his knees, the pain had become quite numb now, but his mind was screaming for him to just close his eyes and succumb to the tiredness.
And so he did.
He collapsed to the ground in front of everyone's surprised gazes.
***
(3 hours later)
"…"
As Stark opened his eyes, the fiery aura surrounding him slowly dissipated, completely seeping into his body for him to use.
Meaning that he had indeed been capable of acquiring the 'domination' class, but it wasn't unexpected either since he had already been capable of using it.
As he checked his surroundings, he noticed he was located in some sort of infirmary, the sun was beginning to go down, but he guessed that it was still the afternoon.
"How long has it been?" this was his biggest worry, after all, he really wanted to participate during the class showcase as it would allow him to gain more power.
"Around three hours," a feminine voice answered his question.
"Oh, well, I guess it's fine, WAIT WHAT," he turned his gaze toward a chair located to his bed side, and there sat the blonde-haired girl he saw at the library yesterday.
"…"
Looking up close, she was extremely beautiful, and most girls would be jealous of her impressive figure, but Stark wasn't interested in any of that for now.
He immediately got out of the bed he had been resting on.
"I carried you here by myself since nobody wanted to touch you, but it seems like it wasn't bad," she was reading a book while talking to him.
'Is she expecting some kind of reward for helping me out…? Or maybe a favor from me in the future?' Stark felt like receiving such kindness out of nowhere was extremely weird.
[Outstanding determination, only three hours sleeping after an awakening? I might have made the right decision picking you]
'Oh yeah that's true, although she doesn't look surprised…' he was talking about the girl beside him.
[Most people wouldn't even believe you if you told them you awakened in three hours, so they must believe it's just a coma after exhausting yourself with Daniel]
'WAIT, DOES THAT MEAN?'
[Yes, although you have shown incredible power, many people think you cheated or got the luckiest battle of your life]
"HOW DOES THAT EVEN MAKE SENSE," he shouted, absolutely furious his efforts were reduced to mere 'luck', even in his past, Stark really enjoyed being praised.
"Huh?" the blonde-haired girl looked at him as though he was crazy.
"Nothing," he began heading toward the exit of the infirmary, and the girl that was sitting on the chair didn't even bother to glance at him.
And then, he left…
As soon as he closed the door behind him though, the girl that had taken care of him for the past hours closed down the book between her hands and let out a deep sigh.
"What the hell was that?" she kept thinking about the feeling she had gotten while carrying Stark here, it was an unexplainable power that was emitting from him.
"Pfft~ cheater, investigate him!"
"Maybe he used the power he would get during his entire life for that?"
She heard such talk from others, but deep inside, she felt like this couldn't be it, there was no way someone could do 800 points of damage out of nowhere.
Although she didn't believe he had gotten a class either since he hadn't awakened all this time, plus he was sleeping only for three hours, which was a day below the world record, but maybe it was something else?
"Well…" after waiting five minutes, she got up from her seat and began heading toward the exit, "the beginning of our classifiers lives is tomorrow, so I need to be full of energy and mana to make sure everything is fine…"

chapters.title: Chapter 10 - 10: The Class Showcase
chapters.content:
Stark woke up in the morning feeling refreshed, he just had gotten the best night of sleep ever, even in his previous life he couldn't sleep much because of work, but everything in here seemed fine.
Except for the fact 5 seconds later he remembered that today was the 'big' day.
Not only was it his graduation ceremony from 'Lotus' Academy, but this also meant he would have to participate in this 'Class Showcase' event to continue his life in this world.
He had absolutely no way of knowing what could happen there except for the book he had read two days ago, but he had the overall gist of it.
He took a shower, ate some food he had bought from a convenience store nearby, then left, yet again with the same school uniform.
Once outside, he remarked that many people weren't wearing his school uniform, instead opting for armors and clothes with powerful materials (at least for their levels), they also didn't have their usual backpacks, instead they were carrying ones filled with items, and also had their weapons in hand, showing them to others.
Some had small animals/creatures on their shoulders (beast tamer), while others had a wooden cross in hand (exorcist).
Stark on the other hand had nothing, his only weapon were his fist, and he would make sure to beat up everything in his way, he was especially angry after yesterday since most people didn't even consider his performance yesterday as legit.
***
Once in front of the school gates, he saw text written on the giant screen at the top of the academy.
[Head to the gymnasium if you are a third year]
Following the crowd of people, he found himself in front of the giant building, many teachers beside the doors to welcome the students.
There were at least three hundred people inside the gymnasium, all third years who would participate in the 'Class Showcase' and hopefully become stronger.
And after a few minutes inside, minutes where the atmosphere was filled with talking and flexing, the doors of the gymnasium closed, and all the lights went off.
Suddenly, everything became silent as all the students were looking at the stage that had been set.
The 'Class Showcase' wasn't the only interesting part about this whole ordeal, it was also the fact that the group 'Golden Dragons' would be the ones to explain the event and bring them there.
Golden Dragons are a mercenary group specialized in the development of the youth, with the sole goal of making the new classifiers stronger and increasing their chances of survival in the 'rifts'.
Obviously, all their members were extremely powerful and famous, many of them envied by many.
'…' Stark stared at stage with a blank expression, and a few seconds later…
~FLASH~
Five golden pillars of light appeared on it, and what came out of them were three men and two women, each with their respective outfits and weapons in hand, all looking powerful.
"Oh my god!"
"Is that Yuli, the heart master?"
"And that's Alex, the ice magus!"
While most people were amazed by their sudden appearance, the one in the middle, a man in his mid-forties with short white-hair as well as a monocle cleared his throat, resulting in the entire gymnasium to go silent.
"Today is a big day for all of you, it is the start of your lives as classifiers," he began his speech, his voice filled with authority, "I know many have only been dreaming of this moment all this time, but do not forget that fighting is not a game, and that you will truly be risking your lives today."
Next to him, a woman with long blue hair and magnificent ocean-colored eyes stared at the students, a staff in her hand, "The rift you will be going to today, as most of you know, is a beginner level one called 'City Ruins', the recommended level is 5 to 15, so it is advised to be within that range, but i'm sure most of you already are!"
"Wait a damn second," Stark stopped for a few seconds to check his status.
[Level:] 2
'…' he shrugged, 'Oh well…'
"You, as well as many other recognized middle schools from Fellarburg will be participating in this event, as you may all know, the best performing people will probably have all eyes on them, so I advise you to try your best, while also making sure not to die, there is no second life after all," the man in the middle continued, a bittersweet smile on his face, a sign that he had seen hundreds of people die already in front of him.
Through the books he had read, Stark realized that there wasn't just one academy in Fellarburg, instead there were dozens of them, each of them specialized in their own classes or future professions.
Meaning that most of the population that wanted to improve their skills without going to an academy would need to move away, be scouted by a powerful teacher/guild, or just keep going solo/creating a party.
And so just like that, the Golden Dragons' speech ended.
Following that, the students inside the gymnasium were guided toward several buses that were set outside the school to guide them toward the first rift.
Rifts in this world are basically like dungeons where monsters and items spawn, they are a portal to other worlds, and each of the recognized ones are classed by level and difficulty.
There are seven difficulties: Beginner, Novice, Advanced, Hell, Nightmare, Determination, Death.
Thankfully enough, the first one was only a beginner level with a 5-15 level requirement.
But this didn't mean this was easy, far from that, it was only the first one they would need to go through, and even then, many will succumb to the monsters.
Without delay, all students boarded a bus heading towards Leforia, which is located southeast to Fellarburg.
As they drew closer to Leforia, all the students inside the vehicles felt a surge of excitement, and even Stark wasn't spared from that.
For many, it was the first time they were going to get first-hand experience in combat as most only got to their levels using their wealth.
'Pay to win bullshit…' Stark groaned as he looked out the window, the seat beside him was empty as no one wanted to sit next to him.
The bus journeyed on, and before long, they reached their destination.
When they did, the sun had already begun descending, announcing the fact the afternoon was soon to end.
They were now just outside what was called the 'safe zone', every single rift was outside of it, making it impossible for anyone to go without at least risking their lives just a bit.
Not far from them, many corpses of decaying creatures eliminated by the Golden Dragons were resting, making everyone realize the extent of what they were going to do from now on.
"If anyone wants to give up, speak now or silence yourself forever!" Oliver, the leader of the Golden Dragons spoke, "There will be no help inside the rift, and I can promise you way too many new classifiers die before even completing it."
But nobody spoke, they had gone too far to give up now, plus it was either completion and improvement, or the risk of being disowned or kicked out of their family home.
In front of the students was a giant ruin, obscured by a dark aura everyone could sense, no matter their levels.
It was the [City Ruins] dungeon!
Noticing no one was moving, Oliver smiled, "It is great to see such determination, you may now do whatever you feel is right."
And just like that, they were allowed to move around now.
'…' Stark stared at the ruins before him, a face full of excitement, 'Welp, it's now or never, who cares if they don't believe in my capabilities, I don't need them anyway…'

chapters.title: Chapter 11 - 11: City Ruins
chapters.content:
As soon as the Golden Dragons and all other adults disappeared using some intricate spells, all that was remaining around the ruins were students from many different middle schools, making their numbers range in the thousands.
Instantly, the surroundings became alike to some kind of market or guild, many people asking for others to create a party with them, and others selling items they brought just for this occasion.
Stark on the otherhand wasn't asked to join any party, and no one even tried to sell him anything.
But he didn't mind, he only smiled at the sight of all these people try their hardest.
'It's fine… because I have my incredible system!'
[Commentary from Rher: you don't have a system, you have to work just as hard if not harder than them or you'll just die]
'…'
Stark was one of the first people to approach the entrance of the [City Ruins] and entering it.
As he passed through the dungeon entrance, it felt like his consciousness was slapped.
And when he opened his eyes, he found himself in another world.
The sun was burning bright in the sky, and instinctively, Stark looked up to check it out.
But…
'Huh?' the sun wasn't normal, not at all, it didn't have its orangeish color, instead…
It was completely black, casting not its usual light on the world below, but an eerie darkness that made it just enough to see.
His [Perception] skill automatically activated as he looked at it.
[Black Sun: Capable of transforming dead humans into monsters, the power of its rays slowly but surely infects others, so it is recommended to always be on the lookout]
[Tip: look for a bonfire every now and then]
Stark then switched his attention from the sun to his surroundings, and he immediately understood why it was called the [City Ruins].
The entire area was covered in broken and decaying buildings, as well as abandoned cars, the ruins of a once-great city.
Piles of rubble and debris filled the streets, and the air was heavy with the stench of decay and the absence of life.
Shadows hid all sorts of lurking threats, and the silence was broken only by the distant sound of battle.
Stark took a deep breath, feeling the tension building in his chest. This was the first challenge he would need to face in this world, and no one would be here to help him, so he would need to solo this dungeon by himself.
This meant more danger, but also more rewards and experience point, and he was ready to take that risk.
With a determined nod, Stark set off into the ruins, his eyes scanning the surroundings for any signs of danger.
He was getting ready to encounter his first monster and see if he was truly capable of dealing with all the shit in this world.
After all, fighting a human was one thing, but fighting monsters with unexplainable appearances was something he had only seen in novels.
It didn't take long for him to encounter his first ever monster in this world though.
As he walked through the seemingly empty streets of the ruined city, he heard noise in front of him, and suddenly, three creatures appeared from behind a corner.
[Name: Decaying Corpses (Black Sun curse)]
[Level: 6]
[HP: 850]
[Strength: 32]
[Stamina: 192 (they don't get tired easily)]
[Speed: 8]
[Defense: 28]
[Skills: Infect; Bite]
'850 HP…' Stark repeated, his eyebrows raised, it was extremely tough even for a level 6 monster, not that he knew anyway.
Plus, the thing that worried him the most was the fact that he could only use his fists as weapons, meaning he would have to approach them no matter what.
Thankfully enough, their speed was extremely low, and their defense not so great either.
And so without hesitation, he focused his thoughts on the battle ahead.
"Domination, activate!" he whispered the words, and suddenly the same aura that had aided him against Daniel surrounded his legs and hands.
Not wanting to waste time, Stark dashed at the monsters, and before they could even attack…
~SLAM~
"-928!"
He hit the first one in the head, causing it to die with a single attack.
It was an instant-kill.
Surprised, Stark backed away to look at his fist again, it was still surrounded by that aura, but it shone brighter than before, a sign that he was starting to dominate the battle.
Without any delay, Stark charged at the remaining two Decaying Corpses.
They were caught off guard by his sudden attack, and the aura in his fists dealt massive damage to both of them.
"-953! -856!" Stark punched them in quick succession, eliminating the last two monsters with ease.
The air was heavy and still, the devastated street silent once more.
Stark examined the bodies of the Decaying Corpses, his eyes narrowing as he noticed a strange symbol inscribed on them.
'What is this, some sort of mark left by the curse of the Black Sun?' he wondered, his curiosity piqued, but eventually didn't put much more thought into it as he would need to keep going if he didn't want to get ambushed.
[You have slain three "decaying corpses lvl6", gained 1800EXP!]
'Phew…' He sighed, it would have been devastating if he failed to even defeat a single one of the weaker monsters, but thankfully he was able to deal massive amounts of damage, almost crossing the 1000 mark.
He continued his way through the streets as he was officially now in the area where monsters would constantly appear to stop him.
He also felt the rays of the black sun on him, but luckily they didn't seem to affect him, yet.
On his way, he encountered more decaying corpses and even some 'cursed dogs', the same symbol was on them when he inspected their dead bodies.
[You have slain two "decaying corpses lvl6", gained 1200EXP]
[You have slain four "cursed dogs lvl7", gained 2884EXP]
Each of these horrifying creatures were extremely fast, enough to almost take Stark by surprise the first time he encountered them, but thankfully enough he was able to avoid them quite easily when his eyes were on them.
Their HP was also lower than the decaying corpses, allowing him eliminate them in one hit too.
[Your level has increased to level 3, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Experience: 1355/10000]
He hadn't paid much attention to it before, but he realized he had gotten something called 'skill points', and so he wanted to check what they were.
…
[Skill Points]
[Description: Able to allocate one to upgrade a skill by one level, once used, it is impossible to get them back, so make sure to use them wisely]
[In Inventory: 2]
…
'Hm…' he thought, 'well, I guess can try that…'
But right as he was about to try, he heard a heart wrenching scream behind him.

chapters.title: Chapter 12 - 12: Defeating Monsters
chapters.content:
Stark hurriedly turned around, his heart racing as he saw a woman, her clothing tattered and torn, pinned down and attacked by five "decaying corpses".
'…' Stark stared at her as the monsters ate her up, it wasn't because he didn't want to save her that he didn't move, but because he knew it was already over.
Above the girl's head was the text [Black Sun Curse], meaning that she was already infected.
And as predicted, only a few seconds after she was pinned down and the monsters got up, the woman's skin turned a dark green color, and her expression became the same as the others.
She immediately got up and joined the group as they all noticed Stark's presence and dashed at him, although very slowly.
'Holy shit, isn't there too many of them…?' he had only fought groups of three/four monsters, but six was a battle he didn't expect.
The reality of the situation hadn't struck him yet, but he had just witnessed one of the other students among the group of new classifiers get killed and transformed into one of these beasts, something anyone would be terrified of if they saw it up close.
Yet Stark just readied his fists, the only thing in his mind was the battle ahead, not even caring about what happened in front of his eyes.
