Or maybe it was because he was too dense and that his priorities weren't set straight.
In the end, it didn't matter.
[Illay Mondel (Black Sun Curse)]
[Level: 9]
[HP: 950]
[Strength: 22]
[Stamina: 52]
[Speed: 23]
[Defense: 42]
[Skills: Infect; Bite]
Stark once using his [Perception] skill on her noticed that her stats were much different than the other 'decaying corpses', possibly because she was an actual human transformed by the black sun instead of an already made monster.
'Almost feels like i'm about to kill a real girl…' Stark squinted his eyes, but his determination didn't falter, after all he didn't know about the duel's 'deathless' type when he fought Daniel, fully expecting him to die.
Stark's domination power came from the fact he was confident/determined and that he would dominate his battles, a simple disorienting thought like this meant his power would be reduced.
With a furrowed brow, Stark focused on the task ahead, calculating the timing of his attacks to maximize efficiency.
He dashed at the six decaying corpses, his fists glowing with the same power that had helped him dominate the other fights.
It was extremely reckless to fight literal zombies that could transform you into one of them with a single bite of their mouths with your fists, but he didn't have any other choice.
He jumped in the air and smashed the transformed girl's head with both his fists.
"-1249!"
Her head was crushed by the attack, and she immediately fell to the ground.
"Rest in peace," Stark nodded before using the girl's body as a jump pad toward a second monster.
"-938!"
"-858!"
"-873!"
After a few hits, Stark was able to eliminate every monster that stood in his way.
By the end, he whipped the sweat off his forehead and smiled as it looked like he was actually capable of taking on this much monsters if he managed his movements well enough.
[You have slain five "decaying corpses lvl6", gained 3000EXP!]
[You have slain "Illay Mondel (cursed) lvl9", gained 1282EXP!]
[Experience: 5637/10000]
He surveyed the street once more, picking up on the faint whispers of darkness in the air, but thankfully enough, there wasn't anyone around here anymore, no monsters, no humans.
It had been around ten minutes since he entered the rift after all, so most people were still probably forming parties.
Stark planned to move on to the next area, but right as he was about to…
He noticed a faint glow beside the 'decaying corpses' bodies.
'…?' he was cautious, but when he saw something shining, Stark's brain immediately knew he wanted to check it out.
Approaching the source of the faint glow, he noticed it coming from a staff on the ground.
It was emitting a faint blue light, unlike the dark aura that lingered around the decaying corpses.
Curiosity piqued, he picked up the magic staff, using [Perception] to inspect it.
…
[Item:] Low-Level Magic Staff
[Type:] Staff
[Class:] Magus
[Tier:] Common
[Required Level:] 7
[Quality:] Bad
[Attributes:] None
[Special Perks:] None
…
'Hmm…' Stark observed the staff, and after reading about the information, he wanted to try something.
He held the staff with both hands, and then tried to pour his aura at the tip.
But right as he tried to do that…
[You cannot use this weapon with your current class]
Such a panel appeared in front of him.
Stark frowned and looked at the staff in his hands, then sighed, "I guess I can just sell it, I hope…"
"Spatial Inventory," he whispered these words, and suddenly, a void appeared beside him.
It seemed a bit small to fit the staff, but once he tried to put it inside, the hole grew in size, enough to accomodate for staff's size.
Instantly, the staff disappeared into his spatial inventory, and Stark let out a breath of relief.
It seemed like monsters were able to occasionally drop items, although it was rare, and the fact the human girl was just transformed increased his odds of getting her staff.
Stark had no idea about the value of any of these items, but it didn't matter, he would take everything with him, whether it was useful or not to his fights wasn't important as he could sell all of it.
Money was a big problem for him as he didn't have any.
And just like, Stark kept moving.
He was more advanced than almost all others participants of the "City Ruins" rift, going solo was risky, but it seemed like he was one of the only ones who went alone that survived, all others were too weak and at a disadvantage against this many monsters.
'Oh yeah… the skill points,' he immediately remembered about his idea before being interrupted by the group of 'decaying corpses', and so he opened his status window.
[Name:] Stark Heartsouls
[Level:] 3
[Health:] 100/100
[Bloodline:] Human
[Class:] Domination
[Info about class:] The first Domination Trial is coming soon, be ready…
'What the?' he raised his eyebrows, this wasn't here before, but quickly moved on.
[Talent:] Chosen one
[Attributes:] Strength 9; Speed 8; Mind/Soul 21; Stamina 11; Defense 7
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv1; Focus lv1
'I can only upgrade domination and focus it seems…' he was walking in the empty streets, now used to the eeriness of the ruined city.
[You have slain 'Black Rat lv7', gained 620EXP!]
He found a rat as big as a human in his way, and just hit its ugly face once to kill it.
'Welp, time to actually use the skill points now!'
[Skill Points: 2 Available]

chapters.title: Chapter 13 - 13: New Skill and Upgrades!
chapters.content:
Stark hesitated for a moment, pondering how to allocate his skill points.
He could upgrade domination all the way to level 3, or maybe upgrade both domination and focus to level 2…
In the end, he decided that it didn't matter as he would get more skill points as he leveled up.
[You have upgraded 'Domination' to level 2!]
[You have upgraded 'Focus' to level 2!]
With that, he should be slightly stronger than before.
[Note: Skills can only be upgraded up to level 10 (without a skill upgrade stone), the rest depends on stats, class, weapon and the strength of the skill]
'Domination should be a really powerful skill… shouldn't it?' after all he was able to do more than 1000 points of damage if he hit the enemy right.
Although he had no real way to know if it was more than others since he had only ever seen Daniel deal 357 to him.
[You have slain two "decaying corpses lvl6", gained 1200EXP]
[You have slain "cursed dog lvl7", gained 721EXP]
[You have slain two "Black Rats lvl7", gained 1240EXP!]
[Experience: 8798/10000]
Soon enough, Stark found himself in the level 10 area, there were no signs of life there either, just broken buildings and solitary, twisted trees that had been bent by the ravages of time.
With a deep breath, he stepped forward and the world around him turned darker than previously.
[The rays of the Black Sun seem to be hitting harder here, the monsters are stronger and more aggressive]
This explanative text appeared right as he entered, making him wonder if he shouldn't turn back and wait for other people to come as to increase his odds of safety.
But no…
"Get yourself together, Stark, these fools don't believe in you, and they would probably sacrifice you if it came to it," he slapped both his cheeks, and took a step toward the level 10 area of the [City Ruins].
As Stark continued his journey through the rift, he couldn't help but feel a sense of unease.
There weren't any decaying corpses, cursed dogs or black rats in here anymore, making it weird as he had gotten used to these fellas.
It didn't take long for the first creature to appear though.
As he passed in between two giant buildings, something grabbed his legs.
"-103!"
"Ouch!" he looked to see that a shadowy hand coming out of the ground had grabbed him and hurt his legs, some blood pouring out from them.
[Name: Shadow Figure]
[Level: 10]
[HP: 1100]
[Strength: 82]
[Stamina: 12]
[Speed: 105]
[Defense: 12]
[Skills: Grab; Shadow Step]
Seeing that its defense was extremely low, Stark took his chance and focused his aura around his leg before kicking the shadow in the face.
The "Shadow Figure" was a monster that could hide in between shadows to take classifiers by surprise, you would usually be able to see them because of their bright yellow eyes that were easily noticeable, but unfortunately enough, Stark had no experience so he didn't pay attention.
And as Stark attacked the shadow with his foot…
"-1427!"
The shadow vanished once it was killed.
'Holy shit, that's a lot of damage!'
[You have slain "Shadow Figure lv10", gained 1300EXP!]
And right afterward, he was surrounded by the familiar golden glow.
[Your level has increased to level 4, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Experience: 98/15000]
Stark was happy he was finally able to upgrade his level and become stronger, but the itch in his leg reminded of him of the sudden attack he had just survived.
[HP: 147/250]
'Hm,' his level was upgraded, and his HP also went up, but it seemed like he wasn't actually able to refill his health without the proper skills/items, meaning he would need to be extra careful.
[You have upgraded 'Domination' to level 3!]
He also didn't waste time and immediately upgraded his domination skill in case he forgot.
And so he kept going, his journey inside the dungeon far from over as the goal of all the participants was to defeat the boss.
The person that would defeat the boss would obviously get the dungeon rewards while also keeping their identity hidden since except if they were in a party, no one would really know.
Until then, everyone would have to keep fighting in the dungeon and risk their lives, the test not over it is confirmed that its boss was dead.
[You have slain "Shadow Figure lv10", gained 1300EXP!]
[You have slain "Decaying Corpse lv10", gained 1100EXP!]
[You have slain "Ghoul lv11", gained 1500EXP!]
…
[Your level has increased to level 5, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Experience: 550/25000]
…
Before long, Stark was able to reach level 5, enveloped by the familiar golden glow after killing more enemies.
Without a second thought, he decided to open up his panel to check his stats.
[Level:] 5
[HP:] 297/400
[Bloodline:] Human
[Class:] Domination
[Info about class:] The first Domination Trial is coming soon, be ready…
[Talent:] Chosen one
[Attributes:] Strength 17; Speed 14; Mind/Soul 26; Stamina 18; Defense 12
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv3; Focus lv2
…
'Hm…' Stark's stats had indeed improved, but what interested him the most was that he had unlocked a new skill.
[Level 5 Reached: please pick a card]
3 different cards appeared in front of him, the three of them painted with a grey color, their front impossible to see from his position, and although he tried to turn around, the cards would obviously just turn as well, making it impossible to check what they contained.
[Each of these cards hold a skill, choose one randomly]
'I'll have to try and get a mirror to see if I can cheat the system…' Stark's first thought as he saw the three cards was to find a way to cheat his way to success.
But realizing it wasn't possible for now, he took a deep breath and decided to take a chance. He reached out and picked one of the cards at random.
As he did, the card flipped over to reveal its front, showing a picture of a glowing fist.
…
[Skill: Aura Smash]
[Type: Uncommon]
[Level: 1]
[Description: Unleash a devastating punch that deals damage based on the amount of aura used, it is perfect for ranged enemies, and has a 30% chance to stun the target, cooldown of 30 seconds between each use]
…
Stark's eyes widened as he read the description. This could potentially be a game changer, especially if he was able to stun his enemies first, plus he was already beginning to think that fighting hands-to-hands with enemies that can infect him was bad.
Below the skill description was some sort of stickman animation, the stickman which represented Stark focusing his aura in his hand before throwing a punch, and a giant crimson fist of aura launching itself toward some enemies.
[Aura Smash has been added to your skill list]
'I'll have to try that later, huh…'
He kept going, but of course not before using his skill point.
[You have upgraded 'Aura Smash' to level 2!]

chapters.title: Chapter 14 - 14: The First Bonfire
chapters.content:
[You have slain "Ghoul lv11", gained 1500EXP!]
[You have slain "Flesh Monster lv10", gained 1350EXP!]
Stark kept advancing through the level 10 area, able to kill most of the monsters in one hit, only the 'flesh monsters' posed a challenge, their sturdy bodies requiring three strikes to take them down due to their massive 2000HP pool.
He hadn't had the opportunity to use [Aura Smash] yet since most enemies came alone, and he felt like it was a waste of time to try something that could reveal his location.
It wasn't long until he found an opportunity though, because as he began turning the corner of a seemingly empty street, he saw a hord of monsters, at least ten of them, just grouping around, looking at the sky, specifically at the Black Sun.
'…' Stark stared at the lot.
"Aura Smash, activate!"
One of his hands began glowing with a crimson aura, brighter than it ever had been before.
'Looks like using this skills makes it so that most of my aura focus's on this hand…' he analyzed the skill as he used it, thinking about its weaknesses as using too much aura meant he was left defenseless if anything happened, his aura wasn't infinite after all.
Luckily, it wasn't the case this time, and so he was able to test out his ability.
Closing one of his eyes for precision, he adjusted his hand to aim in the middle of the hord of monsters.
And although it took him some time since it was his first time using it, he finally unleashed his skill.
He threw a punch, and a giant crimson fist of aura flew out of his hand, aimed towards the monsters.
It followed a trajectory Stark perfectly calculated, and after a few seconds, the aura impacted with the group of monsters, falling in the middle of them as they were all watching the sky.
~BOOM~
A massive explosion of aura hit the monsters, and the damage numbers appeared soon enough.
"-1938!"
"-1648!"
"-1293!"
The closer they were to the middle, the more damage they received, and by the end of the explosion, only one monster remained: a ghoul that had been a bit farther from the group.
It was looking at its dead companions, confused as to how all of them died in an instant, but unable to move as it was stunned.
[HP: 539/1350]
[Status Effect: Stun]
It also received a fair amount of damage, so it only took Stark one simple punch for the Ghoul to fall to the ground.
"Jackpot," Stark thought to himself, impressed with the power of his new skill.
"Aura Smash" was indeed a game-changer, allowing him to attack massive groups of monsters and also be allowed to use it from afar, although it did take him awhile to aim.
Maybe it would become even stronger when his domination skill and aura would level up, but until then, he was satisfied.
[You have slain three "Ghouls lv11", gained 4500EXP!]
[You have slain four "Decaying Corpses lv10", gained 4400EXP!]
[You have slain two "Black Priests lv12", gained 3500EXP!]
[Experience: 15800/25000]
'Hehe~' he was secretly proud of himself for that, wouldn't anyone be after growing stronger, but of course he didn't let it show on the outside, although there was nobody around.
He kept going after that.
But after focusing his attention far into the street ahead, he saw something weird: there was a giant fire burning.
'Huh?'
He approached it cautiously, not knowing what to expect. The fire was so large that it lit up the entire street, casting a warm and safe glow upon the surroundings, different from the darkness.
'A bonfire…?' he made sense of what it was when he was close enough.
But his view wasn't his only sense that was being triggered right now, his ears too.
He heard a faint music, and a voice singing in the direction of the bonfire?
'Humans? Are these guys dumb, they are going to attract monsters!' he began running in the direction of the bonfire, it was only a kilometer in front of him, so not that far.
[You have slain a "Ghoul lv11", gained 1500EXP!]
[You have slain a "Shadow Figure lv10", gained 1300EXP!]
On his way, he had to kill some monsters, but they didn't even put a dent on him.
He was now only 100 meters away from the bonfire.
~Laling Lalang~
The music intensified as he approached, now able to hear another person sing alongside it.
"And when the fire of your heart burns~ Nothing will be left for them to take~"
Only 50 meters.
"The light at the end is growing~ And it transcends everything I know~"
As he approached the 10 meters mark, the heat from the roaring bonfire licked at Stark's skin.
He could feel the warmth enveloping him, creating a sense of safety and comfort that he had not felt in a long time.
And suddenly, as if entering a different realm, Stark felt at ease for the first time.
"Oy~ Looks like someone else joined us!" one of the boys sitting on the ground next to the bonfire called out with a smile.
His short brown hair was ruffled and a scar adorned his right eye. In his hands, he held a yukulele which he had been playing to lift the mood.
Beside him sat another boy with black hair and a blank expression. He had been singing along with an unchanging expression this whole time, his magic staff resting beside him.
"Didn't expect someone else to come here so soon, and alone at that!" the yukulele player nodded in agreement, almost as if he was acknowledging Stark's strength.
"What is this…?" Stark asked, confused, he had felt a shiver run down his spine once he approached the bonfire, a feeling of safety taking over him.
"Hm… it's weird that you don't know, but I might as well use my knowledge to help ya~" the brown-haired man got up and brushed off the dirt from his ass , then pointed at the bonfire, "This thing is the halfway point of the rift, it serves as a landmark."
"Hm," Stark nodded.
"But that's not all," he smiled, "You see that sun above you right?"
"The Black Sun?"
"Yep yep," he nodded, "The more you stay under it, the more cursed you are."
And just as he said, when Stark thought about the black sun curse, a panel appeared in front of him.
[Black Sun Curse: 74%]
But right as he saw that…
[Black Sun Curse: 73%]
'It's going down?'
"The bonfire allows you to remove the black sun curse from your body, that's why the two of us are waiting!"
"Oh well… I hope you don't mind if I join you then," Stark kneeled down to sit on the ground, then quickly noticed that there were several monsters beside them, so he immediately got up and prepared himself to fight.
"They won't attack, they can't attack when you are near the bonfire…" the black-haired boy spoke for the first time.
"What's your name by the way," the yukulele player asked.
"…" Stark thought for a second, giving his real name wouldn't be beneficial, especially if they knew he was THE Stark, "Stalk," he answered on a whim.
"What a weird name…" he laughed, "The name's Kent, and the gloomy guy beside me is Bill!"
And just like that, Stark sat on the ground beside the bonfire, waiting for the curse of the Black Sun to go before he could continue.
After all, Stark did not plan to stick together with anyone, he would take the boss by himself.

chapters.title: Chapter 15 - 15: The Calm Before the Storm
chapters.content:
The blonde-haired girl that had helped Stark before had been waiting outside the city ruins for a bit, checking her surroundings and the people around as they all formed teams or sold items.
"Do you want to team with us Lana?" a group of girls, sparkles in their eyes, spoke, "We are big fans and we can be of help."
Lana dismissed them though, "Sorry, I plan to go alone."
Of course, that was a lie, she obviously had some life-saving items in hand to protect her in case of dangerous situations, so technically she wouldn't be alone, plus it would be great if she could meet someone to team up with, precisely someone that isn't annoying.
The first face that wandered in her mind as she thought of that was Stark's, but she shook it off as she knew that Stark wasn't that strong, at least not strong enough to be at her level.
And then… she entered the 'City Ruins', almost thirty minutes after Stark did, yet there were actually lots of people still outside.
As she entered the ruins, she quickly noticed the presence of the 'Black Sun' and read the panel that informed her about whatever it was doing to this place.
Lana would usually have many bodyguards surrounding her, but in this situation she categorically refused, she would need to survive on her own at one point or another, so she couldn't be protected forever was what she said to her father.
"-224!"
"-271!"
"-182!"
She saw people fight monsters, some dealing good amount of damage, while others less.
For their current level, the average damage that could be dealt was probably from 200 to 300, especially in this first dungeon, meaning it would take a few hits to kill each monster.
Lana on the other hand… She was an archer.
She pulled her bow out of her backpack, as well as some very well crafted arrows, then pointed them at two 'decaying corpses lv6' that were alone, walking towards her.
She fired two arrows at the same time, and then…
"-938! -973!"
The two monsters fell, killed by a single attack.
But it wasn't unexpected…
"Oh wow… she did 900 damage, she must be strong!"
"That's Lana Moonless after all, she has overpowered equipment…"
Lana ignored such talk, after all, she had precisely ordered her father and family to not hand her anything that would give her an advantage, instead she had just an average bow with average arrows, although with better materials.
The other reason this amount of damage wasnt surprising was because…
Lana was level 19, far exceeding the recommended level of this dungeon and most of the people in here, also she had a very good talent.
And so just like that, more and more people started pouring inside the 'City Ruins' rift, now fighting the monsters inside alongside their friends/teammates.
***
(Around the bonfire)
Kent and Bill were extremely considerate, they didn't even ask Stark about his class or about why he didn't have a weapon with him: for them, as long as you came all the way here alone, it meant that you were strong.
"Are you guys teaming?" Stark asked.
"Oh, no," Kent shook his head, "I came here around fifteen minutes ago, and only five minutes later did this guy come," he pointed at Bill.
'Doesn't that mean these guys met like ten minutes ago then immediately began singing together…?' Stark wondered, but of course didn't say that out loud.
"Then you must already be cured from the black sun curse, aren't you?" Stark continued, "Why are you here?"
Kent grinned, clearly enjoying the conversation. "Well, Stalk," he said, using Stark's made-up name, "Look to your right!"
Stark did as he was told, and in the distance he could see a wall of silver fog that took up the entire street, impossible to see beyond it.
"That's the entrance to the mini-boss area, every classifier must traverse it and defeat the monster there, whether in group or solo," Kent pointed at it, "We don't want to risk it as mini-bosses are stronger than normal enemies, so we're waiting for more people!"
Although these guys had the strength to come here all by themselves, making them almost equal to Stark in term of power, they were still not delusional enough to attempt to defeat a mini-boss by themselves.
"Hm…" Stark grinned as in comparison to them, he was actually crazy enough to take on the challenge.
[Black Sun Curse: 0%]
He was completely cured from the curse, but that's not all.
[HP: 400/400]
It seemed like the bonfire also had healing properties, allowing him to be healed.
'Almost feels like a checkpoint before a boss battle,' Stark smiled, 'Unfortunately enough for me though, there are no second chances…'
After discussing with Kent and Bill a bit more, he decided that it was time.
"I think i'll go ahead by myself," he spoke, getting up from his seat.
Kent and Bill looked at each other with widened eyes before looking back at Stark, "Are you sure? I mean, this is basically suicide…"
"I think i'll be fine, if I just sit around and wait for people to help me, then it wouldn't help me in the future, i'd rather risk my life and become stronger by myself," he shrugged as he left the bonfire space, now allowing monsters to sense and attack him.
[You have slain three "Decaying Corpses lv10", gained 3300EXP!]
[You have slain two "Cursed Hounds lv11", gained 2900EXP!]
Seeing him fight up close, Kent and Bill were surprised, they had never heard of someone fight with their fists, even alchemists needed to use potions and items to fight after all.
And yet the numbers that were displayed each time Stark hit an enemy were undeniable.
"-1927!"
[You have slain a "Ghoul lv11", gained 1500EXP]
Right as he reached the edge of the giant silver fog wall, a golden glow envelopped his body.
[Your level has increased to level 6, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Experience: 1300/35000]
He was ready to enter it, but right as he was about to, he heard a voice from behind.
"GOOD LUCK!" Kent shouted, then gave him a thumbs up, "I hope to see you another time, Stalk!"
Stark grinned, he didn't know this guy either, but he couldn't deny he was interesting.
"Goodbye," he whispered before traversing the fog.
[You have entered the mini-boss area, there is no going back from here]

chapters.title: Chapter 16 - 16: The Mini-Boss: Feathered Scourge
chapters.content:
As Stark went inside the silver fog, he couldn't help but feel a chill run down his spine as his vision was extremely obscured, yet every other sense of his was triggered: he could smell rot, he could feel an eerie aura around him, and he could hear the voices of tourmented souls screaming for him to go back.
[Recommended level to attempt mini-boss: 15]
[Warning! It is advised for you to go back!]
But Stark didn't care, and he pushed through the fog, traversing it after a few seconds and now able to see normally again.
'Holy…' he opened his eyes, and took notice of his surroundings.
He found himself in a desolate area filled with decaying corpses, the ground littered with bones and moss that seemed to have grown over everything.
He was still in the ruined city as buildings were still around, but the overall atmosphere was different.
'Am I in the luxury district?' the buildings looked more luxurious than before, and some abandoned jewelry and design clothes stores and could be seen.
[Level 15 area "Advanced District" entered]
'Hm,' Stark began walking through the district, looking around for any signs of monsters or of the mini-boss.
Meanwhile…
High above a building, a grotesque creature with jagged wings, sharped talons, and glowing eyes watched Stark's entrance into the district.
It was the mini-boss, the 'Feathered Scourge', a demonic creature that ravaged the luxury district, feeding on the souls of the dead and twisting the environment to its liking.
But do not be mistaken, it is also under the control of the Black Sun.
Below, Stark continued to explore the district, trying to ignore the growing sense of dread as he pushed forward. He had no idea what awaited him, but he was determined to face whatever came his way.
And after a minute or two of that… the creature decided it was time to start the battle, thinking more people would come.
The creature leaped silently toward Stark from the building, its wings giving it an incredible amount of speed, and its claws ready to kill the boy.
'What's that noise…' Stark mumbled as he heard the small flapping of the wings, and instinctively looked up, just to see the giant creature coming at him from above, "HOLY SHIT!"
Focusing most of his aura around his legs, Stark used some last second decision and jumped out of the attack's way.
~CRASH~
He had luckily been able to avoid the attack, but…
"-382!"
Even that wasn't enough to stop him from being injured as the after shock of the scourge's smash attack managed to send him flying against a nearby building.
[HP: 118/500]
'Fucking hell, one more attack and i'm done for…' Stark immediately got up and readied his fists, intense aura pouring out from them as he analyzed his opponent.
The mini-boss was at least five meters tall, had massive jagged white wings emerging from its back, a mouthless head with only yellow eyes looking down on him, and long legs and arms that could do a lot of damage to anyone who came in contact with them.
[Name: Feathered Scourge (Rift MINI-BOSS)]
[Level: 15]
[HP: 25000]
[Strength: 281]
[Stamina: 738]
[Speed: 372]
[Defense: 182]
[Skills: Wing Dive, Feint Strike, Soul Syphon, Eye Curse, Hellfire, Divine Strike]
'Defense is low… that might be the key to beating it,' it had an enormous amount of HP, and it would take Stark at least 13 hits to kill it, but the fact he would only attack with his fists against such an impossible opponent was terrifying.
And yet, Stark just glared at the winged monster, determination in his eyes.
He clenched his fists, determining his next move. His aura continued to pulsate around him, a testament to his unwavering resolve.
The monster in return merely let out a guttural growl (it had no mouth so kinda weird), the sound echoing throughout the abandoned district. It leaped towards Stark once more, its wings slicing through the air like knives.
Stark timed his dodge perfectly, leaping backward as the wings whizzed past, leaving a trail of dark mist in their wake.
"Hellfire!"
But the monster used one of its skill as it passed through, making a pillar of fire emerge from the ground where Stark had just landed, forcing him to roll away to avoid the damage.
"Feint Strike!"
The Feathered Scourge lunged at Stark again with incredible speed, its claws glowing ominously. But Stark was ready, and he met the attack with a powerful counter strike.
He dodged the claws of the monster, and then…
"-2182!"
Stark's fist connected solidly with the monster's face, the impact sending it reeling backwards.
'Phew… at least I know that I can deal good damage to it…'
"Eye Curse!"
The mini-boss looked down for a few seconds as it activated this powerful skill, then right as the skill reached its peak, it looked back at Stark, its piercing gaze on him.
'HOLY?' the sheer intense and overwhelming aura shook his entire body.
But that was all, nothing else.
[The 'fear' effect cannot be applied to someone with the 'domination' class]
It seemed like the 'Eye Curse' skill made it so that the scourge used its aura to scare off its opponents and deal the 'fear' status effect to them, reducing their movements and accuracy.
But it didn't work on Stark, and so the scourge, believing that he was affected, lunged itself toward him again, using 'Feint Strike'.
But as expected, Stark avoided the attack as if everything was fine, and punched the mini-boss not once, but twice as it was taken aback.
"-4920!"
He had dealt more damage than before, maybe because his confidence had gone up…?
[Mini-Boss HP: 17898/25000]
The winged creature, yet again taken aback by Stark's ability to avoid its attacks, growled again, this one more aggressive and louder than the last.
And for the first time, his confidence as high as ever before, Stark was the one who attacked the mini-boss, rushing towards it.
"Feint Strike…!"
The mini-boss tried to slice Stark in half, but yet again, the boy avoided the attack, punching the monster in the stomach in return as he wasn't tall enough to reach its head.
"-1738!" seems like it still did a fair amount of damage.
"Soul Syphon," the feathered scourge's hand suddenly began glowing as if trying to grab onto Stark's soul.
At that moment, Stark felt a shiver run down his spine. He knew this skill would be dangerous, and so he backed away, only able to punch it one more time.
"-1837!"
[You have been hit by 'Soul Syphon', draining attributes slowly for battle]
[Strength: 26…25…24…]
Even being close to Soul Syphon was enough to activate it, and now it wasn't his life that was being reduced, but his other stats.
'I need to end this quick before I do 1 damage per hit…' Stark thought, feeling the aura around his hands shine brighter because of his determination.

chapters.title: Chapter 17 - 17: Defeating the 'Feathered Scourge'
chapters.content:
[Mini-Boss HP: 14323/25000]
It still had more than half of its life, while Stark on the otherhand was one attack away from dying (two if he counts the 'chosen one' talent's perks, but he didn't know how it worked so he would rather not take his chances).
'Time to use this and hope…' he looked at his hands, which were surrounded by that same crimson aura, and tightened them both.
'Aura Smash, activate!' he reserved this skill for the perfect situation since the 30s cooldown was annoying, but what better situation than him being on the verge of death?
Almost all of Stark's aura went into his right hand, making it shine brighter than it ever had before, even though in the face of death, Stark was still smiling, showing utmost confidence.
The remainder of the aura on the otherhand was still focused on his legs, and the reason for that was obvious: Stark began running in circles around the mini-boss, him not moving at all for a while would obviously make the scourge attack him after all.
The mini-boss stared at Stark as he was running around it, its yellow shiny pupils following him.
And then… it did the unthinkable.
It flapped its wings gently, making it float a few centimeters in the air, then it put its two hands together, lifting them up at the sky.
'What the hell?' Stark was still running in circles, trying to aim his fist at the mini-boss.
"DIVINE STRIKE!" a golden text that announced the mini-boss's ultimate attack appeared above it, making Stark's eyes widen.
And although the feathered scourge could only use divine strike once on a powerful enemy, it decided Stark was worth it.
Immediately, Stark looked up at the sky to see a golden shiny halo above him, following him closely, it was shining so bright that even the people at the beginning of the 'City Ruins' were able to see it.
"Hey what's that?" someone asked.
"A beam?" another answered
"…?" Lana on the otherhand looked at the sky after eliminating another monster, "Weird…"
Stark instinctively knew that he would die if it hit him, so he focused on his movements.
And then…
~BOOM~
A beam of divine light came hurtling toward him from the halo above.
Stark dived forward before the beam could hit him, avoiding it by a strand of hair, and then continued running.
The light beam was following him closely, and he knew that if even one of his fingers touched it, it was over.
The mini-boss on the otherhand was flapping its wing from left to right to avoid its own attack, meaning that it also wasn't immune.
And this gave Stark an idea.
"DIE!" he threw his aura smash at the scourge, and the giant crimson fist appeared as predicted, heading toward the mini-boss at incredible speed.
It hit it directly, creating a massive explosion of aura.
"-5281!" the amount of damage was not enough to kill the monster, but what Stark was praying for was…
[Enemy stunned!]
"YES," the mini-boss was suddenly unable to flap its wings and fell to the ground, wondering why it couldn't move.
Still followed by the 'Divine Strike', Stark began running toward the mini-boss, jumping right above it instead of hitting it, and the reason for that was because… the halo was also heading toward the mini-boss.
Instinctively, seeing its attack returned against it and because it couldn't move to avoid it, the 'Feathered Scourge' deactivated 'Divine Strike', making the halo and golden beam dissapear.
But this was its biggest mistake.
"BINGO!" Stark jumped behind the mini-boss and smashed its head with his aura-filled fists.
"-3718!"
The damage was incredible because Stark was absolutely dominating the battle now.
And so what had to be done was done.
"-3829!"
And finally…
"-4273!"
[Mini-Boss HP: 0/25000]
The feathery creature crumpled to the ground, the once-glowing feathers now dull and lifeless. Stark took a moment to catch his breath, his heart pounding in his chest as he looked around at the wreckage of the battle.
He had quite litterally just "beaten a boss to death".
[You have slain 'Feathered Scourge lvl15 (Rift MINI-BOSS)', gained 40000EXP]
And soon after that panel came a familiar golden glow that surrounded his body.
[Your level has increased to level 7, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
And…
[You have beaten the mini-boss without getting hit (NO HIT achievement), granting you a better equipment piece]
'Well… more like it's either I no hit that guy or I die…'
Stark looked at his hands, still glowing with the remains of the Aura Smash, and smiled. He had done it. He had defeated the Feathered Scourge, his first mini-boss in this treacherous world.
Right on top of the scourge's body appeared an item, his reward for the NO HIT achievement, and so he grabbed it.
It was a necklace.
As Stark picked up the necklace that had materialized atop the defeated Feathered Scourge, a warm sensation spread through his body.
The necklace was exquisitely crafted, with intricate designs etched into the metal and a radiant gem at its center that seemed to pulse with energy.
…
[Equipment:] Soulbearer's Embrace
[Type:] Necklace
[Class:] Domination
[Tier:] Rare
[Required Level:] 10
[Quality:] Good
[Attributes:] +20 Strength; +100 HP
[Special Perk:] Grants the wearer the ability to absorb a very small percentage of damage dealt back as health.
…
This was a necklace that required him a level 10 to use, but also the domination class, meaning that only someone with this class would be able to use it.
'Maybe it's because the domination class is the best that it's so overpowered…?' he frankly didn't know, but getting HP back sounded op.
He clearly remembered reading about items and equipments back at the library, and so he listed what he knew.
There are 8 tiers for each item/equipment piece/skill: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Epic, Legendary, Mythical, Godly, Immortal.
And as for the quality, there are seven categories: Bad, Normal, Good, Exquisite, Perfect, Artifact, Unbeatable.
But for now, he couldn't use that necklace since it was restricted to only people that were level 10 to use.
'Spatial Inventory,' he mumbled and the inventory void opened next to him.
Then he put the necklace inside, 'See ya later, little necklace, when I am capable of using you…'
When Stark beat the boss, the giant wall of silver fog disappeared, meaning that Kent and Bill, who had been looking at it from afar, were now allowed to pass through.
"Holy shit, he actually did it alone!" Kent was astonished.
"…" Bill on the other hand looked at the disappearing fog with a blank expression, he was surprised too, but also very interested in 'Stalk'.

chapters.title: Chapter 18 - 18: Leveling UP!
chapters.content:
"I guess that's it for now," Stark mumbled as he killed the mini-boss and did everything that was needed to do.
[You have upgraded 'Aura Smash' to level 3!]
[You have upgraded 'Domination' to level 4!]
He used the two skill points he had that were available after reaching level 7, and then he kept going.
He of course noticed that the silver fog was gone, meaning that more people would be able to get to this area, but he didn't care, he had gotten the loot for himself.
[Current Level: Lv7]
[Experience: 6300/50000]
'My god, I wonder just how much people at the higher levels must of grinded, especially since this is a beginner level dungeon…'
At the end, Stark just wanted to get to level 10 to be able to use the necklace and to challenge the boss.
He wasn't dumb, and the fact he almost died against the mini-boss was a testament of how difficult the real boss will be.
Because even if in the end the rift had rewarded him for completing it without taking a singular hit, he had been completely forced to that with a little above 100 HP to spare.
And now… he had moved to another area, the "Advanced District" of the [City Ruins], which is a level 15 area.
[The rays of the black sun are calling your name, their cursed nature hitting harder than ever before, move fast or it will be too late]
[Enemies in this area only have one idea in mind: killing you, do not spare any of them]
'Didn't plan to do that…' Stark smiled, and as he turned the corner of a luxurious street, he found himself in front of the first group of monsters (other than the 'Feathered Scourge') he would encounter in this area.
[Name: Shadow Wolves]
[Level: 13]
[HP: 2500]
[Strength: 79]
[Stamina: 132]
[Speed: 271]
[Defense: 92]
[Skills: Shadow Bite, Quick Step, Menacing Eyes]
…
These wolves were swift and vicious, their red eyes locking onto some flesh they were eating as they bared their sharp, blackened teeth.
Their entire body was covered in a black matter that took over their furr, and Stark could only guess it was the black sun curse that changed them this much.
It was a group of six, and looking at their stats, they seemed to be extremely fast, although their strength and defense in contrast were low.
'Aura Smash…' Stark instinctively mumbled the name of the skill, and his right hand started glowing immensely again.
He threw his crimson fist at the wolves, and…
~BOOM~
"-3618!"
"-3238!"
"-2787!"
Three were killed by the attack, one was stunned and received more than half its life, and the other two… they avoided the attack.
"WAIT WHAT?" Stark had not expected them to be able to do that, but two of the shadow wolves had seen the fist coming at them, and began running towards him.
"Quick Step!"
They used that skill to immensely increase their speed, and then…
"Shadow Bite!"
The two lunged at Stark at the same time, their eyes still glowing with that red fury, and their furr's weird structure leaving dark aura behind.
But Stark remained calm.
"Focus…" he activated the skill, and suddenly he could see the wolf's movements better than before, now able to see their trajectory a few microseconds before they attacked.
And that was all that was needed for him to avoid the attack and not be instantly killed.
~Pwish~
He avoided the first wolf, and punched the second in the jaw with his aura-filled fists.
"-2162!"
It wasn't enough to kill it, but the sheer damage Stark had caused it made it so that the wolf was stunned.
"Go meet your friend," he laughed as he grabbed two of the wolf's legs while still mid-air and threw its body with incredible strength toward the other one he avoided.
"-628!"
"-1293!"
The 'Shadow Wolf' died upon impact with its companion, while the other one received more than half of its life with this strike.
It tried to launch itself at Stark again, but he just kicked it in the stomach.
"-1728!"
Now only one 'Shadow Wolf' remained, the one that was stunned and extremely injured.
Stark slowly approached it, almost walking and taking his time.
On the otherhand, the monster could see the human approach, a wide smile on his face.
"=)" Stark was only a few centimeters in front of the wolf now, able to punch it whenever he wanted.
In response, the wolf looked at the human and activated its third skill in a last ditch effort to survive.
"Menacing Eyes!" Its pupils and eyes started glowing more brightly with that crimson aura, trying to scare off Stark.
But…
[The 'fear' effect cannot be applied to someone with the 'domination' class]
And so Stark just stood there, unaffected.
"Aoohhwh~" the wolf growled, now able to move its mouth since the stun effect was going away, and it roughly translated to "Ah, shit…"
"-2719!"
Stark kicked it in the face, and it died.
[You have slain six "Shadow Wolves lv13", gained 14400EXP!]
'Holy!' Stark was bewildered, he had gotten so much EXP on these enemies even though he just took most of them by surprise.
[Experience: 20700/50000]
'The amount needed each level keeps getting bigger and bigger, I wonder just how much do I need to grind for level 10…'
There was only one more area to go through after the advanced district before eventually reaching the boss of the rift, and Stark could confidently confirm that he was probably the most advanced person inside the dungeon as beside Kent and Bill, who had stayed behind, he met no one else.
He checked the wolves' bodies for anything, but unfortunately, no piece of equipment had dropped, after all, these things were pretty rare.
'What about that black sun curse…?' he wondered as he continued walking in the direction he was following.
[Black Sun Curse: 48%]
'Holy shit, it's growing faster than before, although not unexpected…'
…
[You have slain 'Scorthed Businessman lvl14', gained 2100 EXP!]
[You have slain 'Underground Parasite lvl12', gained 1750 EXP!]
[You have slain 'Mother Bird lvl14', gained 2500 EXP!]
…
[Your level has increased to level 8, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Experience: 1793/60000]
…
[Your level has increased to level 9, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Experience: 5720/75000]
…
'Phew… took me at least an hour to level up, killing this many monsters is beginning to be easy, although it takes time,' Stark wiped the sweat off his forehead as he looked at his status window, many monster corpses around him.
[Level:] 9
[Health:] 118/950
[Bloodline:] Human
[Class:] Domination
[Info about class:] The first Domination Trial is coming REALLY soon, be ready, you will suffer.
[Talent:] Chosen one
[Attributes:] Strength 42; Speed 54; Mind/Soul 61; Stamina 81; Defense 68
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv4; Focus lv3; Aura Smash lv4
…
'Hm… I guess it's better than last time,' he smiled.

chapters.title: Chapter 19 - 19: The City Outskirts
chapters.content:
Most people were now inside the [City Ruins] rift, fighting their way through the level 5 area.
"WATCH OUT!"
"HELP ME OUT HERE!"
People could only form parties of 5 inside the rift, and after doing so, they would be allowed to share experience points between each other as long as they participated in the kill, making it safer to level up.
No one could really know what the hell was happening further inside the rift, so everyone just focused on themselves.
"Where is that Stark fucker?" Daniel entered the rift 45 minutes after Stark, rushing his way through the level 5 area and reaching the level 10 one with his squad.
"We saw him enter the rift at the beginning, so he should be here…" one of Daniel's companions spoke, a spear in his hand as he was also part of the warrior class.
"HAHAHA~ That fucker got lucky yesterday, and now he is probably already dead!" Daniel nodded, as for him (and probably most people), it was impossible for Stark to get past the first area, "He probably became one of those monsters!"
"-728! -827!" he eliminated a monster that came his way, then looked around him, noticing all the other people that were fighting.
Lana on the otherhand was also in the level 10 area, currently extremely close to Daniel's group as they were right next to her.
'So annoying…' she groaned while shooting two arrows to kill a monster nearby.
Instinctively, Daniel looked to his right as he saw the high amount of damage being dealt by Lana, and noticed her blonde-hair, beautiful face, and spectacular body.
Nobody knew it, but Daniel had a massive obsession over Lana, always trying to please her and approach her, but she would always reject him.
After all, Lana was used to such attempts from men who thought they had a chance with her.
"Hey Lana-" he tried to approach her, but sensing his presence, Lana immediately began running, acting like she spotted another monster, "Oh… well i'm sure she'll succumb at one point or another!"
"Of course she will, any girl would dream of being with you, the Pridel family name is extremely famous after all," one of Daniel's companions reassured him, making him grin.
And it was at this exact moment that Stark defeated the mini-boss.
Suddenly, everyone stopped, a golden panel appearing in front of them.
[The mini-boss 'Feathered Scourge' was defeated by REDACTED, you can now advance further inside the dungeon!]
Daniel, Lana, and everyone else that were inside the dungeon read the text with shocked eyes.
'Already?!' was what they all thought, after all even their teachers predicted it would take at least five hours before the mini-boss was defeated, and yet in less than an hour it was already down?
"Probably some powerful group that rushed through the dungeon?"
"Maybe it's a hidden high-ranked classifier!"
"Or one of the solo players that went first…"
Such theories appeared among all classifiers that were still fairly at the start or almost middle point of the dungeon.
But what they all knew was that: whoever had defeated the scourge must be pretty damn strong.
This is how dungeons in this world work, once an achievement is made, it is broadcasted for everyone to know, except they wouldn't know the identity of who did it.
Only Kent and Bill, who were two of those 'strong solo players' were aware of the identity of the mini-boss killer, but even they believed that Stark was actually named 'Stalk' since he lied to them.
And just like this, the stage was set, and people began fighting through the monsters faster in hope of reaching the level 15 area and fight the boss too, also they needed to take advantage of such an opportunity to level up.
***
Stark, unaware of the panel that informed everyone of what he did, continued walking through the 'Advanced District'.
And soon enough… he found himself in front of the last area of the dungeon.
'Oh yeah, before I forget…' he mumbled, checking out his available skill points.
[Skill Points: 1 Available]
'Almost forgot to use it, better be safe than sorry…'
[You have upgraded 'Domination' to level 5!]
His domination skill was now at the half-way point as the limit for skills was level 10 (at least until the user leveled up enough, and then the limit would increase, or by using an item)
And that meant…
'Huh?' his body was suddenly being surrounded by a crimson aura, it was not only around his hands and feet anymore, but also his head, torso, legs…
[You have gone far and upgraded the domination skill, your aura was massively increased as a reward, and you are now capable of using it around your body as a sort of protective shield.]
'Holy shit!' Stark smiled, his HP was extremely low, and his journey since the beginning was a giant 'NO HIT' challenge since even one attack would kill him.
And now…
"Can I actually absorb some damage now?" he wondered, eager to use that new ability of his, but also knowing that he couldn't take any risks, "Welp… i'll see when the time is right."
He took a step forward, and now was in the final area of the rift.
[Entered level 15 area, "City Outskirts"]
The atmosphere switched completely, it was already dark and twisted in the 'Advanced District', but the last area was on another level.
The buildings were replaced by shaby old houses, menacing eyes could be seen from every broken window, and the air was thick with tension.
[The Black Sun has noticed and acknowledged you, it will now try everything in its power to stop you, classifier, good luck]
The panel was dark, mimicking the sinister darkness of the empty streets.
[Current Level: Lv9]
[Experience: 12810/75000]
'If this is a beginner level dungeon, I wonder just how bad the higher level ones are, people in this world must have a thick skull…' he said that, but in the end still began walking through the dark outskirts of the [City Ruins].
As he navigated the desolate streets, Stark's acute perception picked up on subtle movements in the shadows.
Yet even noticing all these creatures and eyes on him, nothing came out of a corner to stop him or attack him… for now.
And right after taking another step… another unexpected panel came interrupting Stark in his journey.
[Black Sun Curse: 90%]
[WARNING! GET TO A BONFIRE BEFORE IT IS TOO LATE! THE DARKNESS IS CONSUMING YOU]
'…' Stark sighed, the curse percentage had gone up so fast he didn't even take the time to check, and now he was at great risk of being turned into one of these… things.
Going backward was not a solid option either since he would probably be infected before it happened.
So his only choice… was to keep going forward, speedrunning his way through the monsters that would try to kill him.

chapters.title: Chapter 20 - 20: The Elite Monster [1]
chapters.content:
'…' and even then, the aura around his hands and legs didn't falter, still shining brightly, a proof that his determination hadn't been moved by the circumstances.
He reached a street with many abandonned small houses, the ones around him less out of shape than the others.
Suddenly, a low growl echoed through the desolate streets, and then…
~CRASH~
A massive amount of monsters came out of the windows, their eyes glowing with a bright red aura that indicated they were ready to attack.
"1…2…4…6…10…14" he counted them, "WAIT 14?"
Just looking at their appearances, Stark could notice that it was the same type of monster all over, meaning they were the ones in control of this area.
[Name: Gloomstalkers]
[Level: 14]
[HP: 2500]
[Strength: 102]
[Stamina: 391]
[Speed: 72]
[Defense: 271]
[Skills: Infect, Gloom, Mallet Smash, Lengthen]
Their bodies were completely white, two meat mallets replacing their arms (the mallets took the form and white texture of their hands, making them blend perfectly), and red eyes that shone in the darkness.
These creatures were utterly disturbing, something straight out of a horror movie.
Their sheer number was surprising, and although their speed made them go extremely slowly toward Stark, it seemed like they enjoyed tormenting their victims by slowly watching them tremble in fear.
Stark positioned himself for combat, his fists in front of his face and his aura ready to protect him: he was completely surrounded from all directions.
But then… the gloomstalkers suddenly stopped as they were a few meters away from reaching Stark, and they began looking up, not toward the black sun, but toward the roof of a nearby abandonned house.
'…?' Stark wondered what the hell was happening, and he looked at the direction the monsters were watching.
Just to see… nothing?
It was completely dark, stopping him from seeing anything beyond that point.
'What the fuck-' he didn't have the time to finish his sentence because…
Suddenly, a figure stepped out from the darkness, their form cloaked in tattered robes that billowed ominously in the wind. The figure's eyes gleamed with a dangerous light as they locked gazes with Stark.
'Ah shit… here we go again!'
[Name: Outskirts Second Leader (ELITE)]
[Level: 15]
[HP: 12000]
[Strength: 172]
[Stamina: 581]
[Speed: 461]
[Defense: 615]
[Skills: Summon, Dark Fog, Soul Drain, Cursed Domain, Shadow Magic]
…
'Area's have bosses too now…?' Stark pondered, after all this guy had the 'ELITE' title, and more HP/Stats than any other monster he had met until now other than the 'Feathered Scourge'.
The 'Outskirt Second Leader' was wearing a massive dark cloak that stopped anyone from seeing its body, and a white smiley-face mask to hide its face.
It also had a black staff in hand, one emitting an eerie aura and a ball of void spinning around at the edge.
Seeing their leader arrive, the 'Gloomstalkers' immediately resumed walking, and the boss just sat down at the edge of the house's roof, watching its minions kill the human.
The Gloomstalkers closed in on him slowly, their eerie white bodies moving like specters in the darkness.
As the first Gloomstalker lunged towards him with a menacing swing of its mallet arm, Stark swiftly dodged to the side, feeling the rush of air as the attack narrowly missed him.
In response, he punched it back in the head.
"-3192!" it's body immediately turned to dust.
Using that momentum, Stark launched himself towards the next Gloomstalker, delivering a barrage of punches and kicks with precision and power.
The creatures fell one by one, disintegrating into ash as his attacks landed. Despite their overwhelming numbers, Stark's determination burned brighter than ever, fueling his every move.
By the end of his rampage, all the gloomstalkers had died, and the leader was still watching from the roof.
"Summon!" it lifted its staff in the air, and suddenly… more gloomstalkers started appearing from the ground and windows.
"Is that an infinite EXP generator?" Stark smiled, he was actively quite tempted to keep going and grind, but he knew he would get tired eventually, plus his time was counted because of the 'Black Sun Curse'.
'Aura Smash,' he mumbled as his fist started glowing with that crimson aura.
And then he threw it at the unsuspecting leader, who thought it was safe up there if Stark only used his fists.
"-2312!" it's defense was very high, so the damage was reduced a ton, but it was still a good amount.
Taken aback, the leader was sent flying backward, and once it came back at the edge, it had a dark aura around its body and staff, showing signs it was gonna attack.
"Black Fog!" A thick, inky fog began to swirl around the Outskirts Leader, enveloping the area in darkness. Stark could barely see his own hand in front of his face as the fog crept closer, threatening to suffocate him.
'God damn it,' his senses were on high alert in case a gloomstalker was close, but it seemed like they couldn't see either.
"-3261!" navigating through the fog, he would occasionally find some gloomstalkers he killed, and also had to avoid some others before they could hit him.
One singular touch of their mallets would probably send him flying after all…
And so after thirty seconds of that…
'Aura Smash!' He hurled his right fist again in the direction the leader was in previously, he used his aura as a landmark toward where to aim, and this time landed it on the leader's legs.
"-1937!" the boss roared in pain, and then…
~FIOU~
Losing balance since Stark had aimed for the legs, it fell forward toward the street.
~THUD~
"-728!" it received damage because of the fall, but it was still relatively fine.
Not able to see anything because of the fog, the leader deactivated that skill, and after a few seconds, the mist cleared, revealing the Outskirts Second Leader struggling to stand back up.
Dozens of monsters now surrounded Stark, and the leader was pointing its staff at him too.
'You're close to me now… finally a fair fight,' he smiled while positioning his hands.
"Shadow Magic!" the leader's staff began glowing with an eerie aura, and the ball of void at the edge of it also started growing in size.
And thus, the final battle before the real boss of the dungeon began.

chapters.title: Chapter 21 - 21: The Elite Monster [2]
chapters.content:
Stark felt the weight of the impending battle settle on his shoulders as he faced off against the Outskirts Leader.
The leader's eyes bore into Stark, a silent challenge passing between them.
As the first tendrils of shadow magic began to curl towards him, Stark knew he had to act fast.
Looking at him from all nearby windows, and surrounding him completely were dozens upon dozens of gloomstalkers.
'How are the other people supposed to beat these things…?' he wondered, after all he was confident in his strength compared to all the other students, yet here he was struggling this much against an area boss…
"Shadow Magic!"
Arrows made out of darkness began forming around the second leader, and then hurtled toward Stark.
With a swift movement, he dodged the incoming tendrils of darkness and closed the distance between him and the Outskirts Second Leader in a flash.
With a powerful leap, Stark aimed a devastating punch directly at the leader's chest. The impact sent shockwaves rippling through the air, causing even the gloomstalkers to stagger back in surprise.
"-3618!" the damage was incredible.
The leader staggered backward, its cloak billowing around it as it struggled to regain its balance.
"Summon!" it summoned more gloomstalkers from the ground in front of it to protect itself from Stark's attacks.
Seizing the opportunity, Stark followed up with a series of lightning-fast strikes, each blow landing with precision and force against the monsters, not even letting them get out of the ground.
"-3739! -2638! -2947!"
Forced to back away, Stark made sure that nothing was behind him.
[Area Boss HP: 3405/12000]
'One or two more hits…' Stark thought.
His confidence was its peak, and the leader looked extremely injured, struggling to even stay in place or summon more gloomstalkers.
"-3718!"
"-3918!"
"-4183!"
Each gloomstalker that tried to attack him was met by an instant punch that made it turn into dust: none of them were capable of touching Stark, even with their numbers.
Realizing that: most of the minions just stood there, not even moving anymore, knowing it was futile to even try, it seemed like they had a conscience of their own even while being controlled by the leader.
And that's when it happened: behind the smiley-face mask the second leader was wearing, Stark noticed dark and hostile pupils, glowing with a purplish aura.
"CURSED DOMAIN!"
A sudden surge of dark energy emanated from the leader, enveloping the entire area in a malevolent aura of darkness.
Stark felt a chill run down his spine as his movements slowed, the shadows seeming to constrict around him, sapping his strength with each passing second.
The gloomstalkers that remained standing seemed revitalized, their attacks gaining a dangerous edge under the influence of the Cursed Domain.
[You are in a cursed domain, defeat the enemy boss before it is too late (all enemies receive a stat boost inside the domain)]
Struggling against the oppressive magic, Stark gritted his teeth and focused on maintaining his resolve.
"Shadow Magic!"
The second leader didn't waste time and summoned three darkness arrows again, launching them at Stark.
His movements were reduced, and the arrows were faster than before, but 'Focus' still allowed him to see them coming.
He avoided one… he avoided two…
He couldn't avoid the third.
Sensing that, Stark decided to focus most of his aura around his chest, in the area where the arrow was aimed at, in the hopes of stopping it.
And…
"-82!" the damage he received was minimal as the arrow was stopped by the wall of aura before it could pierce him, meaning that this "aura barrier" truly worked.
[HP: 36/950 (CRITICAL CONDITION)]
'Fuck that shit!' Stark realizing that he was one hit away from dying focused all his aura into another 'Aura Smash'.
He kept avoiding darkness arrows all the while powering up his attack, and after a few seconds…
"GO TO HELL," he punched the air, sending the crimson fist toward the second leader, who was unable to avoid it.
"-2192!" its defense was higher because of the domain.
But…
[Enemy stunned]
Seizing the moment of weakness, Stark wasted no time. Channeling all his remaining strength and fury into a final, decisive strike, he launched himself at the stunned leader with a speed and power that seemed almost supernatural.
"I'm not stuck with you!" he jumped in the air, in front of the leader's eyes as it was unable to move any of its limbs or staff, "YOU ARE STUCK WITH ME!"
He punched it.
"-2719!"
[Area Boss HP: 0/12000]
The leader let out a final anguished cry as Stark's punch connected, shattering its remaining defenses and sending it crumbling to the ground.
A deafening silence fell over the battlefield as the cursed domain dissipated, leaving only the sound of the wind rustling through the trees.
All the gloomstalkers surroundings Stark immediately also began turning to dust as they were all only kept alive by the outskirts second leader's magic.
And just like that, Stark was able to defeat that shitty boss.
[You have slain "Outskirts Second Leader lv15 (ELITE)", gained 22000EXP!]
[You have slain twenty-two "Gloomstalkers lvl14", gained 24500 EXP]
[Experience: 59310/75000]
'Not even enough to level up…' he sighed but immediately began running nonetheless.
[Black Sun Curse: 95% (WARNING)]
…
[You have slain 'Shadow Demon lv14', gained 2300 EXP]
[You have slain 'Water Blob lv13', gained 2150 EXP]
[You have slain 'Crazy Archer lv14', gained 2200
…
[Black Sun Curse: 96% (WARNING)]
Sweat pouring out from his forehead, Stark continued running, his time was counted, and although he wondered just how was any of the other students supposed to survive this, he still had his own safety in mind first.
[Black Sun Curse: 97% (WARNING, GET TO A BONFIRE)]
The warning blared in Stark's mind as he sprinted through the city outskirts, now ignoring the monsters that tried to stop him as he didn't want to waste time.
He could feel the Black Sun looking at him, awaiting for him to be consumed by its powers to transform him.
But… it would never have this pleasure.
Since when he turned around another corner, Stark spotted the flickering glow of a bonfire in the middle of a giant street.
And beyond it… a silver fog wall could be seen.
'BINGO!'
[Black Sun Curse: 98% (WARNING, GET TO A BONFIRE)]
Relief flooded through him as he pushed himself to run even faster
Warning panels surrounded his view as the number reached 99%, but thankfully enough… he was able to reach the bonfire, entering the 'safe space' right before the boss battle.

chapters.title: Chapter 22 - 22: NO CHEATING!
chapters.content:
The bonfire crackled and flickered, casting a warm, reassuring light in the dark world Stark found himself in.
[Entered safe space, enjoy the safety while it lasts =)]
The silver fog wall loomed right in front of him (only a few meters away), a barrier separating him from whatever awaited on the other side: the boss of the [City Ruins].
But for now… all he wanted to do was rest.
He sat on the ground around the bonfire, enjoying the feeling of slowly regaining his HP and the curse of the Black Sun going down.
'No… I can't rest now…' he thought after sitting down for a minute, and then got up.
[Experience: 65960/75000]
'I'll get to level 10, then I can rest as much as I want,' he nodded before getting up, he had retrieved some of his life back, plus he was confident he would have no issue dealing with enemies nearby.
There were some monsters he had never seen roaming nearby, and so he decided to do something… quite strange.
He went to the border of the 'safe zone', and then put half of his body outside, allowing the monsters to see him.
Some immediately rushed to kill the human, while others just looked, waiting to see what would happen.
And so as some monsters were about to hit Stark… he took a step back and went inside the safe zone again.
And then…
"Let's see if that works!" he laughed then tried to punch the monsters while still in the safe zone, giving him an almost impossible to break shield while still being able to hit them as his fist traversed the 'barrier'.
"-2719!"
"-3162!"
"-2913!"
The monsters outside the safe zone roared in frustration as Stark's punches connected through the barrier, dealing damage without putting himself at risk.
'I'm actually cheating the system, how has nobody thought of that before,' he laughed, trying to punch yet another monster.
But…
~ZAP~
"-100!"
A lightning strike that came from the sky hit his body and dealt 100 points of damage to him, luckily he had allowed his HP to go up with the bonfire, or else it would have been bad.
[No cheating]
This panel appeared in front of him.
"…" Stark groaned before leaving the safe zone and killed the last monster that was in front of the barrier, "this was the last one anyway, I wasn't gonna abuse it," he shouted to whoever (or whatever) was watching him, but of course, no response.
[You have slain 'City Beast lv15', gained 3000 EXP!]
[You have slain two 'Mouthless Figures lv15', gained 5800 EXP!]
[You have slain 'Owl Cultist lv15', gained 2750 EXP!]
And of course, eliminating those foes resulted in the reappearance of the golden aura, once again enveloping him.
[Your level has increased to level 10, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Experience: 2510/85000]
'Finally… damn it!' Stark smiled and sat beside the bonfire again, enjoying the feeling of finally reaching level 10, meaning he could now equip the necklace he had acquired.
And also…
[Level 10 Reached: please pick a skill card]
Just like last time, three cards materialized in front of him out of thin air, this time their color was blue.
'Oh yeah… that thing,' this had been how he acquired [Aura Smash], it seemed like he would be able to choose a new skill every 5 levels.
Stark gazed at the three blue cards in front of him, pondering his choice carefully.
"Oh well, it's not like I can decide what skill i'll get," he shrugged and picked the middle card at random.
The other two disappeared once he did that, and so he turned the card he picked to see an image of… himself?
…
[Name: Clone Frenzy]
[Type: Rare]
[Level: 1]
[Description: Summons a clone of yourself that acts and fights just like you do, giving you a temporary additional character to control in battle, the clone does damage based on how much aura you give it, but its stats are extremely reduced, and its HP is set to 1, cooldown period of 30 minutes between each clone]
…
And yet again, below the description was some sort of low-budget animation showing how the skill worked: a stickman that was supposed to be Stark used aura to summon another stickman that looked exactly like him, and he was able to control it to fight enemies.
'I guess it's good…' Stark would need to see it in battle to judge, but this was his first 'rare' type skill, meaning that it MUST be good, right?
[Clone Frenzy has been added to your skill list]
[You have upgraded 'Clone Frenzy' to level 2!]
After reaching level 10 and acquiring this skill, Stark just sighed and looked at the sky while sitting beside the bonfire, its darkness was mesmerizing for some strange reason.
'Spatial Inventory,' he mumbled after five minutes, and the small void appeared beside him.
He hesitated for a few seconds, but then put his arm inside while thinking of the "Soulbearer's Embrace" necklace.
Suddenly, he could feel his fingers brushing against the cool metal of the necklace, and so he pulled out his hand, just to see that the necklace was in fact inside it.
'I guess that's pretty cool and convenient.'
Without wasting time, he put the necklace around his neck.
["Soulbearer's Embrace" Equipped]
If he remembered correctly, that necklace was supposed to give him +20 strength, +100 HP, and also…
[Special Perk:] Grants the wearer the ability to absorb a very small percentage of damage dealt back as health.
If there was a way to gain health through damage, then he sure as hell was gonna take it.
'I guess that's all for now, isn't it?' he lay on the cold ground, maybe it was dirty, but even sitting down left him uncomfortable, so this was his best option.
He needed to be full of energy before attempting to kill the boss after all since he would do it alone and only at level 10 while it was probably recommended to do it with a party of level 15 classifiers.
'I hope that new skill helps… it would be great if it truly worked just as I envisioned it to be…'
Stark kept thinking about the future for a bit… and then… before he even realized it, the ground became strangely comfortable.
And so he closed his eyes.

chapters.title: Chapter 23 - 23: A Sleeping Stark?
chapters.content:
People began rushing through the beginning areas after the message of the mini-boss being defeated appeared.
After all, this dungeon was supposed to be used to level up (mostly) safely while also gaining experience, so if someone completed it quickly, they would have less time to do so.
The deeper they went, the higher amount of experience they could get, and the least the people that would be there to annoy them.
Lana was one of those that prioritized completing the dungeon over leveling up since she already had the gear to do so, although she was alone.
Soon enough she reached the level 15 area "Advanced District", and from now on only the strongest were there.
Kent and Bill had also decided they wouldn't go further inside the dungeon past that point as it was too dangerous, and they also believed that "Stalk" was the same.
After all… who was dumb enough to go for the boss in the first day, right…? RIGHT?
"-928! -827!" killing enemies, Lana kept going.
Her interest wasn't to level up as she was now level 20, more than enough to start going into actual dungeons, not beginner ones.
And although 'Archer' was considered one of the weaker classes, her powers and equipment were still good enough to compete with all the others (except for Domination, obviously).
Her goal wasn't to level up, but to defeat the dungeon and boss.
"Complete that dungeon and be the strongest one inside there," her father, an extremely strong classifier, told her.
So her goal, just like Stark, was to complete the dungeon as fast as possible and retrieve all the rewards/fame.
Of course, she wasn't dumb, so she would obviously wait for some high potential people to help her out with the boss, going alone was suicide.
But for now… she needed to get to the bonfire before the boss.
***
(3 hours later)
"I see it!" Lana smiled, she had successfully entered the "City Outskirts", which was the last area of the [City Ruins] rift, and managed her way through all the monsters.
All she could see around her was the empty streets, no one was there, meaning that she was probably the first to reach this place.
No… she was CONFIDENT that she was the only one.
And right in front of her was the bonfire before the final boss of the dungeon, she would set herself there and wait for around 4 more people to create a party and defeat that boss together.
"This dungeon is more dangerous than I thought… but there's definitely no one there, all the others are too weak to fight the monsters here as of now…" she kept advancing.
And the moment Lana reached the giant bonfire…
"Huh?" she spotted a pair of legs right behind the fire, and as she peeked her head to check what (or who) it was… she spotted a sleeping Stark, "WHAT?"
She was astonished, not only had someone already reached this area… but Stark nonetheless? How did he do it? Did he avoid every monster and through some godly luck reach this place?
No… this wouldn't be possible…
Her mind immediately wandered to the time Stark defeated Daniel and caused massive amount of damage to him.
"Could it be…?" she approached him slowly, making sure not to wake him up, and got closer to his sleeping face.
Stark seemed to be resting peacefully, his face calm and serene. It was as if this whole dungeon didn't matter to him.
Realizing this wouldn't lead to anything, Lana just sat on the ground beside the bonfire, waiting for other people to come.
***
In the realm of dreams, Stark found himself standing in a vast, empty space.
The air was cool and soothing, a stark contrast to the harsh world he had been navigating just moments ago.
As he looked around, he noticed a figure in the distance, its features blurred and indistinct. Something about it drew him closer, an inexplicable pull that beckoned him forward.
With each step he took, the figure seemed to shimmer and shift, changing form until it finally solidified into a mirror image of himself.
Stark stared in disbelief at the doppelgänger before him, feeling a strange mix of curiosity and unease.
The other Stark smiled, a perfect replica of his own grin, and spoke in a voice that sounded like an echo of his own thoughts, "Are you ready?"
"Ready for what?" the real one answered, confused.
"The First Domination Trial, you have read about it several times in your status window, right?"
"Yeah…" he hadn't ignored it all this time, it was just he didn't have any info so he didn't think it was worth it… for now.
"It is coming soon, and you will suffer, but in the end…" the fake Stark didn't have the time to finish its sentence that it vanished.
And suddenly, the dream world started to shake, a proof that Stark was beginning to wake up.
***
(30 minutes later)
'Hm~?' Stark opened his eyes, rubbing them as he got up, then remembered about where he was, "Holy shit, did I seriously sleep in here? Luckily nobody saw-"
He turned his head, and noticed Lana looking at him.
"I'm surprised you could even sleep here with the boss lurking around the corner," were the first words she said as she was busy inspecting her bows and arrows.
"Gotta be full of energy before fighting the boss, shouldn't I be," Stark replied while yawning, not even questioning why she was here, and got up from the ground, his clothes were a bit dirty but it didn't bother him.
"Fighting the boss? But you're alone!"
"Hum… yeah? That's kinda the point, y'know," Stark wasn't the type to hide his achievements, so he didn't care about telling anyone that asked him about the fact he had killed the mini-boss by himself, although most wouldn't believe him…
He stretched for a bit while talking to Lana, the shock across her face growing more and more after each of his replies.
"How did you even get here?"
"Killing the monsters…? Isn't that obvious?" these question were almost becoming silly, and so after a few minutes of back and forth, Stark decided that it was time.
His HP were full, he had all his skills, and his necklace was equipped, nothing could stop him now (except an insta-kill attack from the boss).
And so just like that, he left the safe space and headed toward the silver fog.
"Where are you going???!!!" Lana got up too, surprised.
"Going to kill the boss," Stark grinned and traversed the wall of fog, not even bothering to hear her reply.
Lana stood there, unable to understand whatever the fuck was happening.
The only thing she knew was that… she couldn't let Stark defeat the boss by himself if he had some sort of trick up his sleeve- NO, she meant she couldn't let Stark die alone.
And so she followed after him.

chapters.title: Chapter 24 - 24: The Boss of the 'City Ruins'
chapters.content:
Stark, unbothered, kept advancing through the fog, he had already done this once before for the mini-boss, so the atmosphere and cries of souls that begged him to turn back didn't bother him anymore.
Lana on the other hand had never experienced such a thing, and so she couldn't help but feel slightly uncomfortable, if not scared.
Reaching her arm forward in the hopes of finally leaving the fog, she was able to grab something: Stark's shirt.
"…?" the boy stopped and looked behind him to see a Lana with a weird expression, paranoia stretched across her face as her pupils darted in all directions, "Can you please let me go? Why did you even follow me?"
Hearing his voice, Lana felt more appeased, but of course she didn't show it and instead let go of his shirt, "Don't get ahead of yourself, I just don't want you to steal all the rewards!"
'Tsundere ass attitude,' Stark rolled his eyes before continuing to walk through the fog, Lana following closely as she didn't want to be alone.
And after a few seconds… they reached the boss area.
[You have entered the BOSS area, there is no going back from here]
***
As they emerged from the thick, swirling fog and their eyes adjusted to the dim light, they were finally able to take in the sight of the boss area.
Surrounding them was a massive circle of abandoned buildings, eerie and desolate with no visible exit or means of escape. And at the center of it all, rising above the ruins, stood a grand mansion with shadowy windows and an imposing aura.
Behind them was obviously the silver wall of fog, but once you traversed it, there is no way to go back.
[One of the fifteen members of the 'Godless Demons' group is present here, kill it]
[Participants: Stark Heartsouls, Lana Moonless]
"Where's your weapon," Lana grabbed her bow and magic arrows, ready to fight.
"I don't have one," Stark replied while smiling.
"WHAT? B-BUT?"
