"Don't worry about me and focus on yourself, I won't protect you after all," he replied and began walking toward the mansion.
"…" She knew he was right as she honestly had no reason to worry about him, but of course, there was also the fact they were BOTH participants in this, so she wanted him to at least be useful.
Lana followed closely behind Stark as they approached the grand mansion in the center of the boss area.
But as they reached the halfway point…
~SLAM~
With a loud creak, the massive doors of the mansion swung open, revealing a menacing figure that stood behind them.
The boss stepped out, its powerful presence emanating an overwhelming aura of authority and malice.
[Malakar, City Mayor (BOSS)]
This text appeared in front of both the classifiers when he appeared, and so the two of them took a few seconds to observe him.
Malakar, the City Mayor, stood tall and imposing in front of them. His elaborate smoking gleamed ominously in the dim light, adding to his intimidating appearance.
His eyes burned with a malevolent glow and his wicked grin sent shivers down their spines. He wore pure white gloves on both hands and shiny black shoes, giving off an air of wealth and power.
To further add to his sinister image, Malakar's face was half-hidden by a 'Black Sun' mask while a strange melon hat adorned his head.
Without a word, he raised a hand and summoned dark energy that crackled around his fingers menacingly.
Lana began to aim her bow at the mayor, and seeing that Stark was doing nothing actively scared her more than the boss itself.
On the other hand, Stark took a few seconds to use [Perception] and check the boss.
[Name: Malakar, City Mayor (BOSS)]
[Level: 15]
[HP: 45000]
[Strength: 471]
[Stamina: 289]
[Speed: 154]
[Defense: 829]
[Skills: Dark Pulse, The Cane, Abysall Shield, Godless Demon, The Mayor's Control, Hat Trick…]
The Mayor was slowly walking toward them, his stats were pretty good, although more on the defensive side than in the rest, and its speed was extremely low.
Stark smirked at the boss's stats, analyzing them carefully in his mind. His demeanor was calm and collected, a stark (get it?) contrast to Lana's nerves that seemed to be getting the best of her.
Without a word, he suddenly sprinted towards Malakar.
"Dark Pulse!" Malakar crouched, both his hands touching the ground, and veins of darkness immediately began spreading toward Stark and Lana.
When he was close enough to one of the veins, it would come out of the ground to try and pierce him, but of course, Stark had 'Focus' and was able to narrowly dodge them by rolling to the side each time.
'What the fuck is he doing, why is he rolling like this?' Lana pondered, and shot one of her arrows toward the Mayor.
"-628!" it hit him in the chest, but he was so focused on Stark that he wasn't bothered by such an attack.
Lana was shocked that Stark was going to engage with the boss head-on, something most people would consider suicide, strategy was key in the rifts, yet here he was doing random shit.
After 'Dark Pulse' ended, Malakar rose up to his full height (which was approximately four meters) and unleashed another attack.
"The Cane!" he bellowed, as a shadowy cane materialized in his hand. With a flick of his wrist, the cane elongated and lashed out towards Stark like a viper.
Stark reacted quickly, drawing upon his agility and reflexes. He dodged the sweeping strike by a hair's breadth, but then…
The cane turned around, controlled by the Mayor and able to defy the laws of physics.
Not expecting that, Stark only had a few microseconds to adjust, and so the best course of action was to put lots of aura around the area where it was aimed.
"-721!" he was hit, and although he protected himself, he still received a lot of damage, making him stumble to the ground.
[HP: 479/1200 (+100 from 'Soulbearer's Embrace')]
He immediately got up though, and with unwavering determination continued running toward the Mayor.
Lana shot another arrow at the boss, this time infusing it with the 'Dragon Breath' skill.
"-1219!" she was able to deal very good damage to the boss, enough this time to actually make him acknowledge her presence, but too focused on Stark to attack her.
"He is actually distracting him very well," Lana gently smiled, she was surprised that Stark was able to dodge all these attacks all the while closing the distance between him and the boss, that didn't explain how he would deal damage though since he had no weapon.
And so just like this, the fight against the boss of this rift began.

chapters.title: Chapter 25 - 25: Malakar, The City Mayor [1]
chapters.content:
"Aura Smash!" after getting up from the cane hit he received, Stark focused his aura around his hand, ready to attack the Mayor too.
With a powerful shout, Stark unleashed his Aura Smash towards the Mayor, the giant crimson fist hurtling towards its target.
But of course, Malakar saw the attack coming, and so he used the hand that wasn't carrying the cane to use another skill.
"Abysall Shield!"
A shimmering black barrier materialized in front of Malakar just in time to intercept Stark's Aura Smash. The impact created a shockwave that reverberated through the air, causing the ground to tremble beneath their feet.
"-627!"
The shield after being hit by such a powerful attack obviously cracked under the immense pressure and was destroyed, meaning the Mayor wouldn't be able to use it for a while.
"-1171!" Lana also used another arrow infused with another one of her skills, dealing more damage to Malakar.
It seemed like they were doing it slowly, but little by little, the Mayor was receiving more and more damage.
[Boss HP: 41355/45000]
Lana was a very good support, dealing damage from afar while Stark held him off.
'Our chemistry is surprisingly good, although I would prefer if he could actually do something…' Lana hadn't noticed the appearance of the abysall shield right before Stark's attack hit, meaning that she thought he dealt medium damage to it.
Stark continued his relentless assault on Malakar, dodging the boss's attacks with expert precision and slowly but surely approaching him.
And when he was only a few meters away now…
He dashed forward.
"The Cane!" the boss still had his cane in his hands, and so he tried to hit Stark with it.
Stark rolled on the ground, and once it came to him, instead of taking the hit like last time, he literally just used his fists to hit and break it.
"…?" The Mayor was taken aback.
"Got you," Stark smiled as he had completely closed the distance now, he was in the perfect range to attack the Mayor.
And so he did: before Malakar could even use another one of his skills, Stark focused his aura and…
"-3712!" even with his powerful defense, Stark's aura and stats dealt massive damage.
"WHAT?" Lana was astonished, even going as far as stopping to aim with her bow to make sure the number she was seeing was right, and it was.
'Calm down, Lana, focus on the battle,' She shook her head and began arming her bow to shoot again.
"-3819!" Stark was even able to punch the boss again as it hadn't had the time to counter the first one.
"Hat Trick!"
The Mayor used another one of his skills, and suddenly, his hat was enveloped in a dark, ominous energy. The hat lifted off his head, spinning wildly in the air before shooting towards Stark like a spinning blade of darkness.
Stark barely had time to react, but he managed to deflect the hat with a swift movement of his arm.
"-281!" it dealt him some damage, but not enough to actually be worried.
The hat ricocheted off a nearby rock and soared back towards Malakar, who grabbed it and bowed like a gentleman afterward, a smirk could be seen on the visible half of his face.
Stark backed away after that, sensing that the Mayor was going to keep attacking.
And after a few back steps… he found himself right next to Lana, who was still aiming her bow and arrows at Malakar.
"-718!" she hit him in the chest again, then armed another arrow right after.
Malakar on the otherhand was spinning the cane in his hand, almost enjoying the show.
'I'm low on HP…' Stark thought, he had received two hits already.
But as he thought about that… a panel appeared in front of him.
[Dealt massive damage to BOSS ENEMY, regaining 59HP!]
The 'Soulbearer's Embrace' Necklace perk activated, and he was able to gain some of it back.
'Oh shit, it's small, but it might actually make the difference…' Stark, regaining his confidence, smiled.
"I'm gonna go back, keep doing whatever you're doing, i'll keep him away from you," Stark spoke to Lana, then began dashing away before she could reply.
"I-" she sighed before smiling, "You better do your job."
Stark sprinted back towards the Mayor, his determination burning brighter than ever. Malakar smirked as he saw Stark approaching, readying himself for another round of combat.
"Dark Pulse!" the Mayor summoned the veins into the ground again, and every single one of them went rushing toward him.
This time, however, Stark had a new strategy in mind.
"Clone Frenzy!" he used his latest skill.
[Description: Summons a clone of yourself that acts and fights just like you do, giving you a temporary additional character to control in battle, the clone does damage based on how much aura you give it, but its stats are extremely reduced, and its HP is set to 1, cooldown period of 30 minutes between each clone]
And suddenly, his aura started seeping out of his body and headed right in front of him, forming a perfect replica of Stark, ready to assist in the battle against the Mayor.
"…" The clone's eyes were completely white, some aura pouring out from them like a fire, and its expression was neutral.
Its eyes were locked on Malakar with unwavering focus, awaiting Stark's orders.
"Let's do this," Stark muttered to his clone as they both charged towards the oncoming Dark Pulse veins.
The clone mimicked Stark's movements (almost) perfectly, matching his speed and agility as they weaved through the rushing veins.
"What the?" Lana was confused, why were there suddenly two Starks?
She aimed her bow at the Mayor as he smiled at the upcoming enemies, then fired again.
"-528!" somehow, it felt like she was doing less and less damage… was there a reason to that?
Meanwhile, Stark and his clone dodged and countered, working in perfect synchrony to break through the dark onslaught.
"The Cane!" feeling threatened for the first time, the Mayor summoned his cane in hand, then elongated it… towards the clone.
'Ah shit…' Stark knew that his clone's HP was set to 1, meaning it couldn't even defend such an attack without dying.
And so he positioned himself right in front of the cane and deflected it with a powerful slam.
"-72!" he received almost no damage thanks to that.
And then…
"Aura Smash!" now only 5 meters away from the Mayor, Stark decided it was time.
And so, both his and his clone's hands began glowing with a bright crimson aura.

chapters.title: Chapter 26 - 26: Malakar, The City Mayor [2]
chapters.content:
Thankfully enough though, it seemed like the clone actively thought for itself and subconsciously did what Stark wanted it to do.
Which was why it also used [Aura Smash] when he did, copying him.
Both Stark and the clone's right hands began glowing with that ominous aura, and after a few seconds…
Stark punched the air in the Mayor's direction, sending a crimson fist of aura toward him.
"-3712!" a powerful blow to the boss, who was forced to back away because of the sheer damage.
But that wasn't all…
Stark immediately ordered the clone to repeat what he just did, sending another Aura Smash attack towards the Mayor.
The clone, without hesitation, mirrored Stark's movements perfectly, launching a second crimson fist at Malakar.
"-1727!" it was less powerful than the original, but still fairly good for a copy.
And also…
[Enemy stunned]
'OH MY GOD,' Stark was bewildered, he didn't believe that the clone could also cause status effects, but oh boy was he wrong.
The boss fell to his knees, unable to get up or move any of his limbs, and also unable to use his magic since it required him to move his hands.
'What the?' Lana thought as she saw both Starks suddenly run toward the boss without caring about anything, she wasn't even aiming with her bow anymore, instead just enjoying the spectacle before her eyes.
Stark ordered his clone to dash toward the boss as it was the perfect moment to cause a huge amount of damage, and so they both did just that.
The clone lunged at the stunned Mayor with a fierce battle cry, its aura-infused fist ready to strike. Stark followed closely behind, channeling all his energy into his next move.
As they closed in on Malakar, the clone unleashed a devastating blow, hitting the boss with unparalleled force.
"-2319!"
The clone backed away after this attack as Stark followed through with a kick to the jaw.
"-4312!"
Then Stark also moved to the right for the clone to punch Malakar in the face.
"-2129!"
Using the clone's back as a jumping pad, Stark then grabbed both its shoulders to jump in the air and smash the Mayor's head.
"-6462!"
They had just comboed the boss, and dealt almost 15K points of damage in a matter of seconds.
[Dealt damage to BOSS ENNEMY, regaining 158HP!]
[HP: 343/1200]
After receiving all these attacks, Malakar was finally able to move, and immediately used [Hat Trick], sending his hat toward the real Stark.
Taken aback, Stark asked his clone to place itself in front of him.
And so it did.
"-1728!"
'My god, the damage is insane, is something wrong with that boss…?' Stark would have definitely died if he had been hit, even if he deflected it or used his aura around his body.
The clone after being hit by this attack immediately vanished, and the crimson aura that formed it went back to Stark.
'You did well,' he smiled, almost feeling like he lost someone close to him, but instantly going back to serious mode as he needed to focus.
…
[Boss HP: 11917/45000]
[The boss is ENRAGED, be careful]
This panel appeared in front of them both.
It seemed like that in this world, when bosses reach their halfway point (or when their HP gets reduced enough), they go into some sort of second phase/frenzy.
And Malakar was no different.
"THE MAYOR'S DOMAIN!" he got up, lifting both his arms sideways as his eyes began glowing, and even his black sun mask was emanating a dark aura.
"-462!" but even mid power-up, Lana still shot an arrow at the boss.
'…' Stark turned to look at her, "Aren't we supposed to let him finish his transformation before attacking?"
"I think killing him while he is powering up is more efficient…" she replied, somehow during the fifteen minutes they had been fightning, she found it in herself to trust Stark.
"Fair enough, but I still wanna see what he does!" Stark smiled and waited.
As the Mayor continued his transformation, a dark energy began swirling around him, creating an ominous aura that sent shivers down Stark's spine.
He couldn't help but feel a sense of foreboding as he witnessed the dark power radiating from the Mayor's form.
Lana, sensing the imminent danger, notched another arrow on her bowstring, ready to strike at any moment. The tension in the air was palpable as they all waited to see what Malakar's new form would bring to the battlefield.
And then…
~CRASH~
From all the nearby buildings, the mansion, and even the ground, monsters began to come out.
"Hey, that's not a transformation, he looks the same," Stark complained, although he couldn't deny the aura around the boss was more sinister, and its figure felt more imposing.
[Name: City Inhabitant lv8]
[Name: Businessman lv12]
[Name: Cursed Dog lv6]
All the different monsters they had met in the dungeon appeared all of a sudden: all under the control of the Mayor as they followed his every command.
Lana shot a monster, killing it, then armed her bow again, sweat pouring from her forehead as she knew the sheer number of monsters was too much for her to take currently.
"Survive, i'll go kill that bastard," Stark looked at her with his determined eyes, and all she could do was nod.
"Be quick… please…" she mumbled, low enough for him to not hear her.
With a nod of understanding, Stark focused his attention on the Mayor and his horde of creatures.
The monsters moved with unnatural coordination, their eyes filled with a malevolent gleam as they closed in on Stark.
But Stark wasn't interested in any of them, and so he began running toward the Mayor: his arms were still lifted up, probably because this is how he controlled the 'inhabitants of his city'.
He avoided most of the monsters, and occasionally killed some that were fast enough to catch up to him.
And so, just like this, Stark closed the distance between him and the boss.
And thus, the final showdown could begin.

chapters.title: Chapter 27 - 27: Defeating the BOSS!
chapters.content:
"TAKE THIS," Stark activated [Aura Smash] and sent another crimson fist toward the boss.
But…
"-4729!" a bunch of lv13 monsters placed themselves in front of him to protect the Mayor, taking the hit in its place.
"-627!" the Mayor received minimal damage since he was protected.
Malakar smirked as he saw his monster take the blow for him, clearly enjoying the show of power and the feeling of being in total control.
Stark was surrounded, and surprisingly enough, Malakar ordered his monsters to mainly target Stark, leaving Lana to deal with a low amount of monsters.
Stark gritted his teeth in frustration at the interference, but didn't let it deter him.
He swiftly followed up with a series of lightning-fast punches, aiming to break through the defenses and land a crippling blow on the Mayor himself.
No monster that was in his way stood a chance.
Malakar, however, remained calm amidst the chaos, his eyes locked onto Stark with an unsettling calmness.
With a swift gesture of his hand, he activated "The Cane" skill, summoning the object in his right hand.
His left one however was still in the air, controlling the monsters.
"It seems like it's losing control over them when one of its hands is down…" Stark noticed that some monsters weren't even moving anymore, giving him the chance to close the distance further.
Only five meters before reaching the boss now.
The cane came rushing toward him, changing directions everytime it met a monster, and then…
"-272!" Stark saw it coming, but even while deflecting it, it still did good damage.
"His defense and attack are higher than before," he thought, not even stopping after that hit, "But it doesn't matter…"
Stark wanted to end it, and so he used the back of a monster to jump in the air, high enough to avoid any incoming attacks from the Mayor or his minions.
He soared through the air, his aura blazing around him like a fiery comet, looking down on all the monsters below.
With a fierce battle cry, Stark descended upon Malakar, his fist aimed straight at the Mayor's face.
"-3718!" as Stark's fist connected with the Mayor's cheek, a shockwave resonated through the battlefield.
Using in the momentum in his favor, Stark used the Malakar's body to launch him in the air again, avoiding both the [Hat Trick], [The Cane], and all the attacks from the monsters.
"LET'S END THIS," the sea of monsters below awaiting for him to fall, Stark spinned in the air.
"Aura Smash!" he activated the skill, ready to launch it down, this time confident he would hit all his targets as he had the boss in his vision.
'Holy shit…' Lana was astonished, and she found it quite beautiful as Stark's figure perfectly aligned with the giant Black Sun in the sky, creating an effect where Stark's aura was perfectly visible around him.
It only took Stark a singular second to aim his attack below, and so he launched the giant crimson fist at the monsters under him.
~FWISH… BOOM~
The explosion was bigger than any other this attack had ever caused.
"-6371!" the Mayor couldn't use his minions to protect himself, and so being hit by the center of the attack meant he received the highest amount of damage.
Plus…
[Enemy stunned!]
All the monsters in his surroundings cleared from the crimson fist, Stark began dropping down toward Malakar as he couldn't move his body anymore.
The boss used every ounce of strength it had left to lift its face just a bit, and thus he saw the sight of Stark diving toward him, his fist full of aura, ready to end the battle.
'It's the end,' It thought, acknowledging that it couldn't do anything anymore.
With a fierce determination in his eyes, Stark descended upon the stunned Mayor Malakar, his fist crackling with intense energy as he prepared to deliver the final blow.
The air around them seemed to vibrate with anticipation as Stark's attack loomed closer and closer to its target.
Malakar, unable to move due to the stunning impact of Stark's previous strike, could only watch in helpless horror as the inevitable approached.
As Stark's fist made contact with Malakar's form, a blinding explosion of energy erupted from the point of impact, sending shockwaves rippling through the battlefield.
"-5372!"
[Boss HP: 0/45000]
Malakar fell to the ground, his body lifeless as his HP had been reduced to 0.
And so, unable to control his domain anymore, all the monsters inside the boss area fell, disappearing a few seconds later.
Lana, who was overwhelmed by the monsters, almost let a cry of joy when she noticed that they were all gone, and so without wasting time she dashed toward Stark.
"YOU DID IT!" she jumped to hug him.
"…" Stark, a neutral expression on his face, didn't reciprocate the hug.
"O-Oh," realizing how embarassing what she did was, she let go of him, "G-good job!"
"Yes," Stark nodded, unaffected by her presence, after all he had done most of the job.
[You have slain 'Malakar, City Mayor lv15 (BOSS)', gained 75000EXP]
And adding the experience gained from the many monsters he had defeated while rushing to the boss…
Stark was enveloped by the golden glow again.
[Your level has increased to level 11, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Experience: 2617/100000]
Lana was also enveloped with the glow, meaning she had leveled up as well, and even though she hadn't done much, she was still a participant.
[Dealt killing blow to BOSS ENNEMY, regaining 507HP!]
[HP: 578/1450]
But of course, along these few panels came a few other ones.
[You have beaten the boss while only being two (LOW HELP achievement), granting you a better equipment piece]
[You have defeated the boss of this rift, the black sun has acknowledged your strength and will not be trying to infect you anymore]
[Your efforts have paid, you can now leave this rift whenever you want]
Above the Mayor's lifeless body, something began shining: an item had appeared.
Immediately, Stark began walking toward it.
"I'm taking it by the way, I did everything," A neutral expression on his face, he informed Lana, who was also reading the panels.
"I-… Okay," she had nothing to say, he had done most of the work after all.
And just like that, Stark was able to defeat the boss.
'I wish she hadn't followed me though… I would have probably gotten an amazing item if I beat it solo…' he groaned while crouching to take the item.

chapters.title: Chapter 28 - 28: New Items and Information
chapters.content:
When Stark approached the shiny light on top of the Mayor's body (Lana following closely behind him to see what he would get), he noticed that there wasn't only one item… but TWO!
The first one was a blue bow that emanated some sort of chilly magic aura, it seemed to be of high quality.
The second item, however, caught Stark's attention even more. It was a ring with a glowing crystal in the center, radiating a soft, soothing light.
He immediately decided to use [Perception] to analyze both these items.
…
[Item:] The Ice Bow
[Type:] Bow
[Class:] Archer
[Tier:] Rare
[Required Level:] 20
[Quality:] Good
[Attributes:] +30 speed, +20 Stamina
[Special Perks:] While using this bow, arrows have a 5% chance to freeze enemies
…
[Item:] Crystalheart Band
[Type:] Ring
[Class:] Domination
[Tier:] Epic
[Required Level:] 15
[Quality:] Excellent
[Attributes:] +50 Health, +40 Mind, +10 to all other stats
[Special Perks:] Grants the wearer a shield that absorbs 10% of incoming damage.
…
'Holy shit, this is OP!' Stark laughed, he had gotten an incredible item again, and he would also be able to sell the bow at a fair price, making his journey totally worth it.
"Wait, there are two items, one is a bow, and i'm an archer, so can I get it?" The bow in front of her was better than the one she was using currently, and she also had the required level.
Weapons with perks weren't that rare, but those that had one were much more expensive than the ones that didn't.
"…" Stark stared at her for a few seconds, then back at the bow, "Nah, it's mine."
He activated [Spatial Inventory] and put the bow and ring inside.
Lana didn't even question the weird void that opened and that was somehow able to store both the items, she was just shocked Stark wouldn't even give her that while he wasn't even an archer.
"If you want the bow," Stark maniacally smiled at her, "You'll have to pay up," he rubbed three of his fingers together, mimicking the sign of money.
"I-" Lana didn't know what to reply, on one hand she knew that Stark was the sole reason she survived the boss fight, whether it was from stopping him from approaching her, or forcing most of the monsters to go toward him, it was undeniable that he had helped her.
And yet… she couldn't believe he was so petty over such a small matter.
"You can take them," she made up her mind, but she would make sure to buy a bow way better than the one he had acquired.
"Good girl!" Stark patted her shoulders, then began walking toward the exit.
"…?" she had never been treated this way before, it was always respect and admiration that surrounded her, as well as undeniable love from all those around her.
And yet… when she saw Stark so nonchalantly call her a 'good girl' without even being embarassed, it was like something snapped inside of her.
Her face was bright red, and she tried her hardest to hide it, "What the hell is happening… calm down me… you can't be aroused by this…!"
Leaving Lana behind to fight with her inner conflicts, Stark decided it was time for him to leave the dungeon, he had nothing else to do in there, and wanted to sell his items as well.
But as he began taking steps toward the exit…
A panel appeared in front of him.
[Congratulations for completing your first dungeon, Host! As a reward, you have been granted new information!]
'…?'
Stark stopped for a few seconds to read, 'What kind of information do I need at this point.'
[You can read the information now or leave it for later (not recommended)]
Curiosity getting the better of him, Stark decided to read the new information he had received as a reward for completing his first dungeon. As he focused on the panel in front of him, the words started forming a message:
[New Information Unlocked: Domination Class]
'Hm…' he guessed that it was actually interesting, he had absolutely no information about this one after all.
[The domination class is possibly the most powerful class in this world, but it is also the hardest!]
[Classifiers who own this class are bound by many rules:
-Their life is immediately set to HELL mode, meaning that enemies are a lot stronger while fighting them.
-The amount of experience needed to level up is also increased by a ton, but in exchange, every level up grants a lot more power than any other class.
-The monsters are stronger, but they also grant more EXP!]
'Huh… I guess the amount of experience needed between each of my levels is indeed much more than anyone else…'
Thinking that was all, Stark continued walking toward the exit of the boss area: the mansion, as a portal had appeared there.
[WAIT.]
A crimson panel that exuded a menacing aura appeared again before.
[5 days left until the 'First Domination Trial', GOOD LUCK]
'The fuck? It stopped me again for that?' this was all that appeared in front of him, and once that panel disappeared, nothing else came, 'The trial is happening in five days…?'
Subconsciously, Stark remembered that such a thing was written on his status window, and so he decided to open it.
…
[Level:] 11
[Health:] 578/1450
[Bloodline:] Human
[Class:] Domination
[Info about class:] The first Domination Trial is in 5 days, good luck.
[Talent:] Chosen one
[Attributes:] Strength 103; Speed 92; Mind/Soul 73; Stamina 73; Defense 78
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv5; Focus lv3; Aura Smash lv4, Clone Frenzy lv2
…
'What the hell is the domination trial…' Somehow, he had a really bad feeling about it, one that told him he would meet his end there.
The fact it was so soon meant he wouldn't be able to look for an academy/organization/guild to go to after showing his achievements to the world.
The first thing he would need to do was to… participate in that thing.
Stark was a bit overwhelmed by the new information about the Domination class, but he didn't have much time to think about it.
He had to focus on selling his items and on the impending "Domination Trial" in five days.
He reached the portal that was beyond the mansion's door, and after giving one last look to the embarassed Lana, he passed through it.
'Fuck that shit, i'll find a way…' he thought.

chapters.title: Chapter 29 - 29: Second Duel?
chapters.content:
With new information about the Domination class in mind, Stark appeared in the area where he had first entered the [City Ruins] from, in Leforia.
[Congratulations on completing the rift, Stark Heartsouls]
This panel appeared as soon as he left, of course invisible to everyone but him.
There were still a lot of people still outside the [City Ruins], mostly just engaging in pointless conversations and forming teams, while some others just procrastinated or waited for the first layers to be less crowded.
Some people noticed him coming out of the rift, but of course they just thought he was another one of those that took a break as many did.
And right after that…
[THIS RIFT HAS BEEN COMPLETED BY REDACTED]
This giant red text appeared above the portal to the dungeon, taking everyone aback as they hadn't expected it.
"WHAT?"
"SO SOON, BUT I DIDN'T EVEN ENTER?"
Panic spread through the crowd, and after a few seconds…
~BOOM~
Five beams of lights appeared at the entrance area, it was the Golden Dragons military group.
"Is there some kind of issue with the rift…?" their leader, Oliver, wondered, unable to understand how could it be completed so fast.
They had expected at least three days, giving the time for all the students to gain experience and sort out the ones unfit to fight the enemies.
Yuli, a white-haired girl beside him, analyzed the portal for a bit, using some sort of skill to check out whatever was happening, "No… the boss has truly been defeated by someone…"
"Ohoh~" Oliver chuckled, we have a high potential individual/team in our hands, don't we, "Welp, the rules are the rules, order everyone to be back here in less than 30 minutes."
It had only been half a day since the start of the 'Class Showcase', and yet it had already ended.
"It is unfortunate," Alex, a magus with a blue staff in his hands, sighed, "We'll find some way to make the students gain more experience, probably just by allowing them to go back inside the rift, but for now we need everyone to leave for a check-up…"
'…' Meanwhile, Stark stopped in the distance beside some other classifiers who hadn't even gone inside, no one would ever suspect that he was the one who did it, except if Lana spilled the beans, and even if she did, he honestly had no issues showing his powers.
Some of the Golden Dragons went inside to relay the message about the immediate call back of everyone inside.
All of them had also received the message of defeat of the boss, and it was an understatement to say that they were shocked.
And after thirty minutes… all of those still alive after the few hours inside the rift had already gone out, some annoyed they weren't able to keep going, others relieved as the world inside was terrifying.
Those that didn't come out had either been killed by monsters, an unfortunate end, but proof that they weren't fit for this life, while the remainder had been cursed by the black sun, forcing them to transform into these… beasts.
The Golden Dragons after making sure everything was set used a [Voice Enhance] spell to make sure everyone heard them.
"The busses that will bring you back to Fellarburg will be coming in less than an hour, until then we will be holding an inspection on everyone!"
Dozens of men in black suit were postponed all around the perimeter of the dungeon, and most people hadn't even noticed their presences until they were actually pointed at by Oliver.
"Please do not do anything reckless, these men are trained to be violent in case of any sign of resistance."
Their suits were shining, proof that they were actually enhanced to increase their defense, and the atmosphere around them made it obvious they would be at least level 50 or above.
'All that for low-levels students…?' Stark thought, and his mind immediately went to the scenario of them forcibly taking items from people.
Luckily enough, he had [Spatial Inventory], meaning no one beside him could ever find these items as long as he didn't take them out.
As a giant queue was beginning to form around all the different 'inspectors', Stark like many who were uncertain just stood in the middle of ruins, waiting for time to pass.
And suddenly… after ten minutes of that.
"YOU!" Stark heard a voice from behind, and when he turned to look, he saw an angry Daniel running toward him alongside his goons, "I FOUND YOU!"
'Does this guy want to get beat up again…?'With determination in his eyes, Stark braced himself for the confrontation with Daniel and his minions.
Hearing Daniel's shout, most people in the crowd began looking at him, and even those from afar tried hard to see what the commotion was about.
"I didn't find you in the dungeon, and it was because you didn't even enter it, you fucking pussy," he laughed, his steel sword in hand.
In response, Stark just stared at him, confused.
"Uh… okay."
"You got lucky the first time we fought, but this time… it's over, i'm really gonna kill you!" his sword began glowing with a silver aura.
"Holy shit, what's happening?" someone spoke.
"Are they fighting?" another replied.
Even the Golden Dragons watched from afar.
"Should we stop them," Alex wondered, he frankly enjoyed this type of drama, but not among young folks that weren't even adults yet.
"No," Oliver smiled, a bright aura shining in his eyes, "I think we should let them do whatever they want, if someone dies, then it means they weren't fit to be a classifier."
Back to Stark, he just stood there, a neutral expression on his face, looking down.
To most people, it just meant that he knew he was cornered with no way out, and that he was just begging for mercy.
But no, it was the complete opposite: he was stopping himself from laughing.
After a few seconds, the black-haired boy looked up, a wide grin on his face, "So let me guess, you wanna fight again?"
His confidence was enough to even make Daniel uncomfortable, a drop of sweat pouring from his forehead.
"Yes asshole, i'm going to kill you-" the tanned boy doubled down though, ready to slash Stark with his sword.
"Domination!" Stark didn't waste time and activated his main skill, aura enveloping his hands and feet.
He was ready to avoid Daniel's attack and absolutely decimate him in front of everyone.

chapters.title: Chapter 30 - 30: Back to Fellarburg
chapters.content:
His fists full of aura, Stark positioned himself for the battle against Daniel, and this time there would be no deathless duel or anything of the sort, it was all or nothing.
"I am going to kill you…" Daniel was starting to doubt his judgment now, the atmosphere around Stark was different than it was ten seconds ago for some reason.
But he couldn't let it show that he was hesitating, he was part of the Pridel family, one of the biggest ones in Fellarburg, if not the entire world.
Luckily for him though, someone came to stop whatever was happening: Lana Moonless.
"Stop whatever you're doing," she spoke with an emotionless voice, placing herself between the two.
"Oh my god, that's Lana!"
"THE Lana? From the Moonless family, the ones that own lots of businesses, guilds, and are all extremely powerful…?"
"I heard her father is called the 'Archer King'…"
Frankly, Lana would never stoop so low as to stop ongoing battles between people as she all considered that extremely childish, but for some reason… she felt like she needed to stop this one, and it's totally not because Stark is there, obviously!
"Lana, what are you doing?" Daniel showed his soft spot for the blonde-haired archer, unable to defy anything she said, both because of his obsession for her and because her family was stronger.
Stark, on the otherhand just looked at her with a neutral expression, it was as if his eyes were staring at her soul.
"That black-haired guy is done for… of course Lana is gonna side with Daniel!"
"It's business matter, that guy is cornered."
"I guess the weak really should just stay back huh…"
Lana really wanted to say something to Stark at that moment, not to criticize him or anything, just to make sure everything was alright, but seeing his expression and aura while looking at her, she switched her gaze and looked at Daniel.
"Aren't you tired of causing problems," she spoke to him, giving him a harsh look, completely different from her expression with Stark, "Seriously… I HATE men like you…" she groaned and began walking toward Stark.
"W-what the?" Daniel was astonished, he had not expected to be called out by Lana in such a way.
And honestly, no one did, they all expected her to lash out at Stark for being a nuisance.
'Well, she's going toward him anyway, so he is also getting it!' Daniel smirked again, ready to see Lana unleash another barrage of insults at him.
But… when she approached Stark, none of this happened.
She just grabbed his arm and took him away, toward one of the men in black.
They disappeared into the crowd before anyone could do anything, and everyone present to see the scene was left speechless, Daniel the first.
He had known Lana since she was little, falling in love with her the first time he saw her as a little girl, and their families were on good terms, so to him, everything was going well.
When they reached middle school, he relentlesly persued her, but she would always shrug him off, not even interested in him a single bit.
And it wasn't like she was making a bad choice: Daniel is a hypocrite, vowing his love to her but still sleeping around.
Just like that, the inspection kept going.
***
When it was Lana's turn to be inspected, the guards let her pass without checking anything: it was obvious, she was famous and her father was probably the boss of these guys, no wonder they didn't check her.
Stark on the otherhand was right behind the blonde archer, and of course, he was stopped like everybody else.
"Please show us the items you acquired, and inform us about what you did in the rift."
"No items," he lied, "And also, I am the one that beat-" he tried to speak about his achievements to the guard, after all Stark was someone who loved to boast.
But Lana came to interrupt them, "He is with me, no need to inspect him either."
"But miss, we were tasked to-" the guard was put in a tough spot, he had been given strict instructions to not let anyone that isn't Lana or from a big faction/family pass without a search
"This guy is my friend, is it so hard to understand or do you want me to tell my father about it?" she hated abusing her powers, but this time was a special occasion as she didn't want Stark to tell them about his fight with the boss.
"V-Very well!" the guard let Stark pass, "Next in line!"
And so just like that, Stark was allowed out.
The busses had already arrived by now, and people were leaving little by little.
"Welp, thank you I guess," Stark smiled before heading toward a half-full bus that was ready to take off in less than five minutes.
It was currently around midnight, and so all he wanted to do was take advantage of this ride to sleep.
He sat on a bus chair (with no one beside him), and yawned, he had been the one that probably had done the most things inside the rift, so of course he was tired.
'I just want to sleep…' he closed his eyes, and after a few seconds, he sensed a presence beside him, "…?"
He looked to his right, just to see Lana, "Do you have a crush on me or something? Why are you following me?" he asked.
"HUH? ME? There are just no other chairs beside this one I feel comfortable sitting on!"
Stark took a few seconds to notice many empty chairs in the bus, but just decided it wasn't worth it, and went back to closing his eyes.
Soon enough, he fell asleep.
***
(Many hours later)
The sun was starting to rise, casting its warm rays through the windows of the bus. Stark slowly stirred, feeling the uncomfortable stiffness in his neck and shoulders. He opened his eyes and sat up, blinking away the gritty remnants of sleep from his eyes.
They had finally arrived back at the Lotus Academy, and soon enough most of the people left the bus, greeted by their parents or other figures related to them.
For this special occasion, even Lana's father, the 'Archer King' went to check on his daughter, hugging her as soon as she left the bus, Stark right behind her.
"My little princess, did you do well?" he smiled, a proof that he really cared about his daughter.
"Of course I did, dad, I beat the boss!"
"THAT'S MY GIRL," he was extremely tall with blond hair and a beard, and lifted her up while spinning.
Stark wasn't interested in such a scene, and so he decided to go back to his hotel room as nobody had come to check on him, he had a rough day ahead of him as he wanted to sell his items, and maybe, just maybe, try to find anything related to that Domination Trial.
But right as he was about to leave…
"Wait, you," Lana's father shouted, and gestured for him to approach him, for some reason, he had the feeling that Stark was an important person.

chapters.title: Chapter 31 - 31: The Classifiers Trading Association
chapters.content:
"Wait, you," Lucas, Lana's father, called out, he was able to spot Stark's aura thanks to his formidable archer eyes, and of course that's how he was able to spot people with high potential.
His daughter was the same, which was how she knew if someone only wanted to speak to her because they had ulterior motives, and also able to gouge their strength that way.
Stark was one of the few people that were actually genuine and strong, so he decided to call out to him.
"Oh come on," Stark rolled his eyes, he didn't want to get involved in such a matter, and so he did the thing he thought was best in this situation: run away.
Anybody else that was called by the Archer King would of jumped in joy since it was an opportunity to get closer to the big boss and his daughter, yet Stark just wanted to rest and sell his items.
"Hahahahahahah~" Lucas laughed, he of course had the speed to catch up to Stark instantly, but didn't bother to do as it was more interesting this way, "He seems to be important to you, Lana!"
"H-Huh?" she didn't understand how her father could see that, and she visibly blushed at his remark, "W-well… just a friend…"
"A friend is more than enough for me, finally someone that can understand you, I feel like he is gonna achieve great things!" and so the two of them climbed inside a luxurious car that had been waiting for them and took off.
***
Stark went to his hotel room, which was only around ten minutes away from his middle school, Lotus Academy.
He arrived in his room, and it was the same as ever, thankfully they hadn't given it to another person as he hadn't come back for an entire day because of the 'Class Showcase'.
He took his wallet with him, it contained his credit card, debit card and student card, which would probably make things easier for him.
His phone was also on a table beside his bed, and out of frustration, he grabbed it and decided a few pass-codes.
[1234… INCORRECT]
[2024… INCORRECT]
[0000… INCORRECT]
'…' he thought for a few seconds, and an idea came to mind as he took his student card in hand, 'Even in my previous world, my phone code was the same…'
Stark's birthday was the 21st of May, and so that meant…
[2105…]
And surprisingly, it actually did work.
'Holy shit, the FBI needs to hire me!' he was proud of himself.
But not wanting to waste time, he took his wallet and phone with him and left the hotel room.
He had done his research beforehand, and so instead of taking his time to rest or go back to the library to acquire information, he hailed for a taxi and drove to the biggest classifier trading district in all of Fellarburg.
It took him only 20 minutes since he was close to the center of the city he was in.
"Thank you for the ride," he thanked his driver and exited the car, now standing in the bustling trading district of Fellarburg.
It was around 7am in the morning, yet hundreds of people were coming and going from different buildings and talking to one another.
The buildings around him had massive neon signs hanging above them, advertising various items and services that could be bought and sold at their respective establishments.
Stark walked past the familiar sounds of negotiations and deals being made, his heart pounding with anticipation.
Soon, he arrived in front of the biggest building of them all, and the one that attracted the most people.
"Classifiers Trading Association," he mumbled, and guessed that it was probably the right place to be at.
He entered the building, leaving the bustling streets behind him, he frankly didn't enjoy the noise too much as he would much rather stay in silence, something he had inherited from his past and calm life.
Inside, he found himself in a massive lobby with a high ceiling and bustling with other classifiers who were here for the same purpose as Stark.
All over the place, holographic screens could be seen advertising items, equipments and weapons that could be useful to people.
Feeling a bit lost because of the sheer amount of people, Stark stopped for a few seconds to observe his surroundings.
Thankfully enough though, a woman in a stylish suit approached him with a friendly smile, "Welcome to the Classifiers Trading Association, sir, how may I help you today?"
Her attitude, posture and entire posture had probably been rehearsed hundreds of time to make her seem as friendly and professional as possible, and even Stark couldn't deny that it was working.
"I'm looking to sell some items i've acquired inside a dungeon recently," Stark explained, smiling back.
"Oh~ very well, please follow me to one of our special rooms and I will call a professional appraiser to evaluate the prices."
The receptionist didn't seem very interested in him based on her expression, after all, the 'Classifiers Trading Association' was mainly interested in buying items and weapons that were from higher classed rifts, and Stark's appearance screamed "hey I just started my life as a classifier".
'Low level items' were also appreciated since they could be bought for cheaper and were a good way to start your journey, even more so when they had perks, but it was just that, they were just temporary until you could acquire better loot as your level got higher.
The woman took Stark to a reception room, and inside of it, sitting on a couch, was a middle-aged man with glasses and a soon-to-be balding head.
He was enjoying a cup of coffee while using his phone, probably just waiting for his next customer.
And so as soon he saw Stark, he switched his attitude and went into 'business' mode.
Stark sat in front of the man, neither of them exchanging a greeting as they knew they were here for one thing: trading.
'Spatial Inventory,' Stark with a blank expression opened the void that stored his items, which appeared beside him and surprised the man.
Then he thought about the items he acquired in the rift, and suddenly, he was able to grab them.
He pulled out the [Low-Level Magic Staff] and the [Ice Bow], placing them in front of the table.
"What a weird… skill?" the man stared, confused.
"Don't worry about it, just check these items please," Stark smiled, staring at the man with his deep aura-filled eyes.
The man nodded and began to examine the items.
After a minute or two, he put the staff down, then spoke, "the staff seems of bad quality and only of common rarity, we are ready to offer 53,000 rher coins for it."
Rher coins are the currency of this world, and yes, that stupid god of fate actually named the money after himself.
"Hm…" Stark thought, but was satisfied enough with the first price even though it was extremely low, possibly because it was one of the lowest rated piece of equipment there was, "I accept."
"Very well," the man grabbed the staff and put it beside him, then immediately began inspecting the bow, which interested him much more.

chapters.title: Chapter 32 - 32: Unexpected Conflict
chapters.content:
The appraiser grabbed the ice bow from the table, and just like with the staff, he grabbed a magnifying glass enhanced with the [Appraise] spell and began inspecting every centimeter of it.
It took him much more than with the staff, instead of a minute, he spent around five just inspecting and mumbling, "Hm~"; "Interesting~"; "Ohoh~".
After that, the appraiser put the bow on the table and smiled at Stark, "Our association is willing to exchange this bow for around 150,000 rher coins."
At first, Stark was ecstatic as he was gonna be able to pay off many things he needed in his journey, and maybe rent an actual appartment instead of that expensive hotel he was in.
Such an amount would guarantee some people to live comfortably for many months, yet for a classifier, this was a sum that would disappear as soon as he wanted to buy better equipment, skill scrolls or items.
Yet, somehow, Stark felt a hunch, and decided to activate his [Perception] skill to check out the bow.
…
[Item:] Ice Bow
[Type:] Bow
[Class:] Archer
[Tier:] Rare
[Required Level:] 20
[Quality:] Good
[Attributes:] +30 speed, +20 Stamina
[Special Perks:] While using this bow, arrows have a 5% chance to freeze enemies
[Price:] 180,000
…
A new category had appeared all of a sudden, one that wasn't available for even the staff, maybe it was because his skill felt that it was unfair and showed him the actual fair price.
"Are you trying to scam me?" Stark looked at the man with a deep menacing stare, grabbing the bow from the table, "This bow should be worth at least 180,000 rher coins."
"Yes but…" the man suddenly explained to Stark that even though what he was saying was right, the association still need a marge to profit from the items that were bought.
'…' Stark looked at him for a few seconds as he explained, "I want 165,000 rher coins."
"Very well," the appraiser gave up and agreed to the amount before grabbing the bow and putting it beside him, "You would be a great businessman sir, are you maybe interesting in joining us-"
"I'd rather not," Stark immediately answered.
"Very well, then please register your name in the association's data base and we will proceed with the payment in the shortest of times," the man gave Stark a tablet, and so he did as he was told.
Soon after, Stark was allowed to leave the reception room and found himself yet again in the lobby of the 'Classifiers Trading Association', there were still hundreds of people walking around, and several hallways leading to different sections of the giant building.
[Market Section]
A sign next to it explained: "Where people can buy/sell/trade items with the help of a middle-man from the association, it can range from armor, weapons, items and equipment."
[Gambling Section]
'Gambling? Seriously?' Stark had experience in his past life, and he sure as hell wasn't taking that chance in here either.
[Party Formation Section]
'Self explanatory I guess…'
After scouring the area for another 30 minutes, Stark decided it was time to leave, plus a notification on his phone alerted him to a deposit of 218,000 rher coins into his account, bringing a sense of satisfaction to him.
Exiting the bustling 'Classifiers Trading Association', he emerged onto the crowded streets, now even more packed due to the "busy hour" rush.
'Classifier' was probably the most dangerous job in this world as you could probably start your day thinking you would gather material inside a dungeon, and never come out of it, so that's why many just enjoyed their life of luxury.
Stark made his way into a nearby clothing shop. Despite his eccentric taste in fashion, he purchased four sets of decent shirts and pants to replace his now dirtied middle-school uniform, he obviously put them inside the [Spatial Inventory].
'I guess that's it for today,' he was satisfied, and while navigating the streets of the giant trading district, which went on for kilometers upon kilometers, Stark decided to open his phone and look out for information.
[Domination Trial] was what he typed in the search bar, but even after many minutes of searching, absolutely no information came out, it was either it was censored, or that no one had ever talked about it online.
'…' this put Stark in a bad situation, after all he had five days before the first domination trial, and having no information with such a thing was suicide.
He didn't know how hard it would be, but even his status panel had told him that he would 'suffer'.
"Ah~ this is gonna be difficult-" not seeing where he was walking because of his focus in his search, Stark bumped into someone, managing to balance himself not to fall.
He instinctively looked up, and once he did, he saw a giant man, at least 195cm tall, muscles all over his arms, legs and body, as well as red hair and a beard; there were two women gripping his arms, their breasts pushed against him.
"Can you not see where you are going, kid?" the man spoke, looking down on Stark.
"Oh, i'm sorry I wasn't watching-" Stark was the type to not seek unwanted problems, so he just apologized and began moving on.
But of course, annoying people will always be annoying.
"You think you can get away after that?" the man replied, driven by the thought of his pride being hurt and to impress the women in his arms.
"Yes, I think I can," Stark looked back, he had already apologized, and if someone wanted to cause problems, he sure as hell was gonna retort.
At this point, many people in the streets stopped to look at whatever was happening: it wasn't that rare for two classifiers to disagree and duel, most of the times it would break into a fight that would be recorded and sent all over the internet, the winner of course being praised.
"Let's settle this the 'adult' way, kid," the tall man laughed, and the two girls that were holding his arms stepped back, a circle had now formed around them, many other classifiers holding their phones, filming the scene.
'What the fuck is happening?' Stark, a neutral expression on his face, wondered, he was just walking minding his own business, yet somehow it had turned out like this in less than a minute.
And suddenly… a crimson panel appeared in front of Stark, one he had already seen before.
[Duel Request: Aaron]
[Type: Deathless]
[Y/N]
'…' Stark smirked, 'I'm going to destroy that guy.'

chapters.title: Chapter 33 - 33: Call from Lana
chapters.content:
[Duel Request: Aaron]
[Type: Deathless]
[Y/N]
Stark smirked as he saw such a panel in front of him, it reminded him of his fight against Daniel on his second day in this world.
But… Stark didn't want to waste his time on such a matter.
Without even accepting the duel request, he activated [Domination], allowing his crimson aura to surround his body, and dashed toward the man.
Of course, he had already used [Perception] to analyze his opponent and make sure he could take him.
…
[Name: Aaron Winston]
[Level: 29]
[Class: Warrior]
[HP: 8530]
[Strength: 271]
[Speed: 102]
[Stamina: 321]
[Defense: 193]
[Skills: Endure; Strike; Charge; Defensive Stance; Sword Mastery…]
…
Aaron wasn't able to draw his sword that Stark closed the distance between them, and with his intense speed and power, he managed to smash the man's chin, sending him flying.
"-5728!" this number appeared next to the man as he was hit.
Launched a few feet in the air, the man didn't know what just happened to him, and soon after the pain came rushing.
~CRASH~
He hit the ground hard, resulting in him falling unconscious without the battle even starting for real.
"If you set up a duel and put the type as 'deathless', then you are just a pussy," Stark spoke, taking the man's sword as his reward and putting it inside his inventory void, and no, this isn't stealing since no one stopped him.
This was probably the quickest duel these people had ever seen since it didn't even start that it ended, but it was enough to cause a commotion as many cheered for Stark and his nonchalant attitude.
"NICE JOB, KID!"
"Pretty damn nice!"
They cheered for him, but all Stark wanted was to leave, and so they allowed him that by forming a straight path toward the exit of the trading district.
'I'm sure it's because of the chosen one talent and its perk that this keeps happening…' he groaned.
As Stark exited the trading district, he couldn't help but shake his head at the whole incident. He had learned that people would always look for reasons to stir up trouble, and sometimes, it was hard to avoid such situations.
He hailed for a taxi and after a short ride, arrived in front of his hotel, where his room was waiting for him.
Not even bothering to change clothes, he jumped on his bed, plunging his head into his pillow even though it was only around 8am.
And soon… he fell asleep.
***
By a string of fate, though, Stark found himself in the same space he had first entered when he slept beside the bonfire inside the [City Ruins].
In his sleep, he saw the infinite void, stretching on and on, and of course, just like last time, the doppelganger of himself could be seen in the distance, standing idle and smiling.
"Maybe it can help…" he mumbled, approaching it slowly, though he found it hard.
Panels appeared in front of him each time he got closer to the other him.
[The Domination Trial starts in 5 days, it is something every person with the 'domination' class must go through once they reach the adequate level.]
'…'
[Though these trials are extremely hard, they aren't impossible: there is always a way to survive, but it depends on the person inside the trial.]
'…'
[These trials are classified in five categories: Hell, Nightmare, Doom, Godless, Death.]
[These are based on luck, but are still possible, just much harder.]
'Keep pushing,' he was getting closer and closer to the other Stark, who was still smiling, almost inviting him to come.
[Those that complete the domination trials are granted incredible rewards, so be one of them, Stark Heartsouls.]
He was now right infront of his other self, but as he extanded his arm to touch it, the figure vanished, and the world began to shake again.
[Good luck, more information will be given later.]
And then, Stark woke up.
***
~Beep, Beep, Beep~
'Hm…?' Stark opened his eyes, hearing the sound of his phone ringing beside him even though he had set no alarm.
He didn't know how much time had passed, but it was still morning and the sun was in the sky, so it couldn't have been more than a few hours, right?
Taking a few seconds to adjust to his surroundings, he grabbed his phone to see who was calling him on this number.
[Unknown number]
'…'
He didn't know who it was, maybe someone close to Stark, although he doubted that since no one had called him before and that he wasn't liked in general.
Curiosity got the better of him, and he pressed the green button to answer the call.
"Hello?" he heard an extremely familiar voice on the other side.
"…" Stark blinked a few times, trying to make sense of it, "Lana…? Is that you?"
"O-Oh, you found me out! What have you been doing these past two days, i've been calling you non-stop yet you weren't answering at all!"
"The past two days? What are you talking about-" Stark didn't know what she was talking about, after all there was no way that…?
He looked to his right, and he saw a panel that confirmed what she said:
[The first Domination Trial is in 3 days, good luck.]
'Ah shit…'
He had slept for two entire days, maybe it was because of that weird dream of his, or because he used so much aura inside the rift that he was finally able to rest from all the action.
In the end, it didn't matter.
"How do you even have my phone number? I don't remember giving it to you," Stark raised an eyebrow, confused as to how the archer got his contact.
"Huh… surprise…?" on the other end of the call, Lana was lying on her stomach on her bed, swinging her legs back and forth while in her luxurious condo in the capital of Fellarburg, "Anyway, it doesn't matter, I have called you for a job opportunity!"
"Not interested," he tried to hang up.
"WAIT! It involves getting stronger, and i'm sure you won't be going back to the [City Ruins], so it's a good way to increase your level!"
"…" Stark wasn't interested at all, after all he had the domination trial to expect in three days, but… "Okay, just explain."
"It's a level 35-50 Hell-Level rift that just appeared, many classifiers will be there to explore it-"
"NOW WE'RE TALKING!" Stark nodded.
"Well, I won't talk more on the phone, let's set up a meeting in the capital, and we'll meet there in one week as I have things to do in the meantimes"
"…" Stark thought about how long it would take for him to beat the Domination Trial, but not knowing the answer, he still responded positively to her request, "Okay, i'll try to be there, but not guaranteed."
And just like that, both of them hang up the call.

chapters.title: Chapter 34 - 34: The Start of the Trial
chapters.content:
Stark got up from his bed, feeling refreshed and slightly more awake.
Checking the date on his phone and based on the fact the Domination Trial was now in 3 days, Stark guessed that he had truly slept for two entire days, something no normal person should be doing.
After taking a shower and changing his clothes into ones he had bought two days ago, he felt extremely hungry, and went outside to eat.
And so, just like that, Stark passed the time.
…
[The first Domination Trial is in 2 days, good luck.]
…
[The first Domination Trial is in 1 days, good luck.]
…
[The first Domination Trial is in 12 hours, good luck.]
…
The last days went on smoothly without anything happening, Stark spent them mostly outside exploring Fellarburg to familiarize himself and have fun before the big day.
Lana didn't contact him anymore either, maybe because she truly had things to do, or because she felt like it would be too obvious she was stalking him if she did that.
Any how, these days passed peacefully while Stark regained his strenght, now able to confidently fight through another rift if possible.
Based on the timer shown in his status window, the Domination Trial would start at exactly midnight of the next day, and even though he had no idea how this trial worked and how he would even go there, Stark still waited.
***
On his last night of sleep, Stark dreamt yet again of that void with the other Stark looking at him, a blank expression on his face
And surprisingly, he was able to talk.
"Is this… an obligation?" he asked.
"Yes," the doppelganger nodded, "Everyone with the 'Domination' class that successfully awakened will go through it, and as you know, those who succeed are granted an amazing reward."
"Okay, and what are my chances of actually completing it?"
"Hm…" he put his hands against his chin, "I would give you a good 1/10000 chance of you getting out of there alive."
"A 1/10000 chance?" Stark's eyes widened in disbelief.
The other Stark simply nodded, a solemn expression on his face.
"But don't worry," he continued, "It's a fair challenge. It's just that only a small amount of people complete it."
Stark frowned, but he couldn't help but feel a sense of determination. This trial might be nearly impossible, but he was a 'Domination' class fighter. He had to give it his best shot.
As the doppelganger vanished once more, the world around Stark began to shake violently, and he woke up, his heart pounding in his chest.
"21:37…" he checked the time on his phone as he decided to sleep the entire day to be in perfect condition.
[The First Domination Trial is in 2 hours 23 minutes]
Stark looked out of the window, the streets of Fellarburg were starting to fill with the bustling nightlife. He took a deep breath, calming his nerves.
Tonight, everything would change.
…
[The First Domination Trial is in 1 hours 52 minutes]
In the two hours leading to the Domination Trial, Stark found himself restlessly pacing around his apartment.
[The First Domination Trial is in 1 hours 15 minutes]
The anticipation of the unknown was almost too much to handle, but he couldn't afford to lose focus now.
[The First Domination Trial is in 30 minutes]
No information, nothing but himself and his class to survive.
[The First Domination Trial is in 10 minutes]
Once the ten minutes mark was reached, more panels began to appear around Stark as he kept going back and forth in his room.
[Upon the timer reaching 0, you will be forcibly put to sleep, in a state of unconsciousness nothing will be able to get you out of: it is either you complete the trial or… become one of 'them']
[The level of the trial will be decided the moment you enter it, each trial has a different theme and different challenges, so use your brain]
It was almost as if the class in itself was giving him a tutorial to increase his chances of survival.
…
[The First Domination Trial is in 1 minute]
The timer ticked down to its final seconds, and Stark felt a sudden surge of energy coursing through his veins.
It was time.
As the last second struck, the room around Stark dissolved into a swirling vortex of darkness.
He struggled to keep his eyes opened even though he had slept the entire day, almost as if a curse had been put on him.
[Do not fight it.]
'…'
Stark's consciousness faded.
***
And then he opened his eyes again, finding himself in a competely different realm.
But there was nothing around him, it was just black void again, almost making him believe if he wasn't in the dream world again.
He was soon proven to be wrong as a panel appeared.
[Information every classifier gets before the trial! Please read carefully!]
[Stark Heartsouls; Code Name: "The Chosen"]
'…'
[Your goal: get to the end of the trial alive, do not die (you aren't affected by hunger and thirst inside)]
The screen faded away, and Stark was left standing in complete darkness, unsure of what to do or where to go.
[Good luck, it will be needed.]
'Okay,' he nodded.
And suddenly, his surroundings began to change, the black void beginning to be replaced by a small clearing, surrounded by impenetrable walls and flowers everywhere.
For a second, it almost felt like he was sent somewhere peaceful.
But the crimson text that appeared afterward brought him back to reality.
[Domination Trial: Glass Purgatory]
[Difficulty: DEATH]
'Ah shit…'
This was the most difficult category of them all.
As he stood in the center of the clearing, Stark couldn't believe what was happening. His surroundings were no longer just a black void, but now a strange and surreal landscape.
The ground beneath his feet was made up of gravel and dirt, leading up to towering walls that boxed him in.
Pillars rose up to the sky, casting long shadows across the area.
But what caught Stark's attention even more were the skeletons scattered at the base of each pillar, dozens upon dozens of them, their bones bleached white by some unknown force.
It was an eerie sight.
And in the middle of it all, there was a giant mirror, reflecting everything around it, its frame made out of human bones.
Just as he was trying to make sense of it all, Stark heard a voice behind him. Turning around, he saw four figures resting against a pillar, their eyes fixed on him.
"Looks like the last one is here," one of them said, breaking the silence.
"Hm… Is it time to start the trial then?"
"I guess so… but don't be too hasty, it is a 'Death' difficulty one after all…"
Stark was confused: why wasn't he alone.
And just as he thought of that, a panel appeared.
[The five most promising new 'Domination' class users have been chosen to participate in this trial, have fun =)]
'Ah shit…' Stark looked at the four figures, not trusting them at all as they were just like him: people who would do anything to survive this trial and its challenges.
And so just like that, the Domination Trial began.

chapters.title: Chapter 35 - 35: Entering the Glass Purgatory
chapters.content:
Stark stared at the four other 'Domination' users that were with him in this trial.
"Seriously? Only guys here…? Man this is gonna be a sausage party…!" a muscle-head with black hair held his forehead, laughing out loud.
"Shut up, we aren't here to have fun," another boy with short white hair replied, he seemed to be of the extroverted type.
[These are the other participants of the trial, stay together to increase your chances of survival or… go alone (not recommended)]
"Can we at least introduce ourselves," a green-haired boy adjusted his glasses and smiled, "We were waiting for the last one before doing anything after all."
"Who cares about that, all of us are gonna die anyways, this is a death difficulty trial…" a nervous looking boy finished, he had short red hair and a burn scar on his right cheek.
Stark raised an eyebrow, this wasn't what he expected, but it seemed like they were all just like him, although their aura indicated that they weren't clueless either.
'The 5 most promising new 'Domination' class users,' he remembered this panel, meaning that in this small clearing with the mirror in the middle were the domination users with the most potential to be the strongest, maybe some of them were stronger than him…
Just as he thought of that… a panel appeared above the mirror, and all the guys looked at it.
[5 minutes to enter the 'Glass Purgatory' before 'Skeleton Revival']
"The skeletons are gonna wake up probably," Stark spoke for the first time, pointing at the skeletons at the feet of the pillars, their eyes were shining, giving their owners an unnervingly lifelike appearance.
"Well then let's introduce ourselves quickly, code name is Dreamer," the glassed-man spoke, referring to himself with the code name he was given in the void, just like Stark.
"Oh~ We're doing that?" the white-haired one spoke, "then my name is Hero!"
"Chosen," Stark introduced himself too.
"Orasio…" the nervous boy added.
"Just so you fuckers know," the muscled man, who was much older than the rest, looking at least twenty-five years of age, talked, "I am not your friend and I will never be, this is just a temporary alliance to get out of this shit-hole, the name's Boxer by the way."
[2:38 minutes remaining before the 'Skeleton Revival']
The atmosphere in the clearing was tense, all the boys looked at one another.
[Participants: Chosen, Dreamer, Hero, Orasio, Boxer]
"Let's go, then," Dreamer advanced toward the mirror in the middle of the clearing, after all it seemed to be the most obvious way to get inside the 'Glass Purgatory'.
The others followed closely, and after a few seconds, they found themselves in front of the glass that reflected their appearance perfectly.
But this wasn't all they saw: in the reflection, a huge doorway leading to a long corridor could be seen, looming over them.
"What the?" Orasio turned around, but of course, there was nothing behind them.
It was inside the mirror.
"I guess that makes sense," Hero put his arm forward and touched the glass, but nothing happened.
They expected to be able to pass through the glass to begin their descent of the 'Glass Purgatory', but even entering it was a difficult task it seemed.
[1:32 minutes remaining before the 'Skeleton Revival']
They tried many things in thirty seconds, which seemed like hours for them: hitting the glass, rushing toward it, slowly reaching it, activating their aura, but none of it worked.
Stark stared from afar with a blank expression, he had noticed that even though the boys had activated their aura, they never went as far as to show their powers, probably all cautious as they couldn't trust anybody.
"Let me try something," after analyzing for a bit, he decided to act.
[22 seconds remaining before the 'Skeleton Revival']
Making way for him, the others allowed Stark to place himself in front of the mirror.
And so he did something illogical: instead of heading toward the mirror, he went backward all the while keeping his eyes on the glass showing the corridor.
Soon enough, he was engulfed by the walls of the mysterious hallway, entering the 'Glass Purgatory'.
[Only those who observe the world with eyes of glass will find their way into the Purgatory]
The explanation appeared as soon as the puzzle was solved.
[7 seconds remaining before the 'Skeleton Revival']
"HOLY SHIT," realizing that he was onto something, the others repeated his actions.
And so just like that, they were able to enter the 'Glass Purgatory'.
[0 seconds remaining before the 'Skeleton Revival']
[Skeleton Revival]
The hundreds of skeletons in the clearing began to stir, their empty eye sockets glowing red as they slowly rose to their feet, their bones creaking and cracking with each movement.
But luckily for the five participants, they managed to get away from that place, and so the skeleton monsters were left standing aimlessly as no opponent was in their view.
Soon enough, they all crumbled back.
***
Back to the five boys, they found themselves inside the corridor they only were able to see from the mirror's reflection.
"Nice thinking my guy," Boxer patted Stark's back.
"…" Stark didn't answer, instead just looking ahead, the corridor was long, with torches illuminating the path.
The torches cast flickering shadows on the walls as the five boys walked cautiously down the corridor.
Each step echoed ominously, making them acutely aware of the oppressive silence surrounding them.
Hero kept talking, possibly to enlighten the mood, but it was no use: they all knew they were in the face of death, and only themselves could save their skin.
Surprisingly enough, they didn't meet any monsters or horrors for the ten minutes they were inside the hallway, it stretched on endlessly, so nothing surprised them.
In the distance, they saw a blue light.
"FINALLY," Hero jumped in joy, "I was getting tired of these stone walls, i'm kind of claustrophobic…"
"…"
But as they approached the source of the blue light, their excitement turned into dread.
[Welcome to the 'Colossal Paths', good luck participants]
The corridor opened up into a vast chamber, and at the circular center rested an eerie statue under a pillar of light.
There were no walls limiting the room, the darkness ahead made it feel like it went on infinitely.
But thankfully, at the center of the room, three paths converged: flights of stairs led to three gargantuan glass-faced effigies with massive mirrors under them, inviting the participants to enter.
These were the 'Colossal Paths'.
The five boys got out of the hallway and went down the stairs toward the center of the chamber, reaching a statue.
[The Sphinx]
Such a name appeared above the statue, almost as if it was informing them of its name, light poured out from the face of the sphinx, a contorted grin visible and a ghastly aura enveloping the stone beast.
"I guess that's it," Dreamer advanced to examine the Sphinx, then pointed at the three paths, "Look at the forehead of the effigies."
And just as he said, there were numbers displayed on them, heading from 1 to 3.
Which meant…
"We need to complete all the paths and head back here," he pointed at the Sphinx's forehead, where three pearls could be seen, meaning that each time they completed a path, a light would manifest in that pearl.
And so just like that, the participants understood what they needed to do.
[5 participants alive]
But they didn't know... that only one could come out alive, since this is how the [Domination] trial works.

chapters.title: Chapter 36 - 36: The First Guardians
chapters.content:
They exchanged determined looks with each other, their expressions a mix of apprehension and resolve.
The stakes were high, the challenges ahead unknown, but they had absolutely no choice but to move forward.
"How about just each of us going toward a path and hoping that we all complete it?" Hero smiled.
"Are you brain dead? This is suicide, who knows what awaits us, this is probably harder than a Death-Level rift in the real world," Boxer shouted at the stupidity, and the remaining three agreed with him.
Even if somehow one of them managed to beat his path, it didn't mean the others would too, meaning they would be forced to fight all the other things that awaited them.
"Fighting together is the safest option," Dreamer spoke while adjusting his glasses, "And don't get me wrong, I am the first to think it is a bad idea to associate with the likes of you."
"The likes of you?" Boxer took a step toward Dreamer, his fists clenched, centimeters away from his face, "Don't get ahead of yourself asshole."
"No need to fight… we need to win after all… killing each other isn't an option…" Orasio put himself between the two, and somehow the atmosphere calmed down after a few seconds.
"The first thing to do is choose the path we take, after all we are not forced to pick the first one," Stark pointed at the paths and numbers, "Trying to get rid of the easier ones is a good start."
[Please choose your path.]
After a moment of tense silence, Hero stepped forward and pointed confidently at the third path, marked with the number 3.
"How does this even make sense, let's just get to the first one to see," Boxer sighed, unable to understand why they wouldn't just follow the order.
"The order is supposed to show the difficulty, isn't it?" Dreamer spoke, it was just a theory, but a very comprehensible one.
"Who ever said that? It probably doesn't even mean anything!" Hero replied.
Stark watched them argue for a while, after all it was an important choice, taking a difficult path on their first try could end up in all of them dying, while taking an easy one could allow them to gain experience.
"I'm going for the first," Stark began walking toward the staircases of the effigy with the number 1 engraved on its forehead, and he was soon followed by Boxer, Dreamer, and Orasio.
"You guys aren't fun," Hero pouted, but still followed them regardless as it was the group that decides, and he knew deep down trying to clear another path by himself was a bad idea.
As the group descended the stairs of the effigy marked with the number 1, they felt a sense of foreboding wash over them.
A massive mirror stood before them, covered in intricate carvings that seemed to shift and move as if alive.
Stark being the first in the group, he decided to push through, and was able to pass through the mirror.
[The Glass Purgatory is a place divided between two worlds, floating in an eternal limbo between reality and illusion]
[Its four guardians are keeping it together, kill the first three, and the path to the 'Greater One' will open, participants]
[Once you do, the 'Glass Purgatory' will cease to be what it is and disappear]
[Good luck]
This much information was shown to all the boys as they passed, and now they found themselves in yet another giant chamber, illuminated by many torches.
