Strangely enough though, there seemed to be no exit door from this place, it was giant, bigger than a football stadium, yet there was nothing other than the rocks that formed its walls and floor.
'Wait,' Stark thought, 'Maybe it's blocked until we complete another path?'
He decided to turn around, but once he did, instead of facing the mirror that transported them here, he found himself staring at a stone wall.
"Hey, there's actually something in the distance, look closely," Dreamer pointed at the very far end of the room, his glasses seemed to be able to zoom.
And he was right: there was a small door there.
"I guess that's our exit path," Hero took a step forward.
But once he did…
[Glass Guardian #1: The Conjoined Siblings]
[Good luck]
These panels appeared before everyone, and as soon as they vanished.
~FWISH~
~BOOM~
A loud explosion echoed in the distance, and suddenly two figures appeared out of nowhere.
To the right stood a… creature, dressed in a cloak and holding a scepter. It also wore a pointed hat, giving off a witch-like appearance. The head was disturbing, with two female faces merged together in all directions.
[The Conjoined Witch lv20], its name appeared above its head.
Next to it stood a massive skeleton only wearing some small cloak over its head and upper half, the rest was naked, it had a necklace with a purple gem in the middle, and was brandishing a sword; just like the other monster though, it had two skeletal heads on its neck.
[The Conjoined Warrior lv20]
The first guardians of this trial appeared before the five participants, and immediately all of them got ready to fight.
[Eliminate the guardians to be able to leave]
This was all they needed to hear, and they all activated [Domination].
Stark of course began being enveloped by the crimson aura around his body, but it was the other four that felt new.
Boxer, just like his name described, was now wearing magic boxing gloves around his hands, ones that gave him power and strength.
Hero had two floating swords appear in both his sides, and he didn't even bother grabbing them, instead just crossing his arms and waiting for the perfect moment to strike.
Dreamer, on the other hand, had a series of floating magical books spinning around him, their content emenating a dark glow.
Finally, Orasio had a shield materialize on his arm, its surface covered in mysterious runes that seemed to shimmer and shift with energy.
All of them had the [Domination] skill, yet it seemed to react differently to each of their aura, creating a unique power.
"Pretty cool, isn't it," Hero laughed, his pupils burning with a white aura.
"…" none of the others replied, too focused on the boss ahead to speak now.
Stark decided to be smart and use [Perception] on his enemies like he always did.
…
[Name: The Conjoined Witch (GUARDIAN)]
[Level: 20]
[HP: 75000]
[Strength: 50]
[Stamina: 892]
[Speed: 128]
[Defense: 927]
[Skills: Beam, Spark, Buff, Witch's Domain, Glass Attack, Life Share, Heal, Conjoined Bond, Chain Block…]
…
[Name: The Conjoined Warrior (GUARDIAN)]
[Level: 20]
[HP: 75000]
[Strength: 721]
[Stamina: 523]
[Speed: 637]
[Defense: 398]
[Skills: Strike, Skeletal Aura, Final Stand, Warrior's Domain, Conjoined Bond, Split…]
…
'Ah shit, these guys are tough, and there's two of them…' Stark positioned himself for combat like the others.
And thus, the first fight of the 'Domination' trial could begin.

chapters.title: Chapter 37 - 37: The Conjoined Siblings
chapters.content:
The chamber was filled with tension as the five participants faced off against the Conjoined Siblings, their unique powers crackling in the air.
"Just for your information, i'm staying behind and using my books to cast spells," Dreamer was the first to break the silence and initiate what could only be called the start of a strategy.
"I have swords, but they can head toward enemies, so i'll be at the mid-range," Hero smiled.
"I can defend everyone using my shield and also attack… I think i'll just switch based on the situation," Orasio spoke with his nervous voice.
And that left…
"Seems like me and Chosen use our fists to fight, so we'll have to fight head on…" Boxer sighed, he knew that this was the most dangerous role, but also the most essential.
"Just for your information," Stark stretched, ready to attack and avoid, "Each of them have 75k HP, the witch's strength and speed are low but its defense and stamina are very high, the warrior on the other hand has overall average stats."
All the participants looked at Stark as if he was talking gibberish, confused as to how he knew all that, but they all knew he wouldn't try to deceive them in such a situation, so they all nodded.
[3…2…1…]
[BATTLE START!]
The first to attack was Stark as he immediately began running toward the witch and warrior.
But just like them, the guardians seemed to have gotten ready for the assault, the witch rising her scepter in the air and casting [Beam], while the warrior on the other hand placed himself in front of his sister, his skeletal hands ready to unsheathe his sword if they approached.
But Stark didn't care about that.
"Aura Smash," he focused his aura in his right hand, then punched the air, sending the giant crimson fist toward the two bosses.
The Conjoined Warrior immediately tried to cut the attack with his sword, but it was futile, after all you can't cut 'Domination' magic.
"-3427!" on the witch, but it also cancelled her beam spell.
"-5329!" on the warrior.
"Hey, that guy's pretty good," Hero began floating in the air right next to his swords, which were now spinning around him, "But I think it's time to help."
"Fair enough," Dreamer opened ten of the books around him and began casting.
"IT'S SHOW TIME," Boxer laughed and dashed at incredible speed toward the guardians, reaching them before Stark did.
"BOXER SMASH!" he used one of his skills to punch the warrior while he was still disoriented from the crimson fist.
"-8291!"
'Holy… this guy is doing damage,' Stark thought.
But they weren't the only ones that could use skills.
"Strike!" with a powerful blow, the warrior tried to attack Boxer, who was taken aback not expecting the monster to balance itself after such a blow.
~SLASH~
~THUD~
But a green shield appeared in front of Boxer, allowing him to move away, when he and Stark looked back, they saw that it was Orasio that threw his shield and used [Ally Protection].
At the same time, Hero threw his two magic swords at the warrior and witch, each slicing the guardians with a very precise and swift slash.
"-2638!" on the witch.
"-4182!" on the warrior.
Immediately, the sword went back to spin around their owner.
Dreamer's books emanated a dark aura as they unleashed spells upon the siblings, it was like a machine gun that wouldn't end no matter what.
"-327! -251! -425!" the damage was extremely low, but the sheer number was enough to make up for it.
[Conjoined Witch: 65763/75000]
[Conjoined Warrior: 51937/75000]
"We are actually doing decent!" Hero laughed while floating mid-air.
"Greatest team ever?" Orasio dared to add.
Stark and Boxer had already backed away at this point, ready to attack again in the front lines when they could, but they were confident, after all they had done so much damage in less than a minute.
It almost seemed… pathetic, maybe they were too strong for the first guardians?
'…'
But no… this was just a delusion.
Of course they weren't.
"Heal!" the witch raised her scepter, and a golden light enveloped the warrior.
"+15000HP!"
The Conjoined Warrior let out a fearsome battle cry as his wounds began to heal rapidly, rejuvenating his strength and stamina.
"Ah shit…" Stark mumbled, of course it wouldn't be easy, "Aura Smash!"
He sent another crimson fist toward the duo and began rushing toward them, followed closely by Boxer.
~BOOM~
The warrior was able to jump out of the attack's way, but the witch with her very slow speed wasn't able to.
"-3789!"
[Enemy stunned]
Immediately as he saw this message, Stark shouted at the others, "THE WITCH IS STUNNED, ATTACK HER NOW!"
None of them could understand, but they listened regardless: Hero launched his swords at the witch, slashing her three times, while Orasio threw his shield to create an explosive barrier that dealt enormous damage, Dreamer also cast more spells.
And in the end…
"-16271!"
Furious, the warrior rushed toward Stark and Boxer, his sword ready to strike.
"Strike!" it jumped and struck down, but Stark avoided it, "Strike!" it spinned to try and take out Boxer, but he perfectly blocked using [Parry] and punched the warrior away again.
"-4728!"
The warrior stopped himself from being sent too far using his sword, making it scratch the ground and create sparks.
"Skeletal Aura!"
"Beam! Glass Attack!"
After being mostly on the receiving end since the beginning, the guardians were finally able to use their attacks.
And that's when the participants hoped they could have just continued to stale for damage endlessly.
The warrior's hands began glowing with a silver aura, it was as if souls were dancing around him now, and he pointed its sword at Boxer as he was the one that hit him the most.
The witch on the other hand was able to use two attacks at once, sending not only a giant beam toward Hero, who used his swords to block it and receive 637 points of damage out of his available pool.
But it also sent 'Glass Attack' toward Orasio, fortunately enough though, he just used his shield and blocked all the piercing shards that were sent.
"HAHAHAHAHA~" Hero, blood pouring out from his mouth, was laughing hysterically, confusing everyone.
But it was only a few seconds later that they all understood.
"The Hero's Resolve!" he smiled while activating this skill and grabbed the two magic swords in his hand.
He dashed toward the warrior, closing the distance between them in a fraction of a second.
~SLASH, SLASH, SLASH…~
He kept on attacking and attacking, and although the warrior at first tried to shield himself from the relentless assault, he was soon enough overwhelmed.
"-8271!"
"-10172!"
"-9381!"
After hitting three incredible attacks on him, Hero calmed down and backed away.
"Phew~" he feel to his knees, seemingly exhausted after using such a powerful skill, "I'm gonna be out for a bit, I hope what I did is enough…"
But it wasn't.
"Life Share," the witch's scepter began glowing with a green light, and suddenly…
"-20000!" she dealt a massive amount of damage to herself.
And…
"+20000!" she gave it to her brother.
'These things are fucking annoying if they can keep on healing each other…' Stark groaned.
They needed to find a solution to kill them both, and fast.

chapters.title: Chapter 38 - 38: The Witch/Warrior Domain
chapters.content:
[Conjoined Witch HP: 25703/75000]
[Conjoined Warrior HP: 54385/75000]
"The witch lost two thirds of her life," Dreamer spoke while adjusting his glasses, the books around him still spinning, "We should focus on killing her, then the warrior will be defenseless."
Boxer, Hero and Orasio nodded as they heard Dreamer speak, but Stark wasn't convinced.
'Why would there be two of them if they could die like this… they are named the 'Conjoined Siblings' after all…' he thought, he was much more analytical than even Dreamer, so he wouldn't let any detail go unseen.
He examined their status window again while Boxer was stalling for damage.
And that's when he saw it: a skill that the two monsters both shared for some reason.
[Conjoined Bond] was the skill.
Right afterward, he tried to do something he had never done before: use [Perception] to check a skill's description.
He focused his aura not on the monsters, but on their status window and specifically the skills panel.
Seeing that Stark was thinking of something, Hero decided to take his place as a close-ranged fighter and began flying toward the guardians with his swords in hand, he had mostly recovered from his frenzy.
"Ally Protection," Orasio summoned the green shield around Boxer when the witch tried to use [Spark] on him, which created a massive explosion at the edge of her scepter, enough to insta-kill any of them.
And that's when Stark saw it.
…
[Skill: Conjoined Bond]
[Description:] The siblings share both their power, aura, and fate, if one of them is killed while the other is still alive, then the dead one will be revived at half health within a minute.
…
"HOLY SHIT!" he shouted, taking everyone aback as they all stepped back.
"What the hell is happening?" Hero used his swords and slashed the warrior once again.
"-4526!"
Stark didn't beat around the bush, "We need to kill them both within a minute of each other or else they get revived."
Everyone froze for a moment, processing the new information, they didn't understand how Stark knew, but there was no way he would say something like that out of nowhere.
Stark, Hero, and Boxer immediately dashed toward the warrior again, they needed to lower his HP to match the witch's as it was extremely low.
"Strike!" he tried to attack, but Hero used his swords to block and give an opportunity for the others to deal damage.
"BOXER SMASH!" Boxer used his skill again, and hit the skeleton in one of its head, making it crack a little.
"-10281!"
It was sent flying far away, but Stark didn't waste and also activated "Aura Smash" to send a crimson fist toward the warrior.
"-6372!"
Orasio and Dreamer on the other hand used their attacks to occupy the witch and stop her from protecting her brother.
"-271! -362! - 316!" she was getting shot by dozens of Dreamer's spell, and was hit with Orasio's explosive shield, which exploded upon impact with her.
"-9281!"
They weren't speaking while this was happening, but there was a mutual understanding: they were doing pretty good as a team.
"Heal!" the witch during a single second where the assault stopped used her healing magic.
"+15000!" she used it on herself.
"Buff!" she redirected her scepter toward the warrior, who was able to gain lots of speed and strength, enough to overpower the three boys that were attacking him.
They all backed away after that as they felt that the warrior was too strong.
The Conjoined Siblings were also back next to each other, their empty eyesockets burning with an intense aura.
"Seems like we can kill them both if we continue like this," Dreamer smirked.
"HAHA~ No wonder we are the most promising, look just how we are destroying these guardians!" Hero laughed, his magic swords spinning around him.
…
…
…
But that was their biggest mistake.
As someone said: confidence is good, but don't be confident against the wrong opponents.
[Conjoined Witch HP: 28603/75000]
[Conjoined Warrior HP: 33206/75000]
Both the guardians had now around one third of their life left, meaning that killing them both at the same time wasn't far fetched anymore if they managed their damage enough.
But of course, the guardians also had an ace up their sleeves.
Both their sword and scepter began to glow with an eerie aura, and suddenly…
"THE WITCH/WARRIOR DOMAIN!" they both used their ultimate skills, and directed it toward two persons from the group.
It was an attack impossible to avoid no matter what, so all they needed to do was hope they weren't chosen.
And the unlucky ones were…
"ARGH~" Boxer screamed as he was hit, and suddenly vanished from their view alongside the warrior.
"WHAT THE?" Hero jumped, surprised.
And the second…
[Talent: Chosen One, activated]
'Huh?' Stark was confused.
The second attack was heading toward Orasio after all, so why…
~TURN~
The ray of the attack changed from Orasio's direction to Stark's out of nowhere, almost as if an unknown entity had changed its target.
"…" this was the power of the chosen one's second perk.
[#2 Amidst your journey, your talent will bring forth many events, both good and bad.]
'You gotta be kidding me.'
"ARGH~" Stark was hit by the attack, and suddenly also vanished from the other three's view alongside the witch.
***
The world around Stark shifted as he felt himself being transported to a different realm.
Once his eyes adjusted, he immediately got up and positioned his fists to fight.
Checking his surroundings, he noticed that he wasn't in the other chamber with stone walls and torch everywhere, instead he was in a smaller room where the floor was made out of human bones.
There was no wall or ceiling, the rest was complete darkness.
And the most horrifying things of all… was the giant figure staring at them from above, its eyes gleaming with malice.
'Probably the last guardian of this shit hole…' Stark mumbled then looked to his right to see that Boxer was also looking around, he still had his boxing gloves equipped.
"Looks like those fuckers isolated us to have a greater chance of killing us," he spoke, trying to act tough, although the drops of sweat on his forehead and his expression betrayed fear.
"Then let's kill them," Stark looked ahead with a blank expression, and as expected, the warrior and witch were around ten meters in front of them.
"Skeletel Aura!" the warrior's sword began glowing with a silver aura that had faces on it: the souls of those he killed.
"Chain Block!" the witch also lifted her scepter and pointed it toward Stark.
And for the first time ever… Stark didn't have the time to react.
"Huh?" chains came out of the ground and quickly wrapped around Stark, immobilizing him.
He struggled to break free but the chains were too strong.
Boxer, noticing that his only other help in this space was restrained, he tried to punch the chains, but there were just too many of them.
And instead, he decided to rush toward the witch at full speed to break her scepter, it was the only way to stop the attack after all.
Stark appreciated the help from the stranger.
But it was too late…
"STRIKE!" with the souls aura still around his sword, the warrior dashed toward Stark before Boxer could do anything.
And then…
"-4627!" he was hit by an attack that dealt three times his HP.
[HP: 0/1450]
Stark's eyes became lifeless and the chains that bound him disappeared, resulting in him falling to the ground.
"SHIT!" Boxer shouted as he punched the witch.
"6428!"
But it was no use anymore now: Stark was killed.
…
…
…
Or was he?
[Talent: Chosen One, activated]

chapters.title: Chapter 39 - 39: The First Death in the Trial
chapters.content:
[When the user receives critical damage, enough to kill him in one singular attack, he can use his talent and willpower to keep going, setting his HP to 1.]
Which meant…
[HP: 1/1450]
Stark wasn't dead, just injured and on the verge of dying, the warrior could honestly breath in his direction and he would die.
"BOXER SMASH!"
"-8371!" Boxer hit the witch in full force again, thinking that her spell had actually killed Stark.
It didn't look like it, but Boxer seemed to be the type that respected his teammates, even if they were strangers he met twenty minutes ago.
Plus… this was supposed to be a two versus two, so if it became a 1v2, his chances of victory were slim.
Stark got up from the ground as the chains had disappeared, then activated [Aura Smash], sending a crimson fist toward the warrior who wasn't paying attention at Stark anymore.
"6371!"
[Enemy stunned!]
'Bingo,' Stark smirked and dashed toward the warrior under Boxer's bewildered gaze.
"YOU'RE NOT DEAD? HOW MUCH HP DO YOU HAVE?"
"…" Stark didn't reply, instead he focused on his target and punched it three times.
"-19281!"
The warrior was able to move after receiving this much damage, and tried to use [Strike] on Stark, who just stepped back to avoid it.
…
[Conjoined Witch HP: 13804/75000]
[Conjoined Warrior HP: 7554/75000]
Both the guardians were now head-to-head with Stark and Boxer.
Their HP was extremely low, and so it officially became a true 2V2, where the strongest would win.
"Fucking hell, these things just won't die," Boxer smirked, his hands trembling a bit.
"…"
But of course, there was one last thing that could screw them…
"Buff!" the witch used a buff spell on her brother.
And…
"FINAL STAND!" the warrior used his most powerful skill other than domain, which was only here to put the enemies at a disadvantage.
The aura around the warrior completely changed now: the necklace with the purple gem around was glowing immensely, and in return his entire skeletal body was emitting that same purple aura.
It was as if he was using everything he had in this final attempt to kill the intruders.
Stark immediately ran toward the witch, not wasting time as he needed to get rid of her first before she could heal or transfer some of her life to him.
The warrior on the other hand went for Boxer, it was as if he had some unknown grudge against him since the first "Boxer Smash".
"Ah shit…" Boxer readied his gloves and fists, he wouldn't go down that easily.
[Boxer HP: 1700/1700]
Back to Stark, he rushed at the witch, and surprisingly, it didn't seem like she was looking at him at all.
He closed the distance, now in front of her, and saw her scepter glow with an eerie aura.
Thinking she was gonna unleash an attack on him, he got ready to dodge…
But that attack never came.
"-4728!" he hit her, which made her stumble.
But once she looked at his face again, he could see that both of her merged heads were smiling.
"What the?" he looked back, and to his horror…
Boxer was restrained by chains around his legs, all the while the warrior was only a few meters away from him now.
"Clone Frenzy!" Stark tried to summon his clone in front of Boxer to block the attack, but it was too far, only resulting in the clone appearing next to him, ready to fight.
This was the witch's goal: act as if she was fighting Stark, but instead help her brother by restraining the other human.
"FUCK!" Stark shouted and began running toward Boxer, he couldn't afford to lose a teammate in this hell hole, they still had three more guardians after this, so losing someone so soon wasn't an option.
Also, he remembered Boxer's face when he thought Stark was killed, and although he didn't feel much, he still respected him for going as far as feeling angry for his death.
"WAIT A DAMN SECOND," Stark shouted to the warrior, but the skeletal guardian didn't even budge.
Stark wasn't able to reach Boxer on time.
"-17263!" he was decapitated in a swift blow that dealt massive damage.
"…"
"Heal!" the witch used her spell on her brother.
"+15000!"
"…"
Stark was angry, he was absolutely mad.
He didn't know Boxer at all, but for some unknown reason… all he could see was red.
"RAAAAAAAHHHHH" it wasn't him that screamed, but his clone.
That scream brought him back to reality, and Stark's aura at that time was so overwhelming even the guardians could sense it.
"You're dead," he whispered to the warrior before dashing at him, closing the distance in a fraction of a second.
"-10389!"
[Conjoined Warrior HP: 12165/75000]
The impact was so strong that one of the warrior's heads broke.
Stark then ordered his clone to attack the witch, and it listened immediately.
The witch tried to cast a spell to restrain Stark, but…
"…" the clone grabbed the scepter from her hands and broke it in half, rendering her defenseless.
"Aura Smash!" it sent a crimson fist at her.
[Enemy stunned]
And what came afterward…
"-2262! -2626! -2918!"
It was a one-sided beatdown, and the witch could do nothing.
"-3261!"
[Conjoined Witch HP: 0/75000]
Her HP reached 0 and she fell to the ground.
But of course, Stark didn't forget about the [Conjoined Bond] skill, and so as he faced the warrior, who was holding his broken head, he also used [Aura Smash].
"-7381!"
The skeleton guardian was sent flying, and Stark immediately catched up to him.
~CRACK~
"-3251!"
He broke the arm that was holding the sword in half, and sent it away, rendering the warrior weaponless and with no means to defend himself.
"Skeletal Aura," he tried to use one of his skills to deal just a bit of damage, enough to kill Stark.
But of course, he didn't let him.
[Conjoined Warrior HP: 1533/75000]
"Goodbye," Stark looked at the monster with pure hatred in his eyes.
And at that moment, even the guardian thought that that kid was… a monster.
"-13172!"
Stark broke his head completely, and it died.
Now… the two siblings were dead.
[Dealt massive damage and killing blow to GUARDIANS, regaining 837HP!]
And just as fast as he came in this domain, the world around Stark shifted… and he was transported back.
***
"Prepare yourselves, we're gonna have to fight," Dreamer adjusted his glasses and spoke to Hero and Orasio.
"Why is that?" Hero raised his eyebrow.
"Because the monsters will be back in a short amount of time, and we're gonna have to finish them off."
"W-what about Chosen and Boxer," Orasio mumbled.
"Sorry to break your expectations, but I do not believe they will survive this encounter, I think they will put them at low HP, just enough for the rest of us to survive, but it is unlikely that they will live through it," Dreamer was logical, it wasn't that he hoped they died, it was just logic, no one could defeat such beasts in a 2V2.
Or at least… that's what he believed.
[Glass Guardians #1: Conjoined Siblings, DEFEATED]
It was the moment this panel announced their victory that Stark appeared in the middle of the chamber, a blank expression on his face.

chapters.title: Chapter 40 - 40: The Second Path
chapters.content:
"I've finished them," Stark said in a monotone voice as he walked toward the three other participants, "They're all dead now."
"What did you say about them not winning," Hero smirked at Dreamer, who was actually bewildered that Stark was able to come out on top.
But no… this wasn't just Stark, there was someone missing…
"Where is Boxer?" Orasio was the first to remark that, "Wasn't he with you?"
"You perfectly know why he isn't with me, let's just move on," Stark, with the blankest of expressions, pointed at the door at the end of the chamber.
All of them immediately understood as he spoke: Boxer was dead, killed by the guardians, meaning that Stark had to finish the job by himself.
"Oh well… I guess it's fine, we still have two more paths," Hero sighed and then headed toward the door.
"Seems like we really need to be more careful," Dreamer rubbed his chin, after all the people who were transported to the domain were based on luck, and he couldn't let such a factor decide whether he would live or not.
"Fuck…" Orasio gritted his teeth.
Hero's swords, Dreamer's books, and Orasio's shield disappeared as they deactivated [Domination], no need to keep using it now that the battle ended.
"Alright, let's just focus on the task ahead," Stark said.
The group made their way to the exit, their pace slower than usual, there were five of them when they entered, and now only four remained.
Once they passed the door at the far end of the chamber, they found themselves in a room with five small oval mirrors hang against the wall.
[Each participant needs to destroy a mirror to be transported back to the 'Colossal Paths']
Hero examined the mirrors, "The mirrors are probably holding our consciousness. We destroy one, we're sent back."
Dreamer nodded, "Sounds about right. Let's get going then."
One by one, they each approached a mirror, shattered it with a strike of their weapon or a burst of their magic.
Once they'd done so, the world around them began to change and they found themselves transported back to the 'Colossal Paths.'
Back at the center of the large chamber, multiple panels suddenly appeared in front of Stark.
[4 participants alive]
[You have slain "Conjoined Witch lv20 (GUARDIAN)", gained 100000EXP!]
[You have slain "Conjoined Warrior lv20 (GUARDIAN)", gained 100000EXP!]
[First path cleared, two remain]
And of course, getting this incredible amount of experience meant that he was enveloped by the golden glow again.
[Your level has increased to level 12, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Experience: 102617/125000]
But he wasn't the only one: just like him, all the others were enveloped by the golden glow that announced the fact they leveled up.
"Seems like we do get experience in here, I was wondering why it didn't appear," Hero laughed.
"I did most of the work, so I was kind of hoping you would get nothing, or at least not much," Stark shrugged.
"That's rude, we were all fighting!" he replied.
They then noticed that one of the pearls on the Sphinx's forehead was now glowing with a deep silver aura, and two remained unlit.
"Let's take a break before going, you guys can sleep," Dreamer sat on the cold ground, seemingly tired.
And the others couldn't say they weren't either, plus their skill had a cooldown, [The Hero's Resolve] and [Clone Frenzy] needed 30 minutes to be used again, so they waited.
***
(1 hour later)
The thirty minutes turned into an hour as they chatted about all and nothing, getting to know each other was futile in such a place, but it still felt good to know you weren't alone, plus every single one of them made sure not to reveal information about their powers.
"Let's go, then," Stark pointed at the effigy with the number 2 engraved on its forehead, and the rest nodded.
There was no leader in the group as each took their initiatives, but based on everything that happened so far, it was safe to say that Stark was the head.
'Oh wait… I think I haven't used my skill points yet…' he remembered the message, and so all the while walking down the stairs to the mirrors, he checked his status.
[Skill Points: 3 Available]
'I don't even know why I kept them, I haven't used any since level 10…' he sighed, and soon enough he arrived in front of the mirror to the second path.
"Ready?" Dreamer, who was right behind Stark, spoke to the group.
"Yeah," and all of them replied, traversing the mirror just like the first time.
~SPLASH, SPLASH, SPLASH, SPLASH~
As soon as they passed through the doorway to the second guardian, they heard splashing noise, and saw that below them was water… although not the usual blue color, but black…
"Black water?" Hero tilted his head in confusion.
It wasn't that deep, only reaching up to their knees, but it was still a weird environment to be in.
They could see sky above them, and a crimson moon could be seen, no stars present in the sky, its darkness looming all over them.
The black water also seemed to stretch endlessly in all directions, trapping them in here as long as they didn't beat the guardian.
"Where's the exit door? We could see it before…" Orasio spoke.
"I don't know, I guess we have to beat it…?" Dreamer replied, although unsure, he didn't like the atmosphere, and none of them could see very far because of the darkness.
Meaning… that the guardian could be anywhere, ready to ambush and kill them all.
While the rest of the participants looked around in confusion, Stark was currently upgrading his skills.
[You have upgraded 'Aura Smash' to level 5!]
[You have upgraded 'Focus' to level 4!]
[You have upgraded 'Focus' to level 5!]
He used his three skill points to upgrade both of his skills to level 5, and that meant…
…
[Skill: Aura Smash lv5]
[New Perk: Thanks to upgrading this skill to level 5, you are now able to use both of your hands and send two crimson fists at the same time, dealing more damage and increasing the chance of stunning.]
…
[Skill: Focus lv5]
[New Perk: Thanks to upgrading this skill to level 5, you now gain a significant boost to your agility and reaction time, allowing you to dodge and counterattack with ease, time seems to advantage you even more.]
…
With these new perks, Stark felt more confident in his abilities.
"Alright, let's search this place. We need to find the guardian and beat it," he said after finishing his business, his eyes scanning the dark water as he stepped forward.
But just like last time, the moment one of them took a step forward…
~SPLASH~
~BOOM~
Another explosion echoed behind them, and once they turned their heads to see what it was.
They saw it.
[Glass Guardian #2: The Black Water Devourer]

chapters.title: Chapter 41 - 41: The Black Water Devourer
chapters.content:
The Black Water Devourer's body is reminiscent of a giant eel, with sleek, black scales that glisten under the dim light of the crimson moon. Its razor-sharp teeth and multiple rows of fins give it a menacing and predatory appearance, and its eyes were like black holes, sucking in everything around it.
And that very monster now stood in front of the four participants, looking at them.
They were in its territory, giving them a massive disadvantage, and yet none of them backed away.
"Domination!" they all activated their powers and got ready for battle.
[3…2…1…]
[FIGHT!]
The water was shaking because of the Devourer's appearance, but it still remained fairly possible to navigate.
"How is this thing even fitting inside the water if it only reaches our knees, it's literally giant," Dreamer wondered, and it was a very good question.
"Don't think too much about it, trial magic I guess…" Hero shrugged, his nonchalant attitude never went away.
Dreamer was right though, the eel-looking guardian was at least fifteen meters tall.
In the end, Stark shook his head, and like he always did at the start of any fight, he activated [Perception] to analyze his enemy.
…
[Name: Black Water Devourer (GUARDIAN)]
[Level: 25]
[HP: 120000]
[Strength: 738]
[Stamina: 1271]
[Speed: 1128]
[Defense: 213]
[Skills: Tail Whip, Bite, Absorb, Reject, Toxic Coating, Reinforce, Evolution, Water Bending, Black Storm, Tidal Wave…]
…
Hero, Dreamer and Orasio looked at Stark as he analyzed the monster, waiting for him to speak like he did the first time.
"…?" after a few seconds, he turned his head and saw them staring.
"120000HP, it has high strength and extremely high stamina and speed, but a very low defense, we should focus on killing it as fast as we can dealing damage," he gave them the information they wanted all the while adding a strategy.
Everyone nodded as they prepared for the battle.
The devourer's black eyes glinted, and the boys could see themselves in the reflection.
"Tail Whip!"
The fight began as the Black Water Devourer lunged at them with its tail, sending a succession of attacks. They all dove to avoid the attack except for Orasio who used his shield to block the tail.
"Just how strong is your shield?" Dreamer wondered, he was able to take on so many attacks and receive zero damage.
"Haha… I don't know…" Orasio shrugged, clearly hiding something.
"Bite!" seeing that its attacks were doing nothing, the devourer used another one of its skills and jumped from the water, at least ten meters in the air in Stark's direction.
"Focus!" like always, he activated the skill that helped him see the attacks before they even hit.
But this time, it seemed different: he was able to see more, and the afterimage of the devourer was more clear than ever before.
~SPLASH~
The guardian opened its mouth as it was about to snatch Stark, but the boy jumped out of the way at the perfect moment.
However, the eel-like guardian swiftly changed its strategy and lunged at Dreamer, its massive tail cutting through the black water towards him. He tried to dodge, but the tail's momentum proved too strong, and he took a direct hit.
"Argh!" Dreamer cried out, the pain radiating through his body. Even with his magic, he wasn't invulnerable to such attacks.
"-1251!" he was injured, but quickly got up and used some of his books to cast [Healing Prayer] on himself.
"+1000!" he regained most of his HP.
'Interesting…' Stark observed from afar, gaining information on the other participants was always a plus.
In response, Dreamer got angry and started using his most basic skill [Spell Fury], and all the books around him began to cast spells at the devourer, who was unable to avoid them all.
"-462! 449! -536!" it was hit at least a dozen times.
"Aura Smash!" Stark didn't waste time either and used his skill, and this time it wasn't only his right fist that was surrounded by that aura, but his left one too.
He punched the air twice in the devourer's direction, and it was hit by the attacks.
"-8371! -7263!"
[Enemy stunned!]
[Dealt massive damage to GUARDIAN, regaining 271HP!]
The Black Water Devourer fell into a brief stupor, unable to move its body around the water anymore.
"It's stunned!" Stark shouted again, and immediately all of them took advantage.
Hero slashed the guardian with his swords three times.
"-18387!"
Orasio used his most powerful skill (that Stark knew off), [Explosive Shield], and launched it at the devourer.
"-16283!"
Dreamer's [Spell Fury] had a cooldown, so he wasn't able to do anything but launch simple spells.
"-3634!"
After that, the devourer was able to move, but injuries could already been seen on its body as it received a massive amount of damage.
"Stunning enemies sure is convenient," Dreamer sighed.
[Black Water Devourer HP: 58432/120000]
'My god, it's already down to half of its health.'
It seemed like the devourer really had nothing on them, the fact that it was alone also made it much easier to hunt.
Maybe the order of the paths really meant nothing, huh?
…
"ABSORB!" The devourer roared and used this skill, putting its head inside the water and absorbing some of it.
And after a few seconds…
"REJECT!" it used a follow-up skill, and a ray of black water came rushing toward the four boys, almost as if it was following them.
Hero cut the water using his swords, Orasio used his shield, Stark kept avoiding the rays as he saw them before they even came close.
But Dreamer… it seemed like LUCK wasn't on his side.
"FUCKING HELL," he shouted, forced to use his last skill to save himself, "BARRIER!"
All the books around him placed themselves in front of the ray, blocking all the damage.
Information was important in this place as there was no saying when any of them could betray each other, so hiding a skill or two was essential, yet now he had been forced to use all his tricks because that stupid guardian was targetting him.
"Tidal Wave!" not giving them any rest, the devourer disappeared into the water.
After the eel-like guardian disappeared, a giant wave could be seen coming in the distance.
"A tsunami?" Hero questionned.
The wave was at least twenty meters tall, and was sure to hit all of them if they didn't do anything.
"Come close to me," Orasio suddenly spoke, the nervousness in his voice disappearing.
All the participants listened, and suddenly, Orasio lifted his shield in the air and activated [Ally Protection].
A giant green sphere surrounded them all, and when the wave came crashing…
~SPLASH~
~CRACK~
The shield cracked, but it survived the attack.
"Thanks buddy," Hero patted Orasio, without him they would have probably all died.
"…" Orasio didn't answer.
"Aura Smash!" Stark sent two crimson fists at the devourer, who came out of the water after using its skill.
"-7382!" but only one hit as it avoided the second.
[Dealt massive damage to GUARDIAN, regaining 129HP!]
The devourer was at half HP, and the boys a bit exhausted.
But that's when it decided to use its ultimate skills.
"EVOLUTION! REINFORCE! TOXIC COATING!"
And suddenly, the devourer's appearance began to shift.

chapters.title: Chapter 42 - 42: Death of the Devourer
chapters.content:
The devourer grew in size, becoming much more menacing and powerful looking. It had evolved and had reinforced its body, making it even more resilient to their attacks. To top it off, it had covered itself in a thick, toxic coating that would harm anyone who came into direct contact with it.
'Is that the second phase?' Stark wondered.
Anyway, Stark now knew that attacking with his fists wasn't an option anymore.
[HP: 1238/1800]
Thanks to the necklace that gave him back life every time he hit an enemy and to his level upgrade, his HP was still fairly good, but he still didn't want to risk it.
He would need to keep using Aura Smash, and hope that the others attacked more than he did since all of them relied on weapons and long-ranged damage.
Everyone watched the devourer in awe, choosing to stand still and assess the situation. The transformation was a clear indication that the guardian was preparing for an all-out attack.
"BLACK STORM!"
The sky above became darker than it was before, and clouds appeared, lightning coming out from them.
The Black Water also became much more agitated than before, making it harder for them to move, even Hero and Stark, who had the highest speed of the group, struggled.
"Aura Smash!" Stark sent two fists of aura again, and the monster didn't even bother to avoid it, too focused on controlling the storm.
"-4312! -3927!"
'Holy shit, it can actually tank damage now…'
[Enemy stunned]
'YES!' Stark almost shouted to the others, but…
[Enemy is immune to status effect: "Stun"]
'…'
[Dealt damage to GUARDIAN, regaining 91HP!]
"It can tank attacks now, we should really focus on taking it down as fast as we can, that thing looks pissed," Hero wasn't smiling anymore.
[Black Water Devourer HP: 42811/120000]
~ZAP~
Lightning hit the water close to Stark, but avoided it.
"It's too focused on controling the water, kill it!" Stark shouted.
"FINALLY SOME FUN," Hero activated [Hero's Resolve], his two swords glowing with a silver aura as he dashed toward the devourer again.
It seems like the [Hero's Resolve] was a skill that boosted Hero's abilities and damage output, but afterward he would become exhausted.
High risk, high reward.
~SLASH, SLASH, SLASH~
He attacked the devourer over and over and over…
It wa surviving his blows because of the [Evolution] and [Reinforcement], but he was still dealing damage.
And in the end…
"17382!"
"THAT'S WHAT YOU GET," Hero stepped back beside Orasio, counting on him to defend him so that he can recover.
"Ally Protection!" the cracked sphere appeared around them, meaning that only Stark and Dreamer remained to deal damage to that monster.
The situation didn't seem to be that bad though as each avoided the guardian's attacks while dealing damage.
"SPELL FURY," Dreamer's book sent dozens of spells at the devourer, who's speed had decreased since the evolution.
"-126! -182! -158!" it wasn't much, but there were so many it made a difference.
"Bite! Tail Whip! Absorb! Reject!" the guardian was using everything in its power to kill them, but Dreamer would use his barrier and Stark just avoided.
"Aura Smash!" he sent two crimson fists at the beast again.
"-4621! -4427!"
And after a few minutes of that…
[Black Water Devourer HP: 12660/120000]
The devourer looked extremely injured, and its attacks were now so jagged that they weren't even precise enough to hit any of the targets.
Hero also finally recovered, and with his two swords in hand, he began approaching the devourer again.
It was the end for it: Dreamer was ready to fire more spells, Stark had his aura smash, Hero was spinning his swords in the air, and Orasio was going to activate [Explosive Shield].
There was no way it could win.
And it knew it.
Which is why, when it saw Stark throw his crimson fists, Hero his magic swords, and Orasio his shield…
It used one final skill.
"WATER BENDING!"
The water around Dreamer began to shake, and suddenly…
~CLANG~
A cage of water surrounded him, trapping him within.
"Huh?" Dreamer was surprised, but it couldn't be that bad, right?
~ZAP!~
A lightning strike came rushing from the sky and hit the cage with Dreamer inside of it.
"NOOOOOOO!"
"-3628!" the damage was enough to kill Dreamer, and he fell to the ground afterward.
In the mean time…
"-3526! -4315! -2371! -7462!"
The devourer received the damage of all the other attacks.
[Black Water Devourer HP: 0/120000]
There was a moment of silence as the team watched in horror, realizing what had just happened. Dreamer lay motionless on the ground, and the devourer was defeated.
"Ah shit… we lost another one," Hero shook his head, "I really believed we could all get out alive too…"
"…" Orasio was staring at Dreamer's body with a blank expression.
"Well, let's go," Stark, not showing any emotions, pointed at a door that appeared beside the Devourer's body.
They began walking toward the door, and soon enough passed through it.
Yet again, they found themselves in a chamber with stone walls and at the end were four small oval mirrors hanged against the wall.
And for the second time, each of them approached a mirror and broke it, which resulted in them being transported back to the 'Colossal Paths'.
And of course, the panels appeared soon after.
[3 participants alive]
[You have slain "Black Water Devourer (GUARDIAN)", gained 250000EXP!]
[Second path cleared, one remains]
'Damn, this much EXP…'
[Your level has increased to level 13, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
But surprisingly enough, he wasn't enveloped just once with the golden glow… but twice!
[Your level has increased to level 14, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Experience: 77617/180000]
[HP: 2500/2500]
After checking their level and status windows, the three participants of the trial pointed at the statue of the Sphinx.
The second pearl on its forehead was now glowing with a deep blue color, and only one was unlit now.
"We take a break and then we finish this, I really want to get away from this place," Hero spoke and sat on the ground.
And so just like that, only one guardian remained before they could meet the 'Greater One'.
Dreamer had died out nowhere in front of their eyes, but it served as a lesson: don't be confident until the enemy is actually dead, or else you might just die.
This was a Death-Level trial, one of the hardest ever, so they would need to be warry of anything that could kill them.
'I made it this far, I really want that reward now,' Stark smirked.

chapters.title: Chapter 43 - 43: The Creeping Shadows
chapters.content:
After not an hour, not two, but FIVE, Stark opened his eyes as he had decided to take a break and sleep.
Five meters away from him were Orasio and Hero, and he woke the latter up.
"Hm~ what?" Hero opened his eyes and rubbed them, confused about his surroundings for a minute since he was still in a daze, "Oh yeah, we need to kill the last guardian…"
Orasio on the other hand hadnt slept at all, instead he was inspecting his shield, just waiting for the others to wake up but not wanting to disturb them.
"Finally," he sighed then pointed at the last path, the one with the number 3 engraved on the effigy's forehead, "Let's go."
The other two nodded, and this time it was the shield user that took the lead toward the mirror down the stairs.
They approached the mirror door, and passed through it without saying anything to one another.
~CRACK~
After their eyes adjusted to the feeling of passing through the mirror, they found themselves in a large, enclosed chamber with hundreds of mirror around.
'What the fuck?' it wasn't just the walls that were filled with mirrors, but the floor and ceiling too.
In all directions they could stare at themselves, which made the atmosphere of this room feel very eerie.
"Hm~ really feels like the final chamber before the big boss, doesn't it," Hero smiled.
"Well, it probably also means it's the hardest guardian, doesn't it, so watch out," Stark replied while looking around.
Each of them took a step forward…
And then…
~SLASH~
~FWISH~
~CLANG~
Three sounds resonated not in the distance, but behind the boys.
Right as they took a step toward the center of the mirror chamber, three shadows appeared behind each of them, ressembling the three participants.
And so what had to happen happened.
Stark's shadow didn't have any weapon, but it tried to punch and kill him regardless, unfortunately for it though, Stark saw it coming thanks to "Focus", and swiftly avoided the attack.
Orasio's shadow had a shield, just like him, and tried to use [Explosive Shield] on him, but right as it was about to attack, a barrier former around the red-haired boy and protected him from the assault, it was almost as if he knew what was about to happen, or maybe there was always such a barrier to protect him at all times?
And as for Hero…
"-8738!" he was cut in half by his shadow as he didn't have his swords in hand and no way to really know they were coming.
And just like that, his life ended.
[2 participants remain]
Hero's shadow immediately disappeared after killing its owner.
"WHAT THE FUCK?" Stark stepped back as he saw Hero's body fall to the ground, "God damn it!"
A true classifier should always be ready in case of an attack, and this surprise one served this purpose: those unable to react accordingly would be killed.
Safe to say that even if Boxer and Dreamer had reached this room alive, they wouldn't have been able to defend themselves and died anyway.
Only the strongest will escape the trial, after all.
"Hm~ This room is filled with mirrors, and these shadows look just like us," Orasio scratched his chin while thinking, "I guess they are shadows of ourselves, we're gonna have to fight them."
[Glass Guardian #3: Creeping Shadows]
[They are shadows of yourselves, defeat them to continue or succumb to your own powers]
"I guess that's why it's called glass purgatory?" he shrugged.
Orasio and Stark had backed away from them, but they were now able to see them clearly: their entire bodies were formed of some black aura, except for the eyes and mouth which were red, they looked exactly like them, and also used the same weapons/skills.
Basically… they were fighting mirrors of themselves.
Stark in the mean time activated [Domination] and [Perception] to analyze the two shadow before them.
…
[Name: Creeping Shadow - Stark (GUARDIAN)]
[Level: 20]
[HP: 10000]
[Strength: ???]
[Stamina: ???]
[Speed: ???]
[Defense: ???]
[Skills: Perception, Domination, Focus, Aura Smash, Clone Frenzy…]
…
[Name: Creeping Shadow - Orasion (GUARDIAN)]
[Level: 20]
[HP: 10000]
[Strength: ???]
[Stamina: ???]
[Speed: ???]
[Defense: ???]
[Skills: Domination, Swing, Ally Protection, All-Time Barrier, Explosive Shield, Block…]
…
"They are both level 20, I don't know about the stats but probably the same as us, also they have our skills and have 10k HP each," Stark informed Orasio.
"If they were shadows of ourselves, they shouldn't have this much HP," he shrugged while smiling, "Looks like that trial really wants us dead, it's basically us but stronger."
"Yeah well, since we know ourselves best, you take care of your shadow and I take care of mine, alright?"
Orasio nodded, then summoned his shield and engaged with his shadow head on.
Stark rushed forward, attempting to engage the shadow of himself as well.
"Aura smash," his fists began glowing with that crimson aura, and he sent two attacks at his shadow.
But…
"AuRa SmASh~" the shadow mimicked him, and the two crimson fists collided with one another, resulting in no damage being dealt to either party.
"Alright, I see how it is now…" Stark smirked.
Orasio, too, had faced the same situation and was trying and failing to hit his shadow copy with his shield.
~SLAM, SLAM, SLAM~
Stark approached his shadow and attempted to punch it, but it only ended in both of their fists clashing with one another.
"-1! -1!"
The damage they were receiving was almost non existant, but if they kept going like this, they would surely lose.
[HP: 2492/2500] while the shadow had 10000, it wasn't fair to begin with.
And so after a few minutes of constant fighting from the two participants, they backed away as their shadows just weren't receiving any sort of damage.
"This isn't working," Orasio remarked.
"No shit, sherlock, they are us but better, you are the one that said it, they keep copying us but have more HP so if this keeps going we're just gonna die," Stark rolled his eyes, he didn't expect this to be the most annoying battle.
"I have a solution then, a risky one but surely we can manage," Orasio smirked.
"I think I already know what you wanna do," Stark sighed, but knew deep down this was the only solution.
"Well then, let's do it!" Orasio laughed, it was almost as if Hero hadn't just died in front of them minutes ago that they already moved on.
Stark and Orasio switched positions, meaning that Stark was in front of Orasio's shadow while Orasio was with Stark's.
They switched shadows, it was more risky, but the only way to truly win.
"Let's do this, fake Orasio," Stark positioned his fists toward the shield wearing shadow, and it smiled at him in return.
Of course, fighting each other's shadows meant they would both need to defeat a better version of their companion, which almost seemed counter intuitive, but oh well, who cares.
[3…2…1]
[FIGHT!]

chapters.title: Chapter 44 - 44: Shadows VS Owners
chapters.content:
Fighting each other's shadows was much more risky than anything else for one simple reason: if for example Orasio died while fighting Stark's shadow, his shadow would die, resulting in Stark having to fight his shadow who still had much more HP than he had.
Basically… if one of them died before they could finish them, it was game over for both.
"COME AT ME, FAKE ORASIO," he shouted again and dashed toward the red-haired boy's shadow, it had his shield in hand, ready to block all the attacks.
"ALl-TImE BArRRiEr" it mimicked one of Orasio's skills, and when Stark tried to punch the guardian, he was met with a green sphere that took his attacks.
~PUNCH, PUNCH, PUNCH~
~CRACK~
In the momentum of his punches, a crack started forming around the sphere, meaning that he was in the right path to kill Orasio's shadow.
But of course, these things weren't dumb.
~FWISH~
The fake Orasio dashed at Stark while he was about to punch again, and…
"SWING!" it swung its shield at Stark, hitting him in the stomach, luckily for him though, he saw it coming thanks to focus and used his aura to protect the area that was targetted.
"-736!" it didn't do much damage since a shield couldn't do that much, but it still hurt.
Not wanting to give it a break though, Stark dashed at it again.
~CRACK~
The sphere was mosly cracked now, only a few more punches and it would be completely shattered.
But then something unexpected happened.
As Stark was about to deliver the finishing blow, Orasio's shadow deactivated [All-Time Protection].
'…?' Stark punched ,his fist full of aura.
"BLOCK!" The shadow raised its shield and placed it in front of Stark's attack.
Not seeing any reason to stop, Stark continued in his momentum.
~CLANG~
He hit the shield in full force, and of course it resulted in no damage being dealt to the shadow.
But…
"OUCH!" Stark's arm burned as he came in contact with the shield.
"-361!" he was damaged for some reason.
…
[Skill: Block]
[Description:] Deflects any type of attacks as long as the user has the level and aura to, in response to physical attacks, it absorbs the damage and deals 10% of the absorbed damage back to the attacker.
…
'This shit is fucking OP?' Stark used perception to check out why he had been hit, but he couldn't have imagined such a skill existed.
Not only was Orasio's defense incredible, but if you tried to attack him physically, he could stall for enough damage to kill you.
Basically: he was the worst kind of opponent Stark could meet as he had only physical attacks other than 'Aura Smash' which had a cooldown and would be blocked.
The shadow stood there, shield up, waiting for the next attack, it wasn't engaging in combat, just waiting for Stark to make the move as it knew there was no reason for it to attack.
'These things are smart… probably mimicking their owner's intelligence as well…'
Stark dashed again, he would not be dominated by such a thing, they both had the domination class after all, so it meant that the winner was the one that dominated the battle the most.
"AURA SMASH!"
He needed to act, and quick… It wasn't about outsmarting a shadow anymore, but Orasio himself since they had the same skills and thought process.
'Let's do this,' he breath in and out, then opened his eyes, his pupils burning with that same crimson aura that enveloped him.
~FWISH~
He punched the air once in the shadow's direction, which just got ready to absorb the attack, a wide grin on its face.
~FWISH~
He punched it again to send the second crimson fist, not toward the shadow though, but beside it.
"Block!" the shadow blocked the first fist easily, dealing not damage.
But this wasn't what Stark wanted to do… instead he focused on the second crimson fist, the hand he used to send it stretched and his palm open in its direction.
'COME ON,' he tried to do something he didn't even know was possible, all he wanted to do was try.
With determination glowing in his eyes, he closed his hand while thinking of the fist's trajectory, and then…
~FWISH~
The fist, which was behind the shadow since Stark had sent it beside it, suddenly changed directions and came back toward him, essentially aimed at the fake Orasio's back.
'GOTCHA!'
The shadow sensed the fist, and so it turned to block the attack, absorbing all the damage.
And as he turned again to face Stark… it saw that his fist was right in front of its face.
~SLAM~
He punched it in the face with an extremely powerful attack, sending it flying against one of the mirror walls, and destroying at least a dozen of them.
"-4728!" Stark thought that this attack would be enough to kill it, but it seemed like it wasn't just Orasio's style that was based on defense, his defense stat was also extremely high to begin with.
'Alright, I only need to outsmart it once or twice more,' Stark sighed while grinning.
Knowing that Orasio's shadow wouldn't attack, he decided to observe how the red-hair was doing against himself.
Orasio was having a tough time, too.
Stark's shadow in comparison to Orasio's was actually the one initiating the attacks, perfectly copying his combat style.
Orasio used his shield to cast [All-Time Protection], but it would soon enough crack under the pressure of the punches.
And right when he used [Block], the skill the real Stark struggled against…
"-362! -436! - 572! -421! -479" Stark's shadow even though it received damage kept attacking, not caring as its HP was fairly high.
And of course, Orasio couldn't block forever, so in the end he had to remove his shield, and that's when he was punched.
"-2718!"
He was sent flying against one of the mirror walls, and many were destroyed again.
[Orasio HP: 482/3200]
Safe to say he was one hit away from being killed, Stark's shadow was just too aggresive for him.
"Ah shit…" Orasio fell to his knees, breathing hard as even though his HP hadn't dropped to zero, the damage was still a lot, "Didn't know Chosen could punch this hard…"
"Aura Smash!" in response, Stark's shadow punched the air twice in Orasio's direction, sending two crimson fists at him as it thought he wouldn't be able to block anymore.
But that was a big mistake, and it was one the real Stark would have never made, making obvious it was just a mere mimic.
"EXPLOSIVE SHIELD," Orasio threw his shield with so much force at the shadow Stark while it was using its skill that it didn't have time to dodge.
The shield burned with a bright fire and aura while it was flying toward the fake Stark in mid-air.
And then…
~BOOM~
"-8362!"
[Shadow Stark HP: 58/10000]
'It's my win,' Orasio smiled.

chapters.title: Chapter 45 - 45: The Final Pearl
chapters.content:
"That guy's doing fine," Stark was relieved, if Orasio had died, then he would have had to fight the fake Stark, which was a game over, yet now there was no way he could lose since he could just use [Block] forever.
But Stark failed to take something into account: that the shadow was smart enough to know that too.
And so sensing that it was about to lose, it did something they hadn't expected: it rushed at Stark, abandoning its fight with Orasio.
"Huh?" Stark saw it coming thanks to the upgraded [Focus] and was able to block the attack by crossing his arms.
"-321!" he received minimal damage, and then he kicked the air in the creeping shadow's direction, but it just backed away.
Stark was surrounded by the two shadows now, behind was Orasio's, which just had its shield positioned to block, and on the other hand was Stark's, its eyes burning with an extremely familiar determination.
It was almost as if the shadow was a real being.
"EXPLOSIVE SHIELD"
"AURA SMASH!"
And suddenly, from both directions, he was attacked.
A shield strong enough to destroy him, and two crimson fists strong enough not only to kill him, but also stun him, were both coming his way.
"Ah shit…"
But Stark didn't even feel the need to dodge, and the reason was obvious.
"Ally Protection," Orasio, who was free from both shadows, used his shield to create a barrier around Stark.
~BOOM, SLAM, SLAM~
The shield and the two fists hit the barrier, which shattered it, but in the end Stark had been saved from taking any damage.
And he decided to take advantage of that opportunity.
"Aura Smash!" he sent two crimson fists at Orasio's shadow, which was essentially defenseless since it was forced to send its shield away to use [Explosive Shield].
The first fist hit the [All-Time Barrier] as it was still activate at all times, but it was immediately shattered as Stark had done too much damage to it.
And so the second hit it in full force.
~BOOM~
"-4961!"
But that wasn't all…
[Enemy Stunned]
The shadow found itself unable to move any of its shadowy limbs, and it fell to its knees.
[Shadow Orasio: 311/10000]
[Shadow Stark: 58/10000]
"You take care of your shadow," Stark shouted while smiling, and Orasio grinned while dashing toward the stunned guardian.
Meanwhile, Stark charged at the imposter version of himself, pinning it against a wall. The fake Stark's HP were low, and it would surely lose if they played the long game.
"GOODBYE," Stark declared confidently as he delivered a final blow to the fake with a powerful attack, and it didn't even defend itself or dodge.
"-12182!" it received its entire life in that single attack, and it immediately vanished into thin air before their eyes.
Orasio had reached his own shadow by then, and with swift precision, unleashed a powerful swing upon it.
"-472!" The damage was not significant, but it was enough to finish off the shadow and make it disappear like its counterpart.
And just like that, the two participants had successfully defeated the last guardians.
But their victory was short-lived as suddenly…
~CRACK, SMASH~
All the mirrors shattered into pieces, except for two that hung on the far wall away from them.
There was a golden aura around those mirrors, almost inviting them to shatter them.
"We did it," Orasio sighed while approaching the mirror to the left, "We fucking DID IT!"
"Not yet," Stark shock his head while walking toward the mirror on his right, "The 'Greater One' is still there."
"…" Orasio didn't say anything and immediately used his shield to destroy the mirror, resulting in him vanishing before Stark's eyes.
"Phew~" Stark looked back at the mirror chamber, it was completely destroyed, "One more…"
And he used his fist to destroy his mirror too.
***
The two of them were back at the 'Colossal Paths'.
[2 participants alive]
[You have slain "Creeping Shadows (GUARDIAN)", gained 150000EXP!]
[All paths cleared, please proceed.]
Stark had yet again gotten a ton of EXP, which meant…
[Your level has increased to level 15, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Level 15 Reached: please pick a skill card]
Three purple cards appeared in front of him, and just like last time there was no way for him to check their content no matter how hard he tried.
"Choosing a skill?" Orasio suddenly said as he had been observing Stark, he had also leveled up and reached level 15 just now, meaning that he had picked a skill too, "I got a new one too, I think it's pretty good!"
"Hm…" Stark scratched his chin, and in the end picked the purple card on his right, "Let's see…"
He took the card and flipped it, and there he saw a drawing of a figure doing a roll.
…
[Name: Invincible Dodge]
[Type: Epic]
[Level: 1]
[Description: A unique skill that grants the user temporary invincibility during a dodge maneuver, when the user uses this skill at the perfect moment, they have invincibility frames that can stop them from receiving damage/status effect, no matter how strong the skill is, cooldown of one minute between each use]
[Note: if the user uses this skill with the wrong timing (it is extremely short), then it will not work]
…
'Doesn't that mean even if some level 999 guy tries to kill me, but I roll, i'll be able to avoid damage?' to Stark, this sounded too good to be true, but he understood upon reading the note that he had to have good timing to use it.
After checking both of their skills out, the two boys instinctively looked at the statue in the middle: The Sphinx.
It's third and final pearl was now glowing with a dark aura, meaning that all of them were lit up.
And suddenly…
~BRRRRRR~
The entire 'Colossal Paths' chamber began to tremble, echoing with a loud humming noise that seemed to come from the very stone walls themselves. Stark and Orasio exchanged a quick glance, their hearts beating in anticipation of what was to come next. The ground beneath their feet cracked open, revealing a blinding light that enveloped the chamber.
And as the light faded and their adjusted, they noticed that in the location the satue was in stood a massive staircase that led down the abyss of the chamber.
This was the staircase to the 'Greater One', the final trial of the domination trial before they could fianlly get out of this hell hole where no one escapes from.
"Let's take a break, and then let's face that little shit," Stark sat on the ground beside the staircase.
"Alright, partner," Orasio smiled and lay down too.
And so just like that, they were getting ready to face whatever awaited them down there.
Down the deepest pits of the 'Glass Purgatory'.

chapters.title: Chapter 46 - 46: A Sacrifice is Needed
chapters.content:
The staircase loomed ominously before them, each step leading closer to the unknown. Stark and Orasio shared a silent moment of determination, a steely resolve shining in their eyes as they stood up from their brief rest.
Without uttering a single word, they began their descent down the grand staircase, the air growing colder with each step they took.
The darkness began more overwhelming each second they descended, the platform and 'colossal paths' quickly getting further and further from them.
Soon enough, they couldn't even the chamber while looking up.
"Five at the start, now only two remain," Orasio suddenly said without even looking back at Stark, "Do you think we will survive this?"
"…" Stark didn't answer, he knew that most people would of died already while fighting the guardians, and less than 1% of domination class users would reach the 'Greater One', but it didn't matter, "We are here now, whatever happens happens, even if one of us dies."
As they reached the bottom, they found themselves in a vast chamber shrouded in darkness.
They were in the deepest parts of the 'Class Purgatory'.
And just to make them understand how fucked they were, the staircase that led them down there disappeared too.
[Good luck.]
They began walking toward the center of the chamber, their footsteps echoing ominously in the darkness. Suddenly, a faint light flickered in the distance, illuminating a weird structure.
It was set against a wall, and there seemed to be nothing else around it.
When they reached the structure, which looked like a massive, ancient door, Stark and Orasio exchanged a glance filled with uncertainty. The door was covered in intricate carvings of unknown symbols that seemed to shift and writhe in the dim light.
And as they approached… a panel appeared before them.
[Only one participant is allowed to meet the 'Greater One']
[One sacrifice is needed to continue]
Without hesitation, Stark turned to Orasio, a solemn expression on his face. Orasio met his gaze with understanding, knowing what had to be done.
There was no emotions on their faces as they both activated 'Domination' and faced one another.
"Of course that shitty trial would only let one person win," Orasio laughed, his shield in hand, ready to block Stark's attacks.
But in contrast to Orasio, Stark didn't activate his aura to fight the red-haired boy, instead, he decided to try something.
"If it doesn't work, then we'll have to fight," Stark smiled, "But until then…"
"CLONE FRENZY!" he hadn't activated that skill even during the fight against the shadows both because he didn't want his shadow to also use it, but also because he wanted it as a trump card in case anything happened.
Stark's aura seeped out of him and created an exact copy of himself.
[One sacrifice is needed, if you want to be the sacrifice, please approach the altar (door) and put your palm against it for three seconds, you will receive 99999+ damage instantly]
'Go, other me,' Stark ordered his clone to do exactly what that thing wanted it to do.
It was a futile attempt in most situations, but he didn't feel like fighting his teammate for now.
Of course… if the skill failed… then he would be forced to, but that is another story: he was already putting himself at a disadvantage by using one of his most powerful skills, but he really wanted to catch onto that small hope.
The clone followed Stark's orders without hesitation, walking up to the ancient door and pressing its palm against the surface. A blinding light engulfed the clone, causing it to disintegrate into nothingness.
"-99999" it received so much damage not even a level 100 classifier could be able to withstand that, luckily it only had one hp.
Stark and Orasio watched in tense silence, unsure of what would happen next.
Suddenly, the symbols on the door began to glow brightly, and a low rumble filled the chamber. The intricate carvings shifted and rearranged themselves until they formed a new message:
[Participant, step forward and face the Greater One.]
"YOU FUCKING TRICKED IT!" Orasio was astonished it actually worked, meaning that it wasn't just one of them that would face the Greater One, but two!
The ancient door opened, and beyond it was another chamber, although this time they could see light pouring out from it.
Stark and Orasio exchanged a surprised glance before stepping through the door into the illuminated chamber.
They were in a clearing with towering pillars and walls around them… it almost felt like… they were back at the beginning!?
But no, it was different, since there were no skeletons, and also the mirror in the middle wasn't present either.
But at the far end of that clearing… was a giant mirror, and on the reflection could be seen a giant figure shrouded in darkness, it was turning its back to them.
"Good job, participant, you have reached the end of this trial-" it turned around, then stopped talking, "What the…"
It tilted its head in confusion, its red eyes squinted, almost as if it was making sure it was seeing things right.
"How are there two of you… it doesn't make sense…" even though it was the king of this place, it looked like it wasn't able to predict everything.
"Aura Smash!" Stark punched the air in the giant mirror's direction, and the crimson fist came hurtling toward it, shattering it upon impact.
"Damn, you didn't even let it finish…" Orasio sighed.
And suddenly…
~BOOM~
The figure that was previously in the mirror's reflection suddenly materialized in front of it, its feet touching the green grass.
"Annoying bugs…" it sneered, pulling out some sort of glass fragment from its cloak.
It was wearing a dark cloak, and its face was covered by a glass mask emanating a dark aura that didn't allow them to see its face, the only thing visible was its eyes and mouth.
"You are alone, three of you already died, no one has ever completed a death-level trial, so WHY, WHY DO YOU STILL FIGHT!" it shouted, almost angry that Stark and Orasio made it this far.
Stark and Orasio stood their ground, undeterred by the intimidating presence before them.
It was the final thing that was stopping them from leaving this place, and they would make sure to shut it up.
Stark's fists glowed with an aura brighter than ever before, while Orasio's shield was ready to block all the attacks that were sent at it.
[Greater One: The Mirror Master]
[3…2…1]
[FIGHT!]
And so the last fight began inside that weird clearing.

chapters.title: Chapter 47 - 47: The Mirror Master
chapters.content:
[Last Guardian: The Mirror Master]
[It is the final obstacle, participants, good luck]
"Welp, let's get out of there," Stark breach in and out before positioning himself against the mirror master.
"You think you can stop me? NO ONE CAN DEFEAT ME, ITS MY WORLD, NOT YOURS!"
The mirror master was one of the rare monsters able to speak human language to communicate, a skill extremely rare for monsters, but it wasn't surprising as he was supposed to be the king of this place.
"Perception!" Stark used his skill to analyze the big boss.
…
[Name: The Mirror Master (BOSS)]
[Level: 30]
[HP: 160000]
[Strength: 1329]
[Stamina: 1151]
[Speed: 927]
[Defense: 428]
[Skills: Glass Rain, All-Area Strike, World's Reflection, Multiply, The Master of Mirrors, Shard Throw…]
…
"Extremely strong," that's all Stark said to Orasio for him to understand they were facing a whole other level of monsters, it could probably take on the three other guardians simultaneously, "And 160000HP, although defense is low."
"Well then, let's destroy it before it can do anything!" Orasio smiled, his shield ready.
The first one to attack was the master since he was furious not only had two of them managed to enter this place while it was only supposed to be only one, but they also destroyed his mirror before he could finish his amazing speech he learned perfectly for this occasion.
"Shard Throw…!"
The Mirror Master let out a roar and raised his hand, shards of glass forming around him before shooting towards Stark and Orasio like deadly arrows.
Stark swiftly dodged to the side while Orasio held up his shield, the glass shards bouncing harmlessly off the sturdy surface.
"Aura Smash," he still had one crimson fist available, and so he sent it at the master while he was using his skill.
"-9382!" he was hit by the attack, but only flinched, not even backing away and not stopping his barrage of shards.
Stark used that opportunity to close the distance between them, and although it became more dangerous the closer he got, he still was able to dodge thanks to his speed, which was greatly enhanced by his aura.
Seeing that, the master focused all his shards on the black-haired boy, completely ignoring Orasio.
"Explosive Shield!"
Orasio saw an opening in the Mirror Master's defenses and seized the chance to strike.
He threw his shield at the big boss, and hit him in full force, creating an explosion that enveloped him.
"-21728!" the damage was insane.
And also…
[Enemy burned!]
[Enemy will receive 200 points of damage every second for 60 seconds!]
'…?' Stark was baffled, he didn't know this skill could do that?
"It's only a 10 percent chance, which is why it never happened until now," Orasio scratched his head before summoning his shield again.
The master's cloak was burning, but it didn't seem like he cared, his fury pushing him to keep attacking.
"YOU WANNA PLAY THIS GAME? THEN LETS PLAY!" the master stretched his arms in both directions, and that same crystal shard that appeared before floating in front of his chest, "WORLD'S REFLECTION!"
He spinned the crystal, and suddenly…
~FWISH~
The gravity switched, sending Stark and Orasio hurtling towards the sky as the world had turned upside down.
~CRASH~
Luckily for them, the sky was fake, and so they crashed onto the fake ceiling.
"-212! -147!" they received a bit of damage, and below they could see the mirror master grinning for a few seconds before suddenly dropping to the ceiling (now ground?), almost as if he wasn't affected by gravity, but just following its rules regardless.
"Multiply!" not even letting them breath, the master activated another one of his skills.
And suddenly, hundreds of mirrors appeared all around the boys, their surfaces reflecting the image of the Mirror Master back a thousandfold.
It was like an army of twisted, dark versions of himself stood ready to attack, it was basically like 'Clone Frenzy', except the clones were harmless and couldn't attack, mostly serving the purpose of confusing the enemy.
And of course, the master hid among them as they began spinning around the boys, making it impossible to discern where he was.
At least, that's what he believed, because Stark had 'Perception', and so he focused into each of the images of the master one by one, until eventually his status window appeared, allowing Stark to know who and where he was.
"Aura Smash!" he punched the air twice not in the master's direction, but toward another one of the fakes.
And the reason was obvious: the master's speed stat was high enough for him to avoid both of these attacks if he wasn't actively using a skill.
So he decided to use the new perk he learned during his fight against the shadows: change the fist's trajectory.
He raised both his arms toward the fists, and then closed his palms while imagining them heading toward the real Mirror Master.
And just as expected, the crimson fists both changed direction and headed toward the unsuspecting boss.
~BOOM~
"-9372! -10218!"
[Enemy stunned!]
"GET HIM!" all the fake images of the boss disappeared the moment he was hit, allowing Orasio to see him clearly.
And so the red-haired boy decided to use the new skill he had just acquired.
"SHIELD CRUSH!"
He threw his shield in the air right above the Mirror Master's head, unable to move since he was stunned.
And right as the shield reached above the monster's head.
~WFINK, FWINK!~
It grew at least fifty times its original size, and with an incredible force came crashing down, it was almost as if it had locked onto its target.
~BOOM~
The shield crashed onto the Mirror Master's head with a deafening impact, sending shockwaves through the area.
The monster let out a bloodcurdling scream as he was crushed under the immense force of the shield. Bits of glass shards flew in all directions as the Mirror Master's body was smashed into the ground, creating a small crater upon impact.
"-38271!" the damage was beyond anything both Stark and Orasio had seen, and even the latter was shocked.
The only problem was that this skill had a ten minute cooldown, and if he fought against too many enemies, Orasio would be overwhelmed since he was forced to throw his shield to use this skill.
And to add to the insane damage, Stark didn't hesitate to rush at the Mirror Master and hit him three times.
"-6572! -7391! -6958!"
"WORLD'S REFLECTION," he immediately used that skill again once able to move and yet again, Stark and Orasio came crashing back onto the ground.
But this time they didn't receive any damage since Orasio used his shield to block the damage by placing it under him, and Stark used his aura.
[Mirror Master HP: 38108/160000]
'Holy SHIT, aren't we doing too much damage to it?' Stark was baffled.
"THIS IS MY WORLD, NOT YOUUUURRRRSSS!" the master repeated, he was in a state close to berserk, and absolutely speachless those puny humans were able to deal so much damage to him in less than five minutes, 'JUST HOW STRONG ARE THEY…'
All he could see were Stark and Orasio's figures, with both their eyes burning with aura, they weren't the most promising domination users for no reason it seemed.
"THE MASTER OF MIRRORS," he activated his ultimate skill, and suddenly the area they were in changed.

chapters.title: Chapter 48 - 48: The Unavoidable Attack
chapters.content:
"THE MASTER OF MIRRORS!"
The once dimly lit clearing was now transformed into a vibrant, kaleidoscopic arena filled with mirrors of all shapes and sizes, it was completely different from anything they had seen before.
The sky was gone, the pillars had crumbled, the grass was nowhere to be seen, and all the walls disappeared to be replaced by giant mirrors.
Stark and Orasio were in the Mirror Master's domain now, giving them a massive disadvantage, much like when Boxer and Stark were fighting the Witch and Warrior.
