The Mirror Master stood at the center, his cloak tattered and his expression twisted with rage and determination, only his eyes and mouth visible beyond his glass mask, but it was enough to recognize that he was angry.
Stark and Orasio exchanged a quick glance, silently communicating their next move as they braced themselves for the final showdown.
[Mirror Master HP: 38108/160000]
One more push and it would be over… they would complete what nobody else had ever done in this world: beat the Death-Level domination trial.
As the Mirror Master raised his hands, shards of glass began to materialize around him, forming a barrier that seemed impenetrable.
And then…
"Glass Rain!"
Shards of glass began to rain down from the ceiling, glinting in the ever-changing lights reflected by the mirrors surrounding them.
"Ally Protection! All-Time Barrier!"
Orasio activated both these skills on himself and Stark, creating a green sphere that protected them both from the hundreds of shards that were dropping, it would honeslty be impossible to avoid them all, so Stark felt relieved he kept Orasio around, he was an excellent support.
"Aura Smash," he tried to calculate the trajectory to send it toward the mirror master, but…
"World's Reflection," the boss suddenly raised his arms upwards alongside the shard that he used to summon his powers, then turned it.
~FWISH~
The gravity changed again, and Stark came crashing against a mirror.
"-326!" Orasio on the otherhand protected himself using his shield.
But of course, that wasn't the end of it.
~FWISH, FWISH, FWISH~
Like a madman, the Mirror Master began changing the gravity of his domain over and over, resulting in Stark hitting almost every mirror in the area where he was, and blood pouring out from his body.
[HP: 732/2800] he wasn't able to recover his HP thanks to his necklace because it was previously full, and so now he really needed some.
Changing the gravity of the room also resulted in Stark being unable to aim his crimson fist.
But of course, that wouldn't stop him.
After thirty second, he used his skill again.
"Aura Smash!" he tried to aim and punched in the master's direction, but the gravity changed yet again, "NOT THIS TIME!"
But he switched the trajectory using his willpower, and although it was harder than usual since he was constantly moving…
~BOOM~
"-7462!" the master was hit.
[Dealt massive damage to Mirror Master, regaining 135HP!]
"DON'T GET COCKY," he was getting more and more angry, "SHARD THROW…"
His anger pushed him to focus his attacks on Stark, who had to keep avoiding more and more.
And of course, that was a mistake since…
"Explosive Shield," he was yet again hit by Orasio's shield, which exploded upon contact with his body.
"-18273!"
[Mirror Master HP: 12373/160000]
"You… annoying… PIECE OF SHITS," he was actively bleeding now, the injuries he had received until now finally taking a toll on him, "I- I will…"
He couldn't understand how he was defeated by Orasio and Stark, not matter how strong they were, it was not possible they could dominate him this easily.
All the other 'promising' domination class users that had been sent to a Death-Level trial had all succumbed up until now, so WHY, WHY WERE THEY ACTUALLY WINNING?
"OK, NOW LET'S END THIS," he shouted, his eyes burning with aura, and the crystal shard between his hand emanating a weird power.
He used his final and most powerful skill.
"ALL-AREA STRIKE!"
'…?' both Orasio and Stark were confused.
But what they hadn't realized yet was that [All-Area Strike]… was an unavoidable attack in the Master's domain.
The shard the master was carrying began floating above his head, a dark energy surrounding it.
"GOODBYE, PARTICIPANTS!"
And so he unleashed his skill: a giant dark fire mixed with glass shards appeared over them, on the room's ceiling.
Unavoidable attacks are not common at all, some might as well say most people will encounter one in their lifetime because of the sheer stupidity of those things.
After all, it was in the name: an unavoidable attack is truly impossible to avoid, no matter your speed, especially in closed off areas.
And right now… Orasio and Stark were experiencing an extremely powerful one.
~FWISH~
The dark fire grew and grew, until eventually taking up the entire ceiling.
And that's when it came crashing down on the participants: it was impossible for them to avoid it since it was taking the entire space.
'Oh wow,' Stark looked up, 'I think I get why no one completes that shit now,' he shrugged.
But he wasn't scared for a good reason: he had [Invincible Dodge], his newly acquired skill.
He would need the right timing while never using it before, but it was all or nothing, being hit by that thing was game over after all.
As the dark flames were at the half-way point of the room, Orasio activated all his defensive skills, [All-Time Protection], [Ally Protection], [Block], then kneeled down while looking up to the flames.
Stark on the other hand crouched a bit while observing the attack go down at an alarming speed: he was analyzing it to use [Invincible Dodge] at the perfect time.
Time seemed to slow down as the dark fire and glass shards drew closer, the heat becoming unbearable, and the threat of being pierced by countless sharp edges loomed over them.
"IT'S THE END FOR YOU TWO," The Master laughed.
~CRASH~
The dark fire and glass shards descended upon Stark and Orasio, enveloping them in a searing blaze and piercing shards. The Master's maniacal laughter echoed through the chamber as the flames consumed everything in their path.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!"
Right as the attack was about to hit him, Stark combined [Focus] with his new skill to activate it at the perfect time.
And so as the flames were millimeters above him, he rolled ahead, giving him the invincibility frames he needed to avoid the attack while the unsuspecting Mirror Master thought he had won.
"AURA SMASH!" he punched the air twice in the boss's direction, sending two crimson fists that hit him directly.
"-12127! -13129!"
The damage was insane, a proof of Stark's constant growth.
And so the mirror master fell to the ground, his HP having reached 0.
"I-IMPOSSIBLE, I-I CANNOT LOSE TO YOU…" he looked up to see Stark in front of him, a wide grin on his face.
"Seems like we won," Stark smirked, provoking the Mirror Master as it was his undeniable defeat.
But…
The Mirror Master grinned too for some reason, "At least… only one of you will escape this place," and right as he said that, he lay on the ground, his body now lifeless.
"What do you mean-" Stark turned toward Orasio's direction, and that's when he saw it: the red-haired boy was covered by those dark flames, burning his entire body to crisps.
"…"
[Mirror Master Defeated]
[One participant alive]

chapters.title: Chapter 49 - 49: The Rewards of The Trial
chapters.content:
Stark stood frozen, unable to believe what had just happened. The Mirror Master's words echoed in his mind: "At least... only one of you will escape this place."
Before him was Orasio's burning figure.
[Orasio HP: 0/4300]
He tried to move, to help Orasio, but there was no point: he was already dead.
All he could do was watch as Orasio's body was consumed by the dark flames, and soon enough ,his aura vanished, then his body turned to dust as the flames were extremely powerful.
"…" Stark looked at the remains of his companion's body with a blank expression, "I guess… sigh… anyways."
Orasio had indeed activated all his skills, but the sheer pressure of the flames were enough to shatter his barrier, and so without any back-up plan, thinking that his barrier would be enough, he was consumed by the flames and killed.
Stark would have suffered the same fate without his [Invincible Dodge] skill, but there was no reason to think too much about it.
[Congratulations, CHOSEN ONE, you have completed the Death-Level domination trial: 'Glass Purgatory']
The world around Stark began to change, and soon enough he found himself in the clearing he and the others were in since they appeared inside that trial, there were five of them at the beginning, all of them smiling, and now, only one was allowed out.
The towering pillars were still there, and the skeletons were back to their original spot, and the path to the mirror with the frame made out of bones was still proudly standing in the middle of that clearing.
[You are the first person to ever clear a Death-Level domination trial, good job!]
Stark began walking toward the mirror where it all started, he didn't know why, but there was something in him telling him it was the right thing to do.
He took his first step, and more panels appeared.
[You have slain "Mirror Master lv30 (TRIAL BOSS)", gained 340000 EXP!]
He was enveloped by the golden glow again, it had become familiar for him to level up after defeating each of the guardians now because of the sheer amount of EXP they gave.
Any normal person would be able to shoot from level 1 to at least 7-10 with this amount, and yet…
[Your level has increased to level 16, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Experience: 187617/225000]
'…' Stark kept walking.
[You have completed the 'Glass Purgatory', granting INCREDIBLE rewards]
[+1 LEGENDARY Skill, +4 Equipment Pieces, +3000 HP]
While heading toward the mirror that would be his exit from this hell, he saw the figures of Boxer, Dreamer, Hero, and finally, Orasio, staring at him.
They were transparent, but it was obvious it was them from their aura and appearance, and by their expressions, it didn't seem like they were mad.
Instead, Dreamer and Boxer were nodding their heads in approval, while Hero and Orasio were smiling bitter sweetly, clapping their hands to applaud for his victory.
[You have proven your worth, Stark Heartsouls, now leave]
And right as this panel appeared, Stark found himself in front of the mirror, the reflection showing his hotel room.
'Sigh, let's get this over with,' he looked at the mirror while stepping backward, just like how they did it to enter the purgatory in the first place.
And soon enough, he passed the portal and was sent back to reality.
[Domination trial: Glass Purgatory… CLEARED]
***
"HWAHHH~" Stark opened his eyes, he had been lying on the ground when he collapsed and was sent to the Glass Purgatory, and he found himself in that exact position when he woke up.
Stark stood in his hotel room, still relatively shaken by the experience he'd just went through.
He was glad he was able to complete the trial, but in exchange all the others had to die: he was the sole survivor.
Even the most promising and powerful domination users at their level died, so he could only wonder how any of the other folks could dream of defeating even the first guardian.
But the answer was obvious: they wouldn't be able to, even a level 40 classifier would struggle.
Then he immediately remembered about the reason he had gone through everything in the first place: those damn rewards.
[+1 LEGENDARY Skill]
[+4 Equipment Pieces]
[+3000 HP]
[Click to unlock!]
These four golden panels appeared in front of him.
Without hesitation, Stark clicked on the HP one, and as soon as he did so, a green aura enveloped his body.
[Gained 3000HP!]
[Health:6100/6100]
His health was extremely high now, especially for his level, meaning he could tank more and do more risky things.
'Nice…'
He turned his eyes toward the second panel, the one with the four pieces of equipment, and he clicked on it without much thought.
As soon as he did, two rings, a piece of clothing, and the crystal shard the Mirror Master was using appeared in front of him, dropping to the ground.
'Let's check it out I guess…'
"PERCEPTION!"
He analyzed the two rings, the first had a black flame burning in the spot where a gem is supposed to be, while the second had a blue gem that emanated a beautiful aura.
…
[Equipment:] The Purgatory Shadows
[Type:] Ring
[Class:] Domination
[Tier:] Epic
[Required Level:] 15
[Quality:] Perfect
[Attributes:] +100 speed
[Special Perk:] When receiving a hit, a shadow of yourself appears to take the hit in your place, whether it is 1 point of damage or 10000.
…
[Equipment:] The Devourer's Ring
[Type:] Ring
[Class:] Magus/Domination
[Tier:] Rare
[Required Level:] 20
[Quality:] Good
[Attributes:] +500MP
[Special Perk:] Your resistance to water type magic increases by 100%, and your water type damage increases by 200%.
…
'I don't have water type skills, so it doesn't matter to me, but it seems like every single one of those items is linked to one of the guardians…'
The first ring was linked to the Creeping Shadows, while the second to the Black Water Devourer.
And that left two items on the ground: the clothing, which was basically just a weird cloak, and the crystal shard.
Stark picked up the cloak, feeling its texture against his fingers.
…
[Equipment:] Conjoined Warrior's Cloak
[Type:] Cloak
[Class:] All
[Tier:] Rare
[Required Level:] 15
[Quality:] Good
[Attributes:] +150 strength, +100 speed
[Special Perk:] Wearing this cloak while fighting will result in the chance of inflicting a critical hit on your opponent (dealing massive damage), the chance is only 5%.
…
'It's the same one that warrior skeleton was wearing… no items from the witch I guess.'
Finally, he picked up the crystal shard, wondering what it could be.
…
[Equipment:] Mirror Master's Crystal Shard
[Type:] Cast
[Class:] Domination
[Tier:] Legendary
[Required Level:] 20
[Quality:] Exquisite
[Attributes:] It is a caste item so no stat boost
[Special Perk:] You can use this crystal to cast a giant glass shard that deals incredible damage to one enemy, there is a cooldown of ten minutes between each use, and it is recommended to infuse the shard into a ring for better use.
…
The rewards weren't disappointing, at least for now.
After all… he still had one more golden panel in front of him.
[+1 LEGENDARY Skill]
And so he clicked it, expecting something incredible, something that was worth the other four's deaths, something that would help him conquer everything.

chapters.title: Chapter 50 - 50: The Calamity-Level Monsters
chapters.content:
As soon as Stark clicked on the golden panel with the legendary skill, he was surrounded by a golden aura that made all of his body tingle slightly.
Even his eyes and pupils were blazing with that same golden aura, a proof that what he was getting was truly a LEGENDARY skill.
Legendary skills are only the 5th type out of the 8 available, but they were still incredible, and nobody that was only level 16 could even dream of having one as it would take either reaching a high level, buying a skill scroll, or getting lucky inside of a rift.
In all cases, most classifiers Stark's age wouldn't get one any time soon.
Soon enough, the panel that explained the skill appeared before him, and Stark could only read in excitement.
…
[Skill: Double Assault]
[Type: Legendary]
[Level: 1]
[Description: Upon activating this skill, all of your stats double in numbers, making you a beast in the battlefield, it only lasts ten seconds, but it should be enough to make both people and monsters fear you, cooldown is 20 minutes.]
…
"Holy…" Stark smiled, this was an incredibly interesting skill, and although it only lasted ten seconds, it was still a fair amount of time in a battle to deal damage and reverse the tides.
Maybe if he had such a skill in hand before, then Orasio wouldn't have died…
'No,' Stark shook his head, 'What had to happen happened, now I need to live.'
[One last question]
A transparent panel appeared, different than the ones with the rewards.
'…?'
[Were these rewards worth the death of the others?]
Stark read the panel a few times before looking at the new skill he had acquired, his now giant HP pool, and the items on the bed.
He grinned, "Yeah, it was pretty damn worth it."
[Interesting =)]
And so it disappeared afterward.
"Spatial Inventory," he called out the name of his extremely convenient skill, and the void appeared beside him, he put every single item on his bed except for the [The Purgatory Shadows] ring as it was useful and he could wear it currently with his level.
He also pulled out the [Crystalheart Band] from it, he had kept it inside his void since the required level was 15, but now that he leveled up, he was able to wear it.
…
[Item:] Crystalheart Band
[Type:] Ring
[Class:] Domination
[Tier:] Epic
[Required Level:] 15
[Quality:] Excellent
[Attributes:] +50 Health, +40 Mind, +10 to all other stats
[Special Perks:] Grants the wearer a shield that absorbs 10% of incoming damage.
[Note:] This ring is a passive so the damage you receive is reduced by 10% the moment you wear it.
…
He wore the two rings on two of his fingers, allowing them to link with him and for their perks to be active.
'That's done for at least,' he jumped on his bed, fighting four (more if you considered that there were two shadows and the conjoined siblings?) bosses in a row was exhausting.
Immediately, he grabbed his phone to check the time.
Bur right as he started it up…
"WARNING, WARNING!"
A red screen appeared on it, and a woman's panicked voice shouted.
"We just have reported the appearance of a calamity-level monster inside of Fellarburg!"
"There have been three other cases in the world these past few hours, if you are in Fellarburg, please refrain from going outside and seek refuge!"
"It has been reported that the amount of casualties is already in the thousands, and experts are actively trying to kill those beasts, as well as find their origins, but it has been years since they have been appearing, yet no one seems to know how."
Stark's eyes immediately widened as he heard the message and saw the pictures of the beasts in question: a giant, humanoid creature with glowing red eyes, horns, and a terrifying scowl, it had giant dark wings, and it used them to fly wherever it wanted at incredible speed, as well as a giant crimson shield.
But there was one single thing that allowed Stark to confirm what he feared: the monster in Fellarburg had a burn mark on its face at the exact same spot of Orasio's.
And that's when he remembered those words.
[It is either you complete the trial or… become one of 'them']
Not completing the trial didn't cause death, instead you turned into one of these calamity-level beasts that caused havoc in the city/country.
Monsters in this world were spread across ten categories: Fodder, Weak, Normal, Strong, Elite, Boss, Calamity, Immortal, Universal, Divine.
And now, all four participants of the trial except for Stark, had turned into one of these things, and their appearances were widely different from one another.
"…" Stark's face was cold as he turned on his television and saw the reports of whatever was going on, the pictures of classifiers fighting the beasts across the screen, all the world watching in terror.
And with that, Stark had realized that time inside the trial moved just like in real life, meaning that he hadn't been gone for more than ten hours that such a disaster occured.
All the others calamity monsters had been taken care of by now, except for Orasio, who relentlessly blocked all the attacks using his shield, he was avoiding conflict and using his wings to fly somewhere nobody knew off.
Nobody… except for Stark, because deep down, he knew that Orasio was coming for him.
~FWISH~
An arrow came hurtling toward the transformed Orasio's head, and he succumbed to the attack.
Lana's father, the Archer King, was the one responsible for getting rid of the monster after being called, and he had done his job.
But before falling to the ground, Orasio used his last bit of willpower to scream something incomprehensible to most.
"CHOOOOSEEEEENNNNN!!!!"
There was fury in his eyes, but soon enough he fell.
It was Stark's code name in the trial, and all he could do was watch with a blank expression as his companion died.
"It seems like all the monsters were taken care of for now, but professionals will be on the look-out for any sign of another attack, stay safe!"
The reporter ended the diffusion, and Stark shut down his TV afterward.
"Only the strongest will survive," Stark quoted while remembering his companion's scream, it was probably the transformation that pushed him to try and find Stark, but it didn't matter.
"Anyways, less than ten hours since the trial started, meaning that ill be able to go to the meeting with Lana about that Hell-Level rift…" Stark made sense of time, he thought that days would have passed after he woke up, but luckily not.
And so Stark lay down on his bed and closed his eyes, he would need to sell some of the items he acquired that he didn't need to make money, and also get ready for whatever awaited him.
During that nap he took, Stark had a nightmare.

chapters.title: Chapter 51 - 51: Before the Meeting
chapters.content:
Six days have passed since the end of the domination trial for Stark.
He had checked his phone daily since that day to check for any news as he realized that it was extremely important in this world.
The entire world was shaken by the appearance of those calamity monsters, and although they appeared only once in a while (when someone failed a domination trial), they were still feared by many.
And what made this new case even stranger was the fact one of the monsters had spoken for the first time.
The name 'Chosen' was analyzed by experts all over the world, yet couldn't find anyone, all they knew was that 'Chosen' was related to the appearance of these monsters.
Stark had also taken a good break after everything he went through, spending the last days just lazing around, only going outside to eat or to grab groceries.
Soon enough though, he realized that tomorrow was the supposed meeting with Lana at the capital, and so he needed to get everything in order before that.
He hailed for a taxi yet again, then went to the classifier trading district of Fellarburg.
Instead of going in the morning like his first time, he went at 4pm, which was pretty much the busy hour as thousands upon thousands of people were navigating the streets.
'Classifiers Trading Association'
He arrived in front of the massive building and entered it, yet again greeted by a receptionist who guided him toward a room where he could appraise and sell his items.
His appraiser this time was a white-haired beautiful woman that looked to be in her early thirties.
She was smoking a cigarette while waiting for the next customer, and she gently smiled upon seeing Stark.
"Let's get started, boy," she immediately asked for his items, and Stark didn't waste time either.
He wanted to sell two things: the sword he took from that guy before, and the [Devourer's Ring] since it was useless for him.
In the end, after a bit of negociating, he managed to sell the sword for 220,000 Rher coins, and the ring for 440,000, giving him a fair amount of money on his account.
"Those rings on your finger look fabulous, mind if I take a look at them too~" the woman seductively said, she had keen eyes, able to spot that these rings wee much more valuable.
"I would rather not," Stark shook his head and left the reception room.
With these new sales, Stark had reached over 800,000 Rher coins in his account, and his assets probably ranged around 2 millions because of the unsold items.
It wasn't much for now, but going from 0 to this was already phenomenal.
[Market Section]
He then moved to the market section, many signs indicating where it was, and it also had the highest amount of people.
There were severals halls and elevators inside the market itself, as it was seperated into multiple categories: low-level items, middle-level items, high-level items… and much more.
He took an elevator to the sixth floor, and there a sign informed him he was indeed in the [Low-Level Items] section of the market.
There were hundreds of people roaming the halls, looking for the items they wanted.
The area was lavishly decorated, and hundreds of display cases were neatly arranged in a way for everything to be visible.
[Items], [Skill Scrolls], [Weapons], [Staffs]…
There was everything related to any and every class, ranging from Beast Tamer to even Alchemist.
Everything… except for Domination.
He searched for a good ten minutes, but there was no such thing as even a single domination item.
'Fucking hell… this makes it even harder…'
He approached the [Skill Scrolls], which were all displayed in cases, and there were even screens with the thousands of items available for people to scroll and find them easily.
…
[Item:] Skill Scroll
[Skill:] Animal Spirits
[Class:] Beast Tamer
[Tier:] Uncommon
[Price:] 350,000
…
[Item:] Skill Scroll
[Skill:] Stealth
[Class:] Assassin, Warrior
[Tier:] Rare
[Price:] 780,000
…
[Item:] Skill Scroll
[Skill:] Curved Arrow
[Class:] Archer
[Tier:] Rare
[Price:] 560,000
…
All these things were available for people who had money, yet there were no 'Domination' skills.
'I knew it would be useless…' he left the market section without buying anything.
But this visit had just served to confirm what he mostly suspected: with his current class, there was no way to get an advantage using money except for wearable items such as rings…
He left the 'Classifiers Trading Association' shortly after, and found himself in the bustling streets again.
'I guess i'll just eat then go back home, need to get ready for tomorrow…'
But while walking to the restaurant, Stark decided to check his status window as he hadn't done it in a while.
…
[Level:] 16
[Health:] 6150/6150
[Bloodline:] Human
[Class:] Domination
[Domination Trial completed, come back later for more information…]
[Talent:] Chosen one
[Attributes:] Strength 346; Speed 412; Mind/Soul 827; Stamina 531; Defense 473
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv5; Focus lv5; Aura Smash lv5; Clone Frenzy lv2; Invincible Dodge lv1; Double Assault lv1…
…
[Skill Points: 5 Available]
'Holy… I keep forgetting about them!' Stark smacked his own head, resulting in some people giving him weird looks, he hadn't used any since level 12 after all…
[You have upgraded 'Domination' to level 6!]
[You have upgraded 'Clone Frenzy' to level 5!]
[You have upgraded 'Invincible Dodge' to level 2!]
And of course, the moment 'Clone Frenzy' reached level 5, it unlocked a new perk, much like every other skill so far.
…
[Skill: Clone Frenzy]
[New Perk: You are allowed to summon two clones, their HP is still one though]
…
'Holy shit… this is incredible,' Clone Frenzy was one of his most powerful skills, and as long as the clone itself was able to dodge attacks, then it was basically like a slightly weaker Stark with his own thoughts.
After grinning for a few minutes, and attracting the attention of more classifiers, Stark entered a luxurious restaurant (it was to reward himself for working so hard, otherwise he would never do that) and went back home after an hour.
He could hear talks about the calamity-level monsters around him, and the name 'Chosen' escaped the mouths of others dozens of times.
None of them could imagine that the responsible was right here, but honestly he preferred it that way, of course, Stark still loved to be praised, but in this situation, it would be mostly be threats rather than praises.
Soon enough, he called out for a taxi and went back to his hotel room, spending the next few hours scrolling around on his phone before sleeping.
Tomorrow would be his meeting with Lana, one where they would discuss the level 35-50 Hell-Level rift that was gonna open soon around Fellarburg, attracting hundreds of powerful classifiers.

chapters.title: Chapter 52 - 52: Triple Succubus Problem...
chapters.content:
Meanwhile, in the noble district of Fellarburg, near the capital, within a luxurious mansion, Daniel stood on the balcony, observing the whole city.
Despite only being 15, he had a glass of wine in his hands, after all, the rules of this world were extremely different than from Stark's previous one.
"It has been confirmed, sir, the Hell-Level rift located near Fellaburg will open in exactly three days, and there are already hundreds of Elite classifiers that are planning to participate in the raid," One of Daniel's right hands, a level 127 classifier from the Alchemist class named Alphis, spoke.
"Hm… seems like this is becoming bigger of an issue than we thought, do they know?" Daniel asked, looking at Alphis.
"Many do not seem to know about the presence of 'that' yet, giving us the utmost advantage," Alphis replied, his face blank.
Alphis was a renown researcher and also a very powerful classifier, making him an incredible ally to the Pridel family.
"I did hear about the fact the Moonless family will participate," Daniel smiled as he mentioned the 'Moonless' name.
"That is true, but it is not surprising, such a rift appearing is a rare occurrence, which is why so many people are gathering, lots of them are confident this could be linked to the 'Godless Demon' as well as the 'Black Sun'…" these unexplainable beings are always there, watching, but no one knew about their plans.
It was also extremely rare, if not impossible, for these two to acknowledge anybody, although it had been proven to be possible.
"Very well," Daniel nodded while sipping into his wine, "I won't be able to participate this time, but make sure to send some of the Pride Family warriors to make sure they know we are present, I need to score points with Lana and her family."
Daniel's obsession with Lana would never go away, no matter what, he wanted her, and he wouldn't let anybody take her away from him.
"Stark," he suddenly said, fury in his eyes, as he remembered Lana take that loser away.
"…?" Alphis tilted his head in confusion, he knew of 'Stark Heartsouls', but he didn't seem to be a very important person.
"I want that fucker gone… he got lucky once, and the second time he was saved by Lana, but the next time I see him…" he broke the glass with his hands.
"Do not fret, Daniel, it is impossible for someone to enter the rift without the major classifier families to allow them to, so we should be fine."
This brought a smile to Daniel's face.
"Make sure to send our finest warriors there, I want everyone to know and fear the Pridel family name."
Whether it was House Potter, House Sunny, House Moonless and many more, all of them would send their most talented young lings to that rift, and the winner would be the one who defeats the boss or brings the most materials.
And so just like that, their plan was set in motion.
***
~BEEP, BEEP, BEEP~
Stark's alarm rang, but he ignored it for a few seconds, before suddenly realizing he had a meeting with Lana.
He took his phone to check the time… and…
"11:28AM? THE MEETING IS SUPPOSED TO BE AT 12, FUCK!" he would undeniably be late at this rate, and he didn't dare to offend a person such as Lana, even more so after checking on the internet and realizing the scale they were at.
Even though Fellarburg was one of the less remarkable countries in the world, there were still many powerful houses there, and there has also been a surge of interest recently because of that Hell-Level Rift.
Taking a quick shower, then wearing the most average of clothes, Stark left his hotel room in a hurry.
He had to take yet another taxi, taking him 30 minutes to reach the capital of Fellarburg since it was close to the 'Classifier Trading District'.
The atmosphere was extremely joyful, and thousands were roaming around, enjoying their peaceful lives outside the rifts.
'Altar Restaurant…' Stark repeated the name of the meeting place while looking at his phone for the location.
He was already late by fifteen minutes, and he could already sense Lana's gaze on him.
On his way to the restaurant, he had to pass through what they called the 'Fun District', which was basically the place where most of the popular love hotels, bars, and people who wanted to have intercourse were.
Of course, the most wanted people in that district were those with the 'Succubus/Incubus' class.
Stark ran for a good five minutes, but as he turned the last corner before reaching the restaurant…
~THUMP~
He bumped into someone, and looking up, he found himself staring into the lustful eyes of a young woman with shiny black hair that seemed to shimmer in the sunlight.
Beside her were two other girls, just as beautiful as the first.
[Class:] Succubus
"Hey~" she stared at Stark, but the only thing the boy was interested in was the restaurant as he could clearly see it from behind their figures.
They were just as tall as he was (roughly 1,75cm), and so not allowing him to leave.
"Not interested," Stark immediately said, trying to avoid them, but the girls stopped him regardless.
"You're pretty cute, wanna have fun~?" a blonde-haired one right next to the first smiled, an aura was in her eyes, almost as if she was undressing him.
"I already said it once, not interested," Stark's tone became more aggressive, and yet again he tried to pass.
But the girl's succubus tails entangled themselves around his arms and legs, "Oh come on~ We love virgins like you, let's just have fun for a few minutes…"
'I swear to god… these people do not give up,' now actually angry, he activated his aura and used it to remove the tails around his body.
"I wouldn't let a SLUT take my virginity," he looked at the three girls as if they were mere objects, surprising them, they hadn't expected that guy to be so… dominating?
But when he tried to leave…
"HEY, WHAT ARE YOU DOING?" He heard a feminine voice come from his front, and he saw Lana run at them, an angry look on her face.
'Great job, assholes,' he groaned at the succubus for wasting his time.
But which surprised Stark the most was that Lana wasn't angry at him, instead she placed herself in front of the three girls, and shouted at them, "Get out of here, and don't approach him anymore if you know what's best for you…"
Lana hated to use her influence for such things, but she had already done it for the second time with Stark.
"Holy… that's Lana…" one of the girls said, sweat pouring out from her forehead, "Haha… w-we were just joking, you know…?"
"I don't care, GET OUT!"
And all three walked away, not expecting the boy they stopped to be with such an important person.
"Fucking hell…" Lana cursed, her eyes on the girls until they turned around a corner, "I was wondering why you were late, and that's because you were entertaining these… succubi?"
"Um… no, they just stopped me thirty seconds ago," Stark shrugged.
"Oh well… it doesn't matter, we'll talk inside the restaurant, I reserved a seat for two after all…"
They began walking toward 'Altar Restaurant', but it was once taking the first few steps that Stark realized something:
"Wait… WAS I GETTING HIT ON?"
He quickly recovered though, 'Heh, who cares...'
He wasn't interested in woman for now.

chapters.title: Chapter 53 - 53: The Secret Rift Meeting
chapters.content:
In opposition to Stark, who was wearing the most average clothes, and had overall the appearance of a guy nobody would pay attention to normally, Lana was completely different.
She was wearing an elegant dress that hugged her curves in all the right places, her long blond hair reaching her waist, and not even needing makeup to be beautiful.
Even during the few seconds it took them to reach the restaurant, dozens of people stopped to observe her beauty (some males attracting the angry gaze of their companions).
She exuded confidence and poise, a true representation of the Heiress of House Moonless, although she did lose her cool when Stark was being hit on for some reason.
As they entered the restaurant, the staff greeted them warmly, and Lana led Stark to their reserved table in a cozy corner.
Stark glanced around the restaurant, taking in the lively atmosphere and the hustle and bustle of the people.
"As you know, I organized this date- I mean meeting to discuss the Hell-Level right that appeared recently," she spoke, and Stark looked at her with the blankest of expressions.
"We have little to no information about it, but all that we know is that it is gonna open in two days, outside of Fellarburg," she tapped on her phone to show the location to Stark, "It is reserved for powerful houses and conglomerates, but there will be hundreds of people, so you should watch out…"
"Ok."
Suddenly, Lana clapped both of her hands, and one of the waiters came to their table with a suitcase, placing it in front of Stark.
"You have to wear this attire and mask when outside and inside the rift, after all, your presence is supposed to be a secret."
Stark opened the suitcase, and just as she said, there was a smoking, alongside a bunny mask that covered only the upper half of his face.
"Why are you doing this to me? This seems a bit too good…" Stark asked, looking into Lana's beautiful eyes.
"I will be frank with you, I think you are extremely powerful, and that you will be useful to me in the future, also this is a great opportunity for you to level up," she smiled for the first time, a genuine one.
"Ok, but I have one simple request."
"Yes?"
Most classifiers would dream of entering a Hell-Level Secret Rift, yet here he was, asking her for a request, anyone watching this would consider him crazy.
Plus, Secret Rifts were basically a treasure trove since no one had explored them before, allowing dozens upon dozens of equipment to be available for grabs.
High risk, high reward, basically.
"I want to be allowed to roam around the rift alone."
Lana raised an eyebrow, slightly surprised by his request, but she just nodded.
"Very well, but you'll have to act as if you are part of the 'Crimson Moon Squad', it is our team that is participating in the raid of the rift."
"Okay," Stark didn't care, he was probably out of place among all those powerful classifiers, but he still believed in himself, after all he was sure none of them would have been able to complete that Domination Trial.
He had already experienced Hell once, so there was no way he would be scared.
Stark didn't know how to talk to women, but he somehow held up a decent conversation with Lana as they were eating.
"Did you see those calamity-level beasts that appeared-" she tried to initiate again after a few minutes of silence.
"No, I don't know," he immediately replied, not wanting to talk about his previous companions transforming into these beasts.
"Oh well… okay."
Soon enough, they finished eating, and said goodbye to each other.
Time passed quickly, and before he knew, two days went by.
Stark woke up early in the morning, before dawn.
"…" he knew it was time to leave.
The Secret Rift was very far, so Lana had requested for him to come to an underground base the 'Crimson Moon Squad' used to meet the members, and also to go there.
In contrary to what he believed though, 'Crimson Moon Squad' wasn't truly part of the Moonless family, instead it was more like a group of powerful classifiers they had formed for such occasions, and Lana was only a member too.
It was her father that was the leader (although when he wasn't present, Vex took his place), and so he asked her to join them for experience, but surprisingly enough also allowed him to be part of it for this expedition.
Stark grabbed the suitcase he had been given in the restaurant and pulled out its contents.
He wore the black and purplish smoking, one that went extremely well with him for some reason.
And as for the white bunny mask, he placed it on his face, covering the upper half. He looked in the mirror, at his transformed appearance, and a strange smile played on his lips.
…
[Item:] Crimson Moon Bunny Mask
[Type:] Mask
[Quality:] Good
[Perk:] Hides your face perfectly, nobody that doesn't know about your identity will recognize you.
…
There were two other things inside the suitcase though: a red badge adorned with a half-moon on it, it was the 'Crimson Moon Squad' logo.
…
[Item:] Crimson Moon Communication Device
[Type:] Badge
[Quality:] Good
[Perk:] Allows all 'Crimson Moon Squad' members who wear this badge to communicate with one another using a powerful 'Telepathy' and 'Voice Transmission' spell.
…
And the final item was a weird potion in a glass, the liquid inside was green.
…
[Item:] Max Health Potion
[Type:] Consummable
[Quality:] Perfect
[Perk:] Heals to full health, and removes any status effect as well as exhaustion.
…
'Thank you, Lana,' she was surprisingly considerate even though he had believed she was just a girl who used her family's money to get what she wanted.
Wearing his two rings, his necklace, the bunny mask, and the 'Crimson Mood Squad' uniform, Stark finally set out for the base.
The sun was rising in the east when he arrived in front of an empty bar near the Capital.
"Crimson Light Bar" was the name, and Stark could only guess it was the right location with the name.
It was still mostly night, and the street he was in was mostly empty, so he knocked twice at the wooden door of the bar.
And after a few seconds, it magically opened.
'Great, another group who tries to seem mysterious,' he groaned as nobody was behind when the door opened.
And so he entered the bar, the wooden door closing behind as if it was controlled by an unknown force.
After marching through the hall for a few seconds, he arrived in the main area with the bar, tables, and drinks.
And in there, seven people could be seen, three women and four man.
They were the 'Crimson Moon Squad'.

chapters.title: Chapter 54 - 54: The Crimson Moon Squad
chapters.content:
The first person he noticed, sitting on a wooden chair, was Lana.
She was looking at him with anticipation, her gaze filled with trust and expectation.
She was one of the two woman in the 'Crimson Moon Squad', and so except for her, Stark knew nobody else.
Stark then switched her gaze to the other members, analyzing them all in the process.
There was a man with silver hair and pale skin, dressed in a neat suit, and a staff in his hands, he immediately got up from his seat once Stark's eyes fell on him.
[Class: Magus]
[Level: 109]
"Welcome, Stark. I'm glad you could make it. My name is Lance, I heard lots of things about you from our little Lana here," he nodded in approval.
"Shut up, old man, don't say anything else if you know what's best for you…" Lana groaned, a fierce expression on her face.
"Haha~ sure sure, wouldn't wanna put off your crus-"
An arrow came flying toward Lance, landing right next to his head.
Of course, Lance was a powerful Magus, so such an attack wouldn't hard him, plus he would have had the time to cast several spells, but he still let it go since it was Lana.
Stark nodded politely, returning the smile.
Next, he noticed a tall, muscular man with short, curly black hair. He wore a leather vest and had a gruff look on his face.
[Class: Warrior]
[Level: 97]
"I'm Thorn, the muscle of the team. Nice to meet you," he grunted, giving Stark a firm handshake.
Stark replied, but immediately as he did so, he felt Thorn's pressure on his hand, almost as if he wanted to crush it.
"…?" Stark looked at him with a blank expression, not hurt at all since he had immediatly activated [Domination] and put the entirety of his aura around that hand.
"Hm…" Thorn was confused, he had the idea of hurting Stark a bit to show him it would be difficult, but he didn't seem affected at all, "Good strength kid, I approve," he finally let go, finally giving him a smirk.
Stark continued to scan the room, his eyes falling on a woman with long, flowing red hair and striking green eyes, she had glasses and seemed to be focused on some potions that were placed on her table.
"Hehe~ almost done," she giggled, not even acknowledging Stark and his arrival, but still telling him her name, "Olivia!"
[Class: Alchemist]
[Level: 116]
The next person that caught his attention was a man, draped in a cloak that seemed to meld with the shadows of the room. His eyes glinted with a keen intelligence as he met Stark's gaze.
[Class: Assassin]
[Level: 105]
"Max…" that's all he said, and Stark nodded.
He then turned his attention to a woman with long, golden hair that cascaded down her back like a waterfall. She wore a simple white dress and had an ethereal quality about her.
[Class: Exorcist]
[Level: 112]
"Stella!' they were stars shining in her eyes, and anybody who saw her from afar could guess that she was a saint, "Nice to meet you!" she grabbed both of Stark's hands with hers, and smiled.
Finally, his gaze settled on a man who exuded a dark aura, his eyes glinting with mischief and power.
He had a green heart with a hat on top of it pulsating in his right hand, and he seemed to be playing with it.
[Class: Soul Wielder]
[Level: 124]
He had white hair and wore an intricate suit that hinted at his agility and skill in combat, fairly similar to the one Stark was wearing.
"Well, well, if it isn't the new recruit," he smirked, crossing his arms over his chest confidently, "Call me Vex."
Vex seemed to be the leader of this small squad, both because his aura was the most powerful, but also because of his level.
"Stark Heartsouls," Stark replied while staring at all the people in the room.
"Welcome, Stark," Vex's voice was smooth and commanding, "We've been expecting you." He gestured for Stark to take a seat at the table where the squad was gathered.
As Stark settled in, Vex continued, "No need for lame explanations, all you need to know is that the Secret Rift opens in exactly 7 hours from now on, so we need to be going there soon."
"Very well, any information I need to know?" he replied.
"You requested to be alone, so all you need to do is seperate yourself from us at the start, that rift is Hell-Level so it is so big we might not see each other until we leave…"
Stark nodded in understanding, mentally preparing himself for the upcoming challenge.
The atmosphere in the bar became tense as each member of the Crimson Moon Squad geared up for the mission ahead.
Lana's eyes sparkled with determination, Thorn cracked his knuckles, and Max's gaze sharpened even more.
After the rest of them (except for Stark) sipped into their wine, which he clearly found to be dumb since what would happen to you if you were drunk inside a dangerous rift, all of them left the bar.
Stark had been given some information along with that alcohol break: dozens of organizations woukd participate in this it was a perfect moment to conquer a powerful rift and attract the media and also gather materials.
Whether it was several powerful houses from other countries, military groups, conglomerates, and even solo classifiers, all would be there.
As they exited the bar, there were a black limousine-like cars waiting for them.
It hadn't been there when Stark had arrived, but looks like these guys were prepared.
"Good luck, let's hope you aren't too late," Vex smiled as Stark and Lana entered the car.
"You aren't coming?" Stark was confused, why were they the only one that needed to take that car?
It didn't take more than a few seconds for him understand.
Vex, using his 'Wielder Heart', began flying in the air, shooting in to the sky with a magnificent green flash.
Max, the assassin, also just hid in the shadows and disappeared out nowhere.
Thorn, the burly man, jumped on a building and dashed toward the location of the secret Rift at an incredible speed.
Lance used some sort of spell and teleported away.
And as for the two women on the group that didn't go inside the car: Olivia, the achemist, just drank a potion and turned into a bird before flying into the horizon.
"What the fuck?" Stark was astonished.
And as for Stella, the exorcist, she summoned a giant golden cross and got on top of it before also flying, like she was on a magic carpet.
"We aren't that strong… are we not?" Stark awkwardly laughed.
"Maybe not…" Lana shrugged, "But i'm sure we'll reach that level some day."
Stark was honestly confident in his speed, he could of course always focus all his aura around his legs and be way faster than the car, but he decided to be prioritize rest over showing off as it was useless.
Six hours passed after they got inside of the car, and soon enough, they left Fellarburg.
They were now in a giant plain with green grass, and in front of them were dozens of other cars, as well as hundreds of people, some still arriving from the sky or even ground.
"That's our stop," Lana nodded, and the two got off the car.
Everyone was there was one simple thing: the Secret Rift that was bound to open soon.

chapters.title: Chapter 55 - 55: Opening of the Secret Rift
chapters.content:
As Stark and Lana stepped out of the car, they were immediately greeted by the sight of numerous fellow classifiers, each huddled in their respective groups, discussing strategies and final preparations.
In front of them all was a weird monument, and a crimson closed off portal that looked like a shut-eye from afar in the center.
The Crimson Moon Squad had already reached the location before Lana and Stark, a proof that their travelling method was way more effective.
They soon enough found the leader, Vex, and from there regrouped all the members one by one.
"Only 20 more minutes," Vex spoke while pointing at the closed portal, "Then let's prove to all those fuckers that we're the stronger ones…!"
This was a competition between all factions, and every single one of them was looking at one another, the sole purpose would be to come out of this shitty place alive while conquering it.
Whatever there was inside, they would need to face it.
Not even ten minutes later, they heard a voice coming from their left.
"HAHAHA VEX, YOU LOOK DESPERATE!" a burly man with a brown heart in his hands laughed, he seemed to be another 'Soul Wielder'.
"Jack… you never get tired of doing shit like this, do you?" Crimson Moon's leader sighed.
"You have a reached a new low it seems," his eyes were burning with an aura the same color of his heart, "Inviting two newbies to such a rift is basically suicide!"
By this point, many people were looking at the commotion.
"I do understand Lana since she is extremely talented and you will actively make sure she is fine, but him?" he pointed at Stark, a wide grin on his face, "You are begging for him to be eaten or what? Plus what is that stupid mask?"
It was obvious from all the different powerful people in this space that Lana and Stark were some of the weakest ones, plus their auras were also lower (although on Stark's part it was only because he hadn't activated Domination, otherwise it would be just as much as all the others)
"Stop caring about my members so much, Jack, maybe it's because you don't focus on your team that you all have been slacking off lately," Vex retorted, and many people laughed, enjoying the show.
"…" Jack was furious, "Well… let's see if your little newbie will survive inside that rift…" he groaned, "A LEVEL 16 PARTICIPATING IN A LEVEL 35-50 HELL-LEVEL RIFT IS CRAZY," he shouted that last part on purpose for everyone to hear.
And immediately, all eyes fell on the masked Stark.
"Is Crimson Moon crazy, did they hire a level 16 newbie?"
"And look at that ugly mask, pfft~ that guy is as good as dead…"
"This is suicide, does he have a death wish?"
Murmurs spread across all the groups of classifiers.
"…" Stark was just looking at everything unfolding with a blank expression on his face though since he didn't care about any of these people and their opinions.
Plus, what good would it be for him to get mad over such petty things.
"You are a grown adult, and i'm a kid, so please act like one," Stark smiled while responding to Jack, and yet again another row of laughter echoed.
"You little…" Jack gritted his teeth, but a white-haired woman, probably his teammate, grabbed his shoulder and asked him to let it go, so he went back to his group.
As the tension in the air eased slightly, Vex turned to Lana and Stark with a reassuring smile,"Don't worry about Jack, he's all bark and no bite," he said, patting Stark on the back, "You'll prove them all wrong once we enter that rift."
But almost all the Crimson Moon Squad members were thinking like the others: Stark is pushing his luck with that rift, and he is surely gonna die inside, although they weren't saying it and acted friendly.
They had no bad intentions, but logic was their priority, and it didn't make sense for someone that is level 16 to attempt that.
Well… every member except for Vex that is, since he could sense Stark's aura and determination, and without any doubt they were some of the strongest he had seen.
Stark felt a surge of determination coursing through him as he stood before the closed portal, the hushed whispers and doubtful gazes of the other classifiers fading into background noise.
He adjusted his bunny mask, the intricate design seeming to gleam with an inner light as he focused on the challenge ahead.
Vex gathered the team together, his voice cutting through the tension in the air. "We're not here to back down from a challenge. We're here to show what we're capable of. No matter what lies beyond that portal, we face it together, well except for Stark since… you know…"
The countdown began, marking the final moments before the portal would open. As the numbers dwindled, a sense of anticipation hung heavy in the air.
Stark could feel the energy crackling around them, a mixture of fear and excitement swirling within everyone.
And then, with a resounding hum, the portal slowly creaked open, revealing a swirling mass of dark energy pulsing within.
[PORTAL OPENED]
The crimson portal was now available for everyone to use, and so people rushed inside, wanting to be the firsts to explore that place.
"Nobody is allowed to leave a Secret Rift before it is completed, so watch out, especially you, Stark," he patted the black-haired boy's back and headed toward the portal alongside the other members.
"Are you sure you wanna go alone?" Lana stayed back for a few seconds to confirm with Stark, and he simply nodded, so she went alongside the others.
'Welp,' he stretched while grinning, still sensing the gaze of those that were still outside on him, it seemed like he had become a target to many in such a short amount of time, 'Let's just… level up…'
And so he entered as well, ready to reach level 25 and spin the [Class Wheel] again, and maybe, just maybe, complete that rift and get all the rewards too…?
As he stepped inside the portal, the world around Stark blurred and twisted, the once familiar scenery dissolving into a whirl of colors.
A rush of wind tugged at his clothes, and his heart pounded in his chest as he was pulled deeper into the unknown.
It was a completely different sensation from the one he had when getting inside the [City Ruins], but it was just to remind him that this rift was on a whole other level.
'No… it can't be worse than this…' he remembered the Domination Trial and the hellish bosses he had to defeat, in comparison, this would be NOTHING.
And so he entered.
[Level 35-50 Hell-Level Rift: The Valley of Shadows]
[Good luck!]

chapters.title: Chapter 56 - 56: The Mountain Challenge
chapters.content:
Stark emerged from the other side of the portal, his eyes taking a moment to adjust to the dim lighting of The Valley of Shadows.
The air was thick with an eerie stillness, broken only by the distant echoes of unknown creatures.
He was currently standing on the grass of a giant plain, and beside him were hundreds of people like him, all looking in front of them without saying a word.
Even the other members of the Crimson Moon Squad were looking, bewildered.
And that's when Stark decided to check out what awaited him.
The sky was red, and three moons hung high above, casting an otherworldly glow on the landscape.
But upon further inspection, he realized that these 'moons' were actually much more terrifying as there was a giant eye on each of them, staring down on the world below.
They were currently on flat ground with no monsters in sight, but right in front of them stood a mountain, a giant door at its surface, inviting them all to enter.
As Stark gazed up at the foreboding entrance to the mountain, a chill ran down his spine. The other participants shuffled nervously around him, whispering among themselves in hushed tones.
But he knew he shouldn't waste time, and so while all the others waited for their teammates or got ready to strategize…
"DOMINATION!" he activated his skill, and his crimson aura surrounded by feet.
~DASH~
He began running toward the entrance with incredible speed, surprising all the others.
"Already going? The fuck"
"Holy shit… isn't that the level 16 guy?"
"Yeah he is definitely going to die…"
The mountain was extremely tall, even reaching the dark clouds with lightning that decorated the red sky.
"Even high level rifts have low-levels monster in some location, try to find one and gain experience there," was what Vex told him, and that's exactly what Stark planned to do.
Going head to head with several level 35 monsters was absolutely suicide when he thought about it, even with his upgraded health and incredible stats.
Many people followed after Stark after he began rushing toward the real start of the rift, these grass plains were in fact only the 'safe' area, the real challenge beginning when you entered the valley.
The entrance of the mountain was akin to some sort of cave, except there was no way to check inside, a black fog stopping anyone from seeing past it.
[Once you enter the level 35 area: "Mountain Challenge", you will not be able to return until at least reaching the Valley of Shadows, so be careful =)]
'Why is it called the valley if it's inside a mountain...' Stark pondered, but he guessed that it was because this was only the beginning: meaning that the rift was just testing them, only those able to pass the Mountain Challenge would be allowed to traverse.
The darkness of the cave enveloped Stark as he stepped through the threshold, the black fog swirling around him like shadows come to life.
Upon coming out of the other side, he found himself in a labyrinth-like area inside the mountain, all walls were made of the same texture as the mountain.
And so he began walking.
[You are the first to enter the 'Mountain Challenge', how BRAVE!]
And of course, what would be his reward for being so brave? Well…
A monster! Of course!
As he rounded a corner, a pair of glowing eyes pierced the shadows, fixating on him with predatory intent.
The creature emerged from the darkness - a massive beast with sleek brown fur and razor-sharp claws.
But of course, it wasn't alone, and behind it, another three pairs of eyes appeared, and then these monsters emerged too.
They looked like wolves.
…
[Name: Mountain Wolf]
[Level: 30]
[HP: 37000]
[Strength: 938]
[Stamina: 738]
[Speed: 1103]
[Defense: 492]
[Skills: Ferocious Bite, Shadow Pounce, Pack Tactics…]
…
[WARNING! Your level is low (16), do not attempt to fight, run!]
'Nah, i'd win,' Stark positioned his fists in front of his face, ready to take on the four wolves, who somehow almost had as much HP as the boss of the [City Ruins].
"AURA SMASH!" he sent two of his crimson fists toward the wolves, but two of them avoided them, while the other two were hit.
"-19231! -20271!" and just like that, the two wolves had died since they both received this incredible amount of damage.
'Huh…?' Stark was confused, but he didn't have the time for that since the other wolves that had avoided his attack were already on their way to attack him.
"Ferocious Bite!"
He dodged the first wolf's attack, feeling the rush of wind as its teeth snapped shut just inches from his arm.
The second wolf lunged at him from the side, but Stark was quick to react, planting a firm kick into its chest and sending it tumbling backward.
"-7261!" even his kick dealt massive damage, but not enough to truly injure it.
With two wolves down and two remaining, Stark knew he had to act fast. The remaining beasts circled him, their eyes glinting with hunger as they closed in for another attack.
As one of the wolves lunged towards him, Stark made a split-second decision. Instead of dodging, he grabbed the beast by its fur mid-air and used its momentum to swing it into the other wolf, knocking them both off balance.
Taking advantage of the momentary confusion, Stark unleashed a flurry of punches and kicks, each strike hitting with precision and strength.
"-13622! -14361! -12838!"
And so, all the wolves were dead, their defense was low, so hit attacks damaged them greatly, only taking him three hits for each of them to send them back to the shadow realm.
[Experience: 187617/225000]
[You have slain two "Mountain Wolves lv30", gained 38751EXP!]
[You have slain two "Mountain Wolves lv30", gained 39817EXP!]
And so immediately, the influx of experience headed toward Stark's body, and he was enveloped by that golden aura again.
…
[Your level has increased to level 17, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Experience: 41185/268000]
[You have upgraded 'Domination' to level 7!]
'Yeah… the amount of experience needed is really getting out of hand…'
But he didn't really have the time to think about it that he heard more noise behind and in front of him.
[Name: Sneaky Mole lv32]
[Name: Sound Bat lv31]
[Name: Rock Golem Lv30]
'Ah shit… here we go again…' Stark got ready to fight them all, after all, nobody would come to save him in this place, especially since he had made himself a target for others, plus they wouldn't benefit from it.
And so he dashed forward, toward one of the many monsters, and punched it as hard as he could.
"-15472!"
"LET'S DO THIS, MY EXPERIENCE POINTS," he laughed before going on a rampage.

chapters.title: Chapter 57 - 57: Out of the First Area
chapters.content:
The Sneaky Mole dug underground, aiming to surprise Stark from behind, but he anticipated its move. As the mole popped up right behind him, Stark spun around and delivered a swift kick that sent the creature flying back into the dirt.
"-17837!"
Then he sent a crimson fist from 'Aura Smash' inside that hole, killing the mole.
"-21263!"
Next, the Sound Bat swooped down from above, screeching loudly in an attempt to disorient Stark. However, he remained focused and timed his jump perfectly, meeting the bat mid-air with two powerful uppercuts that silenced it for good.
"-18263! -17702!"
The Rock Golem lumbered towards Stark, its massive stone fists raised to crush him. Stark knew he wouldn't be able to take this monster down with just brute force. Instead, he dodged its first strike and aimed for the gem embedded in its chest - the source of its power.
With a calculated move, Stark dashed around the golem, avoiding its heavy attacks and striking precisely at the gem. As his fist connected with the crystal, a blinding light burst forth, causing the golem to shudder and crumble into a pile of rubble.
"-37162!"
This was the most amount of damage he had dealt to an opponent, but it seems like aiming for an enemy's weak point caused more damage, just like in video games.
[You have slain one "Sneaky Mole lv32", gained 21627EXP!]
[You have slain one "Sound Bat lv31", gained 19880EXP!]
[You have slain one "Rock Golem lv34", gained 23726EXP!]
'Fair,' he cracked his bones and kept going, after all this was only the starting area, and he didn't want to stay there too long although it was a perfect opportunity to farm levels.
He continued his journey deeper into the heart of the mountain, each step echoing in the dimly lit cavern.
The path ahead twisted and turned, leading him further away from the entrance and into the unknown depths.
Along the way, he encountered more formidable foes - giant spiders with dripping fangs, elemental spirits crackling with power, and even a towering golem made of pure iron.
But in the end…
[You have slain one "Silky Spider lv33", gained 23182EXP!]
Not a single one of those monsters…
[You have slain one "Mountain Spirit lv31", gained 22619EXP!]
Put a dent on him.
[You have slain one "Iron Golem lv32", gained 24271EXP!]
…
[Your level has increased to level 18, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
…
[Your level has increased to level 19, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
…
[Experience: 8261/310000]
By the time he reached the end of the level 35 area, which took quite a while since he had been lost and also struggled to fight some of the monsters, he was already level 19.
[You have upgraded 'Domination' to level 8!]
[You have upgraded 'Aura Smash' to level 6!]
In front of him was yet another black fog, the same as the one as the entrance, making him unable to see anything past it.
He took a deep breath and stepped forward, unsure of what lay ahead. The darkness of the fog enveloped him, and a strange sensation washed over him.
As his eyes adjusted to the lack of light, he could see faint wisps of energy surrounding him, a message appeared before him:
[You have entered Level 40 area: The Valley's Forest]
He emerged from the other side, and then found himself outside again, except it was completely different.
He was now surrounded by trees, and much like the area's name described, he was inside of a forest.
The sky was still a crimson red, and the three moons were still looking down at… him?
'Almost feels like these things are looking at only me…' Stark didn't like it, but he couldn't do anything about it.
Surrounding him were not only trees, but giant mountains in all directions, blocking anyone from leaving this place.
And his objective? Well… the rift itself showed it to him.
[You are the first person to reach the 'Valley's Forest', granting you information!]
The message turned into a sparkling light, and hurtled toward a giant mountain in front of him like a shining star, one he could hardly see because of the tree leaves.
Observing closely, Stark could see that there was some sort of structure on that mountain, and a flight of stairs were leading up to it, but it was extremely far.
'Welp, need to keep going…'
Stark took a few steps forward and then suddenly hear a weird noise.
~BEEP, BEEP, BEEP~
It didn't take him more than a few seconds to look down and see that the "Crimson Moon Communication Device" he was wearing was glowing repeatedly.
[Please click on the badge to answer the call!]
Stark hesitated for a moment, debating whether to answer the call or ignore it and continue his journey into the Valley's Forest. Curiosity got the better of him, and he tapped on the badge, activating the communication device.
And as soon as he did, Vex's voice rang in his ears, even though he wasn't wearing earphones or anything of the sort.
"Yo, Stark, everyone received a message that someone just entered the level 40 area, are you doing good on your end?"
All the 'Crimson Moon Squad' members could hear or engage in their discussion, but they preferred to listen.
"Yeah… I just entered it, I guess…" Stark answered nonchalantly.
"WAIT WHAT?" Thorns intervened, "IT'S YOU?"
"…?" Stark was confused, after all wasn't the reason they called him because they knew?
But unbeknownst to him, Secret Rifts were different from normal ones since they were never explored before.
Everytime someone entered a new area or defeated an elite/mini-boss/boss, everyone inside the rift would be notified (it was the same in the 'City Ruins' except only for mini-bosses and bosses).
Basically, everyone had received this message.
[Someone has reached the level 40 area, hurry up!]
Vex had indeed called to check on Stark, but he hadn't expected him to be the one to reach it.
"You really are stronger than you look, you know?" the leader praised him.
"I hear that often," Stark smiled.
"Well, i'll let you go, we need to make sure not to let any of the other factions take the lead!"
And just like that, the call was ended.
The shadows of the trees ahead of him and the overall atmosphere of this forest were very eerie, but Stark didn't care.
'Level 25…' he mumbled over and over, he wanted to find a good spot to farm experience, and he believed that this rift would be perfect for it.
But of course, just as he was about to head deeper inside the forest, he heard noise behind him, from the 'Mountain Challenge's' exit, and…
~FWISH~
Four people came out from the black fog.
"Haha~ this isn't hard at all, let's just beat the boss and get this over with!"
Instinctively, Stark hid behind a tree, he didn't know whether these people were aggresive or not, and he didn't want to risk it.
Even more so knowing there was the possibility of their level being way higher than his.
In such a rift, where nobody would question what happened, it is kill or be killed, and no one will know the truth even if you were murdered.
"We can also just loot the guy that already came here, he musn't be far since the message appeared three minutes ago…"
"Good idea, let's kill that fucker and take his equipment!"
'…' he had gotten his answer.

chapters.title: Chapter 58 - 58: The Valley's Forest
chapters.content:
'…' while still behind a tree, Stark listened to the conversation of the four classifiers that emerged from the Mountain Challenge's area exit, and his pupils were burning with a bright crimson aura as he realized their ill intentions.
But it wasn't just them, every single one of the classifiers in here had mostly bad intentions and feelings with the others.
After all, it was a competition, and the strongest group would be the winner.
The group of classifiers passed right next to Stark, unaware of his presence, and headed deeper inside the woods.
'No reason to fight people stronger than me for now…' Stark mumbled before heading to the left, which was opposite to where they had gone.
[Watch out for the three guardians of the Valley's Forest]
Such a warning appeared out of nowhere, almost informing Stark about a danger he didn't know of.
The crimson moons cast an eerie glow on the twisted branches and gnarled roots that seemed to reach out for him with every step.
Shadows danced around him, whispering secrets that he couldn't quite make out.
And then…
~FWASH~
A branch slashed through the air toward Stark, who avoided it at the last second using his quick movements.
'What the fuck?' he wondered while looking around, but saw no enemies.
But it was at that very moment that he realized what was happening: the trees were alive.
Five of the trees that surrounded him suddenly sprang to life, their branches twisting and turning menacingly, ready to strike at any moment, plus a crimson eyeball had appeared within the knots of their bark, all fixated on him.
'This is bad…' Stark thought, preparing himself to face these unexpected foes. He had never encountered living trees before, let alone ones with a malevolent intent.
…
[Name: Fake Trees]
[Level: 38]
[HP: 48500]
[Strength: 1782]
[Stamina: 966]
[Speed: 102]
[Defense: 736]
[Skills: Branch Strike, Root entangle, Life drain, Fakeout…]
…
Stark quickly assessed the situation and knew he had to act fast. With a deep breath, he activated [Domination] and focused his energy.
The Fake Trees began to advance slowly, their branches creaking as they moved closer to him.
They were extremely slow as they were basically using their roots to move slowly, but their reach and strength were on a whole other level, and he felt like even one attack would kill him.
"CLONE FRENZY!" he decided to summon one of his clones beside him to increase his odds since fighting such opponents alone could never be good.
Stark's clone appeared by his side, mirroring his every move as they faced off against the menacing Fake Trees.
The Fake Trees, sensing the increased threat from the appearance of the clone, moved more aggressively towards Stark and his doppelganger. Branches lashed out with incredible speed, aiming to strike them down with brute force.
Stark and his clone leaped and dodged with expert agility, narrowly avoiding the deadly strikes of the Fake Trees. They worked in tandem, coordinating their movements to confuse and outmaneuver their wooden adversaries.
And thanks to that, the clone was able to reach one of the trees before Stark did so.
"AURA SMASH!" it jumped in the air and threw its two crimson fists toward one of the trees' eyeball.
"-25918! -24277!"
'Holy, the damage is insane even for the clone…' Stark thought after seeing that first tree fall to the ground, meaning that their weaknesses was indeed that vulnerable eyeball.
Stark knew that he needed to exploit this weakness to defeat the Fake Trees. With determination in his eyes, he focused his energy and dashed towards another tree, his movements quick and precise.
As he approached the towering wooden creature, branches swiped at him viciously, but Stark anticipated the attacks and ducked, narrowly avoiding them.
With a burst of speed, Stark leaped up high and aimed two powerful crimson fists toward the eyeballs of two other 'Fake Trees'.
~BOOM, BOOM!~
"-39272! -38128!" both of them were hit, and put on one HP.
[Enemy stunned]
And in addition to that, one was stunned, allowing Stark's clone to punch the two trees and kill them both.
"Root Entangle!" but he didn't have much more time to do anything else that roots came out of the ground beneath his clone and grabbed it, slamming it to the ground while restraining its movements.
"-5623!" the damage was insane, and of course the clone died since it only had one point of health.
Stark didn't want to summon his second clone either as there could be a risk of losing it, so he decided to face off the last two alone.
Stark stood alone against the remaining two Fake Trees, their crimson eyeballs fixed on him with malice.
He took a deep breath, then began running toward the two trees as they were both right next to one another.
But of course, even monsters had brains.
"ROOT ENTANGLE!" seeing that their branch strikes were all avoided by Stark, they decided to ambush him by summoning hundreds of roots from the ground, making it almost impossible for Stark to avoid them all.
That is… if he didn't have 'THAT' skill.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," at the perfect timing, he rolled forward and passed right through the attack using his invincibility frames.
And so he found himself right in front of the monsters, a wide grin on his face as he knew that it was over.
"CHECKMATE," he laughed as he activated [Aura Smash] and sent the two fists at each of the trees.
"-42718! -43772!" and then he followed through with two punches while they were recovering from that.
~CRACK, CRUNCH!~
The two Fake Trees crumbled to the ground, defeated by Stark's strategic prowess and powerful attacks.
[HP:7650/7650]
Stark observed that with each level he completed, his HP would increase significantly more than it did in the previous level, which was why he was already at 7650 while being only level 19.
[You have slain one "Fake Tree lv38", gained 32619EXP!]
[You have slain one "Fake Tree lv38", gained 31993EXP!]
[You have slain one "Fake Tree lv38", gained 32182EXP!]
…
He had gotten over 150000 experience points in this singular battle, and although he had almost died many times, it was still worth it to him.
And so he kept going inside the 'Valley's Forest', fighting his way through the monsters he would encounter.
…
[You have slain one "Forest Spirit lv37", gained 30736EXP!]
[You have slain one "Grass Wolf lv39", gained 34012EXP!]
[You have slain one "Fire Bear lv36", gained 29824EXP!]
…
And so soon enough, he reached level 20.
[Your level has increased to level 20, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Level 20 Reached: please pick a skill card]
Three red cards appeared in front of him just like the previous times, and Stark took the one in the middle since he didn't really have the time to decide in this dangerous environment.
He took the card and flipped it, and there he saw the drawing of a crimson spear.
'…?' he immediately read the name of the skill.

chapters.title: Chapter 59 - 59: The Fire Fox
chapters.content:
[Skill: Crimson Spears]
[Type: Rare]
[Level: 1]
[Description: A skill that allows the user to summon three powerful crimson spears with incredible piercing capabilities. The spears can be thrown at enemies from a distance, impaling them with devastating force, 30 seconds cooldown between each spear (meaning 1m30 to recover them all)]
…
'Interesting…' Stark was satisfied, after all it was always good to get more skills that were long-ranged since he always needed to be in contact with an enemy to deal damage normally.
[Experience: 12617/340000]
Stark gathered his newfound strength and continued his journey through the treacherous Valley's Forest.
The path ahead was shrouded in darkness, with twisted trees looming overhead like silent sentinels.
It had been thirty minutes since he had entered the Valley's Forest, and now most people that were inside the Secret Rift were going through the 'Mountain's Challenge' area, with only a few classifiers inside the forest.
The air grew colder as Stark ventured deeper into the heart of the Valley's Forest.
And suddenly…
He felt a chill run down his spine, and sensing danger, he stepped back.
~BOOM~
A fireball came crashing in the place he had been just moments ago.
But it wasn't a human that sent this spell, instead…
"ROOOAR~" a giant fox, at least four meters in size,appeared before him, its eyes gleaming with a fierce intelligence.
The creature's fur blazed a vibrant orange, flickering with flames as it slowly inched closer to Stark. Its deep growls echoed through the air, its eyes locked onto him as if he were its next meal.
The heat radiating from the fiery fur was intense, and Stark could feel his skin prickle with sweat.
Every step it took sent sparks flying, illuminating its sharp claws and menacing teeth. This was no ordinary animal; it was a living inferno, ready to consume anything in its path.
And of course, Stark immediately realized this couldn't be a normal monster either.
…
[Name: Fire Fox (ELITE - FOREST GUARDIAN)]
[Level: 40]
[HP: 140000]
[Strength: 1281]
[Stamina: 2351]
[Speed: 1928]
[Defense: 636]
[Skills: Blazing Inferno, Claw Swipe, Flame Burst, Heatwave, Fireball, Fire Shield, Call of the Forest…]
…
[Note: coming in contact with its fire fur will cause the 'burn' effect]
'Great…' Stark groaned, he was essentially fighting an enemy that countered his fighting style perfectly, meaning he would need to focus on using [Aura Smash] and [Crimson Spears] if he ever hoped to have a chance of winning this.
"CLAW SWIPE," the fox didn't waste time and immediately jumped toward Stark with its claws poised to strike.
Stark managed to dodge to the side just in time, feeling the rush of heat as the Fire Fox's claws sliced through the air beside him.
Thinking quickly, Stark decided to summon his Crimson Spears to test them out.
And suddenly, his aura started pouring out in the air behind him, and three crismon spears appeared out of thin air, each gleaming with an otherworldly light.
He could control them using his mere thoughts, making it much easier to use.
Without hesitation and while the Fox was recovering from the sudden attack, Stark launched the three spears towards the Fire Fox.
The spears flew through the air, leaving trails of crimson energy in their wake as they closed in on their target.
The Fire Fox, caught off guard by the sudden attack, attempted to dodge the incoming assault, but one of the spears found its mark, impaling the creature's hind leg with devastating force.
"-19261!"
A pained howl echoed through the forest as the Fire Fox stumbled, its movements momentarily slowed by the wound.
"AURA SMASH!" seizing the opportunity, Stark unleashed his skill and sent two crimson fists toward the slowed fox.
"-26716! -28172!" the damage was insane, and in addition to that…
[Enemy stunned]
Stark couldn't approach the fox since going hand to hand with it would cause him to receive an immense amount of damage and the [Burn] effect, but he stayed focused.
"Blazing Inferno!" but even though the fox was supposed to be stunned, it still somehow was able to slightly move and use a skill.
The Fire Fox unleashed a tornado of flames toward Stark, who was taken aback by the sudden attack.
