All the trees around them were now burning, and he couldn't help but think that this forest would be in flames before their battle ended, who even had the idea to put a fire monster in a flammable environment?
Stark couldn't dodge the toranod since it was too big and too close to him, so he decided to focus…
He closed his eyes while sensing the heat of the attack come closer and closer…
And when it was millimeters away from him, he opened his eyes and used [Invincible Dodge] to roll forward, basically passing right through thr tornado without receiving damage.
"…?" even the fox was confused, but it quickly jumped back on its feet as the stun effect had ended.
"Aura Smash!" Stark sent two crimson fists toward it again, but the fox jumped in the air and dodged them both.
"FIREBALL! FLAME BURST!" it activated both these skills, the first to summon many fire balls to send toward Stark, and the second to enhance these attacks to make them stronger and faster.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
And suddenly, the Fire Fox began sending dozens of fire balls from its mouth.
'SHIT!' Stark summoned his [Crimson Spears] beside him and began running to avoid the balls of fire, each of them crashing against a nearby tree and making it collapse in flames.
The forest around them was rapidly turning into a blazing inferno, the heat becoming almost unbearable as the Fire Fox relentlessly pursued Stark with its fiery attacks.
~BOOM, BOOM~
The fire rate of the fire balls wasn't stopping, forcing Stark ot keep moving.
~FWISH~
He sent one of his spears toward the fox, but it just avoided it.
He knew he couldn't keep this up forever, so he decided to do something crazy: attack the fox up front, after all…
He looked down to his right hand, where the two rings he had were, and noticed that he had [The Purgatory Shadows] with him.
'OK, LET'S END THIS FIGHT,' he suddenly dashed toward the fox.
"CLONE FRENZY!" he summoned one of his clones to aid him, and both of them were now only a few meters away from the guardian, who was still sending attacks at them both.
Both him and the clone jumped in the air, looking down at the fox who was seemingly confused as to why Stark changed his approach.
And then, the original one dived at the Fire Fox, actually ready to fight it from close range.
"Claw Swipe!" but the guardian wouldn't sit there and take it, so of course it raised its claws, ready to cut Stark in half.
And so… the two powerful beings clashed.

chapters.title: Chapter 60 - 60: The Three Forest Guardians
chapters.content:
"Claw Swipe!" the fox aimed for Stark as he dived toward it, slashing its claws at the boy.
But…
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" while still in mid-air, Stark did a roll and passed right through the attack, unharmed thanks to the invincibility frames.
"AURA SMASH!" the clone that was also jumping sent two crimson fists toward the fox, who was unable to dodge because it was too focused on attacking Stark.
"-13252! -12726!"
[Enemy stunned!]
"HAHA," With a maniacal laugh, he brought his hands together and slammed them down on the fox's head, the flames from the fox's back licking at his fingers.
"-24626!" the attack was deadly, but Stark also received some damage…
Or did he now?
[The Purgatory Shadow took the hit in your place]
A shadow of himself appeared as the flames were about to hurt him and blocked them, it was the perk of one of the rings he was wearing, and it was extremely useful.
In addition to that, he used the fox's back as launching pad and jumped back in the air.
"AURA SMASH, CRIMSON SPEARS" he sent two crimson fists and three spears at the already stunned wolf, ready to end the fight.
~BOOM, BOOM, SLASH~
But…
"FIRE SHIELD," the fox used its fire and aura to create an orange sphere that stopped all the attacks from hitting it.
[Fire Fox (GUARDIAN) HP: 15247/140000]
It was extremely injured, and Stark backed away along with his clone once he noticed that it was getting up.
'…' he was ready to fight it up close, now that its HP were reduced so much, he could even go as far as send his clone to finish it off even though it would disappear.
But honestly, he had wished he did that.
"CALL OF THE FOREST!" the Fire Fox suddenly began roaring with fierce urgency several times, over and over, making the leaves of the trees that were still fairly intact tremble.
'…?' Stark was taken aback, his confusion quickly turning into unease.
The injured fox was on the brink of death, what could it possibly do to save itself?
And then, as if in response to his thoughts, a feeling stirred within him. It was a deep instinct, almost primal in nature, urging him to move and dodge 'it'.
Dodge what? He didn't know, but in his mind, a message appeared.
[Above you]
His pupils burning with aura, he dived forward at the last second.
~BOOM~
Something came crashing at the spot he was at before.
"-27182!" the clone had been hit and died, the aura that formed it seeping back into his body.
"FUCKING HELL!" he shouted, then positioned himself.
As the smoke from the sudden attack cleared, he could finally make out the figure in front of him: a towering green gorilla with vines sprouting from its back.
The creature's powerful arms slammed into the ground, leaving behind a massive crater.
…
[Name: Vine Gorilla (ELITE - FOREST GUARDIAN)]
[Level: 40]
[HP: 120000]
[Strength: 2182]
[Stamina: 627]
[Speed: 736]
[Defense: 1595]
[Skills: Vine Whip, Vine Grapple, Earthquake, Leap Strike, Earth Force, Muscle Enforcement, Vine Shield…]
…
"TWO OF THEM?" Stark didn't like that, but he still had a neutral expression on his face, he hadn't expected the 'Call of the Forest' skill to be used to summon another one of the guardians.
That panel when he appeared in this area had informed him there were three of them, and he honestly didn't want to find out what would happen if all three came to him.
"VINE WHIP," dozens of the vines that came from the Gorilla's back suddenly rushed toward Stark, and he swiftly avoided them all.
"AURA SMASH!" he answered with sending a crimson fist toward the Gorilla, and another at the Fire Fox.
"-12372!" it hit the gorilla since its speed was low, but the guardian didn't even look bothered by his attack.
"FIREBALLS!" the Fire Fox obviously didn't stay put and dodged the crimson fist all the while beginning to send another barrage of fire balls at him.
'Fucking hell…' Stark began running in the opposite direction.
"VINE GRAPPLE," vines came hurtling from the ground around Stark, catching his leg as he didn't expect it.
"SHIT," he saw a fire ball coming, and with the right timing used [Invincible Dodge] to save himself before cutting off the vines with his aura-infused palm.
"CRIMSON SPEARS," Stark knew that the fox would just avoid them all, but he summoned back his spears and threw at the gorilla, who didn't even bother avoiding them either.
"Muscle Reinforcement," The gorilla flexed its muscles and its chest began shining.
~PAF, PAF, PAF~
The spears had indeed reached their target, but…
"-0! -0! -0!"
They just bounced off the gorilla's chest like they were made out of plastic.
The guardian smirked at Stark afterward, taunting him.
'I'll sell your fur at the market when i'm done with you…' Stark groaned, but he was too preoccupied with avoiding the vines and fireballs that came from all directions to say it out loud.
'This isn't working…' he thought, he knew he couldn't hit the fox this way since it would avoid all his attacks, and the gorilla would tank everything.
He also didn't want to use another clone or [Double Assault] yet since they could be needed later.
So he did the next best thing: run.
But of course, the point of running wasn't to cowardly escape the fight, in contrary: he wanted to outsmart the two monsters while they were chasing him, and if they didn't, then who cares.
Stark sprinted through the forest, dodging the vines and the constant barrage of fireballs. He kept glancing behind him, making sure he could see both the gorilla and the Fox following him.
He could hear the gorilla's heavy footsteps behind him as it tried its hardest to keep up with Stark's and the Fox's incredible speed.
The fox easily catched up to Stark several times and tried to slash him with its claws, but of course, the boy would just avoid the attacks and force the Fire Fox to back away.
And after a few minutes of that, where none of his [Aura Smash] fists dealt any damage, and where his [Crimson Spears] were all avoided or blocked, he heard something in the distance: the sound of people fighting.
"BINGO!" if they were a higher level than he was, then they could definitely assist him in defeating these monsters.
And so he rushed toward the sounds.
But once he got close enough… the noises suddenly stopped.
"GRRAAAAWWWRRR~" and a massive roar echoed from the location of the sounds.
"What the hell?" Stark kept going, and soon enough he reached the place he had heard the noise from.
And that's when he saw it: the bodies of four classifiers were on the ground, all mutilated or decapitated.
The responsible was the creature that roared: a giant blue bear that was standing up on its two legs, a fierce blue aura in its eyes.
[Water Bear lv40 (ELITE - FOREST GUARDIAN)]
Right behind Stark were the Fire Fox and Vine Gorilla, and in front of him was the Water Bear.
He was surrounded by the three guardians, and the people he believed could help him were already dead.
'Life is terrible,' he sighed.

chapters.title: Chapter 61 - 61: One Down, Two to Go
chapters.content:
The four classifiers that were on the ground, all dead upon meeting with one of the forest guardians, the Water Bear, were the ones that had entered the rift shortly after Stark and talked about looting him if they came close.
He couldn't say they didn't deserve such a fate for trying to kill and steal from others, but they were supposed to help him get out of this situation.
And now…
"GRAWWWR!" the bear roared again, now getting on its four feets, slowly approaching Stark.
"OOUUOUUUHHH!" the gorilla was hitting its chest repeatedly.
"…" and the fox just walked around Stark, the fire on its back still powerful.
He was surrounded by the three most powerful beings of this forest, ones even supposed 'powerful' groups had died to.
"No more running, you little shits," he wouldn't get any help, and he wouldn't be able to out run the fox, so there was no use in running again.
He directed his gaze to the Water Bear to check out its status window using [Perception].
…
[Name: Water Bear (ELITE - FOREST GUARDIAN)]
[Level: 40]
[HP: 100000]
[Strength: 1261]
[Stamina: 371]
[Speed: 1182]
[Defense: 1892]
[Skills: Water Cannon, Nimble Steps, Deep Freeze, Aqua Strike, Aqua Shield, Intimidating Roar, Claw Strike…]
…
"FUCK ME…" Stark wasn't in a good spot. Three high-level guardians were on their way to deal with him, and he was completely outmatched.
He had no choice but to react and adapt to the situation at hand. Taking a deep breath, he braced himself for the upcoming fight.
"AURA SMASH!" he shouted, aiming his fist at the Water Bear.
"Aqua Shield!" a wall appeared before the crimson fist and stopped it before it could reach the bear.
':I' Stark looked at it with the blankest of expressions.
From all three directions now, the guardians were slowly but surely approaching him.
"Fireballs!" the fox began powering up his attacks.
"Water Cannon,' a blue sphere appeared above the bear's head, its eyes still burning with that same watery aura.
"Vipe Whip," dozens of the vines came from the gorilla's back and hurtled toward Stark.
~FWISH, BAM, BOOM~
The water jett from the canon came rushing toward him, several fire balls were launched in his direction, and all the vines hurtled to attack.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" he counted the seconds perfectly and avoided all the attacks using perfect timing.
Then without wasting time…
"CRIMSON SPEAR," he began running toward the fox while summoning his spears and launching them at the other two guardians.
The gorilla just took two of them by himself using his durable chest, but the bear…
"-7269!" the spear actually hit him, but it wasn't enough to do massive damage because of his high defense.
[Fire Fox (GUARDIAN) HP: 15247/140000]
[Vine Gorilla (GUARDIAN) HP: 107628/120000]
[Water Bear (GUARDIAN) HP: 92731/100000]
The point of those spears wasn't to hurt the other two guardians, but to stale for him.
After all, Stark noticed that the Fire Fox was the one with the least amount of HP, and one or two attacks from him would be enough to kill it: if he wanted to increase his odds of survival, he would need to get rid of at least one of them, and the fox was the best option.
Stark moved left to right to avoid both the fireballs, the water jet that was following him, and the several vines.
But he was getting closer.
"-1726!" a vine slashed his leg, but he didn't falter, his speed not decreasing at all.
"-1891!" the water jet hit him for a split second in his back, and it was enough to cause a third of life, but still, Stark didn't stop.
"I GOT YOU!" he jumped in the air above the fox, who was still launching fire balls and all sorts of attacks at him.
"Claw Swipe, Flame Burst, FIRE SHIELD!" feeling its impending doom, the fox tried everything in its powers to stop the boy.
But Stark focused his aura around his body and passed right through the wall of flames.
"-726!" it didn't hurt him much, but now… he got it.
~SLAM~
"-17261!" he punched the fox so hard that it was sent flying against a nearby tree, crumbling to the ground as its HP were reduced to 0.
[Touched 'Fire Fox', dealing 'Burn' effect for 10 seconds]
"-200! -200!…" he received 2000 damage from the attack, but had gotten rid of one of the guardians, so it was completely worth it.
[Dealt massive damage to 'Fire Gox (GUARDIAN)', regaining 682HP!]
But that wasn't all…
[You have slain "Fire Fox lv40 (FOREST GUARDIAN)", gained 245000EXP!]
This wasn't enough to make him level up, but it was good to know he had actually gotten rid of it.
And now… he had to deal with the other two.
"ROOOOAARRR~"
"OUHOUHOUUUH~"
The Vine Gorilla and Water Bear were looking at Stark with menacing eyes and striking menacing poses.
They had just seen the human defeat one of their own, and they were ready to kill him to avenge their companion.
But Stark was having none of that, he was tired of this shit already.
"You had it your way until now, but from now," Stark maniacally smiled, his entire body burning with crimson aura, "We'll play with my rules."
He frankly didn't know if they could understand him, but by their angry expressions, it was safe to say they could.
"CLONE FRENZY," Stark lifted his arm and the second clone he had appeared beside him.
Then he pointed at the Water Bear, "You take care of him using 'THAT', i'll take the gorilla."
The clone nodded, its eyes also burning with that same aura, a visible smirk on its face.
He was now ready to fight them off, it was all or nothing.
And he sure as hell wasn't planning to lose.
Meanwhile, unbeknownst to him, a group of seven people were watching him from afar: they were the 'Wyver's Wrath' group, an up and rising one that have made big news because of their conquests lately.
And each of their members were now looking at the battle from afar.
"It's over," one of them said, recognizing that there was no chance Stark could win after being surrounded by three elite monsters (this was before he killed the Fox).
"…" the others nodded in approval.
They had been watching the four other classifiers to analyze their powers and strength, but they had all been wiped out, and right as they were about to leave, Stark appeared, followed by two guardians.
Now all they needed to do was observe that boy, wait for him to be killed (they had no intentions to help), then finish off those guardians.
"Hm~" but the most surprising thing of all about this group was…
That Stark's brother, the one he had first met in this world, was the leader.
"…" and for some reason, he didn't know why, even though that boy was wearing a mask, he felt strangely familiar, "Must be my imagination, let's focus!"

chapters.title: Chapter 62 - 62: Defeating the Forest Guardians
chapters.content:
"LET'S DO THIS," Stark and his clone were now both facing the two remaining guardians, they were monsters far stronger than they were, and the clone had only one HP, but there was no other solution now.
"EARTH FORCE," the green gorilla hit the ground beneath it with incredible force, resulting in a giant chunk of terrain being flung in the air right in front of it.
Then it grabbed it and launched it toward Stark.
"HAHA~" Stark wasn't afraid and dashed toward the giant chunk of rock, taking it head-on as his clone faced the bear.
"CRIMSON FIST," he sent a crimson fist at the chunk, destroying it and allowing him to close the distance between him and the gorilla.
But of course, Stark didn't go head on with an enemy more powerful, durable and stronger than he was…
He decided to finally use his legendary skill.
"DOUBLE ASSAULT!"
[Description: Upon activating this skill, all of your stats double in numbers, making you a beast in the battlefield, it only lasts ten seconds, but it should be enough to make both people and monsters fear you, cooldown is 20 minutes.]
As Stark activated Double Assault, he felt an incredible surge of power coursing through his veins. His strength, speed, agility, and aura were all doubled, making him a fearsome force to be reckoned with.
The Vine Gorilla and Water Bear immediately took notice of the sudden change in Stark's abilities, but they didn't back down.
[10 seconds left for 'Double Assault']
His time was counted, and so Stark decided he would make the best of it.
He leaped towards the Vine Gorilla, his crimson fists glowing with immense power. The gorilla tried to counter with its trademark "Vine Whip" move, but it was too slow to react to Stark's lightning speed.
~PUNCH~
Stark punched the gorilla's chest, and immediately the beast was sent flying in the opposite direction.
"-27361!" the damage was phenomenal, taking one fourth of the guardians' remaining HP in this single hit.
And in addition to that… Stark could still keep going.
[8 seconds left for 'Double Assault']
He followed the gorilla while it was still in midair and smashed its body to the ground.
"-26182!"
"V-VINE SHIELD!" it tried to summon its wall of vines, but all of them were easily cut by Stark.
"VINE GRAPPLE," it tried to catch Stark, but there was no use since a single step from his allowed him to avoid the attack.
"OOOUUHOUUUHH~" the gorilla tried to hit Stark, but the boy just blocked the punch with his palm.
"Nuh uh~" he did a no sign with his fingers after blocking the attack, and then punched the gorilla in the face.
"-31627!"
[3 seconds left for 'Double Assault']
The Gorilla using its final willpower and entire force got up and flexed its muscles, trying to stop Stark on his assault as it knew it couldn't defend against such a… monster.
"MUSCLE REINFORCEMENT," it used the attack that had allowed it to block both crimson fists and spears.
But…
~PUNCH~
"-0!"
~PUNCH~
"-0!"
The gorilla grinned as it saw that Stark was dealing 0 damage to it.
But…
~PUNCH, PUNCH, PUNCH…~
"-0! -0! -0!"
He became faster, and in less than a second, his punches became so fast that they weren't even visible to the naked eyes, each one was like a blur.
During those two seconds he had left, he had punched the gorilla 34 times.
"-0!"
"-736!"
"-1829!"
"-7261!"
"-17174!"
Gradually, the damage became higher since the gorilla couldn't tank it all.
And soon enough…
[Vine Gorilla (GUARDIAN) HP: 0/120000]
It fell to the ground while holding its chest, visible marks of crimson aura still in the place Stark had hit.
[10 seconds have passed, 'Double Assault' expired]
"…" he looked down at the gorilla before smiling, "Weak."
And then he diverted his gaze to the Water Bear, who also seemed to have a hard time.
The reason was obvious: the clone was also using 'Double Assault'.
As crazy as it sounds, not only can clones copy skills, inflict status effects, cause high damage, but they can also use 'Invincible Dodge' just like Stark to avoid damage, but also… they can use the legendary skill 'Double Assault'.
When the original Stark went to fight the Vine Gorilla, the clone in opposition rushed to face the Water Bear.
"WATER STRIKE," the bear tried to slash Stark's clone when it was approaching, but it was no use since it easily avoided it, and it hadn't even activated 'Double Assault' yet.
"AURA SMASH, CRIMSON SPEARS," the clone jumped in the air and sent all these attacks toward the bear, who was too slow to avoid them all.
"-4267! -4825! -3351! -5794! -4972!"
It dealt decent damage even though it had reduced aura and the bear's defense was extremely high.
And in addition to that…
[Enemy stunned]
The bear was stunned from one of the crimson fists, resulting in stopping all of its attacks, whether it was the many claw strikes it was attempting to use to kill the clone, or even the 'Water Cannon' that was constantly following it.
"DOUBLE ASSAULT!" the clone also activated the skill upon noticing that the bear was down, somehow it was able to think for itself as it was thinking just like Stark and what he would do in such a situation.
Its eyes glowed red with the newly doubled power surge, and the guardian could do nothing but watch as the clone suddenly kicked it in the jaw.
"-7261!"
And what followed afterward was a deadly combo of attacks…
"-8372! -6744! -7261!"
…
By the end of the ten seconds, the clone had dealt 88726 points of damage to the bear, placing it on its final 5k health points.
Stark had already finished off the gorilla by then, and was just watching how his clone was doing, he was ready to intervene, but honestly, he wanted to see how far it would go.
'Of course, I don't expect it to win,' he shrugged, but was immediately proven wrong as even without the increased speed, the clone managed to land three more good punches on the bear before the 'Water Cannon' finally hit it.
"-3261!" the clone disappeared as it was hit, but it had already done its job.
[Water Bear (GUARDIAN) HP: 0/100000]
The Water Bear let out a final cry before falling on its stomach.
"…" Stark looked at the surrounding chaos, then back at the three guardians he had defeated (or just two because a clone had pretty much taken one by itself).
"I WON!" he shouted as hard as he could, although he was bleeding from his back and leg because of the attacks, and there were traces of fire because of the burning.
Meanwhile, back to the 'Wyvern's Wrath' group that had been observing Stark.
Well… saying they were astonished would be an understatement.
"ISN'T THAT THE LEVEL 16 GUY, HOW?"
"No idea... that boy is insane... I don't think even I would have done something so reckless..."
"But his aura was insane! Did he just take on three guardians at the same time?!"
Murmurs spread around, and Stark's brother, the leader of the group, composed himself, "Probably one of those prodigies, I wonder what his class is…" he scratched his chin.
"Well… we did what we needed to do, let's keep going," he told his members, and they all nodded, what they had just witnessed was insane, but they had more serious things to take care of as the rift was far from completed.

chapters.title: Chapter 63 - 63: Maxxing Out the Domination Skill
chapters.content:
[You have slain "Vine Gorilla lv40 (FOREST GUARDIAN)", gained 245000EXP!]
[You have slain "Water Bear lv40 (FOREST GUARDIAN)", gained 245000EXP!]
[Dealt massive damage to 'Vine Goilla (GUARDIAN)', regaining 662HP!]
[Dealt massive damage to 'Water Bear (GUARDIAN)', regaining 721HP!]
And of course, getting this much experience could only mean one thing…
[Your level has increased to level 21, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
…
[Your level has increased to level 22, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Experience: 27617/415000]
'Hell yeah!' Stark fell to the ground on his butt trying to catch his breath after fighting, after all, even summoning the clone and having it use skills took up aura, meaning that it was reducing his stamina regardless.
'Status Window…' he thought while looking at the sky, and there the panel appeared.
…
[Level:] 22
[Health:] 3622/8500
[Bloodline:] Human
[Class:] Domination
[Talent:] Chosen one
[Attributes:] Strength 876; Speed 989; Mind/Soul 1167; Stamina 764; Defense 798
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv8; Focus lv5; Aura Smash lv6; Clone Frenzy lv5; Invincible Dodge lv2; Double Assault lv1…
…
[Skill Points: 3 Available]
Stark sighed, taking a moment to assess his current skills and attributes.
But that's when he noticed it.
'Wait a minute… Domination is at level 8… and I have three skill points…' it didn't take long for him to realize what this meant.
[You have upgraded 'Domination' to level 9!]
'…'
[You have upgraded 'Domination' to level 10!]
[The skill 'Domination' has been MAXXED OUT!]
In that moment, Stark felt a surge of power course through his veins. The Domination skill had reached its highest current possible level, and the aura he emanated was now stronger than ever before.
…
[Skill: Domination lv10 (MAX)]
[Description: Your class resonates with you, the power you have acquired through all your fights vibrates through your body, and your aura is now stronger than ever before, you are now allowed to place a shield around your body that blocks 5K points of damage]
[Activating your aura in front of an enemy or person has a chance to cause the 'fear' status effect if they are weaker than you are or easily intimidated]
[All your skills and stats have evolved (even though the level has no changed, they are all stronger)]
…
"This is... incredible," Stark muttered to himself, still in disbelief. The learning curve was becoming more and more steep, but he was determined to overcome any obstacle in his path.
And suddenly…
~BEEP, BEEP, BEEP~
His communication badge was beeping again, meaning that there was yet another call from Vex or the other members of the 'Crimson Moon Squad'.
He was still sitting on the ground as he answered the call by clicking on the badge.
"WHAT THE FUCK DID YOU DO?" He heard Lana's voice shouting at him.
"What do you mean? I didn't do anything-" Stark, confused, tried to defend himself.
But…
"Stark… I… everyone saw it."
"Saw what?"
"YOUR FIGHT!"
"…" Stark tilted his head, how was that possible, there couldn't be that many people around him now, could there be?
But of course, it was just that Stark didn't understand how this world worked.
"Secret Rifts are different from normal ones, we don't know how or why, but to make it easier to show your feats to the world, well… every time someone does something that is deemed incredible by the rift, it is shown to everyone…" Lana sighed, explaining to Stark about things he didn't know about.
***
Everywhere in the rift, the moment Stark defeated the three forest guardians.
A panel appeared in front of everyone.
[The forest guardians (Lv40 ELITE Fire Fox, Vine Gorilla and Water Bear) have been defeated by REDACTED!]
[Unlocking a replay for credit purposes!]
And thus, everyone inside the rift had seen the fight from its start to finish, whether it was Stark starting off against the Fire Fox, the guardian calling another one as reinforcement, Stark running off to the noise he heard.
Or… most impressive of all: Stark destroying the guardians with his sheer hands and only a few attacks.
The combo against the Vine Gorilla left many speechless as they couldn't understand how he had gone from being outmatched in every aspect to suddenly gain the ability to do that.
And how in the fuck did a clone defeat an elite guardian by itself?
Clones are usually used for bait, so seeing one that could actually deal decent damage was fascinating to most.
In the end, everyone had watched Stark's fight, but none of them (except those close to him) really knew who he was because of the Bunny Mask and its perk.
"Did he defeat an elite in four punches?"
"Did you see how fast he was hitting that gorilla guardian? I couldn't even see his attacks…"
"And what about the bear, it got killed by a mere clone?!"
These whispers of amazement spread like wildfire through the rift, the sheer awe in their voices as Stark's incredible feat became the talk of it.
And it wouldn't be long before all their achievements were uploaded to the internet, and for the entire world to see.
Getting popular in this world was extremely easy as long as you had the beauty or strength to do so.
"Haha~ I knew this kid was special," Vex grinned while slaying a level 45 monster with a single whip of his wielder heart.
"Hm…" Thorns was perplexed, he was supposed to be the muscles of the group, and yet somehow, Stark's damage was fairly close to what he could achieve without skills…
"…" Lana on the other hand had immediately called Stark to inform him of whatever was happening, since knowing about him, she was sure he had no idea.
And she was right, as Stark was left speechless from the news.
"Oh well… it doesn't really matter," the boy grinned, "I'll still conquer that rift by myself."
And so he ended the call.
He may not be as strong as most people on this rift, but he had the potential and skill to defeat most of them.
The Domination class truly was the strongest one…
"3 more levels and I unlock a new one though," he got up from the ground after resting for ten minutes
He was level 22, and from what he remembered, reaching level 25 meant that he would be allowed to spin the 'Class Wheel' again.
The entire rift was trying to figure out who this mysterious boy was, after all he had already caused a commotion before they even entered it since he attracted the attention of Jack, the leader of another powerful faction.
But Stark didn't care, and so he went deeper inside the Valley's Forest with a calm expression, wanting to move on to the next area and level up quick.

chapters.title: Chapter 64 - 64: The Death Canyon
chapters.content:
[Many people have reached the level 45 area!]
Such a message appeared before Stark while he was walking through the Valley's Forest and killing monsters left and right in the hope of leveling up.
But honestly, he wasn't surprised, after all he had spent a good fifteen minutes fighting the guardians, and most of the classifiers were already inside the forest by now.
'Gotta go faster if I wanna fight the boss myself…' he mumbled, but knew deep down he couldn't afford to waste energy.
"-28172!" his aura had indeed gotten stronger, and he could now two-shot most enemies, and even one-shot those that have visible weaknesses like the 'Fake Trees'.
[You have slain "Forest Spirit lv39", gained 33736EXP!]
[You have slain "Rock Python lv40", gained 35128EXP!]
[You have slain one "Fake Tree lv38", gained 30736EXP!]
…
[Experience: 281627/415000]
Stark wondered if the 'Crimson Moon Squad' had already gone ahead and passed the forest, after all Vex and the members were much stronger than he was, so it wouldn't be surprising.
He didn't want (and didn't know how) to call them anyway.
And soon enough, he reached the end of the 'Valley's Forest'.
Little by little, the trees became less and less apparent, until eventually, he left the forest and found himself at the entrance of the next area.
Right in front of him, not even 5KM away, was the giant mountain with the staircase leading to the monument at the top: it was the final area of the rift.
But what stopped him (and many others) from passing was… a giant canyon, cutting the area into two.
'…' Stark approached the canyon and looked down, noticing that at the very end of it was not only spikes that would kill anybody that touched them, but also hundreds of monsters, their eyes looking up at the humans.
[You have entered Level 45 area: The Death Canyon]
Of course, being in such a large space with monsters roaming, and no real visible way to pass it, meant that Stark could see dozens of people fighting around him.
'Why aren't they using their powers to pass… I mean… aren't many able to fly?' he pondered, after all the canyon that seperated this side from the other only looked to be 100 meters in size.
It didn't take long for a panel to appear and explain everything.
[Abilities that allow you to fly or cheat your way to the other side aren't allowed]
[To pass the Death Canyon, you have to either find the item drop "TP Pearl" from a monster (extremely low chance to appear), or… wait twelve hours since it was first discovered]
The latter was obviously the safest solution there was, but when inside a Secret Rift, the true winner would be the one to accomplish the greatest feats and acquire the most material, so waiting around for all the others to arrive was a bad idea.
Basically… those who found that 'TP PEARL' would get a massive advantage.
'Huh…' Stark scratched his chin, he also wanted to be the first to defeat the boss, so this did put a strain on his quest…
Although… he had the [Chosen One] talent, one of its perks being the fact many events, both good and bad will appear, so maybe… with enough luck…
~FWISH~
But something came interrupting his thoughts as he suddenly felt a presence behind him, and moved to the site to avoid the attack.
~BOOM!~
A giant hammer hit the place he was previously in.
'Wowow~ almost forgot I wasn't alone," he grinned and looked up to see a giant minotaur, with a steel hammer in its brown muscular hands.
It wasn't surprising, after all, almost everyone around the canyon was currently fighting a monster.
Another one of the bad things about waiting in this area was that you would need to constantly fight for the next 12 hours, and it was bound to tire out most people, forcing them to take a rest and waste precious time again.
"MINO SMASH!" the minotaur yet again swung its hammer at Stark, forcing him to dodge again by crouching.
…
[Name: Canyon Minotaur (STRONG)]
[Level: 46]
[HP: 80000]
[Strength: 1121]
[Stamina: 426]
[Speed: 293]
[Defense: 1214]
[Skills: Mino Smash, Enraged Charge, Berserk State, Horn Frenzy, Ground Pound…]
…
"ENRAGED CHARGE," the beast didn't waste time and dashed at Stark with its… very low speed.
It was at least 7 meters tall, but it ran very slowly as it took it three massive steps (that shook the earth) to reach Stark and swing its hammer at him.
~FWISH~
Stark knew better than to ignore a charging minotaur and moved every time to avoid the attack.
Enraged charge seemed to allow the minotaur to strike at Stark several times.
But honestly… what was the point of aimlessly trying to hit an opponent faster than you?
"…" Stark jumped in the air after the minotaur got angry and used both its hand to smash the hammer to the ground, creating a giant crater.
"AURA SMASH!" he spinned in the air and sent a crimson fist of aura toward the minotaur.
In response, the minotaur tried to use its hammer to hit the fist that was flying toward it.
But of course… it didn't work.
~BOOM~
"-18271!" almost a fourth of its life was consumed, and it could honestly thank its high defense and HP pool, else it would be just a fodder monster.
'That guy is slow, and dumb, we got a combo,' Stark dropped to the ground and summoned [Crimson Spears] to make his three spears appear behind him.
The minotaur seemed stunned for a moment (not the status effect), not expecting such a sudden change in Stark's strategy. Its slow reflexes made it hard for it to react in time.
"GROUND POUND!" it jumped in the air, extremely high, and then used its strong legs to slam the ground, creating tremors and sending a shockwave in all directions.
Despite its slow speed, it was a powerful blow that could knock down even the fastest of opponents if they weren't careful.
After all… the point of this attack wasn't to cause damage, but if the shockwave even scratched your little pinky, then you would 100% receive the 'stun' status effect, essentially guaranteeing your death.
But in response, Stark just threw his three spears at the minotaur, who clenched its chest and crossed its arms, ready for impact.
~FWISH, FWISH, FWISH~
The three spears hit the minotaur respectively, in the leg, the torso and… the head.
"-7261! -3625! -13152!" the one in the head did massive damage.
At that very moment, Stark understood just how powerful it was to be fast, and that having the highest strength in the world wouldn't mean anything if you were too slow.
"Invincible Dodge!" not wanting to risk it, he rolled as soon as the shockwave was centimeters away from him, essentially avoiding it.
"ROOOOARRR~" the minotaur screamed, a shout that passed through the entire canyon, everyone inside of it able to hear it and turning their heads to see what was happening.
"BERSERK STATE!" it activated its most powerful skill, its eyes flashing with a crismson berserk aura, readying its hammer to strike down the human.
"Alright buddy," Stark's eyes also glew with that same crimson aura, "Come at me, big boy!"

chapters.title: Chapter 65 - 65: The Berserk Minotaur
chapters.content:
The clash between the powerful Canyon Minotaur and Stark was unlike any other battle anyone had witnessed in the Death Canyon (at least for now).
He didn't know why, but somehow, the strongest monster of them all had approached Stark, maybe it was because of his aura, or maybe since he had the [Chosen One] talent?
The mighty creature, aided by its high defense and health pool, tried its best to overpower Stark with its superior strength and brute force.
~BOOM~
It smashed the ground with its hammer, and when Stark avoided it, it would try to use its body to slam him to turn him into a pancake.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," the first time, Stark was taken aback, forcing him to roll away using his invincibility frames and avoid the slam that would surely kill him.
At this point, most of the people surrounding the 'Death Canyon' were watching Stark's fight as it was the most interesting one, all others were too one-sided or just plain up boring, and it seemed like they had wiped out the monsters available already, meaning they would need to wait for more to spawn.
Despite his impressive evasion skills, Stark was not immune to the minotaur's raw power.
Every now and then, the creature, using its increased speed from the [Berserk] state it was in, would managet to take him by surprise and almost hit him.
"AURA SMASH!" Stark dodged another hammer blow and sent a crimson fist at the monster, who received it in the head.
"-5351!" the damage was very low, it's high defense in addition to the berserk state made it immune to pain too, resulting in it not even budging with this attack.
But Stark sent another one, which the minotaur yet again didn't avoid.
It now believed that although Stark was dealing quite decent damage to it, it could overpower him and in the end win by hitting him with a single attack.
~SWING~
It shielder itself from the crimson fist using its hammer vertically, but there was no use.
"-3721!" the damage yet again was extremely low compared to Stark's usual standarts.
But what it didn't expect was…
[Enemy stunned!]
The minotaur felt a shiver go through its spine, and suddenly… it couldn't move anymore, it was like an external force was not allowing him to do anything anymore.
'…?' it looked at the boy with widened eyes, its pupils on him.
"Gotcha!" but all it could see was Stark's wide grin.
"He can stun enemies?" one of the classifirs that had already fought their monster mumbled.
The 'Stun' affect was very rare in comparison to what Stark believed: he had gotten used to it since it was the first real skill he had gotten, but it never really went through his mind just how overpowered being able to stun an enemy was.
And in addition to that, 'Aura Smash' had a 30% chance to stun the enemy, making it one hell of a powerful skill.
"Hmm~ interesting," a white-haired woman grinned as well, she was floating in the air (but of course a magical wall was stopping her from passing the death canyon that way).
"That little shit…" Jack, the one that had caused a commotion at the beginning of the rift sneered, visibly upset that the 'bunny masked' boy was attracting so much attention.
But getting so much attention from powerful classifiers from all over the world was both a good and bad thing, since now even though they didn't know his face, 'the 'bunny masked boy' was an alias they gave to Stark, meaning that he was bringing both people with good intentions, and those who on the otherhand wanted to get rid of him.
"CLONE FRENZY!" not caring about the gazes of everyone, Stark summoned one of his clones since it had been more than thirty minutes since the last use.
The crimson Stark appeared beside the original, looking at him before staring at the minotaur with a blank expression, it then nodded, understanding what it was supposed to do, and dashed at the monster.
"Clones that react to you and can actually fight…" Vex observed from afar alongside the 'Crimson Moon Squad', they had arrived shortly before Stark, and were surprised to see him go all out.
But unbeknownst to them, Stark wasn't going all out at all, it was the complete opposite, he was frankly enjoying toying with the minotaur.
"CRIMSON SPEAR," the clone sent three spears at the minotaur's right leg, the three weapons piercing it and making huge holes appear.
"-3259! -4361! -3972!"
"GAK~" the minotaur fell to its knee, its right leg completely useless now.
A monster didn't need to reach 0HP to become useless, not at all, they could lose both arm and be unable to use their weapons, or both legs, forcing them to be in place.
This was the reason why aiming for the head caused much more damage than anything else, and why decapitating a monster (even if it had 1 million HP), would result in an instant death.
[Canyon Minotaur (STRONG) HP: 17027/80000]
Stark had already caused massive damage to it before it was even stunned, so putting it at such a disadvantage and even summoning a clone to do the work was overkill.
But needless to say, Stark enjoyed this type of things, he was a full-on sadist.
"CRIMSON SPEARS," he summoned his own spears while the clone took the hammer from the minotaur's arm while it could only watch in terror.
"How is that clone even lifting such a massive weapon, it doesn't make sense…" murmurs spread, and the reason was obvious: even though it was only a clone, it was able to easily take that heavy hammer from the minotaur's strong grip and lift it away.
But the real question everyone was asking was: 'Just how strong is that guy if even the clone is that powerful…'
Oh boy… what could their reactions be if they knew Stark actually had two clones, and all of them could use 'Double Assault', a legendary skill.
"CYA, MONSTER," his eyes burning with aura, Stark sent the three sears that appeared behind him toward the minotaur's head.
The first two passed right through its eyes and skull, rendering it blind.
"-18272! -17264!"
And the last one was aimed for the throat.
"-37618!" the damage was phenomenal, the highest amount Stark had ever caused to an enemy yet.
And the reason was obvious: he had aimed for one of the minotaur's weaknesses.
Monsters also have weaknesses in this word, just like the 'Fake Trees' weakness were their eyes, many monster have their heads, throat, or heart, as their weakness.
Although most time it was difficult to reach them since… y'know… you are mid-battle and have to take many things into account.
And so just like that, Stark defeated the minotaur, the beast crumbling to the ground as its HP reached 0 and also because its neck was basically pierced.

chapters.title: Chapter 66 - 66: The Chosen One's Luck
chapters.content:
[You have slain "Canyon Minotaur lv46 (STRONG)", gained 63125EXP!]
'Haha…' Stark smiled after seeing the minotaur's lifeless body fall, it wasn't a very hard battle since he avoided all the monster's attacks, but he couldn't say it didn't come close many times since even one hit from its hammer would be enough to kill him.
Stark knew that many people (if not most) inside the 'Death Canyon' were observing his every move, both thanks to the 'highlight replay' that was seen by everybody, but also since he had basically fought the strongest monster inside the canyon (at least for now).
He didn't know what to do now, and he didn't feel like interacting with anybody while waiting for the next batch of monsters to spawn, it seemed like no one had gotten a 'TP Pearl' either.
But as if some grand entity (well… probably Rher to be honest) heard it…
[Talent: Chosen One, activated!]
'What the?' he was confused, why would it activate now, was another bad thing bound to happen soon?!
He looked down at the minotaur's body, and suddenly, he saw not one, but two shiny sparks, one was red, and the other dark blue.
'Ohoh~ the talent gave me equipment,' he grinned, actually happy that it finally was helping him out after fucking him so many times over.
He first reached out to pick the equipment with the red glow: it was a helmet, one that had two horns much like the minotaur ones, it had a brown color, its interior almost feeling like it was made of fur.
'Great, it's useless…' he groaned, but still inspected it regardless.
…
[Equipment:] The Minotaur's Helmet
[Type:] Helmet
[Class:] Warrior
[Tier:] Rare
[Required Level:] 40
[Quality:] Normal
[Attributes:] +250 Strength, +400 Defense
[Special Perk:] Allows the wearer to go into a berserk state, essentially using the 'Berserk State' skill of the Canyon Minotaur, which greatly enhances strength, defense, and stamina (+50% increase) for a minute.
…
"I don't want to sound ungrateful, but I could really do without this helmet at the moment," Stark grumbled, hefting the helmet in his hand, it was maybe good for a warrior, but to no use for him currently.
'Spatial Inventory,' he mumbled and put the equipment inside the void, before closing it shortly afterward.
Most people had stopped looking at Stark now since the fight ended, instead discussion strategies with their respective team or taking a rest, but those who were still paying attention to him had yet again been surprised: what the fuck was that void next to him, and how did he put an item inside.
People when they wanted to store an item for later would need to use an item called the 'Store Watch', its price depends on the amount of items you want to store inside, but usually it's around 10 for a normal one.
And yet… what did that guy just do? Summoning a void next to him and putting the item inside of it like it was nothing.
'An inventory skill?' they thought, unsure whether such a thing existed as it was only rumors.
Stark paid no attention to them and quickly moved on to the second item drop.
[Talent: Chosen One, activated!]
Yet again, the notification appeared.
'…?' he reached for the dark blue light, and it immediately disappeared once he touched the item, revealing it to be…
A pearl?
It was a dark blue circular pearl that had aura emanating from it, Stark tried to look through it but saw nothing.
Of course, in the back of his mind, a thought was slowly but surely emerging, but there was no way right?
After all… the percentage chance of it dropping was extremely low… RIGHT?
But Stark didn't know that 'Chosen One' could defy anything to bring misfortune (or fortune) to its owner.
Or at least, he had underestimated it.
…
[Item:] TP Pearl
[Type:] Throwable
[Quality:] Perfect
[Perk:] Throw the pearl in the direction you want, and when it hits the ground, you will be teleported to that exact location.
[Hint:] Throw it on the other side of the canyon to pass.
…
Stark stared at the TP Pearl in his hand, trying to comprehend what was happening.
'Chosen One' had actually helped him out, giving him the item he so wanted on his first try against one of the monsters.
The extremely low chances of dropping seemed to be completely defied.
He almost wanted to laugh out loud, but doing so would attract unwanted attention, so he just grabbed the pearl and tightened his hand around it to hide it from the others, all the while slowly approaching the edge of the canyon.
"Yo, what is he doing?" someone asked, pointing at Stark.
"Huh… maybe he is trying to inspect the canyon?"
"What a way to die, anybody could push him off if they felt like it…"
Even Lana was worried, what could Stark be doing, why was he approaching the edge of that deadly space, with spikes and monsters ready to kill whoever came down.
But once Stark reached the very edge.
He enacted his plan: use the TP pearl.
He slightly opened his hand, and suddenly, the glow of the pearl could be seen by everybody.
[TP Pearl acquired!]
A panel appeared in front of everyone, and an arrow pointed to Stark's location.
~FWISH~
Stark threw the pearl as far as he could, easily making it fly over the canyon.
Many people read the message and reacted immediately, dashing toward Stark with an impressive speed, wanting to steal the pearl and use it on themselves.
But it was too late.
Dozens of people reached Stark, but right as they were about to attack him and take it from him…
The pearl hit the ground on the other side of the canyon.
"Invincible Dodge!" Stark used his skill and avoided everybody's attacks, giving him the invincibility frames he needed to teleport.
In a flash of dark blue light, Stark was surrounded by an aura by the same color and disappeared from his current location, leaving behind a confused and frustrated mob of players.
Reappearing on the other side of the canyon, he stumbled slightly from the disorienting teleportation before regaining his balance.
As he looked around, Stark realized that he was indeed on the other side, since just in the distance he could see the many people that had tried to attack him.
"SEE YA SUCKERS!" he laughed out loud and shouted loud enough for everyone to hear.
"THAT LITTLE SHIT!" Jack cursed again, he was among those that tried to attack Stark but miserably failed.
"Pffttt~ look at those dumbasses," those that didn't move from their places mocked those that actually tried to steal the item, leaving them embarrassed.
"Stark…" Lana mumbled, impressed by his ability to avoid everyone, but also by his insane luck, getting the needed item on the first try was phenomenal to say the least.
"Ahhhh~ that feels good," Stark grinned and turned his back to the crowd of furious classifiers, waving his hand from behind to spit them even more, "Anyway… now I have the complete advantage, I need to complete that rift before more people get the TP Pearl…"
And so he began running toward the other direction, ready to get to that monument at the top of the mountain.

chapters.title: Chapter 67 - 67: The Secret Rift's Mini-Boss Appears!
chapters.content:
"THAT FUCKER!" Jack smashed the ground with his wielder heart, he was absolutely furious Stark had somehow gotten past his attack.
He was level 114, and although that was only the middle-range for classifiers, it was still extremely powerful.
And yet… how did a level 16 classifier avoid them all?
Plus, the worse thing of all was Stark's taunt.
Not many would let that slide usually, but they could go nothing when he was on the other side of the canyon, with no possibility for them to traverse except if they found the 'TP Pearl' or waited the 12 hours.
[Someone has just passed the 'Death Canyon']
[Unlocking a replay for credit purposes!]
'Ah…' many sighed as this could only mean one thing…
And although they knew, they still clicked on the video regardless, resulting in it playing in front of everybody.
Of course, the content was obvious: Stark getting the pearl from the minotaur, approaching the edge, and throwing it, resulting in everyone dashing at him.
But this wasn't what surprised people the most.
There was a subtle detail when you zoomed and turned the camera on any angle.
And that detail was… HOW THE FUCK DID STARK AVOID THEIR ATTACKS?
They were far stronger than he was for sure, and yet even with their speed, he somehow… passed through it all?
"Doesn't make sense," Old Kai, a beast tamer with a crow on his shoulder, sighed, he was part of another powerhouse of beast tamers, a guild called, "The Monster Raiders".
"Did you see him avoid my scythe?" a blond-haired girl with stars in her purple eyes exclaimed, she was a warrior and her family was very well off as well.
But no… everyone who was watching the video could see it: he didn't avoid the scythe… IT LITERALLY PASSED THROUGH HIM WHILE HE WAS ROLLING.
It wasn't the only attack, many others also somehow passed through as if he was air, feeling like reality was distorted around that boy.
"I've seen lots of skills in my life," Vex laughed, playing with his heart again, "But this is definitely a legendary skill at minimum, no other way!"
"…?"
Every single one of them (except for Lana) ranged from level 100 to 125 at most (since at some point the rift doesn't allow you to enter if it is too easy).
And yet… they all knew the implications of what a legendary skill was.
After all, even among them, many didn't have one.
"No way he got a skill that is legendary at level 16?"
"What if he is dirt rich and bought it using his family's money?"
"Doesn't make sense, even if you buy a legendary skill scroll, you still need to meet the requirements, and there are enormous chances to fail the awakening of the skill as it is based on your level!"
None of them knew of the domination trial, and it was better that way since probably none of them would have survived if they had been placed in Stark's position.
***
Back to the black-haired boy, he turned after mocking all those that tried to attack him, honestly thanking everything for the [Invincible Dodge] skill as it was truly a blessing.
It was only 'Epic' in its rarity, but he honestly believed it should at least be legendary if not more because of how useful it was.
But unbeknownst to Stark, it wasn't that the skill was powerful, it was just that he had the perfect combination to use it at its full potential.
He had never thought about it, but the fact he had the [Focus] skill, which allowed him to see one micro-second in advance, was basically the perfect blend with [Invincible Dodge] who required perfect timing.
Anybody else would have failed to dodge an attack at least once until now, and yet Stark had always succeeded.
It was like he was in a character in a souls game, able to dodge the attacks of every enemy and leaving them with absolutely no chance to retaliate or hit him.
Stark felt happy about what he had done.
But suddenly…
~FWISH, CRASH~
"Huh?" all the people on the other side of the canyon looked in horror as they saw a giant thing coming out from it.
Stark also heard noise behind him, so he turned, thinking that those losers on the other side were still fussing over his small victory, and then, coming from the canyon, a massive black golem with twisting metal appendages sprang forth from it, its rock-hard body glowing with an ominous aura.
In addition to that, its giant cubic head had three cubic eyes looking down at him.
And once it stood completely, it became obvious the golem was at least twenty meters tall.
Stark's eyes widened, a few seconds ago he was at the top of the world, and the moment he turned, he was now facing an impossible opponent.
"DAMAGE WALLS!" before he could even analyze it using [Perception], the monster attacked.
Summoning four rock-solid walls in all directions, which were all closing in on Stark.
…
[Damage Wall: 10000/10000]
[Perk: deals massive damage if crushed by it, the damage is doubled every other wall that touches the target]
…
This meant… that if he was hit by that thing, it was game over.
~FWISH~
"THAT'S WHAT YOU GET!" many classifiers laughed at Stark for being too certain of himself.
The [Damage Wall] might as well be called an 'unavoidable attack' if the opponent doesn't know about it since it closes off too quick for them to react.
At least… that would be the case if Stark didn't have a skill to get out of this situation.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" he rolled away, and completely avoided the walls crashing on him thanks to his invincibility frames.
The walls all crumbled as they all hit each other, the absence of Stark making them take all their damage and go back into the ground.
Beyond the rubble and the dust that formed, Stark could be seen standing, a smirk on his face while he was wiping his sweating forehead.
"Nice try~" he smiled, "Try that again and it might work!"
"SEE, HE DID IT AGAIN!" a young boy, possibly Stark's age (although he had a bigger level somehow), "HE IS FINE WHILE BEING HIT BY THAT!"
"I'm telling you, this is a legendary skill!" Vex confirmed, enjoying the show as he didn't know his newest recruit had such talent (of course Stark had no plans to stay with the 'Crimson Moon Squad').
And suddenly, a panel appeared in front of everyone as Stark began facing the giant golem.
[Secret Rift Mini-Boss: "Obsidian Golem lv50", was found!]
And just as they all guessed, that was the thing Stark would need to fight… ALONE!

chapters.title: Chapter 68 - 68: The Obsidian Golem
chapters.content:
As the Obsidian Golem let out an ominous battle cry, the crowd of onlookers knew that this would be no easy task for even the most skilled of classifiers among them.
A level 50 elite would seem like nothing against a level 100 classifier, but people shouldn't forget that monsters ALWAYS (in most cases) have more HP than the humans.
Their stats are also overall better and they hit harder than an average human of their level, and even beyond.
But this would honestly be nothing if it wasn't for the fact… the golem was an 'ELITE'.
Monsters are put into such categories for a reason, because of their increased strength and difficulty.
Of course, in the end, most of them would win that fight since they have better stats and dealt more damage, but…
"That boy is dead," Jack laughed, even after seeing Stark avoid the attack and smile, "Defeating a lv50 elite is IMPOSSIBLE for him!"
"Hm~" Old Kai scratched his small beard while petting his crow pet, "I do wonder…"
The golem kept looking down at Stark, its three crimson rock eyes staring at him, analyzing their prey.
Meanwhile, Stark activated [Perception] to look at the monster before him.
…
[Name: Obsidian Golem (ELITE MINI-BOSS)]
[Level: 50]
[HP: 175000]
[Strength: 1726]
[Stamina:1482]
[Speed: 435]
[Defense: 2471]
[Skills: Damage Wall, Obsidian Defense, Smash, Crimson Eyes Vision, Earth Shatter, The Golem's Wrath, Call of the Canyon, Ball Transformation…]
…
'First monster with over 2000 points in a specific stat,' Stark smiled, although he knew that this situation was difficult.
'How does he always end up in such situations,' Lana hit her forehead several times.
"What are you doing?" Stella, the exorcist of the 'Crimson Moon Squad', smiled while seeing Lana repeatedly slap her forehead while mumbling.
"O-Oh… nothing," the blonde-haired archer quickly acted as if nothing was wrong.
"Afraid your crush is gonna die?" Olivia, the alchemist, rubbed a cold potion right next to Lana's ears, it created a very pleasant sound.
"No," but instead of being flustered about what she had said like she would normally be, Lana had a stern expression on her face, "He won't die, I know it."
"…" all the 'Crimson Moon' members looked at Lana as she had become suddenly so serious, and they all shrugged, "Well, you never know, this is an elite, and you guys only started out your real lives as classifiers two weeks ago…"
But Lana just shook her head and smiled again, a hopeful one, then pointed her slender fingers at the other side of the canyon, where the golem and Stark were, "You'll see."
***
The Obsidian Golem, still examining Stark with its three crimson eyes, prepared to unleash its power on the human before it.
"SMASH!" the golem advanced, its steps resulting in the ground to shake because of its sheer weight.
But Stark was quick to respond, avoiding the giant black rock arm, and shielding his face from the debris of the attack.
Even while avoiding it, he could sense that thing was powerful.
He could take maybe… two…?
No.
He would die in one strike if it hit him directly.
"AURA SMASH," he immediately punched the air twice in the direction of the obsidian golem, sending two fists of aura at it.
~BOOM, BOOM~
"-8271! -7837!" it seemed like its defense did in fact make it a harder to kill opponent (who would have guessed).
[Enemy stunned!]
'Yes!' Stark almost got ready to dash and absolutely decimate the golem using his clones.
But…
[I mean, the golem is made of rocks, how do you even wanna stun it?]
This was all that appeared before him, and of course, the golem had in fact not received any status effect.
'Of course…'
So basically, this guy had high defense, high attack, powerful skills (enough to one shot him), and also the ability to ignore status effects since it couldn't affect him.
"…" all the classifiers on the other side of the canyon watched, and none of them was saying anything.
"EARTH SHATTER, DAMAGE WALL!" it summoned the four walls around Stark, which were yet again closing in on him, and at the same time lifted its giant rocky leg, there were some golden lines at the tip of it.
"CRIMSON SPEARS!" Stark wasted no time as he saw the walls and summoned his spears, thinking about a way to get out.
The goal wasn't to escape this attack as it was fairly easily, but to use the least amount of spears while doing so.
Using his quick thinking, one he refined after going through upon hundreds of death situations, Stark launched a single spear at the wall behind him, only pointing one of his fingers at it to make it move, not even bothering to turn.
~CRASH~
"-47281!"
The spear destroyed the wall, it seemed to be extremely weak and have no defense whatsoever.
Then Stark just took a few step backs, thus avoiding the other walls, which all crumbled after crashing against one another.
But of course, he wouldn't get any type of rest as the golem had charged a golden halo around the leg it had lifted, and as soon as Stark avoided its first attack…
~SLAM~
It swung its leg down, and as soon as it hit the ground… the golden halo that was surrounding it suddenly grew in size on the ground, taking up the entire 'space' they were fighting in.
The ground beneath Stark crumbled and shattered as the shockwave from the golem's attack rippled through the canyon. Stones and debris flew in all directions, creating a cloud of dust that obscured vision.
~THUMP, THUMP, THUMP~
Stark couldn't see anything, but he could still hear the sounds of the golem approaching him.
Restricting his vision made it so that all his other senses were sharpened, and the feeling of hearing it getting closer wasn't a pleasant one at all.
"Crimson Eyes Vision," the golem could see him perfectly, thanks to this skill, its eyes on its target since the beginning of the fight.
~THUMP~
It was right in front of Stark now.
"SMASH!" it swung its solid arm down at him again, but of course, Stark couldn't see, but he could hear, meaning he already knew that the golem was right in front of him.
~FWISH~
~CRASH~
He avoided the attack by stepping to his right, then sent his two crimson spears at the golem.
[Hint: aim for the golem's weakness!]
'I can only think of 'THAT' as a weakness,' he smiled, pointing his spears at the eyes of the golem, then shooting them while it was still picking its arm back up.
And just as expected.
"-12172! -13813!" the damage was very high for its defense, meaning that its eyes were indeed its weakness.
They would be very hard to reach under normal circumstances if you didn't have a long-ranged weapon or skill, but Stark could be happy he had those.
~FWISH~
Stark didn't waste time, and sent two crimson fists at the golem's obsidian head again.
"-14626! -13924!"
One of the golem's three eyes cracked after the two fists hit it, meaning that Stark was going in the right direction.
"SMASH!" but the golem took Stark by surprise again, its speed suddenly growing after one of its eyes was broken and somehow gaining the ability to swing down at incredible speed.
"AH SHIT…" Stark got ready for impact.

chapters.title: Chapter 69 - 69: Discovered Weaknesses
chapters.content:
"DOMINATION!" he had been using it until now, but he was calling out to it since he wanted to use the new perk he unlocked after reaching level 10.
[Description: Your class resonates with you, the power you have acquired through all your fights vibrates through your body, and your aura is now stronger than ever before, you are now allowed to place a shield around your body that blocks 5K points of damage]
And just as expected, a barrier of aura suddenly formed around Stark's body, surrounding his figure perfectly, its edges moving like waves.
~CRASH~
Stark tried to avoid it, but he was only half-successful as the attack hit his leg.
~CRACK~
"-4817!" even only hitting his leg, the damage was insane, but it looked like the aura barrier actually endured the attack, meaning he hadn't received any sort of damage.
[HP: 5184/8500]
He had regained some HP both from killing the minotaur, but also doing damage to the golem, that necklace was really useful.
But Stark didn't waste time and immediately jumped in the air at the golem's direction, reaching its head in a matter of seconds if not less.
'GOTCHA!'
He punched its remaining working eyes three times.
"-9271! -8263! -8936!" it did decent damage.
But in contrast…
"-462! -341! -458!"
He also received damage since the golem's thick rock skin and defense were enough to hurt him.
'Ouch,' he dropped to the ground while wiping the small blood that came out of his hands and positioned himself for the battle.
After all these exchanges, the dust finally settled, revealing to the other classifiers on the other end of the canyon the scene of the obsidian golem and determined Stark still standing, although many noticed that the golem had lost one of its eyes in the process.
"He's actually doing it!"
"Did you say something about it being impossible, Jack?" Vex mocked the soul wielder.
"He ain't surviving, it didn't even use its most powerful skills yet," but Jack was confident.
Vex smirked, unfazed by Jack's skepticism. As the battle between Stark and the obsidian golem raged on, the canyon seemed to tremble with each clash of titans.
The golem's strength was truly fascinating, able to shake the entire canyon with a single smash of its rocky arm.
But its speed didn't allow it to hit Stark as he was just too fast for it.
"CLONE FRENZY!" he summoned one of his clones beside him.
The goal of this clone wasn't to attack the golem head on, as he had already proven that when he hit it, he would also receive some counter damage, meaning the clone would die instantly because of its 1 HP, instead it would just… stale for damage and time from afar.
"AURA SMASH!" the clone's hands began glowing with aura, and it sent two giant fists at the golem while Stark toward it.
"-4362! -3827!" the golem was unable to avoid even the 'lesser' version of Stark.
Then while it was getting ready to use another one of its skills…
"OBSIDIAN DEFENSE," first, it doubled its defense, its shiny black body now shining because the obsidian that formed it suddenly became much harder.
And then…
"THE GOLEM'S WRATH!" its burning rocky crimson eyes were ready to unleash horrifying attacks on the human…
The golem's wrath was one of its two ultimate skills, one where it would quite literally shatter its body to make it even harder for Stark to hit or even hope of damaging it.
'…' But Stark knew better.
Every time he allowed a boss to use its ultimate skill, it always ended in him almost dying.
Whether it was the 'Feathered Scourge' with its halo beam, the 'Mayor' with its call of hundreds of monsters, or the 'Mirror Master' and its domain, allowing them to do so always resulted in disaster.
But what if he didn't allow them to do that? What if… he could stop them from casting their ultimate?
Of course, he had noticed that every time, it took at least 5 to 10 seconds for the monsters to use their skills, meaning that between this time… maybe he could do something?
The golden halo's around the golem's limbs and body were now glowing, a fantastic aura surrounding them.
[Note: you cannot stop an ultimate attack from being used, you can only… weaken it =)]
'Send your spears toward the right arm,' he ordered his clone as soon as he read that message, then sent two fists toward that same arm.
The golem was currently busy managing its halos and attack, they were charging up.
But right as the golem was about to unleash its ultimate attack, multiple crimson spears flew toward its right arm, and in addition, two crimson fists as well.
~CRASH, BOOM, CRACK~
"-11271!" the damage was fairly low because of the increased defense, but that wasn't what interested Stark the most.
Instead… he saw an opportunity.
Once all the attacks hit the arm, he saw a crack form on it.
He hadn't really thought about it, but could it be that each of the golem's limbs have HP of their own, like in a game?
He couldn't check them out, and it was only a theory, but one he couldn't refute.
Furthermore, he dashed toward the golem, arriving in front of its cracked arm in less than a second.
And then… he punched it four times at incredible speed.
"-3716! -3639! -3472! -3381!"
Of course, he also received some damage because of the obsidian's increased defense, but it wasn't enough for him to care.
Instead…
~CRACK, CRASH~
The golem's right arm completely cracked and fell to the ground, turning into a pile of dust, and the halo that was around it suddenly turned dark.
[Obsidian Golem (ELITE) HP: 44219/175000]
It had lost one of its arms, and some cracks on its body could be seen.
But this made Stark realize something…
'What if…' he scratched his chin while backing away, 'What if I destroyed its legs…'
It was a rock monster, and if Stark could destroy two… no… even just one of its legs, then wouldn't it just completely crumble and die immediately?
If this was an MMORPG game or strategy game, this was something that would seem obvious.
And so right as he thought about that…
[Monster Weaknesses: every monster has a weakness, whether it is visible or not, there is ALWAYS a way to kill a monster easier than by just reducing its HP to 0]
This panel came confirming what Stark guessed could be true.
'This world is… interesting,' he smirked.
If he had aimed for the golem's leg instead of its arm, it would have surely died.
But it didn't matter.
"THE GOLEM'S WRATH!" even after losing its arm, the elite still used its ultimate skill.

chapters.title: Chapter 70 - 70: The Golem's Wrath
chapters.content:
The obsidian golem kneeled and touched the ground with its working arm, the golden halo and light around it burning even brighter.
Stark could feel the ground rumble as the golem prepared its ultimate attack, or maybe… it was already finished using it?
~BUMP, BUMP~
Rows of spiky rocks began to materialize around the golem, each one sharp and menacing.
But that wasn't all, thanks to the aura of the halo, two smaller golems also emerged from the ground right next to their 'father'.
They were smaller than it was, but still at least five times Stark's size.
…
[Name: Golem Minion (STRONG)]
[HP: 60000]
[Strength: 938]
[Stamina: 737]
[Speed: 201]
[Defense: 1226]
[Skills: Slam, Explode, Eye Beam…]
…
In comparison to the obsidian golem, their skin was mostly brown, made out of rocks from the canyon, but they also had one singular golden eye that looked at Stark.
"QUIT COPYING ME," he shouted at the elite monster, actually mad not only did it copy his spears, but also his clone ability, and it would have probably copied his crimson fists if he hadn't destroyed one of its arms.
The two minions charged at Stark, their bodies putting up a dust cloud as they approached.
One of them started slamming the ground with its fists, causing the earth to shake and sending pebbles flying everywhere, which Stark avoided easily.
"EYE BEAM!" The other adjusted its golden rocky eyes and then…
~FWISH~
Just as the skill described, a golden beam came out of it, aimed at Stark.
~BOOM~
Stark moved out of the way, but the area he was in before exploded, the beam seemed to be extremely powerful, and much like the halo of 'Feathered Scourge', it was following him extremely closely.
"EYE BEAM," the other golem recovered from smashing the ground and used the skill, this time aimed at the clone.
'…' but Stark realized something…
If this attack was similar to the Feathered Scourge's divine strike, then couldn't he do 'that'?
Stark grinned cockily at the sight of the two beams following them, and then…
'GO BEHIND THE OBSIDIAN GOLEM,' he ordered his clone, and it nodded before dashing at the elite monster.
The two beams followed Stark and his clone closely, only a strand of hair away from killing them both, but that was his plan all along.
The clone jumped behind the obsidian golem, avoiding a [Smash] from it.
And Stark did the same while sending a crimson fist to disrupt its vision.
"-4728!" another one of the golem's eyes shattered, with only one shining with that crimson light now.
And thus, now that the boys were behind the golem, and the minions' beams were still following them.
What had to happen happened.
Both beams collided with the obsidian golem's body, creating a deafening explosion.
Debris and dust flew in every direction, and the echoing sound of the blast continued to reverberate throughout the canyon.
The minions realizing what they had done immediately deactivated their attack, but it was already too late.
"-2718! -2179! -2894!"
When the dust settled…
[Obsidian Golem (ELITE) HP: 3716/175000]
The golem's entire body was full of crack, its final eye now flickering, as if it was fighting for dear life.
Its left arm was destroyed, crumbling to the ground, and its two legs were only one hit away from being destroyed too.
"…" Stark was behind the golem, and looking at its destroyed body brought a sense of satisfaction to him.
But it wasn't the end, after all it still had a bit of health.
The minions looked flustered, shaking their bodies in all directions and moving their arms as to gesture they didn't mean that.
'Let's get this over with,' Stark took a step forward and tried to punch the golem.
But…
"BALL TRANSFORMATION," it used its final skill, and its body suddenly became to change, its form shifting rapidly like a metamorphosis of stone and earth.
It went from a destroyed figure to a… giant rock ball with gold cracks around it…?
Spikes grew all over its surface, making it look like a gigantic, armored bowling ball.
Stark stopped his attack, not wanting to touch that thing.
'How are we supposed to… kill it?' he wondered, there seemed to be no way to hurt it by using physical attacks.
"CRIMSON SPEARS, AURA SMASH!" the clone sent all of it at the unmoving obsidian ball.
"-0! -0! -0! -0!" but it didn't receive any sort of damage.
It was truly… invincible…?
~FWISHHHHHHHH~
The spiky ball suddenly started spiking, sending debris toward Stark and the clone as they were behind.
"-1! -1! -1!"
This wasn't much damage, and it wouldn't be a problem in most cases, but…
"OH COME ON," the clone was hit and immediately deactivated, losing all its energy and the aura that created it seeping back onto Stark's body.
And then…
~BOOM~
The obsidian golem began rolling, but it wasn't aiming to attack Stark, not at all, as if it wanted to it would be going backward.
Instead…
~SWASH~
"-46269!" it hit one of the minions, sending it flying and falling back onto the ground, its body almost completely destroyed.
"-38273!" the other golem on the other hand wasn't as lucky, and its body was pierced by one of the spikes, "-57462!".
It died.
"Holy shit?" many of the classifiers on the other side were surprised,
~FWISH~
Lana sent an arrow, trying to help Stark by hitting the golem, but…
[You aren't allowed to do anything that is beyond the canyon]
The arrow was stopped by an invisible wall and fell in the canyon, hitting a random monster in the head and killing it.
'It can't stop… it's gonna head toward the canyon,' As Stark watched the enormous ball continue to roll relentlessly towards the canyon, a grin spread across his face.
But of course.
The obsidian golem's remaining arm came out of the back of the ball and dug itself into the ground, holding it just enough for the golem to turn in the other direction and make a complete 180, going back toward the other golem minion who was still recovering.
"-48271!" just as expected, the second minion died.
This was basically the mini-boss's revenge for the treason from its supposed minions.
And yet… it wasn't stopping, heading straight at Stark.
He hadn't expected it to do that, but right now, only a few meters ahead, was a giant spiky ball that would surely kill him.
"He's dead," Jack smiled, "Now, that's for sure, even I would struggle stopping that thing…"
"I think he should have avoided as soon as he saw it turn," Old Kai shrugged.
"No point, it would have followed," Vex retorted, he knew that thing was immense, and so dealing damage to it would be hard.
And so… all of them watched Stark be executed.
Or did he?
"DOUBLE ASSAULT," he clapped his hands then positioned himself in front of the ball.
Almost as if…
"HE WANTS TO STOP IT USING HIS STRENGTH?"
"He is insane!"
But no, he wasn't insane, it was just that it was his only way of surviving this as [Invincible Dodge]'s frames wouldn't be enough to completely faze through the golem.
It was all or nothing.
"COME AT ME, BALL," he got ready for the spiky impact.
After all… now that his domination skill was at level 10, it meant that double assault was much, much stronger than before…

chapters.title: Chapter 71 - 71: Killing the Obsidian Golem
chapters.content:
The giant spiky ball hurtled towards Stark, its momentum unstoppable. The classifiers watched in amazement as the boy prepared to face the onslaught.
He had already activated [Double Assault], the crimson aura around his body now so powerful they could even sense it from the other side of the canyon, and the feeling of that aura was clear: "Death."
"Haha~ what a weird guy," Stella smiled.
"Y'all think I can beat him in a wrestling match?" Thorn was curious, he didn't want to lose his 'strongest muscles' title to some newbie after all.
"Heh~ I think you beat him, after all there is no way he stops that, he must have some other plan," Max, the assassin of the group, spun his blades while pointing at Stark, "It would be suicide to try and fight it head on like that."
"What's his plan anyway," Jack laughed, "Fucking catch it in this momentum, even I can't see the spikes because of how fast they go!"
And while all of them were indeed saying the truth about the fact anybody else would just try to avoid or deflect the attack…
Stark was crazy enough to actually risk it.
~FWIIIISHHH~
The 20 meters tall ball was now centimeters in front of Stark.
"Focus…" he breathed in and opened his eyes as wide as he could, sensing the movement of the spiky object ahead.
And then…
~CRASH~
Using the momentum and perfect timing… he managed to hold onto one of the spikes while it was spinning.
"-2182!" this allowed the damage to be reduced as much as possible, but there was still the impact.
The ball was still rolling as Stark's sheer strength allowed him to grab onto it.
~SCREECH~
He was being pushed because of the speed, his feet sliding on the rock surface, but he didn't let go.
His feet were being set on fire, and blood was pouring out from his forehead, but Stark didn't stop.
"-3612!" he placed his 'aura barrier' from the level 10 domination skill, which allowed him to endure the damage.
And so after a few seconds of just sliding away…
The golem stopped.
Stark was successful in stopping it.
"Hah~ hah~" he was exhausted, but he had done it.
"-99999!" the golem immediately crumbled after being stopped, it had used too much energy, and it was already on the verge of collapsing, so that last attack was its final attempt to kill the human.
