"Phew~ take that, black rock thingy!" he smiled while wiping the sweat off his forehead.
There was now a pile of rocks in the location of where the golem and its minions were, they had all been defeated.
[You have slain "Obsidian Golem lv50 (ELITE MINI-BOSS)", gained 358000EXP!]
And of course, getting that much experience could only mean one thing…
[Your level has increased to level 23, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
[Experience: 287752/440000]
'…' the crowd of classifiers was speechless.
"HE-HE STOPPED THAT THING WITH HIS HANDS," even Jack was flabbergasted.
Stark had surprised him dozens of times over the course of this fight, and each time he thought he was dead, he would somehow find a solution to escape…
Whether it was finding the golem's weakness, destroying its arm to prevent it from using its full ultimate skill, redirecting the minion's attacks to the mini-boss, or even stopping the spike ball with his sheer hands while risking his life.
All of these things were risks many people would never take, and yet he had done it all in succession.
Plus he had done it so perfectly it was as if… he knew what he was doing since the beginning, with no place for doubts.
[You have beaten the boss while being alone (SOLO achievement), granting you better equipment pieces]
Beside the golem, two pieces of equipment had dropped, one had a green light, and the other a brownish one.
He took the two and put them inside [Spatial Inventory] without bothering to check them out as he didn't feel the need to for now.
"SEE YOU FUCKERS!" then he turned at the classifiers on the other side of the canyon and waved at them.
But they couldn't even be mad at him after what they had just witnessed.
Plus, they couldn't really curse him long since the monsters began spawning again, meaning it was their chance to get a TP pearl.
***
Stark ran toward the giant mountain with the monument on top of it.
"…" he hadn't let it show, but he was extremely exhausted after such a battle.
Of course, there was the possibility of using the [Max Health Potion] he had been given, but no… he didn't want to, not now.
[HP: 3726/8900]
His HP weren't that low thanks to the necklace, which allowed him to recover a small portion of his health every time he dealt good damage to an enemy, and even more when he killed them.
But Stark knew he couldn't let his guard down just yet.
The battle with the Obsidian Golem and its minions had taken a lot out of him, and he couldn't afford to be vulnerable now.
'If only there was a bonfire… somehow I really miss those…' he sighed.
The harder a rift is, the less bonfires there are, and it was safe to assume that there was none in this secret rift, at least not until at least the boss.
But instead of a bonfire, he found something else, a giant rock in the distance.
'That could do…'
Stark approached it, his movements were slow, and his eyes tired.
And after a few minutes, he arrived, then rested against the rock, his eyes dizzy.
Of course, sleeping in a rift was the worst possible idea anybody could have.
Only a madman would have the guts to do that.
And yet…
"Clone Frenzy!" he summoned one of his clones and gave it two simple instructions:
"Wake me up in exactly five hours, and if anybody else approaches, wake me up," the rest was up to the clone as it understood it would need to defend its original body.
Stark wasn't the type to be tired easily, but using so many skills, and enduring all these attacks while trying to control a power he wasn't used to was very hard.
It was already a miracle he was still standing long enough to reach that rock as his stamina was already depleted.
"…" the clone nodded and positioned itself, it was allowed to use every skill and do anything to protect Stark, so it was ready to battle all night as it was like a bodyguard that could never get tired.
And somehow… Stark put his total trust in it (maybe because it was basically just another him?).
And so, Stark closed his eyes and fell asleep.
That night, Stark had no dreams.

chapters.title: Chapter 72 - 72: Clone Fighting
chapters.content:
…
[Name: Flying Wolves]
[Level: 56]
[HP: 70000]
[Strength: 736]
[Stamina: 1184]
[Speed: 1261]
[Defense: 480]
[Skills: Talon Strike, Paralyze, Aerial Assault, Ferocious Bite]
…
Stark was currently asleep, meaning that it was up to the clone to get rid of those 'intruders'.
It had been three hours since Stark fell asleep, and until now… it went pretty well?
The bodies of several monsters could be seen lying around the rock as the clone had successfully killed them all by itself.
Of course, it meant that it had defeated all these monsters while not taking a single hit, its sole objective to protect Stark, nothing else mattered.
Plus, if the clone ever got killed, the aura that would seep inside of Stark's body would immediately awaken him since he would feel the change.
The only downside to such a thing is that the amount of experience Stark would get from using his clone to farm it was extremely low.
[Cannot cheat the system]
It would too easy to just send clones over and over, so there was a limit to how much he would get by using such a method.
Just like the time he used the bonfire to kill enemies from the 'safe zone', it seems like the world itself didn't allow him to cheat.
Stark's clone positioned itself while looking at the winged wolves, ready to take them all.
It had only fought monsters in one on ones up until now, so fighting several opponents could reveal itself to be much harder…
The clone had Stark's intelligence and conscience, meaning that it thought like him, and also used the skills just like he would, which was like it used [Perception] to see the monsters' stats.
'High speed… low defense…' it thought, a trail of aura shining in its eyes.
"AURA SMASH!" it didn't waste time and sent two fists at the wolves, which were taken aback and couldn't avoid it.
"-18371! -16268!" two of them were hit directly while the other two avoided the attack since they were further.
[Enemy stunned]
One of the two wolves fell to the ground as it couldn't flap its wings anymore.
And so the clone took advantage of that while the others were still trying to recover.
"CRIMSON SPEARS," it sent the three spears at the fallen wolf's head, which basically acted as its weakness.
And the three pierced it.
"-27362! -28284! -26837!" it died immediately as holes were left in the places the spears were aimed at.
Then without wasting time, it dashed at the second wolf which had been hit by the crimson fists as its HP was already down.
~FWISH~
"AERIAL ASSAULT!"
"FEROCIOUS BITE!"
One of the two monsters which escaped the crimson attack flew in the air then dived at the clone, attempting to kill it as it sensed that a single attack would be enough.
But…
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" the clone rolled forward and avoided the wolf's claws, which kept flying as it didn't expect for such a thing to happen.
Then the second one got on its feet and dashed at incredible speed toward the clone, which just looked at it with the same blank and calm expression it always had.
A clone couldn't feel emotions after all… or could it?
~SMASH~
Instead of avoiding the 'Ferocious Bite' from the wolf, it just surrounded its hands with aura and smashed its head.
The momentum sent it flying very far.
"-28372!"
But the clone didn't let go.
"-29329! -27624!" it killed the second wolf, then dashed toward the one that was hit by its crimson fists.
"PARALYZE!" it roared at the clone, as the skill [Paralyze] basically paralyzed enemies if they had just an ounce of fear while looking at them.
But of course…
['Fear' and 'Paralyze' don't work on 'Domination' class]
And anyway, it was a clone, it couldn't sense fear.
So while the wolf was getting ready to use another skill…
The clone smashed its head, killing it instantly.
"-48371!" their weaknesses were their heads, so destroying it was an insta-kill.
"CRIMSON FIST!" then finally, the clone sent two final fists as the last wolf which was just coming after flying too far.
And it was killed.
'…' the clone went back in front of Stark after getting rid of the enemies, its mission wasn't done yet as there were still two hours before waking up its owner.
[You have slain four 'Flying Wolves lv56', gained 28271EXP!]
And of course, the experience was massively reduced as in under normal circumstances, he should have gotten at least 200000.
***
~SHAKE~
'Huh…' Stark slowly opened his eyes, rubbing them after a few seconds.
He sat up, glancing around to find his surroundings eerily quiet.
The clone stood vigilantly nearby after waking up its owner, its eyes meeting Stark's with an unreadable expression.
Stark couldn't help but feel a sense of pride at the clone's success in protecting him while he slept.
"Good job," he smiled before making the clone disappear.
It had been exactly five hours since he slept, and now he felt that his stamina was recovered thanks to that.
Plus… it seemed like nobody had traversed the canyon yet, the odds of a pearl appearing were even lower since someone had already found one after all.
Or at least, that's what he thought.
Because before the clone disappeared, it pointed in the distance at the direction Stark came from.
And there he saw… a group of classifiers marching toward him.
'…?' it hadn't woken him up because the time was up, but because people were arriving!
'Ah shit… need to go!'
Stark quickly stood up, feeling the adrenaline pumping through his veins, then he began running, using the giant rock as some sort of vision-blocker.
He counted the number of classifiers there, and there were at least seven of them.
'How is that possible… aren't pearls rare…?'
…
30 minutes ago, on the other side of the death canyon…
One of the classifiers had finally gotten hold of a pearl, and so just like Stark, they approached the edge of the canyon, and threw it before anyone could do anything.
~FWISH~
They teleported to the other side, then grinned.
And that person was none other than… Stark's brother.
He didn't waste a single second and dashed toward the giant golem's body, using his 'Soul Wielder' heart and powerful [Creation] skill to use the rocks and form a bridge that traversed the entire canyon.
It wasn't obvious, but once someone passed the canyon using a 'TP Pearl', they were basically allowed to use any cheats to go back or to help the others.
After forming the rock bridge, Stark's brother gestured at the members of his group to come while most of the others were too focused on resting or fighting.
And so just like that, the 'Wyver's Wrath' group was able to pass the canyon.
"HEY, WAIT A MINUTE," Jack realized what was happening and tried to use this opportunity to catch up.
But…
~CRACK, CRUMBLE~
The bridge was destroyed the moment all the members passed, they wouldn't allow anyone else but them to get an advantage after all, right?
And so just like that, a group was able to pass, heading toward the final area, and most importantly… toward Stark.

chapters.title: Chapter 73 - 73: The Wyvern's Wrath Group
chapters.content:
'Now… I just need to get to the boss before anyone else…' he grinned, the mountain was now closer than ever before, and he could see the flight of stairs that would lead up to it.
His heart pounded in his chest, adrenaline fueling his every step. He was determined to outrun them and protect his position as the first.
But of course…
~FWISH~
A blue trident crashed in front of him, halting his run.
Instinctively, Stark looked behind him, and there he saw that the seven figures were much muuuchh closer than he expected them to be.
'…' he switched directions to avoid the trident that had stopped him…
But another interrupted him again, the head of the trident hitting the ground.
'FUCK…'
No matter where he would try to go, another trident would be there, slowly but surely blocking all his options.
And after only 30 seconds, he was now surrounded by a circular cage of blue tridents, aura pouring out from them as they encercled Stark like a rat in a testing lab.
~FWISH~
In a flash of light, the tridents disappeared, and instead of the weapons, Stark was now surrounded by the seven classifiers.
[Group: Wyvern's Wrath]
A panel appeared to tell him who he was facing, probably thanks to [Perception].
[Tip: Idk, just don't anger them]
'Nice tip!' Stark nodded.
"What took you so long?" one of the members of this group, a burly man with dark skin and refined muscles laughed.
"Sleeping," Stark replied while smiling.
"HAHAHAHAH~" the man held his forehead, "You were sleeping in this rift?"
"How is that even possible?" a woman with short pink hair in a bob cut scratched her chin, she was holding a scepter with a heart on it, and even her eyes had hearts in them, Stark thought that she could either be a succubus (he read too many cultural books) or a magus.
"Secret technique," Stark shrugged, "Why did you guys interrupt me?"
There was absolutely no reason for them to go as far as to throw weapons at him to make him stop.
Except if… they wanted to kill him.
"Just for your information, I have no items on me, you can check my body," it was the complete truth, and he wanted to get the 'trying to steal from me' theory out of the lot as it would hopefully dissuade them from doing anything.
"Of course there is no items on you if you used that weird void thingy to put them inside…" a black-haired woman with glasses nervously said.
"…" Stark didn't expect them to catch on so quick, but it meant he couldn't outsmart them.
A blue-haired guy with tridents floating around him, probably the guy that sent them to capture Stark, was just staring at the conversation, not saying anything.
Stark lowered his gaze, feeling a mixture of irritation and respect for the Wyvern's Wrath group's cleverness.
Then he looked back up, staring at the leader's eyes with his most calm eyes, ones filled with aura, enough for none of those present to not notice that he was serious.
"Ok, and so what do you want me with me," he looked at his brother, he had the same black hair and red eyes he did.
But of course, he had no plans to reveal that since he was currently wearing the bunny mask, which perfectly hid his identity to anyone who didn't know who he was.
"Nothing much," Stark's brother grinned, "Just wanted to see why you were still there after so long, plus are we not allowed to talk?"
"I would rather not talk with you all," Stark smiled and lifted his arms.
Even to those that were stronger then he was, they could sense that his aura was weird.
They knew he was weaker, and yet they felt like there was a risk in approaching him.
"Funny guy," two red-haired boys that looked exactly the same, apparent twins, spoke at the same time, "Don't think you can get away with that."
And with that, Stark saw all the members of this weird group.
After one minute of silence, Stark knew they couldn't let him off the hook.
'…' he sighed, then out of nowhere… took a fighting stance, putting his aura-filled fists in front of his face.
"Oy~~ is this guy insane?" the dark-skinned man was bewildered.
"I wouldn't underestimate him…" the nervous woman adjusted her glasses, she seemed to be the smartest of the group.
"I'll repeat, what do you want from me," Everything about Stark's stance and aura indicated he wasn't kidding, yet his face remained calm.
"I'll tell you what we want, then…" Stark's brother took a step forward, putting his hand on his chest before pulling out his 'Wielder Heart' from it, "We just want to be the first to complete this rift."
"Fair enough," Stark nodded, but he obviously wouldn't let them be.
"So I hope…" a small grin began to form on the black-haired leader's face, "You don't hate us for what's about to happen."
Right as he finished his sentence, a blue magic circle appeared around Stark, and blue chains appeared, slowly approaching Stark.
'I can't move,' no matter how hard he tried to fight it, there was no way he could move.
"Should have been smarter than this," the leader winked at Stark, mocking him for just standing there while they restrained him behind the scene.
The owner of that attack was the blue-haired guy with tridents around him, its name was [Timed Chain], and if the opponent stays still for five seconds in the domain of the circle, they would be forcefully paralyzed, then restrained, with no way to escape.
And so this meant…
"It's our victory, bunny masked guy," the dark-skinned man laughed, enjoying the show.
As if to mock him even more, the chains that were supposed to restrain him were moving very slowly toward his body, to make sure that Stark could see them.
'Their victory…?' Stark internally grinned.
On the outside, it seemed like he was perplexed and taken aback, but on the inside… he was laughing.
He had [Perception] and [Focus], how the hell would he have not noticed it?
He had seen the circle since the moment it appeared, but just let it do what it was supposed to do, even going as far as reading the skill's description to make sure that it would work.
The objective of this small plan of his was obvious: take all of them aback to be able to reach the boss area before they did.
And so right as the chains were going to wrap around his limbs…
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," Stark focused all his aura around his legs, all the while summoning [Aura Smash] and [Crimson Spears] around him.
And then… he dodged the chains, essentially getting out of the [Timed Chains] skill's range thanks to the invincibility frames.
And so just like that, Stark began his plan to reach the boss of the Secret Rift before this group of classifiers more powerful than he was.

chapters.title: Chapter 74 - 74: Outsmarting an Elite Group
chapters.content:
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," Stark dodged the blue chains that were wrapping around his body.
And immediately afterward, before any of the 'Wyvern Wrath' members could do anything…
"AURA SMASH!" he sent two crimson fists toward the guy with the tridents around him.
"-4736! -4827!" the damage was low because of the powerful equipment he had and also because of his defense.
But that wasn't what Stark wanted… what he wanted was another one of this skill's abilities…
[Enemy stunned!]
'YES!' he almost shouted, it was based on luck, but it seemed like he hadn't been abandoned.
Thanks to the upgrade of the 'Domination' skill to level 10, the amount of aura he had was so high that even a person that was level 100+ would be affected by the status effects.
And so the blue-haired man suddenly fell to the ground, unable to move his legs anymore.
~FWISH~
Stark took advantage of this opportunity to dash toward him as he was the one that was in the mountain's direction.
~SLAM~
He kicked the man's face as hard as he could, sending him flying against the ground, yet still unable to move.
"-5738!"
Despite the damage being low, the group was stunned by the sudden turn of events.
And so Stark began dashing toward the mountain, focusing the entirety of his aura around his legs.
This was a giant risk he was willing to take: abandon all the protection around his body with the hopes of being able to run as fast as the rest of them.
"SHIT, CATCH HIM," the dark-skinned man was the first to snap back to reality after a few seconds and chased after Stark.
The rest immediately followed except for the blue-haired man who was still down, it would take some time for him to recover as 'Stun' usually goes away after being hit.
"GET THAT KID," the leader shouted.
They didn't know why they took so long to chase after him, it was almost as if they were… hypnotized… by his aura.
But it didn't matter now, all they needed to do was catch up to him.
Stark was running as fast as he could, passing through the many plains of the 'Shadow Valley' while avoiding the monsters in his way.
The closer he got to the mountain and the flight of stairs that led up to the monument, the more monsters would appear.
But…
~FWISH~
"-74728! -83816! -93774!"
Extremely close behind him were the six classifiers, all able to one shot the monsters, fury in their eyes and not letting go of Stark for a single second.
[6 following you]
"I'M GETTING FUCKING TIRED, I'LL KNOCK HIS ASS OUT," the dark-skinned man shouted and activated [Berserk Sprint] to increase his speed, leaving the remainder of his team behind, but also getting closer to Stark.
"…" Stark grinned, a trail of aura in his eyes.
He could never hope to win against even a single one of them at his current level, but… he could outsmart them.
…
[Skill: Berserk Sprint]
[Description:] Increases the user's speed by 200%, leaving them in a state of berserk which they cannot get out of until hitting a target or wall/object
[Flaw:] Your stamina will be immensely reduced if you hit an unknown object instead of the target.
…
[He would…]
'CRIMSON SPEARS!'
[Take advantage…]
'GO AT HIM!' he pointed at the burly man who was right behind him, a few centimeters away from catching him.
[…Of their weaknesses.]
The three spears immediately turned and headed toward him, and of course, just as his skill indicated… he wasn't able to avoid them.
"-4627! -3813! -5837!" he tripped after being hit as he didn't expect his [Berserk Sprint] to stop so suddenly.
He fell to the ground, catching his breath as just as the flaw described, he was not unable to run as fast as before to keep up with the others.
[5 following you]
"-29182!" he punched a random 'flying wolf' that was trying to bite him, sending it flying toward the red-haired twins, who cut it into a million pieces at intense speed.
Looking ahead, he could see that he was only a few hundreds of meters away from the mountain, the white giant stairs visible from here.
Those stairs went like spirals around the mountain, and they were large enough to fit at least twenty people.
"JUST FUCKING CAPTURE HIM," Stark's brother shouted, two of his members had unexpectedly been taken care of by this random kid…
WHY COULDN'T THEY BEAT HIM EASILY LIKE THEY DID WITH ALL THE OTHERS?!
Despite the quick burst of anger and frustration coming from his brother's voice, Stark grinned.
"You guys left two of your teammates back while they were weakened," he looked at them, a chilling smile on his face, "You are horrible companions…"
He had reached the stairs by this point, and he was beginning to climb them.
[You have reached the level 50 area: 'The Final Stretch']
After a few seconds, the last five classifiers that were chasing after him reached the area, climbing up as fast they could.
"DIE!" the twins dashed toward Stark, finally catching up to him, their magic swords (which both looked the same too) slashing in his direction.
~SLASH~
They attacked from above and below, leaving no space for Stark to avoid their attack.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," but instead of rolling forward like he always did, he went backward.
Which meant he was right behind the two twins, who didn't expect this.
"CLONE FRENZY," he summoned one of his clones.
And then…
"AURA SMASH!"
The twins were in the air, unable to avoid this attack, so instead they spinned their bodies toward Stark, looking at the four crimson fists heading toward them.
"ATTACK CUT!" they both shouted, their blades burning with a white aura.
…
[Skill: Attack Cut]
[Description:] Allows you to cut a magic attack as long as you perfectly aim for the weak point, an amazing skill that can help you deflect unavoidable attacks.
[Flaw:] Doesn't work on 'Domination'.
…
"=)" Stark smiled as he saw the crimson fists head toward the two twins.
Obviously, they tried to cut the two fists that hurtled toward each of them, but as expected, it was futile.
~BOOM, BOOM~
[Enemy stunned]
[Enemy stunned]
The twins were too confident in their abilities, thinking they could cut any attack, and yet… they failed.
~THUMP~
They began rolling down the flight of stairs, unable to move their bodies.
"-1! -1! -1!"
Stark and his clone then resumed running toward the top of the mountain.
Because of the fact he slowed down to take care of the twins, the other three had almost catched up, now only a few meters behind.
[3 following you]
"This is absolutely BULLSHIT," Stark's brother was furious, but just like any good novel villain, he wouldn't give up, "SELENA, SEND YOUR BEASTS AT HIM, ALEX, INTERCEPT HIM WITH YOUR SCEPTER!"
And so just like that, Stark had to face off against the last three classifiers that were still following after him, their level much higher than his.
But still…
The 'Domination' class made it so even his level 23 self could beat monsters that were up to level 50-60, and his increase in aura meant he had a chance to escape them…
Stark was confident he could get away.
All he needed to do was… get to the boss area.

chapters.title: Chapter 75 - 75: Another Mini-Boss in the Rift?
chapters.content:
The remaining three classifiers gave their all in pursuit of Stark, their intense aura radiating like a storm cloud behind them.
Each of them were climbing up the stairs, soon reaching the middle point.
"SELENA, SEND YOUR BEASTS AT HIM, ALEX, INTERCEPT HIM WITH YOUR SCEPTER!"
Stark heard his brother speak, and immediately as he did so, the task of 'avoiding them' became much more difficult since they knew they wouldn't be able to catch up under normal circumstances.
Selena, the nervous black-haired woman put her palms together, and in an instant, shadowy beasts materialized around her, growling and snarling as they leaped towards Stark with menacing intent.
She was a [Beast Tamer] and her sub-class was [Shadow Tamer].
Although there are only ten classes in the world, sub-classes ranged in the thousands if not hundreds of thousands, which was what allowed each individual to be mostly unique.
Alex, the pink-haired girl, on the otherhand, raised her heart scepter high as crackling energy formed around the tip, she was either a succubus or magus, and in both cases it wasn't good.
~FWISH~
He crouched to avoid a shadow wolf that jumped toward him, and the beast crashed against a wall, disappearing into a puff of eerie black smoke.
Stark quickly turned his attention to Alex, who was now sending pulses of magical energy in his direction.
"ALEX BEAM!" it was a pink beam with hearts around it, but in contrast to its cute nature, the attack was deadly as it hit the stairs and completely destroyed them, following Stark closely as he needed to zigzag to avoid the laser.
"Use your heart, Jay!" Alex said, looking at Stark's brother.
'So his name is Jay…' this made Stark realize he didn't know his supposed brother's name in this world.
"WIELDER HEART," Stark's brother summoned his heart in his hands, and just as he remembered, it was a red one with pulsating veins on it.
~FWISH~
"CREATION!" Jay held his heart high just like he did when he created that bridge to pass the canyon, and suddenly, parts of the mountain and stairs began morphing around his heart, transformig into spiky spears.
~THUMB, THUMB, THUMB!~
He could create an endless amount of spears with no cooldown, and he would continuously send them toward Stark, who tried his best to avoid them.
Add the 'Alex Beam' and several shadow creatures from Stella that were constantly jumping at him, and you have a very disadvantageous chase, where Stark was forced to avoid everything if he didn't want to die.
Which was most surprising though was that even his close somehow managed to avoid the attacks, following Stark's commands perfectly.
But of course… they couldn't forget about something that was very crucial…
It's that they were still in a rift area.
And although the level 50 'The Final Stretch' area didn't have any monsters as the stairs wouldn't allow that… it still had a single danger that could cause chaos.
"ROOOOOOARRRRRR~" a giant red bird appeared above them, flying around the mountain and occasionnaly stopping to look at the humans that were climbing its area.
Secret Rifts aren't line normal ones at all, they abide by their own rules, and they are much more dangerous than the other ones, which was why they were so sought after by classifiers who seeked fame or thrill.
And this one was no different.
"Perception!" Stark analyzed the bird, it had vibrant, scarlet feathers that glisten in the sunlight with ocassional white motifs, it's wingspan was immense, casting a shadow over a large part of the mountain, its beak was sharp and pointed, and its eyes were a piercing yellow.
The flapping of its wings was like thunder, sending vibrations through the air, and when it let out a loud roar, it echoed through the entire valley, maybe even those still at the canyon had heard it?
…
[Name: Crimson Raptor (ELITE MINI-BOSS)]
[Level: 55]
[HP: 190000]
[Strength: 762]
[Stamina: 826]
[Speed: 2362]
[Defense: 2184]
[Skills: Wing Slash, Feather Storm, Flame Breath (Blast), Claw Swipe, Bone Crush, Bird Vision, Prey of the Raptor, Wind Gust, Babies Summon…]
…
'ANOTHER MINI-BOSS?' this was the only monster of this area, yet it was probably much more deadly than the obsidian golem since they were basically in its territory, falling from the stairs being guaranteed death.
So now, in additions to the three beasts that were following him closely from behind to either kill him or capture him, there was a mini-boss flying around them, ready to strike.
And so, in this hopeless situation where Stark could really death getting closer and closer as his stamina was going down and the attacks not stopping…
He did something to get himself out of this situation… which was facing the mini-boss.
"AURA SMASH!" all his precious fists and spears were being sent toward the people that were chasing him, but this time he changed his approach.
He punched the air in the giant bird's direction, sending two fists toward it, and of course, although it had incredible speed, easily avoiding them…
~SWISH~
Stark used the technique he had learned during the Domination trial and switched the fists' directions, making them go back toward the bird, who didn't suspect anything
~BOOM, BOOM~
It was hit twice.
"-15736! -18216!" the damage was decent, but no stun.
And it was fine, since now, Stark could only hope that his plan would work.
The 'Crimson Raptor' was furious that it had been hit by such a cheap attack, and so it dived toward Stark and his clone, trying to kill them both.
"CLAW SWIPE, WING SLASH," it activated both skills, making both its wings and claws shine.
Stark looked up, seeing the bird now only a few meters above him, still diving to kill him off.
"…" he grinned, 'Bingo.'
~SLAM~
The bird landed on the stairs on Stark.
But…
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," he dived forward, avoiding both the bird's attacks and also continuing to climb upward alongside his clone who also used the skill.
The raptor was so big that it took up the entirety of the stairs, essentially blocking the three classifiers that were chasing after Stark as they couldn't do anything: they were forced to get rid of it if they wanted to pass through.
This was Stark's plan.
"YOU FUCKKERRRRRR!" Jay shouted as hard as he could, figuring out that Stark had outsmarted them again.
'I guess using your brain is useful, isn't it,' he grinned, continuing to climb the stairs while the others were stuck with the mini-boss.
"FLAME BREATH," the raptor immediately turned its head toward them and sent a fire blast at the three classifiers, who were forced to go on the offensive to kill it.
And so just like that, Stark was getting closer to his goal.
'Easy win!'
Or at least… that's what he thought.

chapters.title: Chapter 76 - 76: Entering the Secret Rift's Boss Area
chapters.content:
As Stark continued to climb the stairs, carefully watching the events unfolding below him, he couldn't help but feel a sense of accomplishment.
Alex, Stella and Jay were now focused on the raptor as it had put itself between him and them.
And now, Stark was climbing as fast as he could, there were no more enemies to stop him in his quest to reach the boss.
~THUMP, THUMP, THUMP~
Even though he knew the three were distracted, he didn't slow down his pace at all.
'After all...'
~BOOM~
He heard a massive explosion behind him.
'I know they are monsters…'
Back to Jay, Alex and Stella, they were absolutely furious, they had been tricked again by that bunny-masked guy, and were now forced to fight off another mini-boss.
But it didn't matter to them, they were way to strong.
"Flame Breath," the raptor unleashed a blast of fire.
"CREATION!" but Jay just raised a wall using the materials and rocks around him, essentially blocking the attacks.
Trails of aura were in each of their eyes, and as soon as the [Flame Breath] ended…
"ALEX BEAM," the pink-haired magus used the beam attack yet again, sending a pink laser toward the bird's wings to stop it from flying away.
~BOOM~
"-47261!" a massive hole was left in the middle of the right wing.
And when the raptor sensed the danger and tried to use its last wing to leave…
"SHADOW BEASTS!" Stella used her signature move to send dozens of beasts of all sorts toward the raptor's feet/tallons.
Many of them biting it and eating pieces of its flesh, stopping it from doing anything else.
"-21721! -19288! -26454!"
"BONE CRUSH!" knowing it couldn't move anymore since both its feets had been massively injured and that its wing had a hole in it, it tried to use one of its more powerful attacks, strenghtening its body and rushing at the classifiers to try and fall on them.
But…
"CREATION!" Jay's skill creation was so powerful that he could do pretty much anything with it, which was why he only reserved his other ones for special occasions.
~FWISH~
Jay formed a giant spiky rock in the air above the bird's head while it was rushing at them.
And after a few seconds…
The rock began falling at incredible speed.
~BAM~
The 'Crimson Raptor's" weakness was its head, and once the powerful rock absolutely demolished it, it died.
"-102826!"
With the mini-boss defeated, Jay, Alex, and Stella turned their attention back to the stairs which Stark was climbing and dashed, their speed much higher than before since they were much more angry.
"DON'T LET THAT FUCKER GO!" they had defeated the boss in three attacks, and in under thirty seconds, proving that whatever Stark attempted to do from now on was futile.
Stark was now almost at the top of the mountain, and as soon as Jay, Alex and Stella defeated the mini-boss…
[The Mini-Boss 'Crimson Raptor' has been defeated by Jay, Alex and Stella from 'Wyvern Wrath'!]
[Unlocking a replay for credit purposes!]
He, just like the rest of the people at the canyon who were bored to death waiting, clicked on the video and saw the thirty seconds battle, which ended almost just as quick as it started.
'They are not fucking around,' he mumbled, but immediately grinned as he saw that he had reached the top of the staircase.
He was now at the peak of the mountain, which was basically just a large area of flat ground, and a monument at the end.
But what was most interesting wasn't the monument in itself, instead, it was the giant doors that led to it, and obviously, the silver fog that appeared in the door frame.
He knew from the moment he saw them that they were the doors he had been looking for.
"Alright, time to see what's on the other side," he said to himself as he took a deep breath.
Even though he was excited for what might be waiting on the other side of the door, he couldn't help but feel a bit of unease.
He had battled everything by himself until now, and even went as far as fighting people and monsters much more powerful than he was.
And yet… he felt like that going against the boss of this area alone was a bad idea, almost as bad as attempting to beat the 'Domination' trial alone.
Nevertheless, he took a step forward, placing his hand on the cold, metallic frame of the door, right next to the silver fog.
'Welp… here goes nothing,' he took a step inside of the fog.
But at that exact moment…
"ASSHOLE!" he heard the sound of the wind slashing., and the three classifiers he had seen on the video were now right in front of him, fury in their eyes, "STOP RIGHT THERE!"
'…'
"Y-you are really annoying…' Stella, the nervous beast tamer, mumbled.
"Let's just kick his ass, Jay!" Alex spinned her scepter in her hands.
Stark currently had a foot inside of the silver fog, meaning that he was pretty much guaranteed to pass through alone now.
"I enjoyed the chase," Stark bowed, a chilling grin on his face, "But I think i'll take my leave for now.'
Stark's brother, seing his foot half through the fog, immediately dashed toward him, his 'Wielder Heart' ready to cut him in half.
But he was too late.
"Cya, loser!"
And so, Stark passed through the fog alone.
Jay, of course, tried to follow closely after him as to try and get him on the other side.
But…
[You are currently in the 'Wyvern Wrath' party, cannot enter!]
He was locked out of the boss area since he was already in a party, meaning that Stark had essentially gotten away with everything he did.
And to add even more to the embarassment of getting outsmarted by a level 23 classifier…
[Something INCREDIBLE has happened inside the rift!]
[Unlocking a replay for credit purposes!]
In addition to everyone being able to see who defeated a boss/mini-boss/elite enemy, when something spectacular happened inside of a Secret Rift (or any rift that was at Hell difficulty or above), such replays would be available for everyone to see.
And the fact a level 23 classifier escaped the 7 members of the 'Wyvern Wrath' group could only be deemed as spectacular by the 'Greater Force' that judged such things.
"No way," Stark's brother's eyes widened as he saw the panel, and he clicked on it reluctantly, sensing that he would see something he would regret.
And as expect…
Whether it was at the start of the rift, in the forest, the canyon, and even those that passed it and were heading toward the stairs of the mountain… everyone could see the chase between Stark and the 7 members of the group.
From the beginning to its end, from the moment Stark stunned the blue-haired man to him reaching the boss area.
It was visible for everyone to see.
And so immediately, the 'Wyvern Wrath' group was humiliated, and given the name 'Cannot catch up to a level 23 bunny!'
"YOU ASSHOOLLLLEEEEEEEEE," Jay shouted as hard as he could, blood pouring out from his mouth because of how hard he bit his tongue.

chapters.title: Chapter 77 - 77: The Shadow Monument
chapters.content:
'Stark…' Lana was astonished, looking at the video that was playing before her felt unreal, and it almost made her vomit each time she saw how close Stark was to die, 'What the hell is wrong with you…'
She closed her eyes, not even daring to watch it until the end.
Instead, she just looked at the rest of the people still in the canyon who were watching the video to its end.
And after a few minutes…
"That bastard is insane," Thorn's eyes widened, then he laughed, "He is actually insane, there is no way…"
"Lana, how did you find and bring someone so… crazy?" Stella (yes, she has the same name as the pink hair) looked at the blonde-haired archer with an open mouth.
"…" Lana couldn't understand as she didn't have the guts to finish the video, but immediately pieced the information together thanks to all the talk around her.
"How the fuck is a level 20 or so as fast as an up-and-rising elite group that are each over level 100?"
"Doesn't make sense, and did you see how he kept avoiding their attacks?"
"Am I the only one who saw how he got rid of Mark (blue-hair), Tyson (dark-skinned man) and the Elona twins?"
'Phew…' he sighed in relief, thanking whoever was above for allowing Stark to live.
But if he had succesfully escaped from them.
It only meant one thing…
[Someone had entered the BOSS area!]
Such a panel came to confirm everyone's suspicions, and so now all they needed to do was wait in hopes of Stark dying inside the boss area to hopefully catch up.
"Interesting…" Vex smiled, "Very… very… interesting…"
The 'bunny-masked man' was already becoming the talk of the rift, and soon enough of the entire world once all these highlights get out.
He was low-level, yet extremely strong and shrouded in mystery.
"Who is he…" was everyone's sole question.
***
[Boss Area: "The Shadow Monument"]
[Warning! Your level is too low, it is advised to turn back!]
[Warning! You will suffer, please turn back!]
[Warning! One of the fifteen 'Godless Demons' member is on the other side, please go back!]
Of course, no matter how many messages appeared around Stark, he would keep going.
He could hear the pleads of the souls, his vision completely blocked by the fog as he kept advancing for a seemingly endless amount of time.
As the messages warning him to turn back sounded, Stark gritted his teeth and pushed forward, determined to face the boss. He knew it would be a difficult battle, but the thrill of the unknown kept him going.
Finally, after what felt like hours of walking through the fog, he reached the end of the tunnel, and passed through it…
The boss area was bathed in a deep blue light, casting eerie shadows on the ground.
He was in a very small chamber, and around him were walls with intricate and uncomprehensible scriptures.
And in front of him was a giant door: it was the final thing that separated him from the boss.
'…' Stark opened his [Spatial Inventory] and took both the [Conjoined Warrior's Cloak] and the [Max Health Potion] from the void.
~GULP, GULP~
He drank up the entirety of the green liquid inside the glass, and immediately, he felt all his wounds being closed, as well as his strength, stamina, and HP recovering.
[Level:] 23
[Health:] 8900/8900
[Bloodline:] Human
[Class:] Domination
[Talent:] Chosen one
[Attributes:] Strength 887; Speed 997; Mind/Soul 1184; Stamina 773; Defense 806
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv10; Focus lv5; Aura Smash lv6; Clone Frenzy lv5; Invincible Dodge lv2; Double Assault lv1…
…
[Skill Points: 2 Available]
[You have upgraded 'Double Assault' to level 2!]
[You have upgraded 'Double Assault' to level 3!]
He knew this skill would be his saving grace inside this monument area, so that's why he decided to upgrade it.
Then he wore the [Conjoined Warrior's Cloak] around his head and upper half.
[Special Perk:] Wearing this cloak while fighting will result in the chance of inflicting a critical hit on your opponent (dealing massive damage), the chance is only 5%.
"Alright, here we go," Stark said to himself, mentally preparing for the upcoming battle.
He took a deep breath, stepped forward, and pushed the door wide open.
There was a path drawn from the door he had opened to the end of the giant room by a giant red carpet, dozens of pillars placed across the room in random positions.
It looked like he was in an empty museum, although there was no furnitures or anything of interest other than the pillars and the white walls, which were still inscribed with weird symbols and text, one of them reading: "The apostles want revenge…"
And at the very end of the room, at the end of the red carpet… stood a stone statue, placed on a giant display which ressembled those from colosseum's.
The statue was that of an angel with pitch dark wings on its back, a crimson sword with spikes coming out randomly from its sides, and a crown with pointy edges was placed on its head.
The statue was surrounded by a red mist, making it very hard to see the actual figure.
It didn't take a genius to figure out that this was the boss of the 'Shadow Monument'.
He began walking toward it, the statue was two times Stark's size, which was still relatively smaller than most other monsters or bosses he had faced.
As he got closer to the statue, he noticed another inscribed text on the walls, and it read: "The Chosen One shall come face to face with their destiny…"
'Chosen…' that was his code name, and also the name of his talent, but it's only a coincidence, right?
And when he was ten meters away from the statue… he heard a voice coming from all directions, making it impossible to pin point its source, yet he knew that it was the angel who spoke.
"The Chosen One has appeared…" its voice was like a mixture of a deep and resonant echo, filled with an ominous aura that sent a shiver down Stark's spine.
~BOOM~
The layer of stone that formed the statue desintegrated, forcing Stark to back away if he didn't want to get it.
And suddenly… it started moving, jumping from the display to the ground of the chamber, its crimson sword in its hands, and its crown and wings shining from the deep blue aura that emanated from above.
"You have come alone, it is your biggest mistake," a powerful aura surrounded the angel as it began walking toward Stark, a neutral expression on its face.
'Alright… let's go…'
[Judicator, the Fallen Angel (BOSS)]

chapters.title: Chapter 78 - 78: Judicator, the Fallen Angel
chapters.content:
The room was now filled with a sense of tension, as Judicator, the Fallen Angel, began to close the distance between it and Stark.
The two figures were facing one another, locked in a battle of wills, and perhaps soon, of physical prowess as well since they weren't that far from each other.
"Your destiny ends here, human, for I, one of the apostles of the 'Godless Demons' will erase your puny existence from this place!" its sword glew ten times as bright.
"Lots of talk for someone who is about to die," Stark smiled, activating [Domination] as well as he couldn't allow himself to be overpowered before activating his skill, that boss seemed extremely powerful.
"Let us see, then…" it's pitch black eyes began glowing with a golden light that almost felt like it was sucking up the atmosphere of the chamber.
Then…
~FLAP, FLAP~
Judicator spread its dark wings and began flying in the air as it flapped them repeatedly, slowly but surely still approaching Stark, a wide smile on its face.
"This is only the beginning, and once I get rid of you, I will exit this place and show your kind the terror the 'Godless Demons' will bring to you all…"
"Stop yapping and just get this over with!" Stark retorked, he really disliked mysterious talk for no reason.
"…" Judicator rolled his eyes and dived toward Stark, his crimson sword with spikes all over it aimed to cut the boy's head off.
"PERCEPTION!"
…
[Name: Judicator, The Fallen Angel (BOSS - Godless Demon Apostle)]
[Level: 60]
[HP: 245000]
[Strength: 2172]
[Stamina: 1243]
[Speed: 1827]
[Defense: 1079]
[Skills: Furious Strike, Crimson Reaper, Divine Blindness, Celestial Punches, Angel's Eyes, Wind Absorption, Body of a Saint, Anger of the Fallen, Holy Aura…]
…
"Furious Strike!" the angel used his most common skill and swung his crimson sword at Stark.
"Focus!" Stark's eyes began glowing with aura as he saw the attack a micro-second before it hit him, and so he crouched at the perfect moment.
~SLASH~
The blade missed Stark by a hair's breadth.
"You're not bad," Judicator said, with a hint of respect in his voice, "But you still don't stand a chance."
~BOOM, BOOM,BOOM~
Stark heard an explosion behind him, and he realized that when Judicator slashed the air, a trail of crescent crimson aura was sent toward some of the pillars of the chamber, passing through them and destroying them all.
"NANI?" Stark's eyes widened and sweat poured from his forehead, this was supposed to be the aftermath of the angel's most common attack…?
"AURA SMASH!" Stark focused his aura into his two fists while rolling away, then sent them toward the angel.
~FWISH~
"Interesting… let us see how well your attacks do against my sword!" the angel grinned, positioning himself like a baseball player trying to hit a ball.
~STRIKE~
But of course, he didn't know that such attacks from Stark couldn't be deflected…
"BOOM! BOOM!" he was hit twice while trying to cut the fists in half.
"-16251! -15728!"
But surprisingly enough, once the smoke from the explosion disappeared, Judicator stood there, at the same spot, unfazed, almost as if he hadn't just received 30k damage.
"Hm~ seems like I cannot cut such attacks, what an interesting way of fighting…" he looked like he was actually having fun, everything was but a game for him.
Stark looked at Judicator, his expression unchanged. He had never seen an opponent who could take that much damage and not be affected.
This was not going to be an easy fight.
"CRIMSON SPEARS!" he summoned the three spears beside his body, then crossed his arms, a trail of aura pouring from his eyes, "Let's see how well you can do then, angel!"
"You use your hands… huh… =)" Judicator exclaimed, dropping to the ground and setting his crimson sword aside.
He put both of his palms together before shouting: "CELESTIAL PUNCHES!"
And suddenly, his hands glowed with a golden/divine aura, and with a loud roar, he hurled himself at Stark like a meteor.
Stark sent his spears toward the angel with a calm expression, getting ready for impact.
But… the angel avoided the first two, and even grabbed the third one to break it in half.
The room was filled with an electrifying atmosphere as Stark and Judicator engaged in their intense battle.
This wasn't a fight between sword and fists now, it was a full on boxing match.
~BAM, BAM, BAM~
Stark blocked the blows from the angel using his fists.
"-1! -1! -1!"
Then he would try to sneak in an attack on Judicator, who just avoided it using his wings, which gave him a slight speed boost every time he flapped them.
This was an unfair match to begin, and so Stark needed to figure out a way to get him out of his tail since he seemed a bit faster and stronger than he was.
"GOTCHA!" Judicator laughed as he grabbed Stark's shirt and sent him against one of the marble pillars of the chamber.
~CRASH~
"-3147!" Stark equipped his 'protective barrier', which tanked the blow, but it was still too much.
The pillar he had hit crumbled from the sheer strength of the throw and also because of how durable Stark's body was when surrounded by aura.
"Shit…" he wiped the blood that came from his mouth, and got ready for another barrage of attacks as he saw that Judicator was dashing at him using the speed boost he was getting from flapping his wings, 'Those damn wings…'
Stark gritted his teeth, his eyes entirely focused on the wings, not even paying attention to Judicator who was approaching.
And if he wanted to hit that angel… if he wanted to win… he would need to get rid of them.
"You're no fun anymore!" Judicator laughed, his perfect face contorted into a large grimace as he prepared to punch Stark and end his life.
"CELESTIAL PUNCH!"
Stark didn't back down, he felt like he had an idea and decided to go for it.
~FWISH~
He grabbed the first hand that came toward him with his own aura-filled one.
"-272!" it caused some damage, but it was worth it, he hoped.
"CELESTIAL PUNCH!" Judicator used the skill again, this time tried to kill Stark with his free hand.
But Stark did it again, now grabbing of the angel's hands with his own.
"Is that your plan?" Judicator smiled, increasing the strength of his hands and moving forward, pushing Stark.
"No…" Stark smiled as he looked up.
And then…
He pulled his head back, then filled his forehead with an immense amount of aura.
~SMASH~
With a surge of power, Stark headbutted the fallen angel's face, sending him flying back with tremendous force.
"-21826!" his forehead was really solid, maybe because he was so smart (heh).
"You little…" Judicator was taken aback, his nose bleeding from the impact.
But before he could do anything else as he was recovering…
Stark was already behind him.
"…?" Judicator felt the aura behind him, and for the first time, he lost his smile, sensing that whatever was behind him wasn't something he could joke around with.
"I'LL TEAR THOSE WINGS FROM YOU," Stark shouted then jumped on the angel's back.
And in addition to that situation Stark was put in…
Whatever was happening inside the monument…
Everyone was seeing it from the outside.

chapters.title: Chapter 79 - 79: Battle Against an Angel
chapters.content:
Outside the 'Shadow Monument', there was a screen panel in front of everyone.
It appeared as soon as Stark traversed the silver fog and opened the doors of the monument's chamber.
And the content was obvious: it was live footage of Stark vs Judicator, footage anyone could watch, and just as expected, everyone did.
"Huh…" Vex scratched his chin, he was surprised.
And he wasn't the only one: "Judicator, The Fallen Angel" was one of the 'Godless Demon's' apostles, and an extremely powerful foe.
Even people that were level 85-100 could struggle against him because of his variety of skills and high damage output, and yet… Stark went to fight him alone.
"…" Jack didn't even say anything this time, he had said the phrase 'he is dead' way too many times and had been proven wrong each time, so now he waited for Stark's death, although he really wanted to say it.
All around the rift, people stopped what they were doing and watched the live feed in disbelief.
'…' Lana had the blankest of expressions on her face, wondering just how could Stark get in such situations EVERY SINGLE TIME!
"Are they seriously boxing?" someone joked upon the feed showing Stark and Judicator exchange in a battle of hands.
"That boss dropped his sword to throw hands with that kid? Seriously?" Thorn shrugged, he would have enjoyed being in Stark's place to decimate the boss, but oh well.
~CRASH~
~FWISH~
~SMASH~
They watched the entire interaction of Stark being sent away and then turning the tides by headbutting the angel.
And now, back to the black-haired boy, he was right behind the angel, his face completely hidden except for his eyes and the wide smile on his face.
He grabbed onto the angel's back, not letting go, then immediately began pulling on its two wings.
"YOU LITTLE-" Judicator knew what Stark was trying to do, and he wouldn't allow him to.
He flapped his wings as hard as he could, trying to get Stark off his back, but Stark held on, still trying to get those damn wings off its back.
Seeing that it wasn't working, the angel decided to opt for plan B: fly everywhere at crazy speed.
"WIND ABSORPTION!"
Judicator used his wings to the fullest, creating a massive whirlwind of air around them as they spiraled through the chamber, fazing through several pillars.
Stark hung on for dear life, clutching the fallen angel's wings as tightly as he could, trying to maintain his grip amidst the chaotic windstorm.
Despite his incredible speed, Judicator knew that Stark's aura-fueled strength would not allow him to be shaken off easily. He needed a new strategy, and fast.
"CRASHED AGAINS'T A WALL IF YOU WANT TO HOLD ON SO MUCH!" the fallen angel shouted before heading toward a wall, planning to turn at the last second for Stark to be turned into a pancake from the impact.
But…
'Too strong…' Stark believed as he had put all his strength yet the wings weren't budging, 'In that case…'
~TURN~
Using the angel's wings like some sort of wheel, he spinned them, resulting in completely uno reversing the angel and making it crash against the wall instead of him.
"-12928!"
Stark jumped from the angel's back, and then…
"AURA SMASH!" he sent two fists toward it while it was still recovering from its own attack.
~BOOM, BOOM~
"-21352! -24721!"
[Enemy stunned!]
But beyond the fog from all the destruction, Judicator still got up, his chilling smile now replaced by a face full of madness.
Stark could see why he was a fallen angel now, because he looked more like a devil.
['Stun' doesn't work on 'Judicator!']
"You… will… DIE!" Judicator shouted, and the aura around him tripled in volume, his arms positioned in a weird angle.
"HOLY AURA!"
"Heh… almost looks like he is going super saiya-"
~ZAP~
"-100!" he was hit by another strike of lightning from god knows where.
[Please no copyright issues]
"…Fair."
Judicator's black eyes, glowing with a strange aura, locked onto Stark as he grinned widely.
With a quick motion of his left arm, his crimson sword, previously discarded on the ground, flew back into his hand and pointed directly at Stark.
But that wasn't all…
"CRIMSON REAPER!"
Another weapon appeared in his free hand, and as guessed by he skill's name, it was a magnificent shining scythe, one that had glowing runes etched into its silver blade.
"They call me Judicator since I was the judge of the unfortunate souls who met me, you shall learn what it is to fear!" he lifted both weapons in his hands.
"H-His power level… it's over 9000!" Stark gulped, even he could sense that this was dangerous.
The angel didn't have one, but two weapons, and he was able to perfectly manipulate them.
Reluctantly, Stark put his hands in front of his face, ready to try and deflect whatever was coming.
"FURIOUS STRIKE!"
Judicator threw both weapons a Stark with incredible force, the shining scythe slashing through the air like a bolt of lightning, while the crimson sword created a trail of crimson fire as it rushed to meet its target.
"YOU WILL BE JUDGED, HUMAN!"
As the weapons streaked towards him, Stark's face twisted into a grimace of determination. He released a burst of aura, his entire body glowing with intense power.
"CELESTIAL PUNCH," but Judicator wouldn't let him avoid so easily, so he immediately dashed toward Stark, meaning that three different attacks were heading toward the boy.
Stark leaped to the side, avoidig Judicator's dual weapons.
"GOTCHA!" but the angel was now already in front of Stark, his fists centimeters away from his face.
Under normal circumstances, this would be an attack impossible to avoid, meaning that it was certain death.
But not only did Stark have his shadow from the [Purgatory Shadows] ring which could take a hit for him since he hadn't used it in a while, but also…
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!"
Stark fazed right through the angel's punch, who was taken aback as he had expected to fell Stark's flesh on his holy fist, yet, the boy was behind him…
"=)"
Stark got behind Judicator and smashed his head while he lost his balance.
"-27361!"
"S-SUCH PUNY AND WEAK TRICKS, YOU BASTARD!"
"Yeah yeah blah blah blah," Stark didn't let him go with a single attack, and punched the angel, sending him flying against another pillar.
"-23726! -7362!"
"…"
[Judicator HP: 73745/245000]
"…"
Judicator wasn't moving, his body on the ground, and his face looking at the floor, his pupils were moving like crazy, a sign of his growing madness.
"This…"
"?" Stark tilted his head.
"This is…" Judicator began to get up, "THIS IS THE END!"
He summoned both his weapons in his hands, and then…
"ANGER OF THE FALLEN! BODY OF A SAINT!" he activated not just one, but two of his ultimate skills.

chapters.title: Chapter 80 - 80: Cut in Half?
chapters.content:
As the room shook from the intense power of Judicator's ultimate skills, Stark knew that this was the moment where he would either be annihilated or be victorious.
"CLONE FRENZY-" Stark tried to summon his two clones to aid him, not even taking the time to analyze Judicator's new appearance although it seemed like he had changed.
But…
~FWISH~
In a fraction of a second, Judicator was already in front of him, his scythe and sword right beside his head.
'Huh…?' he didn't understand how this was possible, how could he be so fast.
Time seemed to slow down around him thanks to [Focus], and so he used that opportunity to read about the two ultimate skills of the fallen angel.
…
[Skill: Anger of the Fallen]
[Description:] The angel has fallen from its grace, and now all it seeks is revenge against those that tried to kill it, this skill grants 'Judicator' a temporary boost on all stats depending of his anger at the moment
…
[Skill: Body of a Saint]
[Description:] An angel remains an angel, no matter their current status, this skill allows 'Judicator' to transform his body using his 'Divine Aura', his entire body will be surrounded by that aura, increasing his defense immensely and also making him look really cool
…
'…' Stark decided to use the [Purgatory Shadows] ring as his [Invincible Dodge] was on cooldown.
~SLASH, SLASH~
The angel attacked Stark from both sides, hoping to decapitate him, but…
[The Purgatory Shadow took the hit in your place]
A shadow version of himself appeared on both sides of his head to take on both attacks, giving Stark the time to attempt to hit the angel.
He had just observed it now, but the angel's appearance had changed, his skin didn't look human-like anymore.
Instead… it was dyed in platinum, making him look very shiny.
~SLAM~
Stark smashed the angel's face with full force.
"-4837!"
"OUCH!" Stark shook his hand repeatedly, he had dealt damage to the angel, but his hand was hurting a lot now, it was almost as if he had hit an actual wall of platinum (no one has ever done that).
"Angel's Eyes," the platinum Judicator smiled as his eyes began glowing even brighter, "Now… none of your moves will work…"
Stark clenched his fist, feeling the burning pain in his hand. His opponent had somehow become even stronger and more durable.
And what was that [Angel's Eyes] skill anyway?
"I see all paths, I see all possible attacks, you cannot defeat me, FOOL!"
This was true, as [Angel's Eyes] basically showed every move an opponent could do, which meant that currently, he could see shadows of Stark try all sort of things, whether it was throw the crimson fists or spears, dash at him, stand back to defend himself, or die, he saw it all.
"It is my victory…" however, something strange happened as the angel spoke those words: a sigh escaped him, perhaps because he had considered the possibility of losing for a brief moment, after all, Stark had surprised him.
But at the end of it all…
~FWISH~
Only one would emerge victorious from this confrontation.
~SWISH, DODGE, SLAM~
"-3726!" Stark deftly avoided the angel's attacks and quickly adapted to his speed. He even managed to land some hits on the angel (although they were very painful).
Still, the angel continued to attack with calm determination.
Because deep down, he knew he wouldn't lose - he had seen it in his visions.
~THROW~
He threw his scythe towards Stark, who crouched to evade it.
And then…
"DIVINE BLINDNESS," the angel raised his sword with a golden aura glinting at its edge.
And in that split second when Stark looked at the light... he was completely blinded.
Divine Blindness worked like this: the more sins you had committed, the brighter and more blinding the divine light became.
Needless to say, Stark wasn't a saint.
"FUCK!" he shouted, his vision was completely yellow, and the only thing he could see was a reversed crimson cross that appeared before him, almost as if the angel was mocking him.
"Goodbye, human."
Judicator summoned his scythe back, sending it flying in the opposite direction toward his free hand while it was positioned behind Stark.
And so what had to happen happened.
~SLASH~
Stark's body was sliced cleanly in half.
"-54152!" The damage was critical, but ultimately unnecessary since...
[Stark HP: 0/8900]
And so, the black-haired boy let out a painful gasp and fell to the floor, his upper and lower body separated.
Outside the [Shadow Monument], people from all class and levels gasped in shock.
"…" Even Jack didn't even dare say that he knew Stark would die, proof that whatever just happened was truly shocking.
"N-No way…" Lana put her hand against her mouth, tears forming in her eyes.
"Ah shit… we need to watch out for this angel guy..." Thorn scratched the back of his head.
The sight of someone getting cut in half and dying wasn't surprising to most, but this time, for some strange reasons, they felt emotions they had never felt before.
In the end, all of them thought of one thing: we need to get rid of that angel before he becomes too powerful.
Just observing his skills and powers, they knew that thing was no joke.
Almost all had seemingly already accepted Stark's death, and honestly, it wasn't their fault since who would survive after such an attack?
Inside the monument, Judicator gazed at the floor at Stark's half-cut body, feeling his power at its peak: he had won.
"You were… interesting… but still weak," he turned around, heading toward the display where he had been standing previously to rest and recover his HP.
He didn't see any visions anymore, meaning that Stark's heart had truly stopped beating, confirming his victory.
He didn't deactivate his skills though, his body was still dyed in platinum, and he still held his two weapons in case any other intruders wanted to defy him.
"It's our turn soon," Jay, Stark's brother, remarked to his two companions who were still at the top of the mountain, "Let's kill that boss and get all the fame!"
"Yeah!" the two girls nodded.
But there was something strange.
Thirty seconds had passed, yet they were still not allowed to enter the boss area.
"What is happening?"
"Huh…?"
"Maybe we have to wait?"
Usually, when someone or a party gets completely annihilated, a message appears to confirm that they lost, and that the boss area is now open again, yet there had been nothing of this sort for some reason.
The camera was centered on Judicator's body, the entirety of the rift seeing his handsome platinum face slowly walk toward his rest area.
None of them could see what was happening behind…
And that was great, as it would make the surprise even better.
Suddenly, Stark's body began to convulse, and a bright crimson light illuminated the area where he had been cut in two.
~TREMBLE, FWISHHHH~
Strands of crimson aura intertwined between the two parts of his body, and within moments, Stark was fully restored as if nothing had ever happened.
[Talent: Chosen One, activated]
[Stark HP: 1/8900]
Stark immediately understood that he had died, and that he had been saved by his talent.
A vortex of crimson aura that sucked the air off the room could be seen in his eyes: he wasn't kidding anymore, he was more serious than ever before.
And so… he slowly got up from the cold ground, ready to end this battle.

chapters.title: Chapter 81 - 81: Death of the Fallen Angel
chapters.content:
The Shadow Monument boss chamber was quiet.
Way too quiet.
The only thing people outside of it could hear were the slow footsteps of Judicator as he headed toward his display to rest: he couldn't deny the battle against Stark put a toll on him.
Behind him, Stark stood up, a wide smile on his face although he was completely serious on the inside.
'Heh~ not as hard and painful as my accounting exam back then,' he shrugged, even finding the time to joke in such a situation.
Although Stark was revived thanks to his [Chosen One] talent, it didn't mean he didn't feel anything, actually, it was the total opposite: he was in constant pain.
But it was only physical, his mental fortitude too strong to succumb to such things.
"Clone Frenzy!" wind blew through his hair as he calmly lifted his arms and summoned his clones beside him.
They had the same tired eyes and blank expressions on their faces, just looking at Stark, knowing what they needed to do.
'Let's get this over with,' one of the clones nodded, they couldn't talk, but Stark just guessed thanks to its body language.
'Alright… kill this asshole,' the other one smiled.
"Damn right," Stark winked, his opened eye glowing not with a crimson… but blue aura?
"""DOUBLE ASSAULT!!!""" all three activated the legendary skill, and without a single second of doubt… dashed toward Judicator, who wasn't suspecting a single thing.
Inside the rift, people could still see Judicator's figure head toward its display.
"How long do we have to watch this guy?"
"Just open the damn boss area already, I wanna see who goes next!"
People were getting impatient after seeing Stark's death, knowing that it was already over for the 'bunny-masked guy' that had caused so much trouble.
"…" Lana shook her head frantically, unable to understand how THE Stark, the one that had always been so confident, could lose while he had only started his journey.
Maybe he had truly pushed his luck.
She kept looking at the floor for a good minute, not accepting reality.
Until…
"Hey, what is that…?" someone suddenly said, pointing at their screen.
"Yeah, there's something weird on my screen?"
"Me too! What's that in the back…?"
People began to speak about weird things, and quickly, all the others decided to check their screens.
And it was true: behind Judicator, three small points appeared, heading at incredible speed toward him.
The camera zoomed out…
~FWISH~
And right behind Judicator…
"HOW?"
"NO WAY?"
Three Stark(s) could be seen behind him, all their eyes glowing with a deep aura.
But their aura had changed, it wasn't only crimson anymore, no… now it was also blue, resembling some kind of blue fire that could never go out.
The life-threatening situation, his talent usage, his determination, and the upgrade of his [Domination] skill, all of that led to Stark's aura to change.
It was almost purely visual, but to him, it meant that he had grown.
"…?" Lana's eyes widened as she saw Stark smiling right behind an unsuspecting boss.
And then… the fight continued.
"It's over…" he whispered at the fallen angel's ears, sending a chill down its spine.
"…?" Judicator didn't have the time to turn around that…
~SWASH, SWASH~
Stark's two clones grabbed the angel's wings and ripped them right off his back, their increased strength enough to do that easily.
"AHHHHHH!" the angel shouted in pain, losing his balance as he had lost two of his most important things, "Y-YOU LITTLE, HOW ARE YOU NOT DEAD-"
He didn't have the time to finish his sentence that Stark punched his face.
"-15837!" his stats were still upgraded from [Anger of the Fallen], and his body still dyed in that platinum texture that increased his defense.
And yet… that punch hurt like hell.
Stark's hand didn't hurt this time, his entire fists, face, and body surrounded by that crimson/blue fire as his auras were now mixed.
Of course, Stark's clones didn't just sit around and do nothing while their leader punched Judicator, they just dropped the pitch-black wings on the ground as they were useless now, and dashed at the angel, who fell to the ground from the punch.
"Y-YOU, YOU FUCKING CHEATER!" Judicator shouted as hard as he could, trying to get up, and sending his scythe toward the human.
But Stark didn't even bother to avoid it.
Instead…
~GRAB~
He grabbed the scythe's handle and broke it using his hands and knees.
"No more weapons," Stark looked at Judicator while throwing his scythe away in front of his face.
"I-I still got my-" Judicator tried to dash toward Stark with his crimson blade, after all Stark couldn't have that much HP after being cut in half.
But the clones both grabbed Judicator's shoulders, stopping him from moving.
And once he looked back to see what was happening…
~SLAM~
One of the clone's smashed his face while the other took the blade from his hands.
"-13724!"
The angel was unarmed and stepped back, trying to back away from the clones as he felt that even they could defeat him.
"You can't run," Stark appeared under Judicator and punched his jaw from below, sending him flying toward a pillar.
"-21721! -3937!"
By this point, both of his ultimate skills had been nullified, meaning that his skin was back to normal, and his stats too.
'How… is this… possible' he lay against the bottom of the pillar he had landed against, his body too weak to do anything, and his eyes slowly closing, 'I… I killed him… and yet…'
Stark and his clones were advancing toward Judicator, a blank expression on their faces.
"M…Monster…" this was the only word he could utter as Stark's face was now right in front of his, a wide smile spread across it, one that made his skin crawl.
"No matter what you try, even if you kill me again, and even if you reincarnate to another rift… i'll be sure to find you and end your miserable life…"
Boss monsters aren't supposed to feel fear, their sole goal was to cause trouble to classifiers from their sheer confidence, and yet… even he, an apostle of the 'Godless Demon', could see that this boy was something else…
"Angel's Eyes!" his eyes glew bright, and he smiled as he looked at Stark's face, "I knew it…"
Even in the thousands, millions or even billions of different moves that could happen in that very moment, even if he summoned back his weapons in hand or activated his ultimate skills.
Hell… even if he got back all his HP, wings, skills, and weapons…
In not a single one of those visions did he win.
"Bye bye," Judicator just put his head down as he saw Stark ready to charge his final punch, accepting his fate.
~BOOM~
The explosion shook the entire rift, sending tremors through the air.
"-69372!" Judicator gasped in pain before smiling.
"Y-You… are… going to die at some point… do not worry…" then he closed his eyes, and his body disintegrated into a pile of white ash.
Nobody in the outside audience dared to cheer or celebrate, the atmosphere was heavy, and the silence was deafening.
[The BOSS of the Secret Rift has been defeated by REDACTED!]

chapters.title: Chapter 82 - 82: Level 25 Reached
chapters.content:
After a few minutes of shock and disbelief, a sudden sigh sent everyone's attention back to their screens.
"Phew~~" Stark fell to his knees, and his clones disappeared, their aura seeping back into his body, "That was… an experience…"
They had seen the fight, they had seen the bunny-masked guy defeat the boss, and yet…
They still couldn't believe it.
Questions such as "how is this possible" or "how did he do that" kept popping left and right.
But the biggest mystery of them all was…
"HOW DID HE SURVIVE BEING CUT IN HALF!"
Lana sat there in stunned silence, her eyes wide with disbelief and awe.
The fight had been intense, brutal, and impressive as hell.
"Thank you… Stark…" she thanked him for surviving.
"Hey, Lana," Vex and all the other 'Crimson Moon Squad' members approached her, disbelief on their faces, "He is your little boyfriend, so you must know how he did it right, I mean, he fucking came back to LIFE while his HP were at 0, we all saw it!"
"H-Huh?" Lana was taken aback, "W-wait, he is not my boyfriend, and no… I don't know how he did that…"
If she knew that he could do it, she wouldn't have cried.
Once your HP reached zero in this world, there was nothing much you could do in 99.9% of cases, it was immediate death.
Drinking a [Max Health Potion] was only possible if your HP were 1 or higher, and life-saving items like the [Escape Bundle] could allow you to escape a rift if your HP dropped to 0, but that would mean leaving the rift.
Yet Stark hadn't left, and he probably didn't have the money to buy such an expensive thing.
The only other known item that could save someone from death was the [Life Crystal], and there were almost no pieces that were sold in markets because of their sheer rarity, even top powerhouses wouldn't be able to get their hands on it with all the money in the world.
This left two options: it is either a skill even above legendary, probably mythical, godly or even… IMMORTAL!
"Or…" Jack spoke loudly for everyone hear, "It's his talent, a talent so powerful that it could bring you back from the dead…" he scratched his chins.
"We don't know for sure," Old Kai shook his head, "There could be other explanations we just don't know about."
"My ass… i'm gonna stick with my theory," Jack suddenly began walking toward the exit portal that opened nearby, and his team followed closely, "We'll be going, no more business in here if the items were taken and the boss was defeated."
This was all the classifiers outside the boss room could see as the screen suddenly faded to black, now all they could do was wait for Stark to come back, leave the rift as everything would be taken (usually people attempt to steal, but most were dissuaded after seeing everything that happened), or keep fighting inside to hopefully gain experience and level up.
"Welp, let's go, we'll get them next time," Vex shrugged, their squad were from the second category too.
"I think i'll wait here," but Lana shook her head, she needed… no… she WANTED to see Stark.
"Oh well, it's fine then, you'll help him get back too!" Stella smiled and the 'Crimson Moon Squad' began heading toward the exit, which appeared at the edge of the canyon.
"…" Lana sat on the ground, then opened up the 'highlight replay' to rewatch Stark's battle.
***
[You have slain 'Judicator, The Fallen Angel', gained 550000EXP!]
'Holy… that's a lot of experience,' Stark smirked, this was proof that Judicator was truly the strongest opponent he had fought yet, even stronger than the mirror master.
But getting this much EXP could only mean one thing…
[Your level has increased to level 24, granting you one skill point and boost in stats]
'Nice!' Star's eyes widened, he was so close now…
And surprisingly enough… he was surrounded by the golden glow again.
[Your level has increased to level 25, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Experience: 8391/500000]
'I DID IT!' he jumped, the adrenaline granting him a boost in stamina.
But getting to level 25 was much more overwhelming than Stark believed since many panels suddenly appeared around him, taking over his entire surroundings.
It was a new milestone, and a giant one at that.
He calmed down and decided to check them out one by one.
The first thing he noticed was that familiar text: [Level 25 Reached: please pick a card].
Just like all the previous times, three cards appeared before him, their color was orange.
Without hesitation, Stark reached out to pick one.
And once he turned the card, he saw the drawing of a… beam?
…
[Name: Heaven's Wrath]
[Type: Legendary]
[Level: 1]
[Description: Unleash a powerful ray of crimson light from the heavens that destroys all enemies within a certain radius, the damage they receive is only in effect when they are inside the beam, otherwise they won't be damaged if they leave it, cooldown is thirty minutes!]
…
'My first skill to get rid of big amount of monsters, huh?' Stark immediately thought of using that skill on armies of monsters to get rid of them, and it was even better since he could control where the beam would go.
Overall, it was a great skill, but its cooldown was higher than 'Double Assault' for some reason.
After knowing what skill he had gotten from reaching level 25, Stark turned his eyes toward the next panel.
[You have beaten 'Judicator, The Fallen Angel' while being alone (SOLO achievement), granting you AMAZING equipment pieces]
And just as it said, right on top of the pile of ashes that were previously Judicator's body stood not one, not two, nor three, but FOUR equipment pieces, their small lights shining, inviting Stark to take them.
'I'm rich,' Stark nodded, proud of himself.
He crouched and grabbed one of the items to inspect it, it was a pair of black wings, and he immediately knew that these could do as they ressembled those from Judicator.
Most items that came out of monsters/mini-bosses/elites or bosses were related to their monster, so it was pretty obvious.
But right as he was about to check it out…
~TREMBLE~
The entire chamber began shaking violently, and the pillars that were still standing after the battle began to crumble.
'What the…?' Stark thought, he didn't know what was happening.
[The boss has been defeated, the boss area is now crumbling since its power source has died, please leave shortly]
'Ah shit…' Stark didn't waste time and immediately took all the equipment pieces that were on the pile of ash and put them inside his [Spatial Inventory], making sure not to drop anything as it was the rewards of his hard work
And as for the panels… he would check them out later, but he knew that there were many incredible things to uncover from there.
~SHAKE, SHAKE~
The 'Shadow Monument' shook more and more, until eventually, a part of the ceiling almost fell on Stark, which he only avoided thanks to [Invincible Dodge].
'This place is actually crumbling, I need to get out of here, and quick,' Stark mumbled while looking around him, trying to find an exit.

chapters.title: Chapter 83 - 83: The Crimson Moons Trio
chapters.content:
Stark was alone, and the chamber of the 'Shadow Monument' was currently falling apart.
