He needed to find a way out before it was too late.
He took the items from Judicator's ash body, minimized all the panels (but made sure not to close them as he would read them later), then began running and jumping over collapsing debris, while also avoiding the ceiling that was falling on him.
He looked up as a major part of the ceiling was now gone, and he hoped that there could be a way to get out from there since he had technically entered the monument at the top of the mountain.
And yet…
It was pitch black, there was no crimson sky, no clouds, nothing.
Nothing… except for those three giant crimson moons with eyes on them, and they were all staring down at Stark, almost mocking him.
Seeing them blink was disgusting, and Stark couldn't help but shiver at the thought of these things being alive.
[Do not be disgusted by us, puny human!]
[Hah~ he beat the boss and now thinks he is hot shit?]
The moons spoke, they were much closer to him than before, almost as if they were… GETTING CLOSER?
After a few seconds (which kept increasing the amount of damage around the chamber), the ceiling was completely destroyed, and the moons were now so close that Stark could perfectly see their eyes and pupils, he was like an insect in comparison.
…
[Name: The Crimson Moons Trio (Immortal-Level Monsters)]
[Level: ???]
[HP: ???]
[Strength: ???]
[Stamina: ???]
[Speed: ???]
[Defense: ???]
[Skills: ???]
…
Immortal-Level monsters were the 8th category of monsters in this world, even above calamity.
There was not a single chance Stark could win if he fought them.
[Haha~ look at him, so scared!] Stark could hear their voices in his head
[Makes me want to crush him!]
[Don't do that… it's not our time yet!]
They were talking with one another, ignoring Stark who was just standing there, taking in the view of those monsters: he realized that there were truly some things beyond comprehension in this world, and these moons were one of them.
"How do I leave?" Stark shouted at the moons, and the three of them turned their eyes toward him.
[Look at this kid, really getting confident, huh~]
[What's the point of telling if he can't hear us!]
[Yeah, humans can't listen to our holy voices, so just sit and die!]
"Stop talking and tell me already!" he repeated, "Plus your voices are anything but holy!"
And suddenly, the moment he responded to them, all three moons stopped what they were doing and slowly turned their pupils toward Stark.
[…]
[…]
[…]
Even though it was their only feature, Stark could see that they were surprised.
'Fucking hell…' Stark realized that they wouldn't help after a few seconds, and so he looked around again.
The floor of the monument was beginning to crumble too, and just as expected, below was also a black void: it was certain death if he fell.
Thankfully enough, he noticed that on top of the display the fallen angel's statue had been on appeared a portal.
'Phew…' he began running toward it, avoiding the debris and the destroyed floor.
[You… can hear us…]
[Ohoh~ interesting… I think 'Godless' will be interested]
[Hm~ what's the point of telling if he is gonna die anyway?]
And so before they could even finish their sentences or say anything else, Stark jumped into the portal to get out of this place.
He didn't know what the hell had just happened, but it was weird.
***
As Stark emerged from the portal, he came out of the silver fog and found himself at the top of the mountain again.
And as soon as he did that…
~CRUMBLE~
The giant monument that was taking up the majority of the flat mountain top suddenly fell appart, and the silver fog also dissipated.
"Ah shit…" Stark sighed, he had been this close to dying again.
He looked around, but there was nobody, his brother and the 'Wyvern Wrath' group had seemingly already left since they weren't interested in a rift with no rewards anymore.
Honestly, he had expected many classifiers to ambush and steal his items away as soon as he left (which he would have never given because they were in his inventory void), but it seemed like he was wrong.
As Stark began to make his way down the mountain, he couldn't shake the feeling that he was being watched.
He looked up to the sky, and the crimson moons were still there, looking at him, amused expressions on their faces.
[The exit portals are located at the start of the rift and at the death canyon, please head there to leave!]
Such a panel appeared to inform Stark, and he nodded, descending the stairs of the mountain very slowly: winning didn't mean he wasn't injured, and he planned to buy many [Max Health Potions] when he got back.
Even when he walked in the plains, heading toward the canyon, Stark couldn't shake the feeling that he was being hunted by those three crimson moons.
He knew that he had beaten the boss and claimed victory, but he couldn't for a moment believe that he was out of danger.
These things were… terrifying.
But Stark didn't even bother looking too much into it as they couldn't do much if they were so high in the sky, otherwise they would have already killed them all, right?
Soon enough, he reached the death canyon, and he noticed that there weren't that many people remaining as the majority left.
Those that remained were fighting monsters.
After he defeated the boss, a path to pass the canyon had appeared, meaning that anybody could keep going now.
But once he did pass the small bridge that had formed… all eyes fell on him.
All the classifiers stopped what they were doing once they saw him, their faces showing all kinds of emotions.
"…" Stark didn't mind, and he immediately spotted the exit portal.
"W-WAIT!" Stark heard a voice behind him, and once he turned around, he saw that it was Lana, the blonde-haired archer.
"What's up, Lana?" Stark asked, raising an eyebrow, he was so nonchalant about it that it almost looked like he hadn't just killed the rift boss by himself.
Many people were skeptical of Stark, Lana included, they had seen him come back to life, who could guarantee he couldn't do that over and over?
Lana took a deep breath and approached him, looking nervous, "I-I just waited for you since… huh… y-you need a ride back home, right?"
"Oh…" Stark nodded, he felt thankful to her, and out of pure habit, he patted her head, "Thanks!"
"…" Lana's face flushed as she felt Stark's hand on her hair, but she couldn't say she didn't enjoy that feeling, "L-Let's go!"
"Yeah!" Stark replied, already starting to walk towards the portal.
No one dared to approach Stark, some were hesitant since it was obvious that his level didn't indicate how strong he truly was, and others because Lana Moonless was with him, and they feared her father, the Archer King.
In the end, it didn't matter since Stark successfully left the Secret Rift alive.
[Congratulations, Stark Heartsouls, you have completed the Secret Rift 'Shadow Valley'!]

chapters.title: Chapter 84 - 84: Checking Out the Panels
chapters.content:
Stark was now back at the place he was in before even entering the Secret Rift, and around him was still a fair amount of people as many were still discussing their next move with their teammates.
Of course, the moment he exited the rift, all eyes fell on him yet again, but no one said anything, instead it felt like… they were judging him.
"Our car is already waiting for us," Lana said, her face still slightly flushed from Stark patting her head.
"Thanks, I really don't like the atmosphere around here," Stark was extremely tired even though he didn't let it show, and all he wanted by now was to go back to his house to check out the remainder of the panels that had appeared when he reached level 25.
"Let's go, then, climb inside the limousine, my friend!" Lana smiled as she opened the door of the black car and gestured for him to enter like a true gentleman, "Lads first!"
"…" Stark let out a quick smile, which almost made him forget about the battle against Judicator and the stare of the three moons that pierced his soul.
"Thank you my lady," Stark bowed and entered inside the vehicle, then Lana did too and she sat right beside him.
Stark still had his bunny mask on, and he didn't plan to remove it for a while, there was always the possibility of someone chasing after them to find his identity and get revenge after all.
"You know, Lana," Stark began as he adjusted the leather straps of his seatbelt, "I think I did good inside the rift!"
"…" Lana was speechless, "Huh… yeah, I think you did good…?"
Was he seriously joking with her?
And so just like that, the car started moving, and the two of them began returning to Fellarburg.
***
"Zzzzz…" Stark slept rather quickly, it had not even been ten minutes since the car started up that his eyes were closed.
Lana on the other hand was far from tired.
She opened the 'Highlight' screen for the tenth time and checked all the replays from Stark.
She didn't know why, but she had just acquired some sort of obsession with Stark's fights: she found them beautiful.
His techniques, his skills, his ways of getting out of situations, and his unwavering determination, she enjoyed all of it.
Nobody knew that the person behind all of this was Stark Heartsouls except for her and the 'Crimson Moon Squad', and she actually felt proud to be able to have such a secret for herself!
Hours upon hours passed, and Lana kept rewatching Stark's fight against Judicator.
The moment where his cut body suddenly began forming back was hypnotizing, and the way he killed the boss so quickly by completely dominating it was even better.
And yet… the person who did all of this was right beside her, sleeping.
Unconsciously thinking of that, Lana closed the replay screen and approached her beautiful face toward Stark's.
'…' she kept looking at it for a good twenty minutes.
Until…
"We've arrived, my lady," the driver suddenly announced, surprising Lana as she had been in a daze, and it was safe to say she probably would have kept looking at Stark for hours if there were no interruptions.
Lana quickly awoke from her stupor, too surprised to even register the statement from the driver.
She hastily turned her gaze away from Stark.
"Hm~" Stark woke up too since he sensed that the car stopped, "Did we arrive?"
"Yeah," Lana nodded before smiling warmly at him, "We dropped you off in front of your hotel, so just go rest!"
"Oh? Thank you," Stark left the car, and just as Lana said, they were right in front of his hotel.
"No problem, I'll contact you later if anything comes up," Lana waved goodbye to him with a small smile, her eyes lingering on Stark for a moment before she closed the window of the car and let out a sigh.
"Stark Heartsouls," she mumbled under her breath, shaking her head slightly as if trying to clear her thoughts, he was a mysterious guy, and deep inside of her she realized that she didn't really know anything about it beside that he was extremely strong, stronger than his level showed.
She hated to admit it, but he was also much stronger than her, and she felt like that no matter how much she extended her arm to reach for him, she would never be able to do that.
And so she began heading toward her mansion in the luxury district.
Back to Stark, he began to head towards the lobby of the hotel, until a realization hit him.
"Wait a damn minute, how does she know where I live-"
***
Stark didn't waste time and climbed to his room, opening it thanks to his keys (which he put inside the inventory void) and then jumping on the bed.
But surprisingly, he wasn't tired anymore.
'Hm…' Stark got up, he planned to sleep for a good two days again to make up for whatever happened inside that rift, but his body didn't respond no matter how long he closed his eyes.
"Did my body adapt?" maybe his increase in level and stats had made it so that he didn't need to sleep that long after each rift anymore, and that was a good thing.
No.
He was wrong.
And he knew it, instead he just decided to deny the truth.
It wasn't that he wasn't tired anymore, it was just that now that he had already slept inside the car, whenever he tried to close his eyes, the sight of the three crimson moons' pupils looking at him greeted him.
[Funny human… it's futile]
[You can't escape us!]
['Godless' will kill you!]
Even when he was far away, in the actual world, he could still hear their voices.
But in the end, it didn't matter, since this small boost in adrenaline meant he didn't need to sleep anymore.
And that meant one thing and one thing only…
"Open panels," he mumbled, and suddenly, the remainder of the panels that he had minimized previously were there.
He wasn't able to check them all inside the shadow monument since it was falling apart, but now that he was in the safety of his hotel room, he could do whatever he wanted!
He couldn't deny it, but checking those panels brought immense excitement to him, like a child having to wait the night before opening his christmas gifts.
"First panel is…" his eyes wandered toward the first panel to the left, it was the one he hadn't been able to read at that time.
[You have reached level 25, you can now initiate the 'breakthrough' sequence to increase the skill level limit from 10 to 15!]
'Ohoh~ I knew that level 10 couldn't be the last level, it wouldn't make sense,' Stark smiled, this meant that he could upgrade [Domination] and his other skills even more.
But he didn't know what that breakthrough sequence was about, so he would need to check the internet or possibly go to the trader district to buy an item for it (if a panel didn't explain it to him).
Feeling happy, he immediately looked to the right, toward the next panel.
And that's when he saw it.
THE panel he had been waiting for…
[You have reached level 25, congratulations, you can now spin the 'Class Wheel' again!]

chapters.title: Chapter 85 - 85: The ApostleDex
chapters.content:
[You have reached level 25, congratulations, you can now spin the 'Class Wheel' again!]
Stark's heart raced with anticipation as he read those words.
Since the moment he had first spinned the wheel and gotten the Domination class, he had always been waiting to reach level 25.
It was more difficult because of the 'Domination' class's [Hell Mode] curse, but now that he had done it, he felt extremely proud of himself.
He wanted to spin the [Class Wheel] immediately to check out what he could get, and hopefully begin training using his new class as his entire fighting style would change whatever the class he would get was.
But…
[Please read all panels and information before spinning the 'Class Wheel']
He was restricted, and even when he tried to push through and attempted to activate the [Class Wheel] skill…
[You are not allowed to use the wheel for now, please try again later]
'Ah shit…' it wouldn't be long until he was gonna be able to use it anyway, so he just looked to the next panel.
And it was… a surprising one, much more than even the 'Class Wheel'…
[The ApostleDex has been unlocked, please do check it out (you are allowed to right now)]
Stark felt a strange mix of doubt and curiosity at the words, his eyes widening slightly as he scanned the panel.
He had no idea what the ApostleDex was, but the fact that he was allowed to check it out right now intrigued him.
'Sounds like a cheap copy of poke-' he stopped himself before getting struck by another zap, he had learned from his lessons.
But basically, it was something he knew from his past life.
In the end, he decided to check it out as there was no reason not to.
He clicked on the 'ApostleDex' word since it was highlighted, and suddenly, another crimson panel appeared before him.
But instead of the normal ones which only contained text, this one looked more like a quest window.
On it were 15 square cases, meaning three lines of 5.
The title: "Godless Demon Apostles" could be seen written in white above them.
And as for the content of the cases… well… it was basically like in any video game.
Each one of the cases represented one of the Godless Demon's apostles.
The first two of the first line had the images of [Malakar] and of [Judicator], the two bosses he had fought, and of course, there was a giant X on them as they had been defeated.
The rest of the apostles couldn't be seen, instead, all Stark could see was their shadows inside of the square cases, with no way to know of their appearances until he saw them.
It was truly like some kind of 'Assassination' quest inside of a game, where he would need to find all of them and kill them all.
Or at least… that's what he believed, since when his eyes slowly moved to the 5th square of the second line… it wasn't a shadow that he was seeing, but an actual image of the apostle that is supposed to be there.
And it was one he had already seen before.
[Crimson Moons Trio] was written below the image of the three moons with a giant eye on them.
'…' Stark's eyes widened, he had figured out that those things must be part of the 'Godless Demon' group, but he couldn't believe that they could be fought.
They were massive monsters, and he looked like an insect in comparison to their sizes, there was no way he could fight them, right?
And yet…
[Upon defeating 5 of the apostles, you will receive a MYTHICAL reward!]
[Upon defeating 10 of the apostles, you will receive a GODLY reward!]
[Upon defeating 15 of the apostles, you will receive an IMMORTAL reward!]
He immediately reminisced the different categories for skills and items: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Epic, Legendary, Mythical, Godly, Immortal.
This meant that he would get something incredible after each milestone he reached.
It was a massive risk to fight those bosses, but the rewards given for that were also amazing.
High risk, high reward, basically.
And in the end… the fact that he could be rewarded for killing them all meant that the [Crimson Moons Trio] could be defeated at some point.
At the very end of the window, a pair of black eyes could be seen, ones that looked like they were piercing his soul.
And right above those eyes… stood a crimson text.
[Upon defeating all of the apostles… you will be allowed to meet the 'Godless Demon']
[Enjoy!]
Before he could do anything else, all the panels related to the [ApostleDex] closed, and there was no way for him to open it back up for now until he checked out all the other information.
"Wow, this is a lot to process," Stark muttered to himself as he looked at the remaining two panels.
He knew he had to keep going, though, because there was no way of knowing what these two panels might contain.
[Survey: Are You Happy?]
[Y/N]
'…' Stark titled his head, this was just becoming confusing at this point.
"I guess I am…?" he clicked on yes.
[Thank you for the answer, see you later for the next survey =)]
And so that panel also disappeared.
'What the actual fuck?' Stark didn't even know the purpose of such a thing.
But deep down… he felt that the [Survey] would be important, so he kept it in mind… just in case.
And so now, there was only one panel remaining.
It was different from all the others: it wasn't crimson or blue, instead… it was entirely black, and its edges were moving like waves, almost as if it was alive.
[You have proven your strength…]
The panel was black with no text on it, but as soon as he lay his eyes on it, white text started slowly appearing.
[But you need to be stronger…]
[Thus, you have been granted access to the…]
[MEMORIES MUSEUM]
'Huh…' the text stopped as soon as the words 'Memories Museum' appeared, and after a few seconds resumed.
[Inside of the memories museum, you will be able to access the memories of your previous battles and fight the bosses you have already defeated inside the arena to increase your technique…]
[Note that you can only relive the memories of the bosses you have fought!]
[The museum serves only one purpose: training, fight against the bosses you have already beaten and find new ways and techniques to come out victorious]
[You can now access the museum, good luck!]
And before he could even say anything since he was speechless, a black door that emanated a dark aura appeared in front of him.
'…' Stark looked at the door in front of him with widened eyes, but then clenched his fists and stepped forward.
Deep inside, he really wanted to see what this was all about.

chapters.title: Chapter 86 - 86: The Memories Museum
chapters.content:
As he stepped through the dark portal, Stark found himself in an entirely different realm.
When he was transported to the 'Domination trial' or when he dreamt about meeting with his doppelgänger, he didn't actually leave the real world, instead his physical body stayed behind.
But this time, his body had actually gone somewhere else from his hotel room, and it was safe to say nobody would find him if he decided to stay here.
'At least I know how to escape the cops or assassins,' he smiled before looking around the area.
He was inside the 'Memories Museum'.
It was a large space with a red carpet rolling down toward an endless hall that seemed to never end.
[Welcome to the 'Memories Museum', please select the memory(ies) you want to experience!]
On both sides of the hall (which weren't very far from him) were marble displays, and on top of these displays weren't any sort of item or statue, but an image shaped like a thought bubble: it was a picture of a boss he had fought.
Stark looked around, going from left to right to check all the displays that were available., and he counted that there were 6 of them, 3 on each side.
When reaching out for one of the images, a holographic screen would appear in front of him, displaying the name of the memory and a short description of the boss he had faced.
…
[Judicator, The Fallen Angel]
[Description: Judicator is the second apostle of the 'Godless Demon', he is an arrogant piece of shit who thinks he owns the world, but you taught him his place and took him by surprise, he uses his dark wings to fly and has a multitude of skills that are able to end a battle in a single attack.]
…
This was the same for all the other displays: Malakar, The Conjoined Siblings, The Black Water Devourer, The Creeping Shadows and The Mirror Master, as these were all the bosses he had faced.
'But… what's the point of that?' Stark couldn't understand.
What did it mean by relive the memories of his battles, maybe he would be able to rewatch them all and analyze every bit of them?
[Please select the memories you want to experience!]
Not knowing what to do, Stark approached the memory of [Malakar] and of [Judicator], selecting the two of them by putting his hand inside the image.
[You have selected… 2 memories: Malakar; Judicator]
[Do you want to experience those memories now?]
[Y/N]
Stark clicked "Y" without a second thought.
But the moment he made the choice, he found himself consumed by the memories, his body surrounded by a dark aura as he was transported somewhere else.
And the moment his eyes were cleared from that aura, and he regained his vision…
He found himself inside of a giant circular arena, and before him… were the two bosses he had selected.
'Huh?' Stark's eyebrows arched in confusion and his heart rate quickened as his eyes grew wide with shock.
His senses were on high alert as he took in the sight before him: [Malakar], wearing his elegant suit and black sun mask, and [Judicator], the angel with black wings, were both in front of him.
"SHIT? THE TWO OF THEM?" Stark immediately got in position, why were they both here? Hadn't he killed them?
This was bad, really bad.
[3…]
"WAIT!"
[2…]
He could already see Judicator summon his scythe in hand, now wielding his two respective weapons.
[1…]
Malakar also summoned his cane in hand, spinning it, a wide grin on the visible half of his face.
[FIGHT!]
"THE CANE!" Malakar extended his cane toward Stark, which elongated.
'It's fast! Way faster than before!' he used his arm to deflect the cane away.
But…
~SLASH~
Judicator used that opportunity, and unlike last time when he was playing around, he didn't let Stark a single chance to retaliate.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," Stark rolled away.
"DARK PULSE," but Malakar answered immediately, and a dark vein that came from the ground was rushing to pierce Stark.
[The Purgatory Shadow took the hit in your place]
Stark didn't know what the fuck was happening, he was currently fighting two bosses he had struggled against so much, and at the same time.
"ANGER OF THE FALLEN!" Judicator didn't waste any time, and instead of waiting for Stark to deal damage to him, he immediately activated one of his ultimate abilities.
And so while Stark was still avoiding the dark veins that came out from the ground…
~SLASH~
"-57784!"
He was cut in half by Judicator's scythe.
'Oh… I guess… I lost…' he closed his eyes, thinking it was over as he felt the world around him spin.
He had been completely overwhelmed by these two bosses as they kept launching skill after skill at him…
But…
"HAH~" he took a deep breath as he opened his eyes, and found himself back in the memories museum again, with the displays of the memories still at their respective places.
'What the?' he reached for his stomach, but there was no wound at all, yet he could swear he had been cut down by Judicator…
[Do you want to try again?]
[You can try as many times as you wish, you cannot die inside the memories museum, but you also do not receive any experience defeating the bosses]
Immediately, everything clicked inside of Stark's brain: the museum was a way for him to train in battle without the risk of death, basically… it was a way for him to get stronger without going anywhere else.
"This is… amazing," Stark put his hands on his chin and smiled.
He was easily defeated by the two bosses, who were both at his level... but what if he persisted and tried again and again? What if he adapted to the situation and improved his movements to dodge even more attacks?
Wouldn't that help him in the future too?
"Now…" Stark loved that new feature, "It really does feel like a game…"
Also… couldn't it help him try out all of his skills, finding new ways to use them and also testing out his new ones?
Even more so knowing that he is bound to unlock a new class soon…
This was perfect.
This was actually so great that Stark couldn't help but laugh.
'Oh yeah… I need to spin the wheel,' he remembered after thinking about his new class.
"Class Wheel!" he mumbled to himself, and this time he was actually able to use it since he had checked all the panels.
And so just like last time, the giant colorful wheel appeared in front of him.
"Let's do this," he smiled.

chapters.title: Chapter 87 - 87: New Class: ???
chapters.content:
[Pull me!]
The sign located right next to the lever used to spin the wheel was still there, inviting Stark to follow its order.
He looked up, taking in sight the giant wheel with all the name of the classes that could be picked: Magus, Exorcist, Beast Tamer, Warrior, Archer, Assassin, Soul Wielder, Incubus and Alchemist…
Domination was ruled out as he had already unlocked it the first time he span the wheel, so it wasn't even available.
[9 classes available to unlock, please spin the wheel!]
'…' Stark sighed before reaching out to the lever and pulling it down, resulting in the wheel to begin spinning extremely fast.
As the wheel spun, Stark's eyes followed the classes, trying to glimpse what one might be the one he would get.
It was completely random, and it was the red arrow at the top that would decide, but he couldn't help but be nervous: this would change his entire approach to fighting.
Finally, after what felt like an eternity, the wheel began to slowly stop spinning.
~FWISH~
It went from "Magus" to "Soul Wielder" to "Beast Tamer", and the more it slowed down, the more aura could be seen around it as the wheel focused its power: only it knew the class that would be picked.
~FWISH…~
The wheel was now on the verge of stopping as the red arrow went from class to class, and suddenly, it settled on a specific class, one he hadn't considered before.
[The wheel has stopped!]
Stark immediately looked up as it was the final verdict, there was no change from now on.
And the class he got was… ALCHEMIST?
[Congratulations! You have unlocked the class: Alchemist!]
'I mean… sure?'
[You can spin the wheel again at level 50!]
Not wasting a second, he checked that class's description.
…
[Class: Alchemist]
[Description:] Masters of potions and of random experiments, the alchemists are able to brew potions using their precise hands and sell them or even use them in battle themselves (although watch out for side effects), this may seem like an average class, but with the good ingredients, you can pretty much do anything.
[Class Effect:] Now able to brew potions with different effects depending on the ingredients
[Class Flaw:] You cannot use any sort of weapon, you have to rely on your potions.
[Basic Skills:] Alchemist; Potion Crafting
…
'Huh… I mean, I guess it makes sense, but I wonder how I'll be able to make potions without the real equipment,' Stark wondered, and decided to check out the two new skills he had gotten.
…
[Skill: Alchemist]
[Type:] Basic Class Skill
[Level:] 1
[Description:] This is just the basic skill for alchemists that confirms you are one of them, it increases your craftsmanship skills and precision while making potions and using 'Potion Crafting', the higher your level, the strongest your potions will be.
[Note: Also this skill allows you to check what could be an ingredient so that you pick it out, very useful to not waste time on ingredients that don't work on any potion!]
…
[Skill: Potion Crafting]
[Type:] Basic Class Skill
[Level:] 1
[Description: Well, it's in the name…]
[Note: The higher the level, the stronger your potions become, finding potions depends completely on you, you can buy recipes, or find them out by yourself while experimenting!]
…
He was in the 'Memory Museum', with the possibility to fight all the bosses he had previously defeated with an infinite amount of lives at his disposable, meaning that he could test out his new ability.
But he would need to figure out how to be an alchemist first.
Domination was great since it was just 'haha punch punch', but now he would actually need to do things and prepare.
He couldn't deny though that this was probably the best mix of classes ever beside probably beast tamer or incubus, since he would continue fighting with his fists while using potions to get effects that aid him in battle.
He was frankly excited… and he couldn't help but smile.
"Potion Crafting!" he immediately decided to use his skill.
And suddenly…
A panel appeared in front of him.
'Huh…'
[Do you want to summon your brewing station?]
[Brewing station level: 1]
[Y/N]
'Sure, I guess,' he shrugged and clicked on the Y option.
The panel immediately disappeared, and out of thin air appeared a wooden table in decent shape with a small cauldron placed on top of it, as well as a brewing stand.
But this wasn't how he would be able to make potions, these two objects were solely here to make sure the process go smoothly.
Instead, another panel appeared in front of a confused Stark.
It wasn't crimson, blue, or dark, instead it was brown of color, mimicking the texture of the wood.
[Welcome to the Potion Crafting panel!]
[You have… 3 recipes available as a start!]
These two window disappeared after a few seconds, and another one appeared, but this time it was truly the one he had been looking for.
It contained the images of three potions, each inside of a crimson glass with a liquid inside of it.
With no hesitation in his actions, Stark clicked on one of the potion images.
…
[Potion of Strength]
[Effect: Increases the user's strength stat by 10% for 5 minutes!]
And below was a list of ingredients he couldn't understand how to get.
[Ingredients: x2 Wolf Teeth, x1 Ogre Ear, x1 Strength Flower…]
'I guess I need to go to some sort of market to acquire those…'
[Note: Ingredients can be acquired through exploring different rifts, it is always good to pick any material you encounter in case you need them later, many alchemists go to great length to acquire just one ingredient needed for a potion, and they also take commissions from classifiers!]
'How about just buying them from the trading market?' Stark shrugged, this seemed like a much better solution.
[Lame, plus the ingredients there are mostly expensive when they are of higher quality, and you won't find incredible ingredients to discover powerful potions there since some are unique or bought instantly!]
'Oh well,' Stark shrugged and immediately moved to check the two other potions that were available for him to craft.
…
[Potion of Speed]
[Effect: Increases the user's speed stat by 10% for 5 minutes!]
…
[Potion of Regeneration]
[Effect: Heals 1000HP to the user, effect is instant but it does not heal severed limbs!]
…
'That last one is very good if I can stack them,' Stark thought.
He didn't really think much of it, but he had basically the best skill ever for this class: [Spatial Inventory], since he could store an infinite amount of ingredients or potions and take them back whenever he wanted.
This meant that he truly had the potential to be a master alchemist, all the while fighting close range thanks to [Domination]!
But first… he wanted to sell all his unneeded equipment, and stock up on ingredients and food.
The reason?
Well… it's obvious!
Basically… Stark planned to train like hell inside the Memories Museum.
Train until he could at least take down both Malakar and Judicator at the same time… no… he wanted to take down all 6 bosses at the same time!
He had an unlimited amount of tries after all… =)!
'Well… let's get this over with,' he slowly went toward the black door, which was located at the start of the hall.
And so he went through it, ready to deal with the outside world to begin his training.

chapters.title: Chapter 88 - 88: Equipment and Key
chapters.content:
Stark emerged from the black door, stepping back into his hotel room, nothing had changed, except for the time since he had been inside for around twenty minutes.
Time inside and outside the 'Memories Museum' worked the same, meaning that if he wanted to train inside, it would mean stocking up on food and also not expecting anyone from the outside to come look for him (this wouldn't be a difficult task).
Plus, he hadn't realized it yet, but the sun was already mostly up.
He had gotten up very early yesterday to go to the rift, but it still took him around 11 hours to complete it, as well as around 12–13 hours of travel to go and come back.
Add that to the time he spent checking out his new panels, as well as the many different waiting periods, like for example waiting for the opening.
And so as soon as Stark checked the time… he noticed that it was 7:30am.
"Spatial Inventory!" he opened his inventory, and pulled out all the equipment he had gotten inside of the secret rift.
There were a total of 7 items, 1 from the Minotaur, which was the [Minotaur's Helmet], two from the obsidian golem, and 4 from Judicator.
He would need to sell many of them since he either didn't have the required level, wasn't interested, or it wasn't for his class, but in the end it was fine since it would increase his assets.
…
[Equipment:] The Minotaur's Helmet
[Type:] Helmet
[Class:] Warrior
[Tier:] Rare
[Required Level:] 40
[Quality:] Normal
[Attributes:] +250 Strength, +400 Defense
[Special Perk:] Allows the wearer to go into a berserk state, essentially using the 'Berserk State' skill of the Canyon Minotaur, which greatly enhances strength, defense, and stamina (+50% increase) for a minute.
…
He had already checked this one before, but just made sure that it was correct.
It immediately went to the 'sell' list though, since he could only use it if he was a warrior.
He decided to skim through the rest quickly, only paying attention to the items that could actually be used by him (class related, not for required level).
And the two items the obsidian golem had dropped were…
…
[Equipment:] Obsidian Gauntlets
[Type:] Gloves
[Class:] Beast Tamer, Magus
[Tier:] Uncommon
[Required Level:] 35
[Quality:] Normal
[Attributes:] +250 Mind, +450 Strength
[Special Perk:] Summons two obsidian beasts to aid you in battle.
…
[Equipment:] Obsidian Golem's Ring
[Type:] Ring
[Class:] Assassin, Warrior, Soul Wielder
[Tier:] Rare
[Required Level:] 30
[Quality:] Good
[Attributes:] +500 Defense
[Special Perk:] Like the obsidian golem, create a layer of obsidian (like an armor) that can tank up to 20k damage.
…
'None of these are useful either,' he groaned as he put the two obsidian equipment beside the Minotaur helmet.
This left him with four equipment pieces: the ones that had dropped from Judicator.
Of course, Stark remembered that one of the items was wings as he had picked it up before the monument began to collapse, but he hadn't checked the window either.
…
[Equipment:] Judicator's Black Wings
[Type:] Wings
[Class:] Domination
[Tier:] Legendary
[Required Level:] 25
[Quality:] Perfect
[Attributes:] +200 Speed, +300 Stamina
[Special Perk:] Ability to use [Dash], which basically gives the user a boost in speed to evade an attack by flapping the wings in the direction you want to go.
[Note: the wings become invisible when put on!]
…
'Interesting…' he moved on to the next two items, which were respectfully a mask with Judicator's face on it and a staff with a golden orb at the edge of it.
…
[Equipment:] The Fallen Angel's Mask
[Type:] Mask
[Class:] Assassin, Soul Wielder
[Tier:] Epic
[Required Level:] 25
[Quality:] Good
[Attributes:] +500 Mind/Intelligence
[Special Perk:] Grants the user the ability to see through illusions and detect hidden traps or enemies within a certain radius.
…
[Equipment:] Judicator's Staff
[Type:] Staff
[Class:] Magus, Exorcist
[Tier:] Rare
[Required Level:] 40
[Quality:] Normal
[Attributes:] +250 Mind, +100 Stamina
[Special Perk:] Highly increases proficiency in divine magic, and also allows the user to blind the opponent with a divine light.
…
'Everything except for the wings is fucking useless…' Stark groaned, he knew that all these items would fetch him a good amount of rher coins, but he also wanted to be able to gain more power from his equipment.
And finally, Stark turned his gaze to the last item he had gotten from the angel, and it was a rather… surprising one.
It wasn't a ring, or any weapon/wearable piece actually, instead… it was a key.
…
[Item:] Devil's Abyss Key
[Type:] Key
[Quality:] Artifact
[Perk:] The key that allows to open the 'Devil's Abyss' rift and its secret final chamber (home of three 'Godless Demon' apostles)
…
Below the crimson with a demon shaped stone on it was a note, Stark immediately picked it up to read its contents.
[Good job on killing the angel, now come see us if you want to meet your demise, little human =)]
'…' Stark was shocked, but not because of the content of the note, instead it was because… "What the actual fuck is that writing, I'm going to these guys and teaching them a lesson of basic english."
The text was almost incomprehensible, and it took Stark a few minutes to make sure he understood whatever was written on there.
'Well… I get it,' Stark put all the equipment he had gotten, including the wings (he would use them when he was back) and the key, inside the [Spatial Inventory], then immediately left his hotel room and hailed for a taxi to the trading district of Fellarburg.
It was still early in the morning, but he got used to going there at this time since there were fewer people, and he truly enjoyed the peaceful atmosphere.
'What about the breakthrough for my skills, though?' he remembered that he needed to do something to increase the limit from 10 to 15, yet he didn't know what or how.
[You need to purchase a 'Lv25 Breakthrough Stone', which is also called the 'Iron Breakthrough Stone']
'Hm… Why is that?'
[Classifiers are only usually ranked based on their level, but for their overall strength, there are several categories: Iron, Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, Diamond, Ascendant, Prodigy, Immortal and Classified]
[Note: these categories are only used for breakthroughs to another tier, so you probably won't hear them much…]
'Like a competitive fps game!' Stark nodded, being an avid Volarant player (typo is on purpose).
[Huh… yeah, whatever that is…]
And so, Stark reached the trading district, he had lots of things to do since he had reached level 25, and he was excited to do all of that quickly to get back to the 'Memories Museum' and finally start training.

chapters.title: Chapter 89 - 89: Appraising New Equipment
chapters.content:
The trading district was bustling with activity as Stark made his way through the crowded streets.
Even though it was only around 8am, there were already tons of people, which was honestly kind of weird since usually the streets wouldn't be that crowded.
"Did you see the Secret Rift conquest?" one classifier told his friend.
"Yeah! It was insane, I wish I was there to meet that guy," his friend replied.
"I mean, fucking hell, he came back from the dead," another classifier spoke while showing his phone to his friends, and all of them gasped in shock after a minute.
'Hm…' Stark was skeptical about all of this: wherever he went, he could hear people talk about the secret rift conquest from yesterday.
And the main topic of discussion was… as guessed, the bunny-masked man.
The videos and highlights of all his fights had spread throughout the internet, not only inside Fellarburg, but through the entire world.
Many people called him 'a powerful classifier that hides as if he is weak', and others preferred to call him a 'prodigy with immense talent'.
But what all the organizations looked at was the fight with Judicator, and the fact that he had been cut in half by the boss, yet somehow came back to life to get revenge, was the most interesting part of all.
Stark reached the 'Classifiers Trading Association', but even on the massive screen at their entrance was played the replay of him fighting Judicator.
'Can't escape, but what can I say, I'm just him,' he shrugged and entered the massive building.
"I wish to sell some items," he told a receptionist who approached him as soon as he entered, and just like the previous times, he was guided toward a room.
And his appraiser… was that white-haired woman with a cigarette in her mouth again.
"Oh, it's you again," she smiled, letting out a trail of smoke from her mouth, "Sit down and let's see what you got for us again!"
She was extremely friendly, and one of the best appraisers in the association, but…
"Yo, can I get another appraiser?" Stark tried to talk to the receptionist as she was about to close the door, "I don't want to be in a room full of smoke-"
But the receptionist didn't care and closed the door on him.
":("
"Sit down… BOY!" the white-haired woman had a cold smile on her face, not liking the fact he had refused her services.
"Sigh…" he agreed as he just wanted to get this done, trying to ignore the smoke, "But I would much rather you didn't smoke in front of customers."
"As long as it's allowed by the rules, then can't do anything about it kiddo," she shrugged, "Show me those items!"
In their room was a big TV that also showed his fight with Judicator.
'…' Stark looked at the screen for a few seconds, it was a strange feeling to know the entire world was looking at you, yet didn't know you were the one who did all of that.
"Interested in that classifier too, huh?" the woman smiled, "He is fascinating, can't deny it!"
"…" Stark looked back at her and pulled out the five equipment pieces he didn't need as he couldn't use them, placing on the table five shiny-looking items that immediately grabbed the woman's interest, "Oh, and by the way, I'm not interested in that since it's me."
Stark smiled as he said those words, a nonchalant expression on his face.
"Hm~" the woman raised her eyebrow, "Sure, let's just get your appraisal going, then," she didn't believe him, but Stark didn't care enough to prove that it was him.
After a few minutes, the woman's eyes widened as she inspected all the items.
And the first thing she instinctively did after that was look at the screen, where Stark was fighting the angel.
Eventually, she shook her head and gave Stark his items, "These items are incredible, let me tell you the amount we are willing to give for each…"
…
[Equipment:] The Minotaur's Helmet
[Tier:] Rare
[Quality:] Normal
[Price:] 470,000 rher coins
…
"This is a rather powerful helmet, many warriors will jump on the opportunity to buy it, the berserk state is a very nice perk," the white-haired woman added as commentary.
Stark almost choked when hearing the amount: was it always this easy to earn money?
He could probably already have a wife and a dozen kids with this amount! (if anybody was willing that is...)
But of course, this wasn't all the items, so he just sat down and waited.
…
[Equipment:] Obsidian Gauntlets
[Tier:] Uncommon
[Quality:] Normal
[Price:] 248,000 rher coins
…
[Equipment:] Obsidian Golem's Ring
[Tier:] Rare
[Quality:] Good
[Price:] 535,000
…
While reaching this item, the white-haired appraiser didn't seem that surprised, although she couldn't deny that these were good items.
But upon looking at the mask and staff… she knew that something was up.
She couldn't read the name of the items, so the trading association would usually name them themselves to something that makes sense considering their perks and appearance.
But this mask… she couldn't help but look at Judicator's face and notice that they look extremely similar.
"I'm not interested in that since it's me," she remembered that boy's words, and looked at him, he had a blank expression on his face.
…
[Equipment:] The Fallen Angel's Mask
[Tier:] Epic
[Quality:] Good
[Price:] 783,000
…
[Equipment:] Judicator's Staff
[Tier:] Epic
[Quality:] Good
[Price:] 601,000
…
Selling all these items would mean that Stark would be getting around 2.63 million rher coins.
'Nice!' he smiled and began to get up from the couch he had been sitting on.
But…
"Where did you get these items?" the woman suddenly spoke, a powerful and chilly aura surrounding her body.
"…" Stark saw in her eyes that she wasn't kidding, and so he smiled, "I already told you once, didn't I?"
'Perception!' he decided to use his skill on her as he sensed that her power was way too much for a mere appraiser.
And he was right.
…
[Name: Violette Winkson]
[Level: 194]
[Class: Magus]
[HP: 89000]
[Strength: 4716]
[Speed: 12842]
[Stamina: 15198]
[Defense: 13184]
…
She was extremely powerful, even more than the people inside the Secret Rift, and yet… here she was… standing before Stark.
"Who… are… you?" she tilted her head.
"You can call me Stark, ma'am, I need to go now," Stark immediately headed toward the door, and she didn't stop him at all, instead just glaring at the boy with her aura out.
"Goodbye, customer," she gave him a smile that sent a shiver down his spine.
But after a few instants, he immediately recovered and returned the smile.
"See you later, Violette."
He had the feeling she wasn't just an appraiser, and that they would meet again soon.

chapters.title: Chapter 90 - 90: Gathering Ingredients for Potions
chapters.content:
Stark left the reception room with the white-haired woman still inside, leaving her to wonder who that boy was as he knew her name.
Frankly, Stark didn't care enough to show off or not do it, if he was asked something, he would just answer accordingly, which was something Lana would probably tell him to hide.
Stark immediately went to the market section of the trading association, then guided himself to the 'boost items' part of it.
Standing on luxurious displays stood many items.
...
[Item:] Skill Level Candy (lv1-10)
[Tier:] Epic
[Quality:] Perfect
[Perk:] Each time you consume a candy, the level of the skill you choose will increase by one, note that it only works on lv1-10 skills.
[Price:] 500,000 rher coins.
...
There were also other variants of this candy (which was already expensive as fuck) but these candies were just for skills with greater skill limits, for example it wouldn't work for level 10-15, so he would need to buy the next variant.
Basically, it was something only rich people could afford, he wasn't interested.
Instead... what interested him was placed in another hall, and there was a wooden sign next to it that displayed the words he wanted to read: 'breakthrough stones'.
The halls were pretty empty, a big reason why he loved to come during early mornings.
And only a few seconds later, he found the item he wanted as it was the first one that was placed on the right.
It was a rune with the word 'iron' written on some sort of small magic circle in the middle, and a small aura emanated from it.
...
[Item:] Breakthrough Stone (Iron-Level)
[Tier:] Rare
[Quality:] Normal
[Perk:] Increases your skill level from 10 to 15 when you meet the conditions to do so.
[Price:] 1.2 million rher coins
...
"Holy shit," Stark let out, resulting in some eyes falling on him, "Who decided to make these things so expensive...?"
This would take around half of what he had gotten selling all the items from the secret rift.
'Oh well... no other way,' he took the stone from the display, then had to go to a screen right at the entrance of the market to scan the item and then buy it using his card (he could of course go to a real receptionist to buy it but it was faster like that).
He stored the [Breakthrough Stone] inside of his [Spatial Inventory] and then left the trading association.
They didn't have any ingredients related to Alchemists in there as it was probably another building that held all of it, this building was the one for general purposes, but all classes (except for Domination) should have buildings of their own.
It really did seem like Alchemist and Domination were the classes with the least amount of items and equipment related to them because of how unknown the latter was, while the former is just about making potions, so not much beside armor and rings.
Your level of alchemy is based on your level and skill level, so an equipment piece couldn't increase that (some were able to but they were rare and expensive).
Passing through the crowded streets of classifiers excitedly talking about the bunny-masked man, Stark reached his other destination:
"Alchemist All-in-One Association", it was another giant building, not quite as big as the trading association one, but still fairly big and enough to accommodate everything that is needed.
Inside the alchemist association building was located a place to sell your ingredients, as well as an auction house for alchemists to try and acquire rare items to create new potions/existing ones.
But what he was interested in was... the first section.
[Beginner Alchemist Section]
He guessed that this was it since he had just acquired this class, and so he entered it without hesitation.
A massive screen greeted him.
[Welcome, new alchemist, please pick your starting ingredients, we recommend you to take enough for the beginning level potions as you need to get used to crafting!]
Almost seemed like a tutorial, but he ignored it and began looking for what he wanted.
While walking toward the ingredients section, Stark realized that this wasn't all the beginner section had to offer.
There were also 'Potion Recipe Scrolls', which worked just like skill scrolls except it was to unlock a potion as an alchemist.
Of course, as to not make it too overpowered, many requested a minimal alchemist level to use, much like items.
...
[Name:] Potion of Damage
[Perk:] Will deal 5000 damage to an opponent when throwing it on them
[Required level:] 5
[Price:] 450,000
...
[Name:] Fly Potion
[Perk:] Can fly with perfect control for one minute
[Required level:] 8
[Price:] 792,000
...
This was only the beginner section, but there were some rather interesting potions, Stark could only imagine what would be inside the middle section or even high tier one.
And what about potion recipe scrolls at the top section, they could probably deal hundreds of thousands of damage with one bottle (although the materials would be expensive and very hard to find).
This was a very interesting class.
He decided not to stare too much as the thought of buying a potion was already on his mind even though he hadn't even tried to check if it merged well with domination.
[Beginner Ingredients]
On hundreds upon hundreds of displays stood many ingredients that beginners could use to begin their alchemist life, they were rather cheap compared to the rest, which was good.
Many people around Stark were also busy inspecting ingredients and checking theur panels to see what they needed, and so he did the same.
'Ogre Ear... Wolf Teeth... Flowers...'
It didn't take long for him to find everything he needed for his three potions, and every time he took an item from a display, another one would immediately reappear like some sort of generator.
The ingredients when bought individually weren't much of an issue, but it was when he bought many at once that it became visible his wallet was taking a hit.
...
[Ingredient:] Ogre Ear
[Price:] 1200 rher coins
...
[Ingredient:] Wolf Teeth
[Price:] 1360 rher coins
...
[Ingredient:] Strength Flower
[Price:] 5700 rher coins
...
He took enough ingredients to make 10 of each potions, just to test them out, then left the 'Alchemist Association'.
'Very useful place, I'll need to come back,' Stark smiled as he left.
"Oh~ we got a newbie alchemist it seems!" but as he left, he heard a voice behind him, coming from near the entrance of the building.
"Ah shit, here we go again," he shrugged, expecting another group of classifiers trying to cause problems.
But this time, he was wrong.

chapters.title: Chapter 91 - 91: Crafting the First Potions
chapters.content:
As Stark turned around, he saw a figure clad in dark robes approaching him. The stranger's hood obscured their face, but their presence exuded an air of mystery and power.
"New to the world of alchemy, are you?" the hooded figure spoke in a smooth, melodic voice that seemed to echo in the street, Stark was still cautious of whoever this was, but their voice somehow made him feel at ease.
"Yeah," Stark shrugged, raising his eyebrow.
It was clearly a woman, extremely noticeable from her voice, long purple hair, and also… well… her curves, there was no denying that
"Interesting," without wasting a single second, the hooded woman used her [Potion Crafting] skill to summon her table.
And it was… well… impressive.
Instead of his wooden table with a badly shaped cauldron and brewing stand, her's was on a whole other level.
The table was made out of blue platinum, it's shape glinting in the sunlight, and intricate runes were etched into its surface.
On her table was a set of ingredients that seemed to glow with an ethereal light, emitting a soft hum that reverberated in the air.
The cauldron she had was giant, and made of pure diamonds, while the brewing stand she had was so big and complicated that there were magic circles surrounding it.
But… Stark wasn't impressed, instead his face turned cold.
"Trying to flex on me?" he asked, tilting his head as there was no such reason to show him any of that.
The hooded woman chuckled softly, her violet eyes gleaming with amusement. "Not at all, dear newcomer. I simply appreciate the art of alchemy and like to work with the best tools available to me," she explained, her voice soft yet commanding.
'A tool…?' did she just call him a tool? Or was she just referring to her brewing station.
"Well, see you later," she waved her hand before heading in the opposite direction.
"Weirdo…" Stark groaned as he hailed for a taxi and went back to his hotel.
"Goodbye… CHOSEN," the woman lips grew into a giant smile as soon as Stark left inside that taxi, saying his code name.
She drank a potion and immediately vanished in a trail of blue smoke.
Stark didn't know it yet, but there were already people aware of who he was.
And his recent conquest of the Secret Rift helped them out a lot with that.
***
Stark went to the market and bought lots of pre-made food, as well as enough fast food and such to last him upwards to two-three weeks.
The reason was obvious: he planned to stay a very long time inside of the 'Memories Museum', grinding against the bosses he had already beaten in the hopes of improving his senses and movements.
Being able to take just two of the bosses he had fought and struggled against before simultaneously would prove that he had indeed improved a lot.
After around an hour, he arrived back at his hotel room, having placed everything inside of his [Spatial Inventory] meant he didn't need to move anything, and that everything would be available once he was there.
"Phew…" Stark sighed, lying on the bed and looking up to the ceiling, "…"
He wouldn't do anything other than just fight, fight, and fight, for the next two to three weeks, so he was getting mentally ready.
It would surely take him a while before deciding to enter-
"Ok, i'm ready," he shrugged almost instantly, not even five seconds after getting on the bed, and summoned the black door which led to the 'Memories Museum'.
It appeared before him, surrounded by a dark aura, and Stark opened it wide, passing through the threshold with determination in his eyes.
The familiar sensation of being pulled through dimensions washed over him, and as he emerged on the other side, he found himself back in the vast, endless hallways of the Memories Museum.
Food inside of the [Spatial Inventory] doesn't rot, so he wouldn't pull out anything until he really needed it.
And to add to the immersion, he even bought a 'small tent' from the market, which allowed him to sleep wherever he wanted.
Such tents were only used when classifiers knew they would be spending large periods of times inside a rift, but for Stark, he had decided that he wouldn't leave this space until either his food ran out, or he completed what he wanted to do: defeat all 6 bosses.
[Quest: defeat all 6 bosses at the same time!]
[Reward: +3 skill points!]
In addition to that, as a way to encourage him, even the museum allowed him to get a reward for his efforts.
Frankly, there was a 99.99% chance that he would never be able to complete that challenge because of the sheer difficulty, plus his level wasn't that high compared to theirs, so almost anything would one-shot him.
Infinite tries sounded powerful, but he couldn't forget that time still flew normally in this space.
He was too lazy to train his muscles (useless since he had domination), and attempting to beat yet another rift felt boring, so this 'Memories Museum' was the perfect opportunity to grow stronger all the while improving his techniques.
This would 100% help him in the future.
But before doing any of that…
"POTION CRAFTING!"
Stark wasted no time in getting down to business.
He set up his makeshift alchemy station, a far cry from the extravagant setup of the hooded woman he had encountered earlier.
Despite the humble appearance of his equipment, Stark's determination shone through as he meticulously organized his ingredients and prepared to craft his potions.
He took the required ingredients to craft one of each potion, and got to business.
…
[Potion of Strength]
[Effect: Increases the user's strength stat by 10% for 5 minutes!]
[Ingredients: x2 Wolf Teeth, x1 Ogre Ear, x1 Strength Flower…]
…
He took out everything that was needed and placed it on the table, and immediately as he did so…
[Wolf Teeth 2/2; Ogre Ear 1/1; Strength Flower 1/1!]
[You can craft 'Potion of Strength'!]
He clicked on that panel without a single hint of hesitation, and suddenly, the equipment on his table began to move alone, mixing and brewing the ingredients with precision.
The cauldron bubbled and steamed, emitting a faint glow as the potion took form under Stark's watchful gaze.
It didn't take more than thirty seconds for the potion to be finished.
['Potion of Strength' has been crafted, please touch this screen to make it appear on the table!]
He did as he was told, and just as explained, a red liquid inside of a glass appeared on the wooden table, which Stark took in his hands instantly.
[Perception] showed him that it was indeed the potion he wanted, meaning that the alchemist station and all of the related things were working perfectly.
It was much easier than expected too, meaning that Stark could get to business and craft the remaining potions as he wanted to try them out while fighting the bosses.
He used up all his ingredients, but…
…
[Inventory:] 10x Potion of Strength, 10x Potion of Speed, 10x Potion of Regeneration.
…
And so with everything ready, Stark put all the potions inside of his inventory void and headed toward the displays with the memories on it, ready to select them all and start his training arc.

chapters.title: Chapter 92 - 92: Trial and Error Against the Six Bosses
chapters.content:
Stark after crafting his potions immediately headed toward the displays with the thought-shapped images.
[Do you want to select 'The Conjoined Siblings' as a memory to experience?]
'Yes.'
Then he would move on to the next one.
[Do you want to select 'Creeping Shadows' as a memory you want to experience?]
'...'
[Do you want to select...]
[Do you want...]
After around a minute, he had selected all 6 bosses that were available to be fought inside of the museum.
He had absolutely no strategy whatsoever, instead wanting to test out whatever would happen if he actually tried to do that.
He would surely got demolished that's for sure, but how badly?
He would need a strategy, relying on sole stats and skills wouldn't be enough as even someone that is well over level 150 would probably die against these 6 enemies.
But he had an advantage: infinite tries, infinite attempts to do whatever he wanted.
[You have selected ALL the memories of the museum]
[Difficulty:] Nightmare
[Do you want to proceed?]
'Of course!' He clicked on the panel, and almost instantly was surrounded by that black mist of memories, transporting him to another location.
And when he opened his eyes back...
"Haha... this is still just as terrifying," he felt a drop of sweat on his forehead.
Before him were all the bosses he had previously defeated, and even though they wouldn't be an issue if alone, the fact the 6 of them were here together created a powerful aura even Stark could sense was bad.
His goal: beat them all and get used to fight powerful opponents at the same time.
He also noticed that the arena had changed.
It was... a mix of all of the boss's areas?
Water that reached a little above his feet could be seen, to accommodate the 'Black Water Devourer', the circular walls of the arena were replaced by buildings, much like Malakar's city, there were dozens of marble pillars scattered across the giant space for Judicator, and there was a ceiling with mirrors all over it, for the Mirror Master and the other two.
Basically, this arena was a mix of all the challenges of the previous bosses, which he would also need to take into account.
[3...]
The monsters grabbed their weapons.
[2...]
Judicator let out his giant black wings and the devourer disappeared into the water.
[1...]
The Creeping Shadow, which was just a perfect replica of Stark, smiled, ready to eliminate its owner.
[FIGHT!]
The moment the fight began, Malakar sent his cane at him, while Judicator and the shadow dashed toward him.
[The Purgatory Shadow took the hit for you]
They were fast, and their sheer number was enough to take him back.
But...
~FWISH~
The devourer appeared below him and gobbled him up like he was a tasty meal.
"18371-" even when activating his shield around his body, it wasn't enough to tank the attack.
And so...
He was sent back to the museum.
[Do you want to try again?]
'Fucking hell...' Stark clicked on yes, an excited look on his face at the thought of progressing over and over again, until reaching his goal.
***
(2nd try)
"-27361" this time, instead of staying idle, he used his new equipment, [Judicator's Black Wings], to dash to the side, avoiding the devourer and sending two aura fists at it.
~FWISH~
But while he was still in midair, the conjoined warrior activated [Skeletal Aura] while being buffed by his sister using the [Buff] spell.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," Stark activated his attack immediately, and the warrior's sword passed right through his head, taking the guardian aback.
But Stark took this opportunity to reach for the warrior's hand that carried his sword.
He knew from before that taking it from him was basically making him as inoffensive as a child.
But right as he tried to do that...
~BAM~
"GAH-!" his shadow sent two crimson fists at him, and both hit him straight on as he was too focused on avoiding all the previous attacks,
"12948! -13924!"
He fell to the floor, his HP reaching 0.
...
[Do you want to try again?]
He was greeted by the screen again.
'I was so close to disarming the warrior, I just need to take care of my shadow,' after every try, he would adapt.
***
(13th try)
"AURA SMASH!" instead of using his crimson fists on the devourer, Stark would sent them at his shadow, forcing it to use [Aura Smash] as well.
Meaning that the warrior would be right in front of him and...
~CRACK~
Stark would grab the arm with the sword and break it, before launching the sword far way and kicking the warrior in the face, breaking one of its heads.
"-34817!"
"HEAL!" the sister would obviously use that skill on her brother and give him 15000 HP back, but it didn't change the fact he was disarmed and had no weapon anymore.
"HAT TRICK!" Malakar would also take out his hat and launch it at Stark, razor sharp blades appearing on its edge.
But Stark had already died to that once, so he would grab the hat and send it toward his shadow, forcing it to back away yet again as if he didn't, it would one-shot him.
What he didn't expect though was...
"SHARD THROW!" The Mirror Master, which hadn't done anything until now, charged up a giant mirror shard, twice as big as Stark's body, and sent it flying at him while he was occupied with the others.
"28174!" a giant hole in his body was made after the shard pierced him, and he fell to the ground, dead.
[Do you want to try again?]
'...'
***
(78th try)
'Gulp gulp...' Stark drank two of his potions for the first time, wanting to test them out to see if they would increase his odds.
And they did.
He reached the last point where he died rather smoothly, and even managed to avoid the Mirror Master's shard.
"CLONE FRENZY," he summoned his two clones, who were also affected by the potion effects as they were made of his aura.
The strength and speed potions increased his stats by 10%, and although it might not seem much on an average alchemist, giving that to Stark with his insane stats and aura was a recipe for disaster.
He now managed to easily avoid most of the attacks that came his way, and his movements felt smoother.
His clones were attacking the other monsters, one of them managing to take the witch's scepter from her hands and breaking it before sending two fists of aura toward her brother.
[Enemy stunned]
The warrior was stunned, and so the two clones took advantage of this opportunity to gang up on him while the other bosses were focused on Stark.
"-18372! -19714! -17962!"
And so, just like that... Stark eliminated the first boss.
But...
~FWISH~
With two simple flap of his wings, Judicator killed the two clones and rushed toward Stark, his body was already dyed in platinum since he activated his ultimate skills already.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" he jumped out of the way as he couldn't avoid that attack.
But...
"ALL-AREA STRIKE!" at that very moment, the Mirror Master decided to use his unavoidable attack, summoning the dark flames on the ceiling which all began to descend on him.
"Ok," Stark could just shrug as he was engulfed and killed by the fire, it was in the name: this attack is unavoidable.
[Do you want to try again?]
'It's been hours... I need to keep going,' and so he clicked on yes.
He wouldn't back down until he did it.

chapters.title: Chapter 93 - 93: Reaching the Climax
chapters.content:
(117th try)
He would get decapitated by Judicator
…
(194th try)
He would get pierced by Malakar's [Dark Pulse], putting dozens upon dozens of black sharp spikes through his body.
…
(250th try)
He would finally manage to kill the warrior all the while avoiding [All-Area Strike].
But then…
"CONJOINED BOND," forced to back away because of the other monsters, the warrior would get up only after a minute because of this skill since his sister was still alive, meaning that it was pointless.
'I need to get the clones to kill the sister too…' he mumbled before getting cut by [Water Bending] from the Black Water Devourer.
…
(381st try)
Stark wiped the sweat off his brow as he stood up once more, determination etched into every line of his face.
His heart pounded fiercely in his chest, echoing the throbbing ache of each of his failed attempts.
"Not enough…" he sighed, he had been able to kill the warrior and witch, but it wasn't enough.
"AURA SMASH! THE CANE! WATER BENDING! DIVINE BLINDNESS!"
Stark was blinded by the light, and all the other attacks came to reduce his HP to 0 again.
…
[Do you want to try again?]
'…'
[Do you want to try again?]
He had seen this screen so many times by this point that he really started to dislike it.
[Do you want to try…]
'Yeah.'
[Do you want to…]
'Yes…'
[Do you…]
'YES!'
He sat on the museum's floor and pulled out a giant pizza, taking his time to eat it while pondering what his next move should be.
It felt like no matter what he did, the monsters would always coordinate to fuck him over.
"…" he hadn't used [Double Assault] or his new legendary skill [Heaven's Wrath] yet since he kept them for the final showdown, but maybe he should try to do something with them…?
In comparison to in actual rifts or fights, each time he launched a fight inside the Memories Museum, all his skills would be reset, meaning that he wouldn't have to wait for the cooldown.
'Fuck it,' he got up after eating his pizza and immediately clicked on the panel to try again.
…
(382nd try)
[FIGHT!]
The moment the battle started, before any of the monsters could move, Stark unleashed his skill.
"HEAVEN'S WRATH!"
A blinding light erupted from Stark, enveloping the entire room in a crimson glow.
And then…
That same light appeared in the sky (or ceiling in this case), growing more and more.
~FWISH, FWISH, FWIIIIIIISHHHH~
It became so big that it took the entire area of where the monsters stood.
And then…
~BAM~
The entire room shook as a deafening explosion echoed throughout the arena, and a giant beam of divine light hurtled from above, except it wasn't golden like it was supposed to, but crimson, just like Stark's aura.
"-28371!"
"-34623!"
"-29874!"
All the monsters were hit one way or another since they didn't expect such a thing, and the attack charged up rather quickly.
But Judicator immediately used his wings to get away, the Black Water Devourer disappeared into the water, and The Mirror Master teleported thanks to a mirror.
But as for the Conjoined Siblings, they were both killed, both not having the speed to avoid the attack as staying inside three seconds was enough to remove all of their life.
And even the [Creeping Shadow] got immediately one-shotted by the attack.
'THIS IS INSANE,' Stark laughed, he had finally figured out a way to win.
Or did he?
"HEAVEN'S WRATH!" he had forgotten that his shadow could copy ANY of his moves, meaning that before it died, it also used the legendary skill, sending down a beam toward Stark, who couldn't avoid it.
"-24273!"
He got one-shotted too.
…
[Do you want to try again?]
'Need to get rid of the shadow before using it…'
He had still died, but he was getting closer to his goal.
And so just like that… a week passed.
***
(One week later)
He had tried all sorts of strategies against the bosses, some had worked, others didn't, but in the end, little by little, he was building up his strategy.
And so only after a week of pure grind and repeating this cycle of trial and death… he was ready to end it.
After getting so close his previous tries… he was sure this one was the right one.
[Do you want to try again?]
'Yes,' he smirked and was surrounded by that dark mist again, just to be teleported at the arena.
"THIS IS THE FINAL TRY, I PROMISE!"
[Inventory: x1 Potion of Strength, x1 Potion of Speed, x10 Potion of Regeneration]
…
[3…]
Stark closed his eyes, sensing the air around him.
It was something weird he had learned while fighting: sensing the monsters' auras became much easier for him, and adding that to Focus meant he could manage to avoid a few attacks while blinded.
This would be useful if he ever encountered another monster like Judicator, with the ability to blind someone, he had died so many times to this that his mind and body created a counter.
[2…]
But it didn't mean it was easy, not at all.
[1…]
All bosses stared at Stark, knowing that they needed to get rid of him.
[FIGHT!]
His plan began the moment that screen appeared.
~FWISH~
"SPATIAL INVENTORY," he took his last remaining [Potion of Speed] from the void and gulped it down in one ago, it was rather sweet.
The reason this was his final real try was because these were his last potions, and he truly needed those to hopefully survive this thing, otherwise it was a game over.
Of course, he could always leave to the market and get new ones.
But…
'It would feel like I lost against them,' he had vowed to not go out until he won, so he didn't want to lose this.
[Speed enhanced thanks to potion]
Immediately, he dashed toward his shadow.
~BAM~
He tried to punch it using his bare aura-filled fists, but it obviously just returned the attack.
"-1!"
The other monsters were just turning around, summoning their attacks.
But…
~FWISH, BAM~
"-24827!" Stark managed to hit his shadow and make it disappear as it only had 10k HP.
The reason he was able to hit a perfect mimic of himself? Well… it was the [Potion of Speed]!
The shadow wouldn't receive the status effect when he drank it, so he figured that doing that would allow him to fight back, no matter how strong it was.
That 10% increase in speed was enough to make the difference: it was enough for Stark to hit the shadow first.
And so with his shadow out of the equation…
Stark looked at the others, a wide grin on his face.
But it didn't mean there weren't other ways for him to die, after all… he had reached this exact point two times before, yet was taken aback and killed.
"HEAVEN'S WRATH!" he summoned the beam.

chapters.title: Chapter 94 - 94: The Final Run
chapters.content:
"HEAVEN'S WRATH!" Stark activated his skill as soon as his shadow was dead.
It had fucked him over so many times by returning his attacks against him, so getting it out first was the best way to win.
And now that it couldn't return [Heaven's Wrath] against him....
'I CAN EASILY USE IT!' he grinned as the crimson light in the sky began to grow more and more, looking more dangerous by the second.
And after only a few seconds...
~BOOM~
The giant crimson beam descended on the monsters as they couldn't do anything but watch.
"27461! -29673! -31905!"
Just like before, Judicator, Malakar, the Mirror Master, and the Black Water Devourer managed to get away from the beam's range before getting killed.
But the Warrior and Witch weren't so fast.
They only had 75k HP, and the HP they had when he first fought them inside the glass purgatory doesn't change inside the museum, so it greatly helped as three seconds were enough to turn them to dust.
[2 down, 4 to go]
But Stark didn't stop there.
After all, in a fight where he was at complete disadvantage in terms of power and numbers... his sole strategy was to not let them rest.
How could he die if they were too busy avoiding his attacks to send their own?
The third target was Malakar since he only had 45000 HP, and also since he couldn't allow him to launch his [Mayor's Control] attack since hundreds of monsters would come out of the surrounding buildings, just like when he fought him.
All the monsters were weak, but adding that to the other bosses resulted in him dying over a hundred times to them.
"AURA SMASH!" he sent two crimson fists at him while he was getting away from the beam's radius, meaning he had only a few instants to react.
"ABYSSAL SHIELD!"
A black barrier materialized in front of Malakar just in time to save him.
Or did it now?
~BOOM, BOOM~
"-12716! -17261!"
His barrier wasn't even enough to endure the two attacks Stark sent, and to add to that, Stark kicked Malakar to the left while he was falling down, launching him inside the beam and reducing his body to dust just like the others.
'...'
"ANGER OF THE FALLEN! BODY OF A SAINT!" the angel's body turned to platinum, but that was expected since it already activated its ultimate skills at the start of every... run.
'I do wonder why these bosses don't activate their strongest skills at the start,' he shrugged, but couldn't deny that under normal circumstances he would never activate [Heaven's Wrath] so quickly.
"EVOLUTION! REINFORCE!" the Black Water Devourer also began to transform, using his skills to shape its body, making it bigger and more menacing, but also... "TOXIC COATING!"
Now if Stark even brushed against the surface of its body, he would receive the [Poison] effect, he had already experienced it during one of his runs and he didn't like it at all.
So he would need to keep his distances from the devourer and kill it from long range using his fists and spears.
Also...
"FURIOUS STRIKE," Judicator dashed toward Stark, both his weapons in hand as he spanned them, ready to slice the boy in half.
But he had died too many times to that to fall for it, so he crouched to avoid the scythe, then stepped back to dodge the crimson sword.
'Fuck... too close...' the reason he hadn't used [Invincible Dodge] to take Judicator aback and deal massive damage to him was simple: the Mirror Master was waiting for that to use [All-Area Strike].
It took him a long time, but he figured out that each time he used Invincible dodge, that damn boss would notice it and use his unavoidable attack.
And that's why he was Stark's next target.
"CLONE FRENZY," he summoned his clones, then sent them at the Mirror Master.
But before they reached him...
"AURA SMASH! CRIMSON SPEARS!" They all activated their long-ranged skills and... threw them at the devourer.
6 crimson fists with a 30% chance each to stun, and 9 spears with great chances of piercing through one of the devourer's weaknesses, were heading toward the second guardian of the domination trial.
All of them hit their targets as the devourer was too dumb and slow to actually avoid them.
~BAM, BAM, BAM~
"-31827! -21430! -24906!" and much more damage outputs came out.
In the end, with its 120000 HPs and inability to avoid anything, the devourer fell.
[4 down, 2 remain]
And at the same time...
"DOUBLE ASSAULT!" it wasn't Stark that activated his skill since he was still avoiding Judicator's attacks.
But his clones...
"-31261!" the first punch the Mirror Master received was enough to send him flying, but the clones didn't let him rest.
"G-GLASS SHARD, MULTIPLY, GLASS RAIN!" but no matter what he tried, the clones would avoid it all, the fact he was stressed and angry reducing his accuracy by a ton.
And so after only thirty seconds...
"ALL-AREA STRIKE!" he used his unavoidable attack, which was easily dodged by all the Stark(s) inside the arena using [Invincible Dodge].
"-29482" the clones punched him one last time and the Mirror Master fell, it wasn't because he hadn't been killed and his HP weren't at zero that he didn't feel pain.
Each of the strikes from the clones took out his breath, making it increasingly more difficult to cast skills!
[Mirror Master HP: 0/160000]
[5 down, 1 more]
~FWISH~
Judicator threw his scythe at the two clones, who were unable to avoid it and got cut in half, but there was no blood once they did, they just disappeared and went back inside of Stark (pause).
