"..." the bosses from the memories museum can't speak, so unlike the original Judicator who couldn't shut up, this one was much calmer (although he was more aggressive in his actions).
'I like him better that way,' Stark smiled, then got ready to attack.
"DIVINE BLINDNESS," he lifted his sword in the hopes of blinding Stark.
But this time, the boy wouldn't fall for it.
~SHUT~
He closed his eyes, avoiding the light, but doing that was risky as...
~FWISH~
Judicator immediately closed the distance between them while Stark had his eyes closed.
~DODGE~
But even then, thanks to the new ability he had learned: to sense auras even when he couldn't see anything, he managed to dodge the scythe and go right behind the angel.
"DOUBLE ASSAULT," and obviously, now that he had the complete advantage...
Stark easily won against Judicator.
[All bosses defeated, congratulations!]
He was teleported back to the museum.
"I FUCKING DID IT," he laughed, happy as it was his final try.
[Quest: Beat all bosses at the same time... COMPLETE!]
[Reward: 3 skill points]
[Reward acquired]
And so just like that...
[Skill Points: 6 Available], which meant that Stark could upgrade his skills.
But before that...
"SPATIAL INVENTORY," he summoned the void next to him and pulled out the [Breakthrough Stone].
'Let's do this...'
He put a lot of his aura inside the stone while holding it, and instantly, a panel appeared.
[Do you want to initiate the breakthrough from iron to bronze?]
[Y/N]

chapters.title: Chapter 95 - 95: Breakthrough from Iron to Bronze
chapters.content:
[Do you want to initiate the breakthrough from iron to bronze?]
[Y/N]
'Heh… sure I guess,' he didn't see any reason not to do that as he had already finished his training for now, and had acquired the reward for his quest.
He clicked on the Y option, and suddenly…
[Very well, please break the stone now!]
"Alright," he shrugged, then clenched the fist with the stone inside of it, putting more and more pressure until eventually…
~BAM~
It shattered inside his hand.
The runes around the [Breakthrough Stone] were glowing, and as soon as he broke it, they immediately began to fly around Stark.
For a moment, he was surrounded by small glowing motes of power, dancing around him in an intricate ballet.
They began to slowly but surely disintegrate as they sipped inside of Stark's body.
And after only a few seconds… the stone and its runes had completely disappeared.
[Breakthrough passed smoothly, you have high potential!]
[Iron → Bronze]
[Skill limit increased from 10 to 15!]
When you tried to breakthrough using a stone that isn't at your rank, or if you try without being at the required level, the breakthrough stone would just shatter and be wasted, and it is said that the breakthrough process can vary from person to person, some struggle, while others do it easily.
In the end, it is all based on talent and skills, and if the stone itself while merging with your aura feels like you deserve it.
And in Stark's case, there was no denying the stone wasn't going to let him have a hard time.
Especially with [Chosen One] as his talent…
'Well, time to upgrade my skills, then,' he smiled as he mumbled 'status window'.
…
[Level:] 25
[Health:] 9700/9700
[Bloodline:] Human
[Classes:] Domination; Alchemist
[Talent:] Chosen one
[Attributes:] Strength 1024; Speed 1129; Mind/Soul 1273; Stamina 891; Defense 946
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv10; Focus lv5; Aura Smash lv6; Clone Frenzy lv5; Invincible Dodge lv2; Double Assault lv3; Crimson Spears lv1; Heaven's Wrath lv1; Alchemist lv1; Potion Crafting lv1
…
[Skill Points: 6 Available]
This was actually becoming much more difficult to decide which skill he would need to upgrade.
'Rich people must have it easy… they just have to buy [Skill Level Candies] to get everything at the max…' he sighed.
But he had already an idea of what he wanted to upgrade.
Now that his skill level limit was set at 15, it meant that he could upgrade [Domination] even more, giving him more aura and more perks.
'Yeah, that's a good idea,' he nodded and reached out his hand to click on the domination skill while thinking of using 5 skill points.
[Talent: CHOSEN ONE, ACTIVATED!]
But… his talent suddenly activated, and Stark tripped on something invisible, almost as if the universe didn't want him to do that
~FWISH~
His hand moved slightly to the right, and it ended up clicking on… [FOCUS]!
[You have upgraded 'Focus' to level 10!]
'WHAT THE FUCK?' Stark's eyes widened.
There was no way his talent had activated just to fuck him over like that, right?
Upgrading [Domination] was a much better idea than [Focus], and although that skill was also good, he didn't plan to upgrade it for a while…
'I-Is there a way to go back…?'
[No.]
"WELL FUCK YOU THEN!"
[You have upgraded 'Double Assault' to level 4!]
He had wasted 5 precious skill points on focus, and decided to use his remaining one on [Double Assault] since it would soon reach level 5 anyway.
…
[Skill: Focus lv10 (Iron tier-Max)]
[Description: Your focus is unwavering, and all the attacks that come at you seem very slow when you analyze them well, time is now your friend, and it will support you in your journey!]
[New Perk: Able to sense danger when passing through a space, and also able to sense traps and ambushes!]
…
'Heh…' Stark couldn't deny that it was an interesting perk, as now no traps could work on him, but he honestly believed upgrading [Domination] was such a better option than this.
He knew he couldn't undo it now, so he tried to focus on the positive side - maybe there was a reason his talent had steered him towards enhancing his Focus skill.
[Chosen One's] second perk had two events when activating: to cause something bad/a problem to its host, or… to help them out, much like with the TP pearl in the Secret Rift.
What if it was one of those beneficial things, he couldn't know.
Deciding that he didn't want to waste any more time inside the memories museum and wanting to go back to the real world, Stark headed toward the black door that was located at the entrance of the museum's hall.
It had been a week since he had seen the sun, but even after all this exercise, Stark couldn't deny he felt great, almost after a long session at the gym and knowing you did a lot to improve even though you were tired.
He put his hand on the dark handle, ready to twist it and go back to his hotel room.
But the exact moment he did that…
[Focus, ACTIVATED!]
His skill activated, and Stark's eyes widened, a vortex of aura in them as he could feel that something was wrong.
[New Perk: Able to sense danger when passing through a space, and also able to sense traps and ambushes!]
The surrounding air crackled with energy as Stark's senses sharpened, his focus honed to a razor's edge.
His instincts screamed something at him.
And that message was very clear…
"There are people waiting for you on the other side, and they don't have good intentions."
'Is this why… the talent forced me to upgrade focus?' this seemed logical as the timing was way too good.
Was it plot armor? Or his talent was really just trying to help him once in a while?
In all cases, he knew there were people waiting for him in his hotel room.
[They are much, MUCH stronger than you are, though… =)]
Stark could stay inside the Memory Museum for as long as he wanted, his food still enough to survive two additional weeks.
But no… he didn't want to be forced to hide.
And more than anything, he wanted to know what they wanted from him.
"CLONE FRENZY!" he summoned one of his clones beside him, and sent it to open the door, this was to trick the ones looking for him.
'You want to play… let's play…' Stark didn't know anything for now, but he wouldn't let himself be taken out.

chapters.title: Chapter 96 - 96: Ambush and Intruders
chapters.content:
The clone Stark summoned was an exact replica of his body, face, and even clothes.
He sent it toward the black door as his [Focus] skill warned him that something was immensely wrong.
But there was a slight problem to that plan of his…
HOW WAS HE SUPPOSED TO KNOW WHAT HAPPENS ON THE OTHER SIDE?
Sending a clone was nice, and he would know if it died, but he actually needed a way to prepare for whatever awaited him on the other side.
He stood there for thirty seconds, rubbing his chin and wondering what he should do until…
[Close your eyes.]
'…?' a panel appeared before him, and Stark was confused, how could a panel unrelated to skills or anything suddenly appear?
But it was until looking at his clone that he noticed something: it was turning its head slightly toward him, its eyes locked on his figure, a small smile on its face.
He immediately understood that it was the clone itself that communicated with him as it wasn't able to talk with its mouth.
Stark followed its advice and closed his eyes.
And the moment he did, another panel greeted him.
[Now focus all of your aura, and think about being in my position as hard as you can!]
'…' Stark's aura began to flow around his entire body, and soon enough reached his eyes.
Then he focused on the clone ahead, sending the aura in his eyes toward it.
[Now open them back up!]
He didn't understand what any of this could do, it seemed utterly useless in his opinion.
And yet…
"HUH?" When he opened his eyes, he was no longer looking through his own eyes, but through the eyes of the clone.
No… it's not that he was looking through his clone's eyes… HE WAS CONTROLLING IT!
He moved his left hand upward to make sure that all his sensations were correct, and as expected, his hand did the exact movement he wanted it to do.
No doubts anymore, he was controlling that clone.
But if he was controlling it, then what was his original body doing…?
He looked behind him, and saw that the original Stark was still standing, he was just looking at the ground, an emotionless and lifeless expression on his face, his crimson eyes void of any light.
'Creepy…' he shrugged, but hopefully his body would just stay safe inside of the memories museum.
The clone Stark now controlled moved towards the black door, guided by the consciousness of the real Stark.
The moment he put his hand on the handle again though…
[Imminent danger on the other side, be careful!]
'That's why i'm using a clone… duh…' he closed the panel and opened the door, 'Here goes nothing…'
***
~FWISH~
Inside of the hotel room, the black door that led to the memories museum appeared back in the middle of the room, fading in like it was always here.
And suddenly, that ominous door with its dark aura opened, revealing Stark coming out from it, a blank expression on his face.
"…" Stark looked around while trying to seem as unsuspicious as possible, but there was nobody around.
If it wasn't for [Focus] actively warning him about the presence of intruders, he would have surely not known.
'Are they waiting for me to sleep to finish me off?' he pondered, but it seemed unlikely.
After all, Stark could sense the aura in the air, and he was confident that they were much stronger than he was, if he was stronger he would quite literally just come out in his real body and beat their asses.
But Stark didn't like to take risks when they were unneeded, and he was safe inside of the memories museum.
So he did something the intruders didn't expect him to do: call out for them.
There were 5 of them, and each of them hid somewhere close, yet too hard for Stark to notice under normal circumstances.
It was safe to say they knew exactly what they were doing.
And Stark didn't think of it before, but their aura felt strangely familiar…
'Domination…' he thought of this word as he walked toward his kitchen, there was no denying at least one of them was from the domination class… and maybe even more…?
But no, he didn't want to just sit there and wait.
"Please come out, if you wanted to kill me you would have already done it," he spoke out loud, grabbing a drink from his fridge.
He obviously couldn't drink or eat as he was only controlling a clone, but the goal of everything he was doing was to make it seem like he wasn't surprised or even scared of them.
His voice carried through the room, echoing off the walls and creating an eerie silence that seemed to stretch on forever.
Stark waited, his senses on high alert, waiting for any sign of movement or a response to his call.
A few seconds passed, and the moment Stark wanted to call again…
"Shit… didn't know that kid was smart enough to notice us!" a voice could be heard
"Should have expected it from a high potential individual!" another answered.
And then…
Five figures emerged from different spots of his room: each of them cloaked in a dark, swirling aura that seemed to bend the very light around them.
They were wearing casual clothes, and their faces were visible, but their bodies appeared from the walls, the floor, and even the ceiling, it was as if they had merged with the texture of his room to hide.
"Told you it wouldn't work!" a woman with long black hair laughed, slapping the guy on her left.
"Pss… anybody would of fallen for it," he was fairly tall, reaching 190cm, and had very defined mucles, his head was balding though, and the light on the ceiling was shining on his empty head.
"I mean… what even is that door, we thought he was out of the city or country, but what the hell is that?" another man with grey hair, yellow eyes, and big circular glasses mumbled, rubbing his chin.
"Portable dimension maybe? Wouldn't be surprising knowing what he did or must have experienced…" a second woman with a bob cut and purple hair sighed, she had a staff in her hands, and she was spinning it like it was a blade.
"…" the guy on the middle though wasn't speaking, he had a well defined face although he looked older than the others, and had short white hair that went in all sort of directions, clearly not kept well (or maybe since he always fights?).
But what Stark noticed with him wasn't his clothes, or even the fact he had a katana in his left hand, but his eyes…
Just like Stark's original body, which he left inside the memories museum, his eyes were devoid of any light, almost as if he was lifeless.
"Let's just get down to business," he sighed, his voice just as lifeless as his eyes.
And then…
~FWISH~
The purple-haired girl used her staff to send a magic arrow at Stark.
'AH SHIT? THEY WANT TO FIGHT!'
If it wasn't yet again for [Focus] which allowed him to see the arrow come a few instants before it hit him, his clone would have probably just died.
Stark folded his body backward to avoid the arrow, which came crashing against the wall behind him and destroyed it.
"HEY, I'M GONNA HAVE TO PAY FOR THAT!" he shouted at her while pointing at the damage she had caused.
"Calm down, Yui, we aren't here to fight…" the leader gently smiled and sat on a chair around the main table, while the other four just stood behind him, staring down at Stark.

chapters.title: Chapter 97 - 97: The Domination Association's Offer
chapters.content:
"Mr.Stark, please do sit down," the leader gently smiled while pointing at the chair on the other side of the table.
'Fucking hell…' Stark did as he was told and sat down.
"I seriously could of died by that arrow, you know?" the black-haired boy immediately spoke, looking at the purple-haired girl with a glare.
Of course, he hid the fact that his current body was that of a mere clone, but it was still very close, and he knows that if they put their mind to it, he would stand no chance in winning.
Yet none of them seemed surprised or showed any kind of emotions, they just stared at Stark with blank expressions.
"If you died from that… then it would have meant that you weren't as good as we expected you to be," the leader, his eyes still lifeless, smiled, putting his two hands together and placing his elbows on the table.
"…" Stark was confused, but he could sense all their gazes on him.
"But it's fine… Stark Heartsouls… for we were sure that as the chosen, you would avoid it," the leader smiled, "You may call me Juan."
And the moment the man named Juan spoke to Stark and said his codename, he immediately understood what was happening.
"Please do look at this card," Juan put his hand in his pocket, his katana beside his chair, then pulled out a crimson card.
Stark took it in hand and began reading.
[Domination Association]
[Solves all problems related to the domination class and preserves the overall peace]
"As you may know, mr.Stark, the domination class is the most powerful one, but also the most dangerous, which is why our organization, which is only filled with domination users, do our best to make sure everything is fine!" Juan looked at his teammates from behind while speaking, and they all nodded.
Stark soon realized that all of them were from the domination class, and even Yui, the one that shot the arrow at him, wasn't a magus.
The Domination class wasn't limited to any weapon, and everyone who had received it were granted their own way of fighting.
Much like Orasio with the shield, Hero with the flying swords, and Dreamer with his books.
"I don't see how any of that is related to me," Stark returned the card; plus he didn't like the aura around them all, as it seemed like they weren't as peaceful as they made themselves appear to be, otherwise they wouldn't all have their [Domination] skill activated.
"Oh…" Juan grabbed his katana, an overwhelming aura that almost blinded Stark around him, then pointed his katana toward the boy, almost reaching his face, "But of course it is, CHOSEN, after all… we know what you did."
"…"
"But do not fret," he didn't retract his katana away, "You are a precious pawn after all…"
All others were glaring at Stark, a mix of cautiousness in their eyes even though they were much stronger than he was.
"After all…" Juan's smile grew so wide that it was became creepy, "You are the first and only person to ever complete the 'Domination Trial' on the death difficulty, aren't you?"
Stark stared at Juan for a moment, then rolled his eyes, they somehow knew about his achievements, he didn't know how, but if they were part of some bigger organization, it meant they had both the power and money to take him out at any time.
And yet… Stark wasn't scared.
He didn't know why, but he kept a very calm expression.
Somehow… he wasn't scared of these people.
"As the domination user with the highest potential out of them all…" Juan kept smiling, "We would love if you could join us, you will be granted money, fame, women, anything you want!"
Anyone would of jumped in joy at such an opportunity, but Stark didn't even think of accepting for even a second.
He slapped the katana that was in front of him away, then looked at Juan dead in the eyes, "Sorry, but I think I have too much potential to be stuck in such a lame organization," he smiled back.
For a fraction of a second, Juan's eyes twitched, surprise visible in them.
And then…
~FWISH, CLANG, WASH~
The four people that were behind him suddenly appeared around Stark, all their weapons pointed at him.
Yui, the purple-haired mage, stood on the table, her staff pointed at Stark, and visible particles of magic glowing at the edge of it, meaning she was ready to throw another arrow.
The buff bald man was behind Stark, his hands, as large as the boy's head, glowing with a crimson aura, indicating that he could crush him any second.
The black-haired woman pulled out two daggers from god knows where and stood to his side, one blade against his neck and the other pointed at his crotch.
And as for the last grey-haired man with the glasses, his face turned dark, his glasses being the only visible feature in his face because of the white glow in their reflection, his left hand was also glowing with a golden color, and it was opened, facing Stark, it almost felt like he was about to lift him up using psychic powers.
"..." Stark had seen them get closer, but he didn't for a single second show any surprise.
Knowing that he was a clone somehow boosted his confidence to the max.
"Know your place," the woman with the daggers got her weapons closer to his vital areas.
"Should we teach this kid a lesson, boss?" the tall man put his hands against Stark's head, ready to crush it.
But Juan wasn't convinced, even if Stark was a prodigy, he shouldn't be so calm against people who could actively kill him in one strike.
"Prodigie's Eyes!" he activated his skill, and suddenly...
[Stark Heartsouls HP: 1/1]
The clone was so well-made it didn't only copy appearance, but also even tricked skills, if it wasn't for the one HP, even Juan would have fallen for it.
But now he knew...
"There is no point," he smiled, talking to his friends, not Stark, "That kid is smarter than you all."
Of course, he wouldn't admit that he had fallen for this trick too.
"What do you mean, boss, how can he be smarter than us?" the man with glasses spoke to Juan, confusion on his face.
"There is no point," he repeated, "This is not the real Stark, it is a mere clone, if not an illusion, basically, this kid knows what he is doing."

chapters.title: Chapter 98 - 98: Scheduled a Family Meeting
chapters.content:
Upon hearing their boss talk, all the other members turned their heads toward Stark, just to see him with a wide grin on his face, almost as if he didn't care if he was killed by them.
An expression that showed that even though he was the weakest one in the room, he was still in total control.
They instantly knew Juan was telling the truth, and so they removed their aura and put their weapons away.
"Well... it was nice meeting you Stark," Juan smiled, and his companions immediately disappeared to go back behind him, it was so fast even Stark struggled to see it with [Focus].
"See ya," he shrugged.
"You are not interested for now, and it is fine," he got up from the chair, "I hope to meet you again soon, hopefully you will not be dead by the time the second domination trial starts."
"I won't be," Stark confirmed.
"Then we will be going out," and suddenly, Juan in a micro-second tightened his grip around his katana and...
"Instant Slash," he cut the clone's head so fast that it looked he didn't even move.
"-483618!" the damage was terrifying, enough to take down Judicator in one strike.
"Goodbye, Chosen," he waved from behind while the clone's head was falling, then all of the domination users disappeared instantly in a flash.
"Fucking hell..." Stark's felt his world spin, he didn't feel any sort of pain since it wasn't his real body, but it was still confusing to know someone so strong was right there.
…
"HAAAAAA~" he opened his eyes again as the clone's figure seeped back into his original body: he was now back inside the memories museum in his own body, his clone was dead after all, so his consciousness was immediately transferred back.
And as soon as he got up…
…
[Skill: Clone Frenzy]
[New Perk: By focusing your aura in your eyes and transferring it to your clone, you are now able to control the other Stark perfectly (although it would still be restricted in terms of strength and speed).]
…
'So you can gain perks even if you don't level up your skill…?' now that he knew that, the presence of the Memories Museum became so much more interesting as it meant that over the course of thousands of tries, he could possibly unlock a new perk for his skills using his brain, much like when he learned to see auras even though his eyes were closed.
'Well… let's get out of here,' he sighed and headed toward the black door.
He had seen them leave, but he wasn't dumb, so he obviously sent another clone to check out whether they were trying to double down on him.
But even after a few minutes of analysis, he sensed no auras, so he went back to his original body, then opened the door and entered his hotel room.
The door to the 'Memories Museum' immediately disappeared once the original body left.
'My wall… :(' he was madder that they actually broke down a part of his room, 'Fucking hell I don't have the money to deal with that shit…'
But… after looking around, he noticed that there was something on the table.
It was… a cheque?
…
[Cheque:] 2 million rher coins
[Message:] Sorry for the wall, use that money to fix it up!
…
Two million rher coins was no small amount, and it could easily cover the repairs for his damaged wall.
But the apology accompanying it puzzled him. Why would they care about covering for his room after trying to recruit him and then attacking his clone?
'Heh… I don't care, money is money!' he grabbed his phone and scanned the cheque using his bank application, now all he needed to do was wait for people to notice what happened and come ask him questions, 'They are probably gonna kick me out…'
He figured he should really start saving up to buy a house or even just an apartment as living in hotels wasn't that good.
But surprisingly, as soon as he finished scanning the cheque, putting the money in his account… his network came back.
And so…
~BEEP, BEEP, BEEP~
Dozens upon dozens of notifications flooded his phone's screen.
'The fuck…?'
He opened it using his passcode and realized that the notifications came from one application only: messages.
And even more surprising, it was only one person.
Stark could already guess who it was since he only had one person in his contact list…
And he was right.
…
[Contact:] Lana Moonless
[182 messages, 47 missed calls]
…
{Hey, did you see the news? You were on them!}
{Everyone has been talking about the bunny-masked man haha!}
{Wanna go somewhere later…? Of course, to talk!}
Such messages appeared over and over.
{Why aren't you answering?}
{Ignoring me now? What did I do?}
{Are you mad?}
That's when she began to call him many times.
But in the end, Stark couldn't answer any of those messages or calls since he was inside the Memories Museum, and he had left his phone inside his inventory void since he was too focused on defeating the 6 bosses.
He would try to make up for it, but he didn't really know why she was so obsessed with talking to him.
And the last message she sent, only a mere hour ago was…
[Hey, if you see this… wanna meet up with my family? My father wants to talk to you!]
'…'
He had just come back from his training, and from meeting with five people who clearly had no good intentions with him as they knew who he was.
But…
'Heh… why not!'
He would also use this opportunity to make sure to explain why he didn't respond.
…
{Stark: Why not, when do you want me to come?}
He answered for the first time in a week, and the message was immediately read by Lana.
'Damn, does she stay on her phone all day long?'
This was false, the reason why it was seen so quick was because Stark was the only person Lana allowed notifications to be activated on her phone, so she immediately knew it was him when she heard the BEEP.
{Lana: YOU FINALLY ANSWER? WHERE WERE YOU!!!??}
She went on a five paragraph rant about how she was worried and thought that he had gone on some crazy adventure again and died, which Stark promptly ignored since 'I ain't reading allat'.
But soon enough…
{I'll come get you two days from now, I'll inform my family!}
She seemed to be more excited than he was for that, but oh well, he guessed that spending all his time fighting and going to the market was bad for him, so normal social interactions couldn't be so bad now could they…?
{Stark: Great, I'll be waiting for that :)}
He had a lot of things to think about, and it was possible he would need to attend another rift soon if it opened, plus he had seen after Lana's comment that the videos of his battles had all been posted on MeeTube and were reviewed by many classifiers and news stations, meaning that Stark was basically one of the most famous persons in the world right now.
Or at least, the bunny-masked man was since videos showing his achievements reached tens of millions of views.
'Well, time to get ready for that meeting… hopefully it goes well!'
It didn't.

chapters.title: Chapter 99 - 99: The Moonless Family
chapters.content:
[Bunny-masked man vs Judicator (EPIC FIGHT!!!)]
[28,413,095 views]
The internet had gone wild after the release of the videos from Stark's battles, it wasn't every day that such a high potential prodigy appeared, and even more so when people realized that he was indeed at a very low level compared to the rest of the classifiers present, yet he had managed to conquer the rift first.
And Stark actually kinda wished he had removed that damn mask now, but when he thought about it, he realized that the mystery of him not showing his face was what attracted many people over.
Now it wasn't only average citizens that praised him, but also organizations and guilds that were trying to look for him and hire him.
'No wonder that domination association knew who I was and came to me, huh…'
{No way in hell he is level 25!}
{I'm telling you, it must be a big-shot that's faking his level using the [Level-Bluff] item or a skill!}
{Or maybe it's a powerful talent? After all he came back to LIFE!!}
People were giving their theories over what could be happening, and Stark even saw entire theory videos explaining all of his actions and the possible reason why he came back from the dead after being cut.
Needless to say, all these videos were nonsense, but Stark still laughed at some crazy theories people would come up with.
{Lana Moonless: I'm coming to pick you up tomorrow at 12pm, so be ready!}
{Stark Heartsouls: Okay, see you tomorrow =)}
It had only been one day since he had finished his training and met with those five domination users, and Stark spent the entirety of his small break lazing around in his room.
The hotel staff came to check up on him, and after he paid the 2 million needed for the repair, he was given three days to leave his room as he was "banned" from ever buying a new one in here.
It seemed like saying "some guys intruded my room to kill me" didn't work as an excuse.
Soon enough, Stark fell asleep.
He wasn't nervous about what could happen tomorrow, after all he was just meeting with Lana's family since her father wanted to see him, nothing more, nothing less.
{Lana Moonless: Goodnight, Stark.}
He didn't answer as he was already in the dream realm.
***
The next day, Stark woke up feeling refreshed, then immediately got ready for the meeting by taking a shower and… dressing up in the most average clothes ever.
'What am I supposed to do? I have nothing else,' he shrugged, and he didn't really feel the need to dress up for a mere meeting, even if it was with the 'Archer King' or whatever his name was.
…
{Lana Moonless: I'm waiting for you, please come down!}
He did as he was told, putting everything that he owned inside of his [Spatial Inventory] and leaving his room for good: he wouldn't come back to it ever again.
Stark made his way down to the lobby, and when he went outside… he was greeted by a luxurious white car straight out of a movie.
People around stopped just to observe the car and its owner, it was obvious that they were dirt rich to be able to afford such a thing.
And as Stark guessed… it was Lana that was currently driving.
He didn't say a word as he approached the car and opened the passenger door next to the driver seat, sitting down next to the blonde-haired girl.
She was currently wearing a beautiful dress, looking both elegant and a bit intimidating at the same time.
"Couldn't have worn better clothes?" she raised her eyebrows while looking him from head to toe, analyzing his appearance.
"Nah, plus I don't really have the money!" he wanted to save cash, and he was content with his four set of clothing as they helped him get through for now, no reason to buy more.
"Sigh…" Lana smiled for a bit as she heard his words, then immediately went back to serious mode when noticing that Stark was looking at her, "It's fine I guess, but please make sure to act well, you'll be meeting my mom, dad, and also my brother…"
"Sureeee… by the way you're 16 and you can drive?" he questioned, they had just graduated from middle school and were all sixteen years old, meaning they weren't real adults.
"I mean… you learn how to drive when you're around 14, it's normal," she responded, "Didn't your parents teach you?"
"…" Stark knew how to drive thanks to his past life, but he was pretty sure the 'Heartsouls' family hadn't even bother to sign him up for driving classes, meaning that he had no driving license, "I guess I do too…"
"See!"
And just like that, the two kept going toward Lana's house.
***
Luxury District, Fellarburg
"Are we there yet?"
"For the hundredth fucking time, Stark, NO WE AREN'T!" Lana shouted before turning her face toward the window, "Oh, we actually are there!"
They were in the luxury district, where all the most important and powerful families of the entirety of Fellarburg resided.
Around them were dozens of mansions, and soon enough… Lana parked in the garden of one of the mansions, ten other cars next to it.
"No space to park…" Lana groaned, and Stark just looked at her with a disgusted look, "W-what?"
"Rich problems," he shrugged as he got off the car.
The mansion before them was nothing short of grandeur with its towering pillars and intricate designs.
At the front of it stood a massive moon that kept flickering, a weird aura around it.
'They realllyyyy want to show people who they are…' but they weren't the only ones as Stark noticed that some other mansions nearby also had text or some sort of sign indicating who they were by the entrance.
"Just a neighbor competition to show who the greatest families are," Lana chuckled.
Fellarburg was one of the greatest countries in this world, not only because there were many powerful families in it, but also since there always seemed to be some sort of rift opening or problem that occurred there: a perfect heaven for all those that sought thrill.
Its population was well over 50 million people, although the overall population of this world was only of 1.2 billion because of the constant chaos and death, as well as the fact the outside world was filled with monsters.
"Let's go, they are waiting in the dining room!" Lana smiled, excited to present him to her family for some reason.
But to be honest, all Stark could think about currently was how familiar this situation was to when he met his family when he first arrived in this world.
Of course, he hadn't known who they were for long, so he didn't care, but it was just weird.
And soon enough… they reached the meeting room.
"Mother, father, Aoki, I'm here!" she called out as she opened the giant wooden door.
And that's when Stark saw them: the members of the 'Moonless' family.
'Hopefully no problems this time…' he sighed as he advanced, revealing himself to the members, who all looked at him in the eyes, different expressions on their faces.

chapters.title: Chapter 100 - 100: The Academies of Fellarburg
chapters.content:
"Hello!" Lana's mother, Louise Moonless, gave Stark a warm smile as she fixed her gaze on him, she had long brown hair.
"…" Aoki, the brother, didn't say anything, and instead just glared at Stark, he also had blond hair but didn't seem to like him at all.
Stark promptly ignored him and sat down on one of the available chairs, which were both coincidentally right next to one other.
"Nice to know my future son-in-law has come here!" Arthur, the archer king, laughed.
"DAD?!" but Lana didn't seem to like the teasing.
"…" Stark didn't say anything, instead he just looked down at the table before him, it was made of pure glass, so he was able to see himself in it.
He saw his face in the reflection and… he noticed that he was sweating.
'…?' he didn't know why, but he had a bad feeling about this meeting.
They seemed friendly, but beyond those smiles… he saw something else.
"Let's start eating then we can talk," Arthur laughed and clapped both his hands, which resulted in a dozen butlers and maids to bring many plates filled with food on the table, "Enjoy your meal, Stark!"
Safe to say, Stark didn't touch his meal.
And after half an hour since the meeting started… Arthur finally talked about the REAL reason why they invited him.
Of course, it was visible Lana didn't know anything since she was happily smiling, not knowing why the atmosphere was so tense.
"Oh… and by the way, Stark," Arthur smiled, and the overwhelming blue aura around him suddenly grew ten times in size, from Stark's position, all he could see was his face turning dark, while his eyes and mouth were burning with blue aura.
He asked the question.
"Have you thought about which academy you would like to go to?"
Stark, feeling the weight of everyone's gaze on him, hesitantly looked up from his now-empty plate. His gaze met Arthur's, who was waiting for his answer.
Fellarburg is home to four elite academies recognized as the pinnacle of education, even among others of this world: Rift Conqueror Academy, Crimson Class Academy, Imperial Academy and finally, All-Go-To Academy.
Of course, as a domination class user, Stark truly had no better way to improve his skills than by risking his life inside of rifts… or joining that stupid domination association, but he had no plans to do that.
"My daughter is going to the Rift Conqueror Academy, it is ranked top 1 in the entirety of Fellarburg, and top 3 worldwide," Arthur boasted.
"…"
Inside this world, the 'Class Showcase', which was the event where Stark conquered the [City Ruins], didn't only serve as a start for your classifier career, but also to show your potential to other parties.
Depending on how well you did inside of it, you would receive invitations to academies, guilds and even associations.
And Stark… well… even though he was the one to conquer the rift, he hadn't received any sort of invitations.
He couldn't deny there was a small appeal to it, but he was pretty content with how he was doing currently, and there was pretty much no way for him to attend…
The reason was simple:
First, you need to be part of a big family, or prove your worth inside of rifts to be able to attend to one of them, which would be impossible for Stark since everyone knew that he was the black sheep of his family.
And second… well… there is a tuition fee, obviously, needless to say Stark would rather spend his money buying items that would actually benefit him, or ingredients now that he was an alchemist.
But…
"Would you like to attend an academy, Stark Heartsouls?" Arthur grinned, looking at the boy in the eyes, "I think you deserve it…!"
"…" Stark had a perplexed expression on his face, "Sorry, but I have no way to prove my strength, and the tuition is way too expensive."
"Oh yes, the tuition for these academies vary, but for the top, it is roughly around 20 to 25 million rher coins…" he nodded, which almost made Stark choke, this would be enough to buy a decent house or even a legendary/mythical equipment.
By now, Stark and Arthur were the only ones that spoke, the rest just looked at them both engage in this conversation.
The All-Go-To Academy is the best diverse academy in Fellarburg, it accepts any and all classes, meaning that even those not specialized in close range could benefit in attending.
The Imperial Academy stood as the pinnacle of educational resources, it is for people who would rather stay in the back and use their brains rather than fight and risk their lives.
The Crimson Class Academy is a bit of a special case as it only accepts the top three classes in this world: Soul Wielder, Magus and Alchemist, they are considered the best as they hold the strongest individuals; any person from a different class that attempts to access it, no matter their potential and strength, wouldn't be accepted.
They only want the elite of the elite, basically.
And as for the last and final academy that was considered the 'top' of Fellarburg…
It was the Rift Conqueror academy, and although this one accepted any and all classes as long as you were strong, it was still the one with the highest standards, and the most difficult to enter.
Removing the 25 million rher coin tuition fee, there were also the many other classifiers there, and showing any signs of weakness could result in you being taken over by them, or even getting kicked out if you make a mistake.
"We do not need failures" is their slogan, and it results in hundreds if not thousands of people getting suspended/expulsed every year, they don't even refund the tuition, and it is even said there is a 95% failure rate as the majority of students quit (if they don't just die).
Getting suspended from this academy or quitting also goes on your record, meaning that it would result in most good guilds/groups not wanting anything to do with you: you would have to start from scratch again.
It was a risk many were willing to take though… because if you ever survived the two years and graduated, you were not only guaranteed success, but also strength and connections to back it up.
"Stark… do you want to attend the Rift Conqueror Academy?" Arthur gave a chilling smile to Stark as he suddenly asked the question he had invited him over for.

chapters.title: Chapter 101 - 101: An Offer From the Archer King
chapters.content:
"Stark… do you want to attend the Rift Conqueror Academy?" Arthur suddenly smiled while speaking to the boy.
He had already expected something like that the moment he began to talk about academies, but 'Rift Conqueror' was the top 1 in Fellarburg, and considered the top 3 in the world.
"…" Stark looked at the blond-haired archer for a few seconds before sighing, "I don't have the money or talent to attend."
Of course, the latter was a lie since he was confident in his abilities to dominate others using the domination class, but the money part was true.
"Ohoh~ but I have seen you fight inside that rift, Stark, and I can promise you that you have everything you need to attend," he nodded, reminding Stark that Arthur was the leader of the crimson moon squad (although he never participates, he had just formed the team), and so that meant he knew Stark participated.
He knew that the person before him was the bunny-masked man everyone was talking about, and he would make sure to take advantage of that.
"Dad, you want him to attend with me, don't you?" Lana pouted, suddenly speaking for the first time, "I don't need protection!"
"Princess~ it's not about you or anything, I just feel like granting such a strong person access to a way to get stronger is a good thing, your relationship with him can go the way you want it to go…"
She blushed at the last few words, but stayed silent.
"I still don't have money," Stark shrugged, confident that this would be enough to let him off the hook.
'To be honest… it can't be that bad…' he thought, plus attending such a big school would mean the possibility to get not only stronger, but also access better rifts.
The 95% failure rate didn't scare him at all.
And maybe, just maybe, there was another domination user hiding among the crowd? After all he knew that some others existed thanks to the domination association.
But of course, the 25 million fee was still too much, so he obviously didn't plan to go.
Or at least, that's what he thought.
"Oh, but it's fine, Stark, we can pay your tuition fee for you," Arthur smiled, his tone indicating that he had ulterior motives.
"DAD?!" Lana slammed her fists against the table, lucky she didn't have much strength as an archer or else it would have been destroyed, "You're going to pay for his tuition?!"
Louise and Aoki seemed to already know about this, so the two of them just stared at the conversation with blank expressions.
"Princess…" the aura around Arthur became nauseating all of a sudden, it was one of the perks of [Focus]: the ability to sense the intentions of someone, and this meant that whatever the archer king wanted from him was no good, "Of course it won't be free…"
Stark raised an eyebrow, suspicious of Arthur's sudden generosity, "And what do you want in return for paying my tuition fee?" he asked cautiously.
Arthur chuckled, his blue eyes glinting with amusement, "Actually nothing… but there is one small problem…"
'Here we go,' Stark sighed, he knew there was a twist.
Arthur placed a weird device that resembled a watch in the middle of the table, and after pressing on a button, several holographic pictures appeared.
"Rift Conqueror has no admission test, the only way to attend is to prove your worth," he began explaining, showing the image of a rift portal, "And well… if you want to attend and for me to pay the tuition, you need to do one simple thing…"
"And that is…?"
Arthur grabbed one of the holographic pictures and increased its size, it was the picture of a cave in the middle of nowhere, and at the end of it… a closed rift could be seen.
"This rift was found recently…" his tone became serious, almost as if he wanted to sell something to Stark.
"I can already see where this is going, you don't even need to tell me…" Stark groaned and interrupted the archer king while he was still explaining.
"HEY ASSHOLE, DON'T INTERRUPT FATHER," Aoki suddenly took out his bow and pointed it at Stark.
But Stark wasn't impressed.
They had revealed their true intentions the moment the word academy and rift was spoken.
"…?" Lana looked around, confused as to why the atmosphere had become like that.
'They are using her relationship with me to trick her…' Stark internally laughed, they seemed like good parents, but oh well, he was wrong.
"So you want me to go to this rift and conquer it, that's what you want, don't you?" Stark smirked as he slammed his fist against the table, but just using a bit of his aura was enough to crack the glass.
Arthur raised an eyebrow at the damage Stark had caused, but continued his explanation. "Yes, that's correct. If you can conquer this rift, not only will you gain entry to the Rift Conqueror Academy, but you will also receive a generous sum of money for your trouble."
"So basically…" the aura around Stark became overwhelming, he wasn't joking anymore, "You want me to do YOUR dirty work =)?"
"Dad, what is happening?" Lana titled her head while asking her family, "Why would you need Stark to do that…?"
"Princess~ we just need to see if he is worthy of entering the academy, that is all!"
Arthur without even waiting for Stark to say anything else pulled out the third holographic image, and on it he could see an arrow with a white heart at the edge of it, as well as a powerful aura surrounding it.
"We need you to bring the 'Arrows of Serria', that is all we ask," Arthur looked at Stark, "And if you do that…"
He clicked on a watch that was on his wrist, and a suitcase suddenly appeared on the cracked table, it was full of money, "We will not only pay your tuition but also give you 5 million rher coins, meaning this is a 30 million rher coins mission."
"Go fuck yourself," Stark flipped him off with not a single moment of hesitation, he wouldn't be sold like that by money.
If he wanted, he could go to another rift by himself and get all the items he wanted to become rich, he didn't need all that bullshit.
Lana still seemed quite shocked of whatever just happened, "Father! What the fuck is happening?" she actually started to be mad, "You ask MY friend to do your work?"
And although Stark was grateful to her for getting mad for him… he still decided to leave.
"It was nice to know you, Arthur," Stark got up from his chair and began heading toward the exit.
"Are you sure, kid? This rift may be more difficult than the one you previously went through, but it also means a greater chance to get experience."
"If I want experience i'll just go somewhere else, just hire somebody else to do the work, shouldn't be difficult with all the cash."
"Well… that is true, but the 'Arrows of Serria' are guarded by one of the 'Godless Demon's' apostles…" Arthur scratched his chin, seemingly undisturbed by Stark's behavior.
"Quit it dad, Stark won't accept such a request!" Lana crossed her arm.
But no… Stark stopped in his tracks as he had heard something that made him excited.
The reason was simple: that old man just mentioned a godless demon apostle.
And that meant…
'I need to complete the ApostleDex,' it was his chance to clear one of the remaining 13 squares.

chapters.title: Chapter 102 - 102: Conquer a Rift for Money?
chapters.content:
Suddenly, Stark turned around and went to sit back on his chair again, "I may be interested," he said, which brought a smile to Arthur, and a shocked expression to Lana's face.
Stark didn't want to be used for money or to get items, but oh boy he wouldn't let go of a chance to fight a godless demon apostle.
After all he still had 13 more to defeat before completing his ApostleDex.
And honestly, he REALLY wanted to complete it.
'I can kill an apostle, get experience, money, and prove myself, this is a deluxe combo!'
His ego had been too big to accept it previously as it was straight up disrespectful, but now adding something that TRULY benefited him because it was unique meant he could go in without issues.
"Tell me all the information, old man," he sighed.
"I knew you wouldn't let me down, kid," Arthur smirked, seemingly thinking that money truly could buy anyone.
Meanwhile, Lana just sighed, "I really can't understand how you guys think..."
She hadn't expected Stark to change his opinion after acting so offended, but maybe something interested him in her dad's speech.
In the end, she just stayed quiet and looked at Stark and her dad.
The latter clicked on the watch again, and another row of holographic images and text appeared.
"This watch has everything you need to know about your mission, bring us the arrows as proof that you completed it and we will respect our promises," Arthur slid the watch on the table, and Stark grabbed it with a swift motion.
"..." he looked at the object for a few seconds.
Maybe this was a trap, maybe he was making a mistake, but honestly, it was up to him to judge whether he wanted to go or not, so he accepted it.
"I guess that is all for now, the next time we meet is when you bring us those arrows," Arthur smiled and he pointed at the exit door.
'Or never...' Stark thought as he smiled back, it was visible in the family's expression that there was a huge chance Stark wouldn't come back, yet they didn't seem to care.
"See ya..." Stark waved from behind as he opened the diner room's door and left.
"O-oh, let me accompany him," Lana wanted to follow after him to talk, she honestly didn't like whatever was happening.
But...
"Sit down, dear," Louise, her mother, stopped her, "It's rare we eat with the entire family present, let's take advantage of such a situation shall we not?"
It was now clear that they didn't want her to approach him for now, so she just complied, and instead just hoped Stark would come out on top, like he always did until now.
***
Stark found himself outside the mansion with the giant flickering moon at the entrance.
'Of course they didn't even bother to hire someone to bring me back home, but oh well, i'm banned from the hotel so it's fine...'
He would need to find an apartment or somewhere else to stay, but he just wanted to read about the information he had gotten from Arthur for now.
Public places were out of the question since the watch's images and texts were displayed for anyone to see.
And so he just decided to go in an empty alley in an empty street, then summoned one of his clones to watch the nearby surroundings, as there was only one way people could come in from.
Luckily, there was nobody, and he was able to place the watch on the ground and activate it using a button on the side.
And suddenly... all the information he needed appeared.
…
[Mission Rift:] Sierra's Death Path
[Type:] One-Classifier Run
[Difficulty:] Level 50-75 Nightmare-Level Rift
[Note:] There is no information for this rift other than that it is a 'One-Classifier Run' type, meaning that only one classifier at a time can enter to attempt and beat it, seven people have been sent already, but none have come back since.
We have also been sent small messages by those inside before their demise, and they all usually said two sentences: "Avoid the traps" and "Don't get hit by the arrows".
…
This was pretty much all, and the only other image Stark could see was the one with the cave, where the closed rift was in.
But he understood that it wasn't because it was closed that people couldn't enter, but because there was already someone inside (though they had died since obviously).
"One-Classifier Run" are one of the most hated types of rifts ever, and most people don't even attempt to go through them if they didn't already know they had the level to beat them (and even that couldn't guarantee success).
This was harsh for Stark, but when he thought about it… it didn't change much.
Since the beginning, even inside the Domination Trial, there were always people beside him, but when he tried to conquer the [City Ruins] and [Shadow Valley], he had done it completely alone.
Meaning that such a rift wouldn't change his strategy much.
Of course, the fact that the recommended level was 60-75, as well as the fact that it was Nightmare-Level meant it would be harder than anything else Stark attempted.
But somehow… he was still excited.
His training had helped him improve his movements, as well as unlock new perks for his abilities, but strangely enough, he felt confident.
Plus he had gotten the 'Alchemist' class, meaning that he could use his potions to gain small advantages.
'I need to stock up on ingredients…' he believed, already setting up his strategy.
But as soon as he did that…
Another giant panel came from the watch.
[To the person reading this, this rift is set up in the mid-point to Olympia, which is the country next to Fellarburg, we have already reserved your train ticket, so you have until tomorrow to prepare!]
'That means that… I'll be entering this rift by tomorrow night…' Stark let out a quick laugh, they had just told him and expected him to go do it so quickly?
But that also meant that by tomorrow night… he would enter his hardest rift yet.
…
(Back at the dining room of the Moonless Mansion)
"Father," Aoki spoke while grabbing a piece of meat, "Do you believe that the boy will be able to bring the arrows and defeat the boss?"
They had given him this mission since they believed he had a chance to complete it, but it was the same for the seven others, yet they had all failed.
Arthur didn't speak for a few seconds, then looked at his son with a smile on his face, "It depends on the boy's skills…"
"But if you were to gauge his chances, what survival rate would you give him," Aoki smiled back, seemingly just as sadistic as his father.
"Hm~" Arthur scratched his chin, "Although I do believe there is no such thing as luck in rifts… I think…"
He kept thinking every few seconds, actively trying to analyze Stark's chance of survival.
And once the entire family was looking at the head with their eyebrows raised.
He finally said it.
"I would give him a 6% chance of completing that rift…" Arthur smiled before looking back at the plates before him.
"…?!" hearing that, Lana was astonished, doesn't that mean they sent Stark to his death?
After all… a 6% chance of survival was nothing!
"But oh well… you never know, he might surprise us…" the Archer King shrugged before continuing to eat, his expression showing that he truly believed Stark would not come back, "The ClassiTop event of Fellarburg is also happening in 3 weeks, so we might as well just forget about him if he doesn't come back in a week…"
And so just like that, the Moonless Family kept enjoying their meal (except for Lana).

chapters.title: Chapter 103 - 103: The VIP Express
chapters.content:
This was his goal, or at least that's what the screen on the watch asked him to do.
Already one day had passed since he had spoken to the Moonless Family and given this weird mission in exchange for 30 million rher coins, and also a chance to prove himself to join the 'Rift Conqueror Academy'.
Obviously, he didn't spend yesterday doing nothing, instead he went out to buy enough ingredients to craft 20 potions of Strength/Speed, and 30 potions of regeneration.
And this meant…
[Alchemy Inventory: x20 Potion of Strength, x20 Potion of Speed, x40 Potion of Regeneration]
He was currently waiting inside of the train station, the train heading toward Olympia arriving very soon.
Apparently they had given him the 'VIP' express train, which travelled at around 400km per hour, meaning that he would arrive at Olympia in less than five hours.
'They really want me to complete that mission… or die…' he added that sentence for a reason: there was no way 7 people they had hired beforehand failed, yet they believed that some random kid with a good talent could win.
All his items and equipments were inside of his [Spatial Inventory], but he was currently using:
-The Crystalheart Band
-The Soulbearer's Embrace
-The Purgatory Shadow Ring
-Mirror Master's Crystal Shard, he had never used this one before as he had forgotten about it (and also because the required level is 20), but basically…
[Special Perk:] You can use this crystal to cast a giant glass shard that deals incredible damage to one enemy, there is a cooldown of ten minutes between each use, and it is recommended to infuse the shard into a ring for better use.
And finally… Judicator's Black Wings, as they gave him a boost in speed with the [Dash] perk.
He had equipped everything he had (that he didn't sell) except for the Warrior's Cloak as it was just annoying to wear.
~ATTENTION PASSENGERS, THE VIP EXPRESS IS ARRIVING, IN DIRECTION OF OLYMPIA!~
There weren't many people in the station, possibly since this was a line only for the rich and powerful people of Fellarburg, but he didn't mind.
~FWISH~
As the train arrived and stopped, he stepped aboard and found his own private cabin, complete with a comfortable chair and a small table.
He had noticed that some people were giving him weird looks, maybe they didn't expect a 'commoner' that dresses in 'commoner' clothes to be here?
In the end, it didn't matter as Stark sat down on the chair and placed the watch Arthur gave him on the table.
~ATTENTION, PASSENGERS, THE TRAIN IS ABOUT TO START, PLEASE ENJOY YOUR RIDE!~
Stark glanced out of the window as the train started moving, watching the scenery blur past him.
'It indeed is really fast…' only a minute had passed, yet the train had already reached its peak speed of 400KM per hour, he couldn't even enjoy anything after that since it was just too fast.
But at the same time…
~BEEP~
The watch on the table suddenly activated by itself, and a single screen appeared in front of Stark.
[You have successfully entered the train to Olympia!]
[Time left before arrival: 3 hours 52 minutes]
[Please get off the train when the watch tells you to, the directions of the rift will be given shortly afterward.]
'…' Stark sighed, at least he wasn't left in the dark, Arthur really seemed to have had everything planned for him to reach his destination safely.
As the scenery whizzed by outside the window, Stark couldn't shake off the unease that gnawed at him.
'If seven people supposedly stronger than I am went through that rift and didn't come back… it means there is a trap somewhere…'
First of all, what were those 'Arrows Of Sierra'? And why did the Moonless (a family of archer) want them so badly?
Of course, it was always good to have different types of arrows as an archer, and even better to have unique ones with special perks.
But… what could they be…
The train ride seemed endless as Stark's mind raced with thoughts and questions about the mission ahead.
[Time left before arrival: 2 hours 18 minutes]
The time passed smoothly, and Stark had nothing better to do than use his phone (wifi was included) or just check out his weapons and equipment.
[Time left before arrival: 54 minutes]
He could hear the joyful talks and laughs of the people inside their cabins, or just on the train's public seats.
'Lucky them…'
And after a while…
He arrived at his destination.
[You have arrived, leave the train…]
'…' the closer he got to the rift, the bigger that feeling inside his stomach became, yet Stark, with a blank expression, still got up from his sit.
But that's when he realized… that the train was still going, and that there was still well over an hour of travel before arriving at the terminus station.
'…' Stark's eyes widened as he realized what this meant, and his pupils slowly shifted back toward the watch as the screen changed.
[Jump off the train, you have arrived.]
'Sigh… this better be worth it,' he got out of his cabin, then headed toward the emergency exit, which was a door that you were only supposed to open if the train stops and there is an issue.
"Hello sir, what are you doing-" an attendant smiled as she saw Stark, but that smile immediately vanished as Stark used his aura to forcefully kick the door, opening it abruptly.
"SIR, STOP WHAT YOU ARE DOING?" there was no danger for the passengers on board to open this door, the only real problem now was that he would need to jump from a speeding train that was going at 400KM per hour.
Other passengers from rich and powerful families heard the commotion and came to see what was happening.
But Stark, not wanting to show his face more than he already had… suddenly jumped.
"SIR?????!!!"
"WHAT THE FUCK?" he heard them shout from behind, but the moment he jumped out, the train was already going so fast that he couldn't hear or see them anymore.
~FWIP, THUD~
"-1837!" he rolled on the ground as he took damage, but thankfully enough he was still relatively okay.
[Good job on jumping! Now please follow the arrow!]
And suddenly, another panel appeared in front of Stark, it was a 3D red arrow that was meant to show him where he was supposed to go.
[Distance to Rift: 3.5KM]
He wiped the dust from his pants and shirt, then began walking toward the direction the arrow was pointing.
'Let's get this over with…'

chapters.title: Chapter 104 - 104: Semi-Danger Zone
chapters.content:
[Please follow the arrow!]
Stark had been walking for around five minutes, and now that the train was gone, his surroundings became eerily quiet, there were no people in view, and no monsters either after all, he was in the middle of nowhere, with no landmark other than that red arrow that pointed toward some random direction he was supposed to follow.
[Stark HP: 7463/9300]
He had received around 1800HP of damage since he jumped out of a train going at 400KM per hour, and there were some bruises on his elbows and knees, small drops of blood pouring out from them, but it felt quite numb to Stark, maybe since he had received injuries that were much worse?
'Maybe I could use that...' he thought as he opened his [Spatial Inventory] and pulled out...
Two [Potions of Regeneration]!
Each of them were supposed to give him back 1000HP, and he had never tried it, meaning this was a perfect opportunity to do that.
He opened the two bottles with the green liquid and started gulping them at the same time using both hands.
~SLURP, GULP~
The potion was rather sweet, and it felt great to drink, almost as if his entire body was recovering from that.
And it was.
"+1000! +1000!"
The cuts on his elbows and knees began to slowly disappear as he drank the potions, and by the end of it, they were completely gone.
[Stark HP: 9300/9300]
'Works really well... and I still have 38 of those,' Stark smiled, of course they couldn't save him from a one-shot attack, and using them during fight was pretty much suicide, but outside of that it was fine.
Or so he thought... but he would only realize that later.
[Distance to Rift: 1.1KM]
Stark was currently in deserted plains, no trees in view or even flowers, it almost felt like this part of the world was... desolate.
'I mean... duh, I jumped out of the train, meaning that I must be in some random place almost no one visits...'
[Distance to Rift: 1KM]
And suddenly... far ahead of him... he could see that cave he had seen in the images from the watch.
[Rift in view, advance cautiously...]
Much like the ruins of the [City Ruins] rift, these monument that held rifts seemed to appear out of nowhere alongside their portals.
Plus it wasn't even a cave, just the start of one, and the opened portal at the end made it impossible to go further, meaning there wasn't even anything beyond it.
[Distance to Rift: 400M]
'...'
[Distance to Rift: 200M]
'Wait a damn minute...' Stark remembered something.
[Distance to Rift: 100M]
'Why would the watch ask me to advance cautiously when there is nothing-' he remembered the words he had seen on the watch.
And suddenly...
~BOOM~
A crimson panel appeared in front of him as he heard the explosion ahead.
Crimson meant that it was his own status window, not the watch's.
[You have left the safe zone!]
And at the same time...
"GREEAAAOORRR~~~" he heard a giant roar, and a lizard-like creature at least 10 meters in size got out of the ground.
[You are currently in a semi-danger zone (meaning only a few amounts of monsters will come out!)]
The lizard was big, with dark green shells and patterns all over its body, it had sharp teeth that already had saliva drooping from them after noticing the human.
'...' Stark got ready to fight, the cave wasn't that far anymore, so as long as he could gain space slowly, he would reach his destination without any issues.
[Name: Sneaky Lizard]
[Level: 40]
[HP: 54000]
[Strength: 1127]
[Stamina: 349]
[Speed: 544]
[Defense: 906]
[Skills: Bite, Scale Armor, Lizard Call, Roar, Sonic Beam, Hide...]
'...' it was alone, and its level was so low that it wasn't even a threat to Stark, even though he was only level 25.
"AURA SMASH," he sent his two fists toward the lizard, who obviously wasn't able to avoid thanks to its very low speed.
~BOOM, BOOM~
"-32823! -34761!"
Needless to say it didn't survive this attack.
[You have slain one "Sneaky Lizard lv40", gained 36619EXP!]
[Distance to Rift: 60M]
He was getting extremely close to the portal now, and he could already sense the crackling aura in the air that surrounded it, as well as that feeling that wanted him to head inside.
[Distance to Rift: 40M]
But...
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
A succession of explosions could be heard around him and...
"BITE!" a lizard that was using the [Hide] skill to camouflage in the ground suddenly jumped toward Stark.
"Focus..." but the boy calmly stepped to the left as he had seen that attack coming from a kilometer away.
~PUNCH, PUNCH~
"-29837! -28904!"
Two quick punches to the face ended the lizard's life before it could do anything else.
But by now, he was already surrounded by at least seven of them.
'Sigh... let's get this over with...' he advanced toward the portal, now only 30 meters ahead of him, ready to get rid of those who had the balls to try and attack him.
...
[You have slain one "Sneaky Lizard lv40", gained 35829EXP!]
[You have slain one "Sneaky Lizard lv40", gained 34914EXP!]
[You have slain one "Sneaky Lizard lv40", gained 35976EXP!]
Only three of the lizards attempted to attack Stark, but they were all killed quite easily, resulting in the rest of them to not even approach the boy anymore.
'It was not worth it' was what they thought, and so they all left.
'...' Stark didn't mind if his experience points left, after all he had something much more promising in front of him...
[Distance to Rift: 10 meters]
He was now inside of the cave, and before him was the white portal.
All the previous ones were of crimson color, yet this one was white somehow, maybe since it was from a different type?
In the end, it didn't matter, and so Stark stepped forward, traversing the rift that was supposed to be his hardest one yet.
At the same time, the watch began to shake violently, and a screen appeared.
[You have arrived to your destination, good luck on the mission!]
And...
~BEEEEEPP~
The watch suddenly broke, it didn't explode, but it had malfunctioned and couldn't be used anymore.
But it didn't matter since Stark's already now fully inside of the portal.
...
~FWISH~
After the nauseating feeling of being transported to another dimension ended, Stark opened his eyes again.
And he was greeted by three white panels.
[Welcome to 'Sierra's Death Path']
[Level 60-75 Nightmare-Level Rift]
[Don't get hit by the arrows, and have fun!]

chapters.title: Chapter 105 - 105: Serria's Death Path and the Arrows
chapters.content:
Behind him was… nothing?
There was a black line, and beyond it nothing could be seen, almost as if the limit of the world was set.
[Welcome to 'Sierra's Death Path']
[Level 60-75 Nightmare-Level Rift]
'Sure…' he sighed as he shook his head and began walking.
In comparison to the other rifts where there was somewhat of a safe zone at the beginning where he could gather with others.
This one was different, first of all since there was nobody else, but also because he was already placed inside of an area.
[Level 65 Area: 'The Beginning of Death']
The silence was eerie, broken only by the occasional rustle of leaves in the wind.
In comparison to the forst inside of the 'Shadow Valley' though, it wasn't completely filled with trees, instead the stone path Stark was on didn't have any obstacles on it, meaning that he could advance safely, while the forest was on the edges.
But of course, it was a nightmare-level, it couldn't be this easy.
After only taking 10 steps in the direction of the exit of the first area…
~FWISH~
Behind one of the dark trees near the stone path… appeared a white figure with black eyes.
"M…Moooveeee~" it spoke in a spooky and distant voice, even though it was so close to Stark.
The figure's body was completely white, except for a pair of black wings, and its black eyes that seemed to absorb the light around them.
'…' Stark stared at the figure for a few seconds, expecting it to be a monster he would have to fight.
But it didn't move.
"Perception…" he activated his skill as he wanted to know what that was, its gaze on him making him feel uneasy for some reason.
…
[Name: Victim of Sierra]
[Level: 65]
[HP: 10000]
[Strength: 1]
[Stamina: 1]
[Speed: 1]
[Defense: 1]
[Skills: Soul's Suckle, Despair…]
…
Without delay, Stark assessed the situation.
The appearance of the 'Victim of Sierra' was perplexing, as its stats suggested it was a creature with no offensive capabilities, or any capabilities at all to be honest.
However, Stark's instincts warned him that there was more to this encounter than it seemed.
"AURA SMASH," he sent one fist toward the monster, expecting it to die instantly thanks to his high damage against its low defense.
But…
The fist passed right through the ghostly creature, not even fazing it as it kept looking at Stark, the dark vortex of despair in its eyes not stopping.
'Huh…' Stark decided to keep walking, if he can't hit it and it's not attacking there was no reason to try and fight it.
But… after taking three steps.
~FWISH~
Another 'Victim of Sierra' appeared, peeking from yet another dark tree.
'…?'
~FWISH, FWISH, FWISH~
In a matter of seconds, dozens… no… HUNDREDS of 'Victims of Sierra' appeared from behind a tree one after the other.
By the end of their sudden appearance, every single tree around Stark had one of these monsters behind it, peeking at him.
The forest was now filled with an eerie atmosphere as the 'Victims of Sierra' surrounded Stark from all sides, their black eyes fixed on him.
Despite their seemingly harmless appearance, a feeling of unease crept up Stark's spine as he realized the sheer number of these creatures that had materialized out of thin air.
Plus he was in a nightmare-level rift, who could say they wouldn't suddenly be able to attack him?
Which was why Stark increased his cautiousness by a mile while he kept advancing through the stone path, just wanting to get out of this area as soon as possible.
A few minutes passed… but nothing happened.
More 'victims' would keep appearing, yet none of them would do anything.
[Don't get hit by the arrows]
This panel suddenly appered before him again, it was the phrase that all the previous classifiers who attempted to conquer this rift said.
And the moment Stark turned his eyes toward the 'Victims of Sierra' again, making sure none of them had any weapons in hand…
~SHHH… FWISH~
In the distance, the faint sound of an arrow cutting through the air reached Stark's ears thanks to [Focus] and its new ability to detect ambushes.
[Avoid it]
He turned his gaze in the direction he felt the aura coming from, and right before his eyes was a white arrow with a white heart on its edge, a string of aura surrounding it.
'It's… an 'Arrow of Sierra'!?' his eyes widened as he saw it so close to his face.
[AVOID IT!]
Time seemed to slow down as another panel suddenly appeared, doubling down on its warning.
But what scared Stark the most… was that it was not the end of it.
[AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT AVOID IT]
Hundreds of crimson panels surrounded his view as the arrow got closer.
He had understood with the first one that he needed to make sure not to be touched, but after all of this… even being close wasn't an option.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" he rolled to the side, avoiding the arrow which passed right through him.
'What the fuck…' he looked back at the ground where the arrow fell, and some sort of white mist was in its place as the arrow had exploded shortly after hitting the ground.
[Do not inhale the mist, do not be touched by the arrow, or else…]
'…?'
[Game over]
And suddenly, the panel disappeared as an arrow came shooting through it, appearing before Stark at an incredible speed.
~DUCK~
Stark crouched to avoid the 'Arrow of Sierra' again.
"Perception!" he tried to analyze the arrow before it fell to the ground, but it was too fast for him to discover anything.
Meaning…
'If I want to find out what these things are… I need to grab one while its in the air,' this was so risky that most people wouldn't do it.
And this time, even Stark hesitated, he had done soem crazy stuff during his stay in this world, and risking his life to do something stupid wasn't that rare of an occurence for him now, and yet… this time for some reason he had a bad feeling.
But if he wanted to survive this rift, he would need to know everything about it and its traps.
And so he took a deep breath, closing his eyes and waiting for the next arrow to come at him, wanting to sense its aura and thus sharpening his senses as it was too fast to even see it come.
~FWISH~
He heard the subtle noise of the arrow being attached to the string, and then being fired in his direction by an unknown entity.
This time, it was either success ot failure, and he didn't even wanna think about kind of fate awaited him if he got hit or inhaled that white mist.
'Come at me,' he opened his eyes suddenly as the arrow was centimeters away from his face, they were glowing with a crimson aura that indicated Stark was now more serious than ever.
He would get it, it's do or die now!

chapters.title: Chapter 106 - 106: The Beginning of Death
chapters.content:
'...'
[AVOID IT]
A panel appeared right next to Stark as he was standing still, ready to catch the arrow that was flying at him, only centimeters away from his face.
The entity that was shooting them really wanted them to hit him somehow, and it only increased his theories as to what would happen if he were to get hit on inhale that white mist.
"Focus, don't let me down..." he mumbled as he focused his aura on his eyes and hands to be able to see the arrow slowly go toward him.
And then...
~FWISH~
Right as the arrow was in front of his eyes, ready to pierce him... Stark with lightning speed moved his right hand to grab the shaft.
This essentially stopped the arrow's momentum while it was now only millimeters away from piercing Stark between his two eyes.
'Phew...' luckily, grabbing the arrow before it hit the ground or somebody didn't activate its perk, meaning that Stark was safe for now...
Without wasting a single second, he activated [Perception] and read the arrow's status panel to learn more.
...
[Item:] Arrow of Sierra
[Type:] Arrow
[Quality:] Perfect
[Special Perk:] If this arrow hits you, you will be infected by the 'white mist' and slowly turn into a 'Servant of Sierra', basically... you'll become a monster, the mist infects your brain and breaks your mind to transform you.
[Note:] There is no known cure or way to resist the 'Arrow of Sierra' once it hits you, so avoid it at all cost.
...
'Servant of Sierra...?' this was a different name than the 'Victims of Sierra', meaning that the latter must truly be monsters from this rift, while the servants would be humans that were hit.
~FWISH~
He didn't have too much time to think about it though as not just one, BUT THREE arrows came rushing at him.
'This little shit is really trying to get me...' Stark sighed as he avoided all three arrows by taking a few steps.
It seemed hard in the beginning, but now that he knew someone was trying to attack him, even when the arrows came from directions, he could still somehow sense and avoid them.
Plus...
[Avoid it]
Focus on maximum level alert, so it would tell him every time an arrow was coming.
Stark stored the [Arrow of Sierra] inside of his [Spatial Inventory] to keep it safe, then began running through the first area.
He needed to get out of here quick since there was no saying these monsters behind the trees wouldn't attack, and adding that to the constant firing of arrows would be terrible.
Stark ran through the stone path as fast as he could, dodging arrows that came from the sky, the distance, from behind the trees and even sometimes from below.
He understood now that Hell-Level rifts and Nightmare-Level ones are different worlds apart, the latter being at least 5 to 10 times harder.
[Keep going.]
Sometimes, the entity would fire up to 5 arrows at the same, in the hopes of tricking Stark, but he would comfortably avoid them all, or use [Invincible Dodge] when it was just too close.
And after a few minutes of running through the path and forest that seemed stretch forever, with no end to it...
Stark encountered his first monster.
"..." it didn't roar or do anything for it's entrance, instead it just jumped out of the right side of the forest with the 'Victims of Sierra', and blocked Stark's way.
It was a large beast, and in comparison to everything he had seen yet, its skin was completely dark/grey, with only its eyes being white, void of pupils.
"GRRAOOUUU~" the wolf-like beast stepped forward.
'Is it also under the influence of Sierra or just a normal monster...?'
...
[Name: White Moon's Werewolf]
[Level: 65]
[HP: 90000]
[Strength: 1362]
[Stamina: 1827]
[Speed: 2174]
[Defense: 891]
[Skills: White Moon Transformation, White Claws, Beam Blast, Red Fury...]
...
After reading its name and status window, Stark instinctively looked up.
The sky was pitch black, its darkness looming over this entire rift.
Yet somehow... there was still light, and it was coming from...
A giant white moon.
Its edges were moving like waves, and it was so big that it must have been extremely close to the ground, the moon taking well over half of the space in the sky while still being up.
'Werewolf of the white moon huh...' Stark mumbled, after all it was indeed a full moon currently.
The white moon was the complete opposite of the black sun it seemed, as it didn't try to corrupt you.
Instead...
~FWISH~
"WHITE CLAWS!" the werewolf suddenly dashed toward Stark while he was observing the location of the next arrow.
Stark spotted the arrow coming at him, and at the same time, with the calmest of expressions, summoned his crimson spears and sent them toward the monster, not even looking at it.
~DASH, DASH~
The werewolf avoided the first two spears by dashing to the sides, but Stark predicted that and placed the final one right in front of the werewolf while it was still avoiding the first two.
