"-25727!" it hit it in the face, exploding one of its eyes and leaving a visible hole on its head.
"..." meanwhile Stark used this momentum to spin and catch a second 'Arrow of Sierra' in mid-air, 'The moment I catch who's sending these... they're dead...' he groaned.
"RED FURY!" the wolf had been humiliated, and so it used another skill, making its last remaining eye burn with a crimson aura, there were no pupils so it looked like it was just set on fire.
And then...
"BEAM BLAST!" it opened its mouth, charging up a white attack that was on the verge of exploding.
It grew more and more after each second, and it was almost as if the monster... was sucking up the power of the 'Victims of Sierra' since the trail of aura that powered up the beam came from them.
~FWIIISHHHSHHH.... BOOOOOOM!!!~
The werewolf its attack, its whole body visibly suffering from using it.
This was an extremely powerful attack, yes, but in exchange, the werewolf would have to feel a lot of pain too.
'...' Stark sighed as he avoided yet another arrow, 'CLONE FRENZY!'
He wanted to end this quickly, as frankly, these arrows were beginning to seriously annoy him.
"Let's go, me" Stark pointed at the werewolf and its beam while summoning one of his clones, which immediately understood the situation.
And so the two dashed toward the wolf, planning on facing the beam that could one-shot them both head on.

chapters.title: Chapter 107 - 107: The White Moon Werewolves Ambush
chapters.content:
The beam of the werewolf was way more deadly than anything a mere level 65 mob could ever hope to achieve, meaning that there was some other power at hand, something much more powerful that aided it to become much stronger than it should be.
Or maybe it was just since he was in a Nightmare-Level rift?
~CRASH, BOOM~
The trees, the path, anything that came in contact with the beam, which seemed to never stop, would be destroyed.
Even the 'Victims Of Sierra' seemed to disappear when hit by the attack, although Stark believed that was only because the trees they were behind were cut.
But even through that…
~FWISH~
A multitude of arrows would still be coming at him and his clone, forcing them not only to avoid the beam at a hair length each time, but also put themselves at risk to not get hit by the arrows which could transform them into monsters.
Yet, Stark noticed something: after every 10 second, the beam would diminish and flicker, meaning that the werewolf was gathering energy back.
And Stark would use that opportunity.
"AURA SMASH!" his clone sent two fists at the werewolf, who easily avoided them.
[Red Fury] seemed to greatly enhance its speed, allowing it quite easily avoid both fists and spears the two Stark sent at him.
'Why is this fodder monster actually putting a challenge…?' of course, without the [White Beam], it would of died in less than ten seconds, but now it was actually getting annoying.
Plus, the fact the wolf was moving its head randomly, not even caring about aiming for Stark or the clone, meant that they were at higher risk of being hit.
~BOOM, FWISH~
The werewolf swung its head, resulting in the beam rushing at Stark.
'…' he was forced to crouch down as the beam passed above it.
But at that very moment…
An arrow was fired, one he hadn't heard or been able to see early since he was too occupied with the wolf.
'SHIT SHIT SHIT,' he shouted as he saw it right in front of him.
But…
[Wings perk, activated!]
'DASH!' he flapped [Judicator's Black Wings] in the opposite direction, granting him a boost and allowing him to move from the arrow's path.
'Ok, now this is annoying,' he gritted his teeth and looked at the werewolf with his eyes full of aura, 'I'm ending this shit.'
He opened his [Spatial Inventory] and pulled out a [Potion of Speed] from it, then gulped it down, giving him a 10% speed boost.
And so without even caring about the beam… he dashed toward the wolf.
The werewolf, surprised by Stark's bold move, tried to redirect its beam towards him but failed as Stark swiftly evaded it.
The clone followed close behind, providing a distraction for the monster.
And before the werewolf could even realize what was happening, Stark was already behind it.
"Goodbye," the boy smiled before grabbing the wolf's jaw and closing its mouth while the beam was still being used.
~BOOOOOMM~
"-93872!" the wolf's head exploded instantly after being hit by its own attack.
'At least I know how to get rid of them easily now…' he had found their weaknesses, now they wouldn't be an issue in the future.
[You have slain "White Moon's Werewolf lv65", gained 71982EXP!]
[Experience: 223711/500000]
He still had a long way before leveling up, but for now, his goal was to reach level 30 by the end of this rift, it shouldn't be that hard after all if each monster would give him around 70K experience, although he couldn't promise that the amount of experience needed wouldn't increase way too much for him to reach.
[Speed (+10%) effect: 3:48 remaining]
He summoned back his clone, avoided another 'Arrow of Sierra' more easily than before, then began dashing forward, really wanting to get out of this first path, since it had already been a nightmare (heh) for him even though he had only fought one enemy.
'I SEE IT,' after running for a few more minutes, he finally saw the end of the path in the distance as the forest suddenly stopped, there was still around a kilometer of running, but he was close.
And yet, as if to mock his hopes and dreams… the rift summoned more problems to fuck him over.
"GAROUUU~" not one, not two, hell not even 5, but 8 'White Moon Werewolves suddenly appeared from behind the trees and blocked Stark's path.
Some also appeared from behind, and the rest stared at him from the darkness of the forest, ready to strike the moment they saw an opportunity that could end the human's life in one blow.
But they weren't the only enemy… as another type of monster appeared: the 'Shadow Stalkers'.
They were creatures that lurked in the darkness, with glowing red eyes and razor-sharp teeth, they had human figures, but no head, instead… their entire torso was replaced by a giant mouth and a pair of eyeballs were located inside of that same mouth.
'Disgusting…' Stark stepped back while activating [Perception].
…
[Name: Shadow Stalkers]
[Level: 64]
[HP: 40000]
[Strength: 1371]
[Stamina: 1927]
[Speed: 1473]
[Defense: 1780]
[Skills: Devouring Darkness, Shadow Meld, Morph, Assemble (STRONG TRANSFORMATION), Shadow Limbs…]
…
Counting them all, Stark noticed there was 5 of them, each hiding in the darkness of the forest as well, it was in their names after all, and they seemed to be more of the 'ambush' type.
'Final battle before I can get away of this shithole…' Stark sighed while summoning one of his clones and also avoiding another arrow.
It had actually become muscle memory for him to avoid these arrows, and he didn't even bother to act annoyed anymore with them being sent relentlesly.
~FWISH~
His clone also avoided the arrows quite easily, only moving its head to the right when one came rushing at it.
But now… he needed to face against the 14 monsters surrounding him.
'…' the clone got in position before he did, and he followed right after.
"AURA SMASH!" he sent two fists at two 'Shadow Stalkers' that were hiding in the distance, maybe believing that he couldn't see them, but too bad, Stark could see auras.
~BOOM, BOOM~
"-33847! -34982!"
Both were hit from the attack, taken aback as they didn't expect the human to be able to detect them.
But this wasn't enough to kill them, even with their low HP compared to all other monsters their level.
'At least I know two of them only need one more attack…' he smiled.
And now that he had attacked… all the other monsters rushed at him.
"WHITE CLAWS, RED FURY, WHITE BEAM!"
Three of the wolves used [White Claws] and rushed at Stark and his clone, also activating [Red Fury] to increase their speed, while the rest all immediately activated [White Beam].
And this meant… that 6 of the werewolves had opened their mouth, charging up their deadly attacks.
Even Stark knew that this was bad, he wouldn't be able to avoid 6 beam coming at him from all directions, all of their powers being charged by the hundreds of 'Victims of Sierra' in the forest.
And so that meant… he needed to find a solution in the following ten seconds, or it would be over.

chapters.title: Chapter 108 - 108: The Shadow Stalkers
chapters.content:
'...?' the clone turned its head toward the smiling Stark, and almost immediately understood what it needed to do.
They were surrounded by 9 [White Moon Werewolves], 6 of which were currently charging up a [White Beam] attack while the other three tried to waste Stark's time with close-ranged combat.
Under normal circumstances, it would be almost impossible to get away, even while knowing the weakness of the werewolves...
And yet...
Stark's clone immediately put its hands together, then drew a circle in a location where many werewolves were currently located.
And then... it hit the palm if its right hand with a fist of its left.
~FWISHH~
"HEAVEN'S WRATH!" the skill immediately activated once the clone did that, and the giant crimson sparkle in the sky grew more and more above the heads of five werewolves.
They really wanted to activate their beams, so they didn't even bother to get out of harm's way...
And as after only a few seconds, before the monsters could even channel their energy...
~FIOOOU- BOOOOM!~
The danger circle erupted, and the crimson beam that could take out anything inside of it came out of the sky, heading toward the monsters.
"-41625! -39847! -40491!"
None of the five werewolves that thought they could endure this attack survived.
'That's why you don't stay grouped in one place...' Stark smiled, after all these monsters had deliberately moved close to each other in hopes of taking Stark aback with the sheer amount of beams.
[Heaven's Wrath] was truly an incredible attack, being able to kill all these things in three seconds was a feat many classifiers can't achieve after all.
And the best thing of all... IT WAS STARK'S CLONE THAT USED IT! Meaning that the original body still had his saved up.
But of course, this didn't mean he could relax.
"WHITE CLAWS!" the three werewolves that were rushing at him didn't stop, instead jumping in the air as their claws began to glow with an otherworldly white aura, it was probably the moon that powered them up so much.
~FWISH~
He avoided the attack of one of the wolves, its speed thanks to [Red Fury] almost allowing it to hit him.
And as for the clone... well...
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" it was a 'lesser' version of Stark, so it was forced to roll away after the first attack.
But... the second werewolf also attacked it, maybe it was bad luck, or maybe they sensed that its HP was low?
In the end...
~SLASH~
"-19371!"
The werewolf's claws slashed the clone's body into three pieces, and it seeped back into the original Stark.
'...'
Not wasting any time, Stark summoned his three spears, and sent them toward the wall farthest from him.
"WHITE CLAW!" another one obviously tried to attack Stark, but he saw it coming and...
~BAM, BAM, BAM, BAM~
He avoided the attack then kicked it in the stomach before finishing it with three quick attacks to the face, leaving it with no time to breath or do anything.
"-29837! -32914! -31098! -33110!"
It obviously killed it, and as for the spears...
~FWISH, PIERCE, PIERCE~
It avoided the first one, but unfortunately slipped and received the other two straight on, the first piercing its stomach and the second its neck.
"-18272! -37927!" the one in the neck obviously did more damage.
But at the same time... the one wolf that had been spared from [Heaven's Wrath] finally charged up its beam and...
~BOOM~
It shot it intensely at Stark, who was busy defending himself against the other wolves and also avoiding another arrow.
~FLAP~
Under normal circumstance, he should have been hit, but [Judicator's Wings] automatically used [Dash] to get him out of the beam's way, saving his life.
~PUNCH~
"-32751!" he ended the life of the werewolf that had been hit by his spears in a single blow, sending it flying against one of the trees, scaring one of the white figures behind it.
And so that reduced the amount of monsters to 2 [White Moon Werewolves] and 5 [Shadow Stalkers], there were still many of them in view (not counting the 'Victims of Sierra' as they did nothing), but Stark was still confident.
The latter were doing absolutely nothing , instead their giant mouths were just contorting into a creepy smile as their dark bodies shook, they seemed to be... celebrating?
'Shit...' he ducked to avoid the beam.
But surprisingly...
~BOOOOM~
The other werewolf, which had been running around Stark, was hit by the beam as it tried to jump at its prey, and its entire body exploded.
"-99999!" it obviously immediately died.
The other monster didn't seem to care about killing its companion as it continued to randomly aim its head in different directions.
"AURA SMASH!' at the same time, Stark shot two crimson fists at the 'Shadow Stalkers', he didn't like the fact they were smiling and celebrating so vividly.
But...
"DEVOURING DARKNESS!" the two monsters that had been aimed by the attack suddenly activated a skill and morphed their body, placing their giant mouths in front of the giant fists.
'...?'
~GULP, GULP~
And they actually ate them.
'??????' Stark was confused.
Then only a few moments later, the Shadow Stalkers that ate his attack began to lick their mouths with their pitch-black tongues.
It was frankly disgusting.
Stark really wanted to sit down and think deeply about what he had just witnessed, but no time for that since the werewolf was still firing the beam.
And as for how the 'Shadow Stalkers' survived the deadly beam while it was hitting them constantly... well... they also just ate it, their big mouths absorbing the white ray as if it was the most delicious thing in the universe.
Stark did notice by their expressions that they prefered his crimson attacks though.
He decided not to send any more attacks at them as it was a waste of time, he would deal with them later.
"Now, werewolf, it's time to die," Stark cracked his neck and smiled at the werewolf as it kept shooting the beam.
The 'Shadow Stalkers' and 'Victims of Sierra' were pretty much just spectator to the fight for now, and so Stark planned to give them a good show.
~FWISH~
With incredible speed, he dashed toward the werewolf, using his wings and flapping them once to give him a boost in the air, allowing him to momentarily float.
And just like that… Stark was now behind of the werewolf.
It tried to turn its head, but… Stark grabbed its neck and locked it in place using his amazing strength.
Now it was done for.
"Bye bye," the boy manically smiled as he slowly began to close the werewolf's mouth, enjoying its panic as it knew what the human was doing.
Then… he closed it.
~BOOM~
The head obviously exploded, and its remains were splattered all over the floor, and some blood even ended up on Stark's shirt and face.
'Blergh…' he was disgusted.
But at this very moment ,as if they had been waiting for Stark to finish off the werewolves…
The [Shadow Stalkers] stepped out of the darkness, revealing their grotesque bodies and mouths, but this time, they weren't celebrating anymore, instead they looked amused, and ready to fight.
'Phew… I knew this couldn't be easy,' Stark now knew why so many classifiers had died in this place before.

chapters.title: Chapter 109 - 109: The STRONG Shadow Stalker Trio
chapters.content:
"Hihihihi~" small laughter escaped the mouths of the 'Shadow Stalkers'.
'Clone frenzy…' Stark didn't waste time and summoned his second clone to aid him in battle.
He knew that these black monsters could eat pretty much any of his attacks, and he sure as hell didn't want to become their dinner either.
"Crimson Spears," Stark's clone calmly sent three spears toward different monsters, wanting to gouge out their reactions.
"Devouring Darkness!" but all three of them ate the spears, then smiled, happy they were allowed to taste a 5-star meal out of nowhere.
But the biggest problems of all for Stark was…
'I'm sure I hit two of them until they were one hit away from dying, yet they all look… fine?'
Something was going on, and even when he checked their HPs…
All of them had the same number:
[Shadow Stalker HP: 40000/40000]
All of them were at full health, and Stark's confusion grew even more.
Not knowing what could be the cause, he decided to investigate the only skill they had used up until now…
…
[Skill: Devouring Darkness]
[Description:] When this skill is activated, the Shadow Stalker can absorb most incoming attacks using its mouth and heal itself by 100% of the absorbed damage.
[Flaw:] None
…
'Ah shit…' the ones that had been damaged probably ate the fists, as well as the [White Beam], and so they regained their entire health.
Stark grit his teeth in frustration. The fight was turning out to be a lot more challenging than he had anticipated.
'Long-ranged attacks are out of the question now, meaning that I have to get close…'
He didn't want to use [Heaven's Wrath] as it was an intense waste against such opponents, plus even if his clone used it, their speed would be more than enough to easily avoid the attack.
He needed to find an opportunity… or create it.
"Hihihihi~" all the shadow stalkers laughed at Stark again as they saw him struggle.
And then…
"Shadow Limbs!" two of the monsters' stepped backward before launching a large black arm toward Stark, its texture was disgusting, but the boy knew he couldn't afford to feel such an emotion.
~SLAM~
He deflected the first arm using his palm, then sent an [Aura Smash] fist toward the second to destroy it.
"Hihihihi~"
And then…
"MORPH!" all of them used this skill, and their bodies began to twist and change.
It really did seem like they could change themselves however they wanted.
Their bodies were liquid, yet somewhat still a bit solid.
'Slime…' was Stark's guessed as it was the closest thing he could think of when hitting that arm with his palm, 'Well… no time to think about this, I need to kill them…'
Without wasting time, while their bodies were still changing, he dashed toward one of the 'Shadow Stalkers'.
But the monster he was rushing suddenly transformed into…
"A FUCKING HAMMER??!"
That same monster had now the perfect form of a hammer, with its giant mouth located in the handle.
~FWISH~
In a sudden motion, the 'Shadow Stalker' moved its body, trying to hit Stark away.
But he wouldn't allow that.
~DASH~
Stark using his wings and momentum began to slide on the ground, avoiding the hammer monster's head by a hair's length.
And now that he was behind it… he wouldn't let it go.
With all his determination at hand… he grabbed the handle of the monster, resisting the urge to drop it because of the black texture which even seemed to go on his hands and arms and then…
"KILL IT," he ordered his clone, and it immediately sent two fits at the 'Shadow Stalker', which was unable to eat them since Stark was constantly moving around.
"-32736! -34827!"
Its tongue dangled from its mouth the moment its HP fell to zero, but Stark wouldn't let it end like that.
Using the momentum, he began to spin around at intense speed, making both him and the hammer-like monster spin.
And after a few seconds…
~FWISH~
Stark let go of the dead monster, sending its body, which retained its final form as it died since it couldn't morph anymore, toward another 'Shadow Stalker'!
It obviously couldn't eat one of its own, and it was too late for it to escape.
~BOOM, CRASH~
The head of the hammer hit its mouth, causing it to receive massive damage, and then the momentum sent it flying against a tree, splashing against it and making both monsters explode into a massive amount of black slime-like texture.
'…' Stark removed some of the black goo from his arm then turned back to face the remaining 'Shadow Stalkers'.
"…" they weren't laughing anymore; proof they weren't as confident as before.
But it didn't mean that they were done…
And so before Stark could do anything else to kill them…
They decided to use their most powerful skill.
"ASSEMBLE!"
The 'Shadow Stalkers' began to merge their bodies together, forming a massive, grotesque creature that towered over Stark. Its mouth began to open wide, revealing countless rows of sharp teeth.
It was as if their three bodies had combined into one giant one, dozens of giants mouths spread throughout its gooey body, they could devour a tree easily, and the amount of goo texture tripled.
…
[Name: Shadow Stalkers Trio (STRONG)]
[Level: 64]
[HP: 120000]
[Strength: 1837]
[Stamina: 2121]
[Speed: 2062]
[Defense: 2104]
[Skills: Shadow Limbs, Devouring Darkness, Morph, Darkness Hypnotize…]
…
'Yeah…' Stark nervously laughed as he saw the beast before him, it wasn't an elite monster, but it was just one category below it, and he even dared to say it was stronger than the elite monsters he had encountered inside of the [Shadow Valley].
Its stats had also increased, and it had gained one more skill, its HP also tripled (probably since the three monsters merged).
And now in this Nightmare-Level rift, Stark was surrounded by incomprehensible figures hiding behind trees, arrows that could transform him into a beast if he was just grazed by them, and now an almost-elite monster that would gladly eat him up (pause, not in that way), right at the first area of this rift…
He knew that this wouldn't be an easy mission.
'I swear to god if I get out of here, I'm beating up that Moonless family...' he groaned as he got ready to face the STRONG monster in front of him.
"HIHIHIHIHI~" the laughter of the now transformed shadow stalkers echoed through the forest and path, their confidence now at its peak as they got ready to swallow the human.
But in return… Stark smiled back, it was a cold smile, one that sent shivers down the spine of those monsters.
"I'm getting rid of you in five attacks," he confidently said as he marched forward, now he wasn't playing any more games.
And his clone followed closely after, it was smiling just as coldly as its owner.

chapters.title: Chapter 110 - 110: The Weakness of the Trio
chapters.content:
The grotesque beast let out a low growl, displaying its readiness to attack.
"SHADOW LIMBS!" a massive amount of goo was suddenly sent toward Stark, which, just as before, transformed into a giant hand that wanted to grab him.
'Aura Smash!' the clone immediately answered back, sending two fists at it.
But…
"DEVOURING DARKNESS!" a mouth suddenly appeared on the hand, eating both attacks.
'What the actual fuck,' this was becoming nonsensical, and Stark frankly hated that monster, much more than any other monster he had seen before.
And no, it's not because its black (lol).
The fact that it could swallow him and end his life so easily, with ho chance to be revived even with his [Chosen One] talent frankly angered him, and the fact that it could completely control its body like that felt unfair.
'It must have a weakness though…' he clearly remembered reading this panel, which said that there is ALWAYS a way to kill a monster without its HP reaching 0.
~BOOM~
[The Purgatory Shadow took the hit in your place]
The shadow of himself appeared from the ring and deflected the attack, but…
~FWISH~
The hand suddenly turned back toward Stark, rushing back at him.
'They have better control over it since they merged…' Stark grunted as he quickly thought of a way to defeat the monstrous creature.
He avoided the hand, but it would come again, and again, AND AGAIN.
Touching it wasn't an option either because of the massive mouth.
'Think Stark… THINK…'
They had also sent a long trail of goo toward his clone, which was also occupied as it needed to avoid them all.
This battle truly seemed unwinnable.
And that was what Stark believed, until…
~FWISH~
He heard the sound of an [Arrow of Sierra] being sent toward him, and so he instinctively crouched down to avoid it.
But…
~BAM~
The arrow hit the mouth of the shadow stalker's elongated limb.
And suddenly…
The arrow exploded and the white mist began to surround the 'Shadow Stalker Trio's' limb.
Sensing the danger, the original body immediately cut off the limb it had sent, knowing that keeping it connected to the original would be instant death
And after only a few seconds… the black goo limb began to turn white, its surface being taken over by the perk of the arrow, and convulsing repeatedly as if it was being taken over by an unknown force.
'So it also works on monsters…' Stark's eyes widened.
He had found it, the weakness of this monster.
The convulsing limb writhed and twisted, until it some sort of white glass crystal began to take it over, and with a loud CRACK, it suddenly exploded.
'Humans transform into monsters… but monsters explode…' Stark smiled.
It meant that if he ever touched it with a single arrow… it would die, or at least be stopped long enough for him to use [Heaven's Wrath].
"Spatial Inventory…" he mumbled, and then… he took out the two arrows he had grabbed from it.
He sent one of them toward his clone, who grabbed it, inspecting it, while he kept the other one in his hands, holding it like a knife.
Trying to throw at the monster was a bad strategy since it could easily morph its body, but if he managed to stab it inside its body… it would be game over.
The monster's (many many) eyes widened in shock as it registered the effectiveness of the arrow, but it quickly recovered its composure: all it needed to do was not get hit.
But the clone and Stark wouldn't let it do that easily.
~FWISH~
The clone suddenly threw the arrow toward the 'Shadow Stalker Trio', not caring about the strategy Stark thought of.
But no… it wasn't doing anything reckless, after all it had Stark's intelligence.
"MORPH," the monster immediately created a giant hole in its body to let the dangerous arrow pass through.
But of course it wouldn't be easy.
"AURA SMASH!" the clone sent two fists at the monster, and even though it would be dumb under normal circumstances…
~BOOM, BOOM~
"-23726! -21827!" the punches actually hit since the monster was too busy morphing its body to avoid the deadly arrow.
'I get it now…' Stark smiled.
But of course, the arrow the clone had sent hit the surface of a tree and exploded into white mist, meaning he didn't have anymore.
Or did he?
~FWISH~
An arrow came rushing toward the clone from above, and… he grabbed the handle using his speed, meaning that he had yet another one to throw at the STRONG monster.
Clones do not fear death since they know that they are clones, meaning that it actually had the guts to do things even the real Stark wouldn't do.
Basically… the entity that was throwing these arrows at them was effectively giving them a chance to survive.
'Infinite arrow glitch,' Stark smiled as he understood why his clone threw that precious arrow so easily now.
"I said I would beat you in 5 attacks," he smiled as tightened the grip around the arrow, "Give me just one!"
The clone immediately sent another arrow toward the monster, immediately scaring it.
"DOUBLE ASSAULT," and then both of them activated one of their legendary skills.
The 'Shadow Stalker Trio' yet again morphed its body to avoid the arrow, but without wasting time, sent dozens upon dozens of limbs toward Stark's clone as it feared it would damage him again.
But…
"I won," Stark mumbled as he now stood right behind the monster, which had completely ignored him, both because [Double Assault] made him too fast, but also since the Shadow Stalker targeted the person that sent the arrow.
And so…
~PIERCE~
The [Arrow of Sierra] Stark was holding pierced the monster's main body, and the reaction was immediate: the white mist began to enter the goo, and after a short while, the black goo began to turn white, restraining the monster as it couldn't move well anymore.
And so without wasting time…
Stark's clone's hand began to shine as it drew a circle at the monster's location, it smiled at the monster as its dozen of eyes and limbs were now too slow to even reach it.
It was truly fucked.
'…' the clone kept smiling as it hit its palm with its other hand's fist, making it shine with a crimson aura.
"HEAVEN'S WRATH!" the sparkle in the sky appeared, and the crimson beam began to power up.
'…' the 'Shadow Stalker Trio' looked up, unable to avoid the attack since its body was being taken over by that shitty mist.
It knew it was fucked, no matter what it did.

chapters.title: Chapter 111 - 111: Over One Million Experience?!
chapters.content:
With the crimson haze of [Heaven's Wrath] rippling through the air and the beam of destruction locked onto its target, the Shadow Stalker Trio could do nothing but watch as its end approached.
~FWISH~
And so after only five seconds of this dead silence…
~BOOOOOMM~
The [Heaven's Wrath] finished charging up and the crimson beam descended on the 'Shadow Stalker Trio'.
"AAAAAAAHHHHHHH-" they couldn't speak since their monster intellect wasn't high enough for that, but the dozens of mouths scattered throughout its body screamed in agony as its body was disintegrated.
"-58378! -57462! -59824!"
It obviously died before the perk of the arrow that pierced it could even make it explode.
After the beam disappeared, there was nothing left at the spot the STRONG monster was in, it was as if it had been erased from existence, none of it remained, and Stark preferred that, he would rather such a disgusting existence to just disappear from the face of the earth
~FWISH~
Stark avoided another arrow that came at him, probably trying to take him off guard since he was happy after eliminating the monster that had caused him trouble.
'Sneaky,' he smiled, but of course he wouldn't let his guard down.
He also couldn't help but notice that the 'Victims of Sierra' that were located inside the range of the beam had also disappeared, were they dead too?
[You have slain "White Moon's Werewolf lv65", gained 70387EXP!]
[You have slain "White Moon's Werewolf lv65", gained 71948EXP!]
[You have slain "White Moon's Werewolf lv65", gained 71244EXP!]
…
…
…
[You have slain "Shadow Stalker lv64", gained 79831EXP!]
[You have slain "Shadow Stalker lv64", gained 80403EXP!]
And finally…
[You have slain "Shadow Stalker Trio (STRONG) lv64", gained 319279EXP!]
…
'…?' Stark's eyes widened upon seeing all these notifications appear, and especially the amount of experience he had gotten.
Because with all of this…
[+1,124,780EXP!]
Suddenly, he was enveloped by the golden glow that signified a level up not once, but twice.
[Your level has increased to level 26, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 27, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Experience: 313491/569000]
'This is… amazing,' he couldn't help but laugh.
He had risked his life and almost died, but just seeing his level go up so much made it all worth it in his eyes.
And in addition to that, it seemed like the 'Shadow Stalker Trio' dropped one item as there was a black glow in the place its body was disintegrated, he took it and immediately put it inside his [Spatial Inventory] without checking what it was.
'Gotta go now…' he mumbled, of course he wanted to take his time to check his status window and attribute his skill points to a skill, but it wasn't possible in here, not with so many arrows being thrown at him, and the possibility of more monsters approaching.
Stark resumed running to the end of the area as it was extremely close now.
And after only a few minutes… he had reached it: the end of the 'Beginning of The End'.
He was now out of the stone path with forest around it, and found himself in a clearing filled with tall, towering trees that reached up into the sky.
The sunlight filtered in between the branches, casting dappled shadows on the ground.
But the occasional trees were the only thing present in this clearing, and there weren't much of them, it was just that they were so big they took up lots of space.
And very far, Stark observed…
'A cave!' at the very back was a cave that resembled the one he used to reach this rift, probably the final area.
[Level 70 Area: 'The Giant Trees Challenge']
'Solo-type' rifts seemed to be much smaller than normal ones or secret ones since they could only be used by a single person at a time, and this one only had three areas, as well as a low amount of monsters to fight.
It was still extremely difficult since it was Nightmare-Level, but it wasn't big enough to worry about monsters, in all cases, the difficulty of this rift mostly came from the fact that the arrows can one-shot you.
Stark took a step forward, stepping in the second area of 'Sierra's Death Path', ready to take care of anything that came his way.
But suddenly…
~FWISH~
He heard the sound of an arrow and got ready to avoid it, but… the arrow wasn't aimed at him this time.
'Huh… did they miss…?'
No… they had sent over a hundred arrows at him until now, yet none of them missed, all were perfectly aimed to hit him if he didn't avoid each time.
So why…?
The arrow exploded normally like it should, and then the giant screen of white mist appeared like usual, which Stark made sure to stay away from obviously.
But this time… it was different.
Once the mist began to slowly clear, a figure was standing there, appearing out of nowhere.
"Haaa~" the figure, its appearance and body still hidden by the mist, smiled, "Seems like you're better than I thought~"
"…" Stark just looked at her with a blank smile, he was referring to the figure as her since she had a feminine voice, "Monster that can talk?"
His mind immediately thought about the fact that it was rare for a monster in a middle area to speak human language as the only one he had encountered before was Judicator since he was 'Godless Demon' apostle.
'Wait a damn minute…' it clicked in Stark's mind as he realized that this could mean only one thing, and he looked up as the mist fully cleared.
[Sierra, The Crystal Archer (BOSS)]
'…?!' Stark's eyes widened and he took a step backward the moment that panel appeared before him, he hadn't used [Perception] at all, but it just automatically appeared, just like it did when he met a boss/mini-boss/elite, meaning that it was the real deal.
He instinctively activated his [Domination] aura in case a battle would break, but he was sure nothing major would happen since he wasn't at the boss area.
'Sierra', the boss of the rift, was a woman (or at least it had a woman's body), long white hair, and a blue/white long dress, as well as 'snowflake' earrings and crystal blue eyes.
She was very beautiful, and her overall aura could be described with one word: chilly.
In her hand was a white bow, an arrow attached to it, and she was holding it with her two hands, smiling at Stark.
And then…
~FWISH, PAW~
At lightning speed, she pointed the bow at Stark then shot the arrow at him.
"Invincible Dodge!" he rolled to the site since at this distance, it was hard to avoid it, even with the wings.
"Hahahahaha~" Sierra laughed, "Looks like you're really good at avoiding things~ better than the 7 others at least," she mocked.
Suddenly, she stopped grabbing the bow with one of her hands and…
"Sierra Arrows!" she used one of her skills to create an [Arrow of Sierra] in the hand that was now free, a cold aura enveloping her and seeping into her hand to form into the shape of the arrow with the white heart at the edge of it.
'She can create as many of them as she wants,' Stark understood now, and it was terrifying to think about.
And so just like that, Stark was in front of the final boss while still being only at the mid-part of the rift.
"Haha kid~ show me what you've got, alright?" Sierra laughed as she pointed her bow at Stark again.

chapters.title: Chapter 112 - 112: Early Meeting with Sierra
chapters.content:
Stark gritted his teeth, focusing all his attention on the boss that lay before him. He had no time to think about the implications of the situation, as Sierra already had her bow pointed at him, only a few meters away from him.
"Well well~ you held on better than the others," she shrugged, "You're actually quite interesting…"
"…" Stark didn't answer, he glared at the rift boss.
"I also see that you have Judicator's wings, don't ya~?" she giggled, "I always thought he was too arrogant."
"…"
Stark tried to use [Perception] on Sierra to check out her skills and overall stats, but…
[You are not allowed to check this monster's stats yet!]
A crimson panel came to stop him.
'Fuck you…' he didn't abandon, and instead pushed through, opening his eyes wider, they were filled with determination.
If he was to fight this monster right now, he was sure that he would die without knowing of her stats, HP, or skills, after all they were things that always helped him predict what they would do.
Plus it also cleared the fear of not knowing whether a monster has more skills or not, since he could already check all their names beforehand.
And so… as Stark pushed through that warning, he was granted two pieces of information.
…
[Name: Sierra, the Crystal Archer (BOSS)]
[Level: 80]
[HP: 315000]
[Strength: ???]
[Stamina: ???]
[Speed: ???]
[Defense: ???]
[Skills: ???]
…
He was allowed to see her level and HP, which was more than any other monster he had encountered yet, but all other info was hidden from him.
"Quit glaring at me like that~" Sierra maniacally smiled and took a step forward.
Immediately, Stark answered that simple move by two skills of his.
"AURA SMASH, CRIMSON SPEARS," he sent all 5 attacks at the archer, who just smiled.
"Crystal Shield," she grabbed the arrow that was in her hand and with lightning speed poured out a different aura inside of it, changing the shape from a heart to a circle.
Then… she pointed her bow down, toward the ground next to her feet and shot the arrow.
~BOOM~
Instantly, the moment the arrow hit the ground, a crystal wall appeared in front of Sierra, blocking all 5 of the attacks.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
~CRACK~
Of course, the wall cracked and crumbled, but it had still protected her.
"Attacking me while I'm only approaching you~" she tried to act cute, "That's really mean!"
"Quit the act, you're too old to do that sort of shit," Stark answered, not breaking his fighting position, but still finding a way to shoot something at her, although it wasn't physical.
"O-Old?!" Sierra looked surprised for the first time, "I don't look old at all!"
And before Stark could even say anything else…
~FWISH, PAW, PAW, PAW!~
"Arrow Barrage!" Sierra pointed her bow at Stark and began to shoot dozens of arrows toward him, each time she shot one, another would instantly materialize, and her movements were too fast for the naked eye to discern.
'FAST!'
Stark couldn't dodge them all, but his upgraded [Focus] allowed him to anticipate the incoming arrows and adjust his movements accordingly.
He grabbed three arrows that were heading toward his face with simple movements of his hands, while he avoided the rest using his speed.
Then he began to run in circles around Sierra, it was the only way to constantly avoid the arrows as being too close meant less time to dodge.
"No point in trying, boy~ just give up~~" Sierra seemed to mock him, not stopping her barrage of arrows at the boy.
"…"
"You know~ I really enjoyed seeing the faces of the seven others as they were transformed into beasts~" she mocked.
"…?" Stark didn't stop running, but his pupils' aura grew stronger.
"They will never see their families again, forced to be stuck in this place with me for all eternity, until I am able to escape that is of course, and I will some day, just like all the other apostles who are still alive!" Sierra laughed, still shooting arrows at Stark.
"…"
[Do not be angry.]
Each arrow that was sent at him, and each word Sierra uttered, only served as fuel to his aura, and it was increasing more and more.
Stark knew that even with all the power he had, he was still weak compared to many other people and monsters, but he still needed to keep going.
If one arrow could transform him into a monster, and if there was no way for him to leave… then he just needed to win.
"Aura Smash!" he sent two fists at the archer.
But…
~FWISH~
In response, Sierra shot two arrows at the crimson fists, and the moments these arrow hit, the two fists turned white and vanished.
"None of your attacks will work," Sierra continued in her speech, just like the villain she was.
"Crimson Spears!" he sent three spears, they were shorter than the fists so he thought they would be able to hit.
But…
~PAM, PAM, PAM~
With expert precision, Sierra shot down the three spears, not missing a single one of them.
"They don't call me the 'Expert Archer' for no reason!" she boasted, puffing out her chest.
'You're too prideful…' Stark's aura was growing more and more, and he was becoming annoyed.
"Those 7 adventurers that came here were all transformed into monsters… how sad…" Sierra giggled, "Five of them instantly got hit at the start since they didn't expect it…"
'…'
"…And the two others traversed the forest, but once they reached me… THEY ALL TURNED INTO BEASTS!" she maniacally laughed.
'…'
"And do you want to know the best thing about all of it?" she stopped shooting Stark for a few seconds, pointing her slender hand at him while he was still running in circles.
By this point, Stark was at his limit, and the aura that surrounded his body was so overwhelming that even he had a difficult time containing it: he hated when monsters talked so arrogantly.
What Sierra said next… was the final straw.
"One of the adventurers was a woman… and after she began to transform into a beast, her body beginning to crystallize and turn white, do you know what she did?" Sierra's smile grew so wide it was scary.
'Kill…'
"She PLEADED, not for herself, but for her UNBORN CHILD, HAHAHAHA~" Sierra laughed and laughed, thinking that she was on top of the world.
'Ok,' Stark understood everything, he wasn't even mad about the woman actually, but just tired of Sierra's attitude, and so…
~BAM, FWISH~
In a fraction of a second, he was right in front of Sierra, his fist centimeters away from her face.
"As I thought, you need to die quick," he sighed, his face hidden by his aura, and making him look as terrifying as ever before.

chapters.title: Chapter 113 - 113: Domination's Anger
chapters.content:
"As I thought, you need to die quick," Stark, his anger so great that his aura covered his entire body, spoke.
After hearing Sierra's final phrase, he snapped, which was something extremely rare for him thanks to his mental fortitude.
And before the archer could even finish her full sentence about the transformation of a pregnant classifier woman and the death of her unborn child, he was already right in front of her.
'?!'
Sierra being an archer meant that her vision and speed were far greater than any other class or types of monsters as she needed both to aim and also avoid.
She could see all of Stark's attacks coming, which was why she was confident.
And yet…
She didn't see that attack coming.
Before she could even realize it, with speed faster than even she could discern, he was already in front of her face.
"Join that arrogant angel, won't you," Stark smiled.
'SHIT!' Sierra couldn't avoid this attack, it was too fast.
~BOOOOOOOMM!!!~
The explosion of Stark's fist on Sierra's face was deafening, and the entire rift shook by it.
"-69382!" the damage output was also beyond anything a mere level 26 could achieve.
[Sierra HP: 245618/315000]
She wouldn't die from this, but she was sent very far away, and the impact was so strong that she even traversed three of the giants trees inside the clearing, breaking their trunks and making them fall.
Her face was a bloody mess, a few teeth were broken, her mouth was bleeding, and her nose was probably broken.
The only thing that was fairly intact were her eyes, and that was only since they were more resistant than the rest.
Her bow still in hand, Sierra immediately got up, she still retained her consciousness, and all she needed to get rid of the human was one simple arrow touching him.
"You... you monster..." she whispered, her voice barely audible as she looked ahead, seeing Stark slowly approach.
"You won't do it again," was all that Stark said, his aura pulsating around him.
'I- I can't shoot any arrow, it won't hit…' she had pointed her bow at him, but she didn't even have the confidence to shoot anything anymore.
No… it wasn't that she lost her confidence… it's just that she saw she couldn't win against Stark in his current state.
'I'm out of here,' she gritted her teeth, running away was humiliating, but it was better to run and survive than be arrogant and die.
"ARROW ESCAPE!"
Sierra grabbed an arrow, then transformed its edge using her aura, going from a heart to a triangle.
Then she shot it down and disappeared in a blur of motion.
"See you at the end, human," she wasn't smiling anymore, her face cold: it was an invitation, and she awaited Stark at the boss area.
And just like that, she was teleported to the place she was supposed to be in since the beginning.
'…' Stark didn't care that she ran away as they would meet up again soon enough, he couldn't leave this rift until killing her and getting that stack of arrows after all.
The aura around his body was slowly beginning to dissipate, but he still walked toward the cave, as calm as ever.
That anger he had just felt was completely different from his normal self, but he didn't really dislike it since it allowed him to become stronger.
But as soon as Sierra disappeared and he began walking toward the cave… he heard rustling in the leaves of the giant trees, their shadows casting a sickly green glow over the clearing's floor.
He stopped in his tracks, his senses tingling as he knew that something was off, then he looked up.
And suddenly…
~SCREECH, CRASH~
A bunch of monsters jumped from all the nearby trees, attempting to stop Stark in his tracks.
They had been hiding inside since the beginning, just waiting for the human to pass to possibly trap him.
There were three types of monsters: the first were green-skinned, scaly beasts with sharp claws and a venomous bite, they looked like chameleons but more aggressive.
The second were brown monkeys with branches coming out from many parts of their bodies, they were rather tall, standing at around 3 meters.
And the third were vicious squirrels, of course much bigger than normal ones, they had red eyes and their skin was completely dark, they looked like demons and they were thirsty for bloods.
'Perception…' Stark, knowing that he would have to fight lots of them before reaching the cave, activated his skill to check out all their panels.
…
[Name: Aggre-Meleon (get it?)]
[Level: 68]
[HP: 82000]
[Strength: 1479]
[Stamina: 1734]
[Speed: 1327]
[Defense: 1231]
[Skills: Poisonous Bite, Claw Attack, Camouflage, Tongue Launch, Hypno-Eyes…]
…
[Name: Branch Monkey]
[Level: 66]
[HP: 76000]
[Strength: 1827]
[Stamina:1373]
[Speed: 789]
[Defense: 1501]
[Skills: Monkey Charge, Parkour, Jungle Roar, Grapple, Spiky Body…]
…
[Name: Demonic Squirrel]
[Level: 69]
[HP: 91000]
[Strength: 1298]
[Stamina: 1883]
[Speed: 1903]
[Defense: 874]
[Skills: Small Bite, Pounce, Demon Tail, Blood Eyes, Shadow Dodge…]
…
Stark sighed, seeing that he would have to face this entire array of monsters.
Without hesitation, he readied himself for the fight, since even though the aura from his anger was slowly dissipating, some of it was still there, and he had lots of frustration he wanted to take out on those things.
It was pretty convenient so many monsters had come as they would become his punching bags.
Looking around him, he noticed at least 18 monsters, 6 from each kind.
'Clone Frenzy,' he summoned his clone next to him, and it immediately got into position.
He was surrounded and outnumbered, but it didn't really matter.
'Aura Smash!' both Stark sent four crimson fists toward a group of four 'Branch Monkeys' since they were the slowest monsters and also regrouped.
~BOOM, BOOM!~
"-31824! -34827! -21380! -23019!"
Turns out this was the right choice since two of them immediately them from the impact, and the other ones inside the group also received a bit of damage since [Aura Smash] was an attack that hit its surroundings too.
[Enemies Stunned]
Both 'Branch Monkeys' had been stunned, and so Stark and his clone immediately rushed to finish the job before the other monsters could attack.
Stark's anger was still there, deep inside of him, but his expression was neutral and cold: all he wanted was to enter that cave, traverse the final area, and meet with Sierra again.
But this time… he would make sure to annihilate her for good.
~PUNCH, PUNCH~
"-38371! -34827!" after two quick punches from each Stark, the two stunned 'Branch Monkeys' died.
Then they turned toward the remaining 14 monsters, who all began to rush at them.
'Let's get this over with,' they positioned themselves again.

chapters.title: Chapter 114 - 114: The Giant Trees Challenge
chapters.content:
"Tongue Launch," all 6 Aggre-Meleons began their attacks at once, launching their long, sticky tongues at Stark and his clone.
And at the same time…
"Demon Tail, Pounce!" the squirrels' tails suddenly began to burn with a crimson fire, and their red eyes glared at Stark even harder as they all launched themselves at him.
The two remaining 'Branch Monkeys' wouldn't just stand idle after seeing their companions die either.
"Jungle Roar!" they stood on their two feet and began to repeatedly tap their chests while shouting, the sheer intensity of their voice creating some sort of supersonic wave around it.
'Jungle Roar' is a skill used not only to boost the monster's attack and defense, a way to motivate them basically, but it also was supposed to cause the [Intimidation] or [Fear] status on the enemy target because of their anger.
But of course it wouldn't work, not only since Stark was from the domination class, but also because… his anger was far greater than the monsters' one.
[Not affected by 'Fear']
Their plan was to all attack him at the same time while he was affected by the 'Fear' effect, but they didn't expect that their plan wouldn't work, and that was their biggest mistake.
"Invincible Dodge!" both he and his clone rolled away to avoid the tongues of the chameleons.
But… ~GRAB~
Stark grabbed one of the tongue while it was returning to its owner's mouth, restraining it.
Meanwhile, his clone was busy avoiding the attacks of several squirrels, their tails aimed to hit it as they would cause the [Demonic Burn] status, which was basically an upgraded version of [Burn].
Of course, some of them obviously aimed at Stark, but he was also too fast for them to even dream of hitting him face on.
He didn't let the chameleon's tongue go, and it was beginning to struggle now, trying to pull Stark toward it.
'Disgusting…' he groaned, and instinctively… he began to pull it too.
After a few seconds of struggle…
~CRACK~
The tongue broke, separating from the monster's body and causing the Aggre-Meleon to wince in pain and immediately fall dead.
"-82000!" it did the entirety of its health, and Stark immediately understood of this monster's weakness.
Now the only problem left were the squirrels, they were probably the most terrifying of the trio as they were both fast and strong, plus their appearance also presaged nothing good.
But even then…
"CRIMSON SPEARS," Stark's clone summoned them, and sent them all toward a squirrel who was currently jumping at it, meaning that it couldn't avoid them no matter what.
"-43827! -39482! -40301!" all three pierced its head, and it did immense damage not only because its defense was low, but also since its head seemed to be its weakness, a single spear hitting its brain would be enough.
"Monkey Charge," seeing that their roar did nothing, the two remaining 'Branch Monkeys' used their boost in attack to rush at Stark.
But he didn't even bother to avoid it.
~CRASH~
He took in the two monsters by himself, stopping them with one hand each, and even though he was pushed back for a bit, he still retrieved the advantage.
"AURA SMASH," the clone, while still avoiding the squirrels, sent two fists at the two monkeys to aid its owner.
~BOOM, BOOM~
"-32762! -37265!" each of them received damage, in addition to the after-shock from both attacks damaging the other one too.
[Enemy stunned]
Now that one of them was gone, Stark easily overpowered the second.
"SPIKY BODY," but the monkey didn't want to get beaten by a human, after all it was supposed to be strong!
A wooden spike came out of its chest and headed toward Stark, it was a surprise attack and the speed was so great that it would have been difficult for many to avoid it from this clone.
~FWISH~
'Holy, that was close,' but Stark managed to move his head at the last second, 'Almost got me…'
'Gulp…' the monkey looked at Stark, it had failed to kill the human with its final strategy.
~PUNCH, PUNCH~
"-31731! -32730!"
He punched its head two times successfully, resulting in it immediately falling to the ground.
Then without wasting anytime, he jumped in the air using the momentum of the first monkey falling, span around, and kicked the second who was stunned before finishing it with crushing its head.
"-34632! -44794!"
Now all 'Branch Monkeys' had been wiped out, with 5 'Aggre-Meleons' and 5 'Demonic Squirrels' left.
But despite the loss of their kin, the remaining enemies did not falter in their aggression.
The five 'Aggre-Meleons' lunged at Stark and his clone.
"HYPNO-EYES, POISONOUS BITE!" the former attack made it so that if you ever made eye contact with the chameleon's spinning pupils, you would immediately get the [Hypnosis] status, decreasing your precision by a ton, it was basically game over.
In the other direction, the 'Demonic Squirrels' continued their relentless charges, their tails ablaze with demonic fire.
Stark and his clone adapted to the new threat quickly, they didn't even bother to avoid the chameleons' pupils as they [Hypnosis] effect didn't affect them, and so all they did was dodge their bites.
~KICK~
Stark kicked one of the Aggre-Meleons away; sending it flying against one of the giant trees, then without wasting time… he did something risky out of nowhere.
While the chameleon's mouth was still full of poison, and while they were still attacking him…
He dashed toward one of them, then forcefully opened its mouth using both his hands, before grabbing the tongue inside of it and pulling it as hard as possible, causing the monster to let out a painful, startled cry as the tongue was detached from its mouth.
"-82000!" of course it died.
Meanwhile, Stark's clone was against the 'Demonic Squirrels', and it managed quite easily to avoid them all.
~PUNCH~
"-28373!" it would even launch a small punch or kick at one of the squirrels as a counter-attack, meaning that slowly but surely, both their HP and stamina were depleting.
And so after only a few minutes of back-and-forth, while completing abusing of the strategies and weaknesses they knew…
"-40398!"
They finally managed to kill off all the monsters.
'Phew…' Stark sighed, his clone hadn't even died, maybe it was just as determined as he was?
…
[You have slain "Aggre-Meleon lv68", gained 76103EXP!]
[You have slain "Aggre-Meleon lv68", gained 74985EXP!]
.
.
[You have slain "Branch Monkey lv66", gained 71029EXP!]
[You have slain "Branch Monkey lv66", gained 72914EXP!]
.
.
[You have slain "Demonic Squirrel lv69", gained 79338EXP!]
[You have slain "Demonic Squirrel lv69", gained 78102EXP!]
.
.
And so just like that…
[+1,357,413EXP!]
'Holy shit…'
[Your level has increased to level 28, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 29, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Experience: 508904/628000]
Stark was beginning to level up extremely easily, and it almost became scary, was this the power of a Nightmare-Level rift?
[Skill Points: 8 Available]
In addition to that, the fact he was now getting 2 skill points per level meant that he could stack them and possibly upgrade a skill all the way in one go.
'Time to finally upgrade Domination,' he smiled as he had more than enough skill points to do that, plus some spare in case he wanted to upgrade anything else.
[Do you want to use 5 Skill Points to upgrade Domination to Level 15 (MAX)?]
[Y/N]

chapters.title: Chapter 115 - 115: Domination Level 15 (Bronze-Max)!
chapters.content:
[Do you want to use 5 Skill Points to upgrade Domination to Level 15 (MAX)?]
[Y/N]
Without hesitation, Stark clicked on the Y option.
~DING, DING, DING, DING, DING~
And after five notifications…
[You have upgraded 'Domination' to level 15 (Bronze-Tier Max)!]
But of course, reached a new milestone also meant… a new perk!
…
[Skill: Domination lv15]
[New Perk: Dominated Status]
[Description:] This new perk doesn't serve much purpose under normal circumstances, but if during a battle, the user somehow manages to turn the tides against an enemy stronger than they are, and their aura increases by that, there is a chance that the enemy will receive the 'Dominated' status.
The 'Dominated' status reduces defense and movements, and gives the user a 10% stat boost against the dominated enemy.
[Note:] When entering a battle against an enemy weaker than you are, or if the enemy in itself fears your aura, there is also a chance they receive the 'Dominated' status, further reducing their chances of victory against the person they feared =)
…
'Holy…' Stark scratched his chin, his eyes burning with excitement.
If he had gotten this perk before, then he was confident his anger against Sierra would have guaranteed for her to get the 'Dominated' status.
In the end, the basis of this perk worked if, and only if the enemy before Stark suddenly became more wary/scared of him, otherwise it was useless.
With that in mind, Stark moved on to the three other skill points he had.
[You have upgraded 'Double Assault' to level 5!]
[You have upgraded 'Aura Smash' to level 8!]
With this… he had everything he needed, but the fact 'Double Assault' reached level 5 also meant a new perk on it as well…
…
[Skill: Double Assault lv5]
[New Perk: Double Impact]
[Description: When using 'Double Assault', there is a very small chance that each attack will count as two hits (deadly), causing double the damage, but also double the status effect or knock back on your opponent.]
[Note: a crimson replica of yourself (much like the clones) will temporarily appear to deal the second attack, then will disappear right afterward]
…
'I don't know the chance, but it must be very low,' Stark mumbled as he closed all the panels and began heading toward the cave.
He heard rustling in the leaves while passing the dozens of giant trees scattered throughout the clearing, but none of the monsters jumped out for some reason.
He would have seriously enjoyed checking out that 'Dominated' status on the monsters, but oh well, he will see later.
[Alchemy Inventory: x20 Potion of Strength, x19 Potion of Speed, x38 Potion of Regeneration]
He hadn't used his potions much since it was difficult in the heat of such situations, but maybe he should begin to drink them before the battle?
Thinking of that, and while still heading toward the cave, Stark pulled out four potions: 2 of strength, and 2 of speed, holding them with his hands.
He was confident no monster would attempt to attack him, so he didn't even bother to free his hands.
And so just like that, he managed to reach the entrance of the rock/crystal cave.
The walls were made out of gray solid rock, but all around these very same walls were hundreds upon hundreds of white crystals, glinting in the darkness.
They were [Crystals of Sierra], and they were used to make those arrows, Stark guessed that's why Sierra was called the 'Crystal Archer' in her boss name.
The cave seemed to go down into a very long and dark tunnel, and so before heading inside of the final area of this rift…
Stark opened up all four bottles in his hands, then began gulping down all their contents.
He had wondered if drinking two potions of the same type at the same time would mean an increase in stat boosts.
But…
[+10% strength for 10 minutes]
[+10% speed for 10 minutes]
It would be too op, so instead stacking up potions meant that the effect time you had would go up.
He had drunk 2 potions of strength, and each was supposed to give him 5 minutes of strength boost, so drinking two meant 10 minutes, if he drank 5 it would have been 25 minutes, etc…
'Interesting… but I need to find new recipes or buy them…' he mumbled as he finally entered the cave.
[Level 75 Area: 'The Crystal Cave']
The darkness within the cave was almost suffocating, but the faint, silvery-white light that came from the crystals illuminated his path slightly.
He went down, and now before him was a giant tunnel that seemed to endlessly stretch forward.
No monsters in sight, nothing.
Stark carefully moved along the tunnel, his senses heightened and his eyes scanning the darkness for any signs of movement.
But of course, it wouldn't be this easy, it couldn't be.
No matter what…
~FWISH~
In the distance, Stark saw a flash of light rush at him at intense speed, like a bolt of lightning.
'…' Without hesitation, he prepared to defend himself.
And so using [Focus] and his boost in speed, Stark grabbed the [Arrow of Sierra] that had been sent to him as it was centimeters away from his face.
'She doesn't give up, does she…' he sighed, and noticed that the many more flashes of lightning were coming, 'Is she struggling because she knows she is about to die? Or does she really believe she can hit me and win?'
With a swift movement, Stark dodged an arrow, then another, and a third one.
"ARROW BARRAGE!" from the safety of her boss chamber, Sierra used her archer eyes to keep sending dozens upon dozens of arrows at him.
In such a case, the human was totally overwhelmed, and even though there seemed to be no monsters, the sole fact that the boss was targeting was already enough.
A Nightmare-Level rift wasn't only described as such because of its high difficulty, or because there were strong monsters there, but many other factors played a huge part in it: its size, its category, the unfairness and how likely someone was to clear it were also factors.
And in this case… it was because a single arrow could send you to your death that it was this hard, and why so many people failed before.
Basically… it was really unfair.
But…
'How is it gonna work on me if i'm faster,' Stark's eyes glew with a blue aura as the speed potion took effect, increasing Stark's speed, and allowing him to easily avoid all the attacks that were sent at him.
"Just you wait Sierra…" he grinned as he ran through the tunnel.

chapters.title: Chapter 116 - 116: The Crystal Cave
chapters.content:
Sierra's eyes widened as she saw Stark narrowly avoiding her arrows that were being scattered in all possible directions in the tunnel, hoping for just one of them to hit his shoulders or any part of his body at all.
She clenched her fists and whispered, "Not today, human…"
~FWISH, FWISH~
'I just need one…'
~FWISH~
'Just one arrow is enough to end this…'
~FWISH~
'PLEASE!'
Much like Judicator, Sierra was a 'Godless Demon' apostle, but also a boss, meaning that she wasn't supposed to be scared, instead supposed to be boasting of confidence and power, this was why she showed herself early in the rift to challenge all humans and kill them.
But she had been forced to run away from Stark as deep inside of her mind, his aura at that time was truly overwhelming, and her face still hurts a bit from the punch he had sent.
At that time, even she, for a quick second, thought: 'what if he wins?', which was why she didn't take the risk to continue the fight and instead went back to her boss area.
'…' Stark had the blankest of expressions on his face, no trace of anger or any emotions at all as he kept rushing through the tunnel, avoiding all the arrows, and even having the guts to catch some of them to store inside his [Spatial Inventory]
'FUCK YOU!' Sierra's body began to be surrounded by her aura, and it was growing more and more, 'Let's see how you like this!"
And then… she snapped her fingers, sending a blue shockwave throughout the entire tunnel.
"…" Stark's eyes narrowed as the shockwave hit him, but it barely fazed him, he felt no pain and he was still able to move with the same agility.
The reason he hadn't avoided it was because [Focus] didn't alert him of any danger, meaning that it wasn't an attack meant for damage.
He wondered what Sierra was planning now, knowing she was up to something.
After all… she wasn't shooting any arrows anymore….
And suddenly, just as he thought of that…
~BIIIIIM, FWISH~
Every white crystal scattered throughout the walls of the cave tunnel began to glow with a white aura that almost blinded Stark because of the sheer amount of it.
~FWISH~
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" Stark heard the sound of an arrow coming, and focus alerted him of danger, but he couldn't see anything, so he was forced to use invincible dodge to guarantee he wouldn't be hit.
And it looks like it was the right decision…
'Huh…? The arrows passed right through him…?' Sierra was making sure that whatever she saw was right, 'I didn't shoot all this time to charge up fifteen arrows but he just avoided them all like this while being blinded…?'
Deep inside, Sierra knew that the human before her was weird.
But this explosion wasn't everything that the 'The Crystal Cave' reserved.
And suddenly… right as the light faded and Stark was able to see…
He noticed that coming out of each crystal was a figure, one he had already seen before.
They were [Victims of Sierra], and there were hundreds of them scattered throughout the walls and ceiling of the tunnel.
Their pitch-black lifeless eyes stared at him, and their black wings were idle.
From all directions now, he had this sense of discomfort he couldn't really describe.
'Great… now he's going to get blocked by them…' Sierra smiled as she began pointing her bow at Stark again.
The [Victims of Sierra] were all the people Sierra previously infected with her arrows ignoring the 7 classifiers as they became another type of monster, and they were in a constant state of agony, forced to followed everything their 'queen' ordered them to do.
This was why the 'Crystal Archer' was so confident, their sheer number all over that cave would distract Stark and hopefully she would hit him.
But… something strange happened this time.
When Sierra ordered something, every [Victim of Sierra] was forced to follow it as if they didn't, they would just suffer more, she wouldn't give them death, it would be a reward.
All they wanted was for her to die.
'STOP HIM, MY MINIONS,' she internally laughed as she ordered them all to make as much movement and noise as possible.
[Victims of Sierra] cannot be killed with attacks, but they also can't harm, so the best thing they could do was obstruct Stark's vision.
And yet… they didn't move.
Instead, they just kept staring at Stark, before all pointing at the end of the tunnel, where Sierra was located.
'I SAID STOP HIM, YOU FUCKING-' the archer shouted again, inflicting pain on all of them.
But they didn't budge.
The reason such a phenomenon was happening is because even the [Victims of Sierra], with their puppet minds, could see Stark's aura, and it was the most powerful one they had seen yet.
Him being an enemy of Sierra almost meant that he was their allies.
Their sole goal was for the apostle to die, so that they can also vanish and go rest, which was why they didn't budge.
They saw potential in Stark, and so they believed in him.
"Go… human…" through the entire tunnel, Stark heard such a whisper, and it sent a chill down his spine.
Sierra, finally realizing the gravity of the situation, knew she had to make her move: the [Victims of Sierra] didn't budge no matter how much pain she inflicted on them, she had never seen them so determined.
And the worst thing of all… was that the human was still running toward her, his crimson aura burning brighter than before.
Sierra's eyes narrowed as she tried to understand the situation.
She had never been so utterly ignored by her minions, and it made her uneasy. But she could not afford to be distracted; she had to end this so-called "human" once and for all.
"ARROW BARRAGE!" she only needed one arrow…
'JUST ONE ARROW DAMN IT!' and so she kept shooting them like a machine-gun, not even a fraction of a second between each reload.
~FWISH, FWISH~
But Stark would avoid them all, his speed potion massively helping him.
And the [Victims of Sierra] were still looking down at him, pointing their hollow arms toward the boss area.
"You… are… close…" they whispered after two minutes.
And so just like that… the final clash was about to happen as Stark looked up and noticed that he could see the silver fog from his current distance: meaning that the boss area was right in front of him.
'I GOT YOU, SIERRA!' he shouted as he increased his pace.

chapters.title: Chapter 117 - 117: Sierra, The Crystal Archer
chapters.content:
Sierra, feeling threatened, could not believe that her "minions" were actually helping the supposed enemy.
And no matter how many arrows she shot from the safety of her area, Stark would avoid them all like it was nothing.
Yet his stamina didn't seem to go down, actually it was the opposite, after every dodge or grab, his determination would grow.
And so just like that… Stark reached the end of the tunnel, and dashed through the silver fog without even taking a second to rest before the boss.
He was yet again surrounded by that weird feeling of being transported to another place as he passed the fog, and after a few seconds…
~FWISH~
He emerged on the other side.
And as soon as he did…
[You have entered the BOSS area!]
[Boss Area: 'Sierra's Crystal Lair']
These two panels greeted him, but that wasn't all… since before he could even check his surroundings or see where the boss was…
A bow was right in front of his face, almost as if it had been waiting for him to come inside of the boss area to ambush him.
And so he bumped into it as [Focus] somehow couldn't detect ambushes while passing through the fog.
~FWISH~
"IT'S MY WIN, HUMAN," Sierra laughed as she shot Stark, this time the arrow was so close that she was confident Stark wouldn't be able to avoid it.
But she never learns, does she?
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" he activated his invincibility frames, not even bothering to move as if it so close he didn't even need to time it, and the arrow fazed right through him.
"Coward," Stark smiled before sending his fist toward Sierra's face.
Every boss until now had waited for Stark to enter its area before appearing, and yet… Sierra had waited just to ambush him.
Basically… she tried to win in a dirty way.
"And you call yourself an apostle of the Godless Demon," he mocked as he punched in her direction.
~SLAM~
Sensing the fist, and getting flashbacks from the immense damage she had gotten previously, Sierra blocked the attack with her bow by placing it sideways, but the impact still sent her back.
"-0!" she didn't receive any kind of damage though.
Stark took the small amount of time to check out his surroundings, after all he was now in the final area, 'Sierra's Crystal Lair'.
The cave space around him was adorned with countless sparkling crystals, and there was a faint silver trail on the ground, leading to a large central platform.
On that platform lay a massive crystal throne, which was where Sierra was supposed to be if she was an actual normal monster/boss.
The boss area was massive, and there was enough space for the two to fight at their full potential in comparison to the 'Shadow Monument' which was limited by the walls.
After analyzing everything he needed, Stark turned his head back to Sierra, who was now a few meters away from him thanks to the knock back of his punch.
"Sigh…" Sierra shook her head lightly, then she began heading toward her throne, "Has anyone told you that you are annoying?"
"Only monsters like you," Stark smiled as he saw her sit on her crystal throne, her bow still in hand.
She crossed her legs, and it was almost as if she wasn't gonna have the battle of her life in a few instants.
"Very well…" Sierra sighed, "Then… I guess it's time to do it the hard way," she suddenly got up, and her ocean eyes began to glow with an ethereal aura, her entire body surrounded by a powerful aura as well.
'Did she just sit, just to get back up?' Stark pondered, but decided not to think too much about it.
And that's when the panel finally appeared.
[Sierra, The Crystal Archer (BOSS)]
Stark decided to immediately use 'Perception' as he hadn't been able to see her entire panel before.
…
[Name: Sierra, the Crystal Archer (BOSS)]
[Level: 80]
[HP: 245618/315000]
[Strength: 1492]
[Stamina: 2783]
[Speed: 3401]
[Defense: 2245]
[Skills: Shoot, Arrow Creation, Arrow Ray, Arrow Barrage, Archer's Focus, Crystal Burst, Teleportation, Crystal Shield, Puppet Control, Sierra's Final Stand, Crystal Transformation…]
…
"It's just you and me now!" Sierra span her bow around, throwing it from hand to hand in a very stylish way, maybe trying to prove that she is a master archer, and that she has complete control over her bow movements.
"ARROW CREATION! SHOOT!"
She tried to shoot an arrow at Stark after creating an arrow out of crystals and aura, but he obviously just avoided it.
'Spatial Inventory,' in return, Stark opened his inventory void and pulled out 2 potions of Strength and 2 potions of Speed, then he drank them all quickly.
He wanted to guarantee he would have the effect during the entire fight since his potions from before had already stopped working.
"AURA SMASH, CRIMSON SPEARS!" Stark retaliated by punching the air twice in Sierra's direction, sending two fists of aura and all his spears to her.
"Crystal Shield," but just like she did before, the archer transformed one of her arrows and shot it down to create a crystal wall that blocked everything.
"-0! -0! -0!"
~DASH~
Not wasting time, Stark dashed toward Sierra while she was defending herself using the crystal wall as a shield, and the moment it got destroyed…
"Hey there…" he appeared from behind the debris, taking the archer by surprise.
But it didn't mean that she couldn't get out of such a situation, after all… Sierra may be in an archer, but she is just as competent as most 'Warrior' classes in hand-to-hand combat.
~FWISH, KICK~
She used her bow to block the punch again, and as soon as Stark tried to use that opportunity to launch his second hand at her… she spanned and kicked him out really hard in the stomach, sending him flying in the opposite direction.
[The Purgatory Shadow took the hit in your place]
"-0!"
He was still launched away, but received no damage whatsoever.
'What the hell was that thing…' Sierra wondered as she saw a shadow come out of one of Stark's rings to protect him, 'This boy is weird…'
'But…' she suddenly grinned as she saw Stark retrieve his balance using his hands, 'This is exciting!'
And so just like that… for the first time in a very long time, Sierra was beginning to enjoy the thrill of a battle.
But that meant that it would become much more difficult for Stark.
"ARROW RAY, CRYSTAL BURST!" she activated two skills at the same time all of a sudden, and the aura around her grew even more.
Her bow was beginning to be surrounded by an electrifying blue aura, and five giant crystal shards appeared behind Sierra, spinning around her in circles as well.
"It's time to end this, human," she shrugged as her grin grew even wider.
'CLONE FRENZY!' but Stark wouldn't let this go, and so he summoned only one of his clones as the other one was still on cooldown for 5 minutes.
'I'm gonna send you to hell, lady,' he smiled as well, his eyes burning with a deep aura, "You're gonna join the mayor and the angel soon," he laughed, and her eyes slightly twitched upon hearing that.
And so just like that, Stark got ready to fight the opponent that could transform him into a monster with one single arrow.

chapters.title: Chapter 118 - 118: The Effect of the Arrows
chapters.content:
Stark's clone nodded as it saw the rift boss use all her powerful attacks, her bow and body surrounded by an electrifying blue aura, and also five crystal shards turning around her in rotation.
"DIE!" she pointed her bow at him, and a giant arrow, at least ten times the size of the others, began charging up inside as she pulled the string.
Stark wasn't dumb, and so instead of letting her charge an attack that could potentially kill him, he immediately dashed toward her.
"AURA SMASH," his clone also sent two fists at her to give Stark a chance to attack.
But…
Two of the crystal shards rotating around Sierra intercepted the fists, then immediately crumbled, meaning only three were left.
"CRIMSON SPEARS," but it wouldn't back off, so the clone also sent three spears again, in hopes of eliminating all the shards.
But…
~BAM~
Like a baseball bat, one of the shards conveniently placed itself horizontally in front of the spears, and as if it was controlled by an invisible creature, it swung to make all three spears disappear, in exchange the shard obviously disappeared.
[Crystal Burst] was an incredibly powerful attack, not only since it granted the user the ability to summon 5 shards that could pretty much block any attack, but also because when it is set on [Attack] mode, Sierra can send all the shards toward a target, and if they ever hit him (or an area close to him), then it would cause massive damage as they would explode.
~PUNCH~
Stark tried to take advantage of Sierra's attack charging up to punch her and cancel it, but yet another shard came to interrupt him, and it shattered as well as it blocked his strike.
Stark knew this would happen as he had seen his clone's attacks being blocked, but…
The thing he didn't expect though is for the shard to suddenly move while he was in midair, unable to dodge, and then…
~BAM, CRACK~
The shard slammed into Stark's chest, sending him flying backward and crashing into the ground.
"-7837!"
He felt a sharp pain as some crystal debris teared the fabric of his clothes and cause manor injuries.
Luckily, Stark had activated his [Domination] shield, which successfully blocked 5K points of damage, meaning that he had overall 'only' received 2837 points of damage.
[Stark HP: 8363/11200]
Thanks to his level increase, his HPs had already gone well over 10000.
After all, the more a classifier levels up, the higher the amount of HP they would get to accommodate for the bigger challenges they would face later.
Stark's clone helped him get up instantly, like the true companion it was, but… it was already too late.
"GOODBYE, HUMAN!" Sierra laughed maniacally as her giant arrow attack charged.
And suddenly…
[AVOID, AVOID, AVOID, AVOID]
The crimson messages appeared all over, but they quickly subdued as another one appeared, and it was extremely unusual.
[CANNOT AVOID, ELIMINATE BOSS QUICK!]
'Huh?'
Not understanding, Stark immediately used [Perception] on Sierra's status panel, and specifically on the [Arrow Ray] skill.
…
[Skill: Arrow Ray]
[Description:] A powerful ranged attack that needs 30 seconds to charge up, but if the user ever succeeds in doing that, then a giant crystal arrow will appear and transform into an unstoppable beam.
[Note:] This skill cannot be stopped unless it hits someone (it will still go if hitting an object), so it would be advised to watch out as the arrow beam works just as the normal ones.
…
And suddenly, as soon as he read that…
~FIOUUU, BOOOOOM!~
Sierra fired the giant arrow at Stark, which created a trail of white aura so overwhelming it could make many classifiers faint upon sensing it.
"DASH!" it was fast, but Stark immediately moved out of the way by flapping Judicator's wings.
