But of course… it wasn't like the other arrows.
Since as soon as the arrow met the wall on the other end of the cave boss area, it didn't explode or disappear like the others, instead, it turned around and flew back toward Stark.
'It's going to follow me until it hits something…' Stark's eyes widened as he crouched to avoid the arrow again.
And in the meantime, Sierra didn't sit down and watch him struggle.
"ARROW BARRAGE," she began to create more arrows and launch them at Stark and his clone while they were busy avoiding the giant arrow.
'This can't keep going,' Stark mumbled as he kept moving in all directions, many arrows almost hitting him, 'But if the arrows need to hit something then…'
He looked at his clone, and suddenly, something came to mind.
Back at the Domination Trial, something like this happened before, where either he or Orasio needed to sacrifice themselves to pass to the final area, and at that the time…
He had used one of his clones so that they both pass.
So maybe… just maybe… his clone could be considered as a person?
And so… he took the risk.
"Hey," he shouted to his clone, and it immediately understood as it suddenly began to run in the opposite direction, toward Stark.
"FOOLISH, DIE, HUMAN!" Sierra didn't stop shooting her arrows, confident in her imminent victory now.
But right as the [Arrow Ray] was centimeters away from hitting the original Stark… the clone pushed him out of the way and took the hit.
"-837!" these [Arrows of Sierra] didn't do that much damage as their perk was already overpowered.
'Dumbass, he wasted a clone,' Sierra maniacally laughed, even stopping her onslaught of arrows to enjoy the show.
But what she didn't expect… was for Stark's clone to be so close to the original, and made from his aura, so it would be considered as if hitting someone.
And so the giant arrow exploded upon contact with the clone's body.
But before it disappeared… it received the effects of the [Arrow of Sierra] perk.
'Oh… I can see what it does now,' Stark smiled.
The white mist engulfed the clone, and its body suddenly began to turn completely white, crystal shards growing on its skin too, its aura also began to flow around the area, as if trying to escape and becoming aggressive.
'WHAT THE?' Stark was taken aback.
And so after a few seconds… the clone's body began to crystallize, the shards spreading and covering its entire form.
And the moment the crystals merged with its figure, the clone's eyes became completely black, and a pair of wings grew from its back.
It had become a [Servant of Sierra], and although Stark couldn't know about the pain, the aura of the clone moving so much during the transformation meant that it was extremely painful.
'I'm sorry,' he sighed, speaking to his clone before calling it back, resulting in its aura seeping back into his body, and for the white mist/crystals to drop to the ground as the bearer of the 'perk' had disappeared.
But… now Stark was mad, and the aura from the clone that merged with his increased his anger as it sought for revenge: it wanted Sierra dead, it wasn't even about the mission anymore.
"Nice try, but now I'm truly gonna end this," Stark dashed toward Sierra, taking her aback as she hadn't expected for the clone to be able to affected by her arrows.
"DOUBLE ASSAULT!" he shouted, activating his legendary skill.

chapters.title: Chapter 119 - 119: Double Assault and Double Impact are STRONG!
chapters.content:
"ARROW BARRAGE," Sierra sensed that something was wrong with Stark as soon as he activated [Double Assault], after all his aura just became twice as imposing, and it made even her uncomfortable.
She didn't want to admit it, but she now understood why Malakar and Judicator had possibly lost against this human, he was strong, there was no denying this fact.
'But I beat humans stronger than he is…' yet she didn't give up, after all, all the classifiers she had infected before were over level 100, and during her life out of this rift, she managed to beat some powerful foes too alongside the 'Godless Demon' and other apostles.
She couldn't lose against this human, not now, it was impossible.
[9 seconds left for 'Double Assault']
Before Sierra could even create her first arrow and shoot it, Stark was already in front of her, his eyes burning with determination.
'SHIT,' this brought back memories to Sierra as the last time such a thing happened, she had been completely destroyed: she couldn't allow that to happen again.
"TELEPORTATION!" she had the time to create an arrow with a triangle shape at its edge, then she quickly launched it to the other side of the room.
~SLAM~
Stark punched the air in Sierra's direction, but she disappeared in a trail of smoke right as his fist reached her.
'She used that arrow to teleport away,' he immediately thought, but didn't care enough to actually think too much about it as his time using [Double Assault] was counted.
And during the split second Sierra took to assess her surroundings again, she opened her eyes and… Stark was right in front of her again.
'Too fast!' she can use [Teleportation] repeatedly, but this time there was absolutely no way for her to do anything.
And so what had to happen happened.
~PUNCH~
Stark punched her face before she could even react.
"-58372!" the damage rose up.
Still… somehow it didn't do as much damage as when Stark was angry, even when he didn't have [Double Assault] activated at that time, was there the possibility that he didn't know something about the [Domination] class…?
Sierra was sent flying for dozens of meters after that punch, but Stark wouldn't let her go this easily.
He caught up to her while in midair using his speed, and smashed her body to the ground using his two hands.
"-38372! -11029!"
"TELEPORTATION," Sierra, even though she was hurt, sent another one of her triangle arrows to the other side of the cave, resulting in her teleporting away from Stark again.
[3 seconds left for 'Double Assault']
"AURA SMASH, CRIMSON SPEARS," Sierra was bleeding, and her body was slightly trembling, maybe she feared that Stark would be able to catch up to her again?
The two crimson fists and three spears rushed at Sierra, but yet again, she activated [Crystal Shield] to defend herself from the attacks, then quickly used [Arrow Creation] and [Shoot] to stale for time.
"ARCHER'S FOCUS," the eyes of an archer are supposed to be perfect, and 10/10 vision is a must, which was why this skill was even able to detect for how much time an ability can go on for, and predict the enemies' movements.
This was why she had been so confident at first: she was able to see all of Stark's movements no matter what he did, yet when he was suddenly able to catch up to her in the surface and still manage to hit her while the skill was active, she knew that something was off.
'SHIT, SHIT, SHIT!' she kept shooting arrows so fast that her hand movements weren't visible to the naked eye.
And yet... in less than a second, Stark had managed to avoid them all and was already in front of her.
"CRYSTAL SHIELD," she shot an arrow down, creating a crystal wall to protect her.
But…
~SLAM~
Stark destroyed it instantly.
"DIE!" Sierra tried to use the chaos and momentum of Stark destroying the wall to shoot another arrow, but…
"DASH!" he flapped [Judicator's Wings] upward, and so he avoided the arrow, looking down at the archer from above, a cold gaze on his face.
[1 second left for 'Double Assault'!]
'It's fine…' Sierra still had the guts to smile, 'Only one second left for that shitty skill… then I can use "them" to win… he can only attack me once with that time after all…!'
She had given up the idea of avoiding the attack since Stark's speed while using [Double Assault] was just too much, and so she was ready to get punched.
And she did.
~SMASH~
Stark smashed her head while he was in the air.
"-48372!" she almost fell to the floor because of damage and pain, but she still thought that it was possible to come back from this as [Double Assault] couldn't be used anymore.
'AND NOW, IT'S TIME FOR ME TO WIN' she immediately tried to get up, a wide grin on her bloody face.
But…
'Huh?'
['Double Impact' activated!]
[Description: When using 'Double Assault', there is a very small chance that each attack will count as two hits (deadly), causing double the damage, but also double the status effect or knock back on your opponent.]
Sierra's smile faltered as she looked up and saw a crimson copy of Stark, it's eyes completely white, and a trail of white aura come out from them.
~SMASH~
The copy, which was the result of 'Double Impact', smashed Sierra's head and did just as much damage as the first attack.
"-48372!"
And with all of that…
[Sierra, The Crystal Archer HP: 41101/315000]
Stark would have loved to finish her off this instant, but his stamina was depleting really fast after all of these movements, and the fact he avoided so many arrows took a toll on him, which was why he decided to back away for a few moments to recover everything.
After all… that boss was pretty much done for.
"…" Sierra was looking down to the ground, her bow still in hand, but she wasn't moving at all, almost as if her spirit had been broken.
But no… this couldn't be it, no way in hell such an arrogant piece of shit like her would give up.
And he was right, since even though from the outside, it looked like Sierra was giving up, on the inside…
'HAHAHAHAHAHAHA,' she was laughing like a maniac.
"I'M GOING TO FUCKING RIP YOU APART, AND WHEN YOU TRANSFORM INTO ONE OF THOSE BEASTS, I'LL MAKE YOU INTO MY SLAVE," she shouted as hard as she could while getting up, a creepy smile on her face.
And so... she activated her ultimate skills.
'Ah shit…' Stark sensed the atmosphere of the room change, and even though it looked like Sierra was done for after everything he had sent her way, she still had the determination to keep going.
"CRYSTAL TRANSFORMATION, SIERRA'S FINAL STAND," she activated her two ultimate skills, and suddenly, the aura around her, much like when Stark used [Double Assault], grew at least five times in size and power.
But Stark wouldn't back down.
"Hah~" he mocked her while seeing the surrounding space distort, "I would love to make you my slave to teach you a lesson, but too bad I'll kill you before that~" he mocked her previous statement.
And so just like that, the final showdown of this battle could begin.

chapters.title: Chapter 120 - 120: The Seven Servants of Sierra
chapters.content:
"CRYSTAL TRANSFORMATION, SIERRA'S LAST STAND!" her HP reaching its final quarter, Sierra knew she couldn't just stand idle while the human eliminated her like her other comrades, she was much better than them after all, she was stronger than Malakar and Judicator!
'...' Stark had a blank expression on his face, just waiting for her to try more things: he wanted her to do everything in her power to stop him, yet miserably fail, and when she will be in the depths of despair, he'll kill her.
This wasn't cruel, after all he was just giving back what she did to all those humans she transformed, and if torture was possible, he would gladly do it.
And so... Stark looked at Sierra as the space around her became to distort.
Then suddenly... [Crystal Transformation], one of her ultimate skills, took effect as it needed to charge.
The other one also needed to charge up, but it would take a much bigger amount of time.
And so...
"CRYSTAL TRANSFORMATION!" Sierra shouted, and her aura became much overwhelming, then...
Many crystals around the walls of the boss area began to shake.
~BRRRRRR~
It created a very annoying sound, but it ended after only five seconds since all the crystal immediately removed themselves from their spots in the wall, meaning that all around Stark and Sierra were hundreds upon hundreds of them.
'...going to attack me with them?' Stark thought, after all there was a chance coming in contact with those crystals was deadly as they were what made the arrows.
But no... it couldn't be it, otherwise she could have done that since the beginning.
Instead, hundreds upon hundreds of crystal shook again, then all began to fly toward Sierra.
It was a beautiful sight as each of them left a trail of white mist behind.
And so after all the crystals of the cave reached the boss... they began to merge with her skin.
'No...' Stark was wrong, 'They're not merging... they're... creating an upper layer of protection...?'
Every crystal that reached Sierra's skin added something to that mystical layer, and it was like some sort of crystal armor was forming itself around Sierra.
And that was exactly what was happening, since when Stark finally decided to use [Perception]...
...
[Skill: Crystal Transformation]
[Description:] This exclusive skill allows Sierra to combine many crystal shards around her to create an armor that gives her protection against any attacks, note that hitting the armor doesn't infect you with the 'crystal mist'.
[Note:] The armor has 100K HP, and it is impossible to hit Sierra until it is destroyed.
...
'Yeah... Basically she gave herself an additional 100K HP,' it wasn't that annoying since two good hits meant that the armor would be destroyed, but it also meant there was a chance Sierra could come back from this.
And by the time the crystal armor was finished... it was already shining, an ethereal aura around it.
It was completely white, and covered up Sierra completely, except for her head as her ocean eyes were still visible, although there was a crystal helmet on it.
"Feels better," Sierra smiled lightly, bold of her after getting beat up by the very human she underestimated.
But by the sheer aura around her... Stark knew that something was wrong.
"I'm impressed," Sierra clapped her hands, "Very impressed, human, you'll make a fine slave, my OWN premium slave!" she laughed.
"..." Stark looked at her with a blank expression, and he took a step forward.
"Don't even think of taking another step in this direction if you don't want to have a bad time."
~STEP~
Stark didn't care and took two more, his expression not changing.
"You know," Sierra shrugged, "I realized that you only got angry when I talked about those transformed humans, and especially that pregnant woman, were they your companions?"
~STEP, STEP~
"Maybe if you accept to become one of my slaves, I'll let them go, you know?" she smiled, pointing her bow at Stark.
'Liar...' he had clearly read in the arrows' description that people who are transformed cannot go back, and either way he wasn't playing to do that for some strangers.
~STEP, STEP, STEP~
Every step Stark took now left a burning mark on the cave ground.
~FWISH~
Sierra shot an arrow at Stark, but he just avoided it before returning to his original position.
"You just won't give up..." Sierra smiled, a malicious glint in her eyes indicating she was preparing something, "Well, let's see how well you do against 'THEM'!"
And suddenly...
"PUPPET CONTROL!" the bow in her hand flew behind her and began to float while spinning, and on the other hand, Sierra lifted both of her arms up, a white electric aura coming out of each of her fingers.
~STEP, STEP~
Stark didn't stop though.
And so… as he kept walking, the electric aura coming out of Sierra hit the ground seven times in front of her, and…
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
From the ground emerged seven figures, they were completely white, but in comparison to the [Victims of Sierra], it was still possible to distinguish that they were human.
They were the so-called [Servants of Sierra], basically, the seven classifiers that had attempted to beat this rift but all failed.
"As I said before…" Sierra clapped her hands, and the seven figures began to walk toward Stark like zombies, "It is possible to save them, they are still alive, we wouldn't want to kill them, would we?"
Did she really think this bluff would work against Stark?
Some of the [Servants of Sierra] were now right in front of Stark, and they stopped, looking at him with their black eyes, they were much scarier than the [Victims] since they still had human features.
…
[Name: Servant of Sierra]
[Level: 80]
[HP: 30000]
[Strength: 1]
[Stamina: 1]
[Speed: 1]
[Defense: 1]
[Skills: Memories, Puppet, Despair…]
…
Other than their improved HP and two additional skills, they were just like the [Victims of Sierra], mere puppets controlled by the boss.
They couldn't do any damage, and any hit would kill them.
And so as all of them stopped before Stark, all he could see in their eyes was the infinite despair of being helpless against this entity.
'Look at him… stopping once he sees them… just as I knew, humans are so easy to manipulate…' Sierra giggled, the malicious grin on her face growing.
But…
"K-Kill… us…" an echo escaped the servants' mouths as they all looked at Stark, their eyes on the verge of tears yet unable to do so.
"Ok," Stark nodded, this was the only mercy he could give them.
The [Servant of Sierra] before Stark was the pregnant woman Sierra had mentioned beforehand, and so…
~PUNCH~
Stark punched her face as lightly as he could.
"-49472!" it still did incredible damage because of her 1 defense stat, and she immediately vanished.
"Huh?" Sierra was shocked that Stark actually had the guts to kill another human, no matter how transformed it was.
She had used this strategy several times against other people, using their loved ones as bait to transform them too.
"Let's get this over with," Stark advanced, he was tired of her dirty tricks, and if killing her was the sole solution to free all the creatures she transformed, then he wanted to do it fast.

chapters.title: Chapter 121 - 121: The Ultimate Skill: Sierra's Last Stand
chapters.content:
~PUNCH~
"-49372!" another [Servant of Sierra] vanished.
"Haha~ you try to act as if you're righteous," Sierra's smile did falter for a second, but she kept her composure as she summoned back her bow in hand, it was floating right behind her.
~PUNCH, PUNCH~
"-51938! -50281!"
"You think you're some hero of justice, don't you?" she continued.
~PUNCH, PUNCH~
"And yet… I can see in your expression that you never cared to begin with!" she pointed her bow at him, "Now all I need is for you to get hit once, then it's game over!"
~PUNCH~
Stark punched the final [Servant of Sierra], making it vanish into thin air as it could finally rest, then he looked up at Sierra, a vortex of aura in his eyes.
"Stop talking so much, my god," he groaned as he kept walking toward the archer.
'Clone Frenzy,' he summoned his clone beside it, and it began to walk beside its owner, the same expression on its face.
"DOUBLE ASSAULT," his clone suddenly activated the legendary skill, and dashed toward Sierra, with zero intention to let her rest.
"I ALREADY KNOW OF YOUR TRICKS NOW!" Sierra shouted as she created three arrows and pulled the string of her bow while all three were in hand.
"Invincible Dodge," the clone calmly avoided the first three, but was forced to use his skill on the third as it was much faster.
[Archer's Focus] adapts to the opponent over time, and so that meant that Sierra at some point would be able to predict even the overly fast Stark.
That is… if he gave her that time.
Since when created five arrows this time, ready to point her at the clone.
"HEAVEN'S WRATH," the clone didn't let it get away with that.
And so right as it was cornered by the arrows, trying its hardest to escape, it was still hit by one of them, transforming its figure into one of those horrifying servants.
'Come back…' Stark didn't want to let his clone suffer so he called it back instantly.
"You won't be able to do that anymore, no more clones, no more stat boosts," Sierra laughed.
But she had failed to notice one simple thing: the small crimson light in the ceiling that was growing more and more.
[Heaven's Wrath] had successfully activated, and Sierra's arrogance didn't allow her to notice it as she thought that the clone was just trying to survive.
Five seconds later… she sensed the aura and looked up.
But it was already too late at this point.
~FWISHHH~ the beam had charged up, and… ~BOOM~
As if descending from the heavens to purge the monster, the giant crimson beam of aura fell perfectly on Sierra, who immediately attempted to get away from the radius of the attack.
After all, even her [Archer's Focus] skill had warned her that surviving this wouldn't be possible.
~BAM, BAM, BAM!~
She was hit three times by the attack while trying to get away.
"-29382! -24827! -25045!"
Her [Crystal Armor] was now almost completely destroyed, cracks visible on every part of it as it only had 100K HP to protect its wearer, and the moment these HPs run out, then Sierra would be defenseless again.
In the meantime, seeing that Sierra was occupied, Stark activated [Spatial Inventory] and pulled out two [Potions of Regeneration] as he had lost some HP during the battle.
But the moment he opened them both using his fingers and got ready to gulp them down…
~FWISH, FWISH~
Sierra sent two arrows, and this time they weren't even aimed at him, but the potion themselves, as the glasses exploded upon impact and all the liquid fell to the floor.
"…" Stark wasn't surprised, of course it wouldn't be easy to heal yourself during a battle.
"…" for the first time since the battle started, Sierra didn't say anything either, instead she just got up, a neutral expression on her face as well, a far cry from the constant smiles and grins she had before.
This surprised Stark, but then he sensed something terrifying.
[WARNING! WARNING! WARNING!]
It seemed like [Focus] detected it as well as dozens of panels appeared around him.
And when he looked up… he saw a small smile on Sierra's face as she lifted both of her arms up, her bow floating between them like she had just acquired it inside a chest.
"SIERRA'S FINAL STAND," her final skill had finally charged up, and so the bow between her hands began to spin at the speed of light, creating a vortex of blue aura, sending shockwaves throughout the cave.
~BIM, BIM, BIM~
He began to hear noise around him.
~BIM, BIM, BIM~
Trails of white aura escaped the bow, and placed themselves all over the cave.
~BIM, BIM, BIM~
Upon further inspection, Stark noticed that… those trails of auras were actually [Arrows of Sierra].
And every 'BIM' he heard was basically the warning that an additional was added.
This honestly wouldn't be scary under normal circumstances, but the problem was… that he heard hundreds upon hundreds of BIM's.
And just as expected, now, all over the walls of the cave, surrounding Stark and Sierra, were hundreds, if not thousands of arrows.
'Huh…?' Stark was confused, after all… this seemed impossible to dodge.
And as if she read his mind… Sierra answered, her malicious grin back.
"Because it's not possible to dodge it!" she laughed.
'…'
[This is an 'unavoidable attack']
If a single one of these arrows was able to kill him, then… wasn't he fucked with this sheer amount?
[Invincible Dodge] wouldn't help since there are too many of them, and there is no way he could avoid them all, it was completely different from the [All-Area Strike] of the Mirror Master…
And so just like that, Stark was at the mercy of the 'Crystal Archer'.
"Phew~ almost thought it would never finish powering up, but thank 'Godless Demon' I was able to do it!"
"AURA SMASH, CRIMSON SPEARS!" he tried to send his attacks at her, hoping it would eliminate her as her bow was still floating, but…
A dozen arrows pointed toward the attacks and flew to block them, meaning that Stark now had nothing to attack from long-range anymore.
Except for [Heaven's Wrath] that is, but he knew that Sierra would send all the arrows if she saw him do something suspicious.
In the end… there was no solution to this problem, he was fucked.
And it made him angry, more angry than even back at the surface, the crimson aura around his body flowing like waves and surrounding his entire figure, as some sort of shield.
'…'
"Well, GOODBYE!" Sierra laughed as she pulled her hands down, and all the arrows suddenly flew toward Stark.
[Death incoming!]
'…'
But Stark refused.

chapters.title: Chapter 122 - 122: Unwavering Determination and Defeat of Sierra
chapters.content:
"SIERRA'S LAST STAND!"
The true ultimate skill of this boss, but also the most terrifying one.
And the reason was right in front of Stark, although he still decided to use [Perception] on it.
...
[Skill: Sierra's Last Stand]
[Description:] Sierra gives up shooting arrows to charge many more, and if she successfully manages to cast this skill after a while, then hundreds upon hundreds of arrows will appear to surround the enemy, leaving them with no real escape.
[Note:] This is an unavoidable attack, so eliminate her before she does that.
...
'...' Stark didn't say anything, his anger was at an all-time high since he knew that he was pretty much fucked, and the worst part was that look on Sierra's face, one that told him she was confident that she had won now.
His entire body, including face, eyes, and even hair was now surrounded by aura, like an armor, from outside perspective, you wouldn't be able to see his features at all, instead it would just be a red aura tracing his figure, and white eyes with blue/crimson pupils burning.
Stark couldn't give up now, he couldn't lose after all of this.
He had been sent here by that damn 'Archer King' because of money and the possibility of joining one of the most prestigious academies in this world, but... Stark was confident that none of the students there would be able to complete this.
Basically, he had given him a task at least thrice as hard as a normal passing test.
Did he hope to kill him? Or maybe he really believed Stark could win?
But he had already sent 7 people previously, and they had all died, so why...
'Why...' his anger was growing as he was looking to the ground, his white eyes' aura burning even more.
"WELL, GOODBYE," Sierra decided to stop the suspense going and pulled down both her arms, which immediately sent all the [Arrows of Sierra] flying toward Stark at the same time.
[Invincible Dodge] wouldn't work, and avoiding is impossible with the sheer amount.
'WHY...' meaning that Stark was fucked.
It was game over...
...
Or was it?
'WHY, WHY, WHY, WHY...' he gritted his teeth, and all he could see was red.
[Your determination to survive is outstanding...]
A crimson panel appeared in front of him as the arrows were only a few meters away.
[But giving up isn't the solution...]
'...'
~FWISH, DASH~
"Oh~?" Sierra raised her eyebrows, "Still trying...?"
[KEEP GOING!]
Stark began to run at terrifying speed toward Sierra.
But... the Archer kept smiling.
Of course, she had no reason to be scared since...
~CRISH, BAM, BAM, BAM~
The arrows reached Stark, and at least fifty of them hit him from all directions.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
All the arrows exploded, and the white mist that infected anybody who came in contact or inhaled it spread all over Stark.
'With this, it's over...' Sierra smiled.
One arrow was enough to stop a classifier at Stark's level, but around fifty would be enough to even stop a level 300 human or a boss monster.
'...' Stark's sudden rush stopped as soon as the arrows exploded, which stunned him and made him unable to move.
~CRWIISH~
Not only his body, but also his mind, were beginning to be infected by the perk of those arrows.
'...'
"Seems like it's my win," Sierra smiled as she sat down, wanting to enjoy the show.
But... even though his body was slowly beginning to transform, his mind on the other hand... screamed for him to keep going.
It REFUSED to give up.
[Keep going, this is not the end...]
And even though that damned mist also tried to get to his head...
[Your determination has chased the infection]
The aura inside his head was enough to stop it from infecting his brain.
It was a feat most would consider legendary, but for Stark, it was a question of survival.
"Look at you, unable to move," Sierra mocked, "It's normal after all, it's impossible to move once you're hit by one of my arrows!"
Even the [Shadow Stalker Trio] from before had been unable to move once a single arrow hit its shoulder.
But if Stark stood idle... he would surely die.
Which was why, with the entire determination inside his body, and his domination armor shielding him... he ordered one thing to his body: MOVE!
[MOVE! MOVE! MOVE!]
The pain was still there even though he wasn't being infected, and Stark struggled.
But in the end... his domination would come out on top.
~STEP~
He took a step toward Sierra, his eyes and aura burning twice as hard.
That [Domination Armor] of his gave him the ability to support the mist of the arrows, and his sheer determination forced him to keep going.
~STEP~
"...?" Sierra's eyes widened, after all, there was no way...
~STEP, STEP, TAP, RUN~
Struggling steps turned into walking, then after a few instants into full on running toward Sierra.
"Huh?" she couldn't believe what she was seeing that Stark's fist was already in front of her face, 'H-How did he move?'
This was impossible, no one can do that!
No one can do that, and yet... an anomaly was right in front of her.
She couldn't dodge as Stark's fist hit her helmet in full force.
~BAMMMM~
"-49288!" the crystal armor that protected her completely shattered, and she received the remaining damage, sending her flying backward.
"Cough, cough," Sierra struggled to breath, and honestly, she didn't even have the motivation to keep going, she was supposed to win after he was hit, and yet even that wasn't enough.
She looked up, and she saw that Stark was already there.
"..." his eyes were piercing her soul, and although it wasn't visible that he was mad, the sheer aura told her that this was bad.
['Sierra' has received the DOMINATED status!]
[End her.]
"W-wait, let me tell you something, LET ME-" she tried to gain time, in hopes that the infection inside of him could stop him, she was now fearful of Stark and his aura.
But Stark wasn't dumb, and so...
~KICK, BOOOM~
"-8372!"
He kicked her down, placing his shoe on her face, but making sure not to do enough damage to kill her.
"Monster..." Sierra coughed again.
"Your first mistake wasn't doing everything that you did," he lifted his foot, focusing the entirety of his aura on it, "Your sole and only mistake was meeting me and thinking you would win."
And so... he slammed her face with his foot while she was still processing what he had said, a terrified look on her face.
"73618!"
She died, and the last expression on her face was one of a scared prey running from her predator.
[Sierra HP: 0/315000]
[You have defeated 'Sierra, The Crystal Archer'!]

chapters.title: Chapter 123 - 123: Mission Completed
chapters.content:
Stark took a deep breath and slowly removed his foot from Sierra's face, his red aura fading slightly as he began to calm down.
[Your body is now unaffected by the mist]
This was good news, as otherwise he would have already been transformed, and Sierra would be the one that emerged victorious.
He didn't understand how he had managed to keep moving after all this, but maybe it was his will power and anger that powered up his aura enough to let him keep going.
In the end, it didn't matter, as he had won.
[You have slain 'Sierra, The Crystal Archer lv80', gained 1,350,000EXP!]
'HOLY!' Stark was astonished, he had never gotten this much EXP, and even the fights against the other monsters of this rift hadn't given him this much.
And of course…
~DING, DING~
He was surrounded by the golden aura twice.
[Your level has increased to level 30, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 31, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
And of course, reaching a new milestone like this meant one thing and one thing only…
[Level 30 Reached: please pick a card].
It wasn't different from the previous times, and three green cards appeared before him.
But this did make Stark wonder something: what about the [Alchemist] class?
If he had gained a new class, aka Alchemist, then shouldn't there be skill cards for it too?
[The 'Alchemist' class is a unique one, since all their power comes from their potions, and they already have everything needed: station, ingredients, ability to see ingredients; then their way of improving mostly relies on crafting good potions and increasing their alchemist level to create more powerful ones!]
'So no skill for an alchemist?' he tilted his head.
[Wrong! There are indeed SOME skills for alchemists, although very rare, and they are all extremely powerful, so most alchemists just rely on their basic ones!]
'Fair…' But this did mean that Stark would actually have to start focusing on how to upgrade his alchemy skills and his station from now on.
Sighing and rubbing his face, Stark took a moment to collect his thoughts.
Then he closed his eyes and picked a card at random.
It was a [Domination] class card, obviously, and once he turned it around, he saw the drawing of… an arrow pointing in several directions.
'The fuck?' this was the most confusing drawing out of them all.
…
[Skill: Target Manipulation]
[Type: Epic]
[Level: 1]
[Description: By focusing your aura on an opponent, you can force them to move in the direction you choose: up, left, right, down… The push completely depends on the amount of aura you put into it]
[Note: using too much aura can deplete your stamina and tire you out, and you can only select one target at a time…]
…
It was a rather interesting skill, and Stark could see some ways to make it work, but it wasn't phenomenal either.
He would need to try it out and see how good it truly was, after all you can't just judge a skill by its description.
After doing that, Stark immediately decided to use some of the [Skill Points] he had gotten from the level ups.
[You have upgraded 'Aura Smash' to level 9!]
[You have upgraded 'Aura Smash' to level 10!]
'I'll keep the other ones in case I need them for later, or just to stack…' he thought, he only wanted to bring [Aura Smash] to level 10 to get another perk after all.
And he got it.
…
[Skill: Aura Smash lv10]
[New Perks: Three Crimson Fist + Merging]
[Description: Not only can you now summon three crimson fists instead of two to aid you in battle, but that would be too lame, so you also have the new ability to merge all three fists into one giant and powerful one that combines the power of all three, creating an explosion that will damage all enemies hit by the attack or are near it.]
…
'Huh…' the first perk was something he totally expected, but the second one was a nice bonus, 'Wonder when i'll get a cooldown decrease though.'
30 seconds between each use didn't seem much, but in the middle of battle it could be decisive.
His eyes then immediately turned to Sierra's body, it didn't disappear like Judicator, maybe even the world wanted to preserve her beauty? Although by human standards, Judicator could also be considered handsome.
In the end it didn't matter, since what interested Stark wasn't her body or face, but… the three glints that could be seen on top of her: it was the call of new items to get!
And frankly, Stark expected a lot from this fight, especially after almost dying (yes, for the third time).
He reached out for the three items, and they suddenly appeared before him.
The first was a bow, the exact one Sierra had been using, the bow is made of shimmering crystal, each curve and detail crafted with precision and beauty. The string is taut and ready for use, gleaming in the light.
…
[Item:] Sierra's Crystal Bow
[Type:] Bow
[Class:] Archer
[Tier:] Legendary
[Required Level:] 60
[Quality:] Perfect
[Attributes:] +700 Stamina; +500 Speed
[Special Perks:] Ability to use the [Archer's Focus] skill, a powerful skill that allows the user to predict the movements of an opponent and also increases your precision while firing an arrow by 50%.
…
He didn't even need to be an archer to know that this item would sell for an incredible amount of rher coins, and this brought a big smile to Stark's face.
The second item was a… QUIVER!?
Stark immediately grabbed it and checked the inside, and he almost jumped in joy after seeing that it was full of [Arrows of Sierra]!
He had forgotten about the mission since he was too busy focusing on his own survival, so it was great that he received the arrows regardless.
…
[Item:] Arrow Quiver
[Type:] Bag
[Quality:] Exquisite
[Description:] Contains exactly 100 [Arrows of Sierra].
…
And so that left him with one item as it was the only one still on the floor, its glint inviting Stark to pick it up.
Once he crouched to take it in hand, he noticed something strange: it was a paper.
No… it was a scroll!
And not a skill scroll, but a potion one, meaning that it was for the [Alchemist] class!
…
[Potion Scroll:] Crystal Stun Potion
[Perk:] Will know once learned!
[Ingredients:] Will know once learned!
…
[Do you want to learn this potion?]
[Y/N?]
'My first potion other than the basic ones,' Stark smiled, he was happy.
And so without hesitation he clicked on Y.
With that, his level as an alchemist was slightly better.

chapters.title: Chapter 124 - 124: The Crystal Stun Potion
chapters.content:
[Do you want to learn how to craft this potion?]
[Y/N?]
'Yes…'
And as soon as he confirmed his choice… another panel appeared before him.
[You have learned how to craft the 'Crystal Stun Potion'!]
Suddenly, the knowledge of how to craft the potion entered his head, which slightly hurt as it was the first time he experienced it, but after a few seconds the pain went away, replaced by knowledge, it was weird that you couldn't craft the potions even while knowing the ingredients if you didn't have the knowledge, but he guessed that it was to not make the [Alchemist] class too overpowered.
And immediately afterward… another panel appeared.
[Potions are the sole power of an alchemist, you cannot rely on skill or stats, so your sole objective is to upgrade your level and acquire powerful potions!]
'Fair…'
…
[Crystal Stun Potion]
[Type:] Epic
[Required Level to Craft:] 25
[Perk:] Throwable potion, if you manage to hit your opponent with it, the liquid will temporarily stun them!
[Ingredients:] 1x Crystal Shard, 1x Sparkling Water
…
'Huh… wait a minute…'
The problem with being an alchemist though wasn't only about getting potions and leveling up, but also about finding the ingredients needed for those potions.
[Sparkling Water] in itself was extremely common, but [Crystal Shard] would be difficult to find or fairly expensive.
And yet… Stark was smiling.
The reason: wasn't he in a rift full of those very same shards?
"ALCHEMIST!" he activated his skill as one of the basic perks was the ability to spot ingredients that could be useful for potions.
And just as expected… all around it were now hundreds upon hundreds of small points.
Text was written above each of them: [Crystal Shard].
Basically… Stark had found himself a massive supply of one of his needed ingredients for his most powerful potion yet.
Of course, he didn't know the powers of this 'stun potion', but wouldn't that be enough to guarantee him a hit on an enemy?
Plus, under normal circumstances, most alchemists would struggle or be forced to buy a [Storage Watch] to store all these ingredients in the limited space they had.
Yet… Stark had [Spatial Inventory], meaning that as soon as he read the text stating that the crystal shards were there, he immediately ran up to one, grabbed it, and put it inside his void.
The exit portal had already opened on top of the platform with Sierra's throne, but he wasn't interested in that for now.
[Crystal Shard acquired!]
In addition to that, the [Alchemist] skill would inform him every time he got an ingredient.
Meaning that each time he picked up a [Crystal Shard], he would hear a DING followed by a panel.
This kept going for two hours as once Stark grabbed all the shards inside the cave, he immediately moved to the tunnel as it was also filled with them.
And by the end of his ingredient search…
[x1673 Crystal Shards]
It took him a while, but now, he was confident that he had enough shards to give him as many potions as he wanted for a lifetime.
And who knows, maybe they will be useful for some stronger potions later!
He hadn't really thought about it, but the idea of finding new potions and recipes was exciting, plus they would aid him in battle, so merging both the [Domination] and [Alchemist] class could reveal itself to be much more interesting than he thought.
'Also…' he grinned, 'I have the 'Memories Museum' to try everything I want!'
After doing everything that he needed to do, including grabbing all equipments and checking out all his panels, Stark finally decided to leave.
And so he jumped inside the ocean-colored portal that appeared in front of the throne.
~FWISH, FIOUU~
'Never going to get used to this sensation…' he sighed as he had the same feeling of being transported through dimensions.
And after only twenty seconds, he emerged on the other side, feeling the rays of the sun on his face.
'Phew… I haven't been inside the rift for long so it's good that it's still day…' Stark sighed.
The [Electronic Watch] he had gotten that guided him here was still broken, so it was useless, but it also meant that Stark was forced to go back to civilization by himself.
It mustn't have been more than six hours since he entered the rift, meaning that he could finish his mission quickly and thus prove that he had the strength to access that 'Rift Conqueror Academy'.
"Spatial Inventory!" instinctively, he opened up his inventory void and grabbed his phone from it, he kept it in there since it would probably break if he kept it in his pocket during battle.
And once he turned on the screen…
His eyes widened, and his face became pale.
'…' he looked at his phone screen for a good minute.
And a panel even came to confirm what he feared.
[You have been inside 'Sierra's Death Path' for 2 weeks 5 days]
This didn't make sense, but even the date on his phone confirmed that fact.
['One-Classifier Run' rifts work differently than others, because as you are alone, time inside of it can move differently than inside of the real world!]
'Basically… time moves much slower when inside of the rift,' Stark grabbed his forehead and began to laugh, 'And that bastard didn't tell me…'
But Stark shook his head.
'No, there is a chance he didn't know.'
Since most classifiers that entered the rift usually died 5–10 minutes after entering it, it would be around a few hours in the real world, meaning that he possibly believed that they had gone far but still died…
'That's a good logic,' Stark nodded, 'BUT I DON'T CARE!'
After all he was still responsible for sending him to this shithole, he had indeed completed his mission though, so he better get back before they all believe he died.
If this didn't already happen, that is.
'The fact he didn't give me a watch or a way to get back to Fellarburg means that he had low expectations for me to survive…' Stark was assembling the pieces of the puzzle, and he was frankly beginning to hate that Moonless family more and more.
In the end, he decided to just get back using his legs.
He still had some food and water saved inside of his [Spatial Inventory], so now he just needed to get back to Fellarburg.
The next VIP express train won't arrive until at least a day, since it had already passed, so there was no point in sitting around and waiting here.
'DOMINATION!' he activated his skill, focusing the entirety of his aura around his legs, then began to run in the opposite direction which he came from.
He didn't have any panel or arrow to aid him this time, but he just followed his instinct.
'Just you wait…' he groaned as he began to run extremely fast, around half the speed of the actual train.
The more determination and anger Stark had inside of him, the more powerful his aura would become, and so that meant that his speed right now was enough to possibly get back to Fellarburg in 10 hours.
Until then, he just had to keep running…

chapters.title: Chapter 125 - 125: Back to Fellarburg and ClassiTop Meeting
chapters.content:
(10 hours later)
"Ahh~ Ah~~" Needless to say that even Stark with his class and high stamina was exhausted after running this marathon, of course he had taken a break or two to replenish his stamina and to drink water, but it was still tiresome.
In the end, though, he could see Fellarburg in the distance, its modern buildings and size so big they could be recognized from anywhere close.
It was strange to think that around this safe country was a landscape of blood lusted monsters.
During his marathon to get back here, he obviously had to face them as he was in a semi-dangerous area, meaning that enemies still spawned.
And so, just during that time, his level went up once, meaning that he had reached level 32; although he tried hard not to fight to save his stamina, only eliminating the ones that were in his way.
Surprisingly enough, there was no big wall surrounding the country at all, instead it was left in the open, with no guards to check if monsters were attacking.
But of course, people weren't this reckless, instead the reason that this giant country (and honestly most others) was in the open was because… a giant dome-like barrier was set up around the entirety of Fellarburg, protecting it from all monsters as this barrier was created from many 'Magic Crystals', enough to withstand thousands of attacks.
Of course though… if the barrier went out for even a few minutes… the amount of monsters who would attempt to attack would be disastrous, but luckily there has been no such kind of incidents before.
~PHEW, FWISH~
Once he got closer, Stark was able to spot the blue barrier, and he carefully approached it, passing through like it was nothing.
[Humans are allowed, monsters aren't], this was how this barrier was set.
And so that meant that he was finally back in Fellarburg after his mission.
"Mom, look, that man in the damaged clothes came back from the evil world!" a child spoke, the evil world seemed to refer to the outside.
"Shh~ let's just go!" the mother began to walk faster.
It seemed that going outside was some sort of taboo around here, maybe since people were scared from the monsters and were only used to classifiers fighting inside of rifts, so someone coming from the dangerous outside world seemed weird and reckless.
In the end it didn't matter much as Stark continued to walk.
He wanted to go back to his hotel, but then he remembered that he was kicked out for damaging the wall, although that wasn't him, meaning he would need to find a new place to stay in.
'Is it time to buy an apartment…?' he pondered, but for now he would just need to find another hotel close to his previous one.
But while Stark was thinking about all of that… the air suddenly became heavier out of nowhere.
'???'
Stark didn't stop, he looked down and kept going, he had a bad feeling, and for some strange reason it felt as if his blood was boiling.
He didn't know why he was getting angry, there was no reason for that, after all he had completed his mission and was now back, meaning that he could get the 30 million rher coins, as well as access to the 'Rift Conquerors' academy.
But suddenly… as if to validate his feelings… a panel appeared.
[Hey, what about our revenge?]
'Huh?' Stark stopped in his tracks, his face full of confusion, why was there a panel before him, it had never happened before except for when his clone spoke to him inside of the memories museum, so why…?
Rher cannot talk to him through panels, he stopped doing that after Stark assimilated his class, and his [Status Window] wasn't sentient, otherwise he would know it.
The sole option was… his aura, or maybe the doppelgänger?
'Revenge?'
[Those 'Moonless' fools sent us to our death, we cannot allow them to get away with that!]
'I mean… I'll have to get to them somehow to give them the arrows and complete the mission, so why-' he tried to argue.
But…
[WRONG! THEY DO NOT BELIEVE YOU WILL COME BACK!]
[LOOK!]
And suddenly, below the text appeared a single image, it was the image of a purple poster card with the words 'ClassiTop Meeting 2024' written in white.
[Do you think these people care about us? Do you think they even remember US?]
And suddenly… a pair of crimson eyes appeared inside of another panel, much like the ones he had seen inside of the [ApostleDex], they were staring at Stark, an intense gaze that could mark his soul.
These eyes were oddly familiar though, almost as if… they were his?
[They are out here organizing private events, leaving us to die!]
And so before Stark could say or do anything…
[You know the location, do what you want with that information.]
Then no more panels appeared, it had said what it needed to, then disappeared just as quick as it appeared, it was a weird feeling.
The only thing it left in view was the image of the poster card.
Not wasting time, Stark zoomed it on that poster card to read everything.
…
[Fellarburg ClassiTop Meeting 2024]
[To the 100 TOP classifiers of Fellarburg, you are hereby invited to the 2024 edition of this special event since the 'academies entrances' begin in a month!]
[Want to show off your skills, levels, or children, then it is the perfect opportunity!]
[Come join, thus we can prove to Fellarburg… no… to the WHOLE world that we are the strongest!]
[Address and Time: 'Campbell Institute' at 2PM!]
…
Stark was confused, he had never heard of such a thing, but it was only two days from now.
And why… WHY did he feel so angry all of a sudden.
Upon turning around one of the streets, he met a giant screen, but this time it didn't display a fight with a classifier or an ad, it was…
"Did you hear about the ClassiTop meeting happening in two days, John?"
"Oh yeah, Maria, it is indeed surprising, but also exciting, knowing that our protectors and most powerful classifiers can meet and discuss together!"
"I do wish we knew what their discussions were about, but all information about this event is left private…"
"That's fine, i'm sure what they do is incredible!"
Some news reporters were speaking, all excited about the very same event that mysterious panel informed Stark about.
The only thing he knew… was that the 'Archer King' would surely participate.
Arthur, the Archer King, had moved on so quick, already planning his next moves as a classifier after believing that Stark was dead.
It was almost funny.
'Campbell Institute…' he mumbled as he began to laugh, 'They want to host a private event for top classifiers? I hope they don't mind me joining it then =)'
He had no information about that thing yet, but he would surely come in with a bang, and make sure they remember him well.
[2 days left before event]
The entirety of Fellarburg was excited about this supposed event, so it must be somewhat important.
'Need to find a way,' he continued to smile as he resumed walking.
Stark was a stubborn person, and he hated when people played him, maybe they didn't know that time moved slower inside of the rift, but not even waiting a month for him was insanity.
Frankly… he didn't like any of them, except for Lana maybe, so for now… he would just need to wait.

chapters.title: Chapter 126 - 126: Training before Incident
chapters.content:
"Holy shit!"
"What's wrong with this guy?"
Stark hadn't realized it, but although he was smiling, his anger made it so that just like inside of the rift against Sierra, his aura surrounded his body like some kind of armor, and his eyes replaced by pure white aura, a trail of power coming out of them, warning anybody close that he was a dangerous person.
He could see normally, but to all those around, all they saw was a human with an overwhelming crimson aura on his figure.
Thus, everyone avoided him, and when they did talk and point at him, he would just stare back, and they would immediately shiver and go away as they didn't want to deal with him.
He was only level 31, but his aura made it seem as though he was over level 200, maybe because [Domination] was just too powerful of a class?
It didn't take long for him to calm down and reach a hotel near the 'Classifier Trading District' though, calming down and ordering a room for the next few weeks, he had the money for that after all.
Soon enough, he reached his room, and collapsed onto the bed, exhausted from the day's events.
It had only been 24 hours for him, but around 3 weeks in the real world, so the reality of this situation took some time to hit him.
While looking at the ceiling of his room though, he opened the panel with the purple poster card.
"Fellarburg ClassiTop Meeting…" he mumbled the words of this event.
He knew the name, date, hour, and location, plus the Archer King would be there, so why not just go? What did he have to lose?
Of course, entering a private property with the 100 most powerful classifiers in Fellarbug alongside their young lings would seem dumb, but for some strange reason… Stark felt that everything would be fine.
'Can't really stay idle and do nothing though…'
After all, he still had two days to prepare for whatever was coming, and he had little to no information.
And so what was the best solution he thought of?
WELL! Of course it was to head inside the 'Memories Museum' and train with new skills/potions, what else could it be?
The first thing he did was open up the fridge inside of his hotel room's kitchen and grab the 10 sparkling water bottles that were there, they were given to him for free by the reception, and it was amazing timing.
"Potion Crafting!"
[Do you want to summon your brewing station?]
[Brewing station level: 1]
[Y/N]
He clicked on 'yes', and the wooden table he had seen before appeared in front of him out of nowhere.
Then he pulled out 10 [Crystal Shards] and put them on the table alongside the [Sparkling Water].
…
[Crystal Stun Potion]
[Perk:] Throwable potion, if you manage to hit your opponent with it, the liquid will temporarily stun them!
[Ingredients:] 1x Crystal Shard, 1x Sparkling Water
…
And immediately as he opened this potion's panel.
[Crystal Shard 10/1; Sparkling Water 10/1]
[Do you want to craft 10 'Crystal Stun Potions'?]
'Yes…' Stark nodded to himself as he confirmed the crafting of the Crystal Stun Potions.
The wooden table before him began to emit a soft glow as the Crystal Shards and Sparkling Water combined, transforming into the shimmering white potions one by one.
And after a few minutes… ten glasses appeared in front of him.
[ x10 'Crystal Stun Potions' have been crafted]
Not wasting time, he put everything inside his [Spatial Inventory] and summoned the 'Memories Museum' door, which appeared before him with a soft shimmer.
'Alright… just two days…' he sighed, 'Need to get familiar with those potions and the new skill…'
And so as he stepped through the threshold and entered the memories museum, he noticed that another display had appeared, and it was obviously Sierra's.
'Let's do this,' he gently slapped both his cheeks and began to select multiple bosses to fight at once.
[2 days before incident]
***
(2 days later)
'Phew~' Stark emerged from the black door of the 'Memories Museum', a big smile on his face.
He had played with the [Crystal Stun Potions], even going outside to a market and buying 100 sparkling water bottles, and he also experimented with [Target Manipulation].
And Stark couldn't lie… both of these were extremely good.
[Target Manipulation] was what surprised him the most though, as although it looked like a skill used only to move a target in one direction, if he manages to do some things right, then it could end a battle really quickly.
But this wasn't all the news for now.
Since around a day ago, when he attempted to craft yet another potion…
THIS panel appeared:
[You have proven your basic skills as an 'Alchemist']
[You can now upgrade your 'brewing station' to level 2!]
[Y/N]
'Level 2…' Stark muttered to himself as he read the panel before him in the Memories Museum.
He obviously clicked on Y and…
[Good job, Alchemist! Your brewing station is now level 2, you can now craft 2 potions at once!]
The appearance of the 'Brewing Station' didn't change much except for the fact the table, cauldron, and brewing stand looked less damaged than before.
But that new perk to craft 2 potions at once massively reduced his crafting time as he would have usually been able to craft only one potion at a time, taking up precious time.
'This is good…'
And to add to that…
[You have upgraded 'Alchemist' to level 3!]
[You have upgraded 'Potion Crafting' to level 3!]
He used up his skill points to give these skills a boost in level as they had been stuck at level 1 for a while.
But now… today was the day the 'ClassiTop Meeting' was happening.
He put on his normal clothing, as well as his [Crimson Moon Bunny Mask].
The reason wasn't to hide his identity, but to guarantee him safety, after all not even those all powerful classifiers would attempt to defeat someone with as much potential as him.
This was his logic, and it was well… interesting, but also flawed, since if someone just wanted to get rid of him, then they could do it.
Anyway, it was better than showing his face and being targeted later.
He checked the time, it was 13:45, and it would take him around 30 minutes to arrive to his location as the 'Campbell Institute' was a giant dome-like building where only the elite are allowed, so it was situated in the middle of the city with many guards surrounding it.
'Got this… and that…' he checked everything before smiling and leaving his hotel room.
He hailed for a taxi and ordered the driver to bring him close to the location of the institute.
While looking outside the windows, he saw many screens displaying the faces of the classifiers that would participate in this 'elite' meeting, as well as many videos showcasing their abilities.
Stark grinned, looking at his aura-filled hands, then peering inside of his [Spatial Inventory], looking at the objects floating inside of the space.
He would surely fight against many people, but it was fine, he was confident that he wouldn't die after all, so as long as he managed to do 'THAT', then surely… it would be fine.
[30 minutes before incident!]

chapters.title: Chapter 127 - 127: Getting Rid of the Guards
chapters.content:
The 'ClassiTop Meeting Event' is something organized by almost every country in this world, and it is an event where the most powerful and popular classifiers of that very same country gather in a huge meeting/gathering to discuss with one another about their whereabouts.
Some use this opportunity to flex on their peers, others to get new connections, some for help with specific rifts or problems, and a few others just to put their children together as they believe that the 'elite' can only be with the 'elite'.
All information about this event is completely confidential, and the only thing the outside world knows is that the top 100 classifiers of their country are gathering to discuss on how to protect the world better.
Of course, this was a massive lie, but it was also incredible publicity for them all.
So now, all over Fellarburg, all those that were invited had received an invitation to that event, and they sure as hell wouldn't miss it, some of them even bringing their children with them.
Stark stepped out of the taxi, his eyes scanning the surroundings of the Campbell Institute.
The prestigious building loomed before him, its towering structure exuding an air of power and secrecy.
It was mostly dark with a dome-like structure, it was standing out from the other surrounding buildings, and there was a park around it, one where people could roam freely.
Stark's eyes burned with determination as he entered the park and began to head toward the entrance.
'Yawn~' he was already mentally and physically ready to get inside, after all it had been around thirty minutes since the event started.
At the entrance stood two guards, the two talking with one another.
They were the only protection this place had as why would they bother having more guards when some of the most powerful people in the country were there?
But this didn't mean they were weak.
[Guard A, level 129]
[Guard B, level 131]
He didn't even feel the need to check their names or skills to be honest since he didn't have a single intention to face them fairly.
'Spatial Inventory,' he mumbled before taking out three [Crystal Stun Potions] from it.
But that wasn't all…
'Clone Frenzy,' Stark went to sit on a nearby bench, then summoned his clone.
His aura began to pulse as it created a perfect replica of himself, much like it did every time.
The clone looked back at Stark, a wide smile on its face, it seemed to enjoy what they were doing.
'Focus…'
Stark closed his eyes, then focused the aura around his body before sending it to his eyes.
He had already done it once before, but it was still a weird feeling overall as it wasn't a perk he used often.
He sent that same aura from his eyes to the clone's, and then… once he opened them back, he found himself in the clone's position, able to control it.
The only other time he had done that (and when he unlocked that ability basically) was when those 'Domination Association' people were trying to ambush him inside his hotel room, but it was a fairly useful skill in other situations as well.
But before doing any of that, he looked behind toward the bench to check out his real body and…
'Holy…' if someone passed by they would surely believe he was dead, there was no light in his eyes and no life force at all around him, 'Let's be quick then…'
~STEP, STEP, STEP~
The clone took the three [Crystal Stun Potions] from the real Stark's hands and began to walk toward the entrance of the giant dome-like structure with the two guards at the entrance.
Of course, as said before, Stark had absolutely no plan to fight them head on as he would probably lose, but it didn't mean he couldn't use cheap tricks.
Too busy talking and laughing with one another, they didn't notice the other Stark approaching before he was extremely close.
'Pretty reckless for guards…' he thought.
But the moment he entered a 10 meters radius from them… they suddenly turned their eyes at him, ones that were filled with caution and aura.
They weren't as weak as Stark thought, and looked like they had the power to stop him if it came to it.
"Hello?" the fake Stark spoke.
"Get out of here kid, this is private property!" both of them suddenly pulled out their weapons, which were two swords, so Stark guessed they were from the [Warrior] class.
Nonetheless he kept walking toward them, trying to seem as friendly as possible, only stopping a few meters away from them.
"HEY, WE SAID DON'T APPROACH!" they took a step toward him and activated their auras, seemingly ready to slash if he came any closer.
"Hey, what is this place," but he just pointed at the giant black dome behind them.
But seems like they weren't having any of it as they both approached Stark, their bodies only a meter away from his now.
"We're seriously gonna kick your ass, get out of here!"
"You didn't answer my question," but Stark, who was still wearing the bunny-mask, smiled, "I just want to know then I'll leave."
The two guards (which Stark didn't even bother to check the names of) looked at one another for a few seconds before slightly turning toward the dome and pointing at it with their thumb from behind.
"It's a secret, kiddo, so don't bother us-" but turning their backs to Stark, even if it was only slightly for a single second, was their mistake.
~THROW~
He aimed at the floor in the middle of the radius between him and the guards, and threw all three [Crystal Stun Potions].
…
[Guard A stunned!]
[Guard B stunned!]
[YOU are stunned!]
…
Of course, it meant that the clone would also receive the effects of the potion since it wasn't immune to it, but it was fine since it was all part of Stark's plan.
"THE FUCK?!"
"THAT FUCKER!"
The two guards were cursing, able to move their mouths but their bodies standing idle.
And then…
"Come back to me…" Stark deactivated the clone's perk, transferring back his vision to himself, and able to move his original body again.
But the first thing he did at the very moment was…
"AURA SMASH… MERGE!" he used the new perk of [Aura Smash] and merged all three crimson fists into a single one, which radiated an intense aura, powerful enough to overwhelm even these classic warriors standing right in front of him.
Even Stark had a hard time controlling this power yet though as he was forced to hold his right hand's wrist with his left one to be able to focus on the attack, otherwise it would explode in his face (yes, it happened inside the memories museum).
The aura around his right hand grew more and more though, and after less than three seconds…
~FWISH, BOOM~
He managed to launch the giant crimson fist at intense speed toward the guards.
'Come back to me…' he repeated, but this time it was to make his clone's figure seep back into his body as he had left it in front of the guards.
And the moment the clone disappeared… the guards were finally able to see the giant fist, as big as them in terms of height, rushing in their direction.
"Ah shit…" they both said, accepting their fate.
~BOOOOOM~
The fist exploded between the two guards, and they were each sent far away in opposite directions.
"-73523! -78472!" the fist's strength was incredible, although both the guards were wearing highly protective armor and had a large pool of HP.
[Guard A is knocked out]
[Guard B is knocked out]
This didn't kill them as they had equipment and armor to withstand the attack, but they still received it in the face, meaning they couldn't stay conscious after that.
It was fine for Stark though as he began to walk toward the entrance door and opened it.
'First part of the plan completed…'

chapters.title: Chapter 128 - 128: Entering the Dome
chapters.content:
Of course, creating such a commotion in a public park would obviously attract the eyes of many people; and so all those that were present nearby stopped to look at whatever was happening.
Many were terrified to see a giant fist attack two people, but unable to do anything as they just used their phones to film the event.
Stark was wearing the bunny mask, so people couldn't recognize him as he entered the dome and closed the door behind.
And so just like that, people began to speculate more and more on the fact this was possibly the real 'bunny-masked man', and what he was doing here.
These simple videos from the people who witnessed what Stark had done would result in the popularity of the 'bunny-masked man' to grow even more than it already was.
…
'Hm…' after Stark closed the door, he turned around and found himself… in a completely black space?
I mean, literally, it was completely dark, with no way to identify the walls, floor or even ceiling, he couldn't see anything, and so navigating inside of this building seemed somewhat impossible.
Maybe this was made on purpose to stop any intruders.
But…
[Welcome, participant, to the Fellarburg ClassiTop Meeting of 2024!]
Suddenly, as soon as he took a step forward, making sure not to hit a wall, a blue panel appeared before him.
[Please follow the arrows to reach the 'Meeting Place'!]
And suddenly, white arrows began to flicker on the ground, leading him through the darkness.
It felt weird, why would they have such an elaborate setting for such an event, couldn't they just make a normal building and ask people to head toward a specific room?
'No… this feels weird…' Stark shook his head.
He still decided to follow the arrows as they were his only way to navigate this place without hitting a dozen walls.
And as he walked deeper into the darkness… he found himself in front of a circular elevator.
[Please select the lowest floor, and enjoy your stay!]
The elevator was illuminated, meaning that he could see it from afar, entering it without much issues.
'No ambush…' he mumbled, otherwise [Focus] would have warned him.
And so he did as he was told and clicked on the lowest floor, which was named 'Omega'.
~VROOUUUU~
The giant circular elevator closed and began to descend.
But te closer Stark got to these people and their meeting place, the more some sort of feeling inside of his heart grew.
Was he scared?
No, he wasn't.
Then was it stress? Anxiousness? Doubt?
'No… none of those either,' he smiled.
Frankly, he didn't know why he was doing any of this, he could just go out to the 'Moonless' mansion and meet the 'Archer King' there.
It was needless risks that he was taking.
Maybe it was his pride…?
[You are reaching your destination in 30 seconds!]
Another blue panel appeared while Stark was thinking.
But it was once Stark looked down and thought really deeply about why he was doing this, his eyes yet again transforming into a vortex of aura, that he figured it out…
[THEY ARE MAKING FUN OF US!]
[DO YOU THINK THEY CARE?!]
[They probably LAUGHED about our death!]
These were such panels that appeared in his dreams, and they were what pushed him to do that.
'Alright… I get it now…' his face turned cold as the elevator suddenly stopped, and the sound of machinery ended.
[You have arrived!]
The elevator doors slid open, revealing a massive wooden door adorned with intricate carvings. It exuded luxury, complete with two golden ring handles for anyone who wanted to enter.
'…'
Even from his stand point, Stark could feel the immense amount of aura coming out from behind this door, there were waves of all sorts of colors escaping from the gaps or the sides.
~STEP~
The tension was at all-time high for him, but strangely, Stark kept a pretty calm and cold face, the ground beneath his feet leaving a crimson mark.
After evry step of his, an image or video of his previous battles appeared all over his surroundings in dozens upon dozens of panels.
Was it his own body's way to dissuade him of doing what he was about to do?
It didn't matter.
Because even with all these images… another panel would appear on top of them to keep him going, it was his determination responding.
[Keep going] were the words that replaced these panels.
The battle against Malakar?
[Keep going]
The fight against Judicator?
[Keep going!]
His last encounter with Sierra?
[KEEP GOING!]
All these things were replaced, and so Stark smiled as he reached the door.
Meeting up with the 100 most powerful people in this country and making them know of your presence would make anyone happy under normal circumstances, but in this very context, it was overwhelming.
Whatever would happen beyond this door, it would surely change Stark's life, maybe for the better? Maabe for the worse?
'It doesn't matter…'
He placed both of his hands on the ring handles, then got ready to pressure into it.
But as he tried to do that…
[Stop.]
A crimson panel appeared before him and interupted him again.
~FWISH, VIOUUU~
He heard sounds behind him, and as he turned… he saw himself.
Well… not really himself, but a replica of himself created from aura.
[Are you really ready?]
It asked, looks like it couldn't speak either, so it used panels.
Not removing his hands from the handles, Stark looked back and spoke, "Were you the one who informed of this event?"
[…], the other Stark nodded.
"Then I can guess you aren't here to stop me, right?" Stark finally removed his hands from the rings and faced the other him.
[…], this time, it nodded its head and smiled, [No, I am quite happy about what we're about to do.]
"Then why stop?"
[I just wanted to say… well… that you should be more confident…]
"…" Stark looked at his hands, traces of aura still visible on them.
[Confidence is key, do not go in there thinking that it will be easy, you are me, and I am you, so just…], the other Stark momentarilly stopped before pointing at the door and smiling, [Prove to the world that we shouldn't be messed with…]
And just like that, it vanished, no… it didn't vanish, instead it went back into Stark.
The moment it did, he felt a surge of energy, and his aura became much stronger than before.
'…'
Stark then turned back toward the door.
He could hear the sounds of laughter, talking, and even some music, coming out from there.
[They are LAUGHING about our death!]
He remembered that panel, and closed his eyes while smirking, and once he opened them back up, they were shining with an aura so powerful it almost seemed like it was burning his pupils.
And so instead of opening the door the easy way like he wanted to do before…
~FWISH… BAM~
He focused his aura into his legs and absolutely smashed the door, destroying it in the process and revealing the interior of that meeting room to him.
Immediately… all eyes fell on Stark, and the music stopped.

chapters.title: Chapter 129 - 129: 30 Minutes Before Intrusion
chapters.content:
(30 minutes ago, meeting room)
All the classifiers that had been invited to this once-in-a-year event had arrived, of course, there was no way any of them would miss out such an opportunity to meet up with their other strong peers as most were always busy with work/rifts.
'…'
'…'
'…'
Some brought their children along with them to show off, and the 'Archer King' was no different since he also brought both his children, Aoki and Lana, with him.
And counting everyone present… there were roughly 182 people in the room.
Once all of them left the elevator and opened the wooden door, they found themselves in a giant black room, no different from the other textures they had seen inside this building yet.
In the middle of that giant room was a round table big enough to host everyone.
And after only five minutes, all the participants sat on their own chair, each person had one designated for them as there was a name plate behind, their children/loved ones also positioned right beside them.
The lighting was really dim - so dark in fact that you couldn't see the face of a person three meters away from you, meaning that in this dark space, all they could do to see others was to check out their auras, each of their eyes burning with anticipation.
Among them were adults, obviously, but also children, teenagers, and even elderly people, after all age didn't matter with such a meeting as it was the top 100 classifiers that were invited.
And so after only another five minutes of silence, five minutes where all of them stared at one another, five minutes where nobody could say or do anything as they had been ordered not to…
"HE" appeared.
~FWISH, FIOUUUU~
His entry was spectacular, appearing out of thin air in the middle of the giant table in a flash of blue light all the while riding a giant blue dragon.
The man slid down the tail of the dragon, and with a simple snap of his finger, the creature vanished in a trail of smoke.
'…'
'…'
'…'
Most people would be speechless at such a scene happening, but all those present were already used to this.
And the person that suddenly appeared in the middle of the table was… the strongest classifier in Fellarburg.
Even among the crowd, their levels were majorly different, some were level 200, others 500, and some even level 900, but that man on the other hand… was rumored to be over level 1000.
His hair was a shade of gold that could rival the sun, styled in a short ponytail, and his emerald eyes held a piercing gaze that seemed to see through everything.
His name was… Drakon Greyrat, and he was in his late 50s.
"Hello, everybody!" he warmly smiled, as although he was the strongest, he wasn't as evil and cunning as many of the others.
'…' nobody answered.
"No answer huh, haha~" he scratched his cheek, "Well, that's fine, i'm sure you all want me to start the event already as this is only the starting phase…"
'…'
"I see that our Fellarburg top has grown stronger since last year, this is good," he nodded…
He was the one that organized such an event in the first place, and was also one of the most respected people in the entirety of the country, his influence even able to affect other countries as well.
Being strong was everything in this world after all.
"Well, if everyone is present, and there is nothing to say… then no reason not to start the event and make sure all of you can talk with one another!" he clapped both his hands and suddenly…
~VIOUUU~
The giant table began to descend slowly into the ground, and all the participants were forced to exit their chairs as they began to disappear as well.
This was a short introduction, but there was no need to keep it going for long as most of them only wanted what happened next.
And what happened next was… the FREE-TIME…
~BIM, BIM, BIM~
Suddenly, all the lights around them turned on, finally allowing them to see their surroundings, and it was… special.
They were in a giant party room, with many tables filled with foods and beverages, all of it was luxurious, and it was big enough to hold at least two thousand people, meaning they had more than enough space to talk.
"Have fun!" Drakon lifted both his arms in each side and vividly smiled before disappearing.
He didn't participate in such events after all, he only hosted them and explained to people the rules.
And so just like that, all 100 (182 counting the children) were finally allowed to roam around.
Instantly, they all regrouped around other people they wanted to talk to.
And so the event could finally begin.
***
"What about that rift you discovered, the one with the godless demon apostle?" a woman asked Arthur, he was surrounded by fifteen other people, and his kids were also just as popular as he was since many others tried to talk with them.
"Well… I sent 7 people and they all died after a few hours, and the last person I sent hasn't given any signs of life for 3 weeks, so I'm confident he just died…" Arthur shrugged as he smiled, not giving a single care about the lives that had been lost.
Lana hearing this felt a pinch in her heart, but no…
'Stark isn't dead,' she told herself.
"I mean, why would they even accept such a mission? Seriously trying to fight Sierra, the apostle that can transform people into monsters with a single arrow… it's a suicide mission!" a man said, holding his forehead while shaking his head.
"You never know…" Arthur span his wine glass lightly, his gaze indicating he knew that already.
The 6% chance of survival he had told Lana was a giant lie, because if he had to guess it… it would be 0.02% at best, he just didn't want his daughter to interrupt Stark from going.
Even classifiers in this very room could die after being hit by one or two of these arrows, and that is why almost no one took up this mission, at least anyone that didn't know of the true challenge that lay there…
But one thing was for sure now… he knew that he had sent Stark to his death, not expecting him to come back ever, no matter how strong you are or how talented, there was no way he could win at his current level.
Twenty minutes passed like that, and as the party was finally getting started, with people making connections and revealing their achievements…
~BAM, VIOUM~
They heard a loud noise coming from the entrance, and suddenly… the wooden door they used to come inside this room came out of its spot, destroyed by a powerful blow.
Immediately, all the classifiers stopped what they were doing and looked at the door, and even the music that had been playing until now stopped as well.
Arthur was no different, but his keen archer eyes already warned him of the possibility of who this individual could be.
But no… his aura was too powerful for a mere level 25 or 30, and he was gone for 3 weeks, it couldn't be…?
And yet…
Beyond the destroyed door appeared Stark, a wide grin on his face.
"I hope you don't mind me joining the party, Arthur?" he laughed as he entered the room like he hadn't just destroyed the door.
And suddenly… the atmosphere around them became at least a hundred times more tense and overwhelming.
Deep inside, many felt that this wasn't good.

chapters.title: Chapter 130 - 130: Meeting the Top 100 Classifiers
chapters.content:
