Arthur's expression didn't change as he saw Stark suddenly appear, intruding this private property and even destroying the door.
"Seems like you're back," he sighed as he took a step forward.
Now all the attention was on them, and the pure amount of aura coming out would be enough to make most people faint, everyone present in here was interested.
"Thought I was dead?" Stark smiled as he began to walk toward them as well.
Many people were wary of him as they already knew who he was: black-hair, bunny-mask, and that familiar aura…
All of them knew immediately knew this was the 'bunny-masked man' that had made it in the news all around the world.
'Stark!' Lana wanted to shout, but she knew that he wanted to keep his identity secret if he was wearing the mask, so she just sobbed silently, happy that he was actually alive.
"So… why are you here?" Arthur lifted his eyebrows, "It's been 3 weeks with no news from you…"
"…" Stark didn't answer.
Of course, all classifiers present here knew that Arthur had acquired the rights to conquer the 'Sierra's Death Path' rift, but hadn't been able to for two months because of the sheer difficulty of the task.
"Let me guess… took you 3 weeks to escape that nightmare rift, heh~?" Arthur smiled, seemingly amused that Stark did all of this for no reason.
"Seriously?"
"I mean… no matter how you look at it, there is no way you don't get hit by those arrows…"
"Yeah, he probably ran away, but at least he is alive?"
Stark remained silent as he heard the murmurs of the crowd, they were mere spectators, but thoroughly enjoyed the drama.
Stark took a few seconds to look at the decoration around the party room, it was lavishly decorated, with paintings and furniture all over, as well as a giant chandelier in the ceiling.
But what was most interesting was…
The giant screen panel placed in the middle of the room for everyone to see.
It didn't take long for Stark to figure out what it was.
…
[Top Classifiers of Fellarburg!]
[Top 100: Naegi, The Electric Blade]
[Top 99: Ursi, The Torch Woman]
.
.
.
[Top 8: Arthur, The Archer King]
[Top 7: Junko, The Despair Queen]
[Top 6: Ludvik, The Doom Slayer]
[Top 5: Kirigiri, The White Jade]
[Top 4: Sonic, The Lightspeed Warrior]
[Top 3: Olya and Olye, Dream Team Twins]
[Top 2: Kevin, The Potion Freak]
[Top 1: Drakon, The Dragon Tamer]
…
The giant screen would occasionally scroll down and up to showcase the names of all the people present, and obviously, the higher the rank, the stronger they were.
Arthur seemed to be the top 8 strongest person in Fellarburg, and as for the others, he had never heard of them, but they were people Stark shouldn't mess with yet.
They each had a name, of course, but next to that name was their 'classifier name', something used to identify them, much like Arthur with his 'Archer King' title.
Stark looked around, and he could see on the gazes of all these people that they were mocking him for trying such a reckless thing as defeating that rift which had a 'Godless Demon' apostle inside.
And yet…
'Spatial Inventory,' the void appeared beside Stark, and he put his hand inside without even looking, pulling out the [Arrow Quiver] that had been rewarded to him for killing Sierra.
~FWISH, CATCH~
With a simple movement, he threw the quiver toward Arthur, who caught it then immediately looked inside.
'…!' his eyes widened for the first time as he noticed that there was indeed a stack (64) of [Arrows of Sierra] inside, and immediately he lifted his gaze to see Stark smiling.
People were confused, what was that even supposed to mean?
"So you did in fact complete that rift," Arthur clapped his hands together slowly, "Didn't expect that."
"So you expected me to die?" Stark smiled harder.
"…" Arthur didn't speak for a few seconds, cornered, "It's just that it's been three weeks, so I thought that you had died," he recovered himself.
The tension in the air was now becoming palpable, and every classifier looked at one another.
THAT rift, which even some of them refused to enter, had been completed by that kid?
And that could only mean one thing…
"You didn't get hit by a single arrow?" it wasn't Arthur who spoke, but another red-haired classifier, he was buff and there seemed to be sharp spikes coming out of his arms, stomach, back, and also at the top of his head.
Everyone that knew about Sierra and her rift already had the knowledge about her arrows and their special perks, which were something even level 200 classifiers feared.
"…" Stark looked at him for only a single second before turning his gaze back to Arthur, not even bothering to answer.
He wasn't interested in the others.
But…
~CRASH, BOOM~
From the same direction the red-haired classifier spoke could be heard a giant boom, and when Stark looked at it, he noticed that another person smashed the ground.
"Teach him a lesson, son," the classifier that spoke to Stark smiled as his son's eyes began to burn with aura.
A mini-version of that classifier appeared, he was a bit smaller in size, but his muscles and hair were the exact same.
[Class: Warrior]
He didn't seem to use a weapon either, but just like his father, his entire body was surrounded by sharp spikes, although his control of them seemed to be lacking.
"Holy… are Derek and his son Karl getting involved…?"
"I heard Karl is getting into 'Rift Conqueror' too… that boy is dead no matter what he tries now…"
The entrance ceremonies for academies were only in a month, and it looked like Karl wanted to show off in front of the other classifiers, his father also wanting to show that their family was strong.
"…" Stark sighed, he knew that losers like these would appear.
But… he just needed to get rid of them.
All the attention was now on Stark and Karl, who was approaching the bunny-masked boy, the spikes in his body shaking and moving like waves, and his silver aura growing more after each step.
But Stark wasn't impressed.
'Time to show off my new skills…' he smiled as he began to breath in and out and focus.
Since the beginning, Stark knew that the top classifiers wouldn't fight with him, he wasn't an 'interesting' opponent after all, which was why they would send off their children at him.
[FIGHT!]
A crimson panel appeared before him, and only visible to him, an indicator that he needed to be ready now.

chapters.title: Chapter 131 - 131: Stark VS Karl Spikeford
chapters.content:
'Perception…' Stark finally decided to pay attention to the boy that was approaching him, his face indicating that he was ready to destroy him, but because he disrespected his father by not responding, but also to show everyone present that he was stronger than that 'bunny-masked guy'.
…
[Name: Karl Spikeford]
[Level: 124]
[Class: Warrior]
[HP: 87000]
[Strength: 3971]
[Speed: 3294]
[Stamina: 2012]
[Defense: 3825]
[Skills: Spike Eruption, Spike Armor, Quake Smash, Spike World, Brain Focus, Coverage, Attach, Spike Chains…]
…
There were much more skills, but it seems like the [Perception] skill only showed the ones that Karl used the most, or maybe they were the ones that he could potentially use during battle, he had never known how the skill selected the skills to be shown, but in all cases until now it had always worked perfectly.
But…
'Weak…' Stark tilted his head, he wasn't that impressed, and although Karl was only 16 years old, starting his academy life (meaning his true classifier start) in a month, it was still weak, too weak to attempt and stop Stark.
Karl was the type of people (and also because he was forced by his family) to grind and reach higher levels than anybody else in the small amount of time he was given, which was why he was at such a high level before entering an academy, a harsh comparison to Lana's poor level 63 as she was occupied with other things.
And yet… Stark felt like he could take him down in one hit, it was just a strange feeling, maybe his intuition got better?
"Aura Smash… MERGE!" he closed his eyes and began to focus, holding his right hand's wrist as to control his attack and not make it explode.
"Hey," Karl's deep voice rang in his ears, and the sound of his footsteps was getting closer, but Stark didn't open his eyes, after all… he could see Karl's aura even while they were shut.
"Spike Armor," Karl didn't waste time, stopping a few meters away from Stark and activating his skill, which made the sharp spikes cover his entire body, making it look very… unsettling, "Come at me, weakling!"
His father behind him laughed, his aura brimming with confidence.
Meanwhile, Stark was focused on charging up the crimson fists, it took some time and lots of control to do that as at first inside the memories museum, they would instantly explode in his fist.
After a while trying to make it work, he reached one simple conclusion: this perk was too strong, and even Stark, the host, couldn't handle it if he didn't train, which was why he spent the entire two days just trying to make it work.
And in the end he succeeded.
~VWISH, VWIISHHH, VIOOOUMMMMM~
After around ten seconds, the aura was completely covering Stark's arm, and the pressure around it as so intense everyone around could sense it.
Karl's face didn't look as confident as it was before when Stark opened his eyes back, which were also burning with determination.
"AUUURAAAA SMASHHHH!" the attack, which was much stronger than when he used it against the guards at the entrance, was sent toward the boy, the giant fist much bigger than he was heading straight at him.
His confidence was fading away by the second, and so the moment he saw the fist hurtling toward him…
'Yeahhh, no,' he took a few quick steps to the left, he wasn't dumb after all, and even though he had massive pride, he wouldn't let himself get hit by that.
But now that Karl was out of the attack's way, what could Stark possibly do?
"All this for that…?" the top 72 classifier, Marco, complained
"Powerful attack, but needs more range and speed," the top 64 classifier, Albert, adjusted his glasses while speaking.
'…' Arthur on the other hand could see it clearly: this wasn't all Stark wanted, actually, he perfectly planned that Karl would move.
"Dumbass," Karl mocked Stark and got ready to attack, the fist which would have hit him if he stayed in place only 3 meters away now.
And then…
"TARGET MANIPULATION!" he used his most recently acquired skill.
[Description: By focusing your aura on an opponent, you can force them to move in the direction you choose: up, left, right, down… The push completely depends on the amount of aura you put into it]
And so despite this sounding pretty useless in most situations… after experimenting with it for two days in the memories museum, Stark reached one simple conclusion: this skill was indeed worthless… unless you combined it with other ones.
[TARGET SET, SELECT DIRECTION!]
'GOT YOU!' his aura surpassed Karl's, so he was able to set is target on him.
And now… he pointed his right hand at him, but more precisely his index and middle finger, almost as if he was doing a gun with his hand and pointing it at Karl.
"…?"
"The fuck?"
People were confused, had he gone insane after his attack failed? Maybe he used too much aura into it?
~FWISH, BIM~
But Stark, while still pointing at Karl, turned his hand to the left with a swift movement.
[Target going left!]
'Huh…?'
Karl's figure was surrounded by a faint outline of Stark's crimson aura, and so his [Target Manipulation] activated.
As if an unknown force was pushing him, Karl was forced to go in the direction Stark pointed.
But that also meant…
"SHIT, SHIT, SHIT!!!"
That he was heading straight onto the crimson fist.
~BOOOOMM~
He was hit in full force by the merged fists.
"-83723!" the damage output was phenomenal, almost high enough to kill Stark, and that was only since his [Spike Armor] and equipment protected him.
Karl was sent flying backwards, his body crashing onto the ground with a loud thud, and the spikes of his [Spike Armor] had been shattered, scattering onto the ground like needles.
[Karl Spikeford is knocked out!]
A giant panel appeared above his body for everyone to read.
'As I said, I would only take one hit to beat him,' Stark smiled as he turned his gaze toward Arthur again.
Surprisingly enough, no one else from the 'children' group attempted to fight Stark, maybe they got scared, the risk of losing to him too great after he knocked out Karl, who was considered a prodigy, in one attack.
'Stark!' Lana smiled warmly, happy that he had won.
But Aoki and Arthur didn't seem to have the same opinion, as the former took the [Arrow Quiver] with the [Arrows of Sierra] inside and took a step forward.
"I hope you don't mind us both having a duel?" Aoki smiled.
He already had his bow ready at any moment, and now that he had the [Arrows of Sierra], he got the complete advantage, as just a few hits from them could incapacitate even the strongest of classifiers, depending on who shot them.
So there is no way anybody would accept such an unfair duel-
"Sure thing…" Stark smiled back, but he didn't forget to add a few words to anger Aoki even more, "Brother-in-law!"
"…" Aoki's smile disappeared, Stark had noticed it, but every time he got closer to Lana, her brother would always grimace and be mad, he was extremely over-protective.
And so that last sentence got him mad, mad enough to want to get rid of Stark, and he would use the very same arrows he brought here to do that.

chapters.title: Chapter 132 - 132: Stark VS Aoki Moonless
chapters.content:
"…" Stark positioned himself to fight Aoki, he wasn't scared of him if he was going to use 'those' arrows to fight him.
Aoki was extremely protective of Lana, going as far as not letting anybody get close to get her, and even threatening Daniel's family when he got too close to her.
He could be considered a good brother if that was it, but unfortunately, his obsession went beyond that, and he refused to acknowledge anybody weaker than him to be with his sister.
"Oh~" Aoki smiled, "But we aren't fighting like that other guy," he quickly glanced at Karl, his body down as he was knocked out by Stark's crimson fist.
This supposed event which was organized for the countdown of the academy entrances, and also for the top 100 classifiers to meet each other became so much more interesting all of a sudden and not a single person dared to interrupt the fights.
They all wanted to know… just how far could Stark go.
"You completed a rift, good job, anybody could have done that," Aoki rolled his eyes, "Now I'll show you that you need to know your place…!"
And suddenly… everyone saw it.
[Duel Request: Aoki Moonless]
[Type: Deathless]
[Y/N]
These three panels appeared in front of Stark, big enough for everyone to see them.
"Aoki-" Lana tried to reason with her brother, but a single glance from her father shot down her attempt.
'Frankly… I seriously hate people who do this type of duels…' choosing [Deathless] was a pussy move for Stark as it meant that even though you were ready to fight, you weren't ready to receive the consequences if you somehow lost.
Basically… Aoki wasn't as confident as he made it seem.
But… Stark was so confident he would win that he didn't want to risk angering Arthur or the others by knocking Aoki out, so he pressed "Y".
Aoki's smirk widened as the duel began, the tension thick in the air as they faced each other.
The giant dome-like arena appeared, it was around 50 meters in size, allowing the two to fight however they liked, and ejecting all of those outside to guarantee a fair fight.
[3…]
The countdown began, and Aoki immediately started to summon his bow.
[2…]
Stark could feel the weight of the onlookers' eyes, their anticipation palpable, yet his expression stayed as neutral as ever.
[1…]
~FWISH, VIOUM~
Aoki's bow appeared in his hands in a flash of sparks, it was very beautiful, and the bow looked extremely powerful, maybe even stronger than Sierra's?
[FIGHT!]
Stark couldn't forget that inside of this room were the strongest people in all of Fellarburg, and that meant that their gazes being on him right now meant that they were witnessing him in battle.
Maybe some would hate him, others would like him, and the remainder would have a neutral opinion, it didn't matter.
Because all he needed to do now… was win.
Derek Spikeford didn't even bother looking after his knocked out son either, and it wasn't that he didn't care, but observing Stark in action was much more important for now.
"TIME TO END THIS," Aoki laughed as he pulled the [Arrow Quiver] filled with [Arrows of Sierra] and took out one of the arrows, pointing at Stark.
The boy just blinked though, he didn't see any reasons to attempt anything: his victory was guaranteed since the moment Aoki started the fight with these arrows.
'Perception…' he decided to still check out his opponent's status window.
…
[Name: Aoki Moonless]
[Level: 187]
[Class: Archer]
[HP: 102500]
[Strength: 2182]
[Speed: 5973]
[Stamina: 4024]
[Defense: 3271]
[Skills: Shoot, Target Lock, Element Merge, Instant Arrow, Archer's Eyes, Sky Barrage, Hunter, Arrow Inventory, Aoki's Ultimate Arrow…]
…
Yet again, the skill showed him the overall stats of Aoki, and it was obvious he was much stronger than Karl, plus he would probably soon enough reach the top 100 of Fellarburg if he continued like that.
His stat points were also extremely high, and Stark knew that he had no chance to ever hope of winning against him under normal circumstances.
But not this time…
"SHOOT, TARGET LOCK!" Aoki grabbed three [Arrows of Sierra] and aimed at Stark's weak points, focusing all his energy into the shots.
The [Arrows of Sierra] when shot by a normal human didn't have the same effect as when the apostle did it, instead, it worked like this:
-The first time you get hit, you are stunned for a few seconds.
-The second time, you are not only stunned, but your movements are decreased as the white mist infects your legs.
-And the third time you are hit is game over as the mist infects you completely and paralyzes you, your body becoming white by the crystals.
Of course you wouldn't transform into a monster, but that pretty much guaranteed victory for the enemy as he could eliminate you easily.
Stark didn't move or show any sign of fear though.
He closed his eyes, took a deep breath, and got ready for impact.
Aoki's aura was overwhelming, and it completely surrounded the three arrows as he shot them, making them all leave a beautiful trail of aura.
In addition to that, Aoki added the [Target Lock] buff to his arrows, it was one of his most powerful skills, and also a big reason as to why he was recognized, it was a rare skill to have.
…
[Skill: Target Lock]
[Description: You can set a 'lock' on a target, and once that lock is set, any arrow will directly fly toward it, no matter what direction you shoot at.]
…
And that's exactly what he did as…
[A 'lock' has been placed on you]
Above his head appeared a crimson marksman symbol.
"Oh… he is using that…"
"All he needs is three arrows to end this fight!"
"More like one, that kid won't survive a single hit…"
But Stark just sighed, a wide smile on his face.
He wasn't scared of these arrows after all as he had already avoided and even got his by dozens of them.
And this meant that since the beginning, it was an impossible battle for Aoki as…
[You are immune to the mist]
These [Arrows Of Sierra] couldn't affect him, his body creating some sort of antivirus towards them after being hit inside of the rift.
He would have surely won if he took other arrows as a single one could kill him, but in this very situation… Stark was confident.
And so without a single care in the world… he dashed toward Aoki, which also meant taking the arrows straight on.
The overall reaction of the crowd was… IS HE CRAZY?!

chapters.title: Chapter 133 - 133: Not Affected by the Arrows
chapters.content:
The three arrows flew toward Stark with incredible speed, their beautiful trails of aura adorning the air around them.
Their tips were as sharp as swords and glowed with a malevolent energy.
Stark, however, didn't seem to be fazed at all, his eyes were locked onto his target, his expression determined and unwavering.
~FWISH~
He avoided the first arrow quite easily, then the second, and finally the third.
"AURA SMASH!" then this time, without merging his fists, he sent all three toward Aoki.
But it was no use…
~DODGE, DODGE, DODGE~
Aoki's speed was still way higher than Stark's, and there was no chance a projectile would hit him.
~DASH~
Knowing that, Stark closed the distance between the two, allowing him to fight with Aoki on close-range, something an archer should never do.
But the moment he reached him…
~VIOU, BAM~
He was hit by an arrow from behind.
'Ah shit… the arrows come back to the target…' he had thought of this possibility, but was too focused on closing the distance to avoid.
'Crimson Spears…' he decided to make use of his spears and hit the arrows with them though.
The moment that happened, the mark above his head disappeared, which meant that these arrows only stopped following him if they hit something, or were destroyed.
Was this why this skill was considered so powerful among archers?
[Hit once!]
~BAM~
While he was thinking of that, Aoki took advantage of this opportunity to spin around and slam Stark's head using his bow.
"-12817!"
He was sent flying in the opposite direction, and that simple attack (which didn't even do that much damage to be honest), but…
[Stark HP: 4933/12750]
One more attack and Stark would lose, the sole reason why he hadn't died because of the 'Domination Armor' which blocked 5000 HP.
'Why does he hit so hard while not even shooting…' Stark didn't know it, but the bow Aoki had was from the 'Mythical' class, just as good in precision as it is in close-range because of its hard materials.
This did indeed put Stark on one HP, but his confidence didn't falter either.
"INSTANT ARROW," Aoki grabbed another arrow, and at a speed so fast pretty much half the people in the room couldn't see it, he shot it toward Stark.
The arrow also received the [Instant Arrow] buff, which increased its speed so much it reached Stark in less than a second.
~BIM~
[Hit Twice!]
These arrows are extremely strong, and so to make up for it, they do not do any sort of damage to the target.
"Ouch~ one more…"
"Its over…"
People were still interested in the fight, but by this point it was already over.
And yet… many of them wondered… why was Stark still smiling.
'Alright… should have done that since the beginning…'
He didn't like to overwhelm opponents at the start of a fight since he wanted to see their abilities and also… make them understand that they can't win against him.
"CLONE FRENZY!" he summoned his two clones beside him, and they nodded as they understood what Stark wanted them to do.
They traced a circle in the palm of their hands and envisioned where there wanted it to go, then…
"HEAVEN'S WRATH!" they both activated the skill.
Under normal circumstances, an archer as fast as Aoki would have enough space to run away from the beam, but in this case, he was locked in an arena.
"=)"
Stark's clones positioned [Heaven's Wrath] perfectly as to not allow Aoki to go to the sides, otherwise he would just be disintegrated.
And so, as the giant crimson sparkles in the ceiling charged up…
"Hey, what are they doing-"
His eyes widened as he felt the intense aura, and he looked up to see that at incredible attack was coming.
'SHIT!' due to the lack of time, he couldn't run to the sides, and so he was forced to dash forward.
But this was a mistake…
"DOUBLE ASSAULT!"
~BOOOMM, BIIEMMM~
The two giant beams erupted at the same time, coming from the sky and converging right on top of Aoki.
The force of the attack was so immense that it created shockwaves throughout the entire arena, shaking the ground beneath everyone's feet.
"Wow…"
"This is insane…"
As if coming from the heaven's, the crimson beam fascinated everyone.
"YOU THOUGHT YOU COULD GET ME WITH THAT-?" Aoki almost got hit, but he smiled again as he turned his gaze back toward Stark, "Huh?"
Because of [Double Assault] and his low HP, Stark's domination made him so fast that he was already right in front of Aoki.
"=)"
~BOOM~
Stark punched his face as hard as he could.
"-84827!" the damage output was something even Stark had never been able to do before, he was also soon reaching the 100,000 damage mark!
Aoki was sent flying in the opposite direction, and he could thank the heaven's that [Heaven's Wrath] stopped working right as he was about to enter it again.
'The duration was cut in half… is it because the two clones were using it at the same time?'
As Aoki landed, his entire body was shaking through the pain.
But he still wasn't down.
"TARGET LOCK!" he grabbed not 3, not 5, but 10 [Arrows of Sierra] and began to pull the stringer with all of them in his hands.
This was a difficult feat to achieve for most archers, but thanks to [Target Lock], all the arrows would indeed fly toward their target.
~VRIM, VRIM, VRIM~
The 10 arrows flew towards Stark with incredible precision and speed, their beautiful trails of aura adorning the air around them.
But this time… Stark didn't even bother to avoid them.
He TRULY wanted to show Aoki that he didn't have any chance to begin with, well to be honest, he would have had a higher chance of winning by simply using his bow as a weapon.
Even though the arrows were flying at him, Stark's face never changed expression. He stood firm and waiting for the arrows to strike.
And when the first one hit…
[Hit Thrice!]
[Effects of 'Arrow of Sierra' activating…]
"GOTCHA!" Aoki laughed, and to add to the fuel, the other 9 arrows also hit Stark, which meant that he would potentially be paralyzed for a few days if he kept him like that.
Not losing a single second, Aoki dashed forward, wanting to step on Stark's face and proving to everyone present that the Moonless family, and himself, shouldn't be messed with.
But… while his confidence was at his max… the unthinkable happened.
"Do you know how I managed to defeat this rift," Stark opened one of his eyes, a burning crimson fire visible in them, a wide smile on his face.
'…?!' the fact that he could talk was weird, after all, all his muscles were supposed to be paralyzed by the mist.
Aoki stopped in his momentum at that moment, "No… no way…" but he resumed heading toward Stark, this time walking.
And right as he got close to Stark… a panel that made everyone's eyes widen appeared above the boy.
[Determination is too strong!]
[Not affected by 'Arrows of Sierra'!]
Aoki's jaw was wide open as he read the message, and the moment he gazed down at the smiling Stark, he could see that his aura was almost five times as overwhelming as before.
And so during that brief instant of doubt…
[Aoki Moonless has received the DOMINATED status!]
He knew this guy was bad news.

chapters.title: Chapter 134 - 134: Defeat of the Moonless Son
chapters.content:
[Determination is too strong!]
[Not affected by 'Arrows of Sierra'!]
~STEP, STEP~
He decided to back away, squinting his eyes and gritting his teeth as he looked around to find a solution.
~SHOOT, FWISH~
Aoki decided to still use those arrows on him though, and he shot a multitude of them one after another, not even taking a second to take a break.
[Hit Four Times]
.
.
[Hit Twelve Times]
.
.
And yet, no matter how many he sent at him, how matter how focused he was, each arrow wouldn't do anything.
On the other hand, Stark was slowly walking to Aoki, each arrow that failed to infect him making his smile grow as he could feel the despair in Aoki, and his futile attempts.
But...
"ALRIGHT, ASSHOLE," Aoki threw the [Arrow Quiver] away and... activated his most powerful skill.
"AOKI'S ULTIMATE ARROW," aura started seeping from his body and began to create a beautiful arrow with a moon symbol on its edge: it was his only chance to win since he couldn't use the [Arrows of Sierra] to do damage.
[Aoki's Ultimate Arrow] created an arrow from Aoki's arrow, and that attack was so strong it dealt over 150000 damage point to whoever was hit, it could also pierce defense and walls, and adding the [Target Lock] buff to it made it overpowered.
It was an attack many archers and even those outside of this class feared.
'Why is he doing nothing...?' Aoki's pressure increased as he saw that Stark was still slowly walking toward him, not even caring about the attack, 'WELL, THAT'S GOOD FOR ME!'
~FWISSHHHH~
The structure of his ultimate aura was nearing completion, the air around it distorting...
"I WON!" Aoki got ready to shoot as his attack was charged up.
But...
'Huh?' he felt an intense pressure from behind, something was holding his arms, not allowing him to fire.
And as he looked behind him... he saw the two clones, both shaking their heads as if they were disappointed.
Aoki had been too focused on Stark, completely ignoring the two clones that he had summoned, and that was his biggest mistake.
~BAM, BAM~
The two punched him at the same time, each strike sounding like a bullet being fired.
"-32617! -34818!"
He was sent toward Stark, and of course the boy didn't miss a chance to finish him in a stylish way.
~KICK~
He kicked Aoki's stomach when he got closer, making his entire figure distort as it removed the air from his lungs.
And so he was sent flying toward the ceiling.
"-58271!"
He was already dead from the clones' punches, so the arena barrier disappeared and he effectively crashed into the ceiling, before falling to the ground and being caught by Arthur.
[Winner: REDACTED (Bunny-Masked Man)!]
A golden panel appeared in the middle of the room for everyone to see.
And instantly...
"NICE!"
"That was cool!"
"That damage is crazy...!"
Surprisingly, many people around him complimented him, while the remainder of them remained calm.
'…' Aoki laid there defeated, his body unconscious since you would always go down to recover after dying inside of a duel.
"Amazing…" Arthur smiled, even he was impressed, and he had also hoped that Stark would win (he would of course never say that to Aoki).
But of course, winning in a duel meant one other thing too…
[You have beaten 'Aoki Moonless' in duel, gaining reward: 582437EXP!]
And so that… Stark was surrounded by the golden golem in front of everybody's eyes.
[Your level has increased to level 33, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Experience: 14737/712000]
He had almost forgotten about the fact that winning a duel against another classifier meant that he would steal some EXP, in that case it was enough to allow him to level up.
'He probably went down one or two levels to give me this…' Stark smiled.
'Spatial Inventory…' he mumbled before taking out three [Potions of Regeneration] and drinking them all, after all he didn't know when any of these people would attack.
But… Stark's intuition made him feel like he wouldn't fight anymore.
"Hey, Archer King…" Stark spoke, and all the chatter in the room suddenly stopped, all classifiers, even the most powerful of them, wanting to hear what Stark was about to say.
They were in front of an up-and-coming prodigy, many realized it.
"Yes, Mr. Bunny?" Arthur smiled, he knew of Stark's identity but kept it a secret as saying his name would be too easy.
How many guild and organization leaders would love to have him as a member? He couldn't allow that…
He quickly glanced at his daughter, then smiled: Stark was the perfect protection to her if something ever happened as he couldn't always be around.
"You know what I asked for, right?" Stark mimicked the sign of money with his fingers, he didn't say what it was about though as asking to join the 'Rift Conqueror' academy would make him so much easier to find.
"Oh~ but of course, I'll be sending all the information to you soon," Arthur smiled, "Thank you for the arrows."
"No problem…" Stark nodded and turned around, "Oh! See you soon, Lana," he waved at the girl, he hadn't paid attention to her since he was too focused on actually surviving.
"B-Bye!"
"Goodbye… FATHER-IN-LAW!" Stark added as well as he turned his slightly toward Arthur, a wide smile on his face.
"Bye, son-in-law," Arthur went along with it, smiling just as hard, a small amount of aura pouring out from his body.
And yet… this small amount was enough to make Stark squint his eyes: he was way too strong, and it would take a while to win.
Once Stark left the room, one of the [Magus] class used his staff to place the wooden doors back in their place, effectively repairing them completely, and stopping anybody from seeing Stark.
But the boy didn't turn back, instead he just went inside the elevator and clicked on the main floor, meaning the entrance.
[Good job…]
A crimson panel appeared before Stark, but he was already lost in thought, holding his head: this was a terrifying experience.
And surely… now all the strongest classifiers in the country, as well as all their children present, knew about him.
'I need to be careful… need to get stronger…' he mumbled over and over as the elevator kept going up.

chapters.title: Chapter 135 - 135: The Devil’s Abyss Key
chapters.content:
"So that's your son-in-law, Arthur?" Derek, the father of the boy Stark had defeated, laughed, "Didn't know your daughter was taken… and here I thought Karl had a chance!"
"Don't push your luck, Derek," Arthur's smile disappeared as soon as Stark left, "Don't ever think my daughter will get with a thug like your son."
"…" Derek was ranked 45th in the ranking, which would seem great for anyone else, but in this room where everyone is strong, rank is everything, and those with lower ones needed to respect those that were stronger.
"Who is he?" a woman asked, approaching the 'Archer King'.
"Hm…" Arthur thought for a while, and everyone watched, awaiting his reaction, "An acquaintance, I guess…"
And so just like that, the party resumed, although it was much more chaotic as many were left wondering who that mysterious boy was.
He intruded this place with no fear in his eyes, beat two powerful classifiers, and left after talking with the top 8 classifier, the 'Archer King', about something.
The Bunny-Masked Man's reputation grew once more.
***
[…]
Stark was still in the elevator, but his body was sweating all over, and he was holding his head tighly, his pupils shaking like never before.
He had acted confident in front of everyone, and even up until entering the elevator, but inside… he could feel it: death.
He made sure not to make it obvious, but he had noticed all thorough his stay inside this room that almost all of the classifiers had their hands on their weapons.
They were all glaring at him, their auras enough to suffocate him.
The [Warriors] had their hands on their sword's handles, ready to cut Stark in a single second, the [Magus] had their staffs in hand, particles of magic already visible at their edges as if one single word from them could crush him, the [Soul Wielders] were already beginning to summon their hearts in hand.
Basically… everyone was ready to kill him if he ever did something wrong.
Luckily, Stark had managed to survive by focusing most of the attention on the fight and his discussion with Arthur, otherwise it would have been game over.
"…!" he put his back against the wall and breathed in and out slowly, in the end… he had managed to do it…
And yet…
Fear wasn't the only thing Stark was feeling, no… there was another emotion he couldn't describe inside of him, one that made him smile even with all the sweat and while his aura was shaky because of the memories of his possible death.
Was it thrill? Excitement? Ecstasy?
He didn't know… but at least he balanced it all out.
And so by the time the elevator stopped on the first floor and he got out, his face was back to normal, and he managed to take complete control over his aura.
'Need to get stronger…' he mumbled, his eyes burning yet again, and a vortex forming inside of them, 'Stronger… stronger… stronger…'
He kept repeating this word over and over until he reached the entrance door again, and left.
Once outside, Stark took a deep breath and started walking home. The events of the day had left him shaken, but also energized.
His plan of showing himself to the others, while also forcing Arthur to respond positively to his return was a complete success.
['Rift Conqueror' academy entrance in one month…]
He still had one month before finally beginning his REAL entrance into the world of classifiers.
He was frankly interested to see what this school was about as he knew that it had a 95% if not more failure rate, meaning that out of 1000 people allowed, only around 50 would pass the first year, and even less the second.
But until then… he needed to become stronger, way stronger…
Karl was simply beaten since he had underestimated Stark, and Aoki didn't have his real arrows.
It wasn't complete luck, of course, but it was just that Stark took advantage of the circumstances to come out on top.
'…'
Stark reached his hotel room quite easily after hailing for a taxi and he jumped on his bed, exhausted, it was around 5pm, but he was still tired nonetheless since fighting decreased his stamina.
'Ways to get stronger…' but he kept thinking of that.
[Memories Museum] was his most obvious option, but it didn't increase his level, and training his movements would have a limit at some point
The second option was the [Devil's Abyss Key] which he had gotten from killing Judicator, but he currently had no idea where it was located, and how he could open it…
He still remembered that its description stated that three 'Godless Demon' apostles were inside, and it would surely be his hardest rift yet… but for now he was safe.
He played with the key for a little while, inspecting it to see if it had any secrets, it was completely crimson, with traces of rust all over it, and its edge had two devil horns as well as holes which resembled a skull.
And when he taped it with his finger three times… something happened.
~GROOOWALLl~
A large sound could be heard all over Stark's room, which surprised him, and then…
A crimson panel, one that had a fire aura around it, as well as a two black horns on top, and a moving tail on its back, appeared.
[The 'Devil's Abyss' rift has not been opened yet, but it will be available very soon.]
[Whoever owns this key, watch out, many will try to take it from you, and trying to go inside by yourself is guaranteed death.]
[Good luck… the devils are waiting for you…]
'Huh…' he had never seen that before since he immediately put the key into his [Spatial Inventory], but it seemed like that thing was much important than he expected.
Was it another secret rift that would cause uproar? It sure looked like it if even the key warned him that people would want to steal it from him.
In the end, he decided to put it back into the inventory and he would keep it there until he found the entrance of that rift.
'Last options to get stronger… find a common rift people go to and level up there, or go outside to the dangerous zone…' this was all he could think off as finding unique rifts like he did before wasn't easy, and he couldn't ask Arthur for another one after such an event today, 'Welp, I think I'll just find out tomorrow…'
He spent the rest of the day lazing around in his room, and watching videos of people analyzing his fights (narcissistic much?), he frankly enjoyed being in the spotlight.
And so just like that… it was time for Stark to sleep, the sun had sipped below the horizon and the moon rose up to watch over him in the night.
Although… the moon wasn't the only thing watching him… but he didn't know that yet.

chapters.title: Chapter 136 - 136: Announcement of the Second Domination Trial
chapters.content:
'...'
Stark slept well that night, no dreams, no nothing, just comfortable sleep he greatly needed.
'Best sleep ever~' he mumbled.
And when he opened his eyes...
"OH COME ON!"
He was yet again in that black void, with nothing in view for what seemed infinity.
Then...
~FWISH, FWISH~
The other Stark, the one completely made out of aura, with only his eyes and mouth visible because of the white aura, appeared.
Crimson cracks were forming beneath his feet.
The background around it changed, it wasn't a complete black void anymore, but the area around the doppelgänger became visible in a 10 meters radius: it was rocky ground with cracks of aura also spreading through this weird land.
This has never happened before, maybe the land would become more visible the stronger he got?
After all, they WERE in his mind, weren't they?
'...' the other Stark didn't speak like he used to, instead... he looked to his right, almost as if he was waiting for something.
And suddenly...
~FWISH~
Another Stark appeared... wait, what?
The other doppelganger's body was made of white aura, and he was wearing a long laboratory coat, he also had two vials in his hands, each with a weird liquid inside.
'Alchemist...?' Stark thought.
"As you said!" the white Stark smiled, answering the original as it was capable of reading his mind.
"This guy appeared ever since you unlocked the [Alchemist] class and has been bugging me..."
'So each class will create a doppelganger of myself...?' Stark couldn't deny he was interested to see what it would look like with 10 of them in here, it would probably be chaos though.
"Love me or hate me, I'm still here," The Alchemist rubbed his two vials, beneath his feet the ground was completely white with a weird marble texture, resembling the ground of a laboratory.
And after only a few minutes of talking... the two Stark suddenly stopped whatever they were doing and turned toward the original.
"..."
"..."
Their eyes looked almost sad, although they had no pupils at all and their entire body was made of aura so it was hard to see.
"...?" Stark was confused, but... a panel suddenly appeared before him.
It was crimson in color, but its edges had vials, a merge of both [Domination] and [Alchemist] speaking to him.
And its content was... rather shocking.
[The Second Domination Trial is arriving soon.]
This was all that was written, and it was enough to make Stark's eyes widen.
If the first Domination trial was already hard enough to kill off 4 of the most promising classifiers from this class... then what could the second one possibly be about.
[It is harder than the first, and it will start the moment you and the 'others' reach level 50!]
'The others...' Stark mumbled, it clearly meant that this Domination trial would yet again have him fight alongside others, with the possibility of only one person being allowed to survive again.
Plus, it being at level 50 would mean the difficulty would skyrocket.
"Ah shit... but I need to get stronger so can't really escape that," he sighed, and the two other Stark smiled.
[That's all... for now...]
And so the two bowed before seeping back into the ground, and the entire realm began shaking like crazy.
'Waking up...' he thought as he looked up, a blinding light growing more and more in the void's sky.
~FWISH~
~BWIING~
Stark woke up shortly after.
***
'Shit...' was Stark's first thought as he got up from his bed, holding his forehead.
Another Domination Trial so soon was harsh, but if he didn't get stronger, there was little to no chance he survived inside the 'Rift Conqueror Academy', basically... he was fucked either way.
'I might as well try my luck with the Domination trial...' he sighed as he opened his phone, he felt extremely hungry for some reason.
And when he checked the date...
"OH COME ON...!" three days had passed, three days he had spent completely asleep, three days, while felt like mere minutes inside his mind.
And of course, dozens upon dozens of messages from Lana appeared as soon as he was connected to his phone.
'Here goes the tsundere…' he didn't bother to read any text beside the last one.
{Lana Moonless: I need to leave for a rift soon as the academy requires to get stronger, please send a message!!!!}
'…'
{Stark Heartsouls: Have fun :)}
Obviously, he didn't get an answer or even a read like he usually did since she was probably fighting monsters by this point.
'Well… I also need to find a way to get stronger…' he still had his own problems to solve, so he paced around the hotel room, thinking of his possibilities.
Looking for another secret rift was out of the question since they were extremely rare to begin with.
He could also try and conquer a random rift too, but most were owned by classifiers.
How do you somehow manage to claim a rift like Arthur did with [Sierra's Death Path] you might ask?
Well, what else than money and power!
There are actually 'Rift Auctions' held in private places for the rich, and he effectively bought it from there, which seemed kinda weird as… you know… anybody can enter the rift if they find it…?
'Heh~ I don't know,' Stark shrugged, not that interested in that as it wouldn't help either, "But what about going outside?"
It was indeed risky, but if he spent long enough outside the barrier of Fellarburg, inside the semi-danger zone, then he could definitely gather experience quickly.
'But… it's not that convenient to do that, is it not…?' Stark kept walking around, but his stomach quickly reminded him that he hadn't eaten for three days straight, and that he should get to it before he died.
~CLANG~
He grabbed a plate and put it on the table before pulling out five different meals from his [Spatial Inventory]
But the moment he sat down… he noticed that there were things placed on his table.
'Huh…?' he was sure that they weren't there before… 'What the fuck?'
There were two envelopes on the table, each with the 'Moonless' family crest in the middle of it.
Stark immediately tried to reach for them, but this time, it was another crimson panel that stopped him.
[WARNING! You should eat quickly!]
[You have received the 'FAMISHED' status!]
[-10 HP…! -10 HP…! -10 HP…!]
'HUH?' his HP was reducing every second that passed.
[When you are extremely hungry, you do not die instantly, your HP just get reduced little by little, but if they do reach 0, you will die!]
"Huh, so it's like in minecra-"
~ZAP~
"-100!"
'Fuck…' he quickly began to ate though and soon enough, the "FAMISHED" status disappeared, and his HP slowly began to go back up.
And once he was finished with all his food… he immediately grabbed both the envelopes and placed them in front of him.
If they were from the 'Moonless' family, then it obviously meant that it was Arthur who sent them, although that would indeed mean that he ordered people to infiltrate his room while he was asleep to deliver them…
'…' it was a rather disturbing thought, but he was confident [Focus] would have immediately woken him up if there was any sort of killing intent.
And so just like that, Stark opened the first envelope and began reading its content…

chapters.title: Chapter 137 - 137: The Rift Storer Association
chapters.content:
'So much presentation…?' Stark was confused
The first envelope contained a luxurious letter, as well as… A CHEQUE!?
"YES!" Stark didn't even need to check the amount, he was already happy, he sure did love money.
…
[Cheque:] 5 million rher coins
…
'Nice…' he nodded happily before picking up the letter that was with the cheque.
The message was written by Arthur, which would already be a miracle for anyone to receive since the 'Archer King' was always busy and didn't have time for anyone, but Stark didn't seem to mind.
…
[Hello, Stark
As promised, here are the 5 million rher coins for the mission, and as for the rest, your tuition has already been paid, and your spot for the 'Rift Conqueror Academy' was secured.
You will be able to go there from next month onward, hope you succeed in graduating…
Arthur.]
…
"…" and so with that, Stark could finally feel that going through all the trouble of fighting his way through [Sierra's Death Path] was worth it, other than just to complete his [ApostleDex] of course.
Using his phone, he scanned the cheque and claimed the money inside his account.
And so with that, his overall assets ranged around 7.76 million rher coins.
Thinking that he went from 0 to this insane number brought a smile to Stark's face, but of course he couldn't forget that he would need to spend lots to buy ingredients in the future, as well as interesting items if he saw them: it meant that money was always needed, no matter how much he had of it.
After finishing with the first envelope, Stark moved on to the second one, curious about what else Arthur might have left for him as everything had already been said.
As he tore open the envelope, only a small letter fell, one much shorter than even the previous one.
And when he picked it up…
~DING~
He heard a notification from a panel, but he decided to read it after the letter.
…
[Want to get stronger? Head to the 'Fighting District' and search for the 'Rift Storer Association'!]
…
This was all that was written, but… somehow, it interested Stark much more than anything else.
Wasn't it too convenient of a timing? He was looking for a way to get stronger and then all of a sudden the 'Archer King' himself helps him out?
[Talent: Chosen One, Activated!]
'Of course…' he sighed as he noticed that the panel that had made a sound earlier was exactly what he thought it would be.
Plus, there was also the fact Arthur saw Stark fight before, and thought that it would be better to have him level up before reaching the academy…
In the end, he truly couldn't understand how any of those 'Moonless' folks thought… but they were useful for now.
[27 days before 'Rift Conqueror Academy' entrance ceremony!]
Around a month was left for him to get stronger, but should he try to reach level 50 before that or… wait?
The domination trial would happen no matter what he tried or thought, so there was no point in trying to escape it.
In the end, Stark left his hotel room with more questions than answers, and hailed for a taxi, asking the driver to send him to the 'Fighting District', which was just as big as the 'Trading District' if not more as it was where everyone who actively fought in rifts was.
Basically…
"Holy…"
It was a place for strong people.
After 40 minutes, Stark reached the 'Fighting District', it was separated from the heart of the city by quite a distance, although not enough to consider it very far.
It was around 1pm, yet there were hundreds, if not thousands of classifiers roaming around, their weapons in hands.
The atmosphere was charged with energy, each passerby exuding a sense of power.
"…" but in comparison to what he saw and experienced before, all of this seemed pretty dull, but maybe it was just a feeling.
Stark took his first step into the district, making sure not to bump into anybody as people in this area were much more aggressive than those in the trading one.
All of them seemed ready to battle whoever even dared to do anything, although it wouldn't matter much since Stark could beat them…
As he navigated the district, he spotted many shops also selling goods related to rift exploration, as well as some luxurious displays with legendary/mythical items that cost a fortune on them.
"Level 100 training dummies, use them however you like, they don't break!" some guy was promoting an object to train.
"So you want to create a party, we're going to be 4…" while others were busy trying to find teammates.
But in the end, this wasn't where most of the activity was located… not at all…
'Rift Storer Association,' he mumbled, and once he looked up… he found himself in front of a giant building, at least five times the size of the biggest one in the 'Trading District', hundreds of people coming in and out of it.
Above the entrance was a holographic screen that displayed the name: "Rift Storer Association".
'Well… that's the place, so might as well go for it…' he had heard several people talk about it while he was heading there, as well as some other place called the [Classifier Colosseum], but he would maybe check it out later.
The interior of the 'Rift Storer Association' was bustling with activity, people from all over the city filling the spacious lobby, which somehow still had enough space to navigate easily even with all these people, it truly was enormous.
The appearance of it was quite luxurious, with marble floors and grand chandeliers hanging from the ceiling, illuminating the room in a soft golden light, although the 'theme' was more neon than anything else as colored lights were everywhere.
Dozens of screens greeted him wherever he looked, and there were many halls to go through, basically, the possibilities were endless, and he could easily guess this was the most popular building in the district.
And when he felt lost…
"Hello, sir, how may I help you?" one of the agents placed in this place to help out new classifiers appeared.
She was beautiful, but her appearance didn't interest Stark enough for him to take note of it.
"I would like to go to the area to get stronger, if that is possible…?" he asked, unsure if those words were right.
"Oh, then I get you are looking for high risk high reward~ you should immediately head toward the 'Rifts' section then, and you should find everything!" she pointed at a specific hallway, with the section name illuminated above with a neon, then quickly went to help the next customer.
'…' Stark sighed, he truly didn't know what to expect, all of this was TOO new for him, and he felt like the more he stayed in this world, the more things he discovered about it.
He immediately headed toward the 'Rifts' section, which also seemed to be the one with the highest amount of people.
And when he emerged on the other side of the hall… he found himself in yet another giant room, maybe even bigger than the lobby?
The first thing that appeared in front of him as he entered a room filled with other classifiers were two blue panels.
[Please choose the rift you want to enter!]
[Warning! Those below recommended level won't be admitted inside of a rift!]
It truly was a weird place… but if it could help Stark level up… then why not?

chapters.title: Chapter 138 - 138: Breaking Through the Rift Barrier
chapters.content:
Inside of the [Rift] section's giant room were many other halls, each leading to another place further inside the 'Rift Storer Association'.
'Huh…' Stark was confused, but this time he just decided to figure it out by himself.
[Please choose the rift you want to enter!]
[Warning! Those below recommended level won't be admitted inside of a rift!]
Those were the words the panel had told him.
And so that meant…
'I think I got it…' he lifted his gaze, and as guessed, above each of the hallways was a neon title that differed in colors.
The hall all the way to the right had the title [Level 10-20 Rift] above, the one next to it was [Level 20-30 Rift] and it continued like this until reaching [Level 240-250 Rift].
Basically… there was a chance that each hall led to a rift where people could train by fighting and killing monsters, as well as level up.
He could see many people, from all classes and levels, head toward a specific hall without any issues.
Some others were even trying to form teams on a whim inside the room, which seemed kind of dumb, but who knows.
[You are level… 33!]
[Please choose the rift you want to go to, note that the barrier will block you from going to a rift higher than your level as to stop needless deaths and reduce risks!]
'Hell nah…' Stark refused to go to the [Level 30-40 Rift] area as the enemies there would all get one-shotted by him, plus it would take him way too much time.
Anyone that heard him think like that would probably think he was crazy, but to him, it made complete sense.
And so he immediately headed toward the [Level 80-90 Rift] area as it was the maximum he could achieve at this very moment with his abilities, any higher and it would be extremely risky, although Stark couldn't say he hadn't risked his life every time.
"Let's go there!"
"Hunt those monsters and come back!"
"Let's go together I said, let's goooo!"
People around were chatting, and it kind of annoyed Stark as the sound was overwhelming.
Around each of the hall's entrances was some sort of energy barrier that shone brightly.
When someone of the required level tried to pass, it would obviously let them pass without any issues.
[Access Allowed!]
And on the other hand… if you ever tried to slip through…
~BZIP, ZAPPP~
They were pushed back by a high amount of electric energy.
[Access Denied, level not high enough to attempt this rift, please do not try again!]
"You fucking liar, you told you were level-" and with that many problems would occur, but as it said before, it was to reduce the risks.
Frankly, Stark didn't really care much about that warning, for him it was either a high level rift or just going to the danger-zone outside of Fellarburg, basically he was too lazy to grind against hundreds of monsters for one level.
As Stark approached the entrance to the [Level 80-90 Rift], he felt a surge of anticipation mixed with a hint of caution.
The purple energy barrier was right in front of him, and people beside him were passing by.
He noticed that the more he went toward the high level rifts, the fewer people there were around.
He got a few weird looks from others though: Stark hadn't activated his aura yet, so for the others, he just looked like some new classifiers trying to explore.
But…
'Let's get this over with…' he took a step toward the purple barrier, the faint glow emitting on his face.
And when he tried to pass…
~BZIP, ZAPPP~
[Access Denied, level not high enough to attempt this rift, please do not try again!]
'…'
Of course, such an occurrence always resulted in people mocking you for trying to fight inside a rift higher than your level.
But Stark didn't care at all, instead his eyes burned brighter with determination and… he tried again.
~BZIP, ZAPPP~
[Access Denied, stop trying!]
This time the shock was more powerful, but Stark didn't stop, he kept going.
~BZIP, ZAPPP~
[Access Denied, we already told you to stop!]
Again.
[STOP. TRYING.]
And again.
[WHY DO YOU KEEP TRYING!?]
The shock was becoming more and more powerful, and by now it would be enough to make even a classifier at level 80 faint, yet Stark's aura and determination kept him going.
'DOMINATION!' he activated his power as he dashed at the purple barrier again.
By now, all the attention was on the boy that kept trying to access an area far higher than his level, and the mockery and laughter turned into worry.
"Why does he keep trying?"
"Is he crazy?"
"Death wish maybe? These newbies really need to give up…"
But it wasn't only the barrier that was powering up after each attempt: Stark's aura also grew more and more.
It was either he passes that shitty barrier, or he faints while trying.
"This is crazy…" one of the bystanders muttered under his breath, genuinely concerned about Stark's actions.
However, as Stark made another assault on the energy barrier, it began to emit a deafening noise, and a sudden flash of purple light engulfed Stark.
[AcCEsS… DEnI…Ed…]
Stark's aura completely shielded him from the shock, and so his body slowly pushed through the barrier, first it was his feet, then his hands, and then his entire torso…
For a moment, time seemed to stand still as the barrier pulsed with energy, and then silence fell.
The people around exchanged astonished glances, waiting to see what would happen next.
And after a few seconds… the energy barrier flickered slightly, allowing Stark to pass.
[Access Allowed…]
Of course, it wasn't solely because Stark pushed its limits that it allowed him to pass but because… the barrier itself could sense his aura.
A barrier isn't sentient at all, but its sole job is to check the level and power of a classifier to decide if he is allowed to pass or not, and in this case… although Stark's level was extremely low compared to the recommended one, his aura told it that he would easily be able to survive.
And so it allowed him to pass.
Stark came out on the other side of the barrier, now allowed to reach the rift, and so he looked back at the other classifiers, a giant grin on his face.
All of them were flabbergasted at the scene that occurred before them, yet unable to do anything as… well… what could they do, and why would they even interfere to begin with?
And so just like that, Stark began to walk through the hallway alongside the other people that were level 80-90, he didn't know what awaited him, but it better be worth it.
All he wanted was to level up after all…

chapters.title: Chapter 139 - 139: An Elite Event Mini-Boss?!
chapters.content:
Stark went deeper into the hall, many other classifiers talking, and some rare ones even pointing at him for being an anomaly: the barrier clearly stated his level was way too low, yet he still managed to pass somehow thanks to his sheer determination and aura that even it (the barrier) could detect.
And so when he reached the end of the hallway… he finally saw it, a massive purple portal crackling with energy.
It was just there, the area near it corrupted by the remnants of aura that came out of it, and dozens of classifiers were coming in and out like it was nothing.
'Hm…' Stark scratched his chin…
It was the entrance to the [Level 80-90 Rift], and frankly, Stark did NOT know how they managed to bring a rift portal all the way here, but it was indeed useful.
And so Stark with no hesitation whatsoever passed the threshold and yet again had that sensation of being transported somewhere else, it was all too familiar to him, and it meant that he was indeed going inside of a rift.
[Welcome to the 'Strands of Corruption' rift…!]
And so after a few seconds, Stark was finally able to emerge on the other side.
His vision was blurry, but it quickly adjusted as he looked up.
He was standing on gray ground, and beside him were dozens of other classifiers, some already fighting monsters.
"KEN IS DOWN, FUCK!"
"Take that!"
"Haha got him~"
People were doing their own things… and so Stark decided to just go somewhere else.
This rift worked like all the normal others, meaning that the further he went, the harder it would become, and it also meant that there was a chance that the boss was still there if it wasn't already defeated or if it spawned again.
The 'Strands of Corruption' rift was weird, there was only a single area before reaching the boss, which wasn't even that far, maybe that was why it was selected as a rift for training?
The ground was gray, with occasional dark and purple trees that emitted aura, as well as dozens upon dozens of monsters that swarmed the land, other than that, the sky was also just as gray as the land, with no moon/sun or any clouds at all.
It felt… empty, almost as if the once blooming view was now reduced to… nothing.
'The strands of corruption…' Stark thought, for some reason he had a bad feeling, he shouldn't be thinking so much about a simple name, yet here he was.
He had a feeling… that it would be important later.
The 'Corruption' was something he noted in his mind for later.
But as he thought of that…
"GROAOORAAAAA~"
A deafening roar echoed through the rift, causing Stark and the other classifiers to pause in their tracks.
The ground trembled beneath their feet as a massive shadow came out of the ground a bit further from the portal, blotting out what little light there was in the desolate landscape.
'…'
It was a colossal, grotesque beast with scales as black as obsidian and eyes that glowed a sinister shade of purple, as well as giant wings that looked like they could strangle you.
Its mouth dripped with purple venom, and its sharp claws scraped against the ground, leaving deep gouges in its wake, it was standing on its legs, but also its two long arms.
'What the fuck is that thing…' even Stark was taken aback, it truly was incomprehensible.
['The Corrupted Ghoul lv85', an ELITE event mini-boss, has appeared, step forward if you want to fight it!]
'Huh… looks like an event is happening,' Stark nodded, and he was the first to take a step toward the monster, a wide smile on his face as he was ready to fight it.
But in comparison to what he believed… well… something else happened, something completely unexpected.
~THUD~
Someone grabbed his shoulder, it was a robust-looking man with a sword in his belt, his face looked horrified and extremely stressed.
"GET OUT OF HERE FAST, WE NEED TO GO AND WAIT FOR THE EXTERMINATION TEAM!"
Stark didn't pay much attention to the man, and instead just swiftly removed his hand from his shoulder, "And why is that?"
The man was taken aback by Stark's nonchalant response, "Are you dense? That beast is an event elite mini-boss that only appears every so often, we can't take that thing by ourselves!"
"…"
Seeing Stark's lack of answer, the man just clicked his tongue and ran away, leaving the boy behind as he traversed the portal alongside… EVERYONE ELSE?!
Literally every single one of the classifiers that was present to fight monsters suddenly ran away as soon as they saw that thing, and even though Stark couldn't deny it was terrifying, there was no reason to run…
After all… if he wanted to get stronger, he needed to take bigger risks, and all those cowards who ran away could never hope to ever achieve great things if they kept it like that…
Just as the man informed Stark, such ELITE monsters don't appear often at all, and it would be at best once every month that they appeared.
When it did happen though, a team of professional classifiers would be dispatched to eliminate the beast so that the rest of the classifiers could return to slaying monsters and gaining levels.
Basically… that thing was super strong, and nobody was willing to risk their lives to eliminate it, even if it was a group of 50 people all uniting their powers.
'This is too convenient…' Stark shook his head, there was absolutely no chance that the moment he entered the rift, some sudden rare event happened.
And of course it wasn't.
Since the moment he turned his gaze back to the beast after witnessing all the classifiers leaving…
[Talent: Chosen One, Activated!]
'Seriously… just how does that thing work, can it bend fucking time and space to cause me trouble?!'
He saw the crimson panel that told him everything he needed to know, and so he just sighed, the beast that was summoned from who knows where already looking around, then its purple eyes falling on the only human left in the land.
Its only available prey was now on sight… and so it took a step toward Stark, its tongue licking its mouth all over, and its sharp teeth already sensing the flesh of the human on them.
'Oh come on…' Stark sighed again, activating [Domination] and positioning himself to fight off the giant ghoul.
He still had absolutely not a single intention to leave this rift today until he was at least level 35, so he might as well get to it now since this monster could probably give him a level or two.
"GRROOOOAAAHHHHH~" the giant ghoul roared, the waves of sound almost visible because of their sheer intensity.
And so… it started running toward Stark, each time its two arms and legs hitting the ground with a force that created shockwaves in the air.
Stark stood his ground, his eyes locked onto the approaching monster, calculating his next move.
That thing was thirty meters tall, and it would be hard to reach its weakness if it had one, so Stark needed to think…
[3…]
[2…]
[1…]
'Hm…' his determination grew stronger the closer the ghoul got.
[FIGHT!]

chapters.title: Chapter 140 - 140: The Corrupted Ghoul (BOSS)
chapters.content:
[10 minutes until the 'Extermination Team' arrives!]
Stark did NOT want to show his powers in front of anybody, which was why he planned to go further inside the rift to begin with: the bunny-masked man, his other identity, was so famous that if he ever used one of its attacks in front of others, they would immediately recognize him.
So maybe… just maybe… his talent did indeed summon the monster, but it also took into account the fact that everyone would leave, letting him kill it peacefully?
'It's a weird talent…' Stark didn't know how it worked, but every time it activated, it somehow distorted reality to make things happen whether they were good or bad to him, 'Well, can't really think about that now with THAT thing coming…'
The giant ghoul-like monsters, with its giant arms, legs, and wings, was still rushing at Stark, its purple aura surrounding its entire figure.
'Perception…' of course that was the first thing he did.
…
[Name: The Corrupted Ghoul (EVENT ELITE)]
[Level: 85]
[HP: 300000]
[Strength: 3726]
[Stamina: 4024]
[Speed: 1873]
[Defense: 3372]
[Skills: Venomous Spit, Shadow Wings, Sonic Roar, Nightmare Gaze, Shadow Strike, Corrupted Regeneration, Death Form…]
…
'…' Stark was actually perplexed: that thing had better stats than Sierra, even though she was supposed to be an apostle of the 'Godless Demon'.
Maybe that thing was even stronger than her…? After all, it was a rare event elite that only appeared once in a while…!
"SHADOW STRIKE!" the giant ghoul raised one of its rugged arms, with sharp skin and claws, and then slammed it down towards Stark.
With quick reflexes, Stark dodged to the side, narrowly avoiding the deadly strike.
No matter how strong that thing was, it was extremely slow compared to even normal enemies since its body was big and easily spottable.
"SHADOW STRIKE!" it tried yet again to hit Stark, but this time his wings just activated [Dash], propulsing him away from the radius of the attack.
Each [Shadow Strike] left a semi-deep crater on the ground it struck, and shimmers of purple aura were even left there, corrupting it.
It hit again, and again, and again… until eventually…
"Hah~ Hah~~ GROOARR~" the monster roared again, its tongue dangling from its mouth.
"AURA SMASH… MERGE!" while the monster was busy recovering some of its stamina after trying to hit Stark dozens of times, he on the other hand crouched down slightly and held his right arm's wrist while summoning his three crimson fists and merging them into one.
And after only a few seconds of controlling this overwhelming power…
"SMASHHH!" he launched the giant fist toward the beast.
Obviously, it couldn't avoid it.
"-53524!" its defense was high, but the damage was still incredible.
And in addition to that…
[Enemy Stunned!]
The Corrupted Ghoul suddenly staggered back from the impact, its enormous body trembling under the force of Stark's attack, and then… it stopped moving altogether, its body stunned.
A single crimson fist has a 30% chance to stun an enemy, that is true, but when you merge them all together… that chance climbs all the way to 60%.
Taking advantage of the opening, Stark lunged forward.
The two arms of the ghoul fell to the ground in a giant thud, their owner unable to do anything other than move its pupils and watch the human run at full speed toward it.
'Thanks for the stairs,' Stark smiled as he jumped on the black hands and began running up the arms toward the face of the ghoul.
'Clone FRENZY!' he also summoned his clones beside him, and they also began following after him.
The reason he didn't just instantly use [Heaven's Wrath] on the monster was because he wanted to try something.
After a few seconds at full speed, he reached the face of the ghoul, its giant eyes, which were half his size, looking at him, and its purple pupils trembling slightly: it was scared.
"CRIMSON SPEARS," all three Stark summoned 9 spears, then sent them all toward one of the specific eyes.
~PIERCE, PIERCE, PIERCE~
"GROOOOARRRHH~" the ghoul cried, now able to move its body slightly as the stun effect was slowly going away.
"-79736!" was the damage the spears caused, but that's not all…
~POP~
Its right eyes completely exploded when the spears hit it, meaning it could only see with one eye now.
"GROOOOARRRHAH~" the ghoul kept crying, then began agitating its head.
"Guess I'm out…" Stark grinned as he jumped out of the way and fell back on the ground with a thud.
"-1726!" of course he received some damage for that, but his domination armor took it all, meaning he hadn't suffered any injuries.
And as for the clones that remained on the ghoul's face… they held on for a bit, and there was simple reason for that: Stark had an idea he wanted to try.
"AURA SMASH… MERGE!" both clones began charging up the giant crimson fist while taking their stand, making sure not to fall.
Stark called this new possible attack the 'Clone Suicide'.
And as the clones charged up the merged crimson fist on the ghoul's face, Stark braced himself for the impact.
Of course, even Stark had a hard time controlling his merged crimson fist the first time he had used it, even though he had a lot of aura.
But what about clones? They don't have as much aura as Stark, and their mastery is also very bad.
Which means…
~BOOM, BOOM~
When they would try to use that super strong attack, they would just explode, and send out all the aura in a radius close to them.
"GROOATHZHHAHZ~" the monster almost looked like it was having a seizure as it began to shake frantically and move in all sorts of direction, its face was blasted by two super powerful explosions after all.
"-79372! -80401!"
It held its face and roared, the blast almost exploding half of the face it had left.
The Corrupted Ghoul, its remaining eye wild with fury and pain, turned its attention back to him.
[Corrupted Ghoul HP: 6967/300000]
'…' it was almost dead, 'Let's end this…'
Stark raised his right arm and traced a circle around the ghoul, then…
"HEAVEN'S WRATH!" he summoned his skill, and the crimson spark in the sky appeared above the beast, its speed wouldn't allow it to escape too since it was still too damaged from all these attacks.
Basically… it was Stark's win.
Or so that's what he thought.
Since… the beast stopped moving altogether, closed its remaining eye… and the purple aura around it suddenly became 10 times as overwhelming.
"CORRUPTED REGENERATION, DEATH FORM," it immediately activated its most powerful skills as Stark didn't even let it use the other ones.
And so… the battle wouldn't end so easily.

chapters.title: Chapter 141 - 141: The Level 100 Ghoul's Death Form
chapters.content:
"CORRUPTED REGENERATION, DEATH FORM," as the sparkle in the sky of the [Heaven's Wrath] reached its speak, announcing that the beam would be coming down soon to end the ghoul, it suddenly activated two skills.
Dark energy enveloped the Corrupted Ghoul, swirling around it like a malevolent storm.
Stark's eyes widened with realization as he saw the monster's wounds begin to close before his very eyes.
'Huh…?'
"+250000!" the ghoul's face regenerated, and it got back its destroyed eye, plus a major part of its HP.
"HEAVEN'S WRATH!"
~BOOOMM~
But as the beam descended… the purple and dark energy storm that envelop the ghoul completely, creating some sort of thick liquid-like armor around its figure, its edges moving like waves.
'…' and so the ghoul just stood there, taking the hit of the [Heaven's Wrath] beam.
"-0! -0! 0! -0!" it received no damage.
That was the ghoul's ultimate skill: "Death Form".
'Huh…' Stark's eyes widened as he saw the ghoul which was supposed to die suddenly regenerate most of its life and also survived his most powerful attack without taking a single point of damage.
And once the beam and its effects faded, the Corrupted Ghoul stood before Stark, its purple aura pulsating with renewed vigor.
It let out a low, menacing growl, its eyes fixated on Stark with a newfound intensity. The ground beneath them cracked from the sheer pressure emanating from the ghoul's darkened form.
And so for the first time since his appearance in this world… Stark took a step back against a monster.
Of course, he absolutely refused to leave before he either eliminated that beast, or the extermination team came, but… that thing was horrifying.
Its skin and figure darkened, the purple/black surrounding it completely, much like when Stark got angry and his crimson aura enveloped him too.
It was flapping its wings, its deep purple pupils staring at his souls, and its mouth opened wide, not saliva coming out, but a purple liquid that looked like poison.
…
[Skill: Death Form]
[Description: allows the ghoul to use insane protection but also boost all its abilities to their maximum potential.]
[Note: It is trying to avenge all its companions from the corruption and wrath of the 'Godless Demon'…]
…
But [Death Form] wasn't all that it changed… since when Stark checked the ghoul again…
[The Corrupted Ghoul, Level 100]
Its level went up by 15, meaning that such a thing didn't have its place in this rift at all.
Maybe… even the extermination team that would be sent here didn't stand a chance either, as people probably believed this monster could only be level 80-90 at best…
Stark could feel the oppressive aura emanating from the ghoul, making his breaths come out in short, tense gasps.
He had no clones, he already drank potions for strength and speed, so they're useless, he already used up [Heaven's Wrath] too…
And so that meant… all he had left were the 10 seconds of [Double Assault], they were his last chance.
"VENOMOUS SPIT," the ghoul spat out a stream of purple venom that flew towards Stark with deadly accuracy.
Stark barely managed to dodge it, feeling the intense heat as the venom landed on the ground beside him, sizzling on impact.
The Corrupted Ghoul's movements were unnaturally quick and precise, the Death Form enhancing its speed and agility to levels far beyond Stark's expectations.
'That thing could probably take on Sierra by himself, and her arrows…!' upon saying the word arrow, he suddenly remembered about his [Crystal Stun Potions].
He didn't think they would work against such a giant opponent, but who knows…
~THUD, THUD~
He didn't really have the time to think about it that giant ghoul, now more terrifying than before because of its aura, advanced toward Stark.
"NIGHTMARE GAZE," its eyes glinted with purple aura, some sort of vortex appearing in them.
And the moment Stark looked at them… he knew he was fucked.
[You have been stunned!]
He couldn't move his body anymore, his limbs frozen in place as the ghoul's dark magic took hold of him.
It was just like Judicator's [Divine Blindness], although this one was much more deadly as blindness could still mean you can do things, but being stunned was bad, REALLY BAD.
The world around him seemed to warp and distort, shadows dancing menacingly at the edges of his vision.
"SHADOW WINGS," the ghoul took advantage of that to suddenly flap its wings.
The shadowy wings seemed to drain the light from the air, casting a pitch-black veil around him, and just as expected, the ghoul began to fly little by little, its figure growing smaller in the distance as it ascended higher into the air.
Stark tried to shake off the effects of the stun, his mind racing for a way to counteract the ghoul's newfound abilities.
But… after only a few seconds… he heard IT…
"GROOOAORRR~" the ghoul roared, then began to dive toward Stark with incredible speed, its shadow wings trailing behind it like a cloak of darkness.
"FUCK…" Stark tried as hard as he could to move away.
The Ghoul was spinning in the air as well was rushing at the boy, and so it almost made it seem like a sharp spiral of purple aura was heading toward him.
"MOVEEEEEE!!!!" he shouted to his body.
But it was too late.
~BOOM, SCRATCCCHH~
The land received immense damage because of the sheer power of the attack.
And once the ghoul got up and looked back, smiling as it knew that the human was dead now… it still saw Stark standing, his face full of blood.
He had survived somehow.
[The 'Purgatory Shadow' took the hit in your place]
That ring had saved him from being killed, otherwise he would have gotten 100000 points of damage.
"…" Stark looked down at the ground, he didn't even look at the ghoul as it took more steps toward him, the sound getting closer as he just stood there.
But from another perspective… if you ever looked at Stark's face from below… you could see that he was mad.
Really mad.
