Much like the Corrupted Ghoul, his face was slowly being enveloped by his crimson aura, while his eyes and mouth were replaced a white one.
"AURA SMASH… MERGE…" he slowly breathed in and out as he activated this skill and began focusing his attack.
He closed his eyes to focus, only able to hear and sense the ghoul to pinpoint where it was: he wouldn't have another chance now.
~THUD~
Stark wasn't stressed, his entire mind was calm and serene.
~THUD~
The crimson aura around his right hand was growing more and more, and this time… he didn't even hold his wrist with his left one: he was that confident.
~THUD~
He was somehow able to perfectly control the flow of his aura now, not needing time to focus more or to hold his wrist to not make it explode, which made the aura of the fist even more powerful.
~THUD~
And so right as the [Corrupted Ghoul] reached Stark and raised its arm…
"SHADOW STRIKE!" it struck down at the boy, its poisonous and sharp claws glowing dark purple.
But as the ghoul's attack began to descend, Stark opened his eyes, both shining beautifully.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," he passed right through the attack, and with a spin… "AURA SMASH…!"
He sent the magnificent crimson fist, the fruit of all his efforts until now, toward the giant ghoul.
This was the final showdown against his first level 100 monster.

chapters.title: Chapter 142 - 142: Defeat of The Corrupted Ghoul
chapters.content:
[1 minute before 'Extermination Team' arrives…]
Stark avoided the Corrupted Ghoul's attack by using [Invincible Dodge] then quickly sent the charged up [Aura Smash] toward its face.
His anger had allowed him to control it, and so it was much more powerful than before.
~FWISH~
The giant crimson fist, as big as the monster's head, collided with the Corrupted Ghoul's face with incredible force.
The impact sent shockwaves rippling through the air, shattering the ground beneath them and creating a deafening explosion that echoed throughout the rift.
~BOOOM~
The ghoul's face was obviously massively injured, and it was yet again roaring, not even its 'Death Form' protecting it from the domination aura as it completely bypassed it.
And once the mist cleared… Stark was able to read the damage output.
"-102832!" this was the first time he managed to do over 100000 points of damage, and it almost felt emotional.
Yet he knew he couldn't just stand there.
[Enemy Stunned]
The Corrupted Ghoul, even in its 'Death Form', even with all its strength, power, and resistance, couldn't move its body when it was stunned by something as powerful as that crimson fist.
Of course, it was still resisting, but the only thing it achieved in the end was the ability to move its mouth and eyes, other than that… it was an open target, just waiting for Stark to kill it.
[30 seconds before 'Extermination Team' arrives!]
Stark didn't want to waste time anymore either, after all… such a thing wouldn't work against the ghoul twice, meaning that it was all or nothing now.
~FWISH, CLIMB~
Stark used the ghoul's arms again to climb up, but that's not all he did…
~PUNCH, PUNCH, PUNCH~
While climbing up, he repeatedly punched the arm of the ghoul using his now powerful aura.
It didn't seem like much, but when you realize that Stark was punching so fast at least a dozen punch were going each second…
Then it becomes quite powerful.
"-3736! -3725! -3827! -3691!"
And slowly…
~CRACK, DISPERSE…~
The 'Death Form' aura armor that had formed around the ghoul was slowly cracking and dissipating after each of Stark's punches.
It was almost… as if HIS aura, which was much more powerful than the monster's, was completely annihilating it, showing it who truly was stronger.
"SONIC ROAR!" the ghoul didn't want to stand there doing anything as it could sense that this human, no matter how low his level was, was bad news.
Seeing the cracks forming in its Death Form, the Corrupted Ghoul let out a deafening Sonic Roar, causing the very air to tremble and Stark to feel pressure building up in his ears.
But he was not deterred, with determination blazing in his eyes, he continued his assault on the ghoul's arm, each punch landing with precision and power.
'Sonic Roar' is an attack used to confuse and scare enemies, as well as causing a bit of damage if it perfectly.
And yet… Stark endured it easily, he didn't even look bothered by it, making the ghoul's roar grew louder, but it didn't help.
As the Death Form began to weaken further under the relentless barrage of Stark's aura-enhanced punches, the ghoul's desperation became palpable.
[20 seconds before 'Extermination Team' arrives!]
It was too late… Stark had already reached its head.
"DOUBLE ASSAULT!" and so at that very moment, he activated his legendary skill, doubling each of his stats for 10 seconds.
And in less than a fraction of a second afterward… the only thing the ghoul's pupils could see was Stark's powerful crimson fist aimed at its eye.
~POP, BOOM~
"-33738!"
"GROOOAORHZ~" it looked to be in pain, and frantically roared, moving its head to launch the human away.
But this time, Stark held on.
And he immediately aimed for the second eye.
~POP, BOOM~
"-35902!"
The ghoul's head was still the part where the 'Death Form' was mostly activated, which was why the damage was so low.
And yet… the ghoul had lost its vision, unable to see anything, unable to know when the human will hit next.
[Corrupted Ghoul HP: 50871/300000]
[15 seconds before 'Extermination Team' arrives!]
Stark focused all of his aura into this final punch, and after 4 seconds, which was the remaining time for his [Double Assault]…
He punched the ghoul's face right in the middle, making it stumble back as it began falling backward.
"-49372!" but this wasn't enough to kill it.
And so now that it was allowed to move its body again, the first thing it did was smile and lick its mouth while activating [Corrupted Regeneration].
If it could regenerate its life, then it could retrieve its vision, and end the human as he didn't have any more tricks up his sleeves.
The Corrupted Ghoul was also on the verge of retrieving its balance, as stumbling wasn't enough to make it fall completely.
But as if divine intervention occurred…
['Double Impact' activated!]
It seemed the ghoul's plan was foiled, as a crimson shadow of Stark appeared and punched it again in the same spot with the same intensity.
"89372!" it had lost its [Death Form] by now, so the damage was much higher.
And that final push was also enough to make it fall and completely ruin its plan to balance itself back.
~THUD, FWISH, BOOOM~
The ghoul's head cracked open like an egg when hitting the ground, oozing black goo and bones splintering.
And on the other hand, Stark triumphantly stood above its lifeless corpse, panting from the adrenaline rush as he had managed to defeat that enemy.
['Extermination Team' has arrived!]
Coming out of the purple portal appeared four classifiers, each a neutral expression on their faces and armed with their weapons, ready to eliminate the threat.
And yet… when they looked around… they saw that the beast was already dead, and on top of it was… another human.
'…?' all of them were confused, they were sure everyone should have evacuated, so why…
No… this wasn't the true question they needed to ask… HOW did this kid defeat that event mini-boss?!
Why was he just standing there, looking at the monster? And what the hell was that aura…?
On the other hand, Stark was maniacally smiling, he had somehow managed to defeat his first level 100 boss, so of course he would want to celebrate.
[You have defeated 'The Corrupted Ghoul'!]
[Gaining 1,927,834 Experience!]
'HOLY SHIT!' Stark almost wanted to jump in joy, he hadn't noticed that the extermination team was looking at him yet since he was kind of exhausted.
And when he turned his gaze… he saw four classifiers looking at him, their gazes showing that they were cautious of him.

chapters.title: Chapter 143 - 143: Naegi and the Extermination Team
chapters.content:
[You have defeated 'The Corrupted Ghoul'!]
[Gaining 1,927,834 Experience!]
Stark was quite amazed by the sheer amount of experience he had gotten, almost reaching 2 million with a single enemy, and way higher than what even Sierra gave him.
[Experience: 14737/712000]
And of course, this could only mean one thing…
~DING, DING~
He was enveloped by the golden aura twice.
[Your level has increased to level 34, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 35, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Skill Points: 8 Available]
Many panels appeared around him as his level went up, but he minimized them all as he had noticed that the 'Extermination Team' had already arrived.
"…" they didn't say a word, just waiting.
Stark jumped out of the ghoul's massive body and dropped on the ground, then began walking toward the exit portal, his stamina was already depleted from all this action, so all he wanted was to just go back to his hotel room and sleep.
[You have defeated the 'Corrupted Ghoul' alone, 'SOLO' achievement, granting better rewards!]
He decided to quickly take it in and put it inside his [Spatial Inventory] before resuming walking toward the 'Extermination Team'.
"Hey, there," a buff man with short brown heard and a well-trimmed beard, spoke, he had a sword in his belt.
"…" Stark didn't answer, he didn't want to explain anything or associate with such people, and so he just tried to pass through the four of them.
The purple exit portal was only a few meters away from him.
But of course…
"Hey, we're talking," a brown-haired woman with hazel eyes and a longbow on her back, said as she jumped in front of him to block his path.
"…"
Stark moved to the side and passed the woman, who just looked at him and her companions back and forth, her expression stating, 'what the hell is wrong with this guy.'
"RESTRAIN!" a woman with short white hair in a bob cut raised her magic staff and pointed it at Stark.
~FWISH, CLANG~
Powerful chains came out of the ground, grabbing Stark's legs, arms, and torso.
They didn't plan to kill him, obviously, but they just wanted to talk as there weren't many people who could take down an event mini-boss by themselves, and even more so one as terrifying as the 'Corrupted Ghoul'…
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," but Stark just activated his skill and his invincibility frames allowed him to pass right through the chains.
"WHAT?" the mage was flabbergasted.
Of course, this 'Extermination Team' wasn't weak at all, and it was apparent by their auras.
Each of them were over level 200 as they needed to make sure that they would be able to destroy the monster without any casualties.
And yet… why was that boy so nonchalant about them?
It's almost like he didn't even acknowledge them as strong enough for him to talk to.
"Alright…" the leader, a man with short purple hair and magenta eyes, sighed as he pulled out his sword from his belt and then…
"LIGHT FLASH!" purple lightning surrounded his body as he dashed toward Stark with intense speed, so fast it couldn't be visible to the naked eye, and his body turned into a legitimate flash of light as he closed the distance.
"Naegi?!" the team was confused as to why their leader, who was always so calm and composed, suddenly lost his temper.
This 'Extermination Team' was very well known among classifiers, and they were respected as well for always coming in to save others with the brightest of intentions.
Their slogan was: "The people come first, and we'll be there to save them!"
And yet… here he was, suddenly dashing toward Stark with the clear intent to harm him.
The reason was simple: Stark's aura.
Naegi, the leader of the 'Yasugi' extermination team, a level 273 classifier, could sense auras and their nature.
And Stark's was… very clearly evil.
Of course, the real Stark wasn't that bad of a person (heh), but it was simply because [Domination] and its crimson nature would seem overwhelming and bad to anyone that looked at it from afar.
This was why it was so easy to intimidate people with that class.
'This is familiar…' Naegi thought the moment he saw Stark standing on the monster.
Stark remembered seeing that the top 100 classifier was named [Naegi, The Electric Blade], so he participated in the 'ClassiTop Event' from before, and this was how he got that weird feeling of having seen that kid before.
"That kid… he is going to cause chaos in the future," Naegi's eyes flashed, almost as if a divine vision was granted to him before using his [Light Flash] skill.
For the first time in a very long time… he believed that eliminating a human was a better solution than to protect them.
~FLASH, FWISH~
[Focus: Behind You]
The [Focus] skill warned Stark of the ambush from behind, and even allowed him to see Naegi even though he was extremely fast.
'…' Stark moved to the side at the last moment, and swiftly avoided the leader's attack.
~FWASH~
The spot he was in before literally exploded from the power of the slash, and small glitters of purple aura were left there.
"…?" Naegi was surprised that the boy avoided his attack, after all, it was supposed to be almost instantaneous, and some other level 100 monsters didn't even have the time to realize what was happening that they were dead.
And just like that, Stark reached the purple, then looked back to see the four classifiers looking straight at him, each with their weapons out.
To them, this random kid had just eliminated a level 100 threat by himself, and nonchalantly acted as if they were mere insects when they tried to talk to him.
It was weird, extremely weird…
"You can tell people you were the ones to eliminate that thing, I frankly don't care," Stark shrugged, "But next time…" and suddenly his aura became overwhelming even for these level 200 classifiers, "Don't try that shit on me again."
And so he left by passing through the portal, leaving them all bewildered at the balls he had to threaten them.
"LET'S GET THAT SHIT," the brown-haired man shouted as he cracked his fingers and began marching toward the portal too, wanting to teach that kid a lesson.
"Forget it," but Naegi raised his arms, "Let's just get all the needed things from that beast before announcing that it's eliminated…"
Frankly, none of them wanted that, not even Naegi, but they couldn't do anything.
Deep inside… Stark's expression and aura at that time might have scared them… just a little.

chapters.title: Chapter 144 - 144: Leaving the Rift and Legendary Skill
chapters.content:
"DIDN'T YOU HEAR, ITS AN AMBUSH MONSTER!"
"Fuck… lucky us we left, we didn't stand a chance!"
"Yeah, hopefully the extermination team doesn't lose either, I really want to keep grinding…"
Stark could hear the words of the classifiers outside even though he was still passing the threshold of the portal.
Many more classifiers, even those above level 90, regrouped to check it out.
An 'Ambush Monster' is a type of monster that reveals itself to be of a certain level, but after some times completely switches up and becomes much stronger.
It happens many times, and it mostly ends with the death of the classifier that is facing it.
"Hey, someone's out!"
Stark passed through the portal and began walking toward the exit, a path forming for him as many people questioned what he was doing.
"Guess he got saved by the extermination team… lucky bastard…"
"Don't try that shit again kid, you might really die," one of them shouted, causing some laughs in the crowd.
Stark didn't even bother to look at any of them, he just left the hallway with a neutral expression, and after a minute found himself in the giant room with the other hallways that led to many rifts.
The dozens of screens that were scattered around each had a red background with the words: [Level 80-90 Rift Area is currently closed because of an event mini-boss, please refrain from entering it!]
Even outside, in the [Rift] section's room, many people gathered to see what was up, and also to know whether the 'Extermination Team' did in fact eliminate the threat.
Stark, still indifferent and expressionless, walked past them without looking at anyone, his eyes never leaving his front.
Frankly, he just was too tired to care about anything else.
'Is that the side effects of having your stamina completely depleted?' it was the first time he actually pushed himself enough to feel like that, and just one more attack would probably send him unconscious.
No one seemed to mind him, and after only five minutes of trying to pass through the crowd, he could see the exit of the 'Rift Storer Association' building.
The neon-like atmosphere was still very lively, although the content of the chatter mostly revolved around the level 100 beast that appeared.
It would surely make the news at this point…
The reason this was such a big issue wasn't because a monster came to disturb people for an hour, but because… if that thing wasn't eliminated after 12 hours, then it would come out of the rift and actually start causing chaos in the real world, resulting in thousands of deaths.
[BIG NEWS!]
[Seems like the 'Yasugi Extermination Team' have managed to kill the beast! They are coming out to make a statement…!]
All TVs showcased this message, with the voice of a woman over it.
And then, the screen switched to a view of the four classifiers that tried to stop Stark leaving the purple portal, all cameras pointed at them.
Safe to say, whatever they would say here would end up in broadcasts all over the country.
'What could they possibly say, though,' Stark smiled slightly as he exited the building… just to face the same screen outside.
Seems like news of that thing already spread all over.
"What happened inside?" a reporter pointed his microphone at the leader, Naegi.
Most of them looked quite uncomfortable, avoiding the gazes of the others, almost as if they felt… ashamed.
Except for Naegi that is, as he simply took the microphone and shouted: "We are not the ones who eliminated that beast, when we entered, some black-haired kid was already there on top of the monster."
Naegi was a righteous man, and he didn't want to claim what wasn't his.
But that also meant… that Stark's identity was at risk.
"Taxi!" he hailed for a driver as he left the 'fighting district', then ordered him to go to his hotel.
Inside the car, Stark thought about his bad fortune and everything that had happened.
He had expected something like this, but not so soon.
He never thought his identity would be revealed so quickly.
After all, they had seen his face, right? And he left the rift with hundreds of people watching him…
'Well… it's fine…' he sighed, and after a while reached his hotel street, paid the driver, then went up to his room, sitting on his bed while drinking water (you should do that too).
There was no need to expect anything now, and soon these people would come for him.
Maybe even the 'Domination Association' would show their face again to try and recruit him?
In the end… it didn't matter.
'Show me the panels,' he swiftly moved his finger upward, and all the panels that he had minimized before appeared around him.
There were only two of them though.
The first was…
[Level 35 Reached: please pick a card].
'Of course,' he smiled, it was always a good thing to reach this milestone as it was always a sign that he was going to get stronger.
Three crimson cards appeared out of thin air in front of him.
'And of course… no way to know what is what-' Stark joked, but his eyes widened as he looked at the back of the cards.
For the first time ever… there was something on their backs.
The first had a smiley face :), the second had a neutral one :I, and the last had a sad one :(.
'The fuck is that…?' each of the faces emanated a strange power, as if each one was prompting him to pick it as it had the best ability, 'Oh well…'
For the first time Stark didn't just close his eyes and pick a random card, but actually thought of the implications of each one.
The smiley would be the optimal choice under normal circumstances, but doesn't it seem too obvious?
'Ahhh, fuck, I don't know… the sad one could also be good…'
In the end, he picked the neutral one because 'balance is everything I need' apparently, and also since he had a neutral expression on his face at that moment.
And so once he turned the card, he saw the picture of a figure swiftly dodging what looked like an energy ball, some lines and after images showing that the figure moved at intense speed.
The skill he got was…
[Skill: Dodge Control]
[Type: Legendary]
'Yeah!' he was happy he had made the right choice, although he didn't know if the other two didn't have better skills as the other cards immediately disappeared when he picked the first one.
But somehow… he felt like this skill was powerful, and that it would become extremely useful in the future, maybe even more so than [Double Assault]?

chapters.title: Chapter 145 - 145: Three Clones and Perfect Dodge
chapters.content:
Stark decided to immediately check out the new legendary skill he had gotten before doing anything else, after all… it was yet another skill that would allow him to get stronger.
…
[Skill: Dodge Control]
[Type: Legendary]
[Level: 1]
[Description:] For exactly 15 seconds, your aura takes over your body and allows you to bend it in any way it needs to, making you able to dodge any and every attack that comes your way, no matter how fast or unavoidable it is.
[Note: Basically, you can dodge anything for 15 seconds, like any attack, even from a level 999 classifier]
…
'…'
This was insane, absolutely insane.
15 seconds of perfect invincibility is too overpowered, no matter how much you think of it.
Of course, the time frame was low, but it was still 5 seconds higher than even [Double Assault], which had saved him many times before.
Plus, if he could dodge and somehow counter-attack his enemy, it would surely benefit him…
But before checking out the second panel that appeared… Stark decided it would be better to see his status window as it had been awhile and also assign the 8 skill points he had to something.
'Status Window…' he mumbled, and the giant panel appeared before him.
…
[Level:] 35
[Health:] 14500
[Bloodline:] Human
[Classes:] Domination; Alchemist
[Talent:] Chosen one
[Attributes:] Strength 1821; Speed 2012; Mind/Soul 2148; Stamina 1490; Defense 1564
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv15; Focus lv10; Aura Smash lv10; Clone Frenzy lv5; Invincible Dodge lv2; Double Assault lv5; Crimson Spears lv1; Heaven's Wrath lv1; Alchemist lv3; Potion Crafting lv3; Target Manipulation lv1; Dodge Control lv1
…
His skills number was getting strangely high, and he did wonder if it wouldn't take up an entire page by the time he reached level 100…
[Skill Points: 8 Available]
But for now… Stark sat back down on his bed and scratched his chin: he needed to think how to place his skill points perfectly.
After all it was something that would determine his entire future, so of course this time Stark was serious and actually took time to decide-
'Yep, I'm taking those,' he nodded after a few seconds and clicked on the skills he wanted to upgrade.
[You have upgraded 'Invincible Dodge' to level 5!]
[You have upgraded 'Clone Frenzy' to level 10!]
He had had the choice to upgrade either [Double Assault] or [Clone Frenzy], but when thinking about all his previous fights, the former wasn't really used much except for urgent cases, while the latter was almost always used, making it an essential skill to upgrade.
And those upgrades could only mean one thing… NEW PERKS!
A crimson light enveloped Stark as not two, but three panels surrounded him for his skills' new perks.
…
[Skill: Invincible Dodge lv5]
[New Perk: Perfect Dodge]
[Description:] What you did up until now were normal dodges, but if you somehow manage to activate this skill at the microsecond before an attack collides with you… then you will activate the 'perfect dodge' perk: the world will turn gray and time will slow down for everyone but you, allowing you not only to check your surroundings for a few seconds, but also have more chances to counter.
[Note:] You won't be able to move your body during the 'perfect dodge' effect, it will still be slowed down, it is your mind on the other hand that will be normal.
…
'Oh~' Stark grinned, this was extremely interesting.
Of course, there was a big risk in doing that as waiting right before an attack hit to activate it gave Stark less leeway and also increased his odds of just being hit and dying with a single bad timing.
'All I need is to upgrade [Focus] to make it better, though…' but he already had a solution to such a problem, and he was already confident that he could do it without much problems.
Even more so after an intensive training inside the 'Memories Museum'.
In the end, he would just need to test it out…
Then he moved to the right, which were the panels for the [Clone Frenzy] skill as it seemingly got two perks instead of only one.
…
[Skill: Clone Frenzy lv10]
[New Perk: Three Clones]
[Description:] I mean… it's in the name, but basically you can summon three clones instead of two.
[Flaw:] The more clones you summon, the less power they will have as you need to share your aura with them, and it's not unlimited.
…
'…' Stark had expected this, so he just moved to the second perk.
…
[Skill: Clone Frenzy lv10]
[New Perk: HP Transfer]
[Description:] You can sacrifice your own HP to gift it to one of your clones (and only one), thus granting them the ability to possibly survive another hit and not instantly die by any attack.
[Flaw:] Doing that will make you lose your own HP while gifting it to your clone, making it extremely risky.
…
'This means that the clones are not limited to 1HP anymore if I gift them my own…' Stark laughed, this was interesting.
What if he gave them the entirety of his HP and just kept himself at one…?
Nah, it would be dumb to do that as in most of his recent battles he always received some kind of damage… and he always gets one-shotted by any powerful attack anyway, making this skill pretty worthless in most situations.
'Well… it depends, it's always a plus anyway…'
And thus, Stark could finally move to the final panel, the one that was beside the card one.
And when he looked at it, his face turned cold.
[15 levels left until the needed level for second 'Domination Trial' is reached, have fun!]
[7/10 classifiers have reached the needed level, be quick or else when everybody but you reaches level 50, you will still be teleported!]
[Basically… once the ninth classifier reaches level 50, the last one will be teleported no matter what their level is]
'HUH?' the doppelgängers in his mind hadn't told him that rule?!
'Shit, SHIT, SHITTT…' Stark was thinking deeply, his eyes burning with aura as a vortex was forming in them.
This was bad, really bad.
As proven before, Domination Trials take into account the fact that the [Domination] class deals much more damage, and so it gives more powerful bosses than normal classifiers can deal with.
Meaning that a 15 level difference would be the end of him if he tried to enter it.
The moment the ninth classifier reaches level 50, then he would be teleported to the domination trial, no matter how far he was from it.
Maybe this was a punishment to the classifier that was slacking off while thinking that they would be fine?
But in the end… it only meant one thing…
'You can't escape the Domination Trial,' he slightly laughed, 'I was going to enter it no matter what I tried…'

chapters.title: Chapter 146 - 146: The Conditions of the Second Domination Trial
chapters.content:
This was a rather interesting piece of information.
But it also meant that no matter how hard anybody tried, they wouldn't be able to escape the 'Domination Trial' once it called for them.
[7/10 participant classifiers have reached the required level: 50!]
This also told Stark that there would be 10 people participating in this trial rather than only five, making the difficulty and chances of betrayal even higher than before if only one person could survive.
'Starting tomorrow I'm going to the 90-100 level rift in that building, no other option…' he needed to be quick now, and wasting his stamina and energy on big bosses wouldn't cut it in the long run.
Stark never thought the day would arrive when getting 2 levels at once seemed too little for him.
'Anyway… it's been like an hour since I left, might as well just take a break…' he yawned, then grabbed his TV remote and sat back down on his bed to watch some mindless entertainment.
But the moment the TV turned on…
"Footage of the battle inside the rift has been found, and it is phenomenal!" a reporter was excitedly shouting.
'…!' Stark immediately got up from the bed, his eyes wide.
There was no way after all, right…
And after only a few seconds, the screen switched to showcase the entirety of the battle between him and the ghoul.
'SHIT, I'M REALLY DONE FOR NOW…' there was no chance people wouldn't know who he was the moment his face was shown.
But surprisingly…
'Huh?' when the screen showed his face, it was completely hidden by his crimson aura, 'Was it like that since the beginning…? I didn't even notice…'
His aura being in front of his face hid any features that could make him recognizable, and it was safe to say it was better than even the bunny mask.
10 minutes of battle followed, and then the footage also showed how he managed to dodge all the 'Extermination Team' attacks and tell them to take the merit for themselves as he didn't care.
"We can't see his face, but he did exit the rift was what many people told us!"
"Then it means we know his face, right?"
"Not at all… look…" the reporter clicked on a button, and several videos taken from different angles when he left the rift appeared.
And in all of them… his aura was still in front of his face.
The reason people were giving him weird looks was because they wondered what he was doing having such a thing in front of his face, as if trying to hide it.
Of course, Stark had no idea why this was happening.
But deep inside…
[Talent: Chosen One]
He knew that it helped him.
And so just like that, Stark fell asleep.
***
The dream came as a blur, but Stark knew it was another one of his 'warnings'.
He was in a dimly-lit room, sitting face to face with his other doppelgängers, each enjoying a cup of tea.
'What the fuck…' he opened his eyes and took his surroundings into account, even though it was weird.
He had always been in an empty black void before, and now he was in some kind of middle-class room…
~SIP~
The Alchemist drank while smiling, "Seems like we're close…"
Domination on the other hand shook his hand, "Wrong, we're further from anyone else."
Domination then lifted his arm, and two panels appeared in front of Stark.
[Classifiers at level 50: 7/10]
"We have no information about their names or weapons, but…" he lifted his other arm.
And suddenly…
[Classifier A: Level 48]
[Classifier B: Level 46]
"Ohoh~ Seems like we have two days at best before reaching it… any solutions?" Alchemist was surprised.
"None other than going inside a powerful rift and grinding the life out of you for two whole days…"
'Ah shit…-'
"Yes, that means that you will have to face the second domination trial before entering the 'Rift Conqueror' Academy, so just try to survive…" Domination shrugged.
'Huh… but wait a minute… doesn't this void space move slower than time in the real world…?' Stark thought.
"It does!" Domination smiled.
"Humu~" Alchemist poured some of his liquid into the cup and drank it.
"But doesn't that also mean that right now… the time I have to level up is decreasing?" Stark's expression stiffened.
"Huh, yeah."
[Classifier A: Level 49]
[Classifier B: Level 47]
'THEIR LEVELS WENT UP… FUCK…' Stark's jaw dropped, "IF YOU GUYS ARE ME, THEN YOU ARE SUPPOSED TO HELP…!"
"Calm down, friend, there is no need to be angry," Alchemist smiled.
"Alright, alright, we said what was needed to be said, so just understand that we can't interfere, it all depends on you, we are simply your classes after all," Domination smiled before snapping his fingers, and the room suddenly disappeared, replaced by the all-too-familiar void.
[Have fun]
A panel appeared, and suddenly, Stark consciousness faded again.
Maybe… just maybe, he was fucked.
***
'…' Stark opened his eyes as calmly as possible, this time he wasn't stressed or anything of the sorts, he just grabbed his phone, noticed that he had been asleep for an entire day, and sat down on a chair to eat.
'…' the video of him battling the corrupted ghoul was all over the country.
It was safe to say he had a gathered a large amount of fans, although none even knew who he was.
'…' but it didn't matter if he died during the [Domination Trial], so he didn't care much, all he wanted was to get stronger.
He got up from his seat after only fifteen minutes, took a quick shower, and put on his normal clothes before leaving the hotel room, directly heading toward the 'Fighting District'.
It was still full because of the events of yesterday, and there was a risk in people figuring who he was, but it didn't matter for now.
'Need…' he hailed for a taxi and got transported to the fighting district with a neutral expression on his face.
'To…' he left the car and walked toward the giant building of the 'Rift Storer Association', the videos of him fighting still all over the many screens that were displayed there, he observed all of it with a neutral expression on his face
'Get…' he entered the building and made his way to the [Rift] section, and the [Level 80-90 Rift] seemed to be full as hundreds of people gathered around, their number didn't change the neutral expression on his face.
'Stronger…' he headed toward the [Level 90-100 Rift] hallway instead, a neutral expression still on his face.
'Need to get stronger…' he mumbled.
His time was counted, and he needed to make use of it the best way he could.
If this kept going, it would only be two… no… only one day until the two others reached level 50, and they were all transported to their doom.
Stark refused that.

chapters.title: Chapter 147 - 147: The River of Souls Rift
chapters.content:
'…' Stark stood in front of the portal of the [Level 90-100 Rift] hallway, it was orange in color, different from the ones next to it as the one before was purple.
He took a step forward, his aura extremely powerful before he even entered the rift.
There was a sense of urgency in this aura, though, and it was normal as Stark's time was counted.
He couldn't catch up to the others, meaning that he just needed to get as many levels as he could.
His goal was reaching level 40 to get a new skill at least, but it would be hard if the other two classifiers kept going now that they were so close.
[Classifier A: 49/50]
[Classifier B: 48/50]
Classifier B's level went up by one again…
And so, with all his determination focused around him, Stark dashed toward the orange barrier.
[Access Deni-] it tried to deny him access because his level was way too low to pass.
But…
[Huh…] it was almost like the barrier was hesitating.
Stark got pushed back after his first attempt, then just stood there as he saw the barrier have white text appear on it.
[It's weird… your level is low but… hm… I guess…]
'…'
[Access Allowed]
And so Stark passed through the barrier easily, he didn't know how these things worked, but maybe it was a human that controlled them…?
In the end it didn't matter much as he passed the portal like anyone else and walked through the hallway, reaching the giant orange portal at the end of it.
The sight of classifiers happily leaving the rift after a good increase in experience, and the one of nervous classifiers ready to enter and risk their lives was everywhere.
Stark was pretty much the only one that was as cold and neutral as he was.
'Stronger,' he walked through the portal without hesitation, then got transported to the rift after traversing the threshold and undergoing the weird feeling.
But for the first time ever, Stark's expression didn't change, and he wasn't dizzy when the sight of the giant vortex sucking him to the rift appeared.
Stark's only thoughts were focused on one thing: the need to get stronger before the others…
~FWISH, VIOUM~
He came out on the other side of the portal and opened his eyes to take his surroundings into account.
He found himself in a vast, desolate landscape with a dark, ominous sky above him, a crimson moon was there too.
As he looked around, he noticed that the terrain was completely dark, barren and inhospitable, with only a few twisted trees and plants to break the monotony.
The air was thick, and the air felt heavy with a sense of dread, plus there was also some sort of mist that stopped people from looking too far ahead of them.
[Level 90-100 Rift: The River of Souls]
He hadn't seen it because of the mist, but there was indeed some kind of river right next to him as he entered the rift, it was pretty big in size, and seemed to go deeper inside the rift, probably even reaching the boss area.
The 'water', if you could even call it that, was completely black, much like the ground, and there were many frightening and scary faces in the reflection of the water.
'The souls…?' Stark thought as he looked for a few seconds, it was in the name after all.
[Follow the river.]
"Watch out, don't go too far…"
"I know, I heard anybody who goes beyond into the mist has never come back before…"
"Haha~ must be some kind of legend the association spread to stop people from risking their lives, but anyway I just don't want to risk encountering a scary beast, so let's stay here like everybody else!"
People were fighting the monsters that appeared around them, remaining close to the exit of the rift to be able to leave at any time, and also since this spot was the one where the mist affected them the least.
But safety wasn't something Stark could seek or afford: he needed to go deeper.
Deep enough for him to see monsters that would allow him to push through further than ever before.
~STEP, STEP~
Ignoring the warning of the people around, and what the association asked for, he went deeper inside the mist, most people too occupied with their fights to realize someone was disappearing.
After only a few seconds, his figure became invisible to those at the entrance, and so he could advance without any worries, staying close to the river as it was his only guidance in this place.
The mist was thick, and the air grew colder as Stark made his way deeper into the rift.
But after a few minutes…
~CLING, FWISH, BANG~
A white glint shone in the mist behind Stark, and then… it jumped toward the boy, trying to slash him in half.
"…" Stark didn't even look back, [Focus] had already warned him.
But he was waiting for a simple thing: the perfect timing to counter.
And he found it, since before the claws of the unknown beast could reach him…
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," he had calculated it at the microsecond, and anything more than this would have caused his death.
[Perfect Dodge!]
This panel suddenly appeared as the world around him turned gray, at least more than it currently was, and time seemed to slow down.
But before that could happen, he slightly turned his head to be able to see whatever had attacked him.
And it was… a gigantic bear, twice Stark's size, its body completely black, and its figure was weird as its edges flowed likes waves.
The only visible parts were its mouth, eyes, ears and claws as they were completely white.
[Level 93: Shadow Bear]
'…'
Perfect Dodge allowed Stark to think for himself as he analyzed the situation around him and thought of the best plan possible.
'Got it…' he sighed.
And when time resumed back to normal, he fazed right through the bear's attack and kicked it in the face before sending two spears at its head.
"-84982! -47261! -48019!" and so it instantly died as its HP reached zero, its black body falling to the ground before it could even realize what had happened.
'…' Stark didn't even acknowledge the bear, looking at it as if it was an insect, then moving on as he kept walking deeper.
[You have slain "Shadow Bear lv93", gained 112928 EXP!]
[Experience: 600499/769000]
'Need more… much more…' he mumbled.
But then…
~CLING, CLING, CLING~
Dozens of pairs of eyes appeared around him in the mist, all looking at Stark.
'More of those bears…' he sighed as he positioned himself to fight.
Under normal circumstances, Stark would have had no problem showing his emotions and surprise because of all these powerful enemies, but he didn't even feel like it now, his thoughts clouded by the goal of reaching level 40.
Maybe it was a good thing that he temporarily didn't care much about anything other than fighting, and the reason was simple: his aura was extremely powerful.
Being able to control his emotions, and being as calm as he ever was before, made it so that his domination aura flowed around him better, granting him a way better control, which also meant more damage.
Trading your emotions for power was something many classifiers did after all.
Maybe Stark would be one of them…?

chapters.title: Chapter 148 - 148: The Shadow Monsters of the River
chapters.content:
'...' Stark didn't even budge when he noticed the dozens of pair of white eyes looking at him from beyond the mist, it was a rather strange feeling, but it didn't scare Stark in the slightest, quite the opposite actually.
What would be the point of acting surprised anyway, he had already killed one of them quite easily, so there was no need to fear anything.
In the end, Stark knew he was going to win, the real question was: how much time would it take him?
'Perception...' he mumbled while looking at the bears.
...
[Name: Shadow Bear]
[Level: 93]
[HP: 127000]
[Strength: 2918]
[Stamina: 2201]
[Speed: 1794]
[Defense: 2822]
[Skills: Shadow Claws, Group Attack, Shadow Body, River Puppet, Hearing Prediction, Slash Momentum...]
...
'...Weak,' Stark couldn't deny that their stats, level, and HP were beyond any enemy (besides ELITE and BOSS) he had fought before, but... it wasn't enough.
"SHADOW CLAWS," two [Shadow Bears] jumped out of the mist to reveal themselves, although it didn't change much since Stark could see their auras from the beginning, then they dashed at him.
They were pretty fast for monsters of their types.
But of course...
~SLASH~
Stark yet again waited for the perfect moment, and when it arrived, he activated [Invincible Dodge].
[Perfect Dodge!]
The world slowed down as Stark fazed through both attacks again, and he could see the claws of the bear slowly go through him, it was a weird feeling even though he didn't feel anything.
"Clone Frenzy," Stark backed away using one of the bear's body as a springboard, then called two of his clones to aid him.
"Aura Smash," then all three Stark sent 9 crimson fists toward the bears.
"Slash Momentum..." the bears tried to cut the attack in half using their momentum skill and shadow aura, but... it wasn't enough.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
The spot they were in exploded when all the crimson fists reached it, it was a giant crimson explosion that even cleared some of the mist by its sheer intensity.
Safe to say the two bears that stood there didn't survive.
"-37371! -39143! -40196! -39447!" and much more.
In the end, their HP reached 0, and they collapsed, well, half of their body was destroyed from the explosion so they would have died even if it didn't reach 0 anyway.
'...' Stark's expression didn't change, and the clones, which were made out of aura from him, also had a neutral expression on their face in comparison to their usual cheerful selves.
"Crimson Spears," the clones summoned their six spears and threw them in the direction of the eyes of one of the [Shadow Bears] that was still hiding in the mist.
"Hearing Prediction," but the bear, using his advanced ears and speed, somehow managed to avoid them all by running around.
'...Annoying.'
Realizing that hiding wouldn't do them any good when their opponent could attack from afar, all the bears came out of their hiding spots.
And after Stark counted... he saw that there were 13 of them.
'Nice... more experience,' he didn't even bother to act surprised, the only thing bringing a smile to his face being the fact he would surely level up by at least one level if he killed all of them.
But as if sensing that the human was too confident...
"ROOOAAARRR~" all the bear suddenly roared, creating a shockwave that shook the air, and even people back at the entrance heard it, some of them leaving as they thought it was another event mini-boss.
And only a few seconds after...
[The River is calling for help...]
A pitch-black panel appeared before him, and the river right next to him began to shake, the faces of the souls distorting even more than they already were.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
And so, as if acting like some sort of monster generator, six bird-like monsters came out of the abyss of the water.
They were giant birds, twice as big as Stark, completely dark and with edges flowing like waves, basically just like the [Shadow Bears], but their wings, beak, legs, and stomach were white.
They turned around Stark, a few meters above him, visible from above as their flapping wings emitted a white aura visible from beyond the mist.
[Shadow Bird, Level 95]
'...' Stark's expression didn't change, 'More experience...'
Stark's eyes glinted with determination as he surveyed the new adversaries that had appeared before him.
The Shadow Birds circled above him with menacing grace, their white features standing out against their dark, undulating bodies, while on the other hand, the Shadow Bears were slowly approaching him, their mouth and eyes full of rage.
'…' Stark and his clones positioned themselves.
…
[Name: Shadow Bird]
[Level: 95]
[HP: 135000]
[Strength: 1738]
[Stamina: 3502]
[Speed: 3981]
[Defense: 2955]
[Skills: Crest of Shadows, Gale Strike, Shadow Dive, Piercing Screech, River Puppet, Call of the Birds, Shadow Flight…]
…
"SHADOW DIVE!" all six birds suddenly dived toward Stark, leaving a trail of aura as they descended upon him, blocking his exit from all directions.
"GROUP ATTACK!" and to make it worse, all thirteen bears swarmed in from the sides, aiming to corner Stark in a pincer attack, some of them even jumping in the air to catch him.
This meant that [Invincible Dodge] wouldn't work as the moment he tried to do that, he would be met with another one of the monsters that would surely slash him.
'…' Stark was unmoved, he just unsummoned his clones and waited for impact, 'Oh well… I might as well…'
Stark sighed as he remembered that he had 'THAT' skill he had unlocked less than two days ago with his most recent level up.
And so he activated it.
"DODGE CONTROL…!"
[Description:] For exactly 15 seconds, your aura takes over your body and allows you to bend it in any way it needs to, making you able to dodge any and every attack that comes your way, no matter how fast or unavoidable it is.
The moment the first Shadow Bird and Shadow Bear reached where Stark stood, he vanished in a blur of crimson light. His body contorted and twisted in an impossible manner, evading the attacks with grace that defied logic.
Stark couldn't control his body anymore.
'Huh…?' he could obviously think, but he wasn't the one moving it, rather, it was his own aura.
Stark reappeared behind one of the Shadow Birds, his crimson eyes burning with determination. With unparalleled speed, he unleashed a barrage of punches, each strike infused with his dominating aura.
The force of his blows sent shockwaves rippling through the mist-covered battlefield.
"-58382! -61291! -59033!" the first bird died before it could even understand what happened.
The remaining monsters on the other hand just looked around, confused as to how the human had avoided their impossible to dodge attack: they had one it against several people before, and it always worked.
[11 seconds of 'Dodge Control' remaining]
He couldn't understand how this skill worked since after avoiding, he immediately took control over his body again, and was the one that killed the bird.
'Does it mean my aura only takes control when an attack is coming…?' it was basically some sort of autopilot, very useful.
And so just like that, Stark got ready to fight the rest of them, quickly but surely getting rid of them all before they could do anything else.

chapters.title: Chapter 149 - 149: Over 2 Million Experience Points!
chapters.content:
"GALE STRIKE!" all the [Shadow Birds] began to repeatedly flap their wings in Stark's dimension, their shadow aura intensifying with each beat.
A whirlwind of shadows and piercing wind blades surrounded Stark, threatening to overwhelm him in a cacophony of darkness.
'…'
"Shadow Body…!" the bears' bodies also began to grow in size, their auras increasing as if the shadow waves were taking over, making them much more powerful, ready to attack the human.
[9 seconds of 'Dodge Control' remaining]
Not even bothering to acknowledge the attacks, Stark just pointed at the sky above all the monsters and himself, then drew a circle before gently tapping his palm.
"HEAVEN'S WRATH!" the crimson spark appeared in the sky above all of them, and especially above Stark as he actually aimed mainly for himself.
~FWISH, FWISH~ it was charging up.
But the [Shadow Bears] and [Shadow Birds] believed this to be a bluff: after all, why would the human aim such a powerful attack at itself if it didn't want to die?
And so they came up with one simple solution: the human was tricking them, and getting close to him was the sole way to survive as even they could sense that [Heaven's Wrath]'s aura was deadly.
~DASH, DASH~
Stark avoided all of the shadow blades of wind quite easily thanks to [Dodge Control], there were dozens of them in all directions, but his body almost teleported at times just to not be hit.
Basically… it was truly impossible for anyone to hit him when he had that skill.
Maybe he would have even teleported or fazed right through the Mirror Master's [All-Area Strike] without even using [Invincible Dodge].
'…' in the end, it didn't matter.
"SHADOW CLAWS!"
"CREST OF SHADOWS!"
He avoided attacks from all directions for a few seconds, the claws of the bears hitting him by a hair's length every time, and the wings of the birds becoming extremely sharp thanks to [Crest of Shadows], but his aura somehow always finding a way to avoid it.
[4 seconds of 'Dodge Control' remaining]
~FWISH~
By this point, the monsters were becoming desperate, and they truly gave up when they saw the massive beam start descending upon them.
[3 seconds of 'Dodge Control' remaining]
Stark looked up as well, the beam now only a few centimeters above his head, truly wondering how 'Dodge Control' could get him out of there now that it was so close, even almost touching his hair.
It was a risk he had taken, and maybe it was wrong… maybe he would die?
'…' Stark's expression didn't change in the face of death.
~BOOOOOM~
The crimson beam descended from the heaven's and finally hit the ground, disintegrating every living thing that was in its radius as it reduced them to ashes in less than two seconds.
"CRAWKKKE!!!" the birds cried.
"ROAWWR!!!!" and the bears roared in pain.
Yes… everything… was reduced to nothing…
Even Stark?
[0 seconds of 'Dodge Control' remaining]
['Dodge Control' disabled]
Stark opened his eyes again, and saw that he was right in front of the beam, the intense aura before him leaving a weird feeling on his skin.
One step ahead, and his foot, if not entire body, would be disintegrated by the laser.
But this little experiment did confirm it: he could avoid anything, no matter how big or fast it is, well the skill description did say it, but he still tried.
He had literally teleported once the laser was centimeters above his head, so fast that even a level 500 classifier couldn't see how fast his aura controlled him to get out of the way.
'…' Stark remained calm and waited for the beam to disappear, and it did after a few seconds, the dissipating smoke revealing the small body parts of the shadow monsters had somehow survived.
But they were all dead, this was a fact now that he observed it.
And so with that… came the rewards.
[You have slain "Shadow Bear lv93", gained 113432EXP!]
[You have slain "Shadow Bear lv93", gained 109381EXP!]
[You have slain "Shadow Bear lv93", gained 114403EXP!]
.
.
.
This went on for the fifteen [Shadow Bears] he had killed, then the panels moved to the other monster.
[You have slain "Shadow Bird lv95", gained 124019EXP!]
[You have slain "Shadow Bird lv95", gained 122387EXP!]
[You have slain "Shadow Bird lv95", gained 123312EXP!]
.
.
.
And so he received an incredible amount of experience.
Because with all of this…
[+2,435,279 Experience Points!]
This was beyond anything he had ever earned, even against the Corrupted Ghoul or Sierra.
But…
'Not enough…' for the first time, Stark squinted his eyes and his expression was filled with worry, 'Not even close…' his eyes were burning with aura as he was surrounded not once, not twice, BUT THRICE, by the golden glow.
[Your level has increased to level 36, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 37, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 38, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Experience: 683778/834000]
'…' Stark truly wanted to feel happy at this very moment, after all, it was the sigh that he was closer to his goal than he believed.
Maybe five or six more encounters like this one, and he could reach even level 45?!
But… something else came to break that hope.
[Classifier A has reached level 50, conditions for 'Domination Trial' have been met!]
[8/10 classifiers have reached the needed level, be quick or else when everybody but you reaches level 50, you will still be teleported!]
[Only one classifier remains before teleportation!]
So basically… it was a battle between Stark and Classifier B.
[Classifier B: 48/50]
That guy must be currently laughing while slaying monsters, knowing that whatever he did, he would always reach level 50 before Stark.
At the end of the day, it was a battle of determination, and Stark was clearly losing it.
'I can't win…' a vortex yet again formed in Stark's eyes as he thought deeply, 'The only thing I can do is cut my losses as much as possible…'
Being the person with the lowest level inside the 'Domination Trial' was always a death wish as you would be outclassed by both monsters and others, meaning that they could betray you.
And in comparison to the first trial, which awaited for all of them to reach level 15, this one seemed… more cruel…?
It was basically forcing someone to be the scapegoat of the group: and currently that person was Stark.
'FUCK, GET YOURSELF TOGETHER,' he slapped both his cheeks as he greeted his teeth, 'JUST KEEP TRYING…!'
And so he began reading through the mist as fast as he could, this was a matter of life and death now, and all the other classifiers that had reached level 50 were probably all sitting back and waiting for the last one to reach the needed level.
He could feel their laughter, he could feel their mockery…
'…' and Stark hated that, he refused to be the weakest one.
HE REFUSED TO LET THOSE FUCKERS TAKE HIM OVER!
Not today, not in this rift, not even during the domination trial, he would NEVER back down, and he would NEVER let himself get trampled on.
Because at the end of the day… he was still the [Domination] user with the highest potential of them all, wasn't he?

chapters.title: Chapter 150 - 150: Reaching the Boss Area of the River!
chapters.content:
[Your level has increased to level 39, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
After a few minutes, Stark encountered two more [Shadow Bears], which were easily disposed off and allowed him to continue walking through the rift.
There was no reason to keep waiting around these parts, he did that for a moment yet no monster was coming out of the river, meaning he needed to advance.
At this point, Stark just wanted to reach the boss to gain a big amount of experience as a last resort before being teleported, there was no other solution as [Classifier B] was already level 49, and he sure as hell wasn't going to wait for him as he didn't care.
The other 9 classifiers could also probably also check his level, so it was even funnier to ruin him like that.
'...' Stark didn't mind, he just needed to reach level 40 at least, and then it wouldn't matter much anymore as he would just need to try harder than any of them.
[You have slain a "Shadow Wolf lv96", gaining 131029EXP!]
[You have slain a "Giant Shadow Beetle lv94, gaining 119282EXP!]
[You have slain a "Shadow Fish lv93", gaining 112440EXP!]
.
.
.
[Experience: 728312/843000]
'One more...' he only needed one more monster before reaching level 40, and then what would need to happen would happen, he didn't have any control over it anymore.
But surprisingly...
'Where are the monsters,' it had been a few minutes, and for the first time the river didn't send anything at him.
~TAP, TAP~
'Where...' a few minutes passed while Stark traversed the mist, which seemed to become denser as he continued.
But no signs of monsters anymore.
It was almost like...
[The River doesn't feel like stopping you anymore, directly fight the boss!]
As expected, the fact the river mobilized most of its resources (monsters) at the start of the rift because of the sheer amount of classifiers there, plus the fact Stark would just kill anything that it sent, resulted in the river not seeing any point in wasting beasts on that boy.
Basically... having him fight and die at the boss is the best solution for it, which is why it stopped.
'WHY SO CLOSE...!' for the first time since entering this rift, Stark was angry, he had been so close, and now he was forced to waste more time and risk more just to level up once.
His luck was terrible, no matter how you think about it.
[Follow the river to reach the boss area]
As if mocking him, a panel appeared and explained exactly what he needed to do.
[I would hurry if I was you.]
[Classifier B: Level 49/50]
'...'
Stark sighed and began to run next to the river.
And just as expected, that shitty river didn't bother sending a single additional monster.
"You're soooo scared, aren't you!?" Stark tried to taunt it several times while running.
"Aura Smash," he even sent some attacks, but they just disappeared into the abyss of the water.
He almost felt crazy talking to an inanimate object and expecting it to follow what he wanted it to do with the threat of violence.
"Look at you, pathetic river, you are WEAK!" he almost had the silly idea of jumping inside the water and looking for the monsters inside himself, but in retrospect it did seem very dumb.
~FWISH, SPLASH~
In response to all his insults and attacks though, the river of souls actually responded by sending a large chunk of black water toward the boy, hitting him straight on as he didn't expect that.
'...' the water that touched him actually had some souls faces on it, but there was no strange feeling whatsoever, except for of course the feeling of being wet, 'Sigh...'
Stark couldn't really fight a river (although he would have loved to), so he just kept going forward, sensing that the boss area was close.
The river after the first attack began to repeatedly throw its water on Stark as to annoy him.
And honestly, it wouldn't have bothered him if not for ONE simple thing.
[Hit by 'Souls Water', slowed for ten seconds...]
Each time he was hit by that black water, he would receive the 'slow' effect, which massively reduced his speed and could make him go from running at full speed to just slowly walking toward his destination.
It was as if... the river knew that he couldn't afford to waste a single second, yet still tried to fuck him over.
The faces of souls on the reflection of the water could be seen laughing repeatedly.
'...!'
[Do not leave the river, or else the mist will completely disorient you!]
And in addition to that, if he left the river for even one second out of his view while heading toward the mist, it would disappear and take time to find his way back again.
Basically... this rift was possibly the worst match ever in this situation.
'If only I could see another monster...' Stark's anger grew more as he continued to run, avoiding the rays of water sent from the river.
[You are close...]
But right as this panel appeared, another one did as well to shatter those futile hopeful thoughts of his.
[Classifier B is 350,000EXP away from leveling up!]
'FUCK THAT SHIT,' he increased the tempo and now was so fast the river couldn't even hit him.
Yet, it wouldn't summon ANY monsters, and the face of the souls were still laughing, their laughter sounding muffled from beyond the water, yet still hearable from Stark's position.
But...
[You have arrived.]
Right before him stood a 10x10 meters circular hole, that same black water with faces staring at him, although those weren't laughing.
[Boss Area: The Pond of Souls]
[JUMP!]
Under normal circumstances, Stark would have hesitated jumping inside of a suspicious looking pool of water to reach somewhere.
But...
'...' this time, Stark didn't hesitate for even a single second.
The moment he spotted the water, and the crimson panels instructed him on what to do, he immediately focused his entire mind on the task ahead and jumped inside of the [Pond of Souls].
~FWISH~
The moment he did, a weird feeling took over his body as it felt like cold hands were grabbing him: and they were.
When he looked down, he saw white ghost-like hands come from the abyss below and grab his legs/knees, pulling him down.
Stark didn't resist for a single second, letting himself sink as to not waste time.
~FWISH~
He was pulled by the hands very fast, traversing the very deep black water without any issues, and reaching the abyss in a matter of seconds without even feeling dizzy or scared.
Stark was truly locked in.

chapters.title: Chapter 151 - 151: Soulayer, The Bearer of Souls
chapters.content:
The descent seemed endless, the only source of light being the faint glow emanating from the hands that dragged him down.
Stark could feel a sense of unease creeping into his mind, but he pushed it aside, focusing on the task at hand.
Finally, after what felt like an eternity, the hands released him, and he found himself standing on solid ground once more.
Before him lay a vast expanse of darkness and mist, broken only by the shimmering reflection of the moon on the surface of the water.
The air was heavy with a sense of foreboding, and Stark could feel a chill run down his spine as he took a few steps forward, absolutely no hesitation in what he was doing.
Much like when he fought the [Black Water Devourer], this Boss Area's ground was completely made out of that black water with faces on it, stretching for what seemed endless.
The gray mist could also be seen ahead, but it surrounded Stark not in the way that it blocked his vision, but as if it was delimiting the area of the arena.
The space he was in currently had no mist or even anything to be honest, the mist formed a circular wall around him and that was all.
[Do not go into the mist, or instant game over]
'…'
[Classifier B: Level 49/50]
[Classifier B is roughly 200,000EXP away from leveling up!]
'…' Stark's eyes expression was unchanged, and the notifications of the other classifier almost leveling up only served as a way for Stark to concentrate even more.
[Boss Area: The Pond of Souls…]
[Good luck!]
'I don't need luck, show me that boss and I'm killing it.'
~STEP, SPLASH, STEP, SPLASH~
Each one of his steps echoed in the vast emptiness of the Boss Area, creating ripples on the black water beneath him.
Stark looked up at the moon.
'…Of course,' the big white moon wasn't normal either, instead there was a giant face on it, resembling the ones of the souls beneath him.
The faces on the black water seemed to contort and twist, their expressions morphing into grotesque forms that seemed to follow Stark's every move.
And after around thirty seconds…
IT appeared.
A deafening roar pierced through the stillness of the Pond of Souls, causing Stark to grit his teeth and ready himself for what was to come.
Emerging from the depths of the black water was a massive creature, its form shrouded in darkness and malevolence.
The Boss monster towered over Stark, its eyes glowing with a sinister light as it fixated on its prey.
When all the aura and water disappeared… Stark could finally what it looked like.
And… well…
[Soulayer (Soul Slayer), The Bearer of Souls (BOSS)]
Standing at four meters tall, the monster had a humanoid figure but was completely covered in bandages except for its head, legs, and arms which were protected by a shadow armor with only a small opening for its eyes.
The bandages were pitch-black and adorned with moving faces that seemed to watch Stark closely.
'The faces are moving…?' Stark could see that the dozens of mouths and eyes on the bandages were moving.
Around its neck hung a giant jar containing three green spheres that spun around.
But what caught Stark's attention the most was the boss's weapon.
It wasn't fancy magic at first glance, but… a sword?
It was a black two-handed great sword, almost as large as the boss itself and emitting an ominous aura that could rival even Stark's own power.
Its design was unusual, being more than three inches thick in the middle and not tapering off at the end for sharpness.
It was clear that this sword was meant for powerful strikes rather than stabbing.
And the boss wielded it with ease, twirling it around as if it weighed nothing.
The boss's eyes burned with crimson aura, leaving a visible trail beyond the small opening of the shadow helmet, and the bandages around it also began to shake as its eyes fell on the human.
'…' Stark's expression faltered for the first time, he couldn't keep calm in front of this thing, which seemed to not even acknowledge him as a worthy opponent.
The shine of the moon hit both Stark and the boss, creating a beautiful scenery around them as their bodies reflected on the water.
If it wasn't for the fact they would fight to the death, then there would surely have been a great moment to enjoy.
'…'
'…'
Soulayer and Stark looked at one another, before the former raised his massive sword, then pointing it at Stark, announcing the start of the fight.
[Classifier B is roughly 120,000EXP away from leveling up!]
A crimson panel came to bring Stark back to reality, it was a reminder of the harsh things that awaited him if he didn't get rid of Soulayer before the other person leveled up.
And so Stark's expression went back to its unusual cold self, his eyes empty and almost lifeless as his thoughts were now clouded with the idea of getting rid of this boss as fast as possible.
'Perception…' Stark decided to immediately analyze the boss, that thing was truly out of this world, well he probably was since the process of getting to this place was basically to jump into an unknown pit and getting dragged by hands, but oh well.
…
[Name: Soulayer, The Bearer of Souls (BOSS)]
[Level: 100]
[HP: 420000]
[Strength: 5128]
[Stamina: 4732]
[Speed: 3901]
[Defense: 4436]
[Skills: Soul Strike, Reap Spirit, Soul Wall, Abyssal Roar, Shadow Step, Death's Embrace, Eternal Darkness, The Three Ultimate Souls, Sword Counter…]
…
'Why me…' Stark sulked after reading its status window, it was even stronger than the [Corrupted Ghoul], and it seemed to have absolutely no intention to let Stark kill it easily.
In a battle against time, how could Stark even hope of killing that monster, with HP and strength beyond anything he had fought before.
But lamenting your misfortune wasn't the solution.
For now… Stark just needed to try.
To hell with that 'Domination Trial', he'll clear it even at level 10 (or maybe not, heh).
"ABYSSAL ROAR~" Soulayer suddenly shouted with his face toward the sky, creating some supersonic shockwaves, that shook the entirety of the arena, making the water tremble.
…
[Skill: Abyssal Roar]
[Description: Doesn't do much except to announce that 'Soulayer' will be fighting with his full abilities, he only uses this skill at the start of battles with opponents he believes are worthy.]
[Note: Soulayer has only used this skill seven times up until now, so it is both an honor, but also terrifying to hear his scream.]
…
[3…]
Soulayer finished his weird shouting then stared back at Stark, his greatsword held behind his back.
[2…]
'Domination…!' Stark's determination didn't falter as he activated his skill and positioned himself.
[1…]
Both warriors looked at one another with the clear intent to eliminate the other party.
[FIGHT!]
It was now or never for Stark, there was no second try or anything that could help him out.
From now on, it is but pure skill, pure technique, and pure determination.
Even among those that would participate in the trial with him, just how many would face this monster with not a single ounce of fear?
Probably none… except for Stark himself.
[Eliminate that damn edge lord before Classifier B gets to level 50!]

chapters.title: Chapter 152 - 152: The Power of Soulayer
chapters.content:
'...'
Soulayer was the first to take a step toward Stark, the water beneath his feet creating a small wave as it was infused with powerful aura.
The area around them was filled with tension.
'...'
Stark would have loved to immediately dash toward Soulayer in the hope of killing it quick, but no matter how much he thought about it, THAT thing was ready for any of his attacks, basically, he needed to find an opportunity and then deal the maximum amount of damage to it.
"SOUL STRIKE...!" and so before Stark could even finish thinking, Soulayer suddenly dashed toward the boy, closing the distance between in less than a second.
Some souls inside of the water emerged from below and placed themselves around the edges of the greatsword, as if covering it to give more power.
And they did, which is why it's called [Soul Strike].
~FWISH~
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" Stark couldn't afford to try a [Perfect Dodge] with such a powerful attack as it was suicide, so he just rolled away, and the sword fazed right through him, surprising Soulayer.
A trail of white/green aura emitted from the sword as it swung, that aura was filled with the faces of the souls, all tortured.
'...' Soulayer didn't back down, though, he always liked to overwhelm his enemies before they could even do anything.
"AURA SMASH," wanting to takes2 advantage of that momentum, Stark sent two crimson fists at the dashing boss.
But...
"SOUL WALL!" Soulayer placed the tip of the sword on the water, then swung it upward.
~VRAM~
A wall of black water, filled with many souls again, appeared before him.
~BOOM, BOOM~
"-0! -0!"
The water, as well as the souls, received the damage and completely blocked the two crimson fists from reaching the boss.
"SHADOW STEP!" suddenly, Soulayer used this skill while still behind the wall.
But that was something Stark didn't know, so he just waited for the wall to go down to spot the boss.
~FWISH, VIOUM~
But once the wall of black water went down... Soulayer was nowhere to be seen?
'Huh?' Stark was confused, how could he possibly disappear out of nowhere…?
[Behind you...]
Soulayer was so precise and fast that even [Focus] took a few moments to notice where he was, and the moment it did, it warned Stark.
"...?!"
Stark turned his head, and saw that Soulayer was already there, his greatsword centimeters away from Stark's neck, the aura of the souls so close he himself could feel it.
Stark's pupils shook violently as time slowed down around him: that boss was too fast.
~BAMMM~
The boss was able to hit because he took Stark by surprise, and it shook its head, disappointed in Stark for dying so fast.
But...
[The Purgatory Shadow took the hit in your place]
The shadow version of Stark came out of the ring and took the hit of the greatsword.
But the real one was still sent away by the knock back of the attack as it was too strong.
~SLAM~
He was sent very far, crashing against the water repeatedly.
[Behind you...]
[Focus] warned him again, and Stark almost shit himself thinking that Soulayer was behind again.
But this time, [Focus] had warned him because of something else: the mist.
He was getting dangerously close to the mist while still being knocked back.
'SHIT...' he knew touching it was game over, so Stark gripped the ground beneath the water to stop his momentum.
~SLIDE, FWISHH~
And when it finally stopped... he saw that he had been only a meter away from entering the grey mist.
'FUCK...' he dashed in Soulayer's direction.
He didn't panic, but his time was getting really short.
[Classifier B is 50,000 EXP away from reaching level 50]
[Critical warning, I would really advise you to kill the boss before he reaches level 50]
'FUCK YOU...' Stark's face began to be covered by his crimson aura again, his eyes burning too, 'FUCK YOU FUCK YOU FUCK YOU...'
In less than a fraction of a second, he closed the distance between him and Soulayer.
"...!" even the boss seemed surprised as its eyes behind the mask clearly squinted, and its aura faltered for a bit.
But...
"Shadow STEP..." it slowly moved one of its legs, and beneath it formed some black aura that resembled a moving shadow.
~FWISH~
It was so quick that it almost teleported behind Stark, already swinging its sword at him again.
"SOUL STRIKE!" the power of the souls was stronger, and this time Stark couldn't be saved by a piece of equipment.
Yet Stark's expression didn't change, and his pupils were already perfectly following Soulayer as it shadow-stepped behind him.
~SWING~
And so when the edges of the greatsword were mere millimeters away from cutting Stark in half...
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" he had decided to actually take the risk as it was his only way to gain the advantage.
And it seemed to be the right call, as...
[Perfect Dodge!]
The world around Stark turned gray, and time slowed down so much that Stark could see Soulayer's sword faze through him thanks to the invincibility frames.
'...'
Right in front of him, only a few centimeters ahead, was Soulayer's determined and soulless gaze, watching the human, and even the trail of crimson aura coming out of the small hole of his helmet was slowed down.
'…!' and when he saw that, he figured a way that could make him do lots of damage.
Hitting Soulayer, even in this slow mode world, wouldn't do any type of relevant damage because of his sheer defense and HP pool, meaning that Stark would need to cause huge amounts of damage at once, enough to cause the [Dominated] status to the boss, or to at least cripple him.
But it didn't mean Stark couldn't do at least some damage…
~SPIN, KICK~
Using Soulayer's body as a platform, he used his knees to spin around and kick the boss in the chin while focusing his aura onto his legs.
"-42919!" surprisingly, the damage was still very high, or maybe it was because the chin was one of Soulayer's weaknesses?
"CRIMSON SPEARS," and while the boss was beginning to get sent upward because of the powerful kick, Stark summoned his three spears and sent them all toward it.
Respectively toward: its leg, torso, and… neck!
The first two spears hit the boss without any issues, and it didn't even try to defend them.
"-24726! -25012!"
But for the last…
"CRAKKARR~" it suddenly roared again, then placed one of its shadow armored arms in front of the jar holding the three green spheres.
"-12931!" it did less damage because of the armor which blocked most of the damage.
The spear, although it was headed toward the neck, was still going to have to destroy the jar to pass through.
But that meant…
'Is that jar important…?' Stark's eyes widened and he mischievously smiled.
Stark wanted to make use of everything to win… and this was jackpot.
~SPLASH~
Soulayer dropped stylishly onto the ground, then immediately checked the jar and the three spears, his expression, although it wasn't visible, softening when he made sure they were safe.
But that calm was only but temporary, as the moment he checked, his turned his head back to Stark, and the aura around him became ten times as strong.
It was both crimson, but it also had the faces of souls repeatedly going upward on it.
He truly deserved his name: The Bearer of Souls.
And now that he was mad… it wasn't fun time anymore.
"REAP SPIRIT, ETERNAL DARKNESS," these weren't his ultimate skills, yet they were just as terrifying.
Stark just smiled as he positioned himself again, ready to take it all, plus, he already had a plan in mind to take care of that boss.

chapters.title: Chapter 153 - 153: Silent Killing in the Darkness
chapters.content:
"REAP SPIRIT, ETERNAL DARKNESS," after Soulayer entered [Enraged] mode as Stark tried to hit the jar between its neck, it suddenly activated two skills.
…
[Skill: Reap Spirit]
[Description:] Soulayer can harvest the souls of fallen foes to strengthen itself during battle, however there is a limit to that, and the backlash it receives can be very high if it uses too much power
…
[Skill: Eternal Darkness]
[Description:] Plunges the world into darkness, giving it an incredible advantage as it is used to fight in the dark because of the [Soul Graveyard] rift.
…
'Soul Graveyard…?' was what confused Stark the most, doesn't that mean this monster was in another much more powerful rift, yet came to this one and became a boss.
In the end, he didn't have the time to think too much about it since…
"REAP SPIRIT," Soulayer kneeled down, then put both of its arms inside of the black water.
~FWISH, FWISH~
Souls started rushing toward it like a black hole, swirling around its arms before entering its body.
The aura around it also steadily began to go from crimson to full on greenish.
The ground beneath them trembled slightly as the souls were being absorbed at an alarming rate.
And once it finished that, its body emitted waves of soul aura that could make most classifiers at its level faint.
Then without wasting a single second…
"ETERNAL DARKNESS!" Soulayer's muffled and incomprehensible voice echoed through the area as everything around them was engulfed in pitch-black darkness.
Everything around Stark became pitch-black, and it was truly impossible to see even one centimeter in front of you.
Basically… this battle was now in full-on darkness, where none of the opponents knew where which one was, and where attacking from behind could grant you immediate victory.
'CLONE FRENZY!' as soon as he was engulfed by the darkness, Stark summoned his three clones, positioning them around the area.
He couldn't see them because of how dark it was, but he could sense their auras, and it also gave him three additional pairs of eyes as they would alert him if they saw the boss.
[Focus] didn't work, and he couldn't sense any aura from the boss, this skill was certainly something he'd never faced before, but he had to adapt quickly.
But as he thought of that…
"DEATH'S EMBRACE!" Stark had a bad feeling, but when he looked behind, he found nothing.
'…?'
~SCRWITCH, SLASH~
"-83719!" it wasn't him that sensed it, but one of his clones, and it died.
…
[Skill: Death's Embrace]
[Description:] Do not let him catch you in the darkness.
…
For a moment, Stark froze.
The loss of one of his clones was unexpected and unsettling, especially since Soulayer was supposed to not be able to see as well, right?!
~SCRWITCH, SLASH~
"-90310!" yet another one of his clones was caught by Soulayer and killed.
But this time…
"AURA SMASH!" Stark sent three fists in the direction the clone had died.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
And all three hit as Soulayer was too busy holding onto the clone, thinking that it was Stark.
"-32812! -34019! -33124!" over 100K points of damage in one go, and this made Stark smiled: he still had one more clone, and it meant one more opportunity to deal damage.
