From the short amount of information he got from his clones though, it seemed like Soulayer had actually dropped his greatsword, or just unsummoned it, as he didn't have it equipped, instead he was just using his hands to catch his preys in the dark, almost like some horror movie villain.
It was a game of cat and mouse in the dark, where the mouse could only fight back using the little information it had available to it.
[Death's Embrace] combined to [Reap Spirit] massively increased Soulayer's speed, stealth, intelligence, and the aura around his hands was extremely overwhelming, small souls floating around it.
And now… it was looking for Stark, the real one that is.
'Hahahahahah…' Stark's grin widened as he knew exactly what to do.
He immediately dashed in the opposite direction to where the Soulayer and his clone were, making to stop right before the gray mist that could kill him.
And then…
'TRANSFER,' he focused his aura into his body, then his eyes, and sent all of it toward the eyes of the clone that was still in the mist.
And when he opened his eyes again… he found himself in the body of the clone.
'Nice…'
He knew that leaving his real body alone, with no way to know what would happen to it, but he put all the chances to his side when he knew that Soulayer was mostly in the area of the third clone, meaning it would be very unlikely for it to go toward Stark.
But just as Stark was about to start looking for Soulayer… he felt an intense aura right behind him.
[He is behind you…]
'=)' but this didn't scare Stark in the slightest, instead it actually was exactly what he wanted.
~FWISH~
Soulayer raised his soul-filled arms and tried to grab Stark's clone body to kill it from behind.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" but he just backed away, pinpointing the location of Soulayer as to not lose track of where he was.
And then…
"AURA SMASH… MERGE!" Stark began to charge up his crimson fists, forced to hold his right hand's wrist as to not immediately explode since the clones didn't have enough power or aura to actually send the attack.
But it didn't matter to begin with, since… Stark planned to do a [Clone Suicide]… this was his plan to deal massive damage.
"…" even through the darkness of it all, Stark could somehow sense Soulayer getting closer and closer, attempting to take the boy from behind again.
He was like a true assassin, and so it did make Stark wonder just what the hell happened inside the [Soul Graveyard] rift for a monster (or possibly human?) to turn into a rift boss…?
'…'
~FWISH~
Soulayer was already behind Stark once he charged up his [Aura Smash] attack to its maximum, any more and it would explode.
'GOTCHA!' was what Soulayer must have probably thought as it reached to grab Stark's torso and began to tear it apart.
But…
"IDIOT~" Stark turned his head toward Soulayer, a grin so malicious and wicked on it that even the boss trembled slightly when seeing it, sending a shiver down its spine.
And then… what had to happen happened.
~FWISHHHH~
Even though the clone's body was being thorn to shreds by the soul hands of the boss, its body suddenly became to bloom with an unimaginable aura, an aura that could blow anyone away who was unlucky enough to be caught in the radius.
This was [Clone Suicide].
~BOOOOOMM~
The boss was sent very far away, and some of the bandages around its body parts were burned by the sheer power of the attack.
In addition to that, it couldn't defend itself much since it prioritized putting its arms in front of the jar to protect it.
"-192713!" the damage was out of this world, and even Soulayer was affected by such an attack, forcing it to deactivate both [Eternal Darkness] and [Reap Spirit].
Suddenly, the arena went back to normal, and the Stark that was hiding in the corner woke up again as the consciousness of the real one took over again.
[Soulayer HP: 64663/420000]
It truly was the final showdown now, and Stark felt confident as he still had a bit of time on his hand.
Or did he now…
~DING~
[Classifier B has reached level 50!]
'…!'

chapters.title: Chapter 154 - 154: The Final Participant is being Watched
chapters.content:
~DING~
[Classifier B has reached level 50!]
'SHIT…!'
It was all over now, and Stark even stopped everything he was doing, ending his assault on Soulayer as there was no point anymore.
[9/10 classifiers have reached the required level for the start of the 'Domination Trial']
Soulayer summoned back his sword in hand, then began to slowly walk toward Stark, he seemed extremely mad, and the bandages hit by the explosion were still burnt: it definitely looked like Soulayer was more fearful and uncertain than before though as he hesitated to approach Stark.
But Stark wasn't paying attention to him.
[But that wouldn't be fun to just teleport you, now, would it?]
It wasn't his crimson panels that were talking to him when it was related to the domination trial, but crimson/black panels that had deep eyes staring in the background beyond the text.
Was it the eyes of the entity that was responsible for those trials?
The creator of the [Domination] class?
In the end, it didn't matter much, as the finality of it all was that everyone but Stark had already reached level 50, the latter only being at level 39, a far cry from all the others.
[The person that hasn't reached the required level is going to receive a punishment!]
Stark lifted his gaze toward the panel, then raised his eyebrows, 'Punishment…?'
This was already bad to begin with, how could this even get worse?!
~DING~
And so… while Soulayer was still walking toward Stark…
[You will be teleported to the 'Domination Trial' after completing this battle]
'…!' Stark's eyes widened, this was incredible news for him.
But of course, life wouldn't be this easy.
[But in exchange, you will receive two punishments!]
[The first: all participants of the trial will be watching your fight from now on]
[Have fun!]
[The second punishment for being the last shall come once the trial start =)]
All 9 participants that were dispersed not only in Fellarburg, but throughout the entire world of Rheria, each in their respective rooms/baths/luxury suits, reading the panels as they appeared.
And then before them… appeared a screen that showed live footage of Stark against Soulayer.
"Oh~" some of them smiled as they increased the size of the screen to enjoy the view, interested in Stark's abilities.
"Hah! Let's hope that loser doesn't die before the trial starts," another sipped his wine before grinning.
"Useless… he is weak…" another one, confined in the darkness of his room, sighed, not interested one bit in the weakest person of them all.
After all, only the weakest would still be at level 39 after a while, wouldn't he be, or at least that's what each of them believed.
They MOCKED Stark as they stared at their screens, almost hoping that he survived this battle so that they could torture him even harder inside the trial.
Back to Stark, the implications of this punishment were clear: it wasn't humiliation to show to all the others around that he was the last.
No… the real goal of showing his fight against Soulayer was to…
Show his skills to them all.
Even during the first 'Domination Trial', information was key, and so hiding your skills was just as important as the fights themselves, after all… just one simple skill could be enough to turn the tides of a battle if they betrayed him (which they probably will).
[Do not, under any circumstances, use any of your strong skills.]
It was himself that summoned this panel, as if to let the thoughts sink onto his consciousness.
And so Stark needed to make a list of the only skills he couldn't use against the weakened boss to not reveal too much info.
'Double Assault, Heaven's Wrath, Clone Frenzy, Aura Smash and Dodge Control…' he thought to himself, these were the skills he would never reveal to them right now, although using them at this very moment would probably end the battle easily.
[Crimson Spears] could be revealed to them as he didn't use it much anyway, and [Invincible Dodge] was pretty much a passive, so they wouldn't understand how it worked anyway.
But that also left one thing he could use to win his battle: the potions, after all, they would just think that he bought them!
"I hope all of you losers are watching," he looked to his right, his determined expression right in front of the camera as he grinned, all 9 other participants looking at his semi-handsome face, "I'll teach you all what real strength is."
Beyond the screens, some were laughing, others intrigued, while the rest kept their neutral expressions.
All of them, for some reason, felt like this very moment would play a huge part in the trial later.
"CRIMSON SPEARS!" he summoned his three spears right behind him, then aimed them at Soulayer, who simply kept walking, his expression even more lifeless than before, one of his arms holding the jar with the green spheres, while the other had the greatsword equipped, its aura much more powerful than before.
But when he sent all three spears toward the monster…
"SWORD COUNTER!" with movement so fast it wasn't visible to the naked eye, it removed its arm from the jar and placed it on the handle of the sword, placing it sideways right below its eyes, which were still burning with crimson aura.
Soulayer waited for the perfect opportunity, and when the spears were right in front of him, he held the handle of his sword tighter and swung it thrice in a motion so smooth it always looked slow from afar.
Then…
~FWING, FWING, FWING~
As the skill said, Soulayer countered Stark's attack by sending it back to him.
'Shit…!'
~FWISH, FWISH~
He avoided the first two quite easily, but the third almost hit him, which forced him to…
'Invincible Dodge,' use his skill at the last second.
[Perfect Dodge!]
'Huh…?' the world around turned gray, and Stark was actually able to see it all go very slowly.
Didn't this mean that even if it was his own attacks, as long as it was the enemy itself that attempted to attack him, then [Perfect Dodge] would work…?
This could be useful later, so Stark made sure to remember that.
'Ok… no other option it seems,' he sighed, [Invincible Dodge]'s perfect dodge gave him around fifteen seconds of free time to think, and that was enough for Stark to reach his conclusion.
'Crimson Spears' wouldn't work, and he couldn't use any of his skills as to not reveal them except if it was really needed.
So now… all he could use were his fist and… potions!
'SPATIAL INVENTORY,' he put his arm inside of the inventory void, then pulled out five [Crystal Stun] potions, as well as one [Potion of Strength]and one [Potion of Speed].
He drank the two latter as to allow him to get a boost, then breathe in and out as he was about to put the plan he thought of since the beginning of the battle into action.
And worst: in front of 9 of the people he would be fighting with/against inside the second 'Domination Trial'.
Such a trivial thing didn't increase Stark's pressure or change his expression one bit though, after all… all that mattered was for him to win, the rest would be all up to him and the others.
And so, it wasn't only Stark that was getting ready, but also the boss…
"THE THREE ULTIMATE SOULS!" he activated his true ultimate skill.
[They are watching us, show them that they never stood a chance to begin with =)]

chapters.title: Chapter 155 - 155: The Three Ultimate Souls
chapters.content:
"THE THREE ULTIMATE SOULS!" Soulayer used his final and ultimate skill, wanting to end this battle as he already had suffered too much damage by the hands of this kid.
He dropped his greatsword, making it splash against the water, then pulled up the string that was holding the jar around his neck.
That jar was as big as his hands, and he held in both of his, his expression yet again softening.
Soulayer immediately shook his head and quickly glanced at Stark, then he shut his eyes and began to turn the lid of the jar, his expression darkening after each twist.
As the jar twisted, Soulayer's eyes began to glow with an intense crimson aura, and the water in the giant pond began to ripple at the sight of this powerful display.
"Die!" Soulayer roared, his muffled voice echoing through the area as he flung the opened jar forward, sending a wave of crimson energy surging around him.
But right as that happened…
Nine screens appeared around Stark.
[They are watching.]
Each of these screens showed the figure of one of the 9 participants of the trial, every single one of them observing the fight with great interest.
Stark couldn't see their faces as their figures with pitch-black, obviously, but their eyes, all burning with different colored auras, could be seen from beyond the crimson screens.
Their judgmental stares indicated that they knew Stark could now see them, and it seemed to make them enjoy that situation even more: after all, HE was the weak one, not them.
"Feeling hopeless yet~?" he saw one of the figures move its mouth, but couldn't hear the words it said.
"Hurry up and die, I want to start the trial," another sighed.
"SHOW MEEEE WHATTT YOUU'VEEE GOOTTT!" some kind of motivator shouted while doing signs.
'I hope you all keep that same attitude when I'm there,' Stark maniacally smiled before turning his attention back to Soulayer, who had seemingly freed the three green spheres that he had been protecting inside the jar all this time.
It was his ultimate skill, so he needed to be careful.
"ABYSSAL ROAR~" Soulayer roared again (for no reason), and this second one was… way stronger than the first.
This could only mean one thing: Soulayer acknowledged Stark as the strongest opponent he had fought yet.
'Appreciate it,' Stark kept smiling as he positioned his fists in front of his face, 'But I'm still killing you…!'
The three spheres inside the jar left it once opened and began to swirl around Soulayer, creating a dark and ominous aura that seemed to engulf him completely.
The crimson glow suddenly turned green again, almost as if Soulayer was absorbing the power of those spheres…
And he was.
…
[Skill: The Three Ultimate Souls]
[Description: The souls of Soulayer's friends who died inside the 'Soul Graveyard' rift, they are his strongest souls and most precious ones, if the battle goes bad for him, he will activate this skill and release those souls to aid him.]
[I do not wish for anyone to experience this.]
…
And just as it said… three green ghost-like figures appeared around Soulayer, spinning around him.
One was a woman, and two were men, their faces were devoid of any feature, and they had no hair either, it was impossible to identify them.
Yet… Soulayer's determination when his friends were around him almost tripled, and he grabbed his sword again.
~FWISH~
One of the male souls surrounded the entire greatsword and a powerful green outline appeared.
~FWISH~
The second male headed toward Soulayer's second arm and created another sword, identical to the first one, yet its texture completely green.
And finally…
~FWISH~
The soul of the woman gently held onto Soulayer's neck and peeked at Stark from behind his shoulders.
'…' Stark wasn't deterred, and such an emotional or powerful skill wouldn't stop him for murdering that boss.
Soulayer was now stronger, faster, and also had two swords, but it didn't matter.
'Two or three hits and he's done…' Stark only thought of the positive in this situation.
"Holy… that thing is strong!"
"Looks like that guy is going to die before even reaching the trial, what went through his mind to attempt this at his level?!"
"Probably too desperate to level up, heh~"
The other participants, who's screens were still around Stark, spoke, even they could sense that boss was abnormally strong.
The soulless Soulayer, and his soul friends, advanced toward Stark, one step at a time.
'Okay, Stark…' the boy slapped his cheeks, 'You can only use your fists, nothing else, you can do it…'
He was getting ready, not using his skills was something he had never done before, but maybe it was time to actively train to not rely on them?
~FWISH, DASH~
Surprisingly, Stark was the one who began dashing toward the boss.
He was holding on to his five [Crystal Stun] potions with his hands, ready to use them at any time: they were his grace, his solution, and his only true plan to win.
Yeah, okay, maybe that wasn't ONLY using your fists and aura, but who cares, he could use as many of these potions as he wanted in battle, right?
~FWISH~
Stark jumped when he was around three meters away from the walking Soulayer, his face full of determination.
'TAKE THIS,' he threw one of his potions toward Soulayer, who didn't even bother avoiding it.
~CRACK~
It hit him straight on, and the mist began to surround its body, and yet…
[Soulayer is unaffected by the mist]
'FUCK…!' here goes his plan.
~FWISH~
Wanting to make sure, Stark threw another one while still beginning to fall down, this time aiming it at his shoulder.
Stark expected him to yet again do nothing as he took a stance, ready to battle the human.
But…
"SWORD COUNTER," almost as if panicked by the potion, Soulayer used his skill to throw the potion back at Stark.
~CRACK~
It exploded on him, but of course, Stark was unaffected by the mist too.
'…!' many people would identify such an action as the boss wanting to not get hit again.
But to Stark… it meant something big, and it could definitely help him win.
He had figured it out, and a light bulb shone in his head as he remembered the actions of Soulayer.
Why would he suddenly defend himself when the potion was headed toward his shoulder…?
What was around his shoulder that he needed to defend?
And so with that logic, the answer came fast: it was the soul of the woman that was hiding behind.
Meaning… Soulayer was defending them.
Stark would make sure to take advantage of that.
"SOUL STRIKE!" Soulayer roared again as he dashed at Stark, ready to cut the human alongside his soul friends.

chapters.title: Chapter 156 - 156: Mythical Skill: Soul Vortex
chapters.content:
"…"
"…"
"…"
All future participants of the Domination Trial looked at Soulayer as he dashed toward Stark, his expression more mad than ever after the boy seemingly attempted to harm his friend.
~SLASH, SLASH~
[Soul Strike] was used twice since one of the green spheres had turned into a greatsword too, making it increasingly difficult to avoid the precise blows of Soulayer.
And yet…
'A boss having emotions is weird… but It's what is going to send you to your death…' Stark avoided the slashes of the two swords quite easily, moving by a single step each time thanks to [Focus]'s warnings as it almost felt like Soulayer was recklessly attacking in all directions, in the hopes of one strike hitting Stark.
Through all that, the human boy kept a very composed face, and he almost… looked bored?
~FWISH~
And so when he saw an opportunity present itself…
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!"
[Perfect Dodge!]
Having two swords did indeed make it harder to dodge, but it wasn't impossible.
Actually… it might even be easier for one simple reason…
The world slowed down around Stark, and right above him, he could see the green greatsword that was formed from one of the 'ULTIMATE' souls slowly descend upon him.
'GOT YOU…!' Stark saw the line that showed an opportunity, and he immediately took it as he dashed forward, and grabbed the boss's legs.
'…?!' Soulayer was surprised as it almost looked like Stark teleported, but then quickly aimed the other greatsword at him.
Soulayer's weapons and figure were extremely big, that is true, but…
~SLAM~
Stark moved to the left the moment Soulayer struck the spot the boy was in, resulting in his sword splashing against the water.
Stark's goal wasn't to make the boss lose his balance, no…
Instead…
"GOT YOU…!" it was to make it impossible for him to counter what he was to do.
~THROW~
He grabbed one of his [Crystal Stun] potions and threw it toward the green greatsword.
The potion exploded upon impact and then…
[Soul A has been stunned]
[A soul cannot be stunned, Soul A is vanishing!]
And just as the panels said, the greatsword began to flicker before vanishing entirely.
One of Soulayer's friends was gone, and he couldn't do anything about it as attacking Stark made it impossible to react fast enough to break the potion.
'IT'S MY WIN,' Stark used this momentum to get to throw another potion, this time toward Soulayer's shoulders.
But…
"GROEIEREREAHAH!!!" he suddenly roared so loudly that the shockwave sent Stark flying in the opposite direction, and it even broke the two potions he was holding.
The loss of one of his friends had pushed Soulayer to the edge, and now he would make sure to kill the human.
But how could he do that when he was this weak, and clearly overwhelmed?
Well…
[Soulayer has acquired a new skill!]
'Huh…?' Stark's eyes widened, and his pupils were shaking.
A skill? Soulayer gained a new skill? How could that be possible? Can bosses do that?!
[Soulayer has acquired the 'MYTHICAL' skill: Soul Vortex!]
…
[Skill: Soul Vortex]
[Description: The bearer of souls, the one who has slain countless foes, can tap the black water with his sword and force the thousands of souls that rest there, in eternal torture, to surround both him and his enemy, forcing them to fight in an arena that is controlled by the slayer's desires.]
[Note: Touching the souls drains your life energy.]
…
"SOUL VORTEX!" Soulayer roared again before slamming the water with his sword vertically, almost as if he was trying to stab it.
And so the soul vortex appeared: thousands upon thousands of souls came out of the water and began to circle Stark and Soulayer like a vortex, spinning around them very fast.
Of course, the latter wasn't bothered as he was the one controlling the souls, but Stark on the other hand actually began to slightly panic.
'What… the… fuck…' he looked back at Soulayer, and saw that another hole opened in his shadow helmet: the place where his mouth was in is now visible, and Stark saw that he was massively grinning.
Soulayer wanted to avenge his now gone friend while keeping the other two with him.
But of course, this couldn't be possible, as it was either Stark or him.
"I'm sending you to hell with them," Stark gritted his teeth, and his face began to be surrounded by crimson aura too, he wasn't smiling anymore.
If [Soul Vortex] was a skill beyond even ULTIMATE or LEGENDARY, then all he needed to do was find a way to end this quickly.
The vortex of souls grew more intense, and Stark could feel the power seeping into him. The souls were not just spinning around them, but also drawing him and Soulayer closer with each passing moment as the circle was slowly closing in on them.
If Stark touched those souls, his life force would be absorbed, so slowly and surely…
~STEP, STEP~
He was approaching Soulayer.
~STEP, STEP~
It was almost as if Soulayer was creating an arena that is convenient to him as it meant Stark couldn't run away.
And to add fuel to this impossible fire Stark couldn't escape…
"ETERNAL DARKNESS!" he yet again spread his bandaged arms wide, and plunged the entire arena in darkness.
But the darkness this time was much more eerie, as although Stark couldn't physically see anything… the faces of the souls were still roaming in the dark, and he could see them all staring back at him.
[Focus…]
Stark closed his eyes.
Using his eyes in this space where he could see nothing was useless, so enhancing his other senses was much better.
Now, what could Stark do, he had no clones (and didn't want to use them to begin with) to distract Soulayer…
Out of pure habit, he began to draw a circle in his hand, and a crimson line was drawn where he aimed before pointing at the sky.
He wanted to use [Heaven's Wrath], as in such a closed arena, it would 100 percent hit Soulayer and kill him before he could do anything.
But there was a problem with this plan: the other participants were still watching, and so it would not only force him to use one of his legendary skills, but also another one as he would be forced to also use [Dodge Control] to get out of this situation without being harmed.
'FUCK…' he wanted to shout, but stopped as it would reveal his location, 'Ah…'
Stark grabbed his forehead, his head hurting from thinking too much, but after only three seconds, he lowered his arm, cancelling [Heaven's Wrath].
This wasn't the solution.
If even one of the other folks knew of his skills, they would predict what he could do in the trial and betray him more easily than anyone else.
And so his only other choice was to…
[Predict Soulayer's movement, he isn't invincible…]
He couldn't pinpoint where the boss went because [Eternal Darkness] blocked any kind of skill to show where the others were, and it also affected Soulayer as he was also forced to search through the darkness as well…
But maybe…
'Maybe instead of trying to focus on where Soulayer is… I should focus on what he could do in this situation…' Stark's eyes widened as he figured something out, 'Yes! This could work…'
And so he looked ahead of himself, in the position Soulayer was in only a few seconds ago.
'Figure out where he could be…' Stark repeated.
This time, it truly was the final showdown.

chapters.title: Chapter 157 - 157: Defeat of Soulayer and the Souls
chapters.content:
Stark couldn't hear Soulayer's steps, but he could imagine them near him as the boss searched the darkness for any signs of the boy.
He was in an enraged state, and wanted to end this battle as soon as possible: he didn't like to torment the souls, but they were needed for his victory this time.
On the other hand, Stark still had his eyes closed, focusing his attention on whatever he needed to do to survive this situation.
[Focus… and create the image of the enemy inside your head…]
He imagined Soulayer's figure in the spot it was in right before using [Eternal Darkness].
'It's working…!' Stark was surprised as even though he had his eyes closed now, he could actually see Soulayer right in front of his body, although that was just a copy from his imagination he wanted to use.
[Now… think of all the possibilities…]
And suddenly, almost as if he was using Judicator's eyes which allowed him to check out what an opponent could do, the figure of Soulayer suddenly turned into hundreds of after images: they showed Stark the many possibilities the enemy could follow up with.
This was only Stark's imagination and not concrete at all, obviously, but this was the best thing he could do in this very situation without risking getting slashed from behind.
"Wait a minute... behind...?"
And so… thanks to the visions of Soulayer's possible actions, Stark reached one simple conclusion…
'Spatial Inventory,' he grabbed another [Crystal Potion] from it.
And then, without a single second of hesitation, he swiftly and very smoothly threw the potion behind him, not even looking if there was anything there as he was this confident in his conclusion.
~CRACK, BOOM~
Through all his visions, Stark reached the simple conclusion that Soulayer would most likely already be behind him by now.
And it revealed itself to be true as the potion hit Soulayer's greatsword right as he was about to swing at the boy.
[Soul B has been stunned]
[A soul cannot be stunned, Soul B is vanishing!]
The ghastly green aura around the original greatsword of Soulayer vanished, much like his first friend, and he could do nothing but watch as the human yet again eliminated another one of his friends.
And now… the only soul that remained was the girl, still hiding behind his shoulder, her figure trembling as she knew what would happen if Stark hit her with one of his potions.
"CRIMSON SPEARS!" Stark used that opportunity to also send three spears at the boss.
~FWISH, FWISH, FWISH~
"-25382!" only one of them hit, but that was more than enough for Stark.
"GOROAOROOFHAH~" Soulayer yet again screamed, this time at least twice as loud as before.
His voice seemed to be in pain, but not from all the attacks…
"SOUL STRIKE!" he dashed at Stark from beyond the darkness and swung at him.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!"
[Perfect Dodge!]
Stark side-stepped to the side as Soulayer's greatsword missed him, then he immediately used his speed to run behind Soulayer and reach for his shoulder.
"GROOARRHHH~" Soulayer tried to hit Stark while he was behind his shoulder, but…
~SLASH~
"-27261!" all he did was cut his own flesh as he yet again missed the boy.
'He is weakening…' Stark thought, and it wasn't because he was losing the souls that powered him, more like… he was losing the will to continue fighting.
Somehow… this boss felt more human than the others.
[Eliminate him =)]
And yet…
'SPATIAL INVENTORY!'
Stark didn't seem to care much, solely guided by his aura, and it was absolutely ruthless.
~FWISH, THROW~
He could hear Soulayer's roars and chaotic movements as he slashed in all directions, hoping to get Stark.
But this only helped the boy perfectly aim his [Crystal Stun] potion and throw it in the direction of the noise.
~CRACK, BOOM~
He had obviously aimed for the shoulders of the boss… and…
He had hit his target.
[Soul C has been stunned]
[A soul cannot be stunned, Soul C is vanishing!]
But as the soul was slowly vanishing away from existence after being hit by the potion, it suddenly moved from its spot behind the boss's shoulders and placed itself in front of Soulayer, holding his head with its gentle hands.
"It is not… your… fault…" it used its last bit of energy to speak and smile at the boss.
Beyond his shadow helmet, crimson tears were already there, and Soulayer couldn't do anything but watch as his final friend disappeared.
~FWISH~
The ghastly body went up toward the sky, and when Soulayer looked up, he could see the green spheres of his friends spinning around, saying goodbye to him.
'…' Soulayer just stood there, falling on his knees.
His eyes became more lifeless than they were before, and he dropped his greatsword in the ground, not moving an inch.
Stark couldn't see anything, all he knew was that the noise had disappeared, so he readied himself for Soulayer to attempt everything in his power to kill him.
And after only a few seconds… [Eternal Darkness] as well as [Soul Vortex] were deactivated, meaning that the area was back to normal.
And once Stark opened his eyes back… all he saw was Soulayer's figure facing him, the boss was on his knees, his head looking down at the water, and red drops pouring from his helmet.
'…?' Stark was confused, maybe that was another trick?
But once he moved his eyes slightly, he noticed that not only did Soulayer deactivate his aura, but he also dropped his greatsword on the ground, with no visible intent to pick it back up.
It was almost like… he gave up?
'…' Stark stood there with a neutral expression, he didn't know what to think.
Soulayer looked… pathetic.
[Kill him =)]
"Huh?"
"Finally, we can see!"
"What happened though?!"
The other participants of the trial, also spectators of Stark's fight, couldn't see inside the [Eternal Darkness] skill's perk, so all they could do was hear the sound of battle from within.
And yet, when the mist disappeared… they saw Soulayer kneeling down, and Stark facing him with a confused expression.
[Soulayer has received the DOMINATED and HOPELESS status]
'Well… doesn't seem like he is going to do anything…' Stark sighed before smiling, Soulayer had completely given up, and he enjoyed this victory.
He observed Soulayer for a good minute, and the boss didn't move an inch, not even looking at the boy, almost as if he was just waiting for him to finish the job.
[End. Him.]
And so before Stark could do anything…
His body suddenly began to move by itself.
'Huh?!' of course, he planned to kill Soulayer soon, but he wasn't the one currently controlling his body.
It was almost as if… his aura was getting impatient…
[Don't give him the time to think… =)]
[Send that little SHIT to his friends, that's what he wants, doesn't he?]
The fact he wasn't in control frankly scared Stark, but… deep down, he knew that HE was his aura, meaning that the thing that was controlling him was just another more twisted part of himself.
And so just like that, he reached the boss, only one meter away from him.
[GOODBYE]
Stark didn't realize it, but he was actually smiling as he focused his aura in his hands and smashed the boss's head with absolutely no hesitation.
"-79482!"
[Soulayer HP: 0/420000]
[You have defeated 'Soulayer, The Bearer of Souls'!]

chapters.title: Chapter 158 - 158: 5 Minutes Before the Second Domination Trial
chapters.content:
[You have defeated 'Soulayer, The Bearer of Souls'!]
"Woohoo~"
"Good job, kid!"
"Damn, and I bet that he would die…"
This victory received many reactions, but they didn't have the time to say anything else as all their screens disappeared, and the connection was interrupted, meaning they couldn't see Stark anymore.
The boy had tried his hardest to hide his most powerful skills, and he had succeeded in that regard, but it still felt like a loss regardless as he still revealed some of his attacks, and also his weapon.
But before he got any other kind of notifications…
~DING~
[The 'Second Domination Trial' starts in five minutes!]
[Buckle up your seats and gather everything you need, there is no going back after this, and I can guarantee you that it is gonna be a tough and long one =)]
And…
[5:00 minutes remain before 'Domination Trial']
.
[4:59 minutes remain before 'Domination Trial']
'Fair…'
Stark needed to be quick, and so he instantly opened up the panels that HE wanted to see.
[You have slain 'Soulayer, Bearer of Souls lv100', gained 2,750,000EXP!]
'…!'
And this could only mean one thing…
[Experience: 728312/843000]
~DING, DING, DING, DING~
He heard four notification sounds, then was surrounded by the thick golden aura that always felt warm.
[Your level has increased to level 40, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 41, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 42, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 43, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Experience: 2312/907000]
Stark's smile grew wider, he could FEEL the crimson power inside of him become more powerful, and it was a feeling that brought him endless pleasure.
[3:38 minutes remain before 'Domination Trial']
In addition to that, he had yet again crossed another threshold (level 40), which could only mean one thing…
[Level 40 Reached: please pick a card].
Three purple cards materialized in front of Stark, but in opposition to last time, they didn't have any feature that could help him pick one out, meaning that it was back to luck.
While closing his eyes, Stark reached for one of the cards and picked the one to the far left.
And when he turned the card, the image displayed on it was that of a figure being in one place, then after using the skill being moved to another spot right next, an after image between the two showing it was instant.
'…?'
…
[Skill: Crimson Ball Transmission]
[Type: Epic]
[Description: To teleport to a specific location while fighting, first concentrate on creating a small ball from your aura, then send the ball to the desired location, but note that this action alone will not teleport you there.
The location the ball hits simply marks the destination for the teleportation, if you need to quickly escape an attack, snap your fingers in the direction of the ball to activate the teleportation, and you will be sent there instantly.]
[Note: You only have one ball, and it takes five minutes to recharge]
…
These were all the panels that appeared before him once reaching level 40.
But… he wasn't done yet.
[Skill Points: 16 Available]
Yeah… he had enough skill points to upgrade a skill to the max if he felt like it.
But this would be dumb: getting multiple perks from different skills would be far more efficient than getting three perks from a single one, isn't it?
'Hm…'
[2:11 minutes remain before 'Domination Trial']
[You should finish whatever you are doing fast!]
It wasn't only Stark that was rushing around, gathering all the stuff he needed, but all other participants as well: they took the domination trial very seriously.
The first trial was always new to all of them as they didn't know what it was about, but once you complete it and reach the second, you know enough to actually begin to take everything into account.
All of them had seen people dying closely to them from monsters in the trial, and they refused to go down either.
It was one of the reason this trial was much harder than the first: experience and knowledge.
'No time to really think, just use your instinct to upgrade the skills you FEEL will be useful to you…' Stark mumbled as he opened his skills window.
…
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv15; Focus lv10; Aura Smash lv10; Clone Frenzy lv10; Invincible Dodge lv5; Double Assault lv5; Crimson Spears lv1; Heaven's Wrath lv1; Alchemist lv3; Potion Crafting lv3; Target Manipulation lv1; Dodge Control lv1; Crimson Ball Transmission lv1
…
'Okay, I know now.'
[You have upgraded 'Focus' to level 15 (Bronze-Tier Max)!]
[You have upgraded 'Heaven's Wrath' to level 5!]
[You have upgraded 'Clone Frenzy' to level 15 (Bronze-Tier Max)!]
And so he was only left with one skill point that he kept in case he needed it later.
The reason of his choices was as followed: [Focus] is possibly the best skill he had yet, and although it didn't seem strong in the grand view of things, it was the skill that allowed him to see attacks come and to dodge them, upgrading it to its MAX is just as important as [Domination] itself.
[Heaven's Wrath] is an extremely powerful skill, and in addition to that the other participants didn't know of it, so having it in a better version of itself could always be good to take huge amounts of enemies, or a giant one, in one beam.
As for the last, he hesitated between upgrading it or [Aura Smash] to the max, but then he remembered that the latter, although only being an [Uncommon] skill, was still one of his strongest skills, and so that meant that upgrading it could result in the chance of him not being able to fully utilize the perk as it would be like with the level 10 one, which he couldn't control well until getting used to it.
'I do wonder if [Aura Smash] is going to rank-up in type as it does seem weird it is only uncommon…' Stark mumbled.
As for the other skills he didn't upgrade, he just had a gut feeling that he didn't really need to do that for now, or more like, that the ones he upgraded would save his life in due time.
But of course, reaching a threshold for these skills also meant… NEW PERKS!
And powerful ones at that since the skills in themselves were really strong.
[1:00 minute remains before 'Domination Trial']
'Oh shit… need to be quick,' Stark hurriedly opened the new panels that appeared before him, and began reading what the new perks he got were.

chapters.title: Chapter 159 - 159: The Final Preparations and The Reveal
chapters.content:
[1:00 minute remains before 'Domination Trial']
'Better be quick, if I don't know what the perks are about it will be difficult to fully utilize them… plus there is no saying if I will have any free time in the trial…' Stark, much like the others, also took this very seriously after witnessing the other four people that fought with him in the previous trial dying.
The reason they died was simple: they weren't strong enough.
But this time… Stark felt like the people he would participate with, not only were the double, but also were much stronger, maybe even more so than he himself was?
'Argh… fuck… just keep going…' he shook his head before opening the panels.
…
[Skill: Focus lv15]
[New Perk: Time Vision]
[Description: You are now able to slow down time for three seconds, this can be useful if an enemy attacks you out of nowhere, so activating this perk would allow you to check them out and find a viable way to get out of this situation]
[Note: Time is slowed for you too, and the time isn't slowed THAT much, it is more like 0.25 speed, oh and, there is a one-hour cooldown between each use!]
…
'Interesting…' Stark could now, at any moment he wanted during a battle, activate this skill and make his eyes faster than even time itself to see the world in slow motion.
And so as predicted, upgrading [Focus] had been the right option all along, these three seconds of slow could definitely save his life and remove the risk of being hit by an ambush as it would also warn him…
Next, Stark moved on to the second skill he had upgraded.
…
[Skill: Heaven's Wrath lv5]
[New Perk: More Radius and Less Cooldown]
[Description: I mean, the skill is already too strong as it is, so giving it a perk at level 5 would be too much, so in exchange, the radius of the beam increased by 20% and the cooldown is reduced from 30 to 20 minutes.]
[Note: The next perks will be much better…]
…
'Yeahh… I got scammed!' Stark knew that he couldn't do anything about it since he would have had to upgrade Heaven's Wrath at one point or another, but in this very situation, it was pretty average, 'Let's hope the last one is better to balance it out.'
He turned his gaze toward the third and final panel, then began reading quickly as he only had 25 seconds left before being teleported.
…
[Skill: Clone Frenzy lv15]
[New Perk: The Superior Clone]
[Description: You can choose to summon your three clones and merge them all together (much like with Aura Smash), thus creating a superior crimson copy that is ALMOST as good as the original]
[Note: This perk will NOT work if one of the clones is out, you precisely need all three, plus the merging time takes around thirty seconds, and if it is interrupted you won't be able to do it again for thirty minutes…]
…
'Huh…' Stark would have loved to test this out before entering the trial, but there was nothing he could do.
[5 seconds left before 'Domination Trial']
But right at that moment…
[You have beaten 'Soulayer, Bearer of Souls,' alone and without taking damage, granting the SOLO and NO HIT achievements, increasing the rarity and power of the equipment!]
And the moment Stark turned his head toward Soulayer's body… he saw two sparkles around him: meaning that two extremely powerful equipment pieces dropped beside the boss.
'SHIT…!'
[2 seconds left before 'Domination Trial']
Stark immediately rushed toward Soulayer's body, not only were such equipment pieces could help him, but there was also the chance that he would be teleported back to the real world once the trial ends, meaning the loss of his precious items if someone else took them…
'GOT IT-' he jumped, only a few centimeters away from reaching the sparkles.
But…
[Teleporting all participants to the 'Second Domination Trial'!]
[Good luck!]
'Sl-Sleepy…' his momentum suddenly stopped while his hand was millimeters away from one of the items.
And then…
'ZZZzzz…' he fell asleep, the start of the trial forcing him to go to sleep just like the first time.
But while he was collapsing, his eyes drowning with dizziness… all Stark could think about was…
'Let's hope I don't die…'
Soon enough, he would discover what the trial was about, and also the 9 other people that had watched him fight.
It would be big, and possibly the hardest thing he ever did until now, even more terrifying than infiltrating an event with the top 100 strongest classifiers in the country.
'Well… it all depends on my strength anyway…' he let a quick smile before the back of his head fell onto the water, and so, Stark officially fell asleep.
[Good luck, participant!]
Stark's consciousness faded.
***
'…!' less than a second after falling asleep, Stark opened his eyes again.
But much like the first time he had done this for the trial, he was yet again in a giant black void.
"Do you think we will win?"
"Heh~ just use my potions and we'll be good!"
Suddenly, he heard the familiar voices of his… classes?
[Domination] and [Alchemist] appeared before him, materializing in front of him like it was nothing, wide smiles on their faces.
'Am I… in the dream world?' Stark wanted to ask, but his voice didn't come out.
"…"
"…"
The two Stark stopped smiling, their expressions turning almost sad as they shook their heads.
"I guess…" Domination shrugged.
"Let's just go along with it…" Alchemist sighed.
And so right as the two spoke… another panel appeared in front of Stark.
[Stark Heartsouls; Code Name: "The Chosen"]
'Oh… then that means I'm in the space between reality and the trial…' Stark sighed as well.
There was a strange feeling deep inside of him, one he couldn't shake off, and it seemed the two other him could also feel it.
Was it stress? Fear of death?
It didn't matter for now, as all that would happen later would completely depend on him.
'But then… why are they here, they weren't here the first time,' he looked at the figures resembling his own, they were around ten minutes away from him.
"Good luck…"
"Don't die on us!"
And so just like that, they faded away, leaving Stark alone in the darkness, alone to face whatever would happen.
He didn't admit it, but their presence appeased him.
A few seconds later… another panel appeared.
[Domination Trial: The Lucullus Prison]
[Difficulty: DEATH]
'Huh…?' Stark's eyes widened, and his pupils began to shake, 'D-Death…?'
He couldn't comprehend the words before him, yet they were as real as could be.
The first trial he participated in was from the [Death] difficulty, which was the hardest of the five.
Nobody had ever completed a trial with the [Death] difficulty before, he had been the first since the appearance of this class.
And now… he would need to do the same thing with his second one too? Alongside nine other people who he could not trust?
He needed to fight in a trial much harder than the first, with the [Death] difficulty…?
This was… the worst possible outcome.
'Is this world fucking with me,' he gritted his teeth, his eyes burning with crimson aura.
And so just like that, his consciousness faded away again as he received the information all the others did as well.
[Good luck, Chosen]

chapters.title: Chapter 160 - 160: Domination Trial: The Lucullus Prison
chapters.content:
"FUAHHH~" Stark opened his eyes, he was sweating profusely for some reason, and really didn't like the feeling of his consciousness forcefully being taken from his body.
[Domination Trial: The Lucullus Prison]
[Difficulty: DEATH]
These panels were the first things that greeted him once he opened his eyes, but he already knew that so he shrugged them off.
Stark looked around him.
He was in a closed square space with dark blue walls around him, they looked to be in a good state, meaning that this trial was much more 'advanced' and 'technological' than the last.
And when he turned his head… he noticed that one of the four walls was actually opened, except for one simple problem: blue laser-like bars were blocking his path.
'Prison cell…?' was the conclusion Stark reached, after all the name of the trial was [The Lucullus Prison], so it did make sense.
But of course, he wasn't alone.
Since all around him, there were nine other cells identical to his, and as guessed, each of them had one participant inside.
Some were still asleep, while others were already up, inspecting their surroundings.
[Wait for the others to wake up before receiving any kind of information about this trial, in the meantime, you can enjoy yourself!]
'Enjoy myself, my ass…' Stark sighed as he got up.
The cell right in front of his was occupied by a woman with long white hair and an elegant black dress and black lips, something not fit for battle, she was currently touching the walls of her cell, trying to see if there was any secret.
'She looks experienced…' Stark didn't call out to her, but he just stood there, looking at her.
After a few seconds, she sensed his gaze and turned her head, wanting to scold the person that had been looking at her so intensely.
But when she stared at Stark… she just looked at him with a neutral expression, unbothered.
Stark could already see everything in that calm look on her face.
She was thinking: 'Oh, that's him…'
Almost instantly, she averted her gaze and went back to what she was doing.
'…' Stark kept his neutral expression, he couldn't see the cells of the people next to him, so he just waited.
After a few minutes… everyone woke up, they had been in the same black void as Stark, receiving the basic information they needed before being sent to the trial.
And as soon as all of them took note of their surroundings… the panels that would inform them of their task appeared.
[Domination Trial: The Lucullus Prison]
[You all are inmates of this prison, your goal is to escape by reaching the surface!]
[You are currently in sublevel 4, make your way to level 0 and defeat the warden to leave!]
[To aid you, each one of you will receive a map of the floor you are currently in, try to follow it, whether in a team or alone, and reach the stairs to go to the next level!]
[On the way, many elite monsters and bosses will try to stop you, you can choose to fight them or run away, but note that on each level, one of the monsters holds a key that is needed to access the next level]
[Once someone kills that monster and opens the door to the stairs, everyone else will be able to access the sublevel above that one!]
'…' This was a lot of information, but it all made sense somehow, basically, they needed to find the monster that had the key, kill it, and then access the next level until reaching level 0.
This didn't seem that hard, actually quite easily, so why would this trial be of the [Death] difficulty…?
[But let me ask you one question… =)]
Another panel appeared, this one ten times more ominous than the others.
[Will you be the one to risk your life and kill the monsters, or will you stay behind and just leech off the hard work of the others, the choice is yours, as the true end goal is just to survive until escaping the prison]
[Oh, and also, there is no limit to how many survivors there can be, so in comparison to the other trials, if all ten of you manage to reach level 0 and kill the warden, then everyone survives!]
'Yeah… I knew it…'
This trial was of course about fighting monsters, but also… about betrayal.
Those who did the hard work wouldn't want the others to profit from them, and that could result in killing the rest…
'How cruel…' Stark couldn't help but smile, almost as if… he enjoyed this?
[You have exactly ten minutes before the door of the sublevel 4 opens, allowing you to access this floor, until then… get to know each other =)]
And so just like that, the blue laser-like bars that had been stopping them from leaving suddenly deactivated, allowing each and every one of them to leave their cells.
"Fucking hell~"
"Stuck with a bunch of losers in a loser trial…"
"Seriously? Death difficulty, this has to be a joke, I heard no one has ever completed one of those…"
He heard the footsteps of people leaving their cells while talking.
The white-haired woman directly in front of him just stayed in the corner though, putting her foot against the wall, not leaving.
'Quit trying to look cool…' Stark rolled his eyes as he also left his cell.
People would come looking for him during the ten minutes of free time as he currently was the center of the attention, meaning the most popular one of them all as they had effectively witnessed him fighting less than half an hour ago.
'…' Stark left his cell, and found himself in a semi-large hallway, all it contained was the 10 cells that participants were held in, and at the end of it was a giant metal door, a timer was displayed above it.
[9:28… 9:27…]
In the hallway were already six of the other participants, excluding Stark, meaning that only three had decided not to interact with the rest.
It was either they were confident in their abilities to survive, or just didn't trust any of the others.
To Stark, they were the smartest, and those with the highest chance of survival.
"You have a problem, my guy?"
"I think you don't realize who you're talking too…"
But there already seemed to be some kind of beef as two men were currently facing each other, one of them had an enraged expression, under the watchful and interested gazes of the other four.
'It's been thirty seconds… literally how…?' Stark was confused, these people were much more aggressive than his allies back at the first trial.
"HAH~ WELL, WE DON'T NEED YOU ANY MORE IT SEEMS!" one of the men, the one that seemed angry, a buff-looking one with silver ring piercings activated his [Domination] aura, summoning claws that came out of his hands.
"CLAW ANNIHILATION!" he jumped toward the first guy.
But…
"Futile…" the other guy also activated his [Domination] skill, and a silver blade appeared in his hands, "See you in hell…"
"MOON CUT!" he deflected the claws of the first man easily and then…
~SLASH~
"-78531!" he cut the man in half.
'…' Stark observed all of this with a neutral reaction, it happened so fast, and it hadn't even been two minutes since the cells opened.
[One participant has died, 9 remain!]
This trial was already getting bad, maybe there would be no survivors by the end of it if this continued…
'…' Stark kept smiling for some reason.

chapters.title: Chapter 161 - 161: Getting to Know Each Other (Pretty Useless)
chapters.content:
[One participant has died, 9 remain!]
"…"
"…"
"…"
And yet, no one said anything, and even the three that were still inside their cells didn't even come out to check what the message was about.
Everyone was way too calm, even though one of the participants had just died.
"He would be useless anyway, we need to get rid of the problems before beginning this trial," the man with the silver blade grabbed the two parts of the other guy's body and threw him into a cell, without any care for his condition as a corpse.
The calm man seemed to be in his mid-twenties, he had a manly face and white hair with a beard of the same color, he also exuded a mature and strong aura as he held his sword in hand, traces of blood on its tip, he was currently in a… business suit?
"I'm sorry for the commotion, folks," he bowed to all the people that were looking at him.
"That's fine, but we could have at least used him as a meat shield," another one of the guys sighed, he had tanned skin and spiky blond-hair, as well as semi-defined muscles, he was in a black tracksuit.
'What the hell are these outfits,' Stark tilted his head, although he couldn't deny that he himself was just wearing average clothes right now.
"Hmm… pretty strong, old man!" a little girl, around 1,48cm in size, with pink hair designed in a short ponytail laughed, she was wearing a high-school uniform with a short skirt.
She looked like a middle-schooler, and her features could also confirm this idea as her face was that of a child.
But…
"A little kid?" another guy with long-black hair, wearing a green robe with a snake pattern on its back, spoke, carrying a neutral expression.
"A K-KID?! I'M 32!" the kid… no… the lady replied, she didn't budge when seeing someone die, but THIS was what embarrassed her.
[7:32… 7:31…], meanwhile, the timer above the giant metal door was still going down.
They seemed to get along… well… partially, for now they were just building meaningless connections that would crumble the moment any kind of danger came in.
"I hope you all understood the rules, it means that no matter what, we can all get out if we somehow manage to get all the keys and reach level 0!" a blue-haired man with a gun in both his hands pointed at the metal door, he was wearing a police officer uniform.
These were the five (alive) people that were in the hallway, chatting with each other while waiting for the door to open.
"Maybe we should introduce ourselves to make it easier for later, shall we not…" the man with the green robe proposed, his expression staying still, his clothes and long back hair made him look like a sect leader, and he even did the iconic pose with joining the sleeves of his robe together to hide his hands.
"Sure thing…" the man that had murdered someone less than two minutes ago smiled, "But let's not forget our friend there," he pointed at Stark, "Why don't you join us?"
Frankly, Stark had a really bad feeling about all of this, and he didn't trust these people one bit, neither did any of them trust one another to be honest, but they were just acting… acting as if they would fight together.
Beyond those faces, Stark could see their true intentions, and all he could as he noticed that was smile.
When the rest of the crowd turned their heads toward the location the white haired man pointed, all of their eyes widened.
"Oh… that's him…" the police officer tightened the grip around his guns.
"Huh…" the tanned man scratched his head.
"Haha~ I knew he would be there, but seeing the real thing is better!" the loli laughed.
'…' Stark didn't walk toward them, "We can speak, but I would rather keep a fair distance from you bunch until the door opens, who knows what crazy bastard would attempt to kill again…" he spoke while precisely looking at the man holding the silver blade.
"Oi~ I wouldn't do that, I just had to get rid of the bad weed from the bunch, that is all!"
"The name's Chosen…" Stark just spoke before looking down at the ground, after all, introducing yourself only meant telling your name.
"Akira," the murderer smiled, Stark had no idea if it was his real name or his code one, but it didn't matter.
"Lolia," the small girl spoke right after.
"Then my name is Bang," the tanned man shrugged.
"And mine is Leader…" the one with long hair added.
"Officer is the name, I guess it does make sense though haha…" the police officer scratched his cheek.
This was all with introductions, and Stark quickly glanced at the folks he would be fighting with.
A calm murderer in a suit, a loli in a school uniform, a police officer with guns, a sect leader, and a tanned guy with seemingly no morals.
This was a weird group, and he didn't even know of the other three that were still in their cells.
[4:56… 4:55…]
"Soooo… how does it feel to fight a boss, then immediately get transferred to this shithole…" Akira smiled, his eyes analyzing all of Stark's movements.
By a simple glance, Stark could tell he was the most dangerous one of the bunch, alongside the sect leader that didn't change his expression even once.
"Nothing much, just trying to live," Stark replied with a neutral expression, not even looking at the man.
"It is surprising… a [Death] level second domination trial is insane, and I have heard no one has ever completed one of these…" Bang spoke.
"My first trial was from the [Godless] difficulty, so not that far behind," Akira informed them, godless was the fourth of the five categories.
"Heh~ mine was from the [Doom] category!" Lolia smiled, almost proud of herself for surviving.
"Me too," Officer nodded.
The sect leader didn't speak, not wanting to give info, he had only spoken twice so far, and only to redirect the conversation to something else.
They couldn't do much but wait for the doors to open, so all they did was engage in meaningless discussions, although all keeping their distance and also making sure to not reveal anything.
Stark was already at a disadvantage since they had seen how he fought, but it was fine for now.
[1:02… 1:01… 1:00]
But when the one minute mark was reached…
A panel appeared before all the participants.
A panel that would crush any hope they had in fighting alongside one another safely to reach the surface.
A panel that rendered everything they did so far meaningless.
[Introducing the 'Kill Bonus' perk… =)]
It appeared before all of them, and so all they could so was read as information was everything in this place, almost as important as strength.
'What the hell is that thing…' Stark's eyes widened as he read about that perk, it was beyond anything he could think of.
It was truly… twisted and cruel…
And it basically… as stated in the name… forced them to kill one another to receive advantages.
'Haha~ knew I couldn't trust anybody…' Stark's smile grew wider as he noticed the atmosphere of the hallway suddenly go from joyful to depressing in a single second.
Well… it was a [Death] difficulty trial after all, so what did they expect?
Only Stark knew how bad this could get.

chapters.title: Chapter 162 - 162: The Kill Perk
chapters.content:
'…'
All the participants of the trial looked up when the timer showed that only one minute remained as another panel had appeared.
[Introducing the 'Kill Bonus' perk… =)]
It wasn't long until all participants read it.
And to even Stark, who had already participated in a [Death] difficulty trial, this seemed… unreasonably cruel.
…
['Kill Bonus' will be active the moment the gates of sublevel 4 open!]
['Kill Bonus' is an advantage that the participants can get inside of the trial, increasing their odds of survival!]
[Basically: if you kill someone, you will be allowed to spin the 'Perk' wheel, granting you an advantage!]
[Note: monster kills don't count, a human needs to be the one to give the fatal blow to another participant to receive the reward]
…
Basically… the moment that timer reaches zero, then if you ever manage to kill someone, you will be allowed to spin some sort of wheel to receive a reward that could massively help you.
Of course, on paper, this seemed like a dumb perk as if you ever killed someone and got found out, then you would be the next to be hunted.
And yet… as if knowing of that, that shitty system actually showed the possible rewards you could get…
At that moment, the atmosphere of the room went from friendly to hostile almost immediately.
…
[There are 10 possible rewards if you manage to kill another fellow participant to aid you in the trial!]
[Key Location Map: You will receive a map that shows you which exact monster holds the key that will allow the group to head to the next level]
[Instant Use Key: Will give you a key that you can immediately use to go to the next level without fighting anybody, one time use.]
[Healing Spring: A special spring that will instantly heal all your injuries, one time use.]
[Revive Token: A token that will allow you to revive yourself once in the event of death, one time use.]
[Instant Level Up: Will make you level up by five levels immediately!]
[Skill Viewer: Will show you a list of all the skills of the other participants]
[Invincibility Token: Will grant you invincibility for the next five minutes following the usage of this token, meaning that no participant or monster can do any damage to you, one time use]
[Monster Scent: Upon usage, all monsters will ignore you as they recognize you as their own, even if you kill many of them, this lasts ten minutes, one time use]
[Aura Blocker: Target a participant and be able to block their powers for thirty seconds, one time use]
[Killing Spree: ??? (only becomes available once five people have died!)]
…
'…'
This was absolutely terrible, an actual disaster.
In a room filled with people who would do anything to survive, these overpowered rewards could truly change everything in the trial, plus no one would really blame them for killing if they said it was for the 'greater good' as some of these rewards could truly be useful for the group…
And the worst: these rewards seemed to advantage the culprit that actually killed.
[Aura Blocker], [Healing Spring], [Invincibility Token] and many more would make it so that any of them could kill anyone that tried to avenge the death of another.
Basically… being a killer has way more advantages.
It was truly well-thought-out, and even Stark had an urge to kill one or two people to get rewards.
Plus, in addition to all of this, there was the presence of the [Killing Spree], which only appeared once five people died, and its goal was obvious: making people wonder just how good it was, resulting in more deaths to unlock it.
'Killing game…' was Stark's first thought as he closed the panels and stared the other participants, all of their eyes were widened in shock, except for Leader as he kept his composure.
The little crowd that was in front of the metal door immediately separated, feeling that their trust in one another was instantly gone: they didn't know who could kill, and even worse, maybe even they had some urges to do it?
[27… 26… 25…]
In the end… everyone know that the moment that timer was up, it was everyone for himself.
[10… 9… 8…]
[Oh, and by the way; if someone dies from a monster, it will be specifically said who died]
[But… if they are killed by one of you…]
[Then this message will appear: "Participant has been slain by a player", without specifying who died or who did it!]
And so with that…
[2… 1… 0!]
[Good luck!]
~FWISH, CLANG~
The giant metal door, at least fifty meters in height, slowly but surely opened, revealing the interior of the sublevel they were in.
~BOOM~
~DASH~
~FVIOUM~
Immediately, he heard the sound of lightning as one of the people that hadn't come out of their cells left the hallway the moment the door was big enough to fit: they were like a flash of lightning, so their body wasn't visible, plus too fast anyway.
'…' Stark sighed, as he began heading toward the metal door, he also had gone inside of his own cell, observing the white-haired woman in the cell in front of him as she just walked in circles.
But the moment he left his cell…
[A participant has been slain by a player!]
It already happened.
Of course, Stark didn't care about that, but the fact it happened so fast meant that there truly was no hope in cooperation.
All the other participants had already dashed through the metal door as it had mostly opened, meaning that the only people that remained were Stark, the white-haired woman, and…
'…' Stark turned his gaze as he heard sounds coming from a cell, and he was met with a disgusting sight.
The man with the silver blade, Akira, the one who had already killed someone, was in front of the beheaded body of Bang, the tanned man in a tracksuit.
Sensing his gaze on him, Akira turned his head toward Stark, his expression still calm as he smiled, doing this was nothing to him it seemed.
"What can I say," Akira shrugged, "Don't act like you wouldn't do the same…"
"I never said I wouldn't, and I didn't judge you," Stark didn't care much as he continued walking toward the metal door, "But…" suddenly, his aura became much more powerful, and even Akira was taken aback, "Don't try that shit on me…" Stark smiled, and Akira smiled back.
[You have entered the 'sublevel 4' area, try to find the monster with the key to escape!]
[Oh, and by the way, remember the second punishment you were supposed to get for not reaching level 50?]
'…?' Stark rolled his eyes, they were trying to fuck him over even in this situation where some of his skills had already been revealed.
[Well… you don't get a map, so maybe killing another person doesn't sound so bad now… =)]
Not getting a map of the floors was a massive disadvantage as he wouldn't know the layouts, but it didn't matter much for Stark, whether he killed or not completely depended on the situation, and for now, he didn't feel the need to.
[Good luck!]
[8 participants remain!]
This trial was cruel, but in the end, survival all depended on your instinct, information and strength, and Stark was confident that he would live.
Even if he was the only one left by the end… he would make sure to survive.

chapters.title: Chapter 163 - 163: The Fourth SubLevel
chapters.content:
[The 4th sublevel holds the worst criminals of the Lucullus Prison!] was what he read somewhere on a sign, so it meant that this one should be pretty empty, and the more they went up, the harder it would become.
The floor looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in months, and the air had a putrid smell that made his nostrils flare.
The walls were made out of purple obsidian, a strong material none of the participants could destroy, and the floor was made of white marble, debris were everywhere so it was pretty hard to navigate.
The hallways were pretty big, enough to fit at least a fifty people next to another, meaning that areas for battles were more than enough.
Also, each sublevel apparently had a name, and this one was… [The Domination's Layer].
Would the name be related to the floor and its enemies? Who knows.
Stark kept walking through the halls, they all looked the same, and it was so big he didn't even meet anybody or anything.
'Not having a map is bullshit…' all the others could navigate easily and spot the exit wherever they were, but Stark was forced to check everything like he was in a maze.
The only good news was that the mastermind of the trial, if they even existed, took pity on him.
[You will get your map back in sublevel 2!]
'…' it had been around ten minutes since the metal door opened, but not a single other notification announcing the death of someone popped up.
But right as he thought of that…
"KRAWKR~" he heard a disgusting noise ahead of him, and from the corner of a hallway he was about to turn, a giant beige hand could be seen.
And what emerged from that hall was… an ogre-looking monster, at least seven meters in size.
[Sublevel 4 Guard]
It had beige/gray skin, a very ugly face with large bumps all over it, making its eyes look swollen, its chest was completely bare except for some sort of circle metal thing that was attached directly to its body, and genitals were hidden by a very short dark cloth, not even reaching its knees.
Its arms, legs, although very muscular, were also full of bumps, almost as if that monster was mutated, in its right hand it was carrying a giant cleaver, and its eyes were full of rage, ready to eliminate the escaping prisoners.
But of course… it wasn't alone.
Since only a few seconds after Stark made his analysis of the monster…
"KRAWKRK, RKKKARK~" two more guards appeared next to the one in front of him.
And…
"KRAWKRA~" another two appeared from behind: he was surrounded by these ugly things.
All the [Sublevel 4 Guards] were slowly approaching Stark, they all looked the same, each having a large cleaver in their hands that could cut Stark's limbs if they even grazed him.
5 giant monsters to take care of, yet Stark wasn't bothered: if he wanted to survive this, winning this battle was the MINIMUM he should be able to do.
'...' he positioned his fists in front of his, while making sure to constantly check behind him if the other guards got closer.
...
[Name: Sublevel 4 Guard]
[Level: 95]
[HP: 147000]
[Strength: 4618]
[Stamina: 1027]
[Speed: 1214]
[Defense: 3356]
[Skills: Cleaver Slash, Stomp, Mad Rush, Slam, Guard Force, Prisoner Detection, Mutation...]
...
They didn't have that many skills to begin with, pretty normal considering they are the lowest of the low monsters in this entire trial, although their strength and defense were pretty high, their stamina and speed were a joke in comparison.
"KRAAKR~" almost as if communicating with one another, the first guard that appeared to Stark pointed at him then looked at his colleagues, and they all nodded.
And then...
"KRKAKAKKRR~" all of them began to run toward Stark.
Of course, they were much faster than the average human, it is not that Stark said that they are slow, but in comparison to him... well... their speed wasn't much.
"CLEAVER SLASH!" two of them raised their cleaver, half the size of Stark, then struck down.
~FWISH~
But the boy moved to the side and avoided the two attacks easily: he had seen them come from a mile away thanks to [Focus].
The sheer strength of their attack though did damage the floor, more than it already was at least...
"Crimson Spears..." Stark calmly summoned three spears and sent them toward one of the guards that had tried to attack, the other three behind as they wanted to ambush him.
~FWISH, FWISH, FWISH~
All three spears hit the target in the face as it was unable to avoid the attack.
"63018! -59227! -60291!" the damage was very high, even for monsters with such a big defense, which probably meant that the head was definitely their weakness.
"Kr...akr..." the first guard fell down in a loud thud as three massive holes were left on its face, and its colleagues were enraged, more than before that is...
"STOMP!" two of the massive guards raised their foot, and then...
~BAMMMM~
They slammed them against the ground as hard as they could.
"-6827! -5918!" doing this damaged even them.
But in exchange...
~FZIP~
'Huh...?'
The shockwave of the attack traversed the entire hallway, and when it reached Stark...
[You have been paralyzed by the shockwave, jump next time!]
'SHIT...!' Stark didn't expect it to work even against the domination class, but he was indeed in a trial specifically made to kill them all, so he should have known...
"CLEAVER SLASH!" meanwhile, the two other guards that had waited for their companions to stun the boy immediately dashed at him, and swung their cleavers at the boy at the same time.
He couldn't move, and two giant weapons were rushing at him from opposite directions by giant monsters that only wanted him dead.
Was it over?
Would he be the 3rd to die out of them all, even though he had been the only one to complete the first trial in the [Death] difficulty?
No...
This couldn't happen.
Not to Stark, at least.
He still needed to get to the exit, or at least find the key to stop everyone else from getting ahead of him… it was a killing game after all, and he was already fucked because he had no map and was around 10 levels below all the others.
He couldn't allow himself to die now.
No… he refused to die by the hand of these weaklings.
And so… Stark's eyes burned with aura as he smiled, ready to cause a massacre.

chapters.title: Chapter 164 - 164: Killing the Sublevel 4 Guards
chapters.content:
The ogre guards' cleavers actually reached Stark, hitting both his neck and waist.
But… he still had that big smile on his face, one that the ogres absolutely hated.
Even though they knew he was fucked now that he was stunned, they hated that stupid confidence of his.
But they were wrong…
[The Purgatory Shadow took the hit]
It was indeed two attacks, but they were aimed at him at the same time, meaning that his shadow came out of the ring and stopped both cleavers, pushing back the guards.
['Paralyzed' effect has been removed.]
And with that, Stark, his eyes still burning with aura, dashed straight for one the guards that had executed the cleaver slash.
"CLONE FRENZY!" and he summoned two other clones , sending them at the second guard.
"Aura Smash…" Stark focused his aura in his hands then sent three crimson fists at the guard.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
Learning from its companion's mistake, it knew it couldn't avoid such attacks, so instead… it used its cleaver as some sort of shield.
"-37462! -36011! -39874!" the damage was still high, but not enough to kill it.
"STOMP!" meanwhile, the two other guards weren't doing nothing, not only did they get closer to Stark and his clones, but they also lifted their foots again, with more power this time.
~SLAM~
They hit the ground, and it completely broke, cracks were everywhere now, except for the obsidian walls.
"CLEAVER SLASH!" knowing that Stark would be stunned again, the guard before him raised its cleaver and began to strike down.
But…
~JUMP, FWISH~
Stark just jumped to the side once the shockwave reached him, thus avoiding both it and the cleaver.
"Krawakr!!!" the guard spoke to his friends, his face full of surprise and sweat pouring out of its ugly forehead.
"S-SLAM!" almost hesitating, it used another skill, sending its empty fist toward Stark as it was surrounded by a powerful force.
The fist was half Stark's size, so the damage would be enough to kill him.
But Stark didn't stop, he knew he couldn't afford to. His aura was burning even brighter, as if fueled by the fear of the enemy.
['Sublevel 4 Guard B' has received the 'Dominated' status!]
And that small amount of hesitation…
~FWISH~
It allowed Stark to spin in midair and avoid the fist by going above it, he placed his foot on the arm, it wasn't big enough to accommodate him, but he just used it as a platform.
And then…
~KICK, BOOM~
Stark jumped toward the guard's head and drop-kicked it in the face.
"-93271!"
The impact was so strong that the guard's face became even uglier, and it was sent flying toward one of the obsidian walls, crashing against it and falling back on the ground.
Meanwhile…
"AURA SMASH!" Stark's clone summoned six crimson fists, as well as 6 spears, and threw them all at the guard they were fighting.
Needless to say that it didn't survive, as even when using its cleaver as a shield, upon reaching the fifth fist, its stamina was already depleted and it was unable to continue holding on against the crimson power.
And so that meant that one fist and 6 spears reached its body as it couldn't defend itself anymore (in addition to the damage from the fist that was also significant).
"-35039! -26361! -27381!" and much more, so it immediately fell to the floor.
And so they were left with two guards to deal with.
The two were taken aback, and even took a few step backs once the third monster died.
But… it was in their instincts as monster and prison guards to keep going.
Would you call it foolishness? Or was it just that they needed to do their job at all costs?
Well… it didn't really matter.
'Hey, clone,' Stark thought, and the two clones looked at him, 'One of you end this quickly,' he smiled.
And immediately…
"DOUBLE ASSAULT," Stark didn't even bother to use the skill himself, instead he summoned back the clone that wasn't doing anything, and sat on the ground as he enjoyed the view of his clone doing the work.
To be honest, these clones actually seemed to enjoy fighting more than staying inside of him, so it was good.
~DASH, DASH~
"CLEAVER SLASH!" one of the guards swung at the clone.
But…
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" it dodged at the final moment.
But wait, if it that, then doesn't that mean…
[Perfect Dodge!]
'HOLY SHIT,' the world around Stark and his clone turned gray as everything moved slowly.
The interesting thing though was that the original Stark wasn't affected by the slow mode, meaning that if his clone avoided an attack perfectly, then he would also get additional seconds to think even without doing a [Perfect Dodge].
This was precious information he would make sure to remember.
~BAM, FWISH~
Using the additional seconds to think, the clone dodged the cleaver and… smashed the guard's hand using his crimson aura.
"KRAKRKKEA~" it screamed in pain as its arm reduced to pulp, at least more than it already was, forcing it to drop its cleaver.
"MAD RUSH!" its eyes glew in a crimson light as its speed increased and it began to attack the clone with both its hands (even the destroyed one), as well as its legs by trying to kick it.
But none of the attacks hit, and in less than a second, as the clone didn't waste time since 'Double Assault' only lasted 10 seconds, it was already behind the guard.
~SPIN, CRACK~
It cracked the monster's neck, killing it instantly.
"-158372!"
'Wait a damn minute, did a clone just make more damage than I ever did?' Stark mumbled with a neutral expression, it was a hit for his pride, 'Oh well, but he just shrugged in the end.'
"KRAAKRK!!!" the final guard was panicking after seeing its fourth companion die, and so it swung its cleaver in all directions in hopes of grazing and killing the clone.
But of course, it was mere useless hope that would never amount to anything.
~CRACK~
The clone appeared behind the guard again, and although it was anti-climatic, it just cracked its neck again.
"-156245!"
It wasn't as cool as defeating it with a punch, but it was much easier and also more efficient.
'Good job,' Stark got up from the cold destroyed ground and summoned his clone back after congratulating it for its victory.
