And so with that, he got rid of five enemies, meaning he could keep going through this giant maze, hopefully not meeting the other participants as he didn't feel like fighting if they were aggressive.
Maybe some had already teamed up? He didn't know, but the fact no one had died after twenty minutes was a good sign.
Or that is what he hoped…
Stark didn't know the massacre had only started.

chapters.title: Chapter 165 - 165: The Sublevel 4 Elite Guard
chapters.content:
[You have slain 'Sublevel 4 Guard lv95', gained 128371 EXP!]
[You have slain 'Sublevel 4 Guard lv95', gained 127025 EXP!]
.
.
[You have slain 'Sublevel 4 Guard lv95', gained 129392 EXP!]
And so that meant…
[+638,838 Experience]
But even that wasn't enough to level him up.
[Experience: 641150/907000]
He was currently level 43, but the amount of experience needed each level was seriously getting out of hand, and it was probably the same for all the others as they also had the [Domination] class.
'For now, let's focus on finding the key or the exit, someone might have already opened it…!'
[Nope! Once someone does open the door then it will be announced, although nothing will be said if someone does find the key, making it possible to hide it for as long as you want =)]
[Oh, and I feel pretty bad for you, so here is a… MEGA DEAL!]
'The fuck…?'
[If you kill one of the participants, then… not only will you get your map back, but you'll be allowed to spin the reward wheel TWICE, just to make up for the punishment!]
And immediately, the panel disappeared, and no new one appeared.
It almost felt like the thing that was talking REALLY wanted to make them kill each other.
'Getting my map back and two rewards doesn't sound so bad though…' even Stark actually had the thought of killing as it could definitely increase his odds of survival.
But no… he suddenly realized something: it wouldn't be possible he was the only one that got such a juicy deal, it was possible all the others got such a panel as well…
It was a killing game after all, but who knows.
'Oh well… doesn't really matter if I can't meet anybody,' Stark shrugged, he quickly put the thought aside as killing wasn't in his plans for now.
Then he began to walk through the halls of the sublevel 4 again, all of them mostly looked the same except for some different furniture and rooms: there were other cells beside the ones they had been in, as well as some rooms with chairs and tables in them.
He even found a cafeteria at some point, but he didn't feel the need to visit it.
But after only another ten minutes of walking around…
[A participant has been slain by a player!]
'…' Stark looked at the panel for two seconds before closing it, he didn't care much.
The fact that all the people that had died until now were all killed by other humans said a lot about this trial: not a single monster kill yet, although this was supposed to be the easiest level.
And the fact the murderer was anonymous was even more sadistic as they could definitely get away with it, hiding their reward to use it whenever the situation became bad for them.
Basically… Stark would need to suspect everyone, trying to fight as a team like in the last trial was not an option before, but now it was truly confirmed.
'…'
Another fifteen minutes passed, fifteen minutes where nothing much happened, everyone else seemed to be exploring and killing monsters, looking for the key.
None of them had known it at the time, but the [Key Location Map] and [Instant Use Key] were much more powerful rewards than they seemed after realizing just how big each level was.
But at this very moment… where Stark really believed there was no way he would find his way…
IT activated.
[Talent: Chosen One, activated!]
'…?'
And when he turned another corner… he found himself in front of the door of a room, although this one was different from the others as the door looked much more damaged and was made out of wood instead of usual metal or other strong materials.
He was in a dead end, and this room was the only thing at the end of the hallway.
'Yeahhh okay…' there was no way this room wasn't important, especially after [Chosen One] activated, and so he immediately began to head toward it.
Stark kept walking toward the wooden door, sensing an ominous aura coming out of it.
His talent had definitely activated for a reason, but did it really twist reality again to make this door appear in front of him, or was it always there, and it was [Chosen One] that somehow guided him to it...?
In the end it didn't matter, because if his talent was on the 'helping' side this time, then it meant... there was a chance this could be the location of the key, if somebody hadn't already taken it that is.
'Here goes nothing...' he sighed as he reached for the wooden handle of the closed door.
But right as that happened, and he began to pull it down...
~BOOM, SLAM, CRASH~
The wall behind the door exploded, sending debris all over the hall and Stark.
'WHAT?' Stark was too close to the door and wall, so the force of the impact sent him flying in the opposite direction, crashing onto the wall in front of the door.
"-3471!" he had activated his [Domination Shield] to take the damage, so he received nothing, but it was still weird.
Was it a trap?
No... his talent wouldn't do this for no reason.
"KRAAKRR~" beyond the smoke screen that had formed because of the destroyed all, and all the falling debris, Stark heard a familiar noise.
It was the same sound those [Sublevel 4 Guards] were making.
'More of those... then maybe the talent wanted me to level up, heh~'
But he was wrong.
~THUMP, THUMP~
The steps that thing was making were much more powerful than the other guards, and its aura was more overwhelming too, exuding an invisible force that even Stark was cautious of.
'...'
~THUMP, THUMP~
And once it got out of the dust screen... Stark was finally able to identify what it was.
'Holy shit...!' his eyes widened, this was definitely not a simple guard.
[Sublevel 4 ELITE Guard]
[The most powerful monster of this floor!]
'I get it now...' of course, this wasn't confirmed, but most of the time, doesn't the strongest monster mean the best drops?
And what better drop was there than... THE KEY TO THE NEXT FLOOR!
The guard, much more powerful, stronger, and even 1.5x times the size of a normal guard, took another step toward Stark, its eyes full of fury as a prisoner had escaped.
'Alright, if it's here it means that nobody was able to reach this spot even with their maps, looks like that talent of mine can both be useful and annoying…' Stark smiled as he positioned himself, the giant ELITE slowly approaching him.
[FIGHT!]

chapters.title: Chapter 166 - 166: Elite and Destruction
chapters.content:
The [Sublevel 4 ELITE Guard] was standing there, its physique now completely visible as the smoke had disappeared, and it just stood there, looking down on Stark.
It was 1.5 times bigger than a normal guard, making it almost reach the very high ceiling of the floor, and at least eight times as high as Stark.
Just like its other peers though, it had mostly beige/gray skin with disgusting bumps all over it, and just like the other guards, a dark cloth was hiding its genitals.
But in comparison to the others, it wasn't bear-chested, as it actually had a piece of silver armor over its chest and stomach, allowing it to protect itself from stabs.
Over its head was also a silver helmet from the same materials as its body armor, with only two small holes where its eyes are supposed to be.
Beyond those holes was darkness, and only a little white point from its pupils was there to show that it was indeed alive.
As for its weapons, it had two: on its right hand it was carrying a giant metal sword with traces of blood all over it, something that showed that thing has already killed many living beings, whether humans or monsters didn't matter.
And on its left hand was… a morning star: it was a spiky black ball with a handle the guard was holding to control it.
"KRAAKRA~" the elite guard roared as it took yet another step toward Stark, ready to destroy the prisoner that tried to escape the Lucullus Prison…
'Heh~ it's fine, it should be as slow as the others-' Stark kept his focus on the monster, but it shouldn't be that fast.
~FWISH~
'Huh?' yet in less than a second, the morning star of the elite guard was already in front of his face.
It was too fast, way too fast.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" he rolled away.
[Perfect Dodge!]
The world slowed down around Stark, and he took advantage of that to activate [Perception] to check out his enemy, the small white pupils beyond the darkness of its helmet's holes burning with aura as a trail was left behind every time it moved.
…
[Name: Sublevel 4 ELITE Guard]
[Level: 100]
[HP: 365000]
[Strength: 5931]
[Stamina: 1312]
[Speed: 3749]
[Defense: 4133]
[Skills: Chrono Dodge, Critical Hit Spin, Morning Star's Darkness, Crippling Blow, Mad Rush, The Fourth Elite, Sword Cut, Body Slam, Intimidation, Status Immunity, Guard Sacrifice…]
…
All of its stats were much higher than any of the normal guards, and its speed was also much muchhh higher for some strange reason.
Stark backed away, that thing was almost as fast as him even with its sturdy body, so staying close wasn't a risk he was willing to take.
"CRIPPLING BLOW," but as soon as the world went back to normal, the guard lifted his morning star and swung it at Stark.
'OH COME ON…!' he avoided it by ducking, but the weapon came crashing against one of the obsidian walls, and it was so strong that it even created cracks on it, 'I'm dead meat if this touches me…'
"AURA SMASH!" he sent three fists at the elite guard, who didn't even bother to avoid them.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
It pumped its chest and received all of the damage.
"-10129! -9837! -11281!" Stark almost thought he went back to the time he was level 15 because of such low damage, but it was reality: that thing's armor was protecting him way too much, even if its defense wasn't even that high compared to the normal guards.
"And just when I thought it's a piece of cake," he mumbled, eyeing the elite guard, "Time to get creative."
"CLONE FRENZY!" he summoned his three clones.
Of course, under normal circumstances, Stark would only summon two as distributing his aura between the three would result in their power massively decreasing.
But this time… Stark had a good reason.
'Go behind the corner and do THAT,' he smiled at his clones, and they all nodded as they ran away to hide.
Meanwhile…
"KRAARKAK~" the guard didn't stand still as he immediately threw his morning star toward the group of clones.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," it hit them straight on, but thankfully they all had the skill to roll away to safety, then immediately began to do 'THAT'.
The ELITE guard, now only with a sword in hand, didn't even seem bothered, instead it just rushed at Stark.
"SWORD CUT!" it sliced in Stark's direction once.
~FWISH~
But the boy avoided the attack by backing away.
"SWORD CUT!" and it did it again.
'…?' Stark avoided by crouching.
"SWORD CUT, SWORD CUT, SWORD CUT!!!" instead of being like the average guard or monster and attacking randomly in the hopes of hitting, the elite guard actually looked like it knew what it was doing, precisely aiming for Stark while keeping its balance enough to be able to strike again.
~FWISH, FWISH, FWISH~
Stark was forced to keep dodging as a single strike would be game over.
"CRIMSON SPEARS!" he summoned his three spears and sent them at the guard.
But…
~KING, KING, KING~
The guard just blocked all three with his sword, taking 0 damage as it was way sturdier than the cleaver the others had.
"SPATIAL INVENTORY," while he was blocking Stark's attacks, the boy opened his inventory void and took out four [Crystal Stun] potions.
~THROW, THROW…~
He threw them all toward the elite's body while it was occupied, and all potions hit it, exploding upon impact and releasing the white mist.
But…
['Status Immunity' makes 'Elite Guard' immune to status effects!]
Meaning that the [Stun] wouldn't work on it, even from his crimson fists.
And so right at that moment, when Stark was thinking of what he should be doing…
~THUMP, THUMP~
Stark lifted his gaze and saw the giant rush at him.
"BODY SLAM!" then it jumped in the air, preparing to land on top of him with its full weight.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" he couldn't avoid this attack to begin with since the monster was almost as big as the hallway, and even damaged the ceiling in the process of jumping, plus the impact would surely send him flying, so this was his only option.
[Perfect Dodge]
Stark looked at the corner of the hallway, his gaze shaking as he wondered when the hell would 'THAT' finish, he really needed it.
"MAD RUSH," not letting him get a single second of rest, the elite guard got up unharmed and rushed toward Stark, placing its shoulder in front of its body like a rugby player wanting to tackle down somebody.
~FWISH~
Stark slid down and somehow managed to avoid the attack by passing between the guard's legs.
~BOOOOM~
It crashed against the obsidian wall in front of it as it couldn't stop in its rush.
~SHATTER~
The wall was completely destroyed as the guard passed right through it, revealing another hallway behind.
"-12813!" it received some damage, but quickly got up and grabbed its morning star back.
This fight was getting really bad, and Stark had no idea how to beat this thing for now…
'Think, Stark, think…!' Stark faced the giant monster as it removed the debris from its armor and got up again.
"KRAKKR~" and the guard was also getting angrier for no apparent reason, I mean, it was the one that decided to crash onto the wall?!
Soon enough… they would be able to use 'THAT' perk for the first time…

chapters.title: Chapter 167 - 167: The Superior Clone
chapters.content:
It seems like the goal of the [Mad Rush] attack just now was simply to retrieve its weapon, so killing Stark was just a bonus to it.
Its silver armor was unscathed, and Stark could see that a giant hole had formed on the wall the guard hit, meaning that he could see another hallway from there.
'Need to do this quickly... if someone sees or hear the noises they could steal the key...'
But wait... wouldn't that mean a chance to kill and retrieve his map, as well as two rewards...?
'Hm...' Stark actually hesitated, but in the end it didn't matter as long as nobody showed up.
~THUMP~
The guard took another massive step, making Stark's body jump slightly because of the sheer force.
And then... it turned its pupils toward the spot the clones were supposed to be at.
"Krakr...?" for the first time it sounded confused, and its pupils widened, the aura around them faltering slightly.
"AURA SMASH... MERGE!" taking advantage of that small opportunity and time frame, Stark focused his aura on his right hand and began to summon the giant crimson fist.
The [Elite Guard] kept looking at 'THAT' thing for a few more seconds, almost if shocked.
"Krakkark?," which roughly translated to, "What that is?" was what it said at that moment.
And then, if sensing something was wrong, it immediately began rushing toward it, knowing that it couldn't allow such a thing to transform.
"Not today, asshole, only five more seconds after all...!" Stark wouldn't let all his efforts go to waste, so he quickly finished charging up the [Aura Smash] and sent it toward the guard when it was only a few meters from reaching the clones.
~BOOOOM~
It could obviously dodge or at least deflect it under normal circumstances using its massive weapons or the [Chrono Dodge] skill, which Stark hadn't seen yet.
But... it's panicked state and rush in stopping the clones made it ignore its surroundings, resulting in the giant fist, much bigger than its head, hitting it straight on the chest sideways.
~FWISH, CRASH~
It was sent flying toward the wall right beside it, crashing into it and almost destroying it because of the sheer impact of the crimson aura.
"-58171!" the damage was still relatively low as to how much it would have dealt normally, but it was fine as it had stopped the guard from interrupting the clones' transformation.
And then, at that moment...
~FWISHHHHH, BWING!~
A giant light emerged from the corner of the hall from Stark's perspective, while the guard was just watching it with widened eyes.
And...
['The Superior Clone' was successfully summoned!]
[Description: You can choose to summon your three clones and merge them all together (much like with Aura Smash), thus creating a superior crimson copy that is ALMOST as good as the original]
This was the perk he had been wanting to use, although it took around thirty seconds for them to merge, which wouldn't seem like a lot normally, but just in this battle, it almost felt like minutes because of the speed of the attacks.
'Come...' Stark called out for his clone, and with speed to fast it was invisible to the naked eye, it placed itself in front of the boy so that he can observe it.
Even the [Elite Guard] was confused because of the speed, taking a few seconds to turn its head to the spot it was on and immediately getting up, knowing it needed to get rid of them both fast.
'...'
The [Superior Clone] resembled the usual clones, except the aura that made its body was much darker in color, and it flowed faster and stronger than before.
Just by viewing it, Stark knew that thing was the real deal as its entire body was surrounded by powerful crimson aura.
'...' it just stood there, a big smile on its face as it awaited Stark's orders.
"Can I control you?" this was Stark's first question.
He had usually been able to control a clone by concentrating his aura in his eyes and sending it to the clones, but maybe that was because they are pretty much.
But what about the [Superior Clone]? Would he be able to control it? If so, how well?
This could definitely be big, as taking control of such a thing while staying back would be overpowered.
'...' the clone put its crimson hand against its chin and acted as if it was thinking, then... it just shrugged.
[Maybe yes, maybe no]
This was its answer, meaning Stark would need to try it himself.
But for now...
"KRAAKKAKRKAKAK~" the elite guard roared so hard that the ceiling was shaking, and small debris kept falling all over.
Then... it dashed toward Stark and his clone, carrying both it's bloodied sword and the morning star.
"MORNING STAR'S DARKNESS!" it used one of its [Advanced] skills while rushing at them both, and suddenly...
~FWISH~
As if it was sucking up the darkness of the elite's eyes, the morning star grew in size, at least thrice as big as originally, now it was even bigger than the arm of the elite and five times as big as Stark' body.
Its silver spikes were also replaced by completely dark ones, emitting a very dark aura.
"K...KRKAKRA~!" even the guard seemed to struggle carrying it, so it just launched its sword at the two Stark.
~BOOOM~
The impact of the weapon exploded the floor, but the two easily avoided it as this attack was mostly just to get rid of the weapon.
"KRAAKKRKS~" the guard tried to carry the morning star, but actually grazed its own arm in the process.
"27291!" that weapon's damage was way too high, and now that it was bigger, faster and stronger, it would be more difficult to avoid it.
"Aura Smash... MERGE!"
"...?" Stark was confused as he wasn't the one that used this skill but... his clone?
He hadn't ordered it to, it was doing it on its own for some reason, and the smile on its face showed that it was confident in its abilities.
Frankly, Stark would expect that thing to explode in its face, but who knows, maybe it got strong to be able to master it...?
After managing to put the giant handle of the dark morning star between both its hands, the elite guard smirked behind its helmet.
It was carrying it like a baseball bat, but oh well...
And then...
"CRITICAL HIT SPIN!" it used another one of its [Advanced Skills], this one not stronger than [Morning Star's Darkness], yet when paired together... they became deadly.
And so, Stark and his [Superior Clone] got ready to deal with that guard.

chapters.title: Chapter 168 - 168: Killing The Elite Guard
chapters.content:
"CRITICAL HIT SPIN!" the elite guard began to slowly spin around while carrying its morning star horizontally, positioning it for the spikes to hit its enemies directly, which would definitely be an insta-kill not only for the clone, but also Stark.
Then…
~FWISH, FWISH~
It began to go faster… faster… AND FASTER, until eventually… the guard's figure was only but a blur, replaced by a series of afterimages.
The [Elite Guard] was spinning so fast it was invisible to the naked eye, and its morning star kept crashing onto the obsidian walls, but it was the walls that were getting destroyed, not it.
~BOOM, CRASH~
Before Stark and the [Superior Clone], the giant spinning figure of the guard, its white aura surrounding it completely as if it was a tornado, kept approaching the two.
It was taking up the entirety of the hallway, with no way to escape, and all there was behind Stark was the room the guard had come out of, and it was just a dead end.
"AURA SMASH… MERGE!" the clone's expression didn't falter as it kept smiling, then sent its giant crimson fist toward the elite guard, who was slowly getting closer.
Of course, it could go much faster even in this [Spin] form, but it was as if it was enjoying tormenting the prisoners.
~FWISH, BOOOM~
The giant fist crashed onto the giant.
"-49382!" it did damage, but the giant guard didn't even falter.
Wind was blowing through Stark's hair as the aura and speed created force, and the ground shook beneath his feet.
'…' Stark's clone just shrugged, and yet it didn't stop smiling.
Was it the [Superior Clone] perk that made it so confident in everything, or…?
"DODGE CONTROL!" as if showing Stark what he should do, the clone dashed toward the giant guard and immediately disappeared.
[Dodge Control] wouldn't let you get hit no matter what, so it basically just teleported to the other side.
'Already knew that… but didn't want to use it in case there was another solution…' Stark thought that he needed to keep this skill in case anything else happened…
But…
Once the cone was on the other side of the hallway… it drew a circle above both Stark and the spinning guard, then hit its palm, a crimson aura glowing in it.
And…?
"HEAVEN'S WRATH!" a crimson glow appeared on the ceiling above Stark, and when he looked at it, his face turned pale.
'DID IT… JUST USE IT ON ME?!'
He could see the [Superior Clone] smiling, seemingly having planned everything.
The [Superior Clone] wasn't listening to Stark, or at least it wasn't doing ONLY what he wanted it to do, almost as if… it gained some kind of sentience?
Of course, this wasn't truly possible, but his aura merged with his could make it do things even he couldn't predict.
~FWISH, FWISHH~
The giant beam was charging up while the [sublevel 4 ELITE Guard] was approaching, now only a few meters away as its giant morning star kept getting closer to Stark.
The [Superior Clone] was basically… forcing Stark to use [Dodge Control], or else he would get killed by its own beam since he wasn't immune.
~FWISHHH, BOOOM!!!~
"DODGE CONTROL!" the morning star actually was about to smash Stark's head when he activated the skill, but his aura moved his head at terrifying speed, defying the laws of physics to dodge.
~BOOOOM~
The beam exploded, its radius taking over not only Stark but also the [Elite Guard] as it didn't expect anything while the human was cornered.
'That clone…' Stark eyed it for a bit, his pupils widening, 'Its… smart…?'
Usually, it's Stark giving all the instructions, with the clones only following what he was asking them to do, yet… this time… it was the [Superior Clone] itself who made up a plan to both escape this situation but also to damage the guard immensely.
'…!'
The crimson beam descended and began to hit the entire radius it was aimed at, hitting both Stark and the [Elite Guard], except that thanks to the [Dodge Control], Stark was able to teleport away right next to the [Superior Clone], who looked at him with a wide smile on its face.
"Never do that shit again…" Stark rolled his eyes, and the clone just shrugged, "Especially when we had [Crimson Ball Transmission]…"
Of course, he had never used it before, so that is the reason why the clone decided to not risk it and used [Dodge Control].
Meanwhile…
~BOOOM~
The intensity of the crimson beam hit their face, and all they could do was watch as the elite guard was getting destroyed by the beam.
"-58372! -59281! -63928! -61928! -73144!" it would take a while to stop itself in its spin rush, so it couldn't even dodge.
Armor? Defense? None of this matters when your very body was getting disintegrated by a giant beam that could take out anything within it.
And so after a few seconds… the beam stopped.
The ceiling and floor within the circle radius of the beam completely disappeared.
And as for the [Sublevel 4 ELITE Guard]… it was nowhere to be seen.
Like literally, in its place were only a massive pile of ashes, and the morning star had also completely disappeared.
'…'
[You have slain 'Sublevel 4 ELITE Guard lv100', gained 2,183,449EXP!]
It truly was dead… just like that.
It almost felt weird for Stark, he was so used to enemies always managing to use up every last one of their skills before being defeated, yet the guard didn't even get to use some of its skills like [Chrono Dodge], [Guard Sacrifice] or even its ultimate skill [The Fourth Elite].
'Well… I guess it's better this way,' he shrugged.
But this also instinctively made Stark turn his head toward the [Superior Clone], its expression was cold and malicious, the grin on its face growing more as it saw the ashes of the guard.
'…' Stark didn't know what to think of this, but the clone had pretty much taken out the elite by itself.
Should he be concerned or happy that such a perk had been gifted to him? He didn't know…
'Okay, what now…'
And right at that moment… many panels appeared around him as he was surrounded by the golden glow thrice.
[Your level has increased to level 44, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 45, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 46, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Experience: 20599/1000000], he had finally reached the stage where he needed 1M experience every time to level up.
But in the end, even if his clone did the damage, he still got all the experience as it also meant the clone grew stronger alongside him.
And so at that moment, Stark began to read the panels as they should be able to help him…
But of course, the first he observed was…
[Level 45 Reached: please pick a card]

chapters.title: Chapter 169 - 169: Domi-Chain Restrain and Floor Key
chapters.content:
[Level 45 Reached: please pick a card]
And of course, three cards appeared in front of the boy, their color was pink, and yet again no indicator to show him which one could be the best.
Frankly, Stark had never thought of it, but just how different would his life be if he had chosen another card from the ones he had been given?
What if he never got [Aura Smash], [Clone Frenzy] or [Invincible Dodge]…?
After all, it had all been luck, and the other cards also held different skills, whether they were better or worse than the ones he got were all up to luck.
'Let's just get this over with…' he closed his eyes and began to aim his hand randomly, reaching for the cards and picking the first one that he touched, it had become somewhat of a ritual for him.
But…
~THUMP~
Something grabbed his shoulder before he was about to grab one of the cards, and when he looked back, he saw it was the [Superior Clone], shaking its head as if telling Stark this wasn't the right thing to do.
'…?'
And so before the boy could even ask anything, the clone headed behind the cards.
'…!!!' Stark immediately understood, and if it worked, then it was insane.
The cards didn't turn once the clone went behind them, but did it truly mean he could read them…?
Cards can only be read by the very person who they are given to, which is why asking other people to read your cards isn't an option to begin with: there was no way to cheat the system.
But… what about a semi-sentient clone made out of the user's aura, then could it maybe… just maybe…?
Suddenly, the [Superior Clone]'s smile grew bigger.
And then… it pointed to the card to the right.
"Can you see the read about the skills?"
'…' the clone shook its head, seemingly it couldn't know the name or the description of the skills, which was a bummer.
But then, why would it pick this card in particular.
'…Oh!' Stark's eyes widened, "Is it because of the images?"
"…" the clone nodded.
Of course, he had no current way to know the skill he would pick, but the cards always had some sort of drawing related to them at the front, so this was the only thing that could help outside of the panels.
Basically… the clone picked the drawing that looked to be related to the most powerful skill out of the bunch.
Of course, such a logic was flawed, as there was the possibility of a boring drawing being related to the most powerful skill, but this was already a good enough indicator.
"Can you tell me the drawings?" he asked, this could also help as he would be judging too.
But…
"…" the clone shook its head.
'Sigh…' Stark reached for the card the clone pointed at and picked it up, making the other two disappear.
And when he turned it to see what the drawing was…
He saw the picture of two crimson chains intertwining one another.
"…"
He looked back to his clone, and it was giving him two thumbs up.
…
[Skill: Domi-Chains Restrain]
[Type: Legendary]
[Description: A skill that allows the user to create a powerful, crimson chain that can bind enemies in a restrictive grip, making it impossible for them to move or use their abilities freely. The longer they remain bound, the stronger the chains become. With enough restraint, the enemy will lose consciousness, allowing the user to freely engage in battle with other foes in the area.]
[Note: The chain has 10000HP, but as long as it is not broken, it will continue to slowly bind itself around the enemy like a moving snake, oh, and you also get one chain for now, plus twenty minutes between each use]
…
'…!' Another legendary skill was granted to him, and this one also seemed interesting.
Of course, descriptions give an overall idea to how the skill works, but it was always better to try it out for yourself before attempting to use it in battle, which was why Stark loved the [Memories Museum] so much.
After reading the description a few times over, Stark closed down his new skill's panel and looked at the one next to it.
[You will be able to spin the 'Class Wheel' in 4 levels!]
Of course, this was logical, although Stark did wonder what other class could he possibly get, and how would he align its usage with [Domination] and [Alchemist].
Of course, getting a new class was always good, but… what if it was totally useless?
For example, getting [Warrior] seemed utterly useless in his case since he only used his fists with his domination aura, so other than some skills that could help, then he probably had absolutely no use to it?
'…I'll think about it later,' he mumbled as he moved to the third and final panel.
And…
[You have eliminated 'sublevel 4 ELITE Guard', and…]
'And…!?'
[He had the key to the next floor! Good job!]
Suddenly, the key materialized out of the thin air into his right hand.
'NICE… VERY NICE…!!!' Stark's widened as he opened his palm and saw a bronze-key with a very small 'sublevel 3' note attached to it.
'Spatial Inventory,' he wasn't going to play any risky games and instantly put the key inside of his inventory void, no way in hell he would allow anyone to steal it as it would be a battle to the death.
And now… everyone was stuck on this floor until Stark eventually finds the exit =).
Plus, if he ever died, the key would stay inside the inventory, not leaving it, meaning that the others would be stuck inside and die of starvation.
Well, if they don't just straight up kill one another that is, and even then it wasn't sure they would get the perks related to keys.
Basically… he had the perfect excuse to stay alive in front of the others as long as he got a key.
'Very good…'
"…" the [Superior Clone]'s smile grew very wide, stretching from one corner of his face to the other, and it was becoming uncanny at this point, it seemed to like Stark's idea: if he dies, everyone else is fucked.
Stark realized it somewhat, but [Superior Clone] seemed… how to say… evil?
He was more malicious and ill intentioned than Stark himself, was it because of his domination aura or something?
'Doesn't matter as long as it listens…' he jumped the destroyed obsidian wall the elite guard had made and ended up in another hallway, then the clone followed closely.
He tried to summon back the clone to himself, obviously, but…
[If you bring the 'Superior Clone' back to you, then the transformation will be cancelled, and you will have to wait for all three clones to regenerate, meaning 1h30!]
'Yeahhh I'm not waiting that long for something that isn't even sure to happen since the transformation does take a while to take place…' in the end, he just decided to keep it close to him.
And so like that, now that they had the key to the next floor in hand, the two Stark continued walking through the maze of the prison's fourth sublevel floor.
Of course, all the others weren't doing nothing either, as they were all slowly leveling up and looking for the key as well: the map showed the exit, so all they needed was the key for it.
'None of you are escaping until I get out… =)' Stark smiled as he turned around another corner.
"=)" the clone smiled too, nothing but bad intentions on its expression: nothing mattered to it except for the safety of the original Stark.

chapters.title: Chapter 170 - 170: Group Gathering at the Exit
chapters.content:
[Your level has increased to level 47, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 48, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
'Phew…' it had been an hour since Stark defeated the [Elite Guard], yet there had been no additional deaths or any other announcements, everyone was truly just waiting for someone to unlock the door or trying to find the key themselves.
He had encountered more [sublevel 4 Guards] on his way, along with some other types of monsters like [Skeleton Prisoners] and [Threat Robots], but they were all taken care of rather easily by… the clone.
Yep, it was still there, walking behind Stark, a wide smile on its face, and the more they killed, the happier it seemed to be, the way it was walking also became weirder as it was leaning left or right after each step.
"KRAKAKRA~" yet again they met two more [sublevel 4 Guards], at first he had somewhat struggled against them, but now they were a piece of cake both to him and his clone.
"DOMI-CHAINS RESTRAIN!" Stark shouted, and a giant crimson chain came out of the ground beneath, heading toward one of the monsters.
It enrolled itself around its arm and continued to roll slowly like a snake trapping its prey.
Domi-Chain Restrain or Domi-Chain in short was an extremely powerful skill against single enemies or large ones, as most of the time they were really easy to restrain.
~CLING, CLANG~
The chain immediately headed toward its second arm and restrained it as well, all of this in the span of two seconds, meaning it didn't have the time to react.
And now that both is arms were out… it couldn't do anything but watch as the chain quickly but surely took out its other limbs and soon enough life force.
"AURA SMASH… MERGE!" the clone sent a giant fist toward the second guard.
"-169382!" its body exploded in a thousand pieces as the first hit it and left a giant hole.
As for the other guard, it couldn't its arms, legs, and now even move its torso as they were all being slowly chained by the crimson chain, which was expanding from the ground beneath Stark, with seemingly no end to it.
~THUMP~
The guard lost its balance and fell, its face full of pain as its energy was drained by the chain.
And then…
[Enemy fell unconscious because of the chain!]
'You do you…' he looked at his clone, and it smiled as it rushed toward the guard, stopping right in front of its head.
And then…
~SLAM, SLAM~
It began to punch it.
Stark didn't know why, but it enjoyed torturing monsters and taking them out slowly gave it the most pleasure, so he just let it do that.
And so after thirty seconds…
[You have slain 'sublevel 4 Guard lv95', gained 128392 EXP!]
[You have slain 'sublevel 4 Guard lv95', gained 126930 EXP!]
But this wasn't all, since the moment the guard being held by the chain died, it retracted on itself really fast and went back to its original spot of apparition.
[Successful bind, chain regained!]
It was a perk he had learned after using the chain a few times: if the chain manages to completely restrain an opponent for Stark to kill it, or if it knocked them out, then he wouldn't need to wait for 10 minutes, the chain would immediately be usable again.
[Experience: 439281/1140000]
There wasn't anything left to do, so they just kept going, hoping their luck would be better as they had just been wandering aimlessly now, and their stamina wasn't infinite (well, at least Stark's wasn't, he didn't know about the clone).
But… after only ten minutes…
'…' Stark turned around yet another corner that looked the same as all the others and… '…!'
He saw four people standing against the walls, sitting, or just walking in circles, all the while talking to one another!
In the middle of them was a giant bronze-textured door with a sign reading 'sublevel 3' next to it.
'Found it…' he smiled, but it was weird why so many people were there, and none of them were killing each other?
~THUMP~
He took a single step in that hall, and all eyes fell on him.
"Oh! If it's not Chosen…!" Officer laughed, his guns still in hand.
The people present were: Officer, the white-haired lady Stark saw as she was in front of his cell, and… the two others he hadn't seen.
Stark stopped in his tracks, wanting to speak to them over some distance to make sure this wasn't a trap, and his clone obviously stopped behind, not revealing itself to the public as it was at the corner of the hallway.
"Oh!" Officer nodded, "I guess you didn't get to know them since they stayed in their cells then immediately ran through the metal door…"
"I guess…" Stark shrugged, he didn't care much.
"HEY!" a man with dark gray eyes that had a white star-shaped detail in the irises, and scraggly hair with a mixture of two colors: pale reddish pink and apple green, suddenly got up and shouted, taking Stark aback, "NAME'S YURI!"
He was wearing a dark teal blazer with gold buttons over a long-sleeved white dress shirt and a gold and black striped tie.
"…?" Stark had frankly expected those to have stayed inside their cells to be of the mysterious type or at least be super cautious of everything, yet… this guy seemed extremely extroverted.
Stark's gaze then moved on to the person next to him, it was a woman with yellow eyes and short, unkempt taupe brown hair with two long ear-like hair locks that stick up on both sides of her head.
She was wearing a pair of round, metal-rimmed red eyeglasses, and a had a device resembling a tablet between her hands.
She was wearing a maroon sweater and a long pair of black jeans.
After realizing it was her turn to introduce herself, she taped a few letters on the tablet and…
"Kokoro!" a blue panel emanated from the tablet like a hologram, showing whatever she wrote.
"Oh yeah, Kokoro doesn't talk much she told us, so don't even bother, I tried haha…" Officer nervously joked.
"And her?" the white-haired girl didn't even give him a single glance.
"Oh, she didn't tell us her name either, so yeah…" Officer shrugged.
She was sitting against the wall, wearing an elegant long black dress with a semi-long skirt that reached her tights.
These were all the people present here.
[7 participants remain!]
Akira, the guy who killed two people, probably was still alive, and he couldn't see the sect leader dying so fast after being so calm all this time, meaning that the person that had died was probably… Lolia.
"What are you doing here?" he asked the group.
"Just taking a break as we've been searching for that key for a very long time!" Yuri shouted again in response.
"Hm~" Stark finally felt comfortable taking a step forward as he wanted to open the next floor already.
But the moment he did that, the clone followed closely after him.
And so when the clone showed itself to the others, its powerful and overwhelming aura could be sensed by all the people in the hall: they saw it as clear killing intent.
~FWISH, BOOOM~
All of them activated their auras, even the white-haired woman, and although she didn't move from her spot, she finally looked in Stark's direction, which could be seen as her acknowledging the threat.
'…' the clone's smile grew wider as it saw the participants activate their auras and summon their weapons the moment they saw it.
'What the hell is happening…' Stark sighed, would he really have to fight these people because his clone was just… twisted?

chapters.title: Chapter 171 - 171: Leaving the Fourth Sublevel
chapters.content:
"=)" the clone kept smiling, peeking from behind Stark's shoulder.
It couldn't stop its aura from pouring out itself, so to everyone else, it just seemed like plain killing intent, and an extremely powerful one at that.
"…!" Officer already had his guns in hand, but they suddenly began to morph slightly with their owner's will, a beautiful ocean-like aura waving around them, then he pointed them not at Stark, but at his clone, "What's that thing!"
"Stay back buddy," Yuri's attitude went from extroverted and cheerful to full serious mode, his gray eyes shining deeply as aura poured out of them.
In comparison to Stark's aura though, his was completely gray, and as for his weapon…
~SWISH, SPARK~
Ten golden stars began to surround the boy, all shining.
[Power of the Stars] was his weapon, and it was unique, no matter how you thought about it.
"…" Kokoro didn't speak at all as she didn't tap anything on her tablet, instead she just got up, and began to hold her tablet with her two hands while pointing it at Stark's clone.
~FWISH~
Five blue things came out of the tablet, and they were… holograms: a sword, a shield, a spear, a person in armor holding a sword, and a two meters tall monster that REALLY resembled the guards Stark had fought, actually, no… it definitely was a guard.
'Perception!' Stark yet again used his skill to check out what her 'main' weapon was, and it was… [Synchro Tablet].
Basically, she could use her tablet and aura to summon holographic and powerful weapons/people/monsters that could actually deal real-life damage.
Guns, golden stars, and a tablet that can summon holograms, it was a very unique set of weapons… and Stark's fist in comparison seemed pretty plain, was that the power of [Domination] and its ability to grant ANY kind of weapon?
As for the white-haired girl, she did in fact activate her aura, it was white and surrounded her, but she didn't summon her weapon.
"…=)" and almost as if trying to sabotage itself, the clone positioned itself for combat, alerting the others that there was true danger now.
'Sigh…' Stark almost wanted to laugh, "Clone Frenzy… HP Transfer!" he activated the perk he had never used until now since it was both useless and too dangerous to give 2000HP to his clone.
And then…
~SLAM~
He gently slammed the back of its head.
"-1482!" his attack was extremely weak, so it didn't deal enough damage to kill it with the additional HP he had given it.
"…=(" the clone held the back of its head for a few seconds, almost acting as if it was hurt, but Stark knew it was all acting since these things don't feel pain.
"Don't mind it… it's just… me!" Stark turned back to the others and shrugged.
"…" all of them looked at one another, then back at Stark, before deactivating their auras.
The golden stars disappeared as they all suddenly flashed to the ceiling (or sky), the holograms slowly went back to the tablet, and Officer just put down his guns.
"You should tell that thing to watch out… it's really creepy," Officer could be seen sweating a bit, and it was the same for all the others: they truly didn't like that thing, it was almost like it was staring at their souls, and ready to kill them at any moment.
~STEP, STEP~
Stark began to head toward the others, and specifically toward the door as he wanted to open it.
"So Akira and Leader are still trying to find the key?" he asked while opening up his [Spatial Inventory].
"Precisely," Yuri went back to cheerful mode, "They said they didn't want to wait in here doing nothing, so we're just waiting for them to find it…"
'So they saw them, meaning that it was Lolia who died…'
"Ok, so who killed Lolia?" he suddenly asked.
It had been less than two hours since the trial started, but it had already become taboo to ask about the whereabouts of a participant or about who killed them.
"Probably the crazy katana guy or the sect leader," Officer shrugged, his expression darkening as a crimson vortex began to form in his eyes, "Fucking criminals…" he mumbled.
"And about the rewards, do you know what they are?"
"Nope, they wouldn't tell us, so we don't even know who did it, maybe they are even… among us," Yuri joked around, but nobody could deny that it was a possibility.
Stark was now only three meters away from the door, his eyes never leaving the other participants, and in that regard, [Superior Clone] was the best possible bodyguard.
~TAP, TAP~
The clone gently taped Stark's shoulder, and when he looked back, he could see that the smile on its face was wider than ever before as it pointed at Yuri.
[He did it], it couldn't talk, and it hid behind Stark so that no one saw its movement except for him, but he immediately understood.
'…' Stark's eyes fell on Yuri as the latter smiled at him, an innocent look on his face, but Stark's gaze was judgmental, and when his clone informed him of Yuri's actions, he immediately noticed how fake his expression was.
'Thanks,' Stark mumbled to his clone as he reached the door, he truly couldn't trust any of these people, even Officer that seemed to hate crime could have other motives after all.
"Are you gonna wait for them to get the key too?" Yuri laughed.
'Annoying…' Stark gritted his teeth as he pulled out the key of his inventory void and suddenly inserted it into the door's lock and twisted it.
Of course, Stark's clone stayed on guard if anybody tried anything, acting like a bodyguard as it looked at each of the participants one after the other, the smile on its face would probably haunt them.
A blinding light emitted from the keyhole the moment he did that, taking all the others aback.
The bronze door slowly creaked open, revealing a dark corridor with a spiral of stairs going up.
[The sublevel 3 Floor has been opened! Head to the exit to be able to climb to the next level!]
And so that panel appeared in front of everyone, even those that were still trying to find the key in the giant maze.
Finally, after almost two hours and three deaths, they would finally be able to reach the third sublevel, meaning only… 4 floors to go, if they counted floor 0 which would only be the fight against the warden.
'…Let's go,' Stark mumbled, and his clone smiled as they both began to ascend, the others shocked that he had so casually opened the door.
Soon after, they began to climb up as well, then it was Akira's and Leader's turn.
And so just like that, everyone left the fourth sublevel.

chapters.title: Chapter 172 - 172: The Dungeon of Fear (Third Sublevel)
chapters.content:
The stairway was dimly lit, the only source of light being the faint glow of their auras as they ascended higher and higher.
Stark was the first who went, so he was technically leading the group, with the rest of them following closely behind.
Stark's clone was climbing the stairs backward, keeping its aura eyes on the group and making sure that a fair distance was kept, and if something ever happened, it wouldn't hesitate to all its arsenal of skills to at least take down two of them with it.
As they climbed, the atmosphere grew heavier with each step, the weight of their experiences in the trial pressing down on them.
Finally, after what felt like an eternity of climbing, they reached yet another bronze door that looked very similar to the one he had opened before.
Stark approached the door cautiously, there was no handle or key slot this time, so he just pressed his palm on it, and then…
~FWISH, DING~
[Chosen has reached the third sublevel first, granting reward…]
'…' all the others peeked and saw the panel appear above the door, their eyes widening.
'Seems like that trial really wants us to kill each other, haha…' if the first person to touch the door would be rewarded, then it meant people would fight to the death to reach it first.
This time though, no one did anything, they all just stared at Stark as the panel closed, and the door began to slowly open, revealing the third sublevel.
[Sublevel 3: The Dungeon of Fear]
The room beyond the bronze door was vast and shrouded in darkness, save for a few flickering torches that lined the walls.
'Does every floor have a different atmosphere and aesthetic?' Stark wondered as he stepped foot inside the floor.
[Once you enter a floor, you aren't allowed to go back!]
'Of course…' Stark didn't even bother to look behind him, instead opting to check out his surroundings.
He found himself in a dungeon-like environment, with damp stone walls and floors with patterns, and in the distance, he could hear cold metal chains rattling against the stone.
It truly felt like they were in a prison dungeon: occasional torches as sole source of light in the darkness, footsteps and weird noises in the distance, cells with sturdy silver bars, basically… this floor was much more oppressing than the previous.
[Introducing a new perk once everyone enters this floor :D]
'Not like I'm gonna sit around and wait for the others to find out,' Stark gestured for his clone to follow him, and it nodded as they both turned around another corner while the others just entered the floor.
'…' no more talking now, and each and every one of them headed toward a different path, making sure to split as to not allow anyone to try and betray someone else.
They were all very cautious of their surroundings, so normal surprise attacks probably won't work.
~PLOP, CLING~
The ambient sound of water drops and of the chains was still present, but it didn't bother Stark as he kept going deeper, his clone right behind, the smile on its face never going away.
And after only five minutes…
[Everyone has entered the third sublevel!]
Seems like Akira and Leader easily found the exit thanks to their maps, and so the panel that would introduce the new 'killing' perk soon appeared.
[Introducing the "TOP 3" perk!]
[If before the end of sublevel 2, only three people remain alive, then you will completely skip sublevel 1 (the hardest and most deadly of them all) as well as the ones you are in, even if it is sublevel 3, immediately heading toward the warden!]
'Cheap tricks…' Stark couldn't help but let out a small laugh, basically, if right now only three people were alive, then they would immediately be sent to the warden, cutting short any danger they would come across.
This would completely defy the point of this trial, as it is to prove that the domination users in question are worthy of owning their abilities.
So why…?
'Maybe… just maybe… the warden is something that even three domination users cannot take down, sending those alive to their doom…' he couldn't know right now, but to be honest, all of this seemed so weird, and it was entirely possible that after each floor, the perk would become more and more tempting, to the point even Stark or even Officer would be forced to kill.
"Spatial Inventory," Stark opened the void and took out two [Potion of Regeneration], three [Potion of Speed] and three [Potion of Strength], then he drank them all, getting him back to full HP and granting him and his clone a boost in speed and strength.
~PLOP, PLOP~
There were skeletons of humans inside the dozens of medieval jail cells scattered across the hallways, yet he hadn't encountered any monster yet.
And then…
~DING!~
[As the first to get the key AND open the door to the next floor, you have been granted one reward from the list without having to kill!]
[Reminder that if you kill, you get your map back and two rewards instead of one, wink wink ;)]
'Doing anything to tempt me, heh~' Stark ignored the second panel and instead focused on the first one.
[Would you like to unlock your reward now?]
[Y/N?]
A colorful clickable button appeared below the question, and Stark didn't hesitate to click on Y as there was no reason not to.
Of course, under normal circumstances, the others would have to think about instantly using their rewards since they would need to hide them in case anybody would steal them or even figure out that they had murdered, but it was a different story for Stark since… he has [Spatial Inventory]!
[Nice! Now just spin the wheel!]
'Seems oddly familiar,' this almost reminded Stark of the times he had to spin his class wheel, but of course deep he knew this was different.
A crimson wheel with horns on top of it and a very overwhelming aura appeared in front of the boy.
There were 10 sections, except the one with the 'Killing Spree' perk was chained, meaning it was impossible to get.
[If you fall on 'Killing Spree', you get nothing :D (should have killed more people, its on you)]
[Now just pull the tail to spin the wheel!]
And as it said, a demon tail emerged from the front, inviting Stark to pull it, and he did so without a single ounce of hesitation.
[Good luck!] and then all the panels disappeared.
~FWISH, FWISH, FWISH~
The wheel began to spin at intense speed, hovering over every perk available.
'Not as much pressure as the classes, that's for sure…' yet he was surprisingly calm.
And so after around thirty seconds…
~BIP, BIP…~ it slowed down, then suddenly stopped moving altogether, ~BEEEEPPPP~
It had chosen the reward, and it was…
[Reward: Revive Token!]

chapters.title: Chapter 173 - 173: Double Revive is Possible?!
chapters.content:
[Reward: Revive Token!]
'…' Stark observed the panel in front of him as the wheel stopped on his reward, 'Wait a damn minute…'
[Revive Token: A token that will allow you to revive yourself once in the event of death, one time use.]
'But I also have [Chosen One], which can revive me once too…' Stark's face began to contort into a smile as scary as his clone's.
Because it meant… that he could revive himself twice.
People would fight to the death to be able to revive themselves just once, and pay astronomical amounts of money to get their hands on items that could come even close to save their lives, and here Stark was, with the ability to revive himself twice…
'This is good… this is VERY good…' he laughed out loud like a maniac, and thankfully there was nobody to hear him, or they would probably attack since he would seem crazy.
But right at that moment…
~CLING CLING~
He heard some noises coming out of some of the cells ahead of him, as well as in the hallway behind him: it was the sound of chains, and of small steps hitting the concrete stone.
~CRACK~
A giant hand held the corner of the hall, and destroyed a part of the wall with its sheer strength.
And so, the giant monster (even bigger than the sublevel 4 guards), appeared.
[Name: Chain Cyclops]
It had beige skin with a brown cloak over its genitals (oddly similar to the guards, heh), except it was way more muscular, didn't have disgusting bumps all over its body, and on its face… was just a single eye.
There was no mouth, no nose, nothing, it was just a giant eye that looked down on Stark as the cyclops seemed to be at least fifteen meters in size.
In the cyclops' left hand was a giant silver chain, and he was spinning it around with scary momentum.
~THUMP, THUMP~
His footsteps echoed everywhere as he slowly approached Stark.
But this wasn't all, since there were two other types of monsters: the first was some sort of green lizard with sharp teeth that made a weird sound as it walked on the ground, they were around two meters in size.
[Name: Dungeon Lizard]
And the other were giant bats, the size of a human torso, flapping their dark wings, these bats didn't have eyes, they only had a very large mouth on their bodies, one that could easily swallow a human head if they grabbed it with their sharp dark teeth.
[Name: Blood Mouth Bat]
So basically, behind Stark was a giant cyclops, while in front of him were two lizards and three bats.
Yet, Stark's giant smile never disappeared from his face, and his crimson aura surrounded him, giving him a crazy look that even his clone would envy.
And so when he turned his gaze to the monster…
"…!" they immediately looked distressed: the lizards took a few steps back while the bats flapped their wings in the opposite direction, slowly getting away from Stark.
[Dungeon of Fear] monsters are supposed to cause fear to the opponents because of their terrifying appearances, yet… in front of this very human, THEY were the ones that feared for their lives.
Stark then turned his head to the cyclops, staring it in the eye, and its sole eye also widened, a few drops of sweat appearing on its bald forehead.
But this one didn't back, instead it stood its ground, yet Stark didn't to care much, after all… even his clone would be enough to take care of these things.
~THUMP~
Although it definitely looked like the cyclops was hesitating, it still took another step toward Stark.
'Perception,' meanwhile, the boy decided to check out his opponents as they would probably be the most common monsters in the lot.
…
[Name: Chain Cyclops (STRONG)]
[Level: 105]
[HP: 218000]
[Strength: 5427]
[Stamina: 1203]
[Speed: 836]
[Defense: 2382]
[Skills: Cyclopsian Might, Chain Whip, The Final Blow, All-Seeing Eye, Stone Wall, Dungeon of Fear, Steel Smash, Eye Block]
…
He wasn't an ELITE, but he was at the category right below it: strong, plus it seemed like the level of monsters was now above 100.
…
[Name: Dungeon Lizard]
[Level: 103]
[HP: 112000]
[Strength: 2193]
[Stamina: 3768]
[Speed: 3231]
[Defense: 1482]
[Skills: Lizard Claw, Tail Whip, Dungeon of Fear, Lights Out, Enemy Detection, Attach Camouflage…]
…
This one was much weaker, and its HP were even lower than the guards even though it had a higher level, also most of its skills seemed useless in combat… maybe there was a trap?
…
[Name: Blood Mouth Bat]
[Level: 102]
[HP: 138500]
[Strength: 2482 (to be able to behead)]
[Stamina: 4928]
[Speed: 2011]
[Defense: 736]
[Skills: Blood Absorb, Mouth Throw, Darkness Burst, Dungeon of Fear, Bat Swarm, Miniature Duplication, Behead (if it hits you, you're dead), Fly…]
…
The bats were also pretty average, except for the fact they cold behead you if their skill hit you, otherwise their defense was so low only one or two hits would be enough to send them away.
All monsters had the [Dungeon of Fear] skill too though, maybe it was a passive?
"=)" meanwhile, Stark's clone just positioned itself in front of the lizards and bats, leaving Stark to take care of the cyclops.
'Sigh…' he turned around, hoping his clone wouldn't be dumb enough to fall into a trap, but… to be honest, it was so twisted and evil that he couldn't see it lose.
Are all [Superior Clones] going to be like this? And if yes, then doesn't that mean it is Stark's very own aura that is the problem?
"CRIMSON SPEARS," the clone, before even starting its fight with the other monsters, summoned three spears and sent them all at the cyclops' eye.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
It was too slow to avoid it, and so all three spears hit its eye.
"-37162! -40103! -38994!"
"=)" it didn't even look back to see what it did, and that surprised Stark.
"…!!!!" the cyclops couldn't scream since no mouth (duh), but it held its eyes with its two hands, and it looked to be in a lot of pain.
~OPEN~
When it opened its eye back, there were giant blood tears coming from it, and three red spots on it where the spears hit.
"I get it…" Stark sighed, but this was pretty damn obvious: the cyclops' weakness was its eye, and the moment it was destroyed, the monster would become blind.
It was kind of easy to figure out, but why the hell did the clone intervene before Stark could even begin to analyze his opponent?!
~DASH~
"AURA SMASH!" Stark looked back, but his clone was already rushing at the rest of the monsters, activating his skills in the process.
"I really need to figure out what that thing is thinking…" he decided not to think too much about it and faced the cyclops again, but this time it would be him against it.

chapters.title: Chapter 174 - 174: The Chain Cyclops
chapters.content:
The cyclops, now almost blinded in its one eye, roared in anger as it swung its massive chain wildly in Stark's direction.
"CHAIN WHIP," almost like a snake, the chain perfectly targeted the human, as if it had a conscience of its own.
Stark dodged with ease, his movements fluid and precise, his crimson aura burning brightly around him.
"ALL-SEEING EYE!" but the cyclops, even though its eye was bleeding, opened it as much as possible, allowing it to follow Stark's movements perfectly.
And so…
~FWISH~
"CHAIN WHIP," using the momentum, it turned its wrist, meaning that the chain came back to wrap itself around Stark.
"Crimson Spears," but the boy just summoned three spears while the cyclops was distracted and sent them at the eyeball.
'…!' the cyclops saw it coming, and it feared for its eye so it immediately half-abandoned was it was doing.
"STONE WALL!" it slammed its fist against the ground of the dungeon and a giant wall from the same material emerged from below, blocking all three spears.
"…" Stark shrugged, but he decided to use this opportunity to do something as the cyclops couldn't see him because of the giant wall, "Crimson Ball Transmission!"
He didn't use the skill much as he wasn't used to it, only using it three times against other monsters on the fourth sublevel, but it basically worked like this…
~FWISH~
A crimson ball the size of a tennis ball appeared in Stark's right hand, emitting a powerful aura.
[Throw the ball in the location you want to teleport at!]
He closed one of his eyes and focused…
Then…
~FWISH~
He threw it very far, aiming for a spot right behind the cyclops.
~BIM~
Stark's accuracy was terrible with this as he hadn't trained, so although the ball did end up hitting the floor behind the cyclops, it was very far from where he had aimed at.
As soon as it grazed the stone ground though…
[Target set!]
The ball didn't move or bounce at all though, staying stationary on the spot where it had landed, and a red circle formed around it, almost like a bullseye but with a weird pattern.
[Snap your fingers when you want to teleport!]
Now that his 'TP' point was set, all Stark needed to do was snap his fingers and he would almost instantly be teleported.
~CRUMBLE~
The giant stone wall fell apart after a few seconds, and the unsuspecting cyclops stared down at Stark, getting ready to attack again.
"CHAIN WHIP!" the cyclops roared, ready to strike at Stark once more, but the boy was already prepared.
~FWISH~
The giant silver chain was sent toward Stark, ready to destroy him, but…
"DOMI-CHAIN!" Stark replied accordingly, also sending his very own crimson chain toward the cyclops'.
The two chains clashed in a dazzling display of power, causing sparks to fly in every direction.
The cyclops' massive strength was evident as it pushed against Stark's chain with all its might.
But… strength isn't everything =), is it not?
~BAM~
Stark's chain was indeed sent away, but it had also stopped the cyclops' one too, and to add to that…
~FWISH, VIM~
It turned around by itself, and started wrapping around the cyclops' chain like a snake.
"…!" the cyclops couldn't control its chain as much as before as it was slowly getting infected by the crimson aura of Stark's
'Works on weapons…?' Stark scratched his chin while squinting his eyes, it was interesting to know.
The cyclops was visibly trying to tame its chain and get Stark's out of the way, but it couldn't no matter what, even going as far as holding the edge of its weapon with its two sturdy hands and pulling.
'AURA SMASH… MERGE!' taking yet again advantage of that opportunity while the cyclops was busy getting rid of the chain; Stark began to concentrate his power on his right hand as he ran in the cyclops' direction.
~SLAM~
The cyclops finally decided to use its brain, if it even exists, to hit the chain and destroy it as it only had 10000 HP.
"…!" then its giant pupil fell on Stark, noticing that the human was getting closer, so it immediately decided to attack again.
Are monsters just brain-dead robots with the sole orders they were given being 'VIOLENCE'and 'KILL HUMANS'? Who knows, but they sure do look like it!
"STEEL SMASH!" its free hand's color began to change, going from beige to silver-like, and it was obvious: it literally turned to steel, like actually.
~FWISH~
It aimed it down at the running Stark.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," the hand was extremely big, so Stark was forced to roll away thanks to his invincibility frames.
~BOOOOM, CRASHHH~
The sheer impact of the attack destroyed the area around the floor that had been hit, but it also resulted in the cyclops' hand being stuck temporarily as it couldn't get it out.
"DUMBASS," Stark laughed as he turned around and used the cyclops' own hand and arm to head toward its head.
"CYCLOPSIAN MIGHT!" the cyclops began to charge up its powers, the aura around it being more bright, and the pupil in its eye growing three times its normal size, then… "CHAIN WHIP!"
After taking control of its chain, it immediately sent it toward Stark while actively trying to get its steel hand out of the hole it had created.
~JUMP~
Stark avoided the attack by jumping, but…
"CHAIN WHIP, CHAIN WHIP, CHAIN WHIP!!!" thanks to the use of [Cyclopsian Might], the cyclops was able to continuously throw attacks at the human.
~FWISH, SLIDE, JUMP~
Stark would avoid them all though, getting closer to the giant eye, and then, when his [Aura Smash] was fully powered up…
"AURA SMASH… MERGE!" he punched the air in the direction of the giant eye, sending a giant crimson fist as big as it was toward it.
~FWISH~
The fist left a powerful crimson trail as it headed toward the cyclops, who could only watch in shock as the attack closed on it.
~BOOOOOOOM~
It hit its eye straight on, right in the middle, with not a single possibility to deny the fact it was a critical hit.
"-219382!" the damage was beyond the 200K mark, something Stark had never achieved before, but it was mostly because the weak point of the cyclops made its defense irrelevant.
And so that meant…
[Chain Cyclops HP: 0/218000], well to be honest the final attack would have been enough, but the clone had done some damage at the start with the spears.
Its HP reaching 0, the cyclops stumbled, knowing that its end was close.
But… it wouldn't go down like this.
And so…
[Death of the cyclops incoming!]
[Passive skill activated: The Final Blow!]
It had a skill that could be used if it was about to die.
'WHAT?!' Stark's eyes widened as he saw the cyclops stand back up, its eye had popped because of the fist, but it could still sense where Stark was, and so it unleashed everything on him.
Maybe it was a bad idea to sit there and do nothing, but Stark couldn't deny that the sight of that monster still trying to eliminate the human after knowing that its death was coming regardless was… kind of amazing?
'BRING IT ON,' he smirked as he got ready to avoid it all (hopefully).

chapters.title: Chapter 175 - 175: The Final Blow
chapters.content:
"THE FINAL BLOW!" the cyclops' eye turned completely dark, and its skin also changed color, becoming entirely red now that it was in its final state: the one right before it would die.
~FWISH~
Its silver chain became sturdier and made out of pure black obsidian, one simple swing resulting in the entirety of the walls around to be destroyed.
…
[Skill: The Final Blow]
[Description: When its HP reach 0, this skill will automatically activate, granting the cyclops godly powers and a new form, but this will only last for one attack, afterward the cyclops will immediately pass out.]
[Note: The attack can be comparable to the one of a 'Calamity' level monster, so you better run!]
…
'Oh well… who cares when I have [Dodge Control]' Stark smirked as he got ready to avoid it, the cyclops grabbing the edge of its darkened chain and getting to swing it with all its might.
"DODGE CONTRO-" Stark immediately wanted to activate his skill.
But…
"EYE BLOCK!" the cyclops' eye and its now crimson pupil glew even brighter, then a beam of light hit Stark directly, putting some sort of lock symbol on top of his head.
"DODGE CONT-" and afterward, he couldn't use his skill anymore, "DODGE CONTR-"
"Huh…?" no matter how many times he tried to chant his skill, all that would appear before him was...
['Dodge Control' has been temporarily blocked by 'Eye Block'!]
'This…' Stark looked up to seeing that the cyclops was on the verge of striking with his chain, probably destroying the entire hallway with it as it was much more powerful than before.
'Is…' Stark looked toward his clone, it had already eliminated all the other monsters, and was looking at Stark with a huge smile on its face.
'A joke…' It seems like Stark's clone could still use [Dodge Control] as it wasn't affected by the skill.
"Right…?" Stark turned his head toward the cyclops again, and it was already beginning to swing down at intense speed.
~FWISH, VIOUM~
"TIME VISION," Stark instinctively activated the new perk of the [Focus] skill when the chain was right above his head, threatening to destroy him if it ever as much as grazed him.
[3 seconds of slow left!]
Of course, using [Time Vision] didn't completely stop time, it just slowed it down to around 0.25 of the actual time, which meant that he could still actively observe the chain slowly go down toward him.
But he just decided to use these three seconds to think…
[Dodge Control] was out of the question, although his clone was currently using it, probably since it could only lock a skill from ONE entity.
[Invincible Dodge] wasn't an option either since dodging would do nothing as the area effect would surely kill him, meaning that trying to dodge normally or with [Judicator's Wings] wouldn't do anything.
He had already used [The Purgatory Shadow] and none of his other equipments would help.
'Think…'
[1 second of 'Time Vision' left!]
'…!' suddenly, Stark's eyes widened as he finally saw it, and he almost wanted to hit his forehead for being so dumb, 'I know how to escape now!'
['Time Vision' stopped, time is resuming]
~BOOM~
The cyclops' chain hit the exact spot Stark was in, and the entire hallway ahead completely shattered by the sheer impact: the walls were destroyed, the floor collapsed, revealing the fourth sublevel under it, and everything was shaking, safe to say even those very far from Stark could sense it.
~FWISH~
Stark's clone on the other hand was able to easily dodge all the attack thanks to [Dodge Control], avoiding not only the chain, but also the destruction and debris.
And as for the original…
'…?' he opened his eyes, and found himself right behind the cyclops, unaffected by the attack as the damage wasn't that big from behind.
And as to how he did it… well it was obvious.
…
'I KNOW HOW NOW,' he peeked from behind the cyclops and noticed that the [Crimson Ball Transmission] TP point was still there, perfectly placed.
And so he just snapped his finger.
~SNAP, FWISH~
His body almost instantly disappeared, leaving a crimson smoke of his exact figure, and after a fraction of a second, he found himself at the spot the ball had hit after emerging from a massive crimson flash, resembling a portal.
[Teleportation successful]
The ball and circle symbol disappeared, but it had already saved Stark and done its job.
~BOOM~
That's when the chain hit, and all Stark did afterward was brace himself for impact, and he received 0 damage in the process.
And so after ending its attack, the cyclops turned back to its normal color, losing all of its power and aura, then falling to the ground with a large thud.
'…' Stark rolled his eyes, this had been way too much for a 'STRONG' level monster, he wished his clone actually helped too if it had eliminated the monsters already, but oh well.
…
[You have slain 'Chain Cyclops lv105', gained 572621 EXP!]
[You have slain 'Dungeon Lizard lvl103', gained 154039 EXP!]
[You have slain 'Dungeon Lizard lvl103', gained 152304 EXP!]
[You have slain 'Blood Mouth Bat lvl102', gained 145928 EXP!]
[You have slain 'Blood Mouth Bat lvl102', gained 143212 EXP!]
[You have slain 'Blood Mouth Bat lvl102', gained 144955 EXP!]
…
[+1,313,059 EXP!]
And so…
[Your level has increased to level 49, granting you two skill points and boost in stats]
[Experience: 612340/1195000]
'I guess that's done…' Stark sighed.
"=)" meanwhile, his clone immediately jumped over the giant hole that had formed, then made its way walking on the corpse of the cyclops before reaching Stark.
To be honest, he wasn't even that interested to know how it killed the rest of the monsters, because if it could do the job, and he got EXP from it, he had nothing to complain about.
'Well, I doubt I'm going to be able to find the key twice in a row, plus I would need to watch out more than before if I want to open the door…' Stark scratched his chin while thinking, he would indeed keep going to increase his level, but his chances of finding the key were slim now, this level was much darker and harder to navigate the fourth sublevel.
Well… except if [Chosen One] suddenly decided to activate again that is, but that was unlikely…
"=)" the [Superior Clone] had gained a will of its own, but it couldn't refute the words of the original, so it just waited around, analyzing their surroundings in case any more monsters showed up.
'Well, let's keep going,' Stark nodded and jumped over the giant hole using the cyclops body, going back would only result in meeting someone else = fighting to the death and taking unneeded risks after all.
Of course, if someone attacked, he wouldn't even hesitate for a single second to counter with everything he had, but it was rather peaceful on his side, so he didn't mind.
But of course… 'peace' wasn't something that everyone could get, because as soon as Stark took one step toward the next hall…
[A participant has been slain by another player!]
[Oh~ I'm loving it when the killing starts to become more interesting :)!]
'…' these two panels appeared before Stark, and he couldn't help but sigh.

chapters.title: Chapter 176 - 176: Officer VS Leader
chapters.content:
(Far from Stark, still on the third sublevel)
~PEW, SHOOT~
Officer was currently busy shooting monsters with his guns, each bullet dealing up to 50000 damage, meaning that he could easily take down a swarm of them without any issues.
His guns adapted to his surroundings and feelings.
At first, he could only summon pistols, but after reaching level 30, he gained the ability to transform them into Uzis, dealing less damage but giving him more speed and a faster shooting rate, also his 'bullets' are made out of aura, so as long as you give him time, he can shoot infinitely.
It was a rather unique ability, and it was obvious that the stronger he got, he would be able to upgrade his guns into shotguns, snipers, and maybe even rocket launchers.
"Phew~ that's done for," he wiped his forehead after taking care of five [Dungeon Lizards] and three [Blood Mouth Bats], each dying after around 4/5 shots.
In terms of strength, he was obviously weaker than Stark, but when it came to taking down enemies precisely and fast, he was way better than the other boy, who could only use his fists.
"…" even when fighting against a [Chain Cyclops], he did struggle slightly more than Stark because of its high defense, but once he figured out that its eye was its weakness, he shot a dozen bullets at it and it died.
"THE FINAL BLOW!" of course, the cyclops used its final attack, but…
"FULL PRECISE MOVEMENT," he used one of his legendary skills, and a trail of aura behind as he parkoured right behind the cyclops, shooting its neck a few more times to make sure it died.
~BOOM~
'…' Officer shrugged as he was surrounded by the golden aura and then the level up prompt appeared before him.
[Officer: Level 57]
Stark was obviously not the only one able to level up, so of course all the others had also gained some levels since coming here, although it was also pretty obvious Stark was the most motivated out of them all.
'Need to watch out for all those criminals…' he mumbled as he clearly remembered the text above Yuri and Akira.
Officer had the [Police Judgment] skill, which helped him identify good and bad people, something he had acquired solely thanks to his high sense of justice, and all he wanted was to put all criminals behind bars.
A golden scale would appear above their heads, and if it went to the right, surrounded by a crimson evil aura, then it meant the person was a criminal, if the scale went to the left and surrounded by a green aura, then it meant the person hadn't done anything yet.
He used it in this trial to identify all the criminals he would need to take care of later, and for now, that list was: Yuri as he killed Lolia, and Akira since… well… it's obvious.
As for Stark… the scale stayed completely neutral, it didn't show whether he was good or bad, but that worried Officer even more since he had never seen something like that before.
Plus, when he saw the other crimson Stark, the scale went crazy and dozens of panels appeared around him, stating that it was not just evil, but… [Pure Evil], which was why he panicked and immediately pulled out his guns.
It was also something he had never seen before, even Akira and Yuri had been given the [Evil] title, so why the hell was that thing [Pure Evil]? He didn't know, but surely it would be bad…
'…' Officer was already pissed because of this trial: it made him seem like a criminal since he was technically a prisoner of the Lucullus prison, but he was probably the most righteous out of all these people.
But of course… being a hero of justice or righteous doesn't mean anything in the [Domination Trial].
And so when he took a few steps after assigning his skill points…
~FWISH, VIOUM~
He sensed something behind him, and when he turned back… he saw a giant green snake rushing in his direction, its mouth big enough to swallow him whole.
The snake was floating in the air, and its body was completely made out of green aura except for its eyes and teeth that were white…
'A human created this,' Officer immediately sensed something was wrong and avoided the attack by ducking under it, resulting in the giant snake to explode against the wall behind him.
"REVEAL YOURSELF… LEADER!" he instinctively also knew the culprit.
"…" and as expected, Leader, the sect leader looking guy with his long black hair and green robe that hid his feet swaying lightly, that robe of his had a giant snake drawing behind it resembling the one he had sent.
"Should have known instantly," Officer didn't hesitate to pull out his guns and point them at Leader.
"…" but the other party didn't even speak, instead he just sighed, "I truly wanted to send you away with the less amount of pain possible, but… it seems like you have chosen the hard way."
