"Everyone must be already far inside the second sublevel's maze, let's just go," he began to calmly walk toward the door, his expression as neutral as ever before, while his clone was still behind, the big smile on its face still there, but they had one thing in common: both surrounded by a powerful crimson aura, now enhanced by the specks and strands of golden and holy aura from the exorcist class.
It was truly only the beginning, and he was ready to explore that floor while hopefully not meeting anybody.
But… unbeknownst to Stark… all the other participants were waiting for him beyond that door.
"=)"

chapters.title: Chapter 188 - 188: Stark is the Winner?!
chapters.content:
"Seriously, for how much longer do we have to wait?" Yuri sighed, "We would have probably found the key already by now…"
Kokoro taped letters on her tablet, and after a few seconds a blue panel appeared, displaying what she wrote, "Risking our lives for no reason is useless, even more so now that we are only six," at this point, Leader hadn't died, him and Stark were still fighting.
"…" the white-haired lady kept inspecting her slender hands, unbothered by the presence of the others.
"Come on, people," Akira clapped his hands as he smiled, "I already told you, but I got the [Instant Use Key] from killing one of the other ANNOYING players… so all you need to do is wait for everyone to enter this level so that we can head toward the final one together…"
As Akira said, he had been the first to enter this sublevel, and so whenever someone went up the flight of stairs, he would show them the key and advise them to stay here, in exchange he promised that he would open the door to the next sublevel once everyone reached this floor.
He even went as far as showing his second item, which was the [Healing Spring], to prove that he wasn't trying to ambush them all then use his perk item to kill them all.
And in the end, surprisingly, all of them sat down beside the entrance of the second sublevel, just waiting for the final participants that were still down to show up.
But after less than five minutes…
[A participant has been slain by another player!]
"…!"
The four people that had been previously silent read the message and figured out why it had taken the other people so long to come here.
"They were busy fighting, huh," Yuri shrugged, "I guess only five of us left…"
"Hm…" Akira scratched his chin, "But I do have a question now…"
"What is it?" a blue panel appeared above Kokoro's tablet.
"I mean… if only five of us remain, and there are four of us here, it means that only one person among Chosen, Officer and Leader survived, right?" Akira had a big smile on his face as he revealed that fact to the others.
And it was undeniably true: all those alive were obviously present, and the only other three they knew were still alive were those three he cited.
Which meant… one among them was a monster that had essentially killed another monster, or one monster that killed two people: people who kill must be truly confident in their strength, and so if someone killed another participant, it would undeniably mean that they are strong, enough to be called a monster at least.
"I don't wanna seem biased, but Leader probably killed Chosen, then killed Officer, it seems the most logical since he is the strongest among them," Akira shrugged, it was completely logical thinking, Officer didn't seem that strong with his guns, especially against a legitimate sect-leader with no mercy in his eyes, and Stark… well… wasn't he the weakest among them all?
"What if Leader killed someone, then got killed by the other one?" Yuri proposed.
~TAP, TAP, TAP~
Kokoro's expression became more serious as she mercilessly taped words on her tablet, her eyes darting everywhere as if she was analyzing something.
And so…
"Impossible, I have already analyzed all three of them, and by far there is no chance Leader would die to any of them, Chosen was probably the first to die, then Officer followed!" Kokoro had a skill called [Tablet Analysis], allowing her to analyse things at incredible speed, and most times her predictions were right, making her someone incredibly useful in terms of gathering information.
And so with that, everyone nodded: they were already ready to see Leader come out of the door, his usual neutral expression visible on his face.
"How are you so sure?" Yuri asked, he had a feeling this was wrong.
~TAP, TAP~
"As I said, I gathered information about their powers, we obviously saw Chosen fighting, and as for Leader… well… I knew about him from real life," Kokoro revealed as she continued taping, "He is a powerful sect-leader, feared by thousands of people, and I know about some of his skills, but one thing is for sure: they are terrifyingly powerful, so it isn't likely he would die to Chosen based on the skills he showed to us!"
"Interesting," Akira nodded.
"…" the white haired lady was looking at Kokoro.
And to add to that… Kokoro continued taping and gave her final statement.
"There is a 0.4% chance that Chosen won against Leader, that is all I know, so Leader definitely won," Kokoro sighed, it was her skill that told her everything, but she truly believed in its analysis powers.
But… she continued taping regardless.
"But…" Kokoro's expression darkened, "If by some miracle, the person we see coming out of this door is Chosen… then… please be wary of him."
Her aura sent chills down the spine of them all, even the white-haired lady, although none showed it on their faces.
"Let's just wait for Leader then, doesn't matter if he killed two people as long as he doesn't try it on us," Akira shrugged, seemingly ready to kill the sect-leader if he tried anything.
With those words, it seemed everyone had already considered the fact Chosen and Officer died to be the truth.
Everyone except… for the white haired woman, who knew that something was up.
And so… after around ten minutes…
~THUMP, THUMP~
They heard noise coming from the beyond the darkness of the door, precisely the sound of someone climbing up the stairs.
"It's him," Akira sighed.
"Fucking finally," Yuri rolled his eyes.
~THUMP, THUMP~
The sound of footsteps in the hallway leading to the door were heard getting closer and closer.
And once the sole survivor of the 'Sublevel 3 Incident' appeared…
"Leader, finally you are here, dear friend!" Akira laughed while pointing the key toward the door to show it to him.
But…
"Leader…?" Stark smiled as he looked at the four people sitting around the entrance, "I'm sorry, but you won't be able to find him anytime soon."
All participants had faces full of disbelief and shock, except for the white-haired lady who actually let a small smirk once seeing Stark emerge from the entrance.
"What are you all doing here?" he asked, acting as if nothing was wrong.
"You… are… alive?" Akira asked, he was the first to be surprised: Leader was powerful, just like Kokoro said, and he TRULY expected him to be the one to emerge victorious.
And yet… Stark won?
"If by some miracle, the person we see coming out of this door is Chosen… then… please be wary of him," the last words Kokoro said rang in the ears of everyone as they looked at the boy.
"So… Leader and Officer are…?" Yuri hinted, trying to get the answer out of Stark.
"Yeah, dead, Leader killed Officer then he tried to kill me," Stark shrugged, he didn't really care to reveal anything as it was already pretty damn obvious he was the one who killed if he was the last person to come out of the third sublevel, "And of course, the moment he tried to kill me… I just HAD to end his life, didn't I =)," Stark smiled as coldly as his clone.
And with that… all people present realized two things: Stark hid most of his skills from them during the fight against Soulayer, yet still won, and… he was an extremely dangerous person.
"Well, anyway," Akira retrieved his composure, "I got an [Instant Use Key] as a reward and plan to use it on this level."
"That's good, then let's get going," Stark began to head in a random direction, of course he planned to take the exit, but not with any of these people as it would be too dangerous.

chapters.title: Chapter 189 - 189: New Deadly Perk: Private Duels
chapters.content:
"…" Stark opened up his map and began following the arrow that pointed toward the green dot, which was the exit.
But right as he was about to turn around the corner… someone called out to him.
"HEY!" it was Yuri, the guy almost the same size as him with the scraggly hair, "Where is the 'THAT' thing?' he asked.
"…?" Stark turned around to see that Yuri had a determined look on his face, "That thing…? Oh!" he immediately understood what he meant, and so he smiled.
For some reason, the [Superior Clone] didn't follow closely behind him, maybe since it knew itself that its presence could result in chaos among the participants?
'Just come,' he ordered the clone, and suddenly…
~FWISH~
It emerged from the other side of the door.
And the moment it did…
~FWISH, VIOUM, KWICH~
Every participant activated their powers, especially Akira who had never seen it before.
The clone's aura was now even more overwhelming than before, the small strands of golden aura from [Exorcist] somehow enhanced it and making it even more powerful.
And… the clone's body was also extremely beautiful, it was glowing, and although it was completely made out of crimson aura, the small specks of holy aura made it as if there were hundreds of stars in it.
"=)" Yet that chilling and cold smile never went out.
~THUMP, THUMP~
All participants were cautious around the clone, it was quite the scary thing even for them.
Meanwhile, the [Superior Clone] just looked around before dashing toward Stark, arriving beside the original in less than a second.
"We'll be leaving, see you at the exit," he spoke as he turned the corner with his clone.
"What the fuck was that thing…?" Akira's pupils were still shaking a bit.
"We don't know, but I think I understand why Kokoro said we need to be wary of him…" Yuri added, he was biting his thumb's nails, "Anyway, I'm out of here," and he disappeared out of the thin air, leaving star particles behind as he also headed toward the exit.
~TAP, TAP~
"See you later," Kokoro taped a button on her tablet, and a blue light emerged from it, taking over her body like some sort of shield, "I hope to see you all alive later."
~FWISH~
She began to float in the air thanks to that blue light then headed toward a direction the others didn't take.
"Just us two now, heh~" Akira smiled as the beautiful white haired woman, who didn't even acknowledge his presence, "Well, we'll meet at the exit again anyway," and so he took yet another hallway.
There were at least seven different halls to take from the entrance, so pretty easy to take different paths as to not meet one another.
"…" the white-haired woman didn't move for another minute, instead looking at the ground, her eyes clearly thinking about something else, "Stark Heartsouls…" she mumbled as she finally got up and took another path as well.
***
Back to Stark, he was walking beside his clone, the two just looking ahead, while the latter obviously kept smiling.
And at the very moment everyone separated… new panels appeared before him.
[5 participants alive!]
[Welcome to the Second Sublevel: The Undead Realm]
Stark looked around, he hadn't really taken his surroundings into account, but the halls were filled with eerie purple mist that seemed to twist and coil around the walls like ghostly tendrils, and the air was heavy with the scent of decay and the sound of distant whispers echoed through the corridors.
There were some torches made out of human bones, and a blue fire coming out of them, giving the small amount of light needed to be able to see, plus the walls and floor were made out of sturdy black stones, a linear granite line in the middle of each of them.
"Just go to the exit…" he mumbled to himself as he continued following the map.
But of course… that wasn't all the panels, there was ONE missing, wasn't there…
And it was…
[New Perk!]
'Oh boy…'
[Introducing the 'Private Duel' perk!]
[It is too difficult to find another participant and kill them safely while avoiding suspicion from the others, so this perk allows you to ask for a duel with another player, and as long as they accept, you will be both put into a giant arena, away from all players and monsters, guaranteeing a fair fight!]
[Use the 'DUEL' panel to request a duel with another player, note that the duel will NOT start until both parties agree!]
[Note: when receiving a duel request, the person who requests the duel will be anonymous!]
And before he could even register what all of this was about…
[You have received a "DUEL REQUEST" from "ANONYMOUS PLAYER"!]
[Do you want to accept the duel request?]
[Y/N]
"…" someone, as soon as they saw that new perk, probably immediately sent invitations to everyone, 'Fuck that shit,' Stark didn't click neither on Y nor N, he just minimized the panel.
Stark had already a pretty giant idea of who it could be: either Yuri, the guy trying to look innocent, or Akira, who didn't hide his intentions to kill for rewards.
"=)" the clone just kept smiling, the smile on its face telling Stark it was the right thing to do, as wasting time on pointless battles wouldn't do him any good.
And so just like that, Stark continued to walk through the purple mist, trying not to bump into walls or anything of the sort since it was pretty hard to see ahead, even with the map as it didn't specifically show exactly where the turn was.
[Watch out!]
But after five minutes of nothing happening, Stark's [Focus] skill warned him, and…
~BIM, BIM, BIM~
All the eyes of the skull torches in the hall he was in lit up with a blue aura, and…
~CRUMBLE, GROWA~
From the ground below emerged dozens of undead monsters, surrounding Stark completely.
'I mean, I can just avoid them all and rush, but it would be annoying as I don't know where the walls are because of the mist, plus… it's just free experience points, isn't it =)?' Stark positioned himself as he began smiling.
"GROAOR!"
"Klklkl…"
"Ooooou…"
He heard many different noises coming from around him, but he couldn't see the monsters clearly.
"Alright, let's just get this over with," he waited for them to approach him first as to not make a fatal mistake.
It wouldn't be long until he would reach the exit of this floor anyway, so might as well take advantage of that and discover which monsters were in the 'Undead Realm', right? As it would be his only ever fight in this sublevel.

chapters.title: Chapter 190 - 190: Crimson Purification of the Undead
chapters.content:
Stark stood his ground as the undead monsters closed in on him, their ghastly forms illuminated by the eerie blue fire of the skull torches. The mist twisted and turned around them, creating a surreal and ominous atmosphere in the corridor.
And when they got close enough… Stark was able to see all the undead monsters: skeletons with rusted armor and jagged swords, ghouls with decaying flesh and glowing red eyes, ghosts with pale figures, their mouths open as if ready to suck Stark's soul, and even a massive zombie with rotting limbs dragging behind it.
They moved in a slow but coordinated manner, their intention clear as they advanced towards Stark.
"GROAOR!"
"Klklkl…"
"Ooooou…"
They were taking slow steps, but the more they approached, the more Stark could see their disgusting bodies and faces.
And also… he noticed just how many of them there were.
From the ground, ceiling, walls, from all around Stark, there were at least fifty of those monsters.
Of course, their sheer number meant that they weren't even that strong, thus giving less EXP per monster, but it didn't matter since it would be really easy to be overwhelmed.
"Perception!"
…
[Name: Skeleton Warrior]
[Level: 90]
[HP: 50000]
[Skills: Critical Strike, Bone Shatter, Shield Bash, Skeletal Body, Undead…]
…
[Name: Undead Ghoul]
[Level: 93]
[HP: 70000]
[Skills: Feast of Flesh, Decay Aura, Shadow Crawl, Fly, Undead…]
…
[Name: Trial Ghost]
[Level: 92]
[HP: 58000]
[Skills: Ghostly Wail, Soul Drain, Phantasmal Form, Ethereal Touch, Undead…]
…
None of these monsters were truly strong, one attack from Stark probably enough to destroy them all, plus they didn't have that many skills compared to other monsters in the trial.
Which meant that it was truly all about the numbers, and while Stark analyzed them, a dozen more monsters appeared, their numbers rising after each second.
There was a single monster stood out from the rest though: the giant zombie.
…
[Name: Undead Elite Zombie (ELITE)]
[Level: 110]
[HP: 400000]
[Strength: 4873]
[Stamina: 7281]
[Speed: 1492]
[Defense: 3910]
[Skills: Raging Smash, Corpse Explosion, Decay, Flesh Feast, Diseased Bite, Undead Control (MYTHICAL), Rotting Grasp, Undead Regeneration, Hulking Presence, The Ultimate Zombie…]
…
Not only was this zombie the bigger out of them, easily towering over Stark and being almost as big as the [Elite Guard] from the fourth sublevel, but it was also the strongest monster Stark encountered yet, even more so than the other elite.
His stamina was extremely high for some reason, while the rest of his stats were still good, but still below those of the other elite guard.
All in all… this monster was powerful.
The Undead Elite Zombie's skin was a sickly green, with patches of flesh hanging loose from its body. One of its eyes was missing, leaving only a hollow socket that seemed to glare at Stark with malevolent intent. Its jaw hung agape, revealing rows of jagged, broken teeth that dripped with black ichor.
It didn't have any kind of weapon, just its bare hands slowly advancing toward Stark, carrying a bunch of corpses that were put together likes chains, it was a disgusting sight.
"GROAOROA~" it roared, but by its tone, it didn't seem like it was talking to Stark… but to the monsters?
And as expected, the moment the elite roared, the monsters suddenly stopped in their slow rush, completely surrounding Stark.
"…"
"=)"
But… Stark wasn't scared, and neither was his clone.
Why, you might ask? Why would Stark not be at least worried of dying by those monsters and maybe even turning into of them, even though there were at least 80 of them around him now?
Was it because he could revive himself twice? Or because he truly believed he could come out on top against all the odds?
Well… no… the real answer was… [Crimson Purification]!
It was the basic legendary skill he got from [Domination] absorbing [Exorcist] and merging them both into one.
But… wasn't this sublevel called the [Undead Realm], and weren't all those enemies somewhat related to undead beings…?
If that is the case… then… isn't [Exorcist] in its perfect element?
And so… without wasting time, Stark's aura grew as he kept smiling: none of these monsters could put a dent on him.
"…?" the zombie was the controlling all the monsters tilted its ugly head, confused as to why the human was so vividly smiling.
But after a few seconds, it decided that it was over and that they should get rid of him quickly.
And so…
"GROAORK!" he roared again, and all the monsters suddenly rushed at Stark, leaving their slow approach from before and now actually running.
But… this was futile.
"CRIMSON PURIFICATION!" Stark shouted.
[Description: A divine ability that eradicates evil and impurities from the surrounding area, dealing massive damage to demonic and cursed enemies while increasing the Holy aura, making you stronger against these types of foes. However, it has no effect on other types of enemies.]
A blinding light erupted from Stark's body, enveloping the entire corridor in a radiant glow. The undead monsters screeched and wailed as they were consumed by the purifying flames, their forms disintegrating into ash before vanishing completely.
This skill was extremely powerful against undead, able to weaken those that are very strong, but completely annihilate the ones too weak to tank the power of the holy aura.
And so just like that, EVERY monster beside the elite zombie disappeared, the floor of the hallway now filled with deep gray ashes, which were previously the monsters that wanted to eliminate him.
"Gro…arork…" even the giant zombie seemed to have been weakened, forced to get on its knees as a small part of its head had evaporated from the holy aura.
"-173819!" this was the damage it had received from this attack, completely destroying its control over the monsters as it had lost all its minions because of the holy aura coming out of Stark's body.
"I feel like a true saint now," Stark smiled as he took a step toward the giant zombie.
"Gr…" the zombie looked down on the floor, its expression darkening as it saw the ashes of its comrades/minions, and then… "GROOAKRK~"
It suddenly got up again, retrieving its full form, and although its now half-destroyed face wasn't restored, it did make it much creepier than before as its sole yellow pupil looked at the human who dared to attack it like this.
"GROAOOOOROA~" it roared again, also taking a giant step toward Stark, making the ground around him shake.
And so just like that, Stark was forced to fight another elite monster even though he just wanted to reach the exit.
But… this was an opportunity to test out [Exorcist] while also getting stronger, so why the fuck not?
"COME AT ME, ZOMBIE," Stark didn't back down as he saw the zombie rush at him.

chapters.title: Chapter 191 - 191: The Undead ELITE Zombie
chapters.content:
~THUMP, THUMP~
"DISEASED BITE," the elite zombie rushed at Stark, wanting to eat him alive as revenge for killing all its minions.
But… it was futile.
"=)" suddenly, Stark's clone snapped its fingers, the golden lines on its body glowing brighter than ever before, "CRIMSON PURIFICATION!"
~BOOM~
A wave of holy energy surged from the clone, enveloping the elite zombie in a blinding light. The zombie let out a guttural scream as its decaying flesh began to disintegrate rapidly, unable to withstand the purifying power of the skill.
After all, if Stark could use a skill, then his clone could too, which meant that he could use [Crimson Purification] twice.
Smoke was coming out of the elite zombie's flesh as it was affected by the holy aura coming out from the clone's body.
"-142719!" although it was weaker than Stark's attack, it wasn't even that far in comparison.
And so the zombie elite fell to the ground again, it wasn't dead or anything, but just too weak to even move as it just lay there.
"Gr…o…a..krz…"
"Damn, undead monsters really are nothing now," Stark was astonished: the skill worked way better than he ever thought it would, able to take down dozens if not hundreds of undead instantly if they were within the range of the holy aura, "Well, let's just kill this guy!"
"DOMI-CHAIN RESTRAIN," he summoned the chain in his hands and threw it toward the zombie, its face and body facing the cold ground.
But…
~GRAB~
The zombie moved its arm at the last second to block the chain, then used his other one to break it in half…
"Groa…k…" it began to get up for the second time, its spirit hadn't left it yet (well yes it did, but you know), "GROAOROAK~" and after a few seconds, the elite zombie was back up again.
It had lost one of its arms, its leg had a chunk of it, and overall its body was in worse condition than before, even though it was already bad at the start.
[Elite Zombie HP: 83462/400000]
It had already lost three fourths of its life from the two [Crimson Purification] skills, and even though it was back up and seemed to roar in anger, it was apparent that its movements were weak.
But…
"UNDEAD REGENERATION!" suddenly, the zombie activated one of its legendary skills.
The ash that was scattered all over the hallway began to float in the air, then after a few seconds, it started heading toward the elite, precisely in the spots where it was damaged: its legs, and head.
It couldn't retrieve its arm since it was already detached from its body, but…
"+175000!" it got back a lot of its health, plus the ash of the other monsters had actually managed to heal its leg and the part of its head that had been destroyed, meaning that except for its lost arm and some small destroyed pieces of flesh, it had mostly recovered its previous form.
"…" Stark didn't even seem bothered by this: it had lost an arm, so it was still much weaker, and even the zombie should know it, as it didn't retrieve its complete confidence even with that much.
~STEP, STEP, THUMP!~
Yet again the giant zombie began rushing ( slowly as its speed stat was low) toward Stark.
Its movements were weak, its body was scarred from the damages, but it was still coming for him.
"DISEASED BITE…" the giant zombie jumped at Stark, its gaping mouth opened to swallow him whole.
…
[Skill: Diseased Bite]
[Description: A massive bite that will surely kill, but the special power of this skill is that those swallowed or bitten by the zombie will also transform into one of them, now under the control of the elite forever…]
…
"GOAIRAKK~" the zombie's mouth was now right in front of Stark as he was ready to bite him.
But…
"AURA SMASH… MERGE," Stark's [Superior Clone] was already ready for this, and so Stark didn't even bother moving out of the way.
The clone had immediately begun charging up the fist the moment it saw the zombie lying down, and although it didn't expect for it to get back up, it didn't matter much since the attack had already been ready.
And so…
~FWISH, VIOUM~
The clone sent the giant fist, two times the size of the zombie's head, toward it.
~BOOOOM~
As it was currently jumping horizontally to eat Stark, the fist hit it straight on, breaking some of its already destroyed teeth and smashing its head in more than before.
"GROAKFKQ~" it couldn't even reach Stark that it was sent away in the opposite direction, crashing against the wall at the very end of the hallway.
"-113928!" the damage was very good, able to damage the zombie's corpse even more so than it already was.
Oh, and as for the reason why [Crimson Purification] did just a littlez more damage than this attack against an undead was because although that skill was extremely strong against undead beings, it didn't specifically mean that it could massive damage.
Basically, its main power was to "WEAKEN" an enemy, and this is exactly what it did.
"Groaoro~" and this is the reason why damage doesn't matter in such a situation as although the fist hit him for 100k points of damage, the zombie still got up, clearly less damaged by this than by the holy aura.
And just like that, Stark could truly understand why an [Exorcist] was so powerful against these beings.
[Enemy stunned!]
"Well, it's our win," Stark smiled as he looked at its clone, and it nodded.
"DOMI-CHAIN RESTRAIN," the clone sent another crimson chain toward the elite, and this time it couldn't do anything but watch as the chain put itself around its legs, slowly but surely taking over its stomach, chest, arms, then head in that order.
And after a few more seconds…
[Elite Zombie is now unconscious!]
The chain has successfully absorbed all its force, knocking it out in the process.
To be honest, seeing it in that sorry state, Stark REALLY wanted to wait another ten minutes for [Crimson Purification] to be usable again so that he can torture it more, but… he didn't really want to wait all this time, so he just decided to end its life.
Much like the [Sublevel 4 Elite Guard], this elite died so quickly that it couldn't even use most of its skills: Stark got rid of its minions immediately, then destroyed its body right afterward, making it harder for it to use skills, and then he knocked it out before it could even attack.
It was a magnificent victory for him in that regard as other classifiers always say that killing a monster before it could even act was something.
"Aura Smash… MERGE!" he focused his power in his right hand, and after ten seconds summoned the giant fist, much more powerful than his clone since he was original, sending it toward the unconscious giant zombie.
And so…
~FWISH, BOOOOM~
"-163748!"
And just like that…
[Undead Elite Zombie HP: 0/400000]
[You have defeated the 'Undead Elite Zombie lv110'!]
He was able to defeat that elite extremely easily, like… it was ALMOST too easy.
"…" Stark had a neutral expression on his face as he saw the corpse of the zombie, as well as the ashes around him.
Was he getting too strong for even the monsters supposed to be at his level…? Or maybe it was just a convenient battle for him since he had all the right skills?
He didn't know, but it was good he could finally get this over with so that he can reach the exit.

chapters.title: Chapter 192 - 192: Wielding Cross
chapters.content:
"Phew..." Stark was kind of happy he was able to get rid of all those monsters easily, and if it wasn't for [Exorcist] and [Crimson Purification], then it would have been much muuuch more difficult, 'Let's go I guess,' he thought while looking at his clone and it nodded.
After all, he had gotten rid of all the monsters, so there were no more threats.
'Just need to pass that huge zombie...' he thought as the corpse of the deformed zombie was placed against the wall, precisely where his next turn was to reach the exit.
Stark frankly didn't like that, because somehow, the atmosphere around the zombie was just as dark as before, it was like some sort of aura was still swirling around it even though it was dead.
'...' Stark never believed in the "it's just my imagination" thing, so he carefully walked toward the monster, with the sole intent of turning around the corner and leaving this hall.
~STEP, STEP~
Stark and his clone got closer to the massive zombie.
'Oh well, looks like everything was fine,' and they were able to pass the zombie, now on the verge of turning around the corner, which meant they were closer to it than ever before.
And right at that moment...
"CORPSE EXPLOSION, ACTIVATED!"
The zombie's body began to glow with a terrifying crimson aura, almost as if it was... about to explode?
'Fucking knew it,' Stark looked at the glowing zombie for a single second before dashing inside the hallway.
But... [Corpse Explosion] was almost instantaneous, so there was no way to truly escape it from there.
And so...
~BOOOOOOOM~
The corpse of the massive zombie completely exploded, sending blood, flesh and organs everywhere, reducing it to nothing but a pile of disgusting green flesh as all its body was scattered everywhere now.
Thankfully enough, Stark's quick thinking allowed him to get out of the radius of the explosion.
But...
~SPLASH~
Some of the blood that had been spread out everywhere actually hit him straight on since it emerged from the corpse like a fountain of blood, every wall having traces of blood on it now.
'...' Stark stopped in his tracks: his body was covered in zombie blood now, and although it didn't do anything, it was still disgusting, and thankfully enough his head had been spared, meaning it was mostly his clothes that had been tainted, "Fucking hell..."
It was indeed unexpected, but it wasn't surprising a monster was able to use a skill even after death to possibly take out its opponent when it least expects it.
"Oh well," Stark quickly moved on as he still needed to get to the exit.
But...
~DING, DING, DING~
He heard dozens upon dozens of notifications, and around 80 panels appeared around him, obstructing his view.
[You have slain "Skeleton Warrior lv90", gaining 23272 EXP!]
[You have slain "Undead Ghoul lv93", gaining 25824 EXP!]
[You have slain "Trial Ghost lv92", gaining 24119 EXP!]
.
.
.
[You have slain "Undead Elite Zombie lv110", gaining 2,658,487 EXP!]
And so with all of this...
[Your level has increased to level 53, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 54, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 55, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Experience: 1122262/1500000]
And so that could only mean one thing...
[Level 55: please pick a card]
And so, just like before, three purple cards appeared in front of him.
"Not five anymore, huh..."
[Note that some cards will now contain skills related to "Exorcist" as it has been merged with "Domination"!]
'Amazing news...' Frankly, Stark wanted to stack up on the maximum amount of [Exorcist] skills possible.
The reason?
Not only were they immensely strong against undead and demons, but also...
The major reason why was because of... the [Devil Abyss] rift, which he had the key of.
If the name was true, then it would be filled with demons, so getting [Exorcist] skills for as long as he could was the best choice to dominate it completely, even more so with the possibility of other classifiers being present after he opened it.
'You know what to do, clone...' Stark smiled at his clone, and it smiled back, the reversed crimson crosses that now served as its pupils shining brightly.
And so the clone went behind the cards to check out the pictures that were on them.
The clone couldn't speak, so Stark just looked at it while it was observing each of the images, trying to discern which one would be better.
And after thirty seconds... the clone pointed at the one in the middle.
~FWISH~
Stark grabbed that card almost instantly then turned it.
And on it was... the picture of a giant crimson cross floating above a stickman figure, at least five times the size of the figure.
'I knew you wouldn't disappoint,' Stark nodded, almost wanting to tear up because of his clone's understanding.
Why? Because it was DEFINITELY an [Exorcist x Domination] skill!
And so Stark immediately read the details.
...
[Skill: Wielding Cross]
[Class: Domination X Exorcist]
[Rank: Epic]
[Description:] Activating this skill allows the wielder to summon a giant crimson cross above them, which emits a powerful aura that is very uncomfortable to undead beings and demons.
But this isn't the TRUE power of the cross, the real power is that the user can use that giant cross and swing it toward enemies for THREE attacks (meaning you can swing it three times), afterward it will disappear!
[Note:] Each attack of the cross has a cooldown of five minutes, so use them carefully.
…
'Incredible...' Stark almost wanted to hug his clone, this would definitely be a useful skill against demons and undead, making him a killing machine against those types.
But right as he thought that everything was going well...
[A participant has been slain by another player!]
Another kill happened, although everyone had gone in different directions and vowed to meet one another at the exit for Akira to open it...
'...' Stark's expression did darken slightly, but he didn't mind much.
The only thing he needed to know was that among the other four, one of them was dead, killed by another person.
Of course, Stark never TRULY believed in the fact that they would begin to cooperate together in escaping this trial together, it would have been too good to be true, after all, he could sense that ALL of these people were twisted in some way, even Kokoro and the white-haired lady who didn't talk.
"Oh well… I guess teamwork was never an option…" although it would have been so much smarter to just fight the monsters together and then the warden since they were all extremely strong, it seems like one or two people among them believed otherwise.
Now, Stark just needed to be more careful and head toward the exit to figure out who died.
If one person had died while each had gone in different directions, it meant that either something else ambushed them by following them right after everyone left… or…
"The duel feature…" Stark mumbled, which would mean that the person who died had actually accepted the duel in the hopes of killing the person who sent the invitation.
Was it the person who sent his invite? He didn't know, but for now, he just needed to increase his awareness as none of these people were allies to begin with.
[4 participants remain!]

chapters.title: Chapter 193 - 193: The Golden Palace of Death (First Sublevel)
chapters.content:
~THUMP, THUMP, THUMP~
Stark walked across the mist-filled hallways of the [Undead Realm] sublevel, and he surprisingly didn't meet any monsters, maybe it truly was all about that elite zombie which was controlling them all?
In the end it didn't matter as Stark reached the green dot that indicated the exit, and there… he saw the white-haired lady sitting against the wall, her eyes closed.
She looked so peaceful, and the white aura around her was moving like a melody, making it extremely pleasant to watch.
"…" Stark and his clone began to head toward the exit, and the lady opened one of her eyes to see who was here, "Just me, not here to kill you," he shrugged, and she went back to closing her eyes without answering.
The fact she was already here meant that someone between Kokoro, Yuri and Akira had died.
Not wanting to waste his energy, Stark sat against the wall right in front of the emotionless woman, not bothering to even look at her as it was useless.
But right as he sat down…
"I am confident you are going to survive," she spoke for the first time, her voice just as angelic as her aura.
"I know," Stark didn't even question it, he just confirmed what he already knew: he sure as hell wouldn't die in this trial.
"Good…" that's all she said before going back to closing her eyes, it was almost as if she was meditating though.
"=)" his clone though seemed to enjoy that, and it didn't sit down as it couldn't really get tired, so it just kept staring at the lady.
"Sora," she didn't open her eyes again, "Don't say it in front of the others."
It might sound confusing like that, but Stark immediately understood that it was her name (or maybe codename, doesn't matter), which meant he was finally able to identify her.
"Alright," Stark nodded as he now kept looking at his fist, it was surrounding by crimson and holy aura.
A few minutes later…
~FWISH, FFINNNNGGG~
There was some sort of noise, and when Stark turned his head, he saw that it was just Kokoro, who was still using her tablet to float in the air rather than walking.
~TAP, TAP, TAP~
"Phew~ That elite zombie was pretty though!" she typed on her tablet and the blue panel appeared in front of the two others.
"Oh?" Stark raised his eyebrows, "I wasn't the only one who had to fight that horde of monsters and that elite zombie that controlled them?"
~TAP, TAP~
"Nope! Had to fight it as well, it seems like everyone did actually, maybe it was the way this sublevel was testing us since we already had the key to leave it?" she shrugged.
It was rather interesting as it meant that everyone, including Sora, Yuri and Akira had probably fought the elite zombie.
But now that Kokoro was here… it meant that someone between Yuri and Akira had died.
~TAP, TAP~
"I knew that neither of them were trustworthy, probably used the duel request thing to fight one another…" Kokoro sighed, it was the first time anyone could hear a small glimpse of her voice, although that wasn't really words.
And right as they spoke of them…
"Hey!" Akira appeared from around another corner.
"…!"
"…"
"=)"
All people in the exit hallway turned their heads toward Akira, his white hair and mature face visible thanks to the light of the blue skull torches.
"Shall we go," he adjusted his neck tie while walking toward the exit door, which was made out of gold.
The fourth sublevel's door was bronze, the third's was silver, and this one was gold, so what texture could the first's…? Only one way to find out!
Akira approached the golden door, grabbing his key from his pocket and ready to place it in the lock.
But… right as he was about to do that… he turned around.
"Hey," he spoke again, his expression darkening.
"…"
"=)"
"…"
No one said anything, except for the Stark somehow found himself smiling.
He already had a giant idea as to why Akira suddenly stopped, and his clone too since the smile on its face grew wider.
"Let me guess," Stark spoke first, and all eyes fell on him, "The 'TOP 3' perk, right?"
"…" Akira sighed, "Precisely."
And so everyone remembered about it:
[If before the end of sublevel 2, only three people remain alive, then you will completely skip sublevel 1 (the hardest and most deadly of them all) as well as the ones you are in, even if it is sublevel 3, immediately heading toward the warden!]
"I might sound crazy, but if someone sacrifices themselves here, then we would be able to directly reach the warden, meaning three people would be able to possibly live instead of only two or one if we don't all die…" Akira's logic would be okay under normal circumstances.
But… who wanted to die?
WHO would sacrifice themselves after reaching so far?
"Let me tell you something," Stark took the initiative, "No one is gonna sacrifice themselves or whatever bullshit you plan, if you want to do that perk, then how about YOU die," Stark's smile grew wider, and it even sent a shiver down Akira's spine, "Or what? Are you going to try to kill one of us?"
"…" Akira didn't even say anything, he would usually try his hardest to argue back or force his way to whatever he wanted, but for some strange, he didn't like Stark's aura and expression, so he just turned around and turned the keyhole with the key inside of it, opening the golden door.
[The door to the first sublevel has been opened, thus canceling the 'TOP 3' perk!]
But this wasn't all…
[Too bad! You all will regret that choice =)]
And just like that, the panel disappeared.
"I am touching the door," Akira suddenly said without even looking back, "If anyone tries to steal it from me…" his aura was completely dark in color, surrounding him as if he was some sort of demon, "I will make sure they regret that choice even after they died," and so he began to climb the spiral stairs.
"=)" Stark's clone smiled, its expression clearly asking Stark to steal the reward so that they could beat his ass.
~STEP~
Stark walked right behind Akira, walking up the stairs while staring at the murderer's back, while his clone was busy protecting him from all angles.
Kokoro and Sora followed afterward, and after around three minutes…
They reached the end of the spiral stairs, the second golden door now in sight.
~FWISH~
Akira put his palm against the door, and it glew.
[Akira has reached the first sublevel first, granting reward…]
After a few seconds, the door opened, allowing the group to enter the last sublevel.
[First Sublevel: The Golden Palace of Death]
[Have fun!]
And when all of them entered the level…
~CLANG~
The golden door closed behind them, meaning they obviously wouldn't be able to go back.
It was the final stretch, but just how many would survive at the end…? No one knew that answer, but it surely wouldn't be much…
After all… this sublevel was extremely deadly.
And in addition to that…
[Introducing a new perk since you have reached a new sublevel!]
A new perk would be revealed… the worst of them all…

chapters.title: Chapter 194 - 194: The Wheel Target Perk
chapters.content:
[Introducing the FINAL perk!]
All participants trial looked at the screens in front of them the moment the golden door that led them to this sublevel suddenly closed.
As it said, it was the final killing perk they would be getting in this trial since the next floor would be floor 0, where they would have to fight the warden and hopefully escape this nightmarish prison and trial.
And so... after a few seconds... IT appeared.
[New Perk: "Wheel Target"!]
[A giant wheel will appear in front of everyone, this wheel will contain the faces of the four remaining participants]
'...?' Stark couldn't understand where this was going, the only times he had to use a wheel was for his class.
[The wheel will spin in front of everyone, and the person selected by the wheel will be the target!]
"..." Kokoro and Sora didn't talk.
"Oh..." Akira scratched his chin.
"=)" the clone kept smiling.
[The person selected as the target by the wheel is going to be the 'Killing Target' of the others!]
[Basically... if someone is selected as the target, and you kill them, not only will the door to floor 0 will be opened, but the warden will also have half of its life reduced, plus each of the alive participants will be getting two rewards each!]
This was an incredible offer: in exchange for one life, they would be almost guaranteed success in the trial.
But... would the target stay still?
No... obviously not... they would surely attack and kill in hopes of eliminating the people that were chasing them.
Yuri was dead, killed by someone (probably Akira), which meant he wouldn't hesitate for a single second to kill anyone.
And so, before anyone could even think deeply about any of this...
[The wheel has appeared!]
A giant crimson wheel with the text "Domination" written in white above it appeared.
On it were four sections: the faces of Akira, Kokoro, Sora and Stark.
But before the wheel could even spin...
"MOON DOMAIN!" Akira activated one of his legendary skills, and a sphere-like domain surrounded them all as he pulled his shining silver katana.
"If any of you move, I'm cutting them in half, you are in my domain, so you can't avoid the slashes and I can attack from any angle," Akira spoke, his face full of determination and ruthlessness, "I'm killing the target then we can get the fuck out of here..."
"And what if you're the target?" Stark spoke, he was the only one who could hold a decent conversation after all, as Kokoro used her tablet and Sora didn't speak at all.
"..." Akira seemed to think, "Then I guess we'll find the key to floor 0 and the four of us will challenge the warden fairly, I still need you folks for that."
"Kind of hypocritical, don't you think?" Stark smiled, he was in the [Moon Domain] but was still strangely confident.
"Doesn't matter, you are all in my domain, so if I wanted I could slash you all right now, just accept the rules," Akira seemed to be determined to make things go his way.
"..."
"..."
"..."
No one said anything, and Stark just kept smiling as he shrugged.
Akira truly wanted to control this entire trial it seemed, otherwise why would he threaten them this much even though he already had lots of rewards (5) from killing others and opening the doors (as well as stealing one from Yuri).
[Spinning the wheel! Good luck!]
And so the giant crimson wheel began to spin by itself, turning so fast the faces of the participants were but a blur.
~TICK, TICK, TICK~
No one talked as they all observed the wheel slow down, the anticipation in the air growing thicker by the second as EVERYONE wondered who the unfortunate soul that would have to face off against the other three would be.
~TICK.... TICK...~
The wheel was slow enough to be able to see the faces of the participants.
'...'
"=)" Stark's clone was still smiling, almost as if it knew who would be selected.
And so...
~TAP~
It tapped Stark's shoulder and gestured for him to run with its head.
"...?" Stark was confused, after all it wasn't certain who would be chosen as he had a 1/4 chance to become the target, and he was sure that the trial would be fair with all participants as it equally wanted to see them dead.
But... once he turned his head back toward the wheel, wanting to check where it was currently as it would important…
He saw IT... THE panel that he wished he would have never seen in this situation.
[Talent: Chosen One, activated!]
'...!' Stark instantly realized what this meant.
[Chosen One] would only activate in such situations to help him out or to do something bad to him, and in this case where he had a 1/4 chance to be selected, what kind of good thing could over occur?
Maybe it was a pun with the talent's name since, you know, "Chosen One" and Stark would be the one chosen by the wheel, but it was still bad.
And so... Stark immediately knew who would be selected as the target before the wheel even stopped spinning.
'Yeah... I'm out of here,' he didn't even want to try his luck.
~TICK.... TICK...~
The wheel was now moving so slowly they would be able to predict who it would land on.
And at that moment...
~DASH~
Stark ran in the opposite direction, toward a random hallway further inside the sublevel.
"YOU LITTLE- IT DIDN'T EVEN STOP!" Akira was furious, and so... "MOON DOMAIN... SLASH~"
He swung his katana in Stark's direction, and as he was in Akira's domain, the swing translated into a giant silver slash that reached Stark out of nowhere: when Akira swung in his domain, the attack would land wherever he wanted.
But...
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," Stark rolled immediately once he saw the attack come in his direction.
"FUCKER!" Akira was getting extremely mad for some strange reason, maybe he truly despised when things didn't go his way?
"MOON DOMAIN, SLASH!" Stark was still in the domain as it was fairly big from Akira upgrading it to the max, and so he immediately slashed again.
But…
"COMBO DODGE x2!" thanks to the new perk of [Invincible Dodge], Stark was able to follow his first roll with another one, meaning he was able to dodge the second slash.
"SLASH! SLASH! SLASH! SLASH!" Akira was ruthless as he kept slashing in Stark's direction, not understanding how he would avoid him so easily.
"COMBO DODGE x3; x4; x5… x8!" Stark kept running.
And after the 8th combo dodge hit… he was able to escape the [Moon Domain].
"=)" and now that they were out, Stark and his clone stopped, able to watch the wheel from their point of view while also escaping the slashes of Akira as they wouldn't be able to hit them from here.
"I'M GOING TO KILL YOU, FUCKER," Akira shouted again as he turned his head toward the wheel.
And at that moment, it stopped on… Sora?
Huh? Why would it stop on Sora? Wasn't Stark the one going to be selected?
"SEE, YOU DIDN'T EVEN NEED A REASON TO RUN!" Akira groaned again as he was ready to slash Sora in half.
But at that moment…
~TICK~
The wheel went crazy and suddenly did a complete 180-degree turn, resulting in the red arrow landing on Stark, who was in the section completely opposite to Sora.
"Knew it," Stark sighed as he got ready to run.

chapters.title: Chapter 195 - 195: Stark is The Target (who would have guessed)
chapters.content:
The other participants of the trial were visibly disturbed, even Sora having a semi-confused look on her face (although it still pretty emotionless).
The wheel was going to land on Sora, this was a truth no one could deny, and yet… it just turned out of nowhere to land on Stark.
The very same Stark that had begun running away before the wheel could even reveal the target.
'Something fishy is going on…' they all thought as they stared at Stark, who was observing them from afar.
That guy somehow knew, and the smile on the crimson replica of him was still extremely cold.
"OH WELL, IT DOESN'T MATTER!" Akira already had his katana in hand, so he just positioned it as he was ready to chase after Stark.
~TAP, TAP~
"Sorry," Kokoro entered this word on her tablet as the blue holographic aura surrounded her, and she began to float, "I need to survive."
Akira and Kokoro seemed ready to attack Stark in the hopes of being able to escape this trial.
Meanwhile...
"…" Sora just shook her head in disagreement as she turned in the opposite direction.
She was the only one not interested in killing Stark, or maybe it was a trap, and she would ambush him later? In the end it didn't matter as she turned around a corner, and he couldn't see her anymore.
"Are you sure about that," Stark asked as he smiled just as widely as his clone, "Are you confident you can take me and him, it is a 2V2 after all…"
"Quit chattering and just die, do it for the greater good…!" Akira proposed, holding his katana with one hand but pointing the other at Stark.
"Weren't you the one who put us inside a domain to guarantee your safety? And didn't you say if YOU were the target, then we would have to nicely look for the key?" Stark's smile grew wider, the crimson around him beginning to surround his body and face.
[EGO Meter: 20/100]
'Oohh…' Stark noticed the panel as it appeared before him: his ego meter had gone up by 20 for some strange reason.
"Well… this was the easy way, now we're going to have to kill you the hard way," Akira shook his head, "That's too bad, I truly wanted to make your death painless…"
"=)" but in response, Stark's clone just pointed at Akira and visibly laughed at him, no sound came out, but everyone could easily notice it was mocking him.
And so…
[3…]
Akira and Kokoro powered up their auras.
[2…]
Stark did the same, it was pretty much a 2v1, but thankfully his clone should also be counted as a person as long as it was alive.
[1…]
All participants face one another…
And…
[FIGHT!]
"HOLOGRAPHIC MISSILE!" the first to act was Kokoro, a blue missile coming out of her tablet, its texture seemed to be glitching as it was made from holographic aura.
And then…
~FWISH~
She sent it toward Stark, with the pure intent to get rid of him in one blow for the 'greater good' of their trial.
"=)" Stark's clone backed away as there was no need for it to stay in the radius of the explosion while it wasn't targeted.
And as for Stark…
'Come on…' he mumbled as the missile was approaching, 'Just a bit more…'
And when it was right about to explode in his face…
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" he dodged the explosion at the perfect microsecond before it hit him.
[Perfect Dodge!]
[+10 EGO!]
The world around Stark turned gray, and it slowed down, Akira and Kokoro's movements now so minimal it almost looked like they froze in time, but some signs of movement were still there to confirm they could move.
"PERCEPTION!" without wasting time, Stark activated his skill to check out his two opponents, it was something he always did of course, but finding the good timing was something essential, and thankfully enough, doing a [Perfect Dodge] gave him exactly enough time to analyze them.
…
[Name: Kokoro]
[Level: 58]
[Class: Domination]
[HP: 49250]
[Strength: 1726]
[Speed: 6291]
[Stamina: 7314]
[Defense: 2409]
[Skills: Domination, All-Use Tablet, Holographic Weapons, Holo-Copy, Holographic Missile, Glitch Barrier, Virtual World (MYTHICAL), Practical Prediction, Time Dilation, Quick Hands, Rune Engraving, Element Simulation…]
…
'All her skills are related to the tablet probably,' Stark thought as his gaze turned to the tablet she was holding in her hands so tightly, her stamina was extremely high in that regard because it was needed for her to cast a lot of spells, and her speed was high as well, thus sacrificing strength (as she didn't need it), and defense.
But… now that he knew…
'That tablet…' Stark thought as he kept staring at it, 'If I somehow manage to destroy it… then… never mind, I don't have much time left…'
He immediately moved to Akira's status window.
…
[Name: Akira]
[Level: 64]
[Class: Domination]
[HP: 43700]
[Strength: 7371]
[Speed: 5938]
[Stamina: 3119]
[Defense: 3345]
[Skills: Domination, Power of the Moon, Moonlight Slash, Moon Domain, Half-Moon Technique, Lunar Strike, Shadow Dash, Celestial Sanctuary, Full Moon Form (MYTHICAL), Silver Illusion, Phase Shift, Cosmic Barrier, Phantom Dance…]
…
Akira's stats were mostly oriented toward attack and speed, leaving out stamina as each of his blows would be tremendous in strength, as well as leaving out his defense as he would be too fast and end the battle quickly.
Each of his skills, much like Leader with the snakes and Kokoro with the tablet, were related to his power, which was the [Power of the Moon]…
~TAP TAP~
Kokoro tapped something on her tablet for Akira, and the message [Got him] appeared.
Of course, from their point of view, Stark was just hit by a FUCKING missile straight up, and so they thought that he would be seen dead on the ground after the smoke from the explosion dissipated.
But that would be a mistake…
'Got them now…' Stark thought as he finished reading the panels.
He was surrounded by a smoke screen… and he wanted to take advantage of it.
"CRIMSON BALL TRANSMISSION!" he summoned the crimson ball in his hand and threw it, aiming for the spot right behind Akira and Kokoro.
The two participants were not suspecting Stark to be alive, or at least he would be knocked down as [Holographic Missile] was a skill that needed around a minute to charge up (without being able to cast anything else), meaning Kokoro had spent precious time powering it up, which is why it was so powerful, worthy of a being a legendary skill.
She had defeated many monsters and people using this skill, so she was absolutely confident in its ability to kill or knock down people.
But… had none of them learned yet that Stark could avoid all their attacks using [Invincible Dodge] when it was aided by [Focus]?
Or maybe they just couldn't understand how Stark did it? Thinking it was a rare skill that could only be used once in a while.
Well, frankly, it didn't matter much for the boy as the smile on his face grew wider.
~FWISH~
They didn't notice the crimson ball flying over them.
And the moment it was in midair at the spot right behind and between Akira and Kokoro.
~SNAP~
Stark snapped his fingers, teleporting behind the two enemies instantly.
Right at that moment, the smoke disappeared, and the two noticed that Stark was nowhere to be seen.
"Huh? Wait a damn minute-" Akira turned around, and his face turned livid as he saw Stark, a huge smile on his face, right behind them.
"…" Kokoro didn't even let out a noise, but her expression was clearly of someone that is surprised and scared.
"Thought I would go out this easily?" Stark smiled as he punched both of them in the face at the same time.
This time, the battle would truly begin.

chapters.title: Chapter 196 - 196: Stark VS Kokoro and Akira
chapters.content:
~BAM, BAM~
Stark teleported behind Akira and Kokoro while they thought that he had died, and punched both of their faces right as they finally noticed his presence.
"-8938!" was what Kokoro received.
"-8123!" and this was Akira's damage.
As said before, when two [Domination] users clashed, their aura would massively protect them, thus reducing the damage they received.
This was one of the reasons Stark was able to withstand some attacks who normally should deal much more damage than normal.
~THUMP, THUMP~
Akira and Kokoro were sent flying backward, both still holding on to their weapons as letting their katana/tablet go out of their hands was instant-death.
And after traveling some distance, they both stopped, getting up almost instantly and staring at Stark, who was looking at them from their previous position.
"Fucking hell…" Akira sighed as he spanned his katana in his hands, ready to cut him in half.
"…" Kokoro didn't say anything, although some blood was dripping from her head as her cheek was visibly bruised.
And right as they were about to attempt to attack Stark…
"AURA SMASH, CRIMSON SPEARS!" before they could even attack, they sensed a powerful aura behind them, and once they turned…
They saw three crimson fists, as well as three spears heading their way, only three meters away from reaching them.
"Can't forget about the other me now, can we?" Stark smiled, and the clone did as well.
The two of them were visibly furious, Kokoro seemed to be of the gentle type, and anyone could almost imagine her talking in an emotionless voice when the messages of the tablet appeared.
But… this time, her expression was full of anger.
"GLITCH BARRIER," a blue and glitchy aura came out of the tablet in her hands, surrounding her completely like some sort of oval shield.
"COSMIC BARRIER," Akira did the same, and as for him, his barrier LITERALLY descended from the sky in a silver glow, its color was purplish/dark, reminiscent of the night sky as some stars could be seen in it.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOOM~
The barriers tanked all the attacks, allowing both of them to receive 0 damage.
"ALRIGHT, LETS-A-GO!" Akira roared as he finally activated one of his skills after being interrupted twice, "POWER OF THE MOON!"
Suddenly, the aura around Akira whitened and… a silver moon, the size of his head, appeared and began to spin around him.
A silver trail of aura was escaping the 'moon' and going into his katana, infusing it with power.
And as for Kokoro…
She finally decided to use not one, but two of her basic skills.
"ALL-USE TABLET, HOLOGRAPHIC WEAPONS," the words appeared with a red tint on her tablet, which now had even more glitches showing up.
The tablet was now glowing with energy, and as soon as she activated her other ability... five immense blue holograms emerged from it, similar to when she first saw Stark's clone. A sword, shield, hammer, bow, and spear materialized, all towering above her and connected to the tablet by a thin stream of blue aura, proving their origin from the device in Kokoro's grasp.
Both of them were now ready, and it also meant that Stark was in a really bad position.
Even if his clone TECHNICALLY counted as another person, it was just another Stark but slightly weaker, meaning that he wouldn't be able to keep up with other people as strong as he was.
Kokoro and Akira were now back to back, the girl looking at the smiling clone, and the man in the suit at the original Stark.
"MOONLIGHT SLASH," Akira shouted, brandishing his katana with a pretty much unnoticeable flick of his wrist. The silver aura trail he had been building up earlier was now fully unleashed, and his katana seemed to glow with the power of the moon.
~SLASH~
And although he wasn't even CLOSE to Stark, at least ten meters apart, he still sliced in his direction, and what resulted from that attack was… a crescent moon trail cutting through the air, emanating a sharp, vitalizing silver luster.
"Aura Smash," Stark sent a crimson fist toward the aftereffect of the slash, which was still rushing at him, and they both collided, dissipating into thin air.
"…!" Akira was surprised, his attack would normally be almost unstoppable against most monsters no matter how much they tried to stop it, "Oh yeah… domination…" he mumbled as he remembered that Stark also had domination aura, meaning he could counter his attack with one of his.
Stark already knew that, but Akira took a few seconds to realize it.
To be honest, Stark was in such disadvantage in this fight that it was already scary enough he didn't just run for his life and hoped Sora would find the key to open the door: Stark attacked from close range using his fists, and who else attacked from close range? Well… Akira of course, he had a katana in hand after all!
And so… he dashed toward Stark.
"Half-Moon Technique," using this skill meant that Akira was entirely changing his strategy: going from long range to short range using the power of his half moon.
The moon that was spinning around him responded accordingly and went from a full moon to a half moon as well.
~FWISH, SLASH~
In a fraction of a second, the white-haired man was already right in front of Stark, his blade aimed at the boy's neck.
Stark easily avoided the attack by backing away though, yet Akira followed him.
~SLASH, SLASH, SLASH~
Using the moon powerhouse that was spinning around him, Akira kept slashing at Stark's decision, who was forced to keep avoiding the attacks to not get cut.
And after a few seconds…
"Crimson Spears…" Stark summoned one single spear above his head, then sent it not a Akira… but… the moon around him.
And while he was too focused on attacking Stark, he avoided the spear, thinking it was aimed to him.
But…
~BAM~
"-74271!"
The powerhouse could actually be hit.
[Moon HP: 925729/1000000]
'Bingo…' Stark thought as avoided another attack and kicked Akira out of his range.
"-1381!" the kick didn't do much, but it served as a way to temporarily allow himself to think before another assault.
All of Akira's power probably came from this moon, but it had so much HP, and it was so small that it would be impossible to destroy it, which is quite understandable as eliminating someone's powers easily would be bad.
In exchange for incredible powers, Akira was forced to put himself at risk by letting his powerhouse constantly spin around him, in the view of the enemies, although most of them never even thought of destroying that though…
But Stark was different: this was a 2v1.5, and so killing Akira's power core would be an almost instant victory in his book.
Stark glanced at his clone afterward, and he saw that it was holding on against Kokoro, who was sending her hologram weapons toward it in a frenzy, with not a single second of rest.
Kokoro vs Fake Stark, and Akira vs Original Stark, who would win this battle? No one really knew…
But one thing was certain: only one team would remain by the end.

chapters.title: Chapter 197 - 197: In Complete Disadvantage Yet Still Fighting
chapters.content:
~SLASH~
"STOP RUNNING AWAY," Akira was forcefully following Stark wherever he went.
'Fucking hell…' Stark was also at completely disadvantage since… well… you can't really stop a silver katana in full power with your bare hands, now can you?
Stark's clone almost seemed to struggle, and although the smile on its face never disappeared, it couldn't get a single hit on Kokoro who easily managed to avoid his punches or used her [Glitch Barrier] to tank his projectiles.
"PRACTICAL PREDICTION," it also seemed like she could predict the clone's next actions as her eyes switched color, some sort of technological zoom appearing in them when she used that skill.
They didn't want to use [Double Assault], [Dodge Control] or [Heaven's Wrath] for the simple reason there was no saying what their opponents could pull, and wasting such precious skills which they could only use once in this battle was terrible.
~FLAP~
[Judicator's Wings] flapped in the opposite direction when Akira juked Stark by making him go to the right then slashing in that same place, saving him.
"LUNAR STRIKE!" Akira jumped in the air, placing his katana downward as he aimed at Stark, the moon behind him growing in size in exchange for an increase in power as he swung down.
"Crimson Spears," unbothered, Stark summoned three spears and sent them all at the moon, making it easier to aim at it since it grew in size.
~BAM, BAM, BAM~
"-77183! -74829! -76491!" all three hit.
But…
~FWISH~
Akira was now falling back, his katana glowing so intensely it was impossible to see the blade without being blinded.
And so he swung it at Stark.
~SLASH… BOOOOOOOM~
[Lunar Strike] concentrated the power of the moon into a giant attack, and right after that attack, an explosion would occur.
And so it did: right as Akira's sword's edge touched the ground between him and Stark, a massive explosion occurred, sending both of them flying.
"-1271!" this attack actually harmed Akira himself, but since it was his own, it didn't do much damage.
"Got him, Kokoro, just get rid of that thing and we're good!" Akira shouted while looking back at the girl, who was still actively fighting the clone, somehow unable to hit it as it avoided everything.
They were in a stalemate: none of them able to hit one another, even though Kokoro should have the complete advantage against one clone that was weaker than the original and was one shot.
Meanwhile…
'Fucking hell…' Stark placed his arms in front of his face to shield himself from the silver smoke of the explosion.
[The Purgatory Shadow took the hit in your place!]
[Invincible Dodge] wouldn't work as the explosion was too close and big for him to roll away, but his ring saved him as otherwise he would have had to use [Dodge Control] or a revive.
A massive shadow form came out of the ring the moment the katana hit the ground to shield him, thus he received the knock back but no damage.
"AURA SMASH… MERGE…" Stark was getting tired, so he focused his aura around his fist, and it was so much more powerful than before, strands of golden and holy aura visible as it was powering up the fist.
Akira didn't think Stark could survive this as he didn't dodge, so he just waited for Kokoro to finish her fight.
But… after ten seconds…
~FWISH… BOOOOOM~
He sent the crimson fist, now 1.5 bigger than Akira in terms of size, flying toward him as he didn't expect anything.
It came out of the smoke like a lightning bolt, leaving a powerful trail of crimson aura that seemed to be able to destroy everything in its way .
"…!" for the second time since this battle started, Akira was taken aback by another attack.
Didn't he learn that overconfidence was bad? And that when battling against Stark, there would ALWAYS be surprises?
~FWISH~
Akira turned his head right as the crimson fist was only a meter away from reaching him, his eyes widening as he saw the giant attack in front of his face.
But… he wouldn't fall for it twice.
"SHADOW STEP," he vanished into thin air, leaving a dark smoke behind, then reappearing a few meters away, sweating a bit.
[Shadow Step] was a very hard skill to use, and even he didn't control it well enough, which is why it took so much energy for him to cast it.
"Nice try, but that fist won't attack me or anyone!" Akira proudly shouted as he got ready to go on another attack spree.
But… Stark just smiled as he kept observing the punch go straight, not even paying attention to Akira.
"Target Manipulation…" Stark calmly mumbled as he pulled his right arm forward, his palm facing Kokoro, a thin crimson aura now appearing not only around him, but also Kokoro's figure as he had set her as the target of the manipulation.
'Focus…' he mumbled to himself over and over as he closed his eyes and breath in and out.
Kokoro was busy fighting off the clone, who was like a parasite, not dying yet not doing any damage either, slowly but surely taking her stamina away while his just never seemed to deplete.
And so once the clone noticed what Stark wanted to do, it just smiled and focused as well.
"AURA SMASH, CRIMSON SPEARS," it summoned everything in its arsenal, then sent it all at Kokoro at the same time.
"GLITCH BARRIER!" she placed it in front of her, thus receiving no damage.
But at this very moment… the crimson fist that Stark sent was behind her.
"…?" she turned around just like Akira, to see that the attack was heading straight at her, her expression full of horror.
~FLY~
She surrounded herself with the aura of her tablet to begin floating and avoiding the attack.
But… it was too late.
"GET BACK DOWN, DUMBASS," Stark pointed downward with the hand that had been facing Kokoro, and suddenly, her entire body was taken over by his aura, resulting in her going down instead of up to dodge the attack.
And so what had to happen happened.
~BOOOOOOOM~
The explosion and attack was so powerful even Sora probably heard it from the other side of the sublevel.
"-38372!" the damage was phenomenal as well, taking most of Kokoro's life as she was sent flying backward, the knock back of the attack almost knocking her out cold.
"SHIT!" Akira knew he couldn't allow his companion (even though it was only temporary) to die like this since it would basically become a 1v2, and he really didn't want to use up his items yet, even though he had five.
Kokoro could die later for all he cared, but now he needed to her to hold off the other enemy.
"Ouch…" for the first time, Kokoro spoke, her mind feeling hazy as the explosion hit her straight on, her eyes almost closing.
"DOMI-CHAIN RESTRAIN!" in addition to that, Stark's clone took advantage of that to send the crimson chain toward the girl, attaching it around her while she was still in midair, then slamming her to the ground with it.
"-1239!" low damage, but now Kokoro's arms and legs were bound by the chain, meaning she couldn't do much anymore.
And so just like that… the situation became really bad for Kokoro and Akira, who truly thought they would easily win against Stark.

chapters.title: Chapter 198 - 198: Quick Save and Celestial Sanctuary
chapters.content:
"DOMI-CHAIN RESTRAIN!" the chain flew and wrapped themselves around Kokoro, who was slammed to the ground, unable to do anything: her tablet was also wrapped up around by the chain, meaning that the hologram weapons she had been summoning disappeared into the tablet as well.
"HELP…!" and for the first time, she actually spoke, her voice sounded terrified.
"SHIT!" Akira knew this was a bad, really bad.
He truly wanted to rush at Kokoro and slash the chain, but there was no way for him to do that as Stark positioned himself right in front of Kokoro, and his clone also crouched down in front of the body, its eyes analyzing each of his movements.
"YOU THINK YOU'RE THE ONLY ONE WHO CAN DO THAT?" the white-haired man roared as he placed his blade in front of his face, closing his eyes.
And after less than a second… he opened them back.
"SILVER ILLUSION!" beside him appeared two exact replicas of himself, completely made out of the silver smoke and aura, a trail of the same color leaving their eyes as they positioned themselves to attack.
"You know I can still see you, right?" Stark never underestimated his opponents, but he just pointed it out for the sake of it, plus he was confident these clones couldn't deal real damage.
But… Akira snapped his fingers, and suddenly, the clones' figures became human, resembling Akira, with no way to discern one from the other.
And then…
~FWISH, FWISH~
They all dashed at Stark, while making sure to do all sorts of crazy movements in hopes of hiding the real one.
But… Stark could easily follow them.
And so… all three jumped at Stark.
His eyes were on the original, so he simply punched in his direction, he was confident that this was Akira, since no matter what you tried, he had [Focus] and could also sense him, so there was no chance in hell he missed him.
And yet…
~SMASH~
His fist fazed right through the Akira he punched, making it turn into a pile of smoke.
"What?" and when he turned around, he saw that the original used the momentum to rush at Stark's clone, "FUCK!"
Stark began to follow closely after Akira, who never stopped.
"CELESTIAL SANCTUARY… OTHERS!" Akira was a masterful user of this technique, and it enveloped Stark and his clone in a bubble of pure white light, making them unable to move or see.
[Do not fret, he cannot harm you inside of the 'Celestial Sanctuary' either]
'FUCK, FUCK!!' Stark tried his hardest to move, but he couldn't, a simple message in his view: [You are in stuck in the 'Celestial Sanctuary', you will be liberated in 23 seconds].
[Celestial Sanctuary] could be used by Akira to isolate himself from everything for 30 seconds, granting him an impenetrable barrier… but now that he powered it up to the max level he could, it could be cast on others, stopping them all.
And so…
~SLASH~
He reached Kokoro and slashed the chain that was slowly taking up her aura and force, resulting in Kokoro instantly waking up and getting up.
"…" she was sweating all over, "Thank… you…" she mumbled to Akira, and he just nodded.
Meanwhile… inside the [Celestial Sanctuary].
"RAAAAAAFGHHHHHHH," Stark was shouting with all his strength, he was so mad now that the aura around him became twice as powerful, and he was so determined that he actually managed to move one of his hands, punching the barrier repeatedly to escape.
His clone was the same, although it was still smiling.
And so after a while…
[You are in stuck in the 'Celestial Sanctuary', you will be liberated in 3 seconds]
[…2 seconds]
[…1…]
[You have been freed from the 'Celestial Sanctuary'!]
"DODGE CONTROL," it wasn't Stark that used this, but his clone as soon as it was freed from the bubble.
And the reason was simple…
"LUNAR STRIKE!"
"QUICK HANDS!"
As soon as the bubble that has trapped it disappeared, Akira used the power of his moon to jump in the air, ready to cause another explosion as soon as the clone would be liberated, thus instantly killing it.
And on the other hand…
~ZAP, FWISH~
Two giant blue and glitchy hands came out of the tablet, each as big as Kokoro, who was roughly 1.68cm in size.
She used her powers and placed those hands on each side of the bubble, planning to squash the clone like a mosquito the moment it escaped, then Akira dealing the final blow with the explosion.
And so as soon as the bubble burst…
~SLAM, BOOM~
The giant blue hands closed in on the clone, then Akira immediately swung his katana downward, causing it to explode on hitting the ground.
"-1238!" he yet again suffered some damage, but it was worth it to kill one of the opponents.
"Nice… now let's just get rid of the other one," Akira smiled, "I'll use an item for this very occasion…"
He pulled out his collection of rewards from his suit, placing them in is hands to check them out.
Akira had acquired two rewards from killing Bang (the tanned guy from the start) and Yuri, two rewards for being the first to reach the floors, and one reward that he stole from Yuri, who had killed Lolia.
He had used [Instant Use Key], so that meant he was left with four rewards in hand.
And they were as follows:
One [Invincibility Token], one [Aura Blocker], one [Monster Scent] and finally, one [Key Location Map].
The reason he hadn't used any of these, especially the [Aura Blocker], is because he feared that if he used it on one of them, the other would just run away while holding the other Stark in hand, thus wasting it completely, and the reason was the same with the [Invincibility Token]: they could run away as they were possibly faster than he was.
But now that he got rid of the clone… Stark was defenseless, all alone with no way to escape…
And so…
"AURA BLOCKER," he used the item, a wide smile on his face, "GAME OVER, KID!"
[Aura Blocker: Target a participant and be able to block their powers for thirty seconds, one time use]
A trail of crimson aura hit Stark straight on as he had no way to dodge it, and suddenly… his very own aura disappeared.
"…" Stark knew what this meant, the [Aura Blocker] successfully had made it impossible for him to use any of his skills or even run now: he was just an ordinary human.
And yet… he didn't seem scared at all?
"It was a nice fight, Chosen," Akira acknowledge the strength of the boy, spinning his katana as he approached Stark.
[Aura blocked for 27 more seconds]
And right at that moment…
~FWISH, DASH~
Both Akira and Kokoro, using a lot of their own powers, suddenly dashed toward Stark, closing in the distance on him in less than a second.
"DIE!" they both spoke, and the fact Kokoro was this mad surprised not only Akira and Stark, but herself too.
And so… both of them swung down using their own attacks, ready to kill Stark.
His expression remained neutral through all of this though, and he didn't look scared one bit…
Wait, no… his expression wasn't neutral…
Instead…
Stark could be seen smiling: he was this confident he couldn't be hurt by them, and so that only angered them more.
This time, they would make sure to end his life so that they could escape this trial.

chapters.title: Chapter 199 - 199: Aura Blocker and Kill
chapters.content:
"PHASE SHIFT… MOONLIGHT SLASH!" Akira used [Phase Shift], which changed the shape of the surrounding moon, making it go from a half-moon to a full moon again, and also making it more powerful in the process.
Also, he began to hold his katana with his two hands instead of only using one.
…
[Skill: Phase Shift]
[Rank: Legendary]
[Description: Just as phases of the moon go by, your attitude and techniques must shift as well, this skill allows the user to change his combat method between two current styles (more will appear after level up)]
…
The second style was like this: more powerful attacks, but reducing speed slightly as he was now holding his weapon with two hands.
It was something he used when he was confident he would be able to kill his enemy in one blow, or wanted to make sure the damage would be enough.
And in that case, he truly wanted to cause the maximum amount of damage to Stark for annoying him so much.
"STOP SMILING, ASSHOLE," he swung down at Stark using his new technique, as well as [Moonlight Slash].
And as for Kokoro…
