"Rune Engraving… Quick Hands!" she engraved some sort of weird rune on the back of her tablet, it was the drawing of lightning bolt, then regrouped the giant glitchy hands from [Quick Hands], which were still active, and got ready to squash Stark in a smash-like attack.
~ZAP, ZAP~
The giant hands had an electric aura around them, and would zap anyone who even went as much as grazed them, this was the power of the runes.
…
[Skill: Rune Engraving]
[Rank: Legendary]
[Description: Engrave one of the three available runes at the back of your tablet: lightning, fire, water, and your attacks will be enhanced by the corresponding element related to that rune, you will unlock more runes as you level this skill up!]
…
And so… both attacks were now coming at Stark, who couldn't avoid or use any skill since his aura had been blocked by [Aura Blocker], transforming him into somewhat of a normal human being.
"I shall accept this…" he mumbled as he looked down, a wide smile on his face, opening only one of his eyes, his pupils staring intently at the two as their attacks were mere centimeters away from hitting him.
~BOOM, ZAP, SLASH~
The room around them began to shake as the electricity from Kokoro's rune engraver mixed with Akira's powerful lunar slash hit the ground.
"Finally…" Akira fell on one knee, breathing in and out repeatedly: he had used too much power for this simple guy, and although he could keep going for long, he still wanted to rest.
"…" Kokoro didn't say anything, she was thankful for Akira for saving her, but that was all, nothing more, nothing less, and so all she wanted was to reach the warden and get out of this place.
"This should be enough, the aura blocker should be deactivated by now," Akira looked at the object in his hand, it was a device with a small screen and a red button under it, some sort of antenna at the top you use to point at the target.
And so once he opened the item panel…
[12 seconds left for 'Aura Blocker']
"Huh? What the fuck…?" he loudly spoke, at least loud enough for Kokoro to hear as she approached him.
"…?" she titled her head.
"No… but if someone is dead… then the 'Aura Blocker' should be deactivated as there is no aura to begin with…" he was holding his chin with his hand, mumbling something to himself.
[6 seconds left for 'Aura Blocker']
~TAP, TAP~
"What does that mean," Kokoro tapped some words on her tablet, and the blue screen displayed what she wrote.
"It means…" Akira became to sweat profusely, "It means…" he repeated, holding his forehead and gritting his teeth as he looked up, "It means he is alive…"
Kokoro's eyes widened, and she began to look around.
If he was alive, then where could he be?
They killed his clone, then immediately aimed for him as he was under the usage of [Aura Blocker], so how could this kid survive…?
Kokoro turned around, looking behind them, and thus, she got her answer: the clone had never died to begin with.
As stated before, it used [Dodge Control] the moment the bubble of [Celestial Sanctuary] popped, meaning that even though both Akira and Kokoro teamed up on it, it would still be able to dodge everything as someone using [Dodge Control] could NEVER be hit.
Right after quite literally teleporting away because of the explosion, Stark's clone immediately noticed that the two used a reward item to block Stark's aura and dashed in his direction.
To be honest, wasn't it weird that even though Stark's aura was stopped, the clone was still there?
Wasn't he made out of Stark's aura after all? So how… was it possible…?
Maybe… heh, it didn't matter.
All that it knew was that it could still move, and that it would have to do everything to protect the original.
"FOCUS… EYES VISION," it slowed down time, and that was something Stark noticed too since he himself was now affected by it, meaning that for three seconds, he saw the figures of Akira and Kokoro at 0.25 speed in front of him.
"CRIMSON BALL TRANSMISSION!" it summoned the ball in hand and placed it in the spot it was in.
[Target point set!]
It focused everything it had in its legs, then… it dashed toward Stark at incredible speed.
~FWISH…FWISH… FWIIISHHH~
In a fraction of a second it was alright beside Stark while Akira and Kokoro were now mere centimeters away from killing the weakened Stark.
And so…
~SNAP~
~BOOM~
Stark's clone held onto him from behind so quickly it was invisible even for the other [Domination] users.
Then… it snapped its fingers while holding him, both of them INSTANTLY teleporting to the target point of [Crimson Ball Transmission].
And so just like that, Stark was able to avoid the explosion and powerful attacks that shook the very hallway they were in.
[Aura Blocker has been deactivated, 30 seconds have passed!]
Stark was able to get his aura back the moment the other two figured out what was happening.
"…"
"…"
Akira and Kokoro were speechless as they saw the figures of both Stark and his clone looking back at them, the smiles on their faces still there, haunting them forever.
~TAP, TAP~
The first to act was Kokoro as she tapped on her tablet.
"M-Maybe we should just try to find the key and fight the warden together…" she began, "I mean, I did see that you had the [Key Location Map], so it's definitely possible…"
She was tired of fighting and attacking just for Stark to avoid everything and somehow living through it all.
But… Akira wasn't of the same opinion, he truly wanted to kill Stark, and the more time the boy spent avoiding his attacks and mocking him, the more he truly wanted to see him in pain.
"You want to give up?" he turned his head toward Kokoro, his expression darkening, "Well…" he raised his blade, "I guess you are useless now."
~SLASH~
Kokoro already had low HP from Stark's previous attacks, and so that slash from Akira…
"-12426!"
[Kokoro HP: 0/49250]
It killed her.
[A participant has been slain by another player!]

chapters.title: Chapter 200 - 200: Virtual World
chapters.content:
~SLASH~
[A participant has been slain by another player!]
Kokoro's body was swiftly cut in half as Akira swung his blade at her so fast she couldn't react.
"You are useless now," were the last words she heard as her head felt dizzy and the world around her turned upside down.
The reason he did that? Well, it was because Kokoro proposed that they stop their assault on Stark to try and find the key to the next floor.
Why would he need to do that when he was stronger than Stark? Why would he need to put himself so low and stop his attacks because it wasn't worth it?
"YOU AREN'T STRONGER THAN ME, KID," he shouted at the boy and his clone, his pride hurt he wasn't able to hit or kill Stark no matter what.
But… what Akira didn't expect… was…
"I… Shall… Avenge… Myself…" Kokoro mumbled as the upper half of the body fell to the ground, separated from her lower half.
There was no way for her to survive this, her HP had already reached 0, but in her final moments before death… her tablet began to glow brightly with that same bluish aura, visible glitches appearing in it.
And suddenly…
~FWISHHHHH~
The entire hallway was taken over by the glitchy aura, the walls, floor, EVERYTHING, now replaced by that very same aura, making the floor look as though they were in some sort of simulation.
"VIRTUAL WORLD!" through her sheer determination, Kokoro was able to activate her mythical skill.
And so… her body suddenly began to fade out of existence.
"…?" Akira and Stark looked around, it was extremely weird.
"Time to end this," and only a few seconds later, a hologram of Kokoro appeared, it was an exact copy of her, except it had no colors, it was just a blue and transparent hologram.
~SLASH~
Akira immediately tried to slash her in half, but his katana fazed right through her, meaning they couldn't damage her.
"You are in my world… and you both shall suffer now…" she put her hands together and closed her eyes, an uncomfortable aura swirling around her, and she was strangely beautiful in that moment, the sight of her in this pose extremely peaceful.
But…
[Virtual World] was everything but peaceful.
…
[Skill: Virtual World]
[Rank: Mythical]
[Description: In a world of glitches and technology, this skill will allow the user to completely change her surroundings to her likings, placing all her enemies in a simulation where he was complete control, this skill lasts 30 seconds]
[Additional info: if the user dies, then if they have enough determination, they can cast this skill to avenge themselves]
…
"Akira, Chosen," she said, her voice distant and muffled, as if she were speaking through a glitchy radio, "You both…" she raised her holographic hand, and suddenly, hundreds upon hundreds of giant blue hands came out of the walls of the virtual world, surrounding the three of them completely (yes, the clone counts as one).
And…
"Goodbye," she closed her hand.
~FWISH, FWISH, FWISH~
~SLAM~
Dozens of hands rushed at each of the participants, each enhanced by [Rune Engraving] as fire, water, or lightning aura surrounded them.
~BOOM, SLASH, SLASH, FWISH~
"PHANTOM DANCE," Akira positioned himself, holding the handle of his katana with two hands, placing it upward.
And then… he started to swing it at each of the hands.
Surprisingly, he was able to cut through those attacks, meaning that as long as he managed to keep like this, he would surely manage to pass the 30 seconds…
[Phantom Dance] allowed Akira to swing his blade to the rhythm of the attacks, abandoning everything else to focus on dodging and countering instead of his usual attitude and skills, which were all on the attacker side.
Like he was dancing, his movements were smooth and following a clear pattern, each swing leaving some white trial of aura that looked beautiful.
And as for Stark… he was struggling more than he thought.
[Focus] allowed him to see all the of attacks, whichever angle they came from, allowing him to dodge them by a hair's length every time, but it was still fairly difficult as there were so many of them.
His clone was on the same situation, although it was still confidently smiling.
All three of them felt one thing: if any of these things hit, then they would be dead.
[23 seconds of 'Virtual World' remaining]
"Holographic Missile…" Kokoro closed one of her holographic eyes, then raised both her arms, summoning not one, not two, but THREE missiles, sending one at each of the people stuck in her virtual world.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," not difficult for Stark and the [Superior Clone] to dodge them using their dodge attack, then following through with a combo of 10 [Invincible Dodges] thanks to the new perk.
But as for Akira…
"COSMIC BARRIER," he was forced to place his barrier in front of him as slashing a missile wouldn't do anything.
And so…
~BOOOM~
Even though he was protected, the fact the attacks were enhanced by the [Virtual World], as well as the fact he took the explosion in the face…
"-3472!" his barrier shattered and he was sent flying backward, forced to continue slashing in the direction of the hands who didn't stop coming.
[19 seconds of 'Virtual World' remaining]
Kokoro's face remained neutral through all of this, she could clearly see that they were all struggling, yet she didn't stop, why would she after all, they were her murderers.
But somehow, around 70 percent of her power was specifically targeted at Akira, maybe since he was the one who dealt the finishing blow…
[13 seconds of 'Virtual World' remaining]
By this point, the three got the hang of it, and now smoothly managed to avoid all the holographic hands coming their way, even though their speed and numbers were in fact increasing.
[9 seconds of 'Virtual World' remaining]
And at that very moment… when all were confident they would be able to get out of this place safely… Kokoro began to float in the air, her eyes closed, her mouth shut, and her hands still together, as well as her legs crossed, almost as if she was meditating.
And so… she used her final resort.
"I didn't want to do this…" she spoke loudly, "But all of you are monsters, undeserving of living or leaving this place, I shall take you with me to spare the world of your presence…"
"…"
"…"
"=)"
And…
"ELEMENT SIMULATION!" she used her strongest [Legendary] skill.
Her hands, feet, torso, her entire body basically, began to glow with four different colored auras: red for fire, green for earth, blue for water and white for wind.
It looked like she was powering them up as some sort of energy sphere was forming in the middle of her chest, a trail of aura leaving each of her body parts and powering up that ball at the center, regrouping all the elements.
[7 seconds of 'Virtual World' remaining]
And while she was doing that, ALL attacks had stopped, meaning that Akira and Stark could Kokoro and whatever she was doing.
Yet in that moment… both of them could sense that this wasn't good, not one bit.
[Element Simulation] was a beam-like attack that could be used from long-range, where Kokoro using her tablet would simulate the four elements and launch it at her enemies.
And now… that attack was coming at them, with only five seconds left before 'Virtual World' ended.

chapters.title: Chapter 201 - 201: Kokoro and the Clone's death
chapters.content:
"ELEMENT SIMULATION," Kokoro's body was surrounding by the four elements: fire, water, earth and wind as she began to float in the air in a meditation pose.
Some sort of energy ball was growing more and more as she was pouring the aura of the four elements inside of it.
[4 seconds of 'Virtual World' remaining…]
The ball of energy was growing more and more, and in less than a second it was already three times Kokoro's size, meaning that it was extremely powerful.
"Tsk… lucky idiots, if I had just a bit more time, this entire hallway would have been destroyed…" Kokoro sighed as she wasn't able to power her attack anymore since only three seconds remained before she would disappear forever.
~FWISH~
She separated the giant energy ball into two different ones that were slightly smaller, yet just as powerful, and then… she sent them at Akira and Stark.
She didn't even bother to send an attack at the clone, option only for the real threats: the actual participants.
"And with this…" Kokoro looked down, a sad expression on her face and tears forming on her holographic face, "I guess it's over for me…" she fell to the floor, sitting down and just looking at the energy balls head toward them, "You'll be joining me…"
'Well… time to use [Dodge Control] I guess…' Stark got ready as soon as the energy ball headed his way.
'…' Akira didn't think of anything, he closed his eyes as soon as he saw the first giant energy ball, and the moon around him began to grow more and more, slowly seeping into his body as it gradually disappeared inside of it, 'FULL MOON FORM!'
~FWISH, FWISH~
Both energy balls headed toward Stark and Akira, the latter already having activated his skill, getting ready to cut the ball in half using his mythical skill.
But… at that moment…
Kokoro opened her tearful eyes one more time, then pointed her arms toward Stark and Akira.
"TIME DILATION!"
…
[Skill: Time Dilation]
[Type: Epic]
[Description: Completely slows down the skill of the users you select (limit of two skills per user), thus allowing you to place an attack as they believe they would be able to dodge it/counter with their skills]
[Note: it pretty much deactivate the skills]
…
And so…
"DODGE CONTROL!" Stark got ready to easily avoid the ball.
But…
['Dodge Control' is affected by 'Time Dilation', thus the speed is too slow to be cast!]
This was the second time such a thing happened to Stark, the first being against the cyclops who locked its skill using its eye to lock [Dodge Control] while it was using its final attack.
And now…
"I'm fucked…" Stark saw the ball of energy, combining all element as well as Kokoro's entire power, heading toward him, only centimeters away from his face
['Invincible Dodge' is affected by 'Time Dilation', thus the speed is too slow to avoid the attack, try something else!]
In addition to that, Kokoro had upgraded that skill to level 10, thus allowing it to lock two skills instead of only one… and so he decided to block [Invincible Dodge], taking Stark completely aback as there was no way for him to avoid now.
~FWISH~
'Ah…' he smiled as he saw the energy ball, 'I guess… heh… doesn't matter…'
He turned his head slightly toward his clone, just to see what it was doing in his final movements as it had been his greatest companion yet.
And…
'Oh…' he saw it right next to him, jumping in his direction.
It didn't have that =) on its face anymore, instead its expression was completely serious, and it was following only one order: "Protect the original Stark, at all costs".
Clones don't have feelings, and the [Superior Clone] may seem more 'human' and sadistic, as well as able to think for itself, it was still following its ultimate rule: Stark needs to live.
And so… it pushed the original out of the way.
~SLAM~
It bumped into him with incredible force, sending him flying to the right and falling to the ground.
But of course… when it did that… the energy ball hit it.
~BOOM, FWISH, ZAP, SPLASH~
The explosion was deafening, a mixture of fire, wind, water, and earth elements colliding with incredible force against the clone, who received all of it and began to tremble, a powerful aura swirling around it as its body convulsed repeatedly.
It didn't have the smile on its face when it saved to Stark, but now that the original was save, then it went back to smiling, the pain was nothing to it.
And so just like that…
"-56732!" it received damage, and it would have more than enough to kill Stark if it actually hit.
'…' Stark sighed, 'There was no need… I can revive myself…' he shook his head, he couldn't understand why his clone did that.
But somehow… Stark did feel somewhat sad, almost as if he had lost a true companion.
He could summon it back after 1h30 since it was the time needed for all three clones to be restored, but… he didn't know why it was still… well… doesn't matter, he had survived.
[The "Superior Clone" has been killed!]
And as for Akira…
"…" he had already activated his [Full Moon Form], so Kokoro couldn't slow it down, meaning she decided to slow down [Moonlight Slash] and [Half-Moon Technique] instead.
And yet…
"Pathetic…" Akira raised his katana and cut the energy ball so easily it was actually quite scary, the ball exploding behind him and creating a cool effect.
"-17362!" he did receive some damage but the elements, but he didn't even look bothered.
"I… No… None of them thing…" Kokoro's eyes widened as she saw that both Stark and Akira avoided her ultimate attack, "T-This… wasn't… how this was supposed… to… g-go…"
And so just like that, her holograph body faded, as well as her tablet, and after a few seconds, [Virtual World] deactivated, meaning that the simulation-like surroundings disappeared, replaced by the normal golden hallway of the sublevel.
"At least that's done with…" Akira spoke, his figure was hidden by a wall of smoke created by the explosion of the energy ball, making Stark unable to see how his new form looked like.
But he wasn't interested to be honest, since he was too focused on something else…
[EGO Meter: 75/100]
The EGO meter was somehow growing each time he avoided an attack or hit one himself… it was definitely interesting.
In the end, he just closed this panel and focused on his final opponent.
He didn't understand how shit could become this crazy in such a short amount of time, but now that it happened there was no going back.
Only three participants alive: Akira, Stark and Sora.
Just how many would survive by the end… no one knows… but one thing was certain: at least one person between Stark and Akira will die by the end of their battle, and the latter was in his mythical form, and he had 4 more rewards that he could use.
Basically… Stark was in complete disadvantage as he had also lost his clone.
Just how would he get out of this situation…?

chapters.title: Chapter 202 - 202: The Final 1v1
chapters.content:
[1V1]
"…"
There was nothing between Stark and Akira now: Kokoro was dead, the [Superior Clone] was killed by the energy ball as well.
Now… it was just the two of them.
A TRUE 1v1, between the two strongest of the trial (or maybe Sora was stronger, nobody knows).
"Fucking hell…" Stark could hear Akira from beyond the smoke screen created by the explosion of the energy ball, but it didn't seem to disappear as the energy of the elements was still present even after Kokoro died.
[Stark Equipment (Rewards of trial): Monster Scent, Revive Token, Key Location Map, Killing Spree]
[Akira Equipment: Invincibility Token, Monster Scent, Key Location Map and the final reward he got from killing Kokoro was… the Healing Spring]
Each had three rewards they could use in battle, but would wasting them all before even meeting the [Warden] be beneficial…?
In the end, it didn't matter.
And after around a minute… the smoke dissipated.
"Full Moon Form…" Akira had activated this perk right as he was the first giant energy ball, thus allowing him to transform into his ultimate form, much like Leader with [Ultimate Fusion] and [Symphony of Snakes].
And so… Stark was finally allowed to see Akira's new form: the [Full Moon] form…
It was as if Akira's body had been infused with ethereal light, his white hair now shimmering with an otherworldly aura, his eyes glowed a piercing violet, and his attire had transformed as well.
The once-casual business suit now replaced by what could only be seen as a [Moon] armor: a sleek, polished white exterior adorned with intricate lunar symbols and patterns, shimmering silver accents that glinted in the light.
The armor was protecting everything except for his head, and it looked frankly beautiful, the lunar power emitting from it.
A small moon was spinning around Akira's waist, much slower yet faster, almost impossible to hit now.
[Full Moon HP: 100000/100000]
But in exchange its HP were reduced massively.
And as for his weapon… he was holding not one, but TWO katanas, each resembling the others as both of them were shivering with light, golden stars glowing in them.
Over all… it looked like a powerful form, and it was a masterpiece of lunar power.
"Sigh…" Akira frankly didn't like using this form as it actually was really difficult to use, and uncomfortable for him as he wasn't used to wearing the heavy armor and using two katanas, but he himself couldn't deny he was much more powerful with it.
[Akira HP: 10853/43700]
The accumulation of all the small damage, as well as the 17000 he got from the energy ball, resulted in Akira being at last quarter of life.
His stamina was also depleted, swinging his katana too much and using too many skills, while Stark just avoided everything and was still just as confident and ready to fight as before, meant that he was tired.
To be honest, his chances of victory were low now, even in his new form.
Stark had lost his clone, and he couldn't avoid everything forever, so if only… he had a way…
"…!" he turned his eyes toward the panel that announced his new reward… and there he saw it.
[Item: Healing Spring]
[Healing Spring: A special spring that will instantly heal all your injuries and recover your stamina, one time use.]
He summoned it in his hand, as it said in the name, it was just a green spring with some strange motifs on it.
[Elongate the spring and place it around your neck, in such a way that it circles it completely]
He did as the instructions said… and when the tail of the spring touched its head… it began to flow in a green aura, some + particles escaping from it.
The spring floated around his neck, and with a deep breath, it instantly activated.
An intense healing sensation surged through his body, repairing his injuries, and replenishing his stamina.
[Your HP has been filled, and all your stats have been reset! Take good care of this new opportunity to win]
And so right afterward, the [Healing Spring] disappeared, evaporating into the air as it did its job.
[Akira HP: 43700/43700]
"Feels better," his handsome face smiled at Stark, who could only smile back as he knew that this was bad.
Stark was a powerhouse, more than the others that's for sure, but he wasn't restless like his clone either: his stamina could deplet.
[+10 EGO!]
[EGO Meter: 85/100]
Strangely enough, the more his EGO grew, the angrier Stark was getting, and the more the aura in his eyes was growing, the vortex of darkness inside of them increasing in power.
Was this the… EGO?
"Time to end this," Akira put one of his katanas against the other and sliced, creating sparkles as both of the blades were extremely sharp, "By the power of the moon… thou shalt die!"
"Why is he speaking like that?" Stark raised his eyebrows as he saw Akira dash at him, closing the distance between them in a fraction of a second, both his katana positioned to slash the enemy.
"MOONLIGHT SLASH," his blades left a trail of aura as both closed in on Stark.
'He can try to dodge, but then I'll continue to slash endlessly,' Akira thought, a wide smile on his face.
And this was true: in his new form, it would be hard to deal damage to him, and keeping up with his new speed would be hard for even Stark to keep up.
His options were to waste [Heaven's Wrath], [Dodge Control] or [Double Assault], but doing so would mean putting himself at risk if he used his reward or somehow managed to counter them.
'EYE VISION!' he used up his new perk from [Focus], and the world slowed down, Akira's blades only a few centimeters away from where he was, 'Think…'
He opened up his skill panel and observed everything as fast as he could.
Akira was too strong in this new form…
'THINK…'
[+2 EGO]
'FUCKING THINK…'
[+3 EGO]
And that's when he saw it: the latest skill he got, and possibly his salvation.
"Here goes nothing…" he deactivated [Eye Vision] and immediately used [Invincible Dodge] once to avoid the blades, which sliced the spot he was in only a microsecond ago.
[Perfect Dodge!]
For the second time, the world turned gray, but now Stark was confident in what he was going to do.
And so he did it.
"WIELDING CROSS!"
[Description: Activating this skill allows the wielder to summon a giant crimson cross above them, which emits a powerful aura that is very uncomfortable to undead beings and demons, you can swing the cross three times.]
A massive scarlet cross, with strands of gold and holy energy surrounding it, materialized directly above Stark.
The cross was at least five times his size and emitted an aura that could make the undead extremely uncomfortable.
Of course, Akira wasn't an undead or demon, so he didn't feel anything, and so he just dashed toward Stark again, wanting to take him off guard after he finally used his 'dodge' skill.
"It's over!" Akira yelled confidently as he closed in on the boy for the second time, certain that he would hit his target.
However, Stark had a surprise in store for him…
"Goodbye," With a smile, he mimicked the motion of swinging a baseball bat and the giant cross above him followed suit, as if guided by invisible hands.
"…!" Akira couldn't avoid the attack as the cross was already right in front of his face.
And so…
~SLAM, BOOM~

chapters.title: Chapter 203 - 203: The Sublevel 1 Elites
chapters.content:
No… he couldn't deny it anymore…
Stark WAS a fantastic opponent, probably in his top 3 ever, an honor he didn't give easily.
It wasn't simply because of Kokoro's energy balls that he did that, but also since he knew victory wouldn't be possibly without giving it his all.
And now… both of them had to fight with everything they had, their destiny determined by the fight that is currently happening.
Akira lunged at Stark, but right afterward, a giant crimson cross appeared above him.
'Doesn't matter, that thing is probably buffing him…' Akira didn't stop, and his excitement grow more than ever before when he saw the blade on the verge of hitting Stark.
And yet… the cross reached it before he could attack.
'Huh?' he saw the crimson cross made out of right in front of him, one of the edges of straight line hitting him and sending him flying.
~SLAM, BOOM~
He hit a wall, then fell, his face showing some signs of visible pain.
"-4381!" and it actually did decent damage.
'Oh…?' Stark didn't expect this much, wasn't this cross made out from [Exorcist]? So wasn't it supposed to be mainly used against the undead and demons? And yet… it still did good damage, huh.
Maybe because [Domination] was mixxed in with it?
"Fucking hell…" Akira instantly got up, rubbing his forehead, he was protected by his armor, but his head wasn't, "QUIT TRYING SO HARD…"
~FWISH~
"MOONSLIGHT SLASH!" he yet again dashed toward Stark, this time faster and stronger.
And yet…
~FWISH~
The cross still ended up in front of him.
"NOT THIS TIME!" he tried to slash it using his two katanas.
But… it was useless as it fazed right through them.
"-4928!"
"STOP DOING THAT…" Akira gritted his teeth, and as he looked up… he saw the cross above him again.
~SLAM~
"SHADOW STEP," forced to use his skill, he instantly teleported away, leaving a dark trail of smoke behind as the cross hit the ground he was in before and vanish.
[3 swings done, wait five minutes for another hit]
Stark could definitely understand why each hit was five minutes of cooldown: each was extremely powerful.
"The cross is gone," Akira was still cautious as he observed around him, Stark through all his battles, and even against Soulayer, always found a way to play 'dirty' to win, and yet again he had proved himself by pulling out skill after skill to avoid or counter him, and this was probably why Leader had died: tricked by the boy he thought was weak.
Akira refused to fall for that, and so he perfectly considered Stark as a great opponent, if not the greatest he ever faced.
But now that all his tricks were out of the way…
"LUNAR STRIKE…" he powered up his blades like before, but as there were two, the power of the attack and explosion would be much, muchhhhh bigger.
And so…
~FWISH~
Right as Akira was about to jump in the air to finish this…
A panel appeared before him, Stark, and Sora, who was far inside the sublevel.
[Boooorinnngggg… this fight is taking ages, so… lets spice this up, shall we?]
[Releasing the 'Death' monsters…]
Akira stopped everything he was doing as he stared at the panels, the few words written on it bringing a confused look to his face.
What the hell were the 'Death' monsters? Were they the monsters of this sublevel? No one knew.
But just as they got ready to resume their fight.
"Kriiiii…" the sound of a sword sliding against the ground of the [Golden Palace].
Frankly, none of them had spent the time to observe the surroundings of this sublevel, but it was quite simplistic: just pure luxury everywhere, chandeliers hanging on the high ceiling, white marble walls and ground, adorned with golden paths that made it look really nice.
Paintings everywhere, each depicting a human with a strange power swirling around them, maybe were they other [Domination] users?
"Groaw…" they also heard weird beast-like noises coming from beyond the corner of the hallway.
Akira and Stark were stuck in a hallway with their only exits being the path to the left and to the right, meaning that they were closed off if an ambush happened.
And just as expected… it did.
Because after only twenty more seconds… the 'death' monsters appeared.
There were dozens upon dozens of them, blocking all exit paths from the hallway, and they all looked different from one another, dozens of types.
The most notable ones were a knight that carrying a sword, making it slide on the ground, creating sparkles.
[Crucible Knight (ELITE)]
Another was a orange beast with flames on its back, also carrying a fire sword and a golden necklace between its neck, it looked like a lion with fire mane, yet the skin of its body was grey and it was standing on its two feet.
[Misbegotten Lion (ELITE)]
And the third was a giant black shadow that seemed to be formed from the darkness itself, floating above the ground and emitting a chilling aura, its presence making the air feel colder, it didn't seem to have a body except for its crimson eyes staring at them.
[Nightmare Shadow (ELITE)]
Way too many elites were present, and the difficulty jump from the last sublevel to this one was out of this world.
One thing was absolutely certain: none them, neither Stark or Akira, would be able to defeat all these things while they were cornered.
Was this the true reason no one completes a [Death] difficulty trial?
The levels before that had been a cake walk, and although many people died, it still seemed doable.
And now… the trial shattered that hope, giving them impossible enemies to defeat, all the while being together in a group.
It was unfair… completely unfair…
And yet… neither Akira nor Stark did back down, both kept staring at one another.
The monsters were a threat, that is for sure, but in the face of it all… nothing was stronger than them in this hallway.
And to add to that fact… both pulled out the item that would save them from this situation: the [Monster Scent] they both owned.
It was a spray with a green liquid inside of it.
[Monster Scent: Upon usage, all monsters will ignore you as they recognize you as their own, even if you kill many of them, this lasts ten minutes, one time use]
[Spray it on yourself…]
And so they did as told, both spraying all the green liquid all over their bodies, making their scent seem friendly to all the monsters, and thus making ALL of them stop their assaults, unable to understand where the humans that were just there go.
[You are protected from 'monsters' by "Monster Scent" for 10 minutes, use them wisely!]
So basically… they had ten minutes to end this fight and get out of this situation, and hopefully find the key while they were at it.
This was not a lot of time, but it could still be doable.
"I hope you are ready, Chosen!" Akira shouted as he positioned himself, holding his two blades.
"That's my line," Stark smiled as he also placed his two crimson fists in front of his face.
[EGO Meter: 95/100]

chapters.title: Chapter 204 - 204: Monster Scent and Invincible Token
chapters.content:
[You are affected by 'Monster Scent', thus all monsters will consider you as their own for 10 minutes]
This was the case for both Akira and Stark, and now, both of them were surrounded by ELITE and STRONG monsters, making it impossible for them to escape if they don't end this fight quickly.
All monsters were staring at them, they considered them as monsters too, but it didn't mean they wouldn't enjoy some good ol' monster beef, right?
And so all monsters began to make noises, almost sounding like cheers.
'Never would have I thought the day would come where I would fight a human while monsters spectate it…' Stark let out an exhausted laugh, this situation was truly becoming weirder by the second.
"I believe we should end this quick, I didn't expect for the last sublevel to be so hard," Akira branded his katanas, crouching down slightly and crossing his blades in front of his face.
"…" Stark just smiled.
And so…
~FWISH~
Akira dashed at him again.
"LUNAR STRIKE!" his first one had been interrupted by the announcement, but this time he was confident in his victory.
"Crimson Ball Transmission," Meanwhile, Stark calmly summoned the ball in his hand and sent it toward the end of the hallway, right before the horde of monsters.
Akira jumped in the hair, his two katanas facing downward as he was ready to hit the ground with all his might, their tips almost on the verge of erupting with aura.
And so…
~SNAP~
~FWISH, BOOOOM~
He hit the ground and his attack erupted, creating a massive explosive that even made the monsters back down as they didn't want to get hit.
"-2172!" even while wearing armor, Akira still received damage as the explosion was much stronger.
But…
"I know I didn't hit you…" he sighed as he turned around, and saw Stark smiling, far from where he was, right in front of a minotaur with a golden hammer in its hands, "Didn't expect to hit you anyway…"
Akira was frankly tired of Stark, he was playing so defensively, not attacking unless he was confident he would hit.
"Crimson Spears!" he summoned his three spears above his head, then threw them in Akira's direction, who easily deflected them all using his blade, then closed the distance between them.
And at that very moment…
"Well…" he sighed, "I guess it was to be expected, but now that I've got you trapped…"
Was it because he was put against a wall? Was it because he knew nothing he did would work on Stark? Was it because he really didn't want to lose against him…
In the end… surrounded by monsters, in a place far from everything, where the two of them were fighting to the death… for the first time in his life… he was going to be a coward.
Well, not really a coward since he is allowed to do that, but a 'coward' in his own rules as he vowed to always fight against his opponent fairly, each victory bringing him intense satisfaction.
They were in a place not even known by anybody but them, and people outside were probably enjoying their daily lives, yet here they were… in this trial, in this hell…
No one would know about their existence, even if they did.
And Akira… would never allow that.
His expression darkened as he reached into a pocket in his armor that held all his items, and he pulled out… the [Invincibility Token].
[Invincibility Token: Will grant you invincibility for the next five minutes following the usage of this token, meaning that no participant or monster can do any damage to you, one time use]
He had earned it fair and square by killing, and he truly just wanted to use it against the warden at the start.
But now that he was forced to do it in front of another human… he would give it his all.
"Congratulations, Chosen," Akira laughed loudly, his handsome face contorted into a wide grin, "You truly pushed me to the edge, now you shall learn your mistake…"
The token was like a simple coin the size of a human palm, it was made out of gold, and there was a symbol carved on it: a scale.
[Hold the token in your palm and close your hand, thinking about using it…]
'…' Stark just kept looking at Akira.
And so… Akira did as he was told, the [Invincibility Token] vanishing into particles of gold, seeping into Akira's body.
And with this…
[You are now 'Invincible' for 5 minutes!]
"This was… my victory… FROM THE START," he grinned as he immediately dashed toward Stark.
"…" Stark perfectly knew what he had done, yet he wasn't bothered.
[+1 EGO]
Something inside of him was swirling, ready to come out at any moment, and he felt that the closer the EGO meter got to 100, the harder it would be to contain it.
"MOONLIGHT SLASH!"
"Aura Smash!" Stark summoned his three crimson fists and sent them toward Akira, each exploding in his face.
And yet…
~FWISH, DASH~
He emerged from beyond the crimson smoke of the explosion, unbothered.
"-0! -0! -0!"
In addition to that, a warning appeared in front of Stark.
[You cannot harm someone using the "Invincible Token", just run!]
Stark ignored it as he swiftly backed away, bumping into the body of the minotaur that was behind him.
And then…
~SLASH, SLASH~
Akira slashed twice in Stark's direction.
"Invincible Dodge!" he rolled away, but the minotaur behind wasn't as fortunate.
"-194821! -182710!" and so it fell down, dead.
And instead of being angry or attacking, the rest of the monsters continued cheering.
His [Moon Blades] tainted in monster blood, and his face full of malice, Akira turned around, his pupils not leaving Stark for even a second.
He had never been so confident in his entire life.
'Shit… I need to stop him as much as possible…' Stark thought as he backed away.
[+2 EGO]
It was all or nothing at this point, so might as well use up all of his skills as there was no reason to stop himself anymore: it nothing worked he would run away.
"HEAVEN'S WRATH," he drew a circle in his palm and pointed at the ceiling above Akira, who did notice the attack, but didn't bother to even move out of the way.
~SWISH, BOOOOOM~
The crimson beam erupted from above, hitting Akira straight on as he was in the radius.
And yet… after a few seconds… he emerged from the other side, unharmed and unaffected by Stark's strongest attack.
"Is that all?" Akira smiled, even his face now darkened by his white aura, covering his body completely, much like Stark when it covered his face.
"I always knew you were a coward anyway," Stark laughed, "Using an item to get out of a situation where you would lose, this was totally expected…"
Stark's plan was simply to run away now, the monsters wouldn't attack, and if five minutes was all he needed, then [Double Assault] would definitely help to put some distance even in Akira's [Full Moon Form].
[+1 EGO]
[EGO Meter: 99/100]
And right at that moment… another panel appeared before him.
[The time has come, let the demon out, your EGO shall defeat this fool even in his current state, do not run…]

chapters.title: Chapter 205 - 205: EGO, The Demon
chapters.content:
[The call of the void is erupting inside of you…]
Stark could feel it, he could definitely sense that something was swirling inside of him, ready to get out at any moment.
EGO didn't explain what its power and use was, but maybe it was that?
[EGO Meter 99/100]
'Well… I better start running then,' Stark sighed as he got ready to activate [Double Assault], he needed to avoid Akira for five minutes, until his [Invincibility Token] wore out, anyway.
The man was so confident in his abilities that he was slowly walking toward Stark, coming out of [Heaven's Wrath]'s beam like it was but a mere toy, and trying to corner Stark.
"DOMI-CHAIN RESTRAIN," he launched the crimson chain in Akira's direction, wanting to see if he could actually restrain him long enough to make a run for it.
Someone invincible couldn't receive damage, but what about status effects? He didn't get stunned by the crimson fists after all, but maybe it was pure bad luck?
~FWISH, CLANG~
Akira grimaced as the crimson chain wrapped around his armor.
"…!" Stark's eyes widened for a second there, because surprisingly… the chain was actually absorbing power from Akira.
And this meant one thing: someone couldn't receive damage… but status effects would still be received.
After a small moment of struggle where his smile did falter a bit, Akira broke free with a powerful jerk, destroying the chain.
[Do not run, face the wrath of the Moon]
He didn't know who was speaking to him, was it his own aura again? Or maybe EGO?
In the end, it didn't matter, as when Stark turned around and began to run away…
"Oh no you don't," Akira smiled as he activated another skill, "Cosmic Barrier… REVERSE!"
Usually, the [Cosmic Barrier] would just surround Akira himself, but once he upgraded his skill to level 10, something else could be done with it: instead of just him, he could surround an entire area with that cosmic barrier, meaning no one could enter or leave except if they broke it.
Of course, this would use an enormous amount of [Moon] power, but in this case, Akira didn't care much, all he needed was for Stark to be trapped with him as he couldn't deal damage to him.
~BUMP~
Stark tried to run away using his crimson aura and focusing it on his legs, but the moment the barrier activated, he was trapped like a mouse, bumping into the cosmic walls of the sphere-like barrier and falling to the ground while scratching his head.
"What the…?" he looked up, and saw a wall in a purplish color, small white stars all over it, and it truly is a beautiful sight if he didn't know what it actually meant, "Ah shit…"
"Don't run away, please," Akira laughed.
And to finally finish the job… he decided to make sure that Stark wouldn't be able to survive this, no matter what.
And so…
"MOON DOMAIN!" he activated the very same power he had used against him, Kokoro and Sora when the [Target Wheel] was spinning to stop them from running.
And coincidentally… the radius of the domain was the exact same one as the barrier he had set, meaning that Stark was trapped, in a space where Akira could hit him from wherever he wanted.
Their arena was massively reduced now, only 30 meters in circumference.
~SLASH~
Akira didn't even waste time, slashing both his katanas at once in a random direction, yet the two slashes reaching Stark as if he had been in front of them.
"Invincible Dodge," Stark rolled forward, wanting to get close to Akira as much as possible.
But of course, he wouldn't let him rest.
~SLASH, SLASH, SLASH, SLASH~
What followed was just a one-sided beat down.
"Invincible Dodge… Combo x10," after wasting his 10 dodges, he was forced to continue avoiding using his own speed.
But this was harder than expected.
~SLASH~
"-3837!"
"Fuck…" he did crouch, but the second slash hit one of his shoulders, blood pouring out of it as the blades were extremely sharp.
"Why keep going?" Akira mocked, "You know it's useless, just forget about everything and die!"
~SLASH, SLASH, SLASH~
"…"
"YOU ARE GOING LIKE ALL OF THEM!"
~SLASH, SLASH, SLASH~
"ITS…" Akira laughed as hard as he could, enjoying torturing Stark, "OVER!"
"MOONLIGHT SLASH… ALL-TIME SLASH," he revealed another one of his card, focusing his entire energy in his blade and then suddenly slashing like crazy in every direction, not even aiming specifically for anything.
His attacks were so fast that even Stark couldn't see them with his naked eyes, Akira truly was going too fast.
And after he finished…
~SNAP~
Akira snapped his fingers.
"Adios," he turned his back to Stark at the moment and began to walk away.
He had slashed inside the domain around a hundred times, and the moment he snapped his fingers… all those strikes came back toward Stark, reaching him from every direction: above, below, right, left, anywhere he looked, one slash was coming from that direction.
He was cornered, and he had used [Invincible Dodge] already.
At that moment, the vortex inside of Stark's eyes grew so powerful that his eyes began to actively hurt.
And yet…
[+1 EGO]
[EGO Meter: 100/100]
[Release the demon of hate, and the wrath of the moon shall be nothing to us]
Stark's body suddenly emitted a terrifying aura, as if every particle of his body was screaming for retribution. His eyes glowed a deep crimson, reflecting the same shade as the demon he had unleashed.
Above him appeared a figure, it had horns, a crimson body, and white eyes that looked down at him, as well as a giant tail.
Only its upper body was visible, but anyone who saw it would know that this was the real deal.
"EYE VISION," Stark used up his skill to spare some time, the demon above him had instantly appeared.
[EGO has been unleashed, pray to the poor souls who are going to face it]
The demon crossed its crimson arms, sharp fangs visible.
And so right at that moment, where Stark thought everything over.
"AAAAAAAAAAAGHHHHHHHH," before he even realized him, he was screaming.
A scream so loud that Akira turned back and widened his eyes as he saw the demon above, a scream so loud even Sora could hear it from her position.
A scream so loud… it echoed in the entire prison.
~BOOM~
An explosion occurred around Stark, and all the slashes Akira had sent were negated by EGO.
And what was EGO, you might ask? Well… Stark was finally able to read the panel, his body aching all over as the power residing him was too much for even him to handle.
…
[Skill: EGO]
[Rank: Mythical]
[Description: A power dormant within the host, the EGO meter will keep rising every time they feel a strong emotion during battle, and once it reaches 100, the EGO demon (made out of the host's aura and completely listens to his orders) will be released, ready to annihilate any and everything]
[Note: this also gives a boost in stats to the host as EGO powers him up]
[Other Note: EGO mode has a one-week cooldown]
…
And the second thing that appeared… was the perk of the [EGO] skill, after all he had indeed spent five skill points on it.
…
[Skill: EGO]
[New Perk: Negate Explosion]
[Description: By using the user's will, he can make his own body errupt and thus negate any ability surrounding him in a close radius]
[Note: You can use this thrice in EGO mode]
…
Unlocking that new perk had saved his life, but it didn't matter.
Because now…
"It's time to finally make this battle fair, even if you're invincible," Stark took a step toward Akira, who had lost his smile, the demon above Stark actually making him sweat.
This was EGO.

chapters.title: Chapter 206 - 206: Moon Fatality
chapters.content:
Was this because of the new powers he felt this way? Or maybe was it just that when he saw Akira's terrified face, he instantly realized that he wasn't much without his [Invincibility Token] to begin with.
"WHAT THE FUCK IS THAT THING?" Akira backed away, hitting the barrier he himself created, "You're from the domination class too… so what is that… I… FUCK!" he instantly crossed his katanas and got ready for another assault, "SCREW THIS, I'M INVINCIBLE!"
The demon above Stark was looking at Akira with squinted eyes, its expression saying "weak and pathetic".
Even for a [Domination] user, that aura was terrifying.
"Try me…" Stark slowly said as he got ready in position, and the demon above mimicked the exact movement Stark did: he was copying all his moves since the [EGO] demon was just made out of Stark's aura, much like a clone but scarier.
~DASH, DASH, FWISH~
Akira jumped in the air, his speed much faster than ever before, then he pointed his blades down, ready to create an explosion that would make this entire hallway collapse on itself.
And yet… the moment he was about to reach Stark's head, the boy just looked at him with a neutral expression and shook his head.
"Idiot…" Stark focused his aura into his entire body, and much like the first time he did… Stark's very own body erupted, sending out an explosion of aura around.
~FWISH~
Akira hit the ground right in front of the boy, and yet… no explosion happened?
["Lunar Strike" has been negated by EGO] was what appeared in front of Akira, who was speechless.
"Hit him," he pointed at Akira, and the demon above raised one of its sturdy arms, slamming it onto Akira's body, who was sent flying and hit the wall of the barrier.
"-0!"
"WHY. WON'T. YOU. GIVE. UP. FUCKING DAMN IT!" for a man that was in his mid-twenties and wearing a suit, he sure did scream like a child.
Maybe the frustration really got to him.
"You know…" Stark spoke, finally smiling, "You should have listened to Kokoro when she asked for peace."
"Hah? You think we would just go back to acting like nothing happened?" Akira got up and got ready to attack again, this time aiming for the demon above.
But Stark shook his head, "No, the moment you attacked me instead of working together, both of your deaths were already written."
"THEN STOP TALKING!" and so he dashed for the hundredth time at Stark.
"Phase Shift!" instead of holding his katanas' handles normally and running, he switched to the second mode and instead made his two blades scratch against the ground, creating sparkles as they were extremely sharp.
"MOONLIGHT SLASH… AIR SLASHES!" just like Stark, most of his upgrades skills had at least two if not three perks, so he just used one of them.
He slashed the air in the demon's direction, sending crescent white cuts at it from afar.
~SLASH, SLASH~
The demon was hit in its arm and chest, yet it didn't even look bothered.
"-42261! -39598!"
[EGO Demon HP: 18141/100000]
'Oh?' even Stark was surprised.
So that thing could truly be killed.
It did make sense after all, and it also seemed to not have a good defense, as it suffered greatly from just these basic attacks.
'Need to be careful,' Much like with Akira's [Moon] that was spinning around him, letting his EGO demon die meant that he wouldn't be able to use the power anymore.
[2:28 minutes of 'Invincibility' left], so much happened, yet only half the time had passed.
"HAHA, SO I CAN KILL IT AND YOU, YET YOU CAN'T YOU KILL ME!" Akira regained his confidence, "I'M FUCKING INVINCIBLE RIGHT NOW!"
~FWISH, SLASH~
He jumped diagonally toward the demon, arriving in front of it in less than a second, then slashing in its direction.
But… the moment his blade was going to hit, the demon suddenly disappeared.
"…?" Akira fell to the ground and looked to his left.
The demon was still there, right above Stark.
Akira decided to take his chance and tried again, yet nothing, and even after four more attempts, the demon would just disappear right as he was about to hit it, and Stark would also move.
The reason for that was simple: Stark was using [Invincible Dodge].
When he rolled away, his demon would receive [Invincibility] frames as well, thus making it completely disappear to enemies, and reappear right after in Stark's new position.
Stark crossed his arms together, and the demon did as well, looking down on Akira, who was still slightly cautious of that thing.
"MOONLIGHT SLASH… MOON FATALITY!"
'Is this guy using all the perks of his skill?' he had actually used all three of them.
[Moon Fatality] was basically the 3rd perk he got from upgrading it to level 15, and so it was his final resort.
He began to fly in the air, his two katanas also beginning to float beside him.
A giant moon came out of his body as well, stopping right above him, much like Stark's EGO demon.
He stretched his arms on both sides, both katanas on each end, spinning on themselves.
And after a few seconds…
~FWISH~
He grabbed both of his blades, then actually put them inside of the moon that was above him, inserting the katanas inside of it.
~FWISH, FWISH~
They were absorbing powers, and then he immediately pulled them out.
And for the finisher… he used the very same moon giant moon as a platform to launch himself toward Stark and his clone.
'Alright, it's the final showdown, no need to hold back anymore,' Stark nodded.
"DOUBLE ASSAULT, DODGE CONTROL!" he activated both legendary skills and got ready for what's coming.
~BOOOOOOM~
Like some sort of meteor, Akira dashed with aura surrounding him completely, and landing in the spots where Stark was, creating a massive explosion of moon energy.
Yet… Stark was nowhere to be seen.
"…?" Akira was confused, he was sure that the boy would never be able to avoid this attack.
And yet… Stark was in the opposite direction of where Akira was, almost as if he had teleported.
"AURA SMASH… MERGE!" he didn't waste time and actively began to summon his powers.
"Oh well, seems like you got one more trick up your sleeve, but it doesn't matter," Akira slowly began to approach Stark, "I can use [Moon Fatality] three times after all…" he smiled as widely as possible.
The combination of [EGO] and [Double Assault] made the attack unbearable even for Stark, who was forced to hold his own wrist as to not make it explode in his face.
Surprisingly, even the demon above was mimicking the creation of the attack, actual aura being poured in its own hand as it held its wrist as well.
Basically… this [Aura Smash] would be massively enhanced by EGO, who would be the one sending the attack.
"I don't know why you keep going, but it's fine to me," Akira kept approaching, confident he would finally win.
And yet… after less than five seconds… Stark was already ready, his entire body burning by the intensity of the attack, and even the demon's expression darkened.
And so just like that…
"AURA SMASH… MERGE!" he punched the air in Akira's direction, and the [EGO] demon above sent a crimson fist so large it was five times Akira's size in the man's direction.
This would be the final attack of this battle, the attack that would decide the victor.
No more bullshit or twists from now on.
It's now or never.

chapters.title: Chapter 207 - 207: Defeat of the Moon Warrior, Akira
chapters.content:
"AURA SMASH... MERGE," Stark sent the giant fist in Akira's direction, who was slowly walking toward him, preparing to use his second [Moon Fatality] to end this battle once and for all.
Akira had truly tried his hardest since the beginning, as he had seen many people lose fights because of their overconfidence, yet Stark somehow always managed to avoid his attacks or counter them against him.
And yet… he was actually breaking his own values by being this smug, maybe it was the [Invincible Token] that made him act so unusually?
EGO mimicked Stark's movements and launched a crimson fist as well: it was the main attack, as the demon was the one that would enhance it and also be the one to cast it, meaning that the [Aura Smash] that would appear before Akira would be the strongest one Stark ever launched.
~FWISH~
The fist, at least five times Akira's size, rushed at him, leaving a massive trail of powerful aura behind.
"Futile," Akira laughed, "Why keep attacking when I cannot receive damage, do you truly not comprehend what it means to be INVINCIBLE?" Akira didn't budge even in the face of that thing.
But he couldn't deny the fist was powerful, so he instinctively positioned his two katanas to cut it and thus prove to Stark that he truly was the ultimate participant of this trial, even in his first, he had killed everyone with absolutely no mercy in his eyes, and it wouldn't change, even during the third or fourth trial…
~FWISH... SLASH, SLASH!~
He even went as far as using a second [Moon Fatality] on the attack, using the entire power of the moon he absorbed in his blades to cut the fist of crimson aura.
And his katanas did in fact manage to cut through the aura of [Aura Smash].
"DO YOU NOT REALIZE?" he repeated as his weapons were slicing the fist in three.
"No... YOU do not realize," Stark smiled.
And suddenly...
~BOOOOOMMMM~
Even though he did in fact cut it, the fist still reached him and exploded in his face, its aura and power way too strong for even the [Full Moon Form] Akira.
~FWISH~
"-0"
Akira was sent flying yet again, bumping extremely hard against the walls of the [Cosmic Barrier] he himself had formed, then falling to the ground.
He didn't receive any damage at all, and not a single drop of blood appeared on any of his body parts, since he hadn't been "physically" affected by the attack.
"Do you not realize-" he tried to get up.
Or at least… that is what he believed.
Since…
"Huh?" Akira's vision was drowsy, he couldn't see well, he was tired, and in addition to that, his body still hurt somehow.
His legs weren't listening to him, even though he screamed for them to get up.
"What the..." he placed his two palms against the ground and breathed in and out loudly, drops of sweat dropping on the ground under him, "Why... am I... what...?"
No matter how much he tried, his body wouldn't answer.
[You have been stunned!]
In addition to his body actually hurting from the crimson fist and his stamina depleting, he had been stunned, meaning that he was stuck there.
"Do you not realize?" Stark repeated his exact same words, "You were never truly invincible..."
Akira took the word "invincible" way too seriously, thinking that NOTHING would affect him.
But what about his stamina, or if his body hurts?
Even if he doesn't receive damage, these things still affect him, and it was until too late he realized he had pushed himself too hard.
But the biggest mistake he had made of all... was to forget about status effects.
Stark noticed it thanks to [Domi-Chain], but Akira could actually get affected by things other than damage, and so that is why he fed his confidence by sending all these attacks at him: fists, spears, and even used [Heaven's Wrath] to make him think even the strongest of attacks would do nothing.
And when his confidence was at its peak... he would pull out [Aura Smash] and stun him.
"WHAT THE FUCK..." Akira tried as hard as he could to move, but even his [Moon] power couldn't be used.
"Well... it seems like you lost," Stark arrived in front of Akira, who could only look up as he saw Stark and the EGO demon looking down on him.
"I lost?" Akira was enraged, "NICE JOKE, I'M STILL INVINCIBLE DUMBASS, YOU CAN'T HURT ME!"
Stark looked at Akira's rage with the blankest of expressions, his face covered by his crimson aura and letting only his judgmental white eyes visible to the man below.
Suddenly, the boy intertwined his two hands together and raised them right behind his head.
The demon repeated the action: it looked like he wanted to smash Akira using EGO.
~FWISH, FWISH~
He powered up the attack for a few seconds as Akira kept insulting him and telling him that he would soon be free and kill him.
And then...
"I win..." Stark's eyes lit up as he swung down with his joined hands in a powerful smash attack.
And just as expected... the EGO demon repeated what he did.
"YOU THINK I'M SCARED? YOU CAN'T HURT ME!" Akira shouted as loud as possible, trying to hide his shaky voice as much as possible: even though he was confident he wouldn't be hurt, that thing's attack was still terrifying.
~FWISH~
The demon's sturdy hands smashed Akira's body while he was lying on the ground, creating a small crater because of the sheer power.
"You... what... I... can't lose...-" and so Akira fell unconscious, the pain in his body so strong this time that he almost believed that [Invincible Token] had deactivated, otherwise why would it be this painful?
"-0!" yet the damage output proved otherwise: it wasn't that the invincible token wasn't working, but that his own body was still feeling the pain regardless, the adrenaline slowing down after being stunned.
"You can't receive damage, that is true," Stark smiled, "But don't forget that I can also knock you out, IT'S MY VICTORY!"
[Akira has been knocked out!]
Immediately, his aura disappeared and the [Cosmic Barrier] vanished, revealing that the monsters had gotten closer to inspect it.
And the moment they saw Akira's body lying down...
"GRAOOWLL!"
"HIKHIKHIK!"
They all cheered.
'What the?' Stark was actively confused, but he just shrugged, 'Well, it doesn't matter...'
He had around 6 minutes of [Monster Scent] left, and more monsters had appeared as they fought, meaning that it would be difficult for him to escape even like this when monsters were everywhere.
And so... he left Akira's unconscious body in the middle of the monster-filled hallway.
He truly wanted to kill him, but another two minutes waiting for the [Invincibility Token] to wear off were just too much for him.
And to add to that...
[The door to floor 0 has been opened, head toward the exit!]
It seemed like Sora actually managed to kill the monsters and find the key by herself.
'I don't have anything else to do here,' he mumbled as he opened his map and began to run through the horde of monsters.
They didn't try to attack as they saw him as their own, but he still didn't want to touch them or stay around for too long.
"Goodbye, Akira," Stark looked back one last time to see the white-haired man's body, "You were truly strong."
And so he ran off, leaving him and the monsters behind.

chapters.title: Chapter 208 - 208: Monster Torture Execution
chapters.content:
(5 minutes after Stark left)
"HIKHIKHIK" a dark bird was happily flapping its wings.
"Houhpuh!" and a giant red monkey was jumping left and right while clapping its two hands above its head.
All the monsters seemed to be really happy they had witnessed such a battle, and also the winner of them.
By now, Akira's [Invincible Token] had already worn out, meaning he was vulnerable to monster attacks, yet thankfully enough for him [Monster Scent] was still active.
[19 seconds left for 'Monster Scent']
"...Argh," and at that very moment... Akira actually woke up.
He opened his eyes, still drowsy from all the attacks, and his head felt like it splitting in two, as well as all the aching in his body.
[14 seconds left for 'Monster Scent']
He slowly sat on the ground, his surroundings blurry as he was still adjusting.
[11 seconds left…]
Suddenly, he remembered everything that happened, the memories of the fight, of him being stunned, then smashed by the giant demon's hand came back to him.
'Fuck…' he held his face with his hand.
He had lost, for the first time ever, Akira had actually lost.
But… wasn't he alive right now.
"I lived…" his eyes widened, "Fucking hell I actually lived," he almost wanted to cry of joy, believing Stark would wait for him to lose his invincibility to easily kill him.
[5 seconds…]
After laughing for a bit, he tried to get up, but miserably failed.
"Ouch… my legs…" he couldn't move his legs, and they weren't broken, it was just that his stamina and body were aching, meaning he would need to wait for a bit before being able to continue.
[2 seconds…]
"Well, he isn't here anymore, so it's fine," he finally decided to look around.
[1 seconds…]
"…!" fear immediately took over his entire being as he saw the dozens of monsters dancing and cheering all around him.
And right at that moment… a panel appeared in front of his face.
[The effects of 'Monster Scent' have worn off]
Immediately… all the cheering and dancing stopped.
Finally able to detect their prey, the monsters all turned their eyes toward Akira, who had sweat dripping all over his face.
"W-wait, w-we were friends just a while ago, y-you were cheering!" he tried to talk to the monsters, who began to approach him, their expressions darkening as they finally sensed the human.
Some of them were confused as to how they couldn't sense him, but others didn't waste time and immediately pulled out their weapons or whatever they used to fight.
"HAKHAKHAK~" the dark bird flew above Akira, its beak ready to pierce.
"OUHPUHOU~" and the red monkey was violently hitting its own chest, making soundwaves with it that shook the hallway.
It was truly… unwinnable.
"I'm… fucked…" Akira looked down, no matter how much he tried to move, his body wouldn't answer.
And so soon enough…
"HIIGIHIK~" a giant skeleton with a hammer in its hand hit Akira's side, sending him flying toward another monster who looked like a lizard, hitting him with its tail.
"-23726! -17371!" just like that, he was already down to his final bit of HP.
"I… fucking… hate… this… why… do… I HAVE TO ENDURE THIS…" Akira shouted as hard as he could, begging for anything, ANY miracle to happen and save him.
Yet… in this trial… nothing could save you.
~SLASH, SLAM, GRIM, BOOM~
Dozens of monsters surrounded him and began to hit him with all sorts of weapons.
"Why… me…" he extended his arm upward toward the light of a golden chandelier above him, but quickly… he fell.
[Akira: 0/43700]
He died at the first hit, yet the monsters continued, reducing his body to nothing but a pile of flesh, and even then they kept eating him or burning him.
And just like that… Akira was completely erased out of existence.
***
(Back to Stark)
'Hah~ hah~' he was still running, following his map while avoiding the monsters that were all over the sublevel, although much less in numbers than when he was fighting Akira.
And suddenly, the moment he turned around the corner right before the exit…
[A participant has been slain by another player!]
[You have slain "Akira, the Moon Warrior lv64", gaining 3,921,449 EXP!]
[Your level has increased to level 56, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 57, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 58, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Experience: 113711/1970000]
It seemed like knocking down Akira and doing most of the damage/work actually registered it as though he was the one who made the kill, even though it was the monsters that did the final blow.
Maybe it was to make it fair, since it would stop others from stealing other people's kills?
But then, why didn't he receive experience or the reward for killing Kokoro? Of course, he didn't deal the final blow, but he did lots of damage to her too, right? Yet only Akira was rewarded…
All of this was weird, but Stark decided to give up thinking about it as his [Monster Scent] had also worn out, meaning that he was being chased by a horde of ELITE monsters right now.
'Got it!' he saw the exit door, and it was made out of the blue platinum, already opened as Sora had already done so.
Without wasting a single second, he dashed at it and entered the hallway that led to the spiral of stairs.
The platinum closing right as he left the sublevel since he was the last one, and the sounds of the door banging now hearable from his position.
That sound was terrifying, and he could hear the screams of dozens upon dozens of monsters who had let go of a prey.
After a few moments, all the noise stopped, almost as if all the monsters had been erased the moment the humans left the sublevel.
"…" Stark shrugged as he turned back and began to climb the spiral of dark stairs.
This was the end, the true end.
10 participants at the start, now only 2 remained, and who says he wouldn't have to fight Sora to the death as well?
For now… he just needed to focus on the warden.
[You have a reward waiting to be revealed!]
[Would you like to spin the wheel?]
[Y/N]
Stark didn't stop climbing as he clicked on Y.
The crimson wheel with the tail appeared in front of him.
[Pull me!]
He did as it asked him, and it began spinning extremely fast.
But surprisingly… as the wheel gradually stopped…
[Talent: Chosen One, activated!]
"…" Stark was actually feeling quite exhausted from his fight with Akira, blood pouring out from a side of his stomach and his right shoulder as he had been hit Akira's blades there.
He wouldn't be able to keep going for long if things kept going like this.
And so… by a twist of luck and fate… no… it was definitely the world itself that granted him this luck.
He received…
[Item: Healing Spring!]
[Healing Spring: A special spring that will instantly heal all your injuries and recover your stamina, one time use.]
The perfect item he needed in this situation.
[Chosen One] had actually been nice to him this time.
He did notice something though: every time [Chosen One] fucked him over one way or another, in this example it would be selecting him as the target by twisting reality itself even though it was Sora that was selected, then there would ALWAYS be a reward for his efforts, as [Chosen One] would activate yet again to bring something positive.
A bad for a good? Was this what this skill was all about?
In the end it didn't matter, and so Stark finished climbing up the stairs to floor 0, the final level of the Lucullus Prison.

chapters.title: Chapter 209 - 209: Reaching Floor 0
chapters.content:
Sora, as expected, had been the one to open the platinum door of the first sublevel, thus allowing Stark to access the spiral stairs.
She hadn't opened the door to floor 0 though as she was waiting for Stark, yes, she was confident Stark would win, no matter if it's a 2v1, or they had overpowered skills/rewards.
[A participant has been slain by another player]
[A participant has been slain by another player]
It seemed like only one among the three remained.
Who knows? Maybe Stark actually died and the one of the remaining persons betrayed the other?
"..."
~STEP, STEP, STEP~
Suddenly, she heard footsteps from below.
And after a few minutes...
~STEP... STEP... STEP!~
She usually had a neutral expression to everything around her, and even her friends and family considered her to be emotionless by standards since she NEVER showed any kind of expressions on her beautiful face.
And yet... she actually let out a small smile, barely visible compared to her normal face, but it was still there.
"Hey," she greeted him, her voice still emotionless though.
"Yo," while walking toward her, Stark put the [Healing Spring] around his neck and activated it, giving him back his full health and stamina.
"..." She got up as she has been sitting against the dark walls of the hallway leading to yet another platinum door.
"I guess that's floor 0..." Stark mumbled.
"I was just waiting for someone as I didn't want to fight the warden alone," she shrugged calmly.
"Makes sense," Stark nodded, "But you're awfully chatty all of a sudden, what happened?" she had not said even a word in front of the others, yet here she was speaking like it was a common occurrence.
"Didn't want to waste my saliva on pointless matters, but now that everybody is gone and it's just the two of us, we might as well try our best," she headed toward the door to finally open it, "I hope you're ready," right as she was about to reach her arm for her palm to touch it, she turned around and looked at Stark.
"Always ready," Stark shrugged, "We might as well get this over with."
"..." she just nodded as she put her palm against the platinum door, and after glowing for a few seconds it opened.
~CRANG~
Slowly but surely, the door opened, and once it was fully opened...
Beyond it was nothing but darkness.
Like, actually, it was pitch-black.
[Sora was the first one to touch the door to level 0]
[Unfortunately, no rewards can be given from now on]
Seems like the final floor wouldn't give rewards anymore, and Stark and Sora wouldn't attack one another when the warden was there.
Which means... that there would be no more rewards.
[Stark Rewards: Killing Spree, Revive Token and Key Location Map]
This was the hand he had been dealt, and he would need to make use of it.
"Come on, stop looking at your items," Sora pointed her head at the darkness beyond the platinum door, "We need to go."
"..." Stark just sighed and followed after her.
They entered the dark space... and the moment Stark traversed the threshold, the platinum door closed and disappeared.
"..."
"..."
Sora and Stark could still see one another somehow, and so they just continued walking.
And after less than a minute...
~FWISH, CLANG~
They heard the sound of machinery, and a massive triangular-shaped vault-like door appeared before them.
It was so big and wide it could allow thousands of people to pass at once.
All over it with were cogwheels, advanced screens, technological pieces of equipment and much more, each turning or flickering with energy.
This was...
[The entrance (or exit in your case) of the Lucullus Prison]
The massive metal door that was emitting lots of gray smoke appeared before Stark and Sora, yet the darkness around was still present, meaning it was all they could see.
They both approached the door, touching everything they could from the bottom, but nothing would happen: no keyhole, no way to push it with strength, basically, nothing to open it.
[The door will only open once the 'Warden' is killed]
"Sure, but where the fuck is the warden," Stark sighed as he looked at Sora, who was scratching her chin while thinking.
"..."
"I don't know, but keep looking for him," a voice answered from behind, sounding quite different.
"...?"
"Huh," Stark turned his head toward Sora again, who raised her eyebrows, "Since when did your voice sound so manly Sora...?"
"I thought you were the one who spoke, though?" she tilted her head, still as emotionless as ever.
And once the two of them looked at one another, they realized something: neither of them talked.
"Surprised?" the manly voice came from behind them, and once they looked back...
They finally saw IT.
[Warden, The Prisoner Killer]
It was peeking its head from beyond the darkness, completely covered in a dark blue armor with an oval hole in the middle that let them see how it looked like: it had blue skin, sharp teeth and pitch black eyes.
Its body was covered in that same cool-looking and sturdy armor, and it also had two sculk horns on both sides of its head.
Its arms' and legs' edges also had some sort of 'skull' protection on them made out of human bones.
But the most important part of it all... was the black hole in the warden's chest, and there seemed to be blue glowing spheres visible in the middle of its torso, right at the spot where the void was.
There were three spheres, each around the same size, and around them were some sharp bones (ribs) that came out directly from the armor, shielding them yet still allowing Stark and Sora to see them because of the powerful light they emitted.
That was all for the general appearance of the Warden, who looked extremely powerful.
But before Stark could even look at its weapons.
"Goodbye, prisoners," the warden lifted its [Sculk Hammer] and swung it sideways in the direction of Stark and Sora.
"FLOWER BARRIER!" Sora calmly lifted one of her arms, and vines came out of the ground, three white flowers appearing instantly like shields and blocking the blow.
And right after that... the warden disappeared into the darkness again.
It almost felt like it was using [Soulayer's] skill, except instead of mist it was just pure darkness.
"You should watch out," Sora spoke to Stark as she looked around, analyzing her surroundings.
"Yeah yeah, it can be anywhere," Stark sighed as he activated his aura and got ready to finally fight the final boss of this trial.
But unbeknownst to him...
"Prisoner..." it was already behind him, its hammer lifted higher than its head, and its pitch black eyes emitting a powerful aura, stronger than anything he had ever seen before.
[FIGHT!]
And so… the warden swung down its hammer at Stark, who didn't even realize where it was yet since it could freely navigate in the darkness without being noticed.
Since the moment they left the safety of the hallway with the stairs and passed through the platinum door into the darkness… they were already in its territory.
Stark and Sora vs the Warden, the final boss of the trial.

chapters.title: Chapter 210 - 210: Reveal of the Final Boss
chapters.content:
"I… see… you… prisoner," Although the warden's voice sounded quite manly, it was still apparent that it was broken and also extremely raspy.
The warden lifted its hammer while appearing behind Stark, ready to smash the prisoner's head.
"Prisoner… go back to your cell…"
~SWING~
"…" Stark didn't look back, he already knew that the warden was behind him, and his pupils were at the far edge of his edges, taking everything.
[FIGHT!]
~SLAM~
[The 'Purgatory Shadow' took the hit in your place]
A shadow of himself appeared and got its head smashed in instead of his.
But… Stark wouldn't let that slide.
With a swift movement, he slid while turning around and jumping in the air, spinning repeatedly.
And then…
~SLAM~
He kicked the warden's head with his leg, who had powered up from the spins and aura, sending the monster back by a few meters, although it didn't fall, it just slid on the cold floor as it held its ground pretty well.
"-48372!" the damage was decent, but not enough to actually harm the warden.
Although…
"Cough…" some drops of black blood did come out of its mouth.
And the moment Stark managed to hit the warden…
~FWISH, FWISH~
All the darkness that had surrounded them suddenly disappeared.
[You have hit 'Warden', thus the effects of "Warden's Darkness" have been cancelled]
Seems like it had been using a skill to plunge this entire place in darkness, but hitting it only once would deactivate that skill.
And now… they could observe the surroundings of floor 0:
It was a massive, ancient chamber filled with towering pillars, intricate carvings, and glowing runes on the walls. The ceiling was adorned with swirling patterns of light and dark, and the mysterious hum of energy permeated the air.
The sound of machinery could be heard from anywhere, and obviously, the giant metal door that was the exit of the prison was still there.
Floor 0 was basically a giant arena, and it was completely closed off as there was no way to leave now, going back to a floor below this one impossible as the door had disappeared.
"Ten of you at the start," Warden held its hammer in its own hands, making it glow with aura, "Now only two remain…"
He hadn't observed it well, but his hammer was just a giant and normal one, except for the fact it was ENTIRELY covered in sculk, which was some sort of liquid with white points that were slowly flickering repeatedly.
