And the last observation… was that Warden had some sort of chain around its neck, some sort of gem that was also covered in sculk: it was the [Sculk Necklace], something that gave it power and allowed it to use many of its skills.
Sora immediately rushed right next to Stark to assist, positioning herself while summoning her flowers around her, a vine with flowers of different types surrounding her completely.
'Domination is so weird…' Stark thought as he looked at her.
He had been given fists as powers, but in comparison to others… it was pretty lame.
Officer got guns, Leader got summons, Akira got the moon, Yuri got stars, Kokoro even go a fucking tablet that can summon holograms, and now Sora has the power of the [Flowers]?!
This meant that [Domination]'s weapons could be pretty much anything, but oh well, it didn't matter for now.
~THUMP, THUMP~
Warden slammed its two legs on the ground like a sumo fighter, its entire body glowing with 'sculk' aura.
"Perception!" and Stark decided to check that thing's window before continuing the battle.
…
[Name: Warden, The Prisoner Killer]
[Level: 125]
[HP: 591628/640000]
[Strength: 8372]
[Stamina: 3291]
[Speed: 5094]
[Defense: 7268]
[Skills: Warden's Darkness, Sculk Infusion, Hammer Slam, Sculk Surge, Ultrasound Aura, Prisoner Chain, Horns Detection, Sculk Handcuffs, Flickering Movements, The Dark Spheres, Warden Smash, Armor Sculkification, The End of the Line, The Lucullus Prison…]
…
Other than the fact it had 14 skills, its stats were also extremely high, its strength almost reaching the five digits, and its defense also being really high.
Its speed was extremely decent, although slower than Stark and Sora, while its stamina low, meaning that it would prioritize powerful attacks rather than keeping the fight going.
And as for the HP… 640000 was a lot.
"He has-" Stark immediately tried to talk to explain the warden's skills, stats and HP to Sora.
But…
"No need, the flowers have already informed me," it seemed like she could also check it out thanks to a skill called [Flower Analysis].
"Huh, then doesn't that mean you also checked me out?" Stark tilted his head, one of the flowers from [Flower Analysis] was indeed pointed at him, emitting some sort of signal.
"I won't deny that, you can check out my status as well, we need to know one another better to fight after all," Sora shrugged.
And so Stark just did what he felt like doing.
…
[Name: Sora]
[Level: 62]
[Class: Domination]
[HP: 83000]
[Strength: 2728]
[Stamina: 7201]
[Speed: 6472]
[Defense: 5983]
[Skills: Domination, Flower Analysis, Radiance, Elements of Nature, Vine Surge, Pollen Bombs, The Flaming Rose, Regenerative Drop, Nature Distortion, Flower Barrier, The White Jade (MYTHICAL), Evergreen Resilience, Petrification…]
…
[Domination] as well as 12 other skills since she was level 60, it made sense, and as expected all her skills were related to her flower power.
Low strength, but all other stats were pretty high for someone at her level.
But the thing that caught his attention the most… was the fact that her HP were extremely high, 83000 was around thrice as much as Stark, and even twice as much as Akira.
After observing the status windows of this many users, Stark realized one thing: everyone's stats were different because of their style of combat, for example he had low HP, yet somehow Sora and the others had higher HP than him.
It truly made him feel… that every [Domination] user was unique in their own way, yet all forced to participate in these deadly trials.
But before any of them could finish…
"Prisoners need… to go back to their cells…" the warden suddenly took a step forward, its hammer still in hand, and the blue spheres in the middle of its torso glowing.
"Make us," Stark smiled as he positioned his hands in front of his face, "The moment you get closer I'll just rip you apart!"
"We… will… SEE!"
~FWISH~
In less than a fraction of a second, the warden dashed at Stark and Sora, swinging its hammer at them.
"HAMMER SLAM!"
The sound of the impact echoed through the chamber as the warden's hammer connected with the ground. Stark and Sora used the moment to dodge the attack, the force of the slam causing the floor to shatter and sending up a cloud of debris.
But while they were avoiding… the warden revealed that he was actually doing a combo attack.
And so…
It pointed the arm that wasn't holding the hammer toward Stark, and suddenly, sculk appeared all over it, created freshly thanks to the [Sculk Necklace].
"SCULK SURGE," and it sent a laser-like attack of sculk toward Stark.
"Oh come on, why me," he sighed, although he kept smiling, mimicking the [Superior Clone]'s confident attitude.
This time, the fight would truly begin, would they be able to beat the strongest the enemy they ever faced, or would they succumb to the [Death] difficulty trial like all the others…
And if they did in fact kill the warden, then just how many would survive by the end?

chapters.title: Chapter 211 - 211: Only But a Facade of the TRUE Boss
chapters.content:
"SCULK SURGE," the Warden bellowed, its voice echoing throughout the chamber as it launched a barrage of sculk beams at Stark, its sturdy arm taken over by the liquid as it repeatedly kept sending those small bursts at him.
~FWISH~
Of course, Stark easily avoided them by jumping to the sides, crouching or taking very smooth steps toward Warden.
"Foolish prisoner," on one hand, it had its 'Sculk Cannon' pointed at Stark, and on the other one it was carrying its hammer, extremely heavy, yet making it seem light it was nothing but dead weight.
"Flower Barrier," on the other hand, Sora just summoned her barrier as three giant white flowers, which looked like daisies, stopped all the sculk bursts whenever Warden decided to shoot her.
"Would love a little help," Stark rolled his eyes as he made a run for it and dashed at the warden when it was 'recharging' its sculk.
"CRIMSON SPEARS," he summoned three spears and immediately sent them toward the warden's torso, wanting to see if he could break the 'rib armor' that was protecting the three spheres.
But…
"Armor Sculkification," Warden calmly pointed its sculk arm toward its armor and shot, its torso now completely covered in the dark blue liquid.
And so when the spears reached it…
~SPLASH~
The spears didn't bounce off or anything of the sort, they were just absorbed into the sculk, as if they were nothing but rocks.
Stark frowned, quickly reassessing his strategy.
"HAMMER SLAM," Warden instantly grabbed its hammer again as it swung down at Stark who was pretty close.
"…!" Stark was ready to avoid and counter-attack.
But…
"VINE SURGE," vines came out of the ground under Warden and surrounded its arm, stopping its attack right as the hammer was about to hit Stark (well not really since he was going to avoid).
"Oh?" Warden lifted his eyebrows, "Your little friend seems to have finally decided to join the party…"
Surprisingly, Warden could hold decent conversations with humans, much like the 'Godless Demon' apostles such as Sierra and Judicator.
Was it because he was extremely strong? Because he was the warden? Or because he was the final boss of the trial?
The Mirror Master back at the first trial could also speak after all…
"VINE SURGE… MAX RESTRAIN," Sora closed her hand into a fist as it glowed a deep green color, and more vines came out of the ground, now not only restraining Warden's arm, but also his legs and torso.
"YOU THINK THIS IS ENOUGH TO HARM ME?" yet, Warden flexed his muscles, and the vines slowly began to break.
Sora wasn't bothered though as her eyes glowed a deep fire and then… "Radiance."
~FIRE, FWISH~
All the vines around Warden suddenly burst into flames, the intense heat emanating from them making the air around him feel like a furnace.
Sora when casting spells was always calm and composed, every one of her actions calculated to allow herself to win.
And it seemed to work…
"-4218! -4382! -3903!" it took a few seconds for Warden to remove all the vines as he aggressively moved around, his pitch-black eyes burning and leaving a trail behind, and his sharp mouth contorted into one of a beast in rage.
And by the end of that struggle…
"-49028!" she dealt extremely good damage to the Warden.
"Foolish…" but he didn't even look that bothered after receiving around 100000 points of its health.
"AURA SMASH!" Stark immediately summoned the three crimson fists and sent them at Warden while he was busy trying to attack Sora.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
All three hit him and made him falter slightly, having a hard time holding his own hammer.
"-14827! -15282! -15029!" his armor protected him from most of the damage, but there was no denying it was still there.
And in addition to that…
[Warden has been stunned]
He could actually get stunned by the attacks, unlike most of the other monsters and bosses.
Frankly… Warden looked like a joke currently.
He was not using his skills, he was slow, dumb, and couldn't do anything but take the damage the humans gave him.
"Elements of Natures; Pollen Bombs," Sora calmly closed her eyes and put her hands together once [Flower Analysis] informed her that Warden was stunned.
[Elements of Natures] allowed her to make five different flowers come out of the ground: a sunflower, a tulip, an iris, a poppy and a lily.
Each of the flowers bloomed completely in mere instants and were extremely big, the size of an average human.
~FWISH~
They were all pointed at Warden, who couldn't move his body.
And… some sort of energy balls were beginning to form in the middle of the flowers, powered up by their petals.
The energy balls grew more and more, until eventually reaching half the size of that flower.
And right afterward…
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
All of these balls, linked to their respective flowers in colors, were shot at the warden.
Safe to say, all of them hit.
~BOOOOOOM~
"-32819! 37271! -34383! -38992! -36605!"
Blinded by the explosions, the warden was finally able to move, its body suffering from all these attacks.
But right as it was ready to rush at Sora…
"Pollen Bombs," a giant flower came out of the ground and positioned itself in front of Sora hands, which were joined.
~SHAKE~
The flower shook, and three small white balls fell from it before it disappeared back into the ground.
"DIE, PRISONER," it really seemed to be enraged.
"Phew~" but Sora just blew on her hand to make the three small pollen balls slowly float toward the warden.
And once they touched him… they revealed themselves to be everything but small.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
They exploded, creating a massive explosion that yet again stopped the warden in his run.
"-53729! -51033! -49887!"
[Warden HP: 162743/640000]
This is not normal.
None of this was normal.
'This doesn't make sense…' Stark could have continued the combo with Sora, but he didn't, the vortex in his eyes intensifying as he looked at the pitiful warden, who kneeled down after the explosions, unable to keep holding its hammer, "NONE OF THIS MAKES SENSE…"
Sora was emotionless, so she didn't feel anything when attacking the warden, only thinking that she was just dominating him.
Not once in her mind did she think that it was weird that THE boss of THE second trial would be this weak.
Yes, he could proudly say it: that thing was super weak, no matter how much you thought about it.
It was already down in four attacks? IMPOSSIBLE!
Sora was strong, probably just as strong as Stark, there was no denying it, and he also needed her if he wanted to kill it.
But… this warden wasn't normal.
Stark felt like… everything it showed until now was but a facade: its attacks, expressions, actions, everything was just to make them lower their guard.
After all… he was the final boss of the trial…
Stark had a bad feeling, that same feeling he always had when something was amiss.
That same feeling you get… when you know that death is coming.
Warden was currently on the ground, his hammer down and his head looking at the ground, black liquid oozing from the opening of his helmet.
"The Flaming Rose," Sora got ready to end this battle once and for all as she charged up her [Legendary] skill, unaware of what was coming as she couldn't sense emotions.
But right at that moment… the warden's eyes, which were completely dark until now, suddenly grew yellow pupils.
The TRUE 'Warden' would now appear.
The TRUE boss of this trial.
"Well, well, I had enough fun with you all," it lifted its arm with an emotionless voice, leaving out all its rage as if it never existed.
And suddenly… a metal chain enveloped in sculk came out from the ceiling behind Sora, rushing toward her neck.

chapters.title: Chapter 212 - 212: The First Death
chapters.content:
"Well, well, I had enough fun with you all," the warden spoke in a completely different voice, and Stark's eyes widened.
He knew it, he fucking knew it: no chance that thing was using its full power, or even trying in that regard.
It lifted its right arm, its yellow pupils glowing as it looked at Sora, who was not bothered.
"Prisoner Chain," Warden used one of his [Legendary] skills, and a powerful-looking metal chain that was enveloped in sculk came out of the ceiling and rushing toward Sora's neck.
"Once I get rid of you, the other prisoner will tremble in fear and surrender," Warden slowly got up, as if his injuries were nothing more than an act, as if all that rage was just a show, "But truly," he smiled, "Did you really believe that I was even trying? Did you really think you could defeat the warden of this prison with such useless attacks?"
Sora hadn't noticed the chain yet, too focused on Warden, although she couldn't deny she was surprised to see him this carefree after all her attacks.
"FUCK… TIME VISION," time slowed down around Stark to the extreme, the chain that was now only a few meters away from closing around Sora's neck slowing down as well, "THINK… THINK…"
Stark's brain was working at 120% at this very moment, the vortex in his eyes growing darker, and his crimson aura taking over not only his face but also his body.
He had a choice to make, one that would determine his entire fate: sacrifice Sora and hope that he would be strong enough to take the warden (unlikely) or… he could save her and possibly sacrifice his [Revive Token].
Sora was needed, there was denying it, her flower powers were the real deal and could deal more damage than he could.
But… would she really be worth a [Revive Token]?
In his mind, all Stark was thinking was for the best way to win, he didn't even care if she died or not as long as she was useful…
And by the end of his reasoning…
[3 seconds have passed, deactivating 'Time Vision']
~FWISH, DASH~
Stark used all his energy to dash toward Sora, he ran the fastest he had ever done yet, closing the distance in less than a fraction of a second.
The chain was right behind her, on the verge of closing in on her and essentially kill her.
But…
~PUSH~
Stark slammed onto Sora, pushing her out of the chain's way.
And instead…
~CLANG~
The metal chain slammed into Stark, embedding itself into his neck with a sickening crunch and closing in on him as its edge was like some-sort of collar that couldn't be removed.
"A hero now? Humans sure as dumb aren't they…" the warden sighed, "Oh well, that heroic act is going to be your last…"
"WARDEN SMASH," he infused his hammer with even more sculk, making it glow extremely strongly, and held it with his two hands to increase the power and damage, approaching Stark, who couldn't move anymore as the sculk was slowly taking over his body, the liquid submerging his head and soon enough his chest.
It was a horrible way to go when you think about it: you couldn't see and couldn't do anything.
And when you expect it the least…
~SMASH~
The warden would use his hammer to smash your head, killing you instantly.
Sora watched in horror as her partner was killed right in front of her eyes: for the first time in as long as she could remember, her expression was something other than that neutral one she had.
Stark had saved her, and although such acts wouldn't normally sway her, the way he had gone after sacrificing himself was horrifying.
"One down, one more to go," the warden calmly turned toward Sora, "Oh yeah, before I forget…"
"SCULK INFUSION," the sculk around his body fused and bulged, taking over his entire armor like some sort of veil.
And after a few seconds…
"+400000," he had been mostly healed, "That's better…" and so he continued walking toward Sora, who was ready to cause chaos.
"THE FLAMING ROSE," this was also the first time Sora was angrily using a skill, and she didn't know how her friends or family would react if she saw her actually showing some kind of emotion for the first time.
But for now… she just needed to kill that thing.
~FWISH, SPARK~
A vine came out of the ground and opened up into some sort of display, inside of it being a red flower with fire around it.
~NOM~
Sora ate that flower in one gulp, and the aura around her became much more powerful.
"Oh?" the warden tilted his head, "Is this one of those tricks? You do realize they won't work?" he was truly mocking all of them.
"…" Sora didn't answer, instead she focused on her hands, and they began to be surrounded by fire as well.
…
[Skill: The Flaming Rose]
[Type: Legendary]
[Description: Eat the flower, and you will temporarily unlock the power to send fireballs using your hands, those fireballs have a chance to cause the 'BURN' effect!]
…
~FWISH, FWISH~
Small balls of fire, the size of her palms, appeared inside her hands, and she began to repeatedly send them toward the warden like some sort of rifle, not stopping for even a second.
And yet…
"Futile," the balls hit the warden's armor, yet he didn't even seem affected: all the balls were disappearing as soon as they hit the armor or sculk, "Did you really believe any of your previous attacks would have worked under normal circumstances?"
~FWISH, FWISH~
Yet Sora didn't stop, she kept sending dozens upon dozens of fireballs, who all did NOTHING to the boss except tickle him.
"Prisoners never learn, do they," he shook his head lightly, mocking her even more, "Your companion died, and here you are… PATHETIC…!"
"SCULK SURGE," he pointed his left arm at her, the one that was taken over by the sculk, and he sent a burst of the dark blue liquid at her.
~STEP~
Sora instinctively stepped to the right with phenomenal speed.
But what was awaiting her in this spot… was Warden's foot.
~KICK, SLAM~
Completely different than before, he actually predicted her movements using [Horns Detection], his two horns repeatedly glowing on and off to check out his opponent's next moves.
And so…
"Argh…" Sora was sent flying backward as the armored foot hit her in the stomach.
"-27162!" and even more terrifying, the damage he did was actually high.
"Come on," the warden sighed, "Show me something interesting, or else you'll just join him while doing nothing…"
The warden considered them as nothing but bugs, pretty normal with just how strong it was.
And what it REALLY wanted was to show the 'prisoners' that they were nothing but trash that could be taken out at any time, which is why he actually allowed them to hit him at the start and think he was weak.
Now… their despair would be amplified.
Or that is what he thought… because behind him… something great was happening.
"…"
[Revive Token used since host is dead!]
The token that resembled a gold coin, the symbol of two angel wings on it, appeared above Stark, then vanished out of thin air, the golden particles heading toward his body.
And once all of them were gone…
[Stark has been revived!]
Stark opened his eyes, remembering everything that happened.

chapters.title: Chapter 213 - 213: Sora's Final Struggle
chapters.content:
[Revive Token used since host is dead!]
[Stark has been revived!]
Stark instantly opened his eyes, his body hurting all over.
"Fucking hell…" he slowly got up, sitting on the ground as he observed ahead and held his head as it felt like it was splitting in two.
Even though he was revived, in comparison to the one of the [Chosen One] talent which didn't hurt one bit, getting revived by the [Revive Token] was actually quite painful.
Memories of everything that happened so far went through his head: the warden's act, his sudden transformation and calm demeanor, then the fact Stark saved Sora by taking in the chain instead of her since he needed her to defeat the boss.
"…" the more he thought about it, the angrier he got, and the darker the vortex in his eyes became.
He played all those moments in slow motion in his head, over and over and over… until he was tired of seeing them.
His entire body was surrounded by crimson and holy aura now, an aura so powerful even the warden would fear it.
"…=)," and… Stark smiled, "Alright…"
He tried to stand up, but his legs actually gave out before he could, meaning that being revived is actually much more of a hassle than he thought since his body still needed to adapt after LITERALLY dying.
And so… all Stark did was watch the fight between Sora and Warden, his piercing eyes on them.
"…?"
"…"
The two felt a shivering sensation on their backs, but were too busy fighting to actually look back: what would there even be there, Stark had died after all, so what was the point.
"Prisoner Chain," Warden lifted his right arm again while blocking yet another [Elements of Nature] attack using his harem, truly showcasing that he could have done that since the beginning by simply tanking the energy balls created from the flowers Sora summoned.
For the second time, a chain came out of the metal ceiling and rushed toward Sora's neck.
[Behind you…], but the white flower that whispering in her ears already informed her now that she was fully aware of her surroundings.
"EVERGREEN RESILIENCE," Sora focused on her skill, and the ground underneath her began to radiate with a vibrant green aura.
Her surroundings in a ten meters radius suddenly grew green grass on the ground, meaning that Warden was actively walking on it.
~SNAP~
One of the blades of grass moving slowly to the rhythm of the wind suddenly grew, becoming extremely sharp as it deflected the chain.
And then… without notice…
~SLASH, SLASH, SLASH~
A dozen more of these blades grew and rushed at Warden to pierce him.
"Oh…?" he was actually surprised, the reason… well… it was because it was actually impossible for him to avoid this attack.
~SLASH, SLASH~
The blades of grass all pierced his body, and one of them managed to actually slightly crack his armor, it was a [Legendary] skill after all.
"-4727! -3839! -4221!"
.
.
"-42819!" by the end, she actually managed to deal good damage, although that wasn't enough to even make the warden budge.
"Alright, time to end this," the big boss sighed as he used one of his hands to grab the [Sculk Necklace] around his neck.
And then…
"ULTRASOUND AURA," the room suddenly reverberated with a deafening sound, and a powerful wave of energy erupted from Warden's body.
Blue rings came out of the necklace and rushed toward Sora, who couldn't avoid them because of the noise.
"Akh…" her head hurt like hell when the rings hit her, and she had a hard time using her own aura while holding her head…
In the midst of the chaos, Sora felt her body being pushed back by an unseen force, struggling to stand against the overwhelming power.
And while she was busy trying to regain control…
"Hammer Slam," Warden closed in the distance in a mere instant and swung his hammer sideways at her, reaching her sides before she could even realize it.
'…!' while holding on as to not faint because of the sound waves of [Ultrasound Aura], Sora only managed to see the hammer once it was mere centimeters away from hitting her.
And then…
~SLASH~
[Evergreen Resilience] was still active around her, and with her last willpower, she summoned a dozen blades of grass to minimize the impact of the hammer attack.
~BOOM~
The [Hammer Slam] obviously destroyed the blades of grass, but they were actually successful in blocking it slightly, since when it actually reached Sora…
~SLAM~
"-51362!" without that, she would have definitely died.
[Sora HP: 4476/84000]
Still, the impact was so strong she was sent dozens of meters away, slamming into one of the walls of floor 0.
"…" blood was pouring out from her nose, mouth, head: her entire body was in bad shape.
~SWISH~
And as to plunge her into even more despair, the warden closed in the distance and arrived right in front of her as she got up and placed her body against the bloodied wall, her head staring at the ceiling above and her eyes drowsy from the blood tears.
"He… gave… me… a chance…" Sora didn't know how could this end like this.
She was always confident in her abilities, even more so Akira, and there was absolutely no doubt that she was way stronger than he was.
And yet… in front of this boss… they all seemed like bugs.
Was this why the "mastermind" of the domination trials wanted them to kill each other? Was this why one of the perks specifically asked for only "three" to remain alive?
Maybe it was because… even if three or five people fought the warden, they would have still lost.
This trial was from the [Death] difficulty, she knew very well that it was the hardest one and that no one had ever completed a trial from this category, her previous being a [Godless-Level] trial.
But… she didn't know just how bad the difference in difficulty would be
Maybe those first levels were actually to deceive them into thinking it would be easier than they thought or that they were actually strong…
And yet… before THAT thing… they were nothing.
"Are these your final words?" the warden shook his head, the sculk on his body taking over his armor, arms, and hammer as he lifted it up, ready to smash Sora.
"He… gave… me… one last chance… to show my powers… and to win…" she repeated as she used her final strength to use one more skill.
"Regenerative Drop…" her head tilted to the side, and she was losing consciousness more and more.
A flower came out from beside Sora and grew into a magnificent purple lavender, its tip standing right above Sora's head and actually facing her head from above.
…
[Skill: Regenerative Drop]
[Rank: Legendary]
[Description: Summons a lavender that will, after thirty seconds, create a single purple drop that will regenerate 50000HP and heal all status effects, plus replenishes stamina]
[Flaw: if someone stops the lavender from growing, then the skill won't work]
…
This was her final chance, her last hope, and if it doesn't work, if the warden somehow manages to still defeat her afterward… then it would truly be over, and she would join Stark and all the others.

chapters.title: Chapter 214 - 214: The Killing Spree
chapters.content:
"Is this all?" the warden's yellow pupils also had a vortex of aura in them, although slightly less powerful than Stark's.
"Please…" she looked above, and almost, ALMOST, showed an emotion for the first time in her life as she saw the purple drop of the lavender flower on the verge of dropping on her head, hoping with all her heart and soul that it would work.
Even when the warden attacked and mocked her, even when she was against a wall and on the verge of dying, she still had that emotionless look on her face, as she didn't care about anything else other than surviving and going back to the real world.
In that regard, she wasn't different from all the others, yet here she was, one of the few people who were able to advance this far, possibly since she didn't seek to fight anyone.
And yet… that simple hope was enough to change her ways.
No matter how much they tried, her parents could never get her to change or smile at them, making them think she was an anomaly, and now… the [Domination] trial was on the verge of doing it simply by pushing her to her limits.
Limits she never knew she could reach, as she had always dominated her opponents quite easily, the power of her flowers making her look like some sort of prodigy, although she made sure to hide their true essence as [Domination] should stay unknown to the world.
"Please…" she was praying that she could actually manage to defeat the warden on her second try once the purple drop hit her head and regenerates her, although she knew there was no luck: it was all skill.
Yet… this second chance would never happen.
"Do you think of me as stupid, prisoner?" the warden shouted for the first time, his expression twisting in anger at the thought of a mere prisoner could underestimate him.
And then…
~GRAB, SQUASH~
He used his powerful sculk-filled hand to reach for the lavender and tear it apart before stepping on it.
[Regenerative Drop has been cancelled!]
And just like that, all of Sora's hopes were shattered, she wasn't able to finish up her spell as it was cancelled right before activating, meaning that it was useless.
A monster wouldn't be dumb enough to actually let you heal in front of them after all, right?
Well… at least the warden wasn't as he kept trampling on the floor in front of Sora's desperate eyes.
For the first time in her life, Sora TRULY wanted to cry.
And yet… her 'condition' was a curse, since no tears actually came out, nothing could relieve her from what was about to happen.
All she could do was watch, the warden destroying every single one of her attacks.
"Well, seems like it's over, goodbye prisoner, join your little companion," he lifted his hammer again, the sculk and aura around his body becoming much more powerful as he knew that his job would be soon finished.
But right as he was about to swing and kill her…
"PAY ATTENTION, FALSE HERO," he heard something from behind, and then…
~BOOOOOOOOOOOM~
He was suddenly hit by an attack so powerful it shook the entire trial, and sent him flying far from Sora, crashing onto the giant metal door of the Lucullus Prison.
"-393814!"
"What the…" Warden received so much damage it was actually scary even for him.
And when he looked to his right… his left arm had been destroyed COMPLETELY: it was cut off from the rest of his body from the impact, and his armor was shattered from everywhere.
"How…" he wondered as he got up, his face now full of rage as his existence was actually threatened by another entity.
And when he lifted his vortex eyes… he saw… Stark.
The boy was staring at his very soul, his aura so powerful that Warden knew it was no joke.
"You… are… supposed… TO BE DEAD," he shouted while getting up, grabbing his hammer with his remaining arm.
"Death is nothing to me," Stark smiled, "Double-check someone the next time you wanna kill them," he shrugged, "Too bad there won't be a next time for you!"
"But how… HOW…" Warden was so mad he was on the verge of going berserk.
"…" Stark didn't answer, "You're just a false hero."
***
Stark had been watching the fight between Sora and Warden, and although he gained hope once seeing Sora damage him, that hope quickly disappeared as he saw the boss absolutely destroy her and send her flying using his skills and hammer.
"Get up…" he still couldn't move, and nobody knew about him, but seeing that his teammate was going to die, Stark pushed his own body and limits as well, "GET UP…"
"GETUPGETUPGETUPGETUPGETUP!!!" he kept trying, and the closer Warden got to Sora, who was lying against the wall, her bloodied body unable to move, the more Stark could sense that his limits were growing.
And so right as Warden reached the white-haired girl…
~FWISH~
Stark managed to stand up.
But now what? What could he possibly do?
Sora had already summoned her [Regenerative Drop], and he was too far to reach her before [Horns Detection] would alert Warden who would kill her than attack him.
What could he do in this situation to win…
"Think…" this trial actually pushed Stark's brain power more than anything else before, and strangely, the more the thought, the stronger the vortex in his eyes and his aura became, "… Oh!"
He figured out something.
"Spatial Inventory," he summoned the inventory void and grabbed something from it: it was a gun-shaped object that resembled just a normal pistol, although it had weird devil symbols all over it, and the words 'Killing Spree' written on the side.
That's right: he grabbed [Killing Spree], the ultimate reward.
[Killing Spree: This reward charges up a destructive power that increases after each monster/enemy defeated, the more monsters killed, and the strongest they are, the more this attack's power increases, also note that the amount of monsters killed counts since the beginning of the trial!]
He had defeated over 250 monsters as well as Leader and Akira, meaning that the power of the gun should be enough.
And so… right as Warden grabbed Sora's lavender and stomped on it, Stark pointed the gun at the boss, ready to end it all.
"Here goes nothing…" and without a single second of hesitation, he pressed the trigger.
Yet instead of firing instantly like a normal gun… [Killing Spree] was different.
[Charging up power!], a panel appeared before Stark.
[268 monsters killed, 2 enemies killed]
[Amazing, host, you are a true KILLER!]
~FWISH, FWISH~
A crimson ball of energy formed in front of the hole bullets were supposed to be fired from.
[You have slain 'Sublevel 4 Elite Guard', power increasing!]
.
.
[You have slain 'Chains Cyclops', power increasing!]
.
.
[You have slain 'Undead Elite Zombie', power increasing!]
.
.
And that crimson ball… began to grow more and more as each panel that showed the monsters he killed appeared.
~FWISH… FWISHHH… FWISHHHHHH~
[You have slain 'Leader, The Sect Leader', power increasing!]
~FWISH~
And in the end…
[You have slain 'Akira, the Moon Warrior,' power increasing!]
[Power has been maxed out! Please fire!]
The gun that Stark had been holding completely evaporated, not able to withstand the power of the crimson energy ball, meaning that it was just there, its energy pulsing through Stark's body as it floated in the air, ready to be sent at the enemy.
"How do I…" yet before he could even finish his sentence.
[Punch it!]
"Alright…" Stark breathed in and out as he focused, the crimson ball of energy before the sole thing that could help them kill that warden monster.
As focused his entire aura in his right hand, he remembered everything that happened in this trial: the fourth sublevel and the elite guard, the fight with Leader in the second sublevel, the awakening of his new class and the moment he killed all those undead with it, the fight with Kokoro and Akira in the first sublevel because he was selected as the target.
Now… all those experience and memories, all those fights and struggles… he put them all in this punch, his right hand filled with an aura so red it could be a demon's to shame.
And then…
~SWING~
He punched the crimson ball so hard that it felt as if time stood still.
The energy ball exploded in a burst of crimson light upon impact with his fist and was sent toward Warden at the speed of light.
And it hit him, saving Sora right as he was about to smash her body.
~BOOOOM~
Which brings us back to the moment before.
"You're just a false hero," he smiled at the warden, who was clearly damaged from the [Killing Spree] ball.
And so just like that, the fight became a little more fair.
-----------------
One chapter today because I'm currently reviewing the previous chapters to enhance them and also increasing stockpile, in exchange this a little longer than the others.

chapters.title: Chapter 215 - 215: Back to Business and Sculk Arm
chapters.content:
[You have used 'Killing Spree' on 'Warden, the Prisoner Killer'!]
"…" Warden was sent flying toward the giant metal door of the Lucullus Prison, the crimson ball of energy sent by [Killing Spree] hitting his left shoulder, and essentially evaporating his left arm in the process, "You… prisoner…" The yellow vortex in the warden's eyes grew darker as he got up, holding his hammer tight in his right hand.
"You're just a false hero," Stark took a few steps forward and arrived in front of Sora, checking her out.
"…" she was still breathing, and her eyes were opened, just enough to be able to see what was happening, yet unable to move her body.
"Useless…" Stark mumbled, he knew she wouldn't be able to help, even though he had been sure she was the strongest one of the batch, "Just sit back and watch me send that asshole to hell…" Stark continued walking toward warden.
"SCULK INFUSION," but Warden cast his skill, and suddenly…
~FWISH~ His left arm reappeared, well… not really… but it was just entirely made out of sculk.
Basically… he artificially created another arm as he couldn't retrieve the last.
"+100000," he couldn't heal himself anymore, and this was the maximum his skill could do at this point.
Meaning… that both parties were in their final form.
A true 1 on 1.
Warden swung his hammer a few times to adjust to the feeling of his new arm, completely made out of sculk, then he stared at Stark.
"Do you believe that you have the right to fight back?" he tilted his head, cracks visible all over his armor, which protected him from dying of the [Killing Spree] energy ball.
"What are you talking about?" yet Stark wasn't bothered, his crimson aura taking over his entire body, his figure being replaced by that aura, except for his mouth and eyes which were white.
"Mere prisoners trying to escape and cause chaos in this world, I am the warden, I am JUSTICE," Warden grabbed his hammer with both his hands and smashed the ground with it, making the entirety of floor 0 tremble, and making cracks appear on the ground.
He was extremely close to reaching his second phase, or "Berserk" mode.
"ULTRASOUND AURA," Warden held his necklace with the "sculk arm" he created, unleashing a deafening wave of sound that echoed through the room.
Stark had seen that he used that to stun Sora before, and he wouldn't fall for that trick.
The blue rings of sound rushed in his direction, but he just swiftly avoided them by starting to run around the warden.
"You seem to be smarter than the other one," Warden smiled, "That's good, shattering all your hopes will be much more fun."
"Heh~ and you call use the evil ones," Stark smiled back, although his was so demonic that even Warden's eyes widened slightly.
"SCULK SURGE… CANNON!" Warden pointed his "sculk arm" toward Stark, but instead of immediately shooting… it started to morph.
The cannon-like structure on Warden's arm grew larger and larger, as if gathering energy from the very air around them.
And by the end of that transformation… his arm was like a giant cannon that could send giant balls of sculk toward his enemies.
~BOOM~
He immediately fired at Stark, who avoided the lightning-fast bullet by a hair's length.
"Is this… your justice?" Stark said as he avoided two more cannonballs.
"Shut up, prisoner."
"SCULK CHARGE… ULTIMATE CANNONBALL!" as if sucking in the air, Warden charged up his attack, the sculk all over his armor and body slowly disappearing and going inside the cannon.
And after a few seconds… ~BOOM~ He fired the ball, and it was so fast Stark would have no chance to avoid it, especially since Warden had [Horns Detection].
And yet… ~SNAP~ Stark snapped his fingers, and he immediately teleported behind Warden.
The reason was simple: while he was running around Warden, he had activated [Crimson Ball Transmission] and sent a ball right behind the beast.
"Watch out, false hero, your justice is wavering," Stark immediately aimed to slam his fist onto Warden's back.
But…
"Flickering Movements," Stark's vision became dark for a split second, almost as if the lights in his eyes had been turned off, and when his vision came back… Warden was…
"My justice will never lose," he was behind Stark.
"Sculk Handcuffs," before Stark could even react, sculk formed around Stark's arms and handcuffs appeared on them, joining them both together.
'Can't move…' he couldn't move his arms anymore, the sculk blocking his movements.
"HAMMER SLAM," he swung his hammer sideways and hit Stark straight on as he couldn't move.
"-23713!"
[Stark HP: 9787/33500]
Thankfully enough, the [Sculk Handcuffs] disappeared the moment he was hit.
But on the other hand… Stark was now only one attack away from dying, blood pouring out from his head, and his arm hurting like hell as he infused it with aura and blocked the attack with it to minimize the damage received.
"You're the only left," Warden pointed his [Sculk Hammer] at Stark, who got up from his kneeling position to continue fighting.
Stark lifted his gaze, and that's when he noticed something: the rib-like bones that were protecting the three [Dark Spheres] in the middle of the warden's torso were on the verge of breaking as well.
If these things were the warden's weakness, then he would need to use them to defeat him, otherwise he had no chance, especially now that Sora was useless and could only watch the fight as it happened.
Stark needed a plan…
And so… he began acting.
"Hahahahahahah!"
"…?" Warden was confused, after all… why was Stark suddenly laughing like a maniac, "Gone crazy?"
"I already figured out everything, WARDEN!" he smiled, "You think you're so righteous, protecting the people from us criminals, huh?"
"That is right, I am the good of this world," Warden actually agreed, he was full of himself and loved to be called a hero.
"And yet, here you are, violent, despicable, nothing but a mere tool used by those above for this pointless game!"
Stark continued, the smile on his face growing more sinister.
[Keep pushing…]
Warden's expression changed at that moment, his neutral look from before faltering.
"You are nothing at all, Warden, and when I end up killing you and getting out of this place, I'll make sure to cause the higher amount of chaos possible."
"You… little…" Warden was beginning to become angry.
Warden, as stated by his role and name, was the guardian of this prison, the one that stopped all evil from escaping, which is why he was fueled by justice and good, refusing to submit to the evil of this world and loving to be called a hero.
Anything that went against these beliefs would need to be wiped out.
And yet…
"You are just a monster, Warden," Stark went for the finishing blow.
[Push him to his limits… make him make a mistake…]
"Stop… talking…" he smashed his hammer against the ground again, debris falling from the ceiling and his body being taken over by sculk and aura.
"YOUR CORRUPT JUSTICE IS WRONG, AND YOU ARE NOTHING," Stark shouted as hard as he could, the atmosphere around both opponents so powerful that Sora couldn't understand how any of this was happening, "NOTHING BUT A FALSE HERO!"
And the moment Stark pronounced those last words…
"WARDEN'S DARKNESS," Warden used up his [Legendary] skill again, the same one he activated when Stark and Sora first entered this floor.
"I'LL SHOW YOU THAT I AM THE TRUE HERO, PRISONER," Warden hid in the darkness of the floor as everything turned dark around Stark.
"Come at me, false hero," Stark sneered as he wiped blood pouring out from his nose.

chapters.title: Chapter 216 - 216: Berserk Form
chapters.content:
"WARDEN'S DARKNESS," Warden spread his arms, and the entirety of floor 0 was plunged in darkness, in which Stark couldn't see anything but the body of Sora, who was still lying, looking at them fight.
She truly couldn't understand where Stark was going, after all, isn't angering a powerful monster against everything they ever taught in schools or books?
And yet… it seemed like it was exactly what Stark was aiming for.
"SCULK SURGE," Warden transformed both his arms into cannons, and from the safety of the darkness began to shoot repeatedly while making sure to move as to not give out his position to Stark.
"Do you see why my justice will triumph?" he spoke, his voice echoing through the entirety of the floor.
But Stark just shrugged as he avoided four more cannonballs, "Nah, I still don't see it, how about you actually hit me?"
"You just had to ask," he heard Warden's voice from behind, his hammer lifted as to strike and finally kill Stark.
But…
"Now that's better," Stark turned around so fast it almost felt like he knew Warden was there since the beginning, and released everything he had in his arms toward the monster.
And what did he have?
Well… [Crystal Stun Potions], obviously!
"…?" Warden didn't expect that, where would he even get those potions from after all, he had nothing on him, and he couldn't hide them anywhere.
~SPLASH, FWISH~
He had grabbed four potions from [Spatial Inventory] and threw them all at the final boss, resulting in all of them hitting him and releasing the mist around him.
"You think this is enough?" he still tried to swing his hammer.
But…
[You have been stunned by the crystal mist!]
"I think it is, false hero," Stark threw a jab at him as he had essentially outsmarted the boss.
There was no chance for Stark to hit the boss straight on with his speed and strength, as well as his multitude of skills, which put him into complete advantage.
So what could Stark do…?
Well… how about FORCING him to get closer to him?
Using [Warden's Darkness], his own skill against him, Stark would force the boss to get closer to him, and when he expected it the least… he would surprise him with the potions.
And it worked…
"PRISONER," all Warden could do was watch, the vortex in his eyes growing more and more.
But…
"My time, false hero," Stark smiled as he began to summon his skills, "CRIMSON SPEARS, AURA SMASH!"
He summoned three spears and three fists, sending them all at the middle of Warden's torso, specifically at the spot where the rib bones protecting the spheres were.
And after these attacks…
"-12162! -13449! -14393! -13396! -15098! -12445!"
~CRACK, SNAP~
The [Protection] of his weakness was now holding by a thin thread, visibly shaking as if ready to crumble at any point.
And so…
"The winners are the good, and the losers are the evil ones," Stark charged up his right hand with an aura so dark it was blending by the darkness of [Warden's Darkness], "I'm sure you also know that."
And…
~SWING, BOOOOM~
He swung at the protection, shattering it in the process and his fist reaching the three dark spheres, punching them with his entire strength, an explosion occurring as the spheres were destroyed, and the atmosphere of the floor trembled.
[Warden's Darkness] was obviously deactivated since the warden had been hit by the attack, meaning that the surroundings of the floor returned to its original ones.
"GAGHZSHHA!" for the first time since this battle started, for the first time even after being hit by [Killing Spree] and getting up like it was nothing… Warden felt true pain.
~FWISH~
He was sent flying backward, the power of the punch so great it dealt immense damage to himself.
"-123828!" Warden crashed against the metal door of the Lucullus Prison again, creating a small crater in the door, although it didn't budge more than that.
"Hah~ Hah~" as to not allow himself to show any more weakness, Warden immediately got up, although it was visible that he was trembling slightly, still affected by the impact of the punch.
[Warden HP: 21339/640000]
Warden was clenching his [Dark Spheres] with his sculk arm, he was one shot away from dying as well, and the attack from Stark was so unexpectedly powerful that it actually created cracks in his spheres, which were basically his "CORES".
"Stark…" Sora's eyes widened.
She had recovered a bit, able to move her arms, yet her legs were too damaged to keep going.
"MOVE… PLEASE…" she was begging her own body, something she had never done before.
Since her birth and the moment she got this cursed class, she had been undefeatable, from monsters and people alike, able to dominate them all easily thanks to her flowers.
This trial… was the first time she actually felt hopeless in the face of two beings much more powerful than her, and yes, she now considered Stark stronger than she was after he actually managed to damage the boss even all the participants combined wouldn't be able to take down.
"Is that all?" Stark tilted his head while smiling at the warden, who had indeed tried to get up, but went back to kneeling down, holding his cores and breathing heavily, "Is that your justice?"
"You…" but Warden looked up, ACTUALLY, TRULY, mad for the first time since this battle started.
No human before had pushed him this far, no human before had made him feel so little.
And… no human before had ever forced him to use "THEM".
"My justice… is… UNBEATABLE," Warden's body began to glow and be surrounded by sculk.
And then…
"THE END OF THE LINE; THE DARK SPHERES!" he used his two [Mythical] skills, and yes, he has two.
The reason he hadn't used those skills before is because they are skills that require [Conditions] to be used.
Such skills are rare, but they do exist everywhere.
For example, [EGO] is a [Condition] skill, since Stark needs to make the [EGO Meter] reach 100 before being able to cast it.
Another example is [Superior Clone] since it requires three clones and 30 seconds for them to morph into it, the condition was pretty harsh, yet the result was a clone almost as powerful as the original Stark.
But there is one simple thing that is special with such skills… and it is… that the harder the condition is to be fulfilled, then the stronger the skill is.
And… Warden had two of those, now both activated and ready to be used, so just how strong would he get, just how much more terrifying would he be?
Warden's body was glowing with a deep blue aura, glowing so intensely it was impossible to see his figure anymore.
Almost… as if he was morphing?
And he was.
He was on the verge of using his ultimate form, the form he had never bothered to use against any of his other enemies.
~FWISH~
He threw his own hammer away, crashing it against the metal door and creating yet another crater because of the impact.
"…" Stark was actually cautious now, he didn't like it one bit, and although he tried to approach that thing to stop his transformation, his own [Focus] screamed for him not to get close.
And after a few seconds… a panel appeared in front of Stark.
[Warden has entered his "Berserk" form]
[Watch out!]
***************
I might occasionally start uploading one chapter a day (but in exchange it's going to be pretty long 1500–2000 words instead of two 1200-1300 words ones) as fixing mistakes and adding stockpile is taking more time than expected, sorry, also since I have to write another story.

chapters.title: Chapter 217 - 217: The Two Condition Mythical Skills.
chapters.content:
"Justice… justice… justice…" Warden could be heard mumbling those words again, it does seem like it had gone crazy from Stark's talk and his attack which damaged him, "JUSTICE!"
A spiral of aura and sculk formed around him, making it practically impossible to distinguish his true form as he was powering up, not wanting to hold himself back anymore as the prisoners were now an actual threat, well it was mostly Stark though.
The aura was so intense that it seemed as if the very fabric of reality was being warped around him.
Suddenly, Warden let out a loud, ear-piercing scream that echoed throughout the entire prison, and they both had to put their hands on their ears if they didn't want to go deaf by the noise.
As he screamed, the sculk and aura surrounding him began to swirl and coalesce, forming a massive, ominous structure that resembled… a colossal [SCULK HAMMER]!
"Is this… his ultimate form?" Stark couldn't help but wonder, feeling a chill run down his spine.
And after that spiral of aura and sculk disappeared, as well as his body stopped glowing… Stark was finally able to check out the warden's [Berserk] form.
Warden, now in his Berserk form, was towering above Stark, his body covered in thick, undulating sculk that mixed with his aura to create a formidable appearance. His eyes, now filled with pure wrath, seemed to hold an almost otherworldly darkness.
His cracked armor was now completely repaired and looked more majestic than before, his fists also were surrounded with aura, much like Stark when he did it with his own.
But there were two major details in its appearance now: first of all, the helmet with a hole in it had completely disappeared, meaning that Stark could now see the face of the warden: it had blue skin, pointed teeth, pointy ears as well as dark blue straight lines on its face that were glowing.
And the second detail… was the warden's cores.
They were no longer visible in his torso, instead they were now floating around him like they were the warden's very essence.
~THUMP~
The giant hammer, at least ten times the warden's size and fifteen times Stark's, dropped in the monster's hands, who grabbed it as if it was a mere stick.
The hammer had no physical appearance, it was LITERALLY made out of sculk, its edges not straight but always moving.
"Justice…" Warden stared at Stark in the eyes, and just this was almost enough to paralyze him, that aura was not normal.
Not wasting time, Stark decided to check out the two [Mythical] skills of the warden as to prepare him for whatever monstrosity was coming his way.
~THUMP~
He needed to be quick since Warden was slowly approaching, leaving a trail of sculk as his legs were also surrounded with it.
…
[Skill: The Dark Spheres]
[Rank: Mythical]
[Description: Use your three cores and make them spin around you, granting you an increase in aura and sculk, you are also now able to summon the COLOSSAL SCULK HAMMER to aid you in battle, let those criminals taste your justice.]
[Note: the sculk is now under your complete control, able to swallow your opponents whole, and each of the spheres can be used to block one of the opponent's skills.]
[Condition: The protection of your cores (aka the rib bones) needs to be destroyed to be able to use it]
…
[Skill: The End of the Line]
[Rank: Mythical]
[Description: All your stats are increased by a lot, and you enter your 'berserk' form, making you intimidating to most opponents who won't even be able to avoid your attacks anymore]
[Condition: your HP needs to be under 50000]
…
One of the skills (Dark Spheres) used his skills to improve his aura and sculk, while the other (The End of the Line) is used to upgrade his stats.
This was… a horrifying combo, and Stark had somehow managed to let the warden fulfill both of these conditions at the same time.
"…" Stark looked at Sora's direction for a quick instant, seeing that her emotionless face was looking at him, although drops of sweats betrayed her actual feelings.
And when he looked back at where the warden was…
The monster had disappeared.
Like literally, the warden wasn't in the spot it was in less than a second ago.
[Above]
[Focus] warned him, and when he looked up… he saw Warden in the air, his colossal sculk hammer in hand, his eyes burning with the fury of the cosmos.
His aura was stronger than ever, and his body seemed to shimmer and shift, as if he were made of the very fabric of reality itself.
The three glowing cores that floated around him now seemed to dance, twirling and spinning in perfect harmony with each other.
"GOODBYE, CRIMINAL," he spanned in the air before striking down with his hammer, grabbing the sculk handle with both hands as he aimed down toward Stark.
"…!" Stark's eyes widened, even he knew that thing was no joke.
And when he saw the perfect opportunity to avoid the attack…
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," he rolled away.
But… for the first time ever…
For the first time since he acquired [Invincible Dodge]… he actually failed to dodge, missing the window of opportunity by a split second.
The reason was simple: two of the dark spheres spinning around Warden suddenly rushed toward his legs, and he used them as platforms to jump again as Stark avoided.
"FUCK IT," Stark got ready, "DODGE CONTROL!"
But…
[One of the 'Dark Spheres' has stopped the use of your skill!]
He used two spheres to juke Stark into using [Invincible Dodge] and waited 3 seconds in the air so he couldn't combo dodge him, then used his final sphere (which couldn't be used since a sphere can only do one thing at a time) to stop him from using [Dodge Control].
That Warden… was way too smart.
"Justice is the winner in the end, it seems," Warden actually smiled, his face full of malice as he began to go down.
And then… as he spanned one more time… the colossal hammer slammed down onto Stark's position, the force of the blow sending shockwaves throughout the prison and shaking the very foundations of the structure.
"-93827!"
"GAH…" Stark's eyes went blank as he received the damage, his HP reaching 0, "…"
But instead of falling like he usually does… Stark held on for a few more seconds, his pure determination stopping him from dying, even though he knew it was inevitable.
[Stark HP: 0/33500]
Stark noticed that there was sculk all over his body, taking over his legs and entire torso, leaving only his head visible: that sculk was taking control of him even though he was about to die.
"I sense that your life force is going down in opposition to before, looks like it truly is the end of the line for you, prisoner," Warden smiled as he kept looking at Stark being taken over.
Soon enough, half his face, his hair, his mouth and his nose were taken by sculk, leaving only one of his eyes, burning with crimson aura out.
"It is already a miracle that your determination is keeping you alive," Warden nodded slightly, acknowledging Stark's strength, "But it's time to fall," and as he snapped his fingers…
The rest of the sculk too over Stark's eyes, his pupils shaking as rage took over his entire being.
Even if he was revived now, even if he somehow came back, the sculk would still deal damage and kill him as he would only have 1 HP.
He was done for, he couldn't live anymore.
The trial… beat him.
And yet… the last thing he did as his last remaining eye was taken over by the dark blue liquid… was look at Sora.
She had a shocked expression on her face, holding her mouth with her right hand and visible tears appearing on it.
"Sorry…" he couldn't hear her as his ears were covered, but he could see her mouth's movements, "I'll be joining you all soon…"
His eye was taken over by the liquid.
And then… nothing.
He couldn't see anything, his entire vision was covered by that thing, and all that Stark could feel was his own heart still holding on, beating slightly as if to keep him alive, trying its hardest not to lose hope.
Losing hope is like accepting defeat, and in this case, if Stark did do that, then both him and Sora would be wiped out.
No one would remember him.
But this was an unacceptable thought to Stark: would everything he did be in vain?
He wanted to be strong, he wanted to show the world that he was here, maybe try to get into a relationship at some point and leave his print on this ruthless world.
But now... as he was facing the Warden, an enemy impossible to even imagine or defeat for classifiers that were level 100 or above...
He felt like it could maybe be the end.
"..."
[No it's not, get up.]

chapters.title: Chapter 218 - 218: Last Revive
chapters.content:
[Do you want to be revived?]
[Y/N]
Stark opened his eyes again and found himself in a dark space, with nothing in view except for that crimson panel before him.
"…" Stark had already been in this place twice before.
Every second that passes in this space is one in real time, meaning that he needed to be quick to make his decision.
[You have 60 seconds to decide, otherwise it is game over!]
He was put on a timer, if he passed that minute he would be dead forever.
But…
"What is the point…" Stark looked down.
His body was taken over by the sculk, Warden had made sure this time that Stark wouldn't be revived, and even if he did then he would be killed.
So what is the point if doing this… why would he revive himself just to die?
[30 seconds remain!]
Stark remembered everything he had went through, not only in this trial but since his appearance in this world and even in his past life.
"…"
[20 seconds remain!]
Nobody is waiting for him beyond this trial, he had no friends or family, all of them probably thought he had already died.
[Are you sure?], a panel appeared in front of him, and right next to it appeared a picture of a smiling Lana.
"…Yes."
[Are you sure?]
A picture of his hotel room (the one he was currently in), as well as dozens of pictures of videos showcasing his power in battle.
"Maybe…"
[Are you sure?]
A final picture, one where Dora had that terrified expression on her face, one that actually scared even Stark as he was used to her being emotionless.
[10 seconds remain!]
[Make your choice!]
"…"
~FWISH~
And when all his thoughts were culminating into his answer…
A crimson replica of Stark appeared five meters away right in front from him.
"You…" nothing like that had ever happened before as normally in this void between life and death, he had always been alone, "What?"
And yet… the only thing that [Domination] replica of Stark did was bend its arm, pointing at him.
"Stop being a bitch, get up," this was all it said in Stark's voice before disappearing.
"…" at this point, Stark's entire existence was taken over by his crimson aura and rage, his pupils shaking so fast they almost became invisible to the naked eye.
And then…
[3 seconds remaining]
[Do you want to be revived?]
[Y/N]
Stark clicked on Y with all his strength, shattering the panel itself as his body and consciousness were transported back to reality.
[Make use of that chance, Chosen One.]
***
"Foolish," Warden peeked one more time at Stark's figure, which was now completely covered by the sculk, making it look like a pile of mud, nobody aware that a human was inside at first glance, "The moment I kill you is the end now."
He turned back toward Sora, who had her stomach against the ground, her right hand positioned against her mouth, and her left one reaching for Stark.
For the first time in her life she cried, and for the first time in her life she actually felt sad and shocked.
This was the power of a [Death] domination trial, it was unlike anything anyone could imagine.
They didn't know each other for that long, and yet the fact they fought together and were the last two alive built a strong connection, beyond anything possible in such amount of time.
Sora couldn't deceive herself: Stark was dead, he couldn't have a second [Revive Token].
And so… she just looked at the warden, who was slowly approaching her, creating another [Colossal Sculk Hammer] out of nowhere, ready to smash her and engulf her in the dark blue liquid, much like her companion.
But right as he reached her and was ready to kill the final prisoner…
~FWISH, BOOM~
Behind him, a vortex of crimson aura formed around the pile of sculk he had trapped Stark in, and as if it was allergic to his aura, all the liquid flew away, revealing Stark's figure as he got up, his eyes red with crimson aura and fury.
He had a neutral expression on his face, not saying anything as he immediately began to walk toward the warden, cracking his fingers.
"What the…?" Warden looked back, his eyes widening and actual fear displayed on his face, "How is this… possible?"
But he wasn't the only one: Sora also looked surprised, unable to comprehend how in the world could Stark get out of such a situation.
Not only was he out of [Revive Tokens], meaning that he could revive himself alone to begin with, but also that he somehow eliminated all the sculk that stopped him WHILE BEING DEAD.
None of this made sense for neither of them.
And all they could do was watch as Stark slowly walked toward them, his eyes so determined and his aura is smooth and powerful there was no saying how strong he had become.
"…" not wanting to back away from a criminal, Warden also began to walk toward Stark while carrying his hammer, the two would soon enough meet.
~FWISH, FWISH, FWISH~
And add to that…
['Dodge Control' has been blocked by a "Dark Sphere"]
['Double Assault' has been blocked by a "Dark Sphere"]
['Heaven's Wrath' has been blocked by a "Dark Sphere"]
Warden actually used his three spheres to completely block Stark's three most powerful skills, scared that he would be able to take him by surprise using them.
"Doesn't matter," Stark shook his head as he spoke, "Was planning to end your pathetic life with my own hands anyway."
Hearing those words, Warden looked at his [Colossal Sculk Hammer] for a few seconds, then threw it toward Stark in a quick gesture.
The boy easily avoided it by stepping to the side, his eyes not leaving the warden for a single second as he did that.
"Alright, I like to catch prisoners with my own hands too," Warden smiled, hiding the small amount of fear deep inside himself as he positioned his own hands, both filled with intense blue aura and sculk, ready to throw down with Stark.
"Doesn't matter to me," Stark positioned himself as well, "You're going to die either way, and your first mistake was putting all that shit on top of my body and thinking it could ever stop me."
[Warden HP: 21339/640000]
[Stark: HP: 1/33500]
Stark was one hit away from dying and didn't have all his skills, while Warden had his advanced armor and all his skills to fight back against the human.
No more second chances now, Stark couldn't revive himself if he was hit, meaning that this was his last attempt at beating this hellish trial.
The second trial was much, MUCH harder than the first, this was a certainty now.
"…" all Sora could do was watch, her legs damaged, she herself didn't know she could let all these emotions flow so easily at this very moment, and she didn't hate it.
"COME AT ME," Warden roared, shaking the entire floor.
"That's my line," Stark responded, he wasn't scared of that thing anymore, all he saw was a parasite trying to stop him from achieving victory.
Stark glanced at Sora one last time, and he quickly nodded at her while smiling, it was reassuring, giving her the impression that Stark could actually win.
And so…
[FIGHT!]
Winner takes all, loser goes to the shadow realm.

chapters.title: Chapter 219 - 219: The Final Assault of the Warden
chapters.content:
Not wasting a single second, Warden threw a direct jab, one filled with aura and power, toward Stark.
[Warden: 10382 speed]
His speed stat had actually reached over 10000 from the combination of both [Dark Spheres] and [The End of the Line], meaning that he was confident he would be MUCH faster than any of the humans present in this prison, which is how he had been able to take Stark aback the first time and kill him.
And yet…
~FWISH~
Stark moved his head to the side, the punch striking only a few centimeters from where he was, yet his pupils never leaving the warden, who was quite surprised by the sheer speed of the human.
And in response…
Stark swung back, his fist filled with crimson aura and rage, aiming for Warden's armor as his face was too difficult to reach.
"ARMOR SCULKIFICATION!" unable to avoid this attack since it was a direct counter of his, Warden activated his skill and filled his entire armor with sculk, pretty much stopping Stark's fist but also… engulfing the boy's arm in sculk again.
"You're an idiot, aren't you," Warden smiled as he pointed at Stark's right arm, which was progressively getting taken over by the liquid, "You're done for again."
But in response, Stark just looked at his arm for a few seconds, tilting his face as if he was confused how did this changed anything.
And then…
~BOOOOOM~
His arm literally exploded with crimson aura, sending away all the sculk that was from it, almost like his aura was an antivirus against that bacteria.
"???" Warden's eyes widened.
"I think you're the idiot," Stark swung again, and this time the attack actually hit as Warden was sent back by a few meters, although it was just his legs sliding against the ground.
"-13827!" his HP was reduced even more than before, scaring him more than it should.
He had vowed to fight against criminals forever, until he died doing his job, and yet… in front of this one prisoner… he felt like he was nothing.
"Aura Smash, Crimson Spears," he summoned three spears and fists and sent them at the warden, who extremely easily avoided them all, "Crimson Ball Transmission," he summoned the ball in his left hand, but instead of instantly throwing it, he kept it inside, just incase something happened.
"SCULK SURGE!" Warden pointed his arm at Stark, then began to fire bursts of sculk at the boy, who ran around in circles around the boss.
"Didn't we say we would only be using our fists?" Stark tilted his head as he slid on the ground.
"You threw projectiles at me, so I consider the deal to be over," truthfully, even if Stark hadn't done that, he would have started using his other skills anyway: deep down he knew he wouldn't win against Stark in a one on one with their fists, even though his were enhanced.
"Oh well," Stark shrugged.
And then…
~FWISH, DASH~
He closed in the distance between the two of them in mere instants, the speed so fast even Sora had a hard time following those two as they exchanged blows and avoided each other.
This kept going for a few minutes, none of them to damage one another as the sculk armor absorbed all the damage Stark would deal, while the sculk Warden sent would be neutralized by Stark's aura.
And after a while…
"WIELDING CROSS," Stark grimaced as he summoned the giant glowing crimson cross right above him.
"…!" Warden took a few step backs.
But before he could do anything…
~FWISH, SWING~
Stark dashed at him again and… swung the giant cross at him, the holy power now also extremely intense, at least strong enough to scare Warden.
"COME BACK TO ME, HAMMER OF JUSTICE," he pointed his right arm toward his hammer that had fallen right in front of the giant exit door of the prison, and its handle began to be surrounded by dark blue aura.
~FWISH~
And as if controlled by an invisible thread, the hammer began to float and flew back to Warden's hand, who immediately used it to deflect the first blow of the cross.
But the holy power was still slightly more powerful than the warden's counter attack, meaning that even though he didn't receive any damage, he was still pushed back.
"What the…"
Not letting him a single instant to rest, Stark pushed himself toward Warden, swinging his cross to the other side as he spanned.
Yet again, it was met with the powerful hammer of the warden, who deflected it.
[One attack remaining!]
His cross could only attack one more time before disappearing, and so Stark knew he needed to make it count.
He jumped in the air, joining his two hands together and mimicking the movement of Warden smashing his [Colossal Sculk Hammer] at Stark like before.
And so… the cross did the same, rushing at Warden from above.
"…!" this attack was much more powerful than the others somehow, and he knew he wouldn't be able to deflect it without receiving damage.
So he decided to finally end this once and for all, actually using his brain to outsmart Stark.
He had always thought using sheer strength would be enough as he was extremely powerful, but that didn't seem to be the case against all opponents, you actually needed to use your brain against some otherwise you would lose, don't you, huh?
"FLICKERING MOVEMENTS!"
~CLICK~
Stark's vision went completely dark, as if all the light had been purposely shut in his eyes.
And then…
~CLICK~
His vision came back.
"Goodbye," and as expected, Warden was right behind him, already beginning to swing down his hammer.
But…
"Dumbass," Stark smiled as he snapped his fingers.
~SNAP, FWISH~
Remember how he had used [Crimson Ball Transmission] yet kept the crimson ball in his hands?
Well… right as his vision went black, he immediately gently threw the ball behind him without even looking back, meaning that it landed RIGHT behind Warden.
~SMASH~
Warden smashed his hammer in Stark's location, creating a massive explosion and a crater forming in that spot.
But Stark was already behind him in the air, ready to punch him one last time and finally end this battle once and for all.
"…" Warden's horns glowed intensely, and then… the monster looked back with a wide smile on his face, as if he had predicted that Stark would do that.
"…?" Stark was confused, but he still went for the kill, as there was no reason not to hit when he had the opportunity to.
And yet… just as his fist was about to connect…
~FWISH, CLANG~
A collar-like chain wrapped itself around his neck, closing in on him as he was suddenly held back.
"Fucking… IDIOT," Warden laughed maniacally as he saw Stark on the ground, "You were SOOOO focused on everything you didn't even notice the chain slowly approach you!"
That's right, Warden had activated [Prisoner Chain], yet instead of making it go fast, he could also make it go slowly as to not alert his opponent.
And so just like that… Stark was stuck with a sculk-filled chain around his neck, one that would normally stop him from moving.
Warden lifted his hammer as he arrived in front of Stark, ready to finally end all of this, having outsmarted the human.
"So long, prisoner."
And then… he swung down.

chapters.title: Chapter 220 - 220: All Cores Destroyed
chapters.content:
~CLANG~
"…" Stark looked down at the sculk collar that had been placed around his neck, meaning he couldn't move as freely as before.
The first thing he did as he saw Warden swing down his hammer at him was back away, avoiding the blow as a single attack, even if it only as much as brushed his little pinky, would be enough to deal one damage and thus kill him.
And of course, Stark would never want to go in such an anticlimactic way.
"Oh? You can move now… you got stronger…" the first time he had been hit by [Prisoner Chain], the sculk and chain made it impossible for him to move as he was restrained, yet now… he was able to move with a neutral expression as it if meant nothing.
And then…
~BOOM~
Stark's neck literally exploded with aura as well, letting out a crimson fire that burned all the sculk, and weakening the chain as it was made of the same stuff.
"…?" Warden was surprised: his chain was actually designed to be EXTREMELY durable, so durable actually that it would take around five hits from his hammer to break it.
And yet… here Stark was, weakening the chain with that same neutral expression, with his aura alone.
Just how powerful was that crimson aura? Maybe even more powerful than even his?
'It's fine, he weakened it, but I can still act!' Warden dashed at Stark as he knew that the chain wouldn't go down with only that.
"Crimson Spears," but the boy summoned two spears: one was aimed at the chain that came from the ceiling, cutting it in half.
The [Prisoner Chain] collar that had been around his neck immediately vanished as its link had been cut, thus freeing him and allowing him to retrieve his movements.
And as for the other spear…
"Crimson spear, please shape my path," Stark's eyes glowed as he sent it toward Warden.
"FOOLISH," but Warden just crouched down to avoid it, since it was aimed at his head, why would the prisoner even attempt such a useless attack after everything they had gone through, did he not learn that Warden was now much faster?
But wait… was it truly aimed at his head?
Or…
"=)" Stark smiled as he saw the warden crouch, because at that moment, he knew that he had won.
~FWISH, SNAP~
"…!"
Warden actually stopped in his rush toward Stark, his eyes widening as he clenched his chest, his body trembling as he looked up at Stark, who was still smiling.
"What?" Stark mockingly asked as the warden had stopped.
"Y-You…" Warden looked up… and… one of his cores had been shattered by the spear.
The dust and dark blue remains fell in his hands, and all he could do was clench them both, anger filling his entire being.
He didn't receive damage from that, but it greatly decreased his powers and actually hurt him like hell, who said monsters couldn't feel pain? Judicator, Sierra and Warden sure as hell did, but maybe it was because they could talk that Stark noticed it.
Basically, Warden's cores are like his hearts, so what Stark did was like stabbing a human heart and shattering it in 1000 pieces.
"PRISONNNERRRRRRRR," he shouted, creating yet another spiral of sculk around him.
"Fine by me," Stark kept smiling.
After all… if one of the [Dark Spheres] that had been blocked was destroyed, it meant… that he got back one of his abilities!
['Double Assault' has been retrieved!]
Stark joined his hands together as he saw Warden approach him, spinning his hammer in his right hand as his eyes were filled with darkness.
"…" Sora on the other hand was just a spectator of it all, "These two are… what the hell are you… Stark Heartsouls…"
She knew of Stark's real name since she knew about him in real life, but she would have never, even in a thousand years, guessed that this guy was such… a monster.
And he was doing all of this to save her (at least that's what she told herself).
"Aura Smash," Stark sent three fists toward Warden, who didn't even bother to avoid them: the sole spiral of aura surrounding him literally evaporated the attacks, meaning no projectiles could get close to him anymore.
It was a physical match now.
Warden put himself in his position, he spread his legs, his sculk arm placed in front of his face, while he was spinning his hammer in the other one: he truly was ready to end it all.
Stark, on the other hand made quick jumps from left to right, his two fists in front of his face.
Both of them knew that this was the final assault of this battle.
"It was interesting while it lasted, prisoner."
"Couldn't agree more!" Stark smiled.
And then…
"DOUBLE ASSAULT!"
"THE END OF THE LINE!"
~BOOM, FWISH~
Both their legs exploded with aura as they closed in the distance between each other, Warden's hammer swinging while Stark's arm responded.
But Warden didn't realize, just HOW strong Stark was when using [Double Assault].
~FWISH, FWISH, FWISH~
Stark was WAY, WAY, WAYYYYY too fast, even for Warden to comprehend.
~BLOCK~
He blocked the blow with his hammer, but before he could even respond, Stark disappeared from his view.
[Horns Detection: Behind]
He turned around to block another attack.
Stark was running everywhere around the floor, leaving a trail of dark crimson aura, impossible to completely follow his movements as he attacked from different spots.
[Horns Detection: LEFT! RIGHT! UP! DOWN! BELOW! ON YOUR LEFT!]
Even his [Horns Detection] was struggling to keep up as it was clearly overwhelmed.
[15 seconds of 'Double Assault' remaining]
In addition to that, Stark had upgraded [Double Assault] before, and the new perk increased the usage from 10 to 20 seconds, meaning he could afford to do what he was doing.
[Horns Detection: L-Left!]
Stark appeared on the left as instructed, and Warden swung his hammer toward it.
But…
~FWISH~
Before the hammer connected with his attack, Stark used his speed to slide behind Warden.
[Horns Detection: BEHIND! BEHIND! BEHIND!]
~SMASH~
He instantly smashed his hammer behind him thinking that Stark was there, but…
"Idiot~" Stark jumped in the air and… punched another one of the warden's cores.
~SMASH, SNAP~
It shattered as well.
[Two cores destroyed, one remains]
"GAhhhh…" Warden fell to his knees while still deflecting Stark's attacks, his entire body was trembling, a second one of his hearts was destroyed, and if this kept going then he would surely die, "FUCK YOU PRISONER-"
But right as he shouted…
"Shhh…" Stark arrived in front of him, punching his hand upward, resulting in the heavy hammer to be sent flying toward the ceiling as his grip on it weakened.
~FWISH~
Stark jumped in the air toward the hammer, and while he was still above, both Sora and Warden looking at him…
~CRACK… BOOM~
He split the hammer in two, separating its handle from its head, meaning that it was useless and unusable, then launching the two parts in different directions.
['Dodge Control' has been retrieved!]
"DODGE CONTROL," he immediately used his skill as he descended back toward Warden, who through his sheer determination got up and was waiting for Stark to use his entire strength to punch him.
But…
~FWISH~
