Thanks to [Dodge Control], he is easily avoided all the attacks.
~FWISH, FWISH, FWISH~
Warden went on a crazy rampage, swinging his fists everywhere and extremely fast, putting his entire energy on his attacks as he only needed to just TOUCH Stark once.
And yet… nothing would hit.
Stark would LITERALLY teleport away from his attack at times, making it impossible for the warden to hit him.
[7 seconds remain for 'Double Assault']
[12 seconds remain for 'Dodge Control']
The reason Stark wasn't actually hitting Warden was because he literally couldn't: he threw way too many attacks, and [Dodge Control] gave him less control over his own body, meaning that even with its new perk, it was still hard to throw even one punch.
And yet… after a few seconds…
Stark saw THE opportunity.
A crimson line formed, moving in different directions toward the boss.
"IT'S THE END, WARDEN," Stark rushed while following that line, avoiding all the attacks.
~FWISH~
He spanned in the air as he avoided a [Warden Smash], arriving in front of the last [Dark Sphere], and then…
~PUNCH, BOOOOOM~
He punched it, using all his strength to take over his body for this simple action.
[All cores have been destroyed!]
['Heaven's Wrath' has been retrieved!]
Suddenly, the warden stopped everything he was doing, kneeling on the ground as liters of blood poured out from his mouth and nose.
"This is… insane…" he had a hard time breathing, and once he looked up… all he saw… was Stark, who was peeking at him from above, a wide and terrifying smile on his face.
"Are you done?" he asked, his gaze piercing the warden's soul.
And all the monster could do… was look down.
He was finished: even though he could rebuild his cores over time, he was too weakened to fight back anymore.
Stark… won.
The prisoners… won…

chapters.title: Chapter 221 - 221: Death of the Warden
chapters.content:
[Finish him]
Warden was kneeling, all his organs screaming for him to get up, yet it was impossible as all his cores had been destroyed, which were basically his hearts and the thing that kept his 'essence' alive.
Even if he somehow found the strength to get up, not only would he not be able to use his hammer, let alone summon it, but he wouldn't be able to use any of his skills or his sculk either.
He was fucked.
"Goodbye," Stark drew a circle in his palm, then pointed at the ceiling: he wanted to end this with a bang.
"HEAVEN'S WRATH," the crimson glow appeared on the ceiling, slowly charging up while Warden was unaware of it above since he couldn't even use [Horns Detection] properly either.
Then… Stark just ran away, heading toward Sora, and arriving in front of her in less than a second.
"C'mon, you owe me a lot for this," he shrugged as he carried her body and put her on his back, giving her a piggyback ride.
"…" Sora was back to her neutral and emotionless self, she had felt strong emotions during the fight as she knew her life was also on the line, and all that happened was frankly crazy, but now she was back to her normal self, "What about him," she pointed at the Warden, who was clenching his fists, his face mere centimeters away from the ground as he let out lots of blood from his mouth, "Aren't you going to kill him?"
"He is already done for," Stark looked back at her, and she just nodded as he pointed above, making her notice that crimson glow that was on the verge of exploding, its aura so powerful even Sora knew this was bad.
"Huh, what about it-" she didn't even have the time to finish her sentence that…
~BOOOOOOOM~
The powerful ray of crimson light descended from above, piercing through the ceiling and reaching Warden, who could only look up at the last second, his expression filled with utter despair as the attack reached him.
The blast created a shockwave that echoed throughout the entire prison, and it was for one simple reason: the beam actually traversed the ENTIRE foundation of the prison, from top to bottom.
Unfortunately, all monsters were "unsummoned" once all participants reached the next floor, but this would have made Stark get at least 10 levels otherwise.
"AAAAAAAAGGGGHHHHHHHHHH-" Warden screamed pierced their ears as they stood in front of the beam, observing its beauty, strands of golden holy aura also apparent in it for some reason, "PRIISOONNNERRRRRR-"
And then… nothing, no more sound, no more nothing, the Warden's presence had been completely erased.
The crimson of the beam hit Stark's and Sora's face as she peeked from his shoulder, her head cutely placed on it, although she wasn't blushing or anything as she remained emotionless, all she wanted was just to leave and go back to the safety of her home (well more like mansion, y'know).
"…" Stark looked at the beam for a whole minute, not averting his gaze even after it had disappeared, and it was as if he was lost in his own thoughts after everything that happened, his mind trying to replay the entire fight to assure that he did everything he did right.
"Hey?" Sora shook her hand in front of his face, bringing him back to reality.
As the beam disappeared, all that was left was a massive circular crater, and below it, you could see the four other floors as the power of the attack was so strong that it broke through the entire structure of the prison.
Warden was nowhere to be found, not even his ashes were visible anymore, like the other enemies Stark annihilated with the destructive beam.
Warden's legacy… was truly over.
And so that could only mean one thing…
[You have slain 'Warden, The Prisoner Killer lvl125', gained 5,240,000EXP!]
"Finally," Stark let out a sigh of relief, still gazing at the spot where the beam had struck.
No more tricks, that thing was truly dead.
And even cooler, the amount of EXP Stark got was exceptional.
"Did you get experience too?" he asked Sora, wondering if such a system existed as it would be unfair for only one person to get EXP if everyone fought, although this time he did most of the work.
"Yes," Sora nodded, "Around 1.8 million, what about you?" she asked.
"Haha…" Stark scratched the back of his head, "Huh, a little above 5 million!"
"…" Sora didn't show or say anything, but deep inside even she was astonished by the amount: this was beyond ANYTHING they had gotten until now.
She almost felt humiliated that she had gotten so little since it meant that she did much less work than Stark (which was true), and she was ashamed of herself for letting him save her not once, but twice!
In the end, she just sighed as she acknowledged the boy's strength: there was no denying he was her savior, and she was grateful for that.
~DING~
~DING, DING~
Sora was surrounded by the golden glow of leveling up once, while Stark twice.
'Feels farm…' she thought, she had never been close to anyone, but the warmth of someone as they leveled up felt very comfortable.
[Your level has increased to level 59, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 60, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Experience: 1293711/2150000]
'…'
He was level 60, meaning that he would be able to unlock another skill using a card.
But before he could even do that… a crimson panel appeared in front of both Sora and Stark.
And it could only be one thing…
[The 'Warden' has been defeated!]
[Survivors: 2]
[CONGRATULATIONS], as this panel appeared, dozens upon dozens of confetti and fireworks lit up and exploded right before reaching the high ceiling, the face of both Stark and Sora drawn with the fireworks.
[You have officially completed the second domination trial "Lucullus Prison" from the "Death" difficulty, granting both of you incredible rewards based on effort in the trial!]
And then, another panel appeared before Stark, this one different from Sora's as it was the rewards they would receive, each one of them getting different ones as it wouldn't be fair for all of them to get the same rewards if one person clearly did more than the other.
And obviously…
[MVP: Chosen]
[+3 Equipment Pieces, +20000 HP]
"Ready," Stark suddenly said while looking at Sora, who was also inspecting her panel.
"…" she just nodded, making sure to hold Stark as her legs were pretty damaged from the attacks of the warden.
"Alright!" he warmly smiled as he began to walk toward the giant metal door.
And right as they checked all their panels…
[Opening exit!]
The sound of machinery became ten times more intense, gray smoke escaping from every part of the giant metal door as pipes were going up and down, buttons were flickering, and cogwheels were turning.
~CREAK~
The middle part of the metal door began to slowly separate one side from the other, opening itself as Stark continued walking toward it.
A bright light could be seen on the other side, impossible to see what was beyond as it was completely white.
And after a minute…
~SWHIP~
The sound of machinery completely stopped, and the metal door stopped moving as it opened more than enough for them to pass through.
Stark stopped right before he was about to enter the light, with no way to return, looking back at floor 0.
There was lots of damage on it from the battle of him against Warden, and all he could do was sigh as he remembered everything that had happened.
10 were alive at the fourth sublevel a few hours ago, and now that they were at the top, only 2 were left, mostly because they all killed each other for rewards and items.
"…" Stark let out a quick smile.
"Let's just go," Sora dared to ask, she truly hated that place, especially this floor.
"Fine," Stark shrugged as he passed the threshold of the metal door and entered the light.
[2 people have successfully escaped the 'Lucullus Prison'!]
[Sending you back to a "safe place"!]
Stark's body began to slowly evaporate, starting from his legs and going up his torso and head, and Sora as well.
"Hey, Stark," Sora suddenly spoke, breaking the silence as they were traversing the threshold between reality and the trial.
"Oh, you know my name, huh," Stark sighed, "What do you want?"
"Thank you," this was all she wanted to say as she actually ALMOST let out a smile.
"No problem," Stark patted her head, it was just a reflex at this point and he quickly realized what he did so he removed it, "If we meet each other again, which probably won't happen, then just treat me somewhere!"
"Deal," she nodded.
And then…
~FWISH, FWISH~
Their bodies evaporated, then were sent back to reality.
[Congratulations on completing the second 'Domination' trial!]
[You're on a roll, Chosen!]

chapters.title: Chapter 222 - 222: Back in the Real World
chapters.content:
"HWAHHH~" Stark opened his eyes.
~SPLASH, SPLASH~
"Huh?" every time he moved to get up, he could hear the sound of water, and that's when he remembered, "Oh shit…"
He had fought Soulayer right before entering the trial, thus meaning that he had been transported to the trial from this location, and so he was back here when he woke up since his "real life" body never left that space, or at least that's what he theorized.
He got up from his slumber, the back of his head wet from staying in the 'soul water' for a long time.
"Oh," and as he looked up, he saw that Soulayer's body was still lying there, dead, "I mean… I guess I did kill him heh…"
But that wasn't what interested Stark, instead, what did was…
"Here!" it was the two dark blue sparkles around Soulayer's body as they were pieces of equipment dropped from defeating the boss.
He had failed to grab them right before being transported to the trial, but luckily they were still here, and seems like nobody even came to this place as his body would have probably been found.
In the end, none of this really mattered: he had completed the trial, got his rewards, and now had five pieces of equipment to check out/sell.
He kneeled down to grab both dark blue sparkles and placed them inside his [Spatial Inventory], not wanting to stay any longer since this place smelled awful because of the rotting corpse of Soulayer.
But… wait a damn minute…
How can a corpse rot so fast…?
He had only been gone for a few hours… so…
"…!"
[You have been inside the 'Lucullus Prison' for 3 weeks!]
"…" Stark sighed, "Alright."
He had believed that time would flow NORMALLY, much like during the first trial, but it looks like he was wrong, every trial had a different concept of time.
"Need to get out anyway," he mumbled as he noticed that a portal had appeared in the distance on top of the 'soul water'.
He marched toward it, then jumped with not a second of hesitation.
Not a single thing was going through his mind at that moment except for the intense desire so sleep on the bed of his new hotel room.
Things such as his new skill, checking out his equipment, or whatever else that would happen in the future… didn't matter, just for this moment.
~FWISH~
Stark traversed the portal and immediately was sent back to the start of the rift, where dozens upon dozens of people could still be seen fighting monsters to level up.
Yet, the moment he left the portal…
An overwhelming aura completely twisted the atmosphere, taking aback everyone, monsters and classifiers.
And then… sensing its source, everyone turned their eyes to look at him.
Everyone's heart raced with caution and a bit of fear as they saw Stark walk toward them, his body completely covered with crimson aura, yet his eyes looking into the void, tired, yet still powerful.
They let him pass easily as he kept going in a straight line, making sure not to annoy such a being as they felt it in their bones that this thing was extremely powerful.
And then…
~FWISH~
Stark jumped into the exit portal, leaving that rift behind.
"What the fuck was that?"
"Contact the association, was that a monster?!"
"No, its a human, just forget about it and don't lose focus!"
Some just wanted to forget about that thing, although it would probably haunt their nightmares.
"…" Stark kept his neutral expression as he was transported through the threshold between the rift and reality, and after a few seconds…
~FWISH~
He emerged on the other side.
Yet again, his arrival was met with several reactions, and some even tried to some him, but one look from his tired eyes was enough to stop them from acting or touching him.
Stark… just… wanted… to… rest.
Stark arrived in the massive room which regrouped all the portals to different rifts, thousands upon thousands of classifiers there.
"..." the number of widened eyes on him obviously increased, more and more people stopping to check out what that boy was doing, as his aura was still sickening to be around.
But then...
"Hey, bud," a classifier with a large chin and. very short gray hair, almost making him look bald, could be heard behind Stark.
Stark turned around, his movements slow and smooth, making it feel like he could black out at any time.
The man before Stark was alone, and he was decently muscular, although not on the extreme side like some other people, he was indeed tall though, at around 1.85cm.
"What the fuck are you doing?" the man spoke as soon as Stark looked at him in the eyes, the vortex of aura still in them as it took the man aback the moment he saw them, but he quickly recovered as to not lose face, "You're scaring people, why don't you leave?"
That guy tried so hard to act menacing, but Stark squinted his eyes in annoyance, clearly realizing what he was trying to do: he was just trying to be a hero, speaking up for the others, and receiving praise if Stark does leave.
"Hey," Stark spoke as he looked at him, and even the tone of his voice sent shivers down the man's spine, "Fuck off."
And so Stark turned back, walking toward the exit again.
But... the man couldn't allow that: if Stark had the last word of the matter, then he would just seem like a coward who ran away and be more humiliated than all the others.
And so...
~FWISH, DASH~
He summoned his sword, which was a claymore, in his hands, and dashed at Stark.
'I'm level 92, there's no chance he can beat me, his aura is probably just for intimidation!'
He didn't realize though... that Stark had just went through fucking hell, a hell he would have died in for sure.
And so... right as he swung his sword down...
~FWISH, BAM~
Stark, without even looking back, took one step to the side, avoiding the attack, and then... he punched the man in the stomach, not even letting him follow up with another strike.
~BOOM~
The impact could be heard through the entire room, the man sent flying toward the wall as everyone avoided his body.
He crashed against it and fell unconscious, the stares of everyone on him before looking back at Stark, astonished expressions on their faces.
"You were also just a false hero..." Stark mumbled as he finally left the room, nobody else annoying him after that even though his aura became even more powerful, remembering Warden increasing his power.
He arrived onto the streets, even more people watching and filming him, some even doing live streams, garnering thousands of viewers, yet all were shocked at the sight of Stark.
He hailed for a taxi, yet even after five minutes no one stopped for him, all too scared their lives.
"..."
Knowing no one would stop, Stark grabbed his phone from his [Spatial Inventory].
And... he did the unthinkable: he contacted Lana Moonless.
[You have 136 unread messages and 28 missed phone calls]
"..." Stark didn't even bother reading any of it.
Instead, he began to type on his phone.
[Stark Heartsouls: Help, I'm at the fighting district, can you come pick me up?]
This was all he said, it was currently 7pm, so he didn't expect any response for awhile.
Yet...
~DING~
His message was immediately set as "read", and a response came even faster.
[Lana Moonless: Where were you again? Anyway, don't move I'm close so I'll be there in 10 minutes!]

chapters.title: Chapter 223 - 223: Domination's New Look
chapters.content:
"Oh wow," Stark was surprised she responded this quick, "Must mean she was really worried, but oh well."
To be honest, Stark was mostly focused on fighting and getting stronger, so romantic relationships were something who didn't pass through his head even once.
Whether in his past life as an accountant or this one, who would him anyway?
And so after ten minutes of just waiting, the overwhelming crimson aura not disappearing once, and even Stark not knowing how to remove it...
~VROOM~
A beautiful luxury car painted in red appeared before him.
Some classifiers even stopped pointing at him and filming his appearance to check out the car, as it was a beast that would probably cost a fortune.
"What the hell happened to you?" Lana had a weirded out expression as she lowered the windows, confused how Stark could end up like this.
"Stuff," Stark was actually surprised she was able to recognize him even though his appearance should be hidden by the aura, but oh well, a stalker always recognizes their target, don't they?
"Anyway, just get in, we have things to talk about," Lana patted the seat beside hers, and Stark got inside the car, a cute smile on her face as she didn't look scared of Stark one bit in comparison to all the others.
"Thanks."
And so just like them, both of then drove off, toward Stark's hotel room as he instructed the blonde-haired girl.
***
(20 minutes later)
The ride was just Lana talking about what she did during those three weeks, while Stark remained silent, too tired to even engage in the conversation.
And Lana clearly noticed it as she noticed his eyes were slowly closing, although he was trying not to fall asleep.
"Here we are," she parked herself in an empty spot.
"Anyway, thanks," Stark was grateful, and he got out of the car.
But...
~TUT, TUT~
Lana also left, locking the car behind her.
"What?" he titled his head.
"I'll just stay a bit, I did say I wanted to talk about something, right? If you read my messages you should know about it," Lana raised her eyebrows, absolutely confident Stark hadn't read any of them.
"Huh..." Stark scratched his head, "Yeah... just come up."
They reached his hotel room rather quickly, and Stark was thankful he had paid for a full month stay, otherwise it would have probably been taken by someone else.
"Nothing much," Stark opened the door and welcomed Lana in, he was still tired but if she wanted to say something important, then he would need to listen.
Not wasting a single second, he jumped and laid on the bed, his face staring at the ceiling, yet his body still surrounded with that crimson aura.
"Anyway, I'll be quick," Lana pulled out her phone and tapped a few times on it, before pointing the screen at Stark.
And on it was written…
[Rift Conqueror Academy Entrance Ceremony Cooldown: 3 days]
"…!" Stark's eyes widened, he had literally completely forgotten about it, his thoughts only filled with the idea of finally resting after going through that trial.
"Yeah, as you may know, the academy is in the capital, which is the most powerful part of the entirety of Fellarburg as it regroups all the guilds and classifiers that truly make a difference, meaning that we'll need to go move there," she said casually as if it was the most obvious thing in the world.
"…" Stark just stared at her as she explained.
"My father has already recommended you and paid for the tuition fee, meaning you should have received an email containing all the information, anyway, I already got a train scheduled to move me to the capital as it will take a few hours to reach it," she smiled, "Oh and, don't tell it to anyone, but I heard anyone who is late by even a single minute to the ceremony will be instantly expelled, truly harsh huh…"
"Huh…" Stark's face was slowly darkening, at least more than it already had.
"…" Lana stared at him for a second, before letting out a giant laugh, "Hahaahahha~ I knew you would know nothing, It's just like you," she wiped one of her eyes with one of her fingers, "Don't worry, I also got you a train ticket!"
"Oh!" he almost wanted to jump and hug her, but being tried and in this form made it kind of hard, "Thanks!"
Stark had the habit of checking his emails since he was an accountant before, so he would have surely figured it out, but the [Domination] trial had put him to sleep for three weeks, meaning he couldn't know anything.
"Anyway, I'll let you rest, make sure not oversleep as I'll come pick you up tomorrow," she gently waved at Stark as she headed toward the exit, peeking her beautiful face out of the door right before closing it, "See you later, Stark."
"Cya," she was cute, but Stark just wanted to sleep, as so as soon as she closed the door…
~FWISH, SLAM~
He immediately fell asleep, not able to contain it the dizziness in his head anymore.
***
~FWISH~
"…" Stark opened his eyes, and once he got up, "Ah shit, here we go again."
He was yet again in the black void again.
And obviously, before him were [Alchemist] and… huh, what?
[Alchemist] was there in his white robe and holding his potions.
But…
[Domination], even though he was weird, looked different than usual.
He still had that giant smile on his face, one that was evil, much like the [Superior Clone], but… instead of his body being completely made out of crimson aura, his pupils had a golden cross in them, and strands of holy aura could be seen in his figure.
"New look," Stark smiled.
"You could say that," [Domination] responded.
The reason was obvious: [Domination] had merged with [Exorcist], meaning that they became one, although it seemed like [Domination]'s personality completely ruled out [Exorcist], fragments of his holy aura and power being the only thing left.
In the end, it didn't matter, as it meant less annoying doppelgängers to speak to.
"Good work," Alchemist clapped his hands together.
"I do agree," Domination nodded.
It was the first time they actually praised Stark instead of blatantly insulting him or criticizing what he was doing.
"But…" Domination's expression darkened, "It is not over."
"Remember you're starting your life inside that rift conqueror academy or whatever, be ready to fight things possibly even stronger than the warden," Alchemist shrugged.
"…" Stark nodded.
And then…
""Get up, then, dumbass,"" both Alchemist and Domination (Exorcist) spoke, pointing at the sky.
And when Stark looked up, he saw a giant demon, one that looked very similar to EGO.
"It's time for things to get real," Domination snapped his fingers, and both of them, as well as the demon, disappeared.
And just like that, Stark's consciousness began to fade as well.
He knew that what they said was true: the Rift Conqueror Academy regrouped people that were over level 125, meaning that they some would potentially be able to fight back against Warden, if not beat him.
And… he would have to join this academy, and fight his way to the top to survive as the passing rate for JUST the first year is less than 5%.
Just how bad could this school be…?
Well… he was about to find out.
That it was true hell as well.

chapters.title: Chapter 224 - 224: The Unchecked Equipment: Ghoul, Soulayer, Trial
chapters.content:
"Hah~ Hah~" Stark opened his eyes in the real world, he was sweating all over, his pupils shaking, "Fucking hell…" he quickly got out of his bed and checked out the time on his phone.
It was currently 5:10am, meaning that he had only slept around 9 hours, a record compared to his other times, which often ended in 2-3 days sleep sessions since being in the dream world made it so that time passed... rather quickly.
And strangely enough, his body had recovered completely, and best news of all: the crimson aura had disappeared, meaning he wouldn't scare people anymore by simply going outside, WOOHOO!
Well, not like he really cared about that since when he was in that form, he truly felt invincible, able to one shot all of them, but it would be annoying if he was like that and his identity was revealed as it would SURELY be much more troublesome...
"Lana said she would come today, but when," Stark decided to check out his emails as he did remember Lana telling him he had received an admission letter from the academy as everyone received one when they were accepted.
[To:[email protected] ]
[Congratulations on your admission to the 'Rift Conqueror' academy, Stark Heartsouls, your tuition has been paid, and we have received a recommendation from the highly praised 'Archer King', thus allowing you to access our magnificent school.]
'Seems normal,' this did seem like an average admission letter.
But right under that…
[Enjoy your current peaceful life while you can! Because the moment you set foot inside our school… you will officially become a student, and your life will become a living hell until you either complete your first year alive or quit midway, don't give up though!]
'Wow,' this suddenly became violent and more eery, as expected from a school with a 5% chance of passing the first year.
Stark shrugged, all he had to do was survive whatever shit they threw at him, and by the looks of it, it wouldn't be a normal school where you just learn about things.
Plus... didn't Stark already survive two hells by himself? So it didn't make much more of a difference, since whatever they did, it could NEVER, EVER, be as bad as the [Domination] trial, especially the last one with that warden.
Then he moved on to his messages, and he had actually received a new one from Lana right after sleeping.
[Lana Moonless: I'll be coming at exactly 3PM since the train leaves at 4PM, please be ready and have your luggage with everything, we won't be coming back here for a very long time since the capital has EVERYTHING needed.]
This was good.
But this also meant one thing: Stark was finally able to check out everything he wanted to check, since it gave him enough time to do so.
He had 6 pieces of equipment to check: 1 from the Corrupted Ghoul, 2 from Soulayer, and 3 from the trial.
In addition to that, he also had his [Conjoined Warrior's Cloak] and [Mirror Master's Crystal Shard], which he had NEVER used before as they were way too annoying to do so in battle.
The latter could be infused into a ring, so Stark thought he should maybe look into that.
Yet Stark hadn't noticed one thing until now: the fact [Soulbearer's Embrace] had not activated even ONCE during the trial to give him back some of his health.
And the reason was simple: once Stark reached for his neck… the necklace wasn't there anymore.
At some point, probably before the trial even started, he had lost it as it could easily be detached from his neck if the battle became too intense, no wonder it was only from the [Rare] category.
"Fucking hell," Stark sighed, but it didn't matter much to be honest as the amount of health he regained at this point would be so small and insignificant there would be no point in even having it: he needed better equipment/items now.
"Status window," he whispered.
…
[Level:] 60
[Health:] 57000/57000
[Bloodline:] Human
[Classes:] Domination; Alchemist; Exorcist (Absorbed by Domination).
[Talent:] Chosen one
[Attributes:] Strength 3781; Speed 4309; Mind/Soul 4223; Stamina 3956; Defense 3512
…
His HP had indeed gone up by 20000 in addition to the ones he got from leveling up, meaning he was more resistant, which was good.
[Skill Points: 24 Available]
'I should probably wait to upgrade my skills to silver though as to allow them to be upgrade to level 25…' he thought, it would definitely be the smarter option since upgrading [Domination] and the essential skills was definitely the right choice.
So for now… he just needs to check his equipment, then try to go to the trading district to buy everything he needs when he is at the capital, the strongest place of Fellarburg, and also the biggest.
And of course, sell the spare equipment, he still had [Sierra's Crystal Bow] after all since he kept it in case he ended up being an archer, but looks like fate decided otherwise.
"Spatial Inventory," Stark summoned the inventory right above his bed, then thought of all the items before pulling them out one after the other.
Six sparkles were now on his bed, so brilliant in fact it was impossible to see what the item was, increasing the element of surprise.
Stark reached for one of them, it was an actual eyeball the size of Stark's palm, and immediately...
...
[Item:] The Ghoul's Corrupted Eye
[Type:] Arrow Spell
[Class:] Archer
[Tier:] Legendary
[Required Level:] 100
[Quality:] Normal
[Attributes:] +1200 Mind, +1000 HP
[Special Perks:] infuse this eye into a ring or around a necklace, then wear it to be able to cast the [Corruption] spell around your arrows, each time an arrow hit, the enemy will be slightly more corrupted, until eventually unable to even move.
...
'Archer...' Stark thought, basically he couldn't use it, and the fact it was legendary meant even more cash by selling it.
Then he quickly moved to the other sparkles, this time reaching for the dark green ones, which were from Soulayer.
He reached for one of the items, and it was... a sword, a greatsword to be precise, the exact one Soulayer had been wielding when he was fighting him in that rift right before entering the domination trial, so Stark knew that it was pretty powerful just by its looks.
...
[Item:] Soulayer's Greatsword
[Type:] Sword
[Class:] Warrior
[Tier:] Legendary
[Required Level:] 110
[Quality:] Artifact
[Attributes:] +2000 Strength
[Special Perks:] None, it's just a really good sword.
...
And the next item was... something he had actually never gotten until now.
It was but a simple piece of paper, on it was the drawing of three green orbs with creepy faces on them, a text reading [Triple Soul Summon] above.
...
[Item:] Skill Card
[Skill:] Triple Soul Summon
[Class:] Magus, Assassin, Soul Wielder
[Rank:] Epic
[Description:] Summon three souls that aid you in battle, enhancing three of your weapons/skills.
...
It was a downgrade of the real thing as the real skill was [Mythical] and much more powerful than that, but oh well, it could get him good money anyway, so he didn't ask questions, it was already a privilege to be able to earn money like that instead of working a 9-5 like in his previous life.
Stark threw the two items from Soulayer on the bed right next to the bow, ghoul eye and warrior cloak as they were of no use to him, then turned toward the final and most interesting items: the ones granted to him by the [Domination] trial.
He reached for the first one, and it was... a horn, just a single horn, one that looked oddly similar to the ones Warden was wearing.
...
[Item:] Warden's Horn
[Type:] Wearable
[Class:] All
[Tier:] Legendary
[Required Level:] 50
[Quality:] Good
[Special Perk:] Ability for the user to use "Horns Detection", Warden's Skill, when you put this horn on your head (it will automatically stick once you put it against it)
...
Stark noticed that the required level was lower, something he could actually use, as any class could use it as well.
He hadn't really paid attention, but all other pieces of equipment required a level well above 100 since the monsters he had defeated to get those were around that level.
Yet... for the [Domination] items, the level was enough for him to use it, probably since the trial itself knew that this was the level of its winning participants.
But even then...
'Useless,' he threw the horn in the pile of items he would sell.
Why you ask?
Well.... because... [Horns Detection] was simply worse than [Focus], just a downgrade version of the skill, so what would be the point in keeping it.
Moving on to the next item, and it was... a giant fucking hammer.
'Yeah, no,' Stark didn't even bother checking it out, all that he knew was that its name was [Warden's Sculk Hammer] and that it had no special perks.
And then… he turned his eyes toward the last item.
It was his final chance to get something that could actually help him…
"Come on," Stark's aura actually began to appear around him as he reached for it.

chapters.title: Chapter 225 - 225: Sculk Necklace and Selling
chapters.content:
Stark reached for the final item of the lot, hoping with all his being that it would be useful in battle to him.
He literally only had two pieces of equipment: the [Purgatory Shadow] which was way too useful and saved his life quite sometimes already, and the [Crystalheart Band] which absorbed 10 percent of damage, pretty useless to be honest as he could die from pretty much anything and the damage removed wasn't even noticeable.
There were probably some [Mythical] equipment pieces that remove up to 90 percent of damage received, this was a certainty, but Stark wouldn't afford or be able to use them anyway.
"COME ON," he swiftly grabbed the dark blue, and in his hands was… a necklace, "Oh."
Immediately, Stark realized what this was.
…
[Item:] Sculk Necklace
[Type:] Necklace
[Class:] Domination
[Tier:] Mythical
[Required Level:] 60
[Quality:] Artifact
[Special Perk:] Ability for the user to use three 'sculk attacks', with a 12 hours cooldown between use.
…
'…!' it was perfect: for the [Domination] class but also within his level range, and also the special perk did seem interesting.
He didn't understand what it meant with 'three sculk attacks', but he could always try it out in the [Memories Museum], couldn't he?
'Ok, now I need to sell the rest and buy that stupid breakthrough stone…' Stark mumbled.
He took a quick shower (he hadn't bathed for three weeks and the black water was actually disgusting), then wore some clothes and went outside.
As expected, rumors and videos of him yesterday spread across the entire city, if not country.
Dozens of videos of him walking and knocking out that classifier with one carefree punch spread like wildfire, people wondering who that mysterious entity (yes, entity, that thing couldn't be human), was.
In the end, Stark hailed for a taxi, someone actually stopping this time, and headed toward the trading district to do everything he needed to do.
He entered the [Classifiers Trading Association] then asked for a 'appraisal room', and was yet again led toward the luxurious rooms.
"You again, huh?" it was the same white-haired woman with long hair in a ponytail that was smoking her cigarette, "I expect good stuff after you've been gone for this long!"
"Don't expect too much, I'm not even going to school yet," Stark smiled as he sat down on the red sofa right in front of the lady, he did remember checking her panel and that her name was "Violette Winkson".
And even though he said that…
~SNAP~
He snapped his fingers as he summoned his [Spatial Inventory] above the 'appraisal table', then all items that he wanted to sell appeared: the [Conjoined Warrior's Cloak], the [Mirror Master's Crystal Shard], [Sierra's Crystal Bow], the [Ghoul's Corrupted Eye], [Soulayer's Greatsword], the [Triple Soul Summon Skill Card], [Warden's Horn] , and [Warden's Sculk Hammer].
8 items to sell, 8 items that would earn him good money.
"Oh?" Violette lifted her eyebrows, her eyes glowing as she was currently using her [Item Appraisal] skill, something that made her wanted by hundreds of guilds and associations through the entire world, "These are… amazing…"
Skipping the entire process of checking every item and telling their price to Stark, they finally finished their appraising session.
And Stark gained… 8.58 million rher coins!
This was incredible compared to the 2.63 million he got from his last session, truly showcasing just how much better the items he was getting were than before.
With this amount, he could already afford to rent a luxury apartment!
But of course, this wasn't in Stark's projects, as he still had a lot to do.
"Thank you," he bowed at Violette, who was staring at him intently, her gaze full of suspicions.
"I wanna be nice to you kid, but you come out of nowhere and bring some of the greatest items from the 100-150 level range we get in months," Violette pressed her elbows on the luxurious wooden table, joining her hands, "Just what are you?" she asked again, having already demanded the last time they met.
"I'm just me, the average classifier," Stark smiled as he began to walk toward the door, "also I probably won't be coming here for a while since I start my academy year," he gazed at her, a massive and malicious smile on his face, "Goodbye, Violette," and so he left, closing the door behind.
"Fucking hell," Violette scratched her head, the 8 items Stark brought in front of her.
These items were truly incredible for their current level, and yet here he was acting as if it was nothing.
Also… she noticed that he got a lot stronger than before, his eyes now so powerful even she was slightly intimidated.
"Oh well…" she shrugged, "The customer is king, huh…" and so she began to fill the forms to send the items to the store or to check if anyone wanted them: she was sure they would be sold in under an hour if put on sale.
Stark didn't think much about it, but now his assets reached 13.5 million rher coins!
'Anyway… one more thing and I'm good…' oh and by the way, the [Classifiers Trading Association] is open 24/7, which is why he was able to reach it even though it is a little under 6 am.
Stark headed toward the [Market] section and specifically stopped at the [Boost Items] part, walking through the massive hallway with hundreds of classifiers.
And after a few seconds, he found the sign that read "Breakthrough Stone", looking at the many displays with screens showing different stones on them.
And so, just like that, he found the item he wanted.
…
[Item:] Breakthrough Stone (Bronze-Level)
[Tier:] Rare
[Quality:] Normal
[Perk:] Increases your skill level from 15 to 25 when you meet the conditions to do so.
[Price:] 6.2 million rher coins
…
"Holy shit, inflation hits hard," there was no way that thing was worth half his fortune.
And yet…
[Do you want to buy it?]
[Y/N]
[This will automatically remove the money from your account using your fingerprints]
[Oh, and by the way, no refunds.]
'Fuck off…' Stark groaned as he clicked on Y, taking the stone from the display as another one appeared right as he did that, 'At least that's done with.'
He had done everything he needed to do, and it was only around 6 am, meaning that he had lots of time in his hands.
'Well, let's get to my hotel room then prepare, what else, it did say that this school would be hell, huh…'
40 minutes later, Stark was back in his hotel room, the stone in his hands, his account full of money, and all his useless items sold.
He was COMPLETELY ready to begin his new chapter in life, and although he knew it would only get more difficult from now on, entering a school with powerful people, and possibly even some hidden [Domination] users, Stark knew that his sheer determination will be enough to overcome all of it.
'Well, anyway,' Stark looked at the 'Breakthrough Stone' in his hands, it was a rune with silver-colored symbols all over it, and the word 'silver' written on some sort of magic circle in the middle, an aura emanating from it, 'Alright.'
He put a lot of his aura inside the stone while holding it, and instantly, a panel appeared.
[Do you want to initiate the breakthrough from bronze to silver?]
[Y/N]

chapters.title: Chapter 226 - 226: Breakthrough to Silver-Tier
chapters.content:
[Do you want to initiate the breakthrough from bronze to silver?]
[Y/N]
Stark clicked on Y.
[Very well, please break the stone now!]
The process was literally the same as last time: he clenched his fist with the stone inside, and it shattered inside his hand after enough pressure was put.
The runes around the stone glowed, and they began to fly around Stark, seeping into his body after a few seconds.
[Breakthrough passed smoothly, you have high potential!]
[Bronze -> Silver]
[Skill limit increased from 15 to 25!]
'Alright,' after doing this, Stark grabbed the [Sculk Necklace], the mythical item and only one that he could use, then put it around his neck.
A surge of power coursed through Stark's body as the [Sculk Necklace] activated: the gem in the middle glowing intensely as the sculk liquid he hated so much formed around it.
[You are now able to use the necklace's ability!]
'Nice…' Stark nodded, "And now…"
[Level 60 Reached: please pick a card]
Three magenta cards appeared in front of him.
'Clone Frenzy,' he summoned one of his clones, then instructed it to check out the back of the cards and point at the strongest looking one.
But…
"…" it just shrugged.
"You… can't see?" Stark asked.
"…" the clone shook its head.
Which meant… that it was only the [Superior Clone] that was able to do that.
'Interesting…' Stark scratched his chin, 'Well, anyway,' he closed his eyes and quickly grabbed one of the cards at random.
And once he turned it… he saw the drawing of a + sign glowing in crimson light.
…
[Skill: Crimson Healing]
[Rank: Legendary]
[Description: You are now able to heal yourself using the power of your crimson aura, able to regain 20000HP in one go.]
[Note: One day cooldown and you can't heal others]
…
"FUCKING FINALLY, HOLY SHIT!" Stark jumped in joy, he had finally gotten a healing skill.
He had almost died so many fucking times because his HP were way too low, even for a [Domination] user, and now… he could finally regain 20000 at once.
Of course, this was weak compared to the healing of all the others, for example Sora was able to heal upward to 50000HP and all status effects, even for others, while he was only able to do it for himself and for 20000HP.
But… Stark was a fighter, and being able to heal just ONE HP was enough for him as it could potentially save his life.
'Alright, and last…' he turned toward another panel.
And he was frankly excited.
[Skill Points: 24 Available]
Because…
He would finally be able to upgrade his skills!
…
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv15; Focus lv15; Aura Smash lv10; Clone Frenzy lv15; Invincible Dodge lv10; Double Assault lv10; Crimson Spears lv1; Heaven's Wrath lv5; Alchemist lv5; Potion Crafting lv5; Target Manipulation lv1; Dodge Control lv5; Crimson Ball Transmission lv1; EGO lv5; Crimson Purification lv1; Wielding Cross lv1; Crimson Healing lv1.
…
The amount of skills he had was starting to get out of hands, and Stark truly wondered how ANY of these people at the top remembered the skills they never used.
Or maybe… it was just that there was something he didn't know about?
Somehow… he had a feeling that his intuition was right.
But for now, all he needed to do was upgrade his skills.
And for the first time, he didn't hesitate for a single second.
'Come to me, new perks!'
[You have upgraded 'Domination' to level 25 (Silver-Tier Max)!]
[You have upgraded 'Focus' to level 25 (Silver-Tier Max)!]
What else would he do but upgrade his most important skills, yes, even more important than [Heaven's Wrath], [Double Assault] or even [Clone Frenzy].
And of course, as he passed two thresholds for those skills, it meant he would be getting two perks for each!
Or… that's what he thought.
[From now on, skills reaching level 20 will require 10 skill points to get a new perk, meaning that once reaching level 20, the next perk you get will only be at level 30, 40, 50…]
And so that only meant one thing: he only got one perk from each skill as they had only crossed level 20, meaning that upgrading them to level 25 did increase their power, but no new perk was given.
'Oh well… I think I'm starting to get it…' the amount of perks he would get will probably decrease the more he upgrades his skills, meaning that this was one of the reasons people wouldn't get confused with so many perks.
And so Stark began to read the new perks he was getting.
…
[Skill: Domination lv25]
[New Perk: Facial Camouflage]
[Description: You are now able to hide your face entirely using your aura, making it not entirely up to luck and emotions but now able to control it completely if you want to hide your identity.]
…
His perks for 'Domination' were this: protection shield at lv5, fear inflict at lv10 (pretty damn useless since all the opponents he fought were stronger…), dominated status at lv15 (this one was useful, but having it activate on an opponent is still hard), and finally… facial camouflage at level 20.
Upgrading [Domination] though wasn't about perks… but simply about enhancing his aura since it became stronger after each level, which is why he didn't even bother using its perks, and why they were pretty much all 'passive'.
[Facial Camouflage] would be extremely useful in the future if he wants to hide or when he was in the academy, though.
But in the end, Stark just moved to the next perk.
…
[Skill: Focus lv25]
[New Perk: Target Set]
[Description: You can place a target on an opponent, thus allowing you to observe their movements better and have your crimson 'eyes' always following them, no matter what they do]
[Note: this skill will deactivate if the opponent is out of view or runs out of the range, you can set a target whenever you want, but only one at a time]
…
'Fair…' much like [Domination], [Focus]'s skills were mostly passive too except for 'Time Vision'.
Nonetheless, these were his two most important skills, so he was kind of forced to upgrade them if he wanted to be stronger.
[Skill Points: 4 Available]
'…'
Stark also knew exactly what to upgrade: he had underestimated that skill, but after it helped him many times during the trial, he knew he couldn't afford to let it stay at its current level.
And that skill was…
[You have upgraded 'Crimson Spears' to level 5!]
Yes, it was [Aura Smash] but weaker and with spears instead of crimson fists, but they were still useful, being the ones that broke Warden's first core and helped him win many battles because of the spears' sheer speed.
Of course, another reason he upgraded it was because it had been level 1, meaning he had the perfect amount of skill points to allow himself to get a new perk.
And so…
…
[Skill: Crimson Spears lv5]
[New Perk: More Spears!]
[Description: Instead of only summoning three spears, you are now able to summon 5!]
…
Of course, he didn't expect anything exceptional from the first upgrade of a skill since it was only [Rare] in rank, much like [Aura Smash], but it was still better than nothing.
And so right after doing everything he needed to do, his mind appeased as there was nothing to worry about…
"Memories Museum, come to me," he mumbled, and the dark door appeared before him.
He still had around 7 hours of free time, so why wouldn't he train and discover the power of his new perks, as well as his necklace?
He would need it for later… because that academy is going to be a true hell, much more than Stark anticipated.

chapters.title: Chapter 227 - 227: The Academy's Station
chapters.content:
(6h45 later)
Stark had trained inside the 'Memories Museum', attempting to defeat the Warden again, as well as combine him with some other bosses, but he would somehow keep dying over and over by their hands.
Was it the security of not putting his life in danger that made it so that he was more careless? Or was it that he just got lucky during his fights…?
No… luck doesn't exist in battle, it was all about skill and power at that very moment, meaning that no matter what anyone would think, it was just that Stark had been stronger than all those bosses, although he did get some help with the guardians of the first trial.
In the end, he managed to take down the Warden for the second time right as the time for Lana to arrive came.
The [Sculk Necklace] actually revealed itself to be quite good, dealing decent damage and able to restrain enemies if they were hit, although it was hard to control the sculk as he wasn't used to it.
~FWISH~
Stark emerged from the black door leading to the [Memories Museum], finding himself in his hotel room again.
Some people would definitely panic at the thought of bringing EVERYTHING they needed as luggage space was limited, but… Stark was pretty calm about it, he was never really the kind of people to stress over traveling.
Not only did he not have much to his name (pretty sad when you think about it), but he also could just use [Spatial Inventory] to store all his items, potions and ingredients, as well as his clothes and food, meaning no reason to burden himself.
And then…
~DING~
[Lana Moonless: I came a bit early, please come down.]
[Stark Heartsouls: Alright.]
This was it, he would have to take the train leading to the capital of Fellarburg.
And then… what then… Stark himself didn't know.
But one thing was for sure: that bad feeling he always got when things were going to go south was omnipresent, always there within him as if to warn him of not only the academy, but the entire capital as a whole.
Wasn't Fellarburg in the top 5 of strongest countries in this world? And if that is true… then the capital, the main point of power, would surely be terrifying, filled with many classifiers that could probably beat him in less than a second.
~DING~
Stark left his room, making sure to keep it clean as he wouldn't be returning there, then arriving in front of his hotel and seeing Lana at the back of a luxurious limousine, her palm against her beautiful chin, and her blue eyes staring at him.
They lightened up as she saw him, then she opened the door, greeting him inside.
"Are you ready," she smiled at Stark, who remained stoic, looking ahead while the driver started up the engine.
"I guess so," in comparison to him, the limousine, which was pretty long and gave them lots of space (although Lana somehow still found herself sitting next to him) was full of luggage, at least a dozen of them, "Is this needed?" he pointed at all of it.
"First time I ever leave the city alone, I am usually with my parents when I travel, and I won't be seeing them for at least a year or two considering the academy and other stuff, so I just wanted to be ready," Lana smiled cutely, and Stark just kept his neutral expression as he sighed.
"Sure," he nodded, not minding that much since it was none of his problems, because as long as he can graduate too, then he didn't mind.
And thus… they drove to the station that would transport them to the powerhouse that is the capital.
Thirty minutes later, they arrived at the train station, and left alongside all of Lana's luggage.
"Be careful, my lady, I have heard rumors about the capital being extremely dangerous," the old man that served as a driver bowed as he warned Lana, he was a very faithful servant of the Moonless family, and he wouldn't want anything to happen to the young lady after all.
"Thank you, but I'll be fine," she smiled, and the driver went back inside the limousine before leaving.
"How are you going to carry that?" Stark asked as all the luggage was on the ground, he had [Spatial Inventory] so he could probably her out by putting all of it inside.
"Hehe~ don't underestimate the Moonless family," but Lana grinned as she pulled out her bow and shot an arrow at each of the bags, the arrows appeared out of nowhere in her hand, probably from her arsenal as she could summon it whenever she wanted.
And suddenly…
~FWISH~
All of them began to fly around Lana, slowly following her.
"I just use a [User Attraction] arrow, and they follow me around, hehe~" she seemed really proud of herself, "Our family was the one to manufacture it after all!"
'There are arrows even for that…?' Stark sighed, it was indeed weird, but she probably had dozens upon dozens of different arrow types in case of battle, so no surprise.
As they made their way to the train platform, Stark couldn't shake off the feeling of unease that had been lingering within him.
It was 15:38, meaning 22 minutes left until the train would arrive.
And yet… the first thing Stark noticed was… that the station was FILLED with young people around his age.
All of them looked extremely powerful, some even letting their auras out to intimidate others, while the rest carried their weapons/items in hand and speaking to the rest.
There was not a single adult on sight, it was only flashy and young classifiers.
"Hey, why are there so many people like us here?" Stark asked, wondering what the hell was happening since this definitely couldn't be normal.
And in response, Lana just laughed and pointed at a giant, colorful sign above the train tracks.
And it read…
[Rift Conqueror Express]
[Only students of the academy are allowed to board this train]
The academy went so far in its research of powerful students that it allowed anyone that got accepted into their school to travel to it extremely easily by having their very own trains and even airports, welcoming classifiers from all over the world.
No wonder it was one of the top 3 strongest schools in Rheria, and also considered to be the hardest to graduate from of all.
Just looking at these people… gave the whole picture Stark needed to realize just what he's plunging himself into.
"Sigh~" Stark was forced to stand up next to Lana as there were no seats or benches.
But suddenly…
"Oy~ if that's not Lana Moonless, I'd never think I would see her in person," a tall gangster-looking man with rock star purple hair and a piercing in his nose appeared, followed by two other people that had the exact same aesthetic as his.
"Piss off," she groaned as she turned and walked behind Stark, hiding behind him as if he was her knight and protector.
'…?' Stark was confused, he was pretty sure she could just shoot one of her weird arrows at them, right?
"Come on, we're going to be classmates, we don't know when any of us will die or leave the academy, why don't we be friends," that guy sounded like a total playboy, "Quit hiding behind that weak-looking punk."
He approached his face to Stark's, sticking out his tongue.
"Oy~ look at you…" he tried to continue, many people all over watching as they wanted to see who was dumb enough to argue not even on their first day.
But, before he could even finish his sentence.
~PUSH~
Stark pushed him out of the way with a single hand then looked at him with a disgusted look, "There's no way a loser like you is hitting on a random girl while the year hasn't even started," Stark truly hated people like that, and he made sure to show it.
"Huh?" the punk couldn't answer, and neither could his friends.
"I mean, look at you, I can pretty much guarantee you're not even surviving the first few months," Stark turned around and walked away, his hands in his pockets, Lana following him closely.
And surprisingly, the "Punk Group" didn't follow after him, only looking at one another and shrugging, a smug look appearing on the leader's face: everyone knew that fighting fellow students right now would be stupid, they would have more than enough time to do that later after all.
"…" Stark contained his laughter, a wide smile appearing on his face.
"Thanks," Lana sighed, "I hate people like this, don't you as well-…?" but before she could finish her sentence, her eyes widened as she looked at Stark's face.
"=)" he was smiling like a maniac.
"I think…" he turned his head toward Lana, "I think I'll enjoy this academy much more than expected…"
There were hundreds of people just like them, and many challenges.
But… Stark felt like he would enjoy it all.
[3:55PM]
[The train is arriving shortly, please be ready!]

chapters.title: Chapter 228 - 228: Train to the Capital
chapters.content:
[4PM]
[The train is arriving, please make sure to enter, anyone not inside by 4:05PM will be left behind and expelled!]
The train pulled into the station, looking extremely luxurious as it was dyed in red and had all sort of graffiti representing the academy on it, it also looked to be controlled by magic as there was no driver.
The doors hissed open, inviting the eager students to board, and everyone on the platform (around 300/400 people) went inside at once.
Stark and Lana made their way inside, the bustling crowd of classifiers following closely behind. The interior of the Rift Conqueror Express was nothing short of luxurious, with plush seating and elegant decor.
And yet… there was no chattering.
The atmosphere was as quiet as death itself, everyone's expressions being grim and desolate of any excitement.
Most people would be excited to enter a powerful academy and make their way to the top.
But… with this one… no one could say they were really excited as they knew their lives would be in danger no matter what they did.
"Let's go," even Lana's cheerful attitude disappeared, as if the train and its aura itself had removed all her happy emotions, "There are many seats, let's relax."
"…" Stark just nodded and he sat on one of the dozens of sofa's that were placed all around, Lana sitting beside him as her luggage was still in the air.
All around, people from the same "groups" sat on their respective sofas.
And just like that, people could already have a good view of who was with whom, teams had already been formed after all.
[4 hours 23 minutes until reaching the capital!]
[Get to know each other, it will be greatly needed, teamwork makes the dream work after all, RIGHT?!]
And with these announcements out of the way…
~VROOM, VROOM~
All they could hear was the sound of the train moving, only able to look out of the windows to check the landscape of the city as it quickly passed.
"…"
"…"
"…"
No one spoke, some were playing with their skills, others with their weapons, a few just sleeping and the rest just analyzing the other classifiers to get a head start.
And so… just like that… four hours passed.
[20 minutes until destination!]
[We have entered the capital, by the way!]
They were still in Fellarburg, the landscape of the different cities passing through them as they observed the different buildings, but now… they were in the capital, the biggest and strongest area of them all.
"Hey?" Lana suddenly spoke, breaking the silence, and the people close to them were so bored, and it was so quiet that they actually turned their heads toward them, hoping for anything interesting.
"Hm?" Stark smiled.
"I've just been wondering…" Lana seemed quite nervous, "You… You've been smiling the whole time…"
"Oh? Really =)?" Stark knew that perfectly well: he had been smiling for the entire ride, and some people even pointed at him for that.
No one liked seeing that devilish smile of his, and dozens of people already noted him in their "be cautious around him" list.
"Don't worry," Stark patted Lana's beautiful blonde hair, "I'm just getting ready for whatever's coming."
Stark during these few hours had been part of the "analyze others" group, observing their auras as well as the things they showcased in case it would help, a vortex in his eyes appearing as he continued his observations even beyond his own car, looking at the people on the other ones using [Focus].
And so… after everything was done…
The train came to a screeching halt, signaling their arrival to their destination.
[We have arrived at the center of the capital, the academy is extremely close to here, please do check it out!]
[2 days until the entrance ceremony!]
As the doors slid open, the students emerged cautiously, taking in the grandeur of the city that lay before them. Skyscrapers towered overhead, casting shadows over the bustling streets filled with classifiers.
They called the capital "Classifier City" since only people from that line came to it, anyone else that attempted to live here would just be asking for death.
The soon-to-be students of the academy left in their own directions, heading toward their hotels or apartments as they had prepared themselves to live here, since the academy doesn't provide dorms or anything of the sort.
"Oh?" many groups of classifiers stopped as they saw the students emerge from the train and platform as it was pretty much in the middle of a busy street, only stopping people from getting crushed by a barrier which opened for the students to pass.
"Hey, it's them…"
"Holy shit, those kids have guts…"
"Most of them are going to die anyway, just move on."
Everyone in this city knew about the reputation of the [Rift Conqueror Academy], and the students knew as well, it was just that they held onto the hope and idea that if they ever as much as just PASSED the first year, then their future would be guaranteed, and they would become the powerhouse of their families.
Impossibly high risk, extremely high reward.
Some of these people didn't even value their lives other than for the sake of completing these two years inside that academy, while others truly just wanted to push themselves to their limits and grow stronger.
Everyone had their own desires, but only the strongest would come out on top.
But… what about Stark.
"=)" what was his desire? What was his goal…?
Well… no one knew, and probably not even Stark himself: he just wanted to see what this academy had to offer, maybe he would pass, maybe he would get stronger, who knows…
In the end…
"Hey," Lana tapped Stark's shoulder as he was dozing off, "Let's check out the academy before anything, we can spend the next two days exploring the capital as we'll be spending the next 2 years here!"
"…" Stark looked at her, and his smiled grew, "That is… if we stay alive, isn't it?"
"…" Lana's looked nervous, avoiding Stark's gaze as a drop of sweat appeared on her forehead, "Sure… but I'm sure we can do it!"
"Optimistic, huh…" Stark nodded, "Anyway, let's check out the academy quickly, I need to go look for a hotel room or apartment if they don't have dorms."
"Oh! You don't have to worry about that either…" Lana smiled for the first time since she boarded the train, "My dad already prepared everything…" she sighed while whispering, just loud enough for Stark to hear.
"…?" He was confused, but quickly moved on as they followed the crowd and began to walk toward the academy.
It only took ten minutes to reach it from their current location, and they were able to see the top of it from far because of how high the building was.
As they approached the towering structure of the Rift Conqueror Academy, Stark's expression remained neutral.
But as for the others…
"Wow…"
"Holy shit, that's insane…"
Their reactions only showed shock and admiration.
This was the [Rift Conqueror Academy], the hell that Stark would need to enter.
The hell all these people oh so wanted to pass through.
The hell where everyone would have to fight friends and foes alike, with the sole hopes of surviving.
This was… the [Rift Conqueror Academy].
And now that they saw it… all they could do was observe its beauty, awaiting the day they would have to enter it since the gates were currently locked, only allowing people to see it from afar.
[2 days until 'Entrance Ceremony'!]

chapters.title: Chapter 229 - 229: The Rift Conqueror Academy
chapters.content:
"…" Stark stared at the academy with serious eyes.
The building loomed over them, its architecture both ancient and futuristic, with intricate runes etched into the walls that seemed to pulse with mystical energy.
There were 9 symbols on the marbles and gold walls that people could see from the entrance: two crossed swords (warrior), a magic staff (magus), three claw marks (beast tamer), a cross (exorcist), a dagger (assassin), a bow (archer), a heart (soul wielder), a potion flask (alchemist) and a demon tail (succubus/incubus).
Below all these was a holographic text that read the name of the classes related to these symbols, but it didn't really take a genius to figure out what they were.
All these symbols on the walls pulsated and were in constant movement: for example, the swords of the warrior class would clash together before going back to their original position, while the flask from alchemist would shake, the liquid inside it changing colors.
It was truly like they were considering classes as "divine", something all classifiers took pride in and seemed to enjoy, though.
But Stark noticed one thing…
Domination was there.
Was it really that unknown? Probably, yes, but it didn't make sense for even the experienced teachers and chairman to not know about it.
They actually probably did… but somehow no one talked about that class even though it was the strongest.
"Holy shit, what is that," a girl pointed at the very top of the building, dozens of long rodes on it with a flag that showed a blue portal with a stickman figure entering it, probably the logo of the school, the biggest rode of them seemed to be ten meters in height, showcasing to the entire capital their flag.
And once Stark looked at the sky…
'…!' there was legitimate dragon flying around the school building, but mainly around the rodes, zigzagging between them, "Oh, it's fake."
The dragon cast no shadow on the ground even though the time was sunny, meaning that it was just a super-advanced holographic display, he couldn't deny it was impressive though, and that dragon looked so real some people could be scared.
In the end, they just kept looking for a good five minutes, taking in the view as this 'school' looked more like a palace, and what so big that it could easily host over ten thousand people.
Next to the school was a giant arena where fights could be hosted, probably used for later, and people seemed to call it the "Fate Colosseum" for some reason.
And… that was pretty much all.
There weren't really many ways to describe the school if you weren't there to see it, but just know that it was big and luxurious, truly showcasing the importance of each class as every one of them had a different terrain to train in, leaving nobody behind (except Domination).
"This is great, I'm actually excited now," Lana held her chest as she took quick breaths, "It was really terrifying to think that you could die at any point in this school, but now I feel a bit more confident, let's go, Stark," she smiled as she took his hand and guided him.
But… Lana wasn't the only one.
EVERYONE felt a bit more confidence after seeing the grandeur of the academy, actually now believing in their powers to survive.
Everyone had their dreams, and everyone wanted to fulfill them.
Yet… it was impossible.
All of this confidence and sudden excitement was nothing but a ploy to put your guard down.
And there was no denying it… this school was hell, much more than any of them could EVER imagine it to be.
At the highest floor of the academy, beyond one way sapphire windows, twenty pair of eyes were staring at the student as they left.
"Haha… idiots…" a manly voice rang, "Do they really believe the world is sunshine and rainbows?"
"It doesn't matter, it only starts in two days, they will realize just how wrong they were at that time," a woman that was sitting right beside the man spoke, spinning the glass of wine in her hand.
"Ohoh~" the chairman slowly clapped his hands while adjusting his glasses to get the attentions of the 19 people sitting on chair around a big circle table, "Do not worry, my dear teachers and instructors, the students are going to come soon, and at that time… then their first hellish year will start, and we shall enjoy seeing which will be the strongest to come out of the lot," he smiled.
EVERYONE in this room were graduates of [Rift Conqueror] back in their time as well, meaning that they knew exactly what true horror and hell was, and just how to adjust it for people to become strong.
These 20 people, the powerhouses of the academy, capital, if not entire country, even though they weren't invited to events such as the 'ClassiTop', were present.
In their room, they were surrounded by a sturdy walls, but most importantly, a screen that shows the entrance of the academy from all angles.
They enjoyed observing the new students, and noting the ones that looked strong as they actively enjoyed playing a gamble game of "who is gonna live, die or quit".
Yes, these people were teachers and instructors, yet they were extremely twisted as well: who in their right mind would teach in this academy, which took the most amount of lives between all in the world, after all?
And as to allow themselves to do this, this room was completely isolated, with not even the most stealthy and observant of classifiers would be able to detect it.
Basically… it was their little hiding place to check out the bugs they would play with during the first year: yes, they don't consider classifiers who didn't complete the first year as people, after all they had done it themselves and suffered through all of these "trials" to be in their current position.
Only when you reach the second year while they respect you and consider you human, but in contrast it will also become much harder.
They were called the "Harsh Council" for a reason.
"Well, folks, the students are leaving," the chairman smiled as he looked at everyone, their figures cloaked by the shadow of the closed room, impossible to see their appearances.
"Seems like this year's batch is… interesting," another man remarked.
"That is true, I analyzed them, and I can confirm with certainty that this batch of student is the strongest we have had in around twenty years," a middle-aged woman, holding a crystal ball, smirked.
"Amazing, it does seem like this year is going to be truly fascinating, let us have fun, then!" the chairman laughed, and all others began to leave their seats.
But right at that moment…
"Wait a damn minute," the chairman spoke, a surprised look on his face as he looked at the screen around him, pointing at the entrance.
Suddenly, all the other members of the council stopped in their tracks and looked at the screen, it still shows the outside, but extremely zoomed in.
It was zoomed… on a boy.
"He is… looking at us?" one of the members mumbled.
And who could that boy be?
Well... who other than Stark, duh?
"He knows," the chairman smiled as the camera zoomed in on Stark's eyes, who was clearly looking at the room they were currently in.
Just who is that kid, was what they thought.

chapters.title: Chapter 230 - 230: Noticing the Aura in the Tower
chapters.content:
There wasn't anything left to discover, so they would need to wait 2 days when they were called to participate in the entrance ceremony.
But…
"Hey, wait," Stark stopped Lana as she was walking toward the street like all the other students after checking out the academy.
He got a gut feeling in his heart, and his mind was screaming for him to stop as they were "observed".
[Focus: Look up, toward the top window of the middle tower]
He did as he was told and then…
~GULP~
"Oh shit…" Stark's eyes widened as he sensed an extremely powerful aura coming from that room, it was actually so powerful he had a hard time not vomiting on the spot.
"Hey, are you okay, what's happening?" Lana looked worried as she peered at Stark, who was still looking at the window with a determined look.
"Yeah, I'm fine," Stark sighed after thirty seconds, "Let's just go, I'm kind of tired."
Stark didn't like this at all, and if it was coming from the academy, then it meant they were probably teachers watching them.
Lana and Stark hailed for a taxi and the car drove them around twenty minutes away of the academy, arriving in front of a luxurious apartment complex.
"Thanks for the ride, sir," Lana bowed as she paid, she was actually very kind and respectful to others, yet somehow found the strength in herself to speak casually to Stark.
"Anyway, my father has rented out an apartment in this complex for you and me, its pretty close and luxurious enough to last for the two years as he already gave the down payment on all of it," Lana smiled as she pulled out a card, it had Stark's name on it with the room number [502], which meant the second room of the fifth floor.
"Oh," Stark took the card and thanked Lana, he didn't expect something so good to be given to him out of nowhere.
And yes, it was too good, so Stark squinted his eyes while looking at Lana, knowing something was up.
Apparently she didn't know anything, as she happily entered the elevator and ordered him to come.
"It's fine, I'll take the stairs," he gestured, and she just shrugged then clicked on one of the buttons, "Well, we'll be separated anyway so might as well get used to it, huh…"
An apartment so close to the academy was really useful, and although he didn't know what to expect there, it was still good.
He climbed up the stairs quite easily, his stamina now so good that doing that didn't even make him break a sweat.
'5th floor…' he lifted his gaze and saw a [Floor 5] sign written in blue letters.
Apparently, each floor only had two apartments, allowing for an immense amount of space, but that is why it was very expensive: only the rich could afford it, and Stark would sure as hell not waste his precious money on such a thing, a shabby hotel room was more than enough for him.
But right as he stepped inside the hall, reaching his room, which was the 502… the elevator door opened.
"Oh wooooow," Lana acted shocked, "What a coincidence, my room is the 501!"
"…" Stark looked at her with the most neutral of eyes, "Alright."
He entered his room by scanning the card and then closed the door behind him.
Of course, he already figured it out: the sole reason Arthur, the archer king, put Lana and Stark so close together wasn't because of good will, but because he wanted the latter to protect his daughter.
'Fucking hell… I'm not a bodyguard…' Stark wasn't found of that idea, being solo was his entire way of life, and it wouldn't change no matter what, "Well, worse case scenario I get evicted somehow, and Lana should be able to defend herself…"
As for the interior of his apartment, well… it was pretty damn good.
Luxury furniture that were already placed, a bedroom, living room, kitchen, basically everything he would need during those two years.
He was used to living alone, so giving him a bigger space was useless, but it still felt better than going into a hotel room and entering it to directly see your bed and everything it had to offer.
He lay on his bed and looked at the ceiling.
Somehow, that bad feeling of his never went away, and seeing all these students and this new city added to that pressure he was feeling.
What could be waiting for them in two days.
"I… I'll find out eventually… let's just sleep…" he was so tired.
He shouldn't be at such an important time, not after being so close to entering the hellish academy.
But…
"Zzzzz…" even Stark, the most promising of [Domination] users, who was being watched closely by the [Domination Association], was tired.
Yes, even Stark knew and felt that sometimes he was being watched by a distant pair of eyes.
They did tell him they would ALWAYS keep an eye on him, probably already aware of the second trial and its results.
He hadn't heard of any type of 'Calamity-Level' monster attacks like the first time over though, but maybe it was because they figured out all the participants and contained them all?
Were they even capable of checking out the trial and its results as well? Such a big organization should be able to, right?
This was probably what happened.
'So many things I don't know about… I wish… it was this peaceful, huh…' Stark closed his eyes, "Zzzz.
And he slept, hopefully not long enough to miss the academy entrance, as it would mean instant expulsion.
***
(Dream World)
"…" Stark didn't even act surprised, at this point, even a single second of rest meant that he would find himself in this place.
Was this a curse or a blessing? He didn't know.
It was calm, though.
"Oh, hey," [Domination], who was merged with [Exorcist], visible by the strands of golden aura in its body, was currently playing chess with [Alchemist].
"Hm~" Alchemist seemed to be concentrated on the game, moving his knight to take one of Domination's pawn.
"Is this what all of you do when I'm not here?" Stark questioned as he approached their table, a chair magically appearing out of nowhere.
"Well, somewhat, we can see through your eyes since we are you, but we still are forced to stay here," Domination moved his rook.
"…"
"You know, I've been wondering," Alchemist looked at Stark, "How do you feel about all of this?"
"…?"
"I mean, with the ApostleDex, your goal in this world is probably to complete it by killing all the apostles, then meeting the 'Godless Demon' and kicking its ass," Domination resumed the discussion, "Check by the way," it moved its bishop, checking the king, "But what about all the rest?"
"The rest?" Stark was confused.
"I mean, do you plan to obtain all the classes? It makes more people to interact with, obviously, but also, what about the academy? And relationships? Fame? Power?" Alchemist took back the discussion, and it was almost like the two were in synchro.
"Basically… you're asking what I plan to do?"
"Yeah, I think that Lana chick is onto you, no doubt, and you're strong enough to earn enough money to live your life like this in luxury, what is your true goal, Stark Heartsouls?"
"I don't know, but I don't have a choice but to keep going anyway."
"Why?" Alchemist asked, trying his hardest not to get checkmated.
"Because, well, the [Domination Trial] is still present, so if I sit back and do nothing, there is a huge chance that I will still be teleported away and get fucked as I would be too weak," Stark's argument was literally unbreakable, and even the two classes knew it: Stark couldn't stop until all [Domination Trials] were over, or until he killed all the apostles and proved himself to the world.
It was a never ending cycle.
"But anyway," Stark smiled as he continued, "I actually do enjoy fighting."
"We do too, we were just asking," Domination smiled, "Checkmate, Alchemist," it cornered the king using his queen and rook.
"Well… Then everything is settled, just have to survive the academy and not get destroyed by the other students or some impossible tasks!" Stark felt optimistic.
"We're gonna be fine, just wake up, or you'll be late," both Domination and Alchemist said as they looked at Stark.
"I did guess a long time would pass, thank you," Stark got up from his chair, and all the furniture, as well as the two class figures, disappeared.
What was that feeling inside of him? Why did they talk about something so deep with him after acting goofy and carefree all this time?
"I… Ah, fuck, doesn't matter," Stark lost consciousness as he closed his eyes.
***
"WAKE UP! WAKE UP STARK!"
