"…?" Stark's vision was drowsy, but he could hear someone calling his name and frantically shaking him.
"Oh! Oh my god, finally!" he also felt someone embrace him.
"What the fuck is happening…" he was still confused, that dream of his lasted less than five minutes, but a long time must has passed in the real world.
And so right at that moment…
"COME ON, THE ENTRANCE CEREMONY IS IN AN HOUR!"

chapters.title: Chapter 231 - 231: A Way to Reach the Academy?
chapters.content:
"...?" Stark just wanted to keep sleeping, he didn't know for how long he slept, but to him, it seemed as if he had taken a ten-minutes nap, "What...?"
He was still being shaken by the figure that was yelling his name.
And once Stark was fully aware of his surroundings... he finally understood.
"The ceremony is in an hour, wake up dumbass," the figure was none other than Lana.
"Yeah..." he had finally heard her, and guessed that he had slept for two whole days.
Stark rubbed his eyes then got up.
"I was wondering what you were doing, sometimes, not answering for days on end, yet you were just... sleeping?" Lana asked, her voice was annoyed, but there was a massive sense of relief in it too.
"Doesn't matter," Stark pulled out a cereal box and mill from his [Spatial Inventory] and prepared his breakfast, "The biggest question is how did you get in my room if I had the card."
It didn't take long for him to look at her hands and see an exact copy of his room card.
"Alright, can you get out so I can dress?" Stark ignored that and decided that getting ready for the entrance ceremony was more important.
Stark wore the most casual of clothes for this big event, then he left his room ten minutes later.
Lana was waiting for him outside, she was wearing a beautiful white dress with a skirt that reached her knees.
"...Let's go," Stark never pays attention to this sort of thing, so the two went out of their apartment and complex and hailed for an available driver.
Surprisingly, it was quite difficult to find one, and even after ten minutes nobody was there.
"It's the entrance ceremony of the most powerful school in Fellarburg, so of course the capital is gonna be packed..." Lana sighed, "This is why I wanted to go early, but SOMEONE was sleeping."
"Should have just gone ahead by yourself, I would have woken up and started running either way," Stark smiled.
"..." Lana didn't have an answer, so she used her ultimate technique in such situations: pouting.
After another ten minute, a lone taxi driver appeared before the two upcoming students.
But... after less than five minutes...
They met a roadblock.
There were hundreds of cars, and thousands of people roaming around, both classifiers and reporters wanting to show the entrance ceremony to the real world.
It was a true festival, and there was no chance in hell they would reach it at this pace.
"...Alright, thanks for the drive mister," Stark opened the door and dragged Lana (after she paid) outside, carrying her on his back as he activated his aura and jumped on top of a building.
Surprisingly, dozens of people had the same idea as him as they were all running toward the academy, all students of course.
~DASH~
While holding Lana from the dress, he kept running for a good five minutes, going much faster than even the taxi.
And so... he was finally able to see the academy.
The entrance and surroundings were literally blocked by all the classifiers and reporters, forcing the actual students to use their brains if they want to enter.
Stark stopped at the edge of a building, then grabbed Lana and carried her in his two hands princess style since he knew she probably didn't have enough defense to survive the wall from where they were.
"Alright, get us down," Lana didn't complain either.
And so... Stark jumped from the very tall building's roof toward the ground, precisely right after the gate, as to allow themselves to pass.
~DASH, FWISH~
The building's roof was at least fifty meters in height, and not a single one of the other people that were running on the roofs alongside him even dared to do what he was doing.
"What the fuck?"
"Suicide?"
They really thought he was insane.
And to add to that, while he was still in midair, focusing his aura as faltering meant falling to his death, the reporters noticed his presence and turned their cameras toward him.
~BOOOOM~
In a massive crash, Stark landed on the other side of the gate, actually creating a small crater on the ground.
"WHAT?"
People were both shocked and astonished, but Stark just continued walking toward the academy's giant red doors, which were opened.
[12 minutes until ceremony begins]
A massive text could be seen above it.
[If you are outside when the door is closed, you will be expelled.]
Students actually guessed this was their first 'task': manage to get inside the school with all the commotion, thus proving your ability to adapt.
Some were seen flying inside, others merged in the crowd and climbed up the gates, and some crazy ones like Stark used methods that weren't normal.
They passed the threshold of the red door, and found themselves in a massive room, so big in fact that thousands of students were already inside, all aligned.
"Huh... are you gonna let me down?" Lana mumbled as she could feel the gazes of the others on her: what kind of people would enter this school carrying another person?
"Oh, my bad," Stark put her down, and he searched for an empty spot.
On the ground of the massive room were thousands of small squares, each with a number of them: they were spots where students could stand.
Almost felt like some sort of cult: everyone need to be in their own places, respecting the space they had been given.
"..."
Lana and Stark found two squares titled [2729] and [2730] since they were right in front of one another.
[There are 5000 squares], a panel above a stage at the end of the room could be seen on a holographic screen, [And 5358 people have been accepted into this academy, I think you already know what this means.]
This was just revealed to everyone who entered, meaning that...
[People who are late aren't worthy, no matter how strong they are.]
"Oh."
"I guess you can thank me," Lana tapped Stark's shoulder from behind.
"Yeah yeah," he couldn't deny he would have woken up at the last minute, possibly meaning he would have been among the 358 that were going to be expelled for not having a square.
[4 minutes until entrance ceremony]
The more time passed, the harder it was to acquire a square for yourself, since there were more and more people filling up the empty spaces.
Even Stark and Lana had a hard time, and it was by sheer luck they found some that were right next to each at one of the lanes very far from the entrance.
The sound of cheering from classifiers and reporters was omnipresent, and Stark heard from some people nearby that this was actually broadcasted live for the entire country.
Just what was so good about such a school?
I mean, he could feel the aura in the air, it was pretty damn powerful, but so what?
What could make this school so different and difficult…?
Stark didn't know, but he would for sure come to find out.
And suddenly… right as all the squares were taken, and the timer reached zero…
~THUMP~
The red door that was revealing the outside suddenly closed out of nowhere, leaving every student in pure darkness.
[Anybody who leaves their squares from now on are expelled]
And such a message appeared on the holographic screen above the stage.
***
Great job! You have been continuously updating for 2 months, and we have issued a redeem code for you as a reward. The code can be redeemed by 10 different users with 10 FPs/user. You may use it as a fan give-back gift! Your code number is <ABDHYTMPQY32GSBKA> and you can find the redeem center at Profile-Redeem.
You guys can use that to read my novel for free or any other novel tbh.

chapters.title: Chapter 232 - 232: The Entrance Ceremony of the Academy
chapters.content:
[Anybody who leaves their squares from now on are expelled]
The entirety of the room was quiet and dark now, it was impossible to hear anything from the outside world since it was soundproof, and not a single ray of light was there since no windows were connecting it to the outside.
Meaning… that all 5000 of the present students were just waiting for what was about to happen.
And suddenly…
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
Many explosions happened ahead, and smokes with different colors began to spread around the stage as everyone was looking, trying to discern what the hell was happening.
And after a while…
~CLICK~
"Ultimate Light!"
The lights came back inside the room, even though there was no window or any sort of lightbulb/chandelier.
That light was coming out… of nowhere, but it allowed EVERYONE to see EVERYTHING that was happening, all making sure to stay in their little squares as to not get expelled.
And on the stage, not one, not two, not even ten, but TWENTY figures appeared.
All these figures all had long black robes and masks covering their faces, both with the [Rift Conqueror] academy's insignia on them, their auras impossible to discern as they emitted a chilling presence that engulfed the entire room.
All of them hid their faces from the students, but they could all guess that they were the teachers.
"Welcome, students!" the one in the middle removed his mask, he had small lunar glasses, a dark green hair, he looked to be in his mid 60s, yet an extremely low amount of wrinkles were visible on his face, still making him look handsome, and his posture was impeccable, "I know all of you must be wondering what the hell is all of this!"
The remainder of the teachers then also removed their masks, revealing their faces, although Stark didn't pay much attention to that since he was mostly focused on the principal.
"First of all, let me tell you all that I am also a graduate from this academy, at least I was back in my days," the chairman sighed as he reminisced of the good times, "And I can tell you all that you are going to have one hell of time, quite literally…"
"Let's not waste time, Theodore," a woman with long purple hair, the one carrying the crystal orb, asked the chairman as she moved forward.
"Always so quick to act, Alice, but I think our dear students need to know too."
To be honest, the tension in the room was so heavy that they couldn't focus on anything but the chairman and Alice.
Any piece of information that escaped their mouths could be important, as they had heard just how bad things could get for them during this year.
"…" Stark on the other hand knew pretty much nothing, so he was pretty comfortable, actually finding the scene before him kind of annoying.
"Oh well," the chairman laughed as he suddenly stared in Stark's direction, his eyes widening a bit as he recognized the boy, and saw his neutral expression even though everyone was on edge, "I think the students want to know after all, so let's show them what awaits them…"
Theodore and Alice, the two that stepped forward, backed down, and suddenly, the holographic screen turned on again, explaining all the rules.
[5000 students]
[This first year is going to be use a 'preliminary' phase!]
"Huh?"
"What?"
[Basically, this year is going to be used mostly to weed out all the weak little bastards who think they deserve to be in our school!]
This was harsh, and even Stark felt that, but oh well, it shouldn't be the hardest school in Fellarburg if not the entire world for no reason.
[Whether it is dropping out, failure in completing a task, or death, all these things will result in your expulsion, thus reducing the number of students.]
[It has been said all around the world that the success rate for even the first year is 5% and…]
The tension was so high now that some people were shaking, trying not to get out of the square as their legs trembled.
[It is true.]
[Among the 5000 students of every year, only around 200-300 of them survive long enough to gain access to the second year.]
Of course, the second year was a whole other talk as the difficulty obviously increased, but most people's goal at this moment was literally to just complete the first one.
Even if you completed just the first year, you could immediately drop out and be recognized as one of the [Prodigies] who managed to conquer this academy's challenges.
Thus… this guaranteed your future.
Of course, Stark wanted to fully graduate, otherwise why would he even enter this academy, he could have always gotten the 25 million rher coins from his mission and bought a house.
No… Stark wanted to get stronger, and he figured that the academy would have enough challenges and trials to increase his powers, at least just enough to not fall last in the third domination trial like he did in the second.
The screen kept going, this time changing into a background with very good and detailed drawings.
[This year will be composed of three semesters, lasting 4 months in total, and each of these semesters is gonna be associated to a 'task'…]
[Or maybe…]
The holographic screen turned into a detailed drawing of the academy, separated into three parts with the numbers 1, 2 and 3.
[You could call them "trials"?]
"…" Stark's expression darkened as he heard this.
What a fucking joke.
They think they can make a scary trial? They can keep dreaming, not even in a million years can they even compare to the horror of the [Domination] trial.
And so, somehow, even though many people in the crowd of students were nervous, Stark was just mad.
The word 'trial' had a big meaning to him, and probably to all [Domination] users as well.
[Did you truly believe this is a normal school?]
"I mean, no, duh…"
[Did you think you would seat in a classroom listening to boring lessons? None of that happens, what could we even teach you all anyway, you're already between level 125 and level 150!]
This was true, one of the precise requirements of joining this academy was that ALL the people need to be somewhat in the same range, meaning that people below level 125 were out, and people above level 150 were also gone too, as 25 levels was around the average amount of levels where it is possible for a person to win if they manage their skills well.
Basically, even if it is a lv125 classifier against a lv150 one, the former could still win.
[The semester started since the moment you entered this room.]
[So…]
The room's light became a crimson shade of red, and an ominous aura appeared around all the students from the stage.
[Why don't we explain the first trial, which will last 4 months, much like all the others?]
They actually didn't waste any time in starting up that entrance ceremony: students enter the room, they speak for five minutes, then they reveal the entire plan for these students, specifically informing them that many will die trying.
This school was truly shameless, not caring about anything, not even its own students.
But maybe this was why people were so excited at the prospect of joining it?
Maybe the thrill of risking your life made all these people enjoy it?
In the end, it didn't matter, and so Stark just looked up, a vortex of aura forming in his eyes as he awaited the next instructions.

chapters.title: Chapter 233 - 233: The First Semester Rules and The Year President
chapters.content:
[First Semester: 4 months]
[As said before, this year will be divided into 3 trials, with the sole goal of reducing the amount of people participating as each semester concludes.]
"…"
[I don't believe any information is needed to be said as it is pretty obvious, but this will be dangerous]
[Quitting halfway through the trial is immediate expulsion]
[And the first trial is…]
[Rift Rush!]
"Rift rush, what?"
"Shut up, just listen…"
"I'm kind of nervous…"
Talk immediately rose up as the name of the first trial appeared; yet Stark's expression remained as neutral as ever before, not impressed by any of this.
Nothing could be deadlier than a [Domination] trial, and that sole fact made it so that this seemed like a child's game to him.
"Hey, what do you think it's about," Lana turned around and tried to speak to Stark.
"I think you should watch out, stepping out is expulsion after all," but he just smiled back, avoiding the question as it made his blood boil.
To be honest, anyone that had participated in one of the [Domination] trials, saw one, or even knew just a little bit of information about it would know just how bad they were.
[As stated before, there are exactly 5000 of you in this room.]
[We will divide these 5000 people into 50 different groups, meaning 100 students per group.]
On the screen, a small human figure was copied and divided into 50 small squares, and each time the screen showed something, they switched accordingly as to make the entire presentation more dynamic for people and make them understand faster, they had thought of everything it seems as actually everyone could easily understand.
[100 people - 50 groups, and so the reason it is called 'Rift Rush' is because…]
'Because…?' Stark tilted his head, why were they so keen on keeping the suspense going for no reason.
[Because each of these 50 groups will be given a rift to conquer.]
[And the 20 groups that fall last in conquering their rifts will be expelled.]
The room literally exploded as these words appeared.
This meant that 2000 people would be expelled in the first round no matter what, maybe even more as deaths were counted as failures, and there was no saying everyone would survive in their own teams, as fighting in groups of people of 50 meant, I don't know, AT LEAST 10 people per group had a chance of dying.
"SIR!" A guy in military clothes raised his hand, he was in the first row, meaning he was one of those that arrived first, plus he acted exactly like someone in the military.
"Yes?" the holographic screen stopped, and the chairman responded, he was the one that would take over if someone had a question or something they needed better explanations for.
"How will the rifts be given! And how will we decide about our teammates!"
"Haha~" the chairman laughed, "Calm down, I like your enthusiasm, but everything will be explained later!"
~TAP, TAP~
Theodore clapped his hands, and the video resumed as though it had never paused at all.
[In addition to that, all those that fail to conquer their rifts will be expelled as well!]
[General info: statistics gathered from decades of trials and hundreds of thousands of students from this academy have shown that the rifts given, even though they vary in difficulty, take around 2 to 3 months to complete, meaning that trying to speed run them wouldn't work in your favor, take your time, your life is the most important after all, right?]
[What is the point of succeeding if you die in the end, only allowing the rest of the people to enjoy what you should have had.]
"..." Stark could finally agree with something that screen said, but to be honest, the intent behind it was obvious: it was clearly telling them that sacrificing yourself is a useless and pathetic act as you won't be seen as a hero.
[And now many of you may wonder: then how will we know about our rifts?]
[Well…]
The video changed to the background of a casino, and right in front of the screen was a table with a box on it.
[It will be decided by drawing, obviously!]
[Note that some rifts are actually harder than others while some are easier, although I guarantee all are possible to complete!]
"Basically… its luck?"
[Yes! It is luck, luck is also a factor in being a classifier anyway, and if you aren't able to adapt and conquer any rift you are given, we believe you do not deserve to be here.]
[The "group leader" will have to pick their cards, and each of these cards will contain a single picture of the interior of the rift, some information (monsters, level…), and its name!]
[Each of these rifts are owned the by the 'Academy', meaning you do not have to worry about anyone beside you entering them!]
People wanted to complain, but they literally couldn't as they could only abide by the rules and hope to get an easy one.
[Oh, and inside the drawing box has been placed a single "DEATH RIFT" card, you will recognize it thanks to a skull with crimson eyes, it is a rift so difficult it is almost impossible to complete it with your entire group if they joined hands]
A 3D model of the card began to spin in the screen, the information at the front hidden, obviously, but it was possible to see the skull they talked about.
[And the reason for that, is that it contains a 'Godless Demon' apostle as its final boss!]
"…!" Stark's eyes widened, and his ears twitched instantly as he saw and heard that, and a massive smile grew on his face, "I need that card…"
Maybe he could find the person that got it and trade it with his, yes, this is definitely a good plan as anybody would be willing to not risk their entire lives!
What about his teammates, you might say? Well, who cares, they wouldn't be affected if Stark completed it by himself anyway!
[It's like a game! And I'm sure you will all love it!]
[It's going to be sooo much fun!]
"Pfttt~" Stark contained his laughter, he didn't know why, but this situation just seemed so funny.
A game? Seriously?
This did make some people look at him in a weird way though, thinking he had gone insane, as many of them were simply just uncomfortable, and even the people that weren't couldn't see a single reason to laugh.
[But before we tackle the final section: how the groups will form…]
[I want to introduce you all to your 'year president'!]
"Huh?"
"What?"
"Year president? What kind of bullshit is this?"
[The year president is the strongest person in the entire year!]
[So I would advise not angering them if you don't wanna have problems!]
"Please come on the stage, year president!" Theodore laughed, and all the teachers and instructors clapped their hands to invite the president.
Everyone waited, and in the distance Stark saw that a figure, which had been in one of the squares of the very first row, got out of their spot to head toward the stage.
The figure, with her long beautiful white hair, approached the stage and climbed up, stopping right next to Theodore, an emotionless look on her face as she didn't look one bit nervous.
And so the reveal happened.
[Year President: Sora Gardenis!]
A picture of Sora appeared on the holographic screen, and her beautiful face could be seen by everyone.
[The chairman and teachers have analyzed all the students, and Sora is by far the strongest among all 5000 of you!]
"…" Stark's face was stuck in a state of shock, his mouth wide open as he couldn't believe this.
What were the chances?
"AND WHO SAYS THAT?"
"FIGHT ME AND YOU'LL SEE!"
People were already complaining, but Stark knew perfectly that this was the entire truth: not a single one of them could ever hope to match Sora.
He hadn't seen her fight much, since, y'know, the Warden was too strong, but her aura and skills were already an indicator for Stark.
Maybe even he would struggle, who knows, even though he frankly believed he could beat her if she doesn't overwhelm him with her plants.
"But it's Sora…"
"Makes sense…"
Yet somehow, another group emerged: those that believed Sora was the strongest.
In comparison to what Stark believed, Sora and her family, "Gardenis", were actually extremely well known in the entire world, owning dozens of businesses, and all family members being extremely powerful classifiers.
Sora was not exception, and she had been called a prodigy by thousands of powerful classifiers since her youngest age, plus everybody knew about her and her flower powers, and that you shouldn't mess with them.
Her 'emotionless' condition was also known, but Stark was kind of oblivious to that since he saw her cry during the trial, meaning it couldn't be this bad.
"Alright, you," the chairman pointed at a boy with a muscular body and blazing red hair in the second row as he was one of those that complained, "Come fight Sora, if you beat her you become year president!"
[Anybody who beats the year president instantly becomes "it", obviously.]

chapters.title: Chapter 234 - 234: Fated Meeting with Sora
chapters.content:
Theodore pointed at the red-haired classifier with defined muscles, inviting him on the stage as he had been the loudest among all of them to complain.
"With pleasure," the red hair didn't waste a single second and jumped on the stage from his position.
"Holy shit, it's Karl…"
"Karl Spikeford?"
"Yeah!"
[Attempting to defeat the year president is futile!]
"Yeah, yeah, my ass," Karl, who was the person Stark had already defeated once back at the 'ClassiTop' event, positioned himself.
If Stark remembered right, he was a [Warrior], but his power consisted in his body being able to generate sharp spikes from any and all directions, as well as using them as sharp weapons.
He seemed to be stronger than back then when he fought Stark, maybe the beating actually forcing him to take his training more seriously?
"COME AT ME!" Karl dashed toward Sora without wasting a single second, "SPIKE SLASH," he summoned two spikes in his hands, ready to slash Sora.
But in the end…
"Evergreen Resilience," not even giving him a single look, her face emotionless and looking at the ground, Sora activated her [Legendary] skill, and the ground underneath her began to radiate with a vibrant green aura.
Much like against the Warden, her surroundings instantly grew grass, taking aback Karl as he was still dashing toward her.
But… it was too late for him.
"Boring…" she mumbled in a low voice.
~FWISH, FWISH, CRIWK~
Dozens upon dozens of vines came out of the ground and
wrapped around Karl in a matter of seconds, not even letting him come close to her.
"What the–" Karl tried to struggle against the vines, even attempting to cover his entire body in spikes using [Spike Armor] and [Spike Eruption], but they were too powerful and constricting, and they kept regenerating even when he broke them.
"I think you get it now, right?" Theodore smiled as he saw Karl pitifully try to remove the vines from himself.
Even though his body was renown to be extremely sturdy, and it was impossible to chain him because of the spikes that could come from anywhere, Sora somehow managed to do that, and with a single attack too.
This fight was not fair to begin with, and people all around the room could finally understand why Sora was the strongest, no wonder she was a prodigy.
Even Karl, who was also someone people even in this room respected and feared because of his massive strength, was beaten this easily, after all, meaning that they never stood a chance to begin with.
"…" Sora was kind enough to use the [Evergreen Resilience] vines to slowly sent Karl back at this position in the room, placing him exactly on the square, then deactivating the skill.
He had learned his lesson, and he wouldn't try to fight her anymore, that's for sure, nor anyone in this room for this matter, as they didn't want to risk humiliation or putting her on their bad side.
And yet…
"Pftt~" after the initial shock, Stark couldn't help but laugh at this entire situation, "Hhahahahahahahaha!"
And it wasn't a chuckle or him trying to hold it in, he was straight up laughing like a maniac, unable to contain it anymore.
"HAHAHAHAHAHAH!" he pointed at the stage with Sora on it, while holding his stomach and trying his hardest to stop himself from leaving the white square, otherwise he would be expelled, "HAHAHAHAHA…!"
Even Stark didn't know why he was laughing so hard, but after this fight and the chairman describing Sora as this impossible-to-beat opponent, the sole memory of Sora on the ground after being beaten by the boss brought tears to his eyes, and they weren't sad ones.
Of course, the ENTIRETY of the room started staring at him, as his laugh echoed from every direction.
"…?" Theodore seemed confused, but once he saw who the person that was laughing was, his eyes widened, and he let a quick smile, "Hey, you," he pointed at Stark who was still holding his stomach as it began to hurt.
"Hahahah… w-what?" Stark tried to answer between two laughs.
"If you think this is so funny, then please come on stage and fight Sora, we'll see if you laugh more afterward," this wasn't actually a proposition, but an order from the chairman, and everyone could sense it.
"S-Sure, hahahahaha," Stark wiped some tears from his eyes as he got out of his square and began walking toward the stage, still ominously laughing while people looking at him as though he was the biggest weirdo in the world.
"…Weird," Even Sora mumbled such a word, she didn't see the face of that person, but if they were mocking her, then she would make sure to teach them a lesson.
She had learned something important during the [Domination] trial, and she wouldn't let those teachings go away after being so close to death, and more than once.
Well, she couldn't imagine Stark's pain though as he had literally died twice, but she wouldn't forget him, and hopefully one day…
'Maybe… we'll meet again,' she sighed as she looked to her left, the person that had been laughing now on the stage.
"BOOOOO!"
"GET THE FUCK OUT, LOSER!"
"Stop laughing!!"
People were shouting at him as he got on the stage, and it's at that moment he could finally stop.
"W-W-W…What?" Sora's eyes widened so much you couldn't even imagine she was emotionless, and she took a few steps back.
"Hello, Sora, the name's Stark, nice meeting you for the first time," Stark approached Sora, and he bowed down, his face with a giant smile full of malice.
"Sora? What's happening, come on, teach him a lesson," the chairman wanted to judge Stark's powers as he had managed to sense their auras even through their secret room.
If Sora defeated him, then he wouldn't be much, and if he did defeat her, then this year would become much more interesting.
But what he didn't expect was…
"Nice to meet you," Stark repeated as he extended his left arm toward the white-haired girl, who looked at it for a few seconds, unable to comprehend what the hell was happening, she quite literally had the same reaction as Stark, and although it didn't show much on her face, her mind was in utter chaos.
"Don't worry…" this time he whispered just low enough for only him and her to listen, "I was just as shocked as you," he smiled gently, his arm still extended.
"What are you two doing?"
"Come on, Sora, kick his ass!"
Both students and teachers awaited the clash between the two, but it had been around one minute, and all they did was stare at one another.
"She won't shake your hand, dumbass, just leave!"
"I do agree with them, Mr. Laughter," Theodore finally intervened, "You might already know it, but Sora never touches anybody-"
He was about to say something everyone knew: Sora was NEVER seen being close to anyone, and even her powerful family had a hard time touching her or getting her to touch them, even a hug was already a miracle if it ever happened.
People called her the "Untouchable Rose" because of her flower powers, her emotionless condition, and her personality which didn't allow her to touch anyone, especially guys.
She even said it once herself in a quick interview: "I just don't feel comfortable touching people I don't know, it's like some sort of reaction from my body I cannot control that makes me immediately back away if someone gets too close."
And yet…
"Nice to meet you, Stark," in front of everyone's astonished gazes, Sora returned the handshake, not a single sign of discomfort in her actions, "I'm sorry, chairman," she turned toward Theodore, "But this is my friend, I won't be fighting him," she said in her emotionless voice, although there was a strange hint of happiness in it, one that was NEVER present normally.

chapters.title: Chapter 235 - 235: Forming Groups for the Trial
chapters.content:
The room fell into an eerie silence as Sora uttered the word "friend" out of her mouth.
Even Theodore and the teachers seemed to be quite shaken, actually, wondering what the hell was happening for THE Sora, THE 'Untouchable Rose' to be comfortable enough with Stark to be able to shake his hands without her body being disgusted/backing away.
And more than that, she called him a "friend"! Meaning that they met before.
But then, why would Stark jokingly say "nice to meet you" before?!
People were wondering what was happening, but no answers came as Stark began to go back to his square, his sole goal being to show Sora that he was here.
'Looks like she told us her real name in the trial though…'
"Well, anyway," Theodore coughed and got ready to ease up the atmosphere as soon as Stark returned to his place, the boy ignoring the angry and judgmental gaze from Lana, "As for the last thing you have all been wondering: how the teams will be made!"
The chairman clapped both his hands together, and the final part of the video began to play, although this time it was just a golden text that said:
[You students make the groups, yoohoo!]
[Once the bell rings, you will all be free to choose your own teammates to conquer the rift for three hours, then immediately afterward we will start the 'boxing raffle' for each of you to get your trials!]
"NICE!"
"Finally some good fucking news…"
"Thank you, chairman!"
After all these bad news one after the other, getting just this much was enough to make the students happy.
[NO ONE is allowed to leave until all teams are formed, and those teams pick their respective rifts!]
[And if anyone remains alone by the end of the timer, then they will be randomly paired with teams that need more members or with other people that are alone!]
"…" Stark didn't mind, he would solo the rift anyway, so all he needed were half decent people that could manage to not be annoying for him to kill the 'Godless Demon' apostle.
[3…]
[2…]
[1…]
[RING, RING]
An animation of a bell appeared on the screen, and as soon as the sound came out, the entire room shook as students rushed toward the people they wanted to pair with.
"Hey, wanna pair?" Lana said as she smiled.
"Of course, but I'm the leader, since I want to pick the card!" Stark proposed.
"Fine by me, as long as I complete this trial," she sighed, but was confident that with Stark in her team, there was no way they could be stopped.
Now… they just needed 48 more people.
But surprisingly, people actually seemed to be avoiding them.
"…"
Stark actually expected for people to rush for him to join their group after all that happened, but did it maybe cause the opposite reaction?
Were they scared that Stark's recklessness could lead to their dooms, or even worse: expulsion?!
[Do you want to invite 'Lana Moonless' into your party?]
[Y/N]
'Y'
A panel had appeared in front of everyone as soon as the bell rang, allowing them to create their very own parties without having to go report everything to the chairman as they would now able to see when someone was in a party, and how many members each group had.
It was pretty useful for both students and teachers.
['Lana Moonless' has been invited to your group!]
[48 spots remain!]
"Hey, Lana is here!"
"Pstt~ don't go, she's already in that weirdo's group, I wouldn't risk it…"
And the last feature was the most interesting of them all: you could look up the name of the students through the search bar or by scrolling through the 'participant list', and it would show you if they were in a group, and which one they were in.
This could be used to sway a person you want into joining your own group as a person could always leave another one if it benefits them more.
Even this seemed like a strategy game, but Stark just remained still, a neutral expression on his face, not wanting to participate.
At this point, he was just waiting for the timer to end so that he can be paired with 48 random people and get this over with.
[Timer: 2:37:58 left!]
"You're… not gonna try to recruit people?" Lana tilted her head.
"Nope, I'm sure you already know I could manage to beat that rift by myself, let's just wait," Stark smiled.
"Alright," and Lana, knowing of his strength and capabilities, actually believed in him enough to wait too.
Sora was a student as well, so she immediately went back to her spot as soon as her announcement as the 'year president' ended.
And as soon as the 'team picking' began, she was IMMEDIATELY surrounded by hundreds upon hundreds of people.
"…" they were all asking her to joint their group as having Sora would basically guarantee victory.
Of course, this was how it worked: the strongest and thus most famous people in the room were the ones with the highest demand as everyone attempted to approach them, meaning they had the choice to join whoever they wanted.
People such as Sora, Karl Spikeford (even after being humiliated by the former), Olivier Stardust, Lala Hunter and many more were now surrounded as if they were celebrities at a red carpet event, each person throwing out their own tempting offers of partnership.
[Timer: 1:56:32 left!]
An entire hour had passed, and so many groups had already formed.
Yet Stark and Lana remained, talking to each other calmly as if they didn't even care about any of this, and they clearly didn't.
But… something would change all of that.
Because after an entire hour, Sora finally managed to push through the crowd of annoying people surrounding her, a neutral expression on her face as she approached Stark, hundreds of people still behind her though as they didn't want to give up.
"Want to team?" she said calmly with her normal voice, looking at Stark in the eyes.
"…" Stark looked at Lana, who shrugged, then back at Sora, and he smiled, "Sure, why not, but I'm the leader," he said again.
"I don't mind…" Sora mumbled as she sent out an invitation.
['Sora Gardenis' has sent an invitation to join your party!]
[Do you want to invite her?]
[Y/N]
'Y'
The panel flashed again, and another name was added to the group.
['Sora Gardenis' has been invited to your group!]
[47 spots remain!]
And so suddenly, as soon as that happened and people checked their own panels to search Sora's name and confirm whatever the hell was happening…
[Sora Gardenis is currently in a group]
[Group Leader: Stark Heartsouls]
If they wanted to be with Sora, they actually needed to speak to Stark, as it is the group leader that accepts invitations.
"…" all these students stared at one another, and they actually regretted not joining Stark's group when no one wanted to, now the places were going to be limited.
[You have received 437 party invitations!]
[Do you want to check them out?]
'Holy…' Stark was baffled.

chapters.title: Chapter 236 - 236: The Rift Drawing
chapters.content:
"Hey, let us join, we're really strong," brown-haired twins approached Stark, summoning their weapons and showing them to him, "We can be useful!"
"Get out of here," a two meters tall man pushed them out of the way as he began to flex his muscles in front of Stark, "I can smash the heads of all these monsters easily, just accept my invite-"
A ninja girl drop-kicked him out of the way and landed in his position, though, "I can be stealthy and take out monsters from the back!"
Over and over, people kept coming around Stark, displaying their powers in front of him as a way to impress him and possibly make him want to recruit them.
His team had Lana, a powerful archer, Sora, the strongest classifier in the entire year according to the chairman himself, and Stark, who was respected by Sora herself.
Who wouldn't want to join this almost guaranteed win group?
[You have received 643 party invitations!]
Sora and Lana stood beside Stark, looking at him as he was making his decision.
"Well," he began to speak, and he immediately the surroundings became infinitely quieter, "It's not that you guys are useless, but I pretty much can beat the rift by myself, so all I need is half decent people that won't annoy me," Stark said the entire truth, as he truly ONLY wanted people that wouldn't be annoying over those that would keep asking questions and press him to participate.
"…"
"Is this guy crazy? Beating a rift by himself?"
"I mean, maybe if he teamed up with Sora, then she could carry him to victory, but otherwise this is just stupid."
Stark's bold declaration caused murmurs to ripple through the crowd.
But…
"See, this is the reason why I'm not choosing any of you," he just shrugged, "Anyway, lets get this over with so you don't annoy me."
Stark opened the panel with all the [Party Invitations], making everyone anxious as they could see that he was scrolling through all their names.
And then…
Stark closed his eyes.
"What?"
"Just pick someone, dude."
"That's what I'm doing," Stark replied.
And so to everyone's shock, while his eyes were still closed, Stark began to randomly scroll through the party invitation, not even looking at the screen.
After a few seconds of constant movement, he clicked on the [Accept] option of a person whose name he didn't even know.
"YESSSS!" he heard a girl's shout from the crowd, "THANK YOU!"
And just like that, Stark kept repeating that same process 46 more times, every time he selected a person, he would be hearing a cheering in the crowd, followed by dozens of other angered noises from the people who weren't selected: of course, those that were chosen were extremely happy and found justifications as to why Stark did that, while the others would just keep letting out insults.
Of course, once someone that was insulting Stark for doing this by sheer luck was selected, they would IMMEDIATELY switch their dialogue and go on his side.
But what can I say, that's a human's selfishness, isn't it?
And eventually…
[Your party is full!]
Stark opened his eyes again then shrugged, "Sorry, can't recruit anyone else!"
"FUCK YOU!"
"I swear to god I'm going to rip your eyes out, you little shit."
Those that were invited into the party surrounded Stark as all the others angrily shouted, ready to actively attack him for doing something as dumb as choosing the people in this important trial at random.
Was he crazy? Or was he just reckless? Or maybe it truly was that he believed he could take the rift by himself.
'Well, if they attacked I would have just beat all their asses, but oh well,' all the other students left, deciding to create groups between one another.
All of [Stark's Group] was now cheering as they had been selected.
But…
"Just don't come close to me during the rift, and we'll be good," Stark positioned himself in front of everyone and spoke, "Let me do my own thing, and you'll pass the first trial easily."
"Alright."
"Yessir!"
Surprisingly, all these people listened pretty damn well, maybe luck was truly on his side!
[Timer: 1:32:58 left!]
And so just like that.
[Timer: 54:11 left!]
The remainder of the time passed, with nothing else happening besides some more drama in the room, since people actively fought for places in the more powerful groups.
Karl actually even hosted a mini-tournament between four people for the last spot, and the winner was selected.
[Timer: 5:00 left!]
[Be quick!]
At this point, almost everyone had already gotten inside a group, except for a few people who didn't even bothered looking for one, instead just opting for luck to do the rest of the work.
~DING, DING, DING~
The bell animation appeared on the screen again.
[Timer over, all groups have been formed, and people without a group have been randomly assigned to one!]
[It is time to start the final part of this entrance ceremony: picking the rift!]
The chairman and teachers had been sitting on random chairs that appeared out of nowhere and discussing private matters, while the students were quite literally fighting for a spot in the top groups.
And so once the [Team Gathering] phase ended…
~SNAP~
He snapped his fingers, and all the chairs they had been sitting on disappeared, none of them were taken aback though, all standing up at the perfect moment, their timing immaculate.
"Very well," Theodore snapped his fingers for the second time, and a beautifully carved table, worth millions of rher coins, appeared on the stage, and he gestured dramatically toward a large, ornate box that had appeared on top of that table.
Stark eyed it, feeling the anticipation rising in his veins as he REALLY wanted to get that [Death Rift] card, thus giving him the rift that contained the 'Godless Demon' apostle as its final boss.
"Each group will draw a card from the [Drawing Box]. The card will reveal the rift you'll face. Some will be easier than others, but make no mistake, each has its own challenges," he explained for the second time as it had been more than three hours since they read the text on that screen.
Lana leaned in closer to Stark, whispering, "You think we'll get a tough one? Would be perfect if we got the easiest one, hehe~"
But unbeknownst to her, the black-haired boy was actually aiming for the hardest one of all, although Stark knew that if he said that to his team, then they would surely try to stop him, even Sora would possibly attempt to bind him, and with her reputation, she would easily be selected as the new leader.
Though, he couldn't see any universe where Sora would do something about what other people said, especially since he had saved her and proven his strength already.
"Doesn't matter, just need to get in and out," he said nonchalantly, clearly avoiding the question.
The chairman gestured to the box, his voice booming through the lobby, "All of you should have just received a number on your panel ranging from 1 to 50, it was selected at random and it will be the order you will pick a card in!"
~DING~
And just as he said, a panel appeared in front of Stark, it was completely blue, with the number 8 written in white.
"So I guess we're picking pretty early, that's good, it means we have less chances to pick the [Death Rift] card," Lana sighed, and everyone else in the group felt happy too.
After all, the bigger the number, then the higher your chances of picking that hellish card that the holographic screen had told them would be almost impossible to complete at their level!
Well… that is as long as it wasn't picked by another group.
And honestly, everyone, even Karl and all the strong classifiers didn't want to get it.
"Group number one's leader, please step forward and draw."
A nervous looking girl in group one gingerly stepped forward, and arrived in front of the table with the box floating.
"Please place your hand and pick a card," Theodore, "I promise there is no scary monster inside."
She reached a trembling hand into the box and pulled out a card.
And as soon as she did…
~DING~
The holographic screen that was set above the stage, which everyone could see, flickered to life, displaying the name of her chosen rift: [Forest of Shadows].
In addition to that, the card she had picked was actually displayed in front of everyone too, rotating around slowly as to allow people to read the front and back, much like when the [Death Rift] card they had been shown, although this one wasn't blurred.
Stark didn't read the info as he wasn't bothered though.
More groups passed, each getting their cards.
And eventually…
"Group number eight's leader, please come forward," Theodore spoke, and Stark knew it was his time.
"Good luck!" Lana nodded, while Sora just kept looking at him normally.
If only Lana knew that with Stark, luck wasn't a factor at all.

chapters.title: Chapter 237 - 237: The Death Rift Card
chapters.content:
"Group number eight's leader, please come forward."
"Cya, team," Stark waved as all his team members watched him walk toward the stage, with the most calm of expressions.
"Ohoh~ if it isn't the little Stark, feeling lucky today?" Theodore smiled as he pointed at the black floating box, "Just place your hand inside the hole and pick a card."
"Alright."
Stark was about to do what he had been told in front of everyone's gazes, wondering what could the boy that had caused two massive scenes ONLY during the entrance ceremony possibly pick.
"Come on…"
"Please…"
Stark's team was on edge as he placed himself in front of the box, seemingly ready to place his hand inside.
But right before he did that… he suddenly turned around, specifically facing toward Lana and Sora, then he shouted.
"Hey, team!" he waved, gathering everyone's attention, even those that were not interested, "I just want to tell you all before I pick a card that my luck is absolutely terrible!"
"…?"
"What?"
Of course, him saying that out loud meant everyone would hear it, and so everyone was left questioning what he meant by that.
"What?" Lana shouted back.
"As I said, my luck is terrible, it's like a curse!" he shrugged as he turned back, facing the box again.
Chatter was now filling the room, and even Theodore and the other teachers raised their eyebrows.
"Does he imply he is going to get the [Death Rift] card?"' Theodore mumbled in the ears of the vice-chairman, who was a man in his mid-thirties with spiky orange hair.
"Not possible, we have set it up with a powerful spell so that the [Death Rift] card only appears after group number 25 passes, meaning that it is literally impossible for him to get it."
This was to increase the pressure in the ceremony for the groups that passed late, as the more people passed and didn't get the card, the more stress they would accumulate.
And the teachers of this academy enjoyed seeing that! Quite sadistic, aren't they?
"Good, thanks Breach," Theodore responded to the vice-chairman, he absolutely loved Stark's personality and how chaotic anything he touched or got near became, and to him, it would have been immensely funnier if Stark did in fact get the hardest rift of all.
But, alas, it was impossible…
Stark reached for the interior of the box, his teammates even more pressure than he did after his words.
'Come on…' Stark kept mumbling over and over as he closed his eyes and sensed the cards inside the box, letting the cold feeling around his fingers decide which he would pick.
And suddenly…
[Talent: Chosen One, activated]
"…!" this could only mean one thing, and so Stark smiled as a card seemingly appeared in his hand out of nowhere.
~FWISH~
He pulled out his hand, and inside of it was… the card with the skull on it.
[SOMEONE HAS PICKED THE DEATH RIFT CARD!]
The holographic screen above the stage displayed some sort of alarm as the room began to flicker in and out with a crimson color.
"As I said," he shrugged as he turned toward his teammates, who were all baffled.
"BREACH?" Theodore turned toward the vice-chairman.
"H-How?" Breach's eyes widened, "This is not possible, Theodore, I can promise you that the spell was successful, this is not logical…"
And so this could only mean one of two things: the spell did indeed have a problem, or… Stark's bad luck defied reality.
"Well, I'll take it I guess," Stark sighed, fainting sadness, but deep inside he was throwing himself a party alongside [Domination] and [Alchemist].
He went back to his group under everyone's watchful gaze, and when he arrived…
"WHAT THE FUCK?"
"IF YOU KNEW YOUR LUCK WAS THIS BAD, YOU SHOULD HAVE JUST ASKED SORA TO LEAD!"
Most of them were complaining, and even Lana looked uncomfortable at the idea of attempting such a rift.
"Don't worry, folks," Stark eased up the atmosphere, "I promise to conquer it by myself if needed, I don't need anyone else!" he hit his chest twice as a sign of promise.
"…" no one could say anything, was this guy insane?
But…
"I think we should trust him… he is strong…" Sora suddenly said, and the sole fact she spoke made everyone shut up as they wanted to hear her, "Stark… is very strong…"
This was all she said, but if even the Sora, who they believed was their only hope, acknowledged Stark, then maybe…?
"See, I told you!" Stark smiled, "You don't even have to enter the rift to be honest, I'll do it alone!"
Of course, this was only said by Stark because he didn't want to be annoyed while exploring, and also so they couldn't steal his experience or kill the 'Godless Demon' apostle!
"Doesn't matter," Lana sighed, "Just us the card, quick."
"Righto!" Stark smiled as he joined his palms and placed the card in the middle, since it was fairly big.
The ominous skull with its crimson eyes almost felt like it was staring directly at their souls, sending a shiver down the spines of several of them, but nonetheless, they still needed this info as it would be all they had.
[Take the card for the information to appear!]
This was written on the card, but as Stark's hands were busy holding the semi-giant card between them, Lana was the one who gently taped it.
And suddenly…
~FWISH~
A crimson panel appeared in the air right above the card, making it possible for everyone to read the information.
…
[Name:] Corpse Cemetery
[Difficulty:] Nightmare
[Level Range:] 125-150 (only people around this level are allowed to enter).
[Boss:] ??? (Godless Demon Apostle)
[Information:] A cemetery corrupted by the curse of the 'Forsaken', the monsters there are all dead, killed by him, yet their bodies move like puppets, following his will, with no chance of ever defying him.
[There are 4 zones in this rift.]
[Location of the Rift:] Each of you has been granted a [Location Panel], check it out to know the location of the rift!
…
This was all the info they got, and below this wall of text were now one, but two pictures.
One was showing an ominous cemetery filled with mist, making it almost impossible to see anything.
And the other… depicted a towering figure, draped in tattered black robes, its skeletal hands gripping a gnarled staff. A swirling mass of shadows hovered around it, twisting and writhing like a living thing.
Below the second imagine was the word "Reaper" written in gold.
This was all the information they would be getting, but the sole sight of that thing on the second picture, which they assumed was the boss, made them cautious.
"Still think you can take it by yourself?" the tall man that had flexed his muscles to Stark before asked.
"…" Stark looked at the pictures, then back at him, "Yeah, I would win."
"Oh well, I am really excited to see that then," he groaned.
Soon after that, all 50 groups had successfully passed, although the ones after Stark did feel relieved as there was no chance they would be getting that hellish [Death Card].
"Everyone got their cards and teams," Theodore gestured as he spread his arms wide, "And this means… that the first trial shall begin, see you all in four months, or less depending on whether 30 groups complete their rifts before that!"
And so just like that, they were all dismissed, meaning that they could do whatever they wanted during these four months, under the condition that they beat the boss of their rift, obviously.
Stark was more ready than ever before, though, no chance in hell he was letting that opportunity slide!

chapters.title: Chapter 238 - 238: Stark Can Do it Alone!
chapters.content:
Everyone was allowed to leave the entrance ceremony's room once all the announcements were over.
But they were given one more order:
"Do not say anything about what happened here today, anyone who does will be found and expelled," that is all Theodore said, and with this simple threat everyone vowed to keep quiet.
"Don't worry, I'll do it!" Stark saw all the skeptical members of his group off as they all began to leave the room as the exit door had opened.
Of course, not only were they met with the light of sun, which hit them kind of hard after staying inside for more than 5 hours, but more importantly… what surprised them the most was the sheer amount of people awaiting them.
Hundreds of reporters, cars, and even helicopters were filming their every move as soon as they left.
There were even some cameras on the very tall buildings.
Of course, they were humans, so they absolutely loved the attention.
Meanwhile, Stark, Sora and Lana were the only remaining members of the team to still be inside.
"Are you sure can do it alone?" Lana questioned, seemingly worried that Stark was going on some crazy adventure and trying to fight impossible monsters against all the odds.
"Oh come on, Lana, have you ever seen me die doing this?" Stark smiled confidently.
"Huh, yeah, I did?" Lana remembered the time he did against Judicator, being cut in half.
"Same…" Sora mumbled, as he had died twice in front of her.
"…" Stark rolled his eyes, "Have you ever seen me TRULY die, though?"
And as none of them answered, only glancing at each other to check if what they were hearing was right…
"Exactly!" Stark nodded, "Don't worry, I'll be fine by myself, I prefer to be alone anyway as, y'know, defending people isn't my thing," this time he specifically looked at Sora, who actually felt a little bit of shame, her emotionless expression faltering slightly.
They soon after left the room, but were also met with the crowd of reporters who kept taking pictures of them.
"…" Stark liked attention, don't get him wrong, but he actually found that quite annoying.
"How are we supposed to get out?" Lana was an archer, no way to get out, and Sora could potentially injure people using her plants.
But Stark on the other hand…
"Crimson Ball Transmission," he mumbled as he summoned the crimson ball in his hand, then threw it with all his strength, sending it very far, way above the horde of reporters and classifiers.
[Point Set: It is safe to teleport!]
As soon as he saw that, he smirked.
"Hey," Stark turned toward the two girls, reaching his opened hands at them, "Hold my hand for a second."
"W-What?" Of course, Lana was flustered, "What do you mean?!"
"…" but thankfully, Sora grabbed Stark's left hand without a single ounce of hesitation.
"Thank you, Sora," Stark smiled at her, he liked her straightforwardness.
"H-Hey, I can do that too!" Lana also grabbed Stark's hand as to not be left out (she was totally not jealous, obviously).
"Thanks," Stark nodded, ready to snap his fingers.
But…
"Oh, I'm stupid," he realized he couldn't really snap his fingers if both his hands were holding someone, so he removed his hands from Lana's and instead put it around her shoulder.
"…" Lana didn't say anything, although she did jolt a little.
And so finally…
~SNAP~
Stark quickly tightened the grip around Sora's hand, and hugged Lana as to guarantee she wouldn't stay here.
~FWISH~
~POOF~
And so almost instantly, surrounded by a crimson aura, they found themselves in another street, far from the academy and all the reporters.
Stark looked to his left and right, then sighed in relief as he noticed Lana and Sora were indeed there, although both closing their eyes as they didn't expect this.
They had never felt something like this in their lives, and to be honest, they didn't want to experience it again so suddenly.
"Done," he freed himself from their grasp, then gave them a thumbs up, "Now we can do whatever we want!"
And so he began walking away, with the full intent of going back to his apartment complex to prepare for the rift as soon as tomorrow arrives.
"Well… Goodbye, Sora," Lana waved at the white haired girl, then began to follow Stark.
"You're going in the same direction?" Sora tilted her head, but was still holding that emotionless look, though.
"Oh, yeah, we live in the same building, actually right next to each other," Lana scratched her head in embarrassment.
"…" Sora looked down at the ground, then back at Lana, "Alright," and thus she began to walk away in the opposite direction.
She didn't want them to see it, but her face did falter slightly when Lana said that! Why were they living right next to each other? Could it be…?
'No, doesn't matter,' she shook her head lightly, 'But… what the hell is this feeling… I don't know…' she decided to ignore it as she truly didn't know what it was, having never felt such a thing before was confusing to her.
Back to Stark and Lana, they (yet again) hailed for a taxi, and were transported to their complex, thankfully enough the roads were a bit emptier than before, otherwise it would have been a hassle.
They both used the elevator to climb to the third floor this time, and each went inside their respective apartments.
"Are you really, REALLY sure?" Lana asked one more time as Stark opened the door.
"…" but the boy just looked at her, "Yeah," he shrugged, "By the way I'll probably be gone by the morning, so don't wait up or anything."
"You plan to go tomorrow?!" Lana was shocked, usually people wanted to take a bit of a break, then discuss their plans with others to conquer the rift.
Yet… not only was he going alone, but without thinking of any viable plan at all?
Lana knew Stark was crazy and reckless, but this was going far beyond the limits of normal.
"It's fine," he patted her head, although she didn't blush or anything this time as she kept staring at him dead in the eyes, knowing the dangers of his actions, "I guess we'll see each other when I kill that boss, and it's announced I completed it."
"And you also plan to do it all in one go? While even the chairman said it would take us two months?" Lana was baffled.
"I mean, the rift has four zones, and it can't be that big, I think the average time it takes is because people know they have four months, if they were given one week, many would have completed it in under that, plus if your group is injured you have to take a one or two weeks break, which adds to the time," Stark explained, and the worst of all was that it actually made sense to Lana.
"That's- I- Sigh…" Lana sighed then smiled, "Alright, then I guess I'll see you later, you crazy idiot," she lightly punched Stark's chest in a friendly way, "Just don't die on me."
"I won't," Stark's aura became more powerful as he said that, and so he finally entered his apartment, "Well then…"
It was time to start the trial of the first semester of this academy.

chapters.title: Chapter 239 - 239: Reaching the Rift's Location
chapters.content:
As Stark had some time left, he decided to yet again go inside his [Memories Museum] to train.
He had gotten very familiar with all his skills now, and even though controlling the [Sculk Necklace] was very complicated since the weird liquid never truly did it what he wanted, when he actually managed to touch a monster with the slime-like substance, then he would end up combo-ing the boss 70 percent of the time since it would be restrained by the liquid.
Stark knew why he struggled this much once the sculk ever so much as grazed him now: even other monsters had a hard time with it, so no wonder.
"The time…" Stark mumbled, it had been so long that he had been inside the [Memories Museum] to try and fight a different combination of bosses he hadn't checked, "WHAT?"
It was currently 4 am, meaning that he had essentially spent all day yesterday, as well as a good chunk of the night, fighting.
"I mean…" he scratched the back of his head, "I wanted to be as ready as possible, and I think I am, but cutting back on sleep won't do it… I still need some stamina after all…"
After a fight against his own mind, Stark finally decided that he didn't need that much sleep, and that he would sleep around 3 or 4 hours, weirdly enough though, he actually wasn't THAT tired.
"Weird…" was it [Domination] fueling him as to keep him awake?
Well, it didn't matter.
He left the [Memories Museum], then jumped on his bed and closed his eyes, making sure to set up his alarm.
***
"…" Stark opened his eyes, fully knowing where he would be as it always happened, there wasn't a single night of sleep where he didn't meet them after all.
Strangely enough, though, the scenarios [Domination] and [Alchemist] would find themselves in this dream realm were always different.
Right now, Stark was sitting on the bench of a lively park, and although it was surrounded by darkness, trees and grass were still visible, making it much different than the usual depressing atmosphere of this world.
"Ready?" he heard [Domination]'s voice to the left, and he saw it standing beside him, on the same bench.
"Of course he is, he can always use my potions to destroy them anyway," [Alchemist] shrugged.
"Oh yeah, of course, he can use the only GOOD potion you have, which is [Crystal Stun]," [Domination] shook his head.
"Hey, if he actually took the time to buy some potions instead of praying to get some news one from monsters, then I'm sure our crafting station would already been at level 10!" [Alchemist] scoffed, and it was true, since Stark didn't really take the time to do any of that, he just constantly bought materials for the potions he currently had, but never bothered to buy new ones.
"Doesn't matter, tomorrow is a big day for us!" [Domination] closed his right fist and pointed it at the sky, "New rift, new boss, new apostle to defeat!"
"Right," Stark spoke for the first time.
"Anyway, we don't have anything much to say beside that you should be careful, going solo always worked until now, but I have a bad feeling about this," [Alchemist] nodded, and [Domination] agreed with that statement.
"Don't worry, I'll manage," Stark also got up from the bench, while Alchemist remained sitting.
And so, before he could even realize it, the park had disappeared.
"Good luck," he heard Alchemist's and Domination's voice as they vanished as well, and then he lost consciousness too.
***
~BEEP, BEEP, BEEP~
His alarm was ringing, and Stark quickly shut it down as he opened his eyes and got up immediately, not wasting a single second.
It was currently exactly 8 am, and Stark wanted to leave while the streets were still mostly empty.
Quick breakfast, shower, changing clothes, and he was all set!
"…" he left his apartment, carrying nothing in his hands other than his sole determination, which was burning his heart so strongly that it actually hurt a bit.
Right as he walked through the hallway before reaching the stairs, he passed in front of Lana's hand, stopping for three seconds to look at it.
"…" but then he immediately continued walking.
He reached the ground pretty quickly.
"Anyway, need to find the location of the rift…"
He remembered reading something about it on the [Death Rift] card, which he owned since he was the leader.
…
[Location of the Rift:] Each of you has been granted a [Location Panel], check it out to know the location of the rift!
…
"Right… But how do I open it is the question?" he mumbled, "Well… might as well try."
"Location Panel!" he semi-shouted.
And… nothing.
[You need to also say the name of the rift, since you have been put on the list of people who can do it.] another panel appeared to help him though, otherwise it would have been really difficult.
"Location Panel: Corpse Cemetery!" he spoke again.
And this time…
~DING~
[Follow the arrow!]
Extremely similarly to back when he received that watch from Arthur, the archer king, to conquer [Sierra's Death Path], an arrow appeared on a panel visible to Stark, pointing to a direction.
[26.7 kilometers away, inside the sealed cabin of the 'crosswood cemetery'.]
"Oh," it even added some sort of note afterward as to show him (and probably his other teammates) the exact location, looks like the chairman and the teachers had thought of everything, "Well at least I'll know now."
Stark didn't want to waste any more time, and so he immediately hailed for a taxi, which were basically his primary way of traveling as he didn't have a driver's license, or a car in that regard, maybe he could ask Lana though, she would probably give one to him…?
In the end, he removed that thought from his mind as it actually kind of embarrassed him to think of Lana as his… money giver?
"Please, to the 'crosswood cemetery'" he asked the driver as soon as he got inside the car.
"Oh?" the driver looked at him for a few seconds, but just shrugged, "You should be careful there, kid, it's been abandoned and no one goes anymore since there have been rumors that a powerful rift has opened there."
"Yeah, I've been tasked with conquering it," Stark said nonchalantly, not finding any excuse like 'I'm visiting someone'.
"…" the driver stared at Stark with a neutral expression, then started up the car, "Alright… I hope you do a good job, then."
"Thanks."
It took them around 30 minutes in the car to finally reach the cemetery, which was placed in a really 'creepy' side of the capital, since most of the buildings there were abandoned.
"Heard it was from monster attacks," the driver informed Stark, "I would really be careful if I was you, kid."
"Interesting…"
[1.5 kilometers away, inside the sealed cabin of the 'crosswood cemetery'.]
"Well, that's all," the driver stopped in front of the gates of the cemetery, which was literal end of the road, there was nowhere else to go from there.
"Alright, thanks," Stark paid and left the car, then the taxi driver went away, disappearing as soon as he turned around the corner, "And now…"
"It's time to do this…" he stared at the cemetery from behind the gate, and it actually sent a shiver down his spine.
There was a really creepy atmosphere, and he could sense it in his bones that there was, in fact, a rift in this place.
But right as he tried reached his hand to open the gate…
~CLUNK~
He noticed that it was locked by a powerful-looking chain.
"Oh, great," Stark sighed, but it didn't bother him.
There was a sign right next to the entrance: [Do not attempt to climb up, an electricity spell has been placed on the bars.]
He could see the cemetery through the bars, but he couldn't access.
And when he reached for one of them…
~ZAP~
"-100!"
It was in fact protected, but thankfully enough the people that set it up didn't make it too powerful, as it would have surely killed someone if it was.
"Crimson Ball Transmission," Stark though wasn't bothered, as he just summoned the crimson ball in his hand, then threw it above the gate, landing on the ground inside the cemetery.
~SNAP~
He was teleported inside without a single problem.
To be honest, even outside of battles, [Crimson Ball Transmission] was an incredible and practical skill, at least much more than the boy originally believed.
It allowed Stark to set up a point in the real world in case he wanted to go back, but also allowed him to get past areas that wouldn't normally possible to get past, and quite easily too.
And then there was the teleportation in battles, which were also amazing, allowing him to take enemies aback every time.
"Anyway," but now that Stark was inside the cemetery, he looked around, and all he could see was a small stone road leading deeper inside, tombstones scattered everywhere, and a thick layer of mist blocking the view.
It was in the morning, but the mist made it hard to see even though the sun was up.
[800 meters away, inside the sealed cabin of the 'crosswood cemetery'.]
"Let's get this over with."
And so he began walking down the stone path, trying to find the 'cabin' and the rift.

chapters.title: Chapter 240 - 240: The Corpse Cemetery Rift
chapters.content:
The mist swirled around Stark's legs as he stepped carefully along the stone path.
Each footstep echoing against the silence of the cemetery, and the chill in the air wrapping around him like a cold embrace.
"…" Stark didn't mind though, he wasn't afraid, and he just followed the stone path, looking around once in a while, just to see hundreds of tombstones from different people, probably classifiers that passed away from monsters?
It did seem like "classifier" was one of those professions where you wouldn't live long enough to grow old after all.
Stark kept walking for a pretty good amount of time, he didn't check his phone since no reason to, but it did feel like at least twenty minutes had passed.
This cemetery was so big it was actually scary to think it was abandoned only because of a rift appearing.
And Stark could only wonder just how bad that rift would be.
"Well… as long as I can kill one of those apostles…" he mumbled.
And less than five minutes later… he reached the end of the stone path.
And what was waiting for him at the end, as you might have guessed… was the wooden cabin.
Stark could FEEL the powerful aura emanating from it, and he didn't even know how the wooden structure didn't crumble as it was constantly shaking.
Stark reached for the closed door, ready to open it and see what this is all about.
But right as he was about to turn the handle…
[Warning! You will teleport to a dangerous rift if you open this door!]
[It is advised for you to go back!]
[There isn't just one apostle-]
Some sort of warning came up, but Stark didn't even bother reading all of it as he swung the door open.
Immediately, he was greeted with a gray portal that was sucking everything outside towards it.
And obviously, Stark was no different.
"W-Wow?" Stark was being sucked by the portal, and even though he tried to resist slightly just to make sure everything was alright, he was still forced to enter the rift.
And then the door closed behind him, meaning no one would come for him.
***
~THUD~
After the weird feeling of being transported through time and space, Stark landed in the rift.
[Welcome to the "Corpse Cemetery"!]
[Difficulty: Nightmare]
[Number of classifiers: 1]
[Oh wow, you're brave!]
"Appreciate it," Stark shrugged.
[You are in the first zone: "The Road to Death"!]
[Good Luck!]
As always, the panels that explained everything Stark needed to do appeared, then disappeared just as quickly.
And now… he was truly alone.
First of all, the first thing Stark did was activate the perk of [Domination] he got at level 25, which was [Facial Camouflage], thus hiding his face with his aura, he didn't know why he did it, but it just felt right.
Then Stark took a minute to observe his surroundings.
And…
"Huh?" he was extremely confused, "Wait a damn minute…"
He turned around and…
"Knew it," he saw a giant gate, extremely similar to the one he bypassed to enter the cemetery in the real world, and beyond it was nothing but darkness, meaning no way to leave.
Right now, Stark was in an exact replica of the "crosswood cemetery" he had traversed to reach the cabin.
The dark green grass was omnipresent everywhere, the tombstones were placed in the exact same spots, and the stone path led ahead, although it was a bit more difficult to look far because the mist in the rift was much thicker.
Stark scanned the area, a sense of unease creeping in as the white mist curled around his legs, seemingly attached to the ground.
"Alright, Stark, focus," he muttered to himself, pushing forward along the stone path.
He could hear whispers in his ears as he advanced, but they didn't bother him that much.
Surprisingly, even after ten minutes, Stark met absolutely no monsters, so he just kept going, hoping to reach the second zone quickly.
"…" but deep inside, he knew this couldn't be it.
THIS was the rift of the apostle? This was the [Death Rift] card the chairman talked about?
Of course, there was the possibility that this rift was somewhat like the [Domination] trial: making it seem FAIRLY easy, until you reach the first sublevel and realize the monsters are tougher than all others level combined, and then you reach the boss and realize that It's actually almost impossible to defeat it.
In this case it would be like: very easy first, second, and third zone, but then the fourth is a total nightmare, and the apostle comes to finish the work.
Yet… right as Stark was thinking about that possibility…
~CREAK, CREAK~
He hurt noise behind him, and once he turned… he noticed that all the tombstones that were placed on the sides of the path close to where he was were all shaking like crazy.
Those behind, in front of him, on the side, all of them were shaking.
And then…
~CRACK~
With a simple sound, all the tombstones tore apart.
"…" Stark knew what this meant, and so he positioned himself.
And what came out of them… was one single type of monster.
[It's the only type in the first zone, but their sheer number is what makes it scary!]
Stark clenched his fists, the chill of the air sharpening his focus.
The monsters crawled from the cracked tombstones, skeletal figures clad in tattered rags, their hollow eyes glowing with a sinister light.
"Perception!" they were pretty slow, so he had the time.
…
[Name: Hollow Skeleton]
[Level: 125]
[HP: 60000]
[Strength: 5127]
[Stamina: 9999]
[Speed: 783]
[Defense: 431]
[Skills: Bone Shatter, Skeletal Barrage, Grave Bind, Wraith's Embrace, Curse of Decay, Haunting Whispers, Puppet.]
…
Other than the fact their stamina was abnormally high, probably since they cannot get tired, all their other stats except strength were very, very low, and their HP too, it would probably take only one strike from Stark to kill one.
But this was the problem: hundreds of them were coming out of each tombstone, slowly advancing toward the boy.
Some had blades, others scythes, while the majority remained empty-handed, probably since if they ever even got close to Stark and grabbed him, then he would be fucked.
And their number also meant another thing: much like the zombies in the second sublevel of the trial, they wouldn't be giving out much EXP individually.
But as a group, then it would surely be a lot.
How to kill them all was the problem, though.
But it was a problem Stark didn't have.
"…" the boy wasn't bothered, actually, he was waiting for all of them to come out of their spot and get closer to him, "Focus…"
He closed his eyes, and sensed all of their auras as they slowly got closer, wanting to make sure that he didn't fail whatever he was trying to do.
Stark got the [Exorcist] class, and the entirety of the [Corpse Cemetery] was mostly covered by undead beings, meaning that they were weak not only to his punches since domination's aura had merged with exorcist, but that he also had two skills specially designed to wipe out both a horde of monsters, but also powerful elites.
And in this case…
"Come on…" sweat poured from Stark's forehead as he could sense the hundreds of presence around him, "Don't be scared…"
This was one of the most dangerous things he had done probably, as closing your eyes when surrounded by this many monsters, not even sure you could perceive them all, was basically suicide.
Lana would probably strangle him for doing that.
But now that he was alone…
He waited… and waited… and then, when the monsters were close enough, raising their arms to use their skills…
"I got you all," he opened one of his eyes as it burned with aura.
And…
"CRIMSON PURIFICATION!"
The crimson/golden aura flared to life around Stark, a brilliant halo that pulsed with energy forming around him.
"Feel the light!" he shouted, thrusting his arms forward.
The moment his voice broke through the air, the wave of holy energy surged outward.
~WHAM~
A shockwave radiated from him, sending some sort of [Holy Slash] from all directions around him.
"Kldklkl~"
"Garhh…"
The range was immense, and so all the horde of [Hollow Skeletons] was hit, the moment they came in contact with the attack being the last as they all crumbled to the ground, unable to withstand the holy power.
[Critical Hit!]
And so…
"Phew…" Stark wiped all that sweat from his forehead, then smiled.
If it wasn't for [Crimson Purification], he would have surely struggled so much more, if not died, so he could definitely thank everything that he got the [Exorcist] class.
But killing this many monsters could only mean one thing…
[You have slain "Hollow Skeleton lv125", gaining 28391 EXP!]
[You have slain "Hollow Skeleton lv125", gaining 28114 EXP!]
.
.
[You have killed 274 'Hollow Skeletons'.]
[Due to their number and natures as "puppets of the apostle", the experience points you will get are gonna be reduced!]
And so that meant…
[+7,703,513 experience!]
"Oh… shit…!" Stark's eyes widened.
The harder the rifts and enemies, the more exp he was getting, and this was yet another record broken for him, as he had never received so much at once.
And of course, getting this much experience could only mean one thing.
~DING, DING, DING~
The familiar sound of leveling up was heard by the boy.
"Here we go…"
This was only the beginning of the [Corpse Cemetery], but he was already happy that he came alone.

chapters.title: Chapter 241 - 241: Second Zone: Nightmare Loop Cabin
chapters.content:
