[Your level has increased to level 61, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 62, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 63, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Experience: 2217224/2500000]
[Skill Points: 9 Available!]
The amount of experience needed to level up was truly getting out of hand, true, but the fact he was still able to increase his level by three in such a short amount of time meant that it was still pretty balanced for now.
~WISHHHH~
Stark sighed as he minimized all the panels and looked around.
The first zone was now completely silent, with the destroyed corpse of the [Hollow Skeletons] lying around, some still surrounded by the holy aura.
"Puppets of the apostle…" he mumbled as he read that on one of the panel, specifically the one that told him he would be getting a decreased amount of EXP for these mobs since they were pretty weak, "Well, doesn't matter, I'm killing it anyway."
With determination blazing in his eyes, Stark kept going along the stone path that was set for him, nothing bothering him anymore.
And after ten minutes of eerie silence… he arrived in front of the cabin.
"…" Stark was not stupid, if the first time was a trap (although he had been warned), but what about the cabin that was in the actual rift?
This is something he would have said normally, but there was really no other way to access the second zone, so without a single hint of hesitation he swung the door open, although he positioned himself if anything did happen.
The cabin was pretty small when he looked at it from the outside, barely able to hold more than five humans inside.
But once opened…
"Huh?" the interior was giant, leading to a very long wooden hallway.
He could thankfully check it out from the outside, and the interior was completely made out of the same wood and texture, making it feel very… chilly for some reason.
"Oh well," Stark sighed before stepping inside the cabin.
And then…
~SLAM~
The door closed behind him, with no way for him to open it back, even if he tried to punch it with all his strength or using his skills.
[Second Zone: Nightmare Loop Cabin]
"…" Stark stared in front of him, and he could see the wooden walls of the cabin hallway for what seemed like infinity.
No matter how hard he tried to squint his eyes or use [Focus] to see the end, he just couldn't.
"How long is that hallway?" he sighed as he began walking, at least he would be able to notice if any monsters tried to ambush him since it was a straight line.
Stark stepped cautiously down the seemingly endless hallway, the wooden floor creaking under his weight.
The first five minutes went normally, with Stark suspecting nothing that bad to be occurring, after all it did take him a while before meeting the [Hollow Skeletons] in the first zone, so why should he worry?
Then ten minutes without any monsters: alright, maybe there is something.
And then twenty minutes: how long is this hallway going to keep going for…?
Thirty minutes: "…"
Forty minutes: "…"
Fifty minutes: "Alright."
Stark stopped walking and looked around: behind him was the endless hallway, meaning that he had indeed been walking this distance, but in front of him was literally the same scenery as well, so it didn't help.
What actually frightened Stark the most was the non-presence of monsters, which until now in every rift had ALWAYS been there to stop him.
But in this specific zone… they just didn't exist?
"Either that hallway is REALLY big, and the challenge isn't about monsters," Stark put his hand against his chin, "Or… the name means something."
[Nightmare Look Cabin] he checked the name again, putting all his attention on the "loop".
"Loop," he muttered, glancing over his shoulder, "Hm…"
But there was nothing, just the same wooden walls stretching endlessly behind him.
"AURA SMASH!" he summoned his three fists, then sent them toward one of the walls.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
But they weren't even damaged, all it left was a giant crimson mark as the aura remained in its spot.
"Since when is wood this durable?" Stark raised his eyebrows, "Shouldn't have gone into the cabin without a plan, huh…"
Not knowing what to do, Stark decided there was nothing better than just keep going and figure it out as he went.
And so he started walking again, each step echoing in the silence, and this time paying much more attention than before.
Every single centimeters of the walls he was passing was being inspected by [Focus].
And after exactly fifteen minutes…
"…!" Stark's eyes widened.
No, he didn't find the exit or any monster or whatever.
But…
"Alright, I get it now," he stared at one of the walls, and on it were the traces of the [Aura Smash] attack he used fifteen minutes ago, "That hallway loops for around fifteen minutes by walking…"
There is absolutely NO rift or zone that cannot be completed, meaning that even those that contained puzzles (much like this one) or traps couldn't be used to instantly kill a classifier, as it wouldn't be fair.
Which meant that there was a way to get out.
How though was the answer Stark needed to find.
"Between this exact spot and the entire loop is somewhere that leads to the next zone," he reached his conclusion.
Stark pressed his palm against the wall, tracing the faint markings left by his earlier attack.
"Fifteen minutes…"
He turned and began pacing again, this time going in the opposite direction, his thoughts racing.
As he walked, he scanned for any irregularities, any sign of a shift in the wood grain or an odd texture. He kicked at the floorboards, testing their strength, but they didn't even budge.
"Maybe it's not about the walls," he muttered, "What if it's… a monster?"
After inspecting literally everything, taking him around an hour, Stark found nothing, and was yet again back at his original spot with the marks of the [Aura Smash] available for him to see.
"Think… Stark Heartsouls… think…" Stark stood up in the middle of the hallway and closed his eyes as he began to imagine the structure of the hallway in front of him, white lines forming in his mind as to draw its shape even though he closed his eyes, "Focus… on any kind of weird aura… anything…"
With his eyes closed, Stark began to look around, the white lines showing the shape of the hallway as though they were still opened: this was a way for him to look past the walls for any aura.
But… there was nothing.
Even after several minutes of focusing everything he had on his vision, he didn't see anything remotely suspicious.
Or at least… that's what he believed.
"It's just… not there," Stark sighed as he looked down in disappointment.
But at that moment… his eyes widened.
"…!" because exactly right under his feet, in a spot he would normally never notice it in if he didn't look down… was a dark aura.
"I… got you," Stark smiled as he kept staring down at the moving aura, this time he would make sure to get out of that shitty loop, though he didn't open his eyes again, wanting to make sure that it was indeed real.

chapters.title: Chapter 242 - 242: The Darkness Ghost BOSS
chapters.content:
"…" Stark kept staring at the ground below him with his eyes closed, not leaving the weird black aura out of his field of vision for even a second, 'Calm down…'
That thing's aura was actively terrifying, and he felt like if he let any kind of emotions visible, then it would detect it and come out to surprise him.
Of course, this would mean the beginning of the fight, but Stark didn't want that: HE wanted to ambush it!
He took a step forward, his eyes still closed, and the dark aura followed him.
"Hm…" it seemed to have been following him all this time, making sure to stay under his feet to not get detected.
Too bad for it that it fell against the worst opponent possible at this time.
And so…
"Wielding Cross," he whispered, summoning the crimson/golden cross above his head as he stared at the aura below.
The crimson/golden cross hovered above Stark, radiating with a fierce light, and he could feel the energy crackling in the air.
It was strange that it didn't notice the change in the atmosphere since, y'know, this cross was literally the ultimate weakness of undead monsters, which he assumed that thing was, or maybe it just thought that he was going to use it on the wall?
Who knows!
"Time to end this," he muttered, focusing on the dark aura that slithered beneath him.
And with a swift motion, he took a step back, then smashed the ground where the aura was as it needed to move, not able to predict Stark's movements if he was this fast.
~BOOOOOOM~
This time, the ground actually crumbled as the cross passed right through it, hitting whatever was below as Stark could feel the impact of the hit.
"-243717!" and the damage was beyond anything he had ever done before.
"FGRAGHHHH~" a terrifying scream came from the ground he had hit.
And after a few seconds of suspense…
~FWISH~
The creature emerged from the ground.
It was a mass of shadow and decay, towering above Stark by a long shot, reaching the very high 10 meters tall ceiling easily.
Its form twisted and contorted, shifting like smoke in the wind, and blackened bones could be seen coming out from each of its side.
Its eyes, if they could be called that, glowed a sickly green, piercing through the dim light of the cabin.
As for its figure… well… it wasn't humanoid, instead it just looked like it was wearing its "aura" as some sort of sheet to hide its true form, only allowing Stark to see its eyes and giant mouth, and it literally didn't have a face, it was just darkness.
"Gaahhrrhh~" as it opened its mouth, a low, guttural growl escaped it, reverberating in the hallways of the cabin.
It stretched its arms wide, revealing bony fingers curling into claws, each extremely sharp and sturdy, although it didn't have a weapon, its hands were surrounded by that same aura that covered its body and soul.
The creature swayed, and its body literally moving like a flame on the edges.
And after its introduction… it just stared at Stark, not doing anything else.
"Holy shit…" Stark backed away, that thing was horrifying, and he didn't even know why he felt like that, after all it didn't have a proper face or figure…
"You…" and it could actually speak, even though it could only say a few words, "Die…" it pointed its arm at Stark, "Death aura."
~FWISH, VIOUM~
Stark's heart raced as the creature's bony fingers extended. The air thickened, a chilling weight pressing down on him.
"Die…" it growled again, its voice so rusty it was actually horrible to listen to.
With a flick of its wrist, shadows spiraled from its hand, coiling through the air toward Stark.
But…
"INVINCIBLE DODGE," Stark just rolled out of the attack's way, "Good try!"
"…" the green eyes were still hollow though, showing no malice or any sort of resentment whatsoever, the monster was just… staring, no emotions in its eyes.
"WIELDING CROSS!" yet again, Stark positioned his hands as if he was holding a baseball bat, then swung with full force to his left.
~SLAM, BOOOM~
The monster was yet again hit.
"-231985!"
"…" and yet, it wasn't dead.
"Huh?" this wasn't normal.
Stark had assumed that this monster should be an elite, yet their HPs shouldn't be that high at this current level… right?
"PERCEPTION!" he shouted as he decided to check out the opponent before it could attack again.
And what he saw… was shocking.
…
[Name: Darkness Ghost (BOSS)]
[Level: 130]
[HP: 114298/590000]
[Strength: 9999]
[Stamina: 15000]
[Speed: 3492]
[Defense: 4371]
[Skills: Shadow Grasp, Aura Drain, Bone Shard Barrage, Raging Loop, Shroud of Darkness, Soul Blind, Necrotic Touch, Void Pulse…]
…
Stark's eyes widened.
No, it wasn't because of the stats, which were kind of weird, or because of the skills.
But because… based on the "ranking" next to its name, that thing was a boss.
"A boss… in the middle of the rift?" Stark was confused, this has never happened before, after all!
As to possibly comprehend what was happening, he reminded himself of all possible rankings monsters could have: Fodder, Weak, Normal, Strong, Elite, Boss, Calamity, Immortal, Universal, Divine.
But usually, in video games and in this world, then it was always the final boss of the rift that should be at the [Boss] category… right?
But what if he was wrong? There were four other difficulties after [Boss] after all.
What if… he had been wrong, what if final bosses can actually be way WAY stronger than anything he ever imagined.
What if… the apostle this time is from the [Calamity] difficulty? What if from now on, every rift would have progressively more difficult enemies and apostles?
Just this thought sent a shiver down Stark's spine, as it meant that the next monsters could easily take down the warden…
"Doesn't matter," in the end he just decided to beat it and see for himself, he had said he would go alone after all, and he would never regret that decision.
Plus, even if that thing was a boss, he still had the complete advantage no matter what as he had already damaged it for over 450000 health points in two attacks.
"Focus… Stark Heartsouls… you got this…" but the fact that he knew that this thing was a boss even though he was only in the second zone was still omnipresent.
"…" and the monster literally wasn't attacking, even though its strength stat proved that no matter what it did, it would surely one shot the human.
"Oh well, if you want to sit still, then I'll allow it!!"
"…" the green eyes filled with aura were unmoving, and even after the second attack had crashed, the monster only budged slightly, not even caring about the damage it received.
"GOOD… BYE!" Stark swung for the third and final time toward the [Darkness Ghost], expecting it to take the hit again and die, but…
"Aura Drain…" it whispered in a very calm voice as it positioned its giant skeletal hand in the spot where the cross was hitting.
And then…
"GOT YOU-" Stark wanted to shout this, but before he could even finish, his jaw dropped.
~FWISH~
The [Darkness Ghost] actually stopped the cross with the palm of its hand as if it was the easiest thing in the world, then grabbed it from the tip and began to suck out the holy aura, making the cross essentially disappear in less than ten seconds.
"+100000" and in addition to that, it healed itself.
And then… as if it didn't care about anything, it went back to stare at Stark with its hollow eyes, one that were piercing his soul.
"…" Stark knew that this definitely was a boss now.

chapters.title: Chapter 243 - 243: Exorcism of the Ghost Boss
chapters.content:
[Darkness Ghost HP: 214298/590000]
To be honest, it was the first time Stark fought a monster so… passive.
He could feel its presence and power, yet it wasn't doing anything, just staring at Stark with its empty and emotionless eyes, its body slowly swaying from left to right as if waiting for him to make the first move.
"AURA SMASH!" Stark didn't want to stay in here for too long, so he indeed was the one to attack first, sending his three crimson fists toward the ghostly creature.
But yet again…
"Soul Drain…" it muttered slowly as it raised its two skeletal hands, tanking the attacks and sucking them in once they hit its palms.
"+10000! +10000! +10000!"
"…" Stark's expression turned stoic, "Alright, no more projectiles I guess."
He got ready to dash toward the monster, using his fist to attack, and although it was a ghost, he should still be able to hit it with his aura, right?
Yet, right before he was about to start the assault…
"Bone Shard Barrage…!" The creature hissed, its voice cold and sharp.
Before Stark could react, a barrage of jagged bone shards erupted from the ghost's form, slicing through the air like a deadly storm.
"SHIT!" Stark ducked, rolling to the side just in time to avoid the deadly projectiles that embedded themselves into the wooden walls behind him.
He regained his footing, breathing hard. "Okay, so that's how you wanna play?"
The ghost's empty gaze seemed to challenge him. Stark lunged again, this time aiming for the creature's legs.
"Bone Shard Barrage…" it whispered again, forcing Stark to back away for the second time.
~FWISH~
He tried to avoid again, but not being able to use [Invincible Dodge] made it IMPOSSIBLE to avoid the attack as they were in a closed hallway.
And so…
~PIERCE, FWISH~
Two of the sharp bones that flew in all directions hit his shoulder and hip.
"-17362! -23911!" the [Domination] aura protected him from receiving fatal damage, but he was still extremely low now.
"…" then without wasting a single second, the monster its right arm, enveloping it in its dark aura.
It had been so quiet and calm until now that the fact it suddenly attacked took Stark by surprise.
And yet…
"I… can't… move…" there was a small hole in his hip, which hurt like hell.
The ghost loomed closer, its skeletal arm extending toward Stark, the dark aura swirling around its fingers like smoke.
"Shadow Grasp…" it hissed, and the air grew heavy, oppressive. Stark felt an invisible force wrap around his limbs and body, tightening with a grip that wouldn't let go.
"WHAT THE FUCK," Panic surged through him as he struggled against the grasp, his breath quickening, there were shadows coiled around him, squeezing tighter, drawing him closer to the creature's mouth, basically transporting him to his doom.
Stark tried to struggle, but his hip was still throbbing with a sharp pain that just wouldn't go away, plus the wound was still fresh, blood seeping through his clothes.
And so with the small amount of power he had left in this position…
"Crimson Healing!" he shouted, forcing the words from his lips.
As soon as he activated the skill though, a crimson light began to surround the boy, and specifically the wounds on his hip and shoulder, both of them closing.
"+20000!" and he regained his health, not all of it, but enough to be able to continue.
But there was one problem: this didn't change the fact that some weird shadows were still surrounding him, transporting him toward the creature, who had its mouth open, ready to devour the human.
There was one thing it seemed to forget, though: Stark was an exorcist too, and he had another skill in stock for such situation.
"CRIMSON PURIFICATION!" he shouted again, as the mouth with sharp teeth was now only a few centimeters away from closing in on him.
~FWISH~
A radiant burst of holy energy erupted from him, illuminating the dark space with a fierce glow, and the shadows clutching him recoiled, disintegrating into wisps of smoke as the energy pulsed outward.
~BOOM~
The explosion of holy aura slammed into the Darkness Ghost with a force that shook the air, and he felt a surge of satisfaction as the ghost staggered back, its hollow eyes actually flickering, almost as if its life essence (well not really since it's an undead) was weakening.
The oppressive grip that had ensnared him shattered from all of that, and he stumbled back, regaining his balance and shaking off the effects of the creature's dark grasp.
"Didn't see that coming, did ya?"
The ghost snarled, its twisted mouth opening wider, revealing rows of jagged teeth that glistened with malice, though it still didn't seem angry.
"You die…"
"Is that all you can say," Stark rolled his eyes as he positioned himself for combat, "Anyway, let's end this!"
"Spatial Inventory," when fighting powerful monsters he couldn't defeat using his skills, Stark always opted for the next best solution: his [Crystal Stun] potions!
He grabbed two of those from his void, then immediately threw them at the giant ghost, both of them exploding and spreading the mist as soon as they hit it.
But…
['Stun' cannot be given to undead beings.]
"Fair," he had tried, and now it would just be hands in hands combat, two punches should be enough to kill that thing as its HP were low.
~FWISH~
But for the third time (HOLY!), the darkness ghost stopped Stark's assault, but this time it decided to use everything it had in stock.
"Good… bye…" it spoke in a low voice as it flicked its fingers in Stark's direction, "Soul Blind…"
And then…
~VIOUM~
Complete darkness.
And it wasn't that the room became extremely dark, not at all, it was just… that Stark was blinded, not even able to see his own body or even imagining them.
All he could do…
~FWISH, CRACK~
Was hearing the sounds of the monster slowly approaching.
"HEAVEN'S WRATH," he drew a circle in his palms, then pointed at where the sound was coming from.
He couldn't see anything, and all he could do was follow his instincts to avoid the attacks, and maybe if he could kill the beast with his legendary skill before it could do anything, then it was a massive win.
But…
"Shroud of Darkness," he heard it whisper.
~BOOM~
And less than a second afterward, the beam descended in the location the monster was previously in.
"Did… I win?"
No, he couldn't have won, otherwise the skill should have gone off immediately.
And so, Stark immediately decided to check the description of the skill it had used.
…
[Skill: Shroud of Darkness]
[Description:] Seeps into the ground, transforming its entire figure into dark aura that it can use to lurk underneath its opponents, just out of sight, and it can reappear wherever it wants, though it is indeed possible to hit the aura and damage it.
[Domination Tip: it's going to be behind you.]
…
Stark tried to send one [Crimson Spear] behind him, but they hit nothing.
And so just like that… two minutes passed.
Two minutes where Stark constantly looked around, trying to identify ANY noise that could reveal its location.
And right after that…
['Soul Blind' is deactivated as it only lasts three minutes.]
"…"
Suddenly, Stark retrieved his vision, but there was nothing in front of him.
[BEHIND YOU! BEHIND YOU! BEHIND YOU!] yet, [Focus] warned him like crazy, summoning dozens of panels each saying the same two words.
But before he could even turn around…
~FWISH, GRAB~
He was grabbed by the [Darkness Ghost]'s right skeletal hand.
"What the fuck…" Stark gritted his teeth, "Why didn't it just do that before?!"
[It cannot attack you while you are soul blinded.]
"…Alright," he opened his eyes again, and before him was… the monster's giant face, its hollow eyes looking at him, and its mouth contorted into a giant smile.
"I… got… you… human…" it almost looked like it wanted to laugh, yet couldn't, "Annoying… bug…"
"…" Stark stared at it with a neutral expression though, just wanting to see what it wanted to do now that he was caught.
"YOU… DIE…" it spoke louder than before.
And then…
"NECROTIC TOUCH!"
The skeletal fingers of the ghost's other hand hovered above Stark, the air thick with impending doom.
"…" Stark looked above him with the most stoic of expression though, and he saw the tendrils of dark energy slowly reaching for him from above, ready to seep into his very essence and destroy his human cells as soon as it even as much as grazed him.
But there was a reason Stark was so calm.
Since…
"Dodge Control," he mumbled, and the moment the [Necrotic Touch] was about to reach him, his body quite literally teleported out of the ghost's hand, landing right on top of it.
"…?" even the monster was confused.
But before it could even figure out what had just happened…
~SLAM~
Stark punched it in the "face" while he had the opportunity to.
~BOOM~
The attack quite literally cause an explosion as Stark's [Domination] aura was still merged with [Exorcist], meaning that he did slightly above average damage to the undead.
And so…
"-168372!"
It died.

chapters.title: Chapter 244 - 244: The Third Zone: Reaper's Garden
chapters.content:
"I… Die…" the boss said as it dropped its head, and suddenly its entire began to vanish, probably since it was getting exorcised.
"Adios," Stark smiled as he kept observing the ghost's body, and after a few minutes, it completely vanished, leaving nothing other than a black smoke that was upward, toward the ceiling, "At least that's done with."
And of course, this could only mean one thing…
[You have slain 'Darkness Ghost lv130', gained 3,500,000EXP!]
~DING, DING~
[Your level has increased to level 64, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 65, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Experience: 587224/2700000]
[Skill Points: 15 Available!]
Stark didn't even need for a single second to know what he was upgrading.
[You have upgraded 'Crimson Purification' to level 15!]
Was there even any doubt in his decision? He was in an undead rift, plus soon enough he would be able to enter the [Devil's Abyss] which contained three apostles, and by the name it was also filled with demons and devils, who were weak to [Exorcist].
But as he awaited for his new perks… something else occurred
Something that had never happened before.
[You now have a choice, Host.]
"Huh?" instead of getting his perks, a panel appeared.
[Since you have reached silver-tier, you can now access more features, and in this case…]
[You can choose to merge the perks!]
"What?"
[As I said, you have a choice: either you can choose to get three NORMAL perks like usual since you passed three thresholds, or… you can choose a LEGENDARY perk instead, it's only one, but it merges the three others and is way better (choose that)]
"…" Stark felt like that thing wasn't really giving him a choice, specifically putting the emphasis on the fact that merging the perks was a much better idea, "Oh well," and it wasn't like Stark hated it, didn't his system always reveal itself to be of help after all?
[So, which do you choose?]
And below it appeared two panels.
[Three perks (lame)] or [One LEGENDARY Perk (Wow!)]
"Sigh…" he clicked on the legendary perk, his curiosity getting the better of him, and as soon as he clicked on that panel…
[Amazing choice!]
…
[Skill: Crimson Purification lv15]
[New Perk: Holy Concentration (LEGENDARY)]
[Description: Instead of sending out your holy aura around you to kill all enemies surrounding you, you can instead choose to transform ALL of this aura into a giant energy ball that you can send toward a group of enemies, resulting in more damage!]
[Note: this perk can actually hurt normal enemies as well, though it will not deal as much damage as normal skills!]
…
"Amazing," Stark's eyes widened, he couldn't deny that this perk was the real deal.
[Good choice, the other perks were "less cooldown", "more holy aura" and "holy presence"!]
"Knew you wouldn't lie to me, panel," Stark gave the panel a thumbs up, but it just disappeared as it wasn't sentient, just telling him the info he needed.
"Alright, and now the new skill!" he had reached another threshold since he was now level 65, so he waited for the three cards to appear.
And so he waited, and waited.
And… waited…?
"Huh?" no cards were appearing, although it had been 3 minutes, and he even checked all his panels to make sure he didn't minimize it, "What?"
[Here is some info if you are confused!]
"…?"
[Remember how skills when they reach level 20 are now only able to unlock perks every 10 level?]
"Yeah…?"
[Well, it's the same for skills, wahoo! Meaning that the moment you reached level 60, you could only get a skill every 10 levels, meaning that the next one is at level 70!]
[Note: the gap between each skill will increase more and more as you upgrade your rank!]
[Have fun…!]
"Dude…" I guess he got his answer as to how so many people could keep up with all their skills: they couldn't, it's just that as they upgraded their ranks, they got less and less until it became too difficult to even get one since all their skills would be from the highest ranked category, "I guess that's fair," but even he couldn't deny that having too many skills would mean him forgetting about some of them at some point.
He enjoyed his current balance as he basically used all his skills during battles, and he wouldn't want to change it.
"Alright," he muttered, wiping sweat from his brow. "Time to move on."
He took a deep breath, refocusing.
He was still currently in the cabin with the infinite hallway, though the ghost had disappeared, meaning that he was truly alone.
But right as he finished all the things he needed to do…
~FWISH~
His surroundings began to distort, and it wasn't his vision, it was literally the hallways of the cabin that were now moving like waves, and the ground wasn't normal either.
The air thickened, vibrating with an invisible force that actually hurt Stark's mind.
He steadied himself against the wall, awaiting the end of whatever this was.
And…
Just as suddenly as it began, the distortion ceased.
Stark opened his eyes again, and… the cabin returned to its former state, it was extremely small as you would expect from such a cabin, only enhanced by the [Raging Loop] skill of the 'Darkness Ghost'.
But now that it had died, the skill obviously deactivated.
Stark blinked, shaking off the remnants of dizziness.
Before him stood a door, it was actually pretty damn average-looking as it was completely made out of the wood, but beside it, there was nothing else in that cabin since the door he entered from had disappeared as well.
"Alright, let's see what you've got," Stark muttered, steeling himself for the unknown. He reached for the doorknob, the cold wood biting into his palm.
And with a firm twist, he pulled it open.
But after these two zones, he expected something horrible straight out of a horror movie.
And yet… all he saw… was a garden.
[Third Zone: Reaper's Garden]
The air shifted as Stark stepped into the Reaper's Garden, and the scent of flowers was overwhelming.
He was currently standing on yet another stone path that went in a straight line toward a massive fountain he could see in the distance, probably in the middle of the zone, which meant that it wasn't that big.
Then Stark decided to scan the surroundings: rows upon rows of flowers were present everywhere, their petals moving to the wind, and statues of grim figures loomed, placed , faces carved with eerie expressions that watched him intently.
"Just a garden?" he murmured, incredulous. "No monsters, no traps?"
There were no tombstones this time, and he could see almost the entirety of the zone thanks to [Focus], or at least up until the fountain that was around three kilometers ahead.
But there wasn't a zone that didn't have a single monster, so he knew something was up, much like with the first one.
Would the monsters be waiting for him right before he reached the end? Or maybe an elite would appear the moment he reached the middle point of the garden, which was the fountain.
Or maybe…
Stark looked at the statues, their eyes almost looking like they were following him, as he took a few steps toward the fountain.
"…Yeah, no."
And so Stark immediately punched one of the statues, not wanting to risk it.

chapters.title: Chapter 245 - 245: The Gargoyle Statues
chapters.content:
~FWISH~
Stark punched one of the stone statues that were displayed along the stone path of [Reaper's Garden].
He had aimed for the first one he saw after walking a bit as he didn't want to take any risks: what if those statues were a trap, or what if they came back to life, and thus he would be forced to fight hundreds of them.
The gray statue he had punched was that of an ugly gargoyle, its eyes glowing with a green aura that seemed to following him.
~BOOM~
Obviously, as Stark's attack was enhanced by crimson aura, the statue shattered into hundreds of pieces the moment his fist hit.
"Huh, nothing I guess," Stark titled his head, he actually really expected this to be a trap, "Hm…" but then he looked at the other ones, and all the small auras in their eyes who kept looking at him, "What if it's only a few of them…"
This made much more sense.
And so…
~BOOM~
Stark destroyed the statue next to the one he had already shattered, and then the one in front of it.
And so on, and so on.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
He kept punching as he walked, he didn't lose anything by doing that, so he just slammed every statue he saw, even going as far as going back to the entrance of the garden to destroy the ones he had left.
Just like that, of destruction passed, making Stark believe that he might have been wrong since he was getting closer and closer to the fountain in the middle.
Approaching it though, made Stark notice that above the stone structure of the fountain was a massive gargoyle, yes, at least thrice as big as the other ones.
"…" Stark look at it with a neutral expression, "Yeah… I'm destroying this one."
If there was a trap in this entire zone, it sure as hell was this.
~DASH~
And so he began dashing toward it, wanting to get rid of it as SOON as possible.
The stone gargoyle's wings were extremely big too, each of them just as big as its body, and spread, a dark green aura in its eyes as it faced Stark, who didn't stop running.
~DASH, FWISH~
After reaching an appropriate distance, he jumped in the air toward the monster's statue, confident he could destroy it with one punch, too.
Stark soared through the air, muscles coiling with energy.
"Let's see what you've got," he muttered, his fist clenched tight.
The gargoyle's stony gaze remained fixed on him, the dark green light flickering like a heartbeat, almost judging him.
~FWISH, SLAM~
As he connected, a resounding crack echoed through the garden.
~CRACK~
Stark's punch landed, and so he fully expected it to be destroyed like all the others.
~BAM~
And yet… instead of crumbling, the gargoyle shuddered.
"Huh?" Stark dropped to the ground again, looking up: the statue was not even harmed from his attack.
Instead…
~CRACK, CRACK~
Small cracks were beginning to form on the statue's stony texture, and a green light was escaping those cracks.
~CRACK~
After only ten seconds, the crack grew bigger and spread throughout its entire body.
And then…
~BOOM~
The explosion sent shards of stone flying in all directions, and Stark shielded his face as fragments whizzed past him, the air filled with a sudden roar.
He immediately looked upward toward the top of the fountain.
And…
From the heart of the destruction, the gargoyle emerged, its massive wings unfurling like dark shadows, green light glimmered in its eyes, now burning with life.
"Great," Stark muttered, backing away slowly, "I had the idea but not the right execution, huh…"
Stark thought about the possibility of using [Heaven's Wrath], which would have made it infinitely easier, though he couldn't have known.
"Ksssgrak~" with a low growl, the creature flexed its wings, the ground trembling beneath its weight as it jumped from the fountain, landing on the stone path and making cracks appear on the ground.
"Why do they always have to be so dramatic?" Stark shook his head, readying himself.
But before he could begin attacking…
"KKSREAAAAAKKKKK~" the gargoyle roared again, this time ten times louder than before, creating some sort of sonic wave around its mouth because of the sheer intensity.
And right as it finished its "incantation"…
"Call of the Gargoyle," it cast its skill and…
~CRACK, CRACK, CRACK~
3 of the statues he hadn't destroyed behind him cracked open, their forms crumbling to dust as the gargoyle that had been hidden inside came back to life.
"Just what I needed," he muttered, fists tightening.
The newly animated statues—each resembling the gargoyle although smaller—moved with an eerie grace, their bodies glistening under the faint light.
But they weren't the only ones since…
~FWISH~
From the other half of the zone appeared two other gargoyles, using their wings to fly and land right in front of their "king".
They were regrouping.
But before they could even do anything…
"Domi-Chains Restrain," he summoned the chain, spanned it in his hands a few times, then sent it toward the three flying gargoyles above him as they attempted to go toward their friends.
The chain whirled through the air, slicing the space between Stark and the three flying gargoyles, chasing them as if it was a predator.
And…
~FWISH, SPIN~
Surprisingly, these things were so dumb that they didn't even notice it, meaning that they chain wrapped around one of them, then took a turn and began to surround all of them a few times, restraining them from using their wings as the chain was much more powerful than they were.
"Kraik?"
"Grakks!"
They tried their hardest to keep flapping their wings as to not fall, but it was futile as after less than 5 seconds, the chain began to suck up their energy, all three of them rolled up as the chain forced them to stick close to one another.
And after a few more seconds of struggle, none of them were able to hold the weight of the three of them, so they fell.
~FWISH… CRASH~
Their bodies were crushed upon impact with the hard ground, all three dying since the chain weakened them, and thus reduced their defense.
"Grakkr?!"
"GKrakr!!!"
The two other gargoyles which had placed themselves in front of the bigger one took a step back, actually scared of the human, as it so easily eliminated three of their kind.
But before Stark could even begin truly fighting…
"Krakrkz…" the big gargoyle shook its head, and Stark could ALMOST understand what it said: useless.
~SMASH~
Using its hands with sharp claws, it immediately grabbed both of the gargoyles heads and smashed them together.
"Gkakra…" it didn't seem to care though, as it pierced their bodies like they were some sort of meat kebabs, then drank their blood, "GKRKAKAKK!!!!"
~FWISH~
It threw the bodies toward Stark, who easily dodged them by stepping to the side.
And now... the gargoyle looked more powerful than before, its green aura having strands of crimson one appearing on it, probably because of the blood of the others.
"Alright," Stark got into position again, "I don't really care if you're a cannibal, but you're not eating me."
"GROOAOKKK!"
[Gargoyle King - Level 140 (ELITE)]
And now… it was just another 1V1.

chapters.title: Chapter 246 - 246: The Gargoyle King
chapters.content:
Stark squared his shoulders, feeling the energy crackle around him, and the gargoyle king flexed its wings, dust and debris scattering as it prepared for an attack.
"Bring it on," Stark growled, clenching his fists, muscles tensing.
But right as the monster began to repeatedly flap its wings to float off the ground, Stark decided to use [Perception] as to, like usual, check out its level, HP, stats and skills.
…
[Name: Gargoyle King (ELITE)]
[Level: 140]
[HP: 650000]
[Strength: 8732]
[Stamina: 3213]
[Speed: 6426]
[Defense: 2938]
[Skills: Statue Camouflage, Winged Assault, Bloodlust Surge, Call of the Gargoyle, Shadow Claw, Stone Wings, Curse of Stone, The King of Gargoyles…]
…
Its stats were very high, although it was logical since it was a lvl140 elite, but strangely enough, it didn't have this many skills.
Stark truly couldn't understand how [Perception] worked: was it because these were its only skills that it showed them, or maybe it already knew which skills it would use during this entire battle, which are the skills it displayed for him to see?
~FLAP, FLAP~
Meanwhile, the king was now flying in the air around ten meters above the ground, staring down at Stark with its eyes, which were still burning with that green aura that surrounded its body.
"Crimson Spears," Stark summoned five spears and threw them all toward the gargoyle one by one.
~FWISH~
But the flying monster had very good control over its flight, able to move wherever it wanted to avoid the spears easily, thus rendering any projectile useless as long as it wasn't attacking.
It wasn't the king for no reason after all.
"Ah…" none of Stark's spears hit.
And then…
"WINGED ASSAULT!"
The gargoyle king soared down, wings spread wide, casting a shadow over Stark.
"Invincible Dodge!" Stark darted to the side, barely dodging the monstrous claws that sliced through the air where he had just stood.
"GRAAAAAAAK!" The gargoyle's roar echoed through the garden, its fury palpable, and it wheeled around, circling back for another assault.
But yet again…
"Invincible Dodge," since the interval between each attack wasn't high (less than three seconds), Stark able to keep avoiding those winged assaults.
But Stark knew he couldn't keep avoiding before since the gargoyle literally didn't seem to want to stop, turning back and forth over and over and over, forcing Stark to avoid if he didn't want to get fucked instantly.
"SHADOW CLAW," and after around a minute of this, the gargoyle decide to enhance its arsenal as its claws began to burn with a dark flame, then dove toward Stark again.
Stark braced himself, eyes narrowed as the gargoyle king descended, its claws igniting with that dark power around it.
"Aura Smash," he didn't have the time to merge them, but he sent all three crimson fists toward the descending gargoyle as it should be able to momentarily stop it.
Yet it didn't.
"Stone Wings," while still keeping up its speed, the gargoyle rolled up its wings around its body, using its skill, and… the wings literally turned into stone, much like those from the statue Stark tried to destroy.
~BOOM, BOOM, BOOM~
"-0! -0! -0!" and obviously, it didn't do any damage.
"Dodge Contro-" Stark instinctively tried to use that skill since [Invincible Dodge] was still on cooldown, but…
[Cooldown on 'Dodge Control', you can use it again in 39 minutes!]
"Oh," he had forgotten about the one hour cooldown 'dodge control' had.
And so…
~SLASH~
"-37261!"
[Stark HP: 5766/64300]
He had tried to sidestep, but the shadow claws of the creature hit his side, hurting him like hell and making a ton of blood pour out from the wound.
He had obviously used [Domination]'s aura to surround the area that was about to be hit, and activated the [Domination Shield] to take 5000 damage, and yet… even then he was almost on the verge of death.
"Cough…" Stark's mouth was letting out a massive amount of blood too.
And when he tried to hold his side, he immediately felt the crimson liquid on his hand, then looked at it, his hand now painted a beautiful lively red.
"…" Stark's eyes burned as he saw that, and a powerful vortex appeared in them as he stared at the gargoyle, who was flying above him, spinning in circles as if it was some sort of bird.
Stark clenched his jaw, fighting against the pain. The wound throbbed, but adrenaline surged through him, igniting his resolve.
"Let's do this," he growled, pushing himself off the ground, "WIELDING CROSS!"
The crimson/golden cross appeared above him, and he immediately took his "baseball" player stance, ready to slam it if the gargoyle came to closer.
"CALL OF THE GARGOYLE," but yet again, the gargoyle roared like crazy as it stopped spinning in the air, and instead just kept flapping its wings while moving left and right, staring at Stark.
And of course, the fact it used this skill meant one thing: more of 'them'.
~CRACK, CRACK~
This time, only two of the gargoyle statues cracked opened, and the creatures hiding inside of them came out, both rushing toward Stark as they followed the orders of their king, who knew it was useless to wait.
But…
~SLAM~
Stark used one of his 3 strikes to absolutely decimate the two monsters at the same time, killing them both as they didn't seem to have that much HP to begin with.
The two dead gargoyles were sent flying in the opposite, one crashing against the fountain and the other just falling to the ground.
And…
"Bloodlust Surge," the king gargoyle dropped to the ground in a giant thud, then grabbed the bodies of its two minions and squeezed them out while placing them above its mouth, it was yet again drinking the blood of its companions.
And so just like last that time…
~BOOM~
The gargoyle's body exploded as its aura became much more powerful.
"The more it eats, the stronger it becomes, huh…" Stark thought, and his stance didn't falter at all as he didn't want to be taken by surprise: if that thing comes close, he would smash it away just like its minions.
And just as he expected…
"WINGED ASSAULT," feeling more powerful than ever before, the gargoyle tested its luck by flying above ground, then immediately dashing toward Stark, readying its [Stone Wings] and claws to deflect or attack.
But… that gargoyle was extremely dumb, and its confidence got the better of it, as even its minions should have felt the holy aura emanating from Stark, one that any undead would KNOW was deadly.
Maybe it was just so sure of its own capabilities that it didn't believe it would affect it?
~FWISH~
"GRAKKKK~" at incredible, almost teleporting, the gargoyle was already in front of Stark.
But in the end… it didn't matter: it had pushed its luck.
~SLAM~
Using [Focus] to follow its movements, Stark immediately swung the cross as the gargoyle came close to him, hitting it straight on.
"STONE WINGS!" it of course tried to use its wings as a shield and positioned them both right in front of the cross as it was about to hit its side, turning them into hard stone that couldn't be destroyed normally.
And yet…
~SLAM, BOOOOOM~
The wing's stone defense shattered as it was hit by the cross, the holy aura supressing its powers and weakening them enough for it to be able to pass.
"-183729!"
"GAKGR-" the gargoyle's green aura flickered slightly upon being hit by the crimson cross, which clearly hurt like hell.
But even then… Stark wasn't done.
"And another one," while the gargoyle was still being slowly sent flying toward the other direction after being hit like a baseball, Stark immediately dashed toward it, ignoring the pain as he caught up to it.
And then…
~BOOOOOM~
He slammed it again using his final cross strike as he didn't want to let it get up and have a chance to attack again.
"-211974!"
~BOOM~
It hit the wall on one of the sides, its aura weakened and a lot of bloor pouring out from different parts of its body.
And yet yet again, Stark wasn't done.
He had learned something: if you want to end a battle quickly as you were injured, you shouldn't let the enemy do anything, instead… just overwhelm it with attacks, and it will slowly but surely be unable to answer.
Two [Exorcist] attacks as powerful as [Wielding Cross] on an undead were deadly no matter how you think about it, and it was visible by the gargoyle's expression and movements: one of its eyes had stopped burning with aura, meaning that the green light that was originally there disappeared, and blood and sweat could be seen all over its ugly body.
"…" Stark was hurting too, but he was still standing, staring at the gargoyle with disgusted eyes.
And… as he said before… he wouldn't even let it do anything.
"CRIMSON PURIFICATION… HOLY CONCENTRATION," and so he decided to use his exorcist skill's new perk as to completely annihilate his opponent in one go, and also check out how powerful that attack truly was as the panels that had given it to him had hyped it up so much and described it as a [Legendary] perk, the first one he had ever gotten.
"Let's see, now," Stark's eyes burned with crimson and golden aura as he smiled, pointing at the gargoyle king.

chapters.title: Chapter 247 - 247: Death of the Gargoyle King
chapters.content:
"CRIMSON PURIFICATION… HOLY CONCENTRATION!"
While the gargoyle king was still down from literally being smashed by two attacks that completely weakened it, it lifted its eyes, only one of them functioning as it the green aura was still lit up in it.
"GRAKKKQS~" in addition to that, one of its wings was damaged as it had tried to use it to block the cross, a fatal mistake in that regard.
But even then, the king still believed there was a chance for it to come out victory out of this mess.
It took it around thirty seconds, but in the end, it was able to stand back on its feet, swaying left and right as to keep its balance, the holy aura hurting its head.
And when it finally decided to look at Stark again… its eyes widened, and it finally realized something: it would have never been able to win.
In front of it was a giant energy ball completely created from holy aura, Stark's arms spread around it as it was roughly the size of his chest, an aura pouring out from his fingers to give power to the attack.
This was the legendary perk of [Crimson Purification]: Holy Concentration.
It did take them quite a bit of it to do it since Stark had never done it before, but he had successfully managed to complete his energy ball before the gargoyle got up.
Basically, instead of focusing his aura to send it around his body like some sort of holy wave, he grabbed all of that aura and put it inside that energy ball, making it slowly grow with a magnificent golden color.
And when he was finally done…
"Adios," he smiled as he pushed the ball out with his palm, sending it toward the gargoyle king at intense speed.
And of course, in its weakened state, the monster had absolutely no chance to avoid it.
~FWISH… BOOOOM~
Not only did the holy energy ball touch its body perfectly, but upon impact, it immediately exploded, sending out waves of aura around it, meaning that if it potentially had enemies surrounding it, then they would have died too.
"-278367!"
"Gahg-" the green aura in the second eye of the gargoyle flicked for a few seconds as well before completely vanishing, a trail of smoke leaving the body of the elite upward as it had quite literally been fried by the ball.
[Gargoyle King: 0/650000]
And so it fell, dead.
~SWISH~
And its body turned back to stone instantly, before shattering completely.
"Damn, that's overkill, not gonna lie," Stark laughed.
[You have slain 'Gargoyle King lv140', gained 3,800,000EXP!]
He got slightly more EXP than by the [Darkness Ghost], probably since it was level 140, 10 levels above the other monster, and there was no denying that it was an elite, only one rank below boss.
Of course, nothing until now could ever compete with the EXP he had gotten from the warden, but soon enough the monsters would finally be able to give him 5 million exp at once, catching up to it, though it will take time.
[You have slain 'Gargoyle Minion lv135', gained 227462EXP!]
[You have slain 'Gargoyle Minion lv135', gained 219381EXP!]
[You have slain 'Gargoyle Minion lv135', gained 225448EXP!]
~DING~
[Your level has increased to level 66, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Experience: 2359515/2850000]
And worse of all: he only got one level from that.
"…" Stark sighed, but he was used to it, domination was truly an unforgiving class after all.
~TAP, TAP~
He slowly headed back to the stone path, and specifically the stone fountain which now missed the gargoyle statue at the top, to continue walking toward the path leading to the boss/final zone.
The garden was now in chaos from the battle: MOST of the small gargoyle statues were destroyed, the grass was burned because of the holy aura, and because of the shadow claws, and some walls had cracks on them because of all the damage.
"Battles are intense, huh," this was actually the first time Stark noticed such a distinct change in the atmosphere after a battle, as for some reason he had never seen such a scenery before, "Well, doesn't matter."
He walked around the fountain and continued heading toward the end of this garden as he was now the other half, no monsters coming out as they had quite literally ALL been killed.
But this was a good thing, since it allowed Stark to rest: he still only had 7500 HP from the fight, so trying to fight the apostle right now would be suicide.
In the distance, at the very end of the garden, there was a massive red door that opened, inviting him to enter.
Only ten minutes after that, he reached that very same door.
But instead of immediately going in… Stark went to the right side of the garden and rested against the wall.
His side still hurt a bit from the [Shadow Claws], but surrounding it with his aura massively decreased the pain and stopped the bleeding as well.
"Spatial Inventory," he mumbled, then pulled out THIRTY, yes you heard him right, THIRTY [Regeneration Potions], then gulped them all one by one, "Good thing I always restock my potions, heh…"
[Potions Available: x73 strength, x66 speed and x47 regeneration]
The wound on his side slowly closed up afterward, and he didn't have to put his aura there as to stop him from dying of blood loss.
There were several ways to regenerate your health points: potions of healing, skills and finally… just resting.
As long as you didn't have the [Bleed] effect and weren't amputated or had a massive/fatal injury, then simply resting and sleeping would slowly give you HP, although that's the longest method of all, and the least used since, y'know, when you're in a rift, you can't really take the time to do that.
And the other reason Stark could afford to do that without fearing just a single monster come to kill him while he was resting is because…
"Clone Frenzy," he lifted his arm upward, and three clones appeared in front of him, "Superior Clone," he mumbled, and the clones suddenly began to merge in a flash of beautiful crimson light.
30 seconds later after merging, what emerged from all that light and was, obviously, the [Superior Clone]!
He hadn't summoned it until now because he feared that it could get taken down in one strike, and giving it HP was a terrible idea, just check the fight against the gargoyle: he had been put to under 6000 health points, which would have killed him.
And if a single debris flew toward the clone and hit it, then it would have died too.
"=)" and of course, that little shit had its iconic demonic smile, which never left its face no matter what happened.
"You know what to do," Stark smiled at it, and it nodded as he closed his eyes, "I guess you can wake me up in like… huh… two hours?" he didn't want to stay for too long in here as there was the possibility of this rift's time going much slower than in the real world, meaning that while he thought a few hours passed, it would actually be weeks outside.
The next zone, beyond that red ominous door with a frightening aura coming from the other side, was probably the final boss of this rift: the apostle.
And so Stark needed to prepare himself with everything he had, as it would surely be a hard battle (but not his hardest since, y'know, Exorcist).

chapters.title: Chapter 248 - 248: Last Zone: Reaper's and Lother's Grave
chapters.content:
~SHAKE~
Stark opened his eyes as he was being shaken by the [Superior Clone].
"Ah?!" he actually got startled as the first thing he saw was a crimson light in his face, then the massive mischievous smile of the clone soon after, "Fucking hell…"
It had been around three hours since he had woken up, and thanks to his injury being healed with the potions, his HP was now fully maxed again.
"Thanks," he got up and looked around, it seemed like the [Superior Clone] hadn't fought anything, though he noticed that the last few statues that had been standing after the battle were now all destroyed, "Got bored?"
"=)" the clone shrugged.
"Oh well," Stark didn't have anything to do, and so he went back on the path, followed closely by his close as they faced the giant red door before them.
Stark stood before the ominous red door, its surface pulsing like a heartbeat, shadows dancing along its edges, flickering with an energy that sent a shiver down his spine.
He glanced at his clone, whose crimson aura shimmered, ready for whatever lay ahead, that carefree smile on its face: as long as the original survived, then it was good.
"Here goes nothing," Stark muttered, stepping forward, and the clone walked right next to him.
~FWISH~
But right as they passed the threshold of the door, a strange sensation washed over Stark.
"…!" it was weird, unlike anything he had ever felt before in a rift.
There was no silver fog this time, which actually quite strange, but Stark felt it in his bones that this was it… and soon enough, a panel appeared.
[Last Zone: Reaper's and Lother's Grave]
The sensation Stark felt while walking past the door was something even he didn't know how to describe, though it strangely still felt familiar to him.
Dread? Fear? Anxiety?
No… it was none of these, Stark wouldn't be scared from that, he hadn't been even in the face of death several times after all.
":l" and to prove his point, even his clone had stopped smiling.
The fourth zone was… special.
And as he looked around, Stark noticed that he had stepped into an arena, its vastness swallowing him whole.
The ground beneath his feet felt cold, with a smooth stone surface and black mist reaching only up to his feet.
Surrounding him were towering walls engraved with ancient runes and weird drawings depicting something Stark couldn't understand, each flickering with a deep glow.
And even then, even with that setup and appearance, this wasn't what surprised Stark the most.
Because as soon as he looked up…
"What…"
Above the circular walls that delimited the zone of the giant arena were thousands upon thousands of undead spectators looking down at him.
Their forms varied: skeletal warriors clad in tattered remnants of armor, rotting corpses wearing decaying robes, spectral figures, gargoyles, ghosts… and many more.
It was… a spectacle, and surely nobody would believe Stark if he told them what he saw at the end of the [Death Rift], not that he cared to anyway though.
"What the fuck…" Stark's eyes widened.
Some of the undead brandished rusty weapons, clattering them against one another in a frenzied rhythm, while others raised their hands in the air and clapped, while the rest just pointed their fingers toward Stark as if asking him to head toward the center of the arena.
But right as he was about to walk deeper inside the arena, since he had only stopped at the very edge of the entrance to observe his surroundings…
~CLANG~
He heard a sudden noise, and the giant red door that was previously opened right behind him a few seconds ago closed out of nowhere, trapping him inside here.
"=)" but the clone went back to smiling, which reassured Stark: it meant that it was still confident in their victory.
Stark wasn't particularly impressed except for the massive amount of undead seemingly "spectating" his moves, as he was worried that they would all jump down at once toward him, and there was no guarantee [Crimson Purification] would save his ass this time with this many undead.
~TAP, TAP~
Not seeing a reason to stop, Stark continued to walk toward the center of the arena, and the closer he got to it, the more the cheers of the undead crowd escalated.
Stark pressed forward, the sound of clattering bones and rusted metal filled the air around him, echoing like a taunting song.
And the arena pulsed with a dark energy, the spectators leaning closer, their hollow eyes fixed on him, hungry for the show that was about to occur.
"Why the hell are you all cheering?" he muttered, glancing around.
And at that moment… he finally reached the center of the arena, where a giant incantation circle made with blood could be seen.
"Huh-" it didn't take more than five seconds since he stepped inside the circle for it to suddenly begin glowing with a dark light, "SHIT!"
~FWISH, THROW~
A vortex of darkness was forming around the circle, and it was surely going to suck Stark in if he didn't escape.
But thankfully enough, his clone had stayed behind, and immediately grabbed the boy out of the range.
"Thanks," the clone was thankfully still alive, and Stark got up, taking dozens of steps back since the vortex in the middle of the arena grew more and more.
And then, after a minute…
~THUD~
The ground trembled slightly, and a hush fell over the undead as a figure emerged from the shadows at the center of the arena.
"…!" Stark's eyes widened even more than before.
And that's when he finally understood the emotion that had washed over him before: it was… the feeling of knowing that death was close, which is why it felt familiar to him.
[Reaper, The Undead Puppeteer (Godless Demon Apostle)]
The figure was giant, at least ten meters in height, and it was wearing a dark long robe that flowed downward.
It seemed to be floating in the air though, as it had no feet, and the robe stopped right before the ground, meaning you could clearly see there was nothing there.
It was wearing a dark cloak on top of its head, but even then, you could still see its face: it had a skeleton face, emotionless and hollow, only a small white dot in its eyes showing that it was alive.
And as for its weapon… as you might have guessed… it was carrying a scythe with its two skeletal hands.
"GAKKRKAK!"
"KSKSKSKS~"
The sheers of the undead crowd reached their peak as Reaper appeared, and the skeleton apostle actually seemed to enjoy the praises as he lifted one of his arms upward and nodded his head while looking at all his "fans".
But after that quick break, he immediately went back to serious mode, pointing his scythe toward the human, and a voice coming out of its skull.
"Let the fight begin, human, and do not disappoint them, for if you do, a fate worse than death awaits you," Reaper obviously couldn't change expressions since, y'know, his head was a skull, but Stark felt that in his voice was a mix of both calmness, confidence and… anger.

chapters.title: Chapter 249 - 249: The Undead Arena and TWO Apostles?!
chapters.content:
[Welcome to the 'Undead Arena']
[Fight your opponents to escape!]
These two panels appeared in front of Stark right as Reaper pointed his scythe toward the human.
"Are you ready?" the skeleton grim reaper spoke again, a powerful dark aura swirling around his entire body and weapon, making Stark gulp.
"Sure, why not," Stark kept smiling though: he had his anti-undead skills, so nothing to fear on a 1 on 1, and he would make sure to deliver a beautiful spectacle for those watching.
"=)" but right as he took his fighting stance, ready to start… his clone tapped on his shoulder a few times.
"…?" Stark looked back to see the [Superior Clone] smiling.
"Very well," Reaper's skull mouth couldn't move, but it was clear that he was smiling, "Let ALL the fighters battle, then!" Reaper said while Stark was busy looking at his clone.
"…" the [Superior Clone] was trying to tell something to the boy.
It was pointing at the arena, then making massive circles with its hands: it couldn't speak, so it quite literally had to play a guessing game with Stark.
"The… zone…?" he guessed after a few seconds, and the clone nodded extremely quickly.
Then it moved to another sign.
It pointed at the ground, then it made a simple panel appeared in front of it.
[Reaper, The Undead Puppeteer] this was what was written on the panel as it was the only one the clone could open since it was minimized.
Then the clone repeated that maneuver several times, its smiling expression almost begging for Stark to understand.
"This zone…?" Stark mumbled as the clone pointed at the ground, "This zone's panel?" he asked as the clone made the panel appear again.
And suddenly…
"!!!!" the clone jumped in agreement.
'This zone's panel…?' Stark repeated, and he immediately opened up that panel again (for some reason the clone couldn't do it though).
Stark quickly glanced at Reaper, and he was actually holding his scythe horizontally with his two handles at the edge of its handle, his eyes closed, though you could only see that because, y'know, the small white dots in them had disappeared.
~TAP, TAP~
He was repeatedly taping his scythe's wooden handle on the ground too, doing some sort of… ritual? Or something strange, as it was glowing with dark aura.
'Well, doesn't matter as long as he leaves me alone for now,' Stark went back to focus on his clone, 'Anyway, so this zone's panel…'
Stark tried to open it, but he had actually closed it, probably why the clone couldn't open it at all.
"Third Zone panel!" he mumbled to himself, and it reappeared again.
[Last Zone: Reaper's and Lother's Grave]
"=)" immediately, the clone pointed… at the second name.
"Huh…" and just as quickly as it did, Stark's eyes widened.
In retrospective, this shouldn't be confusing as it is just a normal name, but when you think about it, if Reaper was the 'undead puppeteer' in front of him, the apostle he needed to kill to fill his [ApostleDex].
Then… who the fuck is 'Lother'?
And that's when Stark suddenly remembered something: right as he was about to open the cabin door, he ignored the third panel that had appeared before him, only reading the first few words.
And they were…
[There isn't just one apostle-] there was another bigger part to the sentence that he had skipped, but now…
"Oh… shit…" Stark figured it out.
And as soon as that happened.
"Give them a show they won't forget," Reaper lifted his scythe all the way up to his head, then taped it against the ground one last time, an extremely powerful aura coming out of it, like dark flames taking over.
And suddenly…
Fwish!
'That noise…' it came from right below Stark.
"I summon thee, 'Lother, The Grave Keeper', come and aid me to prevent this human from reaching our lord," Reaper pointed his scythe toward Stark again, its pointy edges burning now.
And then...
Boom! Fwish! Slam!
The ground shook violently, and the air crackled with energy.
Stark braced himself, his heart pounding as the ground rumbled beneath him.
And suddenly…
Boom!
Four long white hands burst from the earth, each one massive and menacing, fingers curling like claws poised to strike.
"Holy hell!" Stark shouted, adrenaline flooding his veins, and even the clone got ready.
The four hands were surrounding him completely from all directions: nord, east, south and west, meaning that they could easily reach him if he wasn't careful.
"=)" the clone was also surrounded since it was right next to Stark, but it didn't look bothered that much.
And then…
"Do not die too quickly," Reaper let out a trail of dark smoke leaving his skull mouth.
~SLAM~
The hands slammed down toward him, each blow sending a shockwave that rattled the air.
Stark reacted instinctively, the familiar rush of power coursing through him as he activated [Invincible Dodge].
In a split second, he sidestepped, a blur of motion, narrowly avoiding the first hand, and the impact cratered the ground, dust and debris flying into the air.
"Not today!" he yelled, pushing himself off the ground to evade a strike from the second hand.
He weaved through the onslaught, his movements precise and fluid, each hand crashing down where he had stood mere moments before, leaving jagged cracks in the arena floor.
The crowd of undead gasped, their hollow eyes wide with anticipation.
"Come on, Lother! Is that all you've got?" Stark taunted, he was sure that this thing was the second apostle.
After around a minute where the giant white hands repeatedly tried to slam both Stark and his clone… they all went back into the ground.
And mere seconds later…
Fwish!
Lother's massive form began to emerge from the ground next to Reaper, rising to a towering height of eight meters, the giant humanoid figure had four arms, each as powerful as a train, ready to unleash fury, and a gaping mouth with what could only be described as a black hole in it.
[Lother, The Grave Keeper - Apostle]
Its body was COMPLETELY white except for the occasional wrinkles then and there, and it was bald, with no nose, no ears, and completely black eyes with no pupils.
As said before, Lother had FOUR arms (two where they normally should be, and another two coming out from his shoulders), and it was currently standing on its two legs, meaning that it could use them all to attack, making it EXTREMELY difficult to avoid it all.
But it did have a second form though, and not talking about when its HP depletes: Lother could use his two front arms, meaning the normal ones, to get on all fours like a dog, making him much more menacing as his face and mouth that stretched downward were actually terrifying.
"Oh~" Reaper laughed, "One of the first who actually managed to avoid it all, you might actually be able to give us a good show, then…"
The "white hands" ambush was actually way faster than you might believe it to be, only taking a split second between the time they emerged and hit the ground where the human stood.
And so, that meant that A LOT of people had died before the fight could even begin, and even Stark only reacted accordingly because he noticed that there should have been TWO monsters, not just Reaper.
"…" the second apostle, Lother, couldn't speak, as his mouth was literally dislocated (or just weird, one of the two), and so only Reaper was capable of speech.
"Your friend's weird," Stark shrugged as he pointed at the white creature straight out of a monster foundation or something.
"He can't speak, hear or breath, and his vision is extremely reduced, to the point he can only attack people based on their vibrations and aura," Reaper informed while inspecting his scythe, "And yet…" the small white dots in Reaper's eyes grew in size, "He is still stronger than you are."
"Hhahaha~" Stark laughed, "I'd love to see that."
"You will."
[3…]
The countdown of the battle began, and all the undead spectators were cheering.
[2…]
Reaper's aura and his body were now surrounded by dark flames of death.
[1…]
Lother was just normal, though Stark noticed that the weird smile on his stretched mouth grew as he kept taping the ground with his arms, ready to dash at the human.
[FIGHT!]
But Stark and his clone were ready too, activating both of their auras as they knew that this was going to be their hardest battle yet.
They were undead, sure (at least Reaper was, not sure about Lother), but they were still apostles, and the strongest ones he had fought yet (the three crimson moons are stronger, but he didn't battle them).
But before Stark could even begin to activate [Perception] to check out his opponent's stats, HP, and skills…
A panel appeared in front of him: it was given by the [Undead Arena] itself.
And on it was information that he feared would be true ever since he fought the [Darkness Ghost] in the second zone.
And it was…
[Lother, The Grave Keeper]
[Rank: Boss]
And… the most powerful of the two…
[Reaper, The Undead Puppeteer]
[Rank: Calamity]
He was at the rank above [Boss].

chapters.title: Chapter 250 - 250: A Calamity-Level Apostle!
chapters.content:
[Lother, The Grave Keeper]
[Rank: Boss]
[Reaper, The Undead Puppeteer]
[Rank: Calamity]
The two apostles stood before Stark, the latter being of a rank above boss, a rank Stark had never fought before.
Of course, he had previously seen monsters of this rank: the [Crimson Moons Trio] back at the rift with Judicator, the second apostle he fought.
And so that meant… that this thing should be within their range of power.
"Come on," Reaper pointed his scythe toward Stark again, "We need to entertain the viewers, don't we?"
"Haha… sure…" Stark had drops of sweat pouring from his forehead as he was actually stressing a bit.
But he wouldn't let that get him to make a mistake.
"PERCEPTION," he shouted as he saw Reaper prepare himself to strike, and Lother on the verge of jumping toward him as well to grab him with his disgusting hands.
…
[Name: Lother, The Grave Keeper (BOSS - Godless Demon Apostle)]
[Level: 145]
[HP: 600000]
[Strength: 11821]
[Stamina: 2368]
[Speed: 5583]
[Defense: 7904]
[Skills: Grave Grasp, Echoing Wail, Vengeful Strike, Burial Mound, Undead Sacrifice, Bone Barrage, Spectral Ambush, Tremor of the Damned, Shovel Wielder, Fate's Chains, Final Rest (MYTHICAL)…]
…
"Decent HP compared to other bosses… but incredible strength and defense, and medium speed, only it's stamina is low…" Stark thought of the possibility of using that fact to his advantage, but he didn't see how.
Stamina meant that the monster would get tired easily since casting skills this powerful could exhaust you easily, and in addition to that the time between his skills would be pretty significant since the lower your stamina is, the longer it will take.
But there was one problem: the presence of Reaper, the [Calamity] apostle, who would obviously buy some time for Lother whenever he needed it.
"Ah shit…" he was basically fighting a stronger version of the warden (Reaper), but along with him was another boss…
This was hell, and Stark couldn't see how any of his group could possibly survive that.
If all 50 of them had tried to conquer this rift, then the giant majority would have died, and even Sora would have probably been overwhelmed.
'They should thank me for sacrificing myself… seriously…' Stark sighed as he took his position, then immediately moved to check Reaper's stats.
"PERCEPTION," he shouted again, eyes darting toward the newly appeared panel.
…
[Name: Reaper, The Undead Puppeteer (CALAMITY - Godless Demon Apostle)]
[Level: 150]
[HP: 750000]
[Strength: 10532]
[Stamina: 6049]
[Speed: 8511]
[Defense: 4875]
[Skills: Soul Rend, Shadow Bind (MYTHICAL), Scythe Dance, Cursed Requiem, Death's Grasp, Phantom Veil, Abyssal Charge, Wraith's Veil, Eternal Night, Unholy Convergence, Spectral Rebirth, Dark Symphony, Fate's Judgement (MYTHICAL)…]
…
"…" Stark didn't even need to analyze that thing, all that he knew was that it was definitely stronger than the warden, "Alright."
Fwish! Throw!
And before Stark could even realize it, a golden ball of energy was thrown from behind him, toward Lother.
"Huh…" he looked back, and saw the [Superior Clone] smiling, it had used [Crimson Purification]'s new perk while he was busy analyzing.
And…
Boooom!
The attack actually hit Lother, who was too dumb and thought that he could tank it.
"-176482!"
"Holy," Stark was flabbergasted, "Amazing job, clone!" he praised it, and it just shrugged.
"…" Lother was sent flying toward one of the walls of the massive arena, which gave them more than enough space to fight freely, crashing against the wall and causing dozens of undead monsters to fall inside of it, all crushed since the height from the stands to the ground was high.
But… was Lother did when he saw those undead fall was… surprising.
"Undead Sacrifice…" the grotesque wide-mouthed creatures grabbed the bodies of all the undead with its four hands, crushing them using its sheer strength, then swallowed all the dust and remains with its mouth.
Stark watched as Lother consumed the remains of the fallen undead. A dark mist enveloped the giant, swirling around him as he fed, tendrils of shadow stretching from the remains into Lother's gaping maw.
…
[Skill: Undead Sacrifice]
[Description:] Lother consumes fallen undead to gain strength. For each undead he devours, he absorbs a fraction of their power, boosting his own physical abilities. However, there's a limit. If Lother consumes too many at once, he risks overwhelming his own body, leading to a temporary (and long) stun.
[Note: take advantage of that, Lother cannot resist the temptation of eating other undead =)]
…
That note was basically telling him to allow Lother to eat a maximum amount of undead and trying to make him reach his limit.
But there was a problem with that: what was the limit?
10? 100? What if it's 1000?
'Not clear, no point in risking it,' and so that was the conclusion he reached.
But his clone, on the other hand… it seemed to think differently.
"Aura Smash… MERGE!"
Fwish!
Reaper was currently just observing the fight, using his scythe as some sort of cane by placing its handle in the ground, "Hm."
Boom!
The crimson fist hit Lother's mouth as it was literally unable to avoid it since it was too fast, way faster than the holy energy ball, obviously.
Crack!
Lother's head literally cracked upon the impact with the fist, and it actually moved a bit as its mouth stretched more.
"-76482!" plus, the damage was very good.
But of course, it resulted in Lother's body crashing against the wall, and MORE undead falling, at least 50 of them this time, and the worst of all was that the ones who fell were actually cheering, anticipating being eaten by one of their 'gods'.
"Undead Sacrifice…" Lother ate them all again, and the dark aura swirling around him increased again: this time, both Stark and his clone sensed that surprise attacks wouldn't work anymore, its mouth letting out a deadly black fog of aura.
"…" yet Stark and the [Superior Clone] weren't impressed: that thing literally just took 250k points of damage in less than ten seconds, so why should they care if it started eating its 'servants'.
But suddenly, right as if Reaper could read their mocking thoughts, he suddenly moved, removing his scythe's handle from the ground and grabbing it again, swinging it a few times to make sure it was working as a trail of black aura with soul particles followed each of the strikes.
"I think I saw enough," he began walking toward Stark, "I give you a 3/10 in the entertainment scale, could do better, I hope you will and your next life."
"Heh, that's pretty low," Stark responded, a smile as devilish as his clone's forming, "Maybe I can make that number go up by kicking your ass?"
"You are free to try," Reaper spanned his scythe in his hands, showing that he had perfect control over it.
Lother on the other hand got up on his two feet, increasing his size and now slightly taller than Reaper: he was a giant, and a grotesque one at that.
"Hey, clone," Stark looked at the crimson replica of himself.
"…"
"You take care of the white guy, I'll get Reaper, and please don't die," Stark gave it a thumbs up as he gave it such an insane order, but it was proof that he trusted his clone.
"…" the [Superior Clone] nodded, still smiling.
And so both of them took their fighting stances.
Reaper and Lother were the same, though, as the calamity apostle slowly walked toward the original Stark, while Lother took huge steps in the clone's direction.

chapters.title: Chapter 251 - 251: Stark and Clone VS Reaper and Lother
chapters.content:
Lother, the grotesque white giant who was standing up on his two feet, looking down at the two Stark with his impressive 12 meters height, suddenly jumped toward the clone, and used its skill.
"Grave Grasp," his four arms all elongated toward the clone, trying to grab and crush it.
But…
"Invincible Dodge," it immediately rolled away every time the hands tried to grab it, sent five crimson spears toward Lother, all hitting him.
"-12732! -13821! -14985! -14334! -13948!" the clone seemed to be doing good damage, so Stark immediately stopped looking and worrying about it, instead focusing on his own battle: the one against Reaper.
To be honest, there was no way for Stark to defeat these two things in a 2v1, so he was happy that the clone actually able to help, otherwise he would have been fucked.
Now… one of them needed to kill their opponent, then overwhelm the second and kill it too.
But Reaper… seemed unbeatable.
"SCULK NECKLACE, ACTIVATE!" he decided to finally use the necklace he had acquired, the sculk liquid that emerged from it slashing in Reaper's direction thrice, yet it did nothing as the apostle just moved his hands, making the sculk look like it was pure weak slime.
He was slowly walking toward Stark, unbothered by the sculk and the fact his ally was already fighting, the dark aura in the eye sockets of the skull glowing.
"Scythe Dance," he began to slowly pull his scythe back, as if he is charging a powerful attack, and he probably was, to be honest, "Let's see you avoid this."
~SWING~
Stark barely had time to react.
Reaper spun, a blur of motion that broke the line between the physical and the ethereal, and dark blades sliced through the air, a whirlwind of death surrounding Stark.
He felt the rush of wind as each sweep cut toward him, leaving no room for escape.
"Invincible Dodge!" Stark ducked low, rolling to the side, barely evading the first wave, the air crackled with the energy of the attack, and he could hear the shriek of the blades as they cut through the space where he had just stood.
Reaper's movements were fluid and uncounterable, but Stark couldn't let himself be mesmerized; he focused on the rhythm, anticipating the next strike.
The ground trembled as the scythe cleaved through the arena floor, sending splintered debris flying, Stark leaped backward, narrowly dodging another barrage.
