[You have received information to aid you in your quest!]
And thus… what Stark got was…
[You have been granted information about the location of all the apostles on the second line!]
"HOLY SHIT!" he shouted out of pure excitement.
This was BIG! REALLY BIG!
Of course, the difficulty would surely rise higher than he could even imagine for these apostles, but at least knowing where they were incredible!
"Hm~ mh…" he heard Lana make some cute noises as she turned around, holding one of the pillows tight, "Hehe~ not here Stark… hehe…"
"…" to be honest, he didn't even wanna know what she was talking about.
And so, he quickly returned to reading the [ApostleDex] panel, wanting to figure out where the hell were those apostles at.
Ding!
He began reading from the second line, stopping his eyes on the first black box, displaying the shadowy figure of an apostle he hadn't seen yet.
…
[Line 2, Apostle 1]
[Name: ???]
[Level: ???]
[Location: Devil's Abyss]
…
Then he quickly moved on to the next one.
…
[Line 2, Apostle 2]
[Name: ???]
[Level: ???]
[Location: Devil's Abyss]
…
"Huh…" he already knew that three apostles were waiting for him in the [Devil's Abyss] rift, which he had the key of, but he didn't expect them so soon!
…
[Line 2, Apostle 3]
[Name: ???]
[Level: ???]
[Location: Devil's Abyss]
…
Yep, this was confirmed: the next three apostles Stark needed to find if he wanted to fight them chronologically as to give himself a chance, were those in the [Devil's Abyss].
"Ah…" Stark sighed, this was bad news for him, since it meant that from now on, the apostles' level would surely be above 200 or even 250, and by the end of the second line, he already expected the [Crimson Moons Trio] to be level 500 or above.
It didn't matter though, so he moved to the apostle to the left from the visible picture of the moon trio, since he had already seen them once, their single eye staring at the boy as if they knew he was inspecting them.
Fwish!
…
[Line 2, Apostle 4]
[Name: ???]
[Level: ???]
[Location: Last Floor (10) of the Colosseum]
….
"Huh?" Stark had never heard of something like a 'colosseum'.
He had been in this world for a while now, and although it had been less than a year since his arrival, there was no chance he would have missed it.
Was the 'Colosseum' a rift? But then why would it talk about floors?!
"Well, I'll figure it out later," but there was one thing Stark knew: it was that at some point, he would enter that colosseum and fight the apostle.
Because no matter what he did, it was his fate as the 'Chosen One'.
Fighting those apostles was inevitable, and it was either he got rid of them one by one, or they killed him… and soon enough… they will take over the world.
For that is the true plan of the 'Godless Demon'.
Nobody, not even Stark, knew that he was one of the few ones actively trying to kill the apostles.
Basically… he was the unknown savior of this world, though his quest was still ongoing.
And as for the only visible apostle of the second line…
…
[Line 2, Apostle 5]
[Name: Crimson Moons Trio]
[Level: ???]
[Location: Third Domination Trial]
…
"…"
[Location: Third Domination Trial]
Stark made sure to read that several times just to make sure that he wasn't going crazy.
And yet, here it was, in front of his very eyes.
"…"
Not only did this mean that there would indeed be a third domination trial, at least a hundred times harder than the previous, but also that at least ONE of the apostles would be there.
"Ah… fucking hell…" Stark held his forehead with such force it actually began to hurt, "FUCK…"
He shouted that last sentence without even realizing it.
Thud!
And it surprised Lana so much she jumped from the bed and fell on the ground.
"Ouch… what happene~d… I had the besssttt dreamm…" Lana mumbled, half asleep.
She rubbed her eyes, adjusting to her surroundings.
The usual Lana would immediately have her face turn completely red as she had essentially slept with Stark, because she got worried after seeing him sleep for two weeks straight.
She would also think something like 'h-he probably thinks I'm a pervert!!!', and almost die of shame.
But… right now… she wasn't feeling any of that.
Because as she was watching Stark, all she could sense was fear.
Stark didn't look normal: he was angry, so angry in fact that his crimson aura didn't only take over his face as usual, but his entire body too.
"Trial… trial…" he kept mumbling those words, deep in thought.
Lana had seen Stark get mad, obviously, but never this much.
"S-Stark…?" she truly couldn't comprehend what he was thinking, and why this happened the moment he woke up.
Did something bad happen in the outside world? Did he receive horrible news?
No… Stark wouldn't be bothered by what happened to others, and he didn't have anyone close to him besides her and Sora…
"Apostle… trial… domination…" he mumbled, his thoughts trying to arrange everything into something comprehensible.
"STARK!" Lana shouted again.
Fwish!
And this time, Stark turned his head toward her, not losing the aura around him, the vortex in his eyes not disappearing as it inspected the girl before him.
Woosh!
This made her legs tremble: she was scared.
She knew Stark wouldn't do anything to her, but seeing him like this was… hard.
But after only thirty seconds… the aura around Stark disappeared, and he retrieved his usual neutral expression.
"Alright, I get it now," he mumbled low enough for her not to hear, "I'll get rid of those bastards myself."
His determination had grown much more than before.
He didn't know why he got so mad after seeing the word apostle and domination trial next to one another, but it just… annoyed him.
Once he was back to normal though, he noticed that Lana was on the ground, her legs trembling, "What's wrong, did you see a demon," he smiled mischievously, back to normal.
"I-I guess you can say so…" she got up and smiled, happy that the Stark she liked was back.
"Heh~ I guess sneaking into my bed wasn't good enough for you, was it?" he added.
"…" and this time, she didn't have anything to say, "Sorry, just felt… comfortable doing so."
She didn't tell him, but she had been doing that for the past week.
Well… not that he would have cared, anyway.

chapters.title: Chapter 262 - 262: Jealousy and New Information
chapters.content:
Another week passed since Stark woke up from his sleep, which lasted two weeks, and since he had learned about the location of the apostles from the [ApostleDex].
Which means that 3 weeks passed since he left the [Corpse Cemetery], and one month since this entire trial started.
[Three months left before second semester/trial]
He still had time to do whatever he wanted until then.
But to be honest, after everything that happened... he didn't feel like it, and it meant that he didn't feel like staying around doing nothing.
After his talk with [Domination] and [Alchemist], after realizing that killing the apostles was basically a path that he quite literally couldn't avoid, after knowing that a third domination trial was coming…
Stark could only do one thing: become stronger.
He had already sold all the items he didn't need too, gaining him roughly 11.3 million rher coins, an incredible amount of cash since the items he had gotten this time were next level even among the usual standard.ù
Much like Fellarburg, the capital also regrouped different districts, well, basically the same ones to be honest, meaning that there wasn't much difference other than the location, and that the people here were much stronger.
"Thank you for the equipment," Violette smiled at him.
Yes, the very same appraiser he had always been using back there was also in this location for some reason.
"Are you… following me?" he asked, raising his eyebrows.
"I got transferred here because apparently the student batch of this year of the 'rift conqueror' academy is the strongest, which attracts thousands of awakeners, haha~" she giggled, seemingly so professional and well-known among appraisers that she was hired to go in different locations to appraise items.
"Oh, alright," she didn't seem to know Stark was in it, but it was fine for him.
Plus… Violette when he first met her was around level 194 and from the 'Magus' class, meaning that she had been stronger than he was.
And yet… in less than a few months, even though he was only level 70, he was already confident he could easily beat her if it came down to it, though it most likely would never happen as she was a very nice woman.
But if you want a rough estimate for the [Domination] class against all the others, you could take the domination user's level and multiply it by around 4 to 5 times their level to make it fair.
Meaning that the current Stark could take down people at around level 250 if he managed to take them by surprise using his skills, and with enough determination he could do it even in a one on one.
And that wasn't considering the fact Stark was a prodigy among prodigies, and that he had two lives, plus the [Superior Clone].
Surely, no one in this academy, not even Sora who struggled against the warden and participated in the second domination trial with him, could even try to hurt him: they would all lose.
But in the end, it didn't matter.
Fwish!
He was currently eating lunch with Lana, which was a steak that he himself had prepared for them both.
"That's… amazing!" Lana's eyes sparkled.
She had recently been spending her entire time in Stark apartment (he kicked her out when night came, though she was reluctant), and there wasn't much for him to do other than hangout since he wanted to take a little break from everything.
Since his appearance in this world, it had only been fighting, fighting, and keep fighting, so maybe a small break wouldn't kill him.
Afterward, though, he would try everything in his power to reach level 75 if not 80 if he could.
Unlocking his next class was a priority after all!
Plus, he needed to reach level 75 to be able to use a [Breakthrough stone] and climb all the way to [Gold] rank.
As said before, Domination works completely differently than any other class in that regard too.
There are 10 categories for rank: Iron, Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, Diamond, Ascendant, Prodigy, Immortal and Classified.
And even though it only took Stark 25 levels between each rank, it was completely different for the others: it took them 100.
Yes, you heard that right, someone at the Iron-rank at the beginning could only reach Bronze upon hitting level 100, then silver would only be at level 200, and so on.
Meaning that they would have to reach level 900 to be at the peak, a feat only a few people could do, and you could count them on your hands.
But for Stark, it would take him reaching level 225 to be at the top, and though it seemed smaller, the amount of experience needed surely would be unimaginable even to the current him.
"Are you okay?" Lana asked as she noticed Stark deep in thought, scared he would go on a crazy rampage again.
"Hm… yeah," he took another bite of his steak, "By the way, I think I'll be gone from two weeks to a month after tomorrow, I need to train."
"Oh…" Lana looked sad once he said that, after all they had only just started hanging out recently for real, "It's fine I guess, my father said that you have to be strong enough to protect me, after all!"
Even she didn't believe in that 'protection' bullshit since she could defend herself using her abilities, but right now… she just felt that it was right.
What was her relationship with Stark, she wondered.
There was no denying it at this point: she had feelings for him, but what about him?
It was always fight, fight, fight… and he probably didn't think about her for a single instant while doing so, while on the contrary, she would keep thinking of him every day until he came back.
Death was never too far in this world, after all.
Basically… she knew that her feelings were one-sided.
And she wasn't wrong: Stark wasn't dense, he could sense it in the air, but he just refused to acknowledge it, as for him, it was all about the apostles and getting stronger now, especially not knowing when the next domination trial would happen.
He couldn't enjoy himself until he was confident that he was safe.
And for now, the looming danger was still there, so getting close to anyone was a bad solution.
"Well, thanks for the meal," he nodded his head after finishing and took the plates.
But right as he did that…
Ding! Dong!
Stark froze for a moment, eyeing the entrance door.
Who could this be?
He certainly had no friends at all, and no one should be visiting him.
Someone for Lana, maybe?
He walked toward the door.
Ding! Dong!
And as he pulled it open, a familiar figure stood on the other side: Sora, the white-haired and emotionless beauty.
"Oh?" Stark blinked in surprise, "Hello?"
Sora's expression remained neutral as she spoke, "Hi, I just felt like visiting since I'm free for today."
"Sure," Stark replied with the same tone, both of them seemed as neutral as ever, making the conversation look robotic, "Consider yourself home."
If Sora was here, it meant that she wanted to speak to him about something important alone, otherwise there was no other reason to come.
And just as expected…
"I have something to talk about, I received it recently but didn't have the time to speak to you because I was busy," she looked at Stark while entering the apartment, making sure to remove her expensive shoes.
"Oh?" Stark wanted to know, "Just sit on the table then."
"Thanks," she bowed out of respect, then entered the living room.
And what she saw there almost made her emotionless expression falter: she saw Lana sitting on the couch, looking at her.
"Oh! Sora!" Lana beamed, genuinely happy to see her friend.
But Sora on the other hand… was annoyed.
"What are you doing here?" she asked.
"Huh…" Lana was taken aback by the question as you normally wouldn't ask that, "Well… I just hang out with Stark since it's our break… you know?"
"…Alright," that's all Sora answered before turning her back to her and sitting on the table, trying her hardest to shake off that annoying feeling she had in her mind.
She still didn't know what it was, but seeing Lana alone with Stark while she wasn't there angered her more than anything else.
And after two minutes…
"Thanks for waiting," Stark placed a cup of grape juice in front of him and Sora, "We can talk now, tell me."
Lana stayed on the couch, though, sensing that she didn't really have the power needed to sit on the table beside these two… monsters.
Sora didn't waste any time in going directly to the point though: she had come here for that, and although Lana's presence annoyed her for some reason, she still needed to inform Stark of 'THAT'.
"As the year president and member of the group that completed this semester's trial first, I got some kind of 'information'," she spoke, emotionless as ever, and looked into Stark's eyes.
"Hm?" Stark sipped into his juice.
"Well… I got a single piece of information about the next trial, apparently the chairman rewards those who complete the trial first with that as to help them."
"Oh?" Stark was surprised, but it could definitely help, "What is it?"
"Well, I have received a panel around a week ago, it seemed as though I was the only one to get it for some reason though," Sora taped something in the air, probably at her screen.
Stark hadn't received anything, so it made sense.
And so…
"Here, I'm transferring the information, read it for yourself," she taped a few more times then slid her finger toward Stark.
Ding!
And so a new panel opened in front of him.
[As the group that completed the trial first, you have received a few pieces of information concerning the next one!]
This made sense for now.
But… what came right after… almost made Stark spit out all his juice.
[Second Semester Trial: The Colosseum.]

chapters.title: Chapter 263 - 263: The Urge to Get Even Stronger
chapters.content:
"What… did you just say?" Stark mumbled while deeply into Sora's eyes, taking her aback slightly as she didn't expect her friend to be this serious over a piece of information.
"I mean… the panel is right in front of you…" Sora shrugged.
"…Right," Stark looked back at it, and immediately his eyes widened again.
…
[Second Semester Trial: The Colosseum.]
[Basic Information: This will be an INDIVIDUAL task, meaning that you will be alone while completing it, get ready.]
…
These were all the informations they got, nothing more, nothing less.
But if what was written here was true.
Then…
The location of the fourth apostle from the second of the [ApostleDex] was just revealed to him.
.
[Line 2, Apostle 4]
[Name: ???]
[Level: ???]
[Location: Last Floor (10) of the Colosseum]
….
The apostle was at the last floor, maybe he was the final boss actually? Who knows!
"Alright," he nodded, "Thank you, Sora, I can prepare something for you if you want?"
It didn't look like it, but Stark was actually very good with his hands, and as he was an accountant who lived alone in his past life, cooking wasn't that strange to him.
"It's fine," but she shook her head, "That is all that I wanted to say, I have to go back to business matters."
Sora was only 18, but she was already vice-president of several guilds under direct order of her father, and her strength was extremely useful to the family.
Of course, her family didn't know about Stark or the domination trials, but if they found out their only daughter, who always acted emotionless and never approached anyone, was getting 'infatuated' to a random boy, then it would be a disaster.
"I'll be taking my leave," Sora got up from her seat, not touching her grape juice, then began heading toward the exit door.
"…" Stark couldn't and didn't want to stop her, so he just followed.
But right as Sora was about to leave…
"Don't worry, Sora, we'll think you while we're having fun!" Lana peeked out of the hall, a genuine smile on her face.
'Thinking of me while you're having fun…' Sora looked down, a fire burning within her: she was annoyed, so annoyed in fact she almost wanted to stay here just to stop them from having 'fun'.
Yes, Sora misunderstood what Lana said, thinking they were having… um… the other kind of private fun.
Lana on the other hand never had such intentions to mock Sora, as she was her friend, but in the end it did sound like she was nagging her.
"Alright," Sora nodded with an emotionless expression as she opened the door and closed it behind her, "You two have fun, then."
"Huh?" Stark felt irritation in her voice, but it was Sora he was listening to, so he simply thought it was his imagination.
Clang!
He closed the door behind Sora, then went back inside his apartment.
'Need to get stronger…' he thought, walking past Lana who was speaking to him, her voice muffled as his brain completely ignored it.
He now had the location of ALL the apostles from the second line of the [ApostleDex].
The first three were in the [Devil's Abyss], the fourth was in the [Colosseum] somewhere, and the crimson moons trio were in the domination trial.
If he ever wanted to know the location of the apostles at the third line, who should be the strongest of all, he would need to kill all those on the second.
Lana watched him intently, her eyes filled with confusion, as Stark sat on one of the chairs around the table and started thinking about something she didn't know.
This had happened several times these past few days, and each time it would take around an hour for Stark to go back to his normal self, any attempt to distract him didn't work.
But surprisingly, this time it didn't take more than ten minutes for Stark to come back.
And once he did, he asked a simple question to Lana.
"Is there a 'Rift Storer Association' in the capital? Or at least somewhere where I could get stronger?" he asked while looking at Lana.
"…?" the blonde-haired girl was confused, "Huh… yeah?"
"NICE!" Stark immediately got up from his seat, a wide smile on his face, "Very nice!"
"???" Lana raised her eyebrows, then immediately she realized, "Stark… wait a damn minute…"
"What?" Stark was already beginning to check out his [Spatial Inventory] to see if he had everything he needed.
"Don't tell me…" Lana's eyes widened more, her pupils shaking.
"Hahahah!" Stark could already see it, he could sense the feeling of growing stronger.
Only 5 levels until level 75 after all, which meant another class AND the possibility to break through to gold-tier!
With three months of break before the next academy semester, he had MORE than enough time to do whatever he wanted!
"You're planning to go inside a rift even in vacation?!" Lana was flabbergasted, "Even though we're having fun?!"
"…"
And suddenly, Stark stopped everything he was doing to look at Lana with the most neutral of expressions.
"Lana, I like spending time with you, no denying it," that first sentence made her blush, "But… no matter what, I need to get stronger."
"Why?! Why risk your life even though we're on break?!"
"You wouldn't understand, but right now, it's either I risk my life and get stronger, or I die later anyway for being too weak."
"With your current strength y-you could definitely earn more than enough money! And I can help you too!"
"Wouldn't work, I am forced to keep going no matter what, for I am the…" Stark didn't finish his sentence.
But…
[Talent: Chosen One].
"…Alright," Lana didn't want that, but she understood, she can't force him to stay either.
She was already happy she spent time with him, as he was always busy.
And deep down, she knew, that no matter how many months or years, her mind would still force her to wait for Stark.
"I'm leaving tomorrow," he told her while approaching her and patting her head, "Don't worry, I won't die, at least I hope."
"…" Lana looked down, she really wanted to cry, but somehow she couldn't, the tears wouldn't pour out.
Maybe because she didn't know about Stark's circumstances? Or because she knew that he was right in trying to become stronger, essentially because the academy year wasn't over and that it would become much harder later on.
So in the end…
"Okay," she smiled bitter sweetly, "Do whatever you want!"
"Thanks," he didn't need her approval, but it still was good she understood.
And just like that, the day passed quickly, Stark spending the most amount of time possible with Lana, and even allowing her to lay beside him on his bed.
Tomorrow came, and so D-Day arrived.
…
"Goodbye," she smiled as she waved at Stark, who was currently leaving the apartment, "Please come back no matter what!"
"I will, so even if a long time passes, know that I wouldn't die," he nodded, and she hugged him.
After that quick embrace, he left his apartment and closed the door behind.
"…" Stark didn't feel much, to be honest.
To him, all that mattered is to get stronger.
If he was sure to meet the apostles at some point, and if the third domination trial was looming over him, then he had no other choice.
For being the [Chosen One] is both a blessing, but also a curse.

chapters.title: Chapter 264 - 264: The Blocked Rift
chapters.content:
Stark checked the location before hand, and so he hailed for a taxi to drive him to the [Training] district of the capital, a district much more popular and powerful than the one in the city he was in before.
'Maybe I should buy a car…' he had more than enough money to do so, and he already knew how to do that from his past life.
Who cares about driving licenses anyway?!
In the end though, it didn't matter, and he left the car after paying, the [Training] district before him.
In all regards it was pretty familiar to the one he went to before, though it was more populated, and you could sense it that the people in here weren't kidding.
And you could clearly see it by the fact there weren't this many fights/dramas: why would strong people even bother with that?
Only a weak person would let their ego get to them after all, and that is why Stark never respected these other people, openly mocking them and beating them if they tried something.
After passing the street with all the shops and people trying to form teams, Stark reached the building for the [Rift Storer Association], who seemed to be present everywhere in this world actually.
The building was bigger than the other one, which already as giant as three mansions, and so he went up to the lobby.
The general structure didn't change, and Stark headed toward the [Rifts] section, reaching the massive hall with all the different rifts in it.
[Please choose the rift you want to enter!]
[Warning! Those below recommended level won't be admitted inside a rift!]
Inside of the [Rift] section's giant room were many other halls, each leading to another place further inside the 'Rift Storer Association'.
The hall all the way to the right had the title [Level 10-25 Rift] above, the one next to it was [Level 25-50 Rift] and it continued like this until reaching [Level 225-250 Rift].
Which meant that there were 10 halls/rifts inside the [Rift] section, which people could access to hope to level up.
And as for Stark… well…
~FWISH~
He slowly began heading to the rift, meaning toward the rifts that are actually of higher level and more difficult.
At this point anything below level 175-200 wouldn't help, he needed more.
But in opposition to before, the further he went, then the more people there were.
It was obvious why: the capital ACTUALLY had strong people in it, since they needed to be strong to begin with to survive.
Meaning that the most popular rifts in this place were the ones between level 175 and 225.
Once Stark reached the hall with the [Level 200-225] sign over it, it became increasingly difficult to navigate.
But even then he kept going.
Too many people were present, meaning a harder time to level up or find monsters.
He needed something else, and so he moved to the last one.
And… surprisingly…
"Huh?" once he passed the [Level 200-225] section… there weren't any people at all, or at least a very small amount of them.
"What the?"
Yes, once he reached the hall with the [Level 225-250] rift, there was almost no one there.
Why? You might ask, well…
[Warning! Please do not take this rift if not prepared!]
[This is a mistake, you WILL die! Do not take this rift!]
The barrier was half sealed with planks of wood and such, as if to give the feeling that no one should enter it. But the association had left an opening big enough for anyone who wanted to still go inside to pass.
"…" literally no one was taking this rift.
And so, that meant that Stark would be alone inside.
'YEEPIE!' he was happy, since it meant more experience for himself, and in addition to that, taking on monsters above level 225 would mean enhancing his power.
To be honest, this was probably the BIGGEST jump in difficulty Stark would ever make until now.
The last rift he went through had monsters at a maximum level of 150.
But now… he would need to face some that had levels up to 250!
Was it recklessness? Or just the urgency and need to get stronger fast.
Because to be honest, Stark had only ever struggled against the calamity apostle: even Lother, the boss one, was destroyed by Stark's clone alone, so there was no need to worry.
But it didn't matter, so Stark began to walk toward the hallway, trying to pass through the small opening the association left.
And yet…
~ZAP! BOOM!~
The crimson barrier that was set up around each of the halls activated again.
'Oh yeah… that thing…' he sighed.
[You are level 70, please do not attempt to enter this rift again!]
Anyone below level 225 wasn't allowed in.
But Stark had already managed to pass the barrier twice before in his previous city, so why should he care?
He got up from the ground and headed toward it again, this time activating his aura as to push through it.
He could sense the judgmental stares from the people who tried to head to the hall right next to his, or were just speaking: they were all thinking if that kid was crazy, some even mocking him.
A mere level 70 trying to enter a rift higher than the one they were entering? HELL NO!
Stark didn't mind though, and right as he was about to push through the barrier using his aura like he always did… he was suddenly stopped, a hand landing on his shoulder.
"…"
"You shouldn't do this, kid," a middle-aged man spoke, but Stark didn't bother to turn around to see his appearance.
"Y-Yeah, are you crazy?! Didn't you read the signs, plus you're level 70!" a woman spoke beside him.
"Wait… maybe he's trying to commit suicide?" a third theorized.
"…" Stark didn't respond, "Am I free to go now?"
He surrounded his body with aura, and instinctively, the man that held his shoulder removed his hand.
"What the…" he mumbled as for a split second, a zap went through his body, as if his aura was toxic to the touch.
~FWISH~
Stark continued walking, positioning himself in front of the barrier, then pushing through.
[WARNING! WARNING! YOU AREN'T ALLOWED!]
The sounds were becoming so loud that most people began looking at Stark, and even those on the other side of the [Rift] section came to check it out.
[WARNING…]
The barrier resisted, but Stark pushed through, surrounding his entire body with aura.
[WAR…NING… DANG…EROUS… RIFT…]
~SNAP, CRACK~
The barrier gave in as even with all these attempts, and Stark's arms were still beginning to go through it, essentially deciding fighting this human wasn't worth it.
If he died, then so be it.
~FWISH~
He phased through, then looked back at all the people, who's jaws quite literally dropped to the ground.
Level 70 allowed to enter this rift?! The most dangerous one in this association, too?! Was this a joke?!
"Oh wow, looks like I'm allowed to pass," he sarcastically said as he shrugged his arms, then turned around again.
~ZAP~
Several people after him tried to repeat what he had done, believing there was something faulty in the barrier, but alas, none of those below level 225 were allowed in.
Meaning… that this kid was different, and that he was hiding lots of things.

chapters.title: Chapter 265 - 265: The Sunken Valley, Level 200+ Rift!
chapters.content:
It didn't take long for Stark to reach the end of the hallway after traversing the crimson barrier, leaving all the other classifiers behind to wonder how he did it, since many of them attempted afterward, and the barrier literally wouldn't let them pass no matter what.
And then… Stark arrived in front of the portal to the rift, also crimson in color.
[WARNING! DO NOT GO!]
[EVEN CLASSIFIERS THAT ARE LEVEL 250 AREN'T ADVISED TO ENTER]
[This rift was placed here but wasn't supposed to be this difficult, the difficulty is "Determination"!]
[CALAMITY BOSS INSIDE!]
Dozens of signs were placed all around the portal, instructing anyone foolish to have gotten here to back away.
And to be honest, after remembering Lana's words about not needing to risk your life for no reason, he did indeed feel like it was futile to go this far even though none of the other classifiers did that.
But… once he closed his eyes…
The image of the [Crimson Moons Trio] appeared before him, all looking at him with their single pupil, their giants body judging him.
This sent a shiver down his spine but also… determination!
"If I can't beat that rift, these things are going to absolutely destroy me," this was what he thought at that moment, remembering the overwhelming despair he felt when seeing them for the first time.
And so he jumped inside, not caring about anything else.
…
Fwish!
Stark traveled through dimensions, after a few seconds landed on solid ground.
Fwish! Thud!
It had become a habit, so he immediately lifted his gaze to look around.
And the first thing he noticed was…
Snow, there was snow everywhere.
It was even pouring down from above, the grey sky filled with clouds, the small snowflakes visible.
The floor was made of dirt, but it was white in color because of the snowy texture.
Though it wasn't actually thick enough to make a difference.
Basically, the snow in itself wouldn't disturb him because there was only a small amount of it, only enough to cover the surface.
And so, soon enough he received the panel he had been waiting for.
Ding!
….
[Welcome to the "Sunken Valley"!]
[Difficulty: Determination]
[Number of classifiers: 1]
[You are in the first zone: "The Descent"!]
[Good Luck!]
[Tip because of low level: watch out for the snake and ape, you won't win against them.]
…
This was all the information he would get.
The name of the rift was 'Sunken Valley', and once Stark actually took the time to observe more, he noticed that behind here were walls blocking his escape: the only path was forward.
And what was forward you might ask…
Well…
[First Zone: The Descent]
In front of was a massive ravine delimited by two giant mountains that were impossible to climb, so all he could was go down.
Thus the title "The Descent" for the first zone: he needed to go all the way down, and just by looking from his current position, he couldn't see the bottom.
[Rift Zone Number: 4]
This was a small amount of them, but if every zone was as big and time-consuming as this one, then it would take him hours upon hours for each.
Was this why this rift was locked up?
Or was the worst to come?
In the end, it didn't matter.
Stark peeked at the void below from above, and he noticed several rocky platforms set along the edges of the ravine, making it possible to go down slowly by parkouring.
"…Alright," he didn't know what awaited for him down below, but going into the unknown abyss made him anxious.
Though not enough to stop him.
But, even if the wanted to leave…
"Hm…" the exit portal was gone.
[Rift Type: No Return]
Just like a [Normal] rift or [One-Classifier] one like [Sierra's Death Path], this rift was one where you couldn't go back once you entered, which is why it had been locked by the association for being too dangerous.
But there were many other reasons why, and Stark would soon find out about them.
"Let's go, I guess," he mumbled as he jumped from the top of the valley into a platform attached to the rocky wall of the ravine.
Debris fell once he hit the ground, and Stark made a mental note to be careful as any of these things could fall at any point.
Nothing much happened afterward as Stark made his way down the ravine, parkouring his way from one rocky platform to the next. He had to be careful not to slip, as the fall would be fatal.
As he descended, he noticed that the snow was getting thicker, and the wind was picking up.
The visibility was getting worse, and he could barely see the platforms in front of him as the darkness of the abyss was slowly taking over: the only thing aiding him was the white color of the snow.
But even with that, Stark didn't see how this was difficult, as any classifier above level 200 should be able to manage this much.
But the moment he thought about that, he received an answer.
~FWISH~
He heard a sound behind him.
And when he quickly turned around…
"…!"
A dozen arrows were in front of him.
"SHIT!"
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" he rolled away, but was hit by one of the arrows in his shoulder, "Argh…"
"-17621!"
Not that much damage, but it still hurt.
~FWOOSH~
He removed the arrow from his shoulder quickly, hurting him a bit more, but it didn't matter.
[+2 EGO]
Oh and yeah, the one week cooldown for EGO had ended, so he was now able to use it again!
[EGO Meter: 2/100]
~FWISH~
More arrows rushed toward him, and Stark activated [Time Vision] to pinpoint where all his enemies were since the arrows came from different directions.
~CLICK, CLICK, CLICK~
He darted his eyes everywhere, taking notes of where all the monsters were, and after he saw them all, he deactivated the skill, taking him less than a second to do that.
~FWISH~
He avoided all the arrows easily now that he knew where they came from, then he looked at the different locations.
What was shooting him were a bunch of human-sized monkeys with bows in their hands, each standing on a different platform, either above him or below.
Yes, this was pretty much all, they didn't look that strong to begin with, and they didn't have any clothes, only their brown fur.
Though by looking at their faces, it seemed as though they were incredibly intelligent, easily wielding their bows and throwing two arrows at the same time.
One of them even had glasses!
~FWISH~
They launched another barrage of arrows, but Stark this time began to run.
The platforms were actually abundant at this part of the 'descent' zone, and so that meant he could parkour to the monsters easily if he managed not to fall.
Since falling = death.
"PERCEPTION," he decided to check them out while running though.
…
[Name: Sniper Monkeys]
[Level: 220]
[HP: 260000]
[Strength: 4631]
[Stamina: 14628]
[Speed: 8790]
[Defense: 3725!]
[Skills: Arrow Shot, Bow Strike, Ultimate Arrow…]
…
These were the first monsters that were over level 200 he fought, but there didn't seem to be that much difference.
Sure, they had double the HP of a common monster, even though they were common too, and their stats were comparable to those of an elite from before, but they only had three skills!
'So they can only shoot when far, and attack with their bows from close-range, huh…'
The main difficulty with these things was the fact that they ALWAYS kept running away no matter what, and that if the classifier in question didn't have good agility or speed, he would be fucked as he would never be able to catch up.
Basically, the monkeys' strategy was to play like cowards.
They were just hoping for one good strike to end the classifier in question.
But…
[Spatial Inventory!]
He pulled two speed potions and drank them, as well as three [Crystal Stun Potions], keeping them in one of his hands.
"Crimson Spears! Aura Smash!"
Stark actually had ways to get to them!
~FWISH~
He threw two spears toward one of the monkeys who was moving away from Stark as he was getting closer to him, piercing its head and stomach.
"-137261! -274179!" the attack in the end dealt the entirety of its life since it was a critical hit.
And so it died.
But Stark wasn't done: 5 of them remained after all.
"HIikk!" the other monkeys got scared and began running, parkouring through the different platforms and taking shots at the human.
~FWISH~
But Stark would avoid it all, smiling mischievously as he chased after them.
He threw yet another two spears toward the closest monkey to him, but Stark was strategic, so he threw one of the spears at the position where it would be, and another right behind it.
~FWISH~
The monkey had seen its friend die, so it immediately backed away, avoiding the first spear.
And… what had to happen happened.
~CRACK~
The second spear exploded its face.
2 down, 4 more to go.
~FWISH~
"Invincible Dodge!" he rolled away from another dozen spears, the rest of the monkey increasing their fire rate.
Everytime he dodged, the monkey's despair grew bigger.
~FWISH~
He aimed at one of the monkeys while it was jumping to another platform, and predicting its movements pierced its stomach, making it hit the wall and fall into the abyss as it failed the jump.
Now… the snipers were getting sniped, and in this ravine, there was nowhere they could go to escape.
"=)" the chosen one had them in his sight.

chapters.title: Chapter 266 - 266: The Sniper Monkeys' Challenge
chapters.content:
But Stark didn't stay idle either, he would move from platform to platform, trying to follow them.
Their speed was phenomenal, and if anyone saw it happening from afar, all they would see were flashes of colors as they kept moving around.
Depending on where Stark was located, the monkeys were smart enough to either go down or go up, and their agility allowed them to hold onto small things to climb, or do a wall run.
Stark on the other hand actually didn't want to risk it, so he did it the normal way: jumping and holding himself into the ledges when needed.
"AURA SMASH!" in comparison to the spears, the crimson fists were much slower, and he only had three, meaning that he focused them all on a single monkey who was running around.
Stark aimed for the monkey that was closest to him, following it for a good two minutes while avoiding the arrows.
And when he saw an opportunity arise…
~FWISH~
He threw the three crimson fists at it, ALL three hitting it as it was unable to avoid them while Stark almost caught up to it.
~BOOM~
The fists exploded upon impact, and the monkey obviously died, letting out a loud screech before collapsing onto the platform below.
Stark took a deep breath, his heart pounding in his chest. He knew that he couldn't afford to lose focus now.
He quickly jumped from platform to platform, trying to continue this momentum by heading toward one of the remaining monkeys.
He found his next target, and began following it, gaining distance on it slowly.
"HRIISK-!" it seemed to be the slowest monkey as Stark was actually faster than it.
As he got closer, he tightened the grip around the three vials in his hands, ready to throw them.
But…
"HIKHIKHIK!" the monkey, sensing that its life was in danger, used everything it had and began running against one of the stone walls of the valley, toward a platform way farther.
'Shit,' Stark knew he couldn't jump all the way there, and stopping would mean losing his momentum and some of his adrenaline.
And so… he did the unthinkable: he copied it.
When he reached the very edge of the platform he was in, he looked ahead, and ALSO began running against the wall, doing a flawless wall run while following the monster.
And so, when the monkey dropped on the ground of the next rock platform, thinking it was safe, it looked behind it and…
It saw Stark in the air, who had used the wall as a jumping pad to get above the sniper.
"Hik-"
~FWISH, SPLASH~
He threw all three [Crystal Stun Potions] at it, its speed not allowing it to avoid them from such short distance.
The vials shattered upon impact, releasing a cloud of white fog that enveloped the monkey.
['Sniper Monkey' has been stunned!]
Stark adjusted quickly to take advantage of this opportunity.
While still in the air, he positioned his two legs and using the momentum of his jump smashed his feet against the stunned monkey's face and slammed its head into the hard ground below.
~SPLASH~
Its head literally exploded until Stark's feet, leaving a puddle of blood under them.
"Argh… my shoes…" Stark was disgusted.
~FWISH, FWISH~
With a single movement of his head he avoided 6 arrows that came at him, and noticed that the other two were together at the very opposite of where he was.
They were probably thinking that Stark couldn't reach them, and that he would grow tired at some point, right?
But… that would not knowing him.
"Crimson Ball Transmission!" he summoned the ball in his hand and threw it with all his might toward the platform the monkeys stood on as they had the high ground.
But he wasn't the only one planning something.
"ULTIMATE ARROW!" the monkeys used their [Legendary] skill, and yes, these monsters actually had one.
The arrow they were holding on their bow began to glow with silver aura, its tip glinting ominously, as if ready to track Stark.
And deep down…
[Warning! Warning! Warning!] he knew that these arrows were bad news, especially with TWO of them coming.
He didn't know if his shot with the crimson ball would work, but if it didn't, he would need to be ready to sacrifice one of his lives.
He kept focusing on the [Crimson Ball] though, paying no mind to the ultimate arrows coming.
And once he felt that the moment was right…
~SNAP, FWISH, FWISH~
He snapped his fingers, immediately teleporting out of his spot.
And at the same time, the monkeys released their bows, the arrows they launched quite literally exploding, and in less than a fraction of a second hit the platform Stark had been in mere moments ago, exploding it as well.
"Hihihihi!"
"Kakaka!"
The monkeys cheered, thinking they had eliminated the human.
But…
"Very bad aim," they heard a voice behind them, and saw the human in the air above them as he teleported, "Good bye."
~SLAM~
He kicked both monkeys out into the abyss, killing them both since, y'know, he wasn't the only one that risked death by falling from this height.
And so he managed to finish his first (and only encounter) in the first zone.
The main goal of this zone was actually to quite literally just ignore the monkeys: the challenge was to keep going while avoiding the arrows that were relentlesly sent toward you.
The system didn't expect there to be anyone crazy enough to try and follow the monkeys, especially with their speed who was higher than an average level 225-250.
You could say Stark found his OWN way of doing it, since for him defeating monsters was always the right choice.
That is actually one of the reasons why they only had three skills: they weren't meant to be fought.
"Phew…" he sighed as he looked around, making sure there weren't any more surprises.
And then.
~DING, DING, DING~
[You have slain "Sniper Monkey lv220", gained 340,000 EXP!]
[You have slain "Sniper Monkey lv220", gained 342,000 EXP!]
.
.
[You have slain "Sniper Monkey lv220", gained 341,000 EXP!]
And so…
[+2,043,000 experience!]
He got over 2 million EXP from that simple fight.
Monsters above level 200 were truly a blessing when it came to helping you level up, though you needed to defeat them for that to happen.
Unfortunately though, Stark didn't level up.
[Experience: 3,603,000/3,690,000]
So close, yet so far.
And so he needed to keep going if he wanted to get to level 75, which was the goal of this entire 'operation'.
After the monkeys died, nothing came disturbing him as he parkoured from platform to platform, slowly going down the valley.
It took him thirty minutes, sure, but they were pretty peaceful and without any issues as the monkeys were the ONLY monsters and challenge of this zone.
And so… in the end…
~THUD~
He managed to end on the ground at the very bottom of the ravine, able to see the corpses of the three monkeys he had sent away, all crushed.
And then…
~FWISH, DING~
[Second Zone: Path to the Bridge]

chapters.title: Chapter 267 - 267: The Cave Leading to the "Bridge"
chapters.content:
[Second Zone: Path to the Bridge]
"…"
Now that Stark managed to reach the bottom of the ravine, he needed to keep going.
Considering that one of the zones would be reserved for the boss, it meant he still had two more he needed to go through.
To be honest, he felt pretty confident, after all he had successfully managed to kill a few level 220 monstes, basically enhancing his technique as the max level monster he fought until now was level 150.
A 75 level jump was a big deal, and no one usually does it if they don't want to get IMMEDIATELY destroyed.
Thankfully enough, though, he was managing thanks to [Domination].
Before him was the entrance of a dark cave, surrounded by very close rock walls, making the entire thing extremely claustrophobic.
"Huh," he couldn't see the insides of the cave since it was way too dark, "Well, anyway."
But it didn't matter, and so he immediately went inside.
In this zone, he would surely encounter monsters that could actually fight, he needed to be ready.
Stark's eyes slowly adjusted to the darkness and he thought that he definitely needed a kill that allowed him to see in the dark at some point.
The cave was… well… as expected extremely claustrophobic, and the actual size only allowed up to two people to go at the same time forward, meaning that if there were any monsters, he would need to fight them an in extremely small environment.
But with his current visibilty, seeing even a meter ahead of him was already a difficult task, and he couldn't even see the exit from where he was, although it could just mean it was hidden by something to confuse him.
It was complete silence too, and he honestly didn't see how any monsters could hide or try get away: after all they were the same as him, restrained by the small space.
"Oh wait!" but Stark remembered something all of a sudden, "Crimson Purification… Holy Concentration!"
He used up his skill, but just like before, instead of sending a wave of holy aura, he began to pour all of his energy into creating a golden balls in hands, slowly lighting up his surroundings.
"Yes!" as actually began to emit some light, Stark was almost starting to compliment his genius.
And the more holy aura he put into it, the bigger the energy ball grew.
And so by the end, once it was fully charged and ready to strike, instead of attacking like he would normally do it, Stark kept it in his right hand, deciding to use it as a light source.
Worse of all: it worked!
He could now see at least five meters ahead of him!
And so once he lifted his energy ball to see ahead…
"Huh," he saw terrifying monsters.
They were humanoid in shape, attached to the wall with their hands as sharp claws came out of them, and their face were devoid of any features except for a massive mouth with a dangling gray tounge, so big in fact that it was almost reaching the ground.
There were three of them around four meters away from attached to the wall.
Instincitvely, Stark wanted to know if there were more, so he moved the [Holy Ball] to the ceiling, and there he saw another two of the same monsters using their tongues as some sort of ropes, slowly going down toward him, ready to slash.
"…" he looked behind, and yet again two of these same monsters slowly but surely approaching him, one of the ground and the other on the wall.
And, to make it worse, he actually pointed down and saw one of these things slowly emerging from the rock surface below.
Basically, there were eight horrifying monsters slowly approaching him from beyond the darkness of the claustrophobic cave.
"…Perception," he mumbled immediately while the monsters didn't realize that they had been seen, yes, they were blind since they had no eyes, so just like Lother, all they could do was feel the vibrations and sense the movements of the opponent.
….
[Name: Tongue-Claw Ambush]
[Level: 228]
[HP: 300000]
[Strength: 11261]
[Stamina: 14850]
[Speed: 2371]
[Defense: 5892]
[Skills: Camouflage, Tongue Lash, Claw Swipe, Wall Crawl, Faceless Monstrosity, Sonic Scream, Stun Saliva, Enhanced Senses, Immolation…]
….
Level 228, good hp, extremely high strength and stamina, probably to be able to crawl on the walls, but low speed (makes sense with how slow they were approaching Stark, and decent defense.
They had eight skills, but what surprised Stark the most was…
"Huh?" he read the panel several times, "Stun Saliva…? Immolation?!"
He truly didn't know how these things could do that, but oh well.
Stark got into position, making sure to keep the energy ball close to him as it floated in the air to be able to see.
But as if to confirm his previous question…
"STUN SALIVA! SONIC SCREAM!" all eight monsters suddenly activated these skills, the two on the ceiling with [Stun Saliva] and the rest opening their face mouths wider than before and using [Sonic Scream].
~FWISH, PLOP~
Stark didn't have eight eyes, so he couldn't see every monster all the time, and he ESPECIALLY needed to keep watch on the one below as it was slowly revealing itself, and yes, he tried to hit it, by its head wasn't full out so no damage received.
~PLOP~
A few drops of water landed on his shoulders.
And suddenly…
~FWISH~
['Domination' cannot be stunned by 'Stun Saliva']
"…!!" Stark realized that these weren't drops of water and looked above him, the two [Tongue-Claw Ambushes] opening their face mouth and letting out a few droplets of saliva on the human below, "Argh…"
It was disgusting, but Stark was just thankful this didn't work on him otherwise he would had one hell of a hard time.
And in addition to that…
"SONIC SCREAM!" the rest of the monsters except the one below Stark used this skill, screaming at the top of their lungs.
"AAAAAAAAAAAAAA-" it was a horrifying sound, and Stark had to cover his ears to not go deaf.
But… yet again…
~FWISH~
['Domination' cannot be affected by the 'Fear' effect of "Sonic Scream"]
Yet again these status effects didn't work, and the monsters realizing that stopped what they were doing.
"My turn, now," Stark smiled as summoned his [Spatial Inventory] and put his hand inside of it, and with the other one he summoned [Aura Smash]'s three crimson fists, and his five [Crimson Spears].
He was ready now, the energy ball floating beside him to illuminate the darkness.
And so… the battle could truly begin now.
He needed to fight these things straight from hell, who tried to ambush Stark, and if he had just walked a few more meters, his head would have surely been cut off before he even realized it.
But… let's not forget that Stark was in THEIR domain, he was currently in THEIR territory, and even though they were blind, they sure as hell wouldn't miss him no matter what thanks to the [Enhanced Senses] skill they had.
And so…
~FWISH~
"TONGUE LASH!"
"CLAW SWIPE!"
ALL of the monsters, except the one crawling below, jumped toward Stark.
It was a seven enemy attack at the same time!
"Oh boy…" he got ready for impact.

chapters.title: Chapter 268 - 268: The Sunken Bridge
chapters.content:
All the monsters that ambushed Stark suddenly dashed toward him, not leaving him a single point where to escape in this small cave, so small in fact that Stark's body was only just barely fitting.
Any tighter and he would struggle to walk!
~FWISH~
"TONGUE LASH!"
"CLAW SWIPE!"
Some of the [Tongue-Claw Ambushes] launched their tongues at Stark, trying to wrap him up around them as to maybe try and crush his organs, or allow the rest of them to cut him in pieces.
While the other half just launched themselves at him, their white claws glinting in the darkness of the cave, though the energy ball from [Crimson Purification] still allowed Stark to see from close.
~FWISH~
They didn't make a sound.
But… of course Stark wouldn't sit down and do nothing against these… things.
"AURA SMASH! CRIMSON SPEARS!"
All this happened in less than half of a second, but basically: Stark summoned his five spears, then immediately threw one at the group of three monsters in front of him, momentarily stopping them as they were pierced.
"-98371! -102371! -97483!"
The three crimson fists on the other hand were sent at the back, hitting the monster's tongue as they were the ones that used [Tongue Lash], burning it.
"-300000! -300000!" and most interesting of all: they received the entirety of their health in one go the moment Stark hit their tongues.
Meaning… that it was their weakness.
It was rare for monsters to have such an obvious weakness, and even more when the simple action of hitting that weakness was enough to instantly one shot them, but oh well, maybe it was to adjust the difficulty.
After all, the cave would be totally dark under normal circumstances.
"SPATIAL INVENTORY," and to fight the last remaining group, meaning the two above that were currently dropping, their mouths opened, revealing their disgusting tongues, and their claws ready to slash…
~FWISH~
Stark put his hand inside his inventory and with lightning speed pulled two [Crystal Stun Potions], instantly launching them above without even looking.
~BAM, BAM~
The potions hit the monster's mouth, and precisely their tongue.
[Weakness hit with 'Crystal Stun Potion'!]
~DING~
And yet again, the monsters fell to the ground, exploding their hands against the rock as stunning their tongue was literally just as bad as hitting it, meaning instant death.
"Huh…" and so, knowing that, Stark didn't hesitate a single second to pull out four more potions, throwing three of them at the monsters above, killing them as well.
And as for the last one… he just looked down.
"KRAAA!" the final [Tongue-Claw Ambush] finally emerged, thinking that its friends were doing a good job distracting the human.
And yet…
"Kra?" as it lifted its head, it just saw Stark look down at it, its friend's corpses all around, "…"
~BAM~
He dropped the last potion on it, and it died instantly too.
"Phew…" the small golden ball beside him was still working, and so he could see around him.
But before that…
~DING! DING! DING!~
[You have slain "Tongue-Claw Ambush", gained 376,200 EXP!]
[You have slain "Tongue-Claw Ambush", gained 374,500 EXP!]
.
.
[You have slain "Tongue-Claw Ambush", gained 377,600 EXP!]
~DING~
[Your level has increased to level 71, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Experience: 2,929,300/3,750,000]
Only one level, but thankfully enough he got enough experience to almost reach the next one too, meaning that it was worth it.
At this point, monsters below level 150, or even 200, wouldn't cut it anymore in terms of experience.
Stark REALLY needed stronger monsters, especially ones that would grant him tons of EXP, and that were actually possible to defeat.
But in the end it didn't matter much as he continued his journey through the small cave, easily following the path and not bumping into any walls thanks to the golden ball that emitted light.
And after around five minutes, where he yet again didn't meet any more monsters (just like the sniper monkeys, these 8 monsters were actually the sole monsters of this zone since it was small to begin with).
But yet again, the simple fact that it was this "EASY" made Stark even more suspicious.
~FWISH~
He saw the exit of the cave, and successfully managed to leave, the sky now visible again as he was back at the ravine.
This was the entire second zone, yes.
First zone had 6 [Sniper Monkeys], second zone had 8 [Tongue-Claw Ambushes].
Literally what was the catch with this rift?
He was currently at the third zone, meaning more than halfway through the rift, yet he didn't see anything worthy of restraining and blocking its access to anyone.
To be honest, he didn't even see why it would be from the [Determination] difficulty.
Was he too strong? Or were all the others too weak?
He didn't know, but surely… there would be something.
And Stark was right!
~FWISH~
He emerged from the cave and took a look at where he was.
And…
[Third Zone: The Sunken Bridge]
In front of him was a massive wooden bridge in extremely bad shape, though still full, allowing anyone to pass through if they dared.
Below was the void, complete void, and anyone who fell would immediately die.
Stark didn't know if it was the same void from his [Void] skill, but even if it wasn't, it was still terrifying to think about the fact that a single wrong step could lead to… whatever awaits below.
For no one knows what is inside the void.
It is death, true, but what causes this death?
"Hm…" Stark kept looking for a few minutes before slapping both his cheeks and deciding to not pussy out right now, "Maybe it's because too many people fell for no reason?"
He theorized of a reason as to why this rift who closed, but even then, it didn't make sense.
In the end, it didn't matter, and he guessed that it would probably be the boss that was the issue.
At least he tried to reassure himself, because if it wasn't the boss… then…
"Hm…" he slapped himself for a second time.
For some reason he kept having that bad feeling inside of him, that bad feeling he always got when something was amiss, that sense of dread he got when he knew that something horrifying was about to happen.
But even when he looked around him for five more minutes, nothing happened.
What could be that feeling…
[Just go, damn it]
"Alright, alright," Stark arrived in front of the bridge.
It was creaking and constantly moving because of the wind, making it seem as though it would all fall apart at ANY point.
But even then.
~CREAK~
Stark took a first step, and immediately…
~DING~
[Do not run, whatever you do, don't try, you will not reach the end.]
"I mean… that bridge is giant, so it would take me around 10 to 15 seconds to reach the end even for me…" this was just how big it was, at least two or three kilometers in size.
So running wasn't an option, as it would immediately collapse under the weight and impact.
~THUD, THUD~
Instead, Stark needed to walk carefully and slowly, calculating each of his steps as to not pass through one of the holes in the planks.
Two minutes passed like that, minutes where Stark just carefully made sure to find the safest way to get to the end.
And.
When he reached the end, when he reached the middle point of the bridge…
IT happened.
~BOOM~
It wasn't the bridge exploding, or anything in the environment, but Stark's aura itself.
At this point, the alarms in his head were ringing so loudly that they were hurting his head.
[WARNING! WARNING! WARNING!]
[GET OUT! GET OUT! GET OUT!]
Stark's heart was pounding so hard that he could feel it in his throat.
The alarms in his head were still going off, and he couldn't shake the feeling that something was very, very wrong.
He tried to calm himself down, taking deep breaths and focusing on the present moment.
But it was no use: the feeling was too great, and he couldn't help but feel like something terrible was about to happen.
Sensing that staying still wouldn't do anything, Stark decided to continue to walk across the bridge, as it was better than just waiting for whatever horror was awaiting him.
Yet even then, he couldn't shake the feeling that he was being watched.
He turned his head, scanning the darkness below him, but saw nothing.
He shook it off and continued on his way.
A mere fifteen seconds passed between that.
And right afterward… the true horrors of this world revealed themselves to Stark.
Out of the corner of his eye, he saw something moving.
It was faint at first, just a shadow against the darkness of the void below him. But as he looked closer, he realized that it wasn't just a shadow – it was something massive and terrifying rising from the depths of the abyss.
His heart skipped a beat as he realized what it was – a creature unlike anything he had ever seen before.
It was at least fifty times his size, with scales as white as snow and eyes that glowed with an otherworldly light. It seemed to be made of shadows themselves, flickering in and out of existence as it rose higher and higher into the air.
And when it fulled revealed itself… Stark realized that it was a giant snake, and it was looking directly at Stark, knowing of his presence.
A snake… that directly came from the void…?

chapters.title: Chapter 269 - 269: The Universal Great Serpent
chapters.content:
The creature before Stark was a snake so big it could devour his entire apartment complex in a single easy bite.
So big in fact that it could enroll itself around the academy and still have leftovers.
"What… the… fuck…" Stark wanted to back away, but he was stuck on the bridge, and the creature was directly looking at him anyway, its red pupils on him.
"Oh…"
IT SPOKE?!
"If it isssn't our little friend… chosssen one…" it seemed to mock him too.
But the simple fact it knew about his [Domination] code name terrified him.
Its aura was out of this world, and Stark's couldn't even compete, even if he doubled or even tripled his.
"Well… it ssseems that you are quite ssschoked," it said, its forked tongue whistling for each S.
"What… are you…"
But even then, Stark's determination was still there, though just a bit.
Anyone else while seeing that thing would piss themselves, or even think that jumping out into the void was the best solution (though the snake would probably just go down to devour them), but not Stark.
He truly wanted to hold his ground, but he knew it wasn't possible against that thing, not at this current level at least.
"Do not worry… chosssen…" the snake spoke.
"…" does it mean that it wouldn't kill him?
"I will try to make your death asss painful asss possssible…" what could only be considered as a smile appeared on its face while it opened its mouth, revealing its fangs.
That thing could probably swallow him by mistake and not even realize it, based on how big its throat was.
'Focus… Stark… calm down…' Stark kept looking at the snake directly while it seemed amused of the human's fear.
And so, at this moment of calm, while he still had the time, he decided to use a skill.
"PERCEPTION!" he used it on the white snake before him.
But…
~DING~
[Not high enough level, most information: HP, attributes and skills will be hidden]
…
[Name: The Great Serpent (Godless Demon Apostle)]
[Level: 820]
[Rank: Universal]
[Note: you will die, don't even try to fight or look at it, run.]
…
"U-Universal…!?"
This is two ranks above the strongest monster Stark ever fought, who was Reaper, a calamity-level apostle.
And in addition to that… the [Great Serpent] was also an apostle as well.
How did that thing end up in here was the real question.
A level 800 in a level 225 rift is pure insanity, and it should definitely be categorized as [Death] instead of [Determination]!
"Why are you ssscared, chosssen?" the great serpent asked.
"I… I'm not scared of you," this was technically true: Stark was just overwhelmed by his aura.
"Oh?" the snake's eyes widened a bit, but he quickly retrieved his confidence, "Then die, chosssen."
The serpent slowly approached Stark, stopping right in front of the boy, its mouth wide open, "You've causssed enough issssues asss it isss, godlesssss wantssss you gone."
"What the-"
Stark didn't have the time to understand anything that was happening.
A level 800 [Universal] apostle stood in front of him while he was supposed to be in a level 225 rift, coming out of the void, and now it was speaking about killing him because the 'godless demon' wanted him dead?
Did the [Godless Demon] know of Stark's existence already?!
This was all his line of thought could reach as with speed impossible to reach by the boy, the serpent backed away, then rushed toward him, its mouth opened.
"GRAND BITE!" it used one of its most basic skills, and yet it was enough to crush Stark's hopes to retaliate.
"TOO FAST-" it was like a blur even with Stark's incredible [Perception], which surpassed even the other domination users'.
And so, he was forced to use one of his skills.
"DODGE CONTROL!"
~CRUNCH~
The great serpent's mouth closed in on him (and the bridge), and the apostle laughed out loud as it believed to have gotten rid of the human that had been killing its companions one after the other.
"Thisss wasss easssy…"
But… of course it wouldn't work, Stark had activated [Dodge Control] after all!
~FWISH~
Right as the mouth closed in on him and the part of the bridge he stood on, he quite literally teleported away from the attack's range, saved by his skill, then began rushing at intense speed toward the exit, not caring about the warning to not run.
"…!" it took the serpent a single second to realize that the human was still alive, and so it began following him at lightning speed, catching up to him almost instantly.
~BOOM, CRASH~
The bridge was falling apart behind him, and every step he took resulted in more of the planks that were holding it all together to fall into the void.
~FWISH, BOOM~
In addition to that, the [Great Serpent] kept trying to crash into the bridge over and over, trying to destroy Stark's way of getting to the other side, yet he would always somehow teleport out of any attack's range, and then land perfectly at a safety spot.
"WHAT?" even the serpent was confused, this shouldn't be possible, no matter how high Stark's level is!
He had been given a simple order by his lord Godless: kill the human known as the chosen one, as he poses an actual threat to him since he was the only one seeking to kill all the apostles to reach him.
And yet… that human was avoiding all his attacks easily? Almost as if the serpent wasn't even a threat to him?!
"GET BACK HERE, YOU LITTLE SSSHIT!"
'Fuck fuck fuck fuck,' on the other hand, in comparison to what the serpent believed, Stark's thoughts were filled with anxiety and fear of falling or getting killed.
He would manage to avoid everything thanks to [Dodge Control], but it was still terrifying since even though his body instantly adjusted to avoid the attacks, his eyes and mind couldn't even follow them.
And so, 15 seconds passed just like that.
'Only 100 meters left…' he was this close to passing the bridge, a small opening in the wall ahead available for him to pass through: it was his safety net, for if he managed to pass that, then the apostle wouldn't be able to follow.
~DING~
[15 seconds have passed, 'Dodge Control' has been deactivated!]
'SHIT SHIT SHIT SHIT,' he had forgotten about that.
But thankfully enough, the serpent was thinking of something else: "If the human is going to avoid all my attacksss, then I might assss well make him fall into the void…"
And with that thinking in its head, the apostle immediately headed toward the end of the bridge, its giant body peeking out from the darkness of the void, giving Stark no idea just how big that thing truly was.
~CRUNCH~
It bit the end of the bridge, then watched in joy as it saw the ENTIRE bridge collapse, resulting in the human falling.
And yet… Stark didn't give up this time either.
"CRIMSON BALL TRANSMISSION," while falling into the void, Stark focused his entire energy into the crimson ball in his hand then threw it toward the ending platform of the third zone.
At this point it was all or nothing, and to add to the pressure, the serpent immediately dashed under the falling Stark, opening its mouth wide, ready to swallow him once he entered its domain (the void below).
"COME ON, PLEASE," Stark begged as he observed the crimson ball, hoping that he had calculated the trajectory right.
Either he succeeds, or he enters the void and gets devoured.
Failure wasn't an option at this point.
-----------------------------------
The code can be redeemed by 10 different users with 10 FPs/user. You may use it as a fan give-back gift! Your code number is <ABDHYVGLEHVNEFT3A> and you can find the redeem center at Profile-Redeem.
Enjoy.

chapters.title: Chapter 270 - 270: Escaping the Third Zone's Bridge!
chapters.content:
Stark watched in anticipation as the crimson ball flew through the air, his heart pounding in his chest. He knew that this was his last chance, his only hope of survival.
The ball seemed to hang in the air for an eternity before finally connecting with the platform.
As stated before, the crimson ball doesn't bounce at all, so the moment it hit the ground…
~DING~
[Target set, teleportation is safe!]
"GOT YOU!" Stark at this point was within range from the serpent's mouth, beginning to enter it.
And so…
~SLAM~
It closed its mouth on Stark.
For a moment, all the boy could see was darkness, and the laugher echoing from inside the serpent terrified him.
But…
~SNAP~
Instantly, faster than ever the giant snake could act, Stark teleported out of its mouth and materialized on the platform at the end of the bridge.
He didn't even take the microsecond it took him to usually adjust to his new surroundings this time: he immediately dashed toward the small hole below, and slid down.
Yet again, it didn't even take more than a single second for the apostle to realize it had been fucked for the second time, and so using all of its speed, moving instantly, almost as fast as the crimson ball, it opened its mouth and rushed toward Stark as he slid down under the hole.
"…" the timing was so close that even a delay of a tenth of a second would have resulted in Stark's body to be cut in half, or at least crushed.
But thankfully enough…
~FWISH~
He managed to slide down, and the serpent hit the wall instead.
"NO, NOT POSSSSIBLE-" the serpent was absolutely enraged, and so it assaulted the wall that protected Stark as he emerged on the other side several times.
~BAM, BAM, BAM~
Normally its sheer size and strength would be able to take out any walls, yet this one was SPECIFICALLY designed so that the apostle couldn't get out if a human ever passed the third zone.
Meaning… that Stark had won.
"You… ah, forget about it," the serpent growled as it backed away, then its body slowly descended back into the void, its piercing crimson pupils staring intently at the human, "You will die, chosssen, do not forget."
And so it disappeared from view.
~FWISH~
Silence.
There was complete silence now that the apostle was gone.
'Fuck…' Stark dropped to the ground on one knee, breathing in and out repeatedly.
This was, without a shadow of a doubt, one of the worst experience he had EVER gotten during his time in this world.
That thing was probably why this rift was ranked [Determination].
But it still didn't make sense: if the serpent was always there to begin with, then why did he speak about getting orders to eliminate him?
Maybe… all the apostles knew about him?
Up until now, the ones he fought and killed probably all believed he was just one of the many humans trying to challenge them.
But now… if all of them knew that he was an [Apostle Slayer], then…
"Hm, doesn't matter," Stark rested five minutes before getting back up.
At this point he just wanted to go home, and seeing how badly shaped he was, Lana would surely scold him while saying that she was in the right and that he should have listened to her, which was kind of true.
But how could he know he would meet such a… thing?!
~DING~
[Congratulations, you have survived an encounter against the 'Great Serpent', one of the most powerful apostles of all, you should be happy!]
"Happy…?"
Stark didn't see how he could feel that way at this very moment.
For him, all of this was bad: the serpent was too fast, so fast in fact his eyes couldn't follow it even though its body was giant, and let's not talk about its strength and aura, easily overwhelming him.
He had fought the monsters and apostles gradually up until now, but now that he saw that difference in level, he knew that getting stronger was the only way to keep going.
Because… at some point… he would have to fight that thing again, at least if he wanted to complete his [ApostleDex].
Oh! And talking about [ApostleDex], Stark decided to open it to check it out.
5x3 again, first line fully completed, the second line's figures completely dark except for the [Crimson Moons Trio], and he knew of their locations anyway.
But now that he met with the [Great Serpent]… Stark looked at the third line.
And just as expected, the third square of the third line revealed itself to be the [Great Serpent], its figure now visible to him as he saw it in real life.
"Hm…" this meant that before it were two apostles who were weaker.
But also… that there were two that are stronger.
Stark felt utter despair: how long would it take for him to finally be able to reach the necessary level to win?
Months? Years? Never?
Who knows.
But right as he got up… another notification appeared before him.
[Despair level is very high, let us change that!]
~DING~
[Please do check the "Great Serpent's" square.]
"Huh?" Stark, while now standing up, clicked on the third square of the third line, which revealed the white snake.
And suddenly…
~FWISH~
….
[Name: The Great Serpent (Godless Demon Apostle)]
[Level: 820]
[Rank: Universal]
…
"Yeah…?" this seemed normal, as it was the information he had already gotten.
But… Stark noticed a new line below it all.
And it was…
[The Great Serpent has a special weakness that can kill it almost instantly, look for that.]
"Oh?"
To be honest, Stark wouldn't usually believe that such a giant and powerful thing could have a hidden weakness, a weakness so powerful against it that it could kill it instantly.
But… after remembering about the many times monsters or even bosses were overwhelmed by their weaknesses… then maybe it was possible.
Let's take example of this rift and the previous one Stark went through!
The [Sniper Monkey]'s weakness was their head and close combat, killing them really fast if they were hit, the [Tongue-Claw Ambushes] on the other hand would INSTANTLY die if their tongues were hit too.
And as for the previous rift, the [Corpse Cemetery], well the weakness was obvious: all the undead in it would instantly if Stark used his [Exorcist] attack, and even [Reaper] and [Lother] were easily defeated once by an attack.
Every monster has a weakness, all you needed to do was to find and exploit it.
"…Oh well," now that Stark knew this, he put it at the back of his mind to remember and try to look for it when possible.
But now… he needed to go forward, as resting in this place forever wouldn't do anything, though it did seem to be like some kind of safe zone as no monster spawned or could reach him here.
Around him were stone walls, and all he could see what the sky above him.
And right in front of him… at the place he needed to go to… was a black fog.
Yes, this was the entrance to the boss zone, which was the fourth.
He had survived the first two zones easily, and the third almost killed him, but he couldn't forget that he still needed to beat the boss to leave.
And now you might ask, what kind of boss could be waiting in a [Determination] rift, right?
Well… only one way to find out.

chapters.title: Chapter 271 - 271: The Fourth Zone: Sunken Valley
chapters.content:
"…" Stark's piercing gaze was on the black fog ahead.
He was only bleeding from his shoulder (sniper monkey arrow hit him) since he hadn't received damage since his encounter with the great serpent (a single hit would have been enough to kill him anyway), but he couldn't deny that he was exhausted.
"Crimson Healing," he mumbled while beginning to walk toward the fog, and his body surrounded itself with aura, mainly his shoulder though, as the wound on it closed.
"+20000"
He was back at full hp, and his [Crimson Healing] was put back on cooldown.
Stark thought he should really upgrade his HP healing the next time he gets skill points, but so as long as the final boss wasn't another apostle then he would surely be able to get out of here, because yes, Stark actually thought of that possibility, and if one of them was here, why not two?
He arrived in front of the black fog, and as if it was foreshadowing what was bound to happen, the alarms in his head rang again.
[Tip because of low level: watch out for the snake and ape, you won't win against them.]
The warning he had received at the start appeared again.
The snake was referring to the [Great Serpent], but… what about the ape.
He had never met anything resembling an ape except for the [Sniper Monkeys], and they couldn't be it.
Which meant… that beyond the fog was the monster of the second warning.
"Clone Frenzy… Superior Clone," he took 30 additional seconds to summon the [Superior Clone] beside him, then got ready.
Stark hesitated for a moment, but then he took a deep breath and stepped into the black fog, the clone following after.
The moment he did, the world around him changed completely.
~FWISH~
He emerged on the other side, fully expecting to see a boss room and a giant ape/monkey to be waiting for him.
But…
[WARNING!] a last warning came.
And…
[Aura too overwhelming, running isn't even an option anymore.]
[Good luck.]
~SPLASH~
He noticed that the ground beneath him was filled with water, though it was such a small amount that it didn't even reach the top of his toes.
He was a massive area, surrounded by trees with leaves on them, and the perimeter was delimited by massive mountain walls.
This was the arena for this boss.
[Fourth Zone: The Guardian Ape.]
"Oh?" the zone had the word 'ape' in it, confirming what Stark knew.
Yet there was nothing in the boss arena currently?
" I mean… huh…"
Normally the bosses would ALWAYS be present, the only time this didn't happen was with the [Darkness Ghost] as he was hiding beneath Stark, but other than that a boss should always be present when the classifier enters the zone, right?!
And yet… there was nothing.
"…" the clone wasn't smiling, and it actually seemed to be sweating, darting its eyes everywhere, trying to look for something.
"…?" Stark looked at it, the clone seemingly panicking and trembling, something that had never happened before.
"=(" it looked sad.
And then… it pointed in the distance.
"Huh?" Stark turned his head to look at whatever it was pointing at and…
~FWISH~
At that very moment, the world around Stark changed, his vision darkening, then coming back.
