And when he was able to see once his field of view was back to normal… he found himself in a different location.
Well, not really.
He was still in the same area of the zone, nothing having changed: the water, trees and surroundings were the same.
But something was off about them: they were different in appearance.
The water wasn't blue and sparkling anymore, instead completely red, color of blood, and trees had lost their colors, now dark with no leaves on them.
But… the worst of all… what made Stark and even his clone lose every ounce of confidence they had…
Was what was in front of them.
Because it wasn't the [Guardian Ape], it wasn't a calamity-level monster, actually, it wasn't one, or two, or three, or even five monsters.
But 10 of them.
In the distance they all stared at Stark, yet he couldn't see them since their figures were blackened, impossible to see.
[The Godless Demon Apostles - 10 remain]
And what actually confirmed what he feared the most… was that two of the figures were actually visible.
The first was… three giant moons in the sky with a single massive eye on them.
"Ohoh~"
"Heh~"
"He's back!"
It was the [Crimson Moons Trio].
And the second…
"You got away human, but now, you shall die before our eyesss," it was the [Great Serpent] he made less than ten minutes ago.
The other 8 figures didn't speak, or move, or do anything, they just stared at the human, their eyes visible.
But suddenly…
~FWISH~
A pair of massive eyes, one oddly familiar, appeared above all of the apostles, a crimson vortex of aura spinning in them.
It was…
"Oh… Chosen…"
It was…
'HOLY FUCK!'
"=("
It was…
"Aren't you the one that wanted this?" the massive figure, the boss of the apostles, asked, "Then… why are you scared?"
It was the [Godless Demon] himself.
His sole presence was enough to stun Stark, who couldn't even imagine how he could defeat that thing, let alone ANY of the apostles in front of him.
The [Great Serpent] was emerging from beyond the mountains, yet still reaching them, meaning that its length was phenomenal, and the [Crimson Moons Trio] stared at Stark from above, in the now crimson sky.
But suddenly…
Stark was fucked, this was a trap, he had been set up!
Maybe they would make it fair by giving him a one on one, but any of the apostles beyond the fourth square of the second line was surely going to murder him in less than a second.
Stark's journey… was over.
"Ohoh~" the godless demon laughed again, his demonic voice echoing.
But suddenly… right as Stark was about to despair…
"=)" the [Superior Clone] smiled again.
Immediately, Stark diverted his attentions from the godless demon and his apostles to his close, who had suddenly regained his confidence.
And seeing act like this, Stark retrieved some of his determination, because if his clone was smiling, then it meant that there was a way out of this.
Stark went back to seeing the monsters and… that's when he realized it as well.
"…"
He realized…
"Hahahaha!" he laughed as loud as possible, taking some of the apostles aback, who immediately turned their heads toward [Godless], as they knew anyone who mocked their lord would suffer.
And yet… the [Godless Demon] couldn't do anything.
"You may be real," Stark pointed at them, "But you can't hurt me, can't you? NONE OF YOU CAN!" he smiled devilishly, actually defying the beings he knew could kill him.
Even the [Great Serpent] couldn't hurt him even though he had been seen less than ten minutes ago.
The reason? Quite simple.
If the [Great Serpent] went back into the void less than ten minutes ago, then how is he back here?
The answer is also just as obvious: these things were only manifestations.
Yes, they were the real deal, and they could summon some of their auras, but other than there was nothing else they could do beside speaking to him and trying to intimidate him.
"Fantastic," the [Godless] demon smiled, revealing a sharp row of teeth from beyond the darkness, "But you still need to fight something, don't you?"
~CLAP, CLAP~
He heard clapping in the distance, and suddenly…
"GROOAOKKKS-!"
~BAM~
A giant white monkey emerged from beyond the mountains and rushed toward Stark's location, smashing the ground.
~FWISH~
Stark backed away; and his clone did too, avoiding the attack.
And so…
"GROOOAZKKKK!!!"
"Let us see you fight, chosen," Godless continued smiling as he and his apostles stood there, watching.
Yes, they were going to watch him fight the calamity-level boss of this rift.
Maybe they wanted to see how strong he was? Or check out his abilities for later?
Or maybe… they just wanted to put pressure on him.
Even though he wasn't looking at them directly right now, he could sense their stares on him.
Judgmental, insulting, mocking, it was all of that.
And yet…
"=)" now that he knew they couldn't hurt him, his confidence reached its peak, "Watch this, assholes," he smiled at them.
"GROOAOSKK!"
[The Guardian Ape - Level 250]
[Rank: Calamity]
As expected, it was above [Boss] level.
But now that he had all the information he needed, he put ALL of his attention of the monster ahead, who kept moving around, sometimes on his two legs, becoming twice as large, and other times crawling on all four limbs.
And so…
"Come at me, monkey," Stark smiled, the clone beside him already charging up a merged [Aura Smash] to send.
Having a clone as competent as Stark's would be a blessing to anyone, as every time, even when Stark forgot because he was overwhelmed, then it would already be thinking about the battle that would occur, making it insanely reliable.
"GROOAKRKK-!" the guardian ape got up again, completing towering over Stark as it was more than seven meters in height, and weighted more than ten thousands kilograms, and yes you heard that right.
A single smash from its long arms would be enough to crush Stark, or any human at its level to be honest.
And yet…
"Let's have fun in front of your masters, ape," Stark positioned himself, ready to give it his all, and even though knowing these things were watching him, he had to remind himself that they weren't real.

chapters.title: Chapter 272 - 272: The Guardian Ape, Overtime Damage
chapters.content:
Almost ANY monster that was in rifts was part of the [Godless Demon's] army as he controlled them.
The ones in the [Danger Zone] of the outside world were the only ones safe from his control, though a small part of them were also under direct order from him.
That thing controlled almost ALL the monsters, and no one really knew what his goal was, most people forgot about his existence already after all, as there was no need for them to remember such an ancient being.
Many didn't even believe in his existence, since there was no proof he existed.
If Stark ever recorded what was in front of him right now, the entire world would be in a state of panic and shock, though he couldn't do that as he was busy with the [Guardian Ape]
"GROOAKKK!" the giant monkey slowly approached Stark.
The [Guardian Ape] has white fur with a red scar running vertically from the top of its head to its left cheek through its left eye, meaning that it was half blind already.
It also had sharp claws on its hands and feet, ready to pierce the human before it as it slowly walked toward Stark in a weird manner, standing on its too feet, its hands positioned like those of a predator.
But the most surprising and noticeable feature of all… was the large nodachi-style weapon (basically it's a giant katana) running through the neck of the beast, piercing it from the left side.
The blade seemed to constantly put it in incredible pain, making it continuously in a berserk state it couldn't leave.
And now… all that rage was directed toward him.
"GROUND POUND!" once reaching appropriate the distance, the ape used its muscular legs to jump in the air, putting its hands together then smashing in Stark's direction.
"Invincible Dodge," but the boy calmly rolled forward, meaning that he passed right between the ape's legs, appearing behind it.
"PERCEPTION!"
…
[Name: Guardian Ape, Protector of the Sunken Valley (CALAMITY)]
[Level: 250]
[HP: 1,100,000]
[Strength: 18532]
[Stamina: 5782]
[Speed: 3511]
[Defense: 17462]
[Skills: Ground Pound, Tree Swing, Poisonous Poo, Rapid Slamming, Jumping Sweep, Claw Combo, Deserved Rest, Immortal Berserker (GODLY), Overtime Damage (PASSIVE MYTHICAL), The Sunkey Valley's Guardian (MYTHICAL)…]
…
It had ten skills, a good number, meaning that it could do many things in addition to doing basic attacks.
As for its stats… well… let's just say that the jump from level 150 to level 250 was out of this world.
The [Guardian Ape] was the first monster Stark faced that had more than 1 million HP, and its stats, strength and defense in that regard, were all so high Stark feared that he could die if he ever as much as got grazed by its claws, or if he could even hurt it.
And also… that thing had a [Godly] tier skill.
Godly was the seventh out of the eight tiers for skills, meaning that it ALMOST had a skill so strong it could be considered good enough be of the [Immortal] rank, which is the highest one.
Maybe the [Godless Demon] only had [Immortal] ranked skills, who knows?
~FWISH~
Stark avoided another smash from the ape who immediately turned around once realizing the human had snuck behind him.
The ape's speed was actually pretty damn slow, and it made sense since it was its lowest stat of all, not even going above 4000.
Though that didn't mean he couldn't hit Stark, as he still had skills, plus a single touch from him would be enough to crush the boy.
And yet… there was no fear in his eyes as the ape turned around for the second time, trying to aim for him.
And this time…
~FWISH… BOOM~
A crimson fist flew toward its head and hit it with full impact, sending it flying and forcing to use its claws to not crash against the walls of the valley.
"GROAKK?!"
And as you might expect, it was the [Superior Clone] that was charging up [Aura Smash] that sent the attack.
"-143628!" the number rose up, a testament to just how much damage Stark was able to deal to his enemies now, even with all that defense.
"GROOOOAKKKKKK!"
["Guardian Ape" passive skill "Overtime Damage" activated]
[+1000 speed! +1000 strength!]
"Huh?" Stark's eyes widened, "What the fuck-"
~FWISH~
"TREE SWING," while getting up, the ape grabbed one of the dark trees around it and teared it off as if it was a mere stick, then dashed toward Stark, much faster than before.
"WHAT THE ACTUAL FUCK!"
…
[Skill: Overtime Damage (MYTHICAL)]
[Description: the more the guardian ape is hit, the more his stats increase randomly by 1000 (except for HP), allowing it to grow stronger as the fight goes on, do remember that these effects are temporary though, and its stats will be reset after battle!]
[Note: smaller hits don't matter, you need to hit hard, as hard as you can.]
…
"Fuck," this was putting him on a 'damage' limit.
If he took too long (and too many attacks to kill it), then he would surely die at some point, as his stats wouldn't be enough to hold up against it.
Oh well… he needed to hit hard, as the note said.
But first…
He needed to try things out, basically, he needed to test some things to make sure if there wasn't some kind of 'exploit' to find.
He was currently much faster than it was, so it greatly helped in his little 'experiments'.
"=)"
"Well… let's start, then."
[First Experiment!]
~FWISH~
"SPATIAL INVENTORY!"
Stark grabbed three [Crystal Stun Potions] from his inventory and immediately threw them towards the guardian ape while avoiding another barrage of attacks and several swings from [Tree Swing] as the ape was currently using it like some sort of sword.
~BAM, BAM, BAM~
All three vials shattered upon impact with the ape's body, releasing the white mist within, surrounding it completely.
But…
[Mist doesn't work on "Guardian Ape"]
To be honest, none of these potions were working against the bosses at this point, so maybe he should really start looking for new ones just in case.
He had done well using only [Strength], [Speed], [Regeneration] and [Crystal Stun], but there were definitely so much more powerful potions to use than these.
But… even though the mist actually didn't work or deal any damage.
The simple fact that it hit the ape's body was enough to activate [Overtime Damage].
["Guardian Ape" passive skill "Overtime Damage" activated]
[+500 speed! +300 defense!]
Didn't work, and it seems even a single attack, or even a single attempt at trying to harm the ape that results in hitting it physically, meant its stats would be upgraded.
"CLAW COMBO," the ape got closer to Stark, and he yet again took Stark aback as his speed did in fact become higher, meaning that Stark would need to keep adjusting over time as using too much speed would exhaust his stamina, but not enough would mean getting hit.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE… PERFECT!"
He rolled and achieved a perfect on the first attack, meaning that the world around him turned gray and stopped.
Currently, the [Superior Clone] was charging up another attack, trying to help its host in case anything dangerous happened.
They really needed to figure something out…
[Second Experiment!]

chapters.title: Chapter 273 - 273: Second Experiment: Failed
chapters.content:
[Second Experiment!]
The ape was slow, much slower than Stark, so any attacks he would send at it would probably hit it straight on, meaning that he only had a limited amount of moves before the ape grew too fast and durable for that.
It was a disadvantageous battle against time for Stark (well not really but he can't keep going forever).
And being watched by all the apostles as well as the [Godless Demon] did in fact add to the pressure.
But oh well…
"AURA SMASH! CRIMSON SPEARS," Stark summoned the eight projectiles, and his clone did the same too with 5 spears and 1 merged crimson fist.
And then….
"CLAW COMBO," after Stark avoided his first combo with [Invincible Dodge], the ape lunged toward the boy again, fully knowing a single hit from his claws would be enough to absolutely destroy him.
Stark wasn't the same to feel the pressure after all: the ape did as well.
He was a calamity-level monster, of course, but in the face of the other apostles he was nothing, and trying to please its masters was its biggest priority.
~FWISH~
Stark kept moving to the side to avoid the giant claws, carefully watching each of the ape's movements, and activating [Time Vision] for a microsecond each time in case he needed it.
He wanted to do something very precise with that monster for his second experiment.
And so once he saw the opportunity…
"GOT YOU!" he smiled.
The guardian ape swung its massive claws, but Stark was ready.
He met the hand with his own strength, blocking the attack after sliding on the surface for a moment.
He planted his feet firmly in the watery ground, using his body weight to restrain the ape guardian.
"Oh?" some of the apostles were surprised.
"-43613!" because even though he had blocked the attack, there was still an impact, meaning that the human did receive a significant amount of damage from that, no matter how confident he tried to act.
"=)" the clone kept watching, ready to unleash everything at any point now.
But Stark didn't back down from the pain and damage.
And so, using all of his strength, though lower than the ape's, he swiftly moved in a way to hold the guardian's arm on his back. And then, with a powerful thrust, he pierced the ground with the arm he was holding, forcing it to do the same.
He didn't know if it would work, but if it did, it would be huge.
"This kid might be smart."
"Nothing better than to just beat its ass though!"
"Weak people need to use strategies to win."
As expected, the apostles were analyzing the battle, but now that he was locked in, Stark didn't even pay attention to them, and if he felt their gazes on his back, he didn't care much to begin with.
The guardian ape tried to lift its arm from the ground, but it just couldn't.
The claws were put in too deeply, and the hard ground made it even harder to get out: it tried to repeatedly slam the ground with its other hand, but nothing.
Then it tried to use all its force to pull it out, but still, nothing either.
And when it felt desperate, its used its other hand to hold the arm that was stuck and began to pull.
"GROOAKKKK!"
"Groak?"
The guardian ape began to panic.
It tried everything it could think of, but it was trapped. Its massive strength was no match for the unyielding ground and Stark's clever strategy.
"GROAKKS?! GAORKA!" the guardian ape roared in frustration, but its efforts were futile, it was stuck, and Stark had now the complete advantage against an enemy that couldn't even move or defend itself.
The guardian ape struggled to break free from Stark's strategy, and once it knew that it was stuck in place, it immediately went back to looking at the human, trying to at least see what it was trying to do.
But once it did, its eyes widened as it saw 10 crimson spears, 3 crimson fists, and another massive merged one ready to strike.
Stark had been prepared for the ape's increased speed and stats, thus making it possible for it to either block or avoid his attacks, and so he decided to increase his chances of success to 100% by forcing the monster to stay in place.
"Groa-" the ape didn't have time to finish its noise, that all the projectiles were right in front of it.
Stark's crimson spears and fists flew in a tight formation, while his clone's merged crimson fist and five spears followed closely behind.
The projectiles slammed into the ape's body with tremendous force, causing it to shudder and roar in pain.
Despite being restrained, the ape was still incredibly powerful. Its muscles bulged as it strained against Stark's assault, trying its hardest to escape, but all attacks hit their mark.
BOOM, BOOM, BOOM
Explosions echoed through the sunken valley as the guardian ape kept roaring,
its body battered and bruised from the relentless onslaught, Stark's strategy had paid off, and now the ape was at his mercy.
BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!
"-44362! -47445! -45649!" first it was the ten spears that hit, dealing around 40000 damage each.
"-64262! -65821! -63487!" then it was the three crimson fists.
And finally…
BOOOOOM!
"148531!" the one that had the biggest impact of all, the merged crimson fist.
And so with all of that…
[-778,331 damage to 'Guardian Ape'!]
[Guardian Ape HP: 179,041/1,100,000]
Not only was this thing's body obliterated by all the attacks, one of its arms visibly pierced and most likely unusable, and his chest also having holes in it, but it was also down to its final portion of HP.
Surely it couldn't do anything now, right?
Surely Stark had won after such a devastating attack… right!?
But of course, reality wasn't as bright.
"This guy is an idiot."
"Right."
"He's dead, not that impressive, I don't know how Reaper lost against him."
All the apostles spoke, mocking the human for doing something so reckless.
And of course, there were many reasons why.
But the most obvious of all…
Ding! Ding! Ding!
['Overtime Damage' has been activated… 14 times!]
"WHAT?!" Stark was absolutely crushed as he saw this.
This had been the topic of his second experiment: to see if dealing damage at the same time would count as a single activation, but it looked like he was wrong, meaning that he went all in for seemingly no reason.
Of course, he had done massive damage, so it wasn't really ineffective, but now… what could he possibly do?
["Guardian Ape" passive skill "Overtime Damage" activated]
[+500 speed! +500 strength!]
[+750 speed! +400 defense!]
[+800 strength! +500 strength!]
.
.
.
[+1000 speed! +1000 strength! +1000 defense!]
And so in the end… that thing was…
"FUCK…" Stark took a step back as the ape's aura was now so powerful it felt nauseating, especially from so close.
The guardian stood up on its two feet, looking down on the human as it easily removed its arm from the ground with its strength.
"Groak," it now didn't exude any emotions, it was just… neutral, as if looking at a bug.
And then…
"Rapid Slamming."
It moved its arm so fast that Stark didn't have the time to react.
~SLAM~
"-75000!"
Stark received the entirety of his health from that attack.
And so…
Ding!
[You have died.]

chapters.title: Chapter 274 - 274: Immortal Berserker, The Ape's Last Stand
chapters.content:
"-75000!"
[You have died.]
Stark had been crushed by the [Guardian Ape's] hand once it powered up.
Its speed was now far greater than Stark's, and its attack strength was also so high that even that simple slam created a small crater in the ground, even though there was water.
And of course, let's not forget: Stark's body was completely crushed, his organs spilling out from his stomach and his eyeballs popping out, meaning that he was… well… dead.
"Fucking hell…" Stark opened his eyes and found himself in that same black void from before.
[Do you want to be revived?]
[Y/N]
Thankfully enough, his talent was still there to grant him a second life, but he didn't expect for that thing to kill him so fast and easily after powering up.
[You have 60 seconds to decide, otherwise it is game over!]
"Hm…" Stark put his hand against his chin as he thought of his next plan of action.
He couldn't fight that thing, no chance in hell.
With its current stats, forget about it being level 250, you can already decide that it is at minimum level 325 if not more.
These stat increases were temporary for the ape, but they would last until the end of the battle, so there was no strategy to counter it.
[You have 30 seconds to decide, otherwise it is game over!]
Most of his skills were cooldown, and those that weren't wouldn't of that much use like those from [Exorcist].
[You have 25 seconds to decide, otherwise it is game over!]
"Think… Stark… THINK…" a vortex of crimson aura began to spin in the boy's eyes as he kept thinking, time slowing down around him even in this space.
In less than 25 seconds, he would be forced to go back into the battlefield, and that thing was probably waiting for him, its perception high enough to notice him the moment he revived.
"FUCK…"
[You have 15 seconds to decide, otherwise it is game over!]
In comparison to when he was against the warden, his determination was still high enough as to allow him to keep going.
But what about now?
In front of the 10 apostles, as well as the [Godless Demon], would he die by the first monster they sent toward him?
Were all these months in this world for nothing, then?
Were all these trials simply for show?
Would he leave everything behind just like this?
[You have 5 seconds to decide, otherwise it is game over!]
[WARNING! WARNING! WARNING!]
The answer was no to all these questions.
"Alright," Stark calmed down as his aura grew in power.
Because even if this situation was unwinnable, even if he knew his chances of survival were slim, almost nonexistent actually… he still needed to try.
[Last chance: do you have to be revived?]
[Y/N]
He was the only one that could help himself, no one else would (except his clone, that is).
And so… he clicked on [Y], shattering the panel, much like against Warden.
[Make use of that chance, Chosen One.]
…
In the real world.
"Hm…"
"That was… all?"
"So uninteresting…"
All the apostles were sighing in disbelief.
They knew about the human who kept killing their companions, but they didn't know any of his abilities: which meant they had no idea that the [Chosen One] talent existed.
Not even the [Godless Demon] knew, meaning that they truly believed that the human had died like this, from a single attack.
"…" their leader didn't speak, though, as he kept looking at Stark's crushed body from above.
The human that was acting so confident until now was… gone, just like that, and his life force was nonexistent either, his aura disappearing completely.
"GROOAKKK!" the [Guardian Ape] was cheering while facing the apostles and [Godless Demon], jumping left to right and repeatedly hitting its chest.
It seemed very happy it had been capable of killing the human that actually posed somewhat of a threat to them.
"Good job, little ape," one of the apostles said, "You seem to actually be useful for once."
"Maybe we should remove that giant sword from his neck, then, as a reward?" another smiled.
"No… keep it…" a third finished, "I like seeing it in pain…"
To them, Stark's death was already confirmed, as someone's aura only disappears when they TRULY die.
[Revive Items] exist, as said before, but if someone has one, then their aura doesn't disappear, meaning that they aren't truly dead.
But in Stark's case, his life force and aura were completely gone, leaving no doubt as to what his status was: it was over him.
And yet… right as they were discussing of leaving…
~FWISH~
~BOOM~
In the distance, right in Stark's location, his crushed body as well as his organs that spilled everywhere began to reform, floating toward the main body to recreate it, not leaving a single drop of blood on the ground.
And after a few seconds… Stark was back.
[Stark HP: 1/75000]
With [Chosen One], it didn't matter whether you were killed by poison, tortured, cut in half, crushed to death or even if every single cell in your body was reduced to nothing: you would revive regardless, your body back to its normal state, though with one HP only.
~FWISH~
Stark got up, he was still bleeding a bit, and his body hurt like hell since, well, he had been crushed, but as long as he could still move around… he was fine.
"=)" something taped his shoulder, and he noticed that the [Superior Clone] was still there: it had disappeared once he died, but came back as his aura revived him, which is why the apostles and [Godless Demon] weren't suspicious.
But surprisingly… the ape didn't notice him.
It actually didn't as it was too busy trying to make its masters happy, or try to get a reward for its achievement.
And so… Stark decided to take advantage of that.
"WIELDING CROSS," both he and his clone summoned the cross above them.
But they didn't plan to just rush and swing at the monster: first of all there was no saying it would do enough damage, and it would probably notice them.
And so… they both decided to use the new ability of [Wielding Cross].
[New Perk: Crushing Gravity (EPIC)]
[Description: By grasping the handle of the Crimson Cross, the user can hurl it high into the air, throwing it very high, and when it reaches its apex, the perk can be activated to make it fall back toward the enemy like a meteor.
It is EXTREMELY difficult to aim and hit with it, so it only takes one of the three strikes you have available, plus you lose the cross for the moment it is in the air, so watch out!
Though, if it does hit, then the damage will be phenomenal, and the area around the enemy that is hit will explode with aura as well!]
It was the best moment, not only to test it out since the ape wasn't moving that much, but also to finally get this over with.
The surprise effect of reviving from [Chosen One] had ALWAYS helped Stark, and this time would be no different.
~FWISH~
Both he and his clone activated the skill, and the giant crimson/golden crosses slowly fell on their two hands as they joined them together, and so with a swift and powerful motion they swung upward, sending the two crosses very high in the sky.
As the crosses reached their apex, Stark and his clone activated the Crushing Gravity perk again.
~BOOM~
And so the two crimson/golden crosses descended like meteors, their trajectory perfectly aimed at the guardian ape's head as it wasn't moving at all, making it infinitely easier to aim.
The monster was still cheering while looking at the apostles (who were actually staring at the crosses above, yet not willing to say anything to the ape), but once it sensed the attack, it roared in surprise as it noticed the giant objects falling toward it, yet it was too late to dodge or avoid them.
With an earth-shattering impact, the crosses slammed into the ape's head, causing its body to be thrown back violently.
The explosion of aura that followed was immense, and Stark and his clone felt their bodies tremble from the force of it.
BOOOOOOOM!
"-437461!" and the perk didn't lie, because even with the ape's enhanced defense, the impact of both crosses was enough to deal all of its remaining life.
For a moment, everything went silent as dust and debris filled the air.
And…
[Guardian Ape HP: 0/1,100,000]
As the dust went away, the corpse of the guardian ape was now on the ground.
"Oh?"
"Hm…"
The apostles were surprised: the human did come back to life after all, and also somehow used yet another skill to end this battle in one attack.
Normally, this would be Stark's victory without a shroud of doubt.
But…
"Chosen," the [Godless Demon] himself spoke while smiling, "Do you believe you are the only one who can revive himself?"
"Huh?" Stark was confused.
But right as he was about to question it about what it just said…
~FWISH~
The [Guardian Ape] got up again even though its HP were at 0.
"Immortal Berserker," and its [Godly] skill activated automatically.
"This is…" Stark took a few steps back, "What the fuck?" his eyes widened.
He had believed that he was the only one who could revive himself, yet was proven wrong.
But now… what should he do now? Now that this thing got up, seemingly unharmed, and its stats still just as high as before, if not higher.
Plus… what was the ability of the [Immortal Berserker] skill?
"…" Stark gulped as he felt that something really bad was bound to happen to him now.

chapters.title: Chapter 275 - 275: A Single Weakness to Kill an Immortal
chapters.content:
"IMMORTAL BERSERKER!"
The [Guardian Ape] which had been hit by the crimson crosses and the explosion that came from them had been down for less than thirty seconds after its HP reached 0 that it was already back up.
The aura around the ape was much stronger, retaining his previous stats in addition to the usage of the [Godly] skill.
A mix of green and blue was inside of his aura, surrounding him completely as he took a few steps that shook the earth toward the boy.
"…" Stark took a few steps back, yet the clone didn't move.
It wasn't smiling anymore either, instead opting for a look of determination in its eyes and face.
And so…
"IMMORTAL SMASH!"
All of the [Guardian's Ape] attacks were enhanced by the [Godly] skill, making it even more difficult to avoid.
BOOOOOOM!
The ape smashed the ground by joining its two hands together and hitting it with all its strength, a green aura surrounding them.
FWISH!
The ENTIRE valley shook from that, and Stark actually jumped slightly from that, taking three more steps back.
"…" the clone on the other hand…
"Huh?"
[The "Superior Clone" has been hit.]
Its HP went to 0 because of the impact of the smash.
The guardian ape also got smarted: its goal wasn't to just show off, but it sent a wave toward the clone, dealing minimal damage, yet enough to kill it as it faded off, and its aura seeped back into Stark's body.
"FUCK."
Stark had lost his clone, and now he was alone against that thing, who was still approaching him.
But the worst was yet to come for Stark.
Because he hadn't realized just how truly fucked he was while the [Guardian Ape] was using [Immortal Berserker].
Soon enough he would figure it out, though, as he used [Perception] to check out the skill's description.
….
[Skill: Immortal Berserker]
[Description: If the ape is one shot or on the verge of dying, he can instinctively activate this skill to revive himself from the dead and give himself a massive boost in power.
In the "berserker" form, the guardian ape CANNOT be killed, no matter what, it has an infinite amount of health, and its only way to come back to life is to kill the opponent in front of it.
This effect lasts five minutes.]
[Tip: endure for five minutes or find another way to end it for good, there is one.]
…
"…" Stark's jaw almost dropped to the ground as he read the description on the panel, making sure to observe the massive figure of the guardian ape behind the panel as it approached him, its tiny eyes glowing as its target was in its view.
Stark lifted his eyes toward the ape as he closed the panel.
And…
[Guardian Ape HP: ∞/1,100,000]
Its HP were indeed infinite, with no way for Stark to ever hope to hurt it.
[Survive for five minutes, if it kills you it can revive.]
This was the current challenge.
But Stark couldn't ignore one simple thing: the tip right under the skill's description spoke about a way to kill it for good, even in this form.
"IMMORTAL RAPID SLAMMING," yet before he could even do anything…
FWISH!
The ape lunged forward so fast that it was almost invisible to him, but thankfully enough the fact his HP were at 1 meant that domination was currently in its strongest form to keep the host alive.
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!" and so he began to roll away while avoiding some of the strikes, each creating a crater in the crater and shaking the sunken valley.
This was truly a battle between two monsters.
[3:47 remaining]
But Stark knew he couldn't hold on for more than one minute against that thing, and it almost seemed like it was playing with him, smashing the ground again and sending a wave of aura that Stark avoided by jumping.
"He is done."
"Hm…"
"That skill is truly weird, undeserving of such a lowly ape."
The apostles were discussing one another.
The only one that was mostly calm was the [Godless Demon] and the [Crimson Moons Trio], who kept observing, waiting for something to happen.
Until the battle was finished, they wouldn't conclude anything.
And so what followed… was a one-sided beat down.
"IMMORTAL GROUND POUND!" the ape would jump, trying to land its butt on Stark's face, who would jump out of the way in the last second.
"AURA SMASH!" he tried to send some attacks, but once they hit the ape, they would immediately disintegrate; not stopping its assault.
"TREE SWING! POISONOUS POO!" with one hand it would grab one of the nearby trees and swing it at Stark, giving it a massive range, while on the other hand it would… well… throw what the skill spoke off.
"SHIT! SHIT, LITERAL SHIT..!"
Boom! Boom!
Stark was actually surprised by his abilities to be on the defensive, avoiding everything by a hair's length every time.
Even the apostles were surprised, and the ape even more: any human by now should have died, yet here he was, still running around, his stamina not exhausting at all as the domination adrenaline and aura was still pumping.
"JUMPING SWEEP!" it then tried to jump in the air and swing its arm sideways as it was falling, but Stark would throw a [Crimson Ball Transmission] ball on the other side and avoiding this wide attack.
[2:54 remaining], and yet, with all of that, less than a minute had passed.
Stark could feel it in his bones that he wouldn't survive any longer than this: he needed a way to win.
But how do you even kill a monster that is immortal?
In theory, this shouldn't be possible, thus the [Immortal] connotation.
But maybe… just maybe…
"GROOOAKK"
~SLAM~
"GROOAKKS!"
~SLAM, SLAM, SLAM~
The ape was relentless now, not even bothering to use skills, instead opting for the easiest option: attack endlessly until the human gets tired or makes a mistake.
'Shit…'
~FWISH~
Stark kept avoiding, and avoiding, and… avoiding.
The more seconds passed, the harder it became for him to avoid, almost as if the guardian ape was adapting to his moves, and the more time passed, the closer these attacks came to him.
[You have approximately… ten seconds before getting hit.]
Even a warning came to inform him of his demise.
And yet, Stark wasn't paying attention to any of that: he had let his instincts take over his body, focusing entirely on the battle inside of his head.
He was fighting a simple question: how to kill that thing before the time ended.
[Tip: find another way to end it for good, there is one.]
If there is a way to kill that thing without waiting for the end of the timer, then he must find it.
"Come…"
~FWISH, FWISH~
He propelled himself off the ground to get out of a sweep's way and used [Invincible Dodge] to avoid three quick [Rapid Slamming].
"On…"
If the 'weakness' to kill it was around, then it meant it wasn't part of Stark's arsenal, else he would have figured it out already, and neither could it be in the environment as they kept moving around while the ape didn't care.
And so that meant… that the weakness was probably on the beast itself.
"GOROOAKKS!" the guardian ape finally roared, which roughly translated to "die" as it swung for a final time.
And this time… Stark couldn't avoid it, he felt it in his soul that it was over.
But even then… even at this moment where he knew he could die… Stark's eyes widened, and a small smile grew on his face as he finished analyzing the ape's body.
Why, you might ask?
Well… because he saw it.
He saw the weakness, the way to win while the ape was immortal.

chapters.title: Chapter 276 - 276: The Execution
chapters.content:
"…!" Stark's pupils became so small that it almost looked like they disappeared once he noticed the possible weakness of the guardian ape.
~SLAM~
And at the same time, the guardian was still swinging its giant hand down, so close to Stark's that he wouldn't be able to avoid it under normal circumstances.
"TIME VISION," time slowed down around Stark as he needed these few seconds to think of a way to put his plan into action.
[Tip: find another way to end it for good, there is one.]
He hadn't found it as he kept avoiding the attacks, so instead of focusing on the environment he decided to focus on the ape, and he almost immediately noticed it.
An immortal being was something that shouldn't be able to be killed, at least that is what the definition says.
But… was the ape really immortal? Or was it only that its HP became infinite?
He couldn't take damage, thus nothing could harm it, that was true.
But in the case of monsters, and even humans, no matter how strong you are, there is one simple action that could INSTANTLY kill you: your weakness.
If your body was crushed to oblivion, or if you were cut in half, it doesn't matter that you have 1, 1000, or even a trillion health point, you would still be dead, or incapacitated enough to not be able to do anything.
And that was exactly what Stark was aiming: kill it instantly, in a way as to not allow it to strike back.
~FWISH~
"DOUBLE ASSAULT!"
[Double Assault activated, 20 seconds remaining.]
~FWISH~
He jumped out of the attack's way almost instantly thanks to his speed, avoiding it at the last microsecond, then dashing toward the ape.
He had 20 seconds to complete the plan, or else it was game over.
Do or die.
"GROAKKSK!" the guardian ape at this point was actually beginning to find this human unbearable, he was like a mosquito, you see him, you know where he is, yet still avoiding all your attacks no matter.
Though the boss did keep some of its confidence because of its [Immortal] status, so no need to worry.
And yet… it was its biggest mistake.
"IMMORTAL SMASH!" the ape smashed the ground, with two times as much force as before, but the [Double Assault] skill allowed Stark to see it coming from a mile and thus turn around the ape in a flash.
And… he saw his opportunity then and there.
[13 seconds of 'Double Assault' remaining!]
He needed all his strength and speed he could find for that, but… he needed to do it.
~FWISH~
While the ape smashed the ground, Stark had gone behind the monster and began to climb on its back, heading toward its head and reaching it in less than a second.
"WRAAAAAHHH-" the ape roared.
But… it was too late for it now.
[Execute it.]
Stark was about to do an [Execution].
Executions are completely different from normal takedowns, since the usual ones just end up being draining the monster's health to 0 without any SIGNIFICANT event happening.
But [Executions] on the other hand were the opposite.
You only considered a kill as an execution when the way you kill the boss/monster is incredibly skillful, being ALWAYS visually incredible to watch, a reason why they are popular across the entire world.
And what was about to follow was one of those executions.
"COME ON! COME ON!" Stark jumped on the [Guardian Ape's] back, then ran up to the back of its head.
"GROAOKK-" the ape's first instinct was to try and stop the human.
But… it couldn't do it as it was suddenly stunned, a shock suddenly being sent all over its body.
Stark had only noticed it because he took some time to analyze the ape, but its weakness was there since the beginning: the large nodachi-style weapon (basically it's a giant katana) running from the back of its head to its left side.
It was so perfectly placed that Stark even believed it was a trap in the beginning.
But now that it came to it… he would make use of it.
The sword was actually almost twice as big as Stark, but even then…
"DIE! IMMORTAL!"
While using all his determination and strength, as well as [Double Assault], he grabbed the handle of the massive sword and began to pull it to the side.
This was one of the weakness Stark sought: decapitation.
Even if the ape was currently immortal, decapitating it would be an instant game over, even with an infinite amount of health.
Stark's muscles strained as he pulled the massive sword with all his might, feeling the weight of it trying to resist the human's attempt.
The guardian ape roared in pain and confusion, its tiny eyes widening in shock as it realized what was happening, yet unable to do anything: all it could do was hope that the human wasn't strong enough to push the sword all the way to do a full rotation.
"DIE!" Stark shouted as he placed his legs against the ape's neck and put more force, his voice echoing through the valley as he continued to pull the sword.
The ape thrashed and struggled, trying to shake him off, but Stark held on tight, his determination unwavering.
"…"
"…"
"…"
None of the apostles were saying anything, but even they knew something was impressive when they saw it.
And… as to prove Stark's determination and efforts, the sword actually began to move.
Slowly at first, then faster and faster as its blade, which was going through the ape's neck, began to slice its neck more and more.
The guardian ape's screams grew louder as it realized that its immortality wouldn't save it from this fate.
[5 seconds remaining for 'Double Assault'!]
[EXECUTE IT NOW!]
And so… with one final pull, which put all the efforts he went through in this rift, and his future determination in defeating all the apostles…
~FWISH~
He pulled, and the sword swiftly made a full rotation, meaning that it severed the ape's neck and decapitated it, spinning twice before landing its blade on the ground, standing perfectly vertically.
The ape on the other hand suddenly jolted as its head was cut, and so it fell to the ground too.
~BOOM~
The impact was strong, and its head rolled away, its mouth opened and eyes widened as that was its final expression before death.
Stark jumped out of the ape's back as it was falling and landed on the watery ground of the sunken valley, his face full of determination and excitement as he had done it.
[EXECUTION SUCCESSFUL!]
[Execution highlight has been sent all over the world!]
Executions are so rare and well-liked by everyone, in fact, that once one happens, it is IMMEDIATELY broadcasted for everyone to see.
And to put it into retrospective, there was at best only one [Execution] every two to three months, just how to show how difficult it was for humans to do something so skillful and finish off a monster in such a way that even the system considered it as a legitimate [Execution].
After all, even Stark had his cool moments when killing monsters, yet none of those were considered executions!
And oh boy were they brutal, you could simply say by how Stark's execution was after all: decapitation of an immortal being, blood spilling everywhere and tainting the water in a crimson color.
~DING~
[You have defeated the "Guardian Ape lvl250" by executing it!]
[EXP bonus will be given.]

chapters.title: Chapter 277 - 277: Aura Storm Epic Perk, Level 75 Reached
chapters.content:
Ding!
[You have slain 'Guardian Ape lv250', gained 18,400,000 EXP!]
[+7,000,000 Execution Bonus!]
And so in total… Stark got around 25,400,000 experience points from this battle, a number so big that Stark couldn't even believe it at first, looking at the panel for more than a minute before finally snapping back to reality.
"Impressive…"
"I liked it."
"Pfft…"
All the apostles spoke, giving their own opinions: some were mad, others excited for their upcoming battle.
But… there was no denying that ALL of them were surprised though.
Stark looked up, and he saw that the three [Crimson Moons] above were staring at him, their eyes widened in shock by what the human had just done: he had just defeated an immortal being, or at least a semi-immortal.
Many among them considered themselves as immortals, especially those in the third line, and so seeing that another monster with infinite HP could be defeated so easily by simply using your head was terrifying: because doesn't that mean that there is also a way to defeat them if Stark found the guardian ape's weakness in less than two minutes?
"I'm out of here."
"See ya…"
"Need better skills…"
And so gradually, one by one, each of them left, and by the end of it all, the only one left was the [Godless Demon], who was still looking at Stark, the only one not surprised by this entire ordeal in fact.
"Hm…" he thought for a few seconds, "Very well, we'll play for a bit longer, chosen one."
~FWISH~
And so he disappeared too, leaving behind only darkness.
"The next time we play is when you die, asshole," Stark replied while smirking.
Because even though he went through a lot, even though he knew even more was coming, he still didn't despair.
If the world, if all these monsters were against him, then by simply using his strength he would crush them all, and build his own safe place.
Stark hadn't had the opportunity to use [Banish] since he could definitely sense that the ape's aura would be too much for the skill, meaning that there a chance he would lose.
He also didn't have the chance to use [EGO] either.
[EGO Meter: 90/100]
Though that was because the EGO meter wasn't full.
"Does the meter stay in place even if I don't do anything?" he asked.
[Yes, it stays at 90 for an indefinite amount of time, only resetting when you use it.]
This was great news.
But now… Stark needed to move to the real stuff: the reward of all his struggles.
Ding! Ding! Ding! Ding!
[Your level has increased to level 72, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
[Your level has increased to level 73, granting you three skill points and a boost in stats]
.
.
[Your level has increased to level 77, granting you four skill points and a boost in stats]
[Experience: 4,029,300/4,400,000]
[Skill Points: 24 Available!]
Yet again, not that it was surprising, the amount of skill points per level increased to four instead of three once he passed the level 75 threshold.
For the first time ever though, Stark wasn't given any skill for his struggles, since, you know, it was one skill every 10 level now.
He did receive other panels, though.
Ding!
[Level 75 reached, you can now break through to 'Gold-Tier' to increase your skill level limit!]
Very good, this meant he would yet again increase in rank, something needed if he wanted to be able to assign his skill points more efficiently and thus increase his important skills to fight the apostles and domination trial.
[Level 75 reached: you can now spin the class wheel again!]
And of course, the most important perk of all was also there.
But first, he wanted to use his skills points.
Yes, you shouldn't usually do this when you were bounded to get a new skill from your next class or even the fact that the limit would increase, but right now this was only 24 skill points, meaning that it wasn't much.
'Maybe I should think of buying some skill stones…' they are used to increase your skill limit without leveling up.
And now you might say: pfft~, then it just means that people can use them infinitely to level up over and over, becoming overpowered.
But there are two penalties when doing that a lot: first of all you wouldn't be used to all your skills, meaning that you wouldn't be ready for battle in comparison to someone who repeatedly used the skills for months.
And second… every [Skill Stone], even those at the highest of quality, have a small chance to break and cause a skill to go back to level 1, resetting all its perks, so yeah.
In the end, it didn't matter, though, and so Stark checked out his skill list to decide.
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv25; Focus lv25; Aura Smash lv10; Clone Frenzy lv25; Invincible Dodge lv10; Double Assault lv10; Crimson Spears lv5; Heaven's Wrath lv5; Alchemist lv5; Potion Crafting lv5; Target Manipulation lv1; Dodge Control lv5; Crimson Ball Transmission lv1; EGO lv5; Crimson Purification lv25; Wielding Cross lv10; Crimson Healing lv1; The Void; Banish
So many possibilities, yet so little skill points to distribute.
"Alright," he nodded.
Ding! Ding!
[You have upgraded 'Aura Smash' to level 25!]
[You have upgraded 'Crimson Spears' to level 10!]
[You have upgraded 'Crimson Ball Transmission' to level 5!]
He decided to use the skills he used the most, as what was the point of leveling up those that he hadn't used at all?
To be honest, Stark already a few skills that he now called the "BIG ONES": they were the skills that he NEEDED to upgrade and use at every rift, no matter what.
And as you might already guess, they were the following: Domination and Focus, though these are passive, Aura Smash, Clone Frenzy, Invincible Dodge, Crimson Spears, Crimson Ball Transmission, Crimson Purification and Wielding Cross.
These were the skills he would always use in rifts, or the "BIG ONES" in that regard.
'New perks,' Stark excitedly thought as he looked at the panels that appeared before him.
…
[Skill: Crimson Spears lv10]
[New Perk: Spear Block]
[Description: Essentially, these spears could only be used as attacks and projectiles to enemies, dealing good and piercing damage to them, but now, you can order up to three spears to spin around, and with the right timing they can block one attack each, though remember that if the attack is too powerful, the spears will break and you will still be hit!]
…
'Oh…' so it served as some other kind of shield, interesting.
…
[Skill: Crimson Ball Transmission lv5]
[New Perk: More balls]
[Description: You get two crimson balls instead of one, that's all, you can throw both at the same time, and when you snap your fingers think about the one you want to teleport at, making it easier to trick enemies.]
…
An even better perk!
He hadn't believed it at first, but crimson ball transmission quickly became a favorite because of all its different usages, and getting another ball could only be good.
And so, Stark moved on to the final perk, the one he had been waiting for the most.
[You now have a choice, Host.]
Before him appeared the same panel that did when he upgraded [Crimson Purification], when he got the legendary perk that helped him, or when he got the choice for an [EPIC] perk for [Crimson Purification].
[Since you used 10 stat points on 'Aura Smash', you can choose to either: get two normal perks, or get an EPIC one!]
[So, which do you choose?]
And below it appeared two panels.
[Two normal perks] or [One EPIC Perk]
Stark understood how this system worked by now: one upgrade is equal to a normal perk, two upgrades at once was an epic perk and three was a legendary perk.
Was there the possibility to get a mythical or godly perk if he upgraded a skill from 1 to its max instantly, though?
"Epic," he made his choice, since these perks were always so much better than normal ones.
…
[Skill: Aura Smash lv25]
[New Perk: Aura Storm (EPIC)]
[Description: The amount of crimson fists you can use went up to 5, and so now, by merging all 5 of them around you, you create a small storm of energy around you, which will pull in nearby enemies and slam them into the ground, dealing massive damage to them. The storm will also slow down enemies caught within it, making it easier for you to follow up with other attacks.]
…
"!!!!" Stark's eyes actually widened.
This might not seem much, but if he could now summon five fists, and it took all five to cast [Aura Storm], then doesn't that essentially mean that it's a straight-up much better version than [Aura Smash Merge], which used up three fists to create a giant one?
"Oh well, that's… great," though this almost meant that he would need to master it, as trying to use it without trying could result in it exploding in his face.
And so, Stark finally moved on to the final and most important panel of all.
[Class Wheel available!]
"Class Wheel!" he mumbled, and the colorful wheel appeared before him.
"Alright, let's do this," it was time to get a new class, one he had been waiting for after realizing how powerful the merge between exorcist and domination was, and surely this class could only be a bonus to his stats and skills, even if he used it less, much like [Alchemist].

chapters.title: Chapter 278 - 278: The Fourth Class
chapters.content:
"Class Wheel," Stark activated his skill, and the giant colorful wheel appeared before him, now only 7 sections on it.
[Pull me!]
The lever was still beside it, its aura ordering him to pull it and discover what he would be getting.
This was like gambling, but a next level one though, as it determined life and death.
What would have had happened to Stark if he didn't get the [Domination] class instantly? He didn't know, but surely he wouldn't be as strong as right now.
You need to suffer to become stronger, heh?
But, right as Stark was about to pull down the lever…
[Wait!]
A crimson panel appeared in front of him.
"???"
[Aren't you tired of the same stuff happening over and over: you reach the designated level, you can only spin the wheel once and hope for the better, rince and repeat!]
"What?" Stark was confused, he had only done that thrice until now, so it wasn't that repetitive.
Though when something like this happened, it was just like with the [Legendary] perk: it was his class trying to help him out and make things easier.
[Introducing a new perk of the class wheel: Class Removal! Woohoo!
"Ah shit… here we go again," he knew where this was going, but still waited to see what it was about.
[You can now decided to remove up to three classes from the wheel… PERMANENTLY!]
[Meaning that you can remove one, two or three classes that you believe you wouldn't want to get no matter what, either because they would be useless in accordance to your current ones, or because you just don't like them at all!]
"Oh!" and Stark actually LOVED this perk.
Of course, as the holder of the class wheel, he had thought for hours about all the different classes and which ones he wanted to get and those he didn't, so this was a good thing.
And so…
[Select the classes you wish to remove from the class wheel, all choices are permanent and cannot go back!]
This perk was mainly here to do one thing: completely remove the classes Stark didn't want, thus meaning that his chances of getting those he wanted increased tremendously.
[7 classes available: Magus, Beast Tamer, Warrior, Assassin, Archer, Soul Wielder, Incubus.]
And I'll be honest with you: Stark didn't like most of them.
Yes, that's right, the only classes he actually wanted were Soul Wielder and Incubus, all others served zero purpose.
Why would he be a magus if [Domination] already allows him to use magic, why would he be a warrior or assassin when his fists deal much more damage than a weapon, why would he be an archer as it meant staying at the back, and last of all, why would he be a beast tamer, when he already struggled so much to keep up with [Alchemist], only using it for the basic potions!
If he had the choice, he would remove all those classes, only keeping those he wanted.
But as his choice was limited to three, he needed to make a choice.
And he made one within thirty seconds.
Ding!
[Are you sure you want to permanantly remove "Warrior", "Assassin" and "Archer"?]
These were the only classes that required a weapon to be used, meaning useless, beast tamer and magus on the other hand could still be useful as it just meant additional skills and help.
"Sure," he sighed.
Ding!
[You have PERMANANTLY removed "Warrior", "Assassin" and "Archer" from the class wheel, meaning you will NOT be able to get them.]
You would usually maybe think that you could have made a bad decision at such times, especially with one this big, but right now, Stark didn't feel anything but relief.
Boom! Boom! Boom
The three sections he chose were instantly erased from the wheel in front of him, only keeping four: Magus, Beast Teamer, Soul Wielder and Incubus.
Stark couldn't help but feel a bit of excitement as he stared at the class wheel.
He had finally removed the classes he didn't want, meaning that his chances of getting the ones he did want were much higher.
And now, all that was left was to spin it and see what fate had in store for him.
Ding!
[Spin the wheel!]
Stark took a deep breath before grabbing onto the lever next to the wheel with both hands and pulling it down.
The wheel spun around and around, its segments flashing by in a blur of colors.
And then… after a thirty seconds, it stopped.
Stark held his breath as he looked at the segment that pointed directly at him.
And it was…
[You have obtained "Soul Wielder"! Congratulations!]
[You can spin the wheel again at level 100!]
He let out a sigh of relief, feeling incredibly happy that he had managed to get one of the classes he actually wanted.
This meant that he could now focus on improving his skills in this area, which would undoubtedly help him in his fight against the apostles and domination trial.
But there was still one more class left on the wheel… Incubus. Would he be able to get it? Only time would tell.
But for now, Stark was content with what he had already achieved.
Another reason why he wanted [Soul Wielder] was because… of his family.
He clearly remembered how they treated him, they were a [Soul Wielder] family, and Stark not having that class was a shame to them, treating him like a dog.
But now, what could happen if he suddenly came back with the [Soul Wielder] class?
The image of their shocked expressions excited Stark so much he had to stop himself from laughing out loud.
But it didn't matter for now, and so he moved on to checking out his new class.
…
[Class: Soul Wielder]
[Description:] Your soul/heart powers you up, summon it before you to allow yourself to use your abilities, you can use weapons, magics or even have a beast companion, it all depends on the heart you get, which mostly changes depending on your personality and attributes.
[Class Effect:] Summons your very own unique heart to help you in battle.
[Class Flaw:] None, it is one of the best.
[Basic Skills:] You do not need any, Domination has already absorbed it.
…
Stark's smile grew wider the more he kept reading the panel.
And at the end, once he reached [Basic Skills], it disappeared.
"…Of course," he sighed.
Of course, this wasn't a bad thing at ALL, [Exorcist] being the proof of that as [Domination] actually enhanced it with his aura.
But what about [Soul Wielder], would it also be enhanced with his aura? Would it become much stronger that it already is?
"Didn't you say that you absorbed Exorcist because it was 'weak' and that it would be a 'burden?'" Stark raised his eyebrows, talking to [Domination] itself, as it overtook all others, "But Soul Wielder is the second strongest class, it just doesn't make sense."
[Domination will make it stronger.]
[Domination is currently absorbing the 'Soul Wielder' class…]
Stark had already experienced it once, so he didn't say anything, instead just looking at the small bar that formed and that was slowly filling up.
And after a minute.
Ding!
[100/100]
[Absorption complete!]
[The 'Domination' class has absorbed the 'Soul Wielder' class, thus inheriting its aura and powers!]
"Status Window," Stark mumbled.
….
[Level:] 77
[Health:] 87000
[Bloodline:] Human
[Classes:] Domination; Alchemist; Exorcist (Absorbed by Domination); Soul Wielder (Absorbed by Domination).
[Talent:] Chosen one
[Attributes:] Strength 8361; Speed 9837; Mind/Soul 10348; Stamina 7421; Defense 10245
[Skill Points: 0 Available!]
[Current Tier: Silver, upgrade to 'Gold' available!]
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv25; Focus lv25; Aura Smash lv25; Clone Frenzy lv25; Invincible Dodge lv10; Double Assault lv10; Crimson Spears lv10; Heaven's Wrath lv5; Alchemist lv5; Potion Crafting lv5; Target Manipulation lv1; Dodge Control lv5; Crimson Ball Transmission lv5; EGO lv5; Crimson Purification lv25; Wielding Cross lv10; Crimson Healing lv1; The Void; Banish…
…
Yep, it was now confirmed, Soul Wielder had been absorbed by [Domination].
[As Soul Wielder has been absorbed, you have been granted one skill!]
And of course, absorption still granted Stark a new skill.
…
[Skill: Domination Soul]
[Tier: Godly]
[Description: Every Soul Wielder has their own soul, and this soul has its own unique, in your regard, your soul is called the [Domination Soul], you can use it to slam your heart into the enemies (yes, literally), and control it as you like, the more you use it, the more possibilities.]
[Note: your soul CANNOT be leveled up, meaning that it is only up to you to see how you want to use it, since 'Soul Wielders' actually do not get these many skills!]
[Double Note: Basically, being creative is the most important part, and you can even merge it with your already existing attacks!]
…
The panel already said all the information, but to resume it quickly: soul wielders each have a unique soul, and they can use it however they like, only restricted by the power of their soul and their imagination, and that also means that they don't get as many skills as other classes.
Plus, much like skills like [The Void] and [Banish], it couldn't be leveled up.
Basically… Stark got a weird new class.

chapters.title: Chapter 279 - 279: The Soul Heart
chapters.content:
'Domination Soul,' plus, his new basic godly skill didn't have ANY kind of cooldown, so he immediately decided to use it.
Fwish! Ding!
[Your soul is being designed, please wait…]
"Oh?"
As stated before, every soul is different from the other, meaning much like talents or domination weapons, each was unique and based on the host's feeling and intentions.
If he could remember right: his mother's in this world was pink, with hearts surrounding it, while his father's was black, with occasional zaps of lightning.
His brother's was yellow with a lasso around it, and his sister's was red with pulsating veins.
Basically: all hearts were indeed different.
[…]
[…]
[….
[Creation of 'Soul Heart' is complete! You can now summon it!]
"Alright!"
"Domination Soul," he used his skill again, and something materialized in front of him, or more like in front of the exact spot his normal human heart should be.
It was obviously crimson in color, was beating strongly, the sound echoing in Stark's ears.
But… what made it so different from the others… was the face at the front.
All his heart had was a white mouth and eyes that kept smiling like this: =) but vertically.
It was basically acting like his clone, and now that Stark thought about it, the face was so similar it was weird and also couldn't be a coincidence either.
In the end though, what his soul heart looked like didn't matter.
Ding!
[You soul heart laughs, ready to smash his enemies!]
And just as this appeared, and crimson stringe appeared in each of the heart's sides, going directly into Stark's hands, meaning he was able to grab them.
"This is…" he could move his heart using those almost invisible strings.
Instinctively though, Stark ready the panel again.
'Smash his enemies…?'
Of course, soul hearts are all different, and it meant their abilities were as well: because while how you used your heart can be decided by you, there was still a limit based on it could or couldn't do from its basic perks.
And Stark's heart…
Fwish! BOOOOOOOM!
Stark's used the strings to spin around smash his heart on the ground three meters away from him, which seemed to be the limit, and unexpectecly, not only did it create a small crater, but the domination aura followed to create a small crimson explosion too.
'HOLY!' that thing was powerful, Stark could see it!
But wait a minute… doesn't that mean that he just got a weapon?
I mean, if [Domination Soul] is directly from [Domination]'s aura, then it meant his attacks and this skill used the same amount of aura to be cast, and so this also meant that he could use it as a weapon without any drawbacks, RIGHT?!
He had only been using his fists until now, so the idea of actually being able to fight with something else was terrifying.
Yes, this was a short-ranged weapon that couldn't even go beyond the three meters mark because of the size of the strings, meaning that it was essentially fists but upgraded and did more damage, but who cares!
He would also need to adapt his control over it, since using fists meant he was able to do whatever he wanted, but with his soul heart he still needed to control it and the strings to move it around meaning the chance to be hit.
[If your soul heart is hit, it will disintegrate to protect itself, and only will be usable after three minutes!]
This was surprising: this usually doesn't happen at all to not a single one of the other soul wielders!
Other [Soul Wielders] all have hearts obviously, and they also fight with them, but there wasn't anything as restrictive as their heart disappearing every time it was hit: otherwise, opponents could just aim at it to make it disappear and thus render their users weak.
Not at all, this wasn't what happened, instead, Soul Hearts actually have way more HP than their users, taking several dozens of hits to begin to corrupt, and then if it receives too much damage then it disintegrates, which is why their host's themselves decide to remove them and think about strategies to survive.
If a [Soul Wielder]'s heart doesn't disintegrate even after receiving too much damage, and it is hit, then there is a chance that it can be destroyed = literal instant death of the soul for its host.
I mean, [Soul Hearts] are basically your hfearts, so it made sense.
Maybe it was to put an EXTRA layer of protection on Stark that it disappeared after one hit? After all he still had other classes, so risking it for [Soul Wielder] wasn't a good idea at all!
Smash! Boom! Smash! Boom:
Stark tried several times to attack in different ways, either smashing directly to ground, an explosion following, or trying to do some sort of combo with it, but not having a clear target didn't help, meaning that using the [Memories Museum] would be useful in this case.
'Alright, time to go,' Stark nodded as he took a step forward.
But right at that moment…
'Heh?' his head began to hurt like hell, and so in single vibration of pain that was sent through his entire body, he fell unconscious.
Yes, he couldn't even find it: vibration of pain, then instant knockdown as his body fell, hitting the ground with the water, his face half submerged under the water., though thankfully his nose was out of it.
'What the hell?'
It was like all his exhaustions from before had actually finally kicked in once he saw his class and relaced, the domination adrenaline that was constantlty pumping through his body catching up to him.
He had just met the [The Great Serpent], a universal level 800 apostle, his aura overwhelming Stark to the point all he thought about was to run, and then he met the rest of the apostles and the [Godless Demon], which would already made most people go unconscious.
Then he was forced to fight some insane monster with immortal abilities and berserker strength, even killing him once and coming back to life, forcing Stark to literally [Execute] it to kill it for good.
Oh, and by the way, that [Execution] of Stark, the one where he jumped on the ape's neck and used its own sword piercing the back of its head to decapitate it, had already been sent to people in the ouside world, screens all over the world now playing the start of fight between Stark and the ape as it displayed everything.
[Classifier S vs Guardian Ape] was the name, and they were currently at the halfway point, even Lana and Sora watching right now, both already recognizing who the boy in the video was simply by his hair and figure.
Surely the world would go on a frenzy when the [Execution] actually happened, because even he knew that what he did was probably insanely cool.
But until then…
Thud!
Stark fell, sleeping.
…
This time, there wasn't any particular setting for when he woke up in the black void, [Alchemist] and [Domination], who now had a small beating heart in front of his chest in addition to his crimson aura body with golden strands and the golden halo above his head.
He had indeed merged with [Soul Wielder].
"Almost makes me feel left out," but it was indeed that alchemist was the only one who couldn't be absorbed.

chapters.title: Chapter 280 - 280: 3 Months Coma
chapters.content:
"What can I say, I'm just too good," Alchemist sighed it with a wide grin on his face.
"Quit lying, it's just that I literally couldn't at that moment!" Domination sighed, the heart beating in front of its chest sending vibrations through the void, "Well, doesn't matter."
"Host!" Domination looked directly at Stark, "So how was the apostle and godless experience?"
"A good 2 out of 10, only giving the two points because it felt good to see their faces when I defeated the ape."
"Makes sense," the crimson doppelganger laughed.
The three kept exchanging small discussions among themselves, speaking of the apostles, the godless demon and how he knew about Stark's existence, as well as all the apostles they currently knew off/had the location.
He couldn't see the rest of the apostles because those he hadn't seen were hidden by some sort of shadow veil, while those he saw weren't, but if you think about it, there were only 4 apostles he currently didn't know anything about.
All those on the second line had their locations revealed to him, and he actually even knew the exact moment he would be able to get to them.
The first three when the [Devil's Abyss] was found, the fourth when the second semester of the academy starts as that was when the colosseum would open, and the last was in the last [Domination] trial.
And even though he didn't know where the [Great Serpent] was or when he would fight it, the fact he saw it and its abilities was enough to judge how bad this would get.
And so just like this, an hour, then two, passed
"Huh… isn't this taking too long?" he had never stayed this long in the void, because usually time passed much quicker than in the real world.
Weren't just twenty minutes in this place equivalent to a week in the real world…?
"Do not worry," Domination's expression darkened, "One more hour and you'll be able to leave."
"Huh?" Stark was confused.
"Aura is like a toxin," Alchemist explained, "And you were exposed to so much of it that its already a miracle you didn't instantly pass out, any other domination users even at your level would have surely been knocked out and killed, which is why they were probably so surprised when you stood your ground and even killed the guardian ape."
"HUH?!"
"Basically, you need to rest so that your very own aura takes over the other, and it should take around 3 hours in here."
"But wait a minute… three hours here means…"
"Yes, 3 months in the real world."
"OH COME ON!"
"Don't worry, when you wake up, there will be around two days before the second semester, you should be fine," Domination shrugged.
"That's not the problem- you know what forget about it," maybe they couldn't understand that losing three months of your life was bad, but to be honest a classifier's age with the [Domination] class doesn't go that far, so he guessed he shouldn't worry.
Maybe using [Domination] took some of his life span away each time he used it, who knows, but for now he didn't care.
Another hour passed, one where the doppelgangers as well as Stark discussed future strategies.
And when it was finally time to leave…
Ding! Ding! Ding!
"Alright, time to get up, host," Alchemist and Domination smiled, "Be sure to destroy those apostles."
"…" Stark didn't answer.
Domination and Alchemist faded, and soon enough Stark lost consciousness.
…
Stark opened his eyes, for him it had been only three hours, so he remembered perfectly, but in the outside world it had been three months, and he immediately noticed it by the smell and color of the water.
The massive amount of blood coming out of the guardian ape tained the water in weird redish color, and the smell from the decaying corpse was overwhelming.
Surprisingly no items had dropped from the boss, and he was thankful since he really didn't want to look for them, immediately leaving by going through the portal at the end of the sunken valley.
The aura from the apostles and godless demon should have disappeared, that's what domination said as it was overtaken by his own aura, yet Stark could still feel this feeling around him: a chilling one, the feeling of death.
He didn't know why or what, but something inside of him had snapped.
His face darkened, and his eyes looked more tired, and it was't even from tiredness: this was just his new look from now.
Was it because he saw the power of those he needed to fight? Or was he just fed up?
In the end, none of it mattered, because something was certain: Stark was tired of this shit, and from now on he would kill all of them without a hint of hesitation, and much faster than before.
"…" be it human, monster or apostles, he wasn't going to play anymore.
Did he lose emotions? No, otherwise this feeling of excitement of going back to meet Lana wouldn't be there, but strangely, he didn't have any feelings towards the concept of fighting.
Fwish!
Stark passed the portal, and found his way back to his apartment complex.
The excitement of battling was almost gone, and now all he wanted was to end all of these battles quickly.
Fighting the apostles? He would absolutely obliterate them before they even realized.
The academy? Not even a challenge at this point, anyone who tried to get in his way was dead.
Domination trial? Didn't matter, he just needed to survive, just like before.
Stark felt such a strange calmness it was scary.
But one thing was for certain: Stark would remain normal on the outside, but the moment he entered a rift/battle, he would completely change, displaying a ruthless version of him no one would want to meet, not even the godless demon.
Click! Clack!
He opened his apartment's door using his keycard, and immediately was greeted by the sight of a cooking Lana.
"S…S-…STARK?!" she dropped everything in her hands and rushed toward him, hugging him tightly, "ITS YOU, RIGHT! RIGHT? I'M NOT IMAGINING IT?!"
"…" Stark didn't say anything for a few seconds as he looked down at Lana, who was crying, then he breathed in and out and changed his expression to a more "Stark-like" one, "Yeah, It's me," he smiled.
"OH MY GOD, I-IT'S BEEN THREE MONTHS!"
"Yeah, my bad."
"A-And that execution three months ago was insane, even now people are talking about it, where in the hell did you go?!"
He couldn't tell her he met with the apostles of the godless demon, and the big boss himself, so he invented, "You know… huh… just fighting and leveling up, I got stronger!"
This was technically not a lie!
And Lana could definitely sense it in Stark's aura: he was much stronger than before for some strange reason, and also… more handsome.
Her emotions got the better of her, and so she rushed in for a kiss.
"…?!" Stark was taken aback, but after going through everything, he still kissed her back.
After around a minute of intertwining their tongues, Stark pulled himself out as Lana would have probably kept going, "What about… the food?"
"O-Oh yeah," she blushed, "Let me finish dinner then we can… um… continue."
'…?'
What the hell does she mean by continue, wasn't this all?
Or maybe she wanted to… Oh!?

chapters.title: Chapter 281 - 281: Deepened Relationship, The Second Academy Trial
chapters.content:
Stark and Lana ate dinner, and as soon as they were finished… well… they did the deed as Lana immediately pounced on the boy who just wanted to rest even though he had slept for 3 months, somehow still tired.
Lana at first wanted to lead and prove to Stark that she could make him feel good, but in the end the roles were totally reversed.
You cannot dominate a [Domination] user after all! Only another one can match with them!
So in the end, she was the one that ended up feeling the best from Stark's… techniques?
He didn't even restrain himself, because the moment she declared she was ready, then he abandoned all his restraints and went full on hard mode, going faster and faster with not a second to rest.
And so like this, they kept going for the entire night, Lana experiencing a feeling she had never felt before since it was both their first times.
She collapsed by the time the sun came up, and all Stark did was sigh as he looked at her stunning figure, now lying on the bed.
"…"
His body was filled with hickeys and kissing marks, but oh well, he couldn't have expected Lana to like this so much when she was in 'submissive' mode.
"What the fuck am I even doing..."
Morning came, and Stark slept like a baby, waking up a few hours later and preparing breakfast.
Lana then woke up, remembered everything that happened last night, and her face flushed with embarrassment.
She couldn't believe she had actually done it with Stark, and why the hell was he so good at it?
'Maybe he… did it a lot before…?' she thought to herself, but decided not to ask him as it would be embarrassing.
"Come on, eat," Stark appeared out of nowhere suddenly, pointing at the toasts and eggs on the table, "Tomorrow is the big day."
Yes, as stated before, tomorrow was the start of the second semester for the academy, meaning they would receive their second 'trial'.
Oh; and by the way; his [Execution] of the guardian ape went viral all over the world, so pretty much everyone saw it.
But Stark didn't care that much: he simply did it because he was forced to, anything else wouldn't have even scratched the ape.
And so just like that, the day passed quickly.
They didn't do anything that night though, Lana feeling a bit overwhelmed and Stark a bit tired, so they just slept in the same bed as a compromise.
When did they become so close? Even Stark didn't know, but being… loved, didn't feel that bad when he knew what was coming.
He needed to be as serious as ever before, but he also just made sure to enjoy it a bit, because at least now they couldn't say he died a virgin!
He lived his life to the fullest, or at least he thought so!
…
Beep! Beep! Beep!
The alarm rang, and both Stark and Lana prepared, leaving their apartment complex and heading toward the academy.
Just like during their entrance ceremony though, the roads were COMPLETELY packed with people, making it impossible to take a ride as it would take too long, and so as Stark was way faster, he carried Lana and did the same thing as before: run through the roofs and jump into the academy from above.
It was currently 7:53 am, and the 'second semester' ceremony was happening at exactly 8 am.
There had actually been only 23 groups out of the 50 that completed their rift, meaning that even though 30 groups could have completed it, it hadn't been the case at all.
Stark couldn't imagine the amount of deaths, but oh well, he completed his rift alone, so who cares.
He and Lana entered the academy, arriving yet again in the lobby.
"Squares again," the blonde-haired girl mumbled as she looked at the ground.
