Lana, who had been lounging on the couch, shot up in alarm. "Wait what? You're going for a week?!" she asked, her eyes wide with surprise.
Stark simply nodded, not bothering to explain further.
He couldn't afford to waste any more time.
The next seven days would be crucial if he wanted to find the entrance to the top of the tower, where Olikar waited.
Sora, who had been leaning against the kitchen counter, sipped her coffee quietly.
She could sense the seriousness in Stark's tone and knew better than to question him, "Good luck," she said simply
With a final nod, Stark activated the token, his body disappearing into the shimmering light as he teleported back into the Colosseum Tower.
This time, he wouldn't leave until he found what he was looking for.
The final week had begun.
[7 days left]
Stark's body materialized in the familiar setting of the Colosseum Tower's ninth-floor safe zone.
The dim lighting and cold stone walls greeted him once more as he immediately set off, wasting no time in resuming his search for the secret area.
For three days straight, Stark scoured the tower with single-minded determination.
Each floor, each arena zone, every single one of them was scrutinized, but the secret area remained hidden.
He had memorized the structure of each floor perfectly by now, down to the cracks in the stone walls and the patterns of dust on the floor.
But none of it helped him find what he was looking for.
"What the fuck am I doing wrong…" Stark thought, it just wasn't working.
The pressure mounted as time kept going, and his frustration grew just as much.
Each passing hour was a reminder of how little progress he had made, and the deadline was getting closer.
On the third night, Stark found himself on the ninth floor yet again, his energy more powerful: Stark was so enraged over time about his inability to find the secret area that his aura grew much more powerful.
He leaned against a wall, catching his breath, the exhaustion from days of relentless searching finally starting to take its toll as he hadn't rested at ALL.
"Dammit…" he cursed.
His body wanted to rest, his muscles sore and his mind filled with bad thoughts.
But just as he was about to take a well-deserved break, a mocking voice echoed through the arena.
"Haha… not so smart, are we now, Chosen?"
Stark's eyes narrowed, immediately recognizing the voice.
Olikar.
The apostle emerged from the shadows, his sharp grin yet again visible.
His aura was menacing, a heavy pressure that weighed down on Stark's already tired body.
Olikar then walked toward him, his golden eyes gleaming with malice.
"Fuck off," Stark said, not even bothering to acknowledge him fully.
He was too tired to engage in useless talking to this guy.
Instead, he turned and started walking toward the tenth floor's safe zone, where he knew there were some sofas he could crash on for a while.
But Olikar wasn't done. He kept pace as he followed Stark, his voice mocking.
"Thank god you're stupid. But even if you do find me, I'll still kill you, y'know?"
Stark rolled his eyes.
Olikar was level 400, a terrifyingly strong opponent, far beyond Stark's current level of 88 (he had leveled up a bit in the mean time, duh).
Stark had focused too much on finding the secret area and not enough on leveling up.
And even after using the [Breakthrough Stone] to reach Gold Rank (which Lana bought for him), raising his skill level limit to 30, he knew that Olikar was a formidable enemy.
"Keep talking," Stark muttered, more to himself than Olikar, as he continued his walk to the safe zone.
"Haha... you idiot," Olikar circled him, delighting in tormenting Stark as he walked, "In less than a year, the preparations will all be complete, and the Godless Demon assault will begin. Your world is doomed."
Stark didn't react at first, but Olikar's words made him pause.
Without turning around, he raised an eyebrow.,"Oh? How so?" he asked, almost sounding bored.
Olikar looked at him, happy that he fell for the bait, then grinned, "What do you mean, how? Isn't it obvious, or are you really this stupid?"
Stark smirked back.
"No... How are you going to take over the world when I'm going to kill you before you do that?"
That threw Olikar off, his grin faltering for a moment.
He hadn't expected such confidence from someone so far beneath him in power.
But he quickly recovered, his sneer returning, "I'd love to see that. Not that it matters, since you won't ever know where to find me."
Olikar began to sink into the shadows of the ground, his body phasing through the stone floor as if it were liquid.
But Stark clenched his fist.
This was his chance, he wasn't about to let Olikar get away again.
"FOCUS… TARGET SET!" Stark shouted, thrusting his right arm forward like a gun.
[Description: You can place a target on an opponent, thus allowing you to observe their movements better and have your crimson 'eyes' always following them, no matter what they do]
His aura flared, and a crimson light shot from his fingertips, hitting Olikar just as his body was about to fully disappear into the floor.
~DING~
[Olikar has been set as a target!]
A sharp ping sounded in Stark's mind as his skill activated.
Now, no matter where Olikar went, Stark would be able to track him, as long as he wasn't out of range.
~BEEP, BEEP, BEEP~
Through his crimson eyes, Stark could see the faint red outline of Olikar's figure as he went deeper underground.
Without wasting a second, Stark bolted after him.
He followed Olikar's red silhouette down… one floor… then two… four floors… nine floors!
Stark's heart raced as he realized just how deep Olikar was going.
He wasn't just retreating, he was heading somewhere specific.
Stark's eyes never left the crimson outline, even as Olikar passed through walls and floors like a ghost.
Finally, Olikar's figure reached the first floor, darting toward a seemingly random wall before disappearing entirely.
Stark's chest heaved as he reached the first floor, eyes scanning the area.
The wall Olikar had vanished through looked unremarkable at first glance, and he was absolutely sure he had searched everywhere in this place, but Stark's senses suddenly told him otherwise.
For some reason he didn't know, he could actually feel something coming from that wall.
He decided not to take his break anymore, instead searching for the secret area for the next few hours.
He knew it was here now.
And suddenly, right as he turned around, right as he finished searching one of the other walls of this place, unsuccessful…
He looked back at the wall Olikar went through, and for a split second, no… even less than that, his crimson eyes caught a faint shimmer, a distortion in the air.
"…!" it was so quick in fact that he wouldn't be surprised that nobody noticed it, only doing so thanks to his perception, and even then he himself wasn't sure.
It happened for 0.001 seconds, but Stark was so desperate that he saw it.

chapters.title: Chapter 292 - 292: Final Preparations, The Skills' Ultimate Forms
chapters.content:
Stark stepped forward, pressing his hand against the wall after seeing the small flicker in the wall.
But nothing happened.
And so he did something you shouldn't do normally.
Or maybe he should have done it from the start, who knows.
'Well… at this point I was going to do it anyway.'
What he did, you might ask, well… he punched the wall, breaking it, revealing a flight of stairs that went down.
This had been Stark's final solution if he didn't find the secret area: if two days remained before the end and he didn't find it, he would begin destroying the tower from the inside.
Even if it could crumble, he would still do it.
"So that's it…" Stark murmured, a grin forming on his face.
He'd finally found it, the secret area.
Without hesitation, he stepped through the passage, descending deeper into the Colosseum Tower.
At the end of the passage, a massive stone archway awaited him, ancient runes carved into its surface.
In the center of the arch was a glowing portal, pulsing with otherworldly energy.
"This must be it..." Stark muttered to himself.
But before stepping into the portal, he had some things he needed to do: upgrade his skills.
[Skill Points Available: 44]
He hadn't used any since leveling up to level 78, meaning that he had a ton of them.
And it was good, he needed the best possible skills he could get to win against Olikar.
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv25; Focus lv25; Aura Smash lv25; Clone Frenzy lv25; Invincible Dodge lv10; Double Assault lv10; Crimson Spears lv10; Heaven's Wrath lv5; Alchemist lv5; Potion Crafting lv5; Target Manipulation lv1; Dodge Control lv5; Crimson Ball Transmission lv5; EGO lv5; Crimson Purification lv25; Wielding Cross lv10; Crimson Healing lv1; The Void; Banish; Domination Soul, Revenant's Fury
With 44 skill points and a level 30 skill limit, he had more than enough to upgrade whatever he wanted.
And in addition to that…
"Spatial Inventory," he pulled something out of the portal, and it was the [Max out Core] from it.
It was the item he got it from completly clearing the [Corpse Cemetery] rift during the first trial from all its monsters, not leaving a single one alive inside that rift.
[Description: You can use this core to max out a skill, no matter what its level is, limit doesn't matter either, the skill will reach its ultimate form.]
"Huh," he had actually never read the full description of that item, but now that he saw it, what the hell was a skill's ultimate form?
He got no answer, and so he decided to just use it last anyway.
After all… he already knew the exact skills he needed to upgrade, it wasn't even a choice at this point.
Ding! Ding! Ding!
[You have upgraded 'Domination' to level 30 (Gold-Tier Max)!]
[You have upgraded 'Focus' to level 30 (Gold-Tier Max)!]
[You have upgraded 'Aura Smash' to level 30 (Gold-Tier Max)!]
[You have upgraded 'Crimson Spears' to level 30 (Gold-Tier Max)!]
[You have upgraded 'Clone Frenzy' to level 30 (Gold-Tier Max)!]
Upgrading these skills weren't even his personal choice, he was just kind of forced, since they were the ones he upgraded the most among all of them!
And with the remaining 4 he had, well, he couldn't do much, so he decided to keep them for later.
'Well… time to check those new perks,' he smiled.
Ding! Ding! Ding!
…
[Skill: Domination]
[New Perk: Aura]
[Description: You just get more aura ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯, be happy with it.]
…
"Wow," Stark wasn't impressed, but to be honest, Domination's perks were never really that important to begin with, and neither were Focus'.
…
[Skill: Focus]
[New Perk: Flow (Legendary Perk)]
[Description: Your focus is unwavering, and by focusing on an enemy for 10 seconds, grasping their movements and flow of aura, you are able to see their attacks coming at least a second before they come, though if they attack you while you 'focus', then the 'link' is disrupted.]
…
"Oh," looks like Focus didn't let him down after all, this should be useful, but if he wanted to use it he would need to spare time at the start of the battle, since otherwise it is impossible to use.
…
[Skill: Aura Smash]
[New Perk: Fist Spam]
[Description: Instead of summoning 5 fists to either send them at your enemies or merging them to do immense damage, you can instead decide to separate these fists into five distinct ones too, meaning 25 crimson fists.
They do MUCH, MUCH, less damage, but if facing an opponent that requires hits instead of damage, then it is useful to overwhelm them, though do note that these fists cannot stun.]
…
Pretty good, could have its use, and so he moved on to [Crimson Spears], eager to see what new power awaited him.
He had the choice between a LEGENDARY perk or three rare ones this time, but he obviously selected the former.
[Skill: Crimson Spears]
[New Perk: Spear of Judgement (LEGENDARY)]
[Description: You can now summon a singular, colossal crimson spear infused with pure energy (uses up your cooldown, though).
When thrown, the spear locks onto a target's aura and follows them until it hits or is destroyed, regardless of distance or barriers.
The spear also pierces through any known defense or shield.
Upon impact, the spear detonates, unleashing a wave of destruction around the point of contact.]
…
"Wow," Stark muttered, clearly impressed.
A homing spear that could pierce any defense was a game-changer, and even he could feel that this thing would be useful…
The Spear of Judgement wasn't just powerful—it was practically unstoppable depending on the amount of aura he had.
Olikar and the others wouldn't know what hit them, though it did use up all of his cooldown and took a few seconds to charge up, so it had its downsides.
"Well, one more and its over for upgrading my skills with skill points," he mumbled to himself as he stared at the panel displaying [Clone Frenzy].
But when he read it… his eyes widened with shock.
…
[Skill: Clone Frenzy]
[New Perk: The Ultimate Clone]
[Description: By merging five clones instead of the previous three, the Superior Clone transforms into the Ultimate Clone, which possesses the same strength, abilities, and skills as the original. This clone has the ability to act independently, thinking and fighting as if it were the true Stark.]
…
A system notification followed after Stark read the description:
[Clone Frenzy has reached its ultimate form. This skill can no longer be upgraded.]
It was then that the meaning of the [Max Out Core] dawned on him.
A skill's "ultimate form" didn't refer to reaching level 30, 40, or 50—it was simply the point at which no further improvements could be made, regardless of the current level.
Clone Frenzy had hit its cap at level 30, but other skills could go much higher depending on them.
Stark's eyes widened as he realized the power behind the Ultimate Clone.
Essentially, he could have another "himself" fighting alongside him.
And with the new revelation about the ultimate form, he felt a renewed sense of urgency to use the [Max Out Core].
Without wasting any time, he put the [Max Out Core] on his palm, activating its powers.
[Which skill do you want to upgrade to the max?]
"Alright… let's see what you can do," Stark muttered.
He had several skills to consider, but after a quick mental debate, he made his decision.
He chose [Crimson Healing], knowing he needed strong support skills if he were to get better later, plus it was the only skill beside [Target Manipulation] that was level 1, making it very cost-effective!
[You have used the [Max Out Core] on 'Crimson Healing'!]
[Crimson Healing has reached level 70 (Ultimate Form)!]

chapters.title: Chapter 293 - 293: Second Chance (Immortal-Level)
chapters.content:
[You have used the [Max Out Core] on 'Crimson Healing'!]
[Crimson Healing has reached level 70 (Ultimate Form)!]
Stark stared at the notification, his eyebrows shooting up. "Level 70?! What the…?"
He hadn't expected it to jump all the way to 70, but apparently, the [Max Out Core] was more powerful than he'd realized.
What's more, it hadn't just upgraded the skill to its current rank's maximum—it had taken it all the way to the skill's true, ultimate limit.
"DAMN IT!" Stark shouted in frustration. He hadn't realized the core could push a skill to such a high level, "I could've used it on Domination or Focus!"
But before his frustration grew, the system came to the rescue again.
[No, you wouldn't have been able to use the core on most of your powerful skills. The core would have broken.]
"Oh," Stark grumbled.
He didn't fully understand how the system worked, but if it said so, then maybe there was more going on than he realized.
Still, he was curious about the new perk for his maxed-out [Crimson Healing].
As a reminder, the levels for classifiers went like this: Iron, Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, Diamond, Ascendant, Prodigy, Immortal and Classified.
Level 70 would mean having to upgrade your level to [Prodigy] or [Immortal] at least, you can already imagine how long this would take, don't you?
And so, you can also imagine just how powerful the ultimate perk of such a skill would be, right?
…
[Skill: Crimson Healing]
[New Perk: Second Chance (Immortal-Level)]
[Description: When the host's health reaches zero, Crimson Healing activates automatically, restoring the user to full health instantly.
This effect can only be triggered once per day.]
…
"WHAT THE FUCK?" Stark blurted out, eyes wide with disbelief.
Second Chance was essentially a free revival, meaning that with his current talent, he could basically revive himself twice in battle!
He couldn't believe his luck.
This perk was insanely powerful, even being at the max level a perk/skill can ever be, even above [Godly]: Immortal.
This perk meant that even if Olikar or any monster managed to bring him down after being revive his talent, Stark would get a full reset.
In a fight against such powerful opponents, that could be the difference between life and death.
With his new skills upgraded and his perks unleashed, Stark took a deep breath, feeling his power surge within him.
His aura had never felt stronger, his abilities sharper.
He was ready—truly ready—to face Olikar.
"This is going to be fun," he said with a mischievous grin.
Taking one last glance at the portal ahead of him, Stark stepped through, the swirling energy engulfing him as he teleported to the top of the Colosseum Tower.
…
A rush of cold air hit Stark's face as he materialized at the top of the Colosseum Tower.
He stumbled slightly, the sudden change in environment disorienting him for a moment.
The top of the tower wasn't enclosed like the other floors. Instead, it was open to the sky, the dark clouds above swirling ominously.
Stark looked around, taking in the vast, open arena-like structure.
The stone platform stretched out before him, surrounded by towering pillars that reached up very high in the sky.
"What the?!"
But his attention quickly shifted when he heard a familiar voice.
Olikar stood at the far end of the platform, his eyes wide with shock.
He hadn't expected Stark to find the secret area, let alone teleport to the top of the tower so quickly.
Only minutes ago, he had mocked Stark for being too slow, too dumb to figure it out.
And yet here he was.
"COME ON, APOSTLE," Stark called out instantly, his voice echoing across the platform.
His aura flared around him, crimson light flickering as it surged from his body. He clenched his fists, his confidence renewed, "LET'S SEE WHO CAN WIN, YOU'VE BEEN ACTING REAL CONFIDENT ALL THIS TIME!"
And this time… Olikar actually felt nervous, just a little bit.
"Flow…" Stark INSTANTLY activated the new perk of [Focus], focusing on his enemy as the air around him became colder, his eyes zooming on Olikar.
But while this was happening, he needed to waste the boss's time, since he could see he was already ready to attack, sensing something was wrong.
"Looks like you aren't as smart as you thought you were, heh~" Stark mocked, though inside he was nervous.
"What do you mean?"
"I mean, I just followed you, don't you see the target on your shoulder?" Stark smiled.
"…!" Olikar looked at his shoulder, thinking the human was lying, but he wasn't, there was actually a target on his shoulder, displaying his position.
And he, the great 'Colosseum Warrior' hadn't even noticed it!
"YOU LITTLE-" Olikar instantly dashed toward Stark, summoning his [Colosseum Sword], which was gifted to him by Godless himself after his victories in the [Demon Colosseum], transforming him into one of the apostles.
But it was already a done deal for Stark.
['Flow' has been activated, now able to see monster's attacks better, keep up with his speed!]
"INSTANT STRIKE!" Olikar used the attack that had won him several battles in the [Demon Colosseum], as his instant strike allowed him to close the distance and attack instantly.
But it wouldn't work on Stark, as he saw it coming with [Flow].
If he hadn't used it, he would have surely lost instantly, because of Olikar's overwhemingly high speed, which was his strongest feature, but now… they were at equal level.
"=)" Stark moved to the side, avoiding the attack.
"Huh?" and Olikar was so shocked by that, that he actually stopped moving for a split second, allowing Stark to punch him in the head, sending him flying in the other direction.
BOOM!
-74628!
"…" Olikar instantly got up, abandoning his confident attitude, instead focusing on getting rid of the human.
He was so confident in his speed that he hadn't actually believed for a single second that the human could actually keep up with him.
But… he wasn't even at the start of his surprises.
[Ultimate Clone] was there, and he was ready to use it whenever he felt like it, protecting the clone with his life if needed now that he had two of them.
Plus… he had [EGO].
[EGO Meter: 100/100]
He hadn't used it all this time because he was waiting for this very moment, and the meter was already full, so if the boss went into a second phase-like transformation, he would use it to destroy it.
"How does it feel, apostle?" Stark asked, the crimson around that came out of him overwhelming even the level 400 apostle.
Normally, a level 88 fighting a level 400 was IMPOSSIBLE, like actually, even for someone with the [Domination] class.
But Stark had four classes, not just one, and his determination and anger level pushed past anything the others could do.
"You're getting cocky, human," Olikar mumbled, his eyes set on him, "My shadows will reign supreme."
Olikar was red-skinned demon clad in tattered, battle-worn armor, with horns on his head, one of them broken, his eyes were black voids, swirling with chaotic energy, and his sword was made of that very same aura.
"I have fought too many opponents stronger than you to be scared, Godless and the others won't have to think of you anymore once I get rid of you," he positioned his sword sideways, meaning that he was now taking this battle seriously.
"I'll collect your head and EXP just like all the others, you won't be different," but Stark responded by giving an almost impossibly wide smile, making him look terrifying even to the apostle.
The battle could now begin.

chapters.title: Chapter 294 - 294: Facing Olikar, The Colosseum Warrior
chapters.content:
The wind howled atop the Colosseum Tower, and the tension between Stark and Olikar hung thick in the air.
Stark stood, his eyes locked on the towering figure of Olikar, the apostle.
Olikar would be his strongest opponent yet, a level 400 apostle.
'I'm skipping some steps, but oh well,' Stark shrugged, and by that he was referring to the fact Olikar was the 4th apostle of the second line, meaning that he skipped the three first that resided in the [Devil's Abyss] rift.
The warrior's aura was suffocating, waves of chaotic energy radiating from his battle-worn form.
Stark clenched his fists, feeling the energy coursing through him.
"PERCEPTION!"
…
[Name: Olikar, The Colosseum Warrior (GODLESS DEMON APOSTLE)]
[Level: 400]
[HP: 2,025,372/2,100,000]
[Strength: 20,556]
[Stamina: 17,812]
[Speed: 16,393]
[Defense: 19,377]
[Skills: Shadow Cloak; Abyssal Chains; Void Slash; Spectral Dash; Titan's Guard; Black Hole Edge; Phantom Blade; Terror Gaze; Dark Ascendance (MYTHICAL); Colosseum Sword (MYTHICAL); Eclipse Blast (GODLY), The Colosseum Strongest (GODLY)…
…
His heart pounded, and though his face bore a grin, he couldn't deny the pressure settling on his shoulders.
That monster, if you could call it that, was stronger than he was: speed, defense, attack, whatever, it was stronger he knew it.
But thanks to [Flow], he was allowed to avoid his attacks, giving him the second he needed not to die instantly.
"Come on, apostle," Stark taunted, the words sharper than the wind whipping around them, "Show me what you're made of!"
Olikar's black, chaotic eyes glowed, and he took a single step forward, the ground beneath him cracking under the sheer force of his aura.
His voice rumbled like thunder,"You don't understand the power you've challenged, human. You've only caught a glimpse of what I'm capable of."
"SHADOW CLOAK!"
Without warning, Olikar disappeared.
Stark barely had time to register the shift in the air before the apostle reappeared right in front of him, his sword already slicing down with terrifying speed.
"VOID SLASH!"
'Flow!'
But Stark's mind had already calculated the movement.
Thanks to the [Focus] perk, he anticipated the attack just in time and dodged to the side, but Olikar's sword still grazed his arm, the dark energy searing his skin.
"You're fast, but I'm faster!" Olikar snarled, already following up with a spinning strike that Stark barely avoided by ducking.
The air screamed as the blade passed inches from his head.
But for the first time, Stark decided to retaliate.
"Crimson Spears!" He summoned a set of spears made from condensed crimson energy and hurled them toward Olikar.
The apostle grinned, raising his sword to block.
But instead of colliding, the spears vanished just before impact.
Olikar's eyes widened in surprise.
"Spear of Judgement!" Stark commanded, and a single, massive crimson spear reappeared behind Olikar, locking onto his aura and shooting forward with deadly precision.
This was something he had just tried to do: summons his spears, send them toward an enemy, cancel them right before they hit, and right as the opponent is confused, summon the spear of judgement behind them!
Olikar turned just in time, throwing up a shield of black aura.
"TITAN'S GUARD!"
The spear collided with the barrier, but instead of shattering on impact, it drilled through, piercing Olikar's defense and sending him staggering back.
"RAAGH!" Olikar roared, his eyes blazing with fury as the spear detonated, a wave of destructive energy sweeping across the arena.
"-342372!"
Stark barely had time to shield himself with his aura as the force hit him like a freight train, though it did no damage since, well, it was his own aura.
For a moment, Stark thought he had the upper hand—until the dust cleared.
Olikar stood, battered but far from beaten, his red skin glowing with renewed rage, "Impressive. But you're nothing more than a minor inconvenience."
Before Stark could react, Olikar slammed his sword into the ground, and dark shadows erupted from beneath him.
"Abyssal Chains!" Black tendrils shot out from the ground, snaking toward Stark with lightning speed.
Stark leaped back, trying to avoid the chains, but one wrapped around his ankle, pulling him toward the ground.
He cursed under his breath, quickly summoning his [Clone Frenzy].
Three clones materialized beside him, each grabbing the tendrils and cutting them off before they could drag Stark to the apostle.
"Come back clones, I need you all safe," he snapped his fingers, and the clones disappeared as they had done their job.
"You're not the only one with tricks, demon!"
"Aura Smash!" Stark unleashed a torrent of energy, five massive crimson fists materializing around him, then he sent them toward the apostle.
"Heh… interesting…"
"FOOL!" Olikar roared, activating Phantom Blade.
Ghostly blades appeared around him, cutting through Stark's fists with ease.
The five were destroyed instantly, their forms dissipating into crimson mist before the remaining blades dashed toward him.
"Spear Block," he had regained one of his spears from the cooldown and used it to deflect all blades before it crumbled.
But as Stark advanced, ready to follow up, he felt the ground beneath him tremble.
As if reading his thoughts, Olikar disappeared into the shadows again, using Shadow Cloak to blend into the darkness.
Stark's senses were on high alert, his heart pounding as he tried to track Olikar's movements.
The apostle was toying with him, circling like a predator waiting for the right moment to strike.
"Where are you?" Stark muttered under his breath, but before he could react, Olikar reappeared right in front of him, using Spectral Dash to close the distance in an instant.
"BLACK HOLE EDGE!" Olikar swung his sword instantly, a vortex of gravitational energy forming at the tip.
The force pulled Stark forward, dragging him into the path of the attack.
"NO!" Stark tried to activate Invincible Dodge at the last possible second, phasing out of the attack's trajectory.
But the vortex exploded, sending chunks of the stone platform flying in every direction.
And he was hit.
-103826!
He received the entirety of his health from that explosion, even while protected with aura.
Even though he had dodged, the shockwave still caught him as he was way too close, sending Stark skidding across the arena.
Stark's vision blurred as his health plummeted. He could feel his consciousness fading, the overwhelming power of Olikar too much to handle.
In that moment, everything went dark.
And then… it didn't.
[Crimson Healing activated, Full Health restored.]
Stark gasped, his eyes snapping open as the system reset his health.
Olikar's eyes widened slightly as Stark's wounds closed instantly, his body surging with renewed life.
"What?" he spoke, though not scared, just surprised.
"Surprise, asshole!" Stark grinned, his fist already flying toward Olikar's face.
The punch connected with a sickening crack, sending Olikar reeling back.
-164731
But Stark didn't stop there as he backed away.
He called upon his trump card.
"Ultimate Clone!" he summoned his five clones, then ordered them to stay at the back of the arena to merge while he occupied the apostle.
"YOU THINK THIS IS GONNA SCARE ME?" Olikar shouted, not even bothering to acknowledge the clones, "FEAR ME, HUMAN!"
"TERROR GAZE!"
Fwish… Plop.
[Sorry, Olikar, but fear doesn't work on a "Domination" user, at least, not this one.]
"FUCK!" Olikar shouted in anger, "WELL, THEN…"
Fwish! FWISH!
The air around Stark changed as Olikar closed his eyes.
'Yeah… keep wasting time,' Stark glanced at his clones, only five more seconds and the ultimate clone would appear.
But… who said Stark was the only one that could charge attacks?
"COLOSSEUM SWORD!" he summoned his sword from the shadows, throwing the one he was currently wielding back into the shadow realm and grabbing the new one, far stronger.
And then, without wasting any time.
"ECLIPSE BLAST!" he used one of his godly skills, charging up a beam of darkness that could kill both Stark and his clone instantly.
[The Ultimate Clone is ready!]
Stark looked beside him, and it was already there, taking up a fighting stance while smiling.
"…!" the clone didn't look that different, though it was smiling.
"=)"
"What do we do?" Stark asked it while pointing at Olikar, who was charging up his attack, even if they rushed at him to try and cancel the attack, it wouldn't work.
They were pretty much fucked for sure.
"FACE THE WRATH OF THE BEAM OF DARKNESS, NO ONE HAS EVER SURVIVED IT," Olikar laughed as he got ready to unleash it.
But, suddenly… the clone opened its mouth.
[Use…. E…G…O…]
It was capable of speech!
Though only a few words, already struggling with those two, but it was able to speak to Stark in battle!
[EGO Meter: 100/100]
And Stark decided to follow its advice, perfectly knowing why it asked him to summon it.
"COME FORTH, EGO, THE DEMON!"
And so, the giant demon above Stark appeared, staring down at Olikar, who wasn't fazed.
With one opponent having a Godly skill charging up and the other a Mythical, just what could happen!

chapters.title: Chapter 295 - 295: Eclypse Blast Negation
chapters.content:
Stark stood firm, facing the apostle, Olikar, whose form seemed to darken the very sky, crimson clouds appearing above.
The wind howled between them, but Stark's focus never wavered as the battle between human and apostle reached its critical point.
Hovering above Stark was the manifestation of his inner power: [EGO], a demon formed from his aura and raw will.
Its giant form loomed like a dark guardian, ready to strike at Stark's command.
The [EGO] demon's eyes glowed with the same crimson intensity as Stark's, and the anticipation for what was to come filled the air with a near-electric charge.
Olikar, in contrast, was unyielding.
His [Eclipse] Blast continued to charge, a godly skill capable of erasing anything in its path.
The apostle's eyes gleamed with malicious confidence as the dark energy swirled around him, growing stronger with each passing second.
"Do you think your demon will make a difference, human?" Olikar's voice boomed, taunting Stark with arrogance, "This Eclipse Blast will obliterate everything, demon, clones, and you along with them!"
Yet Stark remained unfazed.
His grin, wide and audacious, only grew more intense.
Olikar didn't know what was coming.
~FWISH, DASH!~
And he did something crazy: instead of trying to escape the blast, he rushed toward it.
Olikar almost believed that he wanted to commit suicide of desperation at this point.
"HAHA, THINK THAT THING CAN HURT ME?" he noticed that giant demon above Stark ready to swing, "DOESN'T MATTER, MY ECLIPSE BLAST WILL TAKE YOU ALL!"
Meanwhile, the [Ultimate Clone] wasn't doing nothing.
Actually, it was preparing the terrain for what was bound to come in the next thirty seconds.
First of all, it summoned the crimson [Wielding Cross] above it, then used [Crushing Gravity] to send the cross in the air, and as Olikar wasn't moving, it was much easier to aim directly aim.
Then the clone charged up [Aura Smash Merge] to send a giant crimson fist made out of three fists toward the apostle, and finally, it summoned the [Spear Judgement] from the [Crimson Spears], sending it at the apostle.
And to finish all of it, it sent a [Crimson Transmissino Ball] too, creating the small crimson ball in its hands and throwing it.
The ball landed behind Olikar, unnoticed by the apostle, whose focus was solely on charging his godly attack.
[Teleport point set]
But Olikar, too consumed with the power of his Eclipse Blast, merely laughed as he saw all the attacks.
"Futile! Send everything you have! It's all meaningless! My Eclipse Blast will erase it all!" His voice boomed with certainty, dark energy swirling faster around his colossal form.
The apostle was no stranger to overwhelming power.
This skill had been the ace up his sleeve in countless battles within the Colosseum, a place where even the most hardened warriors had fallen to its devastating force.
It was a godly-tier ability, one that had earned him the title of the strongest within this tower, and to be acknowledged by the Godless Demon.
He knew it wouldn't let him down.
[Eclypse Blast is fully charged!]
With a maniacal grin, Olikar prepared to unleash the destructive force.
"GOODBYE, HUMAN!" he roared, his voice echoing across the tower's top.
The beam of utter darkness started to form in his hands, pulsating with raw, lethal energy.
But Stark remained undeterred.
His grin didn't falter. In fact, it widened.
"Goodbye? No… Goodbye to you."
In an instant, the [EGO] demon that hovered above Stark acted.
The massive being clasped its hands together, mirroring its master's intention.
Both Stark and the [EGO] demon's eyes flared with an ominous, crimson aura as they prepared to unleash something truly catastrophic.
"NEGATE EXPLOSION!" Stark shouted, his voice cutting through the wind.
[Description: By using the user's will, he can make his own body errupt and thus negate any ability surrounding him in a close radius thanks to the EGO demon.]
A shockwave erupted from Stark's body as his aura flared, surging outward in a violent eruption.
The small explosion hit Olikar directly, that is one of the reasons Stark got closer after all.
"Wha—?!"
Before Olikar could react, his Eclipse Blast flickered, then faltered.
His expression twisted into disbelief as the beam of dark energy he had painstakingly charged was abruptly canceled, shattered by Stark's perk.
[Eclipse Blast has been negated by EGO.]
Olikar's mouth opened, shock plastered across his face, "What the fuck—"
BOOM! BOOM! BAM!
Before he could recover, Olikar was bombarded by every attack the Ultimate Clone had prepared.
The [Crushing Gravity] cross smashed down from above, the aura fists pounded against him relentlessly, and the [Spear of Judgment] impaled him with devastating force.
"-1,058,213!"
The damage was staggering, and for the first time, the apostle was genuinely hurt.
[Olikar HP: 434,684/2,000,000]
His powerful body, built through centuries of battle, trembled as cracks began to appear on his armor.
Olikar roared in agony, his massive frame momentarily buckling under the combined assault.
But the assault wasn't over yet.
~SNAP~
With a swift motion, the clone snapped its fingers, activating the teleportation it had set up moments before.
In an instant, the clone materialized behind Olikar, grabbing the apostle's head in a death grip.
"YOU LITTLE—" Olikar snarled, but before he could even swing his sword to kill both humans…
FWISH! PUNCH!
Stark's fist came crashing into Olikar's face, the force sending the apostle flying across the arena.
-125271!
[Olikar HP: 309,413/2,000,000]
Olikar's massive form slammed into one of the tower's walls, the impact spreading cracks across the stone surface.
He nearly toppled over the edge, his body barely clinging to the crumbling platform.
The very ground beneath their feet trembled, unable to withstand the intensity of the fight.
The fissures widened, threatening to shatter the arena entirely.
[Warning: The Colosseum Tower may collapse if you continue.]
But Stark didn't care, he was far from done.
His aura surged as he charged toward Olikar, ready to deliver the finishing blow.
The apostle was battered, bleeding, and for the first time, truly cornered.
This was it. Victory was within reach.
But as Stark closed in, something changed.
Olikar's eyes snapped open, blazing with an intensity Stark hadn't seen before.
The apostle's lips curled into a savage grin, blood running down his face.
"You think… this is the end, human?" he growled, rising to his feet despite the damage.
"Let me show you… why they call me the Colosseum's Strongest."
Without warning, Olikar's body began to radiate a godly, overwhelming energy.
His injured form straightened as the air around him shifted, thick with the weight of pure chaos power.
The dark aura surrounding him multiplied, swirling with chaotic fury as his muscles bulged.
Olikar lifted his sword high into the air, and the atmosphere itself seemed to bow under the weight of his transformation.
"BEHOLD!" Olikar roared, his voice echoing across the battlefield; "THE COLOSSEUM'S STRONGEST!"
With a blinding flash, his form shifted, growing even larger, his red skin now a deep, glowing crimson, veins of shadow energy coursing through his entire body.
His sword, now twice as large, crackled with godly energy, ready to decimate anything in its path.
Stark skidded to a halt, his eyes narrowing as he gazed at Olikar's new form.
The apostle's transformation was complete, his aura now nearly suffocating in its intensity.
This was Olikar's true power, a form that had earned him the title of the Colosseum's Strongest.
For a moment, the two warriors stood still, their auras clashing in the storm of energy that now engulfed the tower.
Stark clenched his fists, feeling the weight of the challenge before him.
This was it—the final test. A true battle between a human who had defied fate and a godlike apostle who ruled the Colosseum.
And neither was ready to back down.

chapters.title: Chapter 296 - 296: The Colosseum's Strongest Form!
chapters.content:
Olikar stood in his ultimate form, towering over the ruins of the Colosseum Tower, his colossal sword humming with chaotic energy.
The transformation had made him unstoppable.
His once red skin now glowed a deep, sinister crimson, veins of dark energy pulsing beneath the surface like the lifeblood of a god.
His eyes burned with fury, and his confidence was palpable.
"You think you can stand before me, human?" Olikar's voice was a deep, "I'll show you the true power of a god."
"Damn, so many of these apostles consider themselves as gods, it's insane," Stark laughed, "Yet… all of them die in the end."
Before Stark could even react, Olikar moved.
His speed was blinding, far faster than any awakener at even level 500 could hope to match.
The apostle closed the distance between them in a heartbeat, his blade raised high, shimmering with a deadly aura.
"Die."
The blade sliced through the air with a sharp whoosh, and before Stark could even process the attack, he felt it.
An immense, searing pain flooded his body as Olikar's blade cut through him, splitting his form into thousands of tiny, shimmering pieces.
His body shattered like glass, fragments scattering in all directions.
Stark's world went black.
The sensation of pain vanished as quickly as it had arrived, replaced by an overwhelming stillness.
He was dead.
In the endless void, Stark floated, suspended in nothingness.
No sound, no sight, no sensation.
Just darkness.
But suddenly, a prompt materialized in front of him, glowing in the abyss.
[Do you want to be revived?]
"Damn…" Stark exhaled, his voice echoing in the nothingness.
Olikar had killed him.
Instantly.
Effortlessly.
The realization hit him hard.
On the screen before him, he saw his clone, his [Ultimate Clone], still standing in the ruined tower.
The clone was taking a defensive stance, its fists clenched and its form ready, even as Olikar slowly advanced with his Colosseum Sword raised.
The clone was buying time, holding its ground, but even Stark knew it wouldn't last long.
Stark clenched his fists, frustration flooding his mind.
There was no way to win this.
Olikar was beyond powerful now, his strength, speed, and aura far surpassing anything Stark had faced before, his current stats matching those of a level 500 monster.
The apostle's transformation had made him nearly invincible.
Stark's revival wouldn't change the fact that he was no match for this monstrous foe.
His mind raced, thoughts spinning through his head like a whirlwind.
"I can't win…" Stark muttered, his voice heavy with defeat, "He's too strong. Even if I come back, he'll just kill me again. There's no point…"
But then, something caught his eye.
He looked at the screen again, watching the clone try to dodge Olikar's slow, menacing approach.
The clone was still alive.
Still fighting.
And below it was the cracked ground of the tower.
"Wait…" Stark's brow furrowed, realization dawning on him, "The cracked… ground?"
A grin crept across Stark's face.
An idea began to form, something wild, something absolutely reckless.
But that's what Stark was best at.
"I think… I got an idea," Stark whispered to himself, "It's definitely gonna be an 'Execution' if it works though… haha…"
The prompt appeared again, glowing brighter now.
[Do you want to be revived?]
[Final attempt, not answering will result in game over.]
Stark's grin widened.
He had no other choice. No other chances. It was all or nothing.
"YES!" he declared.
Reality snapped back into place.
…
Olikar advanced slowly, his towering form dominating the clone's.
The apostle's sword was raised high, ready to deliver the killing blow.
"This ends now, human," Olikar rumbled, his voice filled with finality.
The blade crackled with chaotic energy, its edge glowing as it neared the clone's neck.
But then, suddenly, Olikar stopped, remembering something important.
Why was the clone still alive if Stark was dead, it should have disappeared if the host is truly dead… right?
And more importantly, hadn't he seen Stark revive himself during the battle with the ape? He had witnessed it with his own eyes!
"...!" A realization dawned on Olikar, and his eyes widened.
He turned, his massive frame pivoting just in time to see it happen again.
Stark's body reformed before his very eyes.
The thousands of pieces of his shattered form slowly reassembled themselves, each fragment drawn back to the main body.
His body knit itself back until finally, Stark stood there, whole and very much alive.
And he was smiling.
"You think returning will save you?" Olikar spat, swinging his sword in a wide arc, the chaotic energy bursting from it, "You cannot win in this space, human. This is my domain!"
Stark's smile didn't falter.
In fact, it only grew wider.
"That's true," Stark said, his voice calm, yet filled with confidence. "I can't win here."
Olikar's expression twisted in confusion, but before he could question further, Stark pointed down.
"Let's change the scenery, shall we?"
Olikar's eyes widened as he stared at the ground, almost fully destroyed from their battle.
"?!" His mind raced, but he was too slow to react, "WAIT, DON'T YOU EVEN DARE—"
But it was too late.
Both Stark and his clone slammed their fists into the ground beneath them with all their might.
CRACK!
The floor beneath them shattered with a deafening crash, and the Colosseum Tower's topmost platform gave way, crumbling under the force of their combined strength.
The ground beneath Olikar vanished, and the entire battlefield changed now.
…
Fwish!
Both combatants fell through the air, hurtling toward the next floor below.
Stark twisted in mid-air, eyes locked on Olikar as the two descended together.
BAM!
They crashed into the tenth floor of the tower, landing hard amidst a storm of rubble.
Stark barely had time to catch his breath before Olikar was on him again, swinging his Colosseum Sword with deadly precision.
"VOID SLASH… ULTIMATE!"
Every single one of Olikar's had gained the 'Ultimate' perk once he transformed, making them much more deadly.
Stark dodged, narrowly avoiding the blow.
One hit would be fatal, he only had one HP left after reviving, he couldn't afford to make a single mistake.
The fight continued, intense and brutal.
Every clash sent shockwaves through the tower, the structure groaning beneath their fury.
With each exchange, Stark ducked and weaved, landing blows when he could (though they did less than 1000 damage), but always careful to avoid Olikar's deadly strikes.
[WARNING! WARNING! THE TOWER WILL CRUMBLE!]
For some strange reason, one he didn't know, Olikar's movements seemed so much slower than before.
He knew the apostle was going at full speed, but maybe thanks to [Flow], or something else he didn't know of, he could now avoid more easily than before.
Again and again, they smashed through the floors, descending deeper into the tower, either by the floor finally giving after Olikar's attacks, or by Stark smashing the apostle through the ground.
By the time they reached the fifth floor, both were exhausted, their auras flickering with the intensity of the battle.
If anyone saw him right now, they surely wouldn't be able to know who was the monster and who wasn't, the [EGO] demon and his clone still behind Stark, both assisting him.
Stark's breathing was ragged, sweat dripping from his brow, but he knew he couldn't stop.
He had to push through.
He had to win.
Finally, after a few minutes they crashed into the first floor of the Colosseum Tower, the ground beneath them cracking from the impact.
Stark could feel it: the end was near.
His entire body screamed in pain, but he pushed forward.
He had one final move, one final chance.
His eyes locked on Olikar, who was equally battered, his form flickering as the toll of his transformation weighed heavy on him.
"This is it…" Stark muttered to himself, gathering every last ounce of his strength.
Olikar raised his sword one last time, his massive frame trembling with exhaustion, but still unrelenting in his fury.
"You… can't win…" Olikar panted, his voice strained but filled with defiance, "Lord… Godless… will reign."
Stark clenched his fists, his aura flaring around him.
"You're right…" Stark said, his voice low but steady, "But I don't need to win fairly."
Stark couldn't do real damage to that thing in its current form, he would surely die before it did.
And so he chose the next best solution.
Stark's aura surged, filling the entire space with a blinding light.
His eyes glowed with a deep crimson color as he raised his hand high, preparing to unleash his final skill, a vortex of aura forming in his eyes.
All of his power, all of his remaining strength, focused into one moment.
Into a skill he had never used until now.
A skill that could either save him, or kill him.
And so… he shouted its name.
"BANISH!" he screamed at the apostle while pointing at him.
The word echoed through the tower as the light exploded outward, consuming everything in its path.
Ding!
[The Banish Game shall start!]
[Whoever's aura gets consumed by the other will be cast into the void!]
[Good luck!]
Both opponents read that panel, and suddenly… their auras surged from their bodies, clashing against one another.

chapters.title: Chapter 297 - 297: The Banish Game, Defeating Olikar
chapters.content:
The moment the Banish game began, Stark and Olikar stood frozen in the air, their bodies locked in place as their auras erupted around them like violent storms.
[The Banish Game shall start!]
[Whoever's aura gets consumed by the other will be cast into the void!]
[Good luck!]
Olikar's eyes flared wide in disbelief, "What the hell is this?! I've never seen something like this!"
He tried to dash toward Stark, but his movements were blocked by the strange force of the Banish Game.
His body, despite its immense strength, wouldn't respond.
[Hey! The Banish Game has started. You cannot leave or attack. Use your aura to defend and attack the opponent's!]
"HUMANNNNNN!" Olikar roared, but no amount of shouting would change the rules of this strange game.
He glared at Stark, realizing the stakes.
Whatever trick Stark had pulled, he had to play along now.
Suddenly, with an earth-shaking BOOM, both their auras collided.
Stark's crimson aura, crackling with raw, destructive energy, surged forward like a tidal wave, crashing against Olikar's dark, malevolent force.
The two stood, locked in this battle of wills, neither able to physically attack, but their auras now the tools of combat.
[You can form shapes related to your skills with your aura in the Banish Game!]
As soon as that notification flashed, the battle shifted.
Stark's mind raced.
He was the first to figure it out, and so with a determined look, he concentrated hard, imagining a form for his aura.
The crimson energy surrounding him suddenly twisted and swirled, shaping itself into a rough doppelgänger of Stark himself.
The aura clone clenched its fist and, with a booming impact, slammed it into Olikar's dark aura.
BAM! BAM!
The blows reverberated through the battlefield, pushing Olikar's aura back, causing it to shrink slightly.
Olikar's lips curled into a snarl. "YOU THINK YOU'RE THE ONLY ONE WHO CAN DO THIS?!"
Fwish!
His dark aura responded instantly, twisting and forming into the shape of a massive blade, mirroring the Colosseum Sword he wielded in battle.
The dark energy blade slashed at Stark's aura doppelgänger, cutting through it and regaining lost ground.
This was how [Banish Battles] went, a truly… phenomenal thing, you need to gain space by attacking the opponent's aura.
A whole new type of battles!
And so the battle unfolded, their auras transforming into shapes, representations of their power.
Stark formed his aura into fists, spears, and even tried to mimic a [Heaven's Wrath] to clash with Olikar's dark aura.
But Olikar actually fought back, their auras at a fairly same level.
But Stark wasn't giving up.
Olikar was relentless, his dark aura pressing forward with terrifying force, pushing Stark's crimson energy back inch by inch.
The apostle's face twisted with rage, "I AM A TRUE GOD OF BATTLE! YOU CANNOT WIN!"
Stark gritted his teeth, sweat running down his face as he focused harder, pouring everything into his aura, "I don't have to be a god to beat you."
He pushed back with a surge of crimson energy, forcing Olikar's dark aura to halt its advance.
The battlefield of auras fluctuated, the balance constantly shifting, but Stark wasn't done yet.
[WARNING! WARNING! ONE MORE PUSH AND THE TOWER WILL CRUMBLE!]
Their auras were destroying the tower, the very foundations succumbing.
But Stark didn't care, He had one last trick up his sleeve.
"You're nothing but a false warrior who follows orders!" Stark shouted, his eyes blazing with determination.
His crimson aura shifted once more, forming a massive demon-like figure, an embodiment of [EGO], larger than any form he had created yet.
The aura demon roared and slammed into the dark aura Olikar had crafted into a grotesque, twisted version of himself.
The impact was thunderous.
BOOM!
The clash sent shockwaves through the space around them, and Stark's aura surged forward, overpowering Olikar's defenses.
The crimson energy washed over Olikar, consuming him piece by piece.
And then… what had to happen happened: Stark's aura engulfed the apostle, locking him in place.
Olikar's eyes widened in horror as his dark aura was completely overtaken, "Huh? W-What?!" He tried to resist, but it was already over the moment the aura reached him.
[You have lost the Banish Game!]
[Winner: Stark Heartsouls]
Olikar's face twisted in disbelief, "WHAT? HOW? I CANNOT LOSE! THIS IS STUPID!"
On the other side, Stark was smiling, his face radiating with triumph and malice.
He knew it was over.
"Adios, idiot," he laughed.
Fwish... FWISH...
Crimson tentacles of Stark's aura tightened their grip on Olikar, dragging him down toward the ground.
Below him, a swirling portal of darkness appeared, the gateway to the void.
Olikar struggled, clawing at the air, trying to resist the pull, but it was futile.
He couldn't fight against the overwhelming force of Stark's aura.
"No! This cannot be!" Olikar shouted as the portal consumed him, piece by piece, dragging him down into its infinite depths.
And then, just like that, Olikar was gone, erased, cast into the void.
Ding!
[You have 'Executed' Olikar, The Colosseum Warrior!]
Stark's eyes widened in surprise.
An execution. That meant…
['Execution' broadcast has been sent throughout the world!]
This would surely cause an uproar, but it had been more than 6 months since his last execution, so who cares.
Ding!
[You have slain 'Olikar, The Colosseum Warrior,' gaining 47,600,000 experience points!]
[+20,000,000 Execution Bonus!]
Stark blinked in disbelief.
A total of 67,600,000 experience points from this single fight.
It was an astronomical amount, far more than he had ever earned in one battle, and he could hardly process it.
It didn't take much more time for him to hear the level up notifications.
DING! DING! DING! DING!
[Your level has increased to level 89, granting you four skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Your level has increased to level 90, granting you four skill points and a boost in stats.]
.
.
[Your level has increased to level 99, granting you four skill points and a boost in stats.]
Stark's mind went into 'what the fuck' mode.
He had jumped eleven levels in one battle, nearly reaching level 100.
It was unheard of.
"I-Incredible…" Stark muttered, his body still buzzing from the aftermath of the battle.
A level 400 monster (or 500 in this case because of the stat boost, you know) like Olikar had been beyond powerful, but now Stark had gotten everything.
It was sooo worth it!
"Skill!" Stark's eyes immediately sparkled as he expected to see the cards appear before him.
But…
[From now only, you will get skills every 20 levels!]
He was put on yet another restriction…
"Oh well, can't have it all," he shrugged.
But as Stark caught his breath, he noticed something glowing near the spot where Olikar had been dragged into the void.
Three shimmering lights floated where Olikar's body had been.
"Items!" Stark smiled as he approached them, he thought that he wouldn't get anything because Olikar's body was dragged into the void, but looks like he was wrong!
The glowing objects solidified, revealing three pieces of equipment left behind by the fallen apostle:
Colosseum Champion's Blade: A massive greatsword imbued with Olikar's dark energy. It boosts the wielder's strength by 50% when used in combat arenas or colosseums and grants the passive skill "Aura Slash," allowing energy-based ranged attacks.
Aegis of the Fallen: A legendary-grade shield that generates a powerful aura-based barrier around the user, deflecting incoming attacks. It passively increases defense by 30% and regenerates 0.2% of maximum health every 10 seconds during combat.
Gladiator's Chainmail: An enchanted piece of armor that boosts agility and endurance by 20%. When taking a hit, it has a chance to temporarily increase the user's speed, making them harder to strike.
Pretty good, heh?
Well, the world said "FUCK YOU" to Stark.
[Class: Warrior]
Because only the warrior class could use these three legendary or above items, and guess what, Stark had decided to remove the [Warrior] class from his [Class Wheel] option PERMANANTLY!
Who's the real clown now, heh?
"There's nothing we can do," Stark sat on the ground while looking above at the destroyed floors, breathing in and out and able to see the sky from his current position.
But these weren't all of the announcements, there was still one as Stark could still see a panel floating in front of him.
He decided to open it, and what he saw was quite… shocking.
Ding!
[As a reward for purging an entire tower, you have been granted a 'Max out Core'!]
Eliminating Olikar meant killing EVERY monster in the tower, so he was rewarded with another [Max Out Core]!
The reason no one else was able to get it was because, well, Olikar counted as one of the monsters, and Stark was the only one able to kill him.
"Very good," the boy smiled mischievously, "I'll use it later," he put it into his [Spatial Inventory] for now.
Then he sat down and waited, wanting to recover some of his stamina.
But of course, the universe wouldn't let him rest.
[The tower is crumbling, you should really get out!]
"Oh."

chapters.title: Chapter 298 - 298: Leaving The Colosseum, Third Academy Semester
chapters.content:
The ground trembled beneath Stark's feet as he stood amidst the crumbling remnants of the Colosseum Tower.
His battle with Olikar had pushed the structure to its limit, and now, the tower was moments away from total collapse, like actually, they had destroyed EVERYTHING.
"Hmph," Stark muttered, his eyes narrowing as he gripped the [Colosseum Tower Token] in his hand.
He activated it without hesitation, a burst of crimson energy enveloping his body.
The familiar sensation of teleportation surged through him, and in an instant, the chaotic sounds of destruction faded.
Just as Stark disappeared from the collapsing structure, the tower gave one final, earth-shattering groan.
Then the entire thing shattered like glass.
Just like Olikar, that thing died.
…
Back in his apartment room, Stark reappeared in the exact same position he had been in before teleporting to the Colosseum Tower.
His eyes blinked as he adjusted to the sudden shift in scenery.
The familiar warmth of his apartment greeted him, a stark contrast to the cold and deadly battlefield he had just left behind.
Across the room, Lana and Sora sat on the couch, their eyes glued to the television screen.
Both of them looked tense, anxiety painted on their faces (yes, even Sora, a bit) as they watched the massive Colosseum Tower crumble on live television.
"STARK!" Lana screamed, jumping to her feet as the tower collapsed, tears streaming down her cheeks, her voice filled with desperation.
She thought he was still inside.
"Yes?" Stark's calm voice came from behind.
Lana froze mid-sob, slowly turning around as her eyes met Stark's calm expression.
Her jaw dropped, and for a second, she couldn't believe it was really him standing there.
Her face was a mess of tears and snot, but none of that mattered. The next moment, she rushed toward him, hugging him.
"You... you're okay!" she cried, clutching him tightly. "I thought- I thought you-"
"Did you expect me to stay inside and take it?" Stark raised his eyebrows.
"N-No..." Lana sniffled, slowly pulling back from the hug, trying to compose herself, "B-But we saw the whole battle live on TV! We thought you were trapped in there!"
Stark's eyes widened in surprise. "Wait, what? The battle was... live on TV?"
"Yes," Sora confirmed as she stood from the couch, approaching them with her usual calm demeanor, but there was a glint of relief in her eyes.
She smiled softly and extended her arms, as if expecting a hug as well.
Stark didn't know what this gesture meant, as it was Sora we were talking about, and so he put the [Colosseum Token] in her hands.
Sora blinked in confusion, her very small smile faltering slightly, "You hugged Lana, aren't you going to do the same for me?"
"Oh..." Stark scratched the back of his head, "I just... didn't expect it from you, my bad."
He awkwardly opened his arms, and Sora stepped into the hug.
Unlike Lana's emotional embrace, Sora's was way calmer and less excited.
As they hugged, Sora's cheeks flushed slightly, and she realized how strange this sensation was to her.
Human contact... that didn't repulse her, that didn't fill her with disgust.
'No... disgust...' Sora thought, her mind racing as the hug lingered longer than she expected.
It felt... comforting.
She had never touched anyone like this before without feeling the urge to pull away immediately.
This feeling was intoxicating to her, and if she didn't watch out she could definitely become a 'Stark Addict'.
Stark stepped back, looking between the two girls, "So... does that mean the whole world saw the battle?"
"Yes," Lana and Sora replied in unison.
"The TV literally turned itself on," Lana explained, "and your fight was being broadcast everywhere. We checked the forums, and it was the same for everyone. People were forced to watch your battle."
"Oh, wow," Stark muttered, running a hand through his hair, "That's... special."
He was thankful that his face had been hidden by his aura for most of the fight, but it was still strange to think that the entire world had been watching him take down Olikar.
Curious, Stark pulled out his phone and quickly navigated to the forums. Sure enough, the discussions were ablaze with his name.
[WarriorKing98]: Yo, did anyone else see that dude rip through the tower?! What the heck was that battle?!
[ArcaneMaster10]: Bro, it was INSANE. That crimson aura was unreal. I can't believe that guy took down an apostle like that.
[OlikarFanatic]: Nah man, Olikar was supposed to win! This guy came outta nowhere. This isn't over!
[JustAnotherSpectator]: Did anyone notice how the entire tower just... exploded? If it happened in a city it would soooo over!
Stark smirked, shaking his head, "Damn."
…
The next two days passed quietly, a stark contrast to the chaos of the battle. Stark spent most of his time resting and recovering, though Lana seemed intent on... other activities.
One night, Lana made her move, slipping into Stark's bed while Sora was sleeping nearby.
She nudged him gently, her eyes gleaming mischievously in the dark.
"Hey... want to... have some fun?" she whispered, her lips brushing against his ear.
Stark turned to her, half-asleep, and frowned, "You make too much noise," he said, rolling over and pulling the blanket over his head.
But surprisingly, Lana didn't feel rejected, instead she chuckled, "If Sora's going to stay here for a while, how are we supposed to have any alone time?" she teased, poking him in the side.
"I don't know," Stark muttered, his voice muffled by the blanket, "Just... not when she's around."
Lana chuckled quietly, though she couldn't hide her disappointment, "Fine, fine. But don't think you can keep dodging me forever."
"Don't plan to, you're submissive as hell anyway."
"…" her face turned red.
What they didn't know was that Sora, who they assumed was asleep, had her eyes wide open, listening to every word.
Her face was flushed as she lay there, her heart pounding, 'They've already gone this far...?' she thought, feeling a mix of emotions she couldn't quite place.
Jealousy? Curiosity?
If Stark had already been with Lana, what chance did she have to... win him over?
Lana was her friend, and yet... the thought of Stark being out of her reach made her think that the possibility of 'stealing' him wasn't far-fetched.
She scolded herself for even thinking that way.
…
Two days later...
[The third semester/trial of the academy starts today!]
Stark, Lana, and Sora hurried to get ready, tension in the air as they prepared for the new semester.
A new semester in this academy wasn't filled with excitement, just dread.
As usual, Stark carried both girls, jumping from a building and landing smoothly past the academy gate.
They entered the academy lobby, where a large assembly of students was gathered.
But this time, things were different.
There were only 2,000 squares set up on the floor, much fewer than the previous trials.
And of those squares, not even half were filled with students: the rest were empty.
Stark, Lana, and Sora stood together on three squares close to one another.
The atmosphere heavier than before.
The remaining students seemed stronger, more focused, and far more dangerous.
At precisely 8:00, the academy doors closed with a loud THUD, and the chairman, Theodore, appeared on stage alongside the instructors.
"Beautiful day, ain't it, folks?" Theodore grinned, his eyes scanning the room, "You can imagine my surprise when I saw the Colosseum Tower was destroyed by one of you, a true... shocking event."
His gaze locked onto Stark, the knowing glint in his eyes impossible to miss.
It didn't take a genius to figure out who had caused this at this point anyway.
"Well, it doesn't matter," Theodore continued, clapping his hands together, "Let's get on with the third and final trial announcement, shall we?"
A holographic screen descended from the ceiling, casting a glow across the room as the details of the next trial began to display.

chapters.title: Chapter 299 - 299: Daniel Pridel is back, Third Trial Announcement
chapters.content:
Theodore's voice boomed over the hall.
"Congratulations on surviving," he began, his eyes scanning the room, "All of those currently in this room are truly the one deserving of being called Rift Conqueror Students!"
The holographic screen lit up.
[837 students remain out 1763!]
"Holy shit!" one voice echoed from somewhere in the back.
"Less than a thousand..."
"Well, we survived, didn't we?" another student answer, trying to sound cheerful, though the undertone of anxiety was unmistakable.
Stark glanced around the room, taking it all in.
The chatter around him was incessant, but to him, all of these people were just coping.
Despite the noise, the weight of those numbers wasn't anything special to him.
Nearly 4000 students had fallen between the first and second trials.
And there was still one more trial to go.
"Calm down, people," Theodore's voice cut through the noise like a blade, his aura spiking to silence the room, "I know it's scary, but as said before, only the strongest shall survive this academy."
"…" no one dared to say anything.
But Stark clenched his jaw, biting back a curse.
'Fuck off,' he thought.
He didn't care about the death's either as Lana and Sora were alive, but Theodore's indifferent attitude toward all of this infuriated him.
It was as though the deaths and failures were nothing more than a side effect of the academy's grand plan to create the ultimate fighters for the second year.
The silence deepened as the holographic screen behind Theodore flickered to life again, displaying a massive leaderboard.
Stark's group, unsurprisingly, was ranked first.
The names of the Punkz Brothers appeared second, their obnoxious grins from a few months back playing on his mind.
And third place belonged to Karl Spikeford's group, also expected.
The rest of the rankings blurred out in Stark's mind, irrelevant to him.
Theodore's grin widened as he watched the students absorb the information.
"Well… just as before, I guess it's time to introduce your next and final trial for this first year," he said, practically buzzing with excitement, more excited than the students themselves for what was about to come.
The screen began to change.
"But before any of that..." Theodore's smile twisted into something more devious, "We shall introduce a transfer student!"
And just like that, the room erupted.
"WHAT?!"
"TRANSFER STUDENT AT THE END OF THE YEAR?"
"YOU HAVE GOT TO BE KIDDING!"
Outrage spread like wildfire across the hall.
Students began shouting over each other, disbelief evident on their faces.
It was unheard of for someone to be brought in this late, after the trials had already claimed so many lives.
How was that even fair?
Theodore, however, seemed completely unbothered by the uproar, "Calm down, my fellow students, you will understand why once you see him," the chairman smiled, not caring about any of their opinions, after all he ruled this place.
"Never!"
"Let's beat up that guy!"
"He must think sooo highly of himself."
Theodore turned to the screen, and with a wide grin, he finally spoke the name that silenced the room completely.
"Welcome… Daniel Pridel!"
The exact moment his name was uttered, the moment the last syllab escaped Theodore's mouth,, the entire room went quiet, all of them, even the Punkz Brother, turning cold and fearful.
"???" Stark was confused.
Of course, Stark remembered Daniel vividly.
He was the first real opponent Stark had faced after reincarnating into this world, a memory etched into his mind.
Daniel was the one who pushed Stark to spin the [Class Wheel] to unlock his [Domination] class, setting off everything that had happened since.
But as far as Stark knew, Daniel had been nothing more than a minor nuisance at best.
Yet the atmosphere in the room told a different story now.
"Holy shit…"
"Don't piss him off…"
"Fuck, I didn't think it would be him…"
The whispers of fear spread like wildfire through the remaining students.
Stark was puzzled, turning to Lana for clarification.
"Is he that famous?" he asked, genuinely confused.
The Daniel he remembered had been a stepping stone, nothing more.
Lana's expression was serious, her eyes flicking toward the screen, "Are you serious? Daniel Pridel is… different now. You need to see what he's been doing the past year or so since you beat him," she said, her voice low.
"What's he been up to?" Stark asked.
Before Lana could explain, the lights in the room dimmed, and the stage was illuminated.
Daniel stepped into the light, and Stark's eyes widened in shock, his aura almost instinctively making him take his fighting stance.
The Daniel standing before them was unrecognizable from the boy Stark had once fought.
Daniel was muscular before, but now he was a legitimate beast, standing at around 190cm tall.
His chest was bare, littered with scars, and his aura was suffocating, while wearing pants that clearly didn't fit his size.
Stark noted the dried blood still clinging to his torso, his unkempt appearance making him look more like a savage beast than a person.
His gaze was murderous, and his aura was overwhelming.
"Heh." Stark couldn't help but let out a small laugh, though he hid it better than back at the first announcement.
How the hell did he transform this much? No one really knew.
"D-Don't laugh," Lana pleaded Stark, "I've seen articles and even the news refering him as the 'warrior prodigy of today's society'!!"
"And why is that?"
"Well... its just rumors since we aren't sure... but from what I heard all this guy did was fight over and over in rifts, risking his life, yet always coming back stronger, and experts have guessed that he is... at least level 500," she sighed, "At this level, I don't even know if you can take him Stark..."
"Nah, I'd win," Stark smiled, confident, though this guy indeed looked strong.
Lana shot him a skeptical look but said nothing. She knew better than to argue with Stark when he got like this.
On stage, Theodore continued, "No need for further introductions. Daniel, take your place on a square and prepare for the third trial."
Daniel nodded once, his eyes cold and focused as he moved to the front of the room, his presence commanding.
No one dared speak as he walked past, his very aura sending waves of unease through the crowd.
"Well, then let's get to the reall good part!" Theodore clapped his hands.
The screen flickered once more, and the image of a massive dark and crimson hole in the ground appeared
"!!!" Stark's eyes widened in shock, could this be...
[The academy has worked hard.]
[They have found this rift called the 'Devil's Abyss,' an extremely dangerous rift they've been trying to unlock for over a year. And now, they've found one of the only two keys in the world to open it.]
The screen zoomed in, showing the colossal entrance to the rift, an ominous black wall with a glowing keyhole.
[Third Trial: The Devil's Abyss.]
[The Devil's Abyss is a level 250-400 rift from the 'DETERMINATION' difficulty, and yes that might sound crazy, but do not fret, we will NOT be asking you to clear it.]
[Your mission is simple: retrieve three 'Devil Flowers' located in the second zone of the rift. Retrieve them, and you will successfully graduate your first year.]
[That is all, couldn't be easier!]
But Stark didn't believe them: this seemed... WAY too easy.
And the other students knew it
"What's the catch?!"
"Not falling for that, old man!"
[The catch is that the rift is difficult and filled with demons to brim, it was detected as one of the rifts with the highest demonic energy ever.]
[The 'opening' of the rift will happen right after these announcements, you will be teleported to the location where it will happen before your eyes!]
[Of course, you can choose to leave now, as you will be granted a 'Devil Abyss' token to be able to teleport to the location whenever you want, but you won't be able to witness the opening!]
[Have fun!]
And then the holographic screen disappeared, leaving the students baffled.
Especially Stark though, who's jaw almost dropped to the ground.
"That is all," Theodore smiled, "And as our little holo-friend said, we will begin the opening in exactly twenty minutes from now," he snapped his fingers, and suddenly the entrance of the school opened, "Those who want to leave may do so to prepare."
And just like that... the third trial could now start

chapters.title: Chapter 300 - 300: The Appearance of the Devil's Abyss (Finally)
chapters.content:
Stark leaned back against one of the walls of the massive auditorium, arms crossed, his gaze flicking between the countdown timer on the holographic screen and his two companions, Lana and Sora.
The remaining twenty minutes before the third trial felt like an eternity, especially with the tension hanging heavy in the air.
"Seems like they're giving us time to think it over," Lana commented, her arms folded over her chest.
Sora, always the quieter one of the group, just nodded.
"Doesn't matter," Stark muttered, "We're not backing down."
And it seemed that none of the students felt like it either: they had survived two deadly trials, and of course it wasn't a [Domination Trial] level, but it was still difficult!
"…"
Nothing much happened for the first fifteen minutes, and everyone just waited.
But suddenly, the atmosphere in the room shifted out of nowhere as Daniel, the one everyone was scared of, suddenly moved, arriving right behind Stark, looking down at the boy.
"Holy shit!"
"...What did he do to Daniel."
"I would piss myself to be honest..."
But of course, he wasn't dumb: Stark could feel it, a presence, like a surge of pressure pushing against the back of his neck.
His crimson eyes flickered with a sharp, instinctual awareness.
Without even looking, he knew who it was.
The room seemed to grow colder, and the chatter of the other students abruptly died down as they all looked at the event unfolding before their eyes.
Lana stiffened beside Stark, her eyes widening as she stared over his shoulder.
"Stark, watch out!" she warned, her voice trembling with urgency.
Even Sora's usual calm demeanor faltered a bit as she dropped into a defensive stance, her hand positioned as if to use [Vine Smash].
Stark, however, remained completely calm.
He slowly turned around, as if the intimidating presence behind him was nothing more than a mild inconvenience.
His eyebrows raised slightly, and his gaze locked onto the man towering over him.
It was Daniel Pridel.
"Problem?" Stark asked casually, his voice filled with confidence, and his pupils glowing with a burning crimson aura, stronger than anything Daniel was putting out.
Stark could feel Daniel's violent energy trying to dominate the space, but it felt insignificant to him.
"...!" Daniel didn't speak much anymore, but his eyes did widen a bit once seeing that Stark also got just as powerful as he did even though he fought relentlessly in rifts this entire year.
Could he really lose to Stark, the one that had humiliated him?
No, no he couldn't, he would surely destroy that boy.
And yet, when he looked into Stark's eyes, all he could see was chaos, determination and power, as if he had fought and seen opponents a thousands times stronger than he was.
The last time they had fought, Stark had been far weaker, yet now, despite Daniel's own terrifying growth, Stark stood before him as though he was an equal… no… as though he was stronger.
"You will suffer," that is all Daniel muttered, his voice low and filled with venom.
His grip on the hilt of his small blade tightened, yet despite his threatening words, there was hesitation in his eyes
Stark's gaze remained steady, unfazed.
In Daniel's eyes, he could see a mix of rage, pride, and... doubt.
It was almost amusing.
After all the battles Daniel had fought, after all the power he had gained, he was still unsure if he could truly defeat Stark.
With a frustrated grunt, Daniel stepped back, abandoning whatever plan he had to provoke Stark into a fight.
He turned his gaze away, glancing over Stark's shoulder, and for a moment, his eyes softened into something darker: something personal.
Stark followed Daniel's gaze and noticed Lana standing beside him.
Her expression was calm, but the way she looked at Daniel carried no fear, just indifference.
To Daniel, though, that look must have been a slap in the face.
Stark knew the stories about Daniel's obsession with Lana back in their school days, and it seemed that obsession hadn't faded.
He could see how he was looking at him and Lana, and took add a cut to the wound, Stark reached for Lana's waist and got her closer to him.
The girl's face turned bright red, but she didn't retaliate.
Daniel clenched his fists, his jaw tightening, but he said nothing.
With a sharp turn, he marched away, moving to the front of the auditorium, his shoulders tense with barely-contained rage.
"He's still a psycho," Stark muttered under his breath, shaking his head.
*
Lana exhaled in relief. "That guy's worse than I remembered," she admitted, her voice low, "He's been in those rifts for a year straight, fighting who-knows-what, and yet... you didn't even flinch."
"Why would I?" Stark replied with a grin, "He's strong, sure, but nothing we haven't faced before."
Even Sora seemed to relax, though she kept one eye on Daniel.
"We'll deal with him later," Stark added, "Simple as that."
The tension seemed to ease as the minutes continued to tick down.
And finally, the timer on the holographic screen hit zero.
Theodore's voice filled the room again, commanding attention as he stepped forward with a pleased smile.
"I guess no one wants to leave," he said with a chuckle, "Very well then. Let us begin."
With a snap of his fingers, a brilliant light enveloped the entire auditorium, and the room vanished from around them.
The next moment, Stark, Lana, Sora, and the rest of the students found themselves standing in the open air, a vast landscape stretching out before them.
The ground was completely red, and they could see fire all around them, the trees and even rocks burnt.
It almost looked like they were in hell.
Directly ahead was a massive hole in the ground, the entrance to the Devil's Abyss.
