It radiated an ominous energy, a swirling, dark aura that seemed to pulse like a living thing.
Surrounding the hole was a towering aura wall, etched with intricate symbols and runes, and at the center of the wall was a glowing key symbol: this is where you need to place the [Devil Abyss's Key] if you had it.
"Holy..." Stark whispered, his eyes wide as he took in the sight of the rift.
The size of the portal was monstrous, large enough to swallow an entire city block.
Would they need to jump from here to the bottom of the hole to reach the rift? Because it sure did look like it…
Theodore's voice echoed through the air, as one of the instructors stepped forward, holding a small, ancient-looking key, the same one Stark had in his inventory.
"As promised, you will now witness the opening of the Devil's Abyss," Theodore announced.
The instructor raised the key, and with a single, fluid motion, he inserted it into the glowing symbol on the wall.
There was a loud, echoing click, followed by a deep rumble that shook the ground beneath their feet.
The aura wall shimmered, and the key symbol pulsed with light before dissolving completely.
The barrier around the rift collapsed, and the swirling vortex within the hole grew even more intense.
The portal was now fully open.
Ding! Ding! Ding!
[The Devil's Abyss Rift has been opened!]
"Go on," Theodore said with a wicked smile, "jump inside."
Without hesitation, students began leaping into the rift, their bodies disappearing into the dark void below.
Stark exchanged a quick glance with Lana and Sora.
"Here we go," he said, his voice steady as he stepped forward.
With a deep breath, Stark jumped into the abyss too, the darkness swallowing him whole.
The sensation of falling lasted only a moment before his feet hit solid ground.
[Welcome to the Devil's Abyss]
[Level: 250-400]
[Difficulty: Determination]
This is the before last difficulty, right before "Death".
The final trial could now begin, though for Stark, he planned to reach the very end of that rift and kill the apostles.

chapters.title: Chapter 301 - 301: Falling into the Apostles' Trap!
chapters.content:
The usual rush of adrenaline that followed any jump into a rift was there, but something else lingered in the air, something darker, heavier.
His crimson eyes flickered as he took in his surroundings.
The red stone ground beneath his feet was jagged and uneven, and in the distance, lava rivers could be seen flowing.
'Devil's Abyss, heh~' Stark smirked, 'I guess I'm in hell.'
Stark stood up straight, scanning the area for Lana and Sora.
They had jumped into the rift right before him, yet now there was nothing, actually, there was no one.
He waited a few moments, expecting to hear their familiar voices, or at the very least, the sound of other students landing around him.
But the silence stretched on, filling the air with an eerie emptiness.
"...Where is everyone?" Stark muttered to himself, his senses sharpened as a cold chill ran down his spine.
Suddenly, a holographic message flashed in front of his eyes.
[Welcome to your doom, chosen one.]
"…" Stark's focus increased by a hundred the moment he saw the words 'chosen one'.
The next set of words hit him harder.
[You cannot leave.]
[You are stuck here with us.]
[Come and try to challenge us, chosen.]
The gravity of the situation set in, and Stark's smirk faded.
And then it hit him.
"The apostles..." Stark whispered, his hand instinctively clenching into a fist, the three apostles of this rift were here, they were waiting for him.
The apostles must have sensed his presence.
And knowing that he would eventually come to kill them here, they must have crafted this trap just for him.
Meaning that while the other students teleported to the beginning areas with their other peers, passing through its normal challenges, he was in a separate reality—a realm designed by the apostles themselves, much harder.
His crimson eyes gleamed with excitement, even as his situation became more dangerous "Stuck in here?" he laughed, "No… you're stuck here with me, idiots."
Meanwhile, in the regular section of the Devil's Abyss, Lana stood up from her landing.
Dozens of students were already scattered across the open zone, preparing for the trial.
She looked around, her brow furrowing.
"Huh? Where is Stark?" she asked, her voice concerned.
Sora appeared beside her, her sharp eyes scanning the surroundings,"He should've landed right after us…" she muttered, equally perplexed.
The two exchanged glances, but neither could see any sign of their teammate.
Back in Stark's personal nightmare, he couldn't help but laugh more, "Incredible! Thank you for making the job easier!" he shouted into the air while spreading his arms, hoping it would reach the apostles from their safe little zones.
He had come to the Devil's Abyss prepared to fight alongside his team, but if the apostles wanted to give him this kind of special treatment, then so be it.
Without wasting any more time, he took his first step forward, the ground cracking beneath his feet as if even the earth itself trembled at his approach.
His crimson aura surrounded him completely, lighting up the dark, desolate landscape around him.
[Devil's Abyss has 5 zones.]
The message appeared briefly, but Stark barely paid it any mind.
He was already moving.
Five zones were more than what a normal rift would have, but that didn't matter to him. He would tear through them, one by one.
[First Zone: Beginning of Hell]
The landscape shifted as he moved deeper into the rift.
Red, jagged rocks jutted from the ground, and the air grew hotter as he approached the rivers of lava that were spread through the zone.
It was exactly what you'd expect from a place named "Devil's Abyss," but Stark didn't care about the scenery.
His focus was on the creatures that lurked ahead, each between level 250-300.
In the distance, he spotted them: devils and demons, grotesque figures with twisted horns, leathery wings, and glowing eyes filled with malice.
They sensed him as well, their guttural roars shaking the air as they charged toward him in a wave of fury.
Stark's smirk returned, "Come on, then."
Around twenty of these things rushed at him all at once, wanting to get rid of him at the same time.
Without hesitation, Stark raised his hand, his [Crimson Purification] ability activating in a flash of light.
A surge of holy energy exploded outward from him, crashing into the demonic horde like a wave.
The demons didn't even have a chance to react.
The moment the purifying light touched them, their bodies disintegrated into ash, their screams of agony barely reaching Stark's ears before they were snuffed out entirely.
-764293! -832717! -743612!
The damage was phenomenal, and the shockwave of energy swept through the area, annihilating every demon in its path.
Stark walked forward calmly, the light fading behind him as he advanced deeper into the zone.
"Too easy," he muttered, shaking his head.
The apostles clearly underestimated him if they thought these basic demons would slow him down.
[Exorcist] was a masterclass of a skill inside such a rift after all.
As Stark pressed on, more demons appeared, crawling from the shadows, emerging from fiery portals that opened up around him.
But none of them lasted more than a few seconds.
His [Crimson Purification] wiped them out with ease, and if it was on cooldown, he would easily use his other skills or fists to get rid of them.
He swept through the demons with minimal effort, not even needing the full extent of his power to kill them all.
Minutes passed, and Stark found himself nearing the end of the first zone.
And eventually, what had to happen happened.
Ding!
[Your level has increased to level 100, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
He had reached level 100, but before he could even celebrate, he heard a loud roar.
And that's when he felt it: a presence far more powerful than the low-level demons he had been fighting.
Something big.
Stark stopped in his tracks, his eyes narrowing as he scanned the area ahead of him.
From the shadows, a massive figure emerged.
"Oh come on…" Stark just wanted to check his panels at this point.
Its hulking form towered over the landscape, standing at least thirty times the height of a normal man.
Its skin was jet-black, its muscles rippling with raw power, and its eyes burned with an intense red glow.
Two enormous horns curled from the sides of its head, and in its hand, it carried a massive, jagged blade that radiated dark energy.
A message appeared in front of Stark's eyes as the creature roared, the ground shaking beneath its feet.
[The First Elite Demon Commander: Bel'zar the Ravager]
[Level: 300]
[Defeat the zone's commanders to advance to the next!]
Stark's smirk widened, "Finally, something interesting."
Bel'zar the Ravager let out another earth-shattering roar, its bloodthirsty eyes locked onto Stark as it raised its weapon, ready to strike.
But Stark didn't flinch, he just took his fighting stance, ready to attack as well.
"Let's see what you've got," Stark muttered, stepping forward to meet the elite head-on.
The real beginning of the [Devil's Abyss] could now start, and from the shadows, the apostles watched Stark's every move.

chapters.title: Chapter 302 - 302: Level 100
chapters.content:
The battle between Stark and Bel'zar the Ravager began with an earth-shattering roar from the massive demon.
Towering over Stark, Bel'zar swung his colossal blade, the sheer force of the strike causing the ground to tremble.
His demonic energy crackled in the air, and the heat from his presence was almost suffocating.
"Perception…" Stark checked calmly while avoided the attack.
[Name: Bel'zar the Ravager (Elite)]
[Level: 300]
[HP: 1,000,000]
[Strength: 15,573]
[Stamina: 8,371]
[Speed: 19,384]
[Defense: 14,385]
[Skills: Demon Cleave; Hellfire Barrage; Infernal Charge; Ravager's Fury; Bloodlust Surge; Shadowstep; Chaos Shield]
The battle seemed intimidating at first glance, but Stark stood calm, even as the hulking figure lunged toward him.
Stark had fought tougher monsters, and he knew Bel'zar wouldn't stand a chance against his power.
Fighting [Olikar] had made him so much stronger that even a level 450 monster wouldn't stand a chance, so why do these demons even think they could win?
Unfortunately, his most powerful ability, [Crimson Purification], was still on cooldown from his earlier encounter with the demons.
Bel'zar roared once more, his blade slashing down toward Stark, but the crimson-eyed fighter was quick.
"Let's end this quickly," Stark muttered under his breath as he activated [Wielding Cross], summoning a massive, radiant crimson cross that hovered above him, blazing with holy light.
With a single motion, Stark swung the cross downward.
The impact was cataclysmic, a shockwave of light erupted from the strike, slamming into Bel'zar with such force that the elite demon's health bar dropped nearly to zero.
[700,000 damage dealt!]
Bel'zar staggered back, his once overwhelming presence now faltering.
Stark gave him no time to recover.
With another swing of the [Wielding Cross], the holy energy crashed into Bel'zar, shattering his defenses completely.
[You have slain "Bel'zar the Ravager" and gained 750,000 experience!]
Bel'zar's monstrous form crumbled to the ground, disappearing into ash as his essence was absorbed by the abyss itself.
The battle, while seemingly intense, had lasted only seconds in reality.
Stark smirked, satisfied but slightly disappointed, "I expected more," he said, looking at the fading ashes of Bel'zar.
None of these things were even a challenge, and the normal demons had only given him about 175,000 experience each, a surprisingly low number considering the rift's difficulty.
But in the end, experience was experience. He was growing stronger, and that's what mattered most.
[You have fully cleared the first zone!]
The system notification confirmed what Stark already knew: the first zone was done, and he was temporarily safe.
No more monsters could attack him here, allowing him to finally focus on the real prize: his skills and growth.
[Skill Points: 53]
"Nice," Stark murmured to himself, a grin spreading across his face.
After clearing the zone and with his recent level gains, especially from killing Olikar, he had earned a significant amount of skill points.
Not to mention the 11 levels Olikar had granted him, those alone had been a massive boost.
But there was something even more exciting.
[Class Wheel unlocked!]
It had felt like only a few days since he had unlocked the [Soul Wielder] class, but in reality, it had already been seven months.
Time was flying by, and his power was growing exponentially.
Before diving into his skill points, he noticed another message pop up.
[Level 100 Reached: Pick a Card!]
This was something he had been waiting for.
The opportunity to pick a new skill after being locked in by the twenty-level restriction was a huge milestone.
It felt like an eternity since he had gained a new ability that actually worked as 'Revenant's Fury' was… well… you know, it could only be used after he died three times.
[Revenant's Fury: 1/3]
"Five?" Stark raised an eyebrow as five glowing cards appeared in front of him.
Normally, there were only three cards.
Each card glowed with a golden aura, and a holy cross was engraved on their backs.
Stark could feel the divine power radiating from them, like they were calling out to him.
"Well, let's see what fate has in store," Stark muttered as he reached out and selected one of the cards at random.
The moment he touched the card, a sound echoed in his mind.
Ding!
[New Skill: Holy Infusion]
[Tier: Godly]
[Level: Cannot be leveled up, what more could there even be?]
[Description: The user can infuse their attacks with the power of holy energy, increasing the effectiveness of all offensive abilities on undead being. The holy aura will enhance both physical and magical attacks, causing additional damage to demonic and cursed entities.]
Stark's eyes widened in surprise, then quickly turned into a grin of satisfaction.
"A godly tier skill?" he said in awe, his excitement growing, "This is my second godly tier skill!"
The first had been [Crimson Soul], which had already served him well in countless battles.
And now, with [Holy Infusion], his strength would only skyrocket further against undeads!
With his new skill acquired, Stark moved on to his skill points.
The panel appeared before him, filled with his existing skills.
[Skills: Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv30; Focus lv30; Aura Smash lv30; Clone Frenzy lv30 (MAX); Invincible Dodge lv10; Double Assault lv10; Crimson Spears lv30; Heaven's Wrath lv5; Alchemist lv5; Potion Crafting lv5; Target Manipulation lv1; Dodge Control lv5; Crimson Ball Transmission lv5; EGO lv5; Crimson Purification lv25; Wielding Cross lv10; Crimson Healing lv70 (MAX); The Void; Banish; Domination Soul; Revenant's Fury; Holy Infusion]
It was a long list of powerful skills, and with 53 skill points, Stark could upgrade a few of them significantly.
But the decision wasn't easy.
He could either max out a few of his favorite abilities or spread the points across several skills to get more perks.
After a few moments of hesitation, Stark made his choice.
[You have upgraded 'Wielding Cross' to level 30 (Gold-Tier Max)!]
[You have upgraded 'Crimson Purification' to level 30 (Gold-Tier Max)!]
[You have upgraded 'Invincible Dodge' to level 30 (Gold-Tier Max)!]
He decided to focus on his most critical skills.
Both [Crimson Purification] and [Wielding Cross] had proven invaluable in battle, so maxing them out to their gold-tier limits was a no-brainer.
And as for [Invincible Dodge], then it could definitely use some enhancement!
Immediately, Stark felt the surge of power from the upgrades.
[Skill: Crimson Purification]
[New Perk: Divine Retribution (Legendary)]
[Description: When activating your crimson purification, there is a 20% chance that the purification now unleashes a secondary burst of holy energy!]
…
[Skill: Wielding Cross]
[New Perk: Holy Combo (Legendary)]
[Description: If you swing your strike twice in a row, the third strike will light up the cross with so much crimson aura that it will deal 200% damage and without fail stun enemies for five seconds!]
…
[Skill: Invincible Dodge]
[New Perk: The Ultimate Phantom]
[Description: When dodging, the user now creates three afterimages that confuse enemies, granting invulnerability for an additional 0.5 seconds, your dodges manoeuver are also enhanced, and you are granted a bigger timeframe to do.]
[You have truly become the greatest dodger]
…
The perks were nothing short of legendary, as expected.
Stark couldn't help but grin wider as he admired the results. These were the kinds of upgrades that made a real difference in the heat of battle.
Plus, [Invincible Dodge] reached its ultimate form too, meaning it couldn't be upgraded anymore, much like [Clone Frenzy].
It almost… felt sad, knowing that these skills that accompanied him since the beginning had reached their very limit.
With eight skill points left, Stark decided to save them for later.
He had made enough progress for now, and there would undoubtedly be more opportunities to invest in other skills.
But there was one more thing left to do.
[Level 100 reached: You can now spin the Class Wheel again!]
"Class Wheel!" Stark called out.
The wheel appeared before him, just as it always did. But this time, there were only three sections remaining.
[3 classes available: Magus, Beast Tamer, Incubus.]
The wheel had started with ten classes, but now, only three remained.
Stark had already acquired four classes and removed three, so the odds were more straightforward now.
Each section of the wheel was larger than before, and it seemed like fate was closing in on his next path.
"Alright... here goes nothing," Stark said as he reached for the lever labeled "Pull Me" and yanked it down.
The class wheel began to spin, the colors of each section flashing before his eyes.
"…"
Would it be the magic-infused path of the Magus? The wild, primal power of the Beast Tamer? Or the seductive and dark power of the Incubus?
The wheel slowed down, ticking with every moment, as Stark watched with anticipation...

chapters.title: Chapter 303 - 303: New Class: Incubus (Useless)
chapters.content:
Stark stood before the Class Wheel as it spun, the giant sections of Magus, Beast Tamer, and Incubus rotating before his eyes.
The anticipation built as the wheel slowed down, each passing second dragging on like an eternity.
His heart raced, though his face remained calm.
This was always a critical moment; choosing a class wasn't just about adding new skills or perks, it was about the power gained.
The wheel began to slow down further, first hovering over Beast Tamer, then nudging towards Magus. Stark's eyes narrowed, but there was nothing he could do to influence the outcome.
And then... it clicked.
[You have obtained the "Incubus" class! Congratulations!]
Stark blinked, unsure of what to think at first.
Incubus?
[You can spin the wheel again at level 150!]
That part was new. Before, he had been allowed to spin the wheel every 25 levels, but now the gap was 50 levels. Stark couldn't help but smirk.
"Guess the challenges are getting harder," he muttered, "Well, let's check this out."
Stark accessed his newly acquired class.
…
[Class: Incubus]
[Description: Control the desires and emotions of others through your allure. You can drain energy from your victims through physical contact, often in combat situations to weaken foes and strengthen yourself. While many of this class use their charm for manipulation or luxury, the true power lies in turning desires into a weapon.]
[Class Effect: Heightened charisma and emotional manipulation.]
[Class Flaw: Your power depends on how much influence you have over others. In some cases, strength isn't enough to control a situation.]
Stark raised an eyebrow. It wasn't a class built for pure combat!
He could see how that might be useful in certain situations, but his fighting style didn't exactly line up with 'charm'.
But then the system interrupted.
[Domination won't bother absorbing a class that isn't combat-oriented. Just use it for something else, host, if you know what I mean.]
Stark couldn't help but laugh, "Yeah, not really my thing."
After all, Stark gets absolutely ZERO play other than Lana, so yeah.
[You have been granted a basic skill!]
Stark read the new ability.
…
[Skill: Enrapture]
[Tier: Legendary]
[Description: Only works on female foes, but you can use that skill to increase your charm and make them lose focus for a bit. Outside of combat, it enhances the user's charm and allure, making interactions more favorable.]
…
"Well, that's... something," Stark said, scratching the back of his head.
He could weaken opponents just by making them lose focus, which could be useful in larger fights, but overall… it was… mid.
It was mainly for 'outside' use anyway…
Satisfied for now, he pulled up his status window to check his stats:
….
[Level:] 100
[Health:] 103500/103500
[Bloodline:] Human; Incubus
[Classes:] Domination; Alchemist; Exorcist (Absorbed by Domination); Soul Wielder (Absorbed); Incubus
[Talent:] Chosen One
[Attributes:] Strength 16471; Speed 17362; Mind/Soul 15362; Stamina 11382; Defense 18374
[Skills:] Spatial Inventory; Class Wheel; Perception; Domination lv30; Focus lv30; Aura Smash lv30; Clone Frenzy lv30 (MAX); Invincible Dodge lv30 (MAX); Double Assault lv10; Crimson Spears lv30; Heaven's Wrath lv5; Alchemist lv5; Potion Crafting lv5; Target Manipulation lv1; Dodge Control lv5; Crimson Ball Transmission lv5; Domi-Chains Restrain lvl1; EGO lv5; Crimson Purification lv30; Wielding Cross lv30; Crimson Healing lv70 (MAX); The Void; Banish; Domination Soul; Revenant's Fury; Holy Infusion; Enrapture lv1…
…
With his stats in place and no further distractions, it was time to move forward.
[Welcome to Zone 2: The Abyssal Caverns]
Stark stepped into the second zone of the Devil's Abyss.
The ground was made of black, jagged rocks, and the air was thick with demonic aura.
The entire place seemed to pulsate with dark energy, and eerie red eyes glowed in the distance, much more in number than in the first zone.
"Damn, going deeper in hell…" Stark laughed.
Demons of varying sizes and forms wandered the landscape.
Most had grotesque, hulking bodies, and their eyes were locked onto Stark the moment he entered the zone; without hesitation, they charged.
"Alright, let's see what you've got," Stark said, his eyes glowing crimson as he activated Holy Infusion to test the skill out.
With a surge of energy, his fists were wrapped in a divine, radiant light that mixed with his crimson aura.
All his skills were now infused with the holy aura!
"Aura Smash… SPAM!"
[Description: Instead of summoning 5 fists to either send them at your enemies or merging them to do immense damage, you can instead decide to separate these fists into five distinct ones too, meaning 25 crimson fists.]
He sent dozens of fists toward the monsters, killing many thanks to the explosion that followed every impact.
"They're weaker than I thought," Stark muttered, watching the demons fall one after the other. He barely needed to exert himself.
As he charged through the Abyssal Caverns, more demons appeared, but none of them posed a real threat.
Stark moved like a whirlwind, using Crimson Spears too infused with holy energy, piercing through multiple enemies with each throw.
The demons tried to swarm him, but he was too fast, his strength far superior to theirs.
And even when fifty of them all dashed at him, he just exorcised them all with [Crimson Purification].
Exorcist was truly the greatest skill in such a situation, and Stark felt happy he got it early enough to be able to get all those skills with it now.
Before long, he received the notification.
[Your level has increased to level 101, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
He pushed forward, hunting down every last demon in his path.
The ease with which he smashed them down was almost disappointing.
He had expected more from a Determination difficulty rift.
Then, as he approached the edge of the second zone, he felt it: a powerful aura. This was different from the lesser demons.
Stark slowed down, his instincts kicking in as he prepared for a real fight now.
It was the second elite!
A hulking figure stepped out from the shadows. Its massive horns scraped the ceiling of the cavern, and its eyes burned with malice. Its body was covered in obsidian armor, and the ground trembled beneath its feet.
[Name: Mal'gor the Obliterator (Elite)]
[Level: 325]
[HP: 1,800,000]
[Strength: 18452]
[Stamina: 15450]
[Speed: 20532]
[Defense: 17024]
[Skills: Obliteration Strike, Hellstorm, Crushing Wave, Demon Rage, Blood Vortex, Dark Barrier, Void Step]
Stark's eyes narrowed as he read the stats.
This was going to be an interesting fight.
Without hesitation, Mal'gor roared, charging at him with terrifying speed for a creature of its size. Stark sidestepped the initial attack, his body moving with precision, and he countered with Wielding Cross. The giant crimson-and-holy cross appeared above him, and Stark swung it down with both hands.
The impact was devastating. Mal'gor's armor shattered, and his health bar dropped by a third from the first strike alone.
Roaring in pain, Mal'gor tried to retaliate with Obliteration Strike, a dark energy-infused attack.
But Stark was faster, using Invincible Dodge to avoid the blow and land another hit with the Wielding Cross, almost completely draining the elite demon's health.
"RAAGRHHH!"
Mal'gor tried to smash Stark down, but surprisingly, the boy was more focused on something else: his cross was now glowing.
[Holy Combo is now activated, hit your enemy to cause 200% damage and without fail stun enemies for five seconds!]
The demon tried to attack, but Stark swung his cross upward, absolutely destroying the demon's hand and reaching its head.
BOOM!
-1,448,482!
It was the first time his damage output had gone over 1 million!
[You have slain "Mal'gor the Obliterator" and gained 900,000 experience!]
[Your level has increased to level 102, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
Fighting hundreds of demons, no matter how little experience they gave, still allowed you to level up!
[You have full cleared the second zone!]
With the second zone now behind him, Stark felt the power surging through him as he grew stronger.
The next zones would be even more challenging, but for now, he was ready for whatever came next.
He looked toward the path ahead, the entrance to the third zone looming in the distance.
"Let's see what's waiting for me in there," Stark muttered, a smirk forming on his face as he took his first step toward the deeper levels of the Devil's Abyss, "Oh wait!"
But before doing any of that, Stark returned inside the second zone.
"Ah… there it is," he smiled.
In front of him were the [Devil Flowers] the chairman had asked him and the students to take.
He took 9 of them just in case Lana and Sora struggled, though he was the latter would have no problem, then put them inside his [Spatial Inventory].
After that small break though, he immediately returned to what he was doing.

chapters.title: Chapter 304 - 304: Sweeping Through the Devil's Abyss
chapters.content:
The third zone of the Devil's Abyss unfolded before Stark like a vast underworld wasteland as now there were even volcanos in the distance, each of them letting out a ton of lava.
"Damn," it became difficult to even breathe as the smoke and scent hit the boy's nose, but Stark still kept going.
From a distance, Stark could see the new breed of demons awaiting him. Their forms were more grotesque and intimidating, their presence exuding an aura of impending death.
Stark cracked his knuckles, his eyes gleaming with excitement, "Let's see what you've got."
The first wave of demons rushed him almost immediately.
These creatures were known as Hellfang Brutes, towering figures with thick, armor-like skin and jagged claws that dripped with dark energy.
Their eyes glowed a sinister red, and they moved with surprising agility, locking in onto Stark the moment he appeared before them.
He was basically intruding hell, after all, wasn't he?
But Stark barely blinked as they closed in, their snarls filling the air.
He didn't hesitate.
Summoning his crimson energy, Stark infused his fists with Holy Infusion, combining his own overwhelming aura with divine power.
As the first brute lunged, he sidestepped and delivered a single, explosive Aura Smash to its chest.
The holy energy coursed through the demon, shattering its defenses and causing it to explode in a burst of light.
One down, but more were on their way.
Not gonna lie, they were taken care of in under three minutes.
The next wave consisted of Voidshriekers, winged demons that hovered in the air and spat corrosive black energy from their mouths.
They were faster than the brutes, their attacks more ranged, but Stark didn't falter.
He summoned Crimson Spears and used "Spam" from Aura Smash to aim at the flying Voidshrekers, enhancing each one with Holy Infusion and launching them into the air.
The spears and fists tore through the Voidshriekers like divine lightning, burning through their wings and sending them crashing into the ground.
"Too easy," Stark muttered, his smirk growing.
As Stark pressed deeper into the zone, the demons began to grow stronger, and their forms more twisted.
"I am the legitimate doom slay-" Stark tried to laugh, but he was struck by lightning.
-100!
"Damn."
The next set of enemies was a terrifying hybrid of the previous ones: Hellshriek Berserkers.
These demons were both large and fast, their bodies covered in thick plates of armor, while wings allowed them to dash across the battlefield in quick bursts.
They wielded massive, molten swords, each swing powerful enough to split the ground.
Stark darted between them, his movements a blur as he dodged their attacks with ease, using Invincible Dodge to weave in and out of their strikes.
When the opportunity presented itself, he would land a devastating blow ismply by using his fists, two to three punches enough to kill them.
Despite their increased strength and speed, they were no match for him.
[Your level has increased to level 103, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
The sound of his leveling up didn't surprise Stark anymore as, well, he was killing hundreds of demons at this point.
The third zone was actually the one that introduced the highest amount of demon types, advancing one after the other toward him.
When he reached the edge, there was a massive horde of them, at least 500, from each and every type waiting for him.
"Kill… human…"
"KILL! KILL! KILL!"
"We got the human!"
All of them looked like they were waiting to ambush him, but Stark wasn't scared.
He wiped some of the blood on his face with his finger and looked at them with a smile.
"Alright, let's see who's going to go."
10 minutes later, all of the demons were dead.
[Your level has increased to level 104, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Your level has increased to level 105, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
But as he defeated the last of the demons, the ground trembled beneath him, signaling the approach of something much larger.
Stark braced himself, eyes scanning the horizon as the final creature of the zone appeared—an enormous, fire-spewing Dread Infernal.
The Dread Infernal stood at least twenty feet tall, its body wreathed in hellfire, and its hands crackling with molten energy.
It stomped forward with thunderous steps, its gaze locking onto Stark with an intensity that sent ripples through the air.
Despite its terrifying appearance, Stark was unfazed.
"Not gonna lie, dude, if you were smart you would have come while your teammates were ambushing me," Stark spoke, though he didn't know if that thing could understand him.
With a surge of energy, Stark charged at the Dread Infernal, dodging its initial barrage of fireballs.
He closed the distance and summoned his [Wielding Cross] AGAIN, and slammed the massive crimson-and-holy cross down on the demon's fiery body.
The blow caused the Dread Infernal to stagger, chunks of molten rock breaking off its form as it roared in pain.
The battle was fierce, with the Dread Infernal launching wave after wave of projectiles and energy at Stark, forcing him to dodge with precision.
But Stark with a single movement of his hands summoned the [Spear of Judgement], which followed the elite around and drilled into its body, killing it instantly.
-938,372!
[You have slain the Dread Infernal! You gained 1,200,000 experience!]
[You have full cleared the third zone!]
[Zone 4: The Hellforge Plateau]
This zone wasn't even that hard compared to the last one to be honest, it was pretty much the same demons except for the introduction of another type: the Hellforge Guardians.
They were monstrous golems made of molten metal, with burning swords the size of a small building.
Their bodies glowed with the heat of a forge, and each step they took left behind a trail of molten lava. The heat in the air was intense, but Stark didn't flinch.
He dodged their swings with Invincible Dodge and retaliated with Aura Smash, each strike infused with his holy energy, cracking through their defenses.
At this point, there wasn't even a point of using any skills beside [Aura Smash] and [Crimson Spears] (infused with Holy Infusion), as well as [Crimson Purification] and [Wielding Cross].
The battle was longer, but Stark's skills and power were overwhelming.
One by one, the Hellforge Guardians fell, their bodies crumbling into molten debris.
[Your level has increased to level 106, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
Despite the ever-growing strength of the demons, Stark continued pushing through.
The fourth zone was challenging, but Stark cleared it with relentless efficiency.
Crimson Purification was still his most effective weapon, but even when the demons resisted, he adapted, combining his skills to break through their defenses.
The elite wasn't even a challenge to be honest, as he just used [Holy Combo] from [Wielding Cross] to kill it on the third strike.
And so, he moved to the fifth and final zone.
[Zone 5: The Abyssal Core]
As he entered the fifth zone, Stark could feel the energy shift.
"Blah blah whatever," Stark sighed as he killed a demon after the other.
He even encountered a new type of demons! Woohoo!
The Abyssal Fiends were huge, hulking demons with glowing red veins all over their bodies.
They were also fodder to his holy attacks, though, not that different from the others in that regard.
And then, as he reached the heart of the zone, he came face to face with the final boss
[Name: First Abyss Commander, Vorak the Destroyer (Calamity)]
[Level: 400]
[HP: 2,300,000]
"Foolish human, don't you realize that even defeating all these demons is nothing?" Vorak laughed, "For I am the strongest of the abyss!"
Vorak stood towering above Stark, his body covered in jagged spikes and molten armor.
His eyes glowed with a deep, crimson light, and he let out a thunderous roar as he swung his massive, lava-forged axe toward Stark.
The battle was brutal, Vorak's hits causing shockwaves with every swing.
Stark dodged most of them, but when he tried to dash toward him to the boss to take it down with his fists, an axe swing took him off guard.
"Flash Axe," Vorak used his skill, launching an INSTANTANEOUS attack.
"Damn, you're tougher than the others," Stark muttered, but his smile didn't fade.
Crimson Purification… PROTECTION BURST!
[Upon activating this perk, a powerful aura of holy energy envelops the user, shielding him from the attacks of undead creatures for a brief 10-second window. During this time, any undead assaults against him are reduced by a staggering 95% in damage.]
BOOM!
He was slammed by the axe, but received only 743point of damage, which was quite literally nothing.
"Huh," Vorak was confused, but before he could even say something else, the crimson cross already hit him.
[You have slain "Vorak the Destroyer"! You gained 3,800,000 experience!]
As the giant demon crumbled, Stark stood victorious, unharmed.
[Congratulations, you have completed the 'Devil's Abyss!']
And as Vorak was technically the final boss of the rift, then the panel appeared.
"Yeah, no," but Stark wasn't convinced.
It was just like the colosseum: surely there was somewhere where he could find the apostles, the three probably looking and laughing at him right now.
But as the giant demon crumbled, Stark stood victorious, his body bruised but his spirit unbroken.
In front of him, a path revealed itself, but it was locked, a glowing symbol of a key hovering over it.
"..." Stark smiled, realizing that this was where he needed to go.

chapters.title: Chapter 305 - 305: Secret Area, The Three Devil Apostles
chapters.content:
[One is used to open the rift, thus breaking, and the other… can be used to open the secret area, leading to the apostles.]
Meaning that waiting for other people to find the rift had saved Stark a huge amount of time to find whoever owned the second key!
"Well, doesn't matter," the entire rift was silent now.
Click!
He pulled out the key from his [Spatial Inventory] and placed it in front of the aura barrier.
[Do you want to use the 'Devil's Abyss Key'?]
"Yeah."
As the key turned, the barrier pulsed with energy, rippling like the surface of water.
Then, with a soft click, it dissipated entirely, revealing a massive stone doorway beyond.
The air around it was oppressive, thick with the weight of demonic energy, but Stark barely flinched.
His excitement only grew as he stepped forward, eager to see what awaited him in this secret, unexplored part of the rift.
[Sixth Zone: The Doors of Hell]
The zone before him was unlike anything he had seen so far in the abyss.
Stark found himself standing in a vast stone chamber, dimly lit by glowing red runes that ran across the walls and floor.
At the far end of the chamber stood three massive doors, each one carved in the likeness of something terrifying.
The first door bore the face of a monstrous figure, humanoid but twisted, with burning red eyes and horns that curled back like a ram's.
Stark could feel the raw power emanating from it, the air around it thick with malevolent energy.
The second door was a grotesque three-headed dog, its snarling mouths wide open, ready to devour anything that came near.
The demonic energy radiating from the door was suffocating, as if the beast behind it was ready to tear him apart.
The third door was adorned with the visage of a cruel, skeletal figure, its face hidden beneath a tattered hood, eyes glowing with a ghostly light. It seemed to represent death itself, the aura cold and foreboding, sending a chill down Stark's spine.
"Hm…" Stark muttered to himself, rubbing his chin thoughtfully.
The whole setup reminded him of the first Domination trial, where he had to defeat the guardians before battling the Mirror Master.
But there was a difference now: he had grown far stronger, had faced down an apostle stronger than they are, and even crushed Olikar.
"If it's like that trial, this should be a piece of cake," Stark said confidently, cracking his knuckles, "I mean, Olikar was level 400 and in his final form was more like a level 500, so—"
He didn't get to finish his thought.
In an instant, the three doors glowed fiercely, and three figures materialized in front of him, each resembling the carvings on the doors.
The first one was the demonic figure, tall and imposing, his skin a charred black, horns curling back from his skull.
His burning eyes narrowed as he looked at Stark, exuding an aura of immense power.
"Hm…" the demon rumbled, his deep voice reverberating in the chamber, "It seems he's really here."
Beside him stood Cerberus, or at least a monstrous, fiery manifestation of it.
The three-headed beast growled, its massive form bristling with demonic energy, each of its heads snarling in unison as its eyes locked onto Stark.
And finally, the skeletal figure, draped in tattered robes, floated silently.
His glowing eyes flickered with an eerie light as he gave Stark a chilling smile.
"Heh," the skeletal figure chuckled, "The chosen one himself."
Stark sized them up quickly, his confidence unwavering, "Alright," he said, taking a fighting stance, "I'll take you all one by one. Let's get this over with."
The apostles exchanged glances before they all burst into laughter, their voices echoing in the vast chamber.
"Foolish mortal," the demon said with a grin, "Do you really think we'll fight you one by one?"
With a single snap of his fingers, the entire chamber rumbled, and the three doors that Stark had assumed were individual entrances began to merge.
The stone groaned and cracked as they fused into one massive, towering gateway, with all three apostles' faces now carved into its frame, their malevolent visages glaring down at him.
Stark cursed under his breath, "Damn."
Fighting them one-on-one had been his plan, and he had been certain he could handle each apostle separately.
But if they were joining forces, this was going to be much more difficult.
Three apostles fighting together meant their combined power would exceed even that of Olikar.
For a moment, Stark considered retreating, maybe waiting to grow stronger.
But then he remembered something important: there was no way out. as he was stuck in the apostles' trap.
All the monsters in the previous zones were dead, and this was the only path forward.
"Oh, well," Stark sighed, rolling his shoulders, "Guess I'm going through."
He stepped toward the door, the energy around it thick and oppressive.
The three apostles, their spectral forms still standing before him, watched with twisted smiles as he approached.
The air crackled with dark energy, and as Stark placed his hand on the door, a series of system panels appeared around him, flashing ominous messages.
[The Apostles of Hell have been awakened.]
[Proceed at your own risk.]
[Do you still wish to continue?]
Stark grinned at the last message, "Like I have a choice."
He pressed forward, and the door slowly began to open, grinding against the stone with a deafening sound.
Flames erupted from the edges as the entrance to Hell revealed itself.
A massive chamber lay beyond, its size immeasurable, filled with rivers of lava and jagged mountains of black stone.
And in the distance, he could see them.
[Final Destination: Hell]
[Good luck!]
The three apostles—now in their true forms—stood at the far end of the chamber, their eyes locked onto Stark as he approached.
The demon from the first door, now revealed as Valgorth the Desolator, cracked his knuckles, his charred skin smoldering with embers.
His presence alone seemed to distort the space around him, making the air heavy and hard to breathe.
Beside him, Cerberus, the massive three-headed beast, growled low, each head snapping and snarling with anticipation.
Its body was covered in molten chains, each link glowing red-hot, and lava dripped from its jaws, sizzling as it hit the ground.
And finally, the skeletal figure, now revealed as Malthus the Death Devil, hovered silently, his tattered robes billowing in a non-existent wind.
He gripped a massive scythe, its blade glowing with a sickly green light that radiated death and decay.
Stark paused for a moment, taking in the sight before him.
He had fought through countless demons, defeated apostles, and now, the culmination of his journey in the Devil's Abyss was right in front of him.
"Well," Stark said, cracking his neck, "time to show you guys why I'm not to be messed with."
Without another word, he surged forward, his aura flaring as he activated Holy Infusion.
His body lit up with divine energy, and he summoned Crimson Spears and Aura Smash.
Valgorth was the first to move, lunging forward with terrifying speed, his massive fist aimed directly at Stark's head.
Stark dodged, barely avoiding the strike, and retaliated with a flurry of Crimson Spears, each one enhanced with holy energy.
The spears struck Valgorth's chest, but the apostle shrugged them off, his smoldering skin absorbing the blows.
"Nice try, but my body adapted to receiving divine attacks!"
"The fuck?" Stark raised his eyebrows.
As Valgorth backed away, Cerberus charged in, its three heads snapping at Stark with deadly precision.
Stark leapt into the air, dodging the beast's massive jaws, and summoned Wielding Cross, the enormous, glowing cross appearing above him.
He swung it down with all his might, smashing it into Cerberus's back, causing the beast to howl in pain as its molten chains shattered.
-457,374!
But before he could land another blow, Malthus joined the party, his scythe cutting through the air with a bone-chilling sound.
Stark barely managed to block the strike, the force of the blow sending him skidding across the ground.
-7361!
"Damn," Stark grunted, his arms shaking from the impact as he used them to do a back flip and recover.
The apostles began to close in on him at the same time, their combined power overwhelming.
But Stark wasn't done yet. Summoning all his strength, he began to charge a, [Energy Ball] between his two hands, readying it for the impact.
For a moment, the chamber was filled with light, but the apostles didn't stagger as they kept marching, their forms flickering because of his aura, yet their determination just as strong as his.
"This is gonna be fun," he muttered to himself, "I've been waiting to clear this stupid for a year now."
"Judicator had the key didn't he?" Valgorth spoke to his companions, but mainly Matlhus since, well, Cerberus couldn't really talk.
"Yeah, wouldn't have trusted him with that if I knew he would die so easily, but at least a year later it brings the human to us so that we can kill him."
"Lord Godless will surely reward us…"
And so, all the apostles smiled.

chapters.title: Chapter 306 - 306: Three Apostles VS One Human
chapters.content:
[6th Apostle: Valgorth the Desolator]
[7th Apostle: Cerberus, The Protector of Hell]
[8th apostle: Malthus the Death Devil]
And though they had different placements in the [ApostleDex], each of them was level 375!
The massive chamber hummed with ominous energy as Stark's eyes flicked between the three apostles standing before him, their combined presence causing the very air to feel oppressive.
He immediately used [Perception], and it didn't take him long to pull up their status windows as he prepared for battle.
…
[Name: Valgorth, the Desolator]
[Level: 375]
[HP: 1,820,000/1,820,000]
[Strength: 16,500]
[Stamina: 15,900]
[Speed: 13,200]
[Defense: 17,000]
[Skills: Desolating Fist; Inferno Crush; Hellfire Aura; Dark Dominion; Demonic Charge; Earthshatter Blow; Titan's Rampage; Wrath of Valgorth; Hellbound Shackles (MYTHICAL)]
…
[Name: Cerberus, The Protector of Hell]
[Level: 375]
[HP: 1,292,626/1,750,000]
[Strength: 17,000]
[Stamina: 17,500]
[Speed: 12,800]
[Defense: 18,000]
[Skills: Triple Fang; Infernal Chains; Cerberus Howl; Flame Whip; Molten Fury; Hound's Charge; Underworld Sentinel; Guardian's Wrath; Cerberus's Bite (MYTHICAL)]
…
[Name: Malthus, the Death Devil]
[Level: 375]
[HP: 1,650,000/1,650,000]
[Strength: 14,800]
[Stamina: 15,200]
[Speed: 14,000]
[Defense: 16,500]
[Skills: Soul Cleaver; Reaper's Dance; Death Aura; Wailing Scythe; Spectral Strike; Undying Presence; Soul Drain; Phantom Blink; Death's Embrace (MYTHICAL); Blackened Harvest (GODLY)]
…
Stark's heart raced as he processed the stats in front of him.
Even though each of the apostles was just slightly weaker than Olikar, fighting all three of them at once was a different beast altogether.
"Damn," Stark muttered, wiping a bead of sweat from his brow, "Didn't think it would be this… complicated."
But there was no turning back now.
This was the challenge he had been preparing for all along, and hesitation wasn't part of his choices.
He charged up a Crimson Purification energy ball, gathering divine light into his palm.
It hummed with raw power as he prepared to hurl it at the apostles, and when he did, expecting it to do serious damage…
Slash! Fwish!
The ball disintegrated in an instant, sliced cleanly by Malthus's scythe before it reached them.
"Divine light is nothing before the power of the Death Devil," Malthus said coldly, his skeletal grin widening as his weapon gleamed in the chamber's dim light.
Stark blinked, momentarily thrown off, "Well, that's new."
Before he could recover, Valgorth roared and charged forward with terrifying speed, his massive body crashing toward Stark like a speeding boulder.
"Desolating Fist!"
The apostle's fist, surrounded by a dark, molten aura, smashed into the ground where Stark had been standing.
The force of the blow sent cracks spider-webbing through the stone floor, and the shockwave threw Stark backward.
-17472!
He barely managed to roll to his feet, gasping as he felt the impact of the attack in his bones.
Cerberus followed up immediately, bounding toward him on massive paws that left smoldering prints in the ground.
All three heads snarled as it leapt into the air, its claws slashing at Stark with terrifying speed.
"Crimson Spears!" Stark shouted, summoning five spears of crimson energy to block the incoming attack.
He grabbed the spears, using them to deflect the monstrous claws of the three-headed beast.
The force of the impact sent him sliding back, his feet digging into the ground.
"Not enough," Stark growled, as he tried to gain distance.
He jumped back, activating Crimson Ball Transmission to throw the ball at the other edge of the chamber and teleporting a few feet away to give himself a moment to breathe right as Malthus slashed with his scythe were Stark was.
But the apostles weren't giving him any time.
"Hound's Charge!" Cerberus howled, rushing him with blistering speed, while Malthus blinked out of sight, reappearing just behind Stark with another chilling scythe slash.
Stark barely managed to dodge the strike with Invincible Dodge, his body moving at surreal speeds to evade the deadly attack.
He rolled forward and avoided Valgorth's follow-up [Inferno Crush], the molten fists of the apostle crashing into the ground where he'd been only a split second ago.
'These guys are relentless!' Stark thought, as he summoned his Crimson Fists, infusing them with [Holy Energy]
He activated Aura Smash: Merge, pulling all five fists together to create a crimson storm of energy around him.
The swirling vortex sucked in debris and energy as it expanded more and more, yet both Cerberus and Valgorth charged into the storm undeterred.
"Titan's Rampage!" Valgorth's body glowed with a dark aura as he barreled through the crimson storm, slamming into Stark with brutal force.
"GARGH-"
-23381!
At the same time, Cerberus's Bite struck from the side, its three heads snapping at Stark in unison.
-10245! -13261! -12921!
[Stark HP: 40359/125000]
Stark gritted his teeth and activated Double Assault, doubling his stats for a brief 20 seconds.
His body surged with power as he retaliated with Crimson Spears: Spear of Judgement, summoning a massive, glowing crimson spear that locked onto Cerberus and pierced its defenses.
The spear detonated on impact, sending a shockwave through the chamber as the beast howled in pain.
-231938! -238274! -258315! (since it three heads so triple the damage because of the explosion).
But before Stark could capitalize on his momentary victory, Malthus appeared once more, swinging his scythe with deadly precision.
"Death's Embrace!"
The scythe connected with Stark's side, cutting through his aura and drawing blood.
Stark gasped as the deathly energy sapped his strength, leaving him momentarily paralyzed as the death devil grinned.
-33472!
"Your end is near," Malthus whispered coldly.
"Not… yet!" Stark growled, activating his aura to push the scythe and spin in the air to kick the apostle away, making him crash against the ground.
-103739!
He could feel the pressure building.
Every attack from the apostles was overwhelming, each one perfectly synchronized to corner him.
His Invincible Dodge bought him brief moments of respite, but he was running out of options.
Suddenly, Cerberus roared, launching an attack with Abyssal Devourer.
Its three heads glowed with demonic energy as it lunged forward, jaws wide, intending to crush Stark in one bite.
Stark threw out his Domination Soul, his crimson heart slamming into Cerberus and then sending [Domi-Chain Restrain] on it.
-273612!
The beast roared in defiance, but Stark wasn't done.
He focused his energy, merging the chains tighter and tighter, causing the three-headed monster to writhe in pain.
But as Stark tried to restrain Cerberus, both Valgorth and Malthus closed in from either side.
"Hellfire Aura!"
"Blackened Harvest!"
Flames erupted around Stark, burning with demonic fury as Valgorth unleashed his hellfire aura.
At the same time, Malthus summoned a wave of spectral hands that clawed at Stark's body, draining his life force with each touch.
Stark roared as his health dropped dangerously low.
His body was battered and burned, the relentless onslaught of attacks leaving him with barely a fraction of his health remaining.
His vision blurred.
He could barely stand.
The apostles towered over him, ready to deliver the final blow.
[HP: 1/125000]
But suddenly…
[Crimson Healing activated, Full Health restored.]
Crimson Healing activated, bathing Stark in a burst of restorative energy. His health surged back to full, his body glowing with crimson light as he stood up, completely back to full health.
"Guess I'm not done yet," he muttered through gritted teeth, smiling at the apostles.
The apostles snarled, they knew it wouldn't be this easy.
They regrouped, their eyes glowing with murderous intent.
And then… Stark did something weird: he looked to his right, at one of the corners of the room.
"5 seconds…" he mumbled.
As the apostles began to converge on him for one final, combined assault, Stark tried to slam his [Soul Heart] at Valgorth.
Then he launched a barrage of Crimson Spears at Malthus, forcing him to dodge while he leapt backward, putting distance between himself and Cerberus's snapping jaws.
3 seconds.
Sweat dripped down Stark's face as he continued to dodge and weave through their attacks.
2 seconds.
Surprisingly, though, he didn't feel tired, not at all.
1 seconds.
The apostles roared as they prepared their ultimate abilities, demonic energy swirling around them.
0 seconds.
A grin split Stark's face as his Ultimate Clone finally activated.
The reason he had teleported to the edge of the chamber with [Crimson Ball Transmission] was to secretly place his [Ultimate Clone], doing everything in his power to get the apostles' full attention.
And it worked!
[The Ultimate Clone has been summoned.]
"Let's turn the tables, now," he grinned so mischievously the apostles were taken aback.
"What the hell?" the apostles saw the clone teleport right next the original Stark using its very own [Crimson Ball Transmission].
"=)" it smiled at them, as if mocking them for their stupidity.
"WON'T CHANGE A THING HUMAN," Valgorth positioned himself, taking the fight seriously.
"It is but futile… die… it will beautiful," and Malthus span his sight before pointing it at the two opponents.
"Grrrsskkrr…" Cerberus on the other hand was ready to attack at any point.
"Well, what are you waiting for," Stark laughed!

chapters.title: Chapter 307 - 307: Cerberus is Defeated, Two Remain
chapters.content:
The battle inside the hellish chamber continued with unrelenting intensity.
The air was thick with raw energy as the three apostles closed in on Stark.
He stood at the center, breathing heavily, his body faintly glowing from the aftereffects of Crimson Healing.
The Ultimate Clone was beside him, ready to act at any moment, but the apostles showed no signs of letting up. Stark knew they were only moments away from victory if he faltered.
Cerberus growled, the sound vibrating through the ground like deep thunder.
Each of its three heads snapped aggressively, molten saliva dripping from its snarling mouths.
Stark's gaze shifted to the giant beast.
He could feel it—Cerberus was weakening as he was the one Stark focused the most on. Its defenses had taken a beating, and if Stark was going to finish this, now was the time.
[Cerberus HP: 290,487/1,750,000]
With a swift motion, Stark summoned another barrage of Crimson Spears, sending the glowing projectiles flying toward the colossal hound. The air crackled as the spears closed in.
-45,000! -46,500! -47,300!
The spears pierced through Cerberus's tough, leathery hide, making the beast stagger back with a howl of pain.
Its health was dropping fast, but it still wasn't out of the fight.
"Flame Whip!" roared the central head of Cerberus, summoning a blazing chain of fire that lashed out toward Stark with terrifying speed.
Stark barely managed to dodge the first strike, rolling to the side with Invincible Dodge. His clone also shifted out of harm's way.
"Is that all," Stark audibly laughed as he saw the three apostles still walking toward him, confidence visible on their faces, as if they knew victory was close.
And Stark knew that reviving wouldn't work on them, as they had seen him do it against the guardian ape, meaning that even if two forgot, another wouldn't.
"Crimson Ball Transmission!" he commanded, teleporting himself behind Cerberus in an instant.
With a roar of determination, Stark summoned his Domination Soul, the glowing crimson heart appearing in his hand, a familiar =] face etched into its surface.
Chains shot out from it, which Stark grabbed to wield the soul perfectly.
[You can use your chains to bind enemies, but this is risky]
Suddenly, a panel appeared in front of Stark.
"So... basically like Domi-Chain Restrain...?" his chain broke since he had tried to use on Cerberus.
[Yeah.]
"Heh... let's try then."
Chains shot out from the crimson heart, wrapping tightly around Cerberus's legs and necks, binding the monstrous hound in place.
Cerberus roared and thrashed violently, trying to break free, but Stark refused to give in. "Not this time!" he shouted, pulling the chains even tighter.
"Spear of Judgement!" Stark summoned a massive, glowing crimson spear, crackling with divine energy.
He aimed it directly at Cerberus, who struggled helplessly in its bindings.
The spear shot forward like lightning, impaling the center head of the beast.
-123,384!
That thing only had around 20000 HP left!
Cerberus let out an ear-splitting cry as the spear erupted within its skull. Blood and molten fire spewed from the wound, and the middle head went limp, lifeless.
The two remaining heads growled and snapped, but their strength was fading fast.
Suddenly, Valgorth charged at Stark from behind, his enormous fist glowing with a fiery aura.
"Inferno Crush!" The ground trembled as Valgorth's massive fist slammed down, barely missing Stark as he dodged at the last second.
Even so, the impact sent a shockwave that hurled him across the chamber.
-42,372!
Stark hit the wall hard, grunting as he felt the sharp pain in his ribs. He tasted blood in his mouth but pushed himself back to his feet. Cerberus was almost done for—he couldn't afford to stop now.
In a flash, Malthus appeared before him, swinging his deadly scythe in a wide arc. "Soul Cleaver!"
Stark raised his fists to block, but the scythe cut through his defenses with terrifying ease. The cold steel grazed his arm, leaving a deep cut that sapped his strength.
-31,231!
He hissed in pain, but as the scythe came for another deadly strike, he immediately activated [Crimson Purification]'s [Protection Burst], which reduced 95% of damage received by undead beings for 10 seconds!
-1547!
He received no damage.
"???" and so while the reaper was taken aback, he immediately took his chance.
"Crimson Purification!" he shouted, focusing divine energy which shot out from his body.
"Foolish," Malthus used his scythe's special power which cut the divine energy.
But... Stark had never aimed for him at all: he was aiming at Cerberus!
-175,376!
The blast shattered through the remaining two heads of the hellish beast.
With a final, anguished howl, Cerberus collapsed. Its enormous body slumped against the molten ground, its once fearsome flames flickering out.
[Cerberus, The Protector of Hell: Defeated!]
Stark exhaled heavily, relief washing over him for just a moment.
But right as Malthus was about to attack, he was surprised by a second shockwave of holy aura from Stark!
[Ding! Divine Retribution activated!]
[Description: When activating your crimson purification, there is a 20% chance that the purification now unleashes a secondary burst of holy energy!]
Malthus was immediately hit, unable to counter with his scythe again to cut the divine energy, and so he received it, sending him flying!
BOOM!
-231,388!
But there was no time to rest. Valgorth and Malthus still stood back, both almost full health, not seeming weakened again at all.
He glanced at his clone, and it just smiled at him.
"Not bad, human," Valgorth growled, his voice rumbling with menace. "But killing the hound won't save you."
"We'll see about that," Stark retorted, wiping the blood from his mouth.
Valgorth charged once more, his fists glowing with dark, pulsating energy. He swung with all his might.
"Titan's Rampage!"
Stark braced himself, using [Double Assault] to increase his stats for 20 seconds and thus deflecting the blows from the calamity apostle.
-7426! -7847
The hits still hurt a little bit, but Stark held his ground. Then hurled a Crimson Spear with [Holy Infusion] directly at Valgorth's chest.
-114,832!
[Valgorth HP: 1,601,429/1,820,000]
Valgorth howled in agony as the spear tore through his body, his health plummeting, but not enough for him to be in danger.
Malthus lunged toward Stark, his scythe glowing with deadly black energy. Stark dodged the first swing, but the second strike cut across his shoulder.
-22,833!
[Stark HP: 11744/125000]
Stark winced, rolling away to avoid another attack, he was on the verge of dying, another blow and it was over.
"Do not think you can revive yourself or take us by surprise, fool," Malthus laughed, "We will be standing right next to you, and the moment you move, it's over."
"Damn."
Stark knew he was cornered.
But before he could launch a desperate counterattack, something strange happened.
The Ultimate Clone, who was close to Valgorth, suddenly staggered.
The clone hadn't done anything to help Stark for some reason all this time.
Stark frowned in confusion—the clone hadn't been hit.
"What the hell?" he muttered.
But before he could react, a dark, oppressive aura filled the chamber.
The clone began to twitch violently, its body contorting as dark energy coiled around it.
[EGO!]
A system notification appeared before Stark's eyes.
[Ultimate Clone has summoned EGO, The Hatred Demon!]
Stark blinked in disbelief. "What the fuck?"
He had seen this before, but it didn't make sense—why and how would the clone…?
The clone's body exploded in a storm of dark crimson flames, and above it, a massive demonic figure materialized, just as it had once done over Stark.
The demon was enormous, its form twisted and horrific, its eyes blazing with unbridled hatred.
The creature's massive wings stretched out wide, casting an ominous shadow over the entire chamber as it hovered above the clone.
Stark took a step back, his heart racing. "Even I'm confused now," he muttered, staring up at the monstrous figure.
Both apostles, Valgorth and Malthus, stood frozen, their eyes wide with fear—a reaction Stark had never expected to see from them.
The EGO demon let out a terrifying roar, shaking the chamber's very foundations. The air hummed with malevolent energy as the demon's oppressive presence grew stronger by the second.
Stark could feel the hatred radiating from the creature—an intense, overwhelming force. This wasn't just any ordinary summon. It was far more dangerous.
The demon's fiery eyes locked onto Stark, and at that moment, Stark felt a cold sweat trickle down his spine.
"Perfect," Stark muttered, clenching his fists, "Now we're on equal footing," he smiled.
He didn't know how the clone could now a mythical skill like EGO, as it wasn't able to before, but was it because the ultimate clone now had the entirety of Stark's aura at disposition? Meaning it could use anything he did?
He didn't know, but seeing EGO the demon above the smiling clone was already good enough to increase his determination.
"Fool, this will not stop us."
"Kill the original, and the other is dead," Malthus pointed at the original Stark.
And then, the two dashed toward him, summoning two of their mythical skills at once.

chapters.title: Chapter 308 - 308: Deadly Combo, Valgorth is down!
chapters.content:
The atmosphere in the chamber was stifling, a suffocating weight of dark energy pressing down from all sides.
Valgorth and Malthus, the two remaining apostles, stood opposite Stark, their eyes burning with malice.
Stark's muscles tensed under the strain of his previous battles, but he remained standing, his body fueled by [Double Assault].
His strength had been doubled, but even with this temporary boost, he could feel the immense power radiating from the apostles, closing in fast.
"Gulp..." Stark swallowed hard, watching as the apostles charged at him.
Their mythical powers surged, crackling in the air around them, leaving the ground in their wake cracked and broken from their sheer intensity.
"Hellbound Shackles!"
"Death's Embrace!"
Valgorth moved with sinister intent. He raised his hand with a sly grin, and the air around his fingertips shimmered. With a snap of his fingers, thick, black chains erupted from the ground beneath Stark, moving faster than the eye could track.
"What—?" Stark's eyes widened in disbelief as the chains snaked around his legs and arms, binding him tightly in less than a second. The attack was so fast that he hadn't even had the chance to react.
"HAHAHA!" Valgorth's cruel laughter echoed in the chamber as he watched Stark struggle against the bonds, "THESE CHAINS ARE IMPOSSIBLE TO GET OUT OF!"
"...?!"
"DIE!" Valgorth roared, barreling toward Stark with his fists glowing, flames dancing across his knuckles as he prepared to unleash a devastating blow.
For a split second, Stark's heart raced in his chest, a flash of fear crossing his mind.*
He was trapped, and Valgorth and Malthus were closing in fast. There was no way out.
Stark closed his eyes, not because he accepted his death, but because he knew what was about to happen.
And at that moment of supposed despair, the Ultimate Clone acted.
[The Ultimate Clone has commanded EGO to use "Negate Explosion."]
Suddenly, the demon-like entity that accompanied the clone let loose a pulse of dark energy.
It rippled through the chamber, expanding in a small radius around Stark.
BOOM!
Both apostles' abilities were instantly nullified.
Valgorth's flaming fists fizzled out like candles snuffed by the wind, and Malthus's black scythe aura crumbled into dust as if they had never existed.
"What?!" Valgorth's face twisted in disbelief as his powerful attack disintegrated in midair.
"Impossible!" Malthus's rage flared, but before either apostle could react further, the Ultimate Clone struck.
The clone, empowered by the demonic EGO, lunged at them with a ferocious growl. Its massive claws tore through the air, aimed directly at the apostles.
SLASH!
The impact sent shockwaves through the chamber, forcing the apostles to go on the defensive.
The clone's attacks were vicious and unrelenting.
Stark, freed from the chains (as EGO nullified ALL attacks), quickly regained his balance.
And now this battle could finally be fair: he squared off against Malthus, while his clone kept Valgorth busy.
The battle had erupted into chaos once again.
Sparks flew as Stark danced around Malthus's scythe, narrowly avoiding its deadly edge.
The ringing clash of steel echoed through the chamber, their weapons/skills meeting with every swing. Each time Malthus's scythe whistled past Stark's neck, it seemed to graze just a hair away from ending him.
"You can't dodge forever, human!" Malthus sneered, swinging his scythe again, barely missing Stark's throat.
Stark smirked, his mind sharp despite the chaos, "I don't need forever."
"INVINCIBLE DODGE!"
Ding!
[Perfect Dodge!]
The world around him slowed. Time seemed to freeze, allowing Stark to think clearly and deeply as he observed his surroundings.
Every movement, every breath of his enemies was laid bare in this moment of suspended reality.
"These guys aren't invincible. If I hit Malthus with the right combination, he won't stand a chance. As for Valgorth... we can take him down once he's stunned," Stark calculated in his head, his mind racing.
Time snapped back to normal after a few seconds, and Stark's eyes blazed with a fierce vortex of crimson energy. His aura flared, a tangible force surrounding him.
"WIELDING CROSS!" Stark roared, summoning the massive holy cross above him.
The divine weapon hummed with righteous power, its surface glowing with blinding light.
He swung it with everything he had, aiming straight for Malthus.
And even though the apostle tried to cut it down with his scythe, which he did, it still wasn't enough to completely suppress the holy aura.
The cross slammed into Malthus with a thunderous crack.
-82483!
The impact sent the death apostle stumbling back, a grunt of pain escaping him.
But Stark didn't stop there. He swung again, harder this time.
"ARGH—" Malthus let out a howl of agony as the second blow struck him even harder, this time not even allowing him to suppress some of its power, sending him skidding back several feet.
-213748!
Stark could feel the power building within the cross, the energy from the holy weapon surging with every swing.
[Holy Combo] was now in full effect, and he knew the third strike would be the one to turn the tide.
[Holy Combo (just a reminder): if you swing your strike twice in a row, the third strike will light up the cross with so much crimson aura that it will deal 200% damage and without fail stun enemies for five seconds!]
The cross glowed with a searing crimson light, radiating more power than before.
Stark leaped into the air, his body twisting in a graceful spin, "I'M ABOVE YOU!" he shouted as he brought the cross crashing down for the third and final strike.
SMASH!
The impact was devastating. Malthus was crushed beneath the holy weapon, the crimson energy exploding outward as the third strike landed perfectly.
-443612!
[Malthus has been stunned!]
The death apostle crumpled to the ground, momentarily paralyzed, his body limp from the overwhelming force of Stark's attack.
But Stark didn't take time to gloat.
Instead, he turned sharply on his heel and sprinted toward his clone.
The clone was locked in a brutal struggle with Valgorth, and Stark could see that it wouldn't last much longer on its own.
Together, they could finish Valgorth before Malthus recovered.
"DOUBLE ASSAULT!" the clone shouted, its stats doubling as it prepared to unleash a final, devastating attack once seeing Stark approach.
Stark grinned, his mind clear with focus.
He raised his hand, summoning three of his strongest abilities in quick succession.
In one hand, a glowing yellow/red orb—the [Crimson Purification Energy Ball]—crackled with divine energy. In the other hand, the swirling giant fist of [Aura Smash Merge] gathered, ready to unleash chaos.
And lastly, above him, the massive [Spear of Judgment] formed, its tip burning with divine fire as it hovered menacingly in the air.
Valgorth's eyes widened in terror. He knew what was coming.
Stark and his clone moved in perfect synchronization.
The clone attacked first, its demonic claws ripping through Valgorth's weakened defenses.
Stark followed immediately, hurling the [Crimson Purification Energy Ball] with deadly accuracy.
-94728! (this is from EGO)
Valgorth staggered, his health dropping rapidly, but he wasn't down yet.
"Crimson Purification..." Stark whispered as the energy ball exploded.
BOOM!
-323,482!
The chamber shook violently as the energy detonated around Valgorth. His body was thrown back, but Stark didn't stop. The [Aura Smash Merge] was next, and he hurled it toward the apostle like a crashing storm.
-156,045!
Valgorth screamed in pain, barely hanging on, and even when he tried to do anything, either Stark or the clone would punch him out of his spell.
Before he could recover, the [Spear of Judgment] descended from above, the final blow, as it was infused with [Holy Infusion].
"Now!" Stark shouted at his clone as the spear impaled Valgorth, divine energy flooding his body.
-847,372!
Then without wasting time, the clone smashed the ground with EGO dozens of times, dealing damage to Valgorth.
-33623! -37214! -41237!
Valgorth's health dropped to zero in an instant.
He let out one last roar of agony before his body dissolved into nothingness, consumed by the overwhelming power of their combined attack.
[Valgorth has been defeated!]
Stark stood tall, his chest heaving from exertion.
His clone stood beside him, its demonic aura still faintly glowing.
Behind them, Malthus began to stir.
The stun was wearing off.
And yes, all of this happened in mere seconds.
But it didn't matter anymore. Stark and his clone turned to face the death apostle, their focus now fully on him.
Malthus's eyes darted between them, fear creeping into his gaze.
Stark smirked. "It's over."
He raised his hand, preparing to unleash another barrage of attacks.
In moments, this battle would be finished.

chapters.title: Chapter 309 - 309: The Three Devil Apostles are Down
chapters.content:
The atmosphere in the chamber shifted the moment Valgorth fell.
The heavy tension hanging in the air dissipated, replaced by an unsettling silence.
It felt as if the very room itself was waiting.
Two of the apostles were now dead, and even with all of their confidence, thinking they had trapped Stark inside of their domain... all of that was nothing.
Only Malthus remained now, his black robes swirling around him, shrouded in the fading light from the destruction of his allies.
Stark and his clone stood firm, battle-worn but unwavering. They could sense the overwhelming power radiating from Malthus, but neither showed any sign of backing down.
Malthus's scythe hung lazily by his side, his eyes glinting with a cruel amusement.
Slowly, his lips curled into a wicked grin as he raised the scythe high above his head.
The weapon shimmered with a dark, unnatural glow, as though it were feeding on the surrounding shadows.
Without warning, he slammed the scythe into the ground.
"I AM THE MIGHTIEST OF THE ABYSS! FACE ME!" His voice echoed, causing the very floor beneath their feet to tremble.
Stark's eyes narrowed, his expression cold and unyielding.
In that instant, Malthus unleashed his "Godly" ability: [Blackened Harvest].
A dense black mist began to rise from the ground, swirling around Malthus like a living thing.
It absorbed the lingering energy of the fallen—the souls of Cerberus, Valgorth, and the countless devils that Stark had cut down along the way.
Their twisted forms merged with the mist, feeding into Malthus's growing power.
"Just for your information... I am the strongest of the apostles among those three, and my godly skill is one of the best there is in the entire world," Malthus smiled.
His body swelled as the aura around him darkened, his skeleton (?) muscles bulging, and his already towering frame growing larger.
The scythe pulsed, now brimming with raw, demonic energy.
Stark felt the shift immediately. This was no longer the same Malthus. He had become something far more dangerous, far more monstrous.
He had pushed himself past his very own limits.
[Malthus has gone from Calamity to Immortal-Level monster]
And with all the souls he harvested, he became just as strong as Olikar.
With an ominous smirk, Malthus pointed his scythe toward Stark.
"You will kneel before the power of the Abyss," he growled, his voice now deep and guttural, exuding death and destruction.
But Stark didn't move. He didn't even blink. Beside him, the clone was still, their synchronization flawless.
Malthus wasted no more time on words. His body blurred as he surged forward, his scythe crashing down with the weight of a thousand tons.
The blade sliced through the air like a guillotine, aimed directly at Stark's head.
But Stark was already moving.
With reflexes sharpened by countless battles, he activated [Dodge Control], slipping out of the way just as the scythe grazed past, missing him by a hair.
SLASH!
The scythe struck the ground with tremendous force, carving a massive gash into the stone where Stark had stood.
Malthus's attacks were faster now, infused with the energy of every soul he had consumed. Each swing was filled with the essence of hell itself, every strike meant to kill.
The clone sprang into action, darting toward Malthus from the side.
Still ordering EGO, Its demonic claws glowed with dark energy as it aimed to catch Malthus off guard. But Malthus reacted swiftly, spinning his scythe in a wide arc.
The clone barely dodged in time, retreating just as the blade whistled past, too close for comfort.
The fight escalated into a deadly dance. Malthus's scythe cut through the air relentlessly, every strike more powerful than the last.
Stark and his clone moved like shadows, dodging, weaving, their movements in perfect harmony.
Each missed attack from Malthus sent shockwaves rippling through the chamber, shaking the walls, cracking the stone beneath their feet.
But it was the same for Stark, as Malthus managed to avoid everything and cut down every holy attack with no efforts.
"You think you can avoid me forever? Feel the weight of despair!" Malthus's voice echoed, dripping with malice.
He swung the scythe again, but this time, a wave of dark energy erupted from the blade. The wave expanded rapidly, filling the chamber, leaving no room to escape.
Stark's instincts took over.
"Domination Soul!" he shouted, summoning chains of energy not to bind, but to fight.
He swung the chains wide and placed his soul heart in front of them, creating a barrier against the encroaching darkness.
The black energy collided with his souls and the chains, sending sparks flying as Stark whipped the crimson soul back toward Malthus, deflecting the wave.
Malthus snarled in frustration, closing the distance between them, bringing his scythe down with terrifying speed.
Stark barely managed to twist out of the way, sending his soul heart snapping toward the scythe's handle. With a yank, he pulled it aside, just long enough to disrupt Malthus's rhythm.
The clone saw its moment, rushing in with EGO's claws outstretched, ready to tear into Malthus. But the apostle was too quick. He leaped back, spinning mid-air, releasing another burst of dark energy as he did.
SLASH!
The clone narrowly avoided the attack, its body bending impossibly to dodge the blade's lethal edge (because of Dodge Control).
One wrong move, and either of them would be finished. Stark and his clone were pushing themselves to the limit, walking between the edge of life and death.
But they moved flawlessly, their timing perfect.
Malthus's eyes blazed with fury as he realized his attacks weren't landing.
"Enough!" he roared, raising his scythe toward the sky. The very air in the chamber seemed to warp as the full force of his [Blackened Harvest] exploded around him.
Dark energy swirled in a massive vortex above, crackling with power.
The ground beneath them trembled, and from the shadows, spectral hands emerged.
These were the souls of the fallen devils, summoned by Malthus's godly power.
They clawed at Stark and his clone, trying to drag them into the abyss.
