The notifications flashed rapidly in front of Stark's eyes, each one a reminder of the carnage they'd just unleashed on the Moonscorched Villagers.
[You have slain 'Moonscorched Villager lvl500', gaining 1,150,000 experience points!]
[You have slain 'Moonscorched Villager lvl500', gaining 1,150,000 experience points!]
...
The messages kept coming—32 times in total.
Stark and Sora had decimated every monster in their path, and the rewards reflected that.
Stark felt the surge of power course through his body as his level shot up multiple times.
[Your level has increased to level 107, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Your level has increased to level 108, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
...
[Your level has increased to level 110, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
He was now level 110. The notification for his experience progress appeared:
[Experience: 4,327,000/8,900,000], and with it, another reminder of how much stronger he had become.
[Skill Points: 63]
Ding!
[Level 110 Reached: Pick a card!]
Usually, Stark would summon his ultimate clone, a trusted ally in making difficult choices, and the perfect partner to aid him in battle. But this time, something was different.
Fwish!
Only one card appeared in front of him, its back emblazoned with the symbol of a shield.
Curious, Stark reached out and took hold of the card, feeling a strange warmth as he grasped it.
[Domination has sensed your difficulties, and thus has decided to help.]
Ding!
...
[New Skill: Crimson Barrier (Mythical Passive)]
[Level: 1]
[Description: Crimson Barrier is a mystical shield that surrounds Stark at all times, acting as a second layer of protection. The barrier has its own HP pool of 250,000, absorbing all damage until broken. Once shattered, the barrier will take a full day to regenerate.
Stark does not need to activate or maintain it; the barrier operates passively, offering him constant defense, even in the most dire situations.]
...
Stark blinked. "Whoa..."
It was as if the Domination system had sensed his struggle against the powerful foes in this trial and had granted him a massive protection.
The only other time he had received a defensive ability was much earlier, for one of the first perks of [Domination], and that one could only absorb a mere 5,000 HP.
But now, this Crimson Barrier could take up to 250,000 damage—and it didn't even need to be activated.
It was always there, guarding him.
A shield that wouldn't falter unless absolutely overwhelmed.
He felt the immediate comfort of knowing he now had a cushion of defense.
A small smile formed on his lips. "This is perfect."
The new skill entered his arsenal, strengthening him further.
And just as he was reveling in this newfound protection, another notification appeared.
[You have eliminated all the 'Moonscorched Villagers' in your area. The 'Moonscorch Effect' has been removed.]
"Hm?"
[This means that your moonscorch percentage will go down in this area.]
"Oh."
If you eliminate all of the moonscorched beasts in an area, then not only do you gain massive experience, but the effect of the crimson moons is also completely removed.
Stark glanced at the Moonscorch status indicator.
[4% Moonscorched]
.
.
[3% Moonscorched]
Luckily, the moonscorched effect was pretty damn weak, but Stark was confident that the trial played its card on the fact that the more you are hit, the stronger the effect becomes.
Him and Sora would need to protect one another to not get hit.
Sora, standing beside him, still looked battle-ready but calm.
She glanced at Stark. "Want to take a break to recover?"
Stark chuckled. "No, let's keep going." His tone was confident. "Let's enter Termina."
Sora nodded, and together they pressed on, knowing that the real danger had only just begun.
As they approached the entrance to the city, another message greeted them.
[Most of you should now understand how this trial works.]
[But I'm sure none of you are weak enough to die at the hands of the monsters.]
The tone of the message was almost mocking.
Stark braced himself.
[Introducing the "Key" task!]
[If you want to access 'Termina', the main city, you'll have to eliminate three players.]
[Those who eliminate a player receive an overwhelming advantage.]
"Fucking hell…" Stark muttered under his breath.
It was just like the second trial—a ruthless demand to kill other participants.
He knew from experience that no trial in the Domination series was the same, but this one clearly wanted blood.
The system continued, laying out the harsh terms.
[Once three players are killed, the gates to the city will be opened, and no new moonscorched beasts will spawn in the Death Village, making it a 'safe zone'.]
[Kill a player, and you'll receive a 'Moonscorch Cure': Cures you of moonscorch completely for an entire day, meaning that even if you are hit, it won't work on you (Trust me, you'll need this.)]
Stark clenched his fists.
This was a cutthroat trial, even with all the monsters, the real threat was always going to be the other participants.
And now, they were all forced to turn on each other, at least, more than before.
As if that wasn't enough, the final message made Stark's blood run cold.
[Oh, and watch out for the sniper.]
Then, all the panels disappeared.
Wait, what?
"Watch out for the sniper?"
Most players were currently fighting, so they didn't really have the time to watch the panels.
Stark and Sora was the only ones that had gotten rid of all their beasts this fast thanks to [Heaven's Wrath].
"Maybe I should use my skill points..."
And just as he was about to focus on assigning his skill points, another restriction appeared.
Ding!
[You are not allowed to use skill points during this trial, as an item specialized for that will be revealed later!]
"Of course," Stark groaned.
In this trial, you couldn't just upgrade your skills mid-battle.
If you hadn't prepared beforehand, you were stuck.
He was level 110 now, but that didn't mean much if he couldn't improve his skills.
Worse still, these participants weren't ordinary, they were the best of the best, all at the top of their respective Domination levels.
[This trial has selected some of the strongest domination users in your level range.]
"Yeah, I get it now," Stark muttered, realizing that he was truly up against the elite.
Quickly, Stark retrieved his spirits and began to move.
He didn't know the identity, the skills, nor the names of any of the other participants, but surely he could manage.
He always did.
Reaching the end of the street he had been in, he noticed a sign that said [Villagers Street].
Probably related to the monsters he fought, which would also mean that the other participants each got a different type of monsters as well.
Beside the sign was a door.
[Use it to enter the main square, right before the city.]
[From there, you will be access all the other streets.]
This is how the beginning of the trial would force them to fight: the person that is fastest to get here would have an incredible advantage by taking their enemies by surprise.
"Haha..." and Stark was sure as hell about to use it to his advantage!
He pushed the two wooden gates open, and was greeted by the main square, which was surrounded by houses and crumbling buildings.
But he could also see the name of the streets from a distance.
[Ghouls Street]
[Rats Street]
[Birds Street]
Each participant was having their own battles.
Stark truly thought that arriving first would give him the push he needed to take down one of the participants and get a cure to his moonscorch.
But he soon realized, that in the trial, even those that arrive first get unfair treatment.
FWISH!
In the distance, too far for him to notice, the scope of a sniper had been on him right as he opened the door.
And less than five seconds later, a sharp, eerie sound echoed from somewhere far off.
BOOM!
Stark didn't notice it immediately, but within moments, he felt the disturbance.
He had been targeted.
Not by a monster—but by something far worse.
Suddenly, a bright flash lit up the sky.
BOOM!
Before Stark could react, the sniper's bullet struck him square in the chest, a massive blast of energy ripping through his Crimson Barrier and sending him flying backward.
-234,728!
The impact was brutal.
Stark hit the ground hard, gasping for breath as the searing pain of the sniper's attack radiated through his body.
Even with the barrier, you still felt pain, and without it, he would have died, forced to use up [Crimson Healing] at the beginning stage.
His barrier had absorbed most of the damage, but it was already dangerously close to breaking.
The [Sniper] was here.

chapters.title: Chapter 320 - 320: Main Square, The Moonscorched Sniper
chapters.content:
Stark's breath came in ragged gasps as he pushed himself up from the ground, the transparent Crimson Barrier surrounding him flickering, visibly weakened but still holding.
Cracks spidered across its surface, as if one more hit might shatter it completely.
His vision swam for a moment before he steadied himself.
"You okay?" Sora asked, her tone flat and emotionless as usual, though there was a strange undertone that hinted at concern.
"Yeah, I'm fine..." Stark groaned, brushing the dust off as he got to his feet.
His body was aching from the sniper's devastating hit, but there was no time to dwell on it.
Just as he found his footing, another sharp crack echoed through the air.
FWISH! FWISH! FWISH!
Several more bullets cut through the sky, each aimed with deadly precision.
Stark's heart raced, his instincts screaming at him to move.
His eyes sharpened, and his body acted before his mind fully registered.
He twisted and dodged, narrowly avoiding the streaking bullets, each one tearing through the air with the goal of killing him.
But Stark couldn't figure out the sniper's position, it was far beyond the boy's reach.
He couldn't just keep dodging.
The sniper could be anywhere, and retreating would only give the attacker more opportunities.
Going back to Villagers Street wasn't an option either—Stark knew the sniper had an extensive range and could likely shoot him no matter where he went.
Gritting his teeth, he made his decision.
"ASURA'S ARMS... WRATH!" he roared, his aura exploding outward.
Four crimson arms burst from his body—two extending from his shoulders, and two from beneath his original arms.
The ethereal limbs crackled with divine energy, brimming with the raw power of a god.
Each arm throbbed with strength, mirroring his own potential, but imbued with the divine fury of the God of Wrath.
[Asura's Arms - Wrath: Activated]
Stark's six arms flexed as he prepared himself for the next attack.
The sniper was relentless, but if Stark could intercept one of those bullets, he could turn the tide.
It was a gamble, almost suicide, but it was the only option left.
Somewhere in the distance, the sniper clicked his tongue in annoyance, hidden in the shadows of crumbling buildings.
He had been expecting an easy kill.
"Hm..." the sniper muttered, adjusting his scope.
His pale, disfigured hand reloaded the weapon, this time sliding in something far more sinister than a regular bullet. "Looks like I'll have to use this."
The sniper loaded a glowing bullet into his gun, its surface pulsating with an eerie, crimson-black energy.
[Moonscorched Bullet Loaded]
"This one won't miss," the sniper growled, his voice low and mechanical.
Stark, standing in the open with his six crimson arms raised, watched as the sniper prepared his next shot.
He didn't know what kind of bullet this was, but something about it felt overwhelmingly dangerous.
BOOM!
The sniper fired, and the world seemed to slow.
The bullet was unlike any Stark had ever seen.
A spiraling, dark red and black projectile shot toward him at terrifying speed, crackling with energy.
Stark barely had time to brace himself before the bullet made contact with his raised arms.
BAMMM!
The impact was so powerful that the entire village could hear it.
A deafening explosion echoed through the streets, shaking buildings and sending waves of dust into the air.
...
In a nearby alley, Starful, the fashionable blonde-haired girl fighting off Moonscorched Rats, stopped in her tracks, her face twisting in confusion.
"What the hell was that?" she muttered, glancing around nervously.
...
Elsewhere, Miles, the businessman casually smoking a cigar paused for a moment, looking in the direction of the blast.
A smirk curled on his lips. "Oh… it's that boy," he chuckled before returning to his fight.
...
Back with Stark, the Moonscorched Bullet was spinning violently against his six arms, pushing them backward with overwhelming force.
His muscles strained as he resisted the bullet's forward momentum, feeling the raw power coursing through it.
It wasn't just a physical attack—it carried something far more dangerous.
[Description: This bullet has the ability to instantly moonscorch anyone it hits.]
If Stark let this bullet slip past, it was game over.
He wouldn't be able to use Crimson Healing or his Chosen One talent to protect himself from a direct hit.
The Moonscorch would consume him instantly.
"RAGHHHH!" Stark gritted his teeth, digging his heels into the ground.
His arms flickered, the crimson energy wavering as the bullet pressed harder.
The sheer pressure was immense.
Every ounce of strength he had was being funneled into stopping it.
Crack!
One of the crimson arms faltered, but Stark held on.
He couldn't let this thing win.
With a final burst of strength, Stark stopped the bullet, his body trembling from the effort.
His aura arms flickered dangerously, on the verge of dissipating.
The bullet, still crackling with energy, hung in the air, inches from his chest.
But it wasn't over.
Taking a deep breath, Stark did the unthinkable.
He grabbed the bullet with his bare hands.
[Do not touch bullet!]
[Moonscorch infection: 20%… 38%… 53%…]
Ignoring the rising infection rate, Stark spun on his heels, using the momentum to swing the bullet around him.
His body became a blur as he spun faster and faster, his arms moving in unison.
The infection surged, reaching a dangerous level.
[Infection: 72%... 85%... 90%...]
Stark's vision began to blur as the moonscorch threatened to overtake him, but he couldn't stop now.
With one final spin, he hurled the bullet back toward the sniper.
FWISH!
The crimson-black bullet shot through the air, faster than when it had first been fired.
The sniper, unable to react in time, barely managed a startled gasp before the bullet struck him square in the chest.
BOOM!
The explosion was deafening, the sniper's body engulfed in the destructive force of the bullet he had fired. Stark watched as the sniper's form was thrown from its hidden perch, crashing into the main square with a loud thud.
-646,849!
The sniper writhed in pain, a deep, guttural growl escaping its mouth as it fell from its window onto the ground of the main square.
Now that it had been exposed, Stark could finally see it in full view.
The sniper was a towering figure, nearly five meters tall.
Its body was grotesquely twisted, with a strange tank attached to its head, linking directly into its spine like a parasite.
The sniper didn't actually weird a sniper either, it was just that its right arm had morphed into a massive, cannon-like weapon that fired the devastating bullets.
[Moonscorched Sniper - Calamity Boss]
[Level 500]
The sniper growled, its glowing red eyes fixing on Stark as it struggled to stand.
Without hesitation, it raised its cannon arm once more, aiming directly at Stark.
"Even reaching the main square first means trouble, huh?" Stark muttered under his breath, his six arms still raised and ready for action.
The adrenaline still pumped through his veins as he eyed the sniper warily.
Controlling his six arms felt almost natural now, far easier than he had imagined when he first gained the ability.
The intense training in the Memories Museum had paid off—he could manipulate them with ease, every motion fluid and precise.
The sniper, now back on its feet, growled in frustration.
"Die," it grumbled, and its cannon arm came to life once more.
"SNIPE SHOT!"
BOOM!
Another massive bullet tore through the air, but Stark was faster this time.
He sidestepped, the bullet whizzing past him and smashing into the gate behind him, reducing it to rubble.
He activated his Perception, scanning the sniper.
...
[Name: Levi, The Moonscorched Sniper]
[Level: 500]
[HP: 2,353,151/3,000,000]
[Strength: 31,283]
[Stamina: 12,842]
[Speed: 12,472]
[Defense: 11,821]
[Skills: Sniper Arm (Passive); Moonscorched Bullet; Hardened Carapace; Enhanced Scope; Snipe Shot; Unyielding Will (MYTHICAL Passive); Bullet Storm; Shadow Cloak; Explosive Shell; Adaptive Targeting (GODLY PASSIVE)...]
...
That thing overwhelming strength, no wonder it did over 200,000 damage to Stark, even though he was a [Domination] user, which meant his aura protected him.
A normal person could have potentially received 1,000,000 damage.
But what stood out most were its skills—ten of them, all deadly.
...
[Sniper Arm (Passive): Fires bullets with extreme precision and power.]
[Moonscorched Bullet: Instantly moonscorches targets on impact.]
[Hardened Carapace: Greatly increases defense when under attack.]
[Enhanced Scope: Increases accuracy from long distances.]
[Snipe Shot: A charged attack that deals immense damage.]
[Unyielding Will: Gains increased power the longer a battle lasts.]
[Bullet Storm: Fires a rapid succession of bullets in a wide area.]
[Shadow Cloak: Can conceal itself for a brief period.]
[Explosive Shell: Fires a special bullet that causes a large area explosion upon impact.]
[Adaptive Targeting: The sniper adjusts its aim, improving accuracy with each missed shot.]
...
Stark gritted his teeth.
This wasn't just a fight against a regular boss—this thing was built for long-range warfare.
He needed to act fast before the sniper's skill set overwhelmed him.
Levi's Adaptive Targeting and Unyielding Will were particularly dangerous if the battle dragged on.
The longer it lasted, the more deadly Levi would become.
Levi raised his cannon-like arm again, the weapon glowing ominously as it prepared another shot.
Stark couldn't give it the chance.
"Alright, no more games," Stark muttered, his voice a low growl as he readied himself for the next move.
His crimson arms crackled with energy, the power of the God of Wrath burning within him.

chapters.title: Chapter 321 - 321: Fighting the Moonscorched Sniper
chapters.content:
Stark crouched, breathing deeply as he narrowed his gaze on the towering sniper, Levi.
The air around them crackled with tension, thick and suffocating.
The moonscorched sniper's grotesque form loomed ominously, the tank on its head pulsing with crimson energy, its cannon-arm whirring ominously.
Stark knew the sniper wasn't a normal opponent; its attacks were deadly, precise, and overwhelming.
But this time, he had a plan.
"Sora," Stark said, his voice steady despite the adrenaline pumping through his veins. "Hold him off for a few seconds. I need time to lock onto him."
Sora, standing by his side, barely nodded, her emotionless eyes reflecting a faint spark of understanding.
"Understood," she replied in her flat, detached tone, before stepping forward, her hands shimmering with vines and green aura.
Stark closed his eyes for a moment, slowing his breath.
His muscles tensed as he focused on the sniper's movements.
He activated his perk—Flow—allowing him to delve into the enemy's aura.
As the world around him dimmed, all external noise faded into a dull hum. In this state, Stark could feel the sniper's essence, the way its energy flowed and surged through its body.
[Flow: Activated. 10 seconds to focus…]
In those precious seconds, Sora rushed toward Levi, moving with almost mechanical precision.
"VINE SMASH!"
Her fists glowed with an ethereal light as she lashed out, her vine strikes aimed at the sniper's body.
Levi grunted, swinging its massive cannon arm toward her in a wide arc, but Sora was too fast.
She ducked beneath the blow, her expressionless face never wavering as she delivered a flurry of quick strikes to the creature's legs.
-73622! -78472! -72713!
BOOM!
The sniper fired another round, the bullet slicing through the air toward Sora, but she leaped backward just in time, her movements calculated and calm.
Stark's eyes snapped open. He had him.
[Flow: Connection established. Enemy's movements can be predicted 1 second before execution.]
The sniper's aura was a steady, unyielding stream of raw power, but now Stark could see the patterns.
He could anticipate Levi's next attack before it even happened.
With his link secured, Stark grinned, his six aura arms flexing with newfound strength.
"Alright, it's my turn now."
Without hesitation, Stark charged forward, his Asura's Arms glowing with crimson energy as they swung with deadly force.
The first set of arms crashed into the ground where the sniper stood, creating a small shockwave that forced Levi to retreat.
-32731!
Stark followed up with another blow from his secondary set of arms, slamming into Levi's cannon arm, knocking the monster aside before it could fire again.
-184728!
The sniper growled, stumbling from the impact, but quickly recovered.
Levi raised his cannon arm once more, the tank's cannon that served as his eye locked on him.
But this time, Stark was ready.
"SNIPE SHOT!"
The sniper's cannon roared as a bullet flew toward Stark, its speed and power enough to obliterate anything in its path.
But with Flow guiding him, Stark could see it coming.
A second before the bullet was fired, Stark sidestepped, his six arms deflecting the bullet mid-air.
The projectile exploded behind him, sending debris flying, but Stark didn't lose his focus.
He moved swiftly, closing the gap between him and the sniper with ease.
As he neared Levi, he activated Crimson Spears.
Five spears of pure crimson energy appeared around him, each one humming with destructive power.
"SPEAR OF JUDGEMENT!"
The aura around him swelled as he summoned the Spear of Judgment—a colossal, crimson spear that materialized above him.
The ground trembled as the spear descended, locking onto the sniper's massive form.
The sniper tried to swing its cannon/sniper to deflect the spear, but it didn't realize just how strong the spear was.
Levi's eyes widened as the spear pierced through its cannon, spinning faster and faster, until eventually, the crimson energy detonating upon impact.
BOOM!
-837,335!
The explosion sent Levi crashing to the ground, its health bar visibly plummeting.
The sniper struggled to rise, its body smoking from the blast, but Stark could see the wear and tear.
The moonscorched sniper was weakening.
"You're done," Stark growled, his voice filled with determination.
Levi, though injured, was not finished yet.
"THE MOON LORDS HAVE CALLED MY NAME- NO, OUR NAMES!"
Levi spoke for the first time, its aura taking over its entire body, "WE SHALL NOT LOSE. DIE!"
The sniper growled, its tank-like form twitching as it activated its strongest ability—Bullet Storm.
"BULLET STORM!"
A rapid succession of bullets sprayed from Levi's cannon arm, each one capable of dealing devastating damage.
Stark's eyes widened, but he remained calm.
His skill—Invincible Dodge—kicked in, allowing him to effortlessly weave through the barrage of bullets. Each one missed him by mere inches, but Stark didn't falter.
This kept going for 30 seconds.
As Levi became more frustrated, Stark saw his opening.
With a mental command, Stark used [Domi-Chains Restrain]'s Mythical Perk.
Crimson chains erupted from the ground, wrapping around the sniper's legs and arms, restricting its movements.
Levi roared in anger, struggling against the chains, but the more it fought, the tighter the chains became.
It could have broke free from a single chain, but three was just overkill.
Though, if Stark did nothing, then Levi would surely escape.
"Chains of Judgment!"
...
[Perk: Chains of Judgment (Mythical Perk)]
[Description: Not only do you get three chains instead of one, but you can also summon "Gortox", the chain demon, to aid you in chaining your enemies]
...
With the chains holding Levi in place, Stark summoned Gortox, the chain demon.
A massive figure materialized beside Stark, its body wrapped in even more chains, a single eye looking down on Levi as if he was but a mere insect.
Gortox grinned wickedly as it extended its own chains toward the sniper, further restraining it.
Levi's eyes widened in fear as Gortox's chains wrapped around its cannon arm, preventing it from firing any more bullets.
Stark wasted no time.
He raised his arms, summoning the full power of Asura's Arms.
"ASURA'S WRATH!"
The six crimson arms pulsed with divine energy, their aura growing stronger with each passing second.
In the distance, he could see that Sora had been struggling to keep up, getting hit by three of the bullets and receiving massive damage.
Even her [Vine Barrier], that she tried to use on Stark to help him, didn't work.
Stark's rage fueled the attack, his body glowing with an intense crimson light.
The aura arms swung down in unison, releasing a shockwave that obliterated everything in a 100-meter radius ahead.
The ground beneath Levi cracked and shattered as the shockwave hit, the sniper's body engulfed in the destructive force.
Levi let out one final, agonized roar before the light consumed it entirely.
-2,347,849!
The damage was incredible.
BOOM!
When the dust settled, Levi's body lay crumpled on the ground, defeated.
The sniper's health bar hit zero, and the glowing tank on its head flickered before shutting off entirely.
[Levi, the Moonscorched Sniper: Defeated]
[Crimson Barrier has been fully reformed.]
Stark stood over the fallen enemy, his breath coming in heavy gasps.
His aura arms flickered for a moment before fading away, leaving him with only his original two.
The battle had been fierce, but Stark had emerged victorious.
He glanced over at Sora, who had watched the final moments of the fight in silence.
She nodded slightly, acknowledging his victory.
"It's over," Stark said, wiping the sweat from his brow. "Finally."
But before he could even catch his breath, a loud clang echoed through the air.
Stark's eyes widened as he saw the gates of the other streets suddenly swing open.
Dust filled the air as figures emerged from the now-opened gates.
The other participants had arrived.
"Looks like it's finally over," Dave appeared, a smirk on his face, "Damn, our gates were locked… but he beat the sniper, huh?"
Claire, beside him, nodded.
CEO, Or Miles laughed, "If he didn't, it would have just been embarrassing!"
One by one, the other participants gathered in the square, their eyes all focused on Stark.

chapters.title: Chapter 322 - 322: The City Gate, 3 Sacrifices Needed
chapters.content:
Stark stood in the middle of the square, his gaze fixated on the panel floating in front of him.
[You have slain 'Levi, The Moonscorched Sniper' and gained 6,430,000 experience points]
Ding!
[Your level has increased to level 111, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Experience: 1,857,000/9,000,000]
[Skill Points: 68]
But there was more.
[You have defeated one of the five 'Moonscorched Commanders,' granting you a 'Cooldown Gem.']
[Description: Consuming one of these gems will remove the cooldown of one of your skills, no matter how long it is.]
"...!"
Stark's eyes widened as he processed the message.
This was no ordinary reward—it was a game-changer.
A cooldown reset on any skill meant Stark could unleash one of his strongest abilities again, something that could turn the tide of the entire trial.
This item was way too overpowered, no matter how you think of it.
Actually, no.
With every other participant, it wouldn't be as overpowered as Stark thinks.
All of them have powerful skills, that is true, but not a single one is truly worth using it on compared to Stark's [Crimson Healing] and [Crimson Spears].
And if it could remove the cooldown of ANY skill, then Stark already had an idea.
Without hesitation, he whispered to himself, "Use it on 'Crimson Spears.'"
The gem in his hand shimmered and disappeared in a blue flash.
Ding!
[Crimson Spears' cooldown has been reset.]
Which meant...
[Heaven's Spear is now available again.]
"Incredible," Stark muttered, a wide grin spreading across his face.
His aura began to ripple through the air, nearly palpable to anyone close enough.
However, before Stark could relish in his new power, movement caught his eye.
The other participants were approaching from their separate gates, all converging in the same square.
There were 13 of them, each a powerhouse in their own right, each with their own ambitions and lethal skills.
As they gathered in front of the gate leading to the heart of Termina, the city where most of the events of this trial would happen.
A massive [0/3] was written on it in crimson red.
[3 more sacrifices to open the gate.]
"Damn, our gates were locked," muttered Shock, the guy with blond hair and electricity dancing around him. "Looks like it's finally over."
"Yeah, he beat the sniper," replied Claire, the girl with glasses and the ability to transform into a monster.
"Before we go any further," said CEO, stepping forward with a cigar in his mouth, "I think it's time for introductions. We should know who we're fighting with—and against." He pointed to the gate, "This is just the beginning."
The group exchanged glances, some nodding in agreement.
It was clear to everyone that forming alliances or at least understanding each other's strengths and weaknesses could make or break them in the next stage.
Who knows, maybe they will defeat the crimson moons trio?
"I'll start," said CEO, puffing on his cigar.
His presence was calm, authoritative.
"I'm CEO, Level 135." He gestured to the two individuals standing behind him. "These two here are my assets—Righlef and Partner. They're both under my control, thanks to my domination skills. We'll be taking this trial seriously."
Next was Kai Algren, the artist, who looked completely disinterested in everything around him.
"Artist..." he said with a bored tone. "Codename is Artist. Level... doesn't matter. Let's just get this over with." He was already drawing with his fingers in the air, as if crafting an invisible masterpiece that only he could see.
"Follower," the priest-like man mumbled, his eyes never leaving the ground, "That's all you need to know." His voice was soft, yet there was a dangerous undertone in it.
Claire stepped forward next, "Claire, codename Demon." She pointed to the man beside her, "And this is Dave, codename Wielder." Both of them stood confidently, their levels displayed as 122 and 123 respectively.
They gave off a powerful, experienced vibe, clearly ready for what was to come, and they actually gave their real life names!
Shock was next, his blond hair practically glowing as arcs of electricity danced across his body. "Name's Shock, and as you can see, I specialize in electricity. Level 128. Don't get in my way, and we'll be fine."
Clever, the old man with a cane, chuckled before speaking, "Clever. Old, but still dangerous. Keep that in mind."
His calm demeanor was unsettling. He seemed frail, but there was something about him that screamed danger.
The twins stood side by side, both silent until they spoke in unison. "Mio and Mao. We don't talk much." Their presence was eerie, their movements perfectly synchronized.
"Chosen," Stark spoke.
"Sora," and the girl beside him nodded.
Lastly, there was the woman with blond hair and a star in her eyes. She introduced herself as Starfire.
As for the final girl, Lilith, who was always meditating, she didn't even say anything, so everyone ignored her.
After everyone had finished their introductions, the group turned toward the gate.
The crimson text above it still read:
[3 more sacrifices to open gate.]
"Tch, sacrifices again," Shock muttered, crossing his arms. "We need to kill three people. Otherwise, we're stuck here."
"Let's vote on who gets sacrificed, alright?" CEO suggested, exhaling a puff of smoke.
His eyes scanned the group, but they lingered on Stark for just a second longer than anyone else. "No need for unnecessary bloodshed. We can decide this rationally."
"WE AGREE!" Righlef and Partner nodded enthusiastically, clearly under CEO's influence.
"Ok, but who?" Claire raised her eyebrows. "No one's stupid enough to sacrifice themselves. And what if someone runs away into their village? We wouldn't be able to catch them."
"Not possible," CEO interrupted, flicking the ash from his cigar. "All gates are locked."
"Huh?"
"What the hell?"
The participants exchanged confused glances, but when a few of them went to check the gates, CEO's words were confirmed.
[You have reached the main square, no point in going back. Enter the city.]
The system message appeared for everyone.
"Damn, so we really have no choice," Dave muttered.
"I have a proposition," CEO said, his voice carrying authority as he smirked at Stark. "How about him?" He pointed directly at the black-haired boy.
"Hm?"
"Ohh~"
CEO continued, his words sharp and direct. "Not only does he have the most powerful skill among us, but he's already moonscorched. If we take him out now, we eliminate the biggest threat early."
A murmur rippled through the group.
"Yeah... that's true..."
"Can't deny that."
The participants started to nod in agreement.
Stark remained silent, his gaze locked on the sky, seemingly indifferent to the discussion about his potential death.
Sora, however, was not as calm.
She took a step back, panic flashing in her eyes. "Stark?" She whispered, hoping for some kind of reaction from him, but he didn't respond.
His gaze remained fixed on something she couldn't see.
"By process," Dave added, "we should also take out his lover, the white-haired girl." His smile was unsettling as he gestured toward Sora.
"!!!" she had an emotionless look, but even she didn't feel like dying early.
Sora's heart pounded as she looked at Stark again, but he continued to stand motionless, not even acknowledging her worry.
"Yes," CEO agreed with Dave's suggestion, nodding. "Two sacrifices down, and then we just need one more."
Artist, for his part, barely seemed to care, his attention still focused on whatever invisible art he was crafting.
Meanwhile, Follower was whispering to himself, the word "Kill" repeated over and over again under his breath.
A panel appeared in front of Follower.
[Show your devotion to the 'Godless Demon' to unlock some of his powers.]
[Kill a participant.]
And underneath it, another panel popped up.
[Become one of the 'Godless Apostles,' the most precious pawns of the godless demon.]
[Kill 'Stark Heartsouls,' AKA Chosen.]
The name lit up like a beacon in Follower's mind.
His eyes darkened with purpose.
"How about her?" Shock pointed at Starfire, the fashionable blonde with the star-shaped pupils, "She seems to be the weakest."
"H-HUH?" Starfire stammered, her voice quivering. "N-NO I'M NOT!"
"K-KILL..." Follower's mumbling grew louder.
"I-I can manage, really! Find someone else-" Starfire tried to defend herself, but her voice was drowned out by the growing bloodlust in the air.
And then it happened.
FWISH! SLASH!
A cross-shaped sword pierced her chest in an instant, her heart skewered.
Her health bar dropped to zero.
-9,999,999!
It was over. An instant kill.
[Starfire has been killed. 14 participants remain.]
The killer stepped forward, revealing himself—Follower.
He had transformed the cross around his neck into a deadly weapon, striking without hesitation.
Ding!
[You have proved your devotion to the 'Godless Demon' by killing a participant.]
[You have unlocked three perks.]
"Y-YES! YES!" Follower screamed in ecstasy, reading the new powers granted to him.
Meanwhile, CEO paid no attention to the madness, his focus entirely on Stark and Sora. "You two are the last ones. Accept your deaths peacefully, and it won't hurt as much."
Ding!
The text on the gate shifted:
[1/3]
All eyes turned toward Stark and Sora, the entire group of participants slowly closing in on them.
It was an execution march, with CEO, Righlef, Partner, Artist, Follower, Wielder, Demon, Shock, Clever, Mio, and Mao advancing as one.
"A shame," CEO sighed. "You were strong, Chosen, but not strong enough to make a difference in this trial."
The air grew thick with tension as they neared the couple.
And just as they were about to reach them, Stark finally moved.
A slow smile crept across his face, and without warning, he let out a small chuckle.
"Haha..." Stark's eyes gleamed with a strange light as he pointed toward the sky.
Everyone froze.
"...What the hell is he laughing at?"

chapters.title: Chapter 323 - 323: Cooldown Gem Saved the Day, Stark's Threats
chapters.content:
The square had become a tense battleground, with Stark and Sora pinned against the wall, surrounded by the other trial participants.
Everyone was inching closer, ready to strike. Stark, however, stood completely calm, his gaze locked onto the sky.
The smile that had just spread across his face sent a wave of unease rippling through the crowd.
"What's so funny, Chosen?" CEO asked, his voice low and cold, as if he had already won this battle.
Stark didn't respond immediately.
Instead, he simply raised his hand, pointing directly at the sky.
His smile widened, and before anyone could react, his voice rang out, calm and composed, yet filled with an undeniable threat.
"[Heaven's Spear]," he whispered.
The moment those words left his mouth, the atmosphere shifted.
"Did he just say Heaven's Spear-"
A loud crack echoed through the sky as a massive tear split open the heavens above them.
The sound was deafening, like the earth itself was groaning in protest.
Everyone froze, eyes snapping upward in fear and disbelief.
"NOT AGAIN?!"
"WHAT?"
From the rift in the sky, a figure emerged—an angelic being, nearly 50 kilometers tall, towering over everything.
Its wings were vast, stretching across the horizon, casting a dark shadow over the entire city.
The angel's presence alone was enough to paralyze them all.
In its hands, the being summoned a colossal spear of pure crimson energy, glowing ominously.
The spear's tip crackled with power, as if ready to obliterate anything in its path.
The participants who had been advancing just moments ago stopped dead in their tracks, their faces drained of color.
Everyone knew what this meant.
Stark had used this ability before, at the very beginning of the trial, to destroy one of the Crimson Moons trio.
And now, that same unstoppable force was aimed directly at them.
"Shit...!" Shock muttered, electricity still crackling across his skin, but his confidence visibly crumbling.
Kai Algren, the Artist, stopped drawing, his invisible brushes frozen in midair.
Even the ever-bored artist couldn't hide the flicker of fear in his eyes.
Claire and Dave, the two combat experts, exchanged glances.
Dave's grip tightened around his sword, but neither of them moved an inch.
They knew better.
"I'll make this simple," Stark began, his voice cutting through the air like a blade. "If any of you come near Sora or me, that spear comes down. And we all know what happens if it hits."
There was no need for further explanation.
The crimson spear in the angel's hands was so massive, so overwhelming, that it was clear to everyone that even a single strike would result in instant death.
No skill, no defense could withstand that level of destruction.
It was the ultimate form of Stark's ability—[Crimson Spears].
He didn't need to boast or scream. The power spoke for itself.
For a moment, the square was dead silent.
Everyone stood frozen, processing what had just happened.
Some were thinking about their next move, while others, like Follower, were trembling with unhinged excitement.
Even in the face of such overwhelming power, the priest looked as though he wanted to test his luck.
"This is insane…" Claire muttered under her breath. "We're just supposed to give up?"
"You fucking liar," Dave pointed at CEO, "You said that he can only use it once every 2 weeks!"
"That is... supposed to be the case, though," CEO raised his eyebrows.
His eyes darted between the angel and Stark, calculating his odds.
But no matter how sharp his business mind was, no amount of strategizing could get around the fact that the angel could obliterate them all in an instant.
"You've got to be kidding me," Shock hissed, his fists clenched tightly. "We just let you two sit back and watch while we do all the dirty work?"
Stark's smile didn't waver, "That's exactly what you're going to do. Or you can take your chances."
Sora, standing beside Stark, finally relaxed.
Her emotionless eyes now carried a sense of relief.
Stark had just flipped the entire situation on its head with a single move.
She didn't need to say anything or ask how; her trust in him was absolute.
"You can't expect us to just—" CEO started, but before he could finish, Stark's gaze sharpened.
The angel above shifted slightly, lifting the colossal spear a few more inches as if ready to strike.
"Care to try?" Stark asked, his tone casual but with a deadly edge, "Step closer. Just one step closer, and I'll release it."
The sheer size and power of the spear were overwhelming.
No one dared to test his resolve. It wasn't a bluff, and they all knew it.
If what CEO said was right before, then even if Stark's HP reached 0, he would be brought back to full health, meaning he had nothing to lose in releasing it.
He would be hit too, but in the end he would be fine, basically.
Tension hung in the air like a thick fog, the participants locked in place, weighing their options.
If they fought Stark, they would die. It was that simple.
"We need two more sacrifices to open the gate," Dave finally said, breaking the silence, his voice tense. "If we don't do something, we'll be stuck here forever."
"Then decide amongst yourselves," Stark replied, his voice still calm. "But remember, if you try anything with me or Sora, you won't live long enough to regret it."
For several long moments, no one moved.
Then, in a quick flash of motion, Follower lunged toward one of the twins—Mio.
SLASH!
His sword, still glowing from his earlier kill, slashed across Mio's throat before anyone could react.
[Perk of the 'Godless Demon' activated]
SLASH!
-2,482,958!
"YESSS!" Follower laughed.
Blood sprayed into the air, and Mio collapsed to the ground, her lifeless body hitting the stone with a dull thud.
"MIO!" Mao screamed, running to her sister's side, but it was too late. Mio was gone.
[2/3]
The system message flashed in front of everyone's eyes. One more.
"One more," Follower cackled, his eyes wild with bloodlust. "Just one more, and we're free!"
Rightlef, one of CEO's goons, looked visibly shaken, backing away slowly from the chaos.
He had followed orders without question up until now, but this—this was madness.
He turned to CEO, as if waiting for an order or reassurance, but CEO's eyes had gone cold.
"Sorry, Rightlef," CEO muttered, a deadly calm in his voice. "You're the weakest link."
Before Rightlef could even process what was happening, CEO's hand shot out.
A thin beam of energy, almost too fast to see, pierced through Rightlef's chest.
His eyes widened in shock as he crumpled to the ground.
[3/3]
Ding!
The crimson text above the gate shifted once again.
[Gate Opened.]
[Mio and Righlef have been eliminated, 12 participants remain.]
The massive gate slowly began to creak open, the grinding of metal against stone echoing across the square.
The path into Termina lay ahead of them now, dark and foreboding.
Stark lowered his hand, and with it, the angel began to fade, the rift in the sky closing slowly.
The colossal spear vanished, leaving only an eerie silence in its wake.
He didn't use the perk, meaning that it was still available.
For a moment, no one moved.
Everyone was still processing what had just happened.
"Now, if you're smart," Stark said, turning away from the group, "you'll go through the gate and stay the hell out of our way."
The participants glanced at each other, still unsure, but none of them dared make a move against Stark or Sora.
They had seen firsthand what Stark was capable of, and none of them wanted to be on the receiving end of [Heaven's Spear].
With the gate now open, one by one, the group began to move forward.
Shock was the first to step through, followed by Dave and Claire, then Artist and Clever.
Each of them cast wary glances at Stark and Sora, but none of them dared speak a word.
CEO was the last to go, but not before meeting Stark's eyes one final time.
"This isn't over," CEO said, his voice low and dangerous.
Stark just smiled. "We'll see about that."
With that, CEO turned and walked through the gate, disappearing into the city beyond alongside Partner.
As the last of the participants vanished into Termina, Stark finally let out a small sigh of relief.
Sora, beside him, let out an extremely small smile, knowing that—for now—they were safe.
"Well," Stark said, glancing at Sora. "That was fun."
And with that, they turned toward the gate, walking into the unknown.

chapters.title: Chapter 324 - 324: Entering Termina, The Tasks and Map
chapters.content:
The moment the massive gate fully opened, a chilling gust of wind swept through the group, carrying with it the faint scent of decay.
Termina lay ahead, a sprawling, ruined city with crumbling buildings and eerie, silent streets.
Stark and Sora, along with the other participants, cautiously stepped into the city, knowing full well that the real trial had only just begun.
As soon as all their feet crossed the threshold, the gate behind them closed, trapping them in.
"Hm," CEO smirked.
A panel appeared in front of each of them, hovering in mid-air.
[You have entered Termina.]
[Map of Termina unlocked.]
The map that unfolded in front of them was vast, divided into distinct sections.
Each area had its own set of challenges, and in the distance, looming over the city like a grim reminder of their end goal, stood the Hollow Tower.
It pierced the sky like a massive black needle, radiating a dark, oppressive energy.
The map sections were labeled: Outskirts, Temple District, Shopping District, Mayor's Manor, Business District, Train Station, Museum, Orphanage, and, of course, the Hollow Tower itself.
Though it was clear that the tower was where they needed to go eventually, it was far away, and the path to get there was filled with obstacles.
More information quickly filled the panel:
[Trial conditions to open the Hollow Tower:]
[1. Eliminate all other participants except yourself.]
[2. Complete at least 5 tasks (5 tasks per participant, not as a group).]
[3. Defeat all Moonscorched Commanders, if the two conditionsare fulfilled, but the commanders are alive, you'll need to eliminate them.]
[All these need to be fullfilled to open the tower.]
"Tasks?"
"Moonscorched Commanders, huh," the participants mumbled.
A list of tasks appeared in front of all of them, the same across the board.
There were [100 Tasks] you could do in [Termina].
Here are some of them:
[Steal the "Power Ruby" from the museum.]
[Defeat Father Hugo in the Orphanage.]
[Kill The Heartless One and The Tormented One, and take their heads.]
[Defeat the Moonscorched Commander: Mayor of Termina.]
[Bring the heads of two participants to the fountain altar.]
...
[Once a task is complete, it is impossible to complete it again, the difficulty is not stated, but some are obviously than others.]
[Every reward for these tasks is kept a secret as to not rush the participants.]
The enormity of what they were up against hit everyone at once.
This was no simple trial of strength.
It was a slaughterhouse with a long checklist.
Complete five tasks. Kill everyone else. Defeat the commanders.
Only one could stand at the top by the end.
And the sheer amount of tasks truly showed how big that city was.
It could take them months to get all of it.
Everyone looked at one another, the uneasy atmopshere that had formed before the gate now crumbling as they processed what this trial demanded of them.
"Well, this is insane," Claire muttered, her eyes scanning the map. "They're not making this easy at all."
Dave nodded grimly, adjusting the grip on his sword. "We'll need to pick our targets wisely. We can't just rush into these tasks."
"Or we could start eliminating competition right here," Shock sneered, his eyes darting toward Stark. "Let's face it, some of us won't survive if we all stick together."
"Yeah, come on Chosen, with your skill you can eliminate at least half of us, select them and deal with it," Clever, the old man, smiled.
Stark, ignoring the bubbling tension, was focused on the distant Hollow Tower.
His mind was already racing, strategizing.
The infection in his body—the moonscorch infection—was slowly spreading.
He could feel it.
Every second they spent in this cursed city seemed to accelerate it.
The infection had already reached 12 percent, and while he still had control, he knew it wouldn't stay that way for long.
Sora, standing by his side, glanced at him. "How bad is it?"
"Worse," Stark replied quietly. "Being here speeds it up."
[Termina is the heart of the infection, being inside accelerates it, if you want to hold the infection, enter a 'safe house' or drink a "Moonscorch Cure", some of the tasks give it as a reward, among many others.]
They exchanged a glance, but before they could dwell on it, the others began moving.
Shock and Artist were already scouting ahead, heading toward different parts of the city.
CEO and his remaining lackey, Partner, started moving toward the Mayor's Manor.
"We should split up from them too," Stark said, glancing at the map again. "It's better if we avoid them for now."
Sora nodded, and together, they turned toward the Outskirts, hoping to avoid any immediate conflict.
As they moved deeper into the city, the eerie silence was broken only by the sound of their footsteps echoing through the ruined streets.
The buildings were dilapidated, some on the verge of collapse.
The occasional flicker of movement in the shadows hinted at the dangers lurking in the city, but for the most part, the streets were eerily empty.
At least, they were empty—until they weren't.
A sudden, grotesque howl filled the air, and from around the corner, a monstrous figure emerged.
It was a twisted, horrifying amalgamation of flesh and bone, with three heads grotesquely merged together, three arms sprouting from a single torso, and two massive, deformed legs.
Its skin was pale and sickly, covered in veins that pulsed with dark energy.
[Three-Headed Beast - Level 550]
These abominations were scattered throughout the city—vicious monsters that had once been humans, now corrupted by the moonscorch infection beyond recognition.
A status window appeared in front of Stark's eyes as he used [Perception].
...
[Name: Three-Headed Beast]
[Level: 550]
[HP: 2,000,000]
[Strength: 15,893]
[Stamina: 13,842]
[Speed: 12,941]
[Defense: 15,983]
[Skills: Triple Strike, Blood Drain, Limb Regeneration, Vicious Screech, CorruptedCharge, Flesh Tendrils, Moonscorched...]
...
The Three-Headed Beast lunged forward without warning, its three heads howling in unison.
Stark barely had time to react as the creature swung all three of its arms in a wide arc.
He dodged to the side, narrowly avoiding the crushing blow.
The ground where he had been standing cracked from the impact.
"Sora!" Stark called out, "We need to hit it fast!"
She nodded, transforming into her "vine form", meaning that her two arms and legs covered themselves in her plants.
Sora leaped forward, her vine claws slashing across the beast's torso, but the creature barely flinched.
-261,942
It roared, swinging one of its massive arms at her.
She dodged, but the beast was faster than she anticipated.
One of its other arms caught her in the side, sending her crashing into a nearby building.
-24,683
"Sora!" Stark yelled, but he couldn't afford to be distracted.
The beast turned its attention back to Stark, its heads screeching in unison.
Dark tendrils of flesh shot out from its body, trying to bind him in place.
Stark reacted quickly, summoning his [Crimson Spears] and launching a barrage of spears at the creature.
Several of them pierced its body, but the beast didn't stop.
It charged forward, its massive body barreling toward Stark.
"Damn it," Stark cursed, rolling out of the way just in time.
Even if he had the [Crimson Barrier], tanking damage didn't mean that he wouldn't feel pain, wouldn't be sent flying and wouldn't get infected by the moonscorch.
The beast slammed into the ground where Stark had been, its claws digging deep into the stone.
Before it could recover, Stark unleashed 3 of his [Aura Smash] fists, aiming for its heads.
This time, the attack seemed to do more damage.
-137192! -144821! -140283!
One of the creature's heads exploded in a spray of blood and gore, but the other two continued to screech, their eyes filled with rage.
"Regenerating," Stark muttered, watching as the beast's flesh began to knit itself back together.
+300,000!
This thing wasn't going down easily.
Sora rejoined the fight, her vineform already healing from the earlier hit.
Though she was now infected by [Moonscorch] too.
Together, they pressed their assault, dodging the beast's attacks and striking whenever they saw an opening.
But it was a brutal fight.
Every time they landed a blow, the beast would regenerate.
Every time they thought they had it cornered, it would unleash another powerful attack.
Finally, after what felt like an eternity, the beast staggered, its body riddled with wounds from Stark's spears and Sora's claws.
With one final screech, it collapsed to the ground, its massive form twitching before finally going still.
[You have defeated a Three-Headed Beast and gained 1,500,000 experience points.]
Stark let out a breath, wiping the blood from his face. "That... was rough."
Sora shifted back to her human form, panting heavily. "Yeah... and there's bound to be more of those things."
This thing was actually the most common monster in Termina, so yeah, by the end of the trial they're gonna have to be able to fight these things easily.
Before they could catch their breath, the ground trembled slightly, and a familiar, ominous presence filled the air.
Stark's eyes narrowed as he looked down the street.
Standing there, cloaked in the shadows of a crumbling building, was another figure—a Moonscorched Commander: Chaugnar
This one was different from the beasts.
It was humanoid, dressed in tattered robes, one of its hands was cut off, and in the other it carried nothing but a bell.
Its face was covered by a mask, and the aura it emitted was far more dangerous than anything they had faced so far.
Though you could see its mouth.
And it was smiling.
[The Moonscorched Inquisitor.]
"Looks like we've found the second commander," Stark said, his voice tense.
Sora tensed up, preparing for the fight.
[Task #1: Defeat the Moonscorcher Sniper - Completed]
[Reward: Cooldown Gem.]
...
[Task #24: Defeat the Moonscorched Inquisitor]
[Reward: ???]
But before they could make their move, two more figures emerged from different streets.
Shock and Artist, two participants.
Both of them had evidently been drawn by the commotion and had arrived just in time to witness the beginning of a battle that could decide their fates.
"Well," Shock grinned, electricity crackling around him, "this just got interesting."
Stark tightened his grip, knowing that this fight was about to become a lot more complicated.

chapters.title: Chapter 325 - 325: Inquisitor, The Second Moonscorched Commander
chapters.content:
The air around the group crackled with tension as Stark, Sora, Shock, and Artist stood in the eerie street of Termina, facing the Moonscorched Inquisitor.
Its blackened robes fluttered with the unearthly energy that radiated from it, a bell in its single remaining hand.
Stark kept his gaze steady, watching the other participants closely.
The Inquisitor was a real threat, but the greater danger now lay in the ones standing beside him.
"Guess it's finally time to put on a show," Shock muttered, electricity flickering around his body like a second skin.
His eyes darted between the Inquisitor and Stark, the grin on his face widening.
Artist, as usual, remained eerily silent, his gaze lost in the void as if his mind was consumed by something else entirely.
His paintbrushes, which seemed to materialize out of thin air, floated lazily by his side, dripping with vibrant, shifting colors.
Sora said nothing, her vines subtly twitching, ready to strike at a moment's notice.
Her eyes remained locked on the Inquisitor, but Stark knew she was just as aware of the others as he was.
It was Shock who spoke first. "Look, we all know we want the reward. But that thing's no joke." He pointed at the Inquisitor. "How about we form a temporary alliance? Just long enough to wipe out that thing."
"Temporary alliance, huh?" Stark said, his tone flat.
His eyes flickered to Artist, who still hadn't spoken.
Sora remained silent as well, but she gave a small nod, acknowledging the necessity of teamwork.
At least, for now.
Before they could finalize any agreement, the Inquisitor's bell rang—a sharp, haunting sound that cut through the air like a blade.
The street trembled, and from the shadows, five grotesque, three-headed beasts materialized, their monstrous forms twisting and writhing with malice.
[Three-Headed Beast - Level 550]
The same monsters he and Sora struggled against.
The monsters were vicious, relentless, but they weren't his immediate concern.
He needed to know who he was fighting alongside—or more accurately, against.
He turned his gaze toward the others then used [Perception].
The first one he used was against Sora since he hadn't done that since a while back.
...
[Name: Sora]
[Level: 109]
[Class: Domination; Plant Princess]
[HP: 153,000]
[Strength: 18,728]
[Stamina: 17,201]
[Speed: 16,472]
[Defense: 15,983]
[Skills: Domination, Flower Analysis, Radiance, Elements of Nature, Vine Surge, Pollen Bombs, The Flaming Rose, Regenerative Drop, Nature Distortion, Flower Barrier, The White Jade (Mythical), Evergreen Resilience, Petrification, Vine Barrier, Vine Smash, Carnivorous Plant, The Flower of Hope (Godly), Flora-Guns (Mythical), The Birth of a Star (Godly), Vine Transformation (Godly)...]
...
He already knew Sora's capabilities, but it was good to have a reminder.
Then, his eyes shifted to Shock, and his [Perception] skill activated once more.
...
[Name: Shock]
[Level: 127]
[Class: Domination; Electric Overlord]
[HP: 205,000]
[Strength: 20,742]
[Stamina: 19,991]
[Speed: 22,183]
[Defense: 17,632]
[Skills: Domination; Thunderclap, Lightning Flash, Electric Surge, Stormcaller (Mythical), Thunder Prison, Overload, Shockwave (Godly), Static Discharge, Arc Lightning, Volt Burst, Thunder Crash, Chain Lightning, Thunder Blitz, Lightning Blade, Electrocution, Surge Barrier, Ion Pulse (Mythical), Electromagnetic Field (Godly)...]
...
Shock was even more dangerous than Sora in sheer offensive power.
That much was clear.
Finally, Stark focused on Artist, who was still standing silently, his brushes dripping colors into the air.
...
[Name: Artist]
[Level: 130]
[Class: Master of Colors]
[HP: 189,000]
[Strength: 19,582]
[Stamina: 18,937]
[Speed: 18,745]
[Defense: 16,981]
[Skills: Brush of Life (Godly), Palette Shield, Canvas Creation, Color Infusion, Stroke of Genius, Masterpiece Summon, Spectrum Slash, Oil Wave, Canvas Barrier, Portrait of Power, Ink Torrent (Mythical), Watercolor Burst, Chromatic Storm, Paint Strike, Vivid Imagination (Godly), Brush Barrage, Pigment Veil, Artful Dodge, Splatter Explosion (Mythical), Abstract Detonation (Godly)...]
...
Artist, as bizarre as he was, had incredible potential to wreak havoc with his arsenal of artistic skills.
As they said before, each of them could rival Stark in terms of power and skills.
If it wasn't for [Heaven's Spear] being so overpowered, surely it would have been bad for him.
Suddenly, the Inquisitor's bell rang again, snapping Stark out of his thoughts.
The five three-headed beasts lunged forward, charging with terrifying speed.
Stark tightened his grip, and just as Shock moved to engage, a panel appeared in front of all of them.
[Only the person who deals the final blow will have their tasks marked as completed.]
For a moment, there was silence.
The implications hit everyone at once. Shock's smirk widened.
"Well, guess that alliance didn't last long," he said, lightning sparking violently around him. "Everyone's on their own."
"Agreed," Stark muttered.
His hand crackled with crimson energy as he summoned [Crimson Spears], aiming them directly at the oncoming beasts.
They weren't going to cooperate, but the bigger threat still loomed ahead.
...
[Name: Inquisitor, Moonscorched Inquisitor]
[Level: 560]
[HP: 4,800,000]
[Strength: 2738]
[Stamina: 39382]
[Speed: 2391]
[Defense: 27837]
[Skills: Bell of the Abyss, Curse of Unraveling, Echoes of Despair, Lunar Shroud, The Ultimate Summon (GOLDY)...]
...
Sora unleashed a barrage of vines, lashing out at the nearest beast, while Artist, with a flourish of his brush, painted swirling colors in the air that formed into a massive barrier.
The beasts slammed into it, but the barrier held.
Stark wasted no time, throwing one of his [Crimson Balls] into the air and snapping his fingers.
In an instant, he teleported behind one of the beasts, driving a [Crimson Spear] into its back.
-312,942
The creature howled, but its regeneration kicked in immediately.
'Damn, they regenerate just like the last one,' Stark knew they couldn't waste time on these things—they had to focus on the Inquisitor.
But Shock had other plans.
With a wild grin, Shock summoned a bolt of lightning from the sky, striking the beast Stark had attacked.
-656,482
The damage was insane.
"Thanks for softening it up for me," Shock sneered as the beast collapsed.
Stark gritted his teeth. "Focus on the Inquisitor!" he barked, but Shock was too engrossed in stealing kills to listen.
Sora, meanwhile, unleashed her [Pollen Bombs], summoning a few pollens in her hand, then blowing them with her mouth, hitting nearby monsters.
-474,390! -501,238!
Artist remained oddly distant, his brush strokes growing more frantic.
Stark noticed that his abilities were subtly shifting the battlefield—colors bled into reality, warping the space around them.
The beasts would step forward only to be thrown off balance by what looked like nothing more than a splatter of paint.
But the Inquisitor wasn't idle.
Its bell rang out again, and with it came a wave of curses.
Stark felt a cold shiver run through his body as the curses took hold.
[Cursed: Attack Power Reduced by 20%]
[Cursed: Movement Speed Reduced by 10%]
"Great," Stark muttered, his strength sapped by the curse.
The Inquisitor let out a hollow laugh, but before it could ring the bell again, Stark summoned his [Spear of Judgment] and launched it directly at the cursed figure.
The spear tore through the air, but the Inquisitor's bell rang once more, and the beasts surged forward, taking the blows meant for their master.
-1,193,928!
It killed three of them, but at least the inquisitor wasn't hit.
"Damn it!" Stark cursed, but he wasn't done yet.
He activated [Aura Smash], summoning five crimson fists that launched in rapid succession at the Inquisitor.
-145,892
-153,731
-149,321
The Inquisitor staggered but didn't fall.
It retaliated, swinging its bell in a wide arc that unleashed a wave of dark energy.
Sora barely dodged it, and Artist erected a shimmering canvas barrier just in time.
Shock wasn't as lucky.
He took the hit head-on.
[You have been moonscorched.]
But instead of retreating, he smiled. "That all you got?" With a roar, he unleashed [Chain Lightning], his body crackling with raw power as arcs of electricity jumped from him to the surrounding beasts.
-318,294!
-344,281!
-332,180!
The two beasts shrieked in pain, but none of them fell.
Stark, however, had seen enough.
Throwing another [Crimson Ball] into the air, he snapped his fingers and teleported directly behind the Inquisitor.
Without hesitation, he summoned [Asura's Arms] to summon four additional arms.
Crimson energy erupted around him in a violent whirlwind as he smashed ground with all 6 of his arms.
The energy smashed them into the ground, dealing devastating damage.
-789,482!
-823,193!
All creatures were now dead as the others also dealt damage.
The Inquisitor's bell slipped from its hand, clattering to the ground, but it wasn't done yet.
It raised its head, grinning beneath its mask, and slowly reached for the bell again.
"Not today!" Stark roared, summoning his [Crimson Spears] and aiming for the creature's hand.
Just as he was about to land the final blow, the Inquisitor raised the bell one last time, shaking it violently.
"THE ULTIMATE SUMMON!"
The ground trembled, and a massive, horrifying presence began to manifest in the sky above all of them.
"What the..."
"Huh."
Even the participants that were far could see it.
[Summoning Chaugnar...]
The battle was far from over.

chapters.title: Chapter 326 - 326: Chaugnar, The Inquisitor's Servant
chapters.content:
As the Moonscorched Inquisitor's bell tolled with a deep, ominous ring, the air around it rippled, growing heavy with the presence of something immense.
The ground trembled, and in the sky above, a hulking figure began to materialize, its outline barely visible at first.
Chaugnar, The Inquisitor's Servant, emerged from the dark rift, its massive body casting a long, terrifying shadow.
Its physique was grotesquely human, with bulging muscles and a towering stature.
Its head, however, was a twisted mass of flesh resembling a woodsman's helmet, but grotesquely deformed, ending in an enormous elephant-like trunk.
Its skin darkened to an unsettling beige as its overalls warped into suspenders and a long, tattered skirt.
Despite its immense power, the most unsettling detail was its bare feet, each one reduced to a single, grotesque toe.
BOOOM!
It landed on the ground, right in front of the Inquisitor.
Stark quickly activated Perception, scanning Chaugnar's stats as they appeared in a status window before him.
...
[Name: Chaugnar, The Inquisitor's Servant]
[Level: 560]
[HP: 5,000,000]
[Strength: 28,127]
[Stamina: 29,853]
[Speed: 27,632]
[Defense: 29,249]
[Skills: Crimson Rend, Abyssal Rush, Elephantine Slam, Force Crush, Lifebane Touch, Void Pulse, Graviton Collapse, Infernal Stomp, Entropic Grasp, Void-Walker, Master's Shield...]
...
"5 million HP and stats through the roof… This thing's a nightmare," Stark muttered, his voice grim.
The strongest monster he ever faced.
Sora, standing beside him, clenched her fists, her body glowing with a faint aura.
"Well, let's just get Inquisitor and then deal with that thing," Stark proposed as he turned his head toward the commander.
But of course, it wouldn't be easy.
"Master's Shield," Chaugnar immediately activated, and an unbreakable shield appeared around Inquisitor.
[This shield is unbreakable, the only way to release it is to kill Chaugnar, even Heaven's Spear won't break it.]
Sora looked over at Stark, her eyes gleaming with determination, "It's fine, even with all of that, it's not invincible."
Shock snickered, flipping a dagger he summoned out of thunder in his hand. "Just remember who's getting the last hit. This beast is nothing but a stepping stone."
Artist stood silent, observing Chaugnar with cold calculation.
His hand hovered over the air, as though preparing to manipulate the battlefield itself with his brushes.
Without warning, Chaugnar bellowed, a deafening roar that reverberated through the air.
It lifted its massive trunk-like appendage and swung it downward with terrifying speed, the impact shaking the earth.
Sora was the first to charge, her body enveloped in a fiery glow.
She lunged forward with her vines drawn, activating [Vine Surge], sending a wave of spiky vines slicing toward Chaugnar's hulking leg.
The impact was immediate, dealing 200,000 damage and dropping Chaugnar's HP to 4,800,000.
But the creature barely acknowledged the hit, turning its monstrous gaze toward Sora.
Chaugnar retaliated, swinging its enormous arm down with [Crimson Rend], sending a crimson shockwave slicing through the air toward Sora.
Stark moved in a flash, his [Invincible Dodge] activating as he phased through the attack, reappearing in front of Sora.
"Watch it!" he barked, summoning his [Crimson Spears].
Ten blood-red spears materialized around him, and with a sharp motion, he hurled them all toward Chaugnar, each one finding its mark in the creature's torso.
The impact was explosive.
The spears tore into Chaugnar, and with each detonation, chunks of flesh were blown apart, dealing a cumulative 600,000 damage.
"How's that feel, you oversized freak?" Stark snarled, but his victory was short-lived.
With a monstrous roar, Chaugnar activated [Elephantine Slam], its massive fist slamming into the earth with such force that the ground rippled outward in a shockwave.
Stark and Sora were knocked off balance, the raw power of the attack sending them skidding backward.
Shock took advantage of the brief opening.
He vanished in a blur, his [Lightning Flash] activating as he reappeared behind Chaugnar's leg.
With a gleeful smirk, he plunged his dagger into a weak spot, aiming for the tendons.
His strike landed true, and then without warning he activated [Volt Burst], his entire body exploding with electric aura.
-746,389!
Before Shock could retreat, Chaugnar's massive trunk swung around, catching him in the side with a devastating blow.
He was flung across the battlefield, crashing into a nearby boulder with a grunt of pain.
-58,373!
He struggled to his feet, spitting blood, but his grin remained. "That all you got?"
[You have been moonscorched.]
"Oh."
"Brush of life..." Artist closed his eyes as he floated above the battlefield, eyes glowing with arcane energy.
He lifted his hand, and with a flick of his wrist, the very fabric of reality twisted around Chaugnar.
Instantly, he began to draw a massive meteor in the sky using his brush.
Every movement of his brush creating a giant line in the sky.
And in less than 30 seconds, he was finished.
"Come to life... my creation..." he put both hands together.
And then...
BOOOOM!
The meteor instantly became real, slamming onto Chaugnar before it could even realize what was happening!
-1,438,394!
"WHAT THE FUCK?" Stark was astonished, "And I'm the threat?!"
Chaugnar let out a furious roar, but getting up, it activated [Graviton Collapse], summoning a vortex of crushing gravitational force that pulled everything toward it.
Stark, Sora, Shock, and Artist all struggled against the pull, their bodies straining under the immense pressure.
In the midst of the chaos, Chaugnar slammed its foot into the ground, unleashing [Infernal Stomp], a shockwave of molten energy that rippled outward, striking all four combatants and dealing 53,384 damage to each of them.
Artist was the only one that wasn't moon scorched, and luckily for him, long-ranged attacks don't do anything to you.
"I've had enough of this thing," Stark growled, rising to his feet. His body surged with crimson energy as he activated [Aura Smash], merging his three fists into a massive one, almost as big as Chaugnar.
It descended with devastating force, slamming into monster's chest.
-847,839!
Chaugnar's body convulsed, its movements growing more frantic.
In a desperate attempt to retaliate, it unleashed [Void Pulse], a blast of dark energy that erupted from its body, aimed at obliterating everything in its path.
But everyone avoided the attacks in their own way.
Yet, what they didn't expect was what followed next.
"GRAAAAAH-" Chaugnar's roared as it suddenly disappeared from view.
"Huh?"
"What?"
But it wasn't that it fled, or that it became invisible.
Not at all.
It was just too fast.
[Behind you.]
Focus warned him, but Stark didn't even have the time to react.
SLAM!
He was sent flying toward a nearby building, crashing into it.
His [Crimson Barrier] tanked all the damage, but it didn't mean he didn't feel pain.
The same happening to all the others, each of them receiving an additional 30,000 damage from it
[Artist: You have been moonscorched.]
And as for Stark and the other two that were already infected...
[Your moonscorch infection increased.]
"That's it! Time to end this!" Stark shouted, his aura flaring to its peak.
"SPEAR OF JUDGEMENT!"
FWISH... BOOM!
The spear hit Chaugnar directly, following it closely like some sort of missile even though it was moving at intense speed.
BOOOOM!
-1,237,293!
Sensing the end, Shock darted forward, his eyes gleaming with excitement.
But Stark was already ahead of him, summoning his [Clone Frenzy].
Five clones materialized around him.
And for the first time since a while, he didn't merge them.
Instead, they launched a synchronized attack.
"Crimson Spears! Aura Smash! Domi-Chain Restrain!"
Two of the clones died in the process, meaning that he wouldn't be able to summon the [Ultimate Clone] for an hour, but it didn't matter.
For in the end...
-349,382! -221,293! -233,291!
Chaugnar let out a final, deafening bellow before collapsing into the ground, its massive form dissolving into dust.
[Chaugnar has been defeated.]
With Chaugnar defeated, the protective barrier around the Inquisitor shattered, leaving him vulnerable.
His eyes widened in terror, his HP displayed at 400,000, a shadow of the fearsome figure he once was.
"It's over," Stark growled, readying his attack.
His crimson energy surged as he prepared to end the Inquisitor once and for all.
But just as Stark was about to strike, Shock appeared out of nowhere, slamming into Stark with a smirk. "Thanks for the setup," he sneered.
Stark staggered back, eyes wide with fury. "You—"
Before Stark could react, Shock was already upon the Inquisitor, his [Thunder Dagger] plunging deep into the Inquisitor's chest.
"ION PULSE (Mythical)"
The Inquisitor gasped, his eyes wide in disbelief as his remaining 400,000 HP drained rapidly from the electric shocks that kept going through him, dropping to zero in mere seconds.
Ding! Ding! Ding!
[Global Announcement: The Moonscorch Commander Inquisitor has been slain by Shock!]
A smirk spread across Shock's face as he twisted the dagger for good measure, stepping back as the Inquisitor's body slumped to the ground, lifeless.
Stark, still recovering from Shock's sneak attack, stared in disbelief, his hands clenched into tight fists.
"That little shit…" Stark growled, fury burning in his eyes.
His entire body trembled with anger as he watched Shock casually wipe his blade, acting as if he hadn't just stolen the kill.
With a cocky grin, Shock looked over his shoulder at Stark, giving a half-hearted shrug. "What? I told you from the start—I'm getting the last hit."

chapters.title: Chapter 327 - 327: Finding a Safe Zone, The Mayor's Manor
chapters.content:
Before Stark could react to Shock's audacious kill theft, a notification panel materialized before him.
[You have slain "Chaugnar, The Inquisitor's Servant." Gained 7,000,000 experience points.]
[You have defeated a Three-Headed Beast. Gained 1,500,000 experience points.]
[You have defeated a Three-Headed Beast. Gained 1,500,000 experience points.]
Ding!
[Your level has increased to Level 112, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Experience: 4,357,000/9,250,000] (Level 112)
Stark blinked at the notifications, momentarily stunned.
Killing those beasts had been only enough for one level up?
The experience gain was underwhelming.
But that didn't matter now. The only thing on his mind was vengeance. The bastard had stolen his kill, and Stark was determined to settle the score.
"FUCK YOU!" he roared, launching himself at Shock with such speed that Sora could hardly track his movements.
But Shock was a being of electricity, and in an instant, he vanished in a flash of lightning.
"Not fast enough," he sighed, his voice echoing from the rooftop of a nearby building.
"COME DOWN IF YOU'RE A MAN!" Stark shouted, his frustration boiling over.
"I'd rather not," Shock shrugged, using [Lightning Flash] again to teleport just out of Stark's reach, his prize of the Inquisitor's kill slipping further away.
"I'm out too," Artist murmured, his own dark intentions flickering in his mind. He longed to claim Stark's blood for his masterpiece, but with [Heaven's Spear] still in the boy's arsenal, he couldn't risk it.
"Brush of Life," he muttered, sketching a door on the wall of a building before stepping through it, disappearing into the unknown.
Stark shook his head, bewildered.
"WHAT?"
So let's get this straight, one could move at lightning speed and another could draw things to make them real?
These people were utterly bizarre.
Maybe it was because Stark wasn't used to seeing new domination abilities that he felt that way.
Killing [Chaugnar] didn't grant any reward beside experience, so basically, he had done all of this for no reason.
With a resigned sigh, Stark glanced at his panels, and a warning flashed.
[Warning! Moonscorch level at 50% . Find a safe zone!]
"Let's go," he ordered Sora, and she quickly followed him without saying anything, sensing that Stark was angry.
The map they got as they entered Termina didn't specify what constituted a safe zone or how to find one, but Stark was determined to wait until his Moonscorch percentage decreased, using the time to strategize his next move.
This trial had proven to be far more challenging than the previous two combined—not just in terms of the monsters, but the twisted participants, too.
The first trial had semi-normal challengers, the second had its share of madness, and now, they faced pure insanity.
With a simple goal of entering the [Hollow Tower] to emerge victorious, each contestant fought tooth and nail.
Stark may not have understood most of their abilities, but he still possessed the [Heaven's Spear].
Surely, that would see him through this ordeal.
Wouldn't it?
Getting rid of a few additional [Three-Headed Beasts], as well as [Moonscorched Knights], Stark and Sora made their way through the outskirts of the city.
They actually managed to somehow win against the monsters after understanding the fact you shouldn't let them get too close to you if you want to survive.
[Warning! Moonscorch level at 58%. Find a safe zone!]
The percentage was climbing, but not fast enough to actually be a threat.
"If we wanna remove our infection, we're gonna have to get one of those [Moonscorch Cures]," Stark said to Sora, and she nodded.
This meant they needed to complete at least two tasks if they wanted to have a decent chance at survival.
Otherwise, they could soon turn into one of these beasts.
[Stark: 1/5 Tasks]
[Sora: 0/5 Tasks]
After fifteen additional minutes of fighting and walking, both Stark and Sora leveled up to level 110 and 113, respectively, the former getting a new skill.
And thankfully enough, less than five minutes later...
Ding!
[Safe zone detected nearby!]
One of the doors of the nearby buildings was glowing, and once they entered it, it revealed itself to be a safe zone!
The interior was just as moldy and crumbling as the rest of the town, but at least, in here, the moonscorch infection rate would go down.
[This safe zone is now marked on your map.]
Opening the map, they noticed that a small dot appeared where they currently were, meaning they could come back if the situation became too hard.
"That's... fair," Stark sighed as he sat on the couch, resting, "We'll soon get them all."
"Yes," Sora nodded as she sat beside him.
...
Meanwhile, Shock had managed to put some distance between himself and Stark at breakneck speed.
And after claiming the reward from completing the task, he immediately pulled up his map to assess his location.
