Lines of damage numbers floated over the Mayor's body:
-13,934! -12,952! -11,431!
[Mayor has been stunned.]
"GRAB IT, IDIOT!" Shock yelled, feeling the Mayor's menacing gaze on him despite the stun effect.
The Mayor's eyes held a twisted glee, even as he growled, "Another bad guest."
Even stunned, the Mayor managed to speak and move slightly.
Shock had never encountered such resistance against his stun before; it wasn't supposed to happen.
CEO sprang forward, seizing the key from around the Mayor's neck.
Not willing to waste a moment, he fired another beam at the Mayor's arm to prevent him from retaliating.
The Mayor instinctively blocked with his fork, barely holding off the blast.
Shock ceased his Ion Pulse, stumbling back with fatigue.
The two exchanged a look, and without a word, bolted for the door.
As they sprinted through the dark hallways, the Mayor's laughter echoed after them. "So it's a game of cat and mouse, then?" He flicked his wrist, summoning another knife to his hand.
They dashed through the corridor, twisting around corners in a frantic bid to escape.
CEO held the basement key tightly, his mind racing through potential escape routes.
There was no time to formulate a solid plan—the Mayor would be right behind them any second.
"We need to find a way to trap him," CEO muttered as they reached a flight of stairs.
Shock glanced back nervously. "Do you see the size of this place? Trapping him won't be easy."
"Then we'll settle for delaying him," CEO replied, his voice grim. "He's toying with us, but he won't take us lightly if we put some distance."
On the way down, they met up with the [Butlers Trio], which tried to stop them.
"Escaping Master M is useless."
"Master M will catch you."
"He is toying with you."
They kept laughing, pointing at CEO and Shock.
"WELL, FUCK YOU," CEO shouted as he unleashed [Triple Beam], shooting one at every butler, exploding their bodies before they could even say anything else.
The two men then dashed forward, noticing that the butlers were already starting to form back, their exploded bodies merging back.
They could also hear the footsteps of the Mayor coming for them.
There was only one place they could go to at this point: the basement.

chapters.title: Chapter 337 - 337: Unleashing The Basement Demon
chapters.content:
Shock and CEO tore down the narrow corridor, hearing the Mayor's slow, taunting footsteps echo from above.
His laughter sent chills through their spines, a twisted reminder that he was only toying with them.
"COME ON…!" Shock hissed, practically throwing himself forward.
He was mainly saying that to CEO, though, as he was the one holding the key.
Shock would have been much faster, but the businessman wouldn't give the key.
They had one mission now—get the basement door open and figure out an exit plan.
In front of them, the door leading to the basement loomed, a promise of escape that was already starting to slip through their fingers.
They fumbled with the key, hands slick from the adrenaline.
The Mayor's laughter grew louder.
"Shit… hurry," CEO muttered.
Finally, with a loud click, the door swung open.
[You have opened the basement.]
[The exit key is placed beyond the "Basement Demon." You can choose to fight it or try to take the key and run.]
[Note: Opening the manor door without killing the Basement Demon will unleash it on Termina.]
Shock glanced at CEO, his brow furrowing. "Doesn't matter. There's already like five of those level 600 monsters roaming around out there. What's one more?"
Nice thinking, Shock, release something else in addition to Father Hugo, the Altered Ones and Eternal Regret.
8 participants left, and at this point, already 5 level 600 monsters were on the move.
But of course, releasing one more wouldn't make a difference anyway, right?
They dashed down the stone steps, the basement spreading out beneath them, wider than they'd expected, dimly lit and filled with a sour, decaying stench.
Flickering lights cast shadows against the walls, twisting into shapes that seemed to move of their own accord.
Groans and shuffles echoed, and figures lurked in every corner—a hellish greeting party.
They tore through the darkness, ducking and weaving past smaller monsters prowling the basement.
These creatures were low-level, practically irrelevant to them, but a distraction they couldn't afford.
A quick flash of CEO's beams sliced through their ranks, leaving nothing but twitching limbs and the scent of scorched flesh.
And then they saw it: the Basement Demon, a shadowed silhouette that lingered in the farthest reaches of the darkness.
Its figure was massive, a monstrosity barely visible except for the faint glimmer of light against its grotesque, unblinking eyes.
And at the very back of the room, almost taunting them, hung the exit key on the wall.
Right before they could reach the key was a massive hallway of darkness: the territory of the demon.
"That's our way out," Shock muttered.
But first, they need to go through the darkness ahead, the face of the basement demon visible beyond, seemingly waiting for them.
They could also hear the footsteps of the mayor getting closer.
Shock groaned as he suddenly dashed toward the darkness, but then was immediately stopped by dozens of hands coming out of the walls, blocking him.
"AH, FUCK!" Shock swore, his blade flashing as he slashed through the hands.
But he wasn't fast enough; some of the claws dug into his skin, raking down his arms, leaving trails of blood as he pushed on.
After a few seconds, his fingers finally closed around the key.
He turned back, only to see the Basement Demon shift, pulling itself out of the shadows.
Its body was a twisted blend of scales, claws, and muscle, a hulking beast seemingly patched together from nightmares.
It roared, the sound like shattering glass and grinding metal, reverberating through the entire basement.
"Oh, shit," CEO muttered, firing off a beam that blasted part of the creature's hide, though it seemed barely fazed.
Shock was forced to use [Lightning Flash] again to dash from the end of the basement all the way back to CEO.
But now, he couldn't be as fast as before.
They sprinted, the Basement Demon hot on their trail, claws slashing through the air.
It was fast, faster than they'd anticipated, and every time they glanced back, it seemed even closer, its eyes locked on them with a gleeful, malicious hunger.
And then, up ahead, stood the Mayor, still calm, still composed, like he was watching a particularly amusing play unfold.
His expression was unreadable, though a glint of satisfaction crossed his eyes as he saw them struggling.
"Oh, seems like you unleashed 'it,'" he chuckled. "Well, good luck with that."
He even bowed, stepping to the side.
Shock blinked, barely processing what just happened. "Uh… what?"
The Mayor smiled, "I just received some rather interesting news. So, for now, I think I'll sit back and enjoy watching all of you scramble. Do your best to survive."
"AH, FUCK, I DON'T CARE!" Shock shouted.
The basement demon's guttural snarl echoed from behind, making him practically dive up the stairs, the key clutched tight in his hand as they finally burst out of the basement and up toward the manor's entrance.
They skidded to a halt, throwing the door open just as the creature's claws scraped against the steps behind them.
With a last glance back at the Mayor, they bolted through, leaving him standing in the hallway, his expression a mix of curiosity and amusement.
They left the Manor, but as they did, a message appeared.
[You have unleashed the "Basement Demon" on Termina.]
[Pray for your survival.]
The more time they spent doing random shit, and the more they unleashed these monsters, the harder it would become.
And then, just as they caught their breath outside the manor's gate, another notification rang out.
[Global Announcement]
Across Termina, every player paused, their attention turning to the floating panels in front of them.
Stark and Sora, sitting on the square near the Hollow Tower, looked up, squinting at the message.
Lilith and Clever both opened an eye, glancing up from their places of rest.
In the museum, Artist, who had finally managed to steal the coveted [Power Ruby], froze mid-movement.
Every single player was glued to the screen, bracing themselves for what might come.
It wasn't another death notification, though.
It was worse.
[Global Announcement: All elite monsters have now been unleashed and are roaming Termina. Encountering one is nearly guaranteed death.]
[Have fun, participants!]
Shock and CEO exchanged a grim look as the announcement ended.
They were neck-deep in a trial that was now spiraling out of control.
[The Basement Demon, Father Hugo, the Altered Ones (Heartless and Tormented), Eternal Regret and the Mayor.]
[They are all out there now, stalking Termina, each one more bloodthirsty than the last (except the Mayor for now).]
"Well," Shock exhaled, trying to catch his breath. "That's... not good."
"No kidding." CEO ran a hand over his face, his usual stoic expression slipping as he stared at the sprawling town before them. "This whole place is about to turn into a war zone."
And somewhere out there, Stark, Sora, Artist, Lilith, Clever—everyone was now on a collision course with these monsters.
One slip-up, one wrong turn, and any of them could find themselves staring down one of these elite monsters, facing a near-certain death.
Shock shook his head. "I'm out of here, didn't plan to be buddy-buddy with you anyway, you fucking maniac."
Shock ran away, and CEO just shrugged.
"Neither did I."
They both ran as they didn't want to meet with the [Basement Demon].

chapters.title: Chapter 338 - 338: Clever, The Strongest Participant of the Trial
chapters.content:
Follower stalked the empty, decaying streets of Termina, his vision fixated on the arrow floating above him, its gleaming edge supposed to guide him toward Stark's aura.
He had trailed it without question, but then, without warning, it simply vanished.
"Lord?" he muttered, confusion twisting his face. "What happened?!"
The familiar, chilling voice of his patron spoke into his mind:
[The connection has been cut. Either Chosen has died, or he used an item that teleported him somewhere.]
Follower clenched his fist, frustration bubbling under his calm exterior. "Then bring it back! I don't care how. Just bring the arrow back!"
[Impossible. His aura is the key. Unless he uses it again, I won't be able to locate him.]
The voice grew colder, almost amused.
[It's rare to find an aura so filled with raw hatred. It's one of the strongest I've ever sensed.]
Follower suppressed a snarl.
Stark's aura was supposed to lead him, yet now it slipped through his grasp, leaving him in silence.
For now, he'd have to bide his time, he could maybe try to complete his own tasks, or get rid of the other participants/commanders.
The weight of loneliness settled in—he despised the company of people as much as he did monsters.
Only Godless, the true power in this planet, earned his admiration.
Everyone else was nothing more than a distraction, and Follower's pulse quickened with the prospect of being rid of them.
Follower trudged forward, sweeping through a horde of minor creatures, tearing them apart with single-handed strikes, his movements bored yet lethal.
Another beast—a twisted, hulking wolf—lunged at him from the shadows, but he dodged with barely a shift of his foot, his eyes glazed with boredom.
[You should be careful of Chosen,] Godless warned, the voice prickling in his mind.
A message suddenly appeared in front of Follower.
"Hm?" Follower barely reacted, brushing off the warning.
It wasn't the Godless Demon himself speaking, but the curse that he had infused into him using his aura.
"Why should I be careful of him, he is far weaker than we are," Follower shrugged, nonchalant about it.
Then, out of nowhere, a message materialized in front of him, the voice deeper now, almost hesitant:
[Chosen... He's not what he seems.]
Follower raised an eyebrow, ready to question it further, but was interrupted by a thunderous roar.
Startled, he glanced toward the direction of the sound, the ground rumbling beneath his feet as it grew louder.
[Never mind.]
The voice cut off abruptly, vanishing as Follower's curiosity peaked.
"'Be careful'?" he echoed, still half-distracted by the warning, "of Chosen?"
He followed the direction of the noise, moving swiftly between alleyways until he caught sight of the source: a massive, monstrous beast roughly the size of a car, its claws digging deep into the ground as it fought a lone figure.
His eyes narrowed as he recognized both the beast and its opponent.
[Basement Demon], the creature's name blazed above it in crimson letters.
This was the same creature that had recently escaped from the mayor's mansion.
Across from it, a lean, elderly man stood in place, facing the monster.
Follower didn't know him well enough, but there was no doubt this was Clever, the old, unassuming participant who, despite his frail appearance, radiated an aura of cold calculation.
Clever's silhouette was backlit by a golden glow, which took the form of a towering, serene statue of a woman, her arms folded in rest.
It had at least a hundred arms, each golden hand gracefully poised as if waiting to be called into action, her main arms grouped in a prayer, and her eyes closed.
The statue was at least three times the size of a skyscraper, by the way.
Follower watched, transfixed.
With a single motion from Clever, the statue's hands came to life, following his every command.
The old man didn't even need to do anything other than clasp his hands together in some sort of prayer, mimicking the statue's pose to command it, the dozens of hands slamming down and blocking every attack.
Each hit from the golden hands sent shockwaves echoing through the streets, creating deep fissures in the ground.
[This guy is dangerous.]
"Obviously," Follower replied under his breath, watching as Clever effortlessly controlled his golden guardian.
Follower knew instantly—if he tried to face this man, he'd be overpowered.
[This guy is... don't fight him.]
[No matter what.]
"Fighting him is not worth it anyway," Follower shook his head, "I'll watch."
The [Basement Demon], which had been named as one of the strongest beasts of this trial, a level 600 monster that could cause havoc in the real world, even going as far as destroying whole cities, was currently being fought by Clever alone.
And yet, that old man didn't seem scared.
In fact, his eyes weren't opened either.
He didn't move at all as all the arms and hands of his giant golden status did the work.
The monster clawed and screeched, but each of its attacks was met by the golden statue's massive hands, crushing its defenses.
SLAM! SLAM! SLAM!
The relentless barrage echoed across the city, each strike widening the cracks in the ground.
The Basement Demon stumbled, its body bruised and bleeding, its monstrous strength crumbling under the assault.
"Guess I'll need to adjust my rankings," Follower muttered, watching in awe as Clever's powers unfolded before him.
In his mind, he made a note:
Follower could barely believe Clever's strength.
Though they were in a level 100 trial, Clever was operating on a completely different plane.
[Clever - Level 156]
This old man could take on level 700 monsters if he wanted, maybe a bit more thanks to his abilities.
Because right now, Clever was quite literally only using his basic skills.
[Hand Slam], [Golden Chop], and [Hand Synchro] were the skills he was using among the 25 he currently had.
It made no sense for this old man to even be here.
In fact...
[That old man has an Immortal-Level skill.]
Clever had a skill from the highest category.
A skill so powerful it could possibly rival Stark's [Heaven's Spears].
[Follower's Power Ranking:]
[1. Clever]
[2. Follower]
[3. CEO]
[4. Artist]
[5. Shock]
[6. ??? (Girl that didn't tell her name)]
[7. Chosen.]
[8. Sora.]
This was the power ranking he made, and he gradually changed it as he saw the others unleash more abilities.
Chosen was last because he was one of the weakest, the only problem was the [Angel of the Spear] that was protecting him.
He would need to find a way to get through that.
Meanwhile, with a final, devastating blow, Clever's golden statue slammed one of its hands down, slicing the Basement Demon cleanly in half.
The creature let out one last, anguished roar before collapsing, its body lifeless as the remains sizzled in the dirt.
[Global Announcement: "Basement Demon" has been killed by "Clever!"]
Follower took a breath, glancing around to see if other participants had been drawn by the noise.
But the streets remained silent.
The other players had work of their own and, for now, stayed distant.
Clever, however, didn't seem fazed by the announcement.
He finally exhaled, dispelling his aura, causing the golden statue to dissipate as he cracked his neck with a faint sigh. "This trial's too easy."
Follower narrowed his eyes, his curiosity piqued as Clever muttered under his breath.
Clever could probably take care of the [Crimson Moons] that stopped them from leaving by himself, and with his basic attacks too.
The other participants were an eyesore, and none of them, except for Chosen, had actually interested him enough.
"This whole thing isn't even a challenge," Clever continued, a slight smile touching his lips. "I might just kill them all and be done with it."
The other participants were an eyesore, and none of them, except for Chosen, had actually interested him enough.
"Maybe I'll save Chosen for last," Clever mused to himself, his gaze turning towards the center of Termina, where the other participants roamed. "But first… a little rest."
A [Moonscorched Cure] had appeared in his hands, and he instantly used it, curing him from his conditions.
The only reason he had been infected in the first place was because he actually allowed the monster to hit him, just to see how it felt.
Clever's skill with his golden arms and statue meant he could summon them in less than a second, rendering any ambush futile.
He didn't even need his eyes open to sense an attack.
As he resumed his calm, leisurely walk through the ruined cityscape, Follower remained transfixed, every instinct urging him to stay out of Clever's path.
"This is insane," Follower's pupils were shaking in place.
He wanted to kill, he wanted to shed blood.
But it would be impossible to kill this guy, there was no chance anyone could do anything, even if all the monsters, commanders, and participants of this trial joined together.
In the end, your [Domination] powers are the result of luck.
Clever's power was named [100-Golden Arms Statue], and it must be among the top 10 strongest domination powers in the entire world.
Why the hell did he end up in this trial? It wasn't fair!
Maybe it was to give them all a chance to actually win by killing every enemy, then the moons?
Who knows...
"That guy is the most dangerous, I'll need to be more careful than I thought," Follower turned around, but not before eyeing the remains of the [Basement Demon], who wasn't even able to get close to Clever.
But suddenly... right as he thought of that...
[No.]
Follower stiffened, feeling Godless' consciousness grow colder and sharper.
[Clever isn't the most dangerous here.]
"What?"
It was the consciousness of the godless demon speaking, meaning that he could detect auras and powers.
He couldn't deny Clever was powerful.
But... power isn't everything.
"Who could possibly be more dangerous?"
[Chosen.]
[No one is as dangerous as Chosen. His hatred, his aura, his potential... they are unlike anything in this world.]
Follower's breath hitched, and he swallowed hard.
The command in the voice left no room for interpretation.
[Stop him while he is in his weakened state, no matter what.]
Follower clenched his fists, feeling a thrill surge through his veins.
"Yes, Master Godless." He turned, determination hardening his gaze.
Stark, weakened or not, would not escape his wrath.

chapters.title: Chapter 339 - 339: Lilith, The New Party Member
chapters.content:
Stark and Sora took a moment in the Hollow Square, the last safe spot before reaching the tower.
The air was heavy, and Sora leaned against a stone bench, glancing at her hands with emotionless eyes.
The encounter with Father Hugo and Eternal Regret didn't even seem to shake her.
But it had been around 30 minutes since they left the orphanage so it made sense.
So many [Global Announcements] happened as they were resting, meaning that the trial probably changed a lot.
"35%," Sora muttered as she checked her infection level again.
Stark's infection was slower, thanks to the [Blood-Stained Amulet] he'd picked up in the orphanage.
[Moonscorch Infection: 14%]
His display read, far more manageable. But Sora's was climbing fast.
Not fast enough to actually be an issue, though, as each minute would grant you around 1% of moonscorch.
"We can't stay here much longer. We have to get somewhere else," Stark said. "There'll be something out there that can help us."
Every participant was growing stronger, and they couldn't be the only one just sitting there doing nothing.
She nodded, standing straighter as they scanned the path ahead.
But then, out of the silence of the Hollow Square, dozens of monsters roaming around, a voice called out.
"Well, I didn't expect to see anyone here."
Stark and Sora turned, and there she was—a red-haired girl with a relaxed, easygoing smile, nothing like her meditative state back in the village square.
The girl from before, the one who hadn't bothered to share her name.
"Oh, it's you," Stark muttered, watching her carefully.
She grinned, her red hair glowing in the dim light, and waved. "Yeah, I was wondering if you'd remember me. Chosen and Sora, right?"
They exchanged a glance. Stark had a feeling she wasn't here by chance.
"What do you want?" Sora was the one who spoke, seemingly protective of Stark.
No one would dare approach Chosen and Sora, the number one enemies of this trial.
Everyone, even Clever, knew that angering Stark could result in getting hit by a spear capable of destroying entire cities.
So, no thank you!
"The name's Lilith, and I'm just like you: aiming for the moons," she said cheerfully, "You are the only duo left, everyone else is solo, so they probably all plan to kill each other."
The ease in her tone caught Stark off guard, especially after seeing how silent and calm she'd been before. "You didn't seem too talkative back in the village," he pointed out.
"Yeah, well, that was me in my [Meditation] state," she said with a shrug, "Helps me keep my skills up, tune out distractions. But I don't mind company once in a while."
It was strange seeing someone so relaxed, almost cheerful, in this bleak place.
Stark sized her up.
But he couldn't trust anybody.
"Mind if I ask what level you are?" Stark said, his voice casual, but his [Focus] skill activating just in case.
"Level 136," she replied, looking him dead in the eye. "Just enough to take down a level 600 elite boss on my own. Still want me on the team?"
Sora's eyes widened slightly, and even Stark was impressed, though he hid it well.
A level 600 elite boss on her own?
That was pretty much like taking out a commander.
She was stronger than Stark, no denying it.
But this meant a higher chance of betrayal.
'Flower Analysis,' Sora mumbled, and dozens of flowers came out of the ground, stopping right in front of her ears, whispering things to her.
Stark was about to refuse the invitation.
But before he could say anything.
"She can be trusted, I believe," Sora spoke, nodding.
"..." Stark was confused as to why Sora would suddenly say that, but he trusted her, "Alright, you can join... for now."
But to be safe, he activated [Flow], focusing on her for ten seconds, enabling the ability that allowed him to track her every movement one second before she made them.
He then used [Target Set] from his [Focus] skill to pinpoint her location.
No way was he was letting her wander out of his sight unnoticed.
With these two things, there was no chance she could ambush him.
Plus, he always had his second life in case he needed it.
"Let's head out," he said after a moment, leading the way out of the Hollow Square. "We're going wherever we feel like."
"No problemo," Lilith winked while making a small ok sign with her hand.
Stark didn't know who she was, and her appearance was too sudden for his taste, but at the end of the day, if Sora said it was okay, then so be it.
Lilith was extremely beautiful, her long red hair reaching her waist, and her crimson eyes always flaring with aura.
There was some kind of tension around her wherever she went, and she was undeniably powerful.
Whether she was an ally or a future traitor, it didn't matter to Stark.
If he got killed, he would revive and instantly use [Heaven's Spear].
No one knew of his revives besides the one of [Crimson Healing], so it didn't matter.
As they made their way through the eerily quiet streets, Lilith chatted with Sora, their conversation casual, almost too casual for the tension all around them.
Stark kept an eye on them, but Lilith seemed genuinely friendly, if a bit enigmatic.
There was no denying her confidence.
But there was also something about her that Stark couldn't quite put his finger on.
On the way to their next location, Lilith showed incredible power: she could fly, use her energy, beams, magic swords, everything, basically.
Her [Qi Aura], which she got from the [Domination Talent] was something she could use to make almost anything.
[Name: Lilith]
[Domination Talent: Cultivation]
It was yet another top 10 strongest domination talents.
And of course, it was normal: this trial regrouped the strongest at their level, so no wonder.
Lilith even managed to take down a level 550 elite by herself, not allowing Stark and Sora to act under the pretext of "let me show you what I can do".
Stark kept noting every single skill she used in his mind, though, in case they ever fought.
...
An hour later.
Their moonscorch infection was getting pretty high, and so they needed to find another safe zone.
[Most safe zones in Termina are destroyed by now, you need to find one inside of a specific structure.]
Knowing that, the trio soon approached the [Temple District], the path ahead marked by grand pillars and massive, ancient carvings.
The towering stone structures loomed over them, casting long shadows across the ground.
Stark couldn't shake the feeling that something dangerous lay ahead.
But Sora's moonscorch rate was at 94%, so he needed to be quick.
"I'm sure there's a safe zone inside," Lilith nodded, optimistic.
She was actually the only one not moonscorched for some reason.
Unlike Clever, the idea of being touched by these beasts disgusted her, and so she didn't test it out.
"Probably, just make sure to be quick," Stark replied, glancing at Sora's display, her infection still ticking up.
He quickened his pace, leading them toward the central structure.
The entrance to the temple loomed before them, its doors partially opened as if inviting them in.
The air inside was still, a stark contrast to the chaos they had left behind in the orphanage and Hollow Square.
"Just for your info, every place you enter locks itself behind you," Stark informed Lilith, "We'll probably have to complete a task or something."
"Hm... no problem, I'll help," Lilith shrugged, unbothered.
But as soon as they stepped into the vast hall, Stark's instincts flared.
He immediately sensed a presence ahead, something ominous and overpowering.
And then they saw him.
A massive figure knelt at the center of the room, his back turned to them, head bowed in prayer.
The aura around him was cold and merciless, filling the room with a suffocating pressure.
Stark's breath hitched as the name and level appeared above the figure's head.
[Father Hugo - Level 600]
A chill washed over him.
He'd barely survived their last encounter.
And here he was, praying as if waiting for their arrival.
"OH COME ON!" Stark shouted, instinctively shifting into a defensive stance, "That guy is pretty much stalking us at this point!"
Sora's face went pale, and even Lilith's relaxed demeanor tensed as she took in the threat before them.
Father Hugo slowly rose, turning toward them, a smirk playing across his lips.
"Children... I found bad children to play with..."
His gaze held the cold confidence of someone who knew he was invincible, towering above them in his moonscorched form.
That thing could roam through the entire city, but the first thing it did was head to the [Temple]?
Stark almost wanted to say he was a good priest, but that would be too good for such a disgusting being.
"I had hoped you'd come," he murmured, his voice carrying through the vast hall. "You saved me a lot of trouble children."
Stark's grip tightened, his mind racing through every skill he had.
This wouldn't be like before.
He'd barely scraped by last time, and Sora wasn't in a better state than he was.
Click!
[Door of the temple has been locked!]
[There are no tasks in the temple as they have been removed for this occasion!]
"Are you serious?" this trial was pretty much toying with them.
[The only way to leave is to kill Father Hugo.]
[Good luck!]
"Stark… can we even…?" Sora's voice was barely a whisper, her eyes locked on the massive figure.
"We don't have a choice," Stark replied, his voice steady.
He activated his aura, the thought of retreating didn't even cross his mind anymore.
Not with Father Hugo standing between them alone now.
Previously, there was [Eternal Regret] to take care of too, but now, he was alone.
Lilith stepped forward, her usual cheer replaced by a fierce, determined glare.
Her aura flared, a wild, almost feral energy emanating from her as she pulled out two swords made out of blue QI.
"Well, then," she said, her voice a low growl, "looks like I'll have a bit of fun after all."
Father Hugo's smile widened as he raised one hand, summoning a swirling mass of dark energy.
Stark could feel the weight of his power, every fiber in his being screaming to run, but he held firm, focused on every movement, every second that ticked by.
Father Hugo let out a laugh, a sound that echoed through the temple as if mocking their determination.
"Come, then. Show me what makes you think you can survive, or maybe... you want to run just like last time, little rabbits?"
Stark, Sora, and Lilith didn't wait another second.
They lunged forward, their combined auras blazing.

chapters.title: Chapter 340 - 340: The Temple, Father Hugo's Return
chapters.content:
Father Hugo appeared in the doorway, towering and dark, his eyes glowing a sickly yellow that barely lit the shadows around his face.
Stark used [Perception] immediately, the details of Father Hugo's stats flooding his mind.
[Name: Father Hugo, Moonscorch Commander (Immortal)]
[Level: 600]
[HP: 8,000,000]
[Strength: 34,127]
[Stamina: 17,853]
[Speed: 8,632]
[Defense: 37,249]
[Skills: Correction Smash, Divine Wrath, Holy Bind, Redemption Beam, Aura Suppression, Soul Cleaver, Sacred Ground, Iron Fist, Celestial Judgment (Mythical), Punishment, Blessed Chains (Mythical), Salvation's Edge, Abyssal Silence (Mythical), Test of Faith (Godly), Penitent's Fury, Martyr's Barrier (Godly), Return to Sender (Immortal)]
...
Stark swallowed.
"He's level six hundred…" he already knew that, but the stats and skills looked too powerful for his taste.
And he had an [Immortal] level skill, which is the highest rank.
Father Hugo's gaze shifted to him, a slow smirk tugging at his lips as his fists began to glow with a golden light.
The power radiating from him was almost unbearable, pressing on Stark, Sora, and Lilith like a physical weight.
Stark clenched his fists and summoned [Asura's Arms].
With a burst of crimson energy, four powerful, aura-infused arms materialized around him, each one crackling with barely-contained force.
"Alright," he muttered, more to himself. "Let's go."
[3...]
Father Hugo cracked his fingers and neck.
[2...]
"Bad children will be disciplined."
[1...]
"I'll use your bodies and hang them around the temple."
[FIGHT!]
Lilith shot forward with a speed that made her almost invisible.
In a flash, her [Celestial Blades] appeared, dual swords of shimmering qi, and she launched a rapid strike.
She slashed at Father Hugo, but his [Martyr's Barrier] flared up, blocking her blades with ease.
His eyes gleamed as he turned to her, and with a swift motion, he swung his hand to deliver a punishing [Correction Smash].
Lilith managed to dodge at the last second, twisting mid-air and landing on her feet just outside the range of the strike.
She avoided the [Moonscorch] effect.
The impact left a deep crater in the floor, cracks spidering outward as Father Hugo's fist crushed the ground.
"Lilith, keep your distance!" Sora shouted, her hands already weaving vines.
With a sweep of her arm, she summoned [Vine Surge], roots and plants bursting from the ground to wrap around Father Hugo's legs. "We need to slow him down!"
Father Hugo chuckled, his laughter deep and chilling. "You think such pitiful attempts will hold me?"
With a burst of energy, his [Aura Suppression] flared, and the vines withered and snapped under the sheer pressure of his aura.
Seeing the vines break, Stark sprang into action, using his speed to maneuver around Hugo, dodging the wild swings of his iron-clad fists with [Invincible Dodge].
[Perfect Dodge]
This slowed time just enough for Stark to glimpse Hugo's movements, allowing him to counter with his own attacks.
One of Stark's aura fists lunged forward, crashing into Hugo's side with enough force to send a shockwave through the room.
Hugo staggered, momentarily caught off-guard.
-11,849!
Low damage.
But he quickly recovered, smiling, "Nice one, child."
Lilith took the opening, using [Dragon's Breath] to unleash a blazing stream of energy directly into his face.
The flames seared Hugo's skin, leaving charred marks across his face and neck.
"..."
-4,384! -7,371!
But Hugo barely flinched again, his defense and magic resistance too high.
"Is that all?" he sneered, his eyes gleaming with a twisted satisfaction.
He raised his arm, summoning [Celestial Judgment].
A massive, glowing blade of divine energy formed in his hand, radiating a blinding light.
"Watch out!" Stark yelled.
Hugo swung the blade down with immense force, aiming at Sora.
She threw up her [Flower Barrier] just in time, the translucent shield taking the brunt of the strike.
But the barrier shattered instantly, sending her flying backward.
She hit the ground hard, gasping for air.
-32,834!
That thing does high damage, and takes little to none.
How was this fair.
He was comparable to a level 750 normal monster.
"The moonscorch is the true way to strength," Hugo laughed, "Join me."
"Alright, that's enough!" Stark growled, pushing himself to his limits.
He combined his six aura arms and lifted them up, then he concentrated on his [Aura Smash], merging of all his fists into a giant one.
"Fool," Hugo laughed, "Martyr's Barrier!"
The crimson fist collided with Hugo's barrier, it was the thing that allowed him to endure so much and receive so little damage.
But...
"FUCK YOU!"
Right as the fist was about to collide, Stark overused his aura on the fist.
BOOOM!
And it exploded right as it was about to reach Hugo.
This wasn't one of his [Aura Smash] perks, not at all: he just made it in the moment after knowing from the orphanage chase that no projectiel would work.
The fist exploded, sending Hugo flying across the room and slamming him into the far wall.
CRACK!
And the [Martier's Barrier] cracked a little.
It didn't break, but it was progress.
For a moment, the room was silent, dust swirling around the area where Hugo had crashed.
-37,939!
But then, a low, sinister laugh echoed from the debris.
Hugo stood up, brushing dust from his shoulders, not even fazed.
His eyes locked onto Stark. "Impressive... but futile."
He raised his hand, summoning [Blessed Chains].
Glowing, divine chains shot out from his palm, homing in on Sora with terrifying accuracy.
She tried to dodge, but the chains adjusted mid-air, wrapping around her limbs and binding her tightly.
"NO!" Stark yelled, rushing forward, but Hugo raised a hand, his aura flaring with a golden light. "[Sacred Ground]."
A dome of divine energy surrounded Sora, blocking Stark's path as the chains tightened around her.
She struggled, but the chains sapped her strength, glowing brighter with each passing second.
Sora's eyes widened as her energy drained rapidly, and her movements slowed until she finally went limp.
[Sora is knocked out!]
"This dome is unbreakable," Hugo laughed, "Good luck saving her."
BAM! BAM! BAM!
Stark tried to hit the dome with everything he had, using all of his fists, but as Hugo said, it didn't even budge.
'Damn it... I would have to use EGO's Negation...' he thought, but he didn't want to do that now.
[EGO Meter: 100/100]
"Your struggle is worthless," Hugo sneered, his voice cold and mocking. "Bow before the authority of the Moonscorch."
Fury boiling within him, Stark activated [Crimson Purification].
A shockwave of crimson holy energy burst from his body, flooding the room.
The energy clashed against Hugo, but he wasn't phased.
"I am quite literally unaffected by holy attacks," he shrugged, "It's obvious, isn't it?"
"...Yeah, it kind of is."
But that wasn't why he did that.
Beside him, Lilith raised her hand while flying with [QI Flight], and unleashed [Divine Energy Spear].
A colossal spear of pure qi formed in her hand, radiating divine blue energy.
With all her might, she hurled it at Hugo.
'Not as strong as mine, though,' Stark noticed.
The spear headed toward Hugo, but right as it was about to hit his barrier, the priest quite literally just grabbed it with his hands.
"Hm," and just like last time, he broke it in half, "That's all?"
"STOP DOING THAT," Stark was growing more angry every attack Hugo casually dodged or shrugged off.
He seized the moment, summoning all ten of his [Crimson Spears].
They hovered around him, each one glowing with a fierce, red energy.
Then he sent them hurtling toward Hugo, each spear striking with deadly precision.
"Aura Supression," Hugo put both of his hands together, closing his eyes, and a transparent shockwave was sent through the temple.
And the exact moment he did that...
BAM!
"Huh?" Lilith's [QI Flight] was cancelled, resulting in her falling down, forcing Stark to grab her.
In addition to that, all of Stark's spears were reduced to nothing.
But of course, it couldn't end so easily.
"Return to Sender... Initiation..." Father Hugo was using his strongest skill now.
Even for such strong foes, using Immortal-Level skills was a difficult task, and Hugo was concentrating as hard as he could, drops of sweats appearing on his bald forehead.
"Your efforts are wasted," he said coldly. "You cannot stand against the Moonscorch."
"Not yet," Stark muttered, clenching his fists, his aura flaring, "I'm gonna murder you..."
But then...
"RETURN TO SENDER!"
Father Hugo finalized the usage of his strongest skill.
Victory was now impossible.

chapters.title: Chapter 341 - 341: Underground Temple, Only One Left
chapters.content:
Father Hugo's laughter echoed in the temple as the dark, crimson, and blue auras swirled around him.
The air grew thick with a mix of intense energy, twisting and melding into something that looked both holy and corrupted.
He begun hovering a few feet above the ground, his expression one of twisted delight.
"Look at this power!" Hugo's voice boomed, his eyes glinting with an unsettling joy. He raised his hand, allowing the combined auras to dance along his arm. "Your strength, your skills—they're now mine!"
Stark's fists tightened, his gaze fixed on Hugo's smug expression. The realization hit hard: Hugo had just absorbed [Crimson Spears] and [QI Flight].
They were staring down an even more monstrous version of the priest than before.
"Can't believe it…" Stark muttered, gritting his teeth.
He could still feel his connection to his skills, but seeing them twisted in Hugo's hands felt like a violation.
Lilith, by his side, looked equally horrified as Hugo raised one of his newly copied spears, its crimson glow matching Stark's.
"QI flight!" Lilith used her skill, and it seemed as though she could still use it.
'So he copied it...' Stark thought.
"You've both proven quite entertaining," Hugo said, his voice dripping with arrogance. "But playtime is over."
With a smirk, Hugo summoned ten [Crimson Spears], their familiar red glow casting ominous shadows across the walls.
He held them around himself, the ease and familiarity he displayed making it clear he'd instantly mastered Stark's ability.
Hugo waved his hand, sending the spears hurtling toward Stark and Lilith with terrifying speed.
"Dodge!" Stark shouted, leaping to the side.
He summoned his own [Crimson Spears], countering with his own barrage to intercept Hugo's.
The two volleys of spears collided in mid-air, sending shockwaves throughout the temple.
The ground beneath them cracked and trembled from the impact, each explosion adding more destruction to the temple.
Lilith took advantage of the chaos, darting forward with [Flash Step], her swords materializing with a shimmering glow as she lunged at Hugo.
Her blade met Hugo's arm, which was shielded by his barrier.
"You can't touch me," Hugo taunted, his voice dripping with mockery.
Lilith glared, raising her hand to summon another [Divine Energy Spear].
She hurled it toward Hugo, but he countered with Stark's [Spear Block], deflecting it away as if it were nothing.
Stark watched in frustration, feeling the depth of Hugo's mastery over his stolen abilities.
Then Hugo raised his arm high, his eyes locked onto Stark with a twisted grin.
Stark felt the surge of energy even before he saw it—a colossal spear forming in Hugo's hand.
The weapon radiated a raw, overwhelming power.
"Oh no…" Stark's eyes widened as he recognized his own [Spear of Judgment].
Hugo was using one of his strongest abilities, a colossal spear that could shatter even the toughest defenses, and also followed the target no matter what.
But strangely enough, he didn't actually throw it at Stark or Lilith.
With a dark smile, Hugo lifted the spear high above his head and then, with a forceful downward swing, slammed it into the temple floor.
The ground buckled and shattered, splitting open as the spear's impact reverberated through the entire room.
Cracks shot out in all directions as the floor gave way.
"Get down!" Stark shouted, reaching out to grab Lilith's arm as the ground collapsed beneath them.
They fell, tumbling through the crumbling stone and landing hard in the [Underground Temple] below.
"Just how many fucking buildings have underground zones?!" Stark shouted as he fell.
The air was thick with dust, and Stark pushed himself up, coughing as he tried to get his bearings.
The dimly lit underground chamber stretched out before them, with ancient pillars and worn-out symbols etched into the walls.
Somewhere in the darkness, Hugo's mocking laughter echoed.
"Well, well," Hugo's voice sneered from above as he floated down, his silhouette barely visible through the dust. "Welcome to the depths, children. Let's make this even more enjoyable."
Stark got to his feet, eyes narrowing as he watched Hugo descend, the stolen [QI Flight] making him hover effortlessly.
Lilith was right beside him, her breathing heavy but her eyes still fierce with determination.
"We need a plan," she whispered. "This place is smaller—there's less room to dodge."
They were in a circle arena under the temple, and the hole was so big it was impossible to get back up, even using [Crimson Ball Transmission].
They were stuck now, with no exit on sight.
Stark nodded, glancing around at the columns and walls. "Yeah, but maybe we can use that to our advantage."
Before they could coordinate any further, Hugo raised his hand, calling forth more [Crimson Spears].
This time, they were tinged with a faint, dark aura that seemed to taint the crimson glow, making them even more menacing.
He let them loose while flying around, sending a relentless rain of spears toward the two.
Stark and Lilith dove behind one of the large stone pillars, the spears slamming into it with explosive force, cracking and splintering the ancient stone.
As the dust cleared, Stark darted out from cover.
He lunged forward, focusing all his strength as he aimed for Hugo's head.
But just as his fist was about to connect, Hugo activated blocked with [Iron Fists], both of his arms turning silver.
"Didn't think you could actually hit me, did you?" Hugo taunted, delivering a counterstrike that sent Stark stumbling backward.
[Moonscorch infection increased.]
Lilith took advantage of the opening, flying upward with her [QI Flight] and launching herself at Hugo with her twin blades.
She moved with impressive speed, her attacks swift and precise, but Hugo matched her move for move, wielding his many skills with an eerie familiarity.
But then...
Stark made a second mistake.
"DOUBLE ASSAULT," he was getting tired of this bullshit, and so he decided to activate his skill, doubling his stats and aura for 20 seconds, "ALRIGHT, HUGO, AVOID THIS!"
Stark was ready to dash, his speed surely enough to instantly overpower Hugo.
But that was when he made his second mistake: and it was to assume Father Hugo couldn't use his Immortal Perk again.
"Aura Suppression..." He allowed a hit from Lilith to place his palms together.
FWISH!
And Stark's aura was taken straight out of him again.
It didn't cancel his own [Double Assault], but he had a bad feeling.
"RETURN TO SENDER...!" Hugo's eyes opened, and his dark aura completely took over his body, "DOUBLE ASSAULT!"
He used the skill too, and suddenly, right as Lilith was about to swing at him, he moved to fast it almost looked like he disappeared.
"Thanks for the skill, child," Hugo appeared before Stark, punching him in the gut and sending him flying backward.
"GARGH," even with his own [Double Assault], Stark struggled to stay in place.
-43,839!
His defense was doubled, but Hugo's attack was as well.
"Stay put, I'll deal with you last," Father Hugo grinned before disappearing from view.
That exchange lasted less than a second, and so it meant was still in the air, confused as to where Hugo could have gone.
"Hello, there, child," he smashed her down.
[You have been infected with moonscorch.]
And he didn't waste any time in appearing behind her again as she looked up.
"You are slow, child."
Lilith, even though she was level 137, couldn't understand how this was possible.
Her eyes widened before she received another punch in the face.
What followed was a complete beatdown.
Lilith gasped as the combined assault tore through her defenses.
She tried to dodge, but the energy struck her squarely, sending her crashing into the wall.
She slumped to the ground, blood trickling from the corner of her mouth.
[HP: 37,374/232,000]
"Lilith!" Stark yelled, rushing toward her, but Hugo stepped between them, blocking his path with a sneer.
"No interruptions," Hugo mocked. "It's time she learned what happens when you defy the Moonscorch."
He raised his hand, his aura flaring as he activated [Blessed Chains] again.
Glowing chains shot out, wrapping around Lilith's limbs, holding her in place as she struggled against them.
Her strength faded as the chains tightened, draining her energy.
"Stark..." Lilith mumbled, smiling, "Kick that guy's ass..."
He didn't know Lilith for long, not even two hours actually, but even then, he was mad.
"Let her go!" Stark shouted, fury igniting within him.
He charged forward, but Hugo casually extended one hand, using [Sacred Ground] to summon a wall of crimson energy that threw Stark backward.
Hugo turned his gaze back to Lilith, his expression darkening as he increased the power of his chains.
Her struggles grew weaker, her breaths shallow as the chains squeezed the life out of her.
"You… will… break," Hugo whispered, his voice cold and merciless.
Lilith's eyes widened in terror as she felt her energy slipping away, her vision blurring.
[Lilith has been knocked out!]
"I like to make sure the children are aware of the torture, a slow death isn't beautiful, after all," Hugo laughed as he turned back toward Stark, "You are the last one."
"I'll kick your ass alone, I don't need anybody else anyway," Stark's expression turned cold, positioning himself for what was next.

chapters.title: Chapter 342 - 342: Double Heaven's Spear, Dark Angel
chapters.content:
Stark didn't waste a second.
He was beyond angry, but that anger had already come and gone, leaving him feeling nothing but focused.
In the ruined remains of the temple, he glanced around, assessing the damage.
Sora lay crumpled nearby, still breathing, though she was unconscious.
Stark exhaled in relief. At least she'd made it.
A few feet away, Lilith's body was sprawled on the ground, her energy completely drained.
Stark barely knew her, but she'd helped him fight, and that was enough for him.
For a 3v1 battle, Father Hugo had completely wiped them out.
The fact that Hugo had managed this said everything about his power.
Maybe Hugo was as strong as the moon trio themselves?
No, Stark shook his head. No way.
"Child, let us continue," Hugo's voice echoed, cold and mocking.
He lifted his arm, summoning a spear glowing with raw, ominous energy.
It was [Spear of Judgment], a move Stark owned.
Hugo's laugh boomed as he raised it. "Or do you no longer have the strength?"
"Not going to fly anymore?" Stark asked, deadpan.
"I can't," Hugo shrugged, unbothered.
Stark quickly pieced it together: Hugo could only use stolen abilities if the original user was actively using them.
That was why Hugo had only been able to take his [Crimson Spears] and [Double Assault] earlier.
An unconscious person meant he couldn't do it anymore.
Stark needed to be careful of what he used.
Or at least, that is what the him 5 minutes ago would say.
But now? He didn't care if Hugo took his abilities.
"You want my powers?" Stark lifted his hand, summoning his own [Spear of Judgment], "Fine. Let's fight."
Fwish! Fwish!
The two massive, crimson spears hurtled through the air, colliding with an explosive shockwave before shooting upward.
"What the?" Stark was confused, was that a normal reaction.
Or maybe the fact the spears followed one another resulted in a constant loop of going up.
BOOM!
The impact shattered what remained of the temple ceiling, revealing the sky above.
Stark saw the two colossal crimson moons, each with a singular eye, glaring down at him.
But as soon as his gaze met theirs, they fled, vanishing into the night.
"Cowards," Stark muttered, his focus returning to Hugo.
"Alright, Hugo," he said. "Copy this."
Stark drew his energy from deep within, channeling every bit of his aura into a single, destructive move.
He knew what he was about to attempt was reckless, but he was far past the point of caring.
"Heaven's Spear!"
A dark rift tore open in the sky, spilling forth a radiant, towering angelic figure nearly fifty kilometers high.
The being hovered, massive and imposing, its white, ethereal wings stretching across the horizon.
With a slow, deliberate movement, it raised an enormous spear of pure crimson energy, its size capable of leveling entire cities.
Stark couldn't help but feel a surge of confidence—until he looked at Hugo.
The man was grinning, his eyes filled with twisted satisfaction.
A second rift appeared beside Stark's, this one inky black, as Hugo summoned his own angelic figure—a shadowy, warped imitation of Stark's.
This one wielded a dark spear, crackling with a vile energy.
The two divine beings faced off, each with their spears raised high, awaiting their masters' commands.
"You think you're special, child?" Hugo sneered. "You're nothing but another pawn."
Stark clenched his fists. He didn't respond. Talking wouldn't do any good here, not with someone like Hugo.
Suddenly, Hugo leapt forward, fists blazing as he tried to catch Stark off guard.
Stark met him, and the two clashed, exchanging brutal blows.
Each punch shook the ground beneath them, sending shockwaves through the already crumbling temple.
Stark's anger was allowing him to actively compete with Hugo in terms ot physical strength, his eyes leaving a trail of crimson aura as he moved.
"YOU'RE GOING TO DIE, HUGO, YOU KNOW IT!" Stark punched the air so fast that even though Hugo blocked with his arms, he was still stumbling back.
-17,948!
"Heh, getting stronger, I see," the priest laughed.
At last, Hugo's dark angel began to move.
He was ready to strike.
With a menacing grin, Hugo pointed at Stark. "It's time," he said coldly, directing his angel to hurl its spear down toward them.
"Come on, dark angel, show them who's the king."
[Very well, you damn fucking idiot.]
"???"
The air around them grew heavy, thick with energy as the spear hurtled toward the earth.
The shockwave alone was enough to make the ground beneath Stark's feet tremble.
"Holy shit!" Shock gasped while fighting monsters, "STARK IS..."
"There's two of them?" Artist questioned, while drawing on the buildings.
Even the other participants who'd been watching from afar couldn't hide their shock.
One [Heaven's Spear] was already unimaginable—two was enough to bring sheer terror to everyone in range.
"Master... I see what you mean now," Follower looked at the two angels, his vision flooded by their beauty, "Chosen is truly the most dangerous of all."
Stark didn't flinch. He'd expected this.
"Alright, asshole, let's do this," he muttered, a smirk breaking across his face as he activated [Dodge Control].
Immediately, his body shifted, flowing like water as the world around him began to slow down.
The power of [Dodge Control] took hold, his body adapting in real-time to avoid anything that came his way, no matter how powerful or destructive.
In front, Hugo stared at the falling spear, his face a mix of fascination and resignation.
"Child…" he murmured, eyes fixed on the massive energy above. "This world is already in ruins." His mouth twisted into a bitter smile. "Let's both die together."
It dawned on Stark then—Hugo didn't plan to survive this.
His goal had always been to take out as many participants as possible, even if it cost him his own life.
No way anyone survives something so powerful, not even he could.
So his plan was to take the four of them with him.
The domes would probably survive since they are indestructible, but he was already using them on both Sora and Lilith, meaning that as he died, the girls would slowly begin to suffer and moonscorch.
"My plan is perfect!" Hugo cackled, throwing his head back as the spear continued its descent.
But Hugo wasn't stupid—he noticed Stark activating a skill, one that might let him escape the spear's impact.
And just as predicted, Hugo planned to copy it and mimick Stark's actions.
Whether he survived or not, in the end, he would be there to end the humans.
Hugo smirked, immediately calling forth another shockwave of dark energy from [Aura Supression] in an attempt to absorb Stark's skill.
If he could pull Stark's [Dodge Control] from him and copy it, he would be safe.
But this time, it wouldn't work.
"Has anyone ever told you that you're an idiot?" Stark stood in place as the shockwave was approaching him, his expression so malicious that it became even scarier than Father Hugo's.
"What the hell are you talking about, child-" it didn't take Hugo long to realize just how fucked he was.
[Dodge Control] didn't just evade attacks.
It made Stark's body teleport around anything that could hit him—even if that "attack" was an unavoidable shockwave.
Without it, Hugo couldn't use [Return to Sender].
The shockwave passed through empty air as Stark's body blinked between locations faster than Hugo could register, teleporting around the assault until he was beside Hugo, gripping his shoulder with a vice-like hold.
[Your shockwave didn't hit anything.]
"You're fucked, and you know it," Stark muttered, still smiling.
He raised his other hand, pointing toward the sky, where the colossal spear Hugo himself sent was only meters away from impact.
Time slowed down, their gazes fixed on the destructive force about to consume them.
Hugo looked up, eyes wide, a final trace of fear flickering in his gaze.
"…Child of demons," he murmured to Stark, "You win."
And then, the spear hit the ground.
The world detonated in a blinding explosion of crimson and shadow as the spear impacted the ground, tearing the temple and everything around it into shreds.
The impact was felt far beyond the immediate area, a shockwave of light and sound ripping through the landscape.
Every participant, monster, and even the moon apostles themselves were stunned, momentarily frozen in awe and horror.
When the dust settled, Stark was gone from the point of impact, [Dodge Control] allowing him to escape the explosion's reach.
With Lilith and Sora in his asura arms, he leapt and dashed over debris, using his agility to scale the remnants of the temple.
He reached the edge of the crater, glancing back at the devastation.
A massive hole marked the area where the temple had once stood, stretching out like a scar across the landscape.
Stark exhaled, satisfaction coursing through him.
"And to think," he muttered, "that was just a pale imitation." If Hugo's [Heaven's Spear] had been that strong, his own must be even stronger.
He hadn't even used it!
That stupid Father Hugo quite literally killed himself using the skill he thought would end them all!
Ding!
A notification flashed in his vision.
[You have slain "Father Hugo, Moonscorch Commander," +50,000,000 Experience Points!]
[Task 13: Defeat Father Hugo in the Orphanage - Completed]
[Gained two rewards: Priest's Cross (???) and Moonscorch Cure (Use to completely heal moonscorch).]
A smirk tugged at Stark's lips.
"Looks like the priest is going to hell."
Stark didn't waste a single second though, dashing forward as he needed to find a safe zone.
[Sora: 98% Moonscorched]
[Lilith: 13% Moonscorched]
The latter had been hit several times, so no wonder it was going up this fast.
It should stabilize later, but until then he simply decided to not try his luck and so to use the newly acquired [Moonscorch Cure] on Sora.

chapters.title: Chapter 343 - 343: Leaving The Temple, Shock's Last Moments
chapters.content:
[Task 13: Defeat Father Hugo in the Orphanage - Completed]
[Gained two rewards: Priest's Cross (???) and Moonscorch Cure (Use to completely heal moonscorch).]
He used the [Moonscorch Cure] on Sora, and stored the [Priest's Cross] in his system inventory since he couldn't see the description.
[Experience: 1,545,000/10,000,000] (level 115)
He had gained 50,000,000 experience from this, and thankfully enough this time there wasn't any curse to block him.
Ding! Ding! Ding!
[Your level has increased to level 116, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Your level has increased to level 117, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
.
[Your level has increased to level 119, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Experience: 5,545,000/14,000,000] (level 119)
It seems that from 10,000,000 experience and moving, it now added 1,000,000 experience every level.
"Fine by me," he mumbled.
The air around the ruined temple hung thick with smoke and debris, the aftermath of Stark's brutal clash with Father Hugo still fresh.
Sora and Lilith remained unconscious, held securely in the four additional arms of his [Asura's Arms] skill, which granted him the strength to carry them both with ease.
Thankfully enough, by an absolute miracle, Hugo actually didn't deactivate the [Domes] that he had placed around them, essentially saving them.
He murmured a tired acknowledgment as he studied his stats and newly earned skill points.
He could still feel the pulse of energy from [Heaven's Spear] in the air, and he knew that everyone in Termina, humans and monsters alike, would have noticed its power.
The angelic figure summoned by the skill remained hovering in the sky, watching over him with an otherworldly gaze.
[I see many participants and elite monster, master].
[Should I shoot them?]
"No, just come back," Stark shook his head, he needed to keep the angel with him.
Now that everyone witnessed the power of his [Heaven's Spear], no chance in hell they would try anything.
But of course, the fact he created such a massive explosion meant that many monsters, and even participants, would come to check what the hell all of this was about.
Ahead, his map revealed that the museum lay only a short distance from the temple ruins.
Stark opened up his map, noticing that the museum was actually not far from the destroyed temple.
If he met a second commander, it woud be incredibly difficult, so all he could do was hope.
[Asura's] four additional arms allowed him to use his normal ones freely while steal making sure Lilith and Sora were safe.
Maybe he could fight like this, actually, who knows.
But...
"I'm so tired..." he mumbled, his eyes on the verge of closing, his body swaying as he carried on toward the museum.
Avoiding both that [Aura Supression] shockwave, then the massive [Dark Heaven's Spear] (Hugo's Variant) was still exhausting, even though he had [Dodge Control].
He carried on though, knowing that dropping here was guaranteed death.
Actually, he finally decided to summon his [Ultimate Clone] by merging all of those he had since the cooldown of the skill was reset.
Ding!
[Ultimate Clone summoned!]
[Took... you.. long... enough...]
"Yeah, sorry."
He couldn't have used it before, and when he was in constant battle it was difficult sine the clone could die in one strike.
Well, except if he transfered some of his HP to it, but he was already pretty much on the verge of death himself, so it was stupid.
[Its... fine...]
Finally, they reached the museum.
Stark could tell it had once been a grand place, but now it bore the scars of the battles that had ravaged Termina.
Columns lay crumbled, the remnants of shattered display cases littering the floor.
The silence felt almost unsettling after the chaos.
But then, he saw it.
An open doorway bathed in a gentle glow.
Stark's heart skipped. He stepped forward, relief flooding him as the notification appeared:
[Safe zone discovered!]
Sighing, he guided Lilith and Sora over to a small bed.
When looking at them from this position, they were pretty damn cute.
But Stark didn't think of that.
He was too focused on what's next, and so as he sat on his chair, he placed his chin on his hands and began thinking, a spinning vortex of aura appearing in his eyes as he was deep in thought.
"Kill..." he whispered.
[Participants Alive:] Sora, Clever, Lilith, Shock, CEO, Artist, Follower, Stark
[Enemies Alive:] Tormented One, Heartless One, Eternal Regret, The Moon Apostle, The Mayor
...
Meanwhile, outside the temple ruins, another figure lingered, his eyes wide as he took in the scorched earth and wreckage.
"Wow…" Shock muttered, inching closer to the smoking battlefield.
The sight of the massive crater and the faint traces of the [Heaven's Spear] blast made his breath catch. "So, this is what Chosen's power looks like…"
Seeing the extent of the devastation left him feeling unsettled.
As he observed, a creeping sensation of being watched tingled at the back of his neck.
He froze, his gaze darting around.
From behind a half-destroyed column, a figure stepped out, his presence dark and chilling.
Shock stiffened as the tall, looming figure of Follower came into view.
Follower's expression was blank, his movements slow, almost measured, like a predator sizing up its prey.
"The maniac..." Shock mumbled, a forced grin creeping onto his face.
Follower tilted his head slightly, studying Shock with an unblinking intensity.
He looked unfazed by the destruction around them, as if it were simply another day.
The corner of Follower's mouth twitched slightly as he let out his aura, "Why are you here?"
"I mean, I was curious." Shock's grin faltered as he took a step back, his instinct for survival kicking in. "You know, just checking things out."
"Curiosity," Follower murmured, his eyes narrowing as he took a step forward. "Such a dangerous thing."
In an instant, the atmosphere shifted.
Follower's presence became suffocating, his gaze sharpening with a bloodthirsty glint.
Shock felt a cold sweat break out as he realized the danger he was in.
There was no amusement in Follower's expression now—only raw, lethal intent.
Shock scrambled back, his hands already reaching for his weapon.
But Follower was faster.
With a burst of speed, Follower closed the distance between them.
Shock barely had time to raise his guard before Follower's hand slammed into his chest, sending him sprawling onto the ground.
Shock coughed, the wind knocked out of him. "H-Hey, hold on! We don't have to do this!"
But Follower's response was only a cold stare as he approached.
His movements were calm, precise, as though he'd already decided how this encounter would end.
He lifted his arm, energy crackling around his fingers.
[Godless Demon perk activated.]
"WHAT THE FUCK IS WRONG WITH YOU-"
Before Shock could finish, Follower lunged, his fist slamming into Shock's gut with brutal force.
Shock doubled over, gasping, his knees hitting the ground as pain tore through him.
Desperation clawed at him. He raised his hand, trying to summon a skill, but Follower was relentless.
"Please… don't…" Shock's voice wavered, his body shaking from the sheer force of Follower's attacks.
His plea was cut short as Follower grabbed him by the throat, lifting him effortlessly off the ground.
Follower's eyes were unreadable, cold and merciless.
He didn't react to Shock's pleading expression, nor did he flinch at the panic in Shock's eyes.
With a sudden twist, Follower tightened his grip, and Shock's cries grew weaker.
DEMON DEVOURING!
He yet again used up his most powerful perk, a dark aura emerging from his body and gripping onto Shock's, devouring him completely.
"N-No…" Shock's voice was a whisper now, his strength fading as his vision began to blur. "Please…"
But his plea fell on deaf ears.
BOOM!
-999,999!
Instant death.
Follower watched, unblinking, as Shock's body went limp.
Then, with a final, swift movement, he released his hold, letting Shock's lifeless body slump to the ground.
Ding!
The notification rang out, cold and final:
[Participant "Shock" has been killed by "Follower."]
Seven remained.
Follower knelt beside Shock's body, his hand brushing over the item Shock had carried—the [Skill Canceller].
A smile played at the corners of his lips as he held the device, feeling the power it held.
Ding!
[You have stolen "Skill Canceller"!]
The implications of his new prize sank in.
With the ability to cancel one skill, Follower knew he now had a weapon powerful enough to take down even Chosen's [Heaven's Spear].
And also...
There was one last thing...
[Prove your devotion.]
[Kill 5 participants.]
[5/5]
Ding!
[You truly are a follower of the Godless Demon.]
[You have received a new perk: "Godless Demon Transformation" (Immortal)]
[Ultimate Task: Kill Chosen.]
[0/1]
"Yes... Master..." Follower grinned.
He had been following Stark's aura since he used it to fight Hugo, but it seemed the explosion let out so much energy he yet again lost trace of Chosen.
"I'll get you... Chosen One..."

chapters.title: Chapter 344 - 344: The Announcement That Would Change Everything
chapters.content:
[Participant "Shock" has been killed by "Follower."]
Stark sat in silence beside the bed where Lilith and Sora were resting.
He was tired, probably more than anyone else, but still, he needed to stay up.
He couldn't let his [Ultimate Clone] do all the work, and a sudden attack on this room would probably destroy all of it before they even realized it.
Plus, he was too pre-occupied by what would happen next to sleep.
Shock's death meant there were only seven people left in the trial now.
The one who'd stolen his kill on the [Inquisitor] was gone.
Removing himself, Sora, and Lillith, it left 4 other powerful participants.
The fact they each survived in solo already said enough about their power.
Clever? He was an old man, but Stark had a bad feeling about him regardless, almost as if none of the monsters or participants in this trial were worth using his powers on.
CEO? A maniac, truly, and he was the one who exposed Stark at the beginning, as well as started this whole attack.
Artist? Extremely powerful too, the only one Stark saw the powers of live, since he also fought the [Inquisitor] with him.
And finally, Follower, the most mysterious of them.
His [Focus] skill kept shouting [WATCH OUT] every time he got close at the start, was there a reason for that?
And on the other side of the trial, there were the monsters.
Stark hadn't met many normal monsters anymore, meaning that they either got all killed, or that the moon trio realized that it would just give experience to the participants, thus removing them.
In both cases, it means only the elite of the elite remained:
Eternal Regret, the creature made of the hundreds of souls from the orphanage children.
The Mayor, Stark hadn't met him, but he had killed one of CEO's goons, so he was definitely powerful.
Tormented One, Never met either, no idea what it could be, same thing for the Heartless One.
And finally, the big boss of this trial: the moon apostle.
Stark didn't know it, but he theorized that the [Moon Trio] was actually but a facade for the real [Moon Apostle].
Maybe defeating all three would reveal him.
Not that it would make a difference anyway.
Right as he was about to continue thinking about the future, though...
The most important announcement of this trial appeared.
An announcement that would change the entire trial.
No.
It would change the entire world.
[Global Announcement: More than half of the participants have been slain, and all conditions have been met for the "Grand Initiation".]
[Go outside if you aren't already.]
"Huh?"
The atmosphere around the entire trial darkened.
And it wasn't just a feeling anymore, it quite literally did.
Stark felt like he needed to go outside, no matter what.
"Clone, protect them," he whispered, gesturing to Lilith and Sora, and the [Ultimate Clone] nodded in understanding. "I have... a bad feeling."
Stark left the safe zone of the museum, avoiding the debris from the fallen structure, and finally, he opened the entrance door of the museum.
And that's when he saw it.
The sky, now a menacing crimson red, cast an eerie glow over the entire landscape.
And most importantly...
"What the hell is that..." he looked up, specifically toward the [Hollow Tower].
The tower was massive, but at the very top of it, a timer appeared, ticking down.
[Time before the 'Grand Initiation': 59:37 minutes... 59:36...]
Everywhere in the trial, except for Lilith and Sora, every participant could see that timer too.
And they all wondered: what the hell is the [Grand Initiation].
[This will change the entire world outside.]
[Enjoy while you still can.]
At this point, they were used to the trials and their random encounters/events.
But never has any of them claimed to "change the whole world".
Were monsters from this trial appear in the real world? Would they be forced to do tasks in the real world, killing millions?!
What the hell was it?
All they could do was wait the hour to see.
BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!
Three rifts split open in the sky, and the three [Crimson Moons] appeared.
'So he's back...' Stark thought.
[You need to kill all three moons to reveal the "Moon Apostle", otherwise they regenerate at some point.]
To keep things clear, Stark mentally labeled them Moone, Motwo, and Mothree.
"So it's time," Moone grinned, though that was only visible by the massive eye it had.
"Yeah, I guess it was bound to happen at some point," Motwo sighed, sounding almost indifferent.
"From today onward, the moment this timer hits 0, the end of humanity will begin," Mothree added.
The three moons couldn't hear the participants, nor could they see Stark's exasperation as he shouted, trying to get some kind of response.
It seemed as though they were speaking, but the main goal of this conversation was to announce something to the participants.
"This trial is reaching its halfway point."
"Agreed."
"Now the whole world shall see what is happening behind the scenes, beyond what they believed."
"They will discover the truth."
"The participants should feel honored," Moothree dared to add, laughing.
Moone shrugged, as if the lives of the participants were trivial, "Will they be honored? After all, this will be a big deal, won't it?"
"We're going to kill them anyway," Motwo stated flatly. "This is just a warning for humanity."
The three moons then spoke in unison, their voices merging into a chilling harmony as they all stared at Termina, and specifically at the participants, their pupils darting at their positios.
"The new world order is coming. You will all be bound to your fates."
And with that, the three moons vanished, leaving Stark to stand alone in the blood-red glow of the sky.
He stared, dumbfounded, at the timer ticking down.
Every word they'd said only served to deepen the pit of dread in his stomach.
"Bro what?" Stark was flabbergasted.
The hell were they even talking about?
"The end of humanity? The truth? New world order?" Stark murmured to himself, reeling from the cryptic words.
None of it made sense, yet every part of him sensed that whatever was coming was monumental.
What in the flying fuck does any of that mean?
For a few moments, he just stood there, transfixed by the timer.
The entire trial was eerily silent now. No monsters roamed the streets; it was as if everything had gone still in preparation for the "Grand Initiation."
All the moonscorch was gone.
"The halfway point... huh..."
The trial had always been deadly, with monsters and participants killing each other at every turn. But this was different.
This felt like something much larger, something beyond just survival.
Another way of escaping this trial? Maybe?
But before that, they would need to go through the [Grand Initiation].
They claimed that it would change the entire world.
"Probably related to the godless demon," was Stark's guess, and he was completely right.
Knowing that no monsters were there anymore, he just sat on the stairs of the museum, looking up.
It was the same thing for all other participants.
Artist drew a bed and rested on it, knowing that no monsters would come to disturb him.
Clever spun his cane, unfazed, biding his time.
CEO too, didn't do much, deciding to still roam around in case he could find anything.
And then there was Follower.
[It is our time.]
"Yes, master," Follower whispered to himself, a twisted smile spreading across his face.
[You have received the information. The world will now kneel before "Domination" users. Be ready.]
"Yes..."
He was ready for the [Grand Initiation], more than anyone else.
No... he was thrilled.
The chaos to come was exactly what he had been waiting for.

chapters.title: Chapter 345 - 345: The Grand Initiation of the World
chapters.content:
Stark sat on the museum steps, eyes locked on the crimson sky, which had grown darker since the timer appeared.
The clock counted down, second by second, showing just under an hour left.
Whatever the [Grand Initiation] was, it loomed closer with every tick.
Around Termina, the remaining participants waited, each feeling the weight of the impending event.
Stark thought back to the ominous announcement: "This will change the entire world."
The words gnawed at his mind, a sense of dread settling in his chest.
Yet even as Stark's nerves frayed, he knew he couldn't afford to lose focus.
He was one of the few domination users left, and this [Grand Initiation] would likely push them all to their limits.
After all, even in the real world, what actually was the number of domination users who survived until the third trial?
Maybe less than 1%.
...
Elsewhere, in a dark alley across the city, CEO paced, eyes darting between the timer in the sky and the buildings around him.
For once, even he seemed to understand that this event was bigger than any scheme he'd devised.
"So, the halfway point… if they're revealing this to the world, then everything we've done here… it's going to mean something outside, too." He clenched his fists, determination flashing in his eyes.
"Just you wait, all of you," he muttered to himself. "I'll survive this, and then I'll become the richest man alive..."
...
Meanwhile, Clever, an old yet sharp-eyed participant, observed the sky from the shadows at a quiet corner of Termina.
His calm demeanor hid a mind constantly analyzing every detail.
The moons had hinted at something big coming, and he knew that the battle ahead would be unforgiving.
"Let's see if you young ones are ready for what's coming…" Clever murmured, leaning back against the wall.
...
The timer dropped to 30 minutes.
Stark shifted his focus to the door of the museum, where Sora and Lilith lay resting in the museum's safe zone.
He knew he had to plan not only for himself but for the two of them as well.
That is if they didn't wake up.
It would be bad if they didn't, though.
But after getting hit by Hugo's attacks, it was normal anybody would feel down.
With only ten minutes left on the timer, a low, ominous hum vibrated through the sky.
Stark and the others all froze, sensing that something massive was about to happen.
And then…
BOOM!
A deafening crack split the air as a colossal rift opened above the [Hollow Tower].
It looked like the sky itself was tearing apart, revealing swirling blackness beyond.
The three crimson moons reappeared, larger and more terrifying than before.
Their voices echoed across the city, chilling every participant to the bone.
"Welcome… to the end."
The words resounded within their minds.
Stark gritted his teeth, looking up at the moons, his fists clenched. He could feel it—this was just the beginning.
As the timer reached its final seconds, a new message appeared in bright red text across the sky:
[The Grand Initiation has begun.]
1:00…
0:59…
0:58…
The countdown continued, but as it did, a series of panels appeared in the air.
[Since the beginning of it all, the "Domination" class was always the secret one.]
[No one except a select few and those that have it know of its existence.]
[But it is time for it to change.]
"Huh?"
"What?"
[The Grand Initiation of the world to the Domination class will begin once the timer hits zero.]
[You will all be participants of this game, watched by the entire world.]
[Are you ready?]
[The descent of the Godless Demon is happening soon.]
"Mhm," Clever nodded, smirking.
"???" CEO raised his eyebrows, confused. "What?"
"Descent of the Godless Demon?" Artist climbed out of his makeshift bed, startled.
And finally…
"YES! YES! THE WORLD SHALL WATCH AS WE KILL ALL OF THEM!" Follower was on his knees, crying tears of joy. "THE WORLD WILL FALL!"
10…
9…
8…
Stark watched as the timer neared its end, a deep sense of foreboding settling over him.
He didn't know exactly what was coming, but he knew he had to be prepared.
7…
6…
5…
Reveal the Domination class to the whole world? How? And why?
Why were they suddenly players in a game? Weren't they already in a deadly trial?
Or maybe it was another one of those massive events that could kill them all?
4…
3…
2…
1…
And when would the [Godless Demon] descend?
Stark braced himself.
0!
FWISH… BOOM!
The entire trial seemed to explode upon itself.
And every participant suddenly felt a piercing headache, even Follower and Stark.
"What the...?" Stark clutched his head, trying to resist the pain, his vision flooded by shadows and images he knew weren't real.
[Welcome.]
[To the Grand Initiation.]
[Your fates are now sealed.]
Inside the museum, Sora and Lilith woke up, both clutching their heads in agony.
