They'd each had a nightmare—a vision of a massive demon, its voice urging them to wake up and not miss the [Grand Initiation].
Sweat dripped from their foreheads, fear gnawing at them.
For Sora, this fear was even greater than any she'd felt before, it was more than the one she had against the warden of the second trial.
"Did you... see that too?" Sora asked Lilith, her voice trembling.
"...Yeah." Lilith nodded, eyes wide.
"Can't be a coincidence. Let's go outside."
Stark's ultimate clone, who had been guarding them, noticed they were awake and gestured for them to follow it toward Stark.
They made their way through the museum's wrecked halls, stopping at the entrance where Stark stood, looking up at the sky.
The pain in their heads dulled, but as they lifted their gaze, they saw something they could never have imagined.
In the sky, the figure of a colossal demon materialized, its two crimson eyes locking onto them.
Its overwhelming aura filled the air, making them all feel weak.
A single second of inattention would result in them being knocked out again.
[Domination users.]
"…"
"…"
"…"
[The entire world is watching you now.]
[Do whatever you feel is right.]
With those simple words, the creature faded away.
But in that brief glance, it seemed as if it had directed its disgust of the human race particularly toward Stark, as if his mere presence was offensive.
"What did it mean by 'the whole world is watching us'?" Lilith asked, still shaken as she looked up at the sky.
Silence.
Stark didn't respond, his gaze fixed above.
"Hello?" The two girls approached him, trying to catch his attention. "HOLY—!"
They flinched, recoiling from the intense hatred radiating from Stark's aura.
His body seemed cloaked in a crimson energy, his white pupils shaking with fury.
"It meant it literally," he finally spoke, his voice a low growl. "The whole world's watching us. The Domination secret is out."
"Huh?"
"What?"
Across the city, every other participant was coming to the same realization.
This trial was but a game to the apostles and godless demon.
That is why they organized this whole [Corpse Festival] thing: they enjoyed seeing those that could defeat them kill one another.
Stark didn't know who was making these trials, but it seemed that they were now cooperating with the godless demon.
[Every trial needs to be fair.]
That is what Stark remembered, and the probable reason why they weren't just instantly killed.
There were rules to follow, and now, this twisted game of death would be watched by everyone.

chapters.title: Chapter 346 - 346: Domination Class Exposed, The Entire World is Watching
chapters.content:
In the outside world.
Not only in Fellarbrug, but in all other countries in Rheria, something strange happened.
In every country, every town, and every corner, electronic devices suddenly flickered.
Phones, computers, billboards, and even holographic displays glitched for a second, then resumed, but not with their usual content.
Each screen turned a deep, impenetrable black.
People across schools, businesses, cafes, and homes exchanged confused looks.
The usual hustle fell silent, replaced by murmurs of concern and bewilderment.
Faces lit only by the cold light of the screens, they waited, wondering what was happening.
On every screen, a shadowed figure appeared, his outline vague but menacing, with two piercing crimson eyes that seemed to look directly into the soul of each viewer.
The feeling of being watched, of having something far more powerful than them seize control, settled over everyone.
"What the hell?" someone muttered.
"Is this some kind of hack?" asked another.
But there was no answer.
The figure's voice echoed suddenly, resonating not from the devices but seeming to whisper directly into each ear.
"Hello, humans."
The voice carried an otherworldly authority, chilling everyone in an instant.
Before anyone could react further, the figure raised its hand and snapped its fingers.
SNAP!
The world outside transformed in an instant.
The sky shifted, bleeding into a deep, unsettling crimson that spread across the horizon, casting a sinister glow over the entire landscape.
Sunlight dimmed as if absorbed by this red veil, leaving the world beneath it cast in an ominous glow.
It was as if the world itself was plunged into a living nightmare.
"AAAAH!"
"What's happening?"
Even the strongest of classifiers, those at level 600, 700 and up were confused.
What was happening to the world?!
In every corner of Rheria, panic erupted.
Cars screeched to a halt, people pointed to the sky in disbelief, and even newscasters stammered over their words as they struggled to describe the bizarre events unfolding around them.
Back to the broadcast, the Godless Demon's figure still filled every screen, his crimson eyes burning brighter.
His voice cut through the growing chaos with ease, grabbing everyone's attention.
"Welcome to the Grand Initiation," he said, "Today marks a new beginning. You may not understand yet, but you will soon."
In every city, in every gathering, people stared in stunned silence, their eyes glued to the broadcast.
The figure gave a chilling smile.
"Let's cut to the chase," he said, snapping his fingers once more.
The screens shifted, and five words appeared, large and ominous.
[Third Domination Trial: Corpse Festival]
Everyone's confusion only deepened as more words followed:
[Difficulty: Death]
[15 Participants.]
On the screen appeared 15 squares, displaying the faces of all the participants.
"Huh? Isn't that the CEO of the Amaterasu group?"
"That's Sora Gardenis!" another pointed.
"And that's Kai Algreen, the genius Artist!"
Powerful figures, faces known all across Rheria—these were the participants.
Shocked whispers spread as more faces were recognized.
And then... the broadcast shifted again.
BAM! BAM! BAM!
[Starfire - Eliminated by Follower.]
[Rightlef - Eliminated by CEO.]
[Mao - Eliminated by Follower.]
[Partner - Eliminated by the Mayor.]
[Mio - Eliminated by Father Hugo.]
[Dave - Eliminated by Follower.]
[Claire - Eliminated by Follower.]
[Shock - Eliminated by Follower.]
In seven of the fifteen boxes, gray-out effects started appearing, with red X's crossing out the faces.
The crowd gasped as one box after another was grayed out, the participants marked as eliminated.
[7 participants Alive.]
The 7 squares that remained were those of: Chosen, Lilith, Sora, CEO, Follower, Artist and Clever.
It was undeniable—the implication was that they had died.
"What... did they just say Starfire's dead?"
"Mio and Mao too? They were my favorites..."
"That Follower guy is insane, someone has to stop him..."
Then, another message appeared, jolting them from their shock:
[Do you want to watch the trial?]
[Yes] [No]
[The choice that receives the majority vote will determine the outcome.]
[If yes is selected, you will have access to watch the trial live from the perspective of any participant.]
Instantly, all those that shouted quieted down, gulping.
It felt unreal, like a twisted game, yet the allure of watching such a deadly trial was powerful.
Slowly, people began to vote, curiosity overriding their fear.
From teenagers to elders, from the poor to the rich, everyone made their choice.
And in the end...
[Results are in.]
[99.99% of the population has voted for 'Yes.']
[You will be able to follow the trial live now.]
[Enjoy, for the world is in their hands.
A haunting silence settled over the crowd as the screens turned black once more, only to reawaken with the images of a crumbling city with a crimson sky.
In the background, they could see a massive tower.
And then, a prompt appeared on their screens.
[Which participant do you want to follow?]
The list appeared: [Sora, Clever, Lilith, CEO, Artist, Follower, Stark.]
With trembling hands, people selected, and it was no surprise that Follower, the one who had already claimed multiple lives, attracted the most attention.
The allure of such a dangerous figure was irresistible to many.
...
Meanwhile, in the Domination Association headquarters, a place only known to those in the highest circles of power, the event had brought a storm of panic.
"Boss!" one operative shouted. "This is unprecedented. We've never seen anything like this."
The middle-aged boss, Oliver, narrowed his eyes.
His gray hair and the weight of countless years of experience made him an intimidating figure, yet even he couldn't hide his shock.
"BOSS?!"
"THIS ISN'T NORMAL!"
"SHUT THE FUCK UP, ALL OF YOU," he shouted, "I know this isn't normal, but we can't do anything."
The other domination users/staff fell silent, their fear evident but controlled as they awaited further orders.
"The entire world voted, and they now all heard of the term domination trial, plus, it's a death difficulty trial, so it doesn't matter who's in it, they are all going to die."
"But chief, the problem is that the entire world will know about them... no... about us," a beige haired woman sighed.
Oliver's gaze hardened, "Doesn't matter. Whatever is happening in that trial, it's unlike any other we've seen.
We have to watch and observe. There's something... ominous about this. It's as if these participants, as if this trial, is a threat to the entire world."
No one dared to speak, the weight of Oliver's words sinking in.
"Way to say it, boss," only one figure laugh through it all: Juan, the very same guy that first tried to get Stark to join the association.
"We may be the strongest Domination users alive, but even we have limits. Watch and learn. I don't know what awaits us if these participants fail, but my instincts tell me it won't end well."
"..."
All the domination users inside the [Domination Association] were strong, but many hadn't even entered their third trial yet.
Even Oliver was only level 200.
And once he confirmed there was no domination trial at level 200, he believed that it meant there wasn't anything beyond that.
It became too difficult to level up, and he had the strength of a level 1000 classifier already, so there was no need to go any further.
He had all the experienced and knowledge about the domination class he needed, but something like that had never happened before.
He turned to the screens, which showed the remaining participants.
There were only seven left.
"The whole world is watching..." Oliver whispered, "Don't disappoint us. Domination users. It is a death trial, but I hope at least one of you survives."
With that, he and the rest of the operatives settled in to watch, their fear tempered by a sense of pride and challenge.
Across Rheria: Fellaburg, Ostount, Lampod and all other countries, hundreds of millions of eyes fell on their screens, watching.
And so...
[You are currently watching the third domination trial.]
Ding!
Their screens finally showed the participants they selected.
[One final warning to you all.]
A text appeared in front of everyone's eager eyes.
[If every participant dies.]
[Then... well, let's just say there won't be much to observe of this world anymore.]
No participant had transformed yet, but if all of them died, they would instantly transform into moonscorched beings in the real world, rivalling level 700-800 classifiers.
The lives of millions were at stake, at this point.

chapters.title: Chapter 347 - 347: Head to the Hollow Square, Completing Final Tasks
chapters.content:
None of the participants could truly understand what "the world watching them" meant.
It wasn't possible that the outside world would have access to the domination trial after all, right?
Right as he thought of that, Stark suddenly felt the pressure of being watched from every direction.
"What the..." his eyes widened, his pupils shaking, "Could it be..."
But the new notification about their next objective snapped him back to reality.
[Head to the Hollow Tower Square - Time limit of 2 hours.]
[Those that don't have 5 tasks completed by then will be instantly Moonscorched.]
Stark's heart skipped a beat.
The Moonscorch threat was serious, and it was the first time this trial actually threatened them with instant death.
Talk about fair, heh?
He quickly checked his own status and breathed a sigh of relief.
[Completed Tasks: 5/5]
"Oh, then I guess it's fine," he muttered, but not everyone was in the clear.
Another panel popped up, showing everyone's current progress:
[Stark: 5/5]
[Sora: 2/5]
[Follower: 5/5]
[Clever: 5/5]
[Lilith: 5/5]
[CEO: 5/5]
[Artist: 4/5]
"Huh," Stark glanced at Lilith's name. "How'd you finish all your tasks already?"
Lilith shrugged, a small smile tugging at her lips. "Did all I could find in the shopping district, which is where I was resting."
"So, you must have gotten some good items, right?"
"Better than you'd think." Lilith tapped a few times on the air, pulling up her inventory for Stark to see.
[Lilith's Items: Cooldown Gem, Double Power, Revive Token, Teleportation Sphere, Moonscorch Cure]
Stark's eyes widened. "Those are… insane items. You should use the Moonscorch Cure, though."
"Good point," Lilith replied, activating the item.
Instantly, the remaining traces of Moonscorch vanished from her.
She flexed her fingers, looking visibly relieved.
But then Stark's eyes drifted back to Sora's status.
"Only 2 tasks completed. She still needs three more," he said, concern evident in his voice.
Lilith nodded, thinking. "There were a few tasks left in the shopping district that I skipped. She could finish them quickly if we work together."
"Then let's move." Stark turned to Sora. "We have two hours. We're going to get you those tasks and then head to the Hollow Tower. Stay close."
The three of them bolted toward the shopping district, finding it easily.
It was a massive street filled with dozens of shops, though most were overrun and had broken windows, shutdown, or covered with wood planks.
They dashed past dilapidated storefronts, overturned carts, and flickering neon signs casting eerie lights on the streets.
Their first stop was an old bookstore, its windows cracked and dusty.
"There's a task here," Lilith informed as they followed her.
Inside, books were scattered everywhere, but a strange panel appeared as they entered.
[Task: Locate the Forgotten Tome. Reward: Teleportation Token]
"It's like hide and seek," Sora muttered, already scanning the room.
Stark and Lilith split up, moving methodically between aisles and stacks of books, knocking aside debris as they searched.
Minutes later, Lilith's voice rang out as a book at the very far end of the bookshelves emitted some sort of dark energy, "Found it! Come get it, Sora!"
If Lilith grabbed it, it would be considered that she was the one that completed the task, and you couldn't have that.
Sora walked toward Lilith, then lifted a thick, leather-bound book from a stack on a high shelf.
The moment she touched it, the book glowed, and a new item appeared in Sora's inventory.
"Double Speed Token," Sora read out, looking pleased. "That'll come in handy."
"One task down. Let's keep going," Stark urged, already moving back out onto the street.
The next task wasn't far.
An old bakery lay around the corner, its glass door hanging off one hinge.
The smell of something burnt and stale lingered in the air as they stepped inside.
A new notification greeted them.
[Task: Recover the Golden Rolling Pin that is guarded by the "Baker".]
"Huh, so there's still monsters?" Stark wondered.
It would indeed feel refreshing to be able to fight.
The place was a mess, flour and broken glass scattered across the floor.
Sora darted behind the counter while Stark checked the back kitchen.
There, he found a door with the sign [Employees Only].
"Come!" he shouted to Sora and Lilith, whom arrived 20 seconds later, "Watch out, there might be a boss."
He slowly opened the door, his aura activated in case anything ambushed them.
But strangely enough... there was nothing.
Actually, no, there was something.
"Look down!" Lilith pointed, and as Stark did that, he noticed a large corpse.
[The Baker - Level 600 Elite]
This elite boss was dead before anyone even got to it, and there was some sort of black liquid covering half of his body, eating him out.
"Moonscorch," Stark whispered, "Well, doesn't matter."
"Got it!" Sora's voice almost sounded happy as she grabbed it, holding a dusty golden rolling pin, and with a flash, the rolling pin transformed into something else.
"Armor Reinforcement Shard… not bad." Sora held up the shard.
"Alright, two down, one to go," Stark said, feeling the tension ease a bit.
But as they stepped outside, he caught a glimpse of the red sky and remembered the time limit.
"Let's keep moving."
Their last stop in the shopping district was an abandoned electronics store.
Flickering lights cast ominous shadows across the shattered display cases, and most of the screens were cracked or covered in dust.
A panel appeared as soon as they entered.
[Task: Restore Power to the Store. Reward: Protection Amulet]
"We'll need to find the breaker," Stark muttered.
Lilith pointed towards the back, where a faint hum indicated the presence of a power source.
"Come on, it should be here somewhere."
They hurried down a narrow hallway lined with broken display cases, moving deeper into the store until they reached a dusty breaker panel.
Stark yanked open the panel, inspecting the wires and switches inside.
"It's... a puzzle," he was quite surprised to see this, as it was straight out of a video game.
Basically, you needed to place the wires in the good order.
It didn't take Sora much time to do it, though.
The fact these tasks were so easy was mainly because of the facts that there were no monsters to slow their progress.
The library would have had the [Librarian] elite, the bakery would have the [Baker], and the electric store would have had the [Electric Manager].
Without these things, it became too easy.
What was the goal of this trial in stopping the monster spawn...?
"Done!"
The store flooded with light, illuminating everything with a cold, artificial glow.
The Protection Amulet appeared in Sora's inventory too
"Got it!" she cheered. "That's all five."
They shared a quick, relieved smile.
They'd done it—Sora had her five tasks completed.
They stepped back out onto the crimson-lit streets, the Hollow Tower visible in the distance, looming over the ruined cityscape.
The clock was still ticking, and other participants were undoubtedly already on their way there.
Stark glanced at the timer on his panel. "We still have time, but we should hurry."
As they made their way through the shopping district, the city around them felt like it was holding its breath.
The streets were empty, an eerie silence pervading everything.
The only sound was the faint hum of electricity and the echo of their footsteps.
When they reached the square before the Hollow Tower, they saw that everyone else was already there, standing at various points across the wide, open space.
The atmosphere was tense, each participant eyeing the others warily.
"Why aren't they fighting one another-" Stark wondered as he stepped foot, after all he was sure any of these people would kill at any moment.
An answer came as soon as he entered.
[Fighting between participants is prohibited currently, anyone who does it will be moonscorched.]
CEO stood with his arms crossed, his eyes cold and calculating.
Follower's face was twisted into a grin, as if savoring the tension in the air.
Lilith shifted closer to Stark, keeping her gaze sharp as she assessed the crowd.
Artist and Clever exchanged brief glances, as if mentally preparing themselves for whatever came next.
Stark felt the weight of the moment.
The silence stretched, everyone seemingly waiting for someone else to make the first move to talk, or just wait for another panel to appear.
Finally, another notification appeared, breaking the standoff.
[Congratulations on completing the tasks. You've reached the Hollow Tower.]
[Now, let us put on a show for all of our spectators.]
BOOM!
An explosion in the distance could be heard, and suddenly, a dark barrier formed around the [Hollow Tower Square], blocking all of them from leaving.
[Escape isn't possible anymore.]
All the participants could feel that what was about to happen was bad.
And the fact the trial described it as the halfway point meant that there were still things to do.
In the real world, everybody was in the edge of their seats, waiting to see what could possibly happen.
No one even bothered doing their work correctly, focusing on their screens and the trial.
The world had one question: just how much would the participants have to go through.
The answer could come sooner than expected.
Businessmen? Who even cares about the clients, they're also watching their screens after all.
Restaurant/coffee shop workers? We'll prepare your food when something dull happens, until then you'll have to wait.
And let's not talk about the powerful families.
Lana's family, Stark's family, Sora's family, all guilds and groups, they all watched it happen with amazed eyes.
This was unlike anything that happened until now.
And so now, the name of the 7 alive participants was known to everybody in Rheria.
They became world-known celebrities in less than an hour.

chapters.title: Chapter 348 - 348: Reactions of the Families, The Trial Continues
chapters.content:
Moonless Family Home.
Louise Moonless, Arthur Moonless, and Aoki Moonless sat in the cozy living room, leaning into their family discussion.
The soft glow of the lamps barely outshone the massive 4K television that dominated the wall.
As soon as the big announcement that shut down all screens appeared, Aoki went down from his room, just to see his parents in the living room, staring at the screens.
"What's happening–" he began.
"Shhh…" Arthur cut him off, pointing at the TV.
The screen showed Stark's face, as well as every other participant in the 15 squares.
"HIM?!" Aoki's reaction was immediate, his tone laced with disdain. "I knew he was bad news!"
From the start, Aoki never trusted Stark.
He'd been uneasy ever since Stark had visited their home for an offer to join the [Rift Conqueror's Academy].
The idea of someone that young, that mysterious, already aligning himself with such prestigious groups had rubbed Aoki the wrong way.
Plus, he dared to try and flirt with his sister!
Worse of all, they apparently live together now!
And now, seeing him here, as one of the last seven participants of that thing called the Domination Trial, Aoki's suspicions only deepened.
"What even is Stark's class, anyway?" Aoki muttered, glancing at his father.
Arthur looked at him, almost as baffled.
"I don't know," he admitted. "Considering his family, it should be [Soul Wielder]. But I've never seen him summon a [Soul Heart], not even once. And I've seen him fight."
Louise's voice was soft, her curiosity clearly piqued. "But these other participants… they're not just anyone."
She wasn't wrong.
The seven left in the trial were more than just participants.
Every surviving name was well-known and respected—some feared.
"Sora Gardenis…" Louise continued, eyes narrowing thoughtfully. "Who doesn't know about her?"
Sora's beauty and the "Gardenis" family name were extremely famous.
Then, of course, there was CEO, whose very name commanded influence and power.
Known as the head of the Amaterasu group, his presence in such a deadly trial raised questions.
Why would someone as influential as him risk his life? Was he forced into this?
But the most dangerous person among all of them was... Clever.
Stark didn't know it, and most people didn't since he was from another country in Rheria, but Clever was considered one of the most powerful people in his respective country.
He is able to take down level 600 bosses easily, and even manages against level 700s.
There were even rumors that if he used his entire potential, he could beat level 750 or level 800 monsters.
But who knows.
All that Arthur knew was that anybody who dared to defy Clever would die.
...
Gardenis Family Home.
In another household, the tension was equally high.
Mike Gardenis and Elise Gardenis watched in shock as they saw their daughter's face among the final seven.
Unlike their daughter, who was notoriously reserved and expressionless, Mike and Elise were both open and social.
Their family dynamic was warm, and they had three children, two daughters and one son, but Sora was the only one emotionless in their entire family.
They didn't know why that was as they always made sure to provide everything for her using their money from their various businesses, but no one could understand why.
Strangely enough too, she was the strongest person in the family.
Her father was a [Magus], her mother an [Archer], and her brother and sister were both mages too.
Sora was the only weird one, at a young age able to do stuff most people shouldn't be able to do.
And to add to that, Sora was also somehow, though they tried to consider their children all the same, the most beautiful of them all.
Even more so than their mother, who would sometime get jealous and tease her.
And that's why they became extremely overprotective.
Beautiful, smart and powerful? It was a whole package!
As a result, dozens if not hundreds of other families tried to pair her up with their sons for an arranged marriage.
But of course, not only did Sora categorically refuse, but her parents refused that too.
When asked why, Mike had once famously declared, "Our daughter will choose who she wants. If she doesn't like your son, get lost."
"We want someone that will actually protect her and help her out, so no, thank you," and her mother was the same.
Mike and Elise wanted someone that could understand their daughter even though she was emotionless.
They wanted someone that would be there, but unfortunately, that person never came.
None of those that came and went were worthy, and their daughter didn't like them either.
Eventually, no one tried anymore, as Sora wouldn't even bat an eye at them.
So you could imagine the surprise when they saw their daughter on the list of participants of that trial, among one of the 7 alive ones.
And even more shocking, when the screen began displaying the actual trial...
"Mom! Sora's with a guy!" Elise's eyes widened as her son's voice brought her out of her thoughts.
"WHAT?!" Mike and Elise leaned closer to the screen, their jaws dropping.
Sure enough, Sora was standing next to someone, their shoulders almost touching.
Their shock was palpable—Sora, who refused and disgusted to let any man come within three meters, was here, side-by-side with a stranger.
"Just who is he…" Mike's gaze sharpened, his protectiveness flaring up.
"That's Stark Heartsouls," Elise answered after a beat. "I heard his family disowned him… something about him lacking the [Soul Wielder] class."
"STARK HEARTSOULS?" Mike's voice shot up in disbelief. "Well, let's see how this unfolds. If that boy so much as touches a strand of her hair, I'm going to murder him."
But right as he said that, the father suddenly felt a chill run down his spine.
[Bad idea, Mike, Stark is at least twice as strong as you are.]
...
Then there was Stark's own family, perhaps the most bewildered of them all.
"What the hell...?" Jay, Stark's only brother and leader of the [Wyvern Wrath Guild], the one he had outran back in the first secret rift he went into, mumbled.
"Stark?" Both of his sisters, Lara and Nissa, looked at each other, their mouths agape.
Even Aiden, Stark's father, and Sini, his mother, couldn't hide their shock.
They had disowned Stark nearly 1.5 years ago, convinced that he was a lost cause.
Yet now, their son's face was everywhere, proof that he was still fighting.
"Mom! All my friends are messaging me asking if that's my brother!" Nissa blurted out, turning to her mother. "What's going on?"
"I… I don't know," Sini answered, fear edging her voice.
What the hell was Stark doing along with all of those powerhouses.
Even a single one of those participants would defeat their entire family 10x times over without breaking a sweat.
There was no chance Stark was like them, right?
You can't become so strong in less than 2 years... right?!
"He's with Sora Gardenis and Lilith Silent," Jay was baffled as well, why was his brother, much less popular than he was, with these two beauties!?
Both Sora and Lilith came from families with more power and influence than theirs, and possibly even more than the Moonless family.
Yet there was Stark, right by their sides.
The Heartsouls family could only watch, having chosen Stark as the [Chosen] participant they'd follow in this trial.
"Did he unlock his class?" Lara asked.
"Probably," Aiden muttered, though his gaze remained hard. "But the real question is… is it [Soul Wielder]?"
They couldn't watch Stark fight because of the lack of monsters, but soon enough they would.
Maybe it was to make the suspense higher in the entire world that the trial removed every moonscorched monster, actually, it would make sense!
...
And lastly, there was Lana.
Alone in her apartment complex, she felt a tangle of emotions as she watched the broadcast.
"Didn't they say they were going somewhere else?" she murmured to herself, trying to piece together the truth.
But, in opposition to all the others, who were shocked and/or worried, Lana, on the other hand was... relieved.
"PHEW!" She laughed, "And here I was thinking they went to have sex behind my back!"
She had thought about this possibility since they first spoke, but she couldn't stop Stark from having a relationship with Sora if he wanted.
The best she could do was wait for him, and see if he would like her to join.
Instead, he was in a trial that could kill him at any moment!
Her relief, however, didn't last long.
"WAIT WHAT?!"
As she clutched her phone, her fingers shook, her mind reeling at the dangers Stark would be facing.
She didn't understand why they both hid this from her, but there must be a reason.
Stark and Sora wouldn't betray her, she knew it, and Sora wouldn't play dirty in romance, maybe she would even be willing to share if it came to it, who knows.
But then why are they there?!
...
Around the world, the reactions varied.
Some were curious, others worried, and a few were dismissive.
But everyone was tuned in, watching closely.
Whether they were protective like Sora's family, bewildered like Stark's, or holding their breath in fear like Lana, one thing was certain: everyone was watching, waiting to see who would make it out alive.
The trial continued, and the world held its breath.
Back in the trial, the timer finally reached 0, and as the dark barrier that stopped them from leaving the [Hollow Tower Square] formed.
A message appeared.
[Get ready to fight.]

chapters.title: Chapter 349 - 349: Hollow Tower Square, The Entire Gang is Here
chapters.content:
A message hovered in the air in front of each participant:
[Get ready to fight.]
And then–
FWISH! RUMBLE!
The ground shook, and from the shadows emerged every elite monster still roaming the trial.
The atmosphere of the Hollow Tower square, which was up until now only filled with the other participants, changed drastically as five terrifying figures appeared.
The first was the Mayor.
Clothed in fine, noble attire, he looked oddly dignified, but his grotesque face twisted with moonscorched madness.
His beige skin sagged, his bald head crowned by two sharp, triangular horns.
He gripped a fork in his right hand and a knife in his left, his weapons glinting ominously.
And before anyone could react, he threw his knife toward the [Ultimate Clone], hitting it straight on and making it disappear.
"OH COME ON," Stark was the one who shouted, "WHY HIM?!"
"Because I felt like it."
[Termina's Mayor - Level 600 Moonscorch Commander]
Behind him were his loyal servants:
A group of three identical butlers, each dressed in black suits with white gloves.
They followed the Mayor closely, never leaving his side.
The Butler Trio's skill, [Loyal Regeneration], meant they'd revive endlessly as long as the Mayor was alive.
[Butler Trio - Level 590 Mini-Boss]
The next creature was The Tormented One, released by Artist from the museum.
A skinless, humanoid horror, its red muscles and sinews exposed under a cloak made from its own skin.
With no mouth, it couldn't scream, but its mere presence radiated agony, as if each step was a testament to endless suffering.
[Tormented One - Level 600 Moonscorch Commander]
Beside it stood The Heartless One.
She was feminine, yet terrifying, almost divine.
She wore a dark suit, her face disturbingly serene, framed by a golden halo above her head.
In her hands were a golden spear and a black blade. Her black wings stretched wide, casting a shadow over the battlefield.
[Heartless One - Level 600 Moonscorch Commander]
Then there was Eternal Regret.
It towered over the rest, a writhing, shifting mass of shadows that seemed alive.
Its form constantly morphed, the twisted faces of children screaming and crying within it.
Their agony filled the air, a haunting chorus that chilled everyone who heard it.
[Eternal Regret - Level 600 Elite]
Stark already knew about that thing.
The creature absorbed anything thrown at it.
Physical attacks were useless against it, after all, he had hit it hundreds of time over with [Asura's Arms].
These five horrific beings were the last obstacles standing between the participants and their goal.
Then, a new message appeared:
[Killing other participants is completely allowed. In the end, only one may enter the tower and face the moons.]
The phrase sent chills through them all.
"Face the moons?" CEO raised his eyebrows, a grin creeping onto his face. "I knew it. This is a [Death] difficulty trial for a reason."
This meant that even if they survived each other and the bosses… they'd still have to face the moons themselves to win.
A daunting, nearly impossible task.
Everyone exchanged uneasy glances.
Meanwhile, Follower remained unfazed.
A private message had appeared just for him:
[Do not worry about the moons. If you beat them, you'll take their places—and more.]
"Yes, lord," Follower murmured with grim determination, his gaze locked onto Stark.
In contrast, Clever chuckled to himself, rubbing his beard.
"Let's see how these young ones handle this."
The old man was so confident in his powers against everyone that he didn't even know if he should actually use them or just stand back as a spectator.
After all, a single reveal of his domination power would result in nobody attempting to kill him, much like with Stark.
The countdown appeared in front of everyone.
[3…]
Auras flared around each participant.
Stark's aura burned crimson.
[2…]
The five monstrous bosses prepared themselves, each one radiating a terrifying presence.
[1…]
The participants glanced at each other, each silently debating whether to focus on the monsters or turn on each other first.
[FIGHT!]
The trial began.
Without hesitation, Stark dashed forward, heading straight for [Eternal Regret].
He was the first to move among all, taking even the monsters aback.
Even they needed to think of their strategy if they wanted to win against the humans, yet here was that guy, instantly fighting.
"You beat me once!" Stark laughed, charging with fierce determination. "I'll kill you now, just like I killed Hugo!"
He launched a flurry of [Crimson Spears] straight at Eternal Regret.
But as soon as the spears touched the shadowy creature, they were absorbed into its writhing form.
The spears vanished, leaving no trace.
"Damn it!" Stark cursed, "It's gonna work at some point!"
[Eternal Regret] only had one hp, so any attack would instantly kill it.
He tried again, sending a [Holy Infusion]-charged punch as that thing definitely looked demonic, but the impact did nothing.
Eternal Regret absorbed the energy, unaffected.
Sora, meanwhile, had her sights on The Heartless One.
Her eyes narrowed, calculating the right moment to strike.
She darted forward with a flash, her [Vine Sword] swinging in a precise arc.
CLANG!
The Heartless One blocked Sora's attack effortlessly with her golden spear.
"Yawn..."
Their weapons clashed, sparks flying as Sora's sword met the black blade in the Heartless One's left hand.
"Strong…." Sora muttered, her grip tightening as she pushed back, unleashing a barrage of strikes.
"THAT'S MY GIRL!" Mike Gardenis, Sora's father, shouted from the comfort of their living room.
The Heartless One moved with serene grace, deflecting each attack with chilling ease.
"Forgot about me?" but Lilith also jumped in the fight, wanting to help out her new friend.
"Fool," Heartless didn't seem bothered, raising her spear.
On the other side of the battlefield, CEO aimed his sights on the Mayor.
"We meet again," The Mayor sneered, raising his fork and knife like a twisted nobleman ready to feast.
His butlers stood at his side, their eyes locked on CEO with unflinching loyalty.
CEO raised his hand, unleashing a powerful beam of energy.
ZAP!
The beam struck the Mayor square in the chest, but he merely chuckled, shrugging it off.
The Butler Trio moved in front of him, shielding him from any further attacks.
"PLATE THROW!" The Mayor's mocking grin grew wider as the butlers threw their plates at CEO, forcing him to retreat.
"Alright, then. I'll play along." CEO smirked, summoning a barrier to protect himself.
He fired again, determined to pierce the Mayor's defenses.
"I'll help you, old man," Artist sighed, appearing beside CEO, "But I'll expect compensation."
"Heh? Trying to get money in such a situation, we don't even know if we'll all live."
"Doesn't matter, I just want to get money."
"Fine by me, I have too much of it anyway," CEO smirked.
Meanwhile, Follower watched from the shadows, his eyes locked on Stark.
He used one of his perks [Shadow Veil] to hide from everyone and everything.
He hadn't forgotten his mission.
While everyone else was distracted, he moved, blending into the darkness, positioning himself close to Stark.
He waited for the perfect moment to strike, his [Skill Canceller] in hand.
Clever, standing back, watched the chaos unfold with a grin.
"These fools are doing all the work for me." He murmured, crossing his arms.
But when his eyes landed on The Tormented One, he raised an eyebrow.
"Hmm, you might actually be worth my time."
With a powerful stomp, Clever launched himself forward, not even bothering to activate his aura, slamming his fist into The Tormented One.
His strength reverberated through the ground, but the creature barely flinched.
It turned its hollow gaze on Clever, its expressionless face radiating pain and suffering.
"Oh?"
...
Back at Stark, he wasn't giving up on Eternal Regret.
"Fine. Absorb this!" He unleashed [Asura's Wrath], summoning multiple crimson arms to pummel the creature from every angle.
The fists struck Eternal Regret, each blow heavy with energy.
But like before, it absorbed every hit, growing darker and more chaotic with each one.
It wasn't even retaliating!
Stark clenched his jaw.
"There has to be a way…" He muttered, frustration building.
Lilith shifted her strategy.
She broke off from her clash with the Heartless One and aimed a powerful [Qi Pulse] blast at the Heartless One's exposed face.
The attack hit, but the Heartless One merely tilted her head, unaffected.
"Tch…" Lilith frowned. "Looks like brute force isn't enough."
The Mayor, meanwhile, had CEO cornered.
His butlers kept regenerating, returning to shield him each time CEO blasted them away.
"Annoying pests!" CEO growled, backing up to gain some space.
"You should be careful," Artist smiled, not having done anything until now, instead focusing his mind on his future creation to possibly win.
The Mayor chuckled darkly, raising his fork as if about to feast on his prey.
"You're nothing but an appetizer, dear CEO, and I see that your other friend is already gone."
CEO's eyes narrowed.
"He wasn't my friend."
With a shout, he unleashed his [Money Wave] skill, sending a massive wave of energy toward the Mayor and his butlers.
The blast knocked them back, giving CEO a brief moment to breathe.
So basically, this is how it is going:
Stark VS Eternal Regret.
Sora and Lilith VS Heartless One
CEO and Artist VS Mayor and Butler Trio
Clever VS Tormented one, though the former is mostly having fun with it.
And finally, Follower is just hiding, the chaos of the square allowing him to not be noticed, lurking around Stark and waiting for the boy to give him an opening.
Unknown to him, though, Stark could perfectly see him.
[Watch out.]
[Focus] had already warned him, and so he was ready to counter-attack Follower at any time, though he wanted to focus on [Eternal Regret].
Right as Stark gave another punch to the beast...
It finally decided to activate its skill.
"Release..."
The chaos would be much worse now.

chapters.title: Chapter 350 - 350: Eternal Regret's Death, Only 6 Remaining
chapters.content:
"RELEASE...!"
Eternal Regret's hundreds of faces screamed in agony as they released a massive shockwave of dark energy, forcing Stark to back away.
[+50% Moonscorch Infection]
Unfortunately, he had been hit.
And that's when he realized another difficulty in this whole thing: the chance of transforming because of the infection if you stayed exposed too long.
It was a war against the clock.
Stark stood in the middle of the ruined square, his muscles tense as he stared down at the creature before him.
Eternal Regret had no real form, just a mass of writhing, tortured souls screaming in agony as they formed its body.
[Name: Eternal Regret]
[Level: 600]
[HP: 1]
[Strength: ???]
[Stamina: ???]
[Speed: ???]
[Defense: ???]
[Skills: Release...]
Despite the fact it had only one HP, Stark knew it wouldn't be easy to land a blow.
The creature shifted constantly, as though trying to escape its own form.
His anger was rising, fueled by the chaos around him and the fact he just couldn't put a dent on this thing.
Instead, he decided to look around.
Sora and Lilith were struggling against the Heartless One.
CEO and Artist were locked in a desperate battle with the Mayor and the Butler Trio.
And Clever was having fun taking on the Tormented One with nothing more than his basic attacks.
It was a battle of powerhouses, yet amidst all the chaos, Stark was fixated on Eternal Regret.
With a deep breath, he tightened his grip on his fists, and all six of his arms repeated the movements, crimson aura burning in them.
Sora and Lilith fought side by side, battling the Heartless One.
"Stay focused, Sora!" Lilith shouted, her voice strained as she blocked another strike.
Sora nodded, her vines shooting out in every direction to try and bind the creature.
Her skill Vine Transformation allowed her to stretch her abilities to their limits, wrapping the vines around the Heartless One's arms, attempting to restrict its movements.
But no matter how many vines she sent, the creature tore through them as if they were paper.
It was too fast, too unpredictable.
"Flora-Guns!" Sora fired a volley of her most powerful nature-infused bullets at the creature, but the Heartless One simply phased through them, its form flickering in and out of existence.
Lilith's Qi Pulse unleashed another wave of energy that shook the ground, but the Heartless One dodged once again, leaving the two women frustrated and running out of options.
"Hahaha... little ladies, you aren't even close to my beauty!"
"Shut up, old hag," Lilith gritted her teeth.
Meanwhile, CEO and Artist were struggling to keep up with the Mayor and the Butler Trio.
The Mayor's aura of authority was suffocating, his presence alone making it difficult to concentrate.
"DAMN IT!" CEO mumbled under his breath, sweat dripping down his face as he narrowly dodged another plate attack from one of the butlers.
Artist, standing beside him, was panting, clutching his brush tightly.
He had summoned his [Masterpiece Summon], a powerful golem made entirely of living paint, but even it was struggling against the sheer might of the Mayor's attacks.
"I... I can't do it..." Artist muttered, his eyes wide with fear.
His voice trembled as he stared at the Mayor. "I... I need more time..."
In opposition to what you might believe, it had already been 10 minutes since the battle started.
And the Mayor had strangely only been aiming at Artist, already hitting him twice with his weapons.
"Come on, citizen, accept your fate," Mayor laughed.
"FUCK YOU-"
Before he could finish his sentence, the Mayor extended his hand.
In an instant, Artist was lifted off the ground, his body frozen in mid-air.
The Mayor's voice was calm, unyielding.
"You should've known better than to think you could challenge me."
Artist opened his mouth to try and insult him again, but before he could say another word, the Mayor gestured.
A thick, sharp blade of energy extended from the ground, piercing straight through Artist's chest.
"FUCK!" CEO rushed forward.
Artist's body was cleaved in half, his hand reaching desperately towards Stark as his final breath left him.
"My... master...piece..." Artist thought before dying.
"USELESS!" CEO shouted as he used [Mana Laser] to try and damage the Mayor.
...
Stark's eyes burned with fury as the Mayor executed Artist so effortlessly.
He had been watching the scene unfold from a distance, his mind focused on Eternal Regret in front of him.
He didn't care about Artist, but the fact one of them died so easily while none of the elites were down meant that they could all die.
[Ding!]
["Artist" has been killed by "Mayor"!]
[6 participants remain.]
The battle was no longer about tactics or strategy for Stark. It was about rage.
His anger swelled, drowning out everything else.
The souls of the damned in Eternal Regret seemed to feed off his fury, their screams growing louder, more intense.
Stark's hands clenched into fists.
It was time to end it.
Clever, meanwhile, was enjoying himself more than anything.
The Tormented One was relentless, its body made of endless writhing tendrils of agony.
But Clever wasn't using any of his advanced skills.
No, he was fighting it with nothing more than basic strikes and pure strength.
He didn't even summon his [100-Golden Arms Statue], instead only summoning [Golden Gauntlets] around his hands to make it more fun.
Hand Slam, Radiant Pulse, and Crushing Palm—each blow landed with such force that the Tormented One wanted to in pain, its form shifting to avoid each attack.
But Clever's hands were unstoppable, and each hit sent shockwaves through the creature.
"Is this really all you can do?" Clever chuckled, sidestepping an attack. "How disappointing."
He moved with fluid precision, blocking and countering the Tormented One's strikes with ease.
It was almost as if he were playing with it, enjoying the battle for what it was.
The world, all watching everything unfold before them, were baffled.
His power was beyond anything they could comprehend.
And all the participants as well.
These monsters, these humans, they were all so strong, and yet all fighting in front of their eyes.
It was probably the most entertaining scene they had scene in years.
...
Back at the center of the battlefield, Stark was now fully focused on Eternal Regret.
He had had enough of this.
He activated his [Double Assault] skill, doubling his stats for 20 seconds.
His body surged with power, and the four crimson arms from his Asura's Arms skill erupted around him.
Each arm clenched into a fist, radiating an aura of violent intent.
Without a moment's hesitation, Stark dashed forward.
His speed was impossible to follow.
The world seemed to slow as he closed the gap between himself and the creature.
But instead of attacking with his fists, Stark did something reckless that could probably take him out if [Eternal Regret] decided to use [Release] again.
He reached out with all of his arms and took hold of Eternal Regret.
The creature screamed, thrashing in his grip, but Stark's strength held it in place.
It was now or never.
Stark raised one of his hands to the sky, focusing every ounce of his energy.
He drew a circle in his palm, feeling the raw power build within him.
"GO TO HELL, FUCKING DEMON!"
HEAVEN'S WRATH!
The sky above seemed to crack as a massive beam of light began charging up.
One second later though, it was already ready, Stark's aura speeding up the process.
It tore through the air with incredible force, shaking the battlefield.
The other participants and monsters scattered, scrambling to avoid the descending beam.
Even the [Crimson Moons Trio] went out of the way, scared to be hit by another one of the boy's attacks.
Yet Stark didn't move.
The beam was wide, nearly impossible to avoid.
The shockwaves from the blast rattled the ground, sending tremors through the square.
The souls within Eternal Regret shrieked as they were about to be enveloped by the light.
BOOOOOM!
Stark held on, gritting his teeth as the beam drew closer.
Just as it was about to hit the ground, Stark released his grip on the creature.
SNAP!
He wasn't stupid, and he had obviously set up a [Crimson Ball Transmission] just in case he needed to escape.
In an instant he was out of harm's way.
And so the beam descended to the ground with a deafening roar.
Eternal Regret was caught in the full force of the blast, its form disintegrating under the sheer weight of the energy.
The souls that made up its body screamed one last time, and then they were gone, ascended into nothingness.
-1!
It actually received damage.
"HAHAHAHA!" and Stark couldn't help but laugh.
The beam finally faded, and the battlefield was silent.
[You have defeated "Eternal Regret". You have received 1 experience point.]
A single experience point for that was blasphemy, but Stark didn't care, too focused on what to do next.
He wasn't done. Not yet.
Actually, he was ready for more, his anger not stopping at all.

chapters.title: Chapter 351 - 351: Second Target: Heartless One
chapters.content:
Stark stood among the wreckage of his battle with Eternal Regret, breathing heavily, his eyes scanning the chaotic battlefield.
The message flashed before him and every other participant:
[Eternal Regret has been killed by "Chosen"]
[6 Participants Alive: Chosen, Sora, Lilith, Follower, Clever, and CEO.]
[4 Monsters Alive: Mayor, Butler Trio, Tormented One, Heartless One.]
He didn't waste a moment, and he didn't care about taking a break or anything of the sort.
There were still monsters to take down, and he wanted to do it quickly.
As he turned, he caught sight of Sora and Lilith struggling against a towering figure with black wings: the Heartless One.
They were keeping their ground, but their breaths were heavy, their movements slowing.
A bit farther, Clever faced off against the Tormented One, moving in sharp, precise strikes that seemed to almost mock the creature.
Though for some strange reason, no matter how many times Clever hit that thing, it simply wouldn't go down.
CEO, meanwhile, battled the Mayor and his three butlers, looking barely able to fend them off.
And somewhere in the shadows lurked Follower.
Stark frowned.
He could sense Follower's presence nearby, and that dark aura he carried was all too familiar.
The moment he had seen Follower, he'd sensed it.
"Godless Demon?" he had thought, a shiver running down his spine.
It was an aura he'd felt twice before, and it had always signaled danger.
But there wasn't time to worry about him now.
Sora and Lilith needed help.
Without hesitation, Stark dashed toward them, his mind quickly analyzing the situation.
He activated [Perception] as he moved, locking onto the Heartless One's stats and skills.
...
[Name: Heartless One, Moonscorch Commander, Immortal-Level]
[Level: 600]
[HP: 10,000,000]
[Skills: Halo of Despair, Spear of Divine Ruin, Blackblade Cleave, Winged Judgment, Duality Strike, Serene Malice, Harbinger's Descent, Soul Rapture, Heavenly Spearfall, Void Embrace, Golden Retribution, Sin Seeker, Angel's Lament, Dark Purification (Mythical), Eternal Suffering (Mythical), Celestial Annihilation (Godly), Eternal Suffering (Godly), Divine Scorn (Immortal)]
...
Stark's eyes narrowed.
Heartless One was far from an ordinary foe. He had to act fast.
Sora and Lilith barely held their ground, sweat lining their faces as they kept striking with everything they had.
Lilith's [Celestial Blades] sliced through the air while Sora's [Vine Sword] lashed out like a green whip.
But Heartless One only laughed, deflecting each attack with ease using her own golden spear or dark blade.
"When will you learn?" she sneered, her voice dripping with arrogance as she pushed them away, "Let's end this."
With a cold smirk, she activated [Eternal Suffering].
[Eternal Suffering: Stabs her spear into the ground, anchoring her opponents' shadows to it. Enemies bound in this way are immobilized for 8 seconds, taking continuous damage as their shadows try to pull free.]
A dark, twisted aura formed around her as she plunged her spear into the ground.
Instantly, shadows lashed out, pinning Sora and Lilith in place.
Both girls gasped, unable to move as dark energy coursed through them, sapping their strength.
Heartless One raised her spear, a merciless glint in her eyes as she dashed toward the girls, wanting to get rid of them both once and for all.
But before she could strike, Stark lunged forward, his [Spear Block] active.
He intercepted Heartless One's spear just in time, blocking the blow and deflecting it.
"Nice try."
The force of the clash sent a shockwave rippling through the area, but Stark held firm, his eyes locked onto Heartless One.
Sora and Lilith staggered back, freed from the immobilizing shadows.
"Thanks…" Sora whispered, catching her breath.
"No time for thanks. Focus," Stark said sharply, not taking his eyes off Heartless One.
Heartless One's eyes narrowed, a hint of irritation flashing across her face. "Another fool," she murmured, her wings flaring.
Stark launched forward, fists wrapped in the crimson glow of [Aura Smash].
He threw a barrage of flying crimson punches using [Spam], each one a phantom fist that pounded toward Heartless One.
[Spam Perk: Instead of summoning 5 fists to either send them at your enemies or merging them to do immense damage, you can instead decide to separate these fists into five distinct ones too, meaning 25 crimson fists. Not very good damage and no stun, though.]
She deflected the first few with her spear, but the intensity of his assault forced her to step back, her calm demeanor slipping.
Lilith joined in, her [Qi Sword Creation] flickering to life, slashing through the air and aiming for Heartless One's exposed side.
The blade left trails of glowing energy, each strike intensifying with Lilith's focus.
Sora followed, her vines emerging from the ground to overwhelm the boss.
Heartless One snarled, her wings folding protectively as she activated [Wings of Shadowlight], turning momentarily invulnerable.
[Envelops herself in a mix of light and shadow, granting her temporary invulnerability for 5 seconds. Attacks directed at her during this time are reflected back at 50% power.]
Every strike from Stark, Sora, and Lilith bounced off her, each blow deflecting back in shimmering bursts.
The effect only lasted five seconds, but it was enough for Heartless One to reposition.
She leaped into the air, diving back down with [Harbinger's Descent], sending a shockwave that forced them all back.
Stark gritted his teeth, sliding to a stop.
His [Focus] picked up a shift in her stance—she was about to use [Soul Rapture].
[Locks eyes with an enemy, channeling dark energy to rip a portion of their soul. This siphons health and reduces the enemy's stamina, healing the Heartless One and boosting her damage output briefly.]
"Don't let her lock eyes with you!" he shouted.
But it was too late.
Her dark gaze met Sora's, and a tendril of energy lashed out, sapping Sora's health and adding it to Heartless One's own.
Sora's face paled, her knees buckling.
Stark threw himself in front of her and sent his [Crimson Spears] in a sweeping arc, forcing Heartless One to break her focus.
Lilith seized the opening, her [Mystic Bindings] wrapping around Heartless One, momentarily holding her in place.
"Now!" Lilith shouted, her voice strained.
Stark summoned [Spear of Judgment], a colossal weapon forming above him, radiating holy light. He hurled it down with all his might, aiming to break through Heartless One's defense.
The spear smashed into her, sending her reeling back, her wings fluttering weakly.
-2,783,911!
The damage was incredible!
But Heartless One's fury only grew.
"Enough!" she roared, her voice echoing with rage.
With a flick of her hand, she unleashed [Void Embrace], a zone of distorted energy that made their vision swim, hallucinations flickering in and out.
Stark blinked, his sight blurred, but he steeled himself, using [Focus] to stay on track, dodging her [Duality Strike] as it aimed for him.
She understood that Stark was the reason she was losing ground in this battle, and so just like all the others, she aimed for him.
Lilith, breathing hard, lifted her hand and activated [Qi Barrier], protecting herself and Sora from the swirling dark energy around them.
Then she channeled her [Healing Aura], restoring some of her strength and helping Sora recover.
The emotionless girl obviously didn't stand still either, using [Regenerative Drop].
Heartless One scowled, raising her black blade high, her voice a low growl.
"Do you really think you can win? I am beyond your reach!" She charged at them, her blade glowing with a dark light as she executed [Blackblade Cleave], sending waves of damaging energy in every direction.
Stark twisted, dodging, while Sora and Lilith managed to avoid the worst of it, though their movements were visibly slowing.
Realizing their fatigue, Stark knew he needed to do it all himself, grabbing Heartless One's spear with his six arms (4 from [Asura's Wrath]), then after punching her away.
-432,904!
"You…you DARE!" Heartless One screeched, her wings stretching to their fullest.
And so with a look of utter contempt, she activated one of her most powerful skills.
[Celestial Annihilation].
At that moment, the battlefield seemed to freeze.
Heartless One's dark and holy energies merged around her, swirling into an ominous, crackling aura.
Her spear and blade aligned as she pointed them forward, the mixed energy converging into a single, colossal beam of power.
Stark, Sora, and Lilith barely had time to react, their eyes widening as the blinding light intensified.
The air hummed with an unbearable tension, and Stark's heartbeat thundered in his ears.
The ground shook as Heartless One released the devastating blast, the beam stretching across the battlefield with unimaginable force, heading straight for them.
The sheer power and size of the attack left everyone stunned, and even the other participants and monsters knew they could be damaged if it hit them.

chapters.title: Chapter 352 - 352: Celestial Annihilation, 5 Participants Remain
chapters.content:
The Heartless One raised her arms, summoning her deadly attack.
A massive surge of energy erupted, taking shape into a blinding, radiant sphere.
Her skill, [Celestial Annihilation], pulsed with a terrifying light, building power before it would release destruction upon everything in its path.
Stark's eyes went wide, realizing the deadly force behind it.
Everyone else on the battlefield looked up, dread washing over them as the raw energy hummed louder, ready to consume everything.
Even the boss monsters knew they couldn't be hit by that thing.
Sora instinctively reached into her inventory, pulling out her [Protection Amulet].
It was her one plan—a way to shield them from the blast.
But just as she was about to activate it, Stark's hand shot out, gripping her wrist tightly.
"DON'T USE THAT!" he shouted.
His grip was firm, too firm, but he couldn't afford to be gentle right now.
"That's for later," he added, his tone urgent.
Sora stared back, wide-eyed, but she trusted him.
She tucked the amulet back, watching as Stark prepared for what came next.
Without another word, Stark scooped up Sora and Lilith, holding them securely with [Asura's Arms].
Then, he aimed a [Crimson Ball Transmission] just behind the blast radius, snapping his fingers.
In an instant, they teleported out of the blast's range, landing safely a good distance away.
The three of them watched from afar, and Stark let out a tense breath.
Now it was up to the others to survive on their own.
The Mayor stood his ground as the [Celestial Annihilation] hurtled toward him, his face calm.
He crossed his arms, activating his skill, [Giant Utensils].
The knife and fork in his hands enlarged, gleaming with energy as he positioned them before him.
As the deadly blast struck, he swung the utensils, deflecting the energy to the sides, letting it split and crash into the ground around him. He stood in the center of the storm, unfazed.
In the shadows, Follower watched, his dark form blending perfectly with the surroundings.
He didn't even flinch as the blast neared.
He simply melded further into the shadows, the attack passing over him as if he weren't even there.
He stayed completely hidden, waiting for his perfect moment.
The Butler Trio stood close by, but without any special defense in their arsenal, they faced the brunt of the blast head-on.
The blinding light washed over them, their bodies disintegrating instantly.
Yet, only seconds later, their forms began to reappear, reforming themselves with eerie resilience.
Not too far away, the Tormented One remained still as the blast surged toward him.
It struck him directly, the immense power rippling over his body.
-0!
But there was no effect—no damage registered.
Even when Clever had toyed with him earlier, punching him around, he hadn't taken a single hit.
The others could only wonder if he had been through so much pain and torture that he'd become completely immune.
Either way, the attack didn't harm him.
He stood there, untouched.
Clever, however, decided he wasn't going to just stand still.
Though he didn't yet feel like using his power yet, [100-Golden Arms Statue], he wasn't going to leave himself exposed, either.
With a quick command, he activated [Ironclad Defense].
Five massive golden hands appeared, each one of them positioned around him in a protective formation.
The blast hit the hands, dispersing against their glowing surfaces, but Clever stood safely behind, unharmed.
All eyes now turned to one remaining participant: CEO.
He froze, seeing the massive blast bearing down on him, and quickly scanned through his skills.
There had to be something that could protect him…
But as he mentally flipped through each one, he felt panic rising.
Most of his skills were for attacks—countless powerful beams, destructive waves—but very few were defensive.
In desperation, he activated [Diamond Defense] first, a barrier of glittering, diamond-hard energy forming around him.
He added [Infinite Cascade], sending a barrage of beams forward, hoping to weaken the blast.
Then he launched [Endless Beam], followed by [Beam Genesis], firing everything he could into the oncoming energy.
His beams clashed with the annihilation blast, struggling to hold it back.
But after a few moments, he realized it was useless.
His eyes widened.
"AH, FUCK THIS!" CEO shouted, activating every attack skill he had, throwing everything at the blast, hoping to create an impenetrable wall of energy.
But the blast continued, ripping through his beams and defenses.
BOOOOM!
It hit him dead on, a searing wave of energy enveloping his form.
He activated a few last-ditch life-saving items—[Protection Enhancement] and [Instant-Healing Orb]—just barely clinging to life.
After what felt like an eternity, the light faded.
He stood there, smoke rising from his body, his HP dangerously low.
[CEO: 12,832/235,000]
"Heh…" he breathed, trying to keep his composure, "Looks like I'm still good to go—"
He joked around, wanting to prove his superiority, but before he could even finish his sentence...
Knife Slash!
The Mayor materialized behind him and swung.
Without warning, the Mayor's knife sliced through CEO's torso, cutting him clean in half.
The two halves of CEO's body fell to the ground, lifeless.
"You went out the same way as your subordinate, how does it feel," Mayor laughed so hard that everyone else stopped what they were doing to look at him.
Even people in the outside world had chills go down their spines as they saw just how quick he had died.
CEO, real name Miles Volkov, an extremely wealthy businessman that could have anything he wanted, had died, just like that.
Money and power didn't save him.
The world was getting more scared by the second.
The more they watched this trial and the participants die, the more scared they became.
[If all participants die, a terrible event will happen]
And to rub the salt in the wound, the panel that they feared appeared back.
Ding!
["CEO" has been killed by "Mayor"]
[5 Participants Alive]
The blast from [Celestial Annihilation] had left a massive crater behind, almost destroying half of the Hollow Tower Square.
Mayor glanced around the wreckage with a grin before looking up at the sky, "The area's too small, moons," he called out, barely able to contain his amusement.
"Deal with it," the cold voice of the moons replied, cutting off his complaint. "And kill the rest of them quickly."
Mayor shrugged, casually seating himself on the ground. "Alright, alright," he replied with a smirk. "But I think I'll rest a bit for now."
He watched the remaining participants, eyes gleaming with anticipation.
Meanwhile, Stark set Sora and Lilith down, both of them looking worn from the encounter.
He took a moment to catch his breath, then grinned.
"Stay here," he told them, a fierce look in his eyes. "I'm getting rid of that bitch."
He turned his gaze to the Heartless One, who stood across from him, watching him with a mocking smile.
"How foolish," she said, eyes narrowed. "Deciding to fight me? Alone?"
Stark cracked his knuckles, his grin widening. "I don't need anybody to kick your ass."
But he wasn't reckless.
He knew her stats were likely a match for his, and she had powerful skills that could turn the tide if he wasn't careful.
He glanced back at Sora. "Pass me the [Double Speed Token]," he said, holding out his hand.
Sora quickly pulled it from her inventory and handed it to him.
[Double Speed Token: Doubles your speed stats for 5 minutes.]
With his current speed of 28,000—and boosted further by his [Domination Buff]—this would push him well over 60,000.
That is how he always dominated with [Double Assault] except if the monsters had countermeasures.
With that kind of speed, he could outmaneuver even powerhouses at level 800 or 900.
"Let's see if I can manage..."
He crushed the token, feeling its power surge through him, a thrill of energy filling his veins.
[Speed stat doubled for 5 minutes.]
Stark clenched his fists, feeling the sheer speed pulsing in his limbs.
He looked up at the Heartless One, his grin turning into a determined glare.
"Alright," he said. "Let's do this, you ugly monster."

chapters.title: Chapter 353 - 353: Divine Scorn and Crimson Soul
chapters.content:
Stark's body shot forward like a blur, so fast that even Clever, the sharpest observer among them, couldn't follow.
He was a streak, a line of movement, and by the time Heartless caught on, he was right in front of her.
But Stark hadn't won yet.
Because…
"Heh," Heartless smirked, her dark eyes narrowing as she felt Stark's speed bearing down on her. "You're not the only one who can do this."
In that instant, her aura shifted.
Heartless activated her strongest skill.
DIVINE SCORN!
[Description: if a situation becomes too overwhelming, your hatred and dislike will merge together to double one of your stats for the rest of the battle.]
A surge of power exploded around her, a dark energy wrapping over her like armor.
This was no ordinary skill. This was her Immortal-Level skill, a skill fueled by hatred itself, turning her bitterness into raw power.
"SPEED!" she shouted, her voice echoing as she chose the stat she wanted to double.
The dark energy flared around her, doubling her speed.
In the blink of an eye, she matched Stark's swiftness.
Now they were on equal ground.
Stark grinned.
He sent one of his crimson spears flying toward her, aiming right at her chest.
But she deflected it with a flick of her black blade.
"Hahaha," Stark laughed. "Looks like you aren't as stupid as I thought!"
Heartless rolled her eyes, smiling back. "Shhh, boy, you're not my type."
Stark raised an eyebrow. "Thank god. I'd be worried if I was!"
And then—
BOOM!
The clash was like thunder.
Both of them moved at such impossible speeds that all anyone saw was a blur.
They collided again and again, each impact ringing out with a deafening echo.
They were like ghosts, vanishing and reappearing in rapid bursts, each blow shaking the ground.
In the real world, viewers watching the broadcast were left in disbelief.
"Put it in slow mode!" someone shouted.
"Idiot! It's a broadcast; you can't rewind it!"
Each time Stark swung a fist, Heartless countered with her golden spear or her dark sword, every blow either blocked or redirected.
They were equally matched, each of their movements precise, fluid, deadly.
Heartless lashed out with Halo of Despair, a dark aura enveloping her, lowering Stark's defenses and slowing his reactions.
Stark felt it immediately, his body growing heavier, his movements just a touch slower.
[Description: Creates an ominous aura around her, lowering the defense and speed of enemies within a 30-meter radius by 20%. The aura slowly drains their energy, weakening their attacks.]
She followed up with Spear of Divine Ruin, thrusting her spear with lightning speed, aiming for Stark's chest.
Stark barely dodged, but the tip grazed him, leaving a burning mark that intensified the pain.
-9,834!
"Hah!" Heartless cackled, eyes glinting. "Feeling the pressure yet?"
But Stark wasn't about to back down.
He lunged forward with his fists, each punch fast as a bullet, yet she deflected every single one, her smile only growing wider.
They clashed again and again, and slowly, Stark realized something alarming: Heartless was… better than him.
She was faster with each move, deflecting, parrying, countering in ways that left him struggling to keep up.
Two minutes passed, and he was still getting nowhere.
Then, Stark's eyes narrowed.
He realized what he needed to do.
A grin spread across his face, a dangerous glint lighting up his gaze.
"Alright..." he breathed in and out, making everyone look at him.
Domination Soul!
Without hesitation, Stark summoned his Soul Heart.
A small, crimson heart appeared in his hand, pulsing with a fierce energy that only he could control.
He held it up, and suddenly, everyone watching felt a chill run down their spines.
Instantly, not only the participants, but all those in the real world held their breath as they realized something.
How was this guy summoning a soul heart, even though with everything they saw until now, he clearly wasn't a [Soul Wielder]?
There was little to no info about the trial, but if it was the [Domination] trial, then doesn't it mean it was another class.
They knew what this meant.
And yet...
"Hm..." Clever scratched his beard, even he was wondering who the hell was that kid.
Follower, standing nearby, looked baffled. "What…? He's using a Soul Heart?"
"What the..." Lilith, who had never seen Stark use his soul heart until now, was also surprised.
To them, all previous skills could be given to the domination class, but this one, no, it couldn't, it had to be the [Soul Wielder] class.
And even in the real world, the panic was spreading, news were reporting like crazy, and chat forums were exploding.
"A SOUL HEART?!"
"But it doesn't make sense, he didn't even use it until now?!"
"Can Soul Wielders fight without them...?"
"No!"
And of course, the most shocked people of all were Stark's family, who's jaws quite literally hit the ground.
"What the..." Aiden, Stark's Father, looked at the TV screen with widened eyes.
The attention of the entire world was now on the boy as the camera focused on his fight.
"Honey, this is... impossible? They said for sure there was no chance he would awaken this class..."
"Mom?!" Lara screamed.
"Oh come on, my friends are asking if I can introduce them to my brother..." Nissa sighed.
Everyone, everywhere, was shocked, and now all they could do was see what Stark could do with that smiling crimson heart of his.
=).
Stark's grin widened. "Alright, let's end this," he said, holding the heart up like a weapon.
Heartless blinked, her gaze narrowing in suspicion.
"Let's go!" Stark shouted, swinging his Soul Heart forward, aiming it directly at Heartless.
Heartless raised her spear in defense, but Stark's soul weapon was relentless.
With a twist of his wrist, he sent a wave of energy crashing toward her, catching her off guard.
She tried to counter, but the force of Stark's attack was too strong.
-148,392!
They clashed, once, twice, three times, moving so fast that their figures blurred even more.
Each strike sent shockwaves through the ground, breaking rocks and cracking the earth beneath them.
Stark pressed forward, driving her back step by step.
She retaliated with her Winged Judgment, summoning dark feathers from her wings, each feather homing in on Stark.
They exploded around him, bursts of dark energy filling the air.
But Stark powered through, his fists smashing through the feathers, each impact causing a burst of dark energy that he ignored entirely.
His determination was unbreakable.
The fight was brutal, unforgiving.
"Why don't you learn?" the boy mocked, sensing that Heartless was getting more overwhelmed by the second.
Heartless launched a new barrage, this time using Blackblade Cleave, her black blade releasing a wave of dark energy that lingered in the air.
Stark dodged most of it, but he was forced to move through part of the wave, feeling his energy sapped, his strength waver for just a moment.
"Hmph," Heartless sneered, her eyes gleaming with victory. "Not so tough now, are you?"
Stark laughed, barely fazed. "You talk too much."
He swung his Soul Heart again, this time pouring more energy into it, the crimson glow flaring.
Heartless moved to block with her spear, but the impact sent her skidding back, her defenses barely holding.
"You think you're so good, huh?" Stark began to rant midfight, "All of you think you own this fucking place, well, don't worry about that, I'll send you back to Godless, your little master.
Each move was faster, more intense.
Heartless responded in kind, her Duality Strike unleashing a mix of holy and dark energy that exploded around them both.
They moved so fast that no one in the audience could keep track.
But Stark was reaching his limit.
[2:12 minutes of "Double Speed" left.]
His time was running out. Only a little over two minutes left in Double Speed.
He had to end this now.
Heartless noticed his intensity and smirked. "Running out of time, are we?" she taunted.
But Stark only smiled back, his gaze fierce. "Guess you'll find out soon enough."
He needed to win within that time limit, otherwise it was game over.

chapters.title: Chapter 354 - 354: Killing the Heartless One, 100 to 0 Combo
chapters.content:
The battle between Stark and the Heartless One raged on, both of them moving at such incredible speed that the world around them seemed frozen.
To the others watching, the two combatants were nothing more than crimson and black blurs colliding again and again, the force of their blows sending shockwaves through the air.
Stark unleashed his skills over and over, each blow amplified by the crimson aura that surrounded him.
His [Asura's Arms] lashed out too, striking from unpredictable angles and allowing him to deflect the attacks or grab them.
But the Heartless One was relentless, her golden spear and dark blade dancing through the chaos.
Every swing of her weapons carried deadly precision, and she met Stark's attacks head-on, blocking and countering with incredible skill.
BOOM!
Another clash sent both fighters skidding backward, their feet tearing into the ground as they tried to maintain their footing.
Stark smirked, wiping a trickle of blood from his mouth.
At this point, his aura was not only taking over his face, but his entire upper half too.
The angrier he got, the more his aura would take.
"You're tough," he said.
"And you're exhausting," the Heartless One replied with a twisted grin, the black aura of her skills swirling around her like a storm.
[1:31 minutes of "Double Speed" left]
Stark didn't waste a second.
"I need... to... get her... FAST..."
He dashed forward again, closing the distance between them in the blink of an eye.
His [Crimson Spears] materialized mid-sprint, streaking toward her like deadly missiles.
CLANG!
The Heartless One spun her dark blade, deflecting the spears with ease.
Then she finally decided to use her wings for the first time.
"HARBINGER'S DESCENT!"
[Leaps into the air with her wings, before crashing down and creating a shockwave. Enemies in the vicinity are thrown back and momentarily stunned by the impact.]
She does as the skill indicates, but as she crashed into the ground...
"It's my win, human," the stun would be enough to hold Stark for one second, and that would be more than enough for her to cut him in half.
"Not bad," Stark muttered, but he wasn't stupid.
INVINCIBLE DODGE!
He rolled forward, avoiding the attack thanks to his invincibility frames.
"Huh."
"Just like in Dark Sou-"
ZAP!
-100!
"Damn."
People were surprised that a fucking lightning strike hit Stark out of nowhere, but maybe it was one of the Heartless One's skills.
The sheer intensity of their duel left the spectators frozen, even the [Tormented One], who had stopped attacking Clever to watch the fight unfold.
The clock was ticking.
Stark knew his [Double Speed] had less than a minute left.
The strain of maintaining such a high level of combat was beginning to take its toll, but he couldn't let up.
The Heartless One was just as relentless.
She activated [Void Embrace], covering the battlefield in a haze of dark energy.
Stark's vision blurred, his accuracy faltering as hallucinations danced in the corners of his eyes.
"Cheap tricks!" he growled, summoning his [Crimson Ball Transmission] to teleport above the haze.
SNAP!
In a flash, Stark reappeared in the air, hurling another [Crimson Spear] down toward her.
The Heartless One laughed, effortlessly dodging and countering with [Blackblade Cleave] again, sending a wave of dark energy slicing upward.
Stark twisted mid-air, narrowly avoiding the attack and landing with a thud.
Time was running out.
[WARNING!]
[30 seconds remaining!]
With 30 seconds left, Stark felt his body beginning to slow.
His breathing was heavy, and his crimson aura flickered faintly.
The Heartless One sensed his weakness and smiled wickedly.
"This is the end," she declared, raising her spear high.
The golden weapon glowed with radiant energy as she activated [Heavenly Spearfall].
Dozens of holy spears materialized in the air, each aimed directly at Stark.
"Bring it on!" Stark shouted as hard as he could, summoning another [Crimson Ball].
He threw it in the air above, intending to teleport out of harm's way.
But she was faster.
The Heartless One tricked him, and instead of the spears crashing down, SHE shot forward before he could snap his fingers.
"Huh?"
In an instant, she was directly in front of Stark, her spear poised to deliver the final blow.
Stark's eyes widened. He wasn't fast enough to react.
And then... he gambled.
Remember about the [Incubus] class Stark got?
The one that was utterly useless in battle except against females foes?
Well... if the Heartless One could be considered a girl, then maybe...
"ENRAPTURE!"
[Enraptured (Incubus Skill): Only works on female foes, but you can use that skill to increase your charm and make them lose focus for a bit.]
A powerful crimson aura radiated from Stark, and his features shifted slightly.
