That change was only visible to the Heartless One, by the way.
His face became sharper, more alluring, an unearthly charm emanating from his entire being.
"W-Wow," The Heartless One hesitated.
For a single, critical second, she faltered.
Her grip on the spear slackened, her attack freezing mid-motion as her focus wavered.
'He's totally my type now!'
It was all Stark needed.
SNAP!
He teleported into the air, his [Crimson Ball] floating where he was now standing.
From above, he activated [Domi-Chains Restrain], summoning three crimson chains that wrapped tightly around the Heartless One.
She struggled against them, her strength threatening to tear them apart.
"Not enough? Fine," Stark muttered, clenching his fist.
[Chains of Judgment Activated.]
With a deafening roar, the chain demon Gortox appeared, his massive form towering over the battlefield.
Dozens of additional chains shot out, binding the Heartless One completely.
"YOU THINK THIS IS GONNA STOP ME?" she bellowed, her golden aura flaring as she prepared to break free.
"No," he smiled, "But what happens next will."
With a fierce grin, he swung his [Soul Heart] down with all of his might.
"Let's finish this," he said.
CRASH!
The impact was devastating.
The Heartless One screamed in pain as the attack connected, her HP bar plummeting.
-862,821!
Still airborne, Stark followed up with [Spear of Judgment].
The colossal spear of light descended upon her, piercing through her defenses.
-2,726,905!
And he wasn't finished yet.
What was about to follow was what many would call a 100 to 0 combo.
While going down, he summoned [Wielding Cross], and Stark slammed the massive weapon into her with full force.
The ground beneath them cracked and buckled from the sheer power of the blow.
-1,238,182!
WHAM!
He swung again.
-1,153,985!
And so on the third strike, [Holy Combo] automatically activated.
[Reminder: If you swing your cross and strike twice in a row, the third strike will light up the cross with so much crimson aura that it will deal 200% damage and without fail stun enemies for five seconds!
BOOM!
-2,318,461!
The Heartless One was knocked to the ground, completely immobilized.
Stark didn't waste a moment.
He unleashed a relentless barrage of attacks.
His [Asura's Arms] struck her repeatedly, their crimson fists pummeling her without mercy.
He also slammed his [Soul Heart] into her again and again, each strike dealing massive damage.
[Crimson Spears] rained down from above, and flying crimson fists exploded around her, leaving no room for escape.
The Heartless One's HP bar dwindled rapidly, the relentless onslaught overwhelming her.
And finally, with one last devastating blow, Stark's [Soul Heart] struck her chest, shattering her aura completely.
Ding!
-573,945!
[Heartless One HP: 0/10,000,000]
"This is..." she mumbled, "I-Impossible..."
She died.
["Heartless One" has been killed by "Chosen."]
[3 Monsters Alive: Mayor, Butler Trio, Tormented One.]
Stark stood over the defeated Heartless One, his breathing ragged but his expression triumphant.
[You have slain "Heartless One" and gained 60,000,000 experience points!]
Ding!
[Your level has increased to level 120, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Your level has increased to level 121, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
.
.
[Your level has increased to level 123, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
His crimson aura flickered faintly, but his presence was overwhelming, his power undeniable.
The battlefield was silent, the other participants staring in awe.
Stark smiled faintly, his crimson heart pulsing one last time before disappearing.
"Next," he muttered, his voice carrying across the battlefield.
No one dared to move.

chapters.title: Chapter 355 - 355: The Domination Trial's Secret Rule
chapters.content:
[5 Participants Alive]
[3 Monsters Remaining]
The trial was reaching its final showdown, and everyone, including the participants, wondered what would happen once all monsters died.
If the rules were correct, only one of the participants could enter the [Hollow Tower] to win, meaning that by the end of it all, only one could remain.
For the Gardenis family, it meant the huge possibility of their daughter dying.
For Lana, it meant that Stark or Sora would die, and no matter who it would be, they would be devastated.
And for the entire world, it meant that among all of those still alive, only one would rise to be the strongest.
The millions of screens displaying the trial were perfectly connected, meaning that those in the outside world could see all of it happening thanks to smooth cameras that followed everything.
For example, while Stark and Heartless One were fighting, the cameras were all on them, leaving out everybody else.
This was how this trial allowed those outside to see everything.
"Hey," the Mayor was the first to speak, and all the attention turned to him.
In contrast to his usual calm demeanor, the mayor had a bad feeling about all of this, and when he stared at Stark, it was almost as if he saw a terrifying presence.
Almost just as scary as the [Godless Demon].
'That kid... the more he fights... the more he gets fed up with all of this, the stronger he gets,' he realized, 'And so that means that...'
Mayor smirked as he pointed at Stark with his disgusting hands.
"I say we eliminate that guy first."
He was talking to not only the remaining monsters, meaning the [Butler Trio] and [Tormented One], but also the participants.
Mainly to [Clever] and [Follower] though, as it was unlikely Lilith and Sora would betray him.
"Are they fucking serious?"
"NO FUCKING WAY?!"
People in the real world were shocked: these monsters were quite literally asking humans to team on someone else.
This was unheard of in humanity, as monsters ALWAYS fight humans, no matter what happens, yet here they are, trying to gang up on one simply because they fear he might be too strong.
Plus... wasn't Clever the strongest?
That old man could summon his golden statue and smash all of them at the same time if he felt like it.
And yet...
"This might be a good idea," the old man smiled, "I say we tear him apart."
He was totally in, the idea of all of them fighting that kid fascinating to him.
"I'm in too, as long as I get the final blow," Follower appeared from the shadows, quite literally next to Mayor.
Yet, as expected, Mayor didn't attack Follower, meaning that he was actually serious about fighting and killing Stark together.
Tormented One nodded his head too, taking a few steps toward Stark to indicate he was in on the idea.
"Oh, and before we can start the massacre," Clever smiled, "Let's take care of the other two," he pointed at Sora and Lilith.
"I wouldn't do this if I was you, old man," through all of this, Stark was strangely calm, looking at them with the most neutral of expressions.
"Do we kill them?" Follower pondered, he didn't care about the other two, but if they could meddle in his plan then he would get rid of them.
"Don't worry," Clever kept smiling as he snapped his fingers, two massive golden arms emerging from the ground beside the girls and grabbing them both, "They can't escape anymore."
Sora and Lilith tried to escape, obviously, but not only were none of their skills working, but every time they resisted, the grip on the golden arms tightened.
If they kept going, their organs would be crushed, so now, all they could do was watch as Stark was getting teamed on by 5 people.
In the outside world, people were baffled.
"Seriously, 5V1?!"
"Cowards, not gonna lie."
"I mean, that guy's so problematic both monsters and humans decided it was better to eliminate him together, so who knows..."
In schools, restaurants, company buildings, everyone watched, Stark's neutral face appearing on every screen.
The crimson aura that over his face growing in power as his opponents began walking toward him.
"Are you... sure...?" Stark asked one more time, closing his eyes and smiling.
"You ain't gonna do shit," Follower laughed, "We saw you use your giant spear or whatever against Father Hugo, you can't bluff your way out of this!"
"Oh?" Stark kept smiling, "If that's what you think."
Stark, through all of his, could only find it amusing that these people... no... these things would try to team up on him simply because he was a threat.
It was... sad.
Right now, through his vision, all he could see were their darkened figures marching toward him, their eyes glowing with their respective aura's color.
And to make it worse, a panel appeared in front of everybody to seal the deal.
[5V1]
[Mayor, Butler Trio, Tormented One, Follower and Clever] VS [Chosen].
But that's not all.
Because... this trial truly wanted Stark to die.
The [Crimson Moons Trio], the [Apostles] and even the [Godless Demon] wanted the Chosen One to be killed, so that they can take over this world.
All those that joined them would reign, while all those that refused and wanted to fight will be annihilated.
And though Godless knew there were a few levels 900 or even 1000 classifiers that could be difficult to deal with, he was still confident their greed would allow him to recruit them.
But Chosen One was... weird.
Godless Demon felt it through his very being since he saw him: that kid wouldn't back down, no matter what.
Killing him was the best solution.
If he could descend to Rheria, he would have already done it, but the preparations of the [Final Ritual] were soon coming to an end.
The moment they did, the world would be at his mercy.
And so through all of that hatred for Stark, a single rule was added to the trial.
A rule that changed everything, and everyone's eyes widened as they saw it, including the participants, monsters, and those in the real world.
[Secret Rule: if Chosen One is eliminated, then all of those still alive will automatically win, and to all the monsters alive, they will be able to meet with Godless and ascend to a better title.]
Instantly, the tension in the air became ten times as strong.
Even Clever, who was joking around until now, activated his [100-Golden Arms Statue], the giant golden statue appearing behind him.
Follower also activated his aura, a monstrous and dark figure appearing behind him: it was the fruit of his most recent task completion.
And if he managed to kill Chosen, he would be able to use the powers as he wanted, taking over countries when Godless descended.
Mayor and Tormented One also grew serious: ascending in title means possibly becoming an apostle or general of the army, it was something they couldn't refuse.
At this point, killing Chosen was the smartest decision if you wanted to live.
And even people in the real world could now understand why they decided to gang up on him.
But through all of this, Stark kept smiling.
He asked the question one last time.
"Are... you... sure?"
"Yes," Clever grinned.
"Affirmative," The Mayor confirmed.
"If sir decides to kill you, then we are with him," The butler trio nodded.
"Why wouldn't I?" Follower laughed.
"..." Tormented One nodded.
All of them agreed.
The entire world held its breath as they waited to see what Stark could possibly do.
"You should be happy, you know?" Clever spoke as he pointed at the restrained girls, "At least your two little girlfriends are going to be able to get out of here alive."
"..."
"Just give up, you can't beat us, no matter what," Follower advanced, his dark aura taking over his body.
"..."
"It was nice fighting with you, human, but we have more important things to do," Mayor bowed out of respect, "You shall be remembered."
"..."
And then... Stark laughed.
"You guys are so... stupid, hahaha," he held his stomach, actually thinking all of this was funny.
"Did he go insane?"
"No, I'm not insane," he wiped the tears from his eyes, "But..."
Stark's expression suddenly became so serious, and his aura so powerful, that all the others took their defensive stances
"I guess all of you are going to die now."
Clever's golden statue loomed behind him, its massive arms ready to crush anyone who defied him.
Follower's shadowy aura twisted unnaturally, a monstrous figure hovering just behind him, exuding pure malice.
The Mayor's grotesque form pulsed with dark energy, and the Butler Trio's synchronized movements were sharp and calculating.
Even the Tormented One, silent and deadly, glared at Stark with glowing eyes.
The camera focused on Stark as he placed his two hands together, his eyes still closed.
And then...
He pointed at the sky.
"Huh?"
"What is he doing?"
Those outside the trial, and that had never seen it, were confused, but on the other hand, all of those inside suddenly tensed up.
That's when Stark whispered the words that could crush anyone who fought him.
"Heaven's Spear," he smiled, calm as ever, "Angel of the Spear, come to my rescue."

chapters.title: Chapter 356 - 356: Teaming on Stark? Nuh Uh! Heaven's Spear!
chapters.content:
Before everyone's cautious gazes, Stark lifted his arm, an explosive aura emerging from his body.
"Heaven's Spear," he whispered, pointing at the sky, "Angel of the Spear, come to my rescue."
A rift tore through the sky, turning it into a golden color, and from it emerged a giant figure.
Stark's arm stayed raised, the massive angelic figure above him radiating an overwhelming aura.
Its form towered over the battlefield, its colossal spear resting easily in one hand.
[What do you wish for me to do, master?]
The angel spoke, his voice loud and thunderous as he had the spear in hand, ready to throw it.
"If I ever say the word 'GO', then launch it, and if they try to attack me, throw it as well," he instructed, and the angel nodded.
All of the participants now knew they couldn't act out.
Even if they killed Stark in one blow, the angel would still throw the spear, and there was no saying whether any of their barriers could block it.
"I'll inform you of three things," he raised of his fingers while pointing at monsters and participants.
But before he could continue what he was about to say, a panel appeared in front of him.
[To make it fair, we'll inform you that "Follower" has the "Skill Canceller" item, meaning he can cancel your "Heaven's Spear" if he uses it.]
Stark made sure to keep his expression neutral, but turned his pupils toward Follower, who seemed like he wanted to grab the [Skill Canceller] from his system inventory.
"!!!" Stark knew this was bad, and he hadn't expected anything like that.
But now that he did know, he wasn't about to let it slide.
"Clone Frenzy," he whispered, a singular clone, the only one he could summon because of the cooldown, appearing.
Then he whispered a single instruction to it: use [Crimson Ball Transmission] to do what needs to be done.
The clone nodded, throwing the crimson ball, and setting it right behind Follower.
'Now wait.'
The clone kneeled down, it's crimson body waiting for the opportunity it sought.
"Back to what I was saying," Stark repeated, "I'll inform you of three things."
"First of all, the angel above me can't miss his shot, no matter, so don't even think of escaping to somewhere else," as a proof, he displayed the status panels for the [Heaven's Spear] perk.
[Heaven's Spear (Ultimate Form): : Upon activation, a colossal rift tears open in the sky, revealing a towering angelic figure, nearly 50 kilometers in height. With a slow, deliberate motion, the angel summons an immense spear of pure crimson energy, large enough to obliterate mountains with ease.]
Everyone gulped as they saw it, and even the people outside the trial could feel the sheer aura of that thing.
"Second of all, the spear does enough damage to instantly evaporate you, no amount of defense could save you, I believe even a level 850 or 900 classifier would get instantly killed," yet again, he spoke the truth, not needing any proof this time for everyone to believe him.
And last...
"You can't escape the range, as the spear could be enough to destroy a small city due to the blast," he finally said, smiling.
"BULLSHIT!" Follower called out.
"Hm?"
"I saw the spear attack in the temple, and it was only enough to destroy the temple and an area 1 kilometer around it, that's definitely not a city!"
That is definitely true as well, after all, if the attack was so powerful, why did the impact destroy so "little".
Well...
"Father Hugo was the one who threw that spear, not me, he simply copied my attack, basically a weaker version of mine," he smirked, "You can even ask the other commanders if you wish?"
As Tormented One couldn't talk, all eyes fell on the Mayor, whose expression turned serious and cautious.
With a sigh, he admitted, "Hugo can basic skills and their perks to perfection, but when it comes to massive perks such as... this one... he could probably only use around 10% of their power."
"..." Follower instantly began to sweat, making him even more eager in using the "Skill Canceller" now.
If Father Hugo only used 10% of the angel's power, and destroyed that much, then what would even happen with Stark's aura and 100% of it's power?
No one could imagine.
But all the people in the real world had a rough image: total annihilation.
Chosen had the lives of millions in his hands since the beginning.
"I hope you understand now, so..." Stark laughed, "Just let go of them," he pointed at the two girls, "And kill each other."
"That is... if you guys don't want to just team up and kill the moons," he added a last option, pointing at the sky, where the three moons were watching.
"You think we're scared?" the Mayor intervened, "If you use that thing, you're going to die too!"
Instantly, all the others realized it as well: Stark wasn't invincible, he was about to get it too if he throws it.
"That is true," he admitted.
"HAHA, THEN IT MEANS YOU'RE JUST AS FUCKED AS US!" Follower laughed, letting go of the [Skill Canceller], "IDIOT!"
"No," Stark shook his head, "Because I'd rather kill myself with you all than let you win."
"Bullshit," Clever spoke for the first time.
"Oh?" Stark looked at him, a vortex of crimson aura appearing in his eyes, "But I am serious, I'll kill myself to take you all with me."
The aura in his eyes was so overwhelming and insane that everyone instantly believed him.
That kid was fucking crazy!
"And what about your two girlfriends? You're gonna let them die?"
"Yeah," Stark shrugged, pushing the bluff to its max, "I don't care about them that much, all dying together is beautiful, isn't it?"
Of course, everything Stark was saying was pure bluff: he had his [Chosen One] talent perk to revive him, while Lilith and Sora had the [Protection Amulet].
That is the reason why he stopped her from using it when faced with the [Celestial Annihilation].
But it was to push the bluff to its limit that Stark had to say all of that, and best of all: they believed him.
"ARE YOU CRAZY?!" Lilith shouted.
"...Believe in him," but Sora quieted her down, knowing that Stark wouldn't sacrifice them.
In the outside world, everyone was going ballistic.
"HOLY FUCKING SHIT!"
"THAT GUY'S INSANE?!"
"Suicide annihilation, heh?"
Even Sora's family, and specifically her father, was going crazy from rage.
"T-This kid," he couldn't even fathom how his daughter could meet someone so bad, "FUCK!"
To the world, and even those inside the trial, Stark looked more monstrous than ever the monsters themselves.
Stark's family was the same, terrified and shocked.
Just what the hell could have happened during those 1.5 years that made Stark so powerful, and that pushed him to have such a mindset?
Killing them all was alright if you had a backup plan to survive.
And even killing yourself would be brave if it meant your loved ones could survive.
But at the end of the day your plan is just to: kill everyone, including you and the girls you were with, then it's just pure insanity.
That's not brave, nor heroic, it's just... evil.
And worst of all, every screen showed Stark's figure, taken completely over by his crimson aura, only his mouth and eyes visible because of the white trail.
He was completely serious.
"Well then," he spoke, smiling, "What's your choice," he bowed, mocking the Mayor, "It doesn't matter to me."
The world waited for the other's answer.
Because no matter what they answered, then something crazy would happen.

chapters.title: Chapter 357 - 357: The Skill Canceller, Follower's Massive Failure
chapters.content:
The air was thick with tension as Stark stood beneath the colossal angel, the massive spear glowing ominously in its grasp.
At any moment, if Stark felt like it, he could order it to throw the spear, killing every single one of them.
Everyone had been frozen, unsure of their next move, weighing their options carefully.
Stark's crimson aura radiated outwards, making it hard for anyone to look directly at him without feeling overwhelmed.
The Mayor was the first to move, his calculating eyes darting between the angel, Stark, and the other participants.
"Your bluff won't hold forever, Chosen," the Mayor growled, stepping forward. "Someone will call it. Someone always does."
"And yet," Stark replied calmly, his voice carrying across the battlefield, "none of you have yet."
The silence that followed was suffocating.
No one wanted to make the first move.
No one could, or else it would be instant death.
No one wanted to risk being the one who triggered the angel's wrath.
In the midst of this standoff, Follower's lips curled into a sneer.
"Enough of this," he muttered under his breath, reaching into his system inventory.
Stark's eyes shifted slightly, catching the subtle movement.
From his inventory, Follower pulled out a scroll, its surface shimmering faintly with golden text.
The moment the scroll appeared, an announcement flashed before every participant and on every screen worldwide:
[Skill Canceller: Cancels out any skill, even if it is Immortal or level 100!]
Gasps erupted from those watching both inside and outside the trial.
An object that wouldn't be powerful under usual circumstances because of the many skills everyone had.
But in Stark's case, whom [Crimson Spear]'s [Heaven's Spear] was his lifeline, it was a big deal.
"YOU FOOL," Follower bellowed, raising the scroll high. "NOW YOU'RE ABOUT TO BE MASSACRED!"
Every participant's eyes widened, realizing the implications.
And they all smiled as well, ready to dash the moment the angel disappeared.
Stark, however, remained unshaken. His calm demeanor only deepened the unease of those around him.
"GOODBYE, CHOSEN ONE!" Follower shouted, activating the scroll with a triumphant laugh.
But as his fingers began to glow, the sound of Stark's voice cut through the chaos.
"Idiot," Stark whispered, barely audible but brimming with confidence.
"!!!?"
SNAP!
The sharp sound echoed as Stark's crimson clone, calm until now, snapped its fingers.
Using [Crimson Ball Transmission], it teleported directly behind Follower, the crimson energy of the clone swirling as it materialized.
Before Follower could react, the clone grabbed the scroll from his hand.
"YOU LITTLE- GIVE ME BACK-" Follower roared, swinging a fist at the clone.
But the clone didn't hesitate.
It unfurled the scroll and activated it immediately, aimed directly at Clever.
FWISH!
[You have cancelled the "Golden Grip" skill.]
The golden arms holding Sora and Lilith disintegrated instantly, freeing them both.
Both Lilith and Sora fell on their feet, surprised, but ready to fight.
"WRRAAAA!" Follower roared in frustration, his fist finally connecting with the clone and obliterating it in one blow.
Crimson energy scattered like shards of glass, but the deed was already done.
Stark smirked, tilting his head mockingly.
"Thanks for the assist, Follower," he said, his voice dripping with sarcasm.
"YOU...!" Follower growled, his eyes bloodshot with rage.
Before he could charge, Sora and Lilith both moved to Stark's side, their gazes wary.
"Are you alright?" Lilith asked, her voice strained but steady.
"Better now," Stark replied without taking his eyes off the battlefield.
The other participants began to stir, the tension reaching its breaking point.
"Well, does any of you think he had some sort of... how do I say it nicely... a trick to stop me?"
"..."
No one could speak.
"Enough games!" The Mayor's voice boomed, his patience clearly gone. "This has gone on long enough. If we don't act now, that angel will annihilate all of us!"
"You're welcome to try," Stark replied coolly, his hand gesturing towards the angel above. "But I wouldn't recommend it."
Clever, now free of his skill, turned his gaze toward Stark, his expression unreadable.
"I admit," he said slowly, "you've surprised me. But don't think this changes anything."
"It doesn't have to," Stark replied. "Feel free to make your move. I'm ready."
The Mayor stepped forward, his aura flaring.
"If no one else will act, I will," he declared.
But before he could take another step, Tormented One let out a guttural growl, its massive, disfigured form lurching forward.
But it didn't attack Stark, not at all.
It attacked... Clever.
The Mayor stopped in his tracks, narrowing his eyes, "So you fell for his tricks," he whispered, watching as Clever instantly replied by swinging one of his golden fists.
"So," Stark said, his tone casual but laced with a sharp edge, "Gonna kill each other, huh? Then let me enjoy the show."
He gestured upward, where the angel held the colossal spear, its crimson glow intensifying,
"And if any attacks hits me or the girls..." he smiled. "...it's game over."
The participants exchanged uneasy glances, the stalemate dragging on.
Suddenly, Follower snapped.
"ENOUGH!" he screamed, lunging toward Stark with wild eyes.
Stark didn't flinch.
The angel's grip on the spear tightened, and for a moment, it seemed as if the end was near.
But before the angel could act, another participant intervened.
Clever moved with blinding speed, intercepting Follower and slamming him to the ground, while keeping the Tormented One in check with his statue.
"Stop being reckless," Clever hissed.
Follower struggled beneath him, his rage boiling over.
"HE HAS TO DIE!" Follower screamed.
"And so will we if you keep this up," Clever snapped back.
"FUCK... YOU..." Using the entire power he had earned from the [Godless Demon], Follower's body exploded with aura, sending Clever flying in the opposite direction, "I'M KILLING EVERY SINGLE ONE OF YOU!"
[Annihilate them all to prove yourself, Follower.]
A panel appeared in front of him, meaning that killing Stark wasn't the only way to get stronger anymore, he could kill them all.
"Oh?" Mayor's expression was still serious, "Looks like Chosen didn't even have to push you that much to begin to go insane, kid, alright, you're gonna die," Mayor took his stance.
"..." Tormented One also turned his attention, managing to break one of the golden arms that was blocking him.
It went from a [5V1] to a [1V1V1V2] in mere minutes, with Stark, Lilith and Sora able to enjoy the show.
Any movement from the others and he would launch the spear.
The single reason he didn't do it was because he would need it for later, specifically against the moons.
"Oh yeah," Stark spoke to Lilith, watching Mayor and Follower engage in a battle, "Give me the [Cooldown Gem] you got from your task."
"Huh?" Lilith tilted her head, "Why should I?"
"Lilith," Sora held her shoulder, shaking her head, "Trust him."
For some reason, Lilith was really fond of Sora, her calm face and expressions were enough for her to agree.
"Alright, you saved me twice..." she mumbled, pulling out all of her items instead of only the [Cooldown Gem], "You're gonna need them more than me, probably."
In front of Stark's eyes were: [Cooldown Gem, Double Power, Revive Token, Teleportation Sphere, Moonscorch Cure x1]
But Stark decided to only take the [Cooldown Gem], [Double Power], [Revive Token] and [Moonscorch Cure], which he used immediately since his moonscorch percentage was already reaching its peak.
"Keep the [Teleportation Sphere], they're safety items, I don't need them," Stark smiled gently at Lilith, and for some strange reason, through the boy's bruised and tired face, her heart skipped a beat.
"A-Alright," she nodded.
Now all Stark needed to do was sit back and enjoy the show.

chapters.title: Chapter 358 - 358: The Others Actually Start Fighting, Human VS Monster Again
chapters.content:
The others immediately engage in their respective fights.
[Mayor and Butler Trio VS Follower]
[Tormented One VS Clever]
It was yet again back to human vs monster thanks to Stark's threats.
Just a few more, and the first human-monster collaboration would have happened.
The Mayor was a level 600 moonscorch commander, with 17 skills to use whenever he wanted to battle:
[Giant Utensils, Silver Service, Dinner is Served, Chef's Wrath, Utensil Bind, Table Manners, Final Course, Utensil Storm, Polished Edge, Fork Toss, Feast of Fury, Platter's Revenge, Hunger's Drive, Carve and Serve, Dinner Rush (Mythical), Full Course Punishment (Godly), Banquet of Eternity (Godly); Horn Call (Immortal)]
And he was accompanied his followers, the [Butler Trio], who would even oppose master Godless for him.
[Mini-Boss: Butler Trio]
[Level: 590]
[Skills: Loyal Regeneration, Moonscorched, Butler Swing, Random Plate, Mayor's Servant...]
They weren't powerful, but the [Loyal Regeneration] skill was what made them tough to beat.
[Loyal Regeneration: As long as the Mayor is alive, they will keep regeneration no matter what, for they could never leave his as long as he is still here, their loyalty transcends everything.]
Beating Mayor was a challenge in itself, so add to that three immortal beings that would do anything to stop you, and this becomes a boss fight.
But Follower wasn't fazed.
After all, he had already sacrificed everything for the [Godless Demon].
Remember how every domination user has their very own status panel and skills?
Well, Follower sacrificed all of those to gain the power of the [Godless Demon].
Every single skill he had worked for was gone, but in exchange, he gained powers that far surpassed his previous ones.
He only gained 5 perks by now, but each of them was immensely powerful: Crimson Corruption, Demon's Grasp, Attack Negation, Demon Devouring, and finally, Godless Demon Transformation (Immortal).
[Crimson Corruption: Corrupts the air around him and enhance his fists with a dark aura.]
[Demon's Grasp: Transform his hands into claws, and his eyes become sharp enough to notice any weakness an enemy has.]
[Attack Negation: Able to cancel an attack from an enemy if you hit them.]
[Demon Devouring: Pierce your enemy, and hold your claws in their hearts for five seconds, then you'll instantly kill them.]
[Godless Demon Transformation: partially transform your body with the aura of the Godless Demon, gaining immense strength.]
He could only use those, but it was more than enough for him to completely dominate any battle he could be in.
And now that his target, the Mayor, was on his sight, he was about to destroy him.
The Mayor grinned as his utensils grew to massive sizes, activating [Giant Utensils].
The fork and knife slashed through the air with a deadly arc, forcing Follower to dodge swiftly.
The [Butler Trio] surrounded him, their movements synchronized.
They activated [Random Plate], hurling spinning plates that grazed Follower's arms and legs. He ignored the cuts, his fists glowing dark with [Crimson Corruption].
Follower lunged at the Mayor, but one of the butlers intercepted, swinging a massive tray at him.
The blow missed as Follower ducked, retaliating with a punch.
The butler stumbled back as he was hurt, but [Loyal Regeneration] quickly mended the damage.
The Mayor laughed. "You'll need more than that."
With a swipe of his hand, he summoned spinning plates through [Dinner is Served].
The spectral plates homed in on Follower, forcing him to leap backward.
The butlers moved in again, using [Mayor's Servant] to chain their attacks.
One swung a fork, while another hurled plates from a distance.
Follower caught one plate midair, shattering it with his clawed hand.
He growled, using [Demon's Grasp] to extend his claws, which glowing menacingly.
He slashed at the nearest butler, tearing through its chest.
But the regeneration kicked in immediately, leaving no permanent damage.
"You're annoying," Follower muttered.
The Mayor activated [Silver Service], spinning his utensils in a whirlwind.
The energy pulled Follower closer, and the utensils slashed across his torso, leaving deep gashes.
Follower winced but recovered quickly.
-17,834!
He landed a solid punch on the Mayor, but [Table Manners] triggered.
The Mayor dodged and stabbed Follower in the shoulder, dealing true damage.
The Mayor smirked. "You're nothing but a pest."
"Annoying little shit..." Follower growled, "You're simply using tricks over and over..."
"And yet you can't do anything about it."
Follower retaliated with another claw slash, but the Mayor blocked it with [Polished Edge], his knife gleaming with enhanced power.
A counterattack followed, forcing Follower to retreat.
The butlers swarmed again, swinging their plates at random to strike Follower with incredible force, they didn't fear for their lives since they knew they would be revived.
He rolled to the side and used [Attack Negation] on the next swing, canceling it entirely.
Follower then dashed toward the Mayor, claws aimed for his heart again.
"I just need... a single opening..."
The Mayor stepped back, activating [Utensil Storm].
Forks and knives rained down, forcing Follower to zigzag through the onslaught.
A spectral fork struck Follower's leg, pinning him momentarily.
The Mayor dashed forward with [Fork Toss], aiming for Follower's chest.
Follower broke free just in time, dodging the Mayor's attack and slamming a fist into his ribs.
-859,384!
"From a single punch?!" The Mayor stumbled, but the butlers rushed in, their loyalty unwavering.
Their speed and power increasing as they coordinated attacks. Plates flew, forks stabbed, and trays swung, all aimed at overwhelming Follower.
Follower roared, activating [Crimson Corruption] again.
A dark aura burst from him, knocking the butlers back temporarily.
He focused on the Mayor, charging forward with relentless fury.
"Feast of Fury," he smiled, unleashing a rapid combo of utensil strikes.
Follower blocked and dodged, each attack growing faster and deadlier.
One strike connected, leaving a gash across Follower's chest. He gritted his teeth and countered with a clawed strike, but the Mayor dodged effortlessly.
"You'll need to try harder," the Mayor taunted, and his fork struck Follower, marking him with a defense-reducing debuff.
Follower ignored the pain and slashed at the Mayor again.
His claws tore through the air, forcing the Mayor to parry with his knife.
"That kid..." Mayor, though confident, he could sense that no matter how many times he was hitting him, Follower seemed to only grow stronger by the second.
The butlers returned, their regeneration fully healed. They attacked from all sides, overwhelming Follower with their relentless assault.
Follower slammed his foot into the ground, creating a small shockwave to push them back.
His claws glowed brighter, and his eyes sharpened, identifying a weakness in the Mayor's stance.
The Mayor grinned. "You'll never win. As long as I stand, they cannot fall."
Follower smirked. "Then you're gonna be the first to go down."
"BANQUET OF ETERNITY!"
Mayor tried to activate his strongest skill besides his Immortal one to finally end this fight.
But before he could do anything...
"Watch your back next time, dumbass," Follower already behind, having adapted to Mayor's fighting style flawlessly.
This was one of the passive perks Follower acquired besides those he got to deal damage: the more he fought and received damage, then the easier it would be for him to overwhelm his enemies.
He couldn't do that with the [Heaven's Spear] since it was just too strong, able to wipe him in mere seconds, but for anyone else, it was his strategy.
He believed that it would also work perfectly with Stark, that is if he didn't have another skill to instantly end a battle.
"Yawn..." meanwhile, Stark was lying down, observing the battles and taking into account every single skill the others were displaying.
He would surely need to remember them for later.
Tormented One and Clever on the other hand were locked in a stalemate, as Tormented One couldn't even reach the old man, but his [100-Golden Arms Statue] dealt literally 0 damage to the thing.
-0! -0! -0!
Sensing the growing danger of this trial, Clever got serious and slammed his fists repeatedly, but the creature would get up no matter, as if unaffected.
After a short while of fighting, Follower landed a devastating punch, sending the Mayor crashing into a wall.
-1,734,945!
He had adapted to their fighting style perfectly now, even the butler trio sensing that no matter what they did, it wouldn't work.
The square fell silent for a moment.
Follower laughed. "Weak, and worse of all, your horns look stupid and ugly."
Ding!
[Do not insult the Mayor's horns]
Such a warning had appeared in front of Shock and CEO in the manor, but Follower didn't know about it, and frankly, even if he did know, it wouldn't change much.
The Mayor's expression twisted with rage.
His hands gripped his utensils tightly, his entire body trembling with fury.
[Conditions met to use "Immortal" Skill]
[Horn Call] was a condition skill, much like EGO meter and the fact you need to make the meter reach 100, but in that case, the condition was for someone to insult Mayor's horns.
"You're dead, kid," the Mayor said, his voice cold and furious.
"Sure thing, you ugly little shit," Follower replied, unfazed.
The Mayor dashed forward, his rage fueling his every movement.
Follower grinned, ready to end the battle in one counterattack.

chapters.title: Chapter 359 - 359: Immortal Skill Horn Call, Death of The Mayor and Butler Trio
chapters.content:
"HORN CALL!" The Mayor shouted, his horns glowing an ominous dark color after being insulted.
"..." but Follower wasn't fazed by that at all, instead taking his stance, as if he was ready to tank it all and kill.
"No one has ever survived the horn call, for even the moons fear it," Mayor mocked and laughed, boasting about his achievements, "This attack is unavoidable."
Stark was actually really interested to see what this was about: would Follower finally die?
I mean, that guy's pretty annoying, and Stark didn't like his aura at all, so it would be great if he could just disappear.
But it seemed as tough fate itself advantaged him.
Fwish!
Mayor, strands of dark aura visible on his skin, dashed toward Follower, closing the distance between them in a single second.
"YOU CANNOT WIN," Mayor shouted in rage, gripping his utensils and swinging, "The moment you're hit, it's already over!"
"Heh..." but Follower smirked, "Then I guess I just... won't get it."
Attack Negation!
Faster than he could anticipate, Follower punched the Mayor's stomach, canceling his swing.
-17,834!
But the damage he was doing was reduced by a lot, [Horn Call] enhancing the Mayor's aura as much as possible.
"Do you not understand? A single one of my attacks could kill you, and my defense is high enough so that you can't possibly even imagine killing me, give up!" Mayor laughed, dashing again.
"You're becoming boring," Follower whispered, "Goodbye."
Fwish!
Mayor swung, trails of dark aura leaving a dark trail behind.
"GOT YOU!" he successfully managed to hit the place where Follower was, "I cut you so easily that I didn't even notice the chance, humans are so weak."
Outside, all people could was a mist beginning to form, as well as Mayor's dark aura.
"Damn, so Follower's done for just like that?"
"Pretty weak if you ask me..."
"No chance!"
And all of those believed that the great Follower wouldn't die so easily would be completey right.
Because back in the trial...
"You're right, humans are insanely weak, but lucky for me," Mayor heard a voice behind him, sweat dripping from his brow, "I'm not human."
Fwish! Slash!
Sharpening his claws to the max, he used [Demon's Grasp] to pierce through Mayor's sturdy body.
"Fool! My body is too sturdy for you to actually pierce it from one end to the other," Mayor mocked, "Now you're gonna die."
But that was Mayor's biggest mistake: he didn't instantly retaliate.
Because Follower's plan wasn't to pierce him: it was to hold his heart.
[Demon Devouring: Pierce your enemy, and hold your claws in their hearts for five seconds, then you'll instantly kill them.]
1...
"Do you truly believe you can beat me," Mayor kept mocking, "All you humans are so idiotic!"
2...
"First, that stupid and ugly guy with his two girlfriends thinks he can put us all on lockdown simply because he has a powerful skill..."
3...
"...And then you believe you can stop us all?"
4...
"Even if you did kill me, you would still have to face the moons, and I promise you that you're not surviving!" Mayor continued in his speech.
He had tried to liberate himself from the claws several times, but for some reason, Follower held really tightly.
"Now you're about to die, and I'll finally be an apostle-"
5.
He couldn't even finish his sentence that an excruciating pain hit him: his heart exploded, like, literally.
DEMON DEVOURING!
Boom!
-99,999,999!
Instant death!
"H-Huh...?" Mayor couldn't understand how this was possible.
After all... Only the [Godless Demon] had such an ability to begin with, no human should ever have that!
"Oh..." in his final moments, Mayor finally understood, "We were stupid..."
His horns stopped glowing, and his body also stopped emanating this dark aura.
Instead, in a final gesture that displayed his entire personality, he bowed in front of Follower.
"It was a truly beautiful fight, but I have lost."
"Know your place, garbage."
Mayor chuckled before adding something else.
"But you will never win this trial," he eyed Stark, who was behind Follower, "Someone is gonna stop you, someone much stronger than you are."
"Nobody's stronger than me, bitch," Follower gave him the middle finger as Mayor fell, dead.
Ding!
[Mayor has been killed "Follower"!]
[5 Humans Alive: Stark, Lilith, Sora, Follower and Clever.]
[2 Monsters Alive: Butler Trio and Tormented One.]
It didn't take long for Follower to get rid of the [Butler Trio] afterward, the three butlers having lost their will to live after the mayor died.
They didn't even protest as Follower slashed them repeatedly.
[Mayor has died, thus "Loyal Regeneration" cannot be activated.]
Ding!
[Butler Trio has been killed "Follower"!]
[Follower is on a rampage!]
And so with that, only one monster remained: Tormented One.
"Deal with that yourself, old man," Follower groaned, sitting on the ground and closing his eyes, "That little shit actually hurt me a bit."
It didn't mean he was growing stronger after every blow that he didn't feel pain, after all, and so now all they could do was wait for Clever to get rid of [Tormented One].
Actually, once Stark decided to check out the status panel of that thing, something strange happened.
Instead of the usual window appearing, it was simply a few messages.
[So much agony.]
[Cannot kill via damage.]
[Find another way, it can't feel pain besides the one it was put on for hundreds of years.]
[It has nothing but its extreme defense and overwhelming strength.]
These four panels appeared in front of him, meaning that... he couldn't check the status window?
Well, it did give him basic info: that thing for some reason had no skills, maybe removed by the [Godless Demon] after putting him through the torture.
But in exchange, it seemed as though he was invincible, unable to receive damage from anything or anybody, and his two burly arms could potentially destroy a building by a single swing.
Basically, you don't want to get hit by that thing.
And Clever seems to do a great job holding it off, since it easily gets overwhelmed by the dozens of arms blocking its path or slamming it in place.
-0! -0! -0!
But as the panel says, doing all of that doesn't result in anything significant happening to it.
Clever, angry that his all powerful statue couldn't do anything in front of such a weak monster, one that couldn't even retaliate, was growing frustrated.
CELESTIAL SMITE!
Ten of the arms of the golden statue merged into one, slamming the [Tormented One] in place hundreds upon hundreds of times.
Thousand Hands Devotion!
Then he began to punch it with all its arms at once.
Embrace of Eternity!
And finally, he trapped it inside dozens of hands, closing them around it and squeezing as tight as possible in the hopes of crushing its organs.
But even after all of that.
"..." Tormented One's muffled screams could still be heard as he used his hands to block the strikes and liberate himself from the grip.
His strength was truly otherworldly.
And there was no chance they could kill it in a normal way, if even Clever struggled to do that.
Of course... that is if Stark decided not to act, as he in fact had a way, but he wouldn't bother taking the risk for them.
Plus, if the [Tormented One] didn't attack him when he threatened them with the [Heaven's Spear], then it means it still feared being killed by it.
Might as well wait for them to all die before trying anything.

chapters.title: Chapter 360 - 360: The Tormented One is Invincible, Ready to End it All
chapters.content:
"Did they give up?"
"Probably waiting for Clever to do the job..."
"I mean, it's clearly not working, so why bother."
People outside could only talk as they saw Stark, Lilith and Sora sit and do nothing.
While on the other hand, Clever was repeatedly trying to damage [Tormented One], with no result whatsoever.
At this point, the old man, who was supposed to be the strongest of this trial, and one of the best domination users, was growing angrier and angrier.
"Let me try something," Follower groaned, "The faster we do it, then the quicker we can get out of here."
Follower had surprisingly no grudge with Clever as the old man hadn't done anything to upset him, it was only against the only three he wanted revenge.
"Hold it in place," Follower ordered, and Clever did as told, restraining the Tormented One.
Demon's Grasp!
He transformed his hands into claws, then while making sure to not be noticed, he arrived behind the creature and plunged them deep inside its body.
"Got it, now all I need to do is..."
Suddenly, Follower's eyes widened.
Five seconds passed, but nothing happened.
"That thing..." he mumbled, "It doesn't have a heart, I can't kill it."
Before he could remove his arm from the monster's back, it broke free from the restraints and punched Follower so hard he almost shattered the barrier around the [Hollow Tower Square].
-64,834!
This would be equivalent to around 4,000,000 damage, by the way.
They truly weren't kidding when the panel said that it had no skill, but insane defense and attack.
"How are they supposed to defeat it?!"
"What the hell? They're all fucked!"
"Chosen has to do something now, right?"
Clever could hold it off for weeks if he wanted, as he didn't need to focus to give his statue orders, but he didn't feel like doing the work for all these people.
But regardless of that, hours passed.
All the participants were now sitting on the cold ground, while Clever [Golden Statue] kept Tormented One in place, sending him in the opposite direction whenever he approached too much.
He was extremely slow, so it took him around 10 minutes to traverse the square anyway.
Strangely enough, no one in the real world, even those that knew nothing was gonna happen, kept watching.
They returned to their daily tasks, like working or talking to one another, but still kept their phones and screens in case of any development.
Lilith was meditating, her eyes closed, gathering more strength to be able to fight.
Sora on the other hand was playing with her vines, twirling them.
"That's my daughter," Mike Gardenis laughed as he saw Sora act so cutely, something very weird as it didn't happen often, actually, it didn't happen at all.
Was she this comfortable with these people?
Follower was punching the barrier of the [Hollow Tower Square] repeatedly while mumbling unintelligible words, as if speaking to someone else.
His wounds were already healed thanks to his other passive he acquired: [Godless Regeneration].
Clever also just closed his eyes, resting.
Stark was the only one not doing anything, observing all the others.
He could sense Follower's gaze on him sometimes, but every time he looked, the man would go back to punching the barrier.
He looked above, and saw the three moons still looking at them, their pupils locked on him precisely.
"..."
But Stark didn't want to stay here for too long.
He didn't feel like staying in this place any more than he has to, especially now that only one commander remained, and that the moons were within his grasp.
If he killed them, all of this could end.
He also wanted to get rid of Clever and Follower, since they could cause problems.
But as he expected, the moons would never go down, and quite frankly it was impossible for them since they were too big.
[If you kill all three moons, then the true form of the apostle will reveal itself.]
He clearly remembered that panel appearing before him.
If the [Moon] Apostle was in his true form, then he probably wouldn't be able to escape anymore.
Basically, Stark needed to find a way to kill all three moons, as well as Clever and Follower, in one attack.
'Hey,' Stark thought, directly linking himself to the angel above, who still looked down on this trial with his otherworldly gaze, his hand raised.
[Yes, master?]
'Can you manage to destroy all three moons,' this was the simple task he gave it.
Stark believed it would be difficult.
The first time he threw his spear, at the beginning of the trial, all the moons did was get out of the way when their friend was targeted, thus only resulting in one moon being killed.
Plus, as Stark feared killing Sora, he had deliberately reduced the output of the spear, not by saying it loudly, but because the angel subconsciously understood what Stark wanted and followed through.
But now that he wanted to go full annihilation route, there was no need to hold back.
[Yes, I can do that, and even end it with the spear crashing in the middle of the square.]
The angel said in a neutral and holy voice.
'Amazing, then please do that in exactly three minutes.'
[Alright.]
In response to its master request, the angel, who stood idle for all these hours, suddenly moved, taking a more appropriate stance to unleash all of its power.
Though it made sure to not reveal that it was planning to throw the spear, as otherwise it might ruin Stark's plan.
The moment the angel moved, Follower immediately stopped punching the barrier and looked up, and Clever also woke up from his nap.
His golden statue instinctively placed around 50 giant golden hands around him to protect him.
They could sense that something was gonna happen soon if they don't move, as Stark's patience couldn't be infinite.
He was crazy enough to tell the two girls he would kill them at any moment if he felt like it, so no wonder.
But surprisingly, the three moons didn't even bother moving or staring at the angel even though they sensed its presence.
And the reason was simple:
"There's three of us, no chance he can eliminate us," Moone laughed
"His previous spear hit one of us, then disappeared, meaning that with only one spear, we can just escape and attack," Motwo added.
"Just stay on guard, if he throws it, make sure to escape, the one that's been targeted will undeniably regenerate since he can't use it again."
They were just this confident in their power.
Were the foolish? Or was it because they were given the [Apostle] title that they thought they were in invincible in this trial and because it was their domain?
In the end, they would soon realize that they were dumb for thinking like that.
"Use your protection amulet when I throw the spear," Stark ordered Lilith and Sora.
"You're gonna use it?!" Lilith was baffled, "But what about you?!"
"Got the [Revive Token], so it's fine," he didn't reveal he could also revive himself one more time with his talent, but better keep it a secret.
After doing that, Stark got up, grabbing the attention not only those in the trial, but in the real world too.
"HE GOT UP!"
"Shit, shit, what's gonna happen?"
"Chosen, are you gonna the thing?!"
Stark arrived in the middle of the [Hollow Tower Square], and even [Tormented One] stopped what he was doing as the boy approached.
He put his palms together, making sweat drip from everyone's brow, even those outside.
And then...
"Goodbye, everybody," he smiled, a vortex of aura spinning in his eyes, as if he was insane, "ANGEL, THROW THE SPEAR!"
The outside world exploded (not literally) as those words were uttered.

chapters.title: Chapter 361 - 361: Heaven's Spear True Strength, Destroying Termina
chapters.content:
"Goodbye," Stark smirked, raised his hand toward the sky, "Angel, throw it," he ordered.
The angelic figure, towering and divine, didn't hesitate. Its voice echoed like a symphony of bells.
[Very well.]
It hadn't even been 3 minutes, but the angel simply followed what Stark said.
The [Crimson Moons Trio] apostle floated above the battlefield.
Their otherworldly forms, twisted and malevolent, radiated confidence.
Their laughter rang out across the square as they mocked Stark's attempt.
"Does this fool think a single attack can harm us?" one sneered.
"Let him try," another hissed. "We're invincible here. Let him use his strength in vain."
But they would soon learn their confidence would be their downfall.
The angel, with deliberate precision, pulled back its arm, ready.
"GO!" Stark shouted.
FWISH!
Its sheer velocity cracked the air, shattering sound itself, and the world trembled under the might of the throw.
To hit all three [Crimson Moons Apostles], as well as the ground, the angel threw the spear with such force that it damaged itself from the impact, ripping apart the sky, changing its color completely.
However, the spear did not descend in a straight path. Attached by an invisible golden thread, the angel swung the spear like a divine whip.
This was the only way it could think of to actually manage to follow the orders of its master: Stark.
"WHAT?!" the apostles roared as the spear curved, moving sideways
Before they could react, the colossal weapon struck, and it was much bigger than them.
BOOM!
The first moon was obliterated, shards scattering like starlight.
BOOM!
The second moon shattered before it could retaliate, its energy dissipating into nothingness.
BOOM!
The third moon, caught mid-escape, met the same fate, its fragments swallowed by the storm of energy.
The explosions were deafening, their shockwaves rippling across Termina.
The three moons, believed to be invincible, were reduced to cosmic dust.
But that didn't mean the apostle was dead.
...
The outside world erupted in cheers and disbelief.
"OH MY GOD, HE DID IT!"
"HE FUCKING DID IT!"
On every screen broadcasting the trial, people jumped to their feet, screaming in celebration and shock.
"Does this mean we win?!"
"Is it over?!"
Inside the square, Lilith stared at the destruction with wide eyes.
"Wow," she whispered. "But... doesn't this mean there's nothing left for us to do?"
"No." Sora's voice was sharp as she snatched the Protection Amulet from her inventory.
[Protection Amulet: Summon a protection that can tank any attack no matter what.]
She activated it, summoning a golden sphere around herself and Lilith.
This was their only chance at survival, and so as the small sphere closed in on them, they prayed that they would be safe.
"Stark's gonna attack the square for sure, look at his eyes," Sora continued.
"???" Lilith did as told, and she was right, Stark's eyes well full of insanity, the crimson vortex still visible in them as he smiled, looking up.
Right as the spear killed all three moons, the divine entity moved again.
And so the angel above, as if confirming their fears, swung the spear one final time.
Its arc widened, and with unrelenting speed, it descended toward the square itself.
"HOLY FUCK!"
"DAMN?!"
"HE'S GOING TO DESTROY EVERYTHING!"
No one could believe that Stark was crazy enough to still want to kill himself even after having the chance to win that trial.
But of course, Stark knew the reason he needed to send that spear was because defeating the moons only meant the real form of the apostle would appear.
Basically, he couldn't afford to let the other two problematic participants live.
FWISH!
As Follower and Clever observed the spear come down, they saw their lives flash before their eyes.
Never could they have ever imagined their lives could end by the hands of a random kid in a deadly trial that owned an impossibly powerful skill.
A skill so powerful even the strongest of classifiers and monsters could get instantly killed by it, and even the [Godless Demon] would probably get hurt too, or so Follower believed.
A skill so powerful... it was going to kill them in one blow, then completely erase them from existence.
"..."
"..."
But no.
This couldn't end like this, not in such a humiliating way.
"I'M THE FUCKING STRONGEST DOMINATION USER," Clever, the old guy, shouted at the top of his lungs, still carrying his cane in his hand and pointing at the descending spear, "YOU... WON'T... KILL... ME!"
He had never truly had the will to live, fighting monsters simply because it was fun, and you could see it even in this trial: he liked being a spectator more than a fighter, enjoying the drama between the others.
But for the first time, Clever felt like he wanted to get through this and live, then teach that kid a lesson he could never forget.
He would display his head in a public space, and describe him as the public enemy number of humanity.
And so...
"ZERO HAND!"
He used his [Immortal] skill, the strongest skill he had.
He had only ever used it once before, and the outside world had NEVER seen him use it either, even though he was pretty famous in his country.
As he activated his skill, the massive statue behind him suddenly turned from a golden color to a shimmering white, like some sort of diamond.
Then, all 100 arms and hands merged together into the [Zero Hand]: a giant hand, the size of the entire [Hollow Tower Square], made out of pure diamond.
[It is said that this hand is indestructible, granting its wielder both enormous attack and defense.]
"HELP ME, ZERO HAND!" Just like Stark, Clever also requested the aid of the golden statue, now the diamond statue, who lowered the diamond hand in front of Clever.
He climbed inside, then it closed on him, leaving absolutely no room or hole to see him through: it was the perfect defense, the thing he thought could allow him to survive this.
After all, the only way to avoid such an attack is by using an Immortal skill.
"Idiots," Clever laughed, and even though it was dark, he still felt secure inside the [Zero Hand].
Now, the only person who was left was Follower, and he simply watched the spear descend, not doing anything.
In contrast to Clever, he had given up his powers in exchange for the perks he had used until now, meaning that he couldn't avoid or dodge: it was over for him.
"Sorry, Lord Godless," he kneeled, truly sad that it was going to end like this, "I was too weak."
Just like that, he gave up, understanding why the panel had informed him that Chosen was the most dangerous person, forcing even Clever to hide and cower in fear.
And now, the spear was only a few meters above the ground, time slowing down as it was about to hit the point of impact.
Lilith and Sora were inside the [Protection Amulet], Clever was in his [Zero Hand] protection and Follower simply gave up.
What about Stark, you might ask?
Well, he was also just staring at the spear, which hovered right above him, and people couldn't believe that this kid was actually ready to die even though he had already killed the apostle.
"FUCK. CHOSEN."
"FUCK. CHOSEN."
Outside the trial, protests began, with the chant "Fuck Chosen" being shouted everywhere.
"At least that filthy bastard's going to die."
"Yeah, but he's taking everyone with him."
"I think Lilith, Sora and Clever are going to survive because of their protections, though, but Follower's done for."
They truly hoped that at least one of the participants survived, because if everyone dies, they had been already informed twice that something terrible and world changing was going to happen.
"See you in hell, assholes," Stark whispered as he smiled, truly making everyone outside, even his family and those of Lana and Sora, hate him.
And then it happened.
BOOM!
The world faded to black as the spear hit the ground, destroying literally everything around it.
And it wasn't just the square: the barrier around the square was shattered, and the explosion took part in the entirety of Termina.
Everything was destroyed, and through the many cameras in the sky, all humanity could do was watch in disbelief: this was the skill that kid had?!
The Orphanage? Gone!
The Manor? Gone!
All the districts and streets? Poof!
Even from their safe locations, those watching had chills go down their spine, the strongest of classifiers sensing the absurdity of the situation.
"DID THEY ALL DIE?!"
"MY GOD, I DIDN'T EXPECT THAT?!"
"FUCK. CHOSEN."
Well, it was safe to say that this trial couldn't go on anymore, since the main stage was destroyed.
And even the [Hollow Tower], which was where the last surviving participant that had killed all the commanders and completed 5 tasks needed to go, crumbled under the sheer force, reduced to nothing.
The world both inside and outside the trial fell silent as the dust settled.
They were all waiting to see who had survived and who didn't.
Because no matter who it was, then they would be the winner of this trial, or at least that is what they believed.

chapters.title: Chapter 362 - 362: After the Destruction, Still Standing
chapters.content:
After the impact from [Heaven's Spear], the entirety of Termina, which means the trial, was destroyed, including the [Hollow Tower].
Even he didn't expect it to be this powerful, but it also means that if he had decided to use it since the beginning, this entire trial would have been over in seconds.
If he did that though, Sora and Lilith would have died, even though he wouldn't have known of the latter anyway.
The [Hollow Tower Square], being the main point of impact, received the highest percentage of destruction, a massive crater appearing in the middle where the participants previously were.
Stark, on the other hand, completely disintegrated because he had simply just tanked the projectile without even defending himself.
Well, even someone that was kilometers away from the square would have still died, but Stark still took the entirety of the impact.
All he could see now was black.
"Here again, huh."
[Do you want to use the "Revive Token"?]
Because he had taken it from Lilith, he could successfully revive himself without using his talent.
Which meant that he still had a revive afterward!
"How long do I have to use it?"
[30 minutes.]
"Then I might as well just rest a bit," Stark sighed, closing his eyes to think about his next plan.
The [Moon] Apostle was probably now out there, in his true form, meaning that he would need to find him, after all.
...
Back in the trial.
As the dust settled, the cameras focused on the bottom of the crater.
The first thing people noticed was that the [Protection Amulet] had actually survived this impact, meaning that, as its description said, it tanked an attack even as powerful as this one.
[Protection Amulet has been broken.]
"SHE'S ALIVE," Mike and Elise Gardenis, Sora's parents, cried tears of joy as they saw their daughter survive this hell.
"Sis!" and even her brother and sister were happy.
"Sora!" tears also welled up in Lana's eyes, because even though she saw her as a love rival, her interactions and the fact they lived together for a bit did make them closer than before.
Though, in contrast to what many believed, as the golden sphere that protected the two girls disappeared, everyone noticed that they were, in fact, unconscious.
Even through this barrier, the shock from the explosion shook them and resulted in them passing out.
And other than these two, there was one more person alive, whose body didn't disintegrate.
"Clever?"
"Probably, he did use [Zero Hand] after all."
But they were wrong.
Because Clever was nowhere to be seen: the one that survived was Follower, and some weird black substance was over his body, seemingly protecting him.
...
Before the impact.
Follower had completely given up, kneeling to the ground and begging the Godless Demon for forgiveness as he failed his mission of killed Stark.
But right as the spear was about to the ground, killing them all, a panel appeared in front of him, and time slowed down.
[Your devotion to the Godless Demon is admirable, even at the face of death, not many are as devoted as you are.]
"Huh?"
[As a gift, the Godless Demon has decided to aid you.]
In less than a fraction of a second, a black figure materialized in front of Follower, you couldn't see its skin since it was made of a weird substance, but it had crimson eyes and horns.
[The Godless Demon will defend you from this attack.]
"What-?" Follower didn't have time to speak as the spear finally hit the ground, exploding everything around it.
[The ultimate protection of the "Godless Demon" has been granted to you.]
[You have been promoted to "Godless Demon Apostle"]
Follower had actually been promoted mid-crisis, meaning that the Godless Demon was watching the trial from somewhere.
The weird black demon that appeared in front of Follower instantly dashed toward the man, entering his body.
Then a weird black substance materialized all around Follower for some reason.
That is how he was alive.
As for Clever, well, he did use [Zero Hand], but let's not kid ourselves, did he really believe he could escape a goddamned level 100 spell capable of eliminating level 900 classifiers and monsters?
I mean, that would just be silly.
As you might predict it, the moment the spear exploded upon contact with the ground, the diamond hand gripping Clever inside and protecting him instantly evaporated.
"WHAT-" and so the confident old man was also killed before he could even say anything else.
Give him a break, though, there was no chance he could have survived this.
...
Present.
"Follower's alive..."
"What the fuck?!"
The black substance on his body slowly seeped back inside of him as the dust disappeared, revealing that he was also unconscious.
"So three people alive, but all unconscious?"
[Clever has been killed by "Chosen"!]
And then nothing else.
60 seconds passed, then 5 minutes, then 10, then 20.
And yet, nothing was happening.
No one could afford to get their eyes off the screens for even a second, not wanting to miss any important details.
But it seemed like the trial was truly in stalemate.
Or at least, that was until people started noticing something strange.
It all started with some asking a simple question: why was there no message that Chosen had died.
And in mere minutes, the entire world was now asking themselves that very same question.
If Chosen had truly died, then there should have been no problem putting a message that he indeed was gone.
Plus, out of the 15 squares that displayed the participants, the ones that weren't crossed out were: Sora, Lilith, Follower and... Chosen.
There was something strange going on.
...
Back in that dark space of his, a message appeared in front of Stark as he rested.
[Warning, only 5 minutes left to pick option.]
[Failure in picking will result in permanent death.]
"Yeah, yeah," Stark knew that it was time to get back to the trial.
If everything went well, then Lilith and Sora should be the only ones still alive, meaning all Stark needed to do was team up with them and eliminate the apostle.
Ding!
[You have used your "Revive Token"!]
[Brace yourself!]
His consciousness faded as he was being brought back to life.
And so, as the tensions in the real world about what happened to Chosen reached their peak, a sudden flash of light was seen in the middle of the crater.
"Huh?"
"What's happening?"
"The fuck?!"
Stark's body was completely disintegrated from the impact, but the [Revive Token] still needed to revive him.
Meaning that instead of bringing back every single one of his cells, which is what his talent would do, instead, he just... respawned, in a flash of blue light.
Ding!
His body flickered a bit before appearing again.
"Damn, like in a video game," Stark smiled, surprised, moving his arms and body to make sure everything was functional.
The atmosphere around the trial was now extremely calm.
"Lilith, Sora?" he turned his gaze, and noticed that they were out cold, "Oh."
And once he looked around... he noticed Follower too.
"What the fuck?" Stark was more surprised than anybody else: if even Clever with his total protection was killed, then what the hell was this still doing.
Oh, and talking about Clever.
Ding!
[You have slain "Clever", gaining 120,000,000 experience points!]
This was absolutely massive.
Killing that old man gave even more experience than Father Hugo (50 million) and the Tormented One (60 million) combined!
It seems like killing other participants was truly the way to success, no wonder Follower did it!

chapters.title: Chapter 363 - 363: Aftermath of Heaven's Spear, The Moon Apostle's True Form
chapters.content:
[You have slain "Clever", gaining 120,000,000 experience points!]
Ding! Ding! Ding!
[Your level has increased to level 124, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Your level has increased to level 125, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
.
.
[Your level has increased to level 129, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
A six level increase was pretty good, but the amount of experience added between each level was now 1 million.
[Experience: 545,000/24,000,000] (level 129)
Only one more level, and he would be able to get a new skill!
But for now, he had to face what was coming.
"..."
Lilith, Sora and Follower were out cold from the attack.
Though he didn't know how Follower could ever survive this, he would just kill him now.
Spear of Judgment!
Stark wasn't dumb, and so he just summoned his long range weapon, throwing it at Follower to kill him while he could.
Fwish... BAM!
But right as it was about to hit, a dark figure emerged from Follower's body and tanked the attack, placing its hand forward to destroy the spear.
"..." it looked directly into Stark's eyes.
"..." and Stark looked back at it, "Alright."
That thing must have protected Follower from dying.
Was it his talent? Or something else?
But in the end, he was stuck in that giant crater.
Every other participant was dead, Lilith and Sora unconscious, and Follower was being protected by whatever that thing is.
Which means that he was stuck in here alone.
"What's my next move…" he muttered.
Then, suddenly, the air shifted and the sky above began to darken.
"...?"
Stark looked up, his eyes narrowing.
The moon seemed to glow brighter, casting an eerie light over the destroyed trial.
Clouds swirled violently, creating a vortex above the crater.
And from the center of it, something emerged.
A figure descended slowly, shrouded in silver light.
"..."
As the figure came closer, the light dissipated, revealing its form.
The Lord of the Moon had arrived.
"You..." Stark's eyes widened.
Its appearance was terrifying.
A humanoid figure with pale, luminescent skin.
Its body was thin but unnaturally tall, towering at over three meters.
Long, flowing hair, silver like starlight, trailed behind it.
Its eyes glowed with a cold, lunar brilliance, locking onto Stark instantly.
A long robe covered its body, decorated with intricate patterns of moons and stars.
Behind it, eight crescent-shaped blades floated in perfect symmetry, spinning slowly.
The atmosphere grew heavier with every passing second.
[Aphex, Lord of the Moon, Level 600, Immortal-Level]
"…"
This was the true form of the [Crimson Moons Trio].
"You're lucky, human, you get to see my true form before dying," he laughed like a maniac, "The moon is calling for your soul."
"Shut the fuck up," Stark glared at him.
He could sense that this thing was stronger than he was, he could sense its stats and skills were way better than his.
And yet... he didn't feel like backing down.
Because everything they went through in this trial was because of him.
So if he wanted to finally get out of here, and also complete the second line of the [ApostleDex], he needed to get rid of it.
The first thing he did as he saw Aphex slowly descend toward him was point his fingers at him.
"Flow..." he decided to instantly use his perk
[Flow: Your focus is unwavering, and by focusing on an enemy for 10 seconds, grasping their movements and flow of aura, you are able to see their attacks coming at least a second before they come.]
If its speed was overwhelming, then all he needed was to give himself a chance to counter.
[Flow initiated.]
[1...]
"Do you really believe anything you do matters, human?" Aphex glared at Stark after stopping his laughter.
[2...]
"In the end, Lord Godless will soon descend, and humanity will be doomed!"
[3...]
"With your current strength, I can assure you that you can't beat me."
[4...]
"And neither can you beat any of the apostles ranked above me."
[5...]
"In less than a year, I can assure you that the world will be ours."
[6...]
"Don't worry, I respect your powers, after all you still managed to defeat nine of the fifteen apostles, that isn't no easy feat."
[7...]
"But unfortunately, all Lord Godless needs to do is replace them, and with a bit of help from corrupt humans, Rheria will be finally be destroyed."
[8...]
"So now, Chosen," Aphex said his name, "What will you do?"
[9...]
Glaring at him, Stark couldn't help but smirk, after all, his flow was about to end, and thanks to it, he would gain a massive advantage.
"I think..." Stark started, "I think you're an absolute fucking idiot."
"So be it," Aphex pointed one of his crescent blades at Stark, "You're about to die."
[10...]
[Flow has been activated!]
Stark's vision became clearer when he saw Aphex, and whatever the apostle did, he could see an afterimage of what he did before it even happened.
"But unfortunately for you," Aphex laughed, floating above ground, "I'm not going to be your opponent."
"Huh?" Stark was confused.
There was nothing else in this crater.
Maybe [Follower] was going to wake up?!
But as he turned around, Stark didn't see any signs of him moving, the black creature still defending him.
It seemed to glare at Aphex too.
"You need to be more open-minded, Chosen," Aphex laughed again, his laughter echoing throughout the entire trial.
"Then come down if you're not scared!"
"I don't need to, as I said, your opponent isn't me right now, oh, it seems like they are here."
"What the fuck are you talking about-"
But as Stark shouted these words... a hand emerged from the ground and grabbed him from below.
"Huh?"
As Stark felt the hand gripping his ankle, a chill ran down his spine.
He looked down and saw the source of this unexpected assault—a grotesque, disfigured hand, darkened and warped, clawing its way out of the broken ground.
"This is...!?" Stark tried to punch the hand, but it didn't let go of him no matter what.
Crimson Ball Transmission!
But as he was beginning to be pulled down by the hand, which was impossible to liberate himself from, he simply threw a crimson ball.
Snap!
Then snapped his fingers to teleport away.
He had thought that everything had died, since a spear of this power should be enough to instantly make anybody evaporate.
But he hadn't taken into account one thing...
Because as the figure emerged, revealing its disgusting red body, he finally saw who it was, confirming his suspicions.
It was the [Tormented One].
"He cannot be harmed by physical attacks," Aphex kept laughing, "So that spear of yours was useless!"
As the burly creature got up, Stark needed to make sure, and just as expected, that thing in front of him was wearing a cloak made out of its skin, and it had no mouth.
It was truly the [Tormented One].
Which is why he also didn't get a notification about his death.
"So what are you gonna do now, Chosen?" The moon apostle grinned, "You're their last hope, but you cannot deal damage to that creature, what is your play?!"
"..."
Stark's face darkened.
Was this the end?

chapters.title: Chapter 364 - 364: A Way to Kill the Tormented One? To the Void you go!
chapters.content:
"..." the [Tormented One] looked at Stark with neutral eyes, seemingly neither angry about the fact he tried to kill it, or sad about the death of its companions.
"Now," Aphex, floating above the crater, shouted, "Get rid of that human and you'll be promoted!"
"..." Tormented One took a few steps forward, visibly trying to catch Stark.
[Cannot kill via damage.]
[Find another way, it can't feel pain besides the one it was put on for hundreds of years.]
[It has nothing but its extreme defense and overwhelming strength.]
Stark clearly remembered these panels.
And as expected, once he checked the status window, the only important stuff to check were the stats and skills.
[Strength: 68,349]
[Defense: 99,999]
[Skills: Grab, Punch...]
Two skills, slow speed, but with high strength and defense.
In fact, strength and defense even if Stark used [Double Assault], he would still be leagues under it.
"..."
It advanced forward, with very slow steps.
"Aura Smash!"
Boom! Boom! Boom!
-0! -0! -0!
"Crimson Spears!"
-0! -0! -0!
"Spatial Inventory!"
He put his hands inside, pulling out the [Crystal Stun Potions], then threw them at the [Tormented One].
But nothing either.
"Domi-Chains Restrains!"
Three chains emerged from the ground and enrolled around the Tormented One, but regardless he kept advancing as if they weren't there, eventually breaking.
"Wielding Cross!"
Smash! Smash! Fwish! Smash!
-0! -0! -0! -0!
"Domination Soul!"
Smash! Smash! Smash!
-0! -0! -0!
In fact, Tormented One grabbed the heart in midair, squeezing it tightly.
"FUCK!" Stark suddenly realized that he made a mistake.
As said before, if your [Soul Heart] gets destroyed, you die too.
He truly didn't feel like wasting his revive for this.
So instead he dashed forward, arriving in front of Tormented One.
Luckily, the monster was extremely dumb, letting go of the heart to instead try and punch Stark, who simply avoided it.
"This is gonna take hours," Aphex yawned, positioning himself in a comfortable position and opening up a book summoned from who knows where, "I'll just wait for you to get tired."
At this point, Clever had tried to kill Tormented One hundred of times using his golden statue, with no results whatsoever.
No attacks could hurt it, no matter what.
But... was this even a problem for Stark?
Didn't he have a very specific skill that allowed him to kill enemies without hurting them?
Didn't he already use that skill before against the apostle inside of the [Colosseum].
That skill...
"Idiot," Stark smirked, ready to unleash it.
...
Meanwhile in the outside world, people were just too overwhelmed by the turn of events.
Chosen gets a skill that can kill almost every classifiers, forces them to kill each other, but in the end still uses it regardless
Clever who was supposed to be the strongest died, while Follower somehow managed to survive as well.
And Chosen? He simply respawned using an item.
"He predicted everything," Mike Gardenis laughed by himself, "That kid knew from the beginning that these items could be used to protect the girls, and also revive him!"
"He's still insane though, Elise Gardenis shrugged.
"I didn't say he wasn't, but every powerful classifier is a little crazy."
...
