The overall opinion of Chosen did climb a bit after people realized that he wasn't just some kid who was willing to kill everyone because he was getting ganged up on.
Though that didn't mean people weren't cautious.
"But doesn't that mean we win?"
"Y-Yeah, every monster is dead, humanity wins!"
I'll let you imagine the reaction of the world when they saw the vortex in the sky, and Aphex's figure appearing, revealing that he was the true form of the three moons.
But a single human against an apostle as overwhelming as this one wasn't really fair to begin with.
"He's still going to die."
"Dude, just look at it..."
"Bye, Chosen."
And to add more to the disaster this trial was, Aphex wasn't the only surviving monster.
"OH COME ON!"
"Tormented One survived too?!"
They had the proof of the power of the spear, clearly shown by the fact the entirety of Termina was destroyed, yet everyone but Clever had survived?
Seriously?!
This also meant that Stark also would need to face two monsters instead of one.
One was an apostle able to destroy whole cities by himself, and the other was an invincible creature that even Clever wasn't able to injure.
This seemed unwinnable for humanity.
Now all they needed to do was brace themselves for the terrible thing that was going to happen when all the participants die.
"No," Lana shook her head, still looking at the TV with confident eyes, her phone opened up to the internet, where millions of people prayed for the death of Chosen, "Stark's going to win."
Through this entire trial, she had never even cried once, her faith in him not faltering one bit no matter what.
And so the camera positioned itself in a way that you could see the Tormented One advancing forward, Aphex in the sky, and the other three unconscious with Stark standing between the two monsters.
She knew that her (boy)friend was going to win this.
[I think Chosen's going to pull another trick!]
[What trick are you expecting from him at this point, the fucking red monster is invincible!]
[If Clever couldn't kill him, no one can't.]
[Clever got killed by the giant spear and no one else did, though, so you can't really doubt anybody in this trial.]
Forums were going wild, more chats appearing every second, people arguing.
Now all they wanted was to see for themselves what could the boy with the "Chosen" name do.
And Stark's family was no different.
"..."
"..."
"..."
None of them said anything, observing the screen of the TV, except for the little sister, who kept chatting with her friends.
They were pestering her for questions about her brother, but all she would do is say "I don't know".
The entire world one thing at that moment: who was Chosen, and was he strong enough to save them all?
...
"Hey, Aphex," Stark spoke, catching the attention of the apostle and the world as a whole, everyone going silent.
"Hm?" Aphex stopped reading the book in his hands and turned to look at Stark.
"Do you truly believe that I don't have a way to kill that thing?" he pointed Tormented One, his smile growing wider.
"I do believe there is almost no way to kill him, yes."
"But then, how would you do it?"
If Tormented One was truly invincible and couldn't receive damage, then it meant the apostle couldn't kill him either.
"That's the funny part, I can't," Aphex laughed, "He was tortured by Lord Godless, so only attacks from him could damage that thing."
"Damn."
"Now just exhaust yourself, Tormented One can't get tired either."
But at this point, Stark had already heard everything he needed to know.
Avoiding Tormented One whenever he got close, he kept thinking about his options.
Using "that" skill had major risks, and the chance of it turning back on him was also high.
But if there truly was no way, then the risk was the only thing left to take.
"Alright," Stark decided, "Then time to end it once and for all."
Fwish! Fwish! Fwish!
Stark's crimson aura flared around him as he positioned himself, closing his eyes and sensing Tormented One's steps in front of him.
He put quite some distance between the two of them to allow himself to do that.
Breath in...
"Phew..."
Breath out...
"GOT YOU!"
And so he decided to activate the skill that could be his saving grace.
A skill no one could expect someone else to have as it was just too insane to think about, even Aphex probably wouldn't believe it.
And so...
"BANISH!"
[Description: When the user's feels that their aura surpasses that of an enemy, they can unleash Banish, as a result, both his and the opponent's auras clash in a violent surge of energy, a battlefield of ethereal power.
If the user's aura prevails, the enemy is instantly cast into the Void—death is certain and instant, no matter their level or remaining health.
Should the enemy's aura prove stronger, though, the user is sent to the void instead.]
That's right, this was his only chance.
Such a skill didn't care about level, power and defense: if you lose the aura fight, you get sent to the void and instantly die.
And so what had to happen happened.
Ding!
[The Banish Game has started!]
[Chosen VS Tormented One]
[Loser gets sent to the void, which is instant death.]
[Good luck!]
The words about in front of Stark and Tormented One, but in front of Aphex and the screens of those in the real world too.
"WHAT THE FUCK?!"
"HOLY SHIT!"
"CHOSEN HAD A TRICK UP HIS SLEEVE!"
Even the moon apostle was confused.
"That is... surprising," he mumbled, closing his book, actually interested to see what could happen with that [Banish Game].
Tormented One was confused, but instinctively felt something strange for the first time: fear.
The only entity he feared was the [Godless Demon], but now, he could sense that this Banish Game could lead to his actual death.
"LET'S FUCKING GO, ASSHOLE," Stark shouted, his aura exploding forward, trying to overwhelm the Tormented One's aura.

chapters.title: Chapter 365 - 365: Second Banish Game, Eliminating an Invincible Enemy
chapters.content:
The Tormented One tilted its head as if mocking him. Its hand twitched, sending ripples through the air.
Stark knew this was a foe beyond brute strength. He had to rely on something else.
He steadied his breath, focusing all his remaining energy into his aura.
'It's time,' he thought grimly.
It was time to take the risk.
Suddenly, the air shifted violently.
The ground beneath Stark trembled as his aura expanded, swirling outward like a storm.
[The Banish Game shall start!]
A voice boomed in his mind, loud and foreboding.
[Whoever's aura gets consumed by the other will be cast into the void!]
[Good luck!]
The Tormented One froze in place.
Its eyeless sockets seemed to narrow, and its hulking frame stiffened.
It tried to move, but the rules of the Banish Game bound it. Neither could act outside the clash of their auras now.
Stark gritted his teeth, his crimson aura flaring brighter.
He had activated his last resort—a gamble with no second chances.
With a deafening roar, the Tormented One's aura erupted, dark and overwhelming.
It was a sickly red, dripping like blood, twisting into grotesque shapes as it surged toward Stark's own energy.
Once the Banish Game starts, both fighters immediately and instinctively have the knowledge of how to wield their auras.
It was to make it as fair as possible.
The two auras collided with a thunderous BOOM
,
sending shockwaves through the crater.
Stark stumbled, barely holding his ground as the sheer force of the clash pressed down on him.
"The... fuck?!" he didn't expect a useless, ugly monster with nothing going for it except its strength to have such an overwhelming aura.
Plus, it had actually never used it until now!
The battlefield between them became a swirling vortex of light and shadow, a warzone where only their wills mattered.
[You can form shapes related to your skills with your aura in the Banish Game!]
The notification snapped Stark into focus. He had to act fast.
"Alright," he muttered, sweat dripping down his brow. "Let's see what you've got."
The Tormented One wasted no time.
Its aura twisted and churned, forming a massive, hulking figure.
The shape mirrored its monstrous frame but larger, bulkier, and infinitely more menacing.
The figure raised a fist the size of a boulder and slammed it toward Stark's crimson aura.
CRASH!
The impact sent Stark flying backward within the aura battlefield.
He winced as his energy wavered, shrinking under the relentless assault.
In the [Banish Game], you don't push punch or attack your opponent but their aura, and if it's hit, the other receives the damage themselves.
Such a weird concept, probably something anyone outside had never seen before.
"...?" even Aphex seemed surprised at the sight.
"Damn it," Stark growled, forcing his aura to stabilize. "I'm not losing here."
He focused harder, his crimson energy reshaping itself.
It surged upward, forming a giant fist of its own.
With a sharp command in his mind, the aura-fist lunged forward, colliding with the Tormented One's creation.
BAM!
The clash shook the air, but Stark was still losing ground.
The Tormented One's strength was overwhelming, its burly aura-figure advancing relentlessly.
It slammed its fists again and again, breaking through Stark's defenses inch by inch.
He kept creating [Crimson Aura Shields] to defend himself, but it didn't work too much.
Stark clenched his fists tighter, "You want a fight? Fine. Let's make this interesting."
Even the aura fight against Olikar, the apostle of the Colosseum, hadn't been this difficult, so he needed to be better.
His crimson aura twisted and shifted, forming multiple smaller figures, each a copy of himself.
The doppelgängers darted forward, surrounding the Tormented One's massive aura-being.
They launched a flurry of strikes, their combined efforts forcing it to slow down.
For a moment, it seemed like Stark was regaining control.
But the Tormented One wasn't done.
Its aura roared, the grotesque energy shifting into new shapes.
Massive burly fists emerged from its sides, slamming into Stark's clones with terrifying force.
CRASH! CRACK!
One by one, his aura constructs shattered, their energy dispersing into nothingness.
[Warning! You are getting overwhelmed! A bit more and it's game over!]
Stark's crimson aura flickered dangerously, struggling to hold its form.
"No," Stark hissed, his breathing ragged. "Not yet."
The spectators that were watching this were flabbergasted: what the hell was this?
Auras were powerful, sure, but since when could they form such shapes and fight one another?!
"This is absolutely insane..."
"This has to be some of the best fights in years, not gonna lie."
"GO CHOSEN! KICK HIS ASS!"
Stark poured more of his focus into his energy, drawing upon every ounce of his willpower.
"FUCK YOU!" he shouted at the top of his lungs, his form getting taken over by the crimson color.
His aura began to glow brighter, more intense.
It surged upward, reshaping into a colossal figure—a demon-like entity with horns and blazing eyes, an embodiment of his [EGO].
The demon let out a guttural roar and charged forward, slamming into the Tormented One's hulking figure.
The impact was deafening, sending shockwaves through the battlefield.
"...?"
The Tormented One's aura reeled, its monstrous form staggering backward under the force of Stark's attack.
But it wasn't defeated yet. Its energy pulsed violently, reshaping into a massive wall of spikes that shot toward Stark's aura-demon.
The spikes struck true, piercing through the demon's form.
Stark cried out in pain, feeling the backlash as his aura weakened further.
[One more attack and you're done.]
The crimson energy wavered, flickering like a dying flame.
"Damn it," Stark muttered, falling to one knee. His body trembled, his strength waning. "I can't… lose here…"
The Tormented One's aura surged forward again, victory seemed inevitable for the skinless creature.
"..."
But Stark didn't give up.
He closed his eyes, focusing deeply.
But instead of what many could believe, he didn't think about his fights or hardships.
He didn't even think about Sora, Lilith and Lana.
Instead, his mind was clouded by pure hatred.
"Not today," Stark growled, forcing himself to stand.
"...?!" and yet again, for the second time, the Tormented One backed way, even it somehow feeling fear when looking at the human boy.
His crimson aura flared violently, burning brighter than ever before.
And then... it turned blue, changing colors.
The only time this had happened was during his fight with [Judicator], and though Stark couldn't understand what this meant, he could still feel the power.
His aura reshaped itself once more, this time into a massive spear—a towering weapon crackling with raw, destructive energy.
It was an embodiment of his [Heaven's Spear], and it radiated power like nothing else.
The spear shot forward, piercing through the Tormented One's monstrous aura-figure.
The creature's energy recoiled, its form destabilizing as Stark's spear drove deeper.
Of course, the Tormented One tried to push it away, but with his new power, it was too late.
Stark's blue aura surged forward, engulfing the entire form of the Tormented One.
Tormented One dropped to its knees now, the balance had changed.
And so with a final attack, he simply created the demon once more, who held Tormented One's aura in its hands, and crushed it.
The last remnants of its grotesque aura dissolved into nothingness.
In front of it appeared a panel.
[You have lost the Banish Game!]
[Winner: Stark Heartsouls]
[You are going to be sent to the void.]
"???!"
The Tormented One for the first time in years wanted to get out and run, or maybe try to be saved by someone.
But there was nothing that could stop it, for the call of the void is impossible to avoid.
"COME ON, BITCH, WHERE'S ALL THE CONFIDENCE?!" Stark laughed as he pointed at the Tormented One, "GET RID OF HIM!"
The aura-demon, still there, rushed forward, and as Tormented One's aura was gone, there was nothing that could stop it from directly interacting with him.
If it had a mouth, it would probably say something like, "NO, PLEASE!" begging for its life just like Olikar.
But Stark was merciless.
Snap!
He snapped his fingers and a dark portal appeared under the Tormented One.
And so, mimicking Stark's movements, the demon stumbled back before throwing the skinless creature into the portal with all its strength.
Fwish!
"Nice shot, demon," Stark kept laughing as he saw the monster try its best to hold on into the edge of the portal, "You can go now."
The demon disappeared as the Banish Game was finally over, and Stark marched toward the portal.
The human boy spoke, still smiling, "Look under you."
Tormented One did as told, and all it saw was, well, nothing.
It was pitch black.
"This is where you're going to go," Stark laughed like a maniac, kicking Tormented One's hand off the edge.
And even though the monster was sturdy, without its aura defending it, it was as defenseless as a sheep in front of a wolf.
"..."
It tried as hard as it could, but... it was useless in front of the demon that Stark was.
And so it fell, the portal closing behind it, erased from this world and cast into the void.
Ding!
[You have killed "Tormented One", gained 70,000,000 experience points!]
"You're last," Stark groaned, pointing at Aphex.

chapters.title: Chapter 366 - 366: Only One Monster Left: Aphex, The Moon Apostle
chapters.content:
Once Stark was done with [Tormented One], he directly looked at Aphex from below, eyeing the apostle, who looked back at him with interested eyes.
"Huh, so he's really... gone?" Aphex wondered, confused.
"..." Stark didn't answer.
"I'm going to guess that he is," Aphex smirked, "But that's fine, that won't work on me, though you're free to try."
"Don't want to."
Stark's aura was extremely powerful, but he wasn't stupid enough to go for another [Banish Game], especially since he could feel that Aphex would be stronger.
Ding!
[You have killed "Tormented One", gained 70,000,000 experience points!]
Ding! Ding!
[Your level has increased to level 130, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Your level has increased to level 131, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Experience: 21,545,000/26,000,000] (level 131)
And of course, the fact he went past level 130 could only mean one thing.
Ding!
[Level 130 Reached: Pick Two Cards]
"Huh?"
The text now said two instead of one!
Was his class trying to help him out while he was a tough situation?
Who knows, but new skills were always helpful, so he wasn't about to give up on a bonus one.
Ding!
And so around Stark appeared dozens of cards.
"What the-"
Yet again, this was something that had never happened before, instead the max had been 5, though he couldn't be really surprised as events like these weren't that uncommon.
He couldn't summon his [Ultimate Clone] or [Superior Clone] either, since none of his clones were available because of the cooldown.
"..." Stark looked up to make sure the moon apostle didn't attack, and just as expected, he kept staring at the human with a wide smile.
Until Aphex decided to go down himself, Stark couldn't really reach him anyway, so instead he focused on the skills.
"Alright," Stark looked back at the cards, who now began to spin around him, "Damn."
Closing his eyes, he picked two cards at random.
And once he opened them...
Ding! Ding!
In his hands were the two cards, with their usual style.
One had the drawings of a falling meteor, while the second was... an axe cutting off the right arm of a stickman figure.
"Huh."
Still making sure to keep an eye on Aphex and the weird black demon protecting Follower, he decided to read the descriptions of his newly acquired skills.
[Skill: Meteor Crash (Mythical)]
[Description: Summon a blazing meteor from the heavens to crash at a designated location, dealing catastrophic damage to all enemies within a 30-meter radius. The impact creates an intense shockwave that stuns nearby enemies for 3 seconds and leaves a fiery zone behind it, has a 5 minutes cooldown.]
"Nice," that was actually pretty damn good, and very useful with enemies as it added another skill that he could use from long range.
Plus, this one seemed very powerful even from far, the description itself saying it was devastating damage.
"Basically," Stark mumbled as he eyed Aphex, "It's perfect for my situation..." he smiled.
It was as if his class itself had realized what his problem was and answere accordingly.
But then, what could the other skill potentially be?
[Skill: Limb Sacrifice (Godly)]
"Huh?" Stark's pupils shook a little, and a sweat dropped from his brow as he saw the name and rank.
Why are the words limb sacrifice put next to one another, and why was that considered a godly level skill?!
[Description: To awaken the skill's full potential, one must sever one of their arms using the cursed axe that comes with the skill. The axe appears in your hand upon activation.]
[Note: In sacrifice, power blooms. The arm lost shall be the spark for an inferno untamed.]
"What the actual fuck?!"
Sacrificing one of his arms?
This is pure insanity! He wasn't going to do that!
Though, when he read the note, he became skeptical.
Cutting off his arms basically meant cutting his speed and power in half, but to be honest, doesn't he have four more available arms with [Asura's Arms]?
The problem with that was that his normal arms were those he was used to the most, meaning that cutting one of them off was... overwhelming, to say the least.
He would only do it as a last resort if anything happened, but until then he could manage just fine.
"Are you done?" Aphex yawned, spinning in the air, "We don't have all the time in the world, you know."
"Well," Stark sighed, "There's nothing but us, and I don't think the others are going to wake up anyway, so no, we in fact have all the time in the world."
"Plus, you're the one supposed to go down," he completed, glaring at the [Moon Apostle].
"No can do," Aphex laughed, "I'll just wait for you to sleep, get tired or hungry, and it's my win instantly."
In contrast to all other apostles, Aphex was the type to just wait for the perfect opportunity to sneak attack someone.
He had immense strength, yet still didn't feel like taking any risks.
"You can always try that Banish Game on me, though," Aphex suggested for the second time, seemingly really eager to try it.
But Stark simply sighed.
Aphex probably already expected every single one of his skills, and from this distance, even if he tried to throw his crimson fists or spears, a simple move would be enough for him to avoid it.
Domination Soul can't reach that distance either, and neither can Domi-Chains Restrain.
And though he could climb out of the crater if he wanted, leaving the two girls in there would potentially mean Aphex attempting to kill them.
Then if he tried to get them out with him, the moon apostle could also attack him from afar.
Basically, there was no real solution to leave without putting Lilith, Sora or himself at risk.
At least, that would be the case if he hadn't just unlocked the perfect skill for this situation.
And so, he simply pointed his finger at the sky, channeling his aura to try and use [Meteor Crash] for the first time.
Fwish! Fwish!
He sensed an energy ball in the sky, forming slowly from his aura, and once he looked up, a meteor, the size of a building, appeared.
"What the fuck?" he hadn't expected it to be this big!
But in the end, he simply did what he needed to do to keep himself and his friends safe, and so with a single swing of his arm downward, the meteor finished forming and immediately crashed down.
"Are you stupid, human, you can't use the spear anymore-" Aphex laughed, but his sentence was cut as he suddenly heard, and felt, a massive presence behind him.
While floating, he turned around, just to see the massive meteor, five times his size, coming.
"Oh, I guess I didn't expect that," he mumbled, the eight crimson crescent-shaped blades around him twitching.
CRASH! BOOM!
He was hit straight on, unable to avoid something this big even with his speed.
The meteor kept falling though, and Aphex was taken with it toward the crater, crashing down in a massive explosion that shook Termina again.
Stark made sure to place himself in front of Sora and Lilith to defend them, but thankfully enough they were safe.
-2,377,983!
The damage number appeared, and Stark smirked.
If he kept going like this, then maybe it could be manageable.

chapters.title: Chapter 367 - 367: The Start of the Final Third Trial Battle, Chosen VS Aphex
chapters.content:
After [Meteor Crash] forced Aphex down, leaving a massive crater in its wake, the Apostle groaned as he pushed himself to his feet.
The jagged edges of the meteor's fiery aftermath glowed faintly, casting an ominous light over the battlefield.
Dust and debris lingered in the air, mingling with the thick tension.
After all... it was only Aphex and Stark remaining now.
"You little..." Aphex's voice dripped with venom, his silver hair streaked with soot as his eyes burned with raw fury. "You still had tricks you never used?!"
Stark, standing at the edge of the crater, remained silent.
His body tensed as he kept his eyes locked on Aphex, gauging his movements.
Though his face was stoic, his mind raced, analyzing every possible angle.
Aphex was faster, stronger, and more experienced, but Stark had something the Apostle didn't—unpredictability.
And also [Flow], allowing Stark to see Aphex's movements before they even came.
The eight crescent-shaped blades hovering around Aphex glowed faintly with a bluish-white light, spinning slowly as if they were alive, waiting for a command.
"You've been surprising," Aphex admitted, brushing dust off his black armor, "but I've seen your type before. You have many tricks, but they're all shallow in the end."
He smirked, his hand swaying lazily. "Doesn't matter. You'll die before you even realize it."
"Perception," Stark whispered, the crimson vortex in his eyes spinning faster.
...
[Name: Aphex, Lord of the Moon, Godless Demon Apostle]
[Level: 600]
[HP: 22,622,017/25,000,000]
[Strength: 37,948]
[Stamina: 44,381]
[Speed: 41,059]
[Defense: 38,982]
[Skills: Crescent Barrage, Lunar Shield, Gravity Flux, Moonlit Surge, Void Pierce, Lunar Genesis (Mythical), Spectral Crescents (Mythical), Moonfall Eradication (Godly), Moonscourge Storm (Godly), Crescent Oblivion (Godly), Eclipse Dominion (Godly), Lunar Cataclysm (Immortal), Moonlit Obliteration (Immortal)
...
"...Shit."
That thing had just too many powerful skills, like seriously?
Two Mythical, four Godly and two Immortal skills, this was insane.
Aphex tilted his head, the crescent blades surrounding him picking up speed.
Each blade hummed with power, leaving trails of light as they rotated.
The Apostle moved his hand slightly, and two blades shot forward like lightning bolts.
"You're not even worthy of me using any of my real skills!"
But Stark saw it coming easily thanks to [Flow], the blades grazing past him and embedding into the ground.
The force of their impact sent sharp gusts of wind slicing through the air.
"Fast," Stark muttered, raising his guard. "But predictable."
The blades then reversed direction, rushing back toward him.
Stark activated [Invincible Dodge], narrowly avoiding the attack as he flipped backward, his invincibility frames saving him.
It seems like [Flow] couldn't detect attacks that he wasn't seeing, as the two blades that tried to sneak him weren't given the 1-second warning advantage.
"Impressive reflexes," Aphex remarked, his voice carrying a casual malice.
He waved his hand, and the remaining six blades began spinning faster. "But let's see how long you can keep dancing."
With a flick of his wrist, Aphex used [Crescent Barrage].
All eight blades shot forward in a spiraling pattern, leaving little room for escape.
Stark's eyes widened, his [Focus] skill kicking in.
The world seemed to slow as he analyzed the incoming trajectories.
"Too tight to dodge completely," Stark muttered, his hands glowing crimson as he summoned [Crimson Spears].
The ten materialized around him, blocking the first wave of blades.
Sparks flew as the weapons clashed, the sheer force of the attack pushing Stark back several meters.
One blade slipped through his defenses, nicking his shoulder and drawing blood.
-7,987!
Stark winced but didn't falter.
"Not bad," he muttered, "but you're not the only one who can multitask."
Before the next barrage could strike, Stark snapped his fingers too, using up 25 skills points on [Crimson Ball Transmission].
Doing such a thing would be stupid and grant you a beating from any teacher, as everyone knows you shouldn't upgrade your skills mid-fight.
But honestly, who even cares?
Ding!
[You have upgraded "Crimson Ball Transmission" to level 30 (Gold-Max Tier)]
"Merge them," he said instantly, not waiting for the panel to ask him.
[Very well.]
Ding!
[You have gained a new mythical perk!]
[New Perk: Crimson Ball Barrage]
[Description: You have gained the ability to summon up to 10 crimson balls at the same time, perfectly aiming them around your opponent.
Every time you snap your fingers, you will teleport to one of the ten balls at random, giving you the ability to simply just hit your opponent over and over.]
In retrospect, this might not seem like that big of a deal, but to Stark, this could actually work really well.
In fact, it could work so well, he decided to instantly test it out.
"You think leveling up one skill will save you?" Aphex scoffed. "It won't matter. I'll crush you before you figure out how to use it."
Stark smirked, his lips curling upward in defiance. [Crimson Ball Barrage] was ready, and the timing couldn't be better.
Aphex waved his hand, activating [Spectral Crescents], one of his mythical skills.
This time, the eight crescent blades didn't simply spiral—they fragmented, multiplying into countless shards of moonlight that swirled in a chaotic storm.
The air trembled as the shards honed in on Stark like a swarm of meteors, each one humming with lethal energy.
"Die!" Aphex roared, the ground cracking beneath him as he poured more power into the attack.
Stark's instincts screamed.
[Flow] painted the storm in slow motion, but the sheer number of blades made escape impossible.
"Not today," Stark growled, summoning [Asura's Arms] in a burst of crimson light.
Four massive, glowing arms erupted from his back—two from his shoulders, and two from below his natural arms.
Each arm radiated raw power, their fists crackling with crimson energy.
Aphex's crescent shards closed in, but Stark's new limbs moved faster than the eye could follow.
The Asura's Arms swatted the incoming shards like flies, shattering them mid-air in an explosive display of power.
Sparks flew, and the battlefield erupted in chaos.
Dust swirled around Stark, but he didn't let up.
He raised a hand, crimson energy pooling around him as he activated [Crimson Ball Barrage], and using his arms threw them all.
The ten crimson spheres materialized instantly, circling Aphex like vultures eyeing their prey.
"What is this?" Aphex snarled, his eyes narrowing as he tried to track the spheres.
But then, Stark snapped his fingers—and disappeared.
In a flash, Stark reappeared near one of the spheres, his Asura's Arms striking out simultaneously.
The force of the blow sent Aphex staggering, his black armor cracking under the impact.
-572,493!
Before Aphex could retaliate, Stark snapped his fingers again, teleporting to another sphere.
Another devastating punch landed, this time from behind.
-621,774!
"Enough!" Aphex growled, lashing out with a crescent blade, but Stark had already teleported to the next sphere.
The pattern continued, Stark appearing and disappearing in rapid succession, his attacks relentless and unpredictable.
Each teleport brought a new attack: punch, a kick, or a devastating aura-infused strike from one of his six arms.
Aphex's crescent blades struggled to keep up, whirling around him in a desperate attempt to block the onslaught.
SNAP!
He snapped his fingers.
FWISH!
And then teleported away right as Aphex was about to reach him.
BOOM!
Then, finally, he would hit the apostle.
-732,892!
At this pace, he would be able to deal with Aphex easily.

chapters.title: Chapter 368 - 368: Aphex's Finally Getting Serious, Too Many Powerful Skills!
chapters.content:
Aphex spat blood, his silver hair disheveled and his fury uncontained.
His crescent blades lashed out in a wild frenzy, but Stark's teleportation kept him untouchable.
The crimson spheres blinked across the battlefield, creating an intricate dance of destruction that even Aphex couldn't predict.
"You're starting to piss me off!" Aphex roared, slamming his hand into the ground.
The battlefield rumbled as he unleashed [Gravity Flux], creating a gravitational pull that slowed Stark's movements.
But it was too late.
Stark had already reached his last crimson ball, teleporting and then landing his final blow, his fists glowing with crimson energy as all six arms punched Aphex simultaneously.
-1,447,836!
The force of the impact sent Aphex hurtling across the battlefield, his body carving a trench through the ground as he skidded to a halt.
Dust and debris settled as the damage counter tallied up.
[Aphex HP: 17,832,393/25,000,000]
Aphex groaned as he rose, his armor battered and his eyes blazing with unholy light.
Blood trickled from the corner of his mouth, and his crescent blades trembled with rage.
"You think this is enough to defeat me?" he hissed, his voice dripping with venom.
The air around him darkened, and the eight crescent blades fused into a single, colossal weapon glowing with celestial energy.
Crescent Oblivion!
Stark watched as the colossal blade of light formed in Aphex's hand, glowing with raw power.
The battlefield trembled under its weight, cracks spreading out from the Apostle as he lifted the fused weapon high.
The crescent scar left in its wake cut across the sky like a harbinger of destruction.
Aphex's grin widened, dark and malicious. "No more games. Let's see you dance around this, little insect."
Stark readied himself, his six arms glowing with renewed crimson energy.
His crimson spears floated behind him, their points aimed directly at the Apostle.
Stark had to stay calm.
[Flow]
gave him a glimpse of what was to come—Aphex's attack would cover the entire battlefield.
Dodging wasn't an option.
[Crescent Oblivion]
activated, and Aphex swung the colossal blade in a devastating arc.
The sheer force of the attack split the air, sending shockwaves rippling out as the radiant crescent cut across the ground.
The glow was blinding, the heat unbearable.
"Block it, now!" Stark yelled, commanding all ten of his [Crimson Spears] to intercept the attack.
The spears darted forward, slamming into the crescent wave.
The explosion of light and energy was deafening.
The crimson spears shattered one by one, unable to withstand the full power of the attack.
Stark's Asura's Arms crossed in front of him defensively, bracing against the impact as the crescent wave hit him head-on.
-112,904!
The force hurled Stark backward, his feet carving in the ground as he slid.
His
Asura's Arms
flickered and all vanishing, tanking the majority of the damage.
[Your additional arms have been destroyed, you cannot summon them back.]
Dust and debris filled the air, obscuring his view.
When the dust settled, Aphex stood tall, his colossal blade shrinking back into eight separate crescent blades.
"Still alive?" he sneered. "Maybe you're not as pathetic as I thought."
His arms hung limp at his sides, his [Asura's Arms] gone, and his once-mighty crimson aura flickering like a dying flame.
Stark wiped blood from his mouth, his chest rising and falling heavily.
His HP had taken a significant hit. He needed a new strategy, and he needed it fast.
He was pretty much one shot away from certain death.
"You talk too much," Stark muttered under his breath, his body shaking with exhaustion.
He was probably the participant in this trial that took on the most monsters, and pretty much clutched the entire thing with Father Hugo, Eternal Regret, Tormented One, Heartless One and many more.
Stark's aura wasn't infinite.
He had to act. He couldn't wait any longer.
Stark raised his hand, summoning one of the most powerful weapons in his arsenal.
The [Spear of Judgment] materialized in a flash of crimson light, its gleaming shaft humbling even the battlefield around it.
Stark wasted no time, hurling it directly at Aphex with all his remaining strength.
The massive spear shot through the air, a comet of destruction, heading straight for Aphex's chest.
It was a precise, direct assault, one that would pierce through any armor and break through Aphex's defenses.
But Aphex, quick and ruthless, anticipated the strike.
With a slash of his crescent blades, the spear was deflected, spinning off course.
Stark's eyes widened.
His attack had been easily avoided. He'd expected the Apostle to evade, but not with such swift ease.
The [Spear of Judgment] came back from the other direction, but Aphex cut it in half.
"Nice try," Aphex taunted, his voice cutting through the tension. "But you'll need more than that to stop me."
Before Stark could react, Aphex raised his arms high as it was his turn to act.
The air grew heavy as the eight crescent blades shifted in an eerie synchrony.
With a flick of Aphex's wrist, they transformed into spectral copies, creating a deadly swarm of thirty-two glowing blades.
Spectral Descents... Second Form!
He too had perks for his skills, after all!
These Spectral Descents attacked without mercy, each one moving with pinpoint precision, seeking Stark's flesh with relentless intent.
The moment the blades lunged forward, Stark's heart skipped a beat.
He could sense the precision, the inevitability of their strike.
If they hit him, there would be no escape.
He needed something now, something that would keep him alive.
The answer came in an instant.
With a snap, Stark activated Dodge Control.
His body twisted and warped unnaturally, moving beyond the limits of human possibility.
It was as if the very fabric of space around him bent to his will.
Stark's form flickered, almost vanishing, as his body teleported from one spot to the next, narrowly avoiding the spectral blades with impossible precision.
Each time a blade came near, Stark's body would twist and shift, his movements so fast that they defied the laws of physics.
For the next fifteen seconds, Stark was untouchable.
The Spectral Descents flew past him, missing by mere inches each time, their deadly edges whizzing through the air as Stark danced between them.
But he didn't have time to savor his success. He knew that the next few moments were critical.
[10 seconds left.]
As the final spectral blade passed by him, Stark didn't wait to catch his breath.
With a swift motion, he threw a series of crimson punches, his fists crashing into Aphex's form.
His blows landed with a resounding force, sending the Apostle stumbling backward.
-238,319! -194,905! -213,281!
It wasn't enough to bring him down, but it was enough to shake his confidence and bring back his eight blades to him.
Aphex growled, his eyes flashing with malevolent determination. "Then let's see how you handle this."
The atmosphere grew thick with an oppressive presence.
Stark's vision blurred as the light around him was devoured, fading into total darkness.
The air became heavy, suffocating.
Eclipse Dominion.
[Description: Aphex creates an impenetrable field of darkness, completely nullifying enemy healing, mana regeneration, and aura-based skills for 20 seconds. Enemies within the field also suffer from reduced vision and tracking abilities.]
A massive dark field expanded, drowning the entire battlefield in an inky void.
Stark's senses were overwhelmed.
His aura, what was left of it, flickered out of existence, leaving him powerless.
His arms, his defenses—everything—vanished in the suffocating darkness.
Even his [Perception] couldn't lock onto anything in this unnatural pitch-black void.
The world felt alien, like he was lost in a place with no direction, no escape.
"What the—?!" Stark staggered, his breath coming in ragged gasps.
The oppressive darkness ate at him, his energy rapidly draining away. His body felt weak, his strength waning.
Aphex's voice echoed from the void, chilling and triumphant. "Welcome to despair. No healing. No aura. No escape."
Stark gritted his teeth, but he couldn't deny the overwhelming pressure that crushed him.
He was at the mercy of Aphex, and it felt like there was no hope left.
"NOW DIE!" Aphex lunged forward, ready to end it all.
Now that Chosen was inside of his domain, there was no chance he could escape.
Even other apostles feared this attack of his, and so that meant he had won.
He knew of Stark's revive abilities since he had seen them himself before, and trapped inside of this domain, he would easily eliminate him as soon as he got up.
But then, something happened.
Out of nowhere, a sensation—a flicker of divine energy—radiated from deep within Stark's equipment.
He could feel it pulse, glowing faintly in the darkness.
The [Priest's Cross], the item he had acquired from Father Hugo, flared to life.
[Priest's Cross: If overwhelming darkness is sensed, then the cross will completely cancel it, transfering all of it back to the attacker, dealing devastating damage to them.]
In the instant the cross activated, a burst of holy light erupted from it, the darkness around Stark being repelled like a tide retreating from the shore.
The void shattered, the dark energy that had been sapping his strength and sense of self was torn away, and all of it was funneled back toward Aphex in a single, earth-shattering explosion.
BOOM!
A massive shockwave pulsed outward, and Aphex screamed as the pure, blinding light of the cross consumed him.
The damage counter surged wildly.
-5,849,282!
[Aphex HP: 11,336,606/25,000,000]
The force of the attack was so immense that Aphex was sent staggering, his body wracked with pain.
His form, usually so impervious, seemed to crack under the weight of the explosion.
He coughed, his face contorted in anger.
His once-imposing stature wavered for a moment as the explosion dealt unimaginable damage to him.
"YOU FUCKING BITCH," Aphex hissed, his voice filled with unrelenting rage.
"Damn, are you going crazy," Stark backed away, his pupils shaking a bit as he sensed the aura emanating from the apostle.
"KILL YOURSELF!"
With a roar of fury, Aphex summoned one of his two final trump cards.
He raised his hands to the sky, and the heavens themselves seemed to respond.
The moon above began to shimmer, glowing with a sinister red hue.
Lunar Cataclysm (Immortal Skill).
The moon itself seemed to break free from the sky, descending toward Termina.
[Lunar Cataclysm: Aphex calls upon the power of the moon itself to summon a massive, ghostly projection of the lunar surface. The projection descends onto the battlefield, crushing everything beneath it]
The sheer size of the moon's reflection was terrifying, casting the entire battlefield into a dark, ominous glow.
Stark watched in horror as the lunar orb descended, its sheer weight creating shockwaves that rattled the earth beneath him.
The reflection of the moon cast everything in deep shadows.
Stark felt his heart pound as he watched the cataclysm unfold before him.
This was it.
If he didn't act, there would be no escape from the coming doom.
The moon's descent was the final judgment—an unstoppable force descending upon him.

chapters.title: Chapter 369 - 369: Lunar Cataclysm, Make a Choice Stark
chapters.content:
Stark was perplexed, as he needed to actually save not only himself, but also the two girls with him: Sora and Lilith.
If the moon crashes, then they're gonna be all killed, and though Stark didn't care about himself since he could revive, the others couldn't.
In the crater, Aphex hovered above, his arms crossed, his laughter echoing like thunder.
But then he suddenly remembered something: there were still items available besides his, weren't there?
Every single item on the bodies of the other participant was disintegrated by the spear, but those on Lilith's, Sora's and Follower's should still be good to go... right?
[Stark Items: Cooldown Gem, Double Power, Blood-Sainted Amulet and Clarity Orb]
[Lilith Items: Teleportation Sphere]
[Sora Items: Armor Reinforcement Shard]
[Follower Items: ???, ???, ???, ???, ???]
At least that is what he knew.
His brain directly went to the [Teleportation Sphere] though, with it, they could definitely survive!
Instantly, Stark dashed toward Lilith, wanting to grab the sphere and teleport all of them out of the falling moon's way.
If he could manage that, then not only would he get out of the crater, but there was a bigger chance at victory since he would also kill Follower!
"..." the black demon that hovered around the unconscious man looked up, seemingly unbothered.
"COME ON," Stark shouted, reaching Lilith's body and trying to see if he could acquire the [Teleportation Sphere] somehow.
[Teleportation: Teleport you and all the people close to you in a 1-meter radius to a location you pinpoint.]
[In an unconscious state, you can steal the items of the other participants!]
"YES!"
Stark was ecstatic, it meant his plan could actually work!
But of course... with Stark, every time something good happened, something far worse needed to balance it out.
"You really think I'm going to allow you to do that?" Aphex laughed out loud, beginning to float in the air and then pointing at Stark right as he was about to use the item, "GRAVITY FLUX!"
[Gravity Flux: Manipulates gravity to control the battlefield and slow enemies.]
He had already tried to use it two times before, but both time it was simply to slow down Stark.
This time though...
FWISH!
Using his gravity powers, Aphex sent Stark flying in the opposite direction to the two girls, and though he tried to run forward and even use [Domi-Chain Restrain] to bring them to him, it was useless.
Now only 1 kilometer above ground, the giant moon kept coming down.
The crater stretched by dozens of kilometers, so the moon perfectly fit inside.
It felt like [Heaven's Spear], but in this case it would be [Heaven's Moon]...
"Insanity," Stark whispered, rage building up inside of him.
"Enjoy, kid!" Aphex, sensing that the kid didn't have any chance to save his companions, began floating out of the crater left by the spear, as he wasn't immune to his attack either.
Follower's demon did the same thing, grabbing the body of the priest and seemingly teleporting out of existence, only reappearing out of the crater in a black flash of aura.
That thing was REALLY adamant on keeping Follower alive for some reason.
And now, Stark, Lilith and Sora were the only people left in the crater, facing the wrath of the [Lunar Cataclysm] skill.
The [Teleportation Sphere] was still in Stark's hands, but he didn't have the time to reach the two girls, as Aphex also seemed to observe him from above, ready to use [Gravity Flux] again.
Now he needed to make a decision: does he teleport out by himself, dooming the two girls for sure, or does he just stay back to take the gamble?
"..." Stark's face turned cold, but the fury inside of him kept growing more and more, the vortex in his eyes intensifying.
[Make your choice.]
...
In the outside world, people were absolutely baffled, too.
The fight had been intense, sure, but this was on a whole other level.
The broadcast made sure that everyone could understand what was happening by showing it to everyone.
When the description of the [Teleportation Sphere] appeared, people felt hopeful as they thought Stark could survive.
But once [Gravity Flux] kicked in and stopped him from saving them, most people felt perplexed.
And to make it even more interesting, the words [Make a choice] didn't appear in front of Stark, not at all, but on the screens of everybody.
"This is insane!"
"What the fuck?!"
"Save them!"
On one hand, the camera turned toward the girls, with the text [Stay back and try to save them] appearing on the right, and then once Stark looked down, the camera would zoom on the [Teleportation Sphere].
And the text that appeared sent shivers down the spine of many: [Leave them to die, save yourself.]
"..." Mike Gardenis, Sora's father, went pale with nervousness.
"..." and the rest of the family as well.
In fact, most of the world was silent at that moment.
The words [Make your choice] didn't disappear as Stark darted his pupils from the two girls to the [Teleportation Sphere] repeatedly.
The risk of the choice was the following for Stark: either he saves himself and doesn't lose his only revive, or he tries to save the two girls, with a major chance of it failing, and all of them losing their lives.
Though of course, no one knew that Stark could revive.
"Come on, just use the teleportation sphere," people shouted.
"You have to try, stop wasting time," the rest also shouted.
The world was split between the two choices, though the most logical one was obvious: to save his own life.
Even Mike and the Gardenis family knew very well that no one would risk their lives for two people, especially in such a deadly trial.
Stark's gaze kept lingering on the [Teleportation Sphere] more and more.
"..." Elise Gardenis, Sora's mother, as well as her father and two siblings all stood silent, tears streaming down from their eyes.
They were sure that they could say goodbye to their daughter now.
Everyone was sure, in fact, that Stark would choose the smartest option out of the lot.
And so, the time came where he needed to choose.
"Alright," Stark mumbled to himself, opening his eyes and the aura in them burning brighter than ever before, "I know what to do now."
But instead of looking at the [Teleportation Sphere] or even [Lilith and Sora] options, he looked up at the falling reflection of the moon.
A third option appeared at that moment.
One that was so impossibly foolish to do that no one could understand how Stark could even think of doing that.
This was his final choice, and even if he failed, he could proudly say he gave it his all.
"Trying to play hero? How quaint!" Aphex sneered, his outstretched hand glowing with gravitational energy.
"I'm not leaving them!" Stark growled, his crimson aura flickering in defiance.
"Well, then get ready," Aphex laughed, "It's too late now."
The reflection of the moon was right above Stark, and he needed to do what he wanted to do now, because if he didn't at least try, he knows he would regret it.
Plus, Lana would probably insult him with every name in the book.
And above all else... he didn't want them to die.
He chose the third option without hesitation.
[Third Option: Face the Lunar Cataclysm head on.]

chapters.title: Chapter 370 - 370: Tanking the Reflection of the Moon, EGO's Strength
chapters.content:
Stark stood his ground, unwavering, his crimson aura blazing like an inferno.
The reflection of the moon descended, a harbinger of utter destruction.
The sheer pressure from the falling celestial body caused the ground beneath him to crack and groan.
Stark, however, showed no sign of retreat, only pure determination.
[Third Option: Face the Lunar Cataclysm head on.]
The choice was madness itself, but Stark had made it without hesitation.
He took his stance.
"Wait a damn minute." Aphex, hovering above, stared wide-eyed at Stark, his smug grin faltering. "What the hell are you doing?"
Even he was surprised.
Stark didn't respond. Instead, his body tightened as he braced for what was to come.
The outside world erupted into confusion too.
"What's happening?"
"MOVE, CHOSEN!"
"Save yourself, Chosen!"
Yet, Stark's focus was unshakable.
He decided to use [EGO] as his [Ego Meter] had been at 100/100 for a very long time now.
The demon materialized above Stark, Its massive frame cast a shadow over the crater, its crimson aura mirroring Stark's own.
The demon's eyeless face turned upward, mimicking its master's resolve. It knew what was expected. Stark could feel its understanding without words.
His [Asura's Arms] were still on cooldown, destroyed earlier in the fight, leaving him with nothing but this desperate gamble.
So instead, he put his entire focus on [EGO].
"You're final hope, EGO," he mumbled, staring at the demon with such intensity even it knew it couldn't fail.
EGO's massive arms rose as the moon bore down, the air vibrating with unrelenting force.
"Are you serious?!" Aphex roared. "You think you can stop that?"
The world watched in stunned silence as EGO raised both arms, catching the reflection of the falling moon.
A deafening shockwave erupted on impact, flattening everything within miles.
EGO strained under the immense weight, its monstrous body trembling.
Stark stood below it, blood trickling from his mouth as the pressure threatened to crush him.
He refused to move.
"Hold it!" he growled, his voice hoarse but commanding.
"Unbelievable," Aphex muttered, his expression one of both shock and rage.
The broadcast caught every moment, every bead of sweat on Stark's face, every tremor in EGO's frame.
"C'mon, Chosen!"
"Don't give up!"
Despite the overwhelming support, the struggle was far from over.
If he wanted to truly win, he needed to completely erase this attack from existence.
And there was only one way to do it: [Negate Explosion], one of [EGO]'s perks!
For three agonizing minutes, Stark and EGO held the moon at bay, the celestial body spinning violently as if attempting to force its way down.
The ground beneath Stark buckled, his knees trembling but unyielding.
"NEGATE EXPLOSION!"
A panel appeared before him.
[Negating an immortal skill may take some time...]
[Do you want to use your two "Negate Explosions" to shorten the time required to negate this skill?]
"No." Stark growled through clenched teeth.
Surprisingly, Stark refused, wanting to keep his second in case anything else similar happened, and to take Aphex off guard.
[Very well, then hold on, master.]
It was the first time EGO ever spoke to him, even it sensing that this attack was danger.
And while holding down the moon with Stark, it began to channel its energy to completely eradicate it.
"OH, NO, YOU DON'T," Alphex shouted, activating [Moonscourge Storm] around Stark.
[Description: Aphex summons a massive vortex of lunar energy that traps all enemies within a 100-meter radius. The storm rains down energy crescents every second, they don't deal damage but weaken the enemy.]
A whirlwind of energy crescents descended upon Stark.
The crescents didn't deal damage, but each one sapped his strength.
Stark's muscles burned, and his vision blurred, but he didn't falter.
"Keep going, EGO!" Stark roared.
The outside world was a cacophony of shouting, pleading, and cheering.
And right as the climax is about to happen, both EGO and Stark about to give up as they couldn't hold it any longer...
"HE'S GOING TO DIE!"
"CHOSEN, KEEP GOING!"
"Fuck, it's over..."
It finally happened.
NEGATE EXPLOSION!
[The perk has been charged up, do you want to use it?]
"YES!" Stark shouted at the top of his lungs, "GET THIS SHITTY ASS THING OUT OF HERE!"
"???" Aphex and everyone else were confused.
[Very well.]
An explosion emanated from EGO at that moment, covering the entirety of Termina, and cancelling every single skill in it.
The moment the energy touched the moon's reflection, it flickered and began to dissolve.
The [Lunar Cataclysm] skill was eradicated, the silver glow faded, and silence followed.
"HE DID IT!"
"HOLY SHIT!"
"I LOVE YOU CHOSEN!"
The entire world went in an uproar, absolutely baffled that yet again, that black-haired boy somehow managed to find his way out of this situation!
Actually, Stark's fan club probably had millions of people by now.
"This is insane," Aiden Heartsouls had a hard time understanding the situation, "This isn't normal."
"Dad, what the actual fuck," Jay gritted his teeth, HE was supposed to be the strongest sibling!
HE was supposed to get all the praises, have a fan club and get beauties to join him.
Why was the little brother luckier than he was?
"..." Lara and Nissa didn't say anything, none of Nissa's friends even texting her anymore, too absorbed in the broadcast, not wanting to miss a single second.
On the other hand, the Gardenis family was having a party.
"LET'S GO KIDDO!" Mike Gardenis shouted, jumping in excitement, "DAMN RIGHT, YOU STAYED BACK FOR THEM!"
Elise chuckled beside him, "He must love her very much to stand back and take that..."
"Yeah," Mike sighed, "I don't even know anybody crazy enough to do what he did."
When you think about it, those outside the trial could only understand one thing: Stark was given a choice, one that could extremely easily protect his life, but in exchange for the two girls'.
And yet, Stark just refused to take any of the options, creating a third one out of nowhere, and one that was infinitely more dangerous than the other two.
Only someone that cherished the other party very much would do that.
Meanwhile, Aphex stared at the scene below, stunned.
Stark stood amidst the crater, bloodied and barely upright, but alive. The two girls, Lilith and Sora, remained unharmed.
"Chosen..." Aphex gritted his teeth, "You're about to fucking die, looks like you forced my hand."
But you know what's worse than just surviving an immortal-skill, being exhausted yet still forced to keep fighting?
Well, it was to survive ANOTHER Immortal-Skill.
"Huh?" Stark barely had time to catch his breath when he noticed something: the moon above shimmered again.
"If you survive this, I'll kill myself," Aphex mocked as he used the entirety of his power into this next attack.
MOONLIT OBLITERATION!
[Moonlit Obliteration: Aphex channels the entirety of his power to unleash a devastating explosion of lunar energy that annihilates everything within a 1-kilometer radius. The explosion leaves behind a barren wasteland where no skills or abilities can be activated for 20 seconds. This skill halves Aphex's current HP upon use.]
He was truly crazy.
But to be honest, Stark was too.
"Ah... shit..." Stark was exhausted, barely able to stand up.
And now...
The sky turned blindingly bright as Aphex poured every ounce of his power into the skill.
BOOM!
He was going to die.

chapters.title: Chapter 371 - 371: Stark's Death by Moonlit Obliteration, Backlash and Sudden Save
chapters.content:
Moonlit Obliteration!
[Moonlit Obliteration: Aphex channels the entirety of his power to unleash a devastating explosion of lunar energy that annihilates everything within a 1-kilometer radius. The explosion leaves behind a barren wasteland where no skills or abilities can be activated for 20 seconds. This skill halves Aphex's current HP upon use.]
As Aphex unleashed his most devastating ability, a sickening cough tore through his chest.
Dark blood splattered the ground as the backlash of the attack ravaged his body.
He gritted his teeth through the pain, his glowing form flickering like a dying star.
But to him, it was worth it.
BOOM!
-5,668,303!
He received the damage, which was half of his current health.
[Aphex HP: 5,668,303/25,000,000]
Aphex was on the brink of death, but even then he couldn't give up.
[Kill the Chosen One.]
This panel was omnipresent, always following him wherever he looked.
This was the task that the Godless Demon had given them, and he wouldn't let him down.
"NO MATTER WHAT," Aphex shouted.
BOOOOOM!
The devastation he sought to unleash was already forming.
A beam of raw lunar energy descended from the heavens, growing wider and brighter as it neared the Earth.
The sky split with a deafening roar, the ground trembling violently beneath its might as it threatened to consume everything.
"..." Stark looked up, unfazed.
He was going to die, this was a certainty now.
But even then, he didn't care at all.
He was too far from the girls to hope to use the [Teleportation Sphere] on them while inside the radius of the attack.
The best thing he could do now was to save them and hope.
"Time Flow," he whispered, activating one of [Focus]'s perks to slow down time for three seconds.
During these three seconds, he put his plan into action.
The lunar energy was right above him, slowed down, and he couldn't afford to waste a single second.
"Come on, help me for once," He looked down at the [Sculk Necklace] he was carrying.
Stark had realized that for a [Domination] user, equipment never really mattered: they advanced way too fast to even hope of keeping a single equipment or gear.
That is why none of those he met until now had used them, and that could be the same for Stark.
Sculk, though it annoyed him a lot in the second trial, could now easily be broken through by monsters and humans at his level.
But there was one more use for it: he could control the sculk, meaning that he was able to do some things even from a large distance.
And that is what he planned to do now.
Gripping the [Teleportation Sphere] in his hand, he activated it.
[Whisper your location into the sphere, then tap it once more to teleport all people in range instantly.]
He did as told, whispering the words "at the edge of Termina" into the item.
[Coordinates found, please tap again to teleport.]
But he didn't activate it for himself, though he could, instead he immediately threw it at intense speed toward Lilith and Sora.
And that's when the sculk would come into play: he could control it from far.
"COME ON," he repeated, extraction the dark blue liquid from the necklace and sending it forward, creating a hand made out of sculk, one of its fingers pointed as it dashed forward.
The sculk hand followed the teleportation sphere closely, and when it reached the appropriate distance to the two unconscious girls, Stark tapped the sphere with the hand.
"..." he didn't know if it would work, but it was his best bet.
And...
Ding!
[Teleportation successful!]
In a flash of light, Sora and Lilith vanished from the battlefield, their unconscious forms transported far beyond the crater, out of danger.
"LET'S FUCKING GO!" Stark wanted to shout and dance, but he quickly remembered about his situation and saw what was above him.
[Time Flow deactivated.]
"This is gonna hurt," he muttered with a resigned sigh as the time resumed normally, "But oh well."
"HAHA, DESPERATE NOW, ARE YOU?!" Aphex had abandoned every single thought besides this battle, he truly wanted to get rid of Stark now.
"Well," Stark smiled as he looked at Aphex directly in the eyes, "I guess I'll be back in 30 seconds," he shrugged.
"Huh, what do you mean by that-"
BOOM!
He didn't have the time to finish his sentence.
The beam struck, engulfing the crater in an unrelenting torrent of energy.
The broadcast cut to silence as the beam erased everything within the crater.
The ground, the air, and even the light seemed to vanish under its destructive force.
The world outside the trial watched in stunned horror.
"CHOSEN!"
"NOOOO!"
"And here we thought he had a chance..."
People in the outside world were terrified: there was no chance Chosen could survive this.
"After all of this?"
And to make things worse, and also more misleading for everyone involved, the screens displaying Stark's status went dark, the red cross marking his square as deceased.
Only Sora, Lilith, and the silent Follower remained.
Everyone else was dead.
The audience erupted into chaos.
They saw in their screens through the bright lunar energy that Stark's body was disintegrated, turning into nothingness, and many couldn't fathom that truth.
They only knew that kid for a few hours now, but even then, it was insane to think about.
"This is..." Arthur and Louise Moonless, Lana's parents, were shocked, "What the hell..."
"...!" even Aoki Moonless, her brother, was terrified.
He didn't like Stark as he saw him as someone that could steal his sister, but still, it was insane to think about.
Did he just die? Like this? Not even trying anything out?
Or maybe he abandoned, sensing that Aphex was too powerful?
The Gardenis Family was no different either, their jaws hitting the floor.
And it wasn't because Chosen had died or because of the intense power of this attack.
Not at all.
Instead...
"This kid..." Mike couldn't help but look down, tears dripping from his eyes.
As said before, all of Sora's family were all really expressive, she was the only one that wasn't.
"He..." Gardenis continued, her pupils shaking, "The last thing he did was... save them..."
That was the conclusion everybody could reach by simply watching.
Instead of trying to find another solution or escape himself, Stark instead decided to give it his all, activating the [Teleportation Sphere] and sending it toward the two girls while using some weird liquid power to activate it from a distance.
Sora and Lilith were saved, as the camera showed them at the edge of Termina, very far from the danger.
But even then... that kid sacrificed himself.
Did he love Sora that much? Would anyone be this crazy?
If Mike and Elise knew about him before, and if Sora had told them about him, then maybe they would have accepted him as a son-in-law.
But now it was too late.
And finally... Stark's family.
"..."
"..."
"..."
None could say anything, they just looked down.
Wasn't this what they wanted from the start?
The moment they kicked Stark out of their home, they expected him to either come crawling back or just die.
They preferred the latter, simply because it wouldn't tarnish their family name any longer if the weakest link was done for.
And now that it was done.
Somehow, they felt a bit sad.
It probably because of the context, though, and because they knew the entire world was watching Stark's powers.
He probably had no idea he was being watched by millions, yet he still did all of that cool shit regardless.
He still saved those girls because he wanted to, not for validation.
Truly fascinating: he was completely different from them.
They kept watching, though, none of them saying anything or shedding a single tear as what was done was done, they couldn't change it.
Now the world needed to watch for what would happen.
With Chosen dead; and Lilith, Sora and Follower unconscious, though the latter was protected by some black demon, every participant was out.
It was over, and so now they needed to figure out what the "horrible thing that would happen to humanity" was.
In every household, every school, every hotel, every building, every restaurant, everyone watched.
Even those in rifts took the time out of their day to stop their trainings and fights to observe.
[Chosen's Dead?!]
[Nooo, he was my favorite!]
[Fuck Aphex!]
Thousands of discussions on forums and private messages spread, the news hitting everybody in mere seconds, even those that said they "didn't want to watch this useless shit".
The only person that was truly unfazed by all of this was Lana Moonless, who was still patiently waiting in their apartment.
Not a single tear, not a single bat of an eye.
She knew that Stark hadn't truly died after all, so why would she care.
She also was the only one who knew of his "other" ability, so no wonder.
Back in the trial, the massive beam of lunar energy kept coming down for 30 additional seconds, blinding everything in the surroundings.
"Haha..." Aphex laughed, "HAHAHAHHAHAHA!"
His sheer determination in killing Stark and completing his task, as well as his insanity and the blows he received, made him forget of the most crucial thing of all.
But right as the beam stopped, the trial going quite again, he suddenly reminisced Stark's words.
"See you in 30 seconds."
And at that very moment, he finally remembered about the revive, thanking himself for remembering it at such a crucial time.
"IDIOT!" Aphex kept laughing, ready to descend and end it once and for all, as he still had more than enough time to kill Stark the moment he reappeared.
Which meant...
That Aphex and the apostles had won.
It was game over for the boy.

chapters.title: Chapter 372 - 372: Follower Wakes Up, Stopping Aphex
chapters.content:
Aphex floated above the glowing crater, his laughter booming across the barren wasteland left behind by Moonlit Obliteration.
"Alright, time to die," he declared, his voice full of triumph and disdain.
The devastation he'd unleashed had reduced everything within a kilometer radius to nothingness.
Stark's annihilation seemed absolute.
The Chosen One was dead—his body obliterated—and Aphex's victory appeared certain.
He descended slowly, preparing to confirm Stark's death and possibly kill him again if he revived, his mind racing with the possibilities of what awaited him after this victory.
He knew that Stark had the ability to revive himself; he'd seen it firsthand before.
But this time, it felt different. This time, he was sure Stark had no way out of this as Aphex would be waiting for him.
The moon apostle sneered.
"Idiots," he muttered to himself, thinking of his fallen comrades.
How had they failed to recognize Stark's revival ability in the heat of battle?
Their incompetence had paved the way for him, Aphex, to claim glory.
The Godless Demon's task echoed in his mind: Kill the Chosen One.
Aphex could already see himself promoted as the one who fulfilled this divine quest.
This was his moment—his ascension.
But just as Aphex began to descend into the crater, ready to strike if Stark managed to revive, he felt it.
Clink. Fwish.
A sudden weight pulled on his leg, accompanied by the cold, metallic clatter of a chain binding him.
"What the—?!" Aphex whipped his head around, his eyes narrowing as a familiar voice rose from the shadows.
"Finally," the voice said, venom dripping from its tone. "Now that he's gone, it's my time to shine!"
Aphex looked down to see a dark chain coiled tightly around his ankle, pulsing with a sinister energy.
His pupils dilated as he traced the chain to its source.
Follower.
The man stood below, a wide, feral grin on his face, his posture relaxed but his eyes burning with unbridled intent.
The dark demon that was protecting him at all costs had seeped back into his body, waking him up when he noticed that Stark was dead.
"Did you really think I'd just sit back and let you have your way?" Follower taunted. His voice was sharp, cutting through the air.
Aphex's shock turned to anger as he yanked against the chain, attempting to free himself. "What the hell is this?!" he barked.
Follower tilted his head mockingly. "What does it look like, you overgrown lunatic (pun intended)? It's your death sentence."
Dark energy rippled across the chain as Follower pulled hard, dragging Aphex toward him.
The apostle stumbled mid-air, his once-commanding presence faltering.
"Follower…" Aphex growled, his voice dripping with malice. "Do you honestly think you can stand against me?"
Follower's grin widened. "Oh, I don't think, I know. Now that the other asshole's gone, it's just you and me!"
Aphex shot a blast of lunar energy toward Follower, aiming to sever the chain binding him, but the attack dissipated harmlessly against its dark surface.
The chain pulsed again, its dark glow intensifying.
Follower yanked Aphex down, closing the distance between them in a heartbeat.
"You've gotten cocky," Follower sneered. "But let's see how that arrogance fares against me."
Aphex countered with a swipe of his crescent-shaped blades, slashing at the chain itself.
Sparks flew, but the chain held firm.
"Tch. Annoying pest," Aphex spat, his rage building.
He channeled lunar energy into his blades and struck again, this time forcing the chain to loosen slightly.
Follower's eyes narrowed as he tightened his grip on the chain. "You're not getting away that easily!"
The two clashed, exchanging blows with a ferocity that shook the ground beneath them.
Follower's dark magic swirled like a storm, each strike aimed at overpowering the weakened apostle.
Aphex, though injured and drained from his ultimate attack, fought back with a relentless fury.
For a brief moment, they seemed evenly matched, their attacks canceling each other out.
But after 30 seconds, Aphex's patience snapped.
"Enough of this!" he roared, gathering an immense amount of lunar energy into his hands.
The air grew heavy as a silver glow enveloped him, his power threatening to explode outward.
Moonfall Eradication!
Follower didn't flinch.
He lunged forward, his chains, which were a new perk he got, were snaking through the air like vipers, aiming to entangle Aphex completely.
Chains of Darkness!
The two collided, their powers clashing in a blinding display of light and dark.
The battlefield trembled, the ground cracking under the weight of their struggle.
But just as Aphex began to gain the upper hand, his rage boiling over, Follower noticed something strange.
"WHAT THE FUCK ARE YOU DOING?!" Aphex's voice thundered, filled with a mix of fury and desperation.
Follower blinked, momentarily caught off guard. "What?"
Aphex's eyes blazed as he struggled against the chains binding him. "YOU FUCKING IDIOT! CHOSEN'S NOT DEAD!"
Follower froze, his grip on the chains faltering for just a moment.
"What… did you just say?" Follower's voice was low, almost disbelieving.
Aphex's expression twisted into one of frustration and panic. "YOU'RE A FUCKING DUMBASS!"
Follower's mind raced as he processed the apostle's words.
Could it be true? Could Stark still be alive even after enduring Moonlit Obliteration?
Aphex seized the moment of hesitation to break free, shattering the dark chains with a surge of lunar energy.
"You've doomed us both, you idiot!" he snarled, his blades slicing through the air as he advanced on Follower.
Follower barely managed to dodge the attack, his confidence shaken.
If Stark truly wasn't dead, then everything he'd planned—the betrayal, the fight against Aphex—was pointless.
"I don't believe you!" Follower shouted, though his voice lacked its usual conviction. "That attack obliterated everything. There's no way he could've survived!"
"Then why the hell do you think I'm so desperate to kill him now?" Aphex barked, his movements growing erratic.
"Your bluff won't work on me, you lunatic-"
Follower tried to argue and continue his fight, after all, no one can survive being completely disintegrated like this.
And yet...
He was instantly proven wrong, not even able to complete his sentence.
Because then, the impossible happened.
A blinding light pierced the heavens, illuminating the barren battlefield like a divine beacon.
It was not the silver glow of Aphex's lunar energy nor the oppressive darkness of Follower's magic.
This was something else.
Something holy.
Both combatants froze mid-attack, their gazes drawn upward.
"No," Aphex whispered, his face contorting in disbelief.
Above them, the sky had begun to crack and splinter, like a glass dome struck by an unseen force.
Through the fissures, a radiant figure emerged, its presence suffused with an overwhelming, divine aura.
It was Heaven's Spear.

chapters.title: Chapter 373 - 373: Follower's in Shock, They're Both Doomed now!
chapters.content:
What happened before:
"See you in 30 seconds," Stark smiled as he stared at Aphex, pure insanity in his gaze.
BOOM!
The beam of [Moonlit Obliteration] hit him directly.
-99,999,999!
There was no need to even show the number, Stark was instantly killed, every cell in his body evaporated from the sheer power of that thing.
"..."
And the most important thing to note was that when dying, Stark could indeed feel the pain you would usually go through if you actually died.
When he was cut in half by Judicator, when he was swallowed by the sculk of the Warden, or when he was crushed by the Guardian Ape.
He felt it all, yet still didn't abandon because of the pain.
He needed to keep going, no matter what.
Funny enough, Aphex wasn't the first opponent Stark fought that use the moon as his power: there was Akira from the second trial.
BOOM!
[You have been killed.]
His consciousness faded, only to come back a few seconds later, in the black void of his mind.
[Do you want to revive?]
[60 seconds left until permanent game over.]
Yet again, he was put on that timer, but it was fine.
A screen appeared before him, showing the exterior of the trial, where Follower suddenly held Aphex's leg with his chains.
"Looks like I have more time than I thought," Stark smirked, sighing, "You can come out now."
The moment he said those words, 5 figures emerged before him.
It was Domination, Soul Wielder, Alchemist, Exorcist and Incubus, all looking at him with wide smiles on their faces.
Domination was the basic one, completely red with a figure made out of crimson aura moving like waves and white eyes, "Here he is again..."
Alchemist was wearing his coat, a few potions in his hands, "You haven't been using me lately, heh?"
Exorcist's pupils were crimson crosses, and he had a halo above his head, his two hands joined together, "Eradicate the demons..."
Soul Wielder was also red, though a bit lighter than Domination, and with a heart mimicking his [Domination Soul] on his chest, "Bam! Headshot!"
And finally, Incubus was purple, with demons horns and a tail, "Can you stop fighting for a bit and actually get some play? I'm basically useless!"
Each of them had their own personalities, but they were all there, waiting for Stark to wake up and kick these guys' asses.
"Maybe try to throw my potions for once!"
"How about slamming them with the soul heart!"
"Idiots, he should clearly use the cross!"
"I'm useless, why am I even here..."
They all gave their own suggestions, except [Domination], who simply smiled.
He clapped his hands together once, sending a shockwave of aura forward.
"No need to do any of that," he snapped his fingers, and Stark's inventory appeared before him.
[Items: Double Power, Cooldown Gem, Clarity Orb, Blood-Stained Amulet]
There was no need to say or do anything to figure out what Stark needed to do.
He gazed at the [Cooldown Gem] before smiling, his aura flaring around him.
"Alright," he pointed at all his classes, snapping his fingers, all of them disappearing and seeping back into his body, "Let's nuke those assholes."
[Do you want to revive?]
[15 seconds left.]
"Yes," he nodded, and the space around him flashed in a blue light.
But not before one panel appeared.
A mysterious panel that had only appeared once before.
Ding!
[Skill: Revenant's Fury]
[Rank: Immortal]
[Description: Only activates after three deaths, have fun!]
[2/3 Deaths]
[One more, Chosen One.]
"Huh", he did remember getting such a skill from completing the tenth floor of the colosseum, but it was still weird to think it was still active.
It was just waiting for its moment to shine.
One more death and Stark would see its power.
But for now...
[Transferring you back to reality, be careful.]
Fwish!
The black space shattered like glass, his consciousness pulled forward at blinding speed.
...
The battlefield reappeared before him in a flash of light.
Aphex and Follower were locked in a fierce battle, but neither of them noticed the faint glow beginning to emanate from the center of the crater.
The glow intensified, forming into a concentrated ball of crimson energy.
The air grew heavy, charged with an overwhelming force that seemed to pull everything toward it.
Then, the ground shook violently.
Stark's body began to reconstruct itself, cell by cell, as if time itself was reversing the damage.
His crimson aura expanded outward, crackling with raw energy.
Bones reformed, muscles stretched, and skin wrapped around his frame, glowing with an ethereal sheen as his form became whole once more.
The process took mere moments, yet the power radiating from him was unlike anything before.
Stark opened his eyes, his gaze sharp and burning with fury.
The crater had deepened thanks to the [Moonlit Obliteration], going very far into the earth now.
"YOU FUCKING IDIOT! CHOSEN'S NOT DEAD!"
Stark heard Aphex shout that even from this distance, and so he knew he needed to act quickly.
He opened up his system inventory, pulling out the [Cooldown Gem] from it and using it immediately.
Ding!
[What skill do you want to reset the cooldown of?]
"Crimson Spears," by choosing that, every perk within it would come back!
Ding!
[Crimson Spears has been reset, every perk is now available.]
Above him, the two opponents were still arguing.
"That attack obliterated everything. There's no way he could've survived!"
"Then why the hell do you think I'm so desperate to kill him now?"
"Your bluff won't work on me, you lunatic-"
And at that moment, Stark felt that the moment was right.
He raised his hand upward, channeling all of his energy into his next attack.
HEAVEN'S SPEAR!
The sky split open as the [Angel of the Spear] appeared for the fourth time in this trial, ready to kick some ass.
"What the fuck..." Follower looked up, his eyes widening and pupils shaking: why was this thing back?!
"I TOLD YOU ALREADY, CHOSEN'S NOT DEAD!" Aphex shouted again, he had missed his chance because of this idiot.
And now that Stark was back, his strongest attack, akin to a legitimate nuke, available, he knew it was over.
In fact, Stark didn't even wait a single second, he didn't even want to see them or talk to them, neither did he want to make himself look superior.
Right now, he just wanted to win this and get out of this trial, no matter what.
And so he did the most logical thing.
"Angel of the spear," he whispered, smiling.
[Yes, master?]
The giant angel in the sky looked down at the trial, his gaze lingering on the two insects before it.
Fwish!
It used its power to summon the giant spear in its hands, ready to eradicate anything and everything.
"Throw that spear into them, I want them dead, but make sure to not throw it with so much power as to kill me or the girls too."
[Very well.]
The angel perfectly and immediately understood what Stark wanted from it as it had perfect control over the spear.
And so... what had to happen happened.
Fwish... BOOOM!
The angel threw the spear.
"HOLY SHIT!" Follower gasped.
"..." Aphex didn't even say anything.
