The table rotated to the tanned blond-haired man.
Tattoos spiraled down his arms, peeking out from beneath his tank top. Despite his casual attire, Alexis exuded a quiet intensity.
[Domination Power: Bullet Fists]
"Pleasure's all mine, champ," Alexis said with a lazy smirk.
He cracked his knuckles, and faint sparks of aura energy pulsed along his fists. "If it were up to me, we'd skip the show and go straight to seeing how long you'd last against these."
[This guy's all bark.]
"Next!" the glasses-wearing man chirped, hitting the button again before Stark could respond.
...
After the table spun for a few seconds, it stopped, revealing a slender, orange-haired woman in a flowing pink dress.
[Commander #2: Tia]
Beside her chair rested a massive hammer, nearly as tall as she was.
[Domination Power: Hammer of Elements]
"Do we really have to do this?" Tia complained, resting her chin on her palm.
Her sharp, aggressive tone completely clashed with her refined appearance. "We've got bigger problems than babysitting a kid."
"Relax, Tia," the man chimed in. "This is important!"
Stark tilted his head.
"[Cute dress. You always bring a hammer to tea parties?]"
Her eyes narrowed dangerously. "Say that again, and I'll show you why this hammer's famous."
[Sheesh, sensitive.]
...
The table rotated once more.
[Commander #3: Unity]
Stark found himself staring at a white-haired woman with a sleek bob cut.
Her hazel eyes were sharp, and her futuristic outfit shimmered faintly under the room's lighting.
[Domination Power: Mega Static]
From her ears protruded two small USB-like ports, faintly glowing.
Stark blinked at the odd detail but chose to keep his thoughts to himself.
"Behave yourself," Unity said, her tone icy. "We don't have time for your antics."
"Antics? I'm literally tied up," Stark replied, gesturing with his bound wrists. "What do you think I'm going to do? Escape mid-introduction?"
Unity's gaze didn't waver. "I'd put money on it."
...
[Commander #4: Ed]
Finally, the table stopped in front of Ed himself.
He was practically bouncing in his seat, his green shirt and pants giving him a carefree, quirky vibe.
His grin widened as the holographic text beside him displayed his information.
[Domination Power: Domi-Mechanician]
"And here I am, the genius who makes it all work!" Ed announced, spreading his arms theatrically. "Anything mechanical? I can dominate it. Drones, mechas, weapons, you name it, I build it!"
"Keep going," the lead commander said, clearly losing patience.
...
[Commander #5: Oliver]
The table made one final rotation, stopping before the towering figure of the lead commander.
Oliver stood as the holographic screen displayed his name and power.
Dark-skinned and built like a fortress, Oliver's presence alone seemed to command respect.
His muscles rippled beneath his bare chest, and he radiated an aura of raw strength.
[Domination Power: Universal Strength]
"Stark," Oliver said, his voice steady. "I'll keep this simple. You're no ordinary domination user. And whether you like it or not, you'll be fighting alongside us. Understand?"
Stark didn't respond immediately. His gaze flicked to the hologram, then back to Oliver.
[This guy's not messing around.]
As the table clicked back into place, the holographic screens faded, and Ed clapped his hands together.
"See? That wasn't so bad!"
"Can we focus now?" Unity snapped, her USB-like ports sparking faintly. "We're wasting time!"
The holographic screen behind them suddenly flickered, drawing everyone's attention.
It displayed live footage from another city under siege.
A massive creature, its body an unholy amalgamation of flesh and shadow was fighting a bunch of classifiers.
"That's Claire, Domination Power: Monster," Ed informed.
"One of the trial participants who didn't survive," Oliver said grimly. "Their transformation's power is tied to their class, amplified to Immortal-Level monsters."
[We already know, dumbass.]
The screen shifted to another city, where yet another monstrosity wreaked havoc.
Then another.
[Alert: Immortal-Level Monsters converging on cities.]
"We're out of time," Oliver said, rising to his feet. "Ed, I'll take Stark, each of you focus on the monsters you want."

chapters.title: Chapter 384 - 384: The Teleportation Room, Information about The Association
chapters.content:
"Make sure to follow your [Domination Detection Watches]; there's not a single minute to lose after that shitty introduction," Oliver groaned, throwing a pointed look at Ed.
"I'll work twice as hard, boss!" Ed snapped into a mock military pose before activating his boots.
With a burst of energy, he sped toward the next room, the door sliding open for him automatically.
"See you all in two hours," Tia said nonchalantly, grabbing her hammer and heading toward the same door.
"Give me thirty minutes, and I'll be done," Alexis added, his confidence radiating as he followed suit.
"..." Unity just shook her head, then began flying.
Stark watched them go, his curiosity piqued. They were all heading in the same direction, toward the same place. Why?
"That's the [Teleportation Room]," Oliver informed him as he grabbed Stark by the arm.
"..."
Oliver hoisted Stark effortlessly, as though he weighed nothing.
Stark didn't resist, not because he couldn't but because he wanted to observe what was happening.
[Yo.]
This time, his classes weren't answering one of the others' talk, but were speaking to Stark himself.
As he was being transported to the [Teleportation Room], a figure appeared in his vision.
It was a familiar one: a mix of every one of his classes, its color a mix of red, golden and blue.
That figure was wearing a lab coat, had the [Soul Heart] in front of it, an incubus tail and horns, a golden halo on top of its head and a vortex of color in its eyes, with pupils the shape of a crucifix.
[These cuffs are capable of restraining a normal Domination user,] the figure said, its voice smooth and confident, [But there are five of us in here. We can break free whenever you want.]
The figure's lips curved into a knowing smile.
'Good to know,' Stark thought, his expression neutral.
At least now he understood that he wasn't entirely powerless. Still, Oliver was a level 200 classifier, far above Stark's current level.
Even if Stark could break free, there was no guarantee he'd survive the fallout. For now, patience was the smarter choice.
The commanders were clearly gearing up for something major, and despite his usual snark, he knew this situation was far from ordinary.
Even the other commanders looked perplexed, as if this didn't happen often.
As Oliver carried him toward the [Teleportation Room], Stark raised an eyebrow, "Do you often have to intervene, doesn't look plausible to me."
Oliver ignored the comment, his focus unwavering.
The [Teleportation Room] came into view, and Stark's eyes widened.
The chamber was enormous, filled with intricate machinery that pulsed with faint, rhythmic energy.
Glowing runes adorned the floors and walls, humming with a quiet, mystical power.
At the center of the room stood ten large circular platforms, each one surrounded by delicate mechanical arms and glowing conduits.
Above each platform, a screen displayed a destination:
Fellarburg, Ostount, Lampod, Veldoria, Crystoria, Braemont, Avaris, Durathal, Myrelis, Zendorra.
The commanders were already preparing to deploy.
Each one of these platforms led to one of the countries in Rheria.
In fact, Stark didn't even know about any of these beside Fellarburg, as he was there all the time since he came to this world.
But the world was truly bigger than he thought.
'Something's not making sense, though,' he spoke to the figure that appeared, which floated in the air, following him and Oliver.
[Hm?]
'If there are so many countries, why were all the rifts where the apostles are located in Fellarburg.'
This couldn't be a coincidence.
[...]
No answer came, though the classes did smile.
[Plot armor, maybe?]
"Wow."
Or maybe Fellarburg was connected to the descent of the Godless Demon.
Stark shook off the thought for now.
"Alright, I'm going!" Alexis's voice snapped him back to reality.
He stepped onto a platform marked Lampod, offering a casual wave before disappearing in a flash of light.
"My robots will wipe these dumbasses out in seconds," Ed laughed as he headed toward the Braemont platform.
One by one, the commanders moved to their respective destinations, each vanishing in bursts of light.
"For your information, kid, check this out." Oliver raised his arm, revealing a sleek device strapped to his wrist.
It resembled a high-tech watch.
With a tap, a holographic display materialized, showcasing a detailed report:
[Entities: 11]
[4 in Fellarburg]
[2 in Lampod]
[3 in Ostount]
[1 in Braemont]
[1 in Veldoria]
"So I guess we're heading to…" Stark began.
"Veldoria," Oliver finished for him. His tone was grim. "That's where Clever's transformed form is. He's the strongest among them all. Even the other commanders wouldn't stand a chance against him."
Clever was already extremely strong in his human form, regarded as one of the strongest in the real world with his giant golden statue.
But now in his transformed form, where he didn't care about anything but chaos and death; it was a disaster.
"And to answer your earlier question," Oliver continued as they approached the Veldoria platform, "we don't usually intervene. Most monsters come from first- and second-domination trials, and the classifiers can handle those on their own."
This meant that, usually, the monsters could be easily dealt with by classifiers that had completed their respective trials.
"So this is… different?" Stark asked, though he already knew the answer.
"Yes, only around 3 to 4 third domination trials happen every year, meaning we have an extremely low number of people who have the power to deal with those."
Removing the high amount of deaths from these trials, you shouldn't forget the fact that in the majority of cases, every classifier inside dies.
"The power of the transformed monsters depends on the level of the trial, and thus, participants that were transformed inside a Death-Level trial are world-ending abominations."
Remember during the first trial, when the participants were transformed?
They were only level 15, meaning around level 100 classifiers.
Yet, as they were coming from a Death-Level Trial, their power and strength had been boosted to the point where they could cause havoc.
It was scary to think about, and Stark didn't want to end like those... things.
"Anyway, we have to deal with the strongest one, try not to die," Oliver laughed for the first time, and he looked demonic.
Stark frowned. "How am I supposed to fight if I'm restrained?"
Oliver smirked, his expression darkly amused. "You'll figure it out."
Before Stark could protest further, Oliver stepped onto the platform, dragging Stark with him.
"Launch," he commanded.
A burst of blinding light enveloped them, and Stark felt the world around him shift.

chapters.title: Chapter 385 - 385: Transformed Clever, The Giant Dark Gold Statue
chapters.content:
The blinding light of the teleportation portal subsided, Stark momentarily disoriented.
He blinked, his vision adjusting to the stark contrast of their new surroundings.
The capital of Veldoria was now in full view.
The sky was blue, and at first glance, everything seemed to be normal.
That is, if you ignored all the screams.
"RUN!"
"LOOK AT IT, FUCKING HELL!"
"SOMEONE HELP!"
Veldoria was NOT a country where powerful classifiers usually stayed.
Of course, it still had rifts and academies, but in comparison to Fellarburg, it was nothing.
While everyone was running in the opposite direction, Oliver, who was still carrying Stark in his arms, suddenly looked at the sky.
"Heh, this is more insane than I thought, I haven't seen something like that in my entire life."
What he said meant that through all these decades of being the commander of the [Domination Association], a thing of this scale had never happened before.
[Oh boy :)]
The "Classes Figure" materialized beside them, looking at the sky too, it was seemingly able to follow Stark wherever he went.
"So, where the hell is he—" Stark began, still cuffed, but his voice trailed off as his eyes looked up.
A colossal figure dominated the horizon, towering so high it seemed to scrape the heavens.
"…Oh," Stark muttered, his throat suddenly dry.
It was unmistakably a statue, but this wasn't like the decently-sized one Clever was known for in the real world.
This one was different, terrifyingly so.
Instead of shimmering gold, its surface was a dull, menacing dark gold, like corrupted metal that had absorbed centuries of despair.
It was as though the statue itself rejected light, devouring any radiance that dared approach it.
The statue's form was unnerving.
It was at least ten times as big as Clever's golden counterpart, and it still had one hundred arms, all raised toward the sky.
This statue exuded a feeling of dread, an oppressive weight that pressed against Stark's chest even from miles away.
Oliver nodded grimly. "That's him."
"Why isn't he attacking," Stark asked, confused.
With the sheer size of that thing, it should be easily able to defeat level 900-1000 classifiers, destroying entire cities by itself.
"No idea, I'll have to try and take it down, though."
[I think now should be the right time to leave that loser and go our separate ways :)]
'Not yet,' Stark's eyes burned with aura as he answered the Figure. 'I want to see.'
[Damn. Playing the long game, huh?]
'What's your way out, anyway?'
[Well, we actually have two ways, but we'll explain later. Just say "do it" when you're ready. No backing out after that!]
'Alright.'
Oliver dashed toward the statue, dodging panicked citizens, crushed vehicles, and destroyed buildings.
Stark bounced uncomfortably in his arms, the cuffs around his wrists still clinking.
The closer they got, the worse the destruction became.
Bodies of civilians and classifiers alike littered the ground, some crushed beyond recognition.
The ground was flat, scorched black by the statue's power.
The statue looked giant from everywhere, but he still had to run for a while before arriving to its location.
[Clever, Immortal-Level (Transformed)]
[Level: 180]
[Domination Power: 100-Golden Arms Statue.]
[Attributes: ???]
[Skills: ???]
Stark checked from afar, but alas, he was simply given basic information, the skills and attributes hidden from him.
Though the sole fact Clever was level 180 meant he would be insanely strong.
At the level of level 900 classifiers, if not more, especially with that power of his.
Thankfully enough, though, Oliver was level 200, meaning that it should be fairly easy to deal with it: the sole problem was the destruction that would occur.
The sheer weight of the statue's aura suffocated the air, and the figure only seemed larger now, its arms casting shadows over the broken streets below.
At its base, the devastation was absolute. Buildings no longer stood; they were piles of rubble.
In the center of it all, Clever sat.
He was no longer the frail old man Stark had once seen.
His appearance had been twisted, grotesquely enhanced by his transformation.
His body was now unnaturally tall and broad, clad in sleek, dark gold armor that shimmered faintly under the dim light.
His face, once lined with age, was hidden beneath a jagged mask that seemed to fuse with his flesh, only his crimson eyes glowing through the gaps.
Clever floated a few feet above the ground, legs crossed in a meditative pose.
Despite the carnage surrounding him, he exuded a calm, almost serene energy, his dark aura swirling lazily around him.
"Here it is," Oliver said, grinning as he finally set Stark down.
Clever's eyes snapped open, glowing brighter.
He regarded Oliver and Stark with mild interest, then spoke in a voice that echoed unnaturally, as though a dozen others spoke alongside him.
"You're here."
"My statue warned me."
Oliver cracked his knuckles. "I hope it warned you that you're about to die, too."
[Cringe one-liners,] the Classes Figure whispered beside him. "[Need help?]"
"Not yet," Stark replied, watching the scene unfold.
Clever unfolded his legs and rose slowly, his feet still hovering above the cracked ground.
His crimson eyes burned brighter, and the statue above him finally stirred, its hundred arms lowering in synchronization.
"Destruction and chaos," Clever said, his voice eerily calm. "That is all I want. I simply waited for a worthy opponent to appear. Otherwise, it would all be meaningless."
None of the transformed participants were under the influence of the Godless Demon, don't get it twisted.
It was simply their appearances becoming more grotesque, their powers growing stronger, and more importantly, their urges for violence reaching their max, forcing them to kill and destroy.
Clever seemed to be the only one strong enough to actually endure it a little bit, though he still wanted to fight and kill.
These things mimicked the original personalities.
"And now that you're here," Clever continued, a wicked smile spreading across his grotesque face, "this country will burn as I rip your body apart."
Clever raised an arm, and the dark gold statue above him responded instantly, its massive arms descending toward the battlefield.
Each arm carried enough force to flatten an entire city block, and even the faintest brush would mean death.
The crushed bodies of dozens of classifiers surrounding the area were evidence of that.
[A bunch of idiots :) They thought he was level 180. Adorable.]
Stark frowned.
These classifiers, and more specifically the ones that had a perception skill, probably saw level 180 on Clever's status windows, thus thinking that he was an easy target and that his statue was all for show.
Even after witnessing the Domination Trial, it was impossible for anybody to truly know about how the class worked after all.
It was only after hundreds of losses that they realized that this thing was in fact NOT level 180, as it was able to defeat level 900+ classifiers easily.
But as Clever laughed and the statue's arms began their descent, Oliver moved.
"Destruction!" Clever roared, his laughter echoing.
The statue's eye sockets flared with dark flames, its arms ready to strike.
"Sorry to disappoint you, old man," he grinned, "But I'm about to do something only a handful of domination users know of."
[...?]
"...?"
Stark was confused, and so right as he was about to ask for the classes to let him go, he suddenly stopped.
Was there such a thing? Or was Oliver bluffing?
There was no real way to stop the destruction that would happen, and even though Oliver was level 200, thus able to defeat Clever with time, he would still have to endure the assault of arms from the statue.
Or at least... that is what he believed.
Oliver stood firm, the air around him crackling with energy. "Pay attention, kid," he called over his shoulder.
Stark narrowed his eyes.
"That's something you only get after reaching level 200 of the domination class."
Clever's smile faded slightly, his eyes narrowing.
Oliver grinned wider.
"DOMINATION EXPANSION: ARENA SHOWDOWN!"

chapters.title: Chapter 386 - 386: Domination Expansion: Arena Showdown
chapters.content:
The words hung in the air like an unrelenting storm.
"DOMINATION EXPANSION: ARENA SHOWDOWN!"
Oliver's aura erupted outward in a torrent of crimson energy.
It swirled violently, spreading out in every direction and consuming the battlefield.
The space around them shimmered, bending and twisting as though reality itself was being rewritten.
Stark stumbled backward, his cuffs rattling as the Classes Figure smirked beside him.
[Well, that's something you don't see every day.]
A blinding flash enveloped everything.
And then...
Nothing.
The noise, the destruction, the chaos—it was gone.
When Stark's vision cleared, his breath caught in his throat.
They weren't in the city anymore.
The ground beneath his feet was smooth, polished obsidian, reflecting faint outlines of those standing upon it.
Around him rose towering, ethereal walls of fire, enclosing the space in a perfect circle.
Above, the sky was an endless void, stars twinkling faintly in its depths, as though the cosmos itself had been dragged into this new domain.
At the center of it all stood Oliver and Clever.
The giant, grotesque golden statue was still there, still in its overwhelmingly big size, it remained menacing, its hundred arms poised and ready to strike.
Oliver stood confidently across from Clever, his aura burning brighter than ever, casting long shadows across the arena.
Stark's eyes widened. "What... is this?"
Oliver didn't even glance back. "This is my domain."
"Your what now?!"
Stark was flabbergasted: in the year and half he had been in this stupid world, and since he acquired the [Domination] power, he had never heard of this.
Oliver did refer to it as a power only level 200 domination users would get, but even then.
Was this the true form of domination?
Would he also get it if he ever reached that level?!
[An explanation is needed!]
"Yes, it is," Stark groaned, wanting to know.
Ding!
[Domination Expansion]
[Once reaching level 200, your aura becomes powerful enough to use "Domination Expansion".]
[You can only use it once per month, as if you do it more, you risk death.]
"So I can use it multiple times in a row if I can handle it, huh."
[When using Domination Expansion, you utilize the entirety of your aura to create a domain of your own, where anyone who goes inside needs to abide to its rules.]
[That domain will surround you completely in a range that depends from aura to aura, and any enemy within range when the aura domain closes on them will be forcefully transported to this alternate dimension.]
[That is all that can be told for now :)]
"This is insane," Stark muttered, his voice barely audible.
His mind raced as the explanation appeared before his eyes, the familiar system notifications ringing in his head.
The Classes Figure chuckled beside him, its translucent form lazily floating above the polished obsidian floor.
Much like the [Domination Trial] though, [Domination Expansions] also had their own set of rules.
And as Stark was caught within the domain, he was forced to participate too.
Ding!
A panel appeared in front of each of them.
[Domination Expansion: Arena Showdown.]
[Rules: A massive arena, big enough to withstand the battle between two armies, the only rules are that the people inside need to fight to the death.]
[The domain will disappear the moment one person dies.]
"Did he set up those rules?" Stark tilted his head, they didn't seem that powerful after all.
[Yes and no,] Domination was the one who spoke, [Domination Expansions are different from one user to another, each one holding a different power, it could be as powerful as stopping time itself, causing constant damage to the opponent or even instantly killing them.]
"Kind of reminds me about that one manga that ended like-"
Zap!
-100!
"-Alright."
Clever tilted his head, the eerie crimson glow in his eyes intensifying. "A domain, is it? Interesting."
Oliver grinned, cracking his knuckles. "Guess I'm full of surprises."
"Hmm," Clever muttered, his grotesque form floating slightly above the ground. "This doesn't change anything. You've merely confined your death to another stage."
Oliver and Clever faced each other in the heart of the obsidian arena.
Stark could only watch from the sidelines, his mind still reeling from the absurdity of the situation.
Oliver rolled his shoulders, his aura crackling like a storm on the verge of breaking. His eyes were sharp, calculating.
"So," Oliver began, his voice steady, devoid of the bravado Stark was accustomed to hearing. "You're aware of the rules now, Clever. No running, no tricks. Just raw power and endurance."
Clever tilted his head, a mocking smile curling his lips. "It's amusing, really, you've forgotten who you're dealing with."
Clever's golden statue behind him shifted, the hundred grotesque arms lowering slightly as if preparing to strike.
His own aura darkened, a shadowy gold that pulsed with malevolence.
"You think you can endure me?" Clever's voice was low, almost a whisper, but it carried the weight of a predator toying with its prey.
Oliver raised an eyebrow, unimpressed. "Stop talking and show me."
Clever's grin widened. "As you wish."
Without warning, the air exploded with movement.
The statue's arms came to life, each one moving with terrifying speed and precision, striking toward Oliver like a volley of spears.
Oliver didn't flinch.
His aura surged, and he stepped into the attack rather than away.
With a sweep of his arm, he redirected one of the statue's arms, the impact shaking the ground beneath their feet.
Another arm came from above, and Oliver ducked, pivoting fluidly to avoid it.
[Domination Power: Universal Strength]
'I guess the name of his power didn't lie,' Stark mumbled.
[Want to get out of the cuffs now?]
"Yeah, why not," Stark sighed, finally feeling ready even though he was in Oliver's domain.
He didn't want to die by a stray statue hand, after all.
[Here goes nothing...]
On the other side of the domain, the clash was relentless.
Oliver closed the distance, his movements precise and efficient.
He slammed his fist into Clever's midsection, his knuckles glowing with a crimson light.
-6,721,949!
Clever grunted, the force of the blow pushing him back a step, but he quickly recovered, retaliating with a sharp kick that Oliver barely dodged.
'Strong,' Oliver thought.
Even though Clever was supposed to be at level 180, his talents and domination powers were still seemingly superior to Oliver's.
The golden statue's arms moved in unison now, creating a coordinated assault that forced Oliver to stay on the defensive.
[Name: Clever - Transformed]
[Level: 180]
[HP: 93,278,051/100,000,000]
[Skills: Divine Pulverizer (Mythical), Thousandfold Destruction (Mythical), Zenith Eruption (Mythical), Shimmering Collapse (Mythical), Monumental Devastation (Mythical), Eternal Divide (Godly), Wrathful Annihilation (Godly), Crushing Infinity (Godly), Golden Tempest (Godly), Titan's Fury (Godly), Heaven's Rainfall (Immortal), Supreme Execution (Immortal), Zero Hand (Immortal++)]
This guy only had skills from the [Mythical] category and above, including three fucking Immortal ones.
The transformation had made Clever, a beast in the battlefield, into a whole demon.
And what the hell is Immortal+? Was it the next form of Immortal?
His [Zero Hand] from his human form was Immortal, but the + had just been added.
It didn't matter to Oliver, though, who simply got ready to fight with all his might, as in this space, the worse that could happen is for him to die.
Though he knew it was unlikely, even with the massive HP pool the transformed Clever had.
'Come on,' Stark groaned as the Classes Figure was busy dealing with the cuffs.
[On it, just be patient.]
The battle raged on, each clash of power shaking the obsidian arena like a thunderstorm.
Oliver darted forward, weaving between the relentless strikes of the golden statue's arms.
His aura flared, a blazing shield of crimson light that deflected one of the statue's fists inches from his face.
Clever's grin widened as he effortlessly commanded the grotesque monstrosity, its movements fluid despite its size.
"You're faster than I expected, Oliver," he said, his voice calm and condescending. "But speed won't save you here."
The golden arms launched another barrage, this time coordinated to trap Oliver.
Two came from the sides, one aimed to crush him from above, and another stabbed forward like a lance.
Oliver's eyes narrowed.
With a deep breath, his crimson aura surged, and he leaped straight into the onslaught.
Oliver spun mid-air, his aura condensing around his leg.
With one decisive kick, he cleaved through two of the statue's arms, sending fragments of shimmering gold scattering across the arena, destroying them completely.
The remaining arms closed in, but Oliver moved faster than Clever anticipated, rolling beneath them and striking at Clever himself with a devastating punch to the chest.
-8,455,372!
Clever stumbled, his grin faltering for a moment. The golden statue reeled, as though sharing its master's pain.
"You're persistent. I'll give you that," Clever muttered, regaining his composure. "But let's see how long you last."
With a snap of his fingers, the shattered arms of the statue reformed instantly, their golden hue gleaming brighter than before.
The sheer speed of their regeneration was staggering.
Stark watched from the sidelines, his jaw tightening. "He's just regenerating them? That's insane!"
Clever laughed, his tone mocking. "Surely you didn't think you could destroy my creation so easily? These hands are limitless, Oliver. No matter how strong you are, you'll fall eventually."
Oliver wiped the sweat from his brow, a confident smirk playing across his lips. "Limitless, huh? Let's test that."
One of the golden arms launched at him like a spear, faster and more forceful than any of its previous strikes.
The air around it warped as it tore through space, aimed straight at Oliver's chest.
But Oliver didn't flinch.
As the arm closed in, he extended his hand and caught it mid-thrust.
The force of the impact sent shockwaves rippling across the arena, the ground beneath his feet cracking under the strain.
For a moment, the world seemed to hold its breath.
Then, with a roar, Oliver's aura erupted, and he crushed the golden arm in his grip. The limb shattered into a million pieces, golden dust scattering like glittering rain.
"You're weak," Oliver taunted, his voice cutting through the tense silence. He tossed the remnants aside like trash, his smirk widening.
Clever tilted his head, unbothered.
True to his words from before, the golden fragments began to reform, pulling themselves back into shape with a metallic hum.
Clever's grin returned, broader than ever. "Please, keep trying. I enjoy the effort."
Oliver tightened his fists, his aura crackling. "Then I'll just have to destroy them faster than you can fix them."
The two locked eyes, the tension between them palpable. And then, in a blur of motion, the next assault began.
This time though... they started using their skills.
On the other hand, Stark was simply waiting for the classes to do their only job: liberate him.

chapters.title: Chapter 387 - 387: Oliver VS Clever, Stark Frees Himself
chapters.content:
Stark clenched his fists, feeling the weight of the cuffs dragging down his energy like anchors.
His gaze burned toward the [Classes Figure], which hovered silently, studying the restraints.
It extended a shimmering, translucent hand toward the cuffs, its movements precise and deliberate.
A faint light emanated from its touch as it probed the crimson runes etched into the metal.
For a moment, Stark felt a flicker of hope as the cuffs grew warm.
The warmth turned to heat, then pressure.
Suddenly, the runes flared violently, a shockwave of red energy forcing the [Classes Figure] back.
Stark winced as the recoil sent a stinging jolt through his arms.
"Not working?" Stark gritted through his teeth, struggling to keep his tone even.
The [Classes Figure] straightened, its form rippling faintly as if absorbing the feedback.
Without a word, it returned to the task, this time pressing its other hand against the cuffs.
The glow intensified, a low hum building in the air as the runes flared again, brighter than before.
The resistance was palpable, an invisible force pushing back against the [Classes Figure]'s efforts.
The cuffs emitted a sharp, metallic screech as the runes writhed under the strain, refusing to give way.
Seconds stretched into what felt like hours, Stark's patience wearing thin.
The sound of distant battle reached his ears, explosions, the clash of power, and the guttural roar of the regenerating golden beast.
"Enough!" Stark growled, his aura flaring uncontrollably. "Put more into it!"
The [Classes Figure] didn't respond, but its presence grew heavier.
It dug its fingers into the cuffs, the translucent edges of its form hardening like steel.
The hum grew deafening, the air around Stark vibrating with energy.
Then, with a blinding flash, the runes cracked.
[Now it's time,] The Classes grinned, backing away, [Domination skill won't work on it, but we have other classes, which means it's gonna be easy work.]
And so, all the [Classes Figure] did was summon the giant crimson/golden cross from [Wielding Cross].
"Hey, what are you doing with that thing-"
Stark didn't have the time to finish that the figure smashed it onto the boy.
BAM!
-6,281!
[Calm down, it's your own power, it won't hurt much.]
"YOU LITTLE-"
Stark wanted to shout, but... it worked.
The sound of shattering metal echoed through the chamber as the cuffs fell away, breaking into fragments at Stark's feet.
The moment they were gone, Stark felt his power surge back, a wave of energy rushing through him like a long-lost part of his soul.
He flexed his fingers, the crimson aura around his hands flaring to life.
Without looking at the [Classes Figure], he muttered, "Finally."
The translucent being hovered quietly, its task complete, before fading into the shadows.
"At least I can defend myself now."
Stark turned toward the battlefield, his expression dark.
Oliver and Clever were staring at one another.
On one hand, a guy that could destroy divine hands with his sheer strength, and on the other, an old man that could destroy entire cities in mere instants thanks to his statue.
And they were both stuck inside of that domain.
"You angered me, now the world will perish as soon as I deal with you."
"Yeah, yeah, whatever," Oliver grinned, positioning his fists.
Remember how every domination's power works different?
Well, Oliver was one of those.
It would be way too simple to just have him have different skills with his [Universal Strength] domination power, so instead, the system or whoever decides about those things gave him a new "mechanic".
Stark activated his [Perception], and the result was quite shocking.
...
[Name: Oliver]
[Level: 200]
[Class: Domination - Universal Strength]
[HP: 1,500,000]
[Strength: 99,999]
[Stamina: 56,821]
[Speed: 47,859]
[Defense: 78,273]
[Skills: 10%, 20%, 30% (Legendary+), 40% (Legendary+), 50% (Mythical), 60% (Mythical+), 70% (Godly), 80% (Godly+), 90% (Immortal), 100% (Immortal+), 200% (Immortal++), 300% (Immortal+++)]
...
"Huh."
Each of his skills were percentages, and for some reason, even his third skill was ranked as legendary.
In addition to that, he also had those + signs beside the ranks of his skills.
These were the indicatives given to skills when they were strong enough to be beyond their rank, but not quite at the next one.
It was a middle-ground.
The most shocking of all, though... was the [Immortal+++] one.
Immortal skills were already a death sentence by themselves, as they were the highest ranked ones, but if you added even a single + sign, it was terrifying.
And yet, you're telling him that his highest skill had three +'s?
The sole reason it wasn't beyond Immortal was because it was just straight up impossible, since there's nothing...
Just how powerful could it be?
Four immortal skills, with increasing percentages and plus signs next to their ranks.
"..." Stark decided to watch for now, preserving his own life inside that domain, as he couldn't escape even if he tried.
The atmosphere in the domain grew thick, the air buzzing with raw energy as Oliver cracked his knuckles.
Across the battlefield, Clever stood with his regenerating golden statue looming behind him, its hundred arms twitching with restrained fury.
The statue's radiant golden aura clashed against the fiery crimson of Oliver's power, creating a dazzling storm of light and heat.
Oliver smirked, his muscles flexing as a faint golden glow enveloped his body.
He raised a single finger and tapped his temple.
"Alright, let's keep this interesting," he said, his grin widening. "I'll start light, 10% should do."
Oliver enjoyed doing this in every single one of his fights: using one skill after the other, as the percentages displayed were the actual increase in his strength.
He really liked seeing just how far an opponent could take it before falling.
As the words left his lips, Oliver's aura intensified ever so slightly, and the ground beneath his feet cracked.
Without hesitation, Clever commanded his statue to move.
"Thousandfold Destruction," Clever intoned, his voice cold and calculated.
The golden statue blurred as its hundred arms moved with unthinkable speed, delivering a hurricane of punches.
Each strike carried the weight of a mountain, the air around them screaming with the sheer force of the blows.
A storm of golden energy formed, tearing through the domain in a vortex of destruction.
"Holy shit..." Stark could handle it as he was pretty far, but their power was terrifying.
Oliver didn't flinch.
As the first punch reached him, he twisted his body slightly, dodging with millimeter precision.
Another punch followed, then another, but Oliver flowed through the onslaught with ease, his movements effortless.
"You call this a warm-up?" Oliver mocked, his voice carrying over the cacophony.
Suddenly, Oliver ducked low and launched forward with explosive speed.
He didn't have any fancy skills: the only thing that he could do was increase his strength, then everything else was up to him and the mastery of his domination power.
His fist connected with dozens of the golden arms, the impact shattering them into fragments of light.
The statue recoiled, its remaining arms forming a barrier around Clever.
"Zenith Eruption," Clever commanded, unfazed.
Golden pillars erupted from the ground in rapid succession, each one detonating in a cascading burst.
The blasts were relentless, the battlefield a sea of explosions.
Oliver skidded to a halt, his grin fading slightly. "Alright, this is more like it."
He stomped the ground, launching himself into the air to avoid the next eruption.
As he descended, his fist began to glow with a brilliant light.
"Let's bump it up: 20%."
With a thunderous roar, Oliver slammed his fist into the ground.
The resulting shockwave annihilated the remaining pillars, the force ripping through the domain and sending Clever sliding back.
-3,837,271!
Even the shockwave of the attack dealt damage.
Clever scowled, "Radiant Meteorfall."
[Description: Golden hands launch into the sky, transforming into radiant meteors that rain down upon the battlefield. Each meteor strikes with the force of a celestial object, leaving fiery golden craters and stunning impact zones.]
The statue's golden hands shot into the sky, transforming into blazing meteors.
They rained down upon Oliver with devastating speed, each impact shaking the domain.
Oliver planted his feet firmly, his aura flaring brighter.
He raised both arms, deflecting meteors with precision strikes. Each one exploded on contact, but none managed to faze him.
"Not bad," Oliver admitted, his tone still playful. "Let's go 30%."
The domain trembled as his power surged, cracks forming in the air itself.
Clever narrowed his eyes, realizing Oliver was only getting started.
And waiting until Oliver was at full power to use his strongest skills was stupid.
So instead...
"Supreme Execution," Clever declared, his voice echoing ominously.
[Description: Clever summons five giant golden arms, each delivering a devastating attack in sequence before merging into a final cataclysmic strike. The final blow creates a golden shockwave that decimates everything within its radius.]
He decided to use one of his immortal skills immediately.
Five colossal golden arms materialized around the statue, their size dwarfing the battlefield.
Each one drew back, preparing a strike that could level entire mountains.
Oliver's grin returned, wider than ever. "Now this is a fight."
The five arms launched forward simultaneously, the sheer force of their movement distorting the space around them.
Oliver clenched his fists, his aura blazing like a sun.
The screen of energy exploded outward as Oliver met the first arm head-on, his punch colliding with its golden surface.
The shockwave that followed was deafening, shaking the domain to its core.
And then—darkness.
When the dust settled, Oliver stood unharmed, the shattered remains of one golden arm falling around him like glittering ash.
The remaining four arms hovered ominously, preparing their next attack.
"Still holding back, Clever?" Oliver taunted.
Clever's eyes burned with fury as he uttered three words: "You'll regret this."
The four remaining arms prepared to attack.
Oliver's grin finally faded, replaced by a look of pure exhilaration. "Guess I'll have to kick it up to 50% after all."

chapters.title: Chapter 388 - 388: The Battle of Powerhouses, Zero Hand is Absolute
chapters.content:
The battle raged on, the battlefield glowing with the remnants of golden light from Clever's Supreme Execution.
Four golden arms still loomed, each brimming with energy, poised to strike Oliver down.
Oliver stood his ground, his aura growing thicker and more menacing as his strength continued to rise.
His focus remained unshaken, his movements precise as he prepared to counter Clever's relentless assault.
Clever wasted no time, commanding the four remaining arms to attack in quick succession.
The first arm swung down with the force of a collapsing mountain, but Oliver sidestepped with uncanny precision, delivering a crushing blow to the golden construct.
The arm cracked, shards of golden energy scattering into the air.
The second and third arms attacked together, attempting to pin Oliver between their massive strikes.
Oliver, now at [70%] power, caught one arm mid-swing, his raw strength stopping it in its tracks, while he unleashed a devastating punch that shattered the other into golden fragments.
The force of his counterattack sent ripples across the battlefield, the ground beneath them crumbling under the sheer intensity of their clash.
"You're not keeping up, Clever," Oliver taunted, his grin sharp despite the sweat on his brow.
Clever snarled, his golden statue emitting a low, resonating hum as the fourth arm charged forward.
This time, the attack was swifter, imbued with an aura-infused burst of speed.
Oliver didn't dodge.
Instead, he braced himself, his aura flaring to its peak at [80%].
The arm collided with his crossed forearms, but because of Oliver's incredible defense and strength, it wasn't him that was moved, but the arm that broke.
He was just that strong.
Your [Domination] power completely depended on how you wielded the one you got, and [Universal Strength], even though it wasn't considered as one of the "strongest ones", was still really good.
Especially in the hands of Oliver, who perfectly handled it.
"Damn you!" Clever roared, his statue trembling with fury.
With all four arms destroyed, he activated the final phase of Supreme Execution.
"HANDLE THIS, THEN!"
The energy from the shattered arms surged back into the statue, condensing into a single cataclysmic strike.
The golden hand grew massive, radiating destructive energy.
It was no longer just a weapon, it was a force of nature.
Clever commanded it forward.
[You should move :)]
Stark was warned, and so the boy immediately backed away, preferring to simply watch for now.
If Oliver could win, then it would be good as he was able to leave, but if he did in fact die, Stark would simply nuke Clever again.
Oliver planted his feet, his aura now reaching [90%].
He raised his fists, ready to meet the strike head-on.
The collision was apocalyptic.
The golden hand slammed into Oliver with enough force to obliterate everything within its radius.
A golden shockwave erupted outward, consuming the battlefield in a blinding flash.
When the dust settled, Oliver stood at the epicenter of the destruction, battered but unbroken.
His aura had risen to its full normal capacity, [100%].
The golden hand was gone, shattered into oblivion by his sheer power.
"You little shit..." Clever roared with all of his might, "Your confidence will be your downfall!"
"You can't beat me, and I still have two more transformations, each just as strong as the previous ones combined," Oliver smiled, absolutely certain this was his victory.
Though the difference between level 180 and level 200 was large, it didn't meant that one couldn't defeat the other.
But Clever wasn't done.
His statue, though visibly damaged, roared to life once more.
Clever's expression twisted into one of pure determination as he prepared to unleash his ultimate skill: Zero Hand.
If Supreme Execution and nothing else worked, then Zero Hand, the skill he used in the trial to protect himself from [Heaven's Spear], was his only solution.
The golden aura surrounding the statue began to condense, shrinking and compressing into a single point.
The energy became crystalline, forming a massive diamond hand.
The air grew heavy, every molecule vibrating with the overwhelming pressure of the attack.
"Zero Hand!" Clever declared, his voice echoing across the battlefield.
The diamond hand hovered in the air, shimmering with unmatched power.
It was, in fact, even bigger than the one he used to protect himself in the trial, a result of his transformation into a monster.
It was no ordinary strike, this was the culmination of Clever's strength, a technique that sacrificed all his aura to create a singular, unstoppable force.
Oliver's eyes narrowed, his body tensing as he prepared for the incoming attack.
But Clever had other plans.
The diamond hand surged forward.
"200%," Oliver grinned, "Now you can't even hope to hurt me, fucker."
And at that moment, Oliver committed his greatest mistake.
He was all-powerful, he was extremely strong, almost no one could beat him.
And yet, even being outsmarted once could mean the end of his life.
This was that moment that every classifier feared.
He got positioned to handle the giant diamond hand, the size of a big city block, deflecting it or destroying it.
"Idiot..." Clever whispered, knowing that he had won at that moment.
Because instead of striking, the "Zero Hand" veered off course.
In a split second, it suddenly opened and reached out to Oliver, wrapping around him like an unbreakable cage.
The immense strength of the hand locked Oliver in place, its crushing grip rendering him immobile.
"I GOT YOU, DUMBASS!" Clever shouted, his voice filled with triumphant glee.
Oliver's expression shifted from confidence to shock.
He struggled against the grip, his muscles straining as he pushed his power to its limits.
But the diamond hand didn't budge.
"What the-?!" Oliver exclaimed, his voice tinged with disbelief.
The grip tightened.
Oliver could feel the full weight of Clever's aura bearing down on him, amplified by the power of the statue. It was unyielding.
Zero Hand was too powerful, and restrained like this, even his current strength didn't make it budge.
It was the entirety of Clever's aura and the full power of the statue too, it just wasn't breakable.
"You thought you could handle everything, huh?" Clever sneered, leaping onto the diamond hand.
He crouched down in front of Oliver, staring directly into his restrained face. "How does it feel? You're a fucking idiot, and now you're about to be squeezed to death."
Oliver's eyes widened, his composure cracking under the sheer impossibility of the situation.
This wasn't something he could simply break free from. Zero Hand wasn't just powerful, it was absolute.
And there was no "haha you think I'm weak, but I have a comeback", Oliver was genuinely fucked, you can't escape Zero Hand.
He tried to push back, summoning every ounce of his strength.
His aura flared wildly, reaching [300%] for a brief moment, but it wasn't enough.
The system itself seemed to mock him.
[You cannot in current position.]
Frustration filled his gaze as he struggled in vain. He was truly trapped.
Clever smirked, savoring his victory.
"What's wrong, old man? Out of tricks already?" He leaned closer, his grin widening. "You're done. And when you're dead, I'll destroy this country like I should've done from the start."
With a commanding gesture, Clever ordered the statue to tighten its grip.
The pressure increased, the diamond hand beginning to crush Oliver's form.
Slam!
Clever delivered a sharp kick to Oliver's face, though it had little effect beyond hurting his own foot. "Damn it," Clever hissed, clutching his throbbing leg. "Your face is like a damn rock."
He shook off the pain and turned back to the statue. "Crush him already! I've got better things to do than play with this guy."
The statue obeyed, its massive form leaning into the diamond hand as it applied even more pressure.
The ground beneath them cracked and groaned under the immense weight of the attack.
For the first time in the battle, Oliver seemed truly defeated.
The indomitable force that had carried him through countless fights now appeared powerless against Clever's ultimate move.
The battlefield grew silent, the only sound being the creaking of the diamond hand as it closed in on its prey.
Oliver's fate seemed sealed.

chapters.title: Chapter 389 - 389: Oliver's in a Pinch, It's Stark's Turn to Act Now
chapters.content:
"Damn, level 200 and he still got caught," Stark grinned.
He stood at a distance, his sharp gaze locked onto the battlefield where Oliver was trapped, struggling desperately against the crushing grip of the massive diamond hand.
The once-unshakable confidence on Oliver's face was gone, replaced with an expression of grim determination as he fought against what seemed like an impossible force.
But it wasn't working.
For the first time, Oliver's raw strength had failed him.
The diamond hand, formed from Clever's ultimate skill, Zero Hand, was unyielding, and Stark could see that Oliver's aura was flickering under the immense pressure.
"I guess levels don't mean shit when something like this happen," Stark mumbled, "I should have known after using Heaven's Spear this much, though."
[Not gonna do anything :)?]
The classes figure appeared again, staring at the giant statue holding Oliver with all its might.
"The only thing I could do is use [Heaven's Spear], which would kill Oliver too."
[Heh, who even cares?] It shrugged.
And at that sentence, Stark's eyes narrowed a little.
"That's..." Stark put his hand on his chin, scratching it, "That's actually true."
[He's gonna die if you don't do anything anyway, might as well let him be experience points for us :)]
Stark looked to the void above, focusing his energy as he prepared to summon the weapon that had saved him countless times before.
Heaven's Spear.
"I hope it works even in Domination Expansions."
The atmosphere shifted as a colossal rift tore open in the sky above the arena, revealing the radiant figure of the angelic being.
Its form glowed with divine power, its massive wings spread wide as it carried a spear that radiated an overwhelming holy energy.
The sight alone was enough to make even the most hardened warriors falter.
The angel gazed down with cold, piercing eyes, its very presence exuding an aura of judgment.
Clever's eyes widened in pure terror.
"No... not again," he whispered, his voice trembling.
In an instant, memories of his death as a human flooded his mind.
He had faced this before—the same spear, the same overwhelming force.
The pain, the helplessness, the inevitability of it all, it all came rushing back.
He instinctively released Oliver, the diamond hand moving back as Clever focused all his energy on defending himself.
He brought the Zero Hand to him, its immense size and power returning as it hovered between him and the angelic figure.
But as the energy condensed into the hand, another memory surfaced, one that froze Clever in place.
"Wait a minute..." he looked at the diamond hand, "I... Did this before, didn't I?!"
When transformed from a trial, you only retained your core memories, so things like this weren't remembered.
This attack was impossible to avoid.
Heaven's Spear didn't miss. It didn't stop. It didn't forgive.
Stark didn't hesitate.
He raised his hand, his expression cold and unyielding, and sent the massive spear hurtling toward the battlefield.
He didn't care if Oliver got caught in the blast. This was the only way.
The spear descended like a falling star, its radiant energy growing brighter and hotter with each passing second.
The angel's form vanished as the spear reached terminal velocity, a beam of pure divine energy trailing behind it.
"NO!" Clever roared, his voice echoing across the battlefield as he thrust Zero Hand forward in a desperate attempt to block the attack.
BOOOOOOOM!
The impact was cataclysmic.
The moment the spear collided with the ground, an explosion of light and sound erupted, blinding everyone within miles.
The sheer force of the blast tore through the earth, ripping apart the arena and sending shockwaves that shook the very air.
A deafening roar drowned out everything as the divine energy consumed everything in its radius.
The golden statue shattered instantly, its once-imposing form reduced to nothing but fragments of glowing debris.
Clever, caught in the direct blast, let out one final, agonized scream before his voice was silenced, his monstrous form obliterated by the overwhelming power of the spear.
Even Oliver, despite his immense durability, was caught in the blast.
Stark, standing far at the edge of the arena, shielded himself with a protective barrier of aura, watching as the divine light gradually faded.
He had poured an incredible amount of his own power into the spear, not holding back for even a moment.
As the dust began to settle, the arena was left in utter ruin.
The once-imposing battlefield was now a smoldering crater, the air thick with heat and the faint hum of residual energy.
Everything in the center of the explosion had been completely vaporized.
Nothing remained.
"..."
Then, a system notification flashed before his eyes:
[You have slain "Clever - Godless Transformation", gaining 600,000,000 experience points.]
Stark froze, his eyes wide as he read the notification.
Six hundred million?
He blinked, rereading the number.
The sheer magnitude of it left him momentarily stunned.
It was the largest amount of experience he had ever received in a single moment, far surpassing anything he had encountered before.
But then again, it made sense.
Clever wasn't just any opponent, he was a level 180 domination monster, transformed into a Godless entity, with power leagues above most classifiers Stark had faced.
Ding! Ding! Ding!
And so the level-up notifications flooded in.
[Your level has increased to level 148, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Your level has increased to level 149, granting you five skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Your level has increased to level 150, granting you six skill points and a boost in stats.]
Ding!
[Level 150 Reached!]
But of course, this wasn't the end.
[Your level has increased to level 151, granting you six skill points and a boost in stats.]
.
.
[Your level has increased to level 156, granting you six skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Experience: 34,545,000/84,000,000]
Once reaching level 150, the increase of experience between each level is at 4,000,000.
Soon enough, even those 600,000,000 experience points would only result in Stark leveling up four to five times if this kept going like this.
And of course, reaching level 150 meant crossing one of the most important milestones Stark had reached yet.
Ding! Ding! Ding!
Several panels appeared around him to confirm that fact.
Now that he was alone in this place, there wasn't any need to worry.
But...
"Wait a minute."
[:)]
"Why didn't I get experience from killing Oliver? He's level 200, I should have gotten around a billion, shouldn't I?"
[...]
"Then maybe..."
Stark turned toward the crater, and in the distance, the figure of the domination association leader rose up.
[Oliver HP: 1/1,500,000]
He was bloodied and most of his bones were broken, but he had survived.
"..."
[How about we kill him while he's low?] The classes figure grinned, [Easiest experience points ever.]
"Hm..."
That idea was actually kind of good for Stark.
The fact he could gain around 8 to 10 more levels was extremely appealing.
And so, putting aside the several notifications and panels that prompted him to read them, he advanced forward, toward Oliver.
He didn't know what his intentions were yet, but it was surprising that he survived [Heaven's Spear], even though he was a level 200 classifier.

chapters.title: Chapter 390 - 390: Completing the Domination Expansion, Return to Headquarters
chapters.content:
"Damn it," Oliver groaned, rising up from the crater formed from the [Heaven's Spear].
His entire body was aching, and several bones were broken, but even then, he could still move his two legs.
"First of all, how did he even get out of the-" Oliver mumbled, but his voice was cut off once he looked up, just to see Stark staring down at him from above.
Stark's figure was shrouded by an imposing crimson aura, taking over his body.
"..." Stark didn't say anything, instead he just looked at the old man from above.
"Kid," Oliver started, sweating a little, "That was... surprising."
"Was it?"
[Oliver HP: 1/1,500,000]
"I mean... you forced yourself out of the domination cuffs, and managed to kill Clever again, not anybody could do that."
"..."
Crack! Crack!
Cracks began to appear all over the arena.
One of the rules of this [Arena Showdown] Domination Expansion had been met: for someone to die, meaning that it was soon going to break.
"Oliver, do you think you can beat me in your state?" Stark smiled.
"..." and at those words, Oliver's expression darkened, "Yes, I would still kick your ass if I was blinded with my two legs amputated."
The determination in his gaze was unwavering.
[Hm...] the Classes Figure appeared beside Stark, analyzing Oliver, [I don't know, I'll give it a 50/50, maybe you shouldn't try.]
If even the classes didn't approve of that, then it meant he truly should watch out.
"Alright," Stark nodded, letting go of the intimidating aura around his body, "How did you survive."
"Talent, what else."
"Oh."
Stark believed that he was the only one that had gotten a talent, but it seems like though they were extremely rare, some other individuals did too.
"The talent's name is [Sturdy Body]."
[Description: If on the verge of dying and you get hit by a powerful attack, your sturdy body will use its aura to block up to three attacks, dropping your health to one hp instead of dying.]
"Oh."
That was pretty much a triple revive, if you could consider it that.
"Don't get it twisted," Oliver sighed, getting up, "There are a lot of rules for this talent, so it's not like I can abuse it."
"Alright," Stark mumbled, looking around at the arena, which was breaking apart, "You'll tell me more, I hope."
"No problem," Oliver though he was back up, knew he couldn't afford to let his guard down.
He felt that Stark was extremely unstable, able to do anything if it meant getting more levels and grow stronger.
But maybe... they could use that...
The Domination Association had several missions that were incomplete as nobody, even the commanders, wanted to deal with them.
And also because getting to them or completing them in the first place is too difficult.
"Don't run, kid, we won't handcuff you anymore," Oliver marched forward, looking around, "Well, not like you won't just break them apart anyway."
"..."
Stark wanted to check his panels now, but he needed to wait for the domain to break, and for him to go somewhere safe.
After some time, there was an ominous sound in the arena, and a panel appeared in front of the two.
[Domination Expansion: Arena Showdown.]
[Status: Completed]
[Reward: None, since didn't do anything.]
"Oh."
"You get rewards based on the rules of your domination expansion, and if you make it too overpowered, you may even receive permanent debuffs," Oliver grinned, "As mine is simply a way to lock down an opponent and fight fairly in a 1v1, then it greatly helps."
It explained why Oliver's strength was at 99,999+ now: every time he fought an opponent at equal level or just slightly lower.
"Don't get twisted, the reward is based on the level of the opponent I fight, and as you see, I get nothing this time since you did the work," Oliver sighed, "Too bad, these rewards are always useful."
The arena groaned, the cracks widening with each passing second as the energy sustaining the Domination Expansion began to unravel.
Stark and Oliver both stood still, their gazes fixed on the crumbling surroundings.
Then a sharp, ominous snap echoed through the air.
The ground beneath them shimmered, the once-solid battlefield fracturing into countless shards of light.
The dome that had encased the area started to dissolve, its edges fading into nothingness.
With one final, deafening crack, the domain collapsed entirely.
Stark and Oliver found themselves back in the capital of Veldoria.
The air was thick with the stench of ash and scorched stone.
The once-bustling streets were unrecognizable, reduced to a smoldering wasteland by the battles Clever had with the other classifiers.
"Back to reality," Oliver muttered, adjusting his stance, "I just need to get healed now, and we're done."
"..." Stark didn't say anything.
He had survived an entire death-level domination trial, killed an apostle, fought a godless demon transformed human and now used another skill to kill another transformed human.
With all of that in quick succession, anyone would be exhausted.
It was already a miracle he wasn't dead, but what can Stark say, it was just his destiny as the Chosen One.
"Kid," Oliver said, breaking the silence, "we need to move."
Stark glanced at him, his expression unreadable. "How?"
Oliver sighed, leaning heavily on his uninjured leg. "Grab my shoulder and endure. It might feel... odd the first time you travel with a Multi-Task Watch."
Without waiting for a response, Oliver tapped the sleek device strapped to his wrist.
It shimmered faintly, the embedded runes lighting up in sequence as he adjusted its settings.
Stark hesitated for a moment, then placed a hand on Oliver's shoulder.
"Brace yourself," Oliver warned, the faintest grin tugging at the corner of his lips. "This isn't like your typical teleportation spell."
With a final tap, the Spatial Watch activated.
The world around them blurred and twisted, as though the very fabric of reality had been yanked sideways.
Stark felt his stomach lurch, the sensation unlike anything he had ever experienced.
It was as if his body was being compressed into a singular point before being stretched across an infinite void.
Then, as suddenly as it began, the sensation ended.
They reappeared in the Teleportation Room of the Domination Association's headquarters.
A faint hum of energy filled the space, emanating from the teleportation platforms scattered throughout.
Oliver staggered slightly but caught himself, grimacing as he straightened. "Told you it'd be weird."
Stark blinked, his senses slowly readjusting.
"Invented by yours truly," Ed appeared behind them, putting his hands around both Oliver's and Stark's shoulders, "There's not a single one of my inventions that doesn't work!"
"Oh yeah, concerning that, your domination handcuffs broke," Oliver groaned before walking away, "I'm taking a break after that, call the medics please."
His body was still aching even though he acted tough.
"W-What do you mean, the handcuffs broke?!" Ed panicked: this would be the first time one of his inventions failed.
That guy managed to invent a watch and machines that could teleport people, handcuffs that restrained power shouldn't be difficult to create, at least for him!
"Just look at the boy, I wasn't the one that let him go by the way, I'm out," and with that, Oliver left, the sliding door automatically closing behind him.
Ed looked at Stark, he thought that Oliver had trusted the boy enough to liberate him, but he had just confirmed this wasn't the case.
Which meant...
"I broke them, my bad," Stark shrugged, "You got anywhere where I can take a break?"
"..." Ed couldn't hide his shock, his eyes widening, "This is... damn..."
He wanted to ask how he did that, but... Ed felt like that it was just that Stark was special.
His instincts had almost never deceived him, and this time they screamed that Stark wasn't normal.
"Here, take this," Ed took one of the watches Oliver was wearing from his backpack and handed it to Stark, "These watches are so rare and exclusive that only the commanders usually get them."
Stark wanted to refuse while saying that he wasn't going to be part of their little group, but to be honest, after seeing what this watch can do, he wasn't about to refuse.
[Multi-Task Watch (Artifact Item)]
[Description: Created by the genius "Domi-Mechanician" Ed, able to do many things at once, but you should test it out for yourself.]
He took it in hand, thanking Ed, then placed it inside of his [Spatial Inventory].
"Wow! What kind of technology is that?!"
"A skill."
"Damn," Ed sighed, "Well, let me guide you to one of our luxurious rooms, where you'll be able to rest as much as needed."
"Where are the others?"
"Still doing their own missions, I guess, since they had more participants to find and kill."
Both Ed and Oliver only had one transformed participant inside their respective countries, so it was obvious they would complete it faster.
Knowing he couldn't do anything more, Stark simply followed the commander, hoping to get a good night of sleep after all this time.
'I'll check those panels in due time,' he thought.

chapters.title: Chapter 391 - 391: The VIP rooms, Contacting the Girls
chapters.content:
"Wow."
Stark didn't expect for the [Domination Association Headquarters] to be so... big and luxurious.
There were hundreds of rooms that stretched all around, and even Ed seemed to be forced to use the watch on his wrist to navigate.
Sometimes they would see some other members, who would bow at Ed, or back away after seeing Stark in person.
There were cafeterias, gyms and everything you needed, almost like a mini-city.
"Our headquarters hold enough space and rooms to house around 1,000 people, meaning that most if not all of our members can stay here if they want."
"So they can go away if needed?" Stark asked after hearing the last part.
"Yeah, we don't restrain them, though many prefer staying here since it makes it easier for missions," Ed smiled, "And probably because it's free..."
To begin with, the Domination Association doesn't even have as many members as you think it does.
If you were to really count them, you would realize that there were a maximum of 1,000 people in the association at once.
Recruiting more was difficult, and though deaths didn't happen often as they always gave missions to the people who could respectively complete them, it didn't mean it was impossible.
The [Domination] class was rare to begin with, so let's not add all the people that die in the trials.
"We can still handle everything right now, but with the secret revealed, more problems might emerge now," Ed sighed, "I really don't know what was different with that trial for it to reveal it to the whole world..."
"..." Stark didn't say anything.
He still had 5 more apostles to kill, then possibly the Godless Demon himself.
If the Domination Association, and especially the commanders, were as strong as he thought, then maybe they could help...
"Here, VIP rooms, even more luxurious than the normal ones," Ed smiled warmly, "There's only twenty of those, reserved for the commanders and some other high-class members, you should be proud."
"Alright..."
"VIP members use their watches to access their rooms, no one else is allowed to, except if you want to bring a girl in to... you know... hah."
"...I won't."
"Alright," Ed sighed, "I set your watch as VIP, meaning that you get every single feature there is, enjoy it."
These [Multi-Task Watches] came in different ranks, and the higher-ranked you were, the more features they had.
Of course, though, it wasn't because the domination association didn't want to give its members the privilege as it would greatly help in mission: it was more like they couldn't.
The [Multi-Task Watches] used aura to function, and only someone with an extremely potent and powerful aura could fully utilize it.
Basically... only the commanders and very powerful people in the association could.
"Spatial Inventory," Stark put his hand inside of the inventory void, then pulled out the [Multi-Task Watch] he was given.
Without waiting, he placed it in front of the scanner, and the screen above the door suddenly.
The name [Stark] was now moving from the left to the right side.
"Good job, you now own this room until you either leave the association or die!"
"I'm not part of the association."
"Who cares? Even if you're not a member, people who help are appreciated."
"Alright."
The sliding door automatically opened as the scanner identified Stark.
[Welcome back, Stark Heartsouls, enjoy your rest.]
All of this was extremely technological, probably built by Ed at lightning speed.
Stark eyed the [Domi-Mechanician], wondering just how practical his powers would be in battle.
"See you later, kid, there will probably be a meeting after the mission, so take as much rest as needed."
"Ok."
Ed quickly left afterward, off to do some other things.
"Here goes nothing..."
Stark stepped into the room and was immediately struck by its luxury.
A massive screen TV dominated one wall, seamlessly integrated into the sleek design.
In the center stood a plush king-sized bed with crimson silk sheets, exuding comfort.
To the side, a modern kitchen gleamed with high-tech appliances, complete with a robot chef ready to cook any dish.
A bubbling jacuzzi occupied one corner, surrounded by soft ambient lighting, creating a tranquil atmosphere.
The room was a perfect blend of comfort and opulence.
And Stark could stay in this room as long as he wanted.
"...The association could be useful, so I'll stay a little bit," he grinned, jumping on the bed and lying there, "Oh yeah, first, I need to contact them."
He opened his [Spatial Inventory] for the third time and pulled out his phone from it.
Immediately, he opened up his messaging app, just to see dozens of messages from both Sora and Lana.
There were even messages from an unknown sender he had never added.
[Sora: Are you okay? If you need anything, tell me.]
Even though Sora was probably worried, even her messages gave that emotionless look.
[Lana: STARK?!]
[Lana: ARE YOU OKAY??!]
[Lana: WHERE ARE YOU!!]
Lana's messages were much more panicked, and there were several dozens upon dozens of them.
And finally, it was obvious that the unknown sender was none other than Lilith.
[Lilith: Hm... Sora and Lana, extremely nice girl by the way, gave me your number to contact you, I wonder what you're doing right now... it's... amazing...]
She had only sent one message.
In the end, Stark smiled before sending one message to each of them, and soon enough, the replies came.
[Stark: I'm staying somewhere safe, I'll contact you and come back in a bit, don't worry.]
[Attached photo.]
He took a few pictures of the VIP room by the way, sending it to each of them to show that he was okay.
[Sora: Alright, you should really come sometime, Lana is extremely nervous after everything.]
Lana was pretty much the only out of the three girls to have not seen Stark all this time, forced to watch through a screen.
[Stark: I'm fine, you shouldn't be nervous :)]
[Attached photo.]
[Lana: STARK?! COME BACK NOW!]
[Stark: Can't, but soon, I promise, and I'll even give you that reward or whatever once I do.]
At the mention of the reward, Lana's face went red.
[Lana: Alright, but be sure to be back within a week, I wanna see you!]
And finally, Lilith, which probably saw the messages Stark sent from the other two, and also the pictures, instantly send another message.
[Lilith: Domination Association, huh.]
Stark's eyes widened as he saw that.
[Stark: You know about them?]
[Lilith: A little bit, they're nice overall, but the missions they give are batshit insane, so most people quit within their first few months if they don't just die.]
[Stark: Alright, well, as I said to the other two, I'll come back in a bit, just wait.]
[Lilith: I'm not worrying, I trust you.]
After all of that was done, and he messaged them back-and-forth for a little bit, Stark finally felt like he needed to rest.
He wanted to check the features of his new [Multi-Task Watch], as well as all the panels that appeared when he reached level 150, but exhaustion crept over him, his eyelids growing heavier with each passing second.
Before he knew it, he drifted off, sinking into a deep sleep.
When Stark opened his eyes, he wasn't in his room.
He was in his mind, but compared to normal, the sight before him was unlike anything he had ever experienced.

chapters.title: Chapter 392 - 392: The Classes Temple, 5 Remain
chapters.content:
Stark awoke slowly, his senses gradually piecing together the strange environment around him.
As his vision adjusted, he found himself in a vast, circular space that radiated an otherworldly aura.
The air was thick with a kind of holy energy that made his skin tingle.
It wasn't just the atmosphere, it was the entire place.
The space resembled an ancient temple, the kind you'd expect to see at the start of a game to pick your class.
Pillars surrounded him, towering high into a ceiling that disappeared into a golden glow.
Soft light illuminated everything, but there were no torches or clear sources of the glow. It was as if the place itself was alive, radiating energy.
At the center of the room, Stark stood on a polished marble floor.
"What the fuck..."
Around him, a red carpet spread out in all directions like the wheel of the [Class Wheel].
Each path led to a statue, ten in total, arranged in a circle.
For a moment, Stark simply stood there, trying to understand where he was.
His eyes narrowed as he scanned the room, and finally, he approached one of the statues.
It was made of stone but didn't look lifeless.
Crimson energy pulsed through cracks all over it, but these weren't cracks of destruction.
Instead, light spilled out from them, as if the statue was barely containing some immense power.
Stark tilted his head, stepping back to take in the full figure.
The statue looked just like him.
Its features were unmistakable—his face, his stance.
It had one leg raised, as if mid-step, and its arms were stretched forward.
Strings ran from its fingers to a heart hovering in front of its chest.
The heart wasn't just a shape; it had a smiley face etched into its surface, almost mocking him.
"Soul Wielder…?" Stark muttered, his voice echoing in the temple.
He stepped back and turned to another statue.
This one also resembled him, but it was different.
It wore a priest's outfit, complete with flowing robes and a serene expression.
In its hands were two crosses, raised as if in prayer. Golden light leaked out of the cracks on this statue, giving it a holy aura.
Stark's eyes widened. "The classes…"
A panel appeared in front of him to confirm what he thought.
[Classes Temple]
Each statue represented one of his classes. The Soul Wielder was clear, and so was the priestly figure, his Exorcist class.
Curious, Stark walked around, examining the other statues.
Each one was unique but shared a single theme: they all looked like him.
The Succubus statue had horns and a tail, its face twisted in a mischievous grin.
The Magus held a staff with a glowing crimson orb at the tip.
The Alchemist wore a lab coat, holding two bubbling potions that seemed almost real.
Each statue pulsed with energy, except for a few.
Stark frowned as he noticed the difference.
The statues that represented his current classes—Domination, Alchemist, Exorcist, Soul Wielder, and Incubus—all had cracks glowing with light.
But the ones representing classes he didn't have—Magus, Beast Tamer, Assassin, Warrior, and Archer—were untouched.
They stood there, solid and silent, with no energy radiating from them.
"Something's not right," Stark muttered.
Usually, when he encountered something tied to his classes, his class doppelgängers would appear.
They were the mischievous manifestations of his powers, always mocking him or giving cryptic advice.
But now? The temple was eerily quiet. Stark realized just how much he'd grown used to their presence.
"Guess it's fine," he said with a shrug, trying to shake off the unease.
As he turned back to the center of the room, a familiar sound rang in his ears.
Ding!
A notification panel appeared in front of him, its bright light almost blinding in the dim temple.
[Domination Expansion]
"What the…?" Stark's eyes widened as he read the words.
[Unlock all of your classes to gain your Domination Expansion.]
[It will be the most devastating one out of them all.]
"How am I supposed to do that?" Stark groaned.
He'd removed Archer, Assassin, and Warrior, thinking they weren't worth it. But now it seemed like a huge mistake.
If he couldn't get them all, then did it mean that his [Domination Expansion] would be unachievable?
In response, the panel flickered again.
[You will figure it out in due time, but for now, just live long enough to do it.]
The moment the words faded, the temple began to shake.
Cracks formed along the walls, spreading rapidly like spiderwebs.
One by one, the statues began to crumble, their glowing energy disappearing into the air.
Stark stepped back as the entire space started to collapse.
"..."
Within seconds, the walls, the statues, and even the ceiling vanished, leaving Stark standing in the usual black void.
Or at least, that's what he thought, because once he looked around, he noticed something: the only thing left was a single door, standing in the distance.
It was massive, its surface made of dark, ancient wood. Carved into it were ominous letters that glowed faintly.
[5 remain.]
"Five remain… Are you talking about the apostles? Or the classes?"
He asked the question aloud, but no answer came.
The silence was deafening, more unsettling than anything else.
Even his doppelgängers weren't here to give their usual annoying commentary.
For a moment, Stark just stood there, staring at the door.
The emptiness around him was oppressive. He couldn't help but miss the chaotic energy his doppelgängers usually brought.
At least they made things lively. Now, all he had was the door and its cryptic message.
With a sigh, he sat down on the invisible floor.
There was no point in rushing. Whatever this place was, it wasn't going to let him leave until he woke up in the real world.
A new panel appeared in front of him, breaking the silence.
[You can check your panels in here.]
"Wait, really?" Stark's eyes lit up.
If that was true, it meant he could do more than just sit around.
He'd never tried accessing his panels while asleep, but this could change everything.
If he could train or upgrade his skills in this space, it would be a huge advantage.
Normally, he used the [Memories Museum] for training in the real world, but this was different.
Gaining hours of practice while his body rested would be game-changing.
Excited, Stark stood up. "Panels, come," he said, holding out his hand.
Instantly, a cascade of panels appeared before him, each one representing a different aspect of his progress.
There were seven in total—a record for him.
He'd gained several new options after reaching level 150, but he hadn't had the chance to fully explore them yet.
Stark grinned. "Let's see what we've got."

chapters.title: Chapter 393 - 393: The Panels, Gaining a New Class
chapters.content:
The seven panels that Stark could use floated effortlessly around him, their shimmering edges pulsating faintly as if inviting his attention.
Each panel seemed to hold its own significance, radiating a distinct aura.
