Stark studied them for a moment, the flickering lights casting shifting shadows across his face.
Deciding on a methodical approach, he resolved to tackle them in order: from least important to the most vital.
Reaching out, he grabbed the first panel. With a fluid motion, it zoomed into full view.
Ding!
[Survey: What are your thoughts on the things happening around this world?]
Stark blinked, momentarily caught off guard by the question.
"Oh, the surveys are back," he muttered, his voice tinged with both curiosity and unease.
The surveys hadn't appeared the previous two times he could get a new class, and their sudden reemergence stirred a nagging feeling of dread within him.
"I wonder what the deal with these surveys is..."
There was something unsettling about them, and he couldn't shake the impression that the surveys might be tied to something much darker.
Something watching and waiting just beyond his reach.
Still, Stark resolved to answer it.
[It's bad.]
[It's good.]
[I don't care.]
The three options were there, and Stark selected the third.
[Thanks for your help :).]
Shaking off his apprehension as it disappeared, he moved to the second panel.
This one brought a more exciting revelation.
[You have reached level 150! You can now upgrade your Classifier Rank to Immortal-Rank.]
Stark let out a low whistle, the significance of this milestone settling over him.
Immortal was the rank right before [Classified], which was considered the highest rank possible by classifiers.
His skills would reach level 100 at that time.
[You can now upgrade your rank and have your skill limit raised to 80]
Yet despite the importance of the breakthrough, Stark had never had the time nor money to go buy a breakthrough stone, since he didn't care about equipment anymore.
He felt like it was time to do it though, as he had a ton of skill points to use and there was no better timing than right now.
"Those damn [Immortal Breakthrough Stones] though…" he muttered.
Not only were they exceptionally rare, but their cost could reach upward of 500 million rher coins.
"Maybe I can ask the girls to help," he mumbled.
Stark was confident Sora or Lana would gladly assist if he asked. With their help, the stone might finally be within his grasp.
Satisfied for now, Stark turned to the third panel, which displayed a familiar message:
[Domination Expansion]
[Will unlock once all classes have been gained.]
[Possibly your only chance against him.]
Stark's gaze lingered on the word "him," his jaw tightening.
It was an unmistakable reference to the Godless Demon, the shadow looming over everything Stark had faced thus far.
He knew the Demon was amassing an army, turning those desperate enough to abandon their humanity into monstrous servants of his will.
He saw that happen live with [Follower], and even the dead [Clever] was referred to as a "Godless Transformation".
But Stark's determination didn't waver.
"If I grow strong enough," he said quietly, "then none of them will matter."
Resolute, he pushed the thought aside and focused on the next set of panels.
Four remained, each one holding potential surprises.
Ding!
[ApostleDex has been updated!]
Stark's eyes lit up as he read the message. "Finally!"
It meant that he could possibly get new information about the apostles of the third line, like their locations or basic things that could aid him.
He planned to go through a complete apostle rush now that he was level 150 and able to kill monsters around level 750.
Only a bit more and he would reach the theoretical max level for his class, as well as the one where he would complete the class wheel.
[You will be able to check out this information once you wake up.]
Though it seems like something stopped him from checking it out in the void.
"It's already a miracle I can do my business here, so I'll take it," he grinned.
Moving on to the top three panels, he selected the next one.
But what greeted him was… strange.
[238 days 20 hours 3 minutes 49 seconds...]
Stark frowned. The timer glowed with a crimson aura, ominous and unrelenting.
"A cooldown…?" he muttered, tilting his head.
But to what?
There was no answer.
[238 days 20 hours 3 minutes 17 seconds...]
The timer ticked down, its glow pulsing faintly with each second. Stark couldn't help but feel uneasy.
[You'll get more information later.]
And yet again, he wasn't given everything, probably since he was in this void or too low-leveled.
"Maybe it's the Godless Demon's descent..." he mumbled, theorizing, "Who knows."
For now, though, there was nothing he could do but wait.
Shaking off the unsettling feeling, Stark moved on to the second-to-last panel.
[Level 150 Reached: Please Pick a Card.]
[Immortal Skill Guaranteed!]
A wide grin spread across Stark's face.
"Now we're talking!"
He had several powerful skills that he had never used, like for example [Limb Sacrifice]and [Revenant's Fury], but it was simply because he didn't need to.
Maybe soon he would.
[Revenant's Fury] was already charged up with 3/3 deaths, though it told him before that the conditions were met, but the time wasn't right.
So getting a new powerful skill would always be good, no matter what.
Twenty cards, yes, you heard that right, twenty, appeared around him, each glowing faintly.
[Each one is different.]
And this time, there was no twist about them all being the same, nope, each skill behind that card could probably make or break Stark's future.
"...Heh, who cares," he sighed as he instantly grabbed one of the cards, "If it's bad then nothing I can do."
The card flipped over, revealing a crude drawing of what appeared to be a bomb: a round object with a fuse sticking out from the top.
[Skill: Bomb.]
Oh yeah, it definitely was a bomb.
"...Bomb?"
[Rank: Immortal+]
His eyes widened in surprise. It wasn't just an Immortal-rank skill, it was Immortal+, the tier above it!
"Wow," he murmured, impressed.
But then came the catch.
[Warning: One-time use skill. Don't use it recklessly.]
"And of course..." Stark groaned, "My luck couldn't be this could, would it."
One-time use skills were infamous across Rheria for being both rare and frustratingly underwhelming.
Yet something about this skill felt… off.
The simplicity of its name, the strange rank, the lack of detail, it all felt deliberately cryptic.
The description wasn't much help either.
[Description: It's a bomb. You take it out and throw it, then the skill disappears.]
"Helpful," Stark muttered sarcastically.
Still, he couldn't deny that the skill intrigued him.
Ding!
[Your next skill will be given at level 175.]
"Oh."
This meant that there were now 25 levels between each skill, and also that between level 150 and 200, he would only be getting two additional skills from leveling up to aid him.
It meant that he almost was at the end of his journey.
"Well, only one more thing to check out I guess," he eyed the last panel, knowing perfectly what it would be.
[Level 150 Reached!]
[You can spin the "Class Wheel" again!]
A smirk tugged at the corner of Stark's lips.
He had been waiting for this moment.
"Class Wheel," he called out, and the colorful wheel appeared before him, hovering ahead.
Though it wasn't as colorful as it was when he started, since there were only 2 options left: Magus and Beast Tamer.
Stark could feel the weight of the decision, even though the outcome wasn't in his hands.
Would it be [Magus], making him a Grand Mage with countless spells.
Or would it be [Beast Tamer], granting him a [Domination Pet] or something like that.
Stark stood before the familiar lever, the brass handle gleaming faintly in the void's darkness.
Above it were the still the familiar words.
[Pull me!]
He'd pulled this lever countless times before, and every time, it had brought him a new class.
This time, however, the stakes felt higher.
At his current level, every single skill or perk he could get would be useful for later, meaning that whatever he got, it would be helpful.
"Either way, I win," Stark said with a confident grin, gripping the lever.
With a swift pull, the lever clanged loudly, its sound echoing across the void.
The wheel burst to life, spinning with a ferocity that made the air hum.
Its two remaining segments, one blue for [Magus], the other emerald for [Beast Tamer], blurred into streaks of color as the wheel spun faster and faster.
Sparks flew from its edges, and Stark felt the familiar surge of anticipation coursing through him.
After a while, the wheel began to slow, the segments coming into focus.
Tick. Tick. Tick.
It edged past [Beast Tamer], teasing the possibility.
Tick.
And finally, the wheel stopped, the pointer trembling slightly before settling on the blue section.
[Magus].

chapters.title: Chapter 394 - 394: The Magus Class, Insane Passive
chapters.content:
Ding!
[You have unlocked the "Magus" Class.]
The notification lingered in the air as Stark stood, letting the realization sink in.
The wheel had spoken, and the path was chosen: he was now officially a Magus. His sixth class.
That meant the last remaining option, [Beast Tamer], was reserved for level 200, the final milestone.
Stark couldn't help but wonder what kind of beast he might have tamed: a terrifying monstrosity, or maybe something unexpectedly adorable.
A fleeting sense of curiosity tugged at him, but he brushed it aside.
"You can't win them all," he muttered with a shrug.
Instead, he focused on his newly unlocked class.
He pulled up the details.
[Magus: Can wield magic and release spells.]
"...Huh?"
It was... underwhelming.
Stark's brows furrowed.
For any other classifier, the Magus class might have been monumental, a gateway to commanding spells capable of reshaping battlefields.
But for Stark, this was redundant.
If you don't remember, every domination user's abilities and weapons may be different.
But for Stark, his weapons were his [Fists and Magic], and as the latter stated, it meant that he could already use a [Magus]'s magic to begin with.
Getting this class was in fact not helping at all.
"So... what was the point?" he mumbled, annoyed.
Then another notification appeared.
[As this class's power is already granted by Domination, it will be absorbed, offering a boost in power.]
Stark raised an eyebrow, "Oh yeah, that thing, I guess it could help..."
Ding!
[Domination is currently absorbing Magus...]
[0... 20... 40... 60... 80... 100!]
[It has been absorbed.]
The moment the process completed, Stark felt it, a surge of raw energy coursing through his body.
His aura swelled, expanding with a potency that was almost overwhelming.
It was like a limiter had broken, releasing a flood of unimaginable strength.
And then, the next notification left him stunned.
Ding!
[You have been granted the "Domination Magus" Passive!]
[Description: Each skill's damage is now doubled as your aura has become much stronger, the power of a grand mage fusing with yours.]
"...?!"
His jaw dropped. "Damage doubled?!"
This wasn't just good, it was insane.
Every single skill he possessed now dealt twice the damage. His already devastating attacks, which could obliterate enemies in seconds, had just been amplified beyond reason.
Stark quickly did the math in his head. "If I was dealing 5,000,000 damage before... that's 10,000,000 now!"
He clenched his fists, feeling the power radiating from him.
The void around him shimmered in response to his rising aura, the very space trembling under the force of his newfound strength.
This wasn't just a class, it was an evolution.
A step closer to becoming an unstoppable force.
"And it's a passive..." he whispered, grinning. "Always active, no conditions, no cooldowns. Perfect."
Any doubts he had about the Magus class evaporated.
This was beyond what he could have hoped for.
The fusion of grand magical power into his Domination abilities elevated him to a whole new level.
Then the void trembled again, signaling his time here was coming to an end.
[You are about to wake up.]
Stark took one last deep breath, savoring the moment.
"Looks like it's time to wake up," he said, his grin widening.
And after that a few additional seconds, he suddenly lost consciousness.
The last thing he saw in front of his eyes was the door that stated "4 Remains".
"So it's in fact the classes, heh," he mumbled.
Finally, Stark fell down, hitting the ground of the void.
...
And mere instants later, Stark's eyes snapped open in the real world.
He sat up abruptly, the lingering rush of power from the void still buzzing faintly in his veins.
Shaking off the haze, he instinctively reached for his phone on the small table beside him.
The screen lit up, and immediately a flood of notifications bombarded him.
Ding! Ding! Ding!
His brow furrowed as he scrolled through countless missed calls and messages.
[Lana: Where are you?! It's been a week!]
[Sora: Take your time.
[Lilith: They told me that you do that often, it's quite surprising.]
"A week?" he sighed, knowing perfectly what it meant.
Swiping to his clock app confirmed it, seven full days had passed since he entered the void.
It had felt like only an hour at most yet here he was.
He kept scrolling.
[Sora: Just call me when you wake up or are available.]
Sora seemed to be the only reasonable one.
And so, without hesitating, he dialed her number.
The phone rang twice before Sora picked up, her voice calm.
In the background, he could hear Lana and Lilith suddenly get up and shout "who's that" or "Is it Stark?!"
"Stark," Sora spoke first, "Let me guess, sleep?"
"..." Stark smiled, she knew him well, "Yeah, I guess so."
There was a pause. When she spoke again, Sora's voice had softened slightly.
"It's fine, the other two are right next to me, they seem... mad, though, I'll explain everything to them."
"Thanks Sora," he was grateful to Sora for always keeping her composure, as having three people scream at him would have probably angered him more than anything, "I'll try to come today or tomorrow for sure."
Ending the call, he tossed the phone onto the bed and exhaled.
Seven days gone. His newfound power from absorbing the Magus class still thrummed beneath the surface.
He stood, stretching briefly.
He will still in the Domination Association's VIP room, so it was confusing why Ed or the commanders didn't try to wake him up.
"Looks like I've got some explaining to do," he muttered before heading for the door.
As Stark reached for the door, a screen descended from the ceiling, hovering just inches in front of him.
The sudden motion made him pause, and the screen lit up with a familiar face.
It was Ed, the Domination Association's tech expert and occasional nuisance.
"Yo, kid," Ed greeted with his usual nonchalant grin. "You've been sleeping for a while, probably from the trial and stuff.
Don't worry, me and the others are handling things for now. But in the meantime, check out your new toy, your [Multi-Task Watch].
You'll be able to connect with us and do all sorts of cool stuff with it."
The screen flickered off as quickly as it had appeared, leaving Stark staring at the empty space where it had been.
"Hm... I guess it was pretty cool..." Stark muttered, shaking his head.
Still, curiosity got the better of him.
Reaching into his [Spatial Inventory], he pulled out the sleek, high-tech watch.
It gleamed faintly, its design futuristic yet practical, with a smooth black band and a holographic interface visible on the surface.
He tapped the screen, expecting it to light up. Yet nothing happened.
Frowning, he tried again, but a panel suddenly appeared before him:
[Multi-Task Watch needs to link with your aura to activate.]
"Figures," Stark sighed.
Without hesitation, he slid the watch onto his wrist.
The moment it clicked into place, a faint hum resonated through the device, syncing with his aura.
A soft glow spread across the screen, and intricate symbols lit up as it activated.
"Let's see what's so good about it," he murmured, flexing his wrist as the watch displayed its boot-up sequence.

chapters.title: Chapter 395 - 395: The Multi-Task Watch
chapters.content:
The Multi-Task Watch lights up.
[Do you want the tutorial on how to use it?]
"..." Stark looked at the panel for a few seconds before declining, "I'm a fast learner, I think."
[Are you sure, most people don't know how to use it once getting it.]
"Yeah, I'm sure."
[Alright.]
The watch opened up, revealing that it didn't work like a phone, where you needed to look at a screen. Instead, like Stark had seen with Oliver, it projected a holographic display.
Looking up, Stark saw the main menu, which displayed seven applications: Contact, Missions, Domination Association News, Alerts, Market, Internet, and Info.
The first app he explored was Contact.
It already had the contacts of every commander in the association preloaded.
[I made sure to add us all to your contact app, as usually you would have to befriend a member and exchange contacts to be able to communicate, though it's much easier than a phone!]
Ed left a note that popped up the moment Stark opened the app for the first time.
"So I guess even when you decline, the tutorial's still here..." Stark mumbled.
He had no messages from anybody, though Alexis, Oliver, Tia, Unity and Ed were all present, and he was able to message them.
The app worked exactly like a normal messaging platform on a phone, except now it was conveniently on his watch.
[You can also add other people you know outside of the Domination Assocation,] another notification appeared.
This already felt like a significant improvement over a phone. It was much easier to carry around and could even be used during battles without any hassle.
Next, Stark checked out Missions.
However, all that greeted him was a simple message:
[You haven't been given any missions. Maybe later...]
"Huh."
"Huh." He wasn't planning on using it for now anyway, so he quickly moved on.
The third app, Domination Association News, caught his attention.
It functioned like a news outlet, delivering updates about the association's activities to all its members.
The top headline, published a week ago, read: [All Transformed Immortal-Level Participants have been taken care of.]
These were not articles with dozens of pages of text for no reason, they were straight and to the point, used to give information to the busy members of the association.
A few other headlines caught Stark's eye:
[Third Domination Trial: "Termina," which is from the death-difficulty, is being broadcasted. Information on the participants has been released. Please be cautious!]
[Massive unknown attack on Fellarburg recently. Our team handled it before it became a national issue, but a cryptic message was left: "1 year before the descent of the demon." Be careful.]
It seemed the association had a firm grip on handling the threats surrounding the Domination Class and the hidden dangers lurking in the shadows of this world.
"Is there only one association...?" Stark wondered aloud.
It would make sense if there were more associations in other countries., each managing their own area.
After all, guilds and similar organizations usually operated with multiple headquarters for maximum efficiency and influence.
Alternatively, the association might be so short-staffed that there was only one central organization.
"I'll have to ask..." he mumbled before moving to the 4th app.
[Alerts]
[This app is primarily used for emergencies. If it triggers, you'll know it's a problem that could affect the nation, if not the entire world. For smaller tasks, you'll simply receive a notification from Missions.]
[Even if your watch is turned off, the holographic panel will still appear, accompanied by a buzzing sound, to ensure you're informed of an alert!]
"...Alright," for now, the app couldn't be opened, though.
[You can only open it upon receiving an alert, otherwise it is locked.]
A lock symbol was displayed on the app icon.
Each app had its own distinct icon design, much like apps on a phone.
Contact was represented by a text bubble, Missions featured a notepad labeled "mission," Domination Association News was symbolized by an animated eye that darted around as if observing everything, and Alert was marked by a megaphone.
"Alright, next application..."
He moved on to Market, which was represented by a shopping cart.
Opening it revealed something extraordinary: a massive virtual marketplace containing items from all across Rheria.
Even those outside of [Fellarburg], you could find anything.
Whether it was food, furniture, essentials and even weapons, there was everything.
There was even a small search bar where you could type in whatever you wanted, and it would immediately show up all results.
This was next-level technology.
[Once you purchase an item—with your own money, of course—the amount will automatically be deducted from your account, and the item will use spatial travel to reach you within the hour.]
[For furniture, you'll need to confirm the teleportation location, so it might take a little longer. But for most items like weapons, potions, and equipment, the delivery will always take around an hour.]
This was insanity.
Instinctively, Stark searched up an [Immortal Breakthrough Stone], and of course, results appeared for every country.
[Fellarburg - Immortal Breakthrough Stone - 500,000,000 rher coins]
[Lampod - Immortal Breakthrough Stone - 510,000,000 rher coins]
[Braemont - Immortal Breakthrough Stone - 497,000,000 rher coins]
He could even compare the prices and select the best deal!
[This shopping method has been approved by the leaders of the respective associations, so you won't face any issues.]
If the general public had access to this app, it would revolutionize commerce entirely. But of course, it was exclusive to Domination Association members.
Stark clicked on the Braemont listing, as it was the cheapest.
Beep!
[You do not have the funds to make this purchase.]
"Of course..." Stark sighed, though he smiled. "Well, I'll keep that in mind."
[Note: You cannot sell your items through this platform.]
"Yeah, yeah, makes sense."
The sixth app was Internet.
Well, this one was self-explanatory, and Ed only included it so that members of the association could fully utilize their watches instead of phones.
With the internet and even videos on, there was no need to use your phone anymore, most of the members dropping their previous ones or even breaking them.
Finally, Stark opened the last app, Info.
However, a pop-up message immediately appeared:
[You may have the authority of a commander, but you are not allowed to open this app.]
The app locked itself, much like Alerts.
"Huh. I guess that's fine, then," Stark shrugged, slightly confused.
After exploring all the apps, Stark realized just how ingenious the Multi-Task Watch truly was.
It was far more practical and versatile than any phone, and Stark already knew he would be using it regularly moving forward.

chapters.title: Chapter 396 - 396: The Three Impossible-Rank Missions, Godless Demon Footage
chapters.content:
After dealing with the [Multi-Task Watch] and discovering its new abilities, the first thing Stark tried was to remove it.
Unfortunately though...
[This device is used to send your location to all others in case of danger, please do not remove it.]
"Hm."
Regardless, he still tried.
ZAP!
-10,000!
"Holy shit?!"
[Don't. Remove. It.]
"..."
If he wanted to do that, he would have to cut off his right arm.
And he didn't feel like it doing that for now, especially with everything that was bound to happen.
So in the end, Stark decided to enjoy the privilege of this thing.
He left his [VIP Room], and the exact moment he did... he saw a familiar figure.
"Oh, if it's not the Stark, the man, the legend!"
"..."
Remember that guy back then that tried to recruit Stark to the association?
Well, that was him.
His name was Juan, and unlike last time, he wasn't accompanied by the members of his little group.
Though right now, Stark didn't need to worry, as he was much stronger than Juan.
"We meet again," Stark sighed, his expression neutral, "Why do you wanna talk to me?"
"Nothing much," Juan's grin widened, "It was nice to see you."
Other than that, Juan walked away, putting his watch on the scanner, one of the vip rooms opening, meaning that he was probably an important person.
"Oh, and by the way," Juan stopped before entering, "People call you the [Chosen One] as an actual nickname now, enjoy!"
With that, Juan entered his room and the door closed automatically behind him.
"Chosen One..." Stark mumbled, "Doesn't sound too bad," he smiled.
While walking in the corridors, lost as he didn't really know where he was going as the place was too big, he saw dozens of other domination users.
They all stopped what they were doing, looking at him with cautious eyes.
The identity of Stark was known by the entire world at this point, many guilds probably trying their hardest to reach out to him.
He was regarded as one of the strongest there were in this world, especially with all the cinematic stuff that happened in the trial, as well as everything he was able to tank.
But even then... Stark didn't feel that good.
He didn't know why, but the constant feeling of dread that he always had intensified.
People both admired and were scared of him.
Someone that can wield a soul heart, magic, has fists that can deal more than 2,000,000 damage per punch, and had the ability to revive, was someone that shouldn't be interacted with.
Eventually, while wandering around the place, he received a notification on his watch.
[Ed: Looks like you're awake, please come to the commander's meeting room from before, we're hosting one right now regarding future missions.]
[Stark: Where is it.]
[Ed: Huh? I mean, just ask the watch, it will guide you, it has many functionalities not specifically said, you know?]
Stark looked at the thing around his wrist.
"Guide me to the commander's meeting room."
Ding!
[You have the authority level to do that, guiding.]
A holographic arrow appeared before his eyes, strangely resembling the one that he got back when he was trying to find [Sierra's Death Path], you know, the one he got from Arthur.
Stark followed the holographic arrow, watching as it hovered in the air before him.
It guided him through the sprawling corridors of the Domination Association's headquarters.
The place was massive, with halls that seemed to stretch endlessly, punctuated by towering doors and reinforced walls.
Other users glanced at him as he passed, their expressions wary. Murmurs followed in his wake.
"That's him…"
"Be careful. He's insane!"
Stark ignored them.
Eventually, the arrow led him to a grand double door, embossed with intricate patterns resembling the flow of magic and energy.
The doors opened automatically as he approached, revealing a large, oval table surrounded by the high-ranking commanders.
Among them were familiar faces: Ed, seated near the center with his usual grin; Oliver, arms crossed, radiating calm authority; Unity, Alexis and Tia.
Stark stepped in, scanning the room before walking to the far end of the table.
"Sit down, we put a chair for you," Ed smiled.
"..."
Stark didn't like that, but he would rather sit than stand.
He pulled out the chair, the sound cutting through the tense atmosphere, and sat down.
The room fell silent, all eyes on him.
Stark leaned back slightly, his expression unreadable. "What's up?"
Oliver was the one to speak for, his expression just as grim as everyone else's.
"Boy," he called out to Stark.
"..." Stark didn't answer, instead, he looked down at his own palm, his crimson aura dancing around it.
"Remember those tasks that I said were 'impossible', meaning that most people, even us, didn't want to take?"
"Not really."
"Well..." Oliver sighed, snapping his fingers, and suddenly, Stark's [Multi-Task Watch] lit up.
Ding!
[You have received three Impossible-Rank missions!]
"Deal with them."
"..."
Stark almost wanted to summon [Heaven's Spear] to deal with them all, but he stopped himself.
The audacity was insane.
Ed leaned forward, his grin softening into something more serious.
"We call them [Impossible-Rank Missions] because no one is willing to take them, everyone who tried never returned."
Oliver gestured, and a holographic map appeared over the table, displaying three distinct markers spread across Rheria.
Each pulsed ominously, radiating a deep crimson hue.
Stark's bored expression didn't change. "Still not interested."
He had apostles to take care of, and he wanted to do it before that timer reached zero, as he feared it could be linked to the godless demon's descent.
If a single apostle remained by then, they would possibly control an army big enough to wipe out the entirety of humanity.
Why was Stark the only one to deal with them? That is the question many may wonder if they looked back at everything.
Well...
"There's an apostle at each of these locations," Oliver revealed out of nowhere.
And the moment he did that, Stark's eyes widened.
"Do you people know how dangerous the apostles are?" he asked, his expression darkening.
"Yeah."
All of them nodded, and Stark's rage grew a little more.
"You people know they can wipe out countries, right?"
"..."
No one answered except for Oliver.
"We don't care, kid, they're linked to us and this world, so we need them out," the leader of the Domination Association stared at Stark in the eyes, his gaze unwavering, "We want you to deal with them."
"If you want them out so much, then about... I don't know... killing them yourself?"
"We can't."
"How so?" Stark's smile widened, raising his eyebrows.
If each of these people were supposedly stronger than he was, then what was stopping them?
Oliver with his domination expansion could probably deal with all five remaining apostles, or at least the first three of the fifth line.
"We can't," Ed repeated the same words, snapping his fingers.
A holographic screen appeared in the middle of the table, everyone able to see it.
And then...
Bzzzt...
The video began playing.
It showed a mysterious portal.
Dark, swirling energy pulling at the very air around it. Oliver and the commanders were there, standing before it, preparing to enter.
But just as Oliver stepped forward...
[Conditions not met. Access denied.]
[Bring the Chosen One.]
Stark's smirk faded slightly.
The screen glitched faintly as the message repeated, locking them out.
It was clear: no matter how strong or skilled they were, the portal refused their entry.
"I don't get it," Stark said flatly. "If something's blocking you, then why the hell did you say nobody comes back alive?"
"Just watch," Oliver said quietly.
The video continued.
As the commanders hesitated whether to return back or not, the ground beneath them began to shift.
A low rumble echoed through the surroundings, and the skies above turned an unnatural crimson.
Then, without warning...
Drip… drip…
Blood. It began to rain blood.
"What the hell…?" Stark whispered as even the Oliver on-screen tensed, his face betraying a rare glimpse of shock.
Then it hit, the overwhelming aura.
Even through the screen, Stark felt it: an oppressive, suffocating energy that sent chills through his core. It was familiar. Too familiar.
'Godless Demon…' Stark's eyes widened.
On the video, the air cracked and warped.
Slowly, a massive figure emerged, a silhouette that dwarfed everything in sight, its size rivaling even the [Angel of the Spear].
The creature's form was shrouded in shadow, its aura blotting out the very light.
The commanders froze, terror written across their faces. Even Oliver stood still, unable to react to the sheer power radiating before him.
"Another bunch of boring fools," the Godless Demon's voice rumbled through the screen, deep and guttural, as though reality itself trembled from its words. "Goodbye."
The figure raised its colossal arm, its massive hand casting a shadow that seemed to engulf everything.
Just as the hand began to descend, Ed on-screen suddenly sprang into action.
He activated a small device on his wrist, a teleportation gadget, just in time.
The video ended abruptly as the commanders vanished, narrowly escaping annihilation.
Silence settled over the room.
Oliver's expression turned grim. "Now you understand. Everyone who went before us likely met the same fate. After encountering that… we gave these missions the [Impossible] rating. No one should go there anymore."
Stark exhaled through his nose, his gaze unreadable. "Why me, then?" He smiled faintly, though he already knew the answer.
Ed leaned back in his chair, shrugging nonchalantly. "Well, because your ID literally says Chosen One, duh."

chapters.title: Chapter 397 - 397: Accepting the Tasks, Going Back to the Apartment
chapters.content:
"Alright," Stark smirked, his crimson aura flickering faintly around him, "I'll do it."
The room, tense just moments before, lightened up immediately.
The commanders' faces lit with cautious hope, their shoulders relaxing ever so slightly. It was as if a weight had been lifted, even if temporarily.
"But," Stark raised a single finger, his expression turning sly, "In exchange for completing a mission, I want one request granted to me for every mission I complete. It won't be much, I promise."
The commanders paused, exchanging glances.
Three missions, three requests. It was bold of him, but considering the circumstances, they didn't have much of a choice.
"Deal," Oliver said without hesitation, his deep voice cutting through the silence like a blade.
He leaned forward slightly, resting his arms on the table. "Tell us the first one."
Stark grinned, his crimson eyes glowing faintly. "I want an Immortal Breakthrough Stone. Like, right now."
There was a collective murmur of surprise around the table.
All eyes turned toward Ed, the Domi-Mechanician, who only grinned lazily, seemingly unbothered by the request.
"You're in luck," Ed said, his voice holding that casual confidence only he could pull off. "I've got a few in my storage."
He tapped one of the many small gadgets strapped to his arm.
A faint hum filled the air as a small, shimmering blue portal materialized beside him.
Moments later, an Immortal Breakthrough Stone emerged from within and fell to the ground, glowing faintly with ethereal energy.
Without missing a beat, Ed pointed another gadget at the stone.
A holographic hand appeared, grasping it gently and guiding it across the table until it landed in Stark's waiting hands.
Stark inspected it carefully, his eyes narrowing as he confirmed its authenticity.
[Immortal Breakthrough Stone]
[Used to reach the "Immortal" level and upgrade your skill limit to 80.]
Satisfied, he took a deep breath, the room falling silent as he placed his hand over the stone.
Crimson aura surged from his palm, pouring into the artifact.
Stark's muscles tensed as a searing energy coursed through him, every nerve screaming for release.
He gritted his teeth, his body trembling slightly under the strain.
'Damn.'
The first [Breakthrough Stones] were light work, but it seemed like the further you went, the harder it became.
Stay calm, he told himself, Stay calm, or you'll deactivate it and lose levels…
The pressure built to a crescendo, but Stark held on.
After what felt like an eternity, though it was only a handful of seconds, the stone dissolved into light, absorbed fully into his body.
[You have reached the "Immortal" level, and all of your skills' limit has been raised to 80.]
Stark exhaled slowly, his crimson aura now radiating with an even greater intensity.
His power had grown, and the difference was undeniable.
He turned his attention back to the commanders, raising two fingers this time.
"Second request," he said smoothly, "I want the freedom to leave the association whenever I want, or at least the ability to go to the capital."
Tia rolled her eyes, leaning back in her chair with an exaggerated groan. "To meet with your three girlfriends, huh?"
"Precisely," and Stark didn't feel like refuting the claims, so he simply agreed.
Oliver didn't argue. He simply nodded and turned his gaze toward Ed once again. "Granted."
'Does Ed do everything around this place?' Stark thought to himself, watching the Domi-Mechanician fiddle with his gadgets once more.
It was becoming clear that Ed wasn't just some eccentric engineer, he was, in many ways, the backbone of the entire operation.
Without his tools and inventions, the Domination Association might have crumbled long ago.
"As for the third request..." Stark paused, closing his eyes.
The room seemed to hold its breath, waiting for his next demand.
After a moment, he opened his eyes again, a faint smirk on his lips. "I'll keep it for later."
Oliver sighed heavily, "Alright, kid. I hope you can handle those missions. If you somehow come back alive, we'll see about rewarding you further."
Stark got up from his chair, stretching slightly.
"I'll take care of it," he said casually, turning to leave, heading toward the [Teleportation Room].
He remembered seeing a portal that directly led to Fellaburg's Capital, after all.
All of the commanders watched as he exited the room, his footsteps echoing in the silent chamber.
Once Stark was gone, the room remained quiet for a moment longer before Tia spoke up.
"That kid's dead," she said bluntly, crossing her arms. "No way he's coming back from even one of those missions."
"I agree," Alexis added, his voice colder and more analytical. "We've seen the apostles' power firsthand. Even with Stark's growth, his odds are slim to none, plus, what if that thing shows up as he wasn't the [Chosen One] or whatever."
Unity remained silent, her expression neutral.
Oliver, who had been staring at the door Stark had walked through, shook his head.
"No," he said firmly, surprising everyone at the table. "That kid's winning for sure."
The room fell silent once more as the others turned to look at him.
Oliver leaned back in his chair, his arms crossed.
"I've fought with enough people to know when someone's got what it takes. That kid… Stark isn't like anyone else. He'll win. I'm sure of it."
For Oliver, someone who had seen countless warriors rise and fall over the years, to say something like that was rare. The others exchanged uneasy glances but said nothing.
Meanwhile, Stark had made his way to the Teleportation Room.
The vast chamber was filled with shimmering platforms and glowing runes carved into the ground.
He stepped into the platform that said [Fellarburg], feeling a slight hum of energy beneath his feet.
"Capital," he said simply, and the runes beneath him flared brightly.
In an instant, Stark was enveloped in light.
When the glow faded, he found himself standing outside in the middle of the street, or more like, what remained of it since Follower's rampage.
It seemed like a ton of it was already repaired, some buildings back on business and some classifiers even there to witness the chaos.
Stark ignored the stares and whispers of passersby as he made his way through the city.
He passed by the familiar gates of the Rift Conqueror's Academy, where he had once been completing these randoms quests.
'Oh yeah, the second year is supposed to start soon, need to figure things out,' he mumbled.
It felt like a lifetime ago now, though it had only been months.
Pushing those thoughts aside, he continued his journey until he finally reached his apartment building.
Stark climbed the stairs to the third floor, his footsteps light as he reached his door.
He took out the key from his [Spatial Inventory], and opened it.
The first thing he saw was Sora, standing in the center of the room with her arms crossed.
Her bright blue eyes narrowed immediately, widening.
"Stark...?" she mumbled.
Before Stark could reply, Lana appeared from the kitchen, a small smile on her face.
"You're back!" she said cheerfully, her golden hair tied back in a loose ponytail as she jumped to hug him.
And then there was Lilith, lounging on the couch with her legs crossed.
She looked up at him with a smirk. "Look who finally decided to show up."
He didn't know Lilith as much as the other two, though the battle reinforced their relationship, so it was normal she was the less shocked.
Stark paused for a moment, taking in the sight of all three of them.
It was the first time in a while he'd felt a genuine sense of calm, like he was home again, even if only for a little while.
"Yeah, I'm back," Stark said, closing the door behind him.
[Not for long though... :)]
[Get. To. Work.]

chapters.title: Chapter 398 - 398: Talking to the Three Girls, The Dread Never Goes Away
chapters.content:
"Starrrkkkk! I missed you so much~!"
Before Stark could react, Lana tackled him in a full-force hug, her arms wrapping tightly around his waist.
Her golden hair bounced as she buried her face into his chest, her muffled cries of joy echoing through the small apartment.
Stark sighed, patting her head lightly as she clung to him like a child reunited with their favorite toy.
"Alright, alright," Stark muttered, though the corner of his mouth curled into a small smile. "I'm back, calm down."
"You don't understand!" Lana whined, lifting her head to look at him, her eyes glistening with unshed tears. "It's been so long! A few weeks!"
"A few weeks isn't exactly an eternity," Stark replied, though he let her stay latched onto him a little longer.
Lilith, sitting on the couch, rolled her eyes, though she smirked at the scene. "Still as dramatic as ever, huh, Lana?"
Sora nodded.
Once Lana's theatrics calmed down, everything slowly settled back to normal, or as normal as things could be when Stark was involved.
The four of them lounged around the apartment, chatting like no time had passed at all.
It was unique as Lilith was a new addition to their small group, but it seemed like Lana and Sora didn't care that much.
The girls even explained to Stark what had happened during the time he was asleep, which was one week.
Basically, the world went crazy after the trial, everyone both cheering and hating on Stark, one side thinking he is the savior, while the other thinking he is the cause of all of this.
But to be honest, Stark already expected this, so he didn't mind.
"And uh…" Lana's voice faltered suddenly, and her cheeks turned a deep shade of red.
She fiddled with the hem of her sweater, avoiding Stark's gaze. "One more thing happened."
Stark tilted his head slightly. "…Hm?"
The room went quiet.
"Well…" Lana began hesitantly, her voice small. "It's about my dad..."
Stark raised an eyebrow. "What about him?"
[Oh, boy, here we go :)]
Lana's blush deepened. "He, uh… announced something. On public TV."
After lots of stuttering, with Lilith finding Lana's speech hilarious, Stark understood the whole picture.
Arthur Moonless, that bastard, took advantage of his relationship with Lana to announce to the entire world that Stark was his son-in-law.
Or, more like, he said that he was Lana's fiancé.
"...Ok?" Stark raised his eyebrows, "Is that all?"
"Yeah, you're not angry?"
To be honest, it was a bit annoying, but... Stark didn't feel a thing.
His mind was too pre-occupied with the missions he was given, and he wanted to check the [Missions] app as well as the [ApostleDex].
He didn't want to admit it, but even though he finally met the girls in such a calm setting after so long, he kept glancing at the exit door.
[Get. Out.]
[You have work to do.]
[Don't slack off.]
Such panels would constantly appear and disappear from his vision.
Even he... felt like something was missing.
Was it the thrill of fighting for his life, or maybe he just felt like having a calm life after all the threats and intense stuff was dull.
"That's okay, it's not like he lied," Stark simply mumbled to the news as he got up, "I don't mind."
"..." Lana's face almost exploded, it was now almost as red as Stark's aura, "R-Really?" her eyes were sparkling, and she was smiling so much it became scary.
Seeing that Lana got all the attention, though, Sora also reached for Stark's sleeve.
Her face was as neutral as ever, and without even being embarrassed, she simply asked, "What about me?"
"Is polygamy even allowed in this country?"
"Yes it is," Sora replied without hesitation.
"Then it's fine, I guess..."
[Who cares about that. Go complete those missions.]
[You'll play with them later :)]
His classes seemed to really pressure him to get rid of the apostles now that he had a way to know where they were.
"Three's always better than two, you know," Lilith winked too, she was as playful as always, though Stark noticed her face grew a little redder.
"...I'll think about it."
He didn't know how this would play out, but it would be fine as long as he made sure that the girls agreed and were friendly with one another.
And so just like that... a week passed.
Stark didn't spend his time doing anything but enjoying it with Lilith, Lana and Sora.
They went out, spoke together, and had fun.
Everyone would recognize Stark immediately, though, which made things quite difficult.
"You're so famous~" Lana grinned, "Don't go doing anything with anyone else but us, though, right, I would get very mad!"
"...Sure."
Yet even then.
Even though Stark could feel that he was enjoying himself... he could never get the feeling of dread out of his head.
In his vision, the panels that mocked him for enjoying himself kept appearing.
[Are you serious?]
[Chosen One, my ass.]
[Do something!]
And in addition to that, the classes figure appeared again, though this time, it didn't speak.
It simply would appear around him and stare until he moved.
Stark couldn't enjoy himself, no matter what, that's what the world was saying.
Lilith, Lana and Even Sora looked very happy, even though the latter didn't let it out, and yet... he was the only one that really wasn't.
He wanted to be happy with them, but when you have these panels, the constants visions of the Godless Demon and his apostles, as well as the classes figure, how could he do that.
At the end of the week, Lana initiated intimacy while both Sora and Lilith were present.
She knew she couldn't avoid them, so she would rather accept them in their lives instead.
She started off wrong with Sora, but slowly she became a friend of hers.
And Lilith was easier to interact with as she was just playful, matching Lana's personality and making her laugh.
So of course, if Lana tried to do it with these two present, it means she was fine with them joining.
And so for the first time, they did.
He didn't know if it was because of his increased endurance or because of the [Incubus] class, but Stark was... much better than before.
It was Sora's and Lilith's first times too, so he tried his hardest to make it go smoothly.
And it did in the general sense, at least for the girls.
He realized that the only time Sora wasn't emotionless was during intimacy, too, which was a weird contrast.
And Lilith was surprisingly submissive, even though she was pretty playful and dominant in the real world.
Yet... even through all of that...
While the three girls were enjoying themselves, he was the only one sweating, his pupils burning and the vortex of aura in his eyes intensifying.
It wasn't that it wasn't pleasurable.
Instead... once he looked to his left...
[Are you having fun?]
The classes figure's face was right in front of his, their noses almost touching, and the vortex of colorful aura in its eyes more powerful than Stark's.
[Do you... enjoy yourself?]
[Or maybe...]
[...No, it doesn't matter.]
"..."
[Deal with them.]
He still pushed through until morning regardless, but that memory stuck with him.
And now he knew something for certain: he needed to deal with those three missions and the apostles inside them.
Otherwise... he wouldn't be able to keep going like this.

chapters.title: Chapter 399 - 399: The ApostleDex's Third Line, Back to Work
chapters.content:
Once morning came, Stark was the only one still awake.
He had been intimate with the three girls all night long, yet he wasn't tired.
Instead, his mind was clouded with the memories of the classes' figures words: "Get the job done".
He looked back at the bed, Lana, Sora and Lilith lying there, peacefully resting.
"Well, I think it's better to go now," he mumbled, "I'll just send them a message or something."
If he wanted to complete those three missions, he would need to do it quick while he could.
[224 days 14 hours 52 minutes 28 seconds...]
The timer was still ticking down, too.
He went to the kitchen, then ate a bowl of cereal before finally making his choice.
"Alright, I'm ready, classes."
When he uttered those words, the classes figure appeared before him, finally smiling for the first time.
[Good, Chosen One.]
[Let's get rid of these assholes, then we can do whatever we want.]
"That's right."
But first, Stark opened up his [ApostleDex], since he wanted to check out the information he hadn't for a week.
He was so busy trying to enjoy himself every second that he had tried to not do anything related to the classes, his [Multi-Task Watch] or the [Domination Association].
But now he couldn't run anymore.
"ApostleDex, open up."
Ding!
The crimson panel with the 15 squares appeared before him.
All squares of the first two lines were now crossed out, as every apostle there was killed, meaning that only the final line remained.
[Information on the third line is available.]
"Yeah, show it to me."
Out of the 5 squares, four of their figures were darkened, meaning it was impossible for Stark to know what they looked like as he had never seen them.
Only one was visible: the [Great Serpent] he had met on the [Sunken Bridge], looking as terrifying as ever.
And of course, the two eyes that probably belonged to the [Godless Demon] were still there.
[5 remain.]
[Here's your information on them!]
"Yeah, give it to me," these things would tell him about their location, so it was all good as it would greatly help.
Ding! Ding! Ding!
...
[Line 3, Apostle 1]
[Name: ???]
[Level: ???]
[Location Hint: Domination Association's first "Impossible-Rank" mission.]
...
"Damn, as expected," Stark sighed.
Looks like they truly hadn't lied to him about the fact that there were apostles in there.
And the fact the Godless Demon, though he wasn't at his full power, was protecting the portals linked to them was probably to only allow him to enter.
Godless wanted to see Stark die in the hands of his apostles.
And even if they did die, it didn't matter to him.
For in the end, he could always do something very precise to revive them all to continue the chaos.
Stark would never be able to kill him, as that would mean reaching the Godless Demon's level in less than a year.
For now, all of this was but a show to the most powerful monster in this world.
...
[Line 3, Apostle 2]
[Name: Great Serpent]
[Level: 820 - Universal Rank]
[Location Hint: Domination Association's second "Impossible-Rank" mission.]
...
He already knew about this one, so it wasn't news or surprising.
But the fact that the second apostle of the third line was already this powerful, and at the [Universal Rank], meant that the ones beyond it would be even more terrifying.
There was only one rank beyond [Universal], and it was the [Divine] one, probably reserved for the last apostle and the [Godless Demon] himself.
...
[Line 3, Apostle 3]
[Name: ???]
[Level: ???]
[Location Hint: Domination Association's third "Impossible-Rank" mission.]
...
"Damn, they REALLY weren't kidding."
The first three apostles of the last line were ALL inside of one of the missions issued to him.
This made things infinitely easier, and with the association's help, he would be able to teleport there without having to find it himself.
Even with the locations given to him the previous times, some places would still remain unknown.
This happened with the [Colosseum] from before, until he eventually realized it was one of the academy's task.
But now, there was no "unknown", he already had everything he needed.
Except maybe... strength.
Stark clenched his fist, looking at it as burned with aura.
"No... I'll grow stronger, for sure."
He still had [258] skill points that he could assign, as well as ask the association to give him some skill stones or something to upgrade them all.
"Anyway," Stark shook his head as he stared at the final two squares.
These two let out an ominous aura, much more powerful than any of the others ones.
It was also the apostles he didn't know about, since they wouldn't be in the missions.
"Here goes nothing," he breathed in as he checked it out.
...
[Line 3, Apostle 4]
[Name: ???]
[Level: ???]
[Location Hint: The Final Domination Trial]
...
[Line 3, Apostle 5]
[Name: ???]
[Level: ???]
[Location Hint: The Final Domination Trial]
...
"!!!" Stark's eyes widened so much at the sight that he almost woke up the girls.
The... final domination trial?!
There's another one!?
This is insane! How was this possible!
Wasn't Oliver level 200 himself? Wasn't he at the peak yet didn't have any sort of trial?
Or maybe... it was exclusive to him?
Ding!
Another panel appeared at that moment.
[The Final Domination is reserved only for the Chosen One, meaning that he will be alone.]
This meant no participant killing games: it was simply Stark against the monsters.
Stark against the two apostles, alone.
This was all the info he was given about the trial, and though he would have liked more of it, it was still more than enough for him to understand.
"Well... I guess I don't have any reason to be here anymore..." he grinned.
Stark glanced at the sleeping girls one last time, their serene faces bathed in the soft glow of dawn.
His gaze lingered on Lana, Sora, and Lilith.
Despite the chaos ahead, this moment felt like a calm sanctuary he would fight to protect.
"See you later..." he whispered, his voice neutral.
He opened his [Multi-Task Watch], typing out a short message to each of them:
"I've got some business to take care of. Don't worry about me. I'll be back before you know it. Stay together, okay?"
With that done, Stark took a deep breath, his crimson aura flickering faintly as determination coursed through him.
"ApostleDex, close," he commanded, the panel vanishing from view.
The [Classes Figure] stood silently in the corner, its smile unchanging as it watched him prepare.
Stark opened the door, stepping into the crisp morning air.
He clenched his fists, feeling the raw energy pulsing through his veins.
His journey was on the verge of ending.
Only 5 more.
"Alright, Classes," he said, his voice steady. "Let's get to work."
[Good, Chosen One.]
The figure's grin widened, and the air around Stark shimmered as the world shifted.
"Multi-Task Watch, send me back to the association," he ordered as he remembered Oliver doing that.
[Very well, Stark]
In a flash of crimson light, he vanished, leaving behind the quiet room and the three sleeping girls.
He had a little more than half a year before it would be all over.
Within that time frame, the fate of this world would probably be decided.
Stark would do everything to stop it.

chapters.title: Chapter 400 - 400: Heading Toward the First Mission's Location, Scuba Suit
chapters.content:
Stark stepped into the crisp morning air outside his room, his mind already set on the daunting task ahead.
He had left a brief message for the girls, Lana, Sora, and Lilith, knowing they'd understand when they woke.
The time for hesitation had passed. Only five apostles remained, and Stark had no intention of wasting another second.
"Multi-Task Watch," he said calmly, "send me to the [Domination Association] headquarters."
In a flash of crimson light, the world around him blurred and shifted.
When the light faded, Stark found himself standing in the imposing [Commander's Meeting Room] of the [Domination Association].
The room was vast and circular, with a high domed ceiling inscribed with glowing runes.
At the center stood a grand table made of black stone, around which the commanders were seated.
"We need to check out those things, there seems to be at least four ongoing trials," Ed informed.
"Yeah, and new portals have been discovered too, it's weird, there's been a rise in rift portals lately..." Unity sighed.
"How about we just smash them all," Tia laughed.
"Doesn't matter, send the appropriate teams to the locations, we'll deal with them ourselves if needed," Oliver completed, his voice rough and authoritative.
The moment Stark materialized, the conversation came to a halt. All eyes turned to him.
"Well, look who decided to show up," Ed said with a smirk, leaning back in his chair. "Took you long enough."
"Good to see you too, Ed," Stark replied dryly, stepping closer to the table. "I'm here to let you know, I'm heading out to complete the first mission."
The room fell silent for a moment, the weight of Stark's declaration sinking in.
"Oh wow," Tia was the first to react, "So you're actually doing that?"
"...?" Stark titled his head, confused.
"You just lost me 100 bucks kid," Alexis groaned, pulling out his wallets and giving two pieces of paper to Ed and Oliver.
Did they seriously bet about whether he would get cold feet?
"Well, kid, you've got guts. I'll give you that," Ed said, rising from his seat. "But before you go, take this."
Ed walked over to a storage unit embedded in the wall and retrieved something.
When he returned, he handed Stark a sleek, black suit that seemed to shimmer faintly under the light.
"What is it?" Stark asked, holding it up.
A panel appeared from his [Multi-Task Watch], providing a detailed description:
[Submersible Suit]
[Rank: Godly]
[Description: A form-fitting scuba suit that becomes completely invisible once worn. Designed for underwater stealth and extreme conditions. Grants enhanced mobility and durability in aquatic environments.]
Stark raised an eyebrow, then placed the suit into his [Spatial Inventory].
"…Thanks," he said, tilting his head. "But why?"
Ed's grin widened. "You'll see why soon enough. Trust me, you'll be glad you have it."
"I'll take your word for it," Stark muttered, already turning to leave, "I've got work to do."
"Good luck, kid!" Ed called out. "I hope to see you later."
"Yeah, yeah, whatever," Stark replied, waving dismissively as he made his way to the [Teleportation] room.
Once inside, Stark paused for a moment to open his [Multi-Task Watch].
Navigating to the [Missions] app, he examined the three missions displayed on the screen.
However, when he tried to access the second and third missions, notifications popped up.
[Mission #2]
[Complete the first mission before accessing this one.]
[Mission #3]
[Complete the second mission before accessing this one.]
"Figures," Stark said with a shrug.
He selected the first mission, bringing up its details.
[Mission #1]
[Location: Lampod]
[The Multi-Task Watch will guide you if needed.]
"That'll do," Stark muttered as he closed the panel.
He headed toward the [Teleportation Room], the door closing behind him as the commanders all looked at his back.
"500 bucks that he's not coming back," Alexis shouted, "I want my money!"
"You're on!" Ed grinned.
Back to Stark, he stepped into the Lampod Teleportation Device, a circular platform surrounded by glowing runes.
As he stepped onto the platform, a surge of energy enveloped him, and his surroundings blurred once more.
In an instant, Stark was teleported to the capital city of Lampod.
...
The first thing Stark noticed was the light.
Unlike the bustling metropolis of Fellarburg, Lampod was bathed in a serene, almost ethereal glow.
Its architecture was a blend of modern design and ancient elegance, with crystalline towers reflecting the golden rays of the sun.
The streets were paved with smooth, marble tiles, and the air carried the faint scent of saltwater.
"Not bad," Stark remarked, taking in the view as a holographic arrow appeared above his [Multi-Task Watch], pointing him in the direction he needed to go.
He began to run, his shoes clicking softly against the tiled streets.
Yet despite the vibrant atmosphere, there was an undercurrent of tension. People glanced at him curiously, some even whispering as he passed.
"Hey, wait a damn minute... isn't that [HIM]?!"
"IT IS! TAKE A PICTURE! HOLY SHIT!"
Stark paid them no mind, his focus solely on the glowing arrow guiding him.
As he moved deeper into the city, the surroundings began to change.
The streets grew quieter, and the buildings took on a more abnormal design, with fewer decorations and more functional structures.
Eventually, the city gave way to the coastline.
Stark found himself standing at the edge of a vast, glittering sea.
"Huh," Stark muttered, glancing at the arrow.
To his surprise, it still pointed forward, directly over the water.
He frowned, then heard a familiar ding as a panel appeared from his [Multi-Task Watch].
[Mission #1 Update]:
[The first portal is located underwater, which makes us believe that the rift will happen in the same conditions...]
"Underwater, huh?" Stark said, scratching the back of his head.
He glanced at the ocean, the sunlight glinting off its surface, "Figures."
The message explained why Ed had given him the [Submersible Suit].
He briefly considered equipping it but decided to wait just a little bit.
"Alright, let's get this over with," Stark said, stepping closer to the water.
The holographic arrow continued to guide him, shifting as he walked along the shoreline.
Realizing he had no choice but to swim, Stark reluctantly retrieved the [Submersible Suit] from his [Spatial Inventory].
The suit conformed perfectly to his body the moment he put it on, becoming invisible as if it weren't even there.
To his surprise, it wasn't uncomfortable at all, it felt like a second skin.
"Well, at least it's not annoying," Stark muttered, stretching his arms before stepping into the water.
The moment he began swimming, Stark felt the suit's enhancements kick in.
His movements were smooth and efficient, cutting through the water with ease.
His swimming speed, while not groundbreaking, was still impressively fast.
For the first several minutes, the swim wasn't too bad.
The gentle rhythm of the waves and the quiet expanse of the ocean offered a rare moment of peace.
But as time dragged on, Stark began to grow impatient.
"Alright, how much farther is this thing?" he muttered, glancing at the holographic arrow from his [Multi-Task Watch].
He kept swimming for what felt like forever, the ocean stretching endlessly in all directions.
After about 30 minutes, with no sign of a portal or any change in the environment, Stark was starting to get frustrated.
Then, the arrow abruptly shifted.
Instead of pointing forward, it turned back.
"Wait, what?" Stark stopped, treading water as he stared at the arrow, it meant that he had just passed it!
The arrow flickered, readjusting before pointing directly downward.
Stark stared at the water beneath him, the endless blue stretching into darkness.
He let out a heavy sigh, realizing what came next.
"...Of course," he grumbled, taking a deep breath. "Here goes nothing."
With that, Stark dove beneath the waves, following the arrow into the depths.

chapters.title: Chapter 401 - 401: Into the Depths, Entering the Rift
chapters.content:
Stark stared at the arrow that now pointed down into the depths of the ocean.
The holographic marker hovering above his [Multi-Task Watch] seemed almost mocking, as if daring him to take the plunge.
"Great..."
Resigned, Stark dove into the depths of the ocean without wasting a single second, the shimmering sunlight above quickly fading as he descended.
His strokes were strong and steady, aided by the [Submersible Suit], which allowed him to glide through the water effortlessly.
The suit's seamless integration with his body made him feel almost weightless, and the resistance of the water was barely noticeable.
Despite the efficiency of his movements, the journey was long and eerily quiet.
The further down he went, the darker and colder it became.
Stark's keen senses stayed on high alert, scanning the murky waters around him.
He wasn't foolish enough to assume he'd be alone down here.
Minutes turned into what felt like hours.
The vast underwater expanse seemed endless, the occasional flicker of marine life breaking the monotony.
Stark's [Multi-Task Watch] guided him deeper and deeper, the holographic arrow unwavering in its direction.
Then, without warning, his instincts flared.
A shadow moved in the distance, growing larger as it approached.
Stark stopped swimming and hovered in place, narrowing his eyes at the figure emerging from the gloom.
The creature was enormous, at least twenty feet long, with a sleek, eel-like body covered in bioluminescent patterns that pulsed with an ominous glow.
Its gaping maw was lined with rows of razor-sharp teeth, and its fins flared out like jagged blades.
"...Damn."
[Name: Leviathan of the Depths]
[Level: 750]
[HP: 40,000,000/40,000,000]
[Strength: 54,839]
[Stamina: 47,821]
[Speed: 66,924]
[Defense: 35,517]
[Skills: Abyssal Roar, Abyssal Leviathan, The Depths of the Sea, Shadow Lunge, Chasm Wisp, Ebon Cloak, Hydro Frenzy, Concentrated Beam, Blue Fire...]
The monster let out a guttural roar, the sound distorted by the water but still loud enough to rattle Stark's nerves.
It surged toward him with terrifying speed, its glowing patterns intensifying as it closed the distance.
Stark didn't hesitate.
Summoning his crimson aura, he activated Aura Smash, materializing five glowing fists around him.
They hovered briefly before rocketing toward the creature with incredible force.
The first fist collided with the monster's head, sending a shockwave rippling through the water.
-3,082,184!
The second and third struck its sides, creating deep gashes in its tough, scaly hide.
-2,649,059! -2,855,663!
The [Double Damage] passive from the [Magus] class was actually incredible, and with it, even such a monster wouldn't even put a dent on him, well, if it was on land at least.
The creature writhed in pain, but it wasn't finished yet. With a powerful flick of its tail, it darted around Stark, trying to flank him.
Its glowing eyes locked onto Stark, and its maw opened to release a deafening Abyssal Roar.
The shockwave struck Stark like a hammer, sending him tumbling. His ears rang, and his equilibrium faltered.
Disoriented, Stark struggled to regain his balance.
"Annoying," he grunted, activating Focus to steady his senses.
His perception sharpened, allowing him to anticipate the Leviathan's movements.
The Leviathan lunged with Shadow Lunge, its massive jaws snapping mere inches from Stark's head.
He twisted and swam out of the way, a trail of crimson energy following his movements.
"Fast for something that size," Stark muttered.
The Leviathan didn't let up, swinging its colossal tail in a Chasm Whip.
The sheer force sent a shockwave through the water, tearing apart the water itself.
"What the fuck?!"
It was the first time Stark was fighting aquatic monsters, and he was currently in their environment, meaning at a massive disadvantage.
Stark darted upward, evading the attack. He retaliated by hurling three Crimson Spears toward its head.
The Leviathan activated Ebon Cloak, its body vanishing into a shroud of darkness. The spears dissipated, their energy consumed by the void.
"Tch, figures," Stark growled.
But before the Leviathan could fully hide, he threw a [Target Set] at it, locking onto the Leviathan's position despite its cloak.
A glowing mark appeared over the beast's body, visible only to him.
"Can't hide from me," Stark said with a smirk.
The Leviathan charged again, but Stark was ready.
He summoned Domi-Chains, the crimson restraints snaking through the water to latch onto the creature's massive frame.
The Leviathan thrashed violently, the chains holding firm for only a moment before snapping under its sheer strength.
The creature unleashed Hydro Frenzy, spinning water blades shooting toward Stark.
He countered with more spears that pulverized the blades. The shockwaves reverberated through the ocean.
This kept going for a while, of Stark just avoiding all attacks or countering, throwing projectiles when possible.
He even used his [Domination Soul] heart to smash it into the Leviathan's body several times.
Taking advantage of a brief opening as he noticed the Leviathan getting tired, Stark summoned the massive [Spear of Judgment], its glowing tip illuminating the abyss.
He hurled it with all his might, the spear striking the Leviathan's underbelly with a thunderous impact.
-24,847,371!
The creature roared in agony, blood billowing into the water as it recoiled.
And then... it stopped moving, it's HP having reached zero.
"Fucking hell..."
Ding!
[You have slain "Leviathan of the Depths", and gained 35,000,000 experience points!]
This wasn't enough to level up, but at least this was done with, and thanks to that thing, Stark was a little more used to fighting in water.
"This is more difficult than I thought," he muttered, resuming his descent toward the portal.
After what felt like another hour of swimming, Stark finally reached the location indicated by the holographic arrow.
The water here was pitch black, the only light coming from his [Multi-Task Watch].
He looked around, searching for the portal, when a faint glow caught his eye.
There, embedded in the seabed, was a swirling vortex of light.
The portal shimmered with hues of blue and gold, its energy radiating out in gentle pulses.
Stark swam closer, the glow illuminating his face as he studied it.
"Well, this is it," he said, reaching out cautiously.
His fingers brushed against the portal's surface, and a message appeared in front of him.
[Access Granted: Chosen One Detected.]
"Great," Stark muttered, stepping closer.
But before he could fully enter, the water around him began to churn violently.
Stark instinctively looked around, heightening his awareness.
The current grew stronger, and a massive figure began to materialize in front of the portal.
Emerging from the swirling waters was a colossal monster, easily three times the size of the one Stark had faced earlier.
Its body was humanoid but grotesque, covered in barnacles and seaweed.
Two glowing eyes stared down at him with an intensity that made the water feel even heavier.
In its hands, it held two massive tridents, their tips crackling with an eerie energy.
Stark tensed, preparing for another battle, but the creature made no move to attack.
Instead, it spoke, its voice a deep rumble that seemed to echo through the water.
"Seems like Lord Godless was right, he truly came..." it laughed.
Stark blinked, "You are..."
He immediately understood.
The creature didn't respond.
Instead, it raised one of its tridents and pointed it toward the portal.
A sudden surge of energy pulled Stark forward, as if an invisible hand were dragging him closer.
"Wait, what are you," Stark began, but before he could finish, the creature thrust its other trident toward him.
He wanted to avoid, but he still hadn't fully mastered [Aquatic Battles].
"GARGH-"
It pierced his stomach, and then pulled him directly into the portal, the vortex swallowing him whole.
Stark felt his body being pulled through a tunnel of light, the sensation disorienting and almost overwhelming.
He gritted his teeth, trying to regain control, but the energy was too strong.
After what felt like an eternity, the light faded, and Stark found himself standing in an entirely new environment.
The first thing he noticed was the air, heavy and humid, with the faint scent of salt and vegetation.
He wasn't in water anymore by the way, but on actual land.
He looked around, taking in his surroundings.
Looking around, Stark took in his surroundings.
He stood in a vast underwater cavern, its jagged walls adorned with luminous crystals that cast a gentle, otherworldly glow.
Streaks of moisture dripped from the rocky ceiling, forming shallow pools that rippled softly at his feet.
At the far end of the cavern, a wide tunnel descended back into water.
Stark sighed at the sight, realizing he wasn't done swimming just yet.
Behind him, the portal shimmered faintly for a moment before vanishing completely, leaving him alone in the cavern.
"Great," he muttered, brushing himself off. "What now?"
His [Multi-Task Watch] beeped, a new message appearing on the screen.
[User has been detected inside of the rift!]
[Mission Updated: Eliminate the Apostle.]

chapters.title: Chapter 402 - 402: The Underwater Cavern Rift, Starting the First Mission
chapters.content:
Ding!
[Mission Updated: Eliminate the Apostle.]
Stark exhaled sharply as the familiar beep of his Multi-Task Watch broke the silence.
New information then appeared in front of him, providing details about the rift.
[Name: Trident's Underwater Cavern]
[Difficulty: Determination]
[Recommended Level: 700–800]
[Number of Zones: 2]
"Only two zones, huh," Stark mumbled, narrowing his eyes.
Most rifts he had encountered had at least three or four zones.
[You are currently in the first zone: Before the Cavern]
Then again, this one was underwater, which probably made it more complex by default.
"Doesn't matter," Stark grumbled as he stretched his shoulders. "I'll still kick that guy's ass and get out of here."
Determined, he strode toward the water, ready to dive in and confront whatever awaited him in the depths.
But just as his boot grazed the edge...
SPLASH!
The water erupted violently, a massive figure emerging from the depths.
Towering above Stark was a monstrous fishman, easily over 30 meters in size.
The creature's upper half loomed out of the water, revealing a muscular, humanoid frame covered in glistening emerald-green scales.
Its arms were thick and corded with muscle, each holding an enormous trident adorned with glowing runes.
The tridents crackled faintly with an ominous energy, one with jagged, icy spikes and the other radiating with fiery embers.
The creature's face was eerily human-like but twisted, its sharp, angular features set with bulbous, yellow eyes that glared down at Stark.
"I am Voracron, Guardian of the Cavern!" the fishman boomed, his voice resonating like a crashing wave. "None shall pass without facing me!"
Stark frowned, taking a cautious step back as he analyzed the creature's status window.
[Name: Voracron, The Rift's First Guardian, Immortal Level]
[Level: 730]
[HP: 50,000,000/50,000,000]
[Strength: 64,894]
[Stamina: 54,228]
[Speed: 34,895]
[Defense: 43,211]
[Skills: Regenerative Tide; Aqua Barrier; Hydro Chains; Surge Step; Shockwave Dive; Frozen Abyss (Mythical); Trident Cyclone (Mythical); Tidal Smite (Godly); Infernal Tide (Godly); Guardian's Fury (Immortal)]
Stark whistled softly, lowering his watch.
"You know that I'm still gonna beat you, right? It would be bad if we were in water, but right now I'm on land."
Voracron grinned, his serrated teeth glinting as he raised both tridents, clearly unfazed by Stark's comment.
"Prepare yourself, intruder. Your journey ends here!"
It seems like it wasn't only the apostles that were given the order to eliminate Stark, but every single monster in their army.
Only the ones that actually had high-enough intellectual capabilities to speak would register that, though, probably.
Without warning, the massive fishman lunged forward, slamming one of his tridents into the ground.
BOOM!
A surge of water exploded outward, forcing Stark to leap back to avoid the incoming wave.
"Tidal Smite!"
[Description: Strikes with overwhelming force, unleashing a shockwave of water that stuns and damages enemies.
Even though Stark dodged the direct impact, the residual force sent him skidding across the wet cavern floor.
"Alright, big guy," Stark muttered, shaking himself off. "Let's see what you've got."
Voracron didn't give Stark time to catch his breath.
The fishman spun his tridents with blinding speed, activating Trident Cyclone.
A roaring vortex of water formed around him, tearing apart chunks of the cavern walls and sending shards of rock flying toward Stark.
"..."
Stark was unfazed by that, his expression neutral as he began to roll repeatedly with [Invincible Dodge], the projectiles flying through him, literally.
"What?" Voracron was baffled.
Spear of Judgment!
Stark immediately retaliated with his own attack, summoning the massive spear and sending it toward the monster.
The spear struck true, but the glowing aura of Aqua Barrier absorbed the impact.
The spear dissolved into harmless crimson light before even scratching the scales.
"Pathetic!" Voracron sneered, his webbed hand slamming into the ground, though Stark noticed him sweating.
With the passive that the [Magus] class granted Stark, if the [Spear of Judgment] had hit, it would have surely been at least 20,000,000 damage.
This was how powerful Stark became.
"..."
The water beneath Stark began to swirl ominously, forming shimmering chains that shot upward.
Hydro Chains!
Stark leapt into the air, flipping backward to avoid being bound, but Voracron was ready.
The fishman lunged forward with both tridents, aiming to skewer Stark midair.
CLANG!
"Stupid..."
Stark managed to summon another Crimson Spear in time, blocking the tridents with a shower of sparks.
The force of the blow sent him crashing into the cavern wall.
"Not bad," Stark grunted, pushing himself upright. "But let's even the odds."
Raising his hand, Stark decided to activate an ability similar to the [Hydro Chains], but much more powerful.
"Domi-Chains Restraint: Chains of Judgment!"
Blood-red chains erupted from the ground, snaking through the air with unnatural speed.
Three sets of chains wrapped tightly around Voracron's limbs, binding him in place.
But that wasn't all.
The air around Stark darkened as a shadowy figure materialized behind him.
Gortox, the Chain Demon.
The demonic entity towered over even Voracron, its entire body composed of writhing chains.
With a guttural roar, Gortox extended its own crimson bindings, reinforcing the restraints around the fishman.
Voracron thrashed violently, his scales flashing with bursts of energy as he tried to break free.
"What the hell is this..."
"You're not going anywhere," Stark growled, clenching his fist.
He charged forward, summoning the massive crimson cross of Wielding Cross.
Holy Combo!
Stark swung the cross once.
-6,362,839!
Twice.
-6,431,954!
And on the third strike, the weapon lit up with a brilliant crimson aura as the effects of the perk activated.
"Oh shit..." even Voracron knew that he was fucked.
BOOOOM!
The final blow struck Voracron's chest with devastating force, sending shockwaves rippling through the cavern.
The guardian roared in agony, stunned by the overwhelming power.
-12,475,553!
With Voracron immobilized, Stark unleashed a relentless assault.
Crimson fists materialized in the air, pummeling the guardian repeatedly, each blow landing with bone-crushing force.
The cavern shook as Voracron's health plummeted, his once-mighty roars reduced to desperate gasps.
"Let's end this," Stark said coldly, summoning the colossal spear again, "This one won't miss."
Spear of Judgment!
This time, he aimed directly for Voracron's head.
FWISH... BOOOOM!
The spear struck, piercing through the fishman's skull in a burst of crimson light.
[Weakness Hit!]
-52,372,992!
Instant death!
Even if the fishman had been full health, if he was hit by that attack, all of his health would have been drained.
Such a feat wouldn't even be possible by classifiers at level 750 as they would still need to fight that monster.
And yet... Stark did it casually and easily, with a single attack, completely overwhelming the opponent.
He wasn't messing around, wanting to end these three tasks as soon as possible and end the Godless Demon once and for all.
"You... will... be... stopped..." Voracron's body convulsed before slumping forward, lifeless.
The cavern fell silent, save for the faint crackle of energy dissipating from the defeated guardian's weapons.
Stark exhaled, brushing dust off his coat as he stepped forward.
"One down," he muttered, glancing at the still waters ahead. "Let's see what's waiting in Zone Two."
But of course, before that, he received the usual notification.
[You have slain "Voracron, The Rift's First Guardian" and gained 80,000,000 experience points!]
