chapters.title: Chapter 403 - 403: The Underwater Zone, Relentless Determination
chapters.content:
[You have slain "Voracron, The Rift's First Guardian" and gained 80,000,000 experience points!]
Stark smirked as the familiar notification appeared in front of him, accompanied by a satisfying chime.
[Your level has increased to level 156, granting you six skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Experience: 65,545,000/88,000,000] (Level 156)
[Skill Points: 264]
Stark stared at the glowing notifications hovering in front of him.
Despite his annoyance with constant interruptions, the feeling of leveling up was always gratifying.
"Level 156," Stark muttered, running a hand through his wet hair.
He briefly considered spending some of the 264 skill points he had accumulated, but the thought was fleeting.
The adrenaline coursing through him and his drive to finish this task kept him from stopping.
"I'll handle that later," Stark decided, turning his attention back to the cavern.
He felt like he wouldn't be able to stay in place and concentrate enough to make the right decisions.
The silence was eerie after the thunderous battle with Voracron. It almost felt unnatural.
Shaking his head, he approached the water ahead.
The still, mirror-like surface reflected his bloodied figure. The sight made him smirk grimly.
"..."
[It's you.]
"I know."
Without hesitation, Stark leapt into the depths.
The icy chill of the water enveloped Stark instantly as he plunged beneath the surface.
The water was colder than he expected, chilling his skin even through his reinforced clothing.
The cavern seemed much deeper than it had looked from the surface; the further he descended, the darker and more foreboding it became.
The walls vanished into the abyss below, leaving him surrounded by a haunting void.
Shapes moved in the distance, their silhouettes unclear. Were they harmless fish? Or monsters?
It didn't matter to Stark, if they attacked him, he would kill.
But his immediate focus was the path ahead.
He could feel the faint pull of magical energy emanating from somewhere deep in the cavern.
As Stark swam, the water grew thicker, more oppressive.
This kept going for thirty minutes.
Thirty minutes of pure silence.
At this point in a rift, Stark would have expected to have to fight dozens of enemies, yet this time, maybe because he was in the water, it was quiet.
Too quiet for his liking, to be honest.
The abyss below seemed endless, a black void that could hide anything, or everything.
It was easy to imagine some colossal beast lurking in the darkness, its body so massive it would seem like the abyss itself.
Its mouth would swallow him before he even realized.
"..."
But after a while... it happened.
As if summoned by his thoughts, the shadows in the distance that kept following him grew larger, their speed and numbers increasing.
Within moments, a school of massive creatures emerged from the gloom, their sleek, scaly forms glinting ominously in the dim light.
Thirty monstrous piranhas, the size of full-grown humans.
[Abyss Piranha]
[Level: 750]
[HP: 30,000,000]
[Skills: Frenzied Bite, Abyssal Swarm Tactics, Enhanced Regeneration, Bite of The Depths, The Lord's Will, Ultra Sonar, King Piranha Merge (Immortal)...]
"Thirty?" Stark whispered, his voice muffled by the water.
The creatures swarmed around him, their razor-sharp teeth gleaming and their eyes glowing with primal hunger.
For the first time in a while, Stark was the one cornered, surrounded by these things.
The sight was overwhelming, the sheer pressure of the abyss and the ferocity of his foes pressing against his mind.
"Alright," he muttered, "Let's do this."
The first piranha lunged at him with terrifying speed, its jaws snapping mere inches from his arm.
Stark retaliated instantly, summoning one of his Crimson Spears and impaling the creature through its midsection.
-7,234,892!
The piranha writhed violently, but its regeneration began almost immediately.
Before Stark could land a finishing blow, two more piranhas darted in, their teeth sinking into his leg and shoulder.
"Argh!" Stark growled, feeling the searing pain as blood clouded the water around him.
-18,372! -13,389!
They didn't do that much damage, to be honest, but he didn't like the feeling at all.
He spun in place, summoning Aura Smash, and unleashed five crimson fists that pummeled the attacking piranhas.
The blows sent the creatures reeling, their regeneration unable to keep up with the relentless assault.
Yet, they didn't die, simply going back to their original positions.
There were still so many.
The swarm encircled him, glowing eyes flashing like sinister beacons.
Stark gulped as the sheer number of them sank in.
Even for someone as powerful as him, the sight was overwhelming.
"Keep it together, Stark," he muttered under his breath. "You've faced worse."
He used Asura's Arms, four additional crimson limbs sprouting from under his arms and shoulder.
He equipped each arm with a [Crimson Spear].
If the weakness of these things was their mouth or eyes, then he should be able to one-shot them if he manages.
With his enhanced reach and strength, Stark launched into the swarm, his movements swift and precise despite the weight of the water.
One spear pierced through a piranha's head, instantly killing it with a Critical Hit, while the others focused on keeping the swarm at bay.
The battle raged on for what felt like hours.
Stark's aura illuminated the abyss as he unleashed attack after attack, his Invincible Dodge saving him from countless bites.
Still, the piranhas' sheer numbers and relentless regeneration made the fight grueling.
Occasionally, one would get past his defenses, its razor-sharp teeth tearing into his flesh.
Stark gritted his teeth against the pain, his determination allowing him to continue.
Slam! Slam!
Using his [Domination Soul] also revealed itself to be extremely useful, although the piranhas would try to bite down the chains.
"Come on!" he roared, summoning Spear of Judgment.
The colossal spear tore through three piranhas in a single strike, leaving a glowing trail of crimson in its wake.
[Body exploded, instant death.]
-38,381,493!
The swarm began to thin, the piranhas' confidence faltering as their numbers dwindled.
Stark noticed their hesitation and capitalized on it.
"Not so tough now, are you?" he taunted, slamming two more with [Holy Combo].
The stunning third strike obliterated one completely, its body dissolving into the abyssal water.
Finally, after what felt like an eternity, Stark realized that this wouldn't cut it.
Even though it had been a while, still seventeen of those still roamed around him, waiting for the perfect moment.
His [Crimson Barrier] was almost destroyed too.
So instead, he decided to use a perk he had never used before, and it was one from [Asura's Arms].
ASURA'S WRATH!
[Description: Harness the power of the God of Wrath to summon four additional arms, doubling the user's physical power.
You can also unleash a devastating attack that annihilates everything in a 100-meter radius.]
This second part was the one that he had never used before.
And so... what had to be done happened.
The four crimson arms from Asura's Arms pulsed with divine energy, their aura intensifying as Stark slammed them together.
"Tank this, bastards..."
A blinding light erupted, illuminating the abyss with a crimson glow.
The sheer force of his will manifested as an earth-shattering shockwave, tearing through the water and obliterating everything in its path.
The swarm of piranhas didn't stand a chance. The shockwave consumed them before they could react, their bodies disintegrating into the void.
All of them died.
And so, he received the notification.
Ding! Ding! Ding!
[You have slain 30 Abyss Piranhas and gained 234,000,000 experience points!]
Ding! Ding! Ding!
[Your level has increased to level 157, granting you six skill points and a boost in stats.]
[Your level has increased to level 158, granting you six skill points and...]
[Your level has increased to level 159, granting you...]
[Experience: 23,545,000/100,000,000] (Level 159)
[Skill Points: 282]
"Good," Stark muttered, clenching his fists. "One step closer."
The water around him seemed to grow calmer, almost eerily so.
It was as if the remaining creatures in the abyss had witnessed his victory and decided he was not worth it to intervene.
Regardless, Stark pushed forward, swimming deeper into the cavern.

chapters.title: Chapter 404 - 404: The Golden Door, The Test of the Guardians
chapters.content:
After what felt like an eternity of swimming through the oppressive abyss, Stark finally reached a massive structure embedded into the cavern wall.
The sight was breathtaking: a colossal golden door towering over him, at least 50 meters tall and twice as wide.
Its surface shimmered faintly in the dim light, decorated with intricate engravings of battles long past.
Classifiers clashed with monstrous beings, their figures frozen in dramatic poses of struggle and triumph.
"...?"
Stark drifted closer, his sharp eyes scanning every detail.
At the center of the door were three circular indentations, their smooth surfaces gleaming like polished glass.
One of them glowed faintly, filled with a golden sphere.
[Defeat all Three Guardians to access the Boss!]
"So, that's the deal," Stark muttered, his voice low as he stared at the glowing indentation.
The orb seemed to pulse softly, its light almost alive.
Voracron's defeat must have triggered it, marking one of the three slots.
He stepped back slightly, his gaze shifting to the paths branching off to either side of the door.
The left path descended into darkness, the faint echo of dripping water the only sound emanating from its depths.
In contrast, the right path sloped upward, its faint red glow suggesting intense volcanic heat.
"So, like a mini-trial," he mused, tilting his head to one side. "Reminds me of the first domination trial I went through with the guardians..."
Remember, back when he had to kill all guardians to activate a statue to descend to the final boss.
This was oddly similar, almost as if... it was directly taken inspiration from...
"No, I must be imagining it," he mumbled.
The corner of his mouth twitched into a wry smirk.
As powerful as he was, Stark couldn't help but feel like he was being toyed with.
It wasn't the first time a Rift had thrown him into something elaborate, and it certainly wouldn't be the last.
With a sigh, he ran a hand through his damp hair, pushing the blood-matted strands out of his face.
"Two more to go. Might as well get this over with."
His decision was swift.
Without a second thought, Stark chose the left path, drawn to the silent promise of darkness.
He also felt like the right one was too "good", which probably meant the strongest of the guardians was there.
He adjusted his stance, steadying his breathing as he plunged deeper into the unknown.
The air grew colder as Stark ventured further along the left path, the temperature starkly different from the humid waters of the cavern.
A sense of unease began to settle over him, the kind of prickling sensation that set his instincts on edge.
The tunnel twisted and turned, narrowing at times until it felt like the walls were closing in around him.
"..."
Without the scuba suit, he would have never managed to survive long enough, so he could thank Ed for it.
Despite his outward confidence, Stark knew better than to let his guard down in a Rift, especially one as advanced as this.
Suddenly, the path widened into an expansive chamber.
Stark stopped in his swim, his eyes narrowing as he surveyed his surroundings.
The cavern was vast, its ceiling disappearing into shadow far above.
Strange, luminescent plants clung to the walls, casting an eerie blue-green light across the jagged stone.
And then, he saw it.
In the center of the chamber stood a massive creature, its body coiled and shimmering with a metallic sheen.
Its serpentine form was easily the length of several buildings, its scales glinting like polished steel.
Two piercing yellow eyes glared at Stark, unblinking and filled with malice.
[You have encountered "Thalveros, The Abyssal Sentinel!"]
[Level: 740]
[HP: 60,000,000]
[Skills: Abyssal Coil, Venomous Torrent, Steel Skin, Crushing Depths, Sentinel's Rage...]
"..." Stark looked at the monster from above.
Thalveros let out a low, guttural hiss that reverberated through the chamber, the sound rattling Stark's bones.
The creature began to uncoil, its massive body shifting with terrifying grace as it prepared to strike.
"Seems like Valcreon was truly not enough to defeat you, Chosen," it said, smiling, only it's eyes visible in the darkness below.
"..."
Stark didn't wait for the first move.
In an instant, he summoned his Crimson Spears, the glowing weapons materializing around him with a crackle of energy.
The cavern was bathed in a crimson glow as Stark hurled the first spear with pinpoint precision, aiming directly for one of the creature's eyes.
The spear struck true, but instead of piercing through, it glanced off the creature's scales with a sharp clang, leaving only a faint scratch.
-0!
"Steel skin," Stark muttered, his jaw tightening. "Figures."
With a roar that sent ripples tearing through the water, Thalveros lashed out with its massive tail.
The strike was lightning-fast, the sheer force of the movement creating a shockwave that sent Stark hurtling backward.
He managed to regain control just in time, activating Invincible Dodge to avoid the follow-up strike.
The sentinel's tail slammed into the rocky floor, shaking the entire chamber and sending chunks of debris floating upward in the disturbed water.
Stark darted to the side, swimming with fluid agility as he assessed his opponent.
"Alright, big guy," he muttered, gripping his spears tightly with his 6 hands, "Let's see how tough you really are."
"Do you truly believe you can defeat me in my domain?" Thalveros laughed from the abyss, "You beat all the others on land, I'd love to see you try in water!"
There was a clap from below, and immediately, the way Stark came from closed down by an impossibly sturdy wall of rocks.
[You cannot leave until defeating the monster or dying.]
[Though it is possible to destroy that exit if you're strong enough :).]
"..." Stark looked at the tunnel before smiling, "Do you really think I care? You're the one that's gonna one to escape by the time I'm done."
"I will use your remains as decoration for my abyss, and showcase you to the lord and all these lowly humans at the surface," the Sentinel answered.
Stark was surrounded by darkness at this point, the glow of his Crimson Spears being the only other source of illumination, which was why he kept them.
Stark darted sideways, his six hands gripping his spears tightly.
His movements were fluid, calculated, each stroke through the water propelling him with incredible speed.
"You talk too much," Stark said, his voice cold as he flung two Crimson Spears in quick succession.
The spears spiraled through the water, glowing with an intense crimson hue.
Thalveros responded with a swipe of its gargantuan tail, deflecting the projectiles effortlessly.
"I guess it's time to get serious," Thalveros kept laughing over and over.
The water stirred ominously as the Sentinel's laughter echoed, carrying an unsettling resonance through the chamber.
Stark's narrowed eyes were fixed on the looming silhouette before him, but even his enhanced perception had failed to grasp the sheer magnitude of the creature.
As a faint mist began to seep from Thalveros' body, it illuminated the surrounding darkness, creating an ethereal glow that bathed the chamber in eerie light.
The mist, shimmering faintly with golden flecks, coiled around the beast, accentuating its immense form.
Stark's jaw dropped. His mind raced as he took in the sight before him.
"How...?"
The Sentinel was massive.
Its serpentine body twisted and turned, stretching beyond what he could fathom.
The cavern itself struggled to contain the beast, its coils filling the space and wrapping around the jagged walls like an ancient god of the abyss.
At this size, Thalveros wasn't just a creature, he was an environment, a battlefield unto himself.
"You finally see it, don't you, little Chosen?" Thalveros' voice boomed, reverberating through the water. "I am the abyss. I am eternal. You will die knowing the futility of defiance."
Stark didn't answer.
His Crimson Spears floated around him like orbiting satellites, their glow defiant against the overwhelming darkness.
He inhaled deeply, calming the rising tension in his chest.
"Size doesn't matter," he muttered, his voice steady but cold, "And if you were as powerful as you say, you wouldn't be the goon of an apostle."

chapters.title: Chapter 405 - 405: Thalveros is Too Strong, Moving Away to the Second Path
chapters.content:
The cavern shuddered with every thrash of Thalveros' enormous body, the water reverberating as if caught in an endless earthquake.
Stark was struggling to keep up.
His strikes, meticulous, precise, and devastating against most foes, barely left a mark on the Sentinel's impossibly tough steel-like scales.
Even with his stats doubled from Double Assault, the colossal creature seemed untouchable.
-0!
This was the number that appeared every time.
"What the..."
Another spear ricocheted off the creature's hide, spiraling away uselessly into the abyss.
Stark's breathing grew heavier, frustration mounting.
"This isn't working," he muttered, his six arms tense with effort as he maneuvered away from another devastating swipe of Thalveros' tail.
Each movement sent massive shockwaves through the water, leaving Stark with less and less room to evade.
The Sentinel's laughter echoed, deep and rumbling like a storm.
"You dare call yourself Chosen, yet you are nothing more than an insect flailing in my domain!"
"Shut up," Stark hissed, though the weight of the monster's words pressed against his mind.
Every attack he launched seemed to bounce off, his strength insufficient against a foe this massive.
He was strong, among the strongest of the world, but even he had his limits.
A sudden realization hit him like a chilling current: he was completely outmatched.
"I need to retreat," he thought, gritting his teeth.
Retreat wasn't something Stark liked to consider, but he wasn't foolish enough to keep fighting an impossible battle.
The only other solution was [Heaven's Wrath], but he planned to use it against the apostle to instantly end it.
The battle continued, each exchange more brutal than the last.
Stark narrowly avoided another crushing blow, his Crimson Barrier flashing with warning signals as it absorbed yet another massive impact.
BOOM!
[Crimson Barrier destroyed!]
"Shit..."
Now it was only he and his 290,000 HP left.
But then, amidst the chaos, something unexpected happened.
Thalveros' massive tail slammed into the rocky cavern wall with such force that it fractured the structure.
Cracks spread like veins across the stone, and with one final crash, the wall gave way, revealing a hidden passage illuminated faintly by glowing coral-like formations.
An exit.
Stark's eyes widened. "That's my chance!"
Without hesitation, he darted toward the opening, his movements swift and calculated.
Behind him, Thalveros roared in fury, realizing its prey was attempting to escape.
"You cannot run from me!" the Sentinel bellowed, its voice shaking the chamber as it began to give chase.
The newly revealed passage led into an even darker section of the cavern.
Stark swam through it as fast as he could, his Crimson Spears still glowing faintly to light his way.
The oppressive weight of the water seemed to ease slightly, giving him a small sense of relief.
But as he moved deeper, that relief was quickly replaced by a sinking feeling.
The path twisted sharply, and suddenly, Stark found himself back in the giant cavern with the [Golden Door].
"...Well, I'll come back to that later," he mumbled as he took the left path this time.
This one was different from the last as it went up.
The water here was strangely still, almost eerily so, and the temperature dropped sharply.
"I thought for sure it would go up, weird..."
The path abruptly twisted upward before Stark found himself in an enormous chamber, a hollowed-out expanse, impossibly vast, bathed in an eerie, crimson hue.
In the center of the chamber stood a figure, a towering humanoid creature that radiated an overwhelming aura of menace.
The third guardian.
The creature's body was covered in thick, bone-like armor, its surface etched with glowing blue runes.
It stood at least ten meters tall, its elongated limbs ending in clawed hands that crackled with dark energy.
Its head was crowned with a jagged horn, and its glowing white eyes locked onto Stark the moment he entered the chamber.
[You have encountered "Orithal, the Abyssal Warden!"]
[Level: 750]
[HP: 65,000,000]
[Skills: Abyssal Surge, Void Shackles, Soul Rend, Warden's Command...]
Stark cursed under his breath, his muscles tensing as he prepared for yet another battle.
"Of course. Another oversized freak," he muttered, gripping his spears tightly, "Though this is more manageable."
Orithal's voice boomed, cold and echoing like the depths of the ocean.
"Intruder. You dare trespass further? Your punishment will be eternal suffering."
The Warden raised one of its massive arms, dark energy swirling around its clawed hand.
The water began to churn violently, as if reacting to its power.
Stark could feel the oppressive weight of its aura pressing down on him.
"Yeah, yeah, I've heard it all before," Stark said, his voice laced with defiance.
Despite his confidence, he couldn't deny the exhaustion creeping into his body.
He was already drained from the fight with Thalveros, and now he had to face another monstrosity.
Orithal took a step forward, the water trembling with each movement.
Stark raised his arms, preparing to attack.
But then, the darkness stirred.
Before Orithal could strike, an immense shadow emerged from the abyss below.
The water churned violently as the colossal form of Thalveros surged upward, its glowing yellow eyes burning with fury.
The Sentinel's massive body coiled around the chamber, dwarfing both Stark and the Warden.
"What the—" Stark's eyes widened in disbelief as the second guardian loomed over them both.
He barely had time to react before Thalveros lashed out with one of its massive coils.
Orithal turned sharply, its glowing eyes narrowing as it sensed the threat.
But it was too late.
Thalveros' tail struck with devastating force, wrapping around both Stark and the Warden in a crushing grip.
"HEY, I'M WITH YOU," Orithal shouted.
The pressure was immense, squeezing the air from Stark's lungs and threatening to shatter his bones.
He struggled desperately, his six arms flailing as he tried to free himself.
"Let go!" Stark snarled, summoning a Crimson Ball in one of his hands.
The glowing sphere pulsed with energy as he focused on his escape.
In a split second, Stark threw the crimson ball and activated the ability, teleporting himself out of Thalveros' grasp.
He reappeared several meters away, gasping for breath as he clutched his side.
But Orithal wasn't so lucky.
The Warden thrashed wildly in Thalveros' coils, its massive frame dwarfed by the Sentinel's overwhelming size.
Dark energy crackled around Orithal's body as it tried to free itself, but the Sentinel's grip was unrelenting.
"YOU BITCH!"
"You wouldn't have won anyway," Thalveros laughed, "Now once I get rid of you two, I'll be able to defeat the [Lord of Water Guardians] and become an apostle myself, Chosen is the only thing that's disrupting everthing."
"YOU-"
With a sickening crunch, Thalveros' jaws closed around Orithal's upper body.
The Warden let out a guttural roar, its glowing eyes dimming as its life force was drained away.
The Sentinel shook its prey violently, tearing the Warden apart piece by piece.
Stark watched in stunned silence, his Crimson Spears floating uselessly by his side.
The scene was grotesque, a vivid reminder of just how outmatched he truly was.
"What the fuck..." Stark whispered, his voice barely audible.
Thalveros devoured the remnants of the Warden, its massive form writhing with satisfaction.
The glowing runes on Orithal's armor faded into nothingness, leaving only darkness in their wake.
The Sentinel turned its glowing yellow eyes toward Stark, a wicked grin spreading across its colossal maw.
"Did you truly think you could escape me, little Chosen?"
Stark's heart raced as he realized the full weight of his predicament.
"..."
He tightened his grip on his spears, his mind racing.
There had to be a way out, some kind of strategy to turn the tide.
But as Thalveros began to close the distance by climbing from the abyss, Stark couldn't shake the sinking feeling that he was in over his head.

chapters.title: Chapter 406 - 406: Double Deaths, Revive and Ready to Nuke
chapters.content:
The cavern rumbled endlessly, the water trembling with every movement of the massive creature lurking within the abyss.
Stark hovered above the darkness, surrounded by his glowing Crimson Spears, his heart racing.
He had never faced something like this before, an enemy so massive, so overwhelming, that even seeing it felt impossible.
The stats on the creature's status screen haunted him.
[Thalveros, The Abyssal Sentinel (Immortal)]
[Level: 740]
[HP: 60,000,000]
[Strength: 34,372]
[Speed: 31,849]
[Defense: 99,999]
[Stamina: 34,571]
[Skills: Abyssal Coil, Venomous Torrent, Steel Skin, Crushing Depths, Sentinel's Rage...]
"Yeah... I saw that before..." Stark muttered as he saw the defense, disbelief etched across his face. "You've got to be kidding me."
No wonder his attacks weren't working.
From above, Stark hurled another barrage of Crimson Spears into the abyss below.
The glowing projectiles pierced the water with precision, each strike carrying enough force to obliterate most foes.
But as they disappeared into the blackness, the result was always the same.
-0! -0! -0!
Even the [Spear of Judgment] did absolutely NOTHING!
Stark clenched his jaw in frustration. Every single attack was worthless. His sharp eyes scanned the darkness, searching for any hint of Thalveros' true form.
But the creature remained hidden, an unseen titan beneath the water's surface.
The faint glimmers of movement he caught were massive, far larger than anything he had ever fought before, but even as he descended lower and lower, the Sentinel refused to reveal itself.
"Come on, show yourself!" Stark growled, his six arms poised to unleash another flurry of attacks.
Suddenly, the water stirred violently. A shadow moved, impossibly large, far below him.
Stark gritted his teeth and dove closer, determined to get a better view.
He felt the oppressive weight of the Sentinel's presence, a suffocating aura that pressed against his mind and body.
As he neared the abyssal depths, the shadows shifted, and for a brief moment, Stark saw something, teeth.
Endless rows of them, forming a gaping maw that could swallow a mountain whole.
"Holy…" Stark's words trailed off as he froze in place.
Before he could react further, a massive tail shot out from the darkness, crashing into him with the force of a meteor.
-73,839!
Stark was sent hurtling backward, not expecting that from a creature that had supposedly very low strength and speed.
"Damn it!" he spat, regaining his balance just in time to see the tail whip toward him again.
This time, Stark managed to dodge, narrowly avoiding the devastating strike.
He retaliated, launching another series of Crimson Fists.
The projectiles struck the massive tail and bounced off harmlessly.
-0! -0! -0!
"It's like hitting a brick wall," Stark muttered, frustration boiling over.
The Sentinel's laughter echoed through the cavern, a deep, guttural sound that made the water tremble.
"You are nothing, Chosen. A feeble insect grasping at the impossible."
Ignoring the taunt, Stark pushed himself further.
He darted around the battlefield, throwing every technique he had at the creature.
He in fact tried to get close enough to be able to punch that thing, but there were too many things defending it, and getting too close to its mouth was a big no-no for him.
Every attack was useless against Thalveros' impenetrable scales.
The fight dragged on, with Stark dodging the Sentinel's monstrous tail and devastating shockwaves.
He was starting to feel the strain. His stamina was running low, and the oppressive weight of the water made every movement a struggle.
And then it happened.
The tail came again, but this time, it didn't aim to crush him.
Instead, it wrapped around him like a massive serpent, squeezing with bone-crushing force.
Stark struggled, his six arms flailing as he tried to free himself.
He immediately thought of using [Crimson Ball Transmission], but his arms were caught in the tail too.
"Get off me!" he roared, summoning a Crimson Ball in his hand but unable to do anything.
A sudden, searing pain shot through Stark's body.
He looked down and saw a glowing green liquid seeping into his skin: the Sentinel's poison.
"Shit…"
The poison coursed through his veins like fire, his HP dropping rapidly.
He could feel his strength fading, his vision blurring as the venom took hold.
[HP: 1]
Then, all at once, the pain stopped.
A warm, crimson glow enveloped Stark's body, and his health was fully restored.
[Crimson Healing activated: All HP restored upon reaching 1.]
Stark gasped, his body surging with renewed energy. But the relief was short-lived.
The Sentinel roared, tightening its grip and hurling Stark across the cavern.
He crashed into the rocky wall with enough force to crack the stone, coughing up blood as he struggled to stand.
-27,949!
"This isn't working," Stark muttered, his breathing ragged.
His mind raced. He needed a new plan, something drastic.
But before he could act, the Sentinel struck again.
A massive wave of water surged toward him, carrying with it a crushing force that slammed into Stark like a tidal wave.
-121,948!
Then Thalveros used that distraction to slam Stark against the wall.
"IT'S MY WIN," he shouted
BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!
Using his tail and even some tentacles that came out of nowhere, he kept hitting Stark over and over.
A single strike couldn't do more than 30,000 HP, but if repeated over and over, it quickly became too much.
Stark felt his body give out, his vision fading to black as his HP dropped to zero.
Darkness.
When Stark opened his eyes, he was back in the endless void.
The familiar black space he always found himself in after dying.
"Damn it…"
Before him, a screen appeared, displaying a countdown.
[You have 60 seconds to decide.]
[Do you want to be revived?]
In the background, another screen showed Thalveros.
The Sentinel's tentacles loomed over Stark's lifeless body, slowly pulling it toward its massive maw.
The sight sent a chill down his spine.
"You were weak," the Sentinel's voice echoed, its laughter mocking him even in death.
Stark clenched his fists.
He didn't have time to think.
He couldn't rely on his Classes to bail him out. This wasn't a fight he could win by holding back.
For the first time, Stark didn't hesitate.
"Yes," he said, his voice firm, "Revive me, I'm ending that thing for good."
The screen disappeared, replaced by a single notification.
Ding!
[Revenant's Fury's conditions have been met: 4/3.]
[However, it is not the right time.]
"What the hell does that mean?" Stark muttered, but there was no time for answers.
The void began to fade, and Stark's consciousness slipped away.
When he opened his eyes again, he was back in the cavern, his body restored and his health fully replenished as his broken bones were fixed.
This time, there was no hesitation, no second-guessing. He knew what needed to be done.
"You're going down, Thalveros," Stark said, his voice low and determined as he used his strength to get out of the tentacles' grip.
"What the...?"
The Sentinel roared in response, its glowing eyes burning with malevolent fury.
Stark summoned his Crimson Spears once more, their glow illuminating the dark waters around him.
But this time, he wasn't aiming for the Sentinel's impenetrable scales. He was aiming for something far more destructive.
His ultimate skill.
A tactical nuke for the abyssal beast.
And this time, he wouldn't stop until Thalveros was nothing but a memory.

chapters.title: Chapter 407 - 407: Forced to Tactical Nuke the Guardian, Waiting for Cooldown
chapters.content:
After Stark revived, gasping for air as the last tendrils of death left his body, he wasted no time.
The cold, crushing depths of the abyss around him felt suffocating, but survival was all that mattered now.
His body surged upward through the pitch-black water, the suit clinging to his form enhancing every stroke.
He pushed himself harder, faster, desperate to escape the gaping maw of the abyss below.
Every muscle in his body screamed with exhaustion, but he didn't care.
The abyss wasn't empty.
Thalveros' voice thundered from below, a guttural roar that shook Stark's very core.
"YOU THINK YOU CAN ESCAPE, CHOSEN? YOUR FATE IS SEALED!"
With a flick of his wrist, his [Sculk Necklace] activated.
From the strange relic, a surge of slime-like liquid burst forth, forming a protective barrier around him.
The water around him trembled as distant tendrils of Thalveros' fury lashed out, but the barrier absorbed most of the impact.
Stark clenched his teeth as each hit felt like a battering ram against his body. The barrier wasn't going to last long.
"I won't win like this," Stark muttered under his breath.
His crimson eyes burned with determination, but he knew the truth.
His arsenal of skills wouldn't be enough. Not against this. Not against him.
Stark knew he wouldn't win without "IT".
"I guess I'll just have to wait 24 hours in the rift," he groaned, bitterness dripping from his voice.
He glanced up toward the narrow passage that led out of this watery grave, his only hope of escape.
Then he froze.
"Wait a minute... is he getting... closer?!"
His voice cracked slightly as the realization hit.
Thalveros wasn't waiting for him to escape. The Abyssal Sentinel was ascending.
Stark's eyes widened as he watched the shadows far below shift and writhe.
The darkness itself seemed to churn, and then he saw them: Thalveros' glowing yellow eyes.
They burned like twin suns in the void, growing larger and closer with every passing second.
Yes, Stark was right, Thalveros was so mad and enraged that he was starting to climb from the abyss, slowly but surely taking over.
In less than a minute, he would be high enough to where he stopped Stark completely from leaving, and a bit more and he would be crushed or eaten.
Thalveros' roar echoed through the chamber, shaking the water and Stark's very soul.
"YOU CAN'T ESCAPE ME, CHOSEN! I'LL DRAG YOU INTO THE ABYSS AND DEVOUR YOU PIECE BY PIECE!"
Stark's heart pounded in his chest.
But then, something shifted. A spark of defiance ignited in Stark's eyes.
"YOU CAN'T BEAT ME!"
"No..." he murmured, a grin creeping across his face. "But he can."
Without hesitation, Stark snapped his fingers.
The motion was deliberate, filled with resolve.
"HEAVEN'S SPEAR!"
Above him, reality itself seemed to tear apart.
A massive rift opened high above the cavern ceiling, splitting the water and stone as if the heavens themselves had descended.
From within the rift emerged an angelic figure, an ethereal colossus whose sheer presence radiated divine power.
Its form was impossible to comprehend fully, stretching nearly 50 kilometers in height.
The angel's body shimmered with celestial crimson light, and its eyes burned with an intensity that pierced through the abyss.
With a slow, deliberate motion, the angel raised its hand, summoning an immense spear of pure energy.
The spear was so large it defied reason.
But something was wrong.
Stark's grin faltered as he looked up at the rift.
The angel... wasn't there.
"What...?" Stark's voice was a whisper, tinged with confusion and dread.
"HAHAHA!" Thalveros' laughter boomed through the chamber, a cruel, mocking sound.
"FOOL! AND HERE I THOUGHT YOU WERE ABOUT TO UNLEASH SOMETHING WORTH FEARING!"
Stark's mind raced, his thoughts spiraling into chaos.
Of course, the angel was there, it was just that Stark couldn't see it.
"Why isn't it working?! Did I mess up the activation? Is it because we're underwater?! Or is it the rift?! Dammit, what's happening?!"
The pressure in the chamber grew unbearable as Thalveros continued his ascent, his massive form nearing the exit.
Stark's eyes darted between the rift above and the monster below. Time was running out.
Then, a golden panel appeared before him, its shimmering text cutting through the chaos.
[Aren't you going to ask me to shoot?]
Stark blinked, momentarily stunned. "You're here?! Where the hell are you?!"
[My form is too large for this cavern,] the angel replied, its tone calm and almost amused. [I'm above. Just give the order.]
Relief flooded through Stark, followed quickly by determination.
"ALRIGHT!" he shouted, his voice echoing through the chamber. "ANGEL OF THE SPEAR, SHOOT THAT BASTARD WITH ENOUGH POWER TO KILL HIM!"
The moment he heard that, Thalveros' ascent halted abruptly.
For the first time, Stark saw uncertainty flicker in the monster's glowing eyes.
"What do you mean, human—"
He didn't get to finish.
The ceiling of the cavern erupted in a blinding light as the angel's spear descended.
The colossal weapon tore through the rock and water with unimaginable force, its sheer size and speed warping the environment.
The water itself seemed to scream as the spear plummeted toward its target, leaving a trail of searing crimson energy in its wake.
Stark didn't wait to see the impact.
"Invincible Dodge!" he shouted, activating his skill repeatedly.
His body phased through the chaotic currents as he swam frantically toward the exit.
He didn't have time to think, to look back.
His revives and healing were spent, if he got caught in the explosion, it was over.
The spear was about to strike.
Thalveros roared, his voice a mix of rage and desperation.
"I'VE EATEN THINGS MUCH MORE POWERFUL THAN THIS!" he bellowed, opening his massive maw wide enough to engulf the spear.
But... that was his biggest mistake.
For a moment, it seemed as though he might succeed.
The spear disappeared into the gaping abyss of his mouth, swallowed whole.
Then, everything changed once it reached his stomach.
The spear detonated.
From within Thalveros' stomach, an explosion of pure, concentrated energy erupted.
The force was overwhelming, tearing through his body from the inside out.
His scales, once impenetrable, shattered like glass.
His monstrous form convulsed as the energy consumed him, disintegrating every fiber of his being.
-99,999,999!
The number flashed before Stark's eyes, a grim testament to the power of the attack.
Thalveros didn't even have time to scream.
Ding!
[You have slain "Thalveros" and gained 150,000,000 experience points!]
His body dissolved into nothingness, leaving behind only a faint shimmer of energy that quickly faded into the depths.
The shockwave from the explosion rippled through the chamber, shaking the very foundations of the rift.
Stark felt the currents battering against him as he swam, but the reduced force, thanks to the fact Thalveros ate it, spared him from the worst of it.
Finally, he emerged into the main chamber, gasping for air, though he knew he wouldn't get any.
His eyes immediately locked onto the massive golden door before him.
The door glowed softly, its intricate carvings illuminated by the light of the second and third spheres embedded within its surface.
"Ding!"
[You can access the "Apostle Chamber" now by opening the "Golden Door"!]
Stark let out a shaky breath, a victorious grin spreading across his face.
"Three guardians down," he muttered, "You're next, Apostle."

chapters.title: Chapter 408 - 408: DROP NOTICE, STORY ENDING EXPLANATION FOR ALL THOSE THAT WANT TO KNOW
chapters.content:
No, you can't get refunds, it's not like I care to begin with after all.
But I don't wanna do like all those writers that instantly drop the novel and never give news of themselves.
So instead, let me write EVERYTHING that would have happened in the story since last chapter.
I can promise you it is not even more than 60 chapters since the story would have begun to speed up from there.
So here we go:
(Note that everything from there on is a direct continuation of last chapter)
Stark would open the [Golden Door] after waiting for 24 hours, then after that he would simply use [Heaven's Wrath] to kill the apostle.
Afterward, he would go back to the Association and be congratulated, but Stark wouldn't be happy as he still had two more.
And I'm not even kidding from there on, the two other missions would have happened in only two chapters.
Basically, each chapter would be a mission, and the entire point of these two would have been that Stark grew so tired of everything happening that he was simply using [Heaven's Wrath] at the start of the battle, instantly killing them both.
The second apostle of the third line is the [Great Serpent], which is level 820 and Universal.
The third apostle would be a massive wolf that wields thunder, it's name is [Yoru], and it's level 900, Universal too.
He would need to accompany the association and its people in one giant suicide mission.
That's when he would go past level 175 and reach level 183, unlocking the skill [Blade Rains], which would basically summon hundreds of blades in the sky, each one dealing very good damage.
Oh, and by the way, Stark would also clear that rift, thus gaining another max thing that he would use on his [Meteor Crash], which would reach level 80 and immediately unlock another skill just a little less powerful than [Heaven's Wraith].
The academy year is canceled by the way because of all the destruction and deaths, and slowly, the timer that announced the descent of the [Godless Demon] would keep going down.
When there were a little less than two months left, and Stark was level 199, he would meet two familiar people who ambush him.
The first is Daniel, the man that bullied him at the start of the story and whom Stark humbled, and the other is his own brother.
But technically, since Stark knew nothing about his "brother" since he was reincarnated, he kills the two of them without mercy after an intense battle.
"There was no grudge between us, you just attacked the wrong person," he looked at their dead bodies with the most neutral of expressions.
After that, he would reach level 200.
Ding!
[You have the maximum level!]
He would of course unlock the final class, which was [Beast Tamer], thus getting a small but cute crimson-wolf made out of aura.
Its name would be [Ember], and it would be at level 200 since it follows its master.
The characteristics of Ember would be that it can go from a small and cute pet to a terrifying beast capable of killing level 1000 monsters and classifiers.
He would also get the other classes since he's kind of forced to.
[+Assassin], which would increase his agility to 99,999.
[+Warrior], which would increase his strength to 99,999 and enhance the power of his [Sword Rain] skill, making it reach level 100, thus making it terrifyingly strong.
[+Archer], it doesn't give him a boost, but he unlocks the [Crimson Bow] skill, which allows him to summon a giant bow out of his aura, and send [Crimson Arrows].
All of this would have happened in 35 chapters by the way.
And so with this:
Stark would have reached his max level, he would have unlocked all his classes, as well as all his skills and possible perks, and he spent all his skill points.
Only one thing would be left: The Final Trial, which is where the final battle would happen.
[Your trial will happen the moment the timer reaches 0]
And so of course, Stark waits, passing the time with his girlfriends and enjoying his life, though of course the feeling of dread never leaving his side.
But then, the time arrives, and so the call for the trial also comes.
"Goodbye," he announces to the girls, smiling, "Hopefully I'll come back, if I don't, I'll at least take that bastard with me."
What Stark didn't know at that moment was that all three girls were pregnant, but as he explained the situation and that the world was at stake, they didn't inform him.
He enters the fourth trial, which is immediately broadcast for the entire world to see it, and of course, that includes the association, his family and the girls.
[The fate of this world will play now.]
That would be the first message that appears as the arena reveals itself.
[Fourth Domination Trial: Fate]
Immediately, the two other apostles, who are named: "Yumi" and "Yuma", two angels with wings as big as skyscrapers, would come to stop him, but he would kill them.
Both of them are level 999 by the way and from the [Divine] rank, which is above Universal.
And then... he meets the Godless Demon.
He was a demon the size of the [Angel of the Spear], but to make it easier, the joins with his true form: it was 10 meters tall, with four arms, and a terrifying face.
"Let's end this, chosen," the demon would say, pointing his jagged sword at him.
[Godless Demon]
[Level 1000]
[Divine+]
There, Stark would use every skill he has.
This includes the [Bomb] one-time skill he acquired before, and there would even be an entire cool moment where he believes it's gonna do a lot of damage, but the demon easily sends it flying back.
Every attempt Stark would do would end in failure, as the godless demon is just too strong.
He's gonna be killed, and [Revenant's Fury] will activate.
[Grants 5x of all stats for 3 minutes.]
Thanks to that, Stark would destroy the godless demon, not even kidding he would wipe the floor with him.
"LET'S GO!"
Everyone, including the classifiers above level 1,000 would cheer, knowing even their power wouldn't be able to defeat that thing.
And so, the godless demon's HP drop to zero.
But that wouldn't have been the end, far from that, because the moment Stark kills him... the godless demon revives.
"I can do that too, you know?" he grins while Stark is shocked.
[The Godless Demon has used his revive.]
[Final Showdown]
Both of them were out of revives, it was truly the end, and [Revenant's Fury] effects wore out.
"Let's take it to the real battlefield," the godless demon would snap his fingers, transporting the two of them to Earth.
And yes, this time, the battlefield wouldn't be in the trial, but in the actual world, which meant danger.
They would be fighting in the danger zone outside the countries, no monsters approaching them.
Even classifiers that tried to be heroes would be killed, and so at some point no one dared to approach.
Note that all of this would happen in around 15 chapters.
And then after some intense moment where Stark watches back on everything that happened until now... it finally happens: he gets killed, sliced in half by the demon's blade.
"AND IT'S MY VICTORY, CHOSEN!"
The Godless Demon would harvest the souls and power of all those that he killed or were killed by monsters, as well as all the power of the monsters and apostles, reaching his true form.
His true form:
[The Demon God].
"Goodbye," he would bow out of respect for Stark.
On the other hand, Stark would be in the black void again.
[You do not have any revives remaining.]
He was fucked, he wouldn't be able to come back.
But suddenly, right as darkness was about to take him, he sees the crimson door.
He approaches it, his surroundings filled with all doppelgängers of the other classes, each of them cheering for him.
And once he opens the door, he just sees a giant crimson flower, spinning.
"Beautiful..." he mumbles.
[This is your final chance, Chosen]
This was familiar: it was Rher, the god that sent him here.
[I have enjoyed watching you fight, and it has been a pleasure to see you grow, but now, it's time to end it all.]
[One more revive, nothing else.]
"..."
[If you fail... then your soul will be mine, and I'll torture it for a very long time, long enough to atone for your failure.]
[But... when you will atone, I'll send you somewhere else to retry :)]
[Good luck, don't make me do that, kid.]
He will then be revived one last time, and the moment he does, The [Godless Demon] will turn away, his eyes widening.
"No... way..."
But before he can finally end his sentence, instantly trying to kill the weakened Stark, the boy will shouted:
DOMINATION EXPANSION: ULTIMATE DOMINATION!
Basically, this is a domain where Stark can use up all of his skills WITHOUT COOLDOWN!]
And so he unleashes everything he has.
From [Aura Smash] to [Crimson Spear] to [Asura's Arms] to [Domination Soul] to [Crimson Bow] to [Sword Rain]: he would use up everything, each one emotional.
He would unleash dozens of [Heaven's Wrath] and [Meteor of Hell] (which is the ultimate perk of meteor crash].
He would also have [Ember], his pet, repeatedly damage the [Godless Demon], who is unable to do anything.
All of this would be shown outside too, everyone else shocked.
And so by the end, the [Godless Demon] will be at one HP.
"So this is the end..." he grins, "I guess I should have killed when you were level 1."
"You should have," Stark smiles, "Goodbye."
"Good fight."
And with that, Stark will punch him, ending his life.
That's pretty much all.
From there would be the prologue, which would happen 5 years after the incident.
Stark would become worldwide famous and extremely rich, living in a mansion with his three wifes: Sora, Lilith and Lana.
Each of them had two children with him, meaning that he had six kids, with more on the way because of his [Incubus] class and thus amazing libido.
Each of Stark's kid resembled him deeply, that is because of the way the [Domination] class works: his genes would quite literally dominate all of the girls', meaning though he had 3 boys and 3 girls from them, each of his kids had black hair and crimson eyes, not ressembling their mothers that much.
Even [Sora] and [Lilith], even though they were from the domination class too, couldn't beat him in the genes battle.
They would live happily, with the girls considering the others' kids as their own too, meaning there was no discrimination.
And so with that, the novel would end.
At the end, Rher would look down at this world, a wide smile on his face as Stark was enjoying a dinner with his family.
[Well... I guess he did a decent job.]
[I give him an SSS-Rating!]
[Onto the next...]
...
If you're not happy, deal with it, I earned more than enough money lol
